Job_Description: <strong>Konrad Group</strong> <br/><br/> Konrad Group is a next generation digital consultancy. We are dedicated to solving complex business problems for our global clients with creative and forward-thinking solutions. Our employees enjoy a culture built on innovation and a commitment to creating best-in-class digital products in use by hundreds of millions of consumers around the world. We hire exceptionally smart, analytical, and hard working people who are lifelong learners. <br/><br/> <strong>UI/UX Designer</strong> <br/><br/> Konrad Group is looking for a UI/UX Designer to join our Toronto team. You are responsible for designing compelling digital experiences from conception to delivery in a cross-functional environment. You will collaborate with creative, development and strategy teams to ship world-class digital experiences for leading companies and global brands. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities</strong>  <ul> <li>Develop a comprehensive understanding of project needs by attending design thinking workshops, performing user research, conducting user tests, and designing rich interactive experiences</li> <li>Identify areas of opportunities for clients and solve functional challenges through brainstorming, ideating, and designing digital solutions with other members of the team</li> <li>Work with developers and consultants to understand technology requirements and business objectives as they relate to the designs of the products</li> <li>Build industry-leading solutions by staying up to date with design best practices and latest technologies</li> <li>Contribute to Konrads overall design culture by learning emerging softwares, standards and processes</li> </ul> <strong>Skills & Requirements</strong>  <ul> <li>1-3 years of experience in digital design for web and mobile applications</li> <li>Strong conceptual thinking and design execution abilities in both visual and interaction design</li> <li>Intimate knowledge of Sketch, Adobe Creative Suite and prototyping tools</li> <li>Expertise in motion graphics and web or mobile development is a bonus</li> <li>Organization, interpersonal and communication skills, with a passion towards the digital space</li> </ul> <strong>Bonus Points:</strong> Have you taken any courses at BrainStation? A lot of our design and development best practices and processes are taught during our courses - make sure to highlight this experience in your cover letter if you have! <br/><br/> <em>Konrad Group is committed to maintaining a diverse work environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants, regardless of race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status will receive consideration for employment. If you have any accessibility requirements or concerns regarding the hiring process or employment with us, please notify us so we can provide suitable accommodation.</em> <br/><br/> <strong>*Please include a link to your online portfolio with the application</strong>. <br/><br/> While we sincerely appreciate all applications, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.
Title: UI/UX Designer

Job_Description: <div> Do you want to learn and grow with an amazing team? Are you a passionate A-player who strives to exceed expectations, daily?<br/><br/>PathFactory’s Content Insight and Activation Platform helps B2B marketers understand the role of content in the buyer’s journey and discover a new class of data to optimize the path to purchase. PathFactory uses this data and insight to optimize content delivery across every channel, connecting buyers with the most relevant information whenever and wherever they click. <br/><br/> We’re looking for a designer to help us build out the future of product design at PathFactory. You’ll have the unique opportunity to work at the intersection of data and design and own the user experience through prototyping, iterative refinement, product launch, and continuous in-market optimization. Ideally, you are collaborative, passionate about technology and interested in the problems and opportunities available in the world of data, AI and automation.<br/><br/>Responsibilities   <ul> <li>Translate user feedback and insights into elegant prototypes</li> <li>Contribute to research sessions and gathering qualitative and quantitative feedback to improve and iterate on design</li> <li>Collaborate closely with design, development, and product</li> <li>Contribute to building out our design system, design practice, and standards</li> <li>Contribute to meetings with insights and best practices</li> </ul>  What we’re looking for   <ul> <li>2+ years of UX/Product design experience</li> <li>A portfolio that demonstrates shipped products that clearly communicates goals, process, and outcomes</li> <li>Experience in end-to-end product design across research, strategy, UX/UI and visual design</li> <li>Excellent communication skills – can communicate complex concepts to different teams and levels of knowledge</li> <li>Ability to react quickly within the context of a dynamic, agile environment</li> <li>Ability to strike a balance between strategy and hands-on work delivery</li> <li>Proficiency using Sketch (symbols, libraries) and Invision</li> </ul>  Bonus points if you have   <ul> <li>Experience with data visualization</li> <li>Awareness of HTML/CSS/JS and Atomic Design Patterns</li> <li>Experience using prototyping (Framer/Principle) or collaboration tools (Abstract/Wake)</li> <li>Experience with MarTech, automation or integrations</li> </ul>  Location<br/><br/>The position is located in downtown Toronto.<br/><br/>Why Work at PathFactory?<br/><br/>This is where we get to boast a little about why we’re awesome and why it would be awesome for you to work with us. Located in the heart of downtown Toronto, PathFactory is a fast-growing, innovative marketing technology company with a corporate culture that values individuality and diversity. We work hard and play hard and we do both with passion and respect for one another. Our newly renovated open concept office promotes a fast-paced, fun, friendly and highly collaborative work environment, while our management goes out of their way to be transparent and approachable. Weekly all-hands meetings, team lunches, company events and a quarterly Founders’ Award for the team member who best embodies our values – these are all cherries on top of the PathFactory cake!<br/><br/>Interested? We’d love to hear from you.<br/><br/>If you believe you have the right stuff, apply below. Attach your resume and a short cover letter telling us why you are the right person for this job! We are marketers, not HR people, so feel free to let a bit of your personality come through.<br/><br/>PathFactory is an equal opportunity employer.<br/><br/>It prohibits discrimination based on age, colour, disability, national origin, race, religion, sex, sexual orientation, and any other legally protected class in accordance with applicable federal, provincial and local laws. PathFactory is committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible workplace. If you are contacted for an interview and require accommodation during the interviewing process, please let us know.<br/> <div> Apply now</div>  </div> <br/>
Title: Product UX/UI Designer

Job_Description: <div> Lead UX/UI Designer <br/><br/> at eSignLive™ by Vasco <br/><br/> (View all jobs)<br/>   <div> Montréal, Canada</div>  </div><br/>   <div><strong>About the Company</strong>: <br/><br/> VASCO is a global leader in delivering trust and business productivity solutions to the digital market. VASCO develops next generation technologies that enable more than 10,000 customers in 100 countries in financial, enterprise, government, health care and other segments to achieve their digital agenda, deliver an enhanced customer experience and meet regulatory requirements. More than half of the top 100 global banks rely on VASCO® solutions to protect their online, mobile and ATM channels. VASCO’s solutions combine to form a powerful trust platform that empowers businesses by incorporating identity, fraud prevention, electronic signatures, mobile application protection and risk analysis. <br/><br/> <strong>Summary:</strong> <br/><br/> If you are an analytical, methodical, and creative person, equally left and right brained, if you live, dream, and breathe to design great user experiences then you are the one we need. The UI/UX Lead will drive and define standards and guidelines, research, information architecture, interaction and visual design efforts across the company to create interactive solutions that aim to deliver unique customer experiences, achieved with high performance user interfaces, that always take into account both business objectives and the user’s point of view. You will work very closely with product management, R&D, and other functions who are all equally passionate about delighting our customers and users with great products and experiences. <br/><br/> <strong>Key responsibilities and duties:</strong><ul> <li>A portfolio and work samples that proves interaction and visual design: from concept generation to use case-definition, from interaction model definition to user flow and design specs</li> <li>Ability to illustrate and communicate design concepts using a variety of techniques and formats: interactive prototypes, storyboards, sketches, videos, animations, and photography.</li> <li>Lead research such as heuristics, focus groups, analytics, benchmark, field study and usability testing</li> <li>Excellent verbal and written communication skills, fluent in English</li> </ul> <strong>Qualifications:</strong><ul> <li>Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience</li> <li>10 years of professional experience in UI and UX design</li> <li>Experience defining UI/UX standards and guidelines across multiple product lines. Stays up to date with the latest industry trends</li> <li>Experience leading and driving design projects, leading junior designers.</li> <li>Equally comfortable leading design efforts and being hands-on</li> <li>Experience shipping solutions geared towards business users, technical administrators, and consumers</li> </ul> <strong>Why VASCO:</strong> <br/><br/> We offer unlimited potential with a leader in delivering trust and business productivity solutions. VASCO offers the ideal setting for ambitious professionals looking for more than just a job. Our international team is comprised of dedicated and resourceful people who are building an incredible success story in the digital world. We offer a competitive compensation and benefits packages including health, dental, vision, life, AD&D, short-term, and long-term disability insurances, tuition reimbursement, company contribution on 401(K), Employee Assistance Program, free use of onsite fitness center in some locations, and a casual work environment among other benefits. If you are an ambitious professional who is looking to help push VASCO to the next level, we would be interested in hearing from you.</div><br/>  <div> <div> <div>Apply for this Job</div><br/>   <div>   <ul> <li>Required</div></li>  <br/><br/> </ul>  <div> First Name *</div><br/>  <div> Last Name *</div><br/>  <div> Email *</div><br/>  <div> Phone</div><br/>  <div> Resume/CV<br/>  <div> <div> Drop files here</div><br/>  <div> Attach <br/><br/>  Dropbox <br/><br/> Paste</div> <br/>  <div> <div> </div>  </div> </div> </div><br/>  <div> Cover Letter<br/>  <div> <div> Drop files here</div><br/>  <div> Attach <br/><br/>  Dropbox <br/><br/> Paste</div> <br/>  <div> <div> </div>  </div> </div> </div> </div><br/>  <div> <div> LinkedIn Profile</div><br/>  <div> Website</div><br/>  <div> How did you hear about this job? *</div><br/>  <div> LinkedIn profile URL</div> </div>  </div>  <br/>
Title: Lead UX/UI Designer

Job_Description: <strong>Company Overview</strong> <br/><br/> Teranet is the exclusive provider of Ontario’s online property search and registration. We developed, own and operate the Ontario Electronic Land Registration System - one of the most advanced, secure and sophisticated land registration systems in the world. In Manitoba, Teranet owns and operates The Property Registry, providing certification of titles to land, maintains land records and offers reliable information of financial interests in personal property to the public. Teranet is owned by OMERS Infrastructure, a leading global infrastructure investment manager and the infrastructure arm of the Ontario Municipal Employee Retirement System. <br/><br/> <strong>Recent Awards</strong> <br/><br/> Teranet has been recognized as one of Greater Toronto’s Top Employers for 2018. Now in its 12th year, The Greater Toronto’s Top Employer list aims to determine which employers lead their industries by offering exceptional workplaces. To see the complete 2018 Greater Toronto’s Top Employer list, please visit http://www.canadastop100.com/toronto/ <br/><br/> <strong>Job Description</strong> <br/><br/> We are looking for a User Experience & User Interface Designer with a strong interest in human-computer interactions and experience in the design of mobile and web applications with engaging user experiences. You should have strong analytical and problem-solving skills, the ability to make independent decisions, outstanding collaboration abilities, and creativity based on research findings and an eye for clean and minimalistic design. <br/><br/> You will work very closely with product owners, government partners and UX/UI Designers to create and govern the user interface and experience of our applications. You will collaborate with all teams (Product, Development, and Quality Assurance) throughout the entire lifecycle of design and development process. <br/><br/> A strong portfolio demonstrating some of your recent successes including work samples that shows your process and a high attention to detail is a must. <br/><br/> <strong>Primary Responsibilities</strong> <br/><br/> The UX/UI Design Specialist acts as a creative resource on a project(s), with responsibilities that include but are not limited to the following:  <ul> <li>Responsible for the content layout, visual appearance and usability design of applications, websites, and projects.</li>  <li>Creation of UI centered materials such as wireframing, style guides, interaction and behavior design requirements, and workflow diagrams</li>  <li>Assist in the creation of UX centered materials such as user goal capturing, personas, user research studies, and overall usability specifications</li>  <li>Incorporating accessibility (AODA / WCAG) guidelines and Inclusive Design principals into pertaining deliverables</li>  <li>Strong concept development, graphic design ability and attention to details required</li>  <li>Be able to seek opportunities to provide UX/UI improvements for businesses and clients</li>  <li>Ensuring that all deliverables are provided on-time, on-specification with the project plan, as co-ordinated with project stakeholder (exercise good time and project self-management)</li>  <li>Ensuring that all deliverables are produced to the highest standard in terms of: layout, visual appearance, branding requirements, and user experience / user interface best practices</li>  <li>Being a strong communicator and an active listener. Providing and capturing feedback, details, and inputs, then demonstrating it in the work produced</li>  <li>Strength in using the latest tools for interactive design and layout, including: Photoshop, Illustrator, Sketch and others</li>  <li>Being a proactive problem solver, offering well thought out solutions and ideas to all challenges.</li>  <li>Demonstrating professionalism at all times and being a great ambassador for UX/UI with partners, clients, and peers.</li>  <li>Sharing knowledge, insight, resources, and materials that contribute to the success of teammates and/or the company.</li> </ul>  <strong>Required Skills</strong>   <ul> <li>A strong related portfolio</li>  <li>Proficient knowledge of Adobe Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, Dreamweaver, and InDesign is a plus)</li>  <li>Excellent presentation skills</li>  <li>Proficient knowledge in at least one Wireframing tool (Balsamiq, Illustrator, Axure, Sketch)</li></ul>   <ul> <li>Good understanding of web markup, including HTML5, CSS3 and modern front-end interface possibilities</li>  <li>Good understanding of UX principals, testing, and research methods.</li>  <li>Solid team and communication skills.</li>  <li>Must have excellent problem solving skills and love UX challenges.</li>  <li>Must be self-motivated and able to multi-task</li>  <li>Ability to learn new tools and guidelines quickly</li>  <li>Ability to understanding and design for multi-tier applications verses websites</li>  <li>Knowledge of Web Accessibility (WCAG 2.0) and Inclusive Design principals are a plus</li> </ul>  <strong>Required Experience</strong>   <ul> <li>Design related diploma or degree</li>  <li>Minimum 5 years of related experience</li> </ul> <em>Teranet Inc. is committed to accommodating the individual needs of all applicants with disabilities during the recruitment and selection process as required under the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act. Please inform us of any accommodation requirements you may require.</em>
Title: UX/UI Designer

Job_Description: UX Designer<br/><br/>Send to a friend <br/>  Apply for this position<br/><br/>Team<br/><br/>You are part of the user-interface development team for our software products. Development is carried out in a Windows environment, with occasional forays into Web technologies, and following recognized practices of software engineering (specifications, prototyping, technical reviews, etc.) and of quality assurance.<br/><br/>Main responsibilities<br/><br/>As a UX Designer, you will draw on your knowledge of the target users and the concepts of ergonomics to work with the development teams to ensure the usability of our software tools and optimize the user experience. The incumbent will make their contribution by providing an expert assessment, by user testing, or by collaborating directly on design with the creative teams. You will provide conclusions that lead to concrete solutions, discussed and applied in collaboration with the various stakeholders in the project. <br/><br/> Your responsibilities consist in:  <ul> <li>Working closely with product managers to identify and clarify clients’ requirements. Developing user scenarios to help with designing and defining the software application</li> <li>Designing user interfaces based on the functional requirements, users’ needs and task analysis</li> <li>Communicating designs to the development teams with the help of diagrams, drawings, detailed specifications and interactive prototypes</li> <li>Assembling data on users (by various research methods) both in general (workflow) and in more detail (particular user interfaces)</li> <li>Conducting surveys and interviews with internal experts, analysts and users</li> <li>Evaluating user interfaces using a heuristic approach, with reviews by experts, and with usability tests (when applicable)</li> <li>Collaborating with the development teams and guiding their implementation of user interfaces</li> <li>Contributing to drafting the interface guidelines and the specification for customized/advanced UI controls that must be included in the system common library of UI controls</li> </ul>  Desired profile   <ul> <li>Bachelor’s degree in a connected field (computer science, software ergonomics/HCI, industrial design, communications, cognitive psychology)</li> <li>Master’s degree in cognitive ergonomics, an asset</li> <li>3 to 5 years of relevant experience in UI analysis and design (for software, an asset)</li> <li>Excellent knowledge of user-oriented design methods</li> <li>Demonstrated ability to design interactive UI prototypes</li> <li>Knowledge of programming and software-design methods</li> <li>Ability to work in a team; good communications skills</li> <li>Knowledge of branding strategy, typography, or any other related field, an asset</li> <li>Graphic design skills (designing icons or other elements of graphic interfaces), an asset</li> <li>Availability to travel internationally</li> <li>Ability to communicate in French and English (oral and written)</li> </ul>  <div>GIRO promotes employment equity and offers equal opportunity to all. <br/><br/> We thank all applicants. Only those selected for an interview will be contacted.</div>
Title: UX Designer

Job_Description: <b>About LocalCoin</b> <p>LocalCoin is one of the largest Bitcoin and cryptocurrency exchanges in Canada. We pride ourselves in being the first Litecoin and Ethereum ATM provider in Ontario. We have established partnerships with Gateway newstands, Hasty Market, Little Short Stop and Quickie Convenience. We have experienced over a 10,000% YTD growth and still increasing. Our mission is to provide a simple buying/selling experience of digital currency for customers while upholding privacy across Canada. We’ve been featured in major media outlets including: CityTV, Vice Motherboard, Bitcoin.com and CP24. Employees have equal opportunities to contribute to company success within a startup culture that encourages self-starters, transparency and team connectivity. Our Toronto office is conveniently located right next to Finch station. We are not accepting remote work at this moment. Please do not apply if you can only work remotely.</p> <b>What You’ll Do</b> <p>Working with the Marketing and Development teams the UX-UI Designer is responsible for collecting, researching, investigating and evaluating user requirements. We are looking for an experienced and creative UI/UX Designer to join our team! We need a critical thinker who is detail oriented and eager to design new ideas using innovative methods and latest technology.<br><br>As an UI-UX Designer, you will be responsible for delivering the best online user experience, which makes your role extremely important for our success and ensuring customer satisfaction and loyalty.</p> <ul> <li>Plan and implement new UX/UI solutions</li> <li>Optimize existing user interface designs</li> <li>Communicate and collaborate the overall vision with the Marketing & Development team</li> <li>Develop technical and business requirements and always strive to deliver intuitive and user-centered solutions</li> <li>Combine creativity with an awareness of the design elements</li> <li>Create prototypes, wireframes, mockups for new product ideas and collaborate with team to review, refine and implement</li> <li>Promote design guidelines, best practices and standards</li> <li>Assist in the overall brand strategy</li> </ul> <b>Who You Are</b> <ul> <li>2-4 years of experience as an UI-UX Designer or similar role</li> <li>Knowledge of Adobe range of products including Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign, Acrobat and Dreamweaver</li> <li>2-4 years of experience with HTML5 & CSS3</li> <li>Strong understanding of UX best practices, design patterns, research skills and testing abilities</li> <li>Strong sense of visual design, including typography, colour theory, design libraries and grid systems</li> <li>Excellent interpersonal and communication skills</li> </ul> <b>Beneficial Assets</b> <ul> <li>Bachelor’s degree in relevant field</li> <li>Javascript experience</li> <li>Mobile UI design experience</li> </ul> <b>Perks & Benefits</b> <ul> <li>Discount coupon for all our Bitcoin Teller Machines nationwide</li> <li>Access to purchase Bitcoin below Canadian market rate with zero fees</li> <li>Mentorship of the Bitcoin and Cryptocurrency industry</li> <li>Flexible work hours</li> <li>Monthly team social events including: bubble soccer, paint lounge and more!</li> <li>TTC accessible office location in Toronto</li> <li>Work in a rapidly evolving industry</li> </ul> <b>Job Type</b> <ul> <li>Full-time</li> </ul> <b>Location</b> <ul> <li>Toronto, ON </li> </ul> <br> <p><br><br><br></p> <p><br><br><br></p>
Title: UI-UX Designer

Job_Description: <strong>Konrad Group</strong> <br/><br/> Konrad Group is a next generation digital consultancy. We are dedicated to solving complex business problems for our global clients with creative and forward-thinking solutions. Our employees enjoy a culture built on innovation and a commitment to creating best-in-class digital products in use by hundreds of millions of consumers around the world. We hire exceptionally smart, analytical, and hard working people who are lifelong learners. <br/><br/> <strong>Senior UI/UX Designer</strong> <br/><br/> Konrad Group is looking for a Senior UI/UX Designer to join our Toronto team. You will play a key role in leading large-scale innovation and digital solutions for consumer brands and enterprise clients. You will collaborate with creative, development and strategy teams to ship world-class digital experiences for leading companies and global brands. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities</strong>  <ul> <li>Lead design research, ideation and creation of digital interfaces across multiple platforms and devices</li> <li>Facilitate discussions and design thinking / feedback sessions with clients and project stakeholders</li> <li>Ensure successful deliveries of multiple projects by managing design deliverables and timelines</li> <li>Mentor designers by providing clear design guidances and actionable suggestions</li> <li>Inspire all members of the creative team by fostering a culture of constant learning and professional growth</li> </ul> <strong>Skills & Requirements</strong>  <ul> <li>Minimum of 3 years of experience in leading the design of interactive experiences</li> <li>Solid understanding of creating user-centered experiences with complex requirements</li> <li>Driven to innovate and lead creative workflows and processes for the team</li> <li>Excellent communication skills during client engagements and presentations</li> <li>Proficient knowledge of Sketch, Adobe Creative Suite and prototyping tools</li> <li>Expertise in motion graphics and web or mobile development is a bonus</li> </ul> <strong>Bonus Points:</strong> have you taken any courses at BrainStation? A lot of our design and development best practices and processes are taught during our courses - make sure to highlight this experience in your cover letter if you have! <br/><br/> <em>Konrad Group is committed to maintaining a diverse work environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants, regardless of race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status will receive consideration for employment. If you have any accessibility requirements or concerns regarding the hiring process or employment with us, please notify us so we can provide suitable accommodation.</em> <br/><br/> <strong>*Please include a link to your online portfolio with the application.</strong> <br/><br/> While we sincerely appreciate all applications, only those candidates selected for interview will be contacted.
Title: Senior UI/UX Designer

Job_Description: IUGO, one of Vancouver's leading mobile game developers, responsible for smash successes such as The Walking Dead: Road to Survival and Knights & Dragons, is currently seeking a Senior UX Designer. The right candidate will aid in building best practices backed by analytics and play-testing data, guiding the team on interdisciplinary projects to establish a holistic, consistent player experience. You will create collaborative relationships with stakeholders, establishing a strong UX vision and evangelizing player experience design. Refining and optimizing user experience and team processes, utilizing the UX research team and resources you have to hand. The ideal candidate should be highly self-motivated and display exceptional organizational and methodological skills. <br/><br/> <strong>RESPONSIBILITIES</strong>  <ul> <li>Drive UX excellence for the game, and discover opportunities for further research, improvement and innovation</li>  <li>Seek out and leverage the insights of the team's playtesting and player research to inform your game and feature designs</li>  <li>Define and implement standards that help the team create a consistent, quality experience for its players across iOS and Android mobile platforms</li>  <li>Design and audit system architecture and business processes for the project team</li>  <li>Create wireframes and user flows, ensuring that iterative feedback is incorporated into the development process</li>  <li>Collaborate with design teams on in-game feature planning and implementation</li>  <li>Lead a UI/UX team guiding style consistency, and working with internal & external stakeholders</li>  <li>Mentoring and supporting the career development of the UI/UX team</li> </ul> <strong>REQUIREMENTS</strong>  <ul> <li>5+ years of experience delivering innovative results in mobile UX design</li>  <li>Expert in process flow development, journey mapping and user requirements analysis</li>  <li>Familiarity with F2P, RPG games on iOS and Android platforms</li>  <li>Knowledge of standard UX design tools for wireframing, prototyping, flow-charts, etc.</li>  <li>Familiarity with monetization strategies for in-app purchases and free-to-play games</li>  <li>Strong communication skills (verbal and written)</li>  <li>Excellent organizational and methodological skills, with high attention to detail</li>  <li>Expert in integrating new processes, tactical resources for the team (project and disciplinary team)</li>  <li>Understanding of game production pipelines</li>  <li>Proven portfolio demonstrating entire UX process including research, problem, solution and reasonings</li>  <li>A passion for games</li> </ul> <strong>BONUS</strong>  <ul> <li>BA/BS in related discipline or technical equivalent</li>  <li>Working knowledge of analytics, cluster analysis, A/B testing</li>  <li>Previous experience with the development and shipment of AAA titles</li> </ul> <strong>PERKS OF WORKING AT IUGO!</strong>  <ul> <li>Fully stocked kitchen (half of Costco is in our kitchen)</li>  <li>Catered lunch every Friday</li>  <li>Comprehensive benefits package, premiums paid in full by IUGO (including MSP Coverage)</li>  <li>Wellness program (in-studio RMT sessions, gym subsidies)</li>   <li>RRSP Matching</li>  <li>Games tables & consoles</li>   <li>Company socials & team events</li>   <li>Massage chair & relaxation room</li>   <li>IUGO Guilds</li>  <li>Beer Fridays</li>  <li>Vitamix (who doesn’t love a Vitamix?!)</li> </ul> <strong>What Happens Next?</strong> Our team reviews all applications, however, because we receive such high volumes of talent, we are only able to reach out to those who closely match our needs. If you are not contacted right away, don’t be discouraged as we keep all applications on file, and will contact you should a suitable role open up. Thanks for your interest in IUGO! <br/><br/> Please keep an eye out for our opportunities on our careers page: http://www.iugome.com/careers.html <br/><br/> <strong>Follow Us!</strong> <br/> Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/iugomobile/ <br/> Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/iugome/?hl=en <br/> Twitter: https://twitter.com/iugome
Title: Senior UX Designer - F2P Mobile Games

Job_Description: <p><strong>Are you eager to be part of a creative agency that treats designing for a better user experience—like the quality of work and work life at the agency itself—not as an afterthought, but rather as an essential driver of its continuing growth and financial success?</strong></p> <p><strong>Are you prepared to sometimes do things differently, in the belief that doing great work, in a great environment, can be both fun and rewarding?</strong></p> <p><strong>If so, read on.</strong></p> <p><em>At McMillan, the UX team philosophy is simple: Know your user, and always strive to make his or her life better.</em></p> <p>Isn’t it great when your job description can be articulated in a way that’s both succinct and loaded with significance? That’s the kind of job you have as a UX designer at McMillan. What you do is enhance the user experience for the solutions we deliver. You serve as the advocate for unseen but knowable personas, while researching and producing various UX deliverables to give direction for end solutions based on learned business and user needs and objectives.</p> <p>In your role, you’ll report to and support the leader, digital experience, while collaborating daily with others in the strategy department and individuals in our digital, creative, client services, and studio management teams.</p> <b>Your responsibilities</b> <p>Expect to be busy. You’ll spend your days at McMillan alternating between:</p> <ul> <li>Planning and conducting user and stakeholder research activities, including interviews, card sorting, tree testing, and usability testing</li> <li>Producing polished UX documentation, including competitive/heuristic analyses, personas, site maps, user journeys, and flows</li> <li>Translating insights into user-centred deliverables, including information architectures, user scenarios, and wireframes</li> <li>Developing static and interactive prototypes for demonstration and evaluation of concepts by clients, or for testing with end users</li> <li>Providing UX insight and guidance to clients and internal teams</li> <li>Working with visual designers and developers to bring concepts to life, while maintaining UX best practices</li> <li>Creating and leading client presentations</li> </ul> <p>Throughout, you’ll need to be a patient listener and confident communicator.</p> <b>Your success</b> <p>It starts, of course, by carrying out your responsibilities in a way that adds value. You take your role seriously (yourself less so), and you are comfortable with change. In fact, you encourage and champion it.</p> <p>But there’s something else. Win or lose, we do it as a team. At the same time, all employees at McMillan are expected to strive towards being recognized as sought-after, trusted advisors by clients and colleagues alike. That recognition is earned by displaying:</p> <ul> <li><strong>Curiosity</strong> – You show a genuine interest in coworkers and ask tough questions (when appropriate) to inform, explore, and encourage fresh perspectives and solutions. At the same time, you seek to continuously widen and improve your own knowledge and skills, so that you can generate ideas that are both informed and unexpected.</li> <li><strong>Expertise</strong> – You combine expert proficiency in your role with industry-specific awareness. You exude confidence, yet know when receiving constructive feedback is important. In fact, a critical part of the McMillan culture embraces both giving and receiving feedback in the moment, to make all of us better people and turn good work into something that’s great.</li> <li><strong>Service</strong> – You communicate clearly, stay calm under pressure, anticipate the needs of others, respond promptly to requests, show a sincere desire to build relationships, and prove yourself to be a reliable, go-to player on the McMillan team.</li> </ul> <b>You bring</b> <ul> <li>5+ years’ experience as a UX professional (or in a similar role)</li> <li>A firm understanding of user-centred design processes and interaction design principles</li> <li>Previous experience in planning and conducting various user research activities</li> <li>Proficiency in a variety of design prototyping tools, including Sketch, Adobe CS, Invision, Axure, and Omnigraffle</li> </ul> <p>Experience working in a creative agency will be considered an asset.</p> <b>You should expect</b> <p>Travel and overtime may be required.<br><br></p> <p><b>Think you have what it takes? Then we want to hear from you. Click on the link to apply through our careers page, and if you’ve got what we’re looking for, we’ll be in touch.</b></p>
Title: UX Designer

Job_Description: <div><div><div><div><div><p>Beenox is a video game development studio created in 2000. Located in beautiful Quebec City, Canada, Beenox is a wholly owned subsidiary of Activision Publishing Inc., one of the world’s top game developers.</p>  <div> </div> <p>The studio is proud to contribute to the development of the Call of Duty video game franchise. Beenox has also contributed to the resounding success of the Skylanders, Spider-Man, and Guitar Hero franchises.</p> <div> </div> <p>As members of the Beenox family, we feel as if we’re part of a group of like-minded people who are great to work with. Our studio is a real open world where it’s easy to have discussions with everyone, including our studio co-heads. Here everyone brings their own unique touch to projects that showcase their talent on a global stage.</p> <div> </div> <p>You could say that video games are in our blood!</p> <div><b> </b></div> <div><b>HERE'S WHAT AWAITS YOU IN THIS JOB:</b></div> <div><b><br> </b></div> <p>As a UX Designer, you’ll be asked to contribute to the creation of a top-quality user experience for our players. You will achieve this objective by promoting an approach centered around the user, based on human psychology principles user observations (user tests) and graphic design guidelines.</p> <p>You’ll have to ensure that the experience and immersion of the user are aligned with the game design intents. Plus, you’ll oversee the identification of potentials friction points related to ergonomics or player communication, both from a visual and functional standpoint. You will be responsible for coming up with potential solutions to those issues.</p> <p><br> </p> <div><u>You’ll need to:</u></div> <p>• Analyze the game’s UI/UX needs based on the type of user, game direction, market trends and industry standards and adapt it to find the right balance between innovation and conventions;</p> <p>• Develop various game UI elements (HUDs, tutorials, menus…) while working closely with the UI and Design teams;</p> <p>• Design the structure and user flow of interface elements while ensuring a good information hierarchy and a quality player communication;</p> <p>• Document systems related to interfaces and user experience (UX) for the development team by creating flowcharts and wireframes;</p> <p>• Work closely with Game Designers to complement the documentation of Game Design features and get a good understanding of the design intentions for the UI and player communication;</p> <p>• Test various possible options of game UI elements by creating functional prototypes;</p> <p>• Contribute to implementing and integrating in-game UI;</p> <p>• Work closely with UI Designers and Programmers to ensure the quality of the product;</p> <p>• Act as a leader regarding User Experience issues to the rest of the team;</p> <p>• Participate actively in build reviews and iterate quickly based on the team’s feedback.</p> <p><br> </p> <p> <b>YOU ARE:</b></p> <p><b><br> </b></p> <p>• <b>Experienced:</b> You have at least three (3) years of experience working in a video game studio or the equivalent, as a UX Designer, Game Designer, UI Designer or equivalent. You have experience in AAA or FPS development (asset).</p> <p>• <b>Competent:</b> You know the video game development pipeline plus you are efficient and work meticulously. You have a great understanding of the technical constraints of game development (including game engines and game editors);</p> <p>• <b>Expert:</b> You have a solid background in interactivity and User-centered interface design. You own complex tasks and ensure that you deliver quality. You also have a good understanding of human psychology principles and how they apply to UX game design (asset);</p> <p>• <b>Informed</b>: You‘ve kept up with the latest innovations in UX and you make it your business to stay up to date. You also are more than aware of the latest gaming trends. You follow the Call of Duty series closely and you understand its essence (asset);</p> <p>• <b>Versatile:</b> You’re proficient with prototyping and rapid iterations based on feedback. You are especially at ease with Photoshop, Visio and other flowcharts, wireframes and functional mockups software. Photoshop and Substance Painter. You also have basic skills in scripting or programming (asset).</p> <p>• <b>Team player:</b> You like to work in in collaboration with a multidisciplinary team. You communicate effectively with people of various backgrounds – both in English and French.</p> <p>• <b>Resourceful:</b> You’re keen to learn how to use new internal tools and you don’t get discouraged when faced with regular change. </p>                    </div>  </div>  </div>     </div> 	</div>

Job_Description: <div><div><div><div><div><div>Beenox is a <br/> video game development studio created in 2000. Located in beautiful Quebec <br/> City, Canada, Beenox is a wholly owned subsidiary of Activision Publishing <br/> Inc., one of the world’s top game developers.</div> <br/>The studio is <br/> proud to contribute to the development of the Call of Duty video game <br/> franchise. Beenox has also contributed to the resounding success of the <br/> Skylanders, Spider-Man, and Guitar Hero franchises. <br/><br/> As members of <br/> the Beenox family, we feel as if we’re part of a group of like-minded people <br/> who are great to work with. Here everyone <br/> brings their own unique touch to projects that showcase their talent on a <br/> global stage. <br/><br/> You could say <br/> that video games are in our blood! <br/><br/> <strong>HERE'S WHAT <br/> AWAITS YOU IN THIS JOB:</strong> <br/><br/> • Conceptualize the visuals and movements of the UI elements in <br/> collaboration with the Art Director and the development team; <br/><br/> • Develop the interactions and gameplay features relative to interfaces in <br/> collaboration with UX Designers and the development team; <br/><br/> • Own and ensure the readability, enjoyability, and ergonomics of the <br/> user interface within the technical constraints of the projects; <li>Participate in build reviews with your teammates and stakeholders.</li>  <div></div><div><strong>YOU ARE:</strong></div> <br/>• <strong>Experienced:</strong> You have at <br/> least two (2) completed projects in Video games or other relevant industries as <br/> UI Artist, UI Designer, UX Designer, Motion or Graphic Designer or equivalent. <br/> You have experience in AAA game development (asset); <br/><br/> • <strong>Competent:</strong> You know the <br/> video game development pipeline and you are efficient with game engines and <br/> game editors; <br/><br/> • <strong>Versatile:</strong> You’re an expert <br/> in Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, After Effects, InDesign, etc) <br/> and you can adapt to various tools, including internal ones. You also <br/> have basic skills in scripting or programming (asset); <br/><br/> • <strong>Talented:</strong> You’re able to <br/> present an exceptional portfolio to showcase your expertise in graphic design <br/> and excellent artistic sense; <br/><br/> • <strong>Informed:</strong> You have a good understanding <br/> of game art development and newest features. You are also aware of technical <br/> constraints and features related to the field; <br/><br/> • <strong>Organized:</strong> You like to work <br/> in in collaboration with your team and you can achieve quality within the established <br/> deadlines.</div> </div>  </div>  </div> </div> <br/>
Title: UI Designer - Beenox - Applicant bank

Job_Description: <div><strong>Ceridian. Makes Work Life Better™</strong> <br/><br/> This is our promise. Not only for our customers, but our employees as well. <br/><br/> Ceridian is a cloud company powered by people. Join us as we transform the world of work for millions of employees around the world. Our products help employees be paid on time, apply for promotions, grow their careers, and support their work/life fit. Our solutions and our people work together to help organizations control costs, save time, optimize their workforce, minimize risk and grow their businesses. <br/><br/> As a software company specializing in human capital management (HCM), Ceridian has not only invested heavily in cloud software development but in its people as well. We have a variety of career growth (Top Talent, Career Pathing, Tuition Reimbursement, & Job Rotation) and Diversity/Inclusion (YOUnity and Ceridian’s Women Network) programs to support your career journey at Ceridian. <br/><br/> We are looking for fun, intelligent, team oriented people who believe in our values: Customer Focus, Transparency, Diligence, Optimism, and Agility. <br/><br/> Find out why Ceridian employees declare Ceridian a Great Place to Work® in 2017, a Glassdoor Best Places to Work in 2017, and one of Canada’s Top 100 Employers for 2017!</div> <br/>  <div><div><strong>Job Overview</strong> <br/><br/> The Dayforce UI/UX design team is looking for a senior UI/UX designer. Our designs set industry standards in providing engaging user experiences that are both functional and intuitive. As part of a large UI/UX design team you will define the user experience of web and mobile applications used by hundreds of thousands of employees around the world. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities:</strong> <ul> <li>Lead the user-centered design process</li> <li>Collaborate with product management and development throughout the design and development process</li> <li>Create designs and produce storyboards</li><li>Present designs to internal and external stakeholders and audiences</li><li>Conduct user research throughout the design process</li><li>Analyze competitor products</li><li>Acquire a thorough understanding of the domain</li> <li>Contribute to design guidelines and best practices</li> </ul> <strong>Minimum Qualifications:</strong> <ul> <li>A degree in a relevant discipline plus 5+ years related experience or equivalent</li><li>Excellent communication and collaboration skills</li><li>A passion for delivering outstanding products</li><li>A track record of creating successful user experiences</li> </ul> <strong>Preferred Qualifications:</strong> <ul> <li>Experience working in an agile development environment</li><li>Experience designing enterprise SaaS application</li></ul></div> </div><br/>   <div>Ceridian combines the excitement of a startup environment, with the growth opportunities of a large organization. We believe our employees should be happy and healthy, with peace of mind and a sense of fulfillment. We provide our employees with comprehensive benefits for various life circumstances and needs, great opportunities for career development, and a balanced lifestyle to achieve personal and professional success. <br/><br/> Ceridian is fueled by the diversity of our talented employees. We are an equal opportunity employer and embrace all individuals and what makes them unique. We consider all applicants, regardless of age, religion, race, color, ancestry, gender, gender identity, disability, national origin, race, sexual orientation, military or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, provincial or local laws. We enthusiastically encourage all individuals to apply for positions that fit their passions. Come join our inclusive team and start collaborating with us on award winning projects! <br/><br/> Connect with us on Twitter @CeridianCareers or Facebook CeridianCareers <br/><br/> We thank all applicants in advance for their interest in this position, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted. </div>  <br/>
Title: Senior UI/UX Designer

Job_Description: ABOUT US<br/><br/>TribalScale is an innovation firm that brings organizations - from the startup to the enterprise - into the future. We build digital products, transform teams, and grow startups. We’re headquartered in Toronto and have offices around the world. The future is bright, and we’re always looking for excited technologists to create with us. <br/><br/> Some of the platforms that we work with: <ul>  <li>Mobile & Web (iOS, tvOS, Android)</li> <li>Voice User Interfaces (Amazon Alexa, Google Home)</li> <li>Connected Cars and Homes</li> <li>OTT (Roku, Fire TV)</li> <li>Beacon Solutions</li> <li>VR & AR</li> </ul>  ABOUT YOU<br/><br/>You're excited about designing the connected world and want to join a team of ambitious, like-minded technologists. You're passionate about the intersection of design and technology and strive to explore new meaningful interactions between the physical and digital worlds. You want to have high impact, drive design innovation, and have a meaningful contribution to both our work environment and client work at TribalScale. You strive in fast-paced, collaborative environments and are able to quickly switch gears between client work, internal initiatives, and supporting your peers under minimal supervision.<br/><br/>WHAT YOU’LL DO  <ul>  <li>Defining and leading digital transformations at a strategic level. Working with clients to determine where they need to go and how to get there</li> <li>Work closely with the Product Managers embedded with each team/projec</li> <li>Alignment of individual contributors up to the executive level in the client’s organization and our</li> <li>Working with clients as they are immersed with our teams, learning agile XP with lean methodologies.</li> <li>Measuring progress and while managing communications to an executive audience</li> </ul> <strong>REQUIREMENTS</strong> <ul>  <li>Proficiency of UX design discipline – user flows, wireframes, mockups, prototypes, etc.</li> <li>Proficiency with the latest design tools and software (Adobe CS, Sketch)</li> <li>Experience with Roku and FireTV</li> <li>Self-motivated to take initiative and ownership of your work.</li> <li>Immaculate attention to detail, typography, and interactivity.</li> <li>Have a user-centric mindset throughout your design process.</li> <li>Consistently up to date with the latest design trends and best practices.</li> <li>Collaborate well with Product Mangers, Engineers, Sales, and everyone else in our Tribe.</li> <li>Help guide product decisions through user testing and iterative feedback loops.</li> <li>Rapidly iterate on design prototypes and working applications.</li> <li>Produce materials for clients and developers, including user flows, wireframes, mockups, prototypes, and assets.</li> <li>Open to new tools and methodologies, yet opinionated about best practices.</li> <li>A strong portfolio that demonstrates previous work samples.</li> </ul> <strong>BONUS POINTS FOR</strong> <ul>  <li>VUI</li> <li>Voice skills</li> <li>Conversational interface design</li> <li>Experience with motion graphics / animation.</li> <li>Applied knowledge of user testing and validation techniques.</li> <li>Early adopter of new technology and gadgets.</li> <li>Familiar with Lean Startup Methodologies, Design Sprints, and Gamestorming.</li> </ul>  <strong>WHY YOU WANT TO BE AT TRIBALSCALE</strong>  <ul>  <li>Our values: Meritocracy, empowerment, and transparency.</li> <li>Our skills: Our teams were at the front the mobile revolution, are expert builders in Voice tech, and now, they’re connecting the world. They’ve work with brands including the NBA, Twitter, ABC, the CBC, Autonomics, and tons more.</li> <li>You matter: Everyone sits at the table and brings value. We love to be challenged, are happy to go with the flow, and we trust our gut.</li> <li>Growth: We’re a rocketship ready to take-off, you’ll get your hands dirty in every aspect of the business and there are tremendous opportunities for personal and professional growth. Seize them.</li> </ul>  BENEFITS<br/><br/><strong>Stay Happy & Healthy</strong> <ul>  <li>Health benefits: 100% medical, dental and vision coverage</li> <li>Wealthsimple Group Retirement Savings Plan (GRSP)</li> <li>Generous maternity and paternity leave policies</li> <li>Daily hot breakfast</li> <li>Fully stocked kitchen: unlimited drinks and snacks</li> <li>Office fitness and social events</li> <li>Office closed over Winter holidays</li> <li>Corporate-discounted GoodLife membership</li> <li>Perkopolis: company perk plan</li> <li>Free Netflix membership</li> </ul> <strong>Make Meaningful Connections</strong> <ul>  <li>Friday socials to cap off a great week</li> <li>Regular office activities: game nights, movie nights, group fitness, and more</li> <li>Quarterly team events: axe-throwing, beach day, and more</li> <li>Take your pick at a gaming break: Super Smash Bros, foosball, ping pong</li> </ul> <strong>Discover Your Potential</strong> <ul>  <li>Tickets to local events, conferences & meet-ups</li> <li>Out-of-town conference subsidies</li> <li>$2000 annual professional development allowance</li> <li>Weekly Lunch & Learns with industry leaders</li> <li>$3000 referral bonus</li> </ul> <strong>Want To See The World?</strong> <br/><br/> Our employees have the opportunity to rotate through our offices, giving employees the chance to travel, experience new cultures and discover their full potential.
Title: UI/UX Designer

Job_Description: <div>Our client s looking for a talented and motivated individual to join their team as a UX/UI Designer. You will be joining a dynamic team of energetic individuals focused on delivering an innovative software solution for the fitness industry. If you’ve got that spark and want to be a part of a dynamic team building something great, we look forward to hearing from you!</div><br/>  <div><strong>JOB RESPONSIBILITIES</strong></div><div>· Create diagrams, sketches, wireframes, mock ups and interactive prototypes and concepts</div><div>· Work with product teams to design intuitive experiences for the business and end users of our software</div><div>· Develop solutions to design problems while satisfying user and technical requirements</div><div>· Executing designs from prototypes to final solutions</div><div>· Researching current design trends and developments to stay current</div><div>· Collaborating with product teams to plan and create compelling experiences</div><div>· Clearly articulate your design vision and provide suggestions on best practices for bringing designs to life</div><br/> <div><strong>QUALIFICATIONS</strong></div><div>· Minimum of 2 years of experience designing with product teams</div><div>· Diploma or certificate in digital design</div><div>· Proficiency in Sketch, Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign and other design tools</div><div>· Extremely detail oriented and able to collaborate with different teams</div><div>· Strong written and verbal communication skills</div>
Title: UI/UX Designer

Job_Description: News360 employs state-of-the-art natural language processing and personalisation algorithms to build content personalisation and analysis product for consumers and businesses, including the award-winning News360 mobile app, and the NativeAI publisher analytics suite. We provide personalised news recommendations tracking millions of different interests, and build publisher analytics tools that drive content strategies reaching millions of readers every day. <br/><br/> We are looking for a talented UX/UI Designer to join our team. News360 is built with a design-centric approach, and usability and elegance are a big part of our DNA - we are committed to creating products that stand out from the rest and we want your passion for design excellence. You have demonstrated your abilities and strive to create an elegant user experience working alongside a cross-functional team. <br/><br/> Responsibilities: <ul>  <li>Conceptualizing and creating intuitive, engaging, and consistent experiences on all platforms relevant to News360.</li> <li>Immersing yourself in data and customer/business needs to best visualize data.</li> <li>Designing dashboards and data visualizations for analytics tools used by leading news organizations and brands.</li> <li>Sharing product ownership, and participating in the development process from conceptualization, through design, development, testing, release, and maintenance.</li> <li>Researching and tracking advancements in mobile application design patterns.</li> <li>Following and understanding trends in the mobile and web industries.</li> </ul> <strong>Requirements</strong> <ul>  <li>1+ years experience designing web and mobile apps with portfolio of design samples.</li> <li>Bachelor's degree in visual design, human factor and interaction design (or equivalent experience).</li> <li>A deep appreciation for clean, simple, usable interfaces.</li> <li>Solid skills in visual design, with an eye for typography, intuitive layout, and a pixel-level attention to detail.</li> <li>Deeply creative with a thirst for understanding, and is outcome-focused.</li> <li>Knowledge of Bohemian Coding Sketch</li> </ul> Bonus Points: <ul>  <li>You have strong skills in visualizing data</li> <li>Portfolio with complex dashboards or analytics tools is a big plus</li> <li>Understanding of mobile UX principles including iOS and Android guidelines</li> <li>You're a news junkie</li> </ul> <strong>Benefits</strong> <ul>  <li>Choose your own hardware when you join</li> <li>Great insurance package</li> <li>15 vacation days</li> <li>Flexible hours - we track performance, not butts-in-seats</li> <li>A team of top developers in their fields</li> <li>Millions of happy users that love News360</li> <li>Always fresh fruit and tasty coffee</li> </ul>
Title: UX/UI Designer

Job_Description: <strong>About BrainStation:</strong> <br/><br/> BrainStation is empowering working professionals, freelancers, and entrepreneurs with the skills needed to succeed digitally. By 2025, BrainStation will have innovation hubs in major cities worldwide and will have educated young minds, powerful politicians, fortune 500 CEOs and the newest wave of disruptive start-up founders through in-person and online training engagements. With locations in New York, Toronto, San Jose and Vancouver, we’re well on our way. As of the end of 2017, BrainStation has trained over 50,000 professionals with a team of over 250 industry expert instructors. We hire the best and brightest to make our vision a reality. <br/><br/> <strong>About the Role</strong> <br/><br/> BrainStation is looking for an experienced UI/UX Designer to join our Toronto team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for User Interface Design and work directly with our UI, UX, Project Management and Technology teams. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities</strong>  <ul> <li>Understand and solving functional problems for mobile users by designing rich UI experiences</li> <li>Staying up-to-date on mobile UI patterns and trends</li> <li>Researching, conceptualizing, wireframing and designing stunning work</li> <li>Communicating to members of the UX, development and project management teams</li> <li>Working with our team collaboratively to build industry leading systems</li> <li>Developing various designs for cross-platform applications</li> </ul> <strong>Successful candidates will have</strong>  <ul> <li>Strong conceptual thinking and design execution in both visual and interaction design</li> <li>Interactive experience and intimate knowledge of Photoshop, Illustrator and InDesign</li> <li>Solid understanding of designing intuitive wireframes, apps for phones, tablets and sites</li> <li>Great communication, organization skills and a passion for the digital space</li> <li>Must be able to quickly move from one project to the next and seamlessly</li> <li>Contribute ideas and collaborate with all levels of the team to produce stunning work</li> </ul> <em>Bonus Points:</em> have you taken any courses at BrainStation? A lot of our design and development best practices and processes are taught during our courses - make sure to highlight this experience in your cover letter if you have! <br/><br/> <em>BrainStation is committed to maintaining a diverse work environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants, regardless of race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status will receive consideration for employment. If you have any accessibility requirements or concerns regarding the hiring process or employment with us, please notify us so we can provide suitable accommodation.</em> <br/><br/> While we sincerely appreciate all applications, only those candidates selected for interview will be contacted.
Title: UX/UI Designer

Job_Description: The Kabam UX team is looking for a new teammate to join us in delivering exciting titles such as Marvel Contest of Champions and Transformers Forged to Fight. <br/><br/> As a UX designer, you have a good understanding of design principles and design thinking methodology. You are the type of person who loves to learn new things, whether it be software, design methods or simply how your newly-made friends work day-to-day. Although your leads will show you the ropes and help organize your tasks, you are proactive and seek out opportunities to help your team while contributing to the project. Having a leader-mentality is critical; you own your tasks, features, and overall project. You excel under pressure and find creative solutions to the problems at hand. Design process excites you and collaborating with others is your second nature. You believe that honest and genuine communication is the main ingredient for success, and are happy to openly share feedback with others. <br/><br/> Our values are simple - you must have have Nerd Passion! This means being curious, creative, enthusiastic, reasonably joyful, self-motivated and inspiring. We value challenging assumptions, advocating for UX design and always striving to understand our players. As a team member, you must adhere to“We-before-Me” philosophy - this means collaborating and sharing your passions. <br/><br/> Our team crafts both the user experience and interface designs for the titles we work on. We consider UI design to be part of UX design, and breakdown our work by feature. One UX designer is responsible for each feature, from the beginning to the end. This allows us to stay actively engaged with a project, while also focusing on a variety of interests throughout the development cycle. <br/><br/> What would my day look like? <ul> <li>Identifying and defining the goals and requirements of features, and assessing the impact of those features on other parts of your project</li><li>Determining user-targets, creating user-flows and wireframes, and building annotated documentation</li><li>Designing mockups and polishing the final product</li><li>Engaging in and leading conversations with stakeholders to communicate your design solutions</li><li>Learning and sharing best practices with the team</li><li>Pro-actively finding ways to improve our games and processes</li><li>Supporting other UX designers - promoting collaboration and helping with any extra workload</li><li>Working closely with different discipline members, such as:</li>  <ul> <li>Game designers to discuss and define game features and user-stories</li><li>Engineers to review technical requirements, annotations and implementation</li><li>Live Operations members to ensure all planned events and activities are supported</li><li>Back-end programming to determine further technical requirements</li><li>QA analysts to ensure the quality and accuracy of the product is delivered and maintained</li></ul> </ul> What are the credentials? <ul> <li>2+ years of experience as a professional UI and/or UX designer</li><li>Education background in a HCI, UX, or a communication design related field</li><li>A strong portfolio demonstrating effective user experience flows, wireframes and interaction design work</li><li>Having an iterative design process that allows for fast iteration to ensure the best solutions are delivered</li><li>Ability to take complex information and turn it into user-friendly UI design solutions</li><li>A passion for solving human-centered design challenges and graphic design communication problems</li><li>Understanding of“free-to-play” business models, including customer acquisition, retention, and monetization</li><li>Being an active gamer - experience working on mobile games is a plus!</li><li>Bonus points if you have experience working with Unity</li> </ul> While you don’t need to be a hard-core mobile gamer, we do expect you to play the games that you work on, and understand the competitive landscape. After all, if you don’t know your product, you cannot design for it. <br/><br/> Excited by this opportunity? We invite you to apply and start the conversation with us!
Title: UX Designer

Job_Description: <div><div>About Us <br/>  <br/> ScopeMedia is an artificial intelligence company with a focus on proprietary computer vision technology. After being founded in Vancouver in 2013, ScopeMedia went on to open offices in Beijing and Hangzhou, China. For developers and entrepreneurs alike, ScopeMedia’s image and video recognition technology is easily adaptable to any project. <br/><br/> With customer behaviour and sentiment constantly evolving, accessibility to image based information has never been more vital. <br/>  <br/> About the Job <br/>  <br/> We are looking for a UI/UX designer to design, prototype, and refine the experience that define our mobile apps and web applications. As a member of the ScopeMedia team, you’ll work with the Production and Engineering teams to bring beauty and ease-of-use to our products <br/>  <br/> <strong>Responsibilities</strong>   <ul> <li>Understand and solve functional problems for mobile users by designing rich UI experiences</li> <li>Staying up-to-date on mobile UI patterns and trends</li> <li>Researching, conceptualizing, wireframing and designing stunning work</li> <li>Communicating with members of the development and project management teams</li> <li>Collaborate with users, the development team, and the marketing team to implement design</li> <li>Provide clear guidance to the team’s questions during implementation phases</li> <li>Identify and articulate user needs, build prototypes to test internally and through user research, and refine solutions in the face of data and other findings</li> <li>Create project deliverables that clearly and persuasively communicate the UX strategy and the reasoning behind it</li> <li>Prepare assets</li> <li>Staying abreast of industry best practices and trends for UI design and UX processes</li> </ul>  <strong>Requirements</strong>   <ul> <li>2-3+ years of UI/UX design excellence</li> <li>Experience working in a fast-paced, dynamic, and entrepreneurial environment</li> <li>Experience designing applications</li> <li>Interactive experience and intimate knowledge of Photoshop, Illustrator, Sketch, Marvel, etc.</li> <li>Ability to multitask and prioritize</li> <li>Dynamic problem solver</li> <li>A strong portfolio of work that demonstrates your skills, craft, intuition, problem solving, and expertise</li> <li>Design and manage style guidelines for our web and mobile apps across all platforms</li> <li>Process driven with remarkable intuition for product expectations and future development needs</li> <li>Solid intuition and strong passion for detailed interaction design (Marvel)</li> <li>Great communication and organization skills, ability to prioritize projects, communicate progress, and deliver on time</li> </ul>  Method of Application <br/>  <br/> ScopeMedia Headquarters is located in downtown Vancouver, British Columbia. To qualify, applicants must be legally authorized to work in Canada. <br/><br/> We thank all candidates who apply, however, only those being considered will be contacted. <br/><br/> Please send all cover letters and resumes to the email listed below. <br/><br/> careers@scopemedia.com</div> </div>
Title: UI/UX Designer

Job_Description: Job Description<br/><br/>Collaborative, assertive, flexible, passionate, driven, inspired. These aren’t just nice words, they’re the start of every great Fluidigm career. <br/><br/> We are a growing community of thinkers and creators, dedicated to pursuing the fundamental truths of biology. We seek to empower and inspire our customers and each other to push limits and envision ever more creative answers to “what if…?” As the industry pioneer and leader in revolutionary single-cell technology, we are committed to enabling biological exploration at every level. <br/><br/> And if you’re into all that too, we’re ready to commit to you. <br/><br/> We’re looking for an experienced Senior UX / UI Designer to revamp the user experience of our cutting-edge scientific software products. As our first UX hire, you’ll have the opportunity to build our software UX framework from the ground up. This includes creating a UX vision, conducting customer research, selecting design and prototyping tools, building UI prototypes & mock-ups, implementing feedback processes, and integrating the discipline of design into our development process. This is a greenfield activity, and you’re in the driver’s seat. <br/><br/> This is a 9 months contract with possibility of extension. This position is based in Markham, ON <br/><br/> <strong>About You</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>You are deeply curious about people.</strong> You are genuinely interested in interviewing internal stakeholders and customers, conducting usability tests, and sharing important insights with the team. You know how to translate findings into compelling stories and actionable recommendations that stick with teammates. These guideposts help others make decisions, implement features, and greenlight projects that make our products more delightful. <br/><br/> <strong>You are a self-starter.</strong> As our first UX hire, you will be helping the team define the best practices for integrating UX into a software team, to best enable design and collaboration. You should be comfortable in proactively establishing a UX direction. <br/><br/> <strong>You love to collaborate.</strong> You understand successful design doesn’t happen in a vacuum or in secret. You believe in sharing work early, openly, and often. You know how to work across functions (software, product management, support and engineering) to create a single, consistent UX vision. You help teams determine the research methods that will best answer their questions. You involve others throughout the research lifecycle and make it easy for them to participate in the process. <br/><br/> <strong>You know how design impacts development.</strong> You’ve built multiple products before, and you understand the technical complexities a design might introduce, and can work through them with your teammates. You don’t believe in “tossing designs over the wall,” and would dread doing so. <br/><br/> <strong>You love the challenge of making complicated things simpler and easier.</strong> Fluidigm gives world-class researchers and scientists the tools to make their next medical breakthrough, and we do so with complex products that involve both data acquisition and analysis components. Your work will help directly shape the direction of the product, and you flourish in the mission to give each scientist a simple yet powerful experience that enable and expedite their work. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities:</strong> <br/><br/> <ul>   <li>Collaborate with cross-functional stakeholders, both inside and outside Fluidigm, to proactively gather product requirements and create a high-level UX vision for our next gen desktop product</li> <li>Work within a team of software developers, testers, scientists and technical writer to create and deliver new software products and features that help advance scientific understanding</li> <li>Produce UI designs of various fidelity, ranging from quick sketches to mock-ups to detailed prototypes</li> <li>Strive to create an intuitive and engaging user experience with a modern, clean and sophisticated aesthetic sense, one that goes beyond just good design into actually delighting users</li> <li>Learn about mass cytometry and how it aids scientists in their quest to better understand cell characteristics and interactions within medical fields such as oncology, immunology and hematology</li>   <li>Establish and maintain detailed usability and design guidelines for the software development team, based on design trends, industry best practices and competitive benchmarking</li> <li>Plan and conduct user research and usability tests, documenting, communicating and acting upon the results</li> <li>Build relationships with customers and other functional groups to ensure alignment on UX vision</li> <li>During crunch times, be open to participating in software testing, technical writing, and/or software development activities (if you have a development background)</li> </ul> <strong>Skills & Experiences:</strong>  <ul>   <li>7+ years of hands-on UI and UX design experience, ideally with a mix of desktop and web/mobile products</li> <li>A genuine interest in science, and willingness to go out of your comfort zone to learn about concepts of biology, chemistry and physics</li></ul>   <ul>   <li>A strong understanding of current design trends in desktop, web and mobile applications</li></ul>   <ul>   <li>Proficiency in various research and design techniques such as qualitative research methods, personas, wireframing, task analysis, sketching, prototyping, usability testing, etc.</li> <li>Experience with prototyping and workflow tools such as Sketch, InVision, Balsamiq, Adobe XD, etc.</li> <li>An eye for nuance and details. You’re often praised for spotting usability issues that no one else can.</li></ul>   <ul>   <li>Experience in agile software development using a Scrum, XP or Kanban methodology, and an understand of software development project lifecycles</li> <li>Strong negotiation, influencing and communication skills. This is critical as you’ll be interacting with stakeholders and customers who are experts and pioneers in their fields.</li> <li>Excellent communications skills. You can distill complex topics into simple discussions.</li> <li>A great attitude towards work. You work hard, and enjoy working in a close-knit team environment with a diverse range of personalities.</li> </ul> <strong>Nice-to-Haves:</strong> <br/><br/> In addition to the basic skills needed for being successful, the following could set you apart from the pack!  <ul>   <li>A software development background. Ability to prototype your designs in working C# WPF code.</li> <li>Experience designing scientific software products and/or those that interface with scientific instrumentation or hardware equipment</li> </ul> <strong>Education Background:</strong>  <ul>   <li>As our products are of a scientific nature, ideally you have a Science or Engineering degree in Biology, Chemistry or Physics</li> <li>Candidates with Visual Design or Computer Science/Engineering degrees with a demonstrated interest in science will be considered</li> </ul> <strong>We Will:</strong>  <ul>   <li>Value your contribution, enlist your feedback, and support you in your ongoing development and contribution both as an employee and a person</li> <li>Provide you with a fun, modern, sun-filled work environment in Markham, Ontario, near Rouge River walking trails and just 5 minutes drive off of Highway 404, 407 or highway 7</li> <li>Host excellent company-wide events multiple times a year</li>   <li>Offer onsite yoga classes, espresso and fruits, ping pong and foosball tables, board games, samosa socials, walking and running clubs, an outstanding working environment and, seriously, a lot more</li> </ul> <strong>How to Apply</strong><strong>:</strong> <br/><br/> For this position, please submit:  <ul>   <li>Your resume and cover letter</li> <li>A portfolio of your best work, so that we can get a sense of your design experience and aesthetic direction</li> <li>Answers to the following questions: What are some examples of great UX/UI that you admire today? How do they elevate the user experience? What is one change you’d make about them?</li> <li>Anything else that will let us know more about your skills and experiences that you’d be willing to share, ie. your blog, Twitter, Behance, Dribbble, GitHub, etc.</li> </ul> <em>The Company is committed to providing an inclusive and barrier free recruitment process to applicants with accessibility needs in accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA). If you require an accommodation during this process, please inform The Company of your requirements. We are an equal opportunity employer.</em>
Title: Senior UX / UI Designer - contract

Job_Description: The design team is looking for an experienced designer to help create great-looking, functional digital experiences for our clients. As a UI/UX Designer at ImageX, youll be part of the entire project lifecycle from start to finish. A good digital experience is the result of having a designer at the key stages of a project: research/planning, wireframing/prototyping, design, and final visual QA of the build itself. We believe that Collaboration = Quality, so the right candidate will love working in a team-based environment. We are looking for a designer who is a constant learner and stays up to date with the latest digital design techniques and trends, and loves to share them with the rest of the team. Previous agency experience or designing a digital product is key. <br/> For the right candidate, this position can range from ongoing freelance to potential full-time hire. ImageX has team members located around the world, because we look for the best of the best no matter where youre located. Our people make the difference. <br/><br/> <strong>What We're Looking For:</strong>  <ul> <li>A portfolio that rocks, highlighting your design aesthetic and UX problem-solving</li> <li>3+ years of experience designing for the web</li> <li>Proficiency in industry-standard design and UX software</li> <li>The ability to articulate your design rationale with the internal team and clients</li> <li>Prototyping and interaction design experience, creating clickable flows to refine our decisions</li> <li>Clearly translates stakeholder goals and user-flows into a well-thought out design system</li> <li>Thrives working in a team-based environment, rich in collaboration</li> <li>A solid understanding of the latest design best practices, trends, and mobile technologies</li> </ul> <strong>How to Apply:</strong> <br/><br/> Please apply through our online application form with your cover letter, a link to your portfolio and resume. If you have any links to key design sites such as Behance, Dribbble, etc. please include those as well. <br/><br/> <strong>About ImageX:</strong> <br/><br/> ImageX is an award-winning web agency that was founded in 2001. With over 200 successful site launches, we have the expertise needed to ensure success. Some of our clients include Disney, Stanford, Indiana State, Linux, Portland State, A&E and many others. Were located at the nexus of one of the best places on earth with our main office in beautiful Vancouver, British Columbia and our European office in the tech hub of Kiev, Ukraine. Our goal is to exceed the expectations of both clients and our team which means we value creativity, involvement, flexibility & the constant high of being crazy in love with what we do. Learn more about us at http://imagexmedia.com/about
Title: UI/UX Designer
