Job_Description: <div> <div> <div> <div>We value diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive workplace that inspires each of us to be the best we can be. Join our team and make a difference!</div>  </div> </div>  </div> <div> <div> Your Job</div>  </div> <div> <div> <div> <div><strong><em>About us</em></strong> <br/> How do you imagine life at an insurance company - its people, its culture, its offices? We bet that if you swing by Intact Lab, you'll be in for quite the surprise! With offices in downtown Toronto and Montreal, the Lab is a digital innovation hub tasked with creating cutting-edge insurtech products that improve the lives of millions of Canadians. <br/><br/> The Lab merges the best of two worlds: the speed and culture of a start-up, with the resources and means of a large enterprise (you'll have access to all the tools you've ever dreamed of!). With a dynamic team, exciting challenges, beautiful offices, inspiring colleagues and a great work culture (we rank as one of Canada's top 100 places to work), Intact Lab offers an amazing environment to develop your skills and grow your career. <br/><br/> <strong><em>About you</em></strong> <br/> Are you passionate about e-commerce and digital innovation? Are you skilled at translating complex requirements into usable and delightful experiences? Do you keep on top of the latest trends in design and love experimenting with new tools and methodologies? We've got the perfect opportunity for you! <br/><br/> <strong><em>Role</em></strong> <br/> As a UX/UI Designer, you play a mission critical role in conceiving and evolving our digital ecosystem. Reporting to the Director, Digital Innovation, your main responsibilities are :  <ul>   <li>Conceiving compelling experiences that help achieve business objectives</li>   <li>Validating usability and usefulness via user testing and user research</li>   <li>Producing relevant UX and design deliverables where required</li>   <li>Driving a roadmap alongside a product manager and a multidisciplinary agile team</li>   <li>Presenting work to stakeholders</li>   <li>Helping engineers produce quality, delightful interfaces</li>   <li>Being an advocate for user-centered, data-driven design</li> </ul>   </div> </div> </div>  </div> <div> <div> Your Skills</div>  </div> <div> <div> <div> <div>   <ul>   <li>At least 3 years of experience</li>   <li>Expertise in usability and user-centered design practices</li>   <li>Mastery of design tools (Sketch, Axure, InVision, Illustrator, etc.)</li>   <li>Experience with UX research tools an asset (usertesting.com, Optimal Workshop, etc.)</li>   <li>Experience in producing process flows, content inventories, etc.</li>   <li>You love working in a collaborative environment that has a strong focus on teamwork, innovation, open minds and having fun</li> </ul> <em>Please include your portfolio in your application.</em> <br/><br/> <em><strong>You are</strong></em>  <ul>   <li>Fun to work with</li>   <li>Creative, analytical, curious and ingenious</li>   <li>A team player that can share and receive constructive feedback</li>   <li>You excel at explaining your ideas to different stakeholders</li>   <li>Deeply passionate about design and quality</li>   <li>Organized and proactive</li> </ul> <strong><em>As a full-time employee your benefits include :</em></strong>  <ul>   <li>A competitive salary</li>   <li>An annual performance bonus</li>   <li>A pension plan</li>   <li>Flexible work hours and a 35 hour work week</li>   <li>Top of the line medical and dental insurance</li>   <li>And many more benefits (gym refunds, paid conferences, etc.)</li> </ul>   </div> </div> </div>  </div> <div> <div> Closing Statement</div>  </div> <div> <div> <div> <div><strong>This opportunity interests you? We look forward to meeting you!</strong> <br/><br/> As part of Intacts selection process, candidates may be requested to consent to background checks relevant to the role under consideration for, prior to receiving a job offer. These could include: work references, education and credential confirmation, employment verification, identity check, credit report, criminal offence and drivers license record. <br/><br/> You can apply for a posted position if you have been in your current position for at least 12 months and are performing at a satisfactory level.Please note we may have identified other internal candidates through our Employee Development Program, and that the selection process may also be opened to external applicants. <br/><br/> Excellent benefits are offered: competitive salary, flexible benefits, flexible work arrangements, flexible leave, pension plan defined benefit, etc. <br/><br/> <strong>This posting closes on June 02, 2018.</strong></div>  </div> </div>  </div> <div> <div> Referral Bonus</div>  </div> <div> <div> <div> <div>THIS POSITION IS ELIGIBLE FOR A REFERRAL BONUS OF $3000. <br/><br/> #li-qc</div>  </div> </div>  </div> <div> <div> Eligibility to work in Canada</div>  </div> <div> <div> <div> <div>Applicants must be permanently eligible to work in Canada upon hire. Proof of eligibility for permanent roles may come in the form of a Canadian birth certificate, Canadian passport, Canadian citizenship certificate, permanent residence card or confirmation.</div>  </div> </div>  </div> <div> <div> Indeed Sponsored</div>  </div> <div> <div> <div> <div>IN-INEN</div>  </div> </div>  </div>
Title: UX/UI Designer

Job_Description: <strong>We’re on the hunt…</strong><br/><br/>RedRhino is looking for a wildly talented intermediate UI/UX designer to join our team. You are a talented designer with a strong web and digital design portfolio, and a passion for translating brands and ideas to digital and interactive spaces. <br/><br/> Our multidisciplinary creative team is comprised of graphic designers, mobile and web developers, software engineers and brand strategists working cohesively work to offer our clients truly integrated solutions. They get the best of everything and everyone under one roof. You’ll be a part of an innovative, talented team that you can learn, grow, and also have some fun with. Your talent, skill, and hard work will be valued and rewarded.<br/><br/>The Role:<br/><br/>As a UI/UX Designer, you will report to our Art Director and work within a strategic creative team bring ideas to life on the web, mobile devices, digital advertising, and rich media instances as well as assist in crafting other digital experiences designed to solve client challenges and address marketing needs determined by Account Managers and strategic leaders. You have a high level of skill designing for optimal user interaction and flow across digital platforms and are proficient in Adobe Creative Suite as well as Sketch, wireframing and prototyping software. Your great attention to detail and pride in your work are supported by the ability to thrive in a dynamic, collaborative, fast-paced environment.<br/><br/>The successful designer will:   <ul> <li>Be able to work well both independently and within a team of creatives, designers and developers in the conceptualization and production of various projects</li> <li>Have a firm grasp on the latest and most innovative digital design trends and able to distill and translate the best of those trends into client/project work in a day-to-day context</li> <li>Be able to lead digital-focused projects</li> <li>Be comfortable rationalizing design solutions and providing feedback on other designs</li> <li>Provide feedback and solutions to design problems within a digital context</li> <li>Be able to work on large-scale team projects and individual assignments, delivering precise and error-free work</li> <li>Stay positive and analytical</li> <li>Be detail-oriented, with excellent organizational skills at every step of the process</li> <li>Take direction well</li> <li>Be able to roll out production items seamlessly, following other designers’ creative direction</li> </ul>  <strong>Qualifications</strong>   <ul> <li>2+ years’ experience</li></ul>   <ul> <li>A strong portfolio demonstrating digital and UI/UX design skills</li> <li>Expertise in creating wireframes and site mapping</li> <li>UX and user research experience</li> <li>Experience with HTML and CSS</li> <li>An ability to produce wireframes, storyboards, and communicate interaction models</li> <li>Proficiency with visual design software (Illustrator, Photoshop, and Sketch)</li> </ul>  <strong>Responsibilities</strong>   <ul> <li>Ideating and completing interface design and user experience breakouts for web, Android, and iOS applications from concept to completion to brief an experienced development team</li> <li>Creating wireframes, prototypes, storyboards, and user flow models</li> <li>Leading digital projects within an integrated brand strategy, design and development team</li> <li>Staying on top of best practices and trends in the digital world</li> </ul> <strong>To apply, please send your resume to</strong>  careers@red-rhino.com<strong>, referencing</strong> <strong>UI/UX Designer</strong> <strong>in the subject line.</strong> Compensation will be commensurate with experience. This position is open to Canadian residents only. We appreciate the time it takes to apply, but we are only able to contact those being considered for the position. Thanks for your understanding! <br/><br/> Please send resumes and cover letters to  <br/> <br/>  careers@red-rhino.com <br/> <br/>  or submit your application using the form provided below.
Title: UI/UX Designer

Job_Description: <strong><strong>UX/UI Designer:</strong></strong> <br/><br/> We’re looking for a talented designer to join our <strong>Penticton Development Team</strong>! <br/><br/> At Windward Software we build software solutions that empower efficient business growth in small to medium businesses.From inventory control to payroll, and accounting, our solutions allow the entrepreneurs of today to grow their businesses for tomorrow.We have thousands of customers in 35 countries around the world processing over 1.5 billion in annual sales.We like to have fun while we also learn new skills and have several software development company awards to prove it. <br/><br/> <strong>We are growing!</strong> Our solutions are moving to the cloud and we need a talented, creative UX/UI Designer to join our team. <br/><br/> You will learn to understand our business requirements and technical limitations, as well as be responsible for conceiving and conducting user research, interviews and surveys, and translating them into sitemaps, user flows, customer journey maps, wireframes, mock-ups and prototypes. The UX designer will also design the overall functionality of our software solutions. <br/><br/> Working with C-level execs, development team and others in a collaborative environment, your key responsibility is to ensure a functionally sound and amazing user experience. <br/><br/> You are passionate about design and innovation and take pride in staying on top of design trends, ensuring the Windward Software customers’ user experience is second to none. <br/><br/> We don’t expect you to code on the job, but having that skill and knowing enough about technology and Agile development will allow you to participate in meaningful discussions with the team. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities and Duties</strong> <ul> <li>Working closely with Windward customers, C-level executives, development team and others, you will be responsible for the UX strategy which is the blueprint that will help drive development, visual design and ultimately the customer experience</li><li>You will be creating information architecture by researching, conceiving, wireframing, sketching, prototyping, and mocking up user experiences for our Windward Software products</li><li>Define how an application will look and work in different platforms and browsers</li><li>Make strategic design and user-experience decisions related to core, and new, functions and features</li><li>Work with the team to shape a project’s overall creative output and maintain quality</li><li>Introduce, support and encourage compliance with UX/UI best practices</li> <li>2 years’ experience in UX development, preferably within an Agile team environment</li><li>Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science is required.Formal education in the fields of Visual Design, Communications, or Psychology are also beneficial</li> <li>Expertise in standard UX software such as InVision , Axure, UXPin, Balsamiq, OmniGraffle and the like is a must</li><li>Big picture thinker, creative with strong collaborative and communication skills</li><li>Able to build low/high fidelity mock-ups for Web and Mobile applications</li><li>Passionate about resolving user pain points through highly functional, visually appealing, design</li><li>Known for your keen attention to detail and skills in typography, iconography, visual design principles, readability, and legibility</li><li>You love brainstorming and have a good nerf shot!</li><li>Demonstrated knowledge of responsive design principles, user interaction design and experience and posses a clear understanding of the importance of user-centered design</li><li>Basic HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript skills are a plus</li><li>Ability to work effectively in a team setting including synthesizing abstract ideas into concrete design implications</li><li>Proven ability to regularly deliver design solutions for approval in a timely manner</li><li>Ability to rapidly produce multiple visual UI/UX concepts for comparison and prototyping</li> </ul> <strong>Qualifications and Skills</strong> <ul> <li>2 years’ experience in UX development, preferably within an Agile team environment</li><li>Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science is required.Formal education in the fields of Visual Design, Communications, or Psychology are also beneficial.</li> <li>Expertise in standard UX software such as InVision , Axure, UXPin, Balsamiq, OmniGraffle and the like is a must</li><li>Big picture thinker, creative with strong collaborative and communication skills</li><li>Able to build low/high fidelity mock-ups for Web and Mobile applications</li><li>Passionate about resolving user pain points through highly functional, visually appealing, design</li><li>Known for your keen attention to detail and skills in typography, iconography, visual design principles, readability, and legibility</li><li>You love brainstorming and can aim a nerf cannon like it's an extension of yourself</li><li>Demonstrated knowledge of responsive design principles, user interaction design and experience and posses a clear understanding of the importance of user-centered design</li><li>Basic HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript skills are a plus</li><li>Ability to work effectively in a team setting including synthesizing abstract ideas into concrete design implications</li><li>Proven ability to regularly deliver design solutions for approval in a timely manner</li><li>Ability to rapidly produce multiple visual UI/UX concepts for comparison and prototyping</li> </ul> <br/><br/> <strong>We offer:</strong>   <ul> <li>A comprehensive benefit package.</li> <li>Lakes, beaches, wineries – all in our backyard! Take your lunch break at beautiful Skaha Beach – literally just a block away.</li> <li>We have a huge staff lounge area with gym equipment, pool table and showers on-site.</li> <li>Tickets for events at the South Okanagan Events Centre (SOEC).</li> <li>Social activities such as golf tournaments, holiday festivities, etc. <br/><br/> <strong>Please note:</strong> If you are selected for an interview, please prepare and bring a portfolio of your work that demonstrates your creative design skills, along with completed or work-in-progress examples. <br/><br/> <strong>Interested?</strong> <br/><br/> Send your details to careers@windwardsoftware.com and don’t forget a cover letter! While we appreciate all interest, only those selected for further discussion will be contacted. Thank you.</li>  </ul>
Title: UX/UI Designer

Job_Description: <div> <div><div><div><div><div>Tactio is the unique and highly specialized software developer of TactioRPM, a cloud-based platform helping leading healthcare organizations design, build and launch patient-centered digital health programs. Working at Tactio is the opportunity to create the future of healthcare with an exclusive access into the world’s most advanced digital health programs while working from the stylish comfort of Old Montreal with multi-disciplinary teams of smart, dedicated and passionate professionals. <br/><br/> We’re looking for a creative problem-solver, detail-oriented and highly energetic UX/UI Designer to design and develop highly engaging user experiences for beautiful patient/healthcare professional solutions running on TactioRPM, working with a laser-sharp focus on simplicity, elegance and accessibility for elederly/non-technical users.</div></div></div></div></div></div><br/>   <div><div><div><div> <div><strong>Responsibilities :</strong></div></div></div><div><div><div>  <ul> <li>Team up with sales & marketing to analyse customer requirements, define user stories, design and implement complete solutions including functionalities, visuals, and app experience;</li><li>Follow-up on your design throughout development by participating in sprint planning, daily standups and technical meetings, keeping operations aligned with design objectives;</li><li>Create user stories (we call them “patient journeys”), wireframes, storyboards, process flows, interaction prototypes, and site maps to communicate interaction and design ideas;</li><li>Design and code the markup, conduct user testing, and perform other user-facing activities to validate the design, and interaction;</li><li>Provide final detailed design specifications and assets for front-end developers to implement;</li><li>Develop mobile and cross-browser compatible responsive front-end interfaces;</li><li>Conduct user research and evaluate user feedback.</li></ul></div> </div></div></div><div><div></div></div><div><div><div><div>Qualifications</div></div></div><div><div><div>  <ul> <li>Three (3) + years UX/UI working experience;</li><li>Portfolio showing skills and passion for beautiful, functional user interfaces;</li><li>Experience with Adobe Creative Suite and/or other wireframing tools;</li><li>Proficiency creating storyboards, user/process flows, interaction prototypes, and site maps;</li><li>Front-end programming knowledge, and experience working in Agile/Scrum;</li><li>Bilingual (English & French) with excellent oral and written communication skills.</li></ul></div> </div></div></div><div><div><div><div>Applying:<br/><br/>If you like what you see, reach out to rh@tactiohealth.com (subject line UX/UI Designer) with your CV and portfolio. No need for a cover letter with any usual yada yada. We’d like to see what you’re proud of and hear about how you can contribute to Tactio and our clients.</div></div><div><div> <div> I WANT TO APPLY</div> </div></div></div></div></div> <br/>  <div> <div></div></div> <br/>
Title: UX/UI Designer

Job_Description: Soshal is a creative and marketing agency. We design and market products and experiences for some of the worlds top brands and local underdogs. <br/><br/> You have passion and a desire to contribute to the creation of design solutions. You love the craft of design and user experience and you labour over the details. You enjoy following design systems and directions but embrace the opportunity to craft something new. <br/><br/> You are eager to learn and grow and are willing to do what is necessary to ensure your work is something you can be proud of. You expect the same of those who surround you. <br/><br/> <strong>Your role:</strong>  <ul> <li>Contribute to various digital projects including websites, brand development, campaigns, and more;</li> <li>Engage with clients through the design process through working sessions, presentations, and feedback sessions;</li> <li>Ensure work executed is solving problems, and speaking to audiences outlined in creative briefs;</li> <li>Collaborate with content specialists, marketers, and developers to craft the best possible solution;</li> <li>Work with project managers to ensure that your projects are on track;</li> <li>Constantly be learning and growing;</li> <li>Follow and support the constant iteration and improvement of our processes and standards.</li> </ul> <strong>What you'll bring:</strong>  <ul> <li>2+ years of design experience;</li> <li>Confidence in presenting to stakeholders at all levels;</li> <li>Knowledge of visual design, experience design, brand development, and design thinking;</li> <li>Ability to collaborate with internal teams, gather and accept feedback;</li> <li>An ability to find simple solutions to complex problems;</li> <li>A strong attention to detail;</li> <li>A comfort in working with flexible processes, knowing when to shift paths when necessary;</li> <li>A passion for the craft of design;</li> </ul> <strong>What you'll get:</strong><ul> <li>A great team to work with that is dedicated to doing amazing work;</li> <li>Flexible work hours: be in the office when you need to be, work from home (or wherever you want) when you don't;</li> <li>Comprehensive benefits that cover you from dental to massages</li> <li>Five weeks of paid time off;</li> <li>A great location close to coffee shops, bakeries, and lots of lunch spots (and a stocked beer fridge in the lunch room);</li> </ul> <strong>How to apply:</strong> <br/><br/> If you're interested in this position, apply now online, and be sure to include links to stuff you're proud of: your portfolio, sites you've designed (even if they're experimental or personal projects), a link to your Dribbble account (or Behance, or other showcases).
Title: UI/UX Designer

Job_Description: <strong>Who we are:</strong> <br/><br/> Creating a planet fueled by reliable, clean energy isnt what keeps us up at night; its what gets us out of bed. At Opus One Solutions, we pursue solutions that will change how countries access and distribute electrical energy. From microgrids that keep things running in the event of an outage to how Tesla's latest batteries can help accelerate the integration of renewable energy. From how electric utilities can optimize their operations and reduce their carbon footprint to how every homeowner will feed energy into a power grid fueling the electrical sharing economy. <br/><br/> At Opus One Solutions, we believe some of the best talent in the tech industry share our passion for delivering technology that matters and that will make a difference, in our lifetime and beyond. We want to work with people who love the complexities of software; who believe in its power to transform the world into a better place. <br/><br/> Good people know that great ideas are everywhere and what matters most is practical execution. Turning vision into reality is the hard part. But, when its creating technical solutions that support access to renewable energy, its an engineering feat worth contributing to. <br/><br/> <strong>The opportunity</strong> <br/><br/> Opus One Solutions is looking for a UI/UX Designer who will be entrusted with guiding the development of our all-important UX. We need someone who is passionate about designing innovative, engaging products that deliver both business value and a great experience for users. A Designer who is able to build great relationships with subject matter experts and convert their knowledge of energy and power systems into actionable designs. Someone who has the maturity to champion their design choices while respecting the work and input of the experts. <br/><br/> This is a role for a UI/UX Designer who wants to gather requirements, present ideas, make decisions and create rapid prototypes. Someone who approaches complex information with straightforward questions, who knows how to get detailed information from power systems people and how to drill down to the essence of what is needed. <br/><br/> <strong>What is GridOS?</strong> <br/><br/> Our flagship product, GridOS is a first-of-its-kind tool designed to empower utilities to take control of their grid and in the process accelerate the adoption of renewable energy. It combines a core analytics engine, a suite of I/O integrations and a rich web-based user interface to take a sea of real-world data and help utilities plan for optimally operated grids with modern energy resources. <br/><br/> <strong>Who are you?</strong> <br/><br/> You are a UI/UX Designer with a passion for transforming technical user stories into engaging and intuitive designs. You thrive in the role of UI/UX champion, representing both the voice of the end-user and the best practices in your field. You are looking for a company with a purpose, one that is in an exciting growth phase. <br/><br/> You might be working at a large design or web consultancy, moving from one client project to another. Or, you might be at a late-stage startup where you are the one-stop-shop for design from wireframing to graphics; taking requirements to functional prototypes. You have a virtual artists palette and a toolbox of technologies you use to demonstrate your training and your instinct. <br/><br/> <strong>Whats in it for you?</strong> <br/><br/> Challenges. The electrical power grid is a lifeline to millions of people. It is also an incredibly complex network being controlled by archaic software that was designed decades before UX was a thing. Your challenge is taking power systems blueprints and real-time data about the grid and translate that into an intuitive and easy to understand UX. Think Google maps for electricity. <br/><br/> A chance to make an impact. The projects you will work on will be not just local or national but global firsts-of-their-kind. You will set the tone for everything that follows. <br/><br/> Personal and professional satisfaction. You want to do meaningful work. You dont just want to build pretty mobile screens for e-commerce or B2B. You want to build technology solutions that matter. <br/><br/> <strong>Heres what our UI/UX Designer will do:</strong>  <ul> <li>Own it. You will take on responsibility for the UI and UX of the application, ensuring a clean, elegant interface with logical transitions and a user-friendly, intuitive workflow.</li> <li>Bring it to life. You will convert complex business requirements into pixel perfect designs; bringing them to life with a variety of usability techniques.</li> <li>Design. You will design intuitive interfaces, logical task workflows and responsive layouts that meet the needs and vision of the product team and the end-user.</li> <li>Create. You will provide insights and create wireframes, storyboards, user flows and sitemaps. You will present concepts that are scalable.</li> <li>Collaborate. You will work across teams, with in-house and offshore developers to ensure the design is aligned with the business needs and implemented as designed.</li> </ul> <strong>Heres what you bring:</strong>  <ul> <li>Award-winning user interface building experience. You have 3-5 years working on UI and UX design with an emphasis on creating rich user experiences with clean UI layout and responsive performance. Experience with B2B design is a bonus. A related degree is an asset.</li> <li>A portfolio of your recent work demonstrating your ability to deliver eye-catching, intuitive, and engaging customer experiences including responsive web applications. You understand accessibility design requirements and best practices.</li> <li>A virtual palette. You have used a range of tools and technologies:</li> <li>Adobe Creative Suite (expert)</li> <li>A workload prioritisation tool such as TFS</li> <li>A wireframing / prototyping tool such as Omnigraffle, Balsamiq, Axure, Visio, Gliffy, Invision, Sketch, Figma - whatever your preferred tool is; you have the expertise.</li> <li>Translation skills. You can translate client requirements and complex user journeys into clearly laid out user stories and graphical workflows.</li> <li>A stellar analytical process and a checklist that balances advanced UI development and UI frameworks against essential functionality and nice-to-have customization.</li> <li>Technical abilities and focus. You can create rapid prototypes, wireframes, mockups, and more.</li> <li>Drive. You are results-driven and you thrive in a fast-paced environment.</li> <li>All of the skills needed in an awesome team player: outstanding communication skills, attention to detail, flexibility, and a sense of ownership and responsibility.</li> <li>Innovation. You have the ability to anticipate problems and provide creative, quick - and reliable - solutions to complex problems.</li> </ul> <strong>Why join Opus One Solutions?</strong> <br/><br/> Opus One is growing! After spending the last four years under the radar focused on research and pilot projects were ready to shine as one of Canadas top 10 game-changers named by CIX Cleantech! We are deploying exciting microgrid projects in North America and have partnerships with leading energy players such as Tesla and Advanced Microgrid Solutions. <br/><br/> Collectively, we are fanatical about the work we do. Our leadership has assembled carefully selected teams with some of the best strategic visionaries - and executors - in technology and the clean energy space. From the newest team member to the company founders, we are all driven by one common goal: to accelerate the integration of clean and sustainable energy in North America and the world. <br/><br/> As a team and a company, we are committed to working with like-minded people, with opinions and thoughts of their own that will contribute to our innovation and evolution. We equally want to work with people who like to get outside and spend time together on team outings, special events, to grab lunch or take part in off-site brainstorming retreats. Theres a lot of humility at Opus One Solutions. No one person is going to know it all its too complicated. We must work and innovate together to get the job done. <br/><br/> At Opus One Solutions we understand that not everyone develops their talent and hones their skills in a traditional way. Different paths and experiences are part of the diversity we know we need to succeed. If you feel you meet all or most of the qualifications we are seeking; and you are excited by the possibility of growing our company, take a chance and express your interest here. <br/><br/> Opus One Solutions welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.
Title: UI / UX Designer

Job_Description: <div> <div> The opportunity <br/>  <br/> We’re looking for a designer who’s passionate about creating meaningful experiences through beautifully designed products. You will partner with startups to shape and bring their dreams to life and help enterprises redefine the way they work and deliver value to their customers. You’ll bring your empathy of people, continuous improvement, and learning to the table. And collaborate with everyone from sales through development, design and QA to deliver great digital experiences for our partners and their customers.</div>  <br/><div> What we'd like to see   <ul>   <li>You can develop wireframes and create digital prototypes (e.g. Invision)</li> <li>You can research and empathize with the user to create personas, experience / journey maps</li> <li>You have experience in organizing and participating in user testing</li> <li>You can visualize experiences from static comps to fully fledged animations</li> <li>You understand digital design principles and elements, can work with existing atomic design / style guides. Bonus: have experience designing brand identities</li> <li>You’re proficient in Sketch, Invision, Photoshop and other design tools</li> <li>You have experience designing for mobile and can translate designs across native platforms (iOS and Android)</li> <li>You like to be in a super-collaborative environment, working alongside talented developers, designers, QA analysts, delivery managers and business partners throughout the lifecycle of a project</li> <li>You can simultaneously see the bigger picture and focus on the finer details</li> <li>You independently adopt new technologies and practices (e.g. tools, platforms, features, etc.)</li> <li>You love digital and keep your eye on best practices and emerging trends in web and mobile design</li> <li>You are capable in prioritizing and managing design tasks, can work independently while also recognizing when to ask for help</li> </ul>  </div>  <br/><div> Now a little about us <br/>  <br/> Established in 2010, we’re a closely knit team of developers, designers, QA Analysts and leaders who truly love what we do day in and day out. We’ve designed and developed products with companies such as PayPal, Tumblr, TELUS, Microsoft and YogaGlo. We work with early stage startups to help bring their first version products to market, and find product-market fit. We also work with large organizations to teach them how move quickly and create quality products by adopting startup cultures and habits. No matter the scale of the project, our goal is to create products and services that will help our partners further develop their business and deliver an application that people will enjoy using. <br/><br/> Joining Nascent means being able to work on products used by millions of people every day. You’ll be working in an open, honest and engaging environment in downtown Toronto. We offer great opportunities, competitive benefits and a ton of fun.</div>  <br/><div> Go on apply! <br/>  <br/> Nascent’s a great place to work, and we’d love for you to find out firsthand. To apply, e-mail us at careers@nascentdigital.com. Please include your resume or CV, a link to your online portfolio and the position for which you’re applying in the subject line. We look forward to hearing from you!</div> </div> <br/>
Title: Intermediate UX/UI Designer

Job_Description: ABOUT US<br/><br/>TribalScale is an innovation firm that brings organizations - from the startup to the enterprise - into the future. We build digital products, transform teams, and grow startups. We’re headquartered in Toronto and have offices around the world. The future is bright, and we’re always looking for excited technologists to create with us. <br/><br/> Some of the platforms that we work with: <ul>  <li>Mobile & Web (iOS, tvOS, Android)</li> <li>Voice User Interfaces (Amazon Alexa, Google Home)</li> <li>Connected Cars and Homes</li> <li>OTT (Roku, Fire TV)</li> <li>Beacon Solutions</li> <li>VR & AR</li> </ul>  ABOUT YOU<br/><br/>You're excited about designing the connected world and want to join a team of ambitious, like-minded technologists. You're passionate about the intersection of design and technology and strive to explore new meaningful interactions between the physical and digital worlds. You want to have high impact, drive design innovation, and have a meaningful contribution to both our work environment and client work at TribalScale. You strive in fast-paced, collaborative environments and are able to quickly switch gears between client work, internal initiatives, and supporting your peers under minimal supervision. <br/><br/> Your previous work experience has given you a holistic understanding of how digital products are conceived, built, and managed. You don't necessarily know how to code, but you have a general understanding of the infrastructure that makes up an application. You are able to meet with potential clients and understand their business goals, their users' desires, and are able to identify opportunities where design can bring their ideas to the next level while putting the needs of their users first.<br/><br/>WHAT YOU’LL DO  <ul>  <li>Apply a user centred approach to design problems.</li> <li>Work collaboratively engineers, Project Managers, and fellow designers in supporting the TribalScale marketing projects.</li> <li>Assist in preparation of presentation and as required make presentations.</li> <li>Prepare print ready art files for flyers, posters signs, etc.</li> <li>Proof publications for spelling and grammar.</li> <li>Create graphic designs as directed by Director of Design, Marketing Manager or as a creative assignment.</li> <li>Ability to clearly communicate ideas and take direction.</li> <li>Assists all departments with graphic requests as needed.</li> <li>Attend meetings with marketing team, design team, or leadership team to get requirements for work.</li> </ul> <strong>REQUIREMENTS</strong> <ul>  <li>4+ Years of professional work experience in UI/UX related positions.</li> <li>Oversee and ensure that our team produces best-in-class designs for the projects we work on.</li> <li>Continuously work to improve our design process by testing and implementing new tools, and leading initiatives that elevate our design practice.</li> <li>Comfortable with being client-facing with the ability to understand and articulate business goals & talk design strategy.</li> <li>Proficiency of UX design discipline – user flows, wireframes, mockups, prototypes, etc.</li> <li>Proficiency with the latest design tools and software (Adobe CS, Sketch)</li> <li>Self-motivated to take initiative and ownership of your work.</li> <li>Immaculate attention to detail, typography, and interactivity.</li> <li>Have a user-centric mindset throughout your design process.</li> <li>Consistently up to date with the latest design trends and best practices.</li> <li>Collaborate well with Product Mangers, Engineers, Sales, and everyone else in our Tribe.</li> <li>Help guide product decisions through user testing and iterative feedback loops.</li> <li>Rapidly iterate on design prototypes and working applications.</li> <li>Produce materials for clients and developers, including user flows, wireframes, mockups, prototypes, and assets.</li> <li>Open to new tools and methodologies, yet opinionated about best practices.</li> <li>A strong portfolio that demonstrates previous work samples.</li> </ul> <strong>BONUS POINTS FOR</strong> <ul>  <li>Experience with motion graphics / animation.</li> <li>Applied knowledge of user testing and validation techniques.</li> <li>Early adopter of new technology and gadgets.</li> <li>Familiar with Lean Startup Methodologies, Design Sprints, and Gamestorming.</li> </ul>  <strong>WHY YOU WANT TO BE AT TRIBALSCALE</strong>  <ul>  <li>Our values: Meritocracy, empowerment, and transparency.</li> <li>Our skills: Our teams were at the front the mobile revolution, are expert builders in Voice tech, and now, they’re connecting the world. They’ve work with brands including the NBA, Twitter, ABC, the CBC, Autonomics, and tons more.</li> <li>You matter: Everyone sits at the table and brings value. We love to be challenged, are happy to go with the flow, and we trust our gut.</li> <li>Growth: We’re a rocketship ready to take-off, you’ll get your hands dirty in every aspect of the business and there are tremendous opportunities for personal and professional growth. Seize them.</li> </ul>  BENEFITS<br/><br/><strong>Stay Happy & Healthy</strong> <ul>  <li>Health benefits: 100% medical, dental and vision coverage</li> <li>Wealthsimple Group Retirement Savings Plan (GRSP)</li> <li>Generous maternity and paternity leave policies</li> <li>Daily hot breakfast</li> <li>Fully stocked kitchen: unlimited drinks and snacks</li> <li>Office fitness and social events</li> <li>Office closed over Winter holidays</li> <li>Corporate-discounted GoodLife membership</li> <li>Perkopolis: company perk plan</li> <li>Free Netflix membership</li> </ul> <strong>Make Meaningful Connections</strong> <ul>  <li>Friday socials to cap off a great week</li> <li>Regular office activities: game nights, movie nights, group fitness, and more</li> <li>Quarterly team events: axe-throwing, beach day, and more</li> <li>Take your pick at a gaming break: Super Smash Bros, foosball, ping pong</li> </ul> <strong>Discover Your Potential</strong> <ul>  <li>Tickets to local events, conferences & meet-ups</li> <li>Out-of-town conference subsidies</li> <li>$2000 annual professional development allowance</li> <li>Weekly Lunch & Learns with industry leaders</li> <li>$3000 referral bonus</li> </ul> <strong>Want To See The World?</strong> <br/><br/> Our employees have the opportunity to rotate through our offices, giving employees the chance to travel, experience new cultures and discover their full potential.
Title: Senior UI/UX Designer

Job_Description: <div> <div> <div> <div>We value diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive workplace that inspires each of us to be the best we can be. Join our team and make a difference!</div>  </div> </div>  </div> <div> <div> Your Job</div>  </div> <div> <div> <div> <div><strong><em>About us</em></strong> <br/> How do you imagine life at an insurance company - its people, its culture, its offices? We bet that if you swing by Intact Lab, you'll be in for quite the surprise! With offices in downtown Toronto and Montreal, the Lab is a digital innovation hub tasked with creating cutting-edge insurtech products that improve the lives of millions of Canadians. <br/><br/> The Lab merges the best of two worlds: the speed and culture of a start-up, with the resources and means of a large enterprise (you'll have access to all the tools you've ever dreamed of!). With a dynamic team, exciting challenges, beautiful offices, inspiring colleagues and a great work culture (we rank as one of Canada's top 100 places to work), Intact Lab offers an amazing environment to develop your skills and grow your career. <br/><br/> <strong><em>About you</em></strong> <br/> Are you passionate about e-commerce and digital innovation? Are you skilled at translating complex requirements into usable and delightful experiences? Do you keep on top of the latest trends in design and love experimenting with new tools and methodologies? We've got the perfect opportunity for you! <br/><br/> <strong><em>Role</em></strong> <br/> As a UX/UI Designer, you play a mission critical role in conceiving and evolving our digital ecosystem. Reporting to the Director, Digital Innovation, your main responsibilities are :  <ul>   <li>Conceiving compelling experiences that help achieve business objectives</li>   <li>Validating usability and usefulness via user testing and user research</li>   <li>Producing relevant UX and design deliverables where required</li>   <li>Driving a roadmap alongside a product manager and a multidisciplinary agile team</li>   <li>Presenting work to stakeholders</li>   <li>Helping engineers produce quality, delightful interfaces</li>   <li>Being an advocate for user-centered, data-driven design</li> </ul>   </div> </div> </div>  </div> <div> <div> Your Skills</div>  </div> <div> <div> <div> <div>   <ul>   <li>At least 3 years of experience</li>   <li>Expertise in usability and user-centered design practices</li>   <li>Mastery of design tools (Sketch, Axure, InVision, Illustrator, etc.)</li>   <li>Experience with UX research tools an asset (usertesting.com, Optimal Workshop, etc.)</li>   <li>Experience in producing process flows, content inventories, etc.</li>   <li>You love working in a collaborative environment that has a strong focus on teamwork, innovation, open minds and having fun</li> </ul> <em>Please include your portfolio in your application.</em> <br/><br/> <em><strong>You are</strong></em>  <ul>   <li>Fun to work with</li>   <li>Creative, analytical, curious and ingenious</li>   <li>A team player that can share and receive constructive feedback</li>   <li>You excel at explaining your ideas to different stakeholders</li>   <li>Deeply passionate about design and quality</li>   <li>Organized and proactive</li> </ul> <strong><em>As a full-time employee your benefits include :</em></strong>  <ul>   <li>A competitive salary</li>   <li>An annual performance bonus</li>   <li>A pension plan</li>   <li>Flexible work hours and a 35 hour work week</li>   <li>Top of the line medical and dental insurance</li>   <li>And many more benefits (gym refunds, paid conferences, etc.)</li> </ul>   </div> </div> </div>  </div> <div> <div> Closing Statement</div>  </div> <div> <div> <div> <div><strong>This opportunity interests you? We look forward to meeting you!</strong> <br/><br/> As part of Intacts selection process, candidates may be requested to consent to background checks relevant to the role under consideration for, prior to receiving a job offer. These could include: work references, education and credential confirmation, employment verification, identity check, credit report, criminal offence and drivers license record. <br/><br/> You can apply for a posted position if you have been in your current position for at least 12 months and are performing at a satisfactory level.Please note we may have identified other internal candidates through our Employee Development Program, and that the selection process may also be opened to external applicants. <br/><br/> Excellent benefits are offered: competitive salary, flexible benefits, flexible work arrangements, flexible leave, pension plan defined benefit, etc. <br/><br/> <strong>This posting closes on June 02, 2018.</strong></div>  </div> </div>  </div> <div> <div> Referral Bonus</div>  </div> <div> <div> <div> <div>THIS POSITION IS ELIGIBLE FOR A REFERRAL BONUS OF $3000. <br/><br/> #li-qc</div>  </div> </div>  </div> <div> <div> Eligibility to work in Canada</div>  </div> <div> <div> <div> <div>Applicants must be permanently eligible to work in Canada upon hire. Proof of eligibility for permanent roles may come in the form of a Canadian birth certificate, Canadian passport, Canadian citizenship certificate, permanent residence card or confirmation.</div>  </div> </div>  </div> <div> <div> Indeed Sponsored</div>  </div> <div> <div> <div> <div>IN-INEN</div>  </div> </div>  </div>
Title: UX/UI Designer

Job_Description: <strong>The Software Engineering team at AbacusNext has a career opportunity for a UX/IU Designer specializing in text analytics located in Toronto.</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>WHO WE ARE</strong> <br/><br/> AbacusNext® helps businesses with stringent security and compliance needs grow by providing Compliance-Ready turnkey technology solutions, allowing our clients to leverage the power of cloud computing without the added challenges and expenses of managing complex IT infrastructures on their own. As an end-to-end solutions provider, our products and services portfolio includes virtual desktop (DaaS), private cloud, case management software (CMS), email hosting services, security endpoint protection, business continuity (BCP), and on premise solutions. Since 1983, we have delivered on-demand services to over 500,000 businesses worldwide, and recognized by Forbes as one of Americas fastest growing companies. <br/><br/> We were founded on one simple concept: improving the lives of professionals through the use of technology. Its competencies serve to simplify the adoption, implementation, and management of technology to quickly increase revenues, reduce costs, and maximize efficiencies, while keeping security and compliance at the forefront. <br/><br/> <strong>WHAT WE DO</strong> <br/><br/> We serve clients at every level of their organization, in whatever capacity we can be most useful, whether as a trusted advisor to large firm executive management or as a hands-on coach for sole practitioners. Target verticals include lawyers, general counsel, accounting firms, CPAs, government, and other private professional service organizations. For every engagement, we propose a solution tailored to meet their unique business needs and provide the utmost care in the implementation process. <br/><br/> No matter the challenge, we focus on delivering practical and enduring results, and equipping our clients to grow and lead. We partner with clients to put solution recommendations into practice and grow their businesses through the leverage of highly secure, compliant and functional business systems. <br/><br/> <strong>THE POSITION</strong> <br/><br/> Do you believe that all digital products should benefit from the principles and processes of a user-centred design? That the business tools that people use daily should adhere to the same standards of design and usability as the other tools in their digital lives? Do you want to take ownership of a product, be involved in all stages of its development, and help define and drive UX design strategy for a whole company? Do you know your Segoe from your San Francisco? <br/><br/> We are seeking a User Experience Designer to join our product development team in Edinburgh, servicing teams in Edinburgh and the U.S. You should be motivated by the responsibilities and benefits of sound design practice, and be a passionate advocate for the processes and results by which these principles are expressed (the kind of person who experiences acute professional frustration on discovering pull handles on a door that can only be pushed). <br/><br/> Working alongside our Agile development teams as we expand our core enterprise desktop and cloud products, you will have a portfolio that demonstrates proven experience in user research methods, design prototyping and user-testing, with a keen eye for detail, elegant design and layout, from initial wireframe to final implementation. <br/><br/> Our culture embraces doing what is best for others clients, colleagues, and the community while taking a long-term perspective on the organisations success. <br/><br/> <strong>REQUIREMENTS</strong>  <ul> <li>Bachelors degree in design, HCI or UCD-related field</li>   <li>Familiarity with technical considerations of design for desktop and web</li>  <li>Experience of working in an Agile development environment</li>   <li>Fluency in the conventions and best practices of interaction design and usability</li>  <li>Excellent analytical and communication skills can you present to persuade?</li>  <li>Familiarity with the usual UX design tool suspects: Adobe CS, Balsamiq, Sketch, Axure, InVision etc.</li>  <li>Proven projects with portfolio of previous work</li> </ul> <strong>PERSONAL QUALITIES</strong>  <ul> <li>A passion for all things design, visual and product eat it, live it, breath it</li>  <li>The flexibility and the ability to dynamically multi-task youll be working across different teams and products</li>  <li>The ability to communicate and justify design decisions to technical and business audiences just why is that subtle animated cue so vital?</li> </ul> <strong>PERKS</strong>  <ul> <li>Competitive salary</li>  <li>Paid Vacations</li>  <li>Full Health/Dental/Vision/Life benefits</li>  <li>Paid time off for training and certifications</li>  <li>Weekly paid lunches</li>  <li>Company provided beverages and snacks</li>  <li>Casual dress code</li>  <li>Quarterly company outings</li>  </ul> <strong>Equal Employment Opportunity</strong> <br/><br/> AbacusNext is an Equal Opportunity, Affirmative Action Employer.
Title: UX/UI Designer

Job_Description: Help make our products world class. You won't just be designing an app - you'll be designing a system of products involving consumers, merchants, couriers and dispatchers to make deliveries happen at scale. That means you'll be involved in designing for every step of the delivery process: from the interface that the consumers use to place their order to the dispatching systems to the final physical delivery experience.<br/><br/><strong></strong> <br/><br/> WHO YOU ARE: <ul>  <li>Ability to initiate, own and lead big design projects</li> <li>Master of user-centred design process involving all stakeholders</li> <li>Strong sketching and rapid prototyping skills</li> <li>Experience designing mobile and web apps</li> <li>Proficient with Adobe Creative suite</li> <li>HTML/CSS/JS experience an asset</li> <li>Able to work independently and have an entrepreneurial spirit</li> <li>2+ years of UI design and interactive work</li>  </ul>  <strong></strong> <br/><br/> WHAT WE CAN OFFER YOU: <ul>  <li>Experience in one of North America’s fastest growing companies, located in Winnipeg</li> <li>Very high level of responsibilities from day one</li> <li>Exposure to a wide array of the latest technologies</li> <li>Exciting opportunities for advancements for superstar performers</li> <li>A refreshingly meaningful and rewarding work environment</li> <li>Opportunity to participate in the development a world-class startup</li> <li>Be part of an incredible team of highly motivated people set to change day-to-day lives in North America</li>  </ul>
Title: UI/UX Designer

Job_Description: <div><div></div></div><div><div><div>UX/UI Designer – Toronto, Canada | Contract</div></div></div><div><div><div>We are seeking a motivated, career and customer oriented intermediate level UI/UX Designerto join our client's team for a six month contract engagement with potential to extend or become a full-time (permanent) position. <br/><br/> The UI/UX Designer will design and create customer journeys and high-level screen designs (sketches/wireframes) by working closely with business owners and customers to help build the right product. Additionally, the UI/UX Designer will work integrally with the development team, throughout the development cycle to provide guidance on implementation of the designs and modify designs as requirements change. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities:</strong>  <ul>  	<li>Employ participatory design, creative brainstorming and other techniques to collaborate with software developers, systems engineers and other product team members</li> <li>Ensure applications are meeting IT Accessibility Standards</li> <li>Map workflows, user paths, create storyboards, wireframes, mockups, low and high fidelity prototypes and write UI specifications to support development across multiple applications and platforms</li> <li>Design graphic, icons and other visual elements as necessary</li> <li>Evaluate designs using user-centric design techniques such as UI reviews and cognitive walk-throughs</li> <li>Maintain an awareness of current trends in technology design and usability, and share this information across multiple teams</li> <li>Participate in working groups and/or meetings with application stakeholders to discuss user requirements and/or present wireframes and mockups</li> </ul> <strong>Requirements:</strong>  <ul>  	<li>Bachelor's degree</li> <li>Four years of UX design experience</li> <li>Experience delivering products that work across a range of browsers and platforms</li> <li>Experience using modern CSS frameworks such as Bootstrap and/or Material Design to deliver responsive, mobile aware products</li> <li>Understanding of Accessibility standards. Experience delivering and meeting them preferred.</li> <li>Excellent understanding of the life cycle process of website development (discovery, planning, design, requirements, coding, testing, and user testing and evaluation)</li> <li>Excellent communication and writing skills (ability to communicate technical concepts to a non-technical audience)</li> </ul> This opportunity is immediate - please apply now for consideration! <br/><br/> <strong>Please apply for this position through our Online Registration System.</strong> <br/><br/> We appreciate your interest but due to time constraints we can only contact candidates in consideration. Creative Niche is dedicated to matching outstanding communication, design and interactive professionals with the right companies. If you are not contacted for the current role(s) for which you have applied, please be confident that your application will be electronically filed for future searches. <br/><br/> In accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act, Creative Niche welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process for Ontario jobs. To request an accommodation, please contact Creative Niche.</div> </div></div><div></div>
Title: UX/UI Designer –

Job_Description: <div>    What we expect from you?</div>  <div>  <ul>  <li>Collaborate with product management and engineering to define and implement innovative solutions for the product direction, visuals and experience</li>  <li>Execute all visual design stages from concept to final hand-off to engineering</li>  <li>Conceptualize original ideas that bring simplicity and user-friendliness to complex design roadblocks</li>  <li>Create wireframes, storyboards, user flows, process flows and site maps to effectively communicate interaction and design ideas</li>  <li>Present and defend designs and key milestone deliverables to peers and executive level stakeholders</li>  <li>Conduct user research and evaluate user feedback</li>  <li>Establish and promote design guidelines, best practices and standards</li>  </ul>  </div>  <div>What you've got?</div>  <div>  <ul>  <li>Proven UX/UI experience</li>  <li>Demonstratable UI design skills with a strong portfolio</li>  <li>Solid experience creating wireframes, storyboards, user flows, process flows and site maps</li>  <li>Proficiency in Photoshop, Illustrator, OmniGraffle or other visual design and wire-framing tools</li>  <li>Proficiency in HTML, CSS and JavaScript for rapid prototyping</li>  <li>Familiarity with UI frameworks such as Angular JS, Bootstrap, Kendo UI</li>  <li>Excellent visual design skills with sensitivity to user-system interaction</li>  <li>Ability to present your designs and sell your solutions to various stakeholders</li>  <li>Ability to solve problems creatively and effectively</li>  <li>Up-to-date with the latest UI trends, techniques and technologies</li>  <li>BS/MS in Human-Computer Interaction, Interaction Design or related field (is a plus)</li>  <li>Experience working in an Agile/Scrum development process</li>  </ul>  </div>
Title: UX/UI Designer

Job_Description: <strong>Konrad Group</strong> <br/><br/> Konrad Group is a next generation digital consultancy. We are dedicated to solving complex business problems for our global clients with creative and forward-thinking solutions. Our employees enjoy a culture built on innovation and a commitment to creating best-in-class digital products in use by hundreds of millions of consumers around the world. We hire exceptionally smart, analytical, and hard working people who are lifelong learners. <br/><br/> <strong>UI/UX Intern</strong> <br/><br/> Konrad Group is looking for a UI/UX intern to join our team in Toronto. Throughout the work term, you will be involved in our design thinking processes and the creation of innovative mobile, tablet and web products. You will collaborate with creative, development and strategy teams to ship world-class digital experiences for leading companies and global brands. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities</strong>  <ul> <li>Work with design leads to create delightful and elegant interactive experiences</li> <li>Perform user research and develop information architecture, user goals, journey maps, and design quality wireframes and visual interfaces</li> <li>Collaborate with developers to ensure pixel perfect execution across all project deliverables</li> <li>Work with strategy consultants to gain insights into clients businesses and project objectives</li> <li>Learn the end-to-end process of project delivery and the associated design tools involved</li> </ul> <strong>Skills & Requirements</strong>  <ul> <li>Firm grasp of design fundamentals demonstrated by a strong portfolio of digital projects</li> <li>Meticulous attention to detail and a keen eye for typography and visual hierarchy</li> <li>Clear and effective communication skills in articulating design concepts and rationales</li> <li>Proficient in Sketch and Adobe Creative Suite, and an eagerness to learn new tools</li> <li>Positive attitude with a desire to grow within a collaborative, inspiring teamwork environment</li> </ul> <strong>Bonus Points:</strong> Have you taken any courses at BrainStation? A lot of our design and development best practices and processes are taught during our courses - make sure to highlight this experience in your cover letter if you have<strong>!</strong> <br/><br/> <em>Konrad Group is committed to maintaining a diverse work environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants, regardless of race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status will receive consideration for employment. If you have any accessibility requirements or concerns regarding the hiring process or employment with us, please notify us so we can provide suitable accommodation.</em> <br/><br/> <strong>*Please include a link to your online portfolio with the application.</strong> <br/><br/> While we sincerely appreciate all applications, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

Job_Description: Our client is currently seeking a Senior UX/UI Designer to join their capital markets team to help create their new application platform <br/><br/> <strong>This job will have the following responsibilities:</strong>   <ul> <li>Implement next generation trading system that is MiFID II complied.</li> <li>Supports current state systems.</li> <li>Collaborate with global team of UI developers.</li> <li>Proactively identify risks and business issues</li> <li>Facilitate in cross line of business process design.</li> <li>Influence cross discipline teams on next generation user experience</li> <li>Identify continuous improvement opportunities and drive project progress and benefits.</li> <li>Help drive organizational discipline.</li> <li>Ensure accountability</li> </ul>  <strong>Qualifications & Requirements:</strong>   <ul> <li>At least six years of experience at a digital agency or similar relevant experience.</li> <li>Previous experience working within capital markets, trading, wealth management or other comparable finance departments.</li> <li>Proven background within commercial design (up to date, modern design), user experience, user interface design and brand philosophy and values.</li> <li>Good relationship building skills with ability to interact with different people at all levels across the business and externally.</li> <li>Excellent written and spoken communication skills; an ability to communicate with impact, ensuring complex information is articulated in a meaningful way to a wide and varied audience.</li> <li>Excellent attention to detail, highly organized with a proactive approach.</li> <li>Honest and trustworthy, with an open communication style.</li> <li>Strong analytical ability and problem solving skills.</li> <li>Create wireframes, storyboards, user flows and site maps to effectively communicate interaction and design ideas, using standard design software e.g. Adobe Creative Suite, Sketch, InVision</li> <li>Knowledge of HTML, CSS and JavaScript is a must.</li> <li>Working closely with developers as your project is being developed, delivering any necessary annotations/design specifications.</li> <li>Take ownership of an issue through to resolution.</li> <li>Be able to travel to Global offices (UK & US)</li> </ul>  <strong>ID:</strong>  565454 <br/> <strong>Type:</strong>  Contingency <br/> <strong>Salary:</strong>  Competitive - provided by Dice <br/><br/> Adobe, CSS, HTML, JavaScript, Management, Project, User Interface, UX
Title: Senior UX/UI Designer

Job_Description: Every day, Imagine Communications is delivering billions of media moments all over the world — anywhere, anytime and on any device. <br/><br/> Imagine Communications delivers innovative, end-to-end media software and networking solutions to over 3,000 customers in more than 185 countries, including the top broadcast facilities and the most technologically advanced sports and live-event venues. Today, we’re driving an industry transformation by investing deeply in a new generation of media enabled by IP, virtualization, cloud infrastructure and software-defined networks. <br/><br/> At Imagine Communications, groundbreaking work is part of our everyday environment. All our employees play a vital role in our organization, helping the media industry enable instant access to moments that matter. Wherever your skills fit in our business — from engineering and sales to service and support — you’ll find you gain much more than just a job. At Imagine Communications, you’ll gain the opportunity to contribute to the transformation that’s taking place in the way the world is consuming media. <br/><br/> If you’re looking to join a market leader and take your career to the next level, contact us today! <br/><br/> The User Experience team is looking for a new UX/UI Designer with a passion for good design and technology. You must have a strong understanding of web design and production. To be successful on this team you must: <ul> <li>Have a passion for design, web and all things digital</li><li>Thrive in a lean, fast paced and changing environment</li><li>Grasp the importance of collaboration within the design process</li><li>See things clearly from the perspective of a customer</li><li>Fully utilize the power of data to inform your design decisions</li><li>Showcase a strong portfolio of web and mobile projects.</li> </ul> <strong>Responsibilities</strong> <ul> <li>Reporting to the UX Manager you will lead the design effort on a number of projects and be the lead role for helping produce web and mobile projects in a highly collaborative, fast-paced environment.</li><li>Successfully communicate conceptual ideas, rationale and sell your team’s designs</li><li>Evangelize the importance of good user experience across the whole organization</li><li>Mentor other UX designers and team members, with an emphasis on constant team collaboration and knowledge sharin</li><li>Works closely with developers and project teams to establish and ensure compliance with an organizational design strategy.</li><li>Lead the effort with product managers and development staff to understand and define project requirements.</li><li>Works closely with other members of the project team to negotiate implementation issues and supports the development effort.</li><li>Maintain, improve and audit UI specifications and guidelines against existing products and competitor products.</li><li>Research into design and usability best practices to maintain best of breed.</li> </ul> <strong>Required Skills</strong> <ul> <li>5+ years experience with a Diploma or Degree in Graphic or Information Design, Computer Sciences and/or industry experience.</li><li>Proven design experience using Adobe Illustrator, InDesign, Photoshop, Dreamweaver, Flash</li><li>Experience with HTML5, CSS3, and ability to handle cross-browser compatibility</li><li>Knows and applies W3C Standards and established best practices</li><li>Experience working with responsive design infrastructures</li><li>Familiarity with social media best practices</li><li>Good working relationship with web developers and programmers</li><li>Strong organizational skills and ability to meet tight deadlines and changing priorities</li><li>Ability to perform effectively in a multitasking environment</li><li>Require minimal supervision, organized, work well in a team</li><li>Proven aptitude for problem solving, technical thinking with attention to detail</li><li>Strong professional attitude and a drive to get things done</li><li>Have strong interpersonal, as well as written and verbal skills in the English language</li> </ul> <strong> Nice to Have</strong> <ul> <li>Experience using JQuery, JavaScript, Twitter Bootstrap, Wordpress, CMS & ecommerce applications</li><li>Experience with mobile apps design</li><li>Experience handling videos</li><li>Experience with source control such as CVS, Subversion, or related</li><li>Practiced and delivered User Centered Design deliverables in an end-to-end product development lifecycle for software</li><li>Experience with RUP or other types of use case/requirements definitions</li><li>Experience designing and specifying user interfaces for Windows based software products within the Broadcast Industry</li><li>Knowledge of industry standards and guidelines for developing applications</li><li>Experience in designing using XAML</li> </ul>
Title: UX/UI Designer

Job_Description: <div>  <div>  <div>  UI/UX Designer  <p><strong>We're seeking a UI/UX Designer to join our dynamic team.</strong> We are located in the <strong>middle of the Old Port</strong>. We work in an open and collaborative environment, and we make a point to display our company culture very publicly (you can actually read it all on our website). We respect each other and help one another. Who we are is what makes us unique, and this is why we have the opportunity to work on amazing projects with great clients.</p>  <br>  FULL TIME POSITION  <p><strong>Salary:</strong> Based on skill and experience<br>  <strong>Hours:</strong> 9AM - 5PM Monday through Friday</p>  <br>    </div>  </div>  </div>  <div>  <div>  <div>  <p>Now, are you <strong>passionate about web design and user experience</strong>? Do you get a thrill when you witness a user go through the flow of a site you have designed and strategized for, in the exact way you have planned? Do you enjoy meeting with clients directly, and working with a team behind you? This position might be just perfect for you!</p>  <p>Let's get right into the fun stuff, as a Design Shopp team member, you will benefit from group insurance, <strong>including health and dental</strong>. You will have VIP access to our <strong>game room</strong> (video games, board games, Netflix, and more) and work in <strong>a lively and open work environment</strong>. You will always have the support of a young and passionate team and limitless cuddles from Charlie the Dog (aka Vice President of Happiness / aka Sandwich Thief). We have a <strong>gym in our building</strong>, and we can hook you up with a <strong>group discount membership</strong> the day you start.</p>  <p>Since this is a job posting, let’s get right to it! <strong>As a UI/UX Designer at Design Shopp</strong>, you will be meeting with clients, along with a Project Manager, during initial creative briefs. You will then strategize an ideal flow for each client’s responsive website, by developing the sitemap and wireframes. You will also be conceptualizing intuitive and compelling designs with the Web team. You and the Project Manager will be presenting your wireframes and designs to the client throughout the design stage of each project. Your responsibility will be to ensure consistency with branding and marketing efforts of each of your projects, and perform quality control on the designs during the creation phase as well as during the development phase. We're looking for a dedicated designer, with a passion for well-crafted websites that ultimately convert into sales for our clients.</p>  <p>You will be working with other designers on the team. You will be developing many websites at a time, with different clients from various industries. We are looking for someone who is organized and versatile, and who can easily adapt their design style to different types of industries.</p>  <p>We’re looking to hire as quickly as possible so we hope to hear from you soon! Make sure to include a personal note about yourself and sample work depicting your UI and UX abilities. We want to see how well you understand wireframing, and design.</p>  <p>If we select your application, you can expect a first phone interview where we will get to know you a bit better and discuss salary, as we will base it on your experience and skillset.</p>  <br>  <p><strong>What we’re looking for:</strong></p>  <ul>  <li>3+ years experience designing websites and interfaces with a solid portfolio to demonstrate your skillset</li>  <li>A perfectly bilingual candidate with excellent oral and written communication skills in French and English (Because you will often be in direct communication with clients)</li>  <li>Someone with experience in creating responsive website wireframes</li>  <li>Someone with experience in creating App wireframes</li>  <li>Experience with Magento as well as general e-commerce best UX practices for conversions</li>  <li>Someone with basic understanding of HTML, CSS (But you will not be required to write any code, no worries.)</li>  <li>Experience collaborating with a team</li>  <li>A true team player; someone who will stay current on the latest web and mobile design trends, and will maintain design guidelines and process enhancements to be shared with the rest of the design team</li>  </ul>  </div>  </div>  </div>
Title: UI/UX Designer

Job_Description: <strong><em>Please note this is an unpaid internship, however travel costs will be covered</em></strong> <br/> <strong> <ul> <li>Job/Position Summary:</li> </ul>  </strong>  <li>As a UX Designer you will be using your experience in creating exceptional user-centered web applications to contribute to enhancing the visualization and user experience of new and existing applications. You will contribute to innovative and high quality User Interface design solutions for various business applications and tools.</li>  <strong>Organizational Status</strong>:</strong> <br/> Working closely with the PMO, You will understand business requirements and apply fundamental design principals to propose UI/UX design solutions. You will also work with the development team members to assess feasibility and coordinate for designing and implementing solutions. Specifically as an intern you'll get the opportunity to learn the real world applications of your unique skill set <br/> <strong>Responsibilities Include</strong>:  <ul> <li>Design easy-to-use, intuitive user experiences and interfaces for a variety of projects and applications with consideration to end-user platforms/browsers- Work with the PMO & clients to understand business requirements and processes in relation to contextual user behavior for superior design proposals. Slice & dice images quickly and on a regular basis- Work closely with development team to gauge the feasibility of proposed designs and ensuring support of business requirements while conforming to proposed Design Standards- Present designs for review and positively accept constructive feedback to be able maintain fast-paced design-build cycles- Collaborate with the business /clients to understand needs, prototype ideas and provide mockups with ongoing revisions based on feedback- Design web images for web pages, banner ads, icons, logos, marketing fliers- Apply knowledge of HTML/CSS and an understanding of how compositions translate to code in order to deliver feasible designs.<strong>The ideal candidate has</strong>:</li> <li>Received or is working towards a degree/diploma in Computer Science, design, human-computer interaction (HCI), or related discipline. Students coming out of Boot camp programs are more than welcome!- Eagerness to gain experience in designing innovative and forward thinking digital products- Knowledge of Axure/Sketch/Photoshop/ Illustrator/CSS/HTML- Practical understanding of HTML5/CSS, and/or other web/native code. Excellent communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills and ability to gracefully defend your design decisions to clients- A thorough understanding of typography, layout, color and user interface- Desire to learn and continuously get better, bringing a can do attitude to the challenges of working in a fast pace environmentJob Type: Internship</li> </ul>
Title: Internship UX / UI Designer

Job_Description: Think Research is a disruptive and rapidly growing software company that is changing the way healthcare is delivered across Canada, in the U.S. and EU. We are passionate about what we do, and even more so about the amazing people that help make what we do possible. <br/><br/> Were growing fast and we need all hands on deck. Hungry to make a change that will affect millions? Well grab a quick snack, we're looking for you. <br/><br/> <strong>Why us?</strong>  <ul> <li>Be part of something special. Its not every day that you get to change the way your friends and family are cared for</li> <li>Unbeatable downtown location right across the street from Union Station (and 30 seconds away from 17 different Starbucks locations!)</li> <li>Opportunity to join a rapidly growing team of high-energy, brilliant people who are passionate about their work and colleagues</li> <li>Mentorship from senior and c-level employees</li> <li>Exciting, collaborative, fast-paced and multidisciplinary environment</li> <li>Casual dress code</li> <li>Macbook with Creative Cloud, Sketch & Omnigraffle</li> </ul> <strong>The kind of work youd be doing:</strong> <br/><br/> Were seeking a talented intermediate to senior UX/UI Designer to join our team. We take a communicative and collaborative approach to product development. Youll work alongside developers, product owners, and quality assurance in our integrated team. Our ideal candidate is highly motivated, loves learning, and is willing to take creative risks. <br/><br/> As a UX/UI Designer at Think Research, youll touch every part of the design process from user research to wireframing and testing, to designing high-fidelity user interfaces all in the pursuit of building amazing products. <br/><br/> This includes, but is not limited to:  <ul> <li>Designing everything from small features to entirely new products</li> <li>Conducting user research and testing, gaining a full understanding of our users</li> <li>Creating user flows, information architecture and wireframes</li> <li>Working iteratively to develop ideas from sketches to high-fidelity designs</li> <li>Developing interactive design elements and solutions</li> <li>Thinking creatively to produce new ideas and concepts</li> <li>Collaborating with developers to craft designs that use modern standards and processes</li> <li>Collaborating with product owners to create seamless user experiences</li> <li>Ability to deliver high-quality work within a fast-paced environment</li> <li>Presenting finalized ideas and concepts to clients or product managers</li> </ul> <strong>Your ideal qualifications:</strong>  <ul> <li>Diploma or degree in design</li> <li>Minimum 2-4 years of working experience</li> <li>Knowledge of UX design processes</li> <li>Experience in prototyping and user interviewing</li> <li>Keen eye for detail</li> <li>Self-starter who enjoys experimenting with ideas and approaches</li> <li>A love for learning about emerging design trends, standard, and technology</li> <li>Aptitude with Photoshop and/or Sketch and eagerness to learn new tools</li> </ul> <strong>Nice to have's:</strong>  <ul> <li>Proficiency with HTML5, CSS3, especially their issues and quirks</li> <li>Experience with CSS preprocessors like LESS or SASS</li> <li>Ability to create motion graphics to demonstrate interface animations</li> <li>Aptitude with designing, wireframing and prototyping tools including Creative Cloud, Omnigraffle, Invision, etc.</li> </ul> Resumes are useful, but they dont say much about a designers skills or passion. We would love to see a web portfolio of design work with any wireframes or user flow sketches. Please include a link to your portfolio in your resume.
Title: UX/UI Designer
