Job_Description: <strong>Responsibilities</strong>   <ul> <li>Be the go-to person on all things design</li> <li>Work with a fun bunch of product & engineering people to promote good & consistent design</li> <li>Establish visual language and interaction style guide</li> <li>Establish and evangelize design best practices and promote design thinking</li> <li>Develop storyboards, mock-ups, prototypes and other neat things to effectively communicate new and delightful user experiences</li> <li>Produce a super cool library of reusable visual artifacts and interaction elements</li> <li>Have the user’s back at every stage of the design & development process</li> <li>Come up with awesomely simple experiences that allow our users to easily tackle hard problems like navigating through huge piles of data</li> <li>Understanding and solving functional problems for a variety of data management, visualization and analytics user scenarios</li> <li>Rationalize design decisions to peers and stakeholders</li> </ul>  <strong>Qualifications:</strong>   <ul> <li>An incredible design sense and a love for staying current with design trends and UX best practices</li> <li>Excruciating attention to detail</li> <li>Obsession for creating simple, clean and intuitive user experiences</li> <li>Some sort of formal training or education in a discipline that likely has “Design” in the title</li> <li>At least 7 years of experience designing awesomeness</li> <li>Mastery of all the tools every good UX designer needs (Sketch, Axure, InVision, Photoshop and many more)</li> <li>Some experience with the technical stuff would be good but is not mandatory (e.g., XAML, HTML5, JavaScript)</li> <li>Desire to be challenged with your work and enjoy working as part of a great team</li> <li>Amazing communication skills</li></ul>
Title: UX/UI Designer

Job_Description: User Experience Designer <br/><br/> Montreal, QC <br/>  <br/> The Challenge <br/>  <br/> Us LVL’ers share an ambitious goal: to reinvent how consumers enjoy digital entertainment – from the way one discovers and watches TV shows and movies, to the way one unearths and listens to music, plays online games and more! <br/><br/> Critical to our success is having the ability to fully comprehend and relate to consumer needs and behaviours so that we can ensure that every product experience we design meets both our clients’ and consumers’ expectations. This is where you come in! <br/><br/> We’re seeking an experienced UX designer to research, map out, create and improve product experiences for a variety of mandates. <br/>  <br/> The Team <br/>  <br/> Reporting to our Creative directory, you will join LVL’s Creative Department – a lively team of experienced UI and UX Designers that are as creative as they are committed to designing leading solutions. You will also have opportunities to collaborate with some of our developers, depending on the mandate at hand! <br/>  <br/> The Role <br/>  <br/> You will draw upon your full range of design skills, including product and interaction design, to create awesome experiences enjoyed by millions of consumers! In other words, you will be responsible for…   <ul> <li>Conducting research and analysis</li> <li>Developing product strategies for various clients</li> <li>Developing Information architecture</li> <li>Wireframing</li> <li>Prototyping</li>   <li>Providing UX documentation to our Dev team</li> </ul>  The Profile   <ul> <li>You have a minimum of 3 years of interaction design experience related to consumer apps</li> <li>You are able to define a product design strategy based on a list of requirements and constraints</li> <li>You know when to rely on competitive analysis, user research and testing, user journeys, wireframes, information architecture and other UX tools</li> <li>You can quickly grasp business requirements and user insights</li> <li>You have prototyping experience</li> <li>You have the foresight required to identify the various stages of product develop, from minimum viable product to maximally buyable product</li> <li>You see the “big picture” and have the ability to write and fight for innovative concepts</li> <li>You are passionate about new developments and trends in technology and this curiosity is what colours your proposals</li> <li>You have an eye for aesthetic</li> </ul>  In other words, you are creative, independent, meticulous and professional. You are considered an asset to any team and have no trouble planning and managing priorities while working under pressure. <br/>  <br/> The Nice-To-Haves   <ul> <li>You are familiar with TV app design</li> <li>You are familiar with the Service Design approach</li>   <li>You understand the benefits and complexities of interactive media</li> </ul>  Sound Like You? Apply Now! <br/>  <br/> If you are creative, motivated and have a genuine interest in contributing to the advancement of media and entertainment technology, you could very-well be the perfect fit. <br/><br/> Send your résumé to careers@lvlstudio.com and make sure to follow us on LinkedIn and Facebook to stay up to date on any new LVL job opportunities. <br/>  <br/> Why Join LVL Studio? <br/>  <br/> Located in Montreal’s vibrant AI hub, LVL prides itself on fostering a friendly and dynamic working environment where innovation is at the heart of everything we do. <br/><br/> Join LVL and find your place within our team of expert strategists, designers and software engineers who provide major media and entertainment companies with the tools required to better reach, engage and retain audiences. From powerful entertainment platforms to leading products and services, our solutions make their way into the hands of millions of people, allowing our clients to refine the content discovery and consumption experiences they offer based on consumer trends and needs. <br/><br/> Check out our project portfolio <br/>  <br/> Apply to careers@lvlstudio.com
Title: User Experience Designer

Job_Description: The design team is looking for experienced individuals to help create beautiful and highly functional products for our clients and their users. As a product designer at MetaLab, youll be part of the entire project lifecycle from start to finish. Expectations include contributions to all aspects of the design process including research, wireframing/prototyping, and visual design. This is a great role for someone who has had experience with the pace and variety of agency work, and wants to continue to grow their skillset within a team based environment. Adaptability, a highly collaborative attitude, and a desire for continued growth is a must. <br/><br/> We are not looking for those with experience that only touches in advertising, branding, campaigns, or marketing. We are a digital product shop, and the ability to understand digital product building is paramount to your success. <br/><br/> <strong>WHAT WE'RE LOOKING FOR</strong>  <ul> <li>3+ years of experience bringing digital products to life (ideally in an agency or consulting environment).</li> <li>Ability to pitch, educate, and define your design rationale to clients. You can articulate the why and lead discussions around your process, explorations, and conclusions.</li> <li>A solid portfolio of product work that can speak to both your UX and visual design skills.</li> <li>Prototyping and interaction design experience, ideally with Framer.js and/or Principle.</li> <li>Clear and open communication skills. You can articulate feedback to help your teammates become stronger designers.</li> <li>Ability to translate stakeholder goals, user research, and complex user flows into clean, usable UIs.</li> <li>A solid and up to date understanding of best practices, developments and trends in web, mobile and iOS design.</li> <li>Ego-less and objective. You receive feedback well and can iterate on your designs within a team, no matter how attached to them you are.</li> <li>Strong knowledge of UX principles and best practices, including understanding when and where user testing and research should be incorporated into the product design process.</li> </ul> We are open to remote candidates for this role. <br/><br/> Please include a link or attachment with your portfolio when you apply. Resumes are helpful to understand your experience but we would like to see work samples as well. If you aren't able to share work publicly, just note that in your cover letter so we know why it's missing from your application.
Title: Product Designer

Job_Description: <div><strong>Job ID:</strong> <br/><br/> J0518-0747</div>  <br/>UI UX Design Specialist<br/><br/>Teaching and Learning Support Service (TLSS) - Centre for Innovative Pedagogies and Digital Learning (CIPDL)<br/> <div> <div> Addthis <br/> <strong> |</strong> <br/>  Email <br/>  Favorites <br/>  LinkedIn <br/>  Facebook <br/>  Twitter</div> </div><br/>  <div><strong>Job Type:</strong> <br/>  Regular Full Time <br/><br/> <strong>Open Positions:</strong> <br/>  1 <br/><br/> <strong>Posting Date:</strong> <br/>  May 17, 2018 <br/><br/> <strong>Closing Date:</strong> <br/>  May 27, 2018 <br/><br/> <strong>Union affiliation:</strong> <br/>  SSUO <br/><br/> <strong>Job Reports To:</strong> <br/>  Manager—Digital Development, CIPDL <br/><br/> <strong> <br/> <br/>  Job description</strong></div>  <br/>Salary (Grade: 10)<br/>  <div>Hiring salary range</div><br/>  <div> $68,413-$86,419 <br/><br/> Position Purpose <br/>  <div>Handles the design, development and support of print and electronic media resources. <br/> Along with the Centre for Innovative Pedagogies and Digital Learning (CIPDL) team (instructional designers, educational developers, web developers and multimedia designers), works with clients to understand their business requirements in terms of digital strategy for online teaching and learning, branding, marketing and user interfaces. <br/> Applies graphic design, user interface and user experience design principles (UI/UX) to inform user experience across digital platforms, including web and mobile, electronic media and print resources for pedagogical and promotional materials. <br/> Works with web designers to develop wireframes, look and feel, colour palettes and content interaction to support the overall project vision. Collaborates with instructional designers to pilot test usability decisions. Ensures that all design work, marketing and communication materials (conferences, reports, special projects, workshops, special events, publicity for open houses for faculty, etc.) is consistent with the Teaching and Learning Support Service and University of Ottawa brands. Employs effective user experience practices, working with the CIPDL team and professors to design, develop and evaluate material.</div>  <br/>Essential Qualifications <br/>  <div>Certificate or diploma in graphic design from a college, or equivalent experience <br/> Five years’ experience in computer graphic design, e-learning in particular <br/> Extensive knowledge of UI/UX learner-centred design practices as they apply to design, development and review of online learning environments <br/> Ability to create wireframes, mock-ups, personas, UX flows, experience maps, process flow and site maps to effectively communicate interaction and design ideas to team members and clients <br/> Experience in creating pedagogically informed learner-centred resources <br/> Knowledge of marketing and online communications focused on online tools and services <br/> Knowledge of e-learning technical solutions <br/> Experience with audiovisual tools and communication methods <br/> Ability to work within a multidisciplinary team environment involving colleagues both in and outside the service <br/> Communication and organizational skills <br/> Ability to work under pressure and meet tight deadlines while working autonomously <br/> Bilingualism — French and English (spoken and written)</div><br/>   <div>Key competencies required at the University of Ottawa: <br/> <strong>Planning:</strong> Organize in time a series of actions or events in order to achieve an objective or a project. Plan and organize own work and priorities in regular daily activities. <br/> <strong>Initiative:</strong> Demonstrate creativity and initiative to suggest improvements and encourage positive results. Be proactive and self-starting. Show availability and willingness to go above and beyond expectations whenever possible. <br/> <strong>Service Excellence:</strong> Reflect a positive attitude, demonstrate competence and professionalism, treat members of the community with respect, exercise care, devote full attention and find solutions. (Visit the section "Useful links" on the home page to read the detailed definition). <br/> <strong>Teamwork and Cooperation:</strong> Cooperate and work well with other members of the team to reach common goal. Accept and give constructive feedback. Adjust own behaviour to reach team goals.</div>  <br/>Note <br/>  <div>All qualified candidates are invited to apply; however, preference will be given to Canadian citizens and permanent residents. The University of Ottawa is an equal opportunity employer. We strongly encourage applications from women, Aboriginal peoples, persons with disabilities and members of visible minorities. If you are invited to continue the selection process, please notify us of any particular adaptive measures you might require. <br/><br/> Applications from employees belonging to the bargaining unit SSUO will be considered first. Priority will be given to employees who have an entitlement as defined by their collective agreement or university policies. The University also accepts external applications; they will be selected in second place. Schedule with an average of 35hrs/week. Workshops offered by Leadership, Learning and Organizational Development that you have taken may be considered an asset if you apply for a position at the University. Don’t forget to list them on your CV. We thank all candidates for applying. We will only contact candidates selected for further consideration. Any information you send us will be handled respectfully and in complete confidence. Remember to upload a copy of your diploma(s) or a certificate of merit as well as a current version of your CV into the My documents section of your career profile (please include the job ID number, i.e. J0000-0000, in the title of your document).</div></div>  <br/>
Title: UI UX Design Specialist

Job_Description: <div><div><strong>Job Description</strong><br/><br/>D3 Security provides the world’s leading platform for security orchestration, automation, incident response, and investigation/case management. Today more than 1000 organizations- including over 100 of the Fortune 500 rely on D3 to build, automate and execute incident response plans, connect with third-party technologies and apply data-driven decisions across an enterprise-wide vision of incidents, investigations, and risk. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities:</strong> <ul> <li>Analyze and translate requirements and user needs into intuitive, implementable designs</li><li>Conduct user research, heuristic evaluations, usability testing, and competitor research</li><li>Develop user workflow diagrams, storyboards, wireframes, and mockups for concept development and presentation</li><li>Identify and troubleshoot usability problems and pain points, and collaborate with other members of the design team to determine solutions</li><li>Communicate and work with clients to understand their requirements and goals</li><li>Work closely with the development team to gain insight about technical feasibility</li><li>Develop and enforce UX interaction and usability guidelines, as well as style guides</li><li>Take ownership of design solutions from conceptualization to implementation</li><li>Create visual assets for D3’s web and mobile applications as needed</li><li>Create and enforce a consistent D3-branded look and feel within the product, as well as consistent client branding in all client-facing projects</li><li>Juggle multiple priorities in a dynamic and fast-paced environment</li> </ul> <strong>Requirements:</strong> <ul> <li>3 or more years of UX/UI design experience</li><li>Experience in communicating and engaging with business clients to determine their design requirements</li><li>Solid understanding of user-centred design principles</li><li>Strong visual design and typography skills</li><li>Proficiency with Adobe Photoshop and Illustrator, as well as at least one wireframing or prototyping design tool such as Axure, Sketch, Balsamiq, or iRise</li><li>Practical experience with HTML and CSS is strongly preferred; familiarity with JavaScript (and libraries such as jQuery and Kendo UI) is desirable</li><li>Exceptional written and verbal communication skills; must be comfortable communicating with clients</li><li>Ability to manage multiple projects and prioritize tasks with attention to detail while meeting tight deadlines</li><li>Ability to work both collaboratively and independently within a team</li><li>Must have an online portfolio with examples of design projects</li> </ul> <strong>Quick Facts</strong> <ul> <li>The downtown Vancouver, BC, office is a friendly environment with energetic, forward-thinking team members and management team</li><li>Competitive salary</li><li>Generous holiday and health benefits</li> </ul> Interested candidates should send a resume and cover letter outlining their work history and capabilities. Please also include a link to your portfolio <br/><br/> We thank all applicants for their interest. However, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.<br/> <div><div>To Apply Click Here</div></div></div></div><div></div>
Title: UX/UI Designer

Job_Description: <strong>Job Description</strong> <br/> <strong>Change the world at IBM.</strong> There arent many companies who can say they have been an integral part of the global business landscape for more than a century. While the world has changed considerably over the past 100 years, IBM, our people and our offerings have continuously led the way with business and technology innovation. <br/><br/> Today, we are more than a hardware, software and services provider, yet we remain true to our heritage as a team of collaborative forward-thinkers, focused on making business and society work better. We are part of the fabric of everyday life and stand for world-changing progress. <br/><br/> Join a company where you can make an impact and literally change the world. With so many different opportunities available the sky is the limit!   <ul> <li>This position resides in <strong>Ottawa, Ontario</strong> and is a <strong>4 (co-op)</strong> month work term commencing <strong>September 2018</strong>. It is <strong>mandatory</strong> that all applicants are enrolled in <strong>full-time</strong> studies at a post-secondary institution and returning to full-time studies upon completion of the work term.</li> </ul>  <strong>What IBM Offers You?</strong> <br/><br/> Work directly on product and services that affect our clients, while having access to cutting edge software technology <br/> Work on projects which are challenging, innovative and rewarding <br/> A business casual dress code and flexible work hours, to ensure work-life balance <br/> Access to the Future Blue Community - IBMs large student community that provides networking opportunities, sporting and social events. <br/><br/> <strong>It is a mandatory requirement for students to apply online at www.ibm.com/jobs</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Closing Date: Open Until Filled</strong>  <br/><br/> <strong>Job description for the UX/UI Designer is:</strong>  <ul> <li>Brainstorm and collaborate with some of IBMs brightest minds comprising of designers, developers and product managers</li> <li>Demonstrate a clear pride of ownership by communicating design strategies to assist with product development and goals</li><li>Iterate quickly and actively participate in an agile development process within the team to incorporate new concepts and test designs</li><li>Create wireframe and interaction prototypes using hi and low fidelity design tools</li><li>Understand how to focus on a job, yet still remember to have fun</li> </ul>  Required Technical and Professional Expertise  <ul> <li>Co-op or internship program enrollment is mandatory</li><li>Knowledge and experience with interactive design domain</li><li>Demonstrated abilities in a number of UX wireframe and prototyping design tools such as (but not limited to) InVision, Sketch, Axure, and Adobe Creative Suite</li><li>Exceptional verbal, visual and written communication skills to articulate UX logic and reasoning across disciplines</li><li>Ability to collaborate with a team of designers and work well with cross-functional teams</li><li>Must be highly motivated and enjoy working in a fluid and agile environment with fast approaching release dates</li><li>Portfolio (School OK) with work samples and stories</li> </ul>  Preferred Tech and Prof Experience  <ul> <li>Familiarity with the interactive design process</li><li>Experience with research methodologies, creating personas, user scenario flows, usability testing, task analysis and information architecture</li> <li>Appreciation of the users experience when interacting with software</li><li>Ability to collaborate within a multi-disciplinary team</li> </ul>  EO Statement <br/> IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status. <br/><br/>
Title: UX/UI Designer - Coop

Job_Description: <div><div>Tulip Retail is the world’s first mobile platform built exclusively for store associates. Leading retailers like Saks Fifth Avenue, Coach, and Toys”R”Us believe in enabling the next generation of store associates with mobile technology using Tulip. We’re a team of experts who have worked with and for retailers over the past 20 years and are driven to build a company whose mission is to enable one of the world’s largest job markets. By placing Tulip-enabled iPads into the hands of store associates, our goal is to provide them with instant and reliable access to the product information, while also being able to transact, communicate, and collaborate in an omnichannel world.</div><br/> <div>As a key member of the Tulip Retail product design team, you will be responsible for driving the user experience and look and feel of the next set of Tulip Retail products and features. You will channel your passion and motivation to design user experience and UIs that make people fall in love with us. Your work will be showcased and used by some of the world’s top retailers such as Chanel and Saks Fifth Avenue. Additionally, through our partnership with Apple, you will get opportunities to collaborate with the Apple design team.</div> </div><div><div>What you'll do:  <ul>   <ul> <li>Do primary / user research to develop and iterative on wire framing design concepts using industry leading tools like Sketch, InVision</li><li>Collaborate with product managers to understand user goals and pain points</li> <li>Create pixel-perfect designs and show case them to stakeholders for reviews & feedback</li><li>Oversee implementation of the designs by working closely with the development team</li><li>Collaborate and mentor other designers on the team</li> <li>Gather feedback from end users by conducting / participating in usability studies</li><li>Keep up-to-date on mobile design trends, sharing leading practices with our teams and our clients</li><li>Show off a well-considered body of UX, service design and product strategy work</li></ul>   </ul>  </div><div><div>What you have:</strong>  <ul>   <ul> <li>7-10 years of hands-on design experience</li><li>Proven experience in designing Mobile iOS applications</li> <li>Ability to review and adhere to technical documents and brand guidelines, respectfully challenging when there's a better way</li><li>Ability to be versatile and take both leading and supporting roles</li><li>Extremely detail and process oriented</li><li>The ability to write and present eloquently and communicate clearly</li><li>Expert in Sketch and InVision</li></ul>   </ul>  </div><div><div>Bonus:</strong>  <ul>   <ul> <li>Experience in retail (understand store associate tasks, priorities, and functions and how it links to business performance)</li><li>Knowledge of HTML and CSS</li><li>Expertise with Apple Human Interface Guidelines</li></ul>   </ul>  </div></div><div><div>We thank all applicants however only those considered for an interview will be contacted</div></div>
Title: Sr. UI/UX Designer

Job_Description: Company Description<div>Smoking Gun Interactive (SGI) is a dynamic and innovative game development studio lead by industry veterans located in the heart of downtown Vancouver. We work with incredible companies and brands such as Microsoft and NASA to create compelling games, ranging from amazing original IP to the most played game on the planet (!!!), utilizing our own leading edge technology.</div>Job Description<div>SGI is looking for a talented and experienced <strong>Senior UX Designer</strong> to build exciting, innovative and accessible interfaces for our games. UX Designer works directly with the Art Director and Game Design team, helping to define player facing aspects of our games. This individual has the knowledge and sensibility of what makes an interface intuitive and how to employ visual presentation principles to create user-centric experiences. UX Designer has impeccable conceptual and problem-solving skills with a strong understanding of information architecture and how large amounts of information can be visually and functionally transformed into attractive, intuitive user interfaces. <br/><br/> The ideal candidate thrives in a collaborative work culture, is a self-starter with initiative to solve problems and excellent follow through. Strong written and verbal communication skills are critical for the internal cross-department collaboration. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities</strong> <ul> <li>Drive one or more game titles UX / UI design from feature conception to implementation of UI, and support beyond ship date</li><li>Collaborate with the Game Designers to translate game systems and gameplay user experience goals into intuitive interfaces that support and enhance the game experience.</li> <li>Work closely with the Art Director to understand and document the artistic style and goals to help define UX guidelines and build beautiful, user-centric experience</li><li>Conceptualize UI/UX designs through wireframes, flow diagrams, interactive mocks, in-game prototyping, pre-visualization clips while ensuring that iterative feedback from stakeholders is incorporated</li><li>Communicate designs and design rationale clearly, to the team and to management or others as needed</li><li>Produce final wireframes and art mock-ups for design specs, including detailed asset requirements and use cases for UI implementation</li><li>Assist artists, game designers, and programmers to fully integrate the aesthetic, mechanical, and technical elements of the product's user interface according to specifications</li><li>Orchestrate feedback loops including team's play testing and player research , and respond to the results to improve on designs</li><li>Observe and interpret results of usability testing and live game metrics, sharing conclusions with the team that help increase accessibility and inform design decision making game-wide</li><li>Maintain UX standards and related documentation to help the company create a consistent, quality experience for its players across mobile platforms and PC</li></ul></div> <br/> Qualifications<div>  <ul> <li>3+ years of UX/UI experience with interactive media and ideally in mobile development</li><li>Game experience on either traditional/console, Facebook, and/or mobile</li><li>Bachelor's degree in Interactive Design, Graphic Design, or a related field, or equivalent work experience</li><li>Diverse portfolio of UX / UI for Games, Apps, Prototypes or otherwise</li><li>Strong passion for human-centered design challenges and graphic design challenges</li><li>Willingness and ability to take ownership of the creation of a user experience from the concept stage, thru iteration and testing , all the way to the execution of a functional interface</li><li>Awareness of trends in hardware and operating systems, mobile interface design, interactive design, and competitive software to help identify opportunities for innovation.</li><li>Excellent analytical and problem solving skills and a solid understanding of user-centered design principles to design a complete interface for all game features that is functional, usable, appealing, and accessible.</li><li>Mastery of Adobe Photoshop, Flash, other Creative Suite software and proficiency in tools for visual prototyping and creation of pre-visualizations and motion graphics</li><li>Ability and willingness to learn new programs and pipelines</li><li>Sense of humor, passion for your work, and desire to grow yourself and those around you</li></ul></div> <br/> I'm interested
Title: Senior UX Designer

Job_Description: Job Description<br/><br/>We are looking for bright and passionate people to be founding members of Great-West Life’s new Digital Labs. Do you have a passion for creating compelling and meaningful digital experiences? Do you ALWAYS think about the customer first? Are you a creative problem-solver and communicator? Do you want to help lead the transformation of a company and an industry? If you answered a wholehearted yes to all these questions, we want to talk to you. <br/><br/> <strong>ABOUT GWL’S DIGITAL LABS</strong> <br/><br/> Great-West Life is embarking on a transformation that will change the way we work and how we help our customers. In our Digital Labs, we are designing, coding and delivering new products improving the lives of millions of Canadians. We are changing the way a trusted institution operates by acting as a start-up, bringing human centered design, agile and modern web development practices to life. Our multi-functional teams of Designers, Developers, Scrum Masters and Product Owners all huddle together because we have an open, innovative and inclusive culture which is focused on us – talented individuals. <br/><br/> <strong>OVERVIEW</strong> <br/><br/> As a UX Designer, you are an integral part of a team of passionate people who are transforming the design and product vision into seamless and engaging user experiences. You will support the strategic design of customer experience solutions throughout the entire design lifecycle. You will collaborate with business partners, scrum teams and other internal stakeholders to help turn business requirements, user needs and creative strategy into engaging experiences. <br/><br/> <strong>WHAT YOU’LL DO</strong>  <ul>   <li><strong>Create and effectively present UX deliverables</strong> (flows, sketches, wireframes, journey maps, prototypes, etc.) to stakeholders and teams</li>   <li>Assess data from multiple sources (UX research, SEO, product requirements, tech constraints, analytics) and synthesize it to <strong>develop efficient user scenarios</strong>, taxonomies, navigation systems, design patterns, etc.</li> <li><strong>Stay current</strong> on emerging trends in user-centered methodologies, accessibility, UI design patterns, usability principles and web technologies</li> <li><strong>Work collaboratively</strong> with User Experience, Digital Customer Experience and Strategic Customer Marketing teams and act as an <strong>advocate for the user</strong></li> </ul> <strong>WHO YOU ARE</strong>  <ul>   <li>A few years of professional experience in a UX/UI or Interaction Design role and preferably some experience in a previous role where you have acted as the UX/UI project lead</li> <li>A demonstrable portfolio of work that exhibits your process for solving design problems</li> <li>Clear ability to simplify complex concepts and requirements in presentation, design and implementation</li> <li>Experience with industry tools such as Sketch, InVision, Axure, Adobe CC</li> <li>Excellent communicator with ability to effectively convey design processes, ideas, and solutions to teams and stakeholders</li>   <li>Passionate about user experience and all things digital</li> </ul> <strong>Discover your opportunity….</strong><strong>Apply today!</strong> <br/><br/> Great-West Life offers competitive compensation, great benefits such as medical, dental, life insurance, wellness account and personal days not to mention onsite cafeteria and fitness facilities. If you’d like to join our team submit your information online and introduce yourself. <br/><br/> <em>Together Great-West Life, London Life and Canada Life serve the financial security needs of more than 13 million people across Canada, with additional operations in Europe and the United States. As members of the Power Financial Corporation group of companies, we’re one of Canada’s leading insurers with interests in life insurance, health insurance, investment and retirement savings. We offer a broad portfolio of financial and benefit plan solutions for individuals, families, businesses and organizations.</em> <br/><br/> <em>We are committed to providing an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of the communities in which we live, and to creating an environment where every employee has the opportunity to reach their potential.</em> <br/><br/> <strong><em>Great-West Lifeco would like to thank all applicants, however only those who qualify for an interview will be contacted.</em></strong>
Title: Senior UX Designer

Job_Description: <strong>A Little About Us:</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Making fans</strong> - Thats what were all about! Since our humble beginnings in 2011, these two words have driven <strong>Big Viking Games</strong> to become the successful company it is today. With over 100 Vikings already on board, and studios in both <strong>Toronto, ON and London, ON</strong>, we are focused on making our mark by building awesome free-to-play mobile and social games. Big Viking Games has proudly amassed millions of loyal fans across its many popular titles with no signs of slowing down anytime soon. We believe that by investing in our employees and in new technologies, such as HTML5, we can continue our success for years to come. With that in mind, we are on the hunt for exceptional talent to join our growing team, and thats where you come in! <br/><br/> <strong>The Nitty Gritty:</strong> <br/><br/> Big Viking Games is looking to add a <strong>UI/UX Designer</strong> to our Ventures Division (Mobile/Instant Games), who will collaborate with Game Designers and Developers to ship titles! Reporting to the Ventures Producer, this role will be based out of our <strong>Toronto, ON</strong> studio. <br/><br/> <strong>The Duties:</strong>  <ul> <li>Work closely with Product Managers, Producers, Art Director and Game Designers to create an effective user experience</li> <li>Able to understand feature documentation and GDD and break out the User Interface tasks and scope</li> <li>Independently and collaboratively, work with the team in order to develop UI workflow and design</li> <li>Create annotated wireframes, clickable wireframes/prototypes, workflow diagrams, mockups and design specifications for proper implementation</li> <li>Maintain UX-related documentation as needed throughout the lifecycle of the project</li> <li>As a self-motivated individual and triage expert, you will prioritize deadlines while working on multiple projects simultaneously</li> <li>Deliver top quality work while working under tight deadlines</li> <li>Foster and maintain effective relationships with your teammates and fellow Vikings</li> <li>Orchestrate feedback loops including UI analytics and user testing, and respond to the results to improve on designs</li> <li>Ideate on game UI concepts</li> <li>Mentor junior artists</li> </ul> <strong>The Must Haves:</strong>  <ul> <li>A minimum of 4 years working experience in the gaming industry, preference is given to those that have additional experience working in the mobile space previously</li> <li>Previous experience creating UI for mobile games</li> <li>Strong understanding of mobile and interactive design fundamentals</li> <li>Advanced communications and interpersonal skills</li> <li>Expert Photoshop and Illustrator skills</li> <li>Axure and InVision</li> <li>A passion for games with a deep understanding of top grossing mobile gaming products</li> </ul> <strong>The Nice to Haves:</strong>  <ul> <li>An understanding/passion for marketing and branding</li> <li>Proficiency in Zbrush, Mudbox or other 3D modelling suites</li> <li>Previously shipped games, ideally mobile</li> <li>An understanding of statistics, analytics, and AB testing</li> </ul> <strong>Loot:</strong>  <ul> <li>Competitive salary, bonus program, Group Retirement Savings Plan matching, and participation in the Employee Stock Option Plan.</li> <li>Comprehensive benefits package (health, dental, and vision), including generous time off policies.</li> <li>Stocked kitchen, unlimited snacks and beverages, along with breakfast and daily hot lunches. Vikings can't work on an empty stomach!</li> <li>Lots of other great perks such as frequent company paid outings, events and get-togethers.</li> </ul> <strong>Becoming a Viking:</strong> <br/><br/> Does the idea of working for a gaming company doing what you love everyday sound exciting? Great, wed love to hear from you! Send us your resume and cover letter <br/><br/> <em>Big Viking Games is committed to providing accommodations for people with disabilities. If you require an accommodation, we will work with you to meet your needs. Accommodation may be provided in all parts of the hiring process. For More information regarding accessibility, please visit our Accessibility webpage.</em>
Title: UI/UX Designer

Job_Description: About working at CHIMP <br/><br/> At CHIMP (Charitable Impact), we know that everyone has something to give. That's why we’re leading the movement to make giving a part of everyday living for everyone. <br/><br/> We love working with talented, creative, and open-minded people who strive to make a difference. We also look for people who share our core values of generosity, inclusivity, curiosity, courage, and responsibility—the guiding principles we stand by and incorporate into our work every day. <br/><br/> We know that a diverse team is what makes our work and culture great. That's why we're committed to building an inclusive and collaborative workplace that values equity and welcomes everyone. Our team members enjoy competitive salaries, purposeful perks, and a culture that gives back and has fun doing it. So come and join us, and let's change the world together. <br/><br/> About the role <br/><br/> Embedded within the Experience Design team in the Product Department, the UX/UI role is a generalist role which focuses on creating exceptional experiences across various product verticals. <br/><br/> This role will also work closely with business development, research, marketing professionals, various subject matter experts and stakeholders to advance CHIMP through meaningful and refined experiences. <br/><br/> Core responsibilities  <ul>  <li>Create world-class design solutions to various UX/UI problems</li>    <li>Work closely with Product Managers, stakeholders and subject matter experts to assess and understand requirements and work strategically on crafting solutions</li>    <li>Work closely with our Content Strategists and content-first design methodologies</li>    <li>Work seamlessly with different teams and departments</li>    <li>Create flows, wireframes, high-fidelity mock-ups and interactive prototypes for different digital products</li>    <li>Conduct remote usability testing and observe best practices of solution validation</li>    <li>Analyze user feedback and activity, and iterate to enhance the experience for our users</li>    <li>Provide timelines and delivery estimates</li>    <li>Work closely with our Research departments to understand our audiences and how research and analytics translate into our everyday work</li>    </ul> What you’ll bring  <ul>  <li>Creativity and passion for what you do</li>    <li>5+ years of digital design experience, spanning the disciplines of UX, UI and visual design</li>    <li>Undergraduate degree in a relevant discipline</li>    <li>Mastery of industry-standard design tools (Adobe, Sketch, InVision, etc.)</li>    <li>Experience working in a fast-paced environment</li>    <li>Excellent communication and presentation skills</li>    <li>Ability to simplify complexity and distill ideas</li>    <li>Ability to both take high-level direction and have ownership over projects and specific pieces of work</li>    <li>Solid understanding of design best practices and current design frameworks</li>    <li>Design thinking practice as a strategic problem-solving discipline</li>    </ul> <br/><br/> Our ideal candidate  <ul>  <li>A resourceful, authentic and transparent creator and maker</li>    <li>Someone who cares about the same things we do</li>    <li>Is a proactive communicator and someone who can work independently</li>    <li>A lifelong learner who is curious and open-minded</li>    <li>Possesses a collaborative, team-focused working style</li>    <li>Is familiar with omni-channel- and research-driven approaches to design</li>    <li>Has experience working with complex stakeholder groups and senior executives in fast-paced environments</li>    <li>Can translate and express complex information into compelling and effective design solutions</li>    <li>Possesses strong project management skills</li>    </ul> Reports to  <ul>  <li>Director, Experience Design</li>    </ul> Status  <ul>  <li>Full time regular (permanent), 40 hours per week. Based in Vancouver, BC</li>    </ul> More about CHIMP <br/><br/> CHIMP (Charitable Impact) was founded to radically transform how people experience giving. Our online platform makes it easy to support the causes you care about, raise money with others, and track your impact over time. We also help donors make their biggest impact by offering strategic giving support. <br/><br/> By empowering people to give on their terms, we’ve helped Canadians donate more than $350 million to thousands of charities—and we’re just getting started!
Title: UX/UI Designer

Job_Description: <strong>Job Description</strong> <br/> <strong>Location: Ottawa or Fredericton</strong> <br/><br/> Join the development team of IBM® QRadar®, one of the top ranked Security Event and Incident Management (SIEM) platform in the world. As a UX/UI Designer, you will be an integral part of our team and working collaboratively with the managers, developers, other designers in the group, and internal and external stakeholders. You will have the opportunity to address some of our customers most challenging business problems , and make a difference by creating irresistible solutions. The best candidate will be a dynamic and interpersonal individual, results oriented, deadline driven and highly organized with a superior attention to detail and accuracy. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities:</strong>  <ul> <li>Collaborate with various stakeholders to create brilliant interfaces and user experience solutions</li><li>Produce and enhance low-fidelity sketches and medium fidelity wire frames to facilitate communication of recommended solutions</li><li>Participate in stakeholder interviews and translate findings into usable, useful, effective and efficient user experiences</li><li>Participate in user research and design workshops</li> </ul>  <strong>This role may involve working with technology that is covered by embargo Export Regulations. If you are a Foreign National from any of the following embargoed countries (Cuba, Iran, North Korea, Sudan, Syria) on a work permit you are not eligible for employment in this position.</strong> <br/><br/> Required Technical and Professional Expertise  <ul> <li>English Fluent (verbal and written)</li><li>Min 3-5 years experience as a user experience designer</li><li>Strong understanding of UX design and principles</li><li>Ability to work independently and collaboratively</li><li>Strong attention to detail</li><li>Experience with HTML, CSS and Java Script</li><li>Broad knowledge of current computer technologies and applications</li><li>Portfolio Submission</li> </ul>  Preferred Tech and Prof Experience  <ul> <li>Front End Development (like ReactJs)</li><li>Experience with data visualizations</li> </ul>  EO Statement <br/> IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status. <br/><br/>
Title: UX/UI designer

Job_Description: Sengled Canada is looking for a smart and talented Senior UX/UI Designer to join our team in Vancouver, BC. <br/><br/> Are you excited by the latest cutting edge gadgets? Are you interested in Internet of Things? At Sengled Canada, we are at the frontier of Internet of Things. Come and join us to change the future of smart homes! <br/><br/> Sengled currently sells a complete line of smart LED light bulbs with sensors and speakers built in. Sengled products have won numerous innovation awards at CES 2015, CES 2016 and CES 2017. We have offices in five countries including China, US, Canada, Germany and Australia. Sengled Canada is located in Vancouver, BC. Although we are part of a bigger company, we are a small office that encourages a collaborative and relaxed startup-like working environment. <br/><br/> This role is a great opportunity for a UI/UX designer that is looking for a new professional challenge. You will have the chance to grow and hone your leadership skills, flex your creative skills, and have a direct impact on the direction of the company. <br/><br/> Be a part of a smart and friendly team that works hard and has a lot of fun. Free coffee, snacks and a fridge that's always stocked with beverages! <br/><br/> <strong>Why we love working at Sengled Canada:</strong> <br/><br/> * Competitive salary with frequent compensation review <br/><br/> * Competitive annual bonuses with the possibility of partial bonus payouts after each milestone <br/><br/> * Full coverage of MSP, extended health, dental and travel insurance for you and your family <br/><br/> * Convenient downtown location <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities:</strong> <br/><br/> * Oversee the design and delivery of effective user interfaces across a range of corporate websites and mobile apps <br/><br/> * Create, improve and use wireframes, prototypes, style guides, user flows, and effectively communicate your interaction ideas using any of these methods <br/><br/> * Manage and maintain a library of design components across multiple projects <br/><br/> * Update existing UI design style guide for use across the company <br/><br/> * Conduct research by talking to customers and validating design assumptions <br/><br/> * Think big picture strategy but also roll up your sleeves for detailed pixel perfect design work <br/><br/> <strong>Key Skills/Experience:</strong> <br/><br/> * A strong portfolio which demonstrates a range of skills with tools and techniques <br/><br/> * History of consistently delivering considerable ROI for a range of clients <br/><br/> * Experience with agile environment (Kanban and Scrum) <br/><br/> * Ability to collaborate closely with developers, copywriters, product managers, other designers and graphic artists <br/><br/> * An expert knowledge of UI design principles and techniques <br/><br/> * A strong working knowledge of UX and Interaction Design <br/><br/> * A strong working knowledge of Information Architecture <br/><br/> * A strong understanding of e-commmerce UX design principles <br/><br/> * Experience leading a team of junior designers <br/><br/> * Ability to handle feedback graciously and professionally and also provide constructive feedback to peers <br/><br/> * A strong working knowledge of mobile UI design principles <br/><br/> * Experience with responsive design and grid systems <br/><br/> * Working knowledge of HTML and CSS3 (including the Bootstrap framework) <br/><br/> * Strong working knowledge of Figma, Sketch and Zeplin, Photoshop and Illustrator, InVision, Marvel, or Axure, Flinto, Principle, or Framer <br/><br/> * Experience delivering UI design projects to budget and deadlines <br/><br/> * Ability to clearly and effectively present ideas to team and stakeholders <br/><br/> * Strong time management skills and reliably setting and meeting deadlines <br/><br/> <strong>Preferred Requirements</strong> <br/><br/> * At least 4 years of relevant experience exclusively in a UI/UX Design role <br/><br/> * Experience working with distributed teams. <br/><br/> * Being fluent in Mandarin Chinese is a plus but not required
Title: Senior UI/UX Designer

Job_Description: <div> <div> <div> <div>Nous valorisons la diversité et avons cœur de créer un milieu de travail inclusif qui nous inspire tous donner le meilleur de nous-mêmes. Joignez-vous notre équipe et faites une différence!</div>  </div> </div>  </div> <div> <div> Votre poste</div>  </div> <div> <div> <div> <div><em><strong>Nous</strong></em> <br/> Comment imaginez-vous les bureaux dune compagnie dassurance? Et latmosphère de travail qui y règne? Nous gageons que si vous passez nous voir au Lab de Intact, vous serez très surpris! Situé au centre-ville de Montréal, nous sommes un laboratoire dinnovation dont la mission est de créer des produits la fine-pointe de linsurtech qui améliorent la vie de millions de Canadiens. <br/><br/> Mariant la convivialité et la vélocité dune startup aux ressources et aux moyens dune grande entreprise (vous disposerez de tous les outils dont vous avez toujours rêvé!), le Lab est un environnement jeune et dynamique, offrant des défis stimulants, des collègues inspirants et une carrière passionnante (chez un des top 100 employeurs au Canada). Cest lendroit idéal pour parfaire vos compétences et faire évoluer votre carrière. <br/><br/> <em><strong>Vous</strong></em> <br/> Vous êtes passionné par le commerce électronique et linnovation numérique? Vous avez un talent particulier pour traduire des exigences complexes en expériences utiles et agréables? Vous restez laffût des dernières tendances en matière de design et vous aimez expérimenter de nouveaux outils et de nouvelles méthodologies? Nous avons loccasion parfaite pour vous! <br/><br/> <strong><em>Rôle</em></strong> <br/> À titre de designer UX/UI, vous jouerez un rôle essentiel dans la conception et lévolution de notre écosystème numérique. Relevant du directeur principal, Innovations numériques, vous aurez comme principales responsabilités :  <ul>   <li>Concevoir des expériences captivantes en vue de réaliser les objectifs daffaires</li>   <li>Valider la fonctionnalité et lutilité par lentremise de tests et de recherches auprès des utilisateurs</li>   <li>Produire des livrables UX et design pertinents au besoin</li>   <li>Piloter une feuille de route aux côté dun directeur de produit et dune équipe agile multidisciplinaire</li>   <li>Présenter le travail aux parties prenantes</li>   <li>Aider les ingénieurs produire des interfaces de qualité et agréables</li>   <li>Prôner une conception axée sur lutilisateur et les données</li> </ul>   </div> </div> </div>  </div> <div> <div> Vos compétences</div>  </div> <div> <div> <div> <div>   <ul>   <li>Minimum trois années dexpérience</li>   <li>Expertise en matière de convivialité et de pratiques de conception centrées sur l'utilisateur</li>   <li>Maîtrise des outils de conception (Sketch, Axure, InVision, Illustrator, etc.)</li>   <li>Expérience des outils de recherche UX (usertesting.com, Optimal Workshop, etc.) un atout</li>   <li>Expérience dans la production de flux de processus, dinventaires de contenu, etc.</li>   <li>Vous aimez travailler dans un environnement de collaboration qui accorde une importance primordiale au travail déquipe, linnovation, louverture desprit et au plaisir</li> </ul> <em>Veuillez inclure votre portfolio dans votre dossier de candidature.</em> <br/><br/> <strong><em>Vous êtes</em></strong>  <ul>   <li>Une personne avec qui il est agréable de travailler</li>   <li>Créatif, analytique, curieux et ingénieux</li>   <li>Un joueur déquipe capable de partager et recevoir des commentaires constructifs</li>   <li>Excellent pour expliquer vos idées différents intervenants</li>   <li>Profondément passionné par le design et la qualité</li>   <li>Organisé et proactif</li> </ul> <em><strong>En tant que salarié temps plein, vous bénéficierez des avantages suivants :</strong></em>  <ul>   <li>Un salaire compétitif</li>   <li>Un boni de performance annuel</li>   <li>Un régime de retraite</li>   <li>Un horaire de travail flexible de 35 heures par semaine</li>   <li>Des assurances médicales et dentaires hors pair</li>   <li>Et plusieurs autres avantages et bénéfices (remboursement gym, conférences, etc.)</li> </ul>   </div> </div> </div>  </div> <div> <div> Énoncé fermeture</div>  </div> <div> <div> <div> <div><strong>Cette opportunité vous intéresse? Nous avons très hâte de faire votre connaissance!</strong> <br/><br/> Dexcellents avantages sont offerts : salaire concurrentiel, avantages flexibles, aménagements de travail flexibles, congés mobiles, régime de retraite prestation déterminée, etc. <br/><br/> Dans le cadre du processus de sélection dIntact, les candidats peuvent être appelés donner leur consentement une vérification de leurs antécédents pertinente au poste pourvoir avant de recevoir une offre demploi. Celle-ci peut comprendre une confirmation des références demploi, des études et des titres de compétences, une vérification des emplois, de lidentité, des infractions criminelles et du permis de conduire ainsi quun rapport de crédit. <br/><br/> Vous pouvez soumettre votre candidature un emploi affiché pourvu que vous occupiez vos fonctions actuelles depuis au moins douze mois et que votre performance soit jugée bonne ou que votre contrat temporaire arrive son échéance. Une recherche de talents l'externe est menée parallèlement au recrutement l'interne Veuillez donc prendre note que des candidats potentiels pourraient avoir été identifiés pour ce poste dans le cadre de leur plan de développement. <br/><br/> <em>*Veuillez noter que l'usage du masculin a comme but d'alléger le texte.</em> <br/><br/> <strong>Cet affichage prendra fin 02 juin 2018.</strong></div>  </div> </div>  </div> <div> <div> Prime de recommandation</div>  </div> <div> <div> <div> <div>CE POSTE EST SUJET À UNE PRIME DE RECOMMANDATION DE 3000$. <br/><br/> #li-qc</div>  </div> </div>  </div> <div> <div> Droit de travailler au Canada</div>  </div> <div> <div> <div> <div>Les personnes qui posent leur candidature un poste permanent doivent, dès leur embauche, avoir le droit de travailler au Canada de façon permanente. Les documents pouvant servir de preuve dans le cas des rôles permanents sont un certificat de naissance canadien, un passeport canadien, un certificat de citoyenneté canadienne, une carte de résident permanent ou une confirmation de son statut de résident permanent pour prouver quil a le droit de travailler au Canada.</div>  </div> </div>  </div> <div> <div> Indeed Commandité</div>  </div> <div> <div> <div> <div>IN-INFR</div>  </div> </div>  </div>
Title: Designer UX/UI

Job_Description: <b>Are you a well-seasoned designer with an innovative mind and the passion to create cutting-edge digital experiences?</b><br> <p>Founded in 2002, Ballistic Arts Media Studios is a full-service creative agency in Coquitlam, BC providing design, web development, and video production services to local and national clients in a variety of industries. Our designers work on diverse projects from brand logos to websites to expansive interactive presentation centres. To keep up with our growing business, we’re looking for an experienced <b>UX/UI Designer </b>to join our team!</p> <p>As a UX/UI designer, you’ll get to work alongside the talented folks on our design team to create amazing digital experiences through a thoughtful collaborative process! You’ll be responsible for taking part in our creative process from start to finish: collaborative brainstorming, producing wireframes, and creating design prototypes, mockups and assets. The work is fast-paced and challenging, promoting teamwork and individual growth. We work for a variety of different industries and clients, keeping the work diverse and interesting.</p> <p>The position is for a UI / UX designer to work from our Coquitlam office- we are not looking to hire contractors or people that work remotely. The position starts with a probationary 3-month period with a performance review conducted at the end to discuss options.</p> <p>We’re a small team (there’s less than 30 of us!) that likes to have fun; our outgoing crew loves thoughtful conversations over lunch, Smash Bros. tournaments, and occasionally hitting local breweries together after work. We’re also always looking for ways to give back, whether it’s spending an afternoon cleaning up the creek near our building, or holding a workshop with kids from a nearby school!</p> <p> </p> <p>We offer a supportive work environment with a great company culture. We are dedicated to the success of our projects, clients, and team members.</p> <p> </p> <b>Job Description</b> <p><b>Key Responsibilities:</b></p> <ul> <li>Conceptualize and create a range of wireframes, prototypes, and mockups for various web projects and in support of marketing strategies</li> <li>Collaborate with project managers and creative leads to produce user experiences that support our clients goals and visions while considering the end-user</li> <li>Focus on current best practices while looking for opportunities to push for new methodologies and technical advances</li> <li>Communicate the intended user-experience with research, user stories, wireframes, style-frames, module design, prototypes, and mockups</li> <li>Collaborate with our skilled web development team to realize the intended user-experience and provide required visual assets</li> <li>Design for a varied instances such as: websites, email campaigns, intranets and client portals, interactive displays, mobile devices and desktops</li> </ul> <b>Skills and Experience:</b> <ul> <li>Knowledgeable on current best practices and trends in user experience/user interfaces.</li> <li>Advanced knowledge of Adobe Photoshop CC</li> <li>A diverse and visually stunning portfolio of past web-based design projects</li> <li>Experience preparing briefs, wireframes and creative mock-ups</li> <li>Exceptionally organized with great attention to detail</li> <li>Great communication skills</li> <li>Willing to accept and provide direction </li> <li>Committed self-starter, self-responsible, independent worker</li> <li>Strong time management skills</li> <li>Positive attitude and an ability to provide and receive constructive feedback</li> <li>Comfortable with spontaneous outbursts of singing and a fan of all-you-can-eat Indian food</li> </ul>
Title: UI-UX Designer

Job_Description: You find yourself dissecting the progression, monetization, and/or gameplay systems for great action RPGs. You’re intrigued by seeing how the modifications you’ve made change the way people play. You see the world of gaming as so much more than a hobby. Working on a new project, you’re excited by working cross-functionally, partnering closely with Engineers, Designers and others. <br/><br/> Kabam is looking for skilled<strong>Systems Designers</strong> to elevate our Design team on some exciting new projects. <br/><br/> We don’t just design games, we play them and love them, and are fans of the IP’s we work on. <br/><br/> As a<strong>Systems Designer,</strong> you will: <ul> <li>Collaborate with an extremely talented team of Engineers, UI/UX artists, Data Scientists, QA and LiveOps to create addictive, compelling player experiences that will delight users for years</li><li>Provide input on the game’s vision and help champion that vision to other team members</li><li>Design rules and parameters for features and systems</li><li>Design, implement, tune, and balance game systems, economies, and progression</li><li>Create design docs, drawings, diagrams, flowcharts, and any other necessary documents to communicate design functionality and vision</li><li>Continually iterate, balance and tune features and gameplay based on feedback from the game teams, user testing and the broader player community</li><li>Build free-to-play mobile games that the world loves to play</li> </ul> At Kabam, we’re constantly raising the bar of excellence in free-to-play mobile gaming. We hire for passion and diversity so that together as a team we can triumph in our collective skill. Our teams are made up of a fusion of personalities and interests bound together by a collaborative nature, fun-loving culture and drive to do what it takes to make great games. And this is where you come in… <br/><br/> Your background includes: <ul> <li>3+ years of game design experience on commercially successful properties</li><li>Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience with an emphasis on game design, economics, math, or psychology</li><li>Ultimate problem solving, critical thinking, logical, and analytical skills</li><li>Spreadsheet wizardry</li><li>Deep familiarity with RPG, BCG, and action genres on mobile, PC, console, and pen-and-paper platforms</li> </ul> Interested? Tell us what you’re looking for - in your application, tell what games have influenced you? <br/><br/> Apply now and start the conversation with us. Together, we can create some of the best games ever made. <br/><br/> About Kabam <br/> Kabam is a world leader of massively multiplayer games for mobile devices. Console quality graphics and next generation technology are the hallmark of Kabam games. Kabam merges the art of game design and the science of consumer behaviour to create immersive games enjoyed by players around the world. Kabam’s games have generated hundreds of millions of downloads includingMarvel Contest of Champions andTransformers: Forged to Fight and won several awards including Apple Editor’s Choice and Google Play’s Best Game of the Year. Kabam has studios and offices in Vancouver, San Francisco and Austin. Kabam is a wholly-owned subsidiary of Netmarble Games.
Title: Systems Designer

Job_Description: Are you up for the challenge of impacting, defining, and designing an entire SUITE of industry-leading software? Have you always wanted to be part of a team during that rocketship phase from scrappy startup to international powerhouse? Have you dreamed of your designs impacting people's lives in a positive way and enabling them to live their best lives? If youre a user-focused, ambitious Ui/UX designer with an entrepreneurial attitude, Jungle Scout is where you belong. <br/><br/> Were looking for a design wizard who has that magic combination of usability focus, creative passion, and artisanal craftsmanship that is rooted in the best practices of digital experience design. <br/><br/> This is your chance to be a critical component in how Jungle Scout defines the experience of its suite of tools and empowers its incredible (and exponentially growing) user base to become their own bosses. <br/><br/> You will be a key player on the product design team, translating business needs and customer desires into features, flows, and digital tools. <br/><br/> Your work will require deep expertise with UX design best practices across platforms and a creative flare for Ui as well. Youll need a holistic understanding of how people use software and how to translate ideas into intuitive experiences for our customers. You need to be a self-starter that is more focused on getting that MVP out the door than suffering from analysis paralysis when it comes to where exactly that button needs to be placed. <br/><br/> Your Responsibilities:  <ul> <li>Work the with product design team to define and refine the user experience of the Jungle Scout suite of tools.</li> <li>Work closely with our team of amazing designers to maintain and enhance our design component library and overall aesthetic.</li> <li>Work collaboratively with other departments from product management, to customer support, and marketing to ensure we are serving our customers up the best solutions to their problems.</li> <li>Design, test, release, learn and repeat.</li> </ul> Your Qualifications  <ul> <li>You have a portfolio that displays a deep understanding of UX best practices and modern trends in Ui design.</li> <li>Have 3+ years experience as a UX or Ui designer in a startup, product, or agency setting.</li> <li>Have excellent communication skills, and ability to work across functional teams (engineering, product, marketing, customer success and more).</li> <li>Are entrepreneurial. You need to be a self-starter who is comfortable with ambiguity and defining your own direction. You can operate autonomously in a fast-paced environment with the capacity to make informed decisions and guide our customers success.</li> <li>Help build and follow processes and procedures that can scale as we grow.</li> </ul> Why Jungle Scout: <br/><br/> We are a fun-loving group of professionals, working remotely around the world while pursuing one goal: to help people launch and grow successful Amazon businesses.  <ul> <li>Jungle Scout has competitive compensation packages, a generous vacation policy, educational stipend, and the mindset that you should work when and where most suits your personality.</li> <li>We care about our culture and your continued development so twice a year we gather the entire team for Jungle Camp, an all-expense paid trip to a great location to foster learning, growth, fun and team bonding! Past Jungle Camps have been held in Bali, Rio de Janeiro, Budapest, and Bangkok.</li> </ul>
Title: Senior UX/Ui Designer

Job_Description: Ice Edge Business Solutions is a dynamic software company based in Calgary Alberta, offering one of the most unique and exciting work atmospheres to be found anywhere! <br/><br/> We are currently looking for a UI / UX Designer Programmer in our Calgary office. <br/><br/> Why join us? Our unique culture has made Ice Edge and its parent company DIRTT Environmental Solutions one of Canada's 50 Best Managed Companies. <br/><br/> Why else? We offer an extensive benefits package for all full-time employees; including personal Red Seal Chefs cooking up hot and delicious lunches every day. Routinely we exercise our T3 pinballmachine while enjoying Pub night on Thursdays and some of us may have even customized our exercise balls to look like Death Stars. Plus, we're hiring like crazy right now and looking for smart, forward-thinking problem solvers to join our first class and fairly wacky team. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities:</strong>   <ul> <li>Contribute innovative ideas.sounds easyits not..</li> <li>Front end web development, could be as much as 80% of your time</li> <li>Create wireframes and sketches showing the user experience flow</li> <li>Collaborate with other designers and product and project managers</li> <li>Conduct user interviews and fly on the wall research</li> </ul>  Skills & Requirements   <ul> <li>1 or more years of experience with everything looking for ambition and personality!</li> <li>Proficient in Javascript, CSS3, HTML5 and Adobe Creative Suite (Illustrator)</li> <li>Familiar with Invision, Figma, Axure, OutSystems</li> <li>Experience and understanding of user interface and visual design patterns</li> <li>Strong written and verbal skills, unlike me</li> <li>Exceptional design and production skills with strong attention to detail</li> <li>A passion for technology!</li> </ul>  If you are ready to become part of a team that is focused on catapulting our revolutionary product into the mainstream market, then you are ready to JOIN ICE TODAY! <br/><br/> To apply for this position, please apply on-line or email us at: <br/><br/> careers@ice-edge.com. <br/><br/> Please quote the position title in your subject line. <br/><br/> We are an equal opportunity employer. We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted
Title: UI / UX Designer Programmer

Job_Description: <div> <div> <div> <div>We value diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive workplace that inspires each of us to be the best we can be. Join our team and make a difference!</div>  </div> </div>  </div> <div> <div> Your Job</div>  </div> <div> <div> <div> <div><strong>About you</strong> <br/><br/> Are you passionate about human behaviour and digital innovation? Are you skilled at translating complex requirements into usable and delightful experiences? Do you keep on top of the latest trends in design and love experimenting with new tools and methodologies? Do you like to dig into data in search of new solutions? We've got the perfect opportunity for you in downtown Montreal! <br/><br/> Join our team and help us shape the future digital experience of Canada's leading insurance brand. We can't wait to meet you! <br/><br/> <strong>Your role</strong> <br/><br/> As a Senior UX/UI Designer, you play a mission critical role in conceiving and evolving our digital ecosystem. Reporting to the Manager, Digital Platforms, your main responsibilities are:  <ul>   <li>Conceiving compelling experiences that help achieve business objectives.</li>   <li>Validating usability and usefulness via user testing and user research.</li>   <li>Producing relevant UX and design deliverables where required.</li>   <li>Presenting work to stakeholders.</li>   <li>Helping developers produce quality, delightful interfaces.</li>   <li>Helping conceive experiments to optimize the platforms (A/B testing and more)</li>   <li>Being an advocate for user-centered, data-driven design.</li> </ul>   </div> </div> </div>  </div> <div> <div> Your Skills</div>  </div> <div> <div> <div> <div>   <ul>   <li>Bachelor degree in a relevant program</li>   <li>At least 5 years of experience in a similar role</li>   <li>Expertise in usability and user-centered design practices</li>   <li>Mastery of design tools (Sketch, Axure, Photoshop, Illustrator, etc.)</li>   <li>Experience with UX research (ie. user tests)</li>   <li>Knowledge of testing and experimentation (experience with Adobe Target an asset)</li>   <li>Experience in producing wireframes, process flows, prototypes, etc</li>   <li>You love working in a collaborative environment that has a strong focus on teamwork, innovation, open minds and having fun</li> </ul> Please include your portfolio in your application. <br/><br/> <strong>You are</strong>  <ul>   <li>Creative, analytical, curious and ingenious</li>   <li>A team player that can share and receive constructive feedback</li>   <li>You excel at explaining your ideas to different stakeholders</li>   <li>Deeply passionate about design and quality</li>   <li>A leader who takes initiatives</li>   <li>Organized and proactive</li> </ul> <strong>As a full-time employee your benefits include :</strong>  <ul>   <li>A competitive salary</li>   <li>An annual performance bonus</li>   <li>A pension plan</li>   <li>Flexible work hours and a 35 hour work week</li>   <li>Top of the line medical and dental insurance</li>   <li>And many more benefits (gym refunds, paid conferences, etc.)</li> </ul>   </div> </div> </div>  </div> <div> <div> Closing Statement</div>  </div> <div> <div> <div> <div>As part of Intacts selection process, candidates may be requested to consent to background checks relevant to the role under consideration for, prior to receiving a job offer. These could include: work references, education and credential confirmation, employment verification, identity check, credit report, criminal offence and drivers license record. <br/><br/> <strong>This posting closes on April 25, 2018.</strong></div>  </div> </div>  </div> <div> <div> Eligibility to work in Canada</div>  </div> <div> <div> <div> <div>Proof of eligibility for permanent roles may come in the form of a Canadian birth certificate, Canadian passport, Canadian citizenship certificate, permanent residence card or confirmation. Applicants must be permanently eligible to work in Canada upon hire.</div>  </div> </div>  </div>
Title: Senior UX/UI Designer

Job_Description: <div> <div> The opportunity <br/>  <br/> We’re looking for a designer who’s passionate about creating meaningful experiences through beautifully designed products. You should have a proven record leading product design from concept to completion and working collaboratively with your clients and your team. You’re also interested in constantly learning and growing—both building your own skill set and helping develop the people around you.</div>  <br/><div> What we'd like to see   <ul>   <li>You’re a strategic thinker and can translate strategy into products that have real impact</li> <li>You understand user needs and can identify business opportunities</li> <li>You can develop wireframes and build prototypes</li> <li>You have the ability to communicate and collaborate effectively with the business partners</li> <li>You can simultaneously see the bigger picture and focus on the finer details</li> <li>You can provide mentorship to other members of the design team, helping them push their boundaries and build their skill sets</li> <li>You like to be in a super-collaborative environment, working alongside talented developers, designers, QA analysts and delivery managers throughout the lifecycle of a project</li> <li>You can visualize experiences from static comps to fully fledged animations. You’re proficient in Sketch, Invision, Photoshop and other design tools</li> <li>You love digital and keep your eye on best practices and emerging trends in web and mobile design</li> <li>You independently adopt new technologies and practices (e.g. tools, platforms, features, etc.)</li> <li>You’re a fearless advocate. You inspire confidence and educate others around design methods that create great products</li> </ul>  </div>  <br/><div> Now a little about us <br/>  <br/> Established in 2010, we’re a closely knit team of developers, designers, QA Analysts and leaders who truly love what we do day in and day out. We’ve designed and developed products with companies such as PayPal, Tumblr, TELUS, Microsoft and YogaGlo. We work with early stage startups to help bring their first version products to market, and find product-market fit. We also work with large organizations to teach them how move quickly and create quality products by adopting startup cultures and habits. No matter the scale of the project, our goal is to create products and services that will help our partners further develop their business and deliver an application that people will enjoy using. <br/><br/> Joining Nascent means being able to work on products used by millions of people every day. You’ll be working in an open, honest and engaging environment in downtown Toronto. We offer great opportunities, competitive benefits and a ton of fun.</div>  <br/><div> Go on apply! <br/>  <br/> Nascent’s a great place to work, and we’d love for you to find out firsthand. To apply, e-mail us at careers@nascentdigital.com. Please include your resume or CV, a link to your online portfolio and the position for which you’re applying in the subject line. We look forward to hearing from you!</div> </div> <br/>
Title: Senior UX/UI Designer

Job_Description: Are you up for the challenge of impacting, collaborating on, and designing an entire SUITE of industry-leading software? Have you always wanted to be part of a team during that rocketship phase from scrappy startup to international powerhouse? Have you dreamed of your designs impacting people's lives in a positive way and enabling them to live their best lives? Looking for that team and that mentorship that will really enable you to take your craft to the next level? If youre a user-focused, ambitious Ui/UX designer with an entrepreneurial attitude, Jungle Scout is where you belong. <br/><br/> Were looking for a design padawan who has that magic combination of usability focus, creative passion, and inquisitive sensibility that makes an exceptional Jr designer. <br/><br/> This is your chance to be step up to the plate, level up your skills, and be a critical component in how Jungle Scout defines the experience of its suite of tools and empowers its incredible (and exponentially growing) user base to become their own bosses. <br/><br/> You will be a key player on the product design team, executing designs, collaborating on solutions, and cranking out features, flows, and Ui elements for our digital tools. <br/><br/> Your work will require a considerate understanding of UX design best practices across platforms and a creative flare for Ui as well. Youll need a holistic understanding of how people use software and how to execute designs in Sketch. You need to be a self-starter that is more focused on getting that MVP out the door than suffering from analysis paralysis when it comes to where exactly that button needs to be placed. <br/><br/> Your Responsibilities:  <ul> <li>Work the with product design team to define and refine the user experience of the Jungle Scout suite of tools.</li> <li>Work closely with our team of amazing designers to maintain and enhance our design component library and overall aesthetic.</li> <li>Work collaboratively with other departments from product management, to customer support, and marketing to ensure we are serving our customers up the best solutions to their problems.</li> <li>Design, test, release, learn and repeat.</li> </ul> Your Qualifications:  <ul> <li>You have a portfolio that displays a deep understanding of UX best practices and modern trends in Ui design.</li> <li>Have 1+ years experience as a UX or Ui designer in a startup, product, or agency setting.</li> <li>Have excellent communication skills, and ability to work across functional teams (engineering, product, marketing, customer success and more).</li> <li>Are entrepreneurial. You need to be a self-starter who is comfortable with ambiguity and defining your own direction.
