You can operate autonomously in a fast-paced environment with the capacity to make informed decisions and guide our customers success.</li> <li>Help build and follow processes and procedures that can scale as we grow.</li> </ul> Why Jungle Scout:  <ul> <li>We are a fun-loving group of professionals, working remotely around the world while pursuing one goal: to help people launch and grow successful Amazon businesses.</li> <li>Jungle Scout has competitive compensation packages, a generous vacation policy, educational stipend, and the mindset that you should work when and where most suits your personality.</li> <li>We care about our culture and your continued development so twice a year we gather the entire team for Jungle Camp, an all-expense paid trip to a great location to foster learning, growth, fun and team bonding! Past Jungle Camps have been held in Bali, Rio de Janeiro, Budapest, and Bangkok.</li> </ul>
Title: Junior UX/Ui Designer

Job_Description: <div><div><strong><u>Purpose of the Job:</u></strong> <br/><br/> We are looking for a passionate and thoughtful user experience designer to help develop and shape our digital roadmap. You will be responsible for enhancing existing features and creating new ones to deliver outstanding experiences to our Members. <br/><br/> <strong><u>Responsibilities:</u></strong>  <ul> <li>Collaborate alongside product managers, business analysts and developers.</li>  <li>Create low-fidelity wireframes, mockups, and pixel perfect assets.</li>  <li>Clearly articulate design rationale to various stakeholders.</li>  <li>Balance intuitiveness with innovation: make decisions on when to introduce new design patterns or rely on existing ones</li>  <li>Collect data to inform new designs or improvements by way of research, surveys and focus testing.</li>  <li>Contribute to and shape our digital culture</li> </ul> <strong><u>Qualifications:</u></strong>  <ul> <li>At least 3 years’ experience in a design role</li>  <li>A design degree or relevant experience with platform and/or application design</li>  <li>Proficiency with current design and prototyping tools such as Sketch, Illustrator, and Invision</li>  <li>A portfolio consisting of visually engaging experiences that ship across web and native apps; particular experience with financial services is an asset</li>  <li>Ability to create wireframes and flow diagrams that effectively communicate design decisions</li>  <li>Ability to work independently and prioritize and manage work to meet project timelines</li> </ul> <strong>Experience the Difference!</strong> <br/><br/> Thank you for your interest in Meridian Credit Union. Please note that due to the volume of applications, only those under consideration will be contacted for an interview. <br/><br/> Meridian is committed to providing accommodations for people with disabilities. Should you require an accommodation, we will partner with you to meet your needs. <br/><br/> <strong>Follow us on Twitter at</strong> <br/><br/> @MeridianCareers <br/><br/> <strong>Connect with us on LinkedIn:</strong> <br/><br/> https://www.linkedin.com/company/meridian-credit-union/careers?trk=top_nav_careers</div> </div><div></div>
Title: UX/UI Designer- 7 Month Contract

Job_Description: You are a gamer. Whether it’s board , PC, or mobile games, your focus is on creating memorable, positive experiences for people. You enjoy working closely with a wide range of skill sets and personalities and never shy away from contributing your vision to the team. Always looking to take your work from sufficient to mind-blowing - you thrive in a high-feedback culture where you can grow, innovate and iterate until perfection. You are a natural leader and enjoy providing guidance and mentorship as much as you enjoy sharing your day’s learnings. And finally, you’re looking for more fun, passionate and creative people to work with! <br/><br/> Sound like a match? Kabam Vancouver is looking for a<strong>Senior UX Designer</strong> to join us! <br/><br/> We don’t just make games, we play and love them too. <br/><br/> You will contribute by: <ul> <li>Driving features from beginning to end by presenting work, guiding conversations, coordinating with producers to work on timelines</li><li>Working collaboratively with other discipline members such as:</li>  <ul> <li>Game designers to discuss game features, create wireframes, and produce screen mockups and assets</li><li>Engineers to review technical requirements and implementations of screens</li><li>QA analysts to deliver all functionality annotations and answer questions</li><li>Live Operations team members to ensure all planned events are supported</li><li>Back-end programming team to discuss technical requirements</li> </ul>  <li>Mentoring and coaching junior UI/UX Designers</li><li>Learning and sharing best practices of UI and UX design with the team</li><li>Advocating for UX design in the studio</li> </ul> At Kabam, we’re constantly raising the bar of excellence in free-to-play mobile gaming. We hire for passion and diversity so that together as a team we can triumph in our collective skill. Our teams are made up of a fusion of personalities and interests bound together by a collaborative nature, fun-loving culture and drive to do what it takes to make great games. <br/><br/> And this is where you come in.. <br/><br/> Your background includes: <ul> <li>5+ years of experience as a professional UI/UX Designer</li><li>Ability to take complex information and turn it into user-friendly UI design</li><li>Ability to produce high quality work quickly, iterating toward the best solution</li><li>Strong skills in crafting effective user experience flows, wireframes and interactions</li><li>Strong passion for human-centered design challenges and graphic design challenges</li><li>Strong passion for gaming - Experience working on mobile games is a plus!</li><li>A strong portfolio showcasing User Interface Design, User Experience, Graphic Design, etc.</li><li>Understanding of“freemium” business model, including customer acquisition, retention, and monetization</li><li>Bonus points if you have experience in working with Unity</li> </ul> Join a fun and funky group of creative artists who are committed to providing exceptional UI/UX depth to Kabam’s games. Always laughing and always learning, you’ll contribute to the fun and exploration while keeping the team on track to build world-class free-to-play mobile games. <br/><br/> Excited by this opportunity? We invite you to apply and start the conversation with us. <br/><br/> Together, we can create and support some of the best games ever made. <br/><br/> About Kabam <br/><br/> Kabam is a world leader of massively multiplayer games for mobile devices. Console quality graphics and next generation technology are the hallmark of Kabam games. Kabam merges the art of game design and the science of consumer behaviour to create immersive games enjoyed by players around the world. Kabam’s games have generated hundreds of millions of downloads including Marvel Contest of Champions and Transformers: Forged to Fight and won several awards including Apple Editor’s Choice and Google Play’s Best Game of the Year. Kabam has studios and offices in Vancouver, San Francisco and Austin. Kabam is a wholly-owned subsidiary of Netmarble Games.
Title: Senior UX Designer

Job_Description: <strong>Overview:</strong> <br/><br/> eSight is an organization with a simple but profound belief: that people who can see the world, can change the world. <br/><br/> This belief has driven us to invent a truly novel technology - breakthrough, electronic glasses that let the legally blind actually see. This solution dramatically transforms the lives of the legally blind, with thousands of stories online that are likely to leave you with a lump in your throat or a tear in your eye. <br/><br/> We are a well-funded, cutting-edge organization that is passionately driven by our vision to change the world with life-changing, customer-centric technology. We are looking for a talented UI/UX Designer/Developer to create a compelling experience for our low vision clients across a variety of platforms including wearables and mobile. <br/><br/> <strong>More About This Role:</strong> <ul> <li>Gather user experience requirements from customers, researchers, product managers and other sources</li><li>Participate in various user centered design techniques such as stakeholder interviews, surveys, prototyping, usability testing, competitor analysis and UI documentation</li><li>Create storyboards and presentations of the user experience and use cases with mockups and wireframes</li><li>UI testing and debugging</li> </ul> <strong>About You:</strong> <br/><br/> Are you the next<strong> UI/UX Designer/Developer</strong> for eSight? We are looking for an individual who: <ul> <li>Greatly wants to use his/her skills to make a contribution to a meaningful cause</li><li>Has a user-centric mindset with a keen sense of design with an eye for typography, composition, flow and colours</li><li>Has the ability to carry out a concept from start to completion and work independently</li><li>Has the ability to pick up software skills quickly and easily (adaptability and ability to learn new things)</li><li>Is comfortable with complex software (technical savvy)</li><li>Has excellent oral and written communication skills and organizational skills</li><li>Can work in a fast-paced, Startup environment</li><li>Has the ability to stay focused and deliver on time and on budget</li><li>Can work independently with little direction and be self-motivated (you get stuff done!)</li>  </ul> <strong>Skills and Requirements For This Role:</strong> <ul> <li>Bachelor or Masters degree specializing in Software Engineering, Computer Science, Human-Computer Interaction or a comparable discipline</li><li>At least 3 years of UX/UI design experience in UX/UI design for mobile applications on Android or iOS platform with knowledge of best practices for one or more of these platforms</li><li>Experience with prototyping</li><li>Proven track record in working with a software development team</li><li>Strong understanding of Object Oriented Design</li><li>Experience writing GUI software requirements specifications</li><li>Proficiency in typical wireframing and prototyping tools such as Axure, Invision, Balsamiq and visual design tools such as the Adobe design suite</li><li>Understanding of designing for and testing of usability</li><li>Experience with designing user interfaces for individuals with low vision would be an asset</li><li>A relevant portfolio of past projects please include links to your portfolio upon applying</li>  </ul> This is a full-time, permanent position located in Ottawa complete with a competitive compensation package, including health and dental benefits. <br/><br/> At eSight we are committed to fostering an inclusive, barrier-free and accessible environment. Part of this commitment includes arranging accommodations to ensure an equitable opportunity to participate in the recruitment and selection process. If you require any accommodation during the application or interview process, we will work with you to meet your needs. Please contact us at 1 855 837 4448 x317.
Title: UI/UX Designer/Developer

Job_Description: Sr. UX/UI Designer <br/>  <br/> <em>Grossman Dorland Recruiting (gdR) has been growing Canada’s tech ecosystem for 10 years. We match top talent and executives with leading startups, tech companies and innovation labs, and grow leadership capacity through individual and organizational coaching. Our goal is to advise tech talent and organizations throughout their entire growth journey.</em> <br/><br/> gdR is recruiting a Sr. UX/UI Designer to join a fast-growing startup making waves in the retail space. By using technology to blend together the online and physical worlds, they help some of the world’s leading brands deliver an exceptional customer experience. If you’re a seasoned designer who has a passion for mobile and experience leading teams, then this is for you! <br/><br/> <strong>Company overview:</strong>   <ul> <li>Offices in Toronto and Waterloo; 150 total employees.</li> <li>Have been described as “Not just a company, but a community”.</li> <li>Clients include some of the biggest luxury brands and major retailers.</li> <li>Tech stack: PHP, Angular, React, Golang, MYSQL, Redis and OData.</li> <li>Compensation package includes competitive salary, benefits and stock options.</li> </ul>  <strong>You will thrive as a Sr. UX/UI Designer if you have…</strong>   <ul> <li>7+ years of design experience, with a focus on iOS development.</li> <li>A well rounded portfolio of previous design work (required).</li> <li>Some experience leading and supporting design teams.</li> <li>A technical background (bonus).</li> </ul>  <strong>As a Sr. UX/UI Designer you will...</strong>   <ul> <li>Conduct research and design wireframes using Sketch and InVision.</li> <li>Design customer facing applications on mobile iOS platforms.</li> <li>Facilitate and oversee the implementation process of designs.</li> </ul>  Apply today for the Sr. UX/UI Designer role or contact Samantha Colaco, Talent & Client Manager, at samantha AT grossmandorland DOT com to learn more. <br/><br/> <em>gdR values inclusion in Canada’s tech ecosystem and partners with employers that provide equal opportunities for individuals from diverse groups.</em> <br/><br/> <em>Follow gdR on LinkedIn, Twitter and Facebook for updates on new roles in tech.</em>
Title: Sr. UX/UI Designer

Job_Description: <div><strong>Senior UX/UI Designer - Digital Music</strong> </div><br/>  <div><strong>(Montreal, Quebec)</strong> <br/><br/> PlayNetwork helps brands engage consumers through entertainment media, in-store and beyond. These experiences add emotion to omni-channel touch points that strengthen the connection with customers and influence lifetime value. Clients work with PlayNetwork for creative strategy development, branded music curation and global licensing, original video production, messaging, audio/visual systems engineering and installation, technology and software development, and more. They partner with 425+ brands across 110,000+ locations in 125+ countries, reaching more than 100 million people every day. For more information visit www.playnetwork.com. In 2017, PlayNetwork and Touchtunes joined forces forming the Octave Group . TouchTunes is the largest in-venue interactive music and entertainment platform, featured in over 75,000 bars and restaurants across North America and Europe. Together weve created a global market leader for music and media services, with boundless opportunities for our team members to learn, contribute and grow. Were entrepreneurs, finance professionals, engineers, designers, marketers, creatives and visionaries. We are guided by our core values that serve as a compass for how we act and guide our approach to every aspect of our business every day. We are passionate about developing exciting and engaging products that impact consumers and generate emotional connections across our network of over 185,000 stores, restaurants, bars and other social spaces around the world.</div><br/>  <div>The Senior UX/UI Product Designer will lead a key PlayNetwork background music initiative, collaborating closely with the development team to ensure that all client requirements are implemented to spec. This includes creating interactive prototypes, user flows and developing a deep understanding of our clients needs by leveraging analytics and user testing. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities:</strong> </div>   <ul>  	<li>Partner with product management, engineering, and creative leadership</li> <li>Take nebulous ideas and translate them into rapid prototypes for user testing</li> <li>Set the creative strategy to ensure a cohesive user experience</li> <li>Justify and prioritize the design pipeline to be in line with our KPIs, user feedback, and the overall product strategy</li> <li>Take a user-centered approach, attempting to understand how users interact with all aspects of the product, and design a user experience in accordance with this understanding</li> <li>Producing pixel-perfect mock-ups and redlines for use by various team members for the purposes of development and testing</li> <li>Keep all application mock-ups up-to-date based on the latest designs and copy</li> <li>Acquire and maintain a solid understanding of PlayNetworks products and services, in order to produce more relevant designs</li> <li>Pair with software developers to help implement designs</li> <li>Directly collaborate on user experience planning with product manager and production teams</li> </ul>  <strong><div> Required Qualifications:</div>  <br/></strong>   <ul>  	<li>5+ years of experience as a UX/UI designer with substantial experience designing for various digital platforms, e.g., Web, Mobile, etc.</li> <li>Able to provide samples of work that showcase thoughtful UX solutions, strong visual design and solid information architecture</li> <li>Full knowledge of the Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop and After Effects should be a no brainer) Sketch and HTML/CSS</li> <li>Experience working with cross-functional teams to drive strategy, vision, and execution</li> <li>Proven track record of shipping high quality consumer facing products</li> <li>Operates with a user-centric approach to design</li> <li>Ability to do rapid prototyping and enthusiasm for working in an iterative design process</li> <li>Knowledge of UI design cues and standards on Web and Mobile design experience</li> <li>An appreciation for analytics, in order to better understand how UIs are actually used</li> </ul>  <div><strong>Required Skills/Competencies:</strong> </div>   <ul>  	<li>Leads by example and exemplifies the companys Core Values in actions and behaviors.</li> <li>Deep empathy for users and cares about the users wants and needs</li> <li>Able to function independently and in a team environment with excellent collaboration skills</li> <li>Able to multi-task, meet deadlines, and work well under pressure</li> <li>Good time management and grace under fire</li> <li>Good communication skills, with a positive and proactive attitude</li> <li>Good with collaborating, while remaining able to work independently when required</li> <li>A passion for music is a must</li> </ul>  <strong><div> Special Position Requirements:</div>  <br/></strong>   <ul>  	<li>Ability to travel to New York occasionally</li> </ul>  <strong><div> Preferences:</div>  <br/></strong>   <ul>  	<li>An ability to code/script interactive prototypes is a plus</li> <li>Enthusiasm for new technologies and new media</li> <li>A passion for music in general is a plus</li>  </ul>  <strong><div> Work Requirements:</div>  <br/></strong>   <ul>  	<li>Deductive Reasoning the ability to apply general rules to specific problems to produce answers that make sense.</li> <li>Written Comprehension the ability to read and understand information and ideas presented in writing.</li> <li>Inductive Reasoning the ability to combine pieces of information to form general rules or conclusions (includes finding a relationship among seemingly unrelated events).</li> <li>Oral Comprehension the ability to listen to and understand information and ideas presented through spoken words and sentences.</li> <li>Oral Expression the ability to communicate information and ideas in speaking so others will understand.</li> <li>Ability to perform primarily sedentary work, frequently using a computer (visual acuity, fine motor skills) and telephone (talking/hearing).</li> <li>Must be authorized to work in the Canada.</li> </ul>
Title: Senior UX/UI Designer

Job_Description: <div> <div> <div> <div>Nous valorisons la diversité et avons cœur de créer un milieu de travail inclusif qui nous inspire tous donner le meilleur de nous-mêmes. Joignez-vous notre équipe et faites une différence!</div>  </div> </div>  </div> <div> <div> Votre poste</div>  </div> <div> <div> <div> <div><em><strong>Nous</strong></em> <br/> Comment imaginez-vous les bureaux dune compagnie dassurance? Et latmosphère de travail qui y règne? Nous gageons que si vous passez nous voir au Lab de Intact, vous serez très surpris! Situé au centre-ville de Montréal, nous sommes un laboratoire dinnovation dont la mission est de créer des produits la fine-pointe de linsurtech qui améliorent la vie de millions de Canadiens. <br/><br/> Mariant la convivialité et la vélocité dune startup aux ressources et aux moyens dune grande entreprise (vous disposerez de tous les outils dont vous avez toujours rêvé!), le Lab est un environnement jeune et dynamique, offrant des défis stimulants, des collègues inspirants et une carrière passionnante (chez un des top 100 employeurs au Canada). Cest lendroit idéal pour parfaire vos compétences et faire évoluer votre carrière. <br/><br/> <em><strong>Vous</strong></em> <br/> Vous êtes passionné par le commerce électronique et linnovation numérique? Vous avez un talent particulier pour traduire des exigences complexes en expériences utiles et agréables? Vous restez laffût des dernières tendances en matière de design et vous aimez expérimenter de nouveaux outils et de nouvelles méthodologies? Nous avons loccasion parfaite pour vous! <br/><br/> <strong><em>Rôle</em></strong> <br/> À titre de designer UX/UI, vous jouerez un rôle essentiel dans la conception et lévolution de notre écosystème numérique. Relevant du directeur principal, Innovations numériques, vous aurez comme principales responsabilités :  <ul>   <li>Concevoir des expériences captivantes en vue de réaliser les objectifs daffaires</li>   <li>Valider la fonctionnalité et lutilité par lentremise de tests et de recherches auprès des utilisateurs</li>   <li>Produire des livrables UX et design pertinents au besoin</li>   <li>Piloter une feuille de route aux côté dun directeur de produit et dune équipe agile multidisciplinaire</li>   <li>Présenter le travail aux parties prenantes</li>   <li>Aider les ingénieurs produire des interfaces de qualité et agréables</li>   <li>Prôner une conception axée sur lutilisateur et les données</li> </ul>   </div> </div> </div>  </div> <div> <div> Vos compétences</div>  </div> <div> <div> <div> <div>   <ul>   <li>Minimum trois années dexpérience</li>   <li>Expertise en matière de convivialité et de pratiques de conception centrées sur l'utilisateur</li>   <li>Maîtrise des outils de conception (Sketch, Axure, InVision, Illustrator, etc.)</li>   <li>Expérience des outils de recherche UX (usertesting.com, Optimal Workshop, etc.) un atout</li>   <li>Expérience dans la production de flux de processus, dinventaires de contenu, etc.</li>   <li>Vous aimez travailler dans un environnement de collaboration qui accorde une importance primordiale au travail déquipe, linnovation, louverture desprit et au plaisir</li> </ul> <em>Veuillez inclure votre portfolio dans votre dossier de candidature.</em> <br/><br/> <strong><em>Vous êtes</em></strong>  <ul>   <li>Une personne avec qui il est agréable de travailler</li>   <li>Cratif, analytique, curieux et ingénieux</li>   <li>Un joueur déquipe capable de partager et recevoir des commentaires constructifs</li>   <li>Excellent pour expliquer vos idées différents intervenants</li>   <li>Profondément passionné par le design et la qualité</li>   <li>Organisé et proactif</li> </ul> <em><strong>En tant que salarié temps plein, vous bénéficierez des avantages suivants :</strong></em>  <ul>   <li>Un salaire compétitif</li>   <li>Un boni de performance annuel</li>   <li>Un régime de retraite</li>   <li>Un horaire de travail flexible de 35 heures par semaine</li>   <li>Des assurances médicales et dentaires hors pair</li>   <li>Et plusieurs autres avantages et bénéfices (remboursement gym, conférences, etc.)</li> </ul>   </div> </div> </div>  </div> <div> <div> Énoncé fermeture</div>  </div> <div> <div> <div> <div><strong>Cette opportunité vous intéresse? Nous avons très hâte de faire votre connaissance!</strong> <br/><br/> Dexcellents avantages sont offerts : salaire concurrentiel, avantages flexibles, aménagements de travail flexibles, congés mobiles, régime de retraite prestation déterminée, etc. <br/><br/> Dans le cadre du processus de sélection dIntact, les candidats peuvent être appelés donner leur consentement une vérification de leurs antécédents pertinente au poste pourvoir avant de recevoir une offre demploi. Celle-ci peut comprendre une confirmation des références demploi, des études et des titres de compétences, une vérification des emplois, de lidentité, des infractions criminelles et du permis de conduire ainsi quun rapport de crédit. <br/><br/> Vous pouvez soumettre votre candidature un emploi affiché pourvu que vous occupiez vos fonctions actuelles depuis au moins douze mois et que votre performance soit jugée bonne ou que votre contrat temporaire arrive son échéance. Une recherche de talents l'externe est menée parallèlement au recrutement l'interne Veuillez donc prendre note que des candidats potentiels pourraient avoir été identifiés pour ce poste dans le cadre de leur plan de développement. <br/><br/> <em>*Veuillez noter que l'usage du masculin a comme but d'alléger le texte.</em> <br/><br/> <strong>Cet affichage prendra fin 02 juin 2018.</strong></div>  </div> </div>  </div> <div> <div> Prime de recommandation</div>  </div> <div> <div> <div> <div>CE POSTE EST SUJET À UNE PRIME DE RECOMMANDATION DE 3000$. <br/><br/> #li-qc</div>  </div> </div>  </div> <div> <div> Droit de travailler au Canada</div>  </div> <div> <div> <div> <div>Les personnes qui posent leur candidature un poste permanent doivent, dès leur embauche, avoir le droit de travailler au Canada de façon permanente. Les documents pouvant servir de preuve dans le cas des rôles permanents sont un certificat de naissance canadien, un passeport canadien, un certificat de citoyenneté canadienne, une carte de résident permanent ou une confirmation de son statut de résident permanent pour prouver quil a le droit de travailler au Canada.</div>  </div> </div>  </div> <div> <div> Indeed Commandité</div>  </div> <div> <div> <div> <div>IN-INFR</div>  </div> </div>  </div>
Title: Designer UX/UI

Job_Description: <strong>Mission</strong> <br/><br/> We're on a mission to help Canadians achieve their financial goals. <br/><br/> <strong>Problem</strong> <br/><br/> Managing personal finances is complicated, confusing, time consuming and for many, inaccessible. <br/><br/> <strong>Solution</strong> <br/><br/> Mylo automatically rounds up your purchases and invests the spare change. Mylo also uses transactional data and artificial intelligence (AI) to provide personalized insights and recommendations to help you optimize your finances. <ul> <li>Helping tens of thousands of Canadians achieve their financial goals</li><li>Acquired Tactex Asset Management</li><li>Pitched on Dragons' Den</li><li>Named Top Apps Made in Quebec by Journal de Montréal</li><li>Featured as "Apps We Love" by Apple</li><li>Featured in Globe & Mail, Financial Post, CBC, Les Affaires, Techvibes, etc.</li><li>Raised a $2.65M seed from Desjardins, Ferst Capital Partners, and other great investors</li> </ul> We have fantastic investors and an amazing team, and were growing quickly. Were looking for talented people to help us shape the next wave of innovation in financial services. If you enjoy working with talented folks, solving big problems and delighting users - come join us in helping Canadians achieve their financial goals. <br/><br/> <strong>Role</strong> <br/><br/> Your role is to <strong>design</strong> and<strong> deliver</strong> <strong>a world-class user experience</strong> to millions of Canadians. <br/><br/> You'll collaborate with Product, Marketing, Customer Success, etc., and are responsible for the design of the Mylo brand, visuals, website, web app and mobile apps. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities</strong> <ul> <li>Conduct customer research / interviews via phone call, face-to-face interviews or in-app chat</li><li>Design, develop and maintain design artifacts (brand guidelines, style guides, user journey, empathy maps, jobs-to-be-done, personas, etc.)</li><li>Lead design sessions and sprints</li><li>Sketch, build and validate designs and prototypes</li><li>Identify and solve design issues</li><li>Support marketing initiatives (website, visual content, email templates, participate in strategic / creative discussions, etc.)</li> </ul> <br/><br/> <strong>Must-have</strong> <ul> <li>3+ years experience with a <strong>portfolio</strong> showcasing past work.</li><li>An expert in <strong>design software</strong> Sketch (mainly), Illustrator and Photoshop</li><li>An expert in <strong>prototyping</strong><strong> software</strong> (i.e. InVision, Principle, etc.)</li><li><strong>Artistic ability:</strong> You are talented. You pump out great ideas quickly.</li><li><strong>Style:</strong> Your design is fun, friendly and has a lot of character.</li><li><strong>Research:</strong> You follow design trends and love to test-drive new apps.</li><li><strong>Inspiration:</strong> You know who / what inspires you.</li><li><strong>User-centered design:</strong> This is not a buzzword to you - it's what matters.</li><li><strong>Curiosity:</strong> Your favourite question when chatting with users is "Why?"</li><li><strong>Approach:</strong> You despise complexity - simple is beautiful.</li><li><strong>Conversationalist</strong>: You are a great listener and are deeply empathetic.</li><li><strong>Data:</strong> You understand the power of data, but understand its limitations.</li><li><strong>Scientific</strong>: You want to validate / invalidate your assumptions quickly.</li><li><strong>Self-aware:</strong> You recognize and plan for biases in the design process</li><li><strong>Patient:</strong> You don't always get it right. You reiterate until it is.</li><li><strong>Fun:</strong> You don't take yourself too seriously and can be a goof sometimes.</li><li>Interest in <strong>startups</strong>.</li><li>Interest in <strong>personal finance</strong>.</li><li><strong>Download</strong> and<strong> use Mylo</strong> to stay super close to the user experience.</li> </ul> <strong>Nice-to-have</strong> <ul> <li><strong>Bilingual</strong> (English and French)</li><li>Previous <strong>startup experience</strong> </li>  </ul> <strong>What We Offer</strong> <ul> <li>Our open-concept offices at FCP FinTech Studio (dogs are welcome!)</li><li>Awesome and comprehensive health benefits package</li><li>Generous vacation policy as well as flexible work hours and location</li><li>Support with continuing your skills development, developing your industry knowledge and achieving your career and personal development goals</li><li>Team activities and get-togethers like our annual oyster shucking Christmas party</li><li>A casual environment where you will work with smart and passionate people</li> </ul> <em>We believe in being an equal opportunity employer and we celebrate diversity and differences of perspectives at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.</em>
Title: Mylo - UI/UX Designer

Job_Description: Kabam is looking for a Lead Designer to lead the charge on an exciting new project! A natural leader, you’re ambitious yet humble and eager to work with a collaborative and diverse group across multiple sites. You’re not afraid to get hands-on in inspiring a team towards greatness and see the world of gaming as so much more than a hobby. <br/><br/> Elevating our design team as whole, you’ll bring in new ideas, iterate among colleagues and collaborate with interdisciplinary teams to innovate and iterate player-focused design. <br/><br/> As a Lead Designer, you will: <ul> <li>Work interdisciplinary among two sites to lead the charge on a new project for Kabam</li><li>Mentor and grow a team of curious and highly skilled game designers, advocating for growth, ownership and self-leadership</li><li>Collaborate with an extremely talented team of Engineers, UI/UX artists, Data Scientists, QA and LiveOps to create addictive, compelling player experiences that will delight users for years</li><li>Provide input on the game’s vision and help champion that vision to other team members</li><li>Design rules and parameters for features and systems</li><li>Design, implement, tune, and balance game systems, economies, and progression</li><li>Create design docs, drawings, diagrams, flowcharts, and any other necessary documents to communicate design functionality and vision</li><li>Build free-to-play mobile games that the world loves to play</li> </ul> At Kabam, we’re constantly raising the bar of excellence in free-to-play mobile gaming. We hire for passion and diversity so that together as a team we can triumph in our collective skill. Our teams are made up of a fusion of personalities and interests bound together by a collaborative nature, fun-loving culture and drive to do what it takes to make great games. And this is where you come in… <br/><br/> Your background includes: <ul> <li>5+ years of game design and production experience on commercially successful properties</li><li>Experience leading a game team, preferably across multiple sites</li><li>An inherent desire to solve exciting and challenging problems</li><li>Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience with an emphasis on game design, economics, math, or psychology</li><li>Ultimate problem solving, critical thinking, logical, and analytical skills</li><li>Spreadsheet wizardry</li><li>Deep familiarity with RPG, BCG, and action genres on mobile, PC, console, and pen-and-paper platforms</li> </ul> Interested? Tell us what you’re looking for - in your application, tell what games have influenced you? <br/><br/> Apply now and start the conversation with us. Together, we can create some of the best games ever made. <br/><br/> About Kabam <br/> Kabam is a world leader of massively multiplayer games for mobile devices. Console quality graphics and next generation technology are the hallmark of Kabam games. Kabam merges the art of game design and the science of consumer behaviour to create immersive games enjoyed by players around the world. Kabam’s games have generated hundreds of millions of downloads includingMarvel Contest of Champions andTransformers: Forged to Fight and won several awards including Apple Editor’s Choice and Google Play’s Best Game of the Year. Kabam has studios and offices in Vancouver, San Francisco and Austin. Kabam is a wholly-owned subsidiary of Netmarble Games.
Title: Lead Game Designer

Job_Description: <p><strong>Senior UX/UI Designer - Digital Music **(Montreal, Quebec)</strong></p>  <p>PlayNetwork helps brands engage consumers through entertainment media, in-store and beyond. These experiences add emotion to omni-channel touch points that strengthen the connection with customers and influence lifetime value. Clients work with PlayNetwork for creative strategy development, branded music curation and global licensing, original video production, messaging, audio/visual systems engineering and installation, technology and software development, and more. They partner with 425+ brands across 110,000+ locations in 125+ countries, reaching more than 100 million people every day. For more information visit www.playnetwork.com. In 2017, PlayNetwork and Touchtunes joined forces forming the Octave Group. TouchTunes is the largest in-venue interactive music and entertainment platform, featured in over 75,000 bars and restaurants across North America and Europe. Together weve created a global market leader for music and media services, with boundless opportunities for our team members to learn, contribute and grow. Were entrepreneurs, finance professionals, engineers, designers, marketers, creatives and visionaries. We are guided by our core values that serve as a compass for how we act and guide our approach to every aspect of our business every day. We are passionate about developing exciting and engaging products that impact consumers and generate emotional connections across our network of over 185,000 stores, restaurants, bars and other social spaces around the world.</p>  <p>The Senior UX/UI Product Designer will lead a key PlayNetwork background music initiative, collaborating closely with the development team to ensure that all client requirements are implemented to spec. This includes creating interactive prototypes, user flows and developing a deep understanding of our clients needs by leveraging analytics and user testing.</p>  <p><strong>Responsibilities</strong>:</p>  <ul> <li>Partner with product management, engineering, and creative leadership</li> <li>Take nebulous ideas and translate them into rapid prototypes for user testing</li> <li>Set the creative strategy to ensure a cohesive user experience</li> <li>Justify and prioritize the design pipeline to be in line with our KPIs, user feedback, and the overall product strategy</li> <li>Take a user-centered approach, attempting to understand how users interact with all aspects of the product, and design a user experience in accordance with this understanding</li> <li>Producing pixel-perfect mock-ups and redlines for use by various team members for the purposes of development and testing</li> <li>Keep all application mock-ups up-to-date based on the latest designs and copy</li> <li>Acquire and maintain a solid understanding of PlayNetworks products and services, in order to produce more relevant designs</li> <li>Pair with software developers to help implement designs</li> <li>Directly collaborate on user experience planning with product manager and production teams</li> </ul>  <p><strong>Required Qualifications</strong>:</p>  <ul> <li>5+ years of experience as a UX/UI designer with substantial experience designing for various digital platforms, e.g., Web, Mobile, etc.</li> <li>Able to provide samples of work that showcase thoughtful UX solutions, strong visual design and solid information architecture</li> <li>Full knowledge of the Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop and After Effects should be a no brainer) Sketch and HTML/CSS</li> <li>Experience working with cross-functional teams to drive strategy, vision, and execution</li> <li>Proven track record of shipping high quality consumer facing products</li> <li>Operates with a user-centric approach to design</li> <li>Ability to do rapid prototyping and enthusiasm for working in an iterative design process</li> <li>Knowledge of UI design cues and standards on Web and Mobile design experience</li> <li>An appreciation for analytics, in order to better understand how UIs are actually used</li> </ul>  <p><strong>Required Skills/Competencies</strong>:</p>  <ul> <li>Leads by example and exemplifies the companys Core Values in actions and behaviors.</li> <li>Deep empathy for users and cares about the users wants and needs</li> <li>Able to function independently and in a team environment with excellent collaboration skills</li> <li>Able to multi-task, meet deadlines, and work well under pressure</li> <li>Good time management and grace under fire</li> <li>Good communication skills, with a positive and proactive attitude</li> <li>Good with collaborating, while remaining able to work independently when required</li> <li>A passion for music is a must</li> </ul>  <p><strong>Special Position Requirements</strong>: - Ability to travel to New York occasionally</p>  <p><strong>Preferences</strong>:</p>  <ul> <li>An ability to code/script interactive prototypes is a plus</li> <li>Enthusiasm for new technologies and new media</li> <li>A passion for music in general is a plus</li> </ul>  <p><strong>Work Requirements</strong>:</p>  <ul> <li>Deductive Reasoning the ability to apply general rules to specific problems to produce answers that make sense.</li> <li>Written Comprehension the ability to read and understand information and ideas presented in writing.</li> <li>Inductive Reasoning the ability to combine pieces of informati</li> </ul>
Title: Senior Designer - UX / UI - Montreal

Job_Description: <strong>UI Designer</strong><br/><br/><strong>Location: Kanata</strong> <br/><br/> We have partnered with a global communications company looking for a UI Designer for a new suite of analytics products they plan to launch. This position will be with an advanced CTO development team working with the latest technologies in big data. <br/><br/> <strong>This is your dream job IF :</strong> <br/><br/> • If you are a future-thinking individual that can solve complex problems in simple and creative ways <br/><br/> • You can understand the requirements of a project, communicate ideas clearly, put together wireframes/mock-ups, define interactions, and bring a design to life <br/><br/> • You have experience with designing and prototyping mobile and web-based interfaces. Experience with complex or enterprise apps is a bonus <br/><br/> <strong>Skills we are looking for:</strong> <br/><br/> • 4-7 years of UI/UX design experience <br/><br/> • Some experience with web applications or enterprise software is a huge asset <br/><br/> • Experienced with current UI tools and a passion for staying tuned to emerging UI technologies <br/><br/> • Solid experience with HTML/CSS <br/><br/> • Some experience with JavaScript frameworks or modern MVC frameworks such as JQuery, React, Angular, or the related <br/><br/> <strong>Interested?</strong> <br/><br/> All qualified and interested applicants should send their resumes to sarah.doughty@talentlab.com or apply directly to our website at www.talentlab.com.
Title: UI Designer

Job_Description: <strong>Horizn Studios Inc</strong>. is currently looking to add a talented, and driven Junior UX/UI Designer to our cross-disciplinary team. As a UX/UI designer, you will play a key role in researching, conceptualizing and designing interface solutions for a wide range of interesting yet unique UX/UI challenges. A portfolio that demonstrates your passion for interactive design including work samples that show your process and attention to detail is a must. <br/><br/> <strong>About Horizn</strong> <br/><br/> Horizn helps financial services, technology companies and manufacturers accelerate market adoption of their new products and digital technology at speed and enterprise scale. <br/><br/> We do this by inciting employees, sales forces, and yes, customers to quickly become knowledgeable and digitally fluent on the companies latest products. Our revolutionary Go-To-Market mobile platform embraces the dynamics of micro-learning, social technologies, addictive game play and robust analytics to power employee performance, drive customer adoption and increase revenues. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities</strong>  <ul> <li>User & stakeholder research</li>  <li>Produce innovative and engaging user-interface design for websites, and native mobile applications</li>  <li>Create wireframes, storyboards, user flows and sitemaps to effectively communicate interaction and design.</li> </ul> <strong>Skills & Experience</strong>  <ul> <li>Entry level, minimum 1-2 years of professional experience in UX/UI design</li>  <li>Strong understanding of current design standards for modern devices and browsers.</li>  <li>Proficiency in Sketch, Photoshop, Illustrator</li>  <li>Working knowledge of Axure and/or Balsamic, or other visual design and wireframing tools.</li>  <li>Up-to-date with the latest UI trends, techniques, and technologies.</li> </ul> <strong>Competencies</strong>  <ul> <li>Strong passion for design and UX and desire to learn</li>  <li>Ability to work on multiple projects in a fast paced environment.</li>  <li>Excellent written and verbal communication skills.</li> </ul>  Apply!
Title: Junior UX/UI Designer

Job_Description: <strong>Role</strong> <br/><br/> Design is critical to us because our customers use and rely on SEDNA all day, every day, all year round and we care deeply about providing them with a dependable, relevant, and intuitive experience. <br/><br/> You are a skilled interface designer with experience in designing user interfaces and experiences for the web and mobile. You will be in a unique position to help define the shape and vision of a young and sought after product because the design team touches all aspects of the product – from onboarding interfaces to copywriting, micro-interactions to broad user flows - all in the process of developing and documenting the visual direction of the product. You can dig into the nitty gritty details of a feature from a customer’s perspective. You are comfortable working and thinking out loud, documenting your process and working iteratively. <br/><br/> At heart, our philosophy is about honest design. SEDNA is a complex product that solves a very ingrained communication pain point - that of trust. The people who use our platform need to trust that they can access information reliably, accurately, quickly and securely. The industries our users operate in depend upon being able to instantly recognize who has access to what information at any given time. The solutions we design should strive to present users with information and feedback that is accurate and truthful. Designing with honesty will foster trust. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities</strong>  <ul>  <li>Plan the integration of product-wide design systems.</li>    <li>Provide intermittent design support for the marketing of our product.</li>    <li>Create both low and high fidelity design deliverables including prototypes.</li>    <li>Dissect current features and speculate on the future direction of the product.</li>    <li>Work with product and development teams to give feedback on planning and features.</li>    <li>Work with developers to implement your designs, while understanding technical limitations and liberties.</li>    <li>Design user interfaces and experiences for the web and mobile with a strong sense of balance and composition in short, iterative cycles.</li>    <li>Present (and sell) design to others by clearly articulating an elegant solution to address a specific problem through storytelling and documentation.</li>    </ul> <strong>Requirements</strong>  <ul>  <li>You have 3+ years of experience in an individual contributor role, on a Product Design team for desktop and mobile.</li>    <li>You are self-directed toward excellent work outcomes, comfortable working in a startup, and pragmatic about your solutions.</li>    <li>You have a solid and up to date understanding of best practices, developments and trends in web and mobile.</li>    <li>You take a human-centered approach to design and know how to clearly articulate a user’s troubles, and are comfortable going out into the world to find inspiration for it.</li>    <li>You are optimistic, generative, and open to new ideas and ways of working and understand the value of fun in building a team and product.</li>    <li>You have excellent written and verbal English communication skills – we document our work daily.</li>    <li>You are comfortable using modern design and prototyping tools (Sketch, Principle, Framer, Studio, InVision, etc) as well as comfort working with version control (bonus points if it’s Abstract)</li>   </ul>    <ul>  <li>You have an outstanding portfolio, showcasing a foundation in Typography, Colour, Interaction and Visual Design, Ideation and Documentation.</li>    <li>You have experience working with Product Managers to develop the strategy and rationale for features.</li>    <li>You have experience with prototyping as a means of exploring and conveying design solutions.</li>    <li>You are familiar and comfortable with modern front-end web technologies, including HTML/CSS and Javascript.</li>    </ul> <strong>Bonus</strong>  <ul>  <li>You have prior experience in a similar role in a startup environment.</li>    <li>You are familiar with the principles of Material design</li>    <li>You are familiar with the principles and values of design systems</li>    <li>You have experience designing for React or other component-based frameworks</li>    </ul> <strong>SEDNA</strong> <br/><br/> At SEDNA, we help some of the biggest companies in the world manage their day-to-day transactions with a team inbox. We’re doing this by building an enterprise product that helps our customers work faster, better together, and more securely. SEDNA provides you with trust, support, guidance, and an opportunity to grow within the organization. We are a small company doing something disruptive. Our culture is one of trust, experimentation, helpfulness, working out loud, asking ‘what does the data say?’, and letting people self-serve. www.sedna.com
Title: UI / UX Designer

Joignez-vous notre équipe et faites une différence!</div>  </div> </div>  </div> <div> <div> Votre poste</div>  </div> <div> <div> <div> <div><strong>Vous</strong> <br/><br/> Êtes-vous un passionné du comportement humain et de l'innovation numérique? Connaissance d'Adobe Target un atout.</li>   <li>Expérience produire des wireframes, flux de processus, prototypes, etc.</li>   <li>Vous adorez œuvrer dans des environnements collaboratifs avec un focus sur le travail déquipe, linnovation, louverture et samuser!</li> </ul> Svp inclure votre portfolio dans votre application. <br/><br/> <strong>Vous êtes</strong>  <ul>   <li>Créatif, esprit analytique, curieux et ingénieux</li>   <li>Joueur déquipe prêt contribuer et recevoir de la rétroaction</li>   <li>Excellent vulgarisateur capable dexpliquer ses idées divers intervenants</li>   <li>Passionné par le design et la qualité</li>   <li>Leader qui n'hésite pas prendre des initiatives</li>   <li>Organisé et proactif</li> </ul> <strong>En tant que salarié temps plein, vous bénéficierez de :</strong>  <ul>   <li>Un salaire compétitif</li>   <li>Un boni annuel</li>   <li>Un fond de pension</li>   <li>Un horaire de travail flexible et une semaine de 35 heures</li>   <li>Des assurances médicales et dentaires hors pair</li>   <li>Et plusieurs autres avantages et bénéfices (remboursement gym, conférences, etc.)</li> </ul>   </div> </div> </div>  </div> <div> <div> Énoncé fermeture</div>  </div> <div> <div> <div> <div>Dans le cadre du processus de sélection dIntact, les candidats peuvent être appelés donner leur consentement une vérification de leurs antécédents pertinente au poste pourvoir avant de recevoir une offre demploi. Celle-ci peut comprendre une confirmation des références demploi, des études et des titres de compétences, une vérification des emplois, de lidentité, des infractions criminelles et du permis de conduire ainsi quun rapport de crédit. <br/><br/> <strong>Cet affichage prendra fin le 25 avril 2018.</strong></div>  </div> </div>  </div> <div> <div> Droit de travailler au Canada</div>  </div> <div> <div> <div> <div>Les documents pouvant servir de preuve dans le cas des rôles permanents sont un certificat de naissance canadien, un passeport canadien, un certificat de citoyenneté canadienne, une carte de résident permanent ou une confirmation de son statut de résident permanent pour prouver quil a le droit de travailler au Canada. Les personnes qui posent leur candidature un poste permanent doivent, dès leur embauche, avoir le droit de travailler au Canada de façon permanente.</div>  </div> </div>  </div>
Title: Designer UX/UI Senior

Nous avons très hâte de faire votre connaissance!</strong> <br/><br/> Dexcellents avantages sont offerts : salaire concurrentiel, avantages flexibles, aménagements de travail flexibles, congés mobiles, régime de retraite prestation déterminée, etc. <br/><br/> Dans le cadre du processus de sélection dIntact, les candidats peuvent être appelés donner leur consentement une vérification de leurs antécédents pertinente au poste pourvoir avant de recevoir une offre demploi. Celle-ci peut comprendre une confirmation des références demploi, des études et des titres de compétences, une vérification des emplois, de lidentité, des infractions criminelles et du permis de conduire ainsi quun rapport de crédit. <br/><br/> Vous pouvez soumettre votre candidature un emploi affiché pourvu que vous occupiez vos fonctions actuelles depuis au moins douze mois et que votre performance soit jugée bonne ou que votre contrat temporaire arrive son échéance. Une recherche de talents l'externe est menée parallèlement au recrutement l'interne Veuillez donc prendre note que des candidats potentiels pourraient avoir été identifiés pour ce poste dans le cadre de leur plan de développement. <br/><br/> *Veuillez noter que l'usage du masculin a comme but d'alléger le texte. <br/><br/> <strong>Cet affichage prendra fin le 02 juin 2018.</strong></div>  </div> </div>  </div> <div> <div> Droit de travailler au Canada</div>  </div> <div> <div> <div> <div>Les personnes qui posent leur candidature un poste permanent doivent, dès leur embauche, avoir le droit de travailler au Canada de façon permanente.
