Title: Designer UX/UI senior

Job_Description: <strong>Senior Product UX/UI Designer</strong> <br/><br/> Does it excite you to apply your product design skills to help people around the world get home safely after a hard day’s work, and to help elite sports teams gain insight into a critical component of athlete readiness? <br/><br/> If it does, then we’d love to meet you. We are looking for a Senior Product UI/UX Designer to join our Product team. Reporting directly to our Product leader, you’ll work closely with Product, Engineering, and the extended team to create tools and experiences for our web and mobile products. You will also have ample opportunity to design product tests, talk to customers and observe how the product is used in the real world. <br/><br/> <strong>Position Responsibilities</strong>  <ul> <li>Work together with Product to turn ideas into briefs that describe problems and opportunities, embark on prototyping, flesh out and deliver specs, ultimately shepherding ideas from conception to market and beyond</li>  <li>Work directly with Engineering, QA, and other stakeholders, from beginning to end, supporting the implementation of your designs, each step of the way</li>  <li>Use big data insights as part of our decision making, when it makes sense, or make insights from big data the centrepiece of a solution</li>  <li>Look for even better ways to nurture user engagement for daily active use</li>  <li>Turn complex data, calculations, and technical concepts into easy to use tools</li>  <li>Craft scenarios, user flows, wireframes, and working prototypes that clearly communicate design intent to everyone, designers and non-designers alike</li> </ul> <strong>Position Requirements</strong>  <ul> <li>A rich portfolio of design work that speaks to your UX and visual design skills and a track record of delivering products to market</li>  <li>Leadership skills. You are comfortable owning the solution and being the voice for design. As a ~30 person company, we’ll expect you to flex your wings and lead us in your area of expertise</li>  <li>Experience designing data visualizations and/or analytics-based products</li>  <li>Desire to build and create. You have the ability to prototype rapidly, be it with paper, hand-coded HTML/JavaScript, Principle, Axure, Keynote, or whatever</li>  <li>Demonstrate the ability to think critically about data-heavy concepts and make them accessible and delightful to all users, including those who are not themselves data-savvy</li>  <li>Passion for learning, sharing and collaboration: new design tools and processes, new technical areas, better ways to get things done</li>  <li>Collaboration skills and willingness to do what’s needed. A team player, flexible and open while designing, discussing, and presenting your work</li>  <li>Ability to get it done. You work fast and generate a wide variety of high-quality solutions</li>  <li>Experience with software development and/or designing multi-system products and services are a big plus</li> </ul> <strong>Education and Experience</strong>  <ul> <li>Bachelors or higher degree in User Experience related field (UX design, HCI, Graphic design).</li>  <li>5-8+ years of UX/visual/other applicable product and design experience, which may include work as a UX designer, UX architect, creative director, or industrial designer. Solid understanding of the design process and best practices.</li> </ul> <strong>We appreciate your interest in this role. The best way to apply for this position is through this site, please refrain from calling our office. Thanks!</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>About Fatigue Science</strong> <br/><br/> Founded in 2006 and based in Vancouver, BC, Fatigue Science is the leader in sleep and performance analytics. We work with amazing clients, like Rio Tinto, Goldcorp, Vancouver Canucks and Seattle Seahawks, to provide actionable insight into the extent and sources of fatigue within their operations. Our Readiband System can help organizations achieve a higher level of effectiveness during game time or while performing high-risk job functions and improve overall employee health, safety, and performance - We are committed to ensuring our clients’ success in these goals. <br/><br/> We offer the opportunity to be a part of an exciting and buzz-generating technology business and a place to continue growing your career. We have a bright, open concept office located in the heart of downtown Vancouver. If you have a proven track record and share a passion for technology we want to hear from you.
Title: Senior Product UX/UI Designer

Job_Description: <div> </div><div> </div><div> <div>  <div>   <br>   <div>  <p></p>  <p>We value diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive workplace that inspires each of us to be the best we can be. Join our team and make a difference!</p>  <p> </p>   </div>  <br>  </div>   </div> </div><div> <div>  Your Job   </div> </div><div> <div>  <div>   <br>   <div>  <p></p>  <p><strong><em>About us</em></strong></p>  <p>How do you imagine life at an insurance company - its people, its culture, its offices? We bet that if you swing by Intact Lab, you'll be in for quite the surprise! With offices in downtown Toronto and Montreal, the Lab is a digital innovation hub tasked with creating cutting-edge insurtech products that improve the lives of millions of Canadians.<br>The Lab merges the best of two worlds: the speed and culture of a start-up, with the resources and means of a large enterprise (you'll have access to all the tools you've ever dreamed of!). With a dynamic team, exciting challenges, beautiful offices, inspiring colleagues and a great work culture (we rank as one of Canada's top 100 places to work), Intact Lab offers an amazing environment to develop your skills and grow your career.</p>  <p><em><strong>About you</strong></em></p>  <p>Are you passionate about e-commerce and digital innovation? Are you skilled at translating complex requirements into usable and delightful experiences? Do you keep on top of the latest trends in design and love experimenting with new tools and methodologies? We've got the perfect opportunity for you!</p>  <p><strong><em>Your role</em></strong></p>  <p>As a Senior UX/UI Designer, you play a mission critical role in conceiving and evolving our digital ecosystem. Reporting to the Director, Digital Innovation, your main responsibilities are:</p>  <ul>   <li>Conceiving compelling experiences that help achieve business objectives.</li>   <li>Validating usability and usefulness via user testing and user research.</li>   <li>Producing relevant UX and design deliverables where required.</li>   <li>Driving a roadmap alongside a product manager and a multidisciplinary agile team.</li>   <li>Presenting work to stakeholders.</li>   <li>Helping engineers produce quality, delightful interfaces.</li>   <li>Being an advocate for user-centered, data-driven design.</li>  </ul>   </div>  <br>  </div>   </div> </div><div> <div>  Your Skills   </div> </div><div> <div>  <div>   <br>   <div>  <ul>   <li>At least 7 years of experience in a similar role</li>   <li>Expertise in usability and user-centered design practices</li>   <li>Mastery of design tools (Sketch, Axure, InVision, Illustrator, etc.)</li>   <li>Experience with UX research (ie. user tests)</li>   <li>Experience in producing wireframes, process flows, prototypes, etc</li>   <li>Bachelor degree in a relevant program</li>   <li>You love working in a collaborative environment that has a strong focus on teamwork, innovation, open minds and having fun</li>  </ul>  <p>Please include your portfolio in your application.</p>  <p><strong><em>You are</em></strong></p>  <ul>   <li>Creative, analytical, curious and ingenious</li>   <li>A team player that can share and receive constructive feedback</li>   <li>You excel at explaining your ideas to different stakeholders</li>   <li>Deeply passionate about design and quality</li>   <li>A leader who takes initiatives</li>   <li>Organized and proactive</li>  </ul>  <p><strong><em>As a full-time employee your benefits include :</em></strong></p>  <ul>   <li>A competitive salary</li>   <li>An annual performance bonus</li>   <li>A pension plan</li>   <li>Flexible work hours and a 35 hour work week</li>   <li>Top of the line medical and dental insurance</li>   <li>A new MacBook Pro</li>   <li>And many more benefits (gym refunds, paid conferences, etc.)</li>  </ul>   </div>  <br>  </div>   </div> </div><div> <div>  Closing Statement   </div> </div><div> <div>  <div>   <br>   <div>  <p><strong>This opportunity interests you? We look forward to meeting you!</strong></p>  <p>As part of Intacts selection process, candidates may be requested to consent to background checks relevant to the role under consideration for, prior to receiving a job offer. These could include: work references, education and credential confirmation, employment verification, identity check, credit report, criminal offence and drivers license record.</p>  <p>You can apply for a posted position if you have been in your current position for at least 12 months and are performing at a satisfactory level.Please note we may have identified other internal candidates through our Employee Development Program, and that the selection process may also be opened to external applicants.</p>  <p>Excellent benefits are offered: competitive salary, flexible benefits, flexible work arrangements, flexible leave, pension plan defined benefit, etc.</p>  <p><strong>This posting closes on June 02, 2018.</strong></p>   </div>  <br>  </div>   </div> </div><div> <div>  Eligibility to work in Canada   </div> </div><div> <div>  <div>   <br>   <div>  <p>Applicants must be permanently eligible to work in Canada upon hire. Proof of eligibility for permanent roles may come in the form of a Canadian birth certificate, Canadian passport, Canadian citizenship certificate, permanent residence card or confirmation.<br> </p>   </div>  <br>  </div>   </div> </div><div> <div>  Indeed Sponsored   </div> </div><div> <div>  <div>   <br>   <div>  <p>IN-INEN</p>   </div>  <br>  </div>   </div> </div>
Title: Senior UX/UI Designer

Job_Description: <div><strong>UI & UX Designer</strong></div> <br/>Our team is looking for a forward thinking, motivated and energetic UI & UX Designer with an exceptional sense of design and deep understanding of what drives user interactions. We’re seeking experienced and talented UI & UX designer candidates who are passionate about consumer software, building delightful user experiences and who love all things digital. <br/><br/> At Adaware, we are building the next generation of smart monetization solutions for smart consumers. As a member of our Product Team, you will actively contribute to product UI design ideas. As a UI & UX designer, you will be expected to develop functional UI designs compatible with our values of integrity, transparency and our goal to make the Internet a safer and better place. <br/><br/> You’re curious, always challenging yourself and your coworkers with new ideas. You have an ability to effectively interact with stakeholders; and to turn insights and data, along with your ideas into functional and delightful UI & UX design. <br/><br/> Above all, you’re results-driven and know what it takes to turn an idea into reality.<br/>  <div><strong>The Challenge:</strong></div>  <ul>  <li>As a UI & UX Designer, you will work with account managers, project managers and product owners to deliver delightful user interfaces across a range of products, offers and websites.</li> <li>Contribute to Adaware’s UI design style guide</li> <li>Work with the account managers to assess the impact of any UI changes to partners offers and suggest improvements that will drive conversions.</li> <li>Work with the UX manager to ensure any UI design changes help to compliment the overall user experience and increase conversions</li>  <li>Maintain and develop a bank of templates for publishers and advertisers</li> <li>Help create UI design wireframes, mock ups and final designs across all desktop and mobile</li> <li>Stay up to date with the latest UI design and usability trends</li> <li>Actively propose new ideas and solutions to design related tasks or issues</li>  </ul> <div><strong>You have:</strong></div>  <ul>  <li>Curiosity</li> <li>Passion</li> <li>Experience in a marketing environment</li> <li>Strong knowledge of Adobe Creative Suite</li> <li>Very strong attention to detail</li> <li>2-4 years of experience in software, web or mobile UI design</li> <li>A strong portfolio</li> <li>Knowledge of HTML, CSS and some javascript (a big plus)</li> <li>Understanding of the basics of prototyping and wireframing</li> <li>A strong understanding of user experience design best practices</li> <li>Ability to work in a fast paced environment with tight deadlines</li> <li>Ability to manage multiple requests at the same time</li> <li>An Internet-savvy perspective, with a genuine interest for and a good understanding of computer software and new technologies; you must be able to understand our products and their markets;</li>  </ul>  <div><strong>Location</strong></div> <br/>This position is located in Montreal.<br/> <div><strong>Company benefits</strong></div> <br/>Employees at Adaware enjoy a full range of benefits, such as: <ul>  <li>3 weeks of vacation plus 1 week at Christmas;</li> <li>Health insurance with dental;</li> <li>Life insurance;</li>  <li>Public transportation card;</li> <li>RRSP contribution match program.</li> <li>Lunch & Learn monthly</li>  <li>Fruits and Bagels</li>  <li>A weekly masseuse</li>  <li>Catered Meals</li> <li>Free parking</li>  </ul> We also offer a friendly and comfortable work environment with flexible hours, 5-a-7 – and more!<br/><br/>
Title: UI & UX DESIGNER

Job_Description: theScore’s mission is to create highly-engaging digital products and content that empower the sports fan’s experience. Its flagship mobile app ‘theScore’ is one of the most popular multi-sport news and data apps in North America, serving millions of fans a month. The Company also creates innovative digital sports experiences through its web, social and esports platforms. <br/><br/> As a product designer, you will play an integral role in refining and shaping our digital products and be involved in every aspect of the product development process from ideation to pushing a few pixels prior to release. <br/><br/> <strong>Typical Work Day at theScore:</strong>  <ul> <li>Work closely with product owners, developers and other product designers.</li> <li>Take broad, conceptual ideas and turn them into something valuable for our users.</li> <li>Work with low fidelity designs & wireframes to produce flows that get the experience right.</li> <li>Create interaction prototypes to test out complex ideas and produce high fidelity designs.</li> <li>Focus on the user and solving problems from their POV.</li> <li>Other duties as required.</li> </ul> <strong>Requirements:</strong>  <ul> <li>Bachelor’s degree, or equivalent knowledge and/or experience.</li> <li>Extensive experience in UI design on web and iOS/Android.</li> <li>Experience with industry standard design tools (Ex. Sketch, Illustrator, Photoshop).</li> <li>A portfolio that highlights examples of interaction design work.</li> <li>Excellent problem solver and familiarity with technical constraints of various mediums (mobile/desktop web, iOS, Android).</li> <li>Experience producing multiple visual directions and concepts.</li> <li><strong>Nice to have:</strong> Front-end development (HTML, CSS, JavaScript), SVG animation, Mobile UX design experience, User testing experience, UX research</li> </ul> <strong>What We Offer:</strong>  <ul> <li>Competitive salary with Employee Share Purchase Plan.</li> <li>Comprehensive Benefits package.</li> <li>Fun, relaxed work environment.</li> <li>Education and conference reimbursements.</li> <li>Located downtown Toronto; easily accessible by public transit.</li> <li>A/V club, Friday presentations, book library, and more.</li> <li>Snacks and drinks provided.</li> <li>Awesome patio with BBQ.</li> <li>Top of the line office hardware.</li> <li>Parental leave top up.</li> <li>Opportunity for career progression and mentoring others.</li> <li>Games room (bring your A game for our FIFA 18, arcade, ping pong and foosball tournaments!)</li> </ul> <em>We are an equal opportunity employer. Accommodation will be made upon request.</em>
Title: Product Designer (UX/UI)

Job_Description: <div>At TradeRev, we know that our greatest asset is our people; they are and will always be the driving force behind our success. Whether that comes in the form of building a unique sales solution or innovating and evolving our product...we look to our employees to disrupt the norm and make their mark on the world.</div><br/> <div>We are looking for a talented <strong>Senior UI/UX Designer</strong> who will work closely with product managers and key stakeholders to help discover project requirements while translating customer needs into great user experiences to which developers can execute on. You will prototype and build interaction models and work hand-in-hand with a UX Researcher as a part of a larger multidisciplinary scrum (Agile) team. This gives you the opportunity to impact product strategies from the earliest stages, ensuring the user experience aligns with our brand and our customer expectations. You will be an integral member of the product team and report to the Chief Creative Officer.</div><br/> <div><strong>Our Core Values:</strong> Fun. Honest. Accountable. Brave.</div><br/> <div>Take a look at our other benefits here: http://work.traderev.com/</div><div></div><div><strong>How We Support You:</strong></div><div>With great skills comes great responsibilities. We understand that in order to attain and maintain amazing skills, it needs to be continually up to date, so we make sure you're all covered when it comes to any professional development, conferences, and licenses. It's on us.</div>Why choose us?  <ul> <li> Be part of an innovative company that is truly disrupting an industry</li><li> Opportunity to lead UX design and make a direct impact on a product that is used globally</li><li> Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, high performing and talented team</li><li> Flexible work hours and good work-life balance</li><li> Competitive pay and a fun place to work</li><li> Use cutting edge technologies</li><li> Opportunities for continuous learning and professional growth</li> </ul>  <strong>Responsibilities:</strong>  <ul> <li>Define practical user experiences (e.g., storytelling, personas, process flows, etc.) and create design assets. We want you to not only create great experiences but make them look fantastic as well.</li> <li>Lead the ideation and experience design of complex web & mobile solutions, which involves defining data architecture and interfaces, and determining business rules, design interactions, and client flows</li><li>Consult stakeholders in decision making for user flows, sitemaps, design, and feasibility</li><li>Plan, execute and present wireframe, prototypes and proof of concepts to stakeholders to ensure needs and expectations are met, and sell the vision behind user experiences</li><li>Act as main point of contact for all project UX related status, including but not limited to presenting status during stand-ups and demos</li><li>Identify, discuss, and execute opportunities for improvements to the client experience, products, tools, etc., and actively improve scope of knowledge, refine designs, and recommend improved solutions through market research and customer data</li><li>Analyze industry best practices, client feedback, new vendor offerings, learnings from metrics tracking, and market competitive analyses</li><li>Work closely with UX Researcher to monitor client behaviour metrics and determine ongoing improvements to our solutions</li><li>Ensure the product team empathize with our users and understand their needs and pain points</li> </ul>  <strong>Your journey so far:</strong>  <ul> <li>A diploma or degree in a related field (UX Design, Graphic Design, Interdisciplinary Design, Interaction Design) or relevant work experience</li><li>At least 3 years experience leading the design/execution of user experiences in a UI/UX role</li><li>Experience working with multi-member UI/UX design teams on complex User Experience centric initiatives within an Agile team environment and methodologies</li><li>Working within the software development/digital products/service industry or other relevant professional experience</li><li>Experience designing and executing creative user experiences, with track record of implementing responsive designs for medium to high complexity solutions, as well as experience working in a team-based, fast paced Agile development environment</li><li>Exceptional skill in UI and graphic design.</li> <li>A solid online portfolio demonstrating experience creating design solutions with emphasis on web and/or mobile applications</li> </ul>  <strong>Bonus if you've worked with:</strong>  <ul> <li>Origami (prototyping software)</li><li>After effects (motion graphics software)</li><li>Adobe XD (prototyping software)</li><li>Adobe creative suite</li> </ul>  <div><strong>We thank all applicants for their interest. Only candidates selected for an interview who are legally authorized to work in Canada will be considered.</strong></div><br/> <div>TradeRev is committed to providing employment in accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act. Any assessment and selection materials or processes used during the recruitment process will be available in an accessible format to applicants with disabilities, upon request. If contacted for an interview, please advise Human Resources if you require disability-related accommodation.</div>
Title: Senior UI/UX Designer

Job_Description: Are you an experienced Digital Graphic Designer looking for a new challenge? If you understand how to integrate all formats of design with digital technology and are excited to improve user experience by putting your stamp on mobile-first solutions, this job could be just what you’ve been searching for! Think of this as working for an internal agency – the best of both worlds. <br/><br/> Our client, a downtown Vancouver-based organization and world leader in their field, is looking for a Digital Graphic/UX/UI Designer. This individual will be responsible for developing brand guidelines and maintaining visual consistency across multiple touchpoints. As lead designer, you'd collaborate with marketing, sales and operations teams, and effectively communicate designs with the small but mighty, nimble team. <br/><br/> <strong>Our client is committed to:</strong>  <ul>  	<li>Fostering a supportive, collaborative and energetic working environment</li> <li>Development and growth opportunities</li> <li>Mentorship and empowerment</li> </ul> <strong>What the Digital Graphic/UX/UI Designer does:</strong>  <ul>  	<li>Execute all design processes, such as drafting user-flows and building and testing interface prototypes</li> <li>Collaborate with marketing, sales, and operations teams to conceptualize ideas and boost the company’s brand presence</li> <li>Understand project requirements, budget, schedule and technical constraints</li> <li>Define the process for gathering all website or marketing visuals</li> <li>Production duties such as videos, graphics, sales support materials, web updates and email campaigns</li> </ul> <strong>What is expected of you:</strong>  <ul>  	<li>5+ years’ experience as a Digital/Interactive Art Director/Designer</li> <li>Experience in designing responsive websites and user interfaces</li> <li>Proficient with Adobe Creative suite (including After Effects) and Sketch</li> <li>Stellar written and verbal communication skills</li> <li>Interpersonal skills and excellent problem-solving abilities</li> <li>Self-directed with an entrepreneurial mindset</li> <li>Ability to adapt design to a wide variety of target audiences</li> </ul> <strong>What you can expect in return:</strong>  <ul>  	<li>$50,000 - $60,000 salary based on experience</li> <li>A positive and collaborative work environment</li> <li>Growth opportunities</li> </ul> If you are interested in this exciting opportunity, contact <strong>Nancy Bracey</strong> by pressing <strong>"Apply Now"</strong>. <br/><br/> <strong>Only candidates already eligible in Canada will be reviewed. Only qualified candidates will be contacted.</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Fit is important to us and it’s important to the companies we partner with.</strong> At The Headhunters, we understand that finding your next dream role is not just about aligning your skills with a job description. It is about knowing your personality, workstyle and career goals. Learn more about our specialized recruitment services at <strong>www.theheadhunters.ca</strong>.<br/><br/>Apply!
Title: Digital Graphic & UX/UI Designer

Job_Description: Skip is growing at a rapid pace and with that, we will need to expand our elite team of creative and design professionals to advance the innovation and improvements of our existing technology. We’re looking for a leader who excels in creative problem-solving and delivering an exceptional experience to each of our network users. <br/><br/> People need to eat so Skip never sleeps, and that means the show runs around the clock. We’re looking for people who want the chance of contributing to build a world-class tech company right here in the Canadian Prairies. <br/><br/> What you’ll be doing: <ul> <li>Create beautiful experiences alongside an agile team of innovative problem-solvers</li> <li>Deliver creative technology-driven solutions to operational and logistical issues</li><li>Collaborate with end users and the Software Development team for project implementation</li><li>Maintain in-depth knowledge of network functionality in order to sustain the hurdles of a constantly growing, and therefore evolving, environment.</li> <li>Create a seamless and exciting user experience for internal and external stakeholders</li>  </ul> People we’re looking for: <ul> <li>Have a great attitude and are proven self-starters</li><li>Keep hustling and are able to work through rejection</li><li>Thrive in a rapidly changing environment</li><li>Understand that a startup is not a 9-5 job, it's a lifestyle!</li> </ul> What it’s like to work at Skip: <ul> <li>Fast paced entrepreneurial environment</li><li>Casual dress attire, we focus on results, not wearing suits</li><li>Exposure to leading-edge technology</li><li>Advancement opportunities for high contributors</li><li>Merit-based compensation & benefits</li> </ul>
Title: Senior UI/UX Designer

Job_Description: Do you love games, and are an expert in creating polished, yet functional UX? <br/> Are you a human-centric designer who is focused on crafting world-class in-game experiences? <br/> If so, our <strong>Lead UX/UI Designer</strong> role might be the perfect fit for you!<br/><br/>Relic Entertainment, a wholly owned studio of SEGA, is the award-winning RTS developer of Homeworld, Dawn of War, Company of Heroes, (and now!) Age of Empires IV and were on the hunt for a <strong>Lead</strong> <strong>UX/UI Designer</strong> to work in our Vancouver studio. This soon to be Relican will join our <strong>UX/UI team</strong> supporting our exciting unannounced project. As a studio, our role is to create a workplace where people are energized and empowered to not only do their best work but to continually surpass their best. Well push you out of your comfort zone to become the best version of you by giving you the ownership and creative freedom to solve our most challenging problems. <br/><br/> This leadership role requires an individual who is excited to drive our UI/UX team forward, share genuine enthusiasm and interest in video games, human-centred design and learning about (and share!) emerging UI technology and trends.<br/><br/><strong>As our Lead UX/UI Designer, you will</strong>   <ul> <li>Lead the UX/UI team from a creative, technical, schedule and day-to-day perspective.</li> <li>Liaise with the art director, production and UR - ensuring all UI milestones and goals are met on time.</li> <li>Ensure and deliver on an innovative, attractive, and functional user experience youll work closely with our artists, game designers, engineers and UR to achieve this.</li> <li>Communicate the vision of the franchises UI and provide feedback to our teams providing feedback will be essential in ensuring the visual quality of your designs comes together in the finished experience.</li> <li>Conceptualize and prototype youll partner with artists, game designers, engineers, and UR to drive and test the games user interface.</li> <li>Act as a HUD interactions expert, specifying both front-end and in-game HUD interactions through wireframes, prototypes, user journeys and more.</li> <li>Be our architect of where information lives and how it's presented to the player.</li> <li>Collaborate with game designers and UR to communicate the intent of game features to the players.</li> <li>Balance the needs of game design, art, marketing, player expectations, and more, to create an engaging & seamless product.</li> <li>Have a natural ability to understand the intent of our game design and how to make that design come to life through UI.</li> <li>Understand the importance of (and be able to action) giving feedback to other areas - Art, Audio, FX, etc. - on how their work is or isnt meeting UX requirements.</li> </ul>  <strong>Were looking for someone who has</strong>   <ul> <li>5+ years of relevant experience in a Lead role with at least 1 shipped AAA title.</li> <li>Post-secondary education in Interaction Design, Visual Design, UX, HCI or related fields.</li> <li>A portfolio of work that showcases UX and interaction design skills, and high-level problem-solving. Please include this portfolio link in the application below!</li> <li>Expert knowledge of Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator or other visual design tools.</li> <li>Rapid prototyping skills, the ability to bring interfaces to life with usability in mind.</li> <li>Familiar with high and low fidelity prototyping tools, such as Sketch, Framer, Origami or similar.</li> <li>Familiarity with display types and the ability to support a variety of screen resolutions.</li> <li>Deep understanding of UX principles and a how to apply them to games.</li> <li>Experience using various UX design methods - contextual inquiry, card sorting, user journeys, personas, stakeholder interviews, wireframes, etc.</li> </ul> <strong>Its a bonus if you have</strong>  <ul> <li>Experience with WPF, XAML and Microsoft Blend</li> <li>Knowledge of 3D tools such as Maya, 3D Max, C4D or similar.</li> <li>Traditional 2D sketching, illustration, and strong conceptual art skills.</li> <li>Experience with data analysis and visualization in tools like Excel, Tableau, etc.</li> <li>Exceptional visual design skills (i.e., composition, layout, typography, color theory.)</li> <li>Conducted user testing, survey design/analyst and other research methodologies.</li> <li>Comfortable working with 3D assets, basic lighting, and positioning models.</li> </ul>  <strong>Whats in it for you?</strong><br/><br/>You will become part of the SEGA family (includes Creative Assembly, Sports Interactive, Hardlight Studio, and Amplitude Studios) which means youll have an opportunity to work on AAA games and learn a ton. We also offer top-notch benefits and perks, including an extensive extended health benefits plan, retirement savings plan, and support for any required relocation or immigration efforts. On top of that, we realize it takes world-class people to make world-class games so we offer competitive total compensation packages.<br/><br/><strong>Interested?</strong><br/><br/>Please apply through this portal - you'll find the application below! Make sure to tell us a bit about yourself, provide your portfolio details and let us know why YOU would be a great fit for our team!<br/><br/><strong>Next Steps?</strong><br/><br/>Regrettably, we are unable to interview all applicants. Please be patient while we review every application. We will get in touch with the applicants that best fit what were looking for, so please make sure you tell us about yourself and how you would like to contribute to our team. <br/><br/> <em>Note: We are currently only able to accept applications from individuals who are legally qualified to work in Canada.</em><br/><br/><strong>Have you heard? Were making Age of Empires IV!</strong><br/><br/>Check out the trailer here and follow along on social: <br/><br/> <strong><em>Facebook</em></strong><em> |</em> <strong><em>Twitter</em></strong><em> |</em> <strong><em>Instagram</em></strong>
Title: Lead UX/UI Designer

Job_Description: <strong>Senior UI/UX Designer (Wealth Management Digital)</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>What is the opportunity?</strong> <br/><br/> The UX Designer executes interaction and visual design as a part of a multi-disciplinary scrum (Agile) team. Working closely with the product owner to translate brand requirements and customer needs into experiences that the developers can execute on, the UX Designer impacts the strategy for products from the earliest stages ensuring the user experience align with customer expectations and follow style guide and look-and-feel conventions. <br/><br/> Digital Client Experience is becoming the main focus in RBC and as such we are looking to build our UI/UX design practice within the Wealth Management business and technology <br/><br/> <strong>What will you do?</strong> <ul> <li><strong>Design delivery</strong> - Lead the ideation and experience design of complex web, mobile and cloud solutions</li><li>Define data architecture and interfaces from visioning to production/execution</li><li>Determine the business rules, design interactions and client flows for the client experience and support the documentation of business requirements</li><li>Define practical user experiences, including storytelling, personas, process flows and interactions; create design assets including user scenarios, user ecosystem diagrams, competitor analyses, and wireframes</li><li>Consult with Product Owner, Scrum team, customers and users in decision making surrounding user flows, sitemaps, layout, styling and technical feasibility</li><li><strong>Stakeholder management and communications</strong>:- Plan, execute and present wireframe mock-ups and proof of concepts to stakeholders to ensure their needs and expectations are met and sell the vision behind user experiences to key stakeholders</li><li>Act as single point of contact for all project UX related status, including but not limited to presenting status during stand-ups and demos</li><li>Perform required analytics to monitor client behavior metrics (Google, tracking tags, web trends, browser, AB/multivariate testing, etc.) and implement tags to provide information and determine ongoing improvements to our solutions</li> </ul> <strong>What do you need to succeed?</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Must-have</strong> <ul> <li>3+ years leading the design/execution of user experiences</li><li>1-2 years of working with multi member UX/UI design teams on complex User Experience centric initiatives</li><li>2-5 years of software development / digital industry and other relevant professional experience</li><li>A diploma or degree (Bachelors or Masters degree, etc.) in Fine Arts, Liberal Arts, Interdisciplinary Design, Media Arts, Computer Science (Human Computer Interaction),Interaction Design, Digital Media or any related field, with relevant experiences and portfolios</li><li>Experience designing and executing creative user experiences with track record of implementing responsive designs for medium to high complexity solutions</li><li>Experience working in a team-based, fast-paced Agile development environment</li> </ul> <strong>Nice-to-have</strong> <ul> <li>Experience working in the Financial industry specifically with Wealth Management</li>  </ul> <strong>Whats in it for you?</strong> <br/><br/> We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual. <ul> <li>Challenging work, dealing with multiple areas within Wealth Management Technology</li><li>High level of autonomy and flexible work life balance</li><li>Build relationships within IT and Business in Wealth and across the bank</li><li>Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team</li> </ul> SFDG <br/><br/> <strong>Learn more about RBC Tech Jobs</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>About RBC</strong> <br/> Royal Bank of Canada is Canadas largest bank, and one of the largest banks in the world, based on market capitalization. We are one of North Americas leading diversified financial services companies, and provide personal and commercial banking, wealth management, insurance, investor services and capital markets products and services on a global basis. We have over 80,000 full- and part-time employees who serve more than 16 million personal, business, public sector and institutional clients through offices in Canada, the U.S. and 37 other countries. For more information, please visit rbc.com. <br/><br/> <strong>Get Career Alerts</strong> <br/><br/> Stay in-the-know about great career opportunities at RBC. Sign up for Career Alerts and get customized info on our latest jobs, career tips and Recruitment events that matter to you. <br/><br/> Expand your limits and create a new future together at RBC. Find out how we use our passion and drive to enhance the well-being of our clients and communities at rbc.com/careers. <br/><br/> <strong>Inclusion and Equal Opportunity Employment</strong> <br/> RBC is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We are pleased to consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veterans status, Aboriginal/Native American status or any other legally-protected factors. Disability-related accommodations during the application process are available upon request. <br/><br/> <u><strong>JOB SUMMARY</strong></u> <br/> <strong>City:</strong>  Toronto <br/> <strong>Address:</strong> 155 Wellington St W <br/> <strong>Work Hours/Week:</strong> 37.5 <br/> <strong>Work Environment:</strong>  Office <br/> <strong>Employment Type:</strong> Permanent <br/> <strong>Career Level:</strong>  Experienced Hire/Professional <br/> <strong>Pay Type:</strong> Salary + Variable Bonus <br/> <strong>Required Travel(%):</strong> 0 <br/> <strong>Exempt/Non-Exempt:</strong> N/A <br/> <strong>People Manager:</strong>  No <br/> <strong>Application Deadline:</strong>  2018-04-30 <br/> <strong>Req ID:</strong> 160917 <br/><br/> <em>Posting Notes: [[mfield1]]</em><br/><br/>Apply Now!
Title: Senior UI/UX Designer

Job_Description: <div>Position title: UI / UX Designer Programmer</div> <br/>  Position: # 158-1864  <br/>  <div>Location: Ice Edge (Calgary)</div><br/>   <div> Responsibilities: <br/><br/> - Contribute innovative ideas....sounds easy...it’s not..... <br/><br/> - Front end web development, could be as much as 80% of your time <br/><br/> - Create wireframes and sketches showing the user experience flow <br/><br/> - Collaborate with other designers and product and project managers <br/><br/> - Conduct user interviews and fly on the wall research <br/><br/> Skills & Requirements <br/><br/> - 1 or more years of experience with everything... looking for ambition and personality! <br/><br/> - Proficient in Javascript, CSS3, HTML5 and Adobe Creative Suite (Illustrator) <br/><br/> - Familiar with Invision, Figma, Axure, OutSystems <br/><br/> - Experience and understanding of user interface and visual design patterns <br/><br/> - Strong written and verbal skills, unlike me <br/><br/> - Exceptional design and production skills with strong attention to detail <br/><br/> - A passion for technology! </div><br/>  <div>To apply for this position, please apply on-line or email us at: careers@ice-edge.com.</div><br/>   <div><strong>* Please quote the position title in your subject line.   <ul> <li>No direct phone calls or in person visits please.</strong> <br/><br/> DIRTT is an equal opportunity employer. We thank all applicants however only those selected for an interview will be contacted.</div></li> </ul>
Title: UI / UX Designer Programmer

Job_Description: <div> <div>iComply Investor Services is a leading Regulatory Technology (RegTech) company based in Vancouver, BC, Canada. At iComply, we believe that there is an abundance of capital that remains untapped. Our platform aims to build a cohesive ecosystem that fundamentally changes the way capital is distributed globally. Together, we will democratize capital and create a new financial economy with greater security, trust, integrity, and investor protection.</div> <br/> <div><strong>The Role</strong></div> <br/> <div>The UI/UX Designer will define and implement effective solutions for the product direction, visuals and experience. The ideal candidate will be inventive and resourceful at problem-solving while communicating clearly and effectively with a diverse group of stakeholders and executive level leadership. iComply is seeking an individual who can effectively and efficiently translate user research into sitemaps, wireframes, mockups and prototypes with consideration of user/system interaction.</div>  <br/> <div><strong>Duties and Responsibilities</strong></div> <br/> <div>   <ul> <li>Deliver mock-ups for all stages of a design process (modern web applications)</li>  <li>Develop UI assets using Photoshop, Illustrator, Sketch, and XD</li>  <li>Conduct requirement gather sessions with stakeholders and evaluate user feedback</li>  <li>Establish design guidelines, best practices, and standards</li> </ul>  </div><br/>  <div><strong>Key Requirements</strong></div> <br/> <div>   <ul> <li>Bachelor’s degree in computer science or related field</li>  <li>5+ years of experience in web design & development</li>  <li>Proficient in HTML5, CSS3, Bootstrap, JavaScript, jQuery and Git</li>  <li>Previous experience in E-Commerce with Payment Gateways</li>  <li>Effective Verbal and Written Communication Skills</li>  <li>Expertise in modern web standards</li>  <li>Knowledge of web UI frameworks</li>  <li>Working knowledge in creating wireframes, storyboards, user flows, process flows and sitemaps</li>  <li>Fast learner, ability to work with a team, a strong sense of responsibility, and exceptional time management skills.</li>  <li><strong>BONUS</strong>: experience "re-skinning" already build web applications (Bootstrap)</li>  <li>Demonstrate Understanding and Experience with the Following</li>  <li>HTML5</li>  <li>LESS/SASS</li>  <li>Javascript / Jquery</li>  <li>Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign, DreamWeaver)</li>  <li>Source Control (GIT, SVN etc)</li> </ul>  </div> </div><br/>  <div><strong>**ATTENTION**</strong> <br/><br/> We will only consider those who meet all of the requirements listed under Key Requirements.</div> <br/>
Title: UX / UI Designer

Job_Description: POWERSHiFTERs Designers are passionate about design and the difference it makes for businesses and customers. Responsible for the development of design across a variety of touch points and platforms, they lead the creation of design direction and interface design on key projects and initiatives. <br/><br/> You are an interactive designer, conceptor, artist and illustrator. You will collaborate with multidisciplinary teams to design insightful, empathetic, conversion focused experiences for clients. Utilizing design thinking and agile process you will apply the latest design techniques and tools to create stunning visuals and interactive prototypes that find a balance between aesthetic and function. <br/><br/> Located in the Mount Pleasant area of Vancouver, as part of the POWERSHiFTER team you will have access to some of the brightest minds in user experience, design, technology, strategy and data science. You will work in an environment that values, people, process and performance, collaborating with team members in both Vancouver and Toronto. <br/><br/> <strong>Your mission</strong>: <br/> We believe that when you start with empathy, amazing things can happen. You will champion this belief through the practice of design thinking and human centered design principals (HCD) on both client and internal work. You will be instrumental in working with design team members to grow and develop this to become our cultural norm in the way we produce digital experiences. Youll be instrumental in shaping this point of view outside the agency through thought leadership initiatives like, blogging, speaking, and other means. Are you ready to wear someone elses shoes? <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities</strong>: <br/> Work with the Design Director to conceptualize and execute designs that will advance clients businesses. <br/><br/> Establish high level design direction for clients through the development of mood boards. <br/><br/> Articulate and present visual design and design rationale. <br/><br/> Demonstrate and apply key principles of interface design to all screen-based media, including mobile, and emerging formats. <br/><br/> Work closely with user experience and data science to refine designs through cycles of user testing and analytics. <br/><br/> Craft designs that adopt principles of conversion centered design (CCD) to achieve real outcomes for businesses. <br/><br/> Create interactive prototypes of designs in Invison App and Sketch for the purpose of user testing and client presentations. <br/><br/> Work with creative directors, UX designers, strategists and developers to establish strategic and creative approaches for a given assignment. <br/><br/> Produce style guides and any design specific help files for developers and clients as required. <br/><br/> Stay up to date on the latest design trends and requirements for all current and emerging formats of digital UI design. <br/><br/> Work closely with development to bring static designs to life through micro animations and elegant page transitions. <br/><br/> <strong>Will creatively solve problems at all levels of detail</strong>: from the big picture to the nuts and bolts. <br/><br/> Will work independently and efficiently to meet deadlines. <br/><br/> Actively contributes to internal programs and internal marketing materials. <br/><br/> Will alert Sr. Staff in a timely manner to any issues that they may be having with the workload, others in the office or negative work environment so that they can be addressed quickly. <br/><br/> Will share acquired skills with team members through formal and informal channels. <br/><br/> Have fun! <br/><br/> <strong>Requirements</strong>: <br/> <strong>Minimum education requirements</strong>: Bachelor Degree or equivalent combination of education & experience <br/><br/> <strong>Minimum experience requirements</strong>: 2-5 years <br/><br/> This is a full time, permanent position
Title: Intermediate UI Designer

Job_Description: <p>At Intrigue Media, we believe that we need to build an organization full of people that want to strive to be their best and strive for excellence.</p> <p>Our team is expected to grow every day, every week, every month, and every year. We know that the only way that we will prosper in today's marketplace is by having people that believe in themselves, their team, and their organization. The way for us to do that is to grow as individuals and grow as leaders.</p> <p>We are not a faceless marketing agency for brands. We are a group of professionals focused on helping owners; people who have built businesses that need help getting the word out to find the right customers and the right team. We don't work with corporate budgets, we work with people's money. We are here to provide value and an honest environment to build trusted partnerships with our clients. We are designing a company to help thousands of leaders and we need leaders inside our four walls to help pave the way to making this a reality.</p> <p>This means that we need everyone to be a leader themselves. Only when each team member is a leader in their own right, are we able to lead ourselves, our clients, and our communities.</p> <p>This is not an easy process. This means that we all must read great books written by great people. This means that we push ourselves outside of our comfort zone on a regular basis. This means that we do what we are afraid of. This means that we fall down, we fail, and we pick ourselves up and move forward, growing along the way.</p> <p>If you want to experience what it's like to be a part of our team, we invite you to reach out to us and start a conversation.</p> <p>If you want to be a part of our team, you must consider the following:</p> <ol> <li>Am I willing to put in the effort to grow every day?</li> <li>Am I willing to study every week?</li> <li>Am I willing to purposefully put myself into uncomfortable situations?</li> <li>Do I have what it takes to better myself and work hard to do so?</li> <li>Am I willing to put in the long hours to learn my craft and become a leader in my own right?</li> </ol> <p>Our environment is professional, it is respectful, and it is disciplined. We also like to have fun. Life is too short not to have fun along the way. We have a work hard, play hard philosophy, and we focus on results.Our goal is to develop leaders. This is not an easy task. Are you up for it?</p> <p><strong>UX/UI Developer</strong></p> <p>We'll look to you to provide leadership and expertise in all areas of design and development.</p> <p>Core Responsibilities:</p> <p>You will be working collaboratively with our designers and developers to create seamless user experiences. You will be responsible for prototyping and building cross browser user interfaces with a creative flair for web design.</p> <ul> <li>Lead UX and design projects</li> <li>Work directly with our developers, giving them specs and assets</li> <li>Lead the development team on creating and reviewing wireframes and mockups that offer intuitive user experiences</li> <li>Formulate elegant solutions for design problems, working within brand guidelines</li> </ul> <ul> <li>Work closely with other members of the Intrigue Media team and provide thought leadership, strategic insight, and clear communication (written and verbal) to exceed KPIs and hit deadlines.</li> </ul> <p>Required Skills & Experience:</p> <ul> <li>2+ years of experience as a UX/UI Developer</li> <li>Exceptional knowledge of of UX/UI best practices</li> <li>Proven experience designing complex solutions for complete digital environments</li> <li>Passion for details and providing highly-polished, seamless user experiences under tight timelines, going beyond the research to find what actually delivers results for our clients</li> <li>Proficiency in Photoshop, Illustrator, Sketch, and InVision</li> <li>Processing</li> <li>Basic HTML/CSS</li> <li>Basic JavaScript</li> <li>Strong communication skills</li> <li>Experience communicating ideas to clients on a regular basis</li> </ul>
Title: UX/UI Developer

Job_Description: <strong>About VersaPay Corporation</strong> <br/><br/> VersaPay is a Fintech company and leading provider of cloud-based invoice-to-cash solutions, enabling businesses to provide a superior customer experience, get paid faster, streamline financial operations, and dramatically reduce DSO and costs. <br/><br/> <strong>Why VersaPay?</strong> <br/><br/> VersaPay is a fast-growing, FinTech software company located in the heart of downtown Toronto, a world-renowned technology hub. We have been around for 10+ years, but we believe in operating with a start-up mindset. We work hard, building innovative technology that is revolutionizing the accounts receivable space, and make sure we have fun while doing so! If you’re ready for a challenge and want a great opportunity to work alongside other like minded people, join VersaPay, the next Canadian technology success story! <br/><br/> <strong>What we Offer</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Team environment:</strong> organized monthly activities (local baseball, basketball or hockey game; playing sports as a team; team potluck, monthly birthday celebrations) <br/><br/> <strong>Constant learning opportunities:</strong> from experts in the field. You will be challenged with projects that have a real impact, creating an experience like no other for accelerating your career <br/><br/> <strong>Central location:</strong> headquarters located in the heart of downtown Toronto <br/><br/> <strong>Work-life balance:</strong> our flexible working environment promotes work-life balance allowing employees to effectively manage responsibilities at work, at home, and in their community <br/><br/> <strong>Competitive salary:</strong> we are building a team with the best of the best and offer competitive compensation to ensure we attract and retain the best talent <br/><br/> <strong>Vacation:</strong> all employees start at a minimum of three weeks of paid vacation <br/><br/> <strong>Incredible health benefits:</strong> after one month of employment, employees are eligible for an incredible health benefits package including dental, medical, vision and more <br/><br/> <strong>No dress code:</strong> no dress code policy to promote the diverse personalities of our people <br/><br/> <strong>Job Summary</strong> <br/><br/> The UI/UX Product Designer will report into the Director of Product Management and will gather product ideas and requirements from various stakeholders, collaborate with stakeholders and product development team to design user flows, customer journey maps, wireframes, high fidelity designs and prototypes. The UX designer will also be expected to design the overall functionality of the product, and in order to ensure a great user experience, iterate upon it. <br/><br/> <strong>Key Responsibilities</strong>  <ul> <li>Participate in Agile Scrum development process and daily standups</li>  <li>Gathering feature requirements from stakeholders and customers</li>  <li>Translate concepts into user flows, wireframes, high fidelity designs and prototypes that lead to intuitive user experiences</li>  <li>Facilitate the product vision by researching, conceiving, sketching, prototyping and testing experiences for digital products</li>  <li>Design and deliver wireframes, user stories, user journeys, and high fidelity designs optimized for a wide range of devices and interfaces</li>  <li>Identify design problems and devise elegant solutions</li>  <li>Create and maintain graphical style guidelines for the product</li>  <li>Make strategic design and user-experience decisions related to core, and new, functions and features.</li>  <li>Take a user-centered design approach and rapidly test and iterate your designs.</li>  <li>Collaborate with other team members and stakeholders and Engineering.</li>  <li>Help QA design and prepare high level test cases to aid in test team’s planning and perform feature reviews</li>  <li>Work closely with development and test teams to ensure software releases deliver product management’s objectives on time and on budget</li>  <li>Undertake knowledge transfer and create training, operational, and support materials, in order to ensure seamless transition from product management to sales, client services and production support</li>  <li>Investigate problems independently and through collaboration with the development and test teams</li> </ul> <strong>Skills & Qualifications</strong> <br/><br/> <ul> <li>B.Sc. in Computer Science, Graphical Design, Visual Design, Interaction Design, or equivalent</li>  <li>3+years of UI/UX design experience. Preference will be given to candidates who have experience designing complex applications</li>  <li>2+ years of Agile/Scrum experience writing user stories, working directly with a development team is a plus</li>  <li>Be passionate about resolving user pain points through great design</li>  <li>Be passionate about all things UX and other areas of design and innovation. Research and showcase knowledge in the industry’s latest trends and technologies</li>  <li>Solid track record in requirements analysis to drive UI/UX product design described in user flows, user journeys, etc</li>  <li>Ability to clearly and effectively communicate design processes, ideas, and solutions to teams and clients</li>  <li>A clear understanding of the importance of user-centered design and design thinking</li>  <li>Extensive experience in using UX design best practices to design solutions for usability, and a deep understanding of mobile-first and responsive design to improve user experience</li>  <li>Ability to work with clients to understand detailed requirements and design complete user experiences that meet client needs and vision</li>  <li>A solid grasp of user-centered design (UCD), planning and conducting user research, user testing, A/B testing, rapid prototyping, heuristic analysis, usability and accessibility concerns</li>  <li>Domain expertise in accounts payable and/or accounts receivable or related FinTech a plus</li>  <li>Excellent verbal and written communication & organizational skills</li>  <li>Sufficient technical background to provide highly-credible interaction with technical teams, and to objectively evaluate complex project issues and risks</li>  <li>Self-motivation and drive; ability to execute with minimal daily supervision</li>  <li>Be open to receiving feedback and constructive criticism</li>  <li>Be excited about collaborating and communicating closely with teams and other stakeholders via a distributed model, to regularly deliver design solutions for approval</li>  <li>Expertise in standard UX software such as Sketch, OmniGraffle, Axure, InVision, UXPin, Balsamiq, Framer, and the like is a must. Basic HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript skills are a plus.</li>  <li>Experience with Project Management tools such as Jira, Rally, VersionOne or equivalent</li>  <li>Experience working with a startup or SaaS company is an asset</li> </ul> At VersaPay, we are committed to providing an environment that is inclusive and accessible. VersaPay is an equal opportunity employer and considers all applicants for employment without discrimination to race, colour, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veterans status, Aboriginal/Native American status. Please let us know if accommodation for the recruitment/interview process is required and we will work with you to make sure your needs are meet.
Title: UI/UX Product Designer

We also like to have fun. Life is too short not to have fun along the way. We have a work hard, play hard philosophy, and we focus on results.Our goal is to develop leaders. This is not an easy task. Are you up for it?</p> <p><strong>UX/UI Developer</strong></p> <p>We'll look to you to provide leadership and expertise in all areas of design and development.</p> <p>Core Responsibilities:</p> <p>You will be working collaboratively with our designers and developers to create seamless user experiences. You will be responsible for prototyping and building cross browser user interfaces with a creative flair for web design.</p> <ul> <li>Lead UX and design projects</li> <li>Work directly with our developers, giving them specs and assets</li> <li>Lead the development team on creating and reviewing wireframes and mockups that offer intuitive user experiences</li> <li>Formulate elegant solutions for design problems, working within brand guidelines</li> </ul> <ul> <li>Work closely with other members of the Intrigue Media team and provide thought leadership, strategic insight, and clear communication (written and verbal) to exceed KPIs and hit deadlines.</li> </ul> <p>Required Skills & Experience:</p> <ul> <li>2+ years of experience as a UX/UI Developer</li> <li>Exceptional knowledge of of UX/UI best practices</li> <li>Proven experience designing complex solutions for complete digital environments</li> <li>Passion for details and providing highly-polished, seamless user experiences under tight timelines, going beyond the research to find what actually delivers results for our clients</li> <li>Proficiency in Photoshop, Illustrator, Sketch, and InVision</li> <li>Processing</li> <li>Basic HTML/CSS</li> <li>Basic JavaScript</li> <li>Strong communication skills</li> <li>Experience communicating ideas to clients on a regular basis</li> </ul>
Title: UX/UI Developer

Job_Description: UX Designer <br/><br/> Tribal Worldwide is a global creative agency, drawing on its expertise in digital innovation as well as its heritage of creativity and insights to craft effective marketing solutions that connect brands to people. <br/><br/> We are looking for a talented mid-level UX Designer to create clean, thoughtful and strategically sound user experiences within, but not limited to the digital and mobile space. The ideal candidate should have an eye for clean and artful design, possess superior UI skills and be able to translate high-level requirements into interaction flows and artifacts, and transform them into beautiful, intuitive, and functional user interfaces. <br/><br/> Responsibilities: <ul> <li>Ability to collaborate with both Brand strategy and Creative leads to define and implement innovative solutions for the product direction, visuals and experience.</li><li>Execute all visual design stages from concept to final hand-off to engineering</li><li>Conceptualize original ideas that bring simplicity and user friendliness to complex design roadblocks.</li><li>Create wireframes, storyboards, user flows, process flows and site maps to effectively communicate interaction and design ideas</li><li>Present and defend designs and key milestone deliverables to peers</li><li>Conduct user research and evaluate user feedback</li><li>Follow design guidelines, best practices and usability standards.</li><li>Candidate will report to the Creative Director of Experience</li>  </ul> Requirements <ul> <li>Minimum 3+ years of UI experience</li><li>Demonstrable UI design skills with a strong portfolio</li><li>Solid experience in creating wireframes, storyboards, user flows, process flows and site maps</li><li>Proficiency in Sketch, InVision, Adobe Suite</li><li>Excellent visual design skills with sensitivity to user-system interaction</li><li>Ability to present your designs and sell your solutions to various stakeholders</li><li>Ability to solve problems creatively and effectively</li><li>Up-to-date with the latest UI trends, techniques, and technologies</li><li>Experience working in an Agile/Scrum development process</li> </ul> We appreciate all expressed interest in this position, however, only the candidates selected for interview will be contacted. <br/><br/> Tribal Worldwide is an inclusive, equal opportunity employer that values diversity. We also offer reasonable accommodations to applicants with disabilities. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, please let us know when you submit your application.
Title: UX Designer

Job_Description: <strong>About VersaPay Corporation</strong> <br/><br/> VersaPay is a Fintech company and leading provider of cloud-based invoice-to-cash solutions, enabling businesses to provide a superior customer experience, get paid faster, streamline financial operations, and dramatically reduce DSO and costs. <br/><br/> <strong>Why VersaPay?</strong> <br/><br/> VersaPay is a fast-growing, FinTech software company located in the heart of downtown Toronto, a world-renowned technology hub. We have been around for 10+ years, but we believe in operating with a start-up mindset. We work hard, building innovative technology that is revolutionizing the accounts receivable space, and make sure we have fun while doing so! If you’re ready for a challenge and want a great opportunity to work alongside other like minded people, join VersaPay, the next Canadian technology success story! <br/><br/> <strong>What we Offer</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Team environment:</strong> organized monthly activities (local baseball, basketball or hockey game; playing sports as a team; team potluck, monthly birthday celebrations) <br/><br/> <strong>Constant learning opportunities:</strong> from experts in the field. You will be challenged with projects that have a real impact, creating an experience like no other for accelerating your career <br/><br/> <strong>Central location:</strong> headquarters located in the heart of downtown Toronto <br/><br/> <strong>Work-life balance:</strong> our flexible working environment promotes work-life balance allowing employees to effectively manage responsibilities at work, at home, and in their community <br/><br/> <strong>Competitive salary:</strong> we are building a team with the best of the best and offer competitive compensation to ensure we attract and retain the best talent <br/><br/> <strong>Vacation:</strong> all employees start at a minimum of three weeks of paid vacation <br/><br/> <strong>Incredible health benefits:</strong> after one month of employment, employees are eligible for an incredible health benefits package including dental, medical, vision and more <br/><br/> <strong>No dress code:</strong> no dress code policy to promote the diverse personalities of our people <br/><br/> <strong>Job Summary</strong> <br/><br/> The UI/UX Product Designer will report into the Director of Product Management and will gather product ideas and requirements from various stakeholders, collaborate with stakeholders and product development team to design user flows, customer journey maps, wireframes, high fidelity designs and prototypes. The UX designer will also be expected to design the overall functionality of the product, and in order to ensure a great user experience, iterate upon it. <br/><br/> <strong>Key Responsibilities</strong>  <ul> <li>Participate in Agile Scrum development process and daily standups</li>  <li>Gathering feature requirements from stakeholders and customers</li>  <li>Translate concepts into user flows, wireframes, high fidelity designs and prototypes that lead to intuitive user experiences</li>  <li>Facilitate the product vision by researching, conceiving, sketching, prototyping and testing experiences for digital products</li>  <li>Design and deliver wireframes, user stories, user journeys, and high fidelity designs optimized for a wide range of devices and interfaces</li>  <li>Identify design problems and devise elegant solutions</li>  <li>Create and maintain graphical style guidelines for the product</li>  <li>Make strategic design and user-experience decisions related to core, and new, functions and features.</li>  <li>Take a user-centered design approach and rapidly test and iterate your designs.</li>  <li>Collaborate with other team members and stakeholders and Engineering.</li>  <li>Help QA design and prepare high level test cases to aid in test team’s planning and perform feature reviews</li>  <li>Work closely with development and test teams to ensure software releases deliver product management’s objectives on time and on budget</li>  <li>Undertake knowledge transfer and create training, operational, and support materials, in order to ensure seamless transition from product management to sales, client services and production support</li>  <li>Investigate problems independently and through collaboration with the development and test teams</li> </ul> <strong>Skills & Qualifications</strong> <br/><br/> <ul> <li>B.Sc. in Computer Science, Graphical Design, Visual Design, Interaction Design, or equivalent</li>  <li>3+years of UI/UX design experience. Preference will be given to candidates who have experience designing complex applications</li>  <li>2+ years of Agile/Scrum experience writing user stories, working directly with a development team is a plus</li>  <li>Be passionate about resolving user pain points through great design</li>  <li>Be passionate about all things UX and other areas of design and innovation. Research and showcase knowledge in the industry’s latest trends and technologies</li>  <li>Solid track record in requirements analysis to drive UI/UX product design described in user flows, user journeys, etc</li>  <li>Ability to clearly and effectively communicate design processes, ideas, and solutions to teams and clients</li>  <li>A clear understanding of the importance of user-centered design and design thinking</li>  <li>Extensive experience in using UX design best practices to design solutions for usability, and a deep understanding of mobile-first and responsive design to improve user experience</li>  <li>Ability to work with clients to understand detailed requirements and design complete user experiences that meet client needs and vision</li>  <li>A solid grasp of user-centered design (UCD), planning and conducting user research, user testing, A/B testing, rapid prototyping, heuristic analysis, usability and accessibility concerns</li>  <li>Domain expertise in accounts payable and/or accounts receivable or related FinTech a plus</li>  <li>Excellent verbal and written communication & organizational skills</li>  <li>Sufficient technical background to provide highly-credible interaction with technical teams, and to objectively evaluate complex project issues and risks</li>  <li>Self-motivation and drive; ability to execute with minimal daily supervision</li>  <li>Be open to receiving feedback and constructive criticism</li>  <li>Be excited about collaborating and communicating closely with teams and other stakeholders via a distributed model, to regularly deliver design solutions for approval</li>  <li>Expertise in standard UX software such as Sketch, OmniGraffle, Axure, InVision, UXPin, Balsamiq, Framer, and the like is a must. Basic HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript skills are a plus.</li>  <li>Experience with Project Management tools such as Jira, Rally, VersionOne or equivalent</li>  <li>Experience working with a startup or SaaS company is an asset</li> </ul> At VersaPay, we are committed to providing an environment that is inclusive and accessible. VersaPay is an equal opportunity employer and considers all applicants for employment without discrimination to race, colour, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veterans status, Aboriginal/Native American status. Please let us know if accommodation for the recruitment/interview process is required and we will work with you to make sure your needs are meet.
Title: UI/UX Product Designer

Job_Description: Our Client is looking for a Senior UIUX Designer to work on an initial 3 month contract on a Financial Services project <br/>  <br/> <strong>Duties</strong>:</strong>  <ul> <li>Uses the design assets and colour palette of Illustrator to create a website design</li><li>Create digital assets for production</li><li>Work collaboratively with the developer and project stakeholders iterating and finalizing the design</li><li>Works with the developer and team on implementation, testing and iteration</li><li>Participates in user testing of the design</li> </ul>  <strong>Deliverables</strong>  <ul> <li>Design mockups</li><li>Digital assets</li><li>Quality assurance of the design implementation, including bugs</li><li>User testing summaries</li><li>Other documentation as required</li> </ul>  <strong>Qualifications</strong>  <ul> <li>10+ years experience as a senior user experience designer</li><li>experience leading a visual design and UX processes</li><li>a demonstration of creativity and effective design through your portfolio</li><li>awareness of web accessibility implications to design</li><li>previous experience designing interactive experiences for children</li> </ul>  <strong>Skills</strong>  <ul> <li>makes sound, evidence-based decisions</li><li>promotes effective collaboration, communication and information sharing</li><li>thinks strategically when integrating complex or conflicting analysis from a range of sources to provide balanced advice</li><li>knowledge of HTML and JS used to help shape how design ideas are implemented</li><li>outstanding oral and written communication skills</li></ul>
Title: Senior UI/UX Designer

Job_Description: <div> <div><strong>Job Summary</strong></div><br/>  <div>We’re on the lookout for highly talented UX/UI Designer to come join our growing team of instructors in Toronto. <br/><br/> RED Academy is an innovative design and technology school with locations in Toronto, Vancouver and London UK. Our unique learning approach means our students build a real portfolio, developing the skills, and using the tools and technologies used in the industry today. <br/><br/> You share our love for tech and innovation, you lead with your heart and you are willing to go above and beyond to create an impact in the world. You are an experienced dev with a solid understanding of the tech industry, a keen interest in education and a passion for developing people. <br/><br/> We look for people with a passion for sharing their knowledge who have significant real-world experience. Educational experience is a bonus, but all of our instructional team receive in-depth training in the latest instructional and educational approaches, and so this is much less important than your attitude, knowledge and portfolio. <br/><br/> <strong>Why RED?</strong> <br/><br/> In short, working at RED is unlike anything you will have experienced before. Aside from the deeply rewarding work of teaching and mentoring, we offer 4 weeks paid holiday, benefits, OHIP covered, and a wide array of opportunities to be involved in the local tech and impact communities through our events and partnerships. <br/><br/> We believe in autonomy, mastery and purpose, meaning that we encourage our staff to drive their own role, while we provide you with mentoring, training and personal development to support you in building a career path you love and can truly connect with. <br/><br/> Above all, we are committed to providing a deeply engaging, truly dynamic and highly rewarding work environment, where our team can thrive and find the highest possible levels of personal and professional fulfillment and satisfaction. <br/><br/> And best of all, all of our people share a deep passion for what they do: for design and technology, and finding the most forward-thinking ways of delivering a truly world-class learning experience for our students, all of which makes RED an amazing place to work. <br/><br/> We are in a very ambitious phase of growth, and in all of our people - we are looking for competent, hands-on team players. This is a pivotal role at one of Canada’s largest private technology academy, and you will play a central part in our continued growth and success. <br/><br/> <strong>Skills and Qualifications</strong> <br/><br/> • You are the person that your colleagues naturally gravitate to when they are looking for guidance. <br/><br/> • You have at least 5 years of experience working in UX or UI design</div> </div><br/>  <div>You will be a subject matter expert with deep working experience in all of the areas of the UX and UI Design program, which includes the following areas:  <ul>  <li>User Research (interviews, survey, task/competitive analysis)</li>    <li>Data analysis (persona creation, storyboards, use cases)</li>    <li>Business Analytics (conversion funnel, KPI’s, cohort analysis)</li>    <li>IA & Navigation (sitemaps, navigation design, card sorting, taxonomies)</li>    <li>User Flows</li>    <li>Wireframes</li>    <li>Rapid prototyping (sketches, paper prototypes, usability testing)</li>    <li>High-fidelity prototyping</li>    <li>Visual Design (Typography, Colour Theory, Composition)</li>    <li>Industry standard design software (Adobe Creative Suite, Invision, Axure, Sketch)</li>    <li>Brand Design</li>    <li>Mobile-first design</li>    <li>Native Mobile Design</li>    <li>Emerging tech (wearables, VR, AR)</li>    <li>Above all you have a great portfolio of work and a love for what you do.</li>    </ul>  </div><br/>  <div><strong>Primary Duties & Responsibilities</strong>   <ul>  <li>Delivering the immersive full time design programs.</li>    <li>Facilitate a dynamic and collaborative classroom community</li>    <li>Assist students outside of class as necessary.</li>    <li>To work closely with other members of the instructional and operations team to develop our <br/><br/> learning programs and curriculum to ensure we are providing the highest possible quality of <br/><br/> learning to our students.</li>    <li>To work with the RED team on web projects and apps for our network of Community <br/><br/> Partners and charities.</li>    <li>To assist with student admissions processes and policies where relevant, and support the <br/><br/> ongoing management of student records, assessments, evaluations, certification processes <br/><br/> and policies.</li>    <li>Communicating and negotiating with third party partners, associations and suppliers.</li>    <li>Develop new learning programs, curricula and learning approaches to ensure we remain <br/><br/> relevant to the industry’s demand.</li>    </ul>  <strong>Summary</strong></div> <br/> <div>As an Instructor, you will need to have a deep understanding of the subject matter and a passion to teach. Instructional experience in a technology related subject is a big plus, but the most important thing is being a great fit with our values, to be comfortable in a people facing role, and have a real passion for all things related to technology and education.</div> <br/> <div>If you are interested in this role, please contact us with your resume and a cover letter, providing 3 key reasons why you feel you would be the perfect fit.</div>
Title: UX/UI Design Instructor

Experience with JavaScript frameworks such as Angular, React, or Vue is considered an asset.</li>  <li>Certifications in relevant technology or processes is considered an asset.</li> <li>Knowledge and experience in the insurance industry is considered an asset.</li>  </ul> <strong>Wawanesa provides its employees with an environment conducive to achieving their goals for personal performance and career development. The benefit package is comprehensive and far ranging. Wawanesa provides a stable and rewarding environment for its employees in today’s challenging markets.</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Join a Canadian success story!</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>If you are intersted in this exciting, challenging position with Wawanesa, please apply today.</strong></div> <br/>

Vention works with flagship manufacturing companies across the world, empowering their engineers to design, order and assemble industrial equipment as fast as 3 days. <br/><br/> THE ROLE <br/> Reporting to the CTO, you will be responsible for crafting a user experience and building an engaging user interface for Vention e-Commerce website and 3D MachineBuilder.
