Job_Description: <div> <div> <div> <div>Nous valorisons la diversité et avons cœur de créer un milieu de travail inclusif qui nous inspire tous donner le meilleur de nous-mêmes. Joignez-vous notre équipe et faites une différence!</div>  </div> </div>  </div> <div> <div> Votre poste</div>  </div> <div> <div> <div> <div><strong><em>Nous</em></strong> <br/><br/> Comment imaginez-vous les bureaux dune compagnie dassurance? Mariant la convivialité et la vélocité dune startup aux ressources et les moyens dune grande entreprise, Intact Lab est un environnement jeune et dynamique, offrant des défis stimulants, des collègues inspirants et une carrière passionnante (chez un des top 100 employeurs au Canada!). <br/><br/> Situé aux centres-villes de Montréal et de Toronto, nous sommes un laboratoire dinnovation responsable de créer des produits et services la fine-pointe de la #insuretech. Joignez-vous notre équipe et participez concevoir la prochaine génération des expériences numériques des plus grandes marques dassurances au pays nous avons hâte de vous rencontrer! <br/><br/> <em><strong>Vous</strong></em> <br/><br/> Êtes-vous un passionné du e-commerce et de l'innovation numérique? Nous avons une opportunité parfaite pour vous! <br/><br/> <strong><em>Votre rôle</em></strong> <br/><br/> En tant que Designer UX/UI senior, vous jouerez un rôle crucial dans la conception et lévolution de notre écosystème numérique. Relevant de la Directrice, design et sciences comportementales, vous aurez comme principales responsabilités:  <ul>   <li>Concevoir des expériences nous permettant datteindre nos objectifs de performance.</li>   <li>Valider lutilisabilité et lutilité des solutions laide de recherche et tests utilisateurs.</li>   <li>Produire les livrables UX nécessaires aux projets.</li>   <li>Diriger la feuille de route en tandem avec un gestionnaire de produit et une équipe agile.</li>   <li>Présenter le travail aux parties prenantes.</li>   <li>Accompagner les ingénieurs dans la création dinterfaces agréables et de qualité.</li>   <li>Être un ambassadeur de la conception centré utilisateur et axé sur les données.</li> </ul>   </div> </div> </div>  </div> <div> <div> Vos compétences</div>  </div> <div> <div> <div> <div>   <ul>   <li>Minimum de 7 années d'expérience dans un rôle similaire</li>   <li>Maitrise des meilleures pratiques en utilisabilité et en conception centrée utilisateur</li>   <li>Maitrise des outils de design (Sketch, Axure, InVision, Illustrator, etc.)</li>   <li>Expérience en recherche utilisateur (ex. tests utilisateurs)</li>   <li>Expérience produire des wireframes, flux de processus, prototypes, etc.</li>   <li>Baccalauréat dans une discipline pertinente</li>   <li>Vous adorez œuvrer dans des environnements collaboratifs avec un focus sur le travail déquipe, linnovation, louverture et samuser!</li> </ul> Svp inclure votre portfolio dans votre application. <br/><br/> <em><strong>Vous êtes</strong></em>  <ul>   <li>Créatif, esprit analytique, curieux et ingénieux</li>   <li>Joueur déquipe prêt contribuer et recevoir de la rétroaction</li>   <li>Excellent vulgarisateur capable dexpliquer ses idées divers intervenants</li>   <li>Passionné par le design et la qualité</li>   <li>Leader qui n'hésite pas prendre des initiatives</li>   <li>Organisé et proactif</li> </ul> <em><strong>En tant que salarié temps plein, vous bénéficierez de :</strong></em>  <ul>   <li>Un salaire compétitif</li>   <li>Un boni annuel</li>   <li>Un fond de pension</li>   <li>Un horaire de travail flexible et une semaine de 35 heures</li>   <li>Des assurances médicales et dentaires hors pair</li>   <li>Un MacBook Pro neuf</li>   <li>Et plusieurs autres avantages et bénéfices (remboursement gym, conférences, etc.)</li> </ul>   </div> </div> </div>  </div> <div> <div> Énoncé fermeture</div>  </div> <div> <div> <div> <div><strong>Cette opportunité vous intéresse? Nous avons très hâte de faire votre connaissance!</strong> <br/><br/> Dexcellents avantages sont offerts : salaire concurrentiel, avantages flexibles, aménagements de travail flexibles, congés mobiles, régime de retraite prestation déterminée, etc. <br/><br/> Dans le cadre du processus de sélection dIntact, les candidats peuvent être appelés donner leur consentement une vérification de leurs antécédents pertinente au poste pourvoir avant de recevoir une offre demploi. Celle-ci peut comprendre une confirmation des références demploi, des études et des titres de compétences, une vérification des emplois, de lidentité, des infractions criminelles et du permis de conduire ainsi quun rapport de crédit. <br/><br/> Vous pouvez soumettre votre candidature un emploi affiché pourvu que vous occupiez vos fonctions actuelles depuis au moins douze mois et que votre performance soit jugée bonne ou que votre contrat temporaire arrive son échéance. Une recherche de talents l'externe est menée parallèlement au recrutement l'interne Veuillez donc prendre note que des candidats potentiels pourraient avoir été identifiés pour ce poste dans le cadre de leur plan de développement. <br/><br/> *Veuillez noter que l'usage du masculin a comme but d'alléger le texte. <br/><br/> <strong>Cet affichage prendra fin le 02 juin 2018.</strong></div>  </div> </div>  </div> <div> <div> Droit de travailler au Canada</div>  </div> <div> <div> <div> <div>Les personnes qui posent leur candidature un poste permanent doivent, dès leur embauche, avoir le droit de travailler au Canada de façon permanente. Les documents pouvant servir de preuve dans le cas des rôles permanents sont un certificat de naissance canadien, un passeport canadien, un certificat de citoyenneté canadienne, une carte de résident permanent ou une confirmation de son statut de résident permanent pour prouver quil a le droit de travailler au Canada.</div>  </div> </div>  </div> <div> <div> Indeed Commandité</div>  </div> <div> <div> <div> <div>IN-INFR</div>  </div> </div>  </div>
Title: Designer UX/UI senior

Job_Description: <div>  <div> <p><strong>UI/UX Designer<br></strong><strong>(Software and User Interfaces) </strong></p> <strong> <p><strong>UI/UX Designer</strong></p> <p><strong>(Software and User Interfaces) </strong></p></strong> <p></p> </div> </div><div> <p><strong></strong></p> <p></p> <p></p> <p></p> <p></p> <p></p> <p><strong>UI/UX Designer (Software & User Interfaces) </strong></p> <p><strong>Dakis Inc. | Montreal (Qc), Canada </strong></p> <p>Role: Responsible to plan & redesign Dakis’ Software & User Interfaces </p> <p></p> <p></p> <p> </p> <p><strong>Job description & responsibilities </strong></p> <p>You will be responsible to plan and redesign Dakis’ Software Interfaces and User Interfaces to meet today’s modern look and feel, and to provide a great user experience. </p> <p> </p>  <div> <ul> <li> <div>Since we are developing a lot of new software, you will be highly involved and contribute in the making of these new products with your passion to create user stories, sketching out designs and by putting the finishing touch on the final product interface. </div> </li><li> <div>Your implication in all product lifecycle phases will have a great impact on interfaces’ look and fell, planning of requirements, features, user experience, branding and much more. </div></li></ul> </div> <p> </p> <p>There will never be a boring day! You want to work on cutting edge projects and technologies? You have the eye and the skills to make an impact at Dakis? Let’s get in touch! </p> <p></p> <p> </p> <p><strong>Main qualifications and desired skills </strong></p> <p><strong></strong> </p>  <div> <ul> <li> <div>Skilled in UI/UX design </div> </li><li> <div>Passion to create user stories and sketching out designs </div> </li><li> <div>Empathetic and able to see the world from the eyes of a user </div> </li><li> <div>Good communicator and team player </div> </li><li> <div>Staying abreast of UI technology development<br>and user experience best practices (UX); </div> </li><li> <div>Attention to details and strong commitment to quality</div></li></ul> </div> <p><strong></strong> </p> <p><strong>Complementary skill set </strong></p> <p><strong></strong> </p>  <div> <ul> <li> <div>Web programming skills not necessary but an asset. We are first and foremost looking for an amazing designer that understands modern technologies </div> </li><li> <div>Good understanding of responsive front-end framework, cross-browser user interfaces / browser limitations, modern web technologies, SEO and more </div></li></ul> </div> <p> </p> <p><strong>About Dakis </strong></p> <p>Dakis is a relatively small yet rapidly growing private Software Development Company. We are assisting retailers and manufacturers across the globe with easy to use and well adapted Managed Websites, WebStores, Product Information and Photo Solutions. </p> <p></p> <p></p> <p> </p> <p>We are looking for talented and motivated Software Developers to join our agile tech team to develop Dakis’ next generation of products including the Responsive Front-End Framework & Web-CMS, SaaS Multi-Channel WebStores & Product Information Management SOA Platform, Web Photo Solutions, Photo Kiosks and Mobile Photo Apps. Let’s get in touch! </p> <p></p> <p></p> <p><strong></strong> </p> <p><strong>Apply </strong></p> <p>We value talented and motivated individuals that truly love what they do. Interested to shape the future? Send us your CV, links or code sample and salary expectations at cv@dakis.com. </p> <p> </p> <p><strong>UI/UX Designer (Software & User Interfaces) </strong></p> <p><strong>Dakis Inc. | Montreal (Qc), Canada </strong></p> <p>Rôle: Responsable de la planification et du redesign des interfaces logiciels et des interfaces usagers </p> <p></p> <p> </p> <p><strong>Description & responsabilités </strong></p> <p>Vous serez responsable de la planification et du redesign des interfaces logicielles de Dakis et des interfaces usagers pour produire un look moderne tout en fournissant une expérience utilisateur exceptionnelle.</p> <p> </p>  <div> <ul> <li> <div>Puisque nous développons beaucoup de nouveaux logiciels, vous serez également très impliqué pour la réalisation de ces nouveaux produits et vous contribuerez avec votre passion pour créer des scénarios d'utilisateurs, en produisant des esquisses et en mettant la touche finale à l'interface du produit. </div> </li><li> <div>Votre implication durant toutes les phases du développement logiciel au un grand impact sur le design et l’ergonomie des interfaces, la définition des exigences, des fonctionnalités, de l’expérience usager, du branding et bien plus encore.</div></li></ul> </div> <p> </p> <p>Il n'y aura jamais une journée ennuyante! Vous avez le flair et les compétences nécessaires pour avoir un impact chez Dakis? Contactez-nous! </p> <p></p> <p> </p> <p><strong>Principales qualifications</strong></p> <p><strong></strong> </p>  <div> <ul> <li> <div>Expertise en UI/UX design </div> </li><li> <div>Passion pour créer des scénarios d’utilisateurs et pour produire des esquisses </div> </li><li> <div>Empathique et capacité de voir le monde à travers les yeux d’un utilisateur </div> </li><li> <div>Bon communicateur et team player </div> </li><li> <div>Rester à l’affut des nouvelles tendances technologiques web et visuelles ainsi que des meilleures pratiques en expérience usager (UX); </div> </li><li> <div>Porte une attention aux détails et fierté de livrer un produit de qualité </div></li></ul> </div> <p> </p> <p><strong>Expertise complémentaire</strong></p> <p><strong> </strong></p>  <div> <ul> <li> <div>Connaissance en programmation web ne sont pas nécessaires mais un atout. Nous recherchons avant tout un designer exceptionnel qui comprend bien les technologies modernes </div> </li><li> <div>Bonne compréhension des responsive front-end framework, limitations des fureteurs (cross-browser), technologies web modernes, SEO et plus encore</div></li></ul> </div> <p> </p> <p><strong>À Propos de Dakis </strong></p> <p>Dakis est une PME du domaine du développement logiciel en phase de croissance rapide. Nous contribuons au succès des détaillants et des manufacturiers du monde entier en leur fournissant des solutions de Sites Web Gérés, WebStore, Information Produit et des Solutions Photos qui sont simples d’utilisation et bien adaptées. </p> <p></p> <p> </p> <p>Nous recherchons des développeurs logiciels talentueux et motivés pour joindre notre équipe tech pour développer les prochaines générations des produits de Dakis y compris notre Responsive front-end framework & Web-CMS, SaaS eCommerce Multi-Canaux & Gestion de l’Information Produit SOA Platform, Solutions Photo Web, Bornes Photo et Applications Photos Mobiles. Contactez-nous! </p> <p></p> <p> </p> <p><strong>Appliquez </strong></p> <p>Nous apprécions les individus talentueux et motivés qui aiment vraiment ce qu'ils font. Intéressé à façonner l'avenir? Faites-nous parvenir votre CV, des liens ou des exemples de code et vos attentes salariales à cv@dakis.com . </p> <p></p> <p></p> <p></p> </div>
Title: UI/UX Designer (Software and User Interfaces)

Job_Description: <strong>About Our Company</strong> <br/><br/> UNIVERIS, headquartered in Toronto, Canada, is a privately held company and is the leader in enterprise wealth management for the Canadian market. Founded in 1991, UNIVERIS has over 100 staff and 15 leading financial services clients representing over 17,000 financial advisors on the platform. It offers the most comprehensive wealth management solution for financial advisors in the credit union, banking, insurance and investment dealer sectors. <br/><br/> UNIVERIS is a world-class technology platform that boasts a number of firsts in Canadian mutual fund distribution including real-time processing, web access, built-in compliance, plus GIC and segregated funds processing capabilities. Technology innovation is one of the cornerstones of UNIVERIS' product development strategy and through its Evergreen approach to technology, new features and capabilities transparently integrate into the platform. <br/><br/> <strong>About the Role</strong> <br/><br/> We are looking for a talented User-Experience Designer responsible for conceiving and conducting user research, interviews and surveys, and translating them into sitemaps, wireframes and prototypes. You will also make strategic design decisions for the overall functionality of the product and iterate upon it to ensure a great user experience. You will be creating and maintaining a design library for the persona(s) that you will be responsible for. If this sounds like what you are looking for, we are excited to meet you! <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities</strong>  <ul>  <li>Translate concepts into wireframes and mockups that lead to intuitive user experiences.</li> <li>Facilitate stakeholder’s product visions by researching, conceiving, wireframing, sketching, prototyping, and mocking up user experiences for digital products.</li> <li>Design and deliver lofi/hifi wireframes, user stories, user journeys, and mockups optimized for a wide range of devices and interfaces.</li> <li>Identify design problems and devise elegant solutions.</li> <li>Make strategic design and user-experience decisions related to core, and new, functions and features.</li> <li>Take a user-centered design approach and rapidly test and iterate your designs.</li> <li>Collaborate with other team members and stakeholders.</li> <li>Take smart risks and champion new ideas.</li> <li>Stay current with recent developments in the UX/UI design industry and community; and communicate any new insight to fellow designers</li> <li>Create, document and maintain design patterns and assets into a design library/style guide.</li> <li>Maintain the UX community within Univeris, to promote UX awareness across all platforms</li>  </ul> <strong>Requirements</strong>  <ul>  <li>Bachelor's Degree, College diploma OR relevant experience Experience: 3+ years.</li> <li>Expertise in UX software such as InVision, UXPin, Balsamiq, Framer.js, Quartz Composer, and the like is a must.</li> <li>Basic HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript skills.</li> <li>Ability to work with clients to understand detailed requirements and design complete user experiences that meet client needs and vision.</li> <li>Extensive experience in using UX design best practices to design solutions, and a deep understanding of mobile-first and responsive design.</li> <li>Experience designing Web and Hybrid Mobile apps</li> <li>A solid grasp of user-centered design and testing methodologies, subsystems, and usability and accessibility concerns.</li> <li>Ability to iterate your designs and solutions efficiently and intelligently.</li> <li>Ability to clearly and effectively communicate design processes, ideas, and solutions to teams and clients.</li> <li>A clear understanding of the importance of user-centered design.</li> <li>Be excited about collaborating and communicating closely with teams and other stakeholders via a distributed model to regularly deliver design solutions for approval.</li> <li>Be willing to help teammates, share knowledge and experience with them, and learn from them.</li> <li>Be open to receiving feedback and constructive criticism.</li> <li>Be passionate about all things UX and other areas of design and innovation. Research and showcase knowledge in the industry’s latest trends and technologies.</li> <li>A portfolio showcasing your UX skills, capabilities, and strong sense of user understanding and design</li> </ul>
Title: UX Designer

Job_Description: <div> <div> <strong>UX Designer</strong> <br/> <strong>What We Are Looking For</strong><br/><br/>GlobalVision is looking for an experienced and ambitious UX Designer. A strong portfolio of successful UX and other technical projects is essential.<br/><br/><strong>Who We Are</strong><br/><br/>We are GlobalVision, a software and technology company founded in 1990 and headquartered in Montreal. We develop high-tech automated quality control solutions for international businesses. We are a global company and businesses everywhere use and depend on our software. We have a strong vision, and it’s carried out by a tight-knit, talented, and diverse team.<br/><br/><strong>Work Hard, Play Hard</strong><br/><br/>At GlobalVision balance is important to us. Growing our people is just as important as building the best products possible. We have carefully cultivated our team, and we are always looking for new talent to join our company.<br/><br/><strong>The day-to-day</strong>   <ul> <li>Understand product specifications and user psychology.</li> <li>Conduct concept and usability testing and gather feedback.</li> <li>Create personas through user research and data.</li> <li>Define the right interaction model and evaluate its success.</li> <li>Develop wireframes and prototypes around customer needs.</li> <li>Find creative ways to solve UX problems (e.g. usability, findability).</li> <li>Work with UI designers to implement attractive designs.</li> <li>Communicate design ideas and prototypes to developers.</li> <li>Keep abreast of competitor products and industry trends.</li> </ul>  <strong>Qualifications</strong>   <ul> <li>Proven experience as a UX Designer, UI Designer or similar role.</li> <li>Strong portfolio of design projects.</li> <li>Background in project management and research.</li> <li>Familiarity with interaction design and information architecture.</li> <li>Proficient in design software (e.g. UXPin, Balsamiq).</li> <li>Knowledge of HTML/CSS; JavaScript is a plus.</li> <li>Problem-solving aptitude.</li> <li>Analytical mind with a business acumen.</li> <li>Excellent communication skills.</li> <li>BSc in Design, Computer Science, Engineering or a related field.</li> </ul>  </div> </div>   <br/>
Title: UX Designer

Job_Description: <div>Paysafe delivers a full suite of payments solutions. From card issuing to acquiring; from payment gateways to merchant accounts; from fraud and risk to compliance; from digital wallets and mobile to invoicing - we process millions of transactions worldwide and we value our relationships at every point in the process. <br/><br/> Paysafe is a global company with a dynamic environment operating in multiple countries including the UK, Bulgaria, Austria, India, Canada and the US. <br/><br/> Paysafe is currently searching for an experienced Director of UX/UI to join our team in Calgary.<br/><br/>Professional requirements:   <ul>  	<li>Minimum 10 years of relevant UX experience and 5 years leading professional teams</li> <li>Experience with driving qualitative and quantitative user research initiatives</li>   <li>Proven experience in in-house product development and agile/lean environments</li> <li>Master knowledge of UX/UI flows, concepts, methods, trends</li> <li>Experience planning, rolling out and executing successful UX strategy</li>   <li>Experience leading multicultural teams – Large International corporate experience</li>   <li>Excellent communication skills</li>   <li>Proven record of data-driven initiatives and process optimization.</li>   <li>Understanding of coding, development process, and ability to communicate with developers.</li>  </ul>  <strong>Soft skill requirements:</strong>   <ul>  	<li>Excellent communication skills</li>   <li>Capable of giving and receiving candid feedback and constructive criticism.</li>   <li>Active listener</li>   <li>Compassionate and understanding. Believes in human work-life balance</li>   <li>Personable, friendly – displays and understands Paysafe values: Open – Focused – Pioneering - Courageous</li>   <li>An understanding of human behaviour</li> <li>Is driven by learning what motivates humans and how to engage them on a meaningful level Responsibilities</li>   <li>Establish effective working relationships with managers in other related disciplines</li> </ul>  <strong>Nice to have:</strong>   <ul>  	<li>Master’s degree in Business Administration, Marketing, Economics, Design, Engineering, or an equivalent in working experience.</li>   <li>Experience in change management and understanding of organizational behaviour.</li>  </ul>  </div> <br/>
Title: Director UX/UI

Job_Description: As Senior UI/UX Designer you will be responsible for developing and deploying our Integrated Solutions Package for customers seeking to source, create, and measure compelling web and mobile applications in the Financial Services space. <br/><br/> You are inquisitive by nature and passionate about users motivations while delivering the highest level product possible to clients. You thrive at synthesizing varied information to make decisions. You excel at communicating priorities and results with business, technical, design, and executive stakeholders. <br/><br/> You have experience effectively mentoring other UI/UX Designers. You have an inventors spirit, highly refined aesthetic sensibilities, an eye for every pixel, and a track record of producing world class user experiences. <br/><br/> Join our growing UX team and make a significant impact on our business growth while influencing the design direction for existing and new clients. Help us change the perception of how "typical" internal tools are designed by creating innovative interfaces that inject beauty and delight into our customer's day-to-day experiences. <br/><br/> <strong>Your Main Responsibilities:</strong>  <ul> <li>Work closely with the Director of Product Design to relentlessly simplify and distill complex business processes into intuitive and elegant product experience</li> <li>Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand and communicate functional requirements, address technical constraints, and define best-in-class user experiences</li> <li>Collaborate and produce visual brand assets for our energetic and fast-paced lead gen, growth hacking, and marketing team</li> <li>Collaborate and contribute to client meetings, presentations, discovery sessions and process planning</li> <li>Ensure the UI/UX team has a clear understanding of client project context, constraints, and opportunities</li> <li>Help define project goals and objectives, both internally with department leads and clients</li> <li>Ensure all deliverables are of the highest level of quality and precision</li> <li>Be a creative inspirer, foster positivity and awesomeness</li> <li>Assist in the development and evaluation of personas, user stories, persona modeling and customer journeys</li> <li>Handle multiple projects in an agile, fast-paced environment</li> </ul> <strong>What We're Looking For:</strong>  <ul> <li>An established in-production portfolio of work that demonstrates your skills, craft, intuition, problem-solving and expertise</li> <li>Minimum 5 years of experience as a User Experience Designer and Team Lead</li> <li>Ability to prioritize and manage multiple parallel-path projects</li> <li>A working knowledge of UI design standards for web, mobile web, iOS, and Android and wearables</li> <li>Knowledge of web and mobile frameworks, languages, and tools (basic understanding of fundamental build tools such as XCode, CSS/HTML</li> <li>High-level of proficiency with Sketch, Invision, Adobe CS, Zeplin, Framer and Keynote</li>   <li>Confident in speaking during presentations and client meetings, both internally and externally</li> <li>Attention to detailevery pixel counts</li> <li>Strong knowledge base of production tools such as Slack, GitHub, Jira</li> <li>Experience working in a collaborative team and working directly with software development engineers for implementation of designs</li> <li>Report to the Director of Product Design on a recurring basis, distilling project efficiency outcomes, gaps, KPIs and opportunities for improvements</li> <li>Demonstrated history of acquiring user data, hypothetical analysis and creation (e.g., conducting usability studies, performing user research) then processing and delivering data findings to departmental team members and clients</li> <li>Resource planning, interview and recruiting process knowledge</li> </ul> <strong>Bonus Points For:</strong>  <ul> <li>Experience with FinTech as it relates to Tier 1-2 banking institutions and credit union space</li> <li>Solid written and verbal communication skills with the ability to present a strong rationale for design decisions</li> </ul> <strong>Education:</strong>  <ul> <li>Bachelor's Degree in Design, HCI, related field or equivalent agency/work experience</li> </ul> <strong>About Aequilibrium:</strong> <br/><br/> Craftsmanship and speed. Thats something were known for around here. <br/><br/> Aequilibrium helps financial institutions and Fintechs create seamless and personalized digital experiences that attract and retain customers. We have domain and technical expertise to accelerate digital innovation and transform user experiences into life experiences. By building rich and immersive digital solutions, our team empowers FIs to deliver more intelligent and meaningful interactions across every customer touchpoint. <br/><br/> With a perfect pairing of code and design, we want you to create products and solutions that youre visually and technically proud of. Ones that the users will love. <br/><br/> We plan, design, architect and build technology platforms and productsdelivering world-class technology solutions for companies such as Hootsuite, BuildDirect.com, Central 1 Credit Union, Kit and Ace, BackBase, Monexa and more. <br/><br/> Aequilibrium is proud to have been selected as a Top 5 Finalist for the Small Business BC Best Employer Awards for 2 consecutive years. We have a casual and collaborative working environment and support flexible schedules. We're big on technology and creativity, and we believe that through teamwork (whether that manifests itself in your daily work or your next ping pong challenge) we can reach amazing feats together. <br/><br/> Our office is located near Waterfront in the financial district, surrounded by pretty sweet coffee shops and eateries and educational accelerators like BrainStation. We are close to main bus routes and literally steps away from several skytrain access points. Our building is fully equipped with bike storage lockers and a full size gym on the ground floor. <br/><br/> If you feel youll thrive in this environment and make a difference, you should definitely apply! <br/><br/> <strong>The Perks:</strong> <br/><br/> aequilibrium.ca/careers <br/><br/> <strong>Get Social With Us!</strong> <br/><br/> Twitter | Blog | LinkedIn
Title: Senior UI/UX Designer

Job_Description: As a technology industry leader and thriving small business, The Creative Group's client is looking for a talented Lead UX/ UI Designer to join their entrepreneurial team. <br/><br/> Salary: $100K - $120K base <br/> Location: downtown Toronto<br/><br/>Our client is looking for an experienced UX/ UI Designer who:<br/><br/>- Works well in an entrepreneurial environment<br/><br/>- Has management and leadership potential<br/><br/>- Has a proven track record creating engaging user experiences and refining user interface<br/><br/>The Lead UX/ UI Designer will be working with a small, cross-functional team to deliver a highly effective and digital experience.<br/><br/>Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:<br/><br/>* Leading design projects across the full product lifecycle and multiple product launches<br/><br/>* Turning wireframes, flows and product requirements into beautiful, intuitive and easy-to-use user interfaces<br/><br/>* Participating in user testing<br/><br/>The ideal candidate will have:<br/><br/>* 8+ years' experience in UX/ UI design from a mix of large and small companies<br/><br/>* A strong design portfolio, applying user-centered design practices to web/mobile applications with a solid foundation in UX/UI design experience.<br/><br/>* Analytical design skills<br/><br/>* Experience establishing UX/ UI design strategy and enacting it with a multi-disciplinary team<br/><br/>* User testing and research experience<br/><br/>* Proficiency with design and prototyping tools; i.e. Adobe Creative Cloud, Sketch, InVision and/ or other contemporary prototyping suites.<br/><br/>This is a rare opportunity with a company that is rapidly growing! Interested candidates please send your resume and portfolio link directly to The Creative Group Recruiting Manager: samantha.dalton@creativegroup.com
Title: Lead UX/ UI Designer

Job_Description: Description <br/>  <div> <em>Position at DDB Canada</em></div> <br/>UX Designer <br/><br/> Tribal Worldwide is a global creative agency, drawing on its expertise in digital innovation as well as its heritage of creativity and insights to craft effective marketing solutions that connect brands to people. <br/><br/> We are looking for a talented mid-level UX Designer to create clean, thoughtful and strategically sound user experiences within, but not limited to the digital and mobile space. The ideal candidate should have an eye for clean and artful design, possess superior UI skills and be able to translate high-level requirements into interaction flows and artifacts, and transform them into beautiful, intuitive, and functional user interfaces.​ <br/><br/> Responsibilities: <ul> <li>Ability to collaborate with both Brand strategy and Creative leads to define and implement innovative solutions for the product direction, visuals and experience.</li><li>Execute all visual design stages from concept to final hand-off to engineering</li><li>Conceptualize original ideas that bring simplicity and user friendliness to complex design roadblocks.</li><li>Create wireframes, storyboards, user flows, process flows and site maps to effectively communicate interaction and design ideas</li><li>Present and defend designs and key milestone deliverables to peers</li><li>Conduct user research and evaluate user feedback</li><li>Follow design guidelines, best practices and usability standards.</li><li>Candidate will report to the Creative Director of Experience</li>  </ul> Requirements <ul> <li>Minimum 3+ years of UI experience</li><li>Demonstrable UI design skills with a strong portfolio</li><li>Solid experience in creating wireframes, storyboards, user flows, process flows and site maps</li><li>Proficiency in Sketch, InVision, Adobe Suite</li><li>Excellent visual design skills with sensitivity to user-system interaction​</li><li>Ability to present your designs and sell your solutions to various stakeholders</li><li>Ability to solve problems creatively and effectively</li><li>Up-to-date with the latest UI trends, techniques, and technologies</li><li>Experience working in an Agile/Scrum development process</li> </ul> We appreciate all expressed interest in this position, however, only the candidates selected for interview will be contacted. <br/><br/> Tribal Worldwide is an inclusive, equal opportunity employer that values diversity. We also offer reasonable accommodations to applicants with disabilities. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, please let us know when you submit your application.
Title: UX Designer

Job_Description: Catallaxy is looking for a <strong>UX/designer</strong> who can create beautiful websites and intuitive interfaces for blockchain applications and education materials. You should be able to build an engaging website from sketches to html. <br/><br/> You will work directly with the Head of Product and the Lead Developer. <br/><br/> <strong><u><strong>Job Location</strong></u></strong>: Montreal, Quebec, Canada <br/><br/> <strong><u><strong>Job type</strong></u></strong><u>:</u> Part Time, starting immediately <br/><br/> <strong><u><strong>Requirements</strong></u></strong>: <ul> <li>strong design skills</li><li>strong UX skills</li><li>html, css (and/or css preprocessor like LESS, SASS, etc)</li><li>experience with javascript</li><li>experience with react.js or willingness to learn</li><li>excellent communication skills (in English and/or French)</li><li>understanding of mobile/responsive design</li><li>good understanding of best practices for mobile design and web apps</li><li>ability to teach complex concepts in simple terms</li><li>results-oriented</li><li>good sense of esthetic</li><li>attention to detail</li><li>love for clean and elegant web applications</li> </ul> <strong><u><br/> </u></strong> <br/><br/> <strong><u><strong>Bonus:</strong></u></strong> <ul> <li>interest in blockchain technologies like bitcoin</li><li>git</li><li>you've tried storybook.js or similar tool</li><li>familiarity with i18n and a11y</li><li>marketing attitude</li> </ul> <strong><u><br/> </u></strong> <br/><br/> When applying, please include a link to your porfolio (or equivalent).<strong></strong> <br/><br/> <strong></strong> <br/><br/> <strong><u><strong>About Catallaxy</strong></u></strong> <br/><br/> With more than 15 Montreal-based experts and nearly 50 strategic partners worldwide, our service offering combines the technical expertise of the best core Blockchain talents and the strategic consulting power of Raymond Chabot Grant Thornton. Our objective is to prepare businesses for their blockchain transformation. <br/><br/> Catallaxy is also launching the Blockhouse. The Blockhouse is a unique innovation center bringing together the most influential players in the blockchain community. Strategically based in Montréal, the Blockhouse is a unique international showcase for decentralized and distributed technologies.
Title: UI/UX/Designer

Job_Description: <div>At Sonova, our vision is straightforward. We foster a world in which there is a solution to every hearing loss and all people equally enjoy the delight of hearing. We are not just a company that makes products: we are a team on a mission to help people enjoy the delight of hearing. To enable a life without limitations, we – through our core brands Phonak, Unitron, Hansaton, Advanced Bionics and AudioNova – develop, design, manufacture and distribute solutions that push the limits of technology and redefine the future of our industry. Collectively, we aim to be the most respected hearing care company in the world. <br/><br/> In this role, you will have an opportunity to work with one of our innovative brands including Unitron headquartered right here in Kitchener, with individuals who share deep commitment to help improve the lives of people with hearing loss. Join our mission and become part of our amazing team! <br/><br/> <strong>Role Overview</strong> <br/><br/> In your role as User Experience Designer, you will use your research, design and innovation techniques to refine the Unitron user experience. Working closely with Product Management and Development teams, you will identify opportunities and design solutions that create a seamless and enjoyable experience for Unitron customers. <br/><br/> <strong>The Details:</strong><br/> <div>   <ul>   <li>Work closely with a team of Product Managers and Developers to create an intuitive, cohesive and seamless user experience across the Unitron product ecosystem</li> </ul>   </div> <br/> <div>   <ul>   <li>Collaborate with Product Management to influence product strategy and analyze how new products integrate optimally into the Unitron product ecosystem</li> </ul>   </div> <br/> <div>   <ul>   <li>Work with the Engineering team to ensure technical needs are met while maintaining a strong focus on the user experience</li> </ul>   </div> <br/> <div>   <ul>   <li>Distill complex problems and design simple and enjoyable solutions</li> </ul>   </div> <br/> <div>   <ul>   <li>Ability to influence a cross-functional team to achieve the best UX outcome</li> </ul>   </div> <br/> <div>   <ul>   <li>Partner with the brand team to ensure alignment of visual look and feel of product experience elements with the Unitron brand design values</li> </ul>   </div> <br/> <div>   <ul>   <li>Define, implement and document user experience guidelines</li> </ul>   </div> <br/> <div>   <ul>   <li>Perform other duties as assigned by Manager.</li> </ul>   </div> <br/><strong>The experience you bring:</strong>  <ul>  	<li>Bachelors degree in interaction design or other design related degrees</li> <li>5+ years designing user experiences and interaction design for B2C and B2B product experiences</li> <li>Advocate for UX strategy best practices, principles, and methodology</li> <li>Knowledge of emerging UX strategy trends and tools</li> <li>Creative thinker with an ability to use both data and intuition to inform decisions</li> <li>Able to translate findings into clear guidance for Product Managers and Developers</li> <li>Experience in conceptual development and rapid creative prototyping as well as tactical UI design and implementation.</li>   <li>Superior strategic thinking, influence and leadership skills.</li> <li>Excellent organizational, communication and interpersonal skills</li> </ul> We thank all applicants in advance; however only individuals selected for an interview will be contacted. All applications will be kept confidential. Sonova is an equal opportunity employer. Applicants who require reasonable accommodation to complete the application and/or interview process should notify the Director, Human Resources. <br/><br/> Sonova's hiring practices are aligned with human rights laws, which guarantee every person equal treatment in regard to employment and opportunity for employment, regardless of race, color, creed/religion, sex, sexual orientation, marital status, age, mental or physical disability</div>  <br/>
Title: UX Designer

Job_Description: <strong>Job Description</strong> <br/> IBM Global Business Services: Join a Leader. Consult with us.<div> The UX/UI Designer is responsible for creating best-in-class user experiences and helps provide strategic direction for all aspects of the user experience.</div> <br/> <div>Specifically, the UX/UI Designer will design experiences, from journey maps to screen designs (wireframes, mockups, interactive prototypes, design libraries and patterns, style guide etc.) alongside a team of other high performing design practitioners.</div> <br/> <div>The UI/UX Designer will interface with key stakeholders, including clients, management, and architecture, to iteratively refine and improve designs to create the most appropriate possible user experience. <br/><br/> Additionally, the UI/UX Designer will interface with the development team throughout the development cycle to provide guidance on implementation of the designs and modify designs as requirements change.</div><div>The successful candidate will be able to thrive in an Agile development environment, demonstrating ability to manage both time and scope to fit tasks into quick development iterations.</div>Please provide a portfolio as well as a CV when applying for this vacancy. The portfolio can either be as a file or as a link to an online portfolio <br/><br/> Required Technical and Professional Expertise<br/>  <div> <div>• Understanding of how content, design, user interface and technology work together to create an optimal user experience   <ul> <li>Strong knowledge of user-centered design principles</li> <li>Strong understanding of information architecture, user experience, and/or content strategy</li> <li>Demonstrated ability to do UX/UI work and create solutions based on business strategy and needs</li> <li>Ability to complete assigned work on time and on budget</li> <li>Background in all types of digital experiences, including mobile, tablet and responsive web design</div>  <li>Have experience with design tools such as Sketch, Adobe Experience, inVision, Adobe Illustrator, Adobe Indesign, Justinmind, Axure, OmniGraffle</li>  </div> </li> </ul>  Preferred Tech and Prof Experience <br/><br/> <strong>NA</strong> <br/><br/> EO Statement <br/> IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status. <br/><br/>
Title: User Experience Designer (UI/UX Designer)

Job_Description: SimplyCast.com, a leading provider of interactive marketing software and services for organizations worldwide, is seeking a UX Designer to join its growing team located in Dartmouth, Nova Scotia.<br/><br/>About the Position<br/><br/>Do you have an excellent eye for design? Do you know great web UI when you see it and understand why it is so compelling? If so, we have an exciting career for you. <br/><br/> You need to be a Photoshop ninja, fluent in Illustrator, OmniGraffle, or any other software used to create wireframes. You should have at least a working knowledge of XHTML/CSS and if you can cut up your own comps, even better. <br/><br/> Finally, you should have a solid portfolio of web application designs to showcase. We want to see firsthand that you can build great web interfaces, not just great websites.<br/><br/>Benefits of Joining Team   <ul> <li>An office culture that is one-of-a-kind. A happy team is a hard working team.</li> <li>High focus on the health and wellness of our staff including flexible hours.</li> <li>A unique revenue sharing plan. As the company succeeds, so do you.</li> <li>Competitive salaries and accelerated promotions for those who go above and beyond.</li> <li>Dedication to hiring students and new graduates. It keeps us feeling young.</li> <li>Working in the heart of Silicon Dartmouth. The office is car, bike and bus friendly.</li> <li>A kitchen that is stocked with free coffee, tea and hot chocolate. We also provide snacks.</li> <li>Getting the chance to kick your coworker’s butt in a game of Foosball.</li> <li>A social committee that plans 3-4 fun events every year. Paint ball, BBQs, bowling and rock climbing have been done before.</li> <li>Lunch with the CEO and CEO appreciation days.</li> </ul>  Job Responsibilities   <ul> <li>Be a growth agent.</li> <li>Develop ambitious, dynamic user interfaces in HTML5 that enable our customers to deal with complex data in an intuitive and appealing manner.</li> <li>Analyze functional requirements and specifications in collaboration with Product Management.</li> <li>Contribute to product design and architectural decisions</li> <li>Develop product concepts and suggest product direction based on design research and functional analysis.</li> <li>Partner with engineering on the implementation of interactive techniques and technologies.</li> <li>Conduct U/X research and plan visual design enhancements.</li> <li>Create documentation for architectural, design, implementation and test activities.</li> <li>Follow company policies and marketing procedures effectively.</li> <li>Other duties as assigned.</li> </ul>  Job Requirements   <ul> <li>1+ years experience implementing user interfaces.</li> <li>Strong communication skills; spoken and written English required.</li> <li>Ability to prioritize and accomplish tasks in a fast-paced environment.</li> <li>Positive attitude, confident and competitive.</li> <li>Ability to be flexible and self sufficient.</li> <li>Ability to work well in a team environment.</li> <li>A good sense of humor goes a long way.</li> </ul> <strong>Benefits also include:</strong> Top tier Prescription and Dental coverage. Two weeks vacation and free parking. <br/><br/> SimplyCast is an equal opportunity employer. Our organization values the importance of diversity, fairness and trust.<br/><br/>About SimplyCast<br/><br/>SimplyCast.com is a leading provider of interactive marketing software and services for organizations worldwide. The company’s multi-channel marketing platform is a feature-rich solution used by thousands of customers in over 175 countries, including many of the most recognized brand names around the globe in retail, non-profit and hospitality industries. With thousands of organizations using SimplyCast solutions to automate email, survey, event, voice, SMS, Twitter, fax, Facebook, press release, landing pages and autoresponder marketing needs, they now have the power to effectively reach customers on their preferred mode of communication.
Title: UX Designer

Job_Description: QSi is seeking a hands-on UX/UI Designer & Product Owner who can bring a passion for building great user experiences to help shape the design of our client’s cutting edge big data collection and analytics software. In addition to having an interest in Product Management, the ideal candidate should have 5 years or more of UX/UI design experience in the data visualization/analytics software industry or more generally within the business software market. A strong portfolio demonstrating some of your recent successes including work samples that show your process and a high attention to detail is a must. <br/>  <br/> <strong>Responsibilities</strong>   <ul> <li>UX/UI Design Evangelist working directly with all software development teams to promote good, consistent UX/UI design</li> <li>Product Owner (PO) directly managing the work priorities for one UX/UI-centric software development teams</li> <li>PO part of role includes defining epics for new software features, breaking them down into proper Features and User Stories, and ultimately managing and prioritizing the product backlog for your team</li> <li> Create UX/UI design style guide and establish design best practices</li> <li> Develop storyboards, mock-ups and prototypes to effectively communicate interaction and design ideas</li> <li>Lead the design activities for various UI elements within our product suite</li> <li>Act as the user-advocate during the development process, subjecting early-stage designs to usability testing or expert review, and offering implementation suggestions from a user-centered perspective</li> <li>Understanding and solving functional problems for a variety of data management, visualization and analytics user scenarios</li> <li>Rationalize design decisions to peers and stakeholders</li> </ul>  Desired Skills and Experience   <ul> <li>Undergraduate degree or equivalent certificates in interaction design, product design, graphic design, or another UX design-related field</li> <li>5+ years of UX and UI design for desktop and/or web applications</li> <li>Knowledge of graphic design tools such as Photoshop, Sketch, and Illustrator</li> <li>Expertise with UX tools such as Balsamiq, Axure, Visio, OmniGraffle, UXPin, Justinmind</li> <li>Experience with WPF, XAML, JavaScript, CSS3 and HTML5 is a plus</li> <li>Mobile application design experience on iOS and/or Android is a plus</li> <li>A strong understanding of business and user requirements, and the ability to address and advocate for the end-users experience</li> <li>The ability to successfully manage multiple projects simultaneously, handle a fastpaced work environment, deadlines, and changing priorities</li> <li>Strong knowledge of current industry trends and User Interface common practices</li> <li>Familiarity with Scrum or other agile development processes</li> <li>Strong written and verbal communication skills</li> <li>Strong team player who can work with and support many different software teams</li></ul>
Title: UX/UI Designer & Product Owner

Job_Description: Imagine yourself as part of one of the most <br/> dynamic companies in the healthcare technology industry today! QHR Technologies <br/> is a division of Shoppers Drug Mart, a Loblaw Company. QHR is leading the way <br/> in Canadian healthcare technology, by providing solutions to assist healthcare <br/> professionals enrich their practices and improve the quality of care delivered <br/> to all Canadians across the country. We are looking for talented, inspired, and <br/> motivated people to join our incredible team and experience a workplace culture <br/> that stands above the rest! Competitive salaries and generous perks are just a <br/> few of the reasons that QHR has been voted one of BC's Top Employers and <br/> Canada’s Top Small & Medium Employers for 2017. <br/><br/> <strong>Our <br/> Designers:</strong> <br/><br/> As a <br/> department and company, we look to our designers to use their User Experience <br/> minds to create intuitive, innovative experiences that embrace empathy to help <br/> our user’s day to day. Next, we look to our designers to use their Interaction <br/> Design intuition to envision how people should experience our products and <br/> bring that vision to life in a way that feels inspired and refined. Finally, we <br/> look to our designers to use their Visual Design talent to weave iconography, <br/> typography, color, space, and motion all together to help our users <br/> successfully navigate our products. <br/><br/> As a design <br/> group, we love to service teams and create meaningful experiences that are <br/> intuitive, beautiful, and accessible, bringing real value to real people <br/> throughout a products lifecycle. <br/><br/> <strong>Position Summary:</strong> <br/><br/> QHR is <br/> seeking a Senior UX / UI Designer in Vancouver. We are looking for a design <br/> All-star that can bridge the gap between the design lead and our awesome <br/> designers to help produce outstanding digital products that stand out. If you <br/> aspire to designing digital products like Slack, Asana, Googles Allo, Docs or <br/> Apples Health, Calendar or FaceTime then this job could be for you. This designer will need to have the <br/> experience and the skills to partner with their design lead. and product team <br/> members to help turn the company’s insights into a beautifully designed <br/> product, that would satisfy a premium Canadian employer. <br/><br/> This is an <br/> amazing opportunity for a designer to work from our downtown Vancouver office, <br/> and to be a part of a growing design team that leaves ego at the door. Our <br/> design team has found its self at a fast growing company that truly recognizes <br/> the value that design can bring in creating products that at their heart wants <br/> to make a real difference to its users, from the start of a project, to the end <br/> and beyond! <br/><br/> <strong>About You:</strong>  <ul>   <li>You <br/>  are a Senior UX/UI Design All-star that has a portfolio that stands out!</li> <li>Your <br/>  confidence, experience and capacity allows you to take on products that <br/>  have large market and brand aspirations.</li>   <li>As <br/>  a product designer you have experience at working alongside product <br/>  managers, product owners and business analysts to help bring clarity from <br/>  the products core value proposition to improve the products experience</li> <li>As <br/>  a well-rounded Designer, you love being part of a team that designs in the <br/>  world of responsive design and mobile apps.</li> <li>The <br/>  UX designer in you loves to take on complex tasks and transform them into <br/>  intuitive, accessible, and easy-to-use designs that consider mobile <br/>  standard practices.</li>   <li>The <br/>  UI designer in you loves to bring the designs alive with iconography, <br/>  typography, color, motion, and space to help the users successfully <br/>  navigate our products branded experience.</li> <li>The <br/>  seasoned and commercial designer in you will possess the production skills <br/>  that will support preparing designs for the developers through the build <br/>  process.</li>   <li>As <br/>  you progress through the products design lifecycle you will naturally <br/>  think about how to utilize and evolve the design principles, form, and <br/>  maintain interactive consistency through patterns and a branded style.</li>   <li>You <br/>  have experience at decoding user feedback and insights sessions.</li>   <li>You <br/>  naturally seek satisfaction by hitting deadlines and knowing when to be <br/>  creative and when to be practical. The idea of project momentum should <br/>  resonate with you and you take full ownership of your work.</li>   <li>You <br/>  are up-to-date with the latest design tools that support cleaner work <br/>  flow. Tools such as the Adobe Creative Cloud, Sketch, In-vision, Axure and <br/>  Zeplin.</li>   <li>You <br/>  have experience working in an agile environment, planning, and delivering <br/>  your work in sprint based cycles.</li> <li>You <br/>  have a great attitude that thrives on openness and you’re always open to <br/>  feedback from design leadership, team members and stakeholders.</li> </ul> <strong>Essential Functions:</strong> <ul> <li>Work in sketch to produce concepts, user <br/> journeys, prototypes, screens to create great, human-centered products that put <br/> our users first</li><li>Plan, facilitate and decode user tests and <br/> proactively use these learnings to influence the products design principles and <br/> direct new features and improvements moving forwards</li><li>Present designs to the team and use feedback to <br/> direct design</li><li>Work with business and technology stakeholders to <br/> understand features cost, quality, and time tradeoffs</li><li>Effectively communicate and support the <br/> development team to ensure implementation details are met</li><li>Contribute to an innovative and principled design <br/> culture across the whole product team</li><li>Build strong relationships with internal <br/> stakeholders</li> </ul> <strong>Qualifications:</strong>  <ul>   <li>Proven and relevant 7+ <br/>  year(s) experience as a rounded and robust Senior UX/UI Designer</li>   <li>Experience working in <br/>  corporate environment as well as startups is an asset</li> <li>Experience working <br/>  on lifestyle or health and wellness products is an asset</li>   <li>BA Hons degree in <br/>  design or related Education</li> <li>Outstanding design <br/>  portfolio highlighting your talent on web and mobile including responsive <br/>  design and native apps</li> <li>In-depth responsive <br/>  & native app design experience</li> <li>The ability to think <br/>  outside the box to solve problems. Be the 'eyes of the customer' and <br/>  balance customers' needs with business requirements while considering <br/>  technical constraints</li> <li>Excellent written and <br/>  verbal skills to communicate complex interaction design concepts at all <br/>  levels</li> <li>An individual that is <br/>  both a self-starter and can self-organize</li> <li>An insatiable appetite <br/>  for design and a willingness to learn new skills</li> <li>Ability to work in a fast-paced <br/>  environment</li> <li>Great communication <br/>  skills</li> <li>A love of design and <br/>  design delivery</li>  </ul> Sound <br/> interesting? Ready for the challenge? So, if you believe you have all the <br/> design chops and experience needed, why not consider joining our team to make <br/> the difference! <br/><br/> <strong>Next steps:</strong>  <ul>   <li>Please <br/>  provide a brief explanation in your application of why you are excellent <br/>  for this role, while highlighting your portfolio</li> <li>Please <br/>  provide your portfolio in your application. Give us an introduction to <br/>  some of your best work so we can see what drives your creative thinking</li> </ul>
Title: Senior UX/ UI Product Designer

Job_Description: We're looking for a UX/UI Designer who wants to make a difference. Our client works with numerous public sector (government, education, services) clients and are updating numerous websites to fulfill OADA legislation. <br/><br/> This is a full time open ended contract based in downtown Toronto. Our client looks for an individual who is familiar with accessibility industry knowledge, which will include adaptive technologies, accommodations, and best practices. You'll work either on-site, in office, or occasionally remote. <br/><br/> This is a lead position so you'll likely have 1-2 project direct reports, providing guidance on UI and UX, client presentations, and project delivery within set timelines. <br/><br/> If you're keen to work within the public sector to add to your portfolio, please submit your interest with a link to your digital portfolio. This is an immediate opportunity to start ASAP. Our client is a diverse and inclusive work environment so we encourage all to apply with a valid Canadian work permit and who is a local resident to work on site.
Title: UX Designer

Job_Description: Electronic Arts Inc. is a leading global interactive entertainment software company. EA delivers games, content and online services for Internet-connected consoles, personal computers, mobile phones and tablets. <br/><br/> <strong>Position Overview</strong> <br/><br/> BioWare, a member of the incredible family of EA studios, has created some of the world's best-selling titles (including the Mass Effect ™ and Dragon Age ™ series). <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities:</strong> <ul> <li>Create player-centered designs by considering player motivations, gameplay experiences, user research, and usability findings</li><li>Develop user flows, wireframes, and prototypes to effectively communicate game design requirements</li> <li>Develop and maintain detailed user-interface specifications and design patterns that align with an existing UI design system</li><li>Develop UX requirements with key stakeholders to define design objectives and to align with overarching goals</li><li>Work closely with game designers, UX designers and UI artists to execute design.</li><li>Present design work for review and feedback with ability to go over methods, explorations, and rationale.</li><li>Support your design decisions using data such as player feedback, and user research</li><li>Thrive in a fast paced work environment requiring independent self-direction with an aptitude for team collaboration and open communication</li>  </ul> <strong>Qualifications</strong> <ul> <li>An online portfolio or samples of work demonstrating experience creating great user-centered design solutions</li><li>Examples of wireframes, low to high fidelity prototypes and information architecture mapping</li> <li>Excellent communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills.</li><li>Ability to have a bias for action in a fast-paced, sometimes ambiguous environment with multiple stakeholders and / or conflicting needs</li> <li>Highly motivated self-starter; capable of operating with minimal management oversight.</li> <li>Knowledge of usability principles and techniques</li> <li>Working to a degree in Interaction Design, Psychology, Human Factors, Industrial Engineering or related HCI discipline, or demonstrated proficiency and experiences in the field of software user experience/interaction design.</li> <li>Proficiency in a variety of design tools such as Illustrator, Photoshop, Axure (or other flow + prototyping tools)</li><li>Experience in game development is a strong asset</li> <li>Passion for gaming</li> </ul> <br/><br/> <strong>About EA</strong> <br/><br/> It’s not easy building the world’s best digital playground. It’s hair-standing-up-on-end-exhilarating. It’s down-in-the-trenches-challenging. Its stroke-of-brilliance-at-midnight creative. It’s you—taking risks, challenging yourself, pursuing ideas, changing the way millions of people do something they love: Play. We’re EA—we’ve been making games for decades but you wouldn’t know that walking through our studios. We’re still buzzing with the same innovative spirit we began with, though we’ve learned enough to earn our rank as a leading developer, publisher and distributor of the world’s best games. What began as a small group of people determined to “put real life in a box” has become an 8,000-people strong, worldwide organization delivering on that very dream. If you’ve played The Sims lately, you know exactly what we mean. And if you’ve played Battlefield 1, maybe you’d say that we’ve done real life one better. <br/><br/> Whether you’re building Springfield on your mobile or your palms are sweaty from clutching your controller during intense games of FIFA 17, chances are you’ve played an EA game. And if you haven’t, well, what are you waiting for? In an industry that’s changing every day—whether it’s through new social channels, advancing technology, new audiences or unique opportunities for monetization—EA is positioned for growth thanks to smart business plans, strategic acquisitions, and most importantly, our creative people around the world who gather each day to unite the world through play. We take that last part very seriously, so if what you’re reading excites you as much as it does us, we invite you to get to know us better.
Title: Associate UX Designer co-op

Job_Description: <div>RealDecoy is seeking a UX/UI Strategist to join our Digital Services team. The successful candidate will work on production as a senior member of multiple project teams and will also collaborate with the Director of Digital at RealDecoy to define and grow the UX/UI practice.</div>  <br/> <strong><div>Specific responsibilities will include:</div> <br/> </strong>  <li>Leading customer strategy sessions, working directly with them to understand their business and how RealDecoy can design complete experiences to help them achieve the outcomes they want and need from their website or digital product experience.</li> <li>Production of taxonomies, sitemaps, wireframes, screen flows, content inventories/analyses, value propositions, user stories, journey maps (etc), either working independently or through delegating to a more junior team member and supervising to completion.</li> <li>Participation to various degrees in projects across all of RealDecoys service offerings, including but not limited to: Digital Marketing, Analytics, Custom Product Development, Web/CMS, Site Search and Conversion Rate Optimization</li> <li>Constant collaboration with members of RealDecoys Digital Services, Project Management and Engineering teams on project lifecycles that can range from a few days to more than one year.</li> <li>Working with Marketing, Sales and Account Management as a contributor to business development activities such as pitches, pre-sales calls and effort estimations.</li>  <br/> <div>RealDecoy is committed to inclusive, barrier-free recruitment processes and work environments. If contacted regarding this position, please advise us in a timely fashion, of any accommodation assistance you require to be assessed in a fair and equitable manner. Information received relating to accommodation measures will be addressed confidentially. We are an equal opportunity employer and encourage applications from women, members of a visible minority group, Aboriginal people and persons with disabilities</div>Your Personality:  <ul> <li>RealDecoy provides a dynamic, multi-project work environment for a broad base of customers across multiple different technologies and markets. The pace can be fast and our projects usually bring all sorts of novel challenges.</li> <li>	Youre a UX/UI professional with a strong grasp of the tools of your trade, but you have the adaptability and judgement to know how to tailor your approach to the needs of the project. Youre not a one-size-fits-all kind of person.</li><li>	You have a lot of real-word knowledge in general and with the Web and technology in particular: You find it easy to learn a new customers business, market and challenges and produce a cohesive and workable vision that you can articulate to the customer and to the project team</li> <li>	Youre comfortable providing mentoring and thought leadership to your colleagues, but youre willing to learn too.</li> <li>	Youre serious about your work but you dont take yourself too seriously. Youre aware of how you affect your colleagues and customers at all times.</li> <li>	The goal means more to you than the process.</li>  </ul>  <strong>Your Background, Skills and Experience:</strong>  <ul> <li>4+ years of professional UX/UI experience, with a strong focus on designing complex solutions for complete digital environments</li><li>Several years experience working directly with clients to translate their wants and needs into a cohesive vision (e.g. JAD sessions, collaboration meetings, etc)</li> <li>Demonstrable experience in delivering experiences youve designed to a real-world production environment</li><li>Experience in a mentorship, supervisory or managerial position with other team members in your fields</li><li>College or University degree in a relevant discipline (e.g. Degree or diploma in UX/UI, Design, HCI etc, OR related experience preferred);</li><li>Experience with prototyping and wireframing tools (InVision, Justinmind or UXPin, Adobe photoshop etc)</li><li>Several years experience in a multi-project environment.</li><li>Solid understanding of Web trends and concepts (e.g. SEO, analytics, best practices in design, layout and navigation) and how these are inter-related in a real-world Web setting</li><li>Basic knowledge of HTML, CSS and JavaScript is an asset but not required. This is not a development position.</li> </ul>  <div>Thats you, we hopecoming here as RealDecoys newest UX/UI Strategist</div><div>(Or, if you know someone you think would be ideal for this positioneven better suited than you aredo them a favour and tell them about this opportunity).</div><div>Send us your résumé, accompanied by a thoughtfully written cover letter to careers@realdecoy.com</div><br/> <div>If you have that star quality were looking for, well be in touch!</div><br/> <div>Deadline: April 30, 2018</div><br/>
Title: UX/UI Strategist

Job_Description: We are now seeking for a highly motivated Senior Designer, who is experienced in building corporate brand visual identity system(VIS) and proficient in UX/UI design, to join our team in Burnaby branch office. Please kindly provide a link to your online portfolio when you submit the application.
Title: Senior Designer (Branding, UI/UX

Job_Description: <div><div><div><div><div>Beenox is a video game development studio created in 2000. Located in beautiful Quebec City, Canada, Beenox is a wholly owned subsidiary of Activision Publishing Inc., one of the world’s top game developers. <br/><br/> The studio is proud to contribute to the development of the Call of Duty video game franchise. Beenox has also contributed to the resounding success of the Skylanders, Spider-Man, and Guitar Hero franchises. <br/><br/> As members of the Beenox family, we feel as if we’re part of a group of like-minded people who are great to work with. Our studio is a real open world where it’s easy to have discussions with everyone, including our studio co-heads. Here everyone brings their own unique touch to projects that showcase their talent on a global stage. <br/><br/> You could say that video games are in our blood!<br/> <div></div> <br/> <div><strong>HERE'S WHAT AWAITS YOU IN THIS JOB:</strong></div> <br/> <div></div> <br/>As a UX Designer, you’ll be asked to contribute to the creation of a top-quality user experience for our players. You will achieve this objective by promoting an approach centered around the user, based on human psychology principles user observations (user tests) and graphic design guidelines. <br/><br/> You’ll have to ensure that the experience and immersion of the user are aligned with the game design intents. Plus, you’ll oversee the identification of potentials friction points related to ergonomics or player communication, both from a visual and functional standpoint. You will be responsible for coming up with potential solutions to those issues.<br/>  <div><u>You’ll need to:</u></div> <br/>• Analyze the game’s UI/UX needs based on the type of user, game direction, market trends and industry standards and adapt it to find the right balance between innovation and conventions; <br/><br/> • Develop various game UI elements (HUDs, tutorials, menus…) while working closely with the UI and Design teams; <br/><br/> • Design the structure and user flow of interface elements while ensuring a good information hierarchy and a quality player communication; <br/><br/> • Document systems related to interfaces and user experience (UX) for the development team by creating flowcharts and wireframes; <br/><br/> • Work closely with Game Designers to complement the documentation of Game Design features and get a good understanding of the design intentions for the UI and player communication; <br/><br/> • Test various possible options of game UI elements by creating functional prototypes; <br/><br/> • Contribute to implementing and integrating in-game UI; <br/><br/> • Work closely with UI Designers and Programmers to ensure the quality of the product; <br/><br/> • Act as a leader regarding User Experience issues to the rest of the team; <br/><br/> • Participate actively in build reviews and iterate quickly based on the team’s feedback. <br/><br/> <strong>YOU ARE:</strong> <br/><br/> • <strong>Experienced:</strong> You have at least three (3) years of experience working in a video game studio or the equivalent, as a UX Designer, Game Designer, UI Designer or equivalent. You have experience in AAA or FPS development (asset). <br/><br/> • <strong>Competent:</strong> You know the video game development pipeline plus you are efficient and work meticulously. You have a great understanding of the technical constraints of game development (including game engines and game editors); <br/><br/> • <strong>Expert:</strong> You have a solid background in interactivity and User-centered interface design. You own complex tasks and ensure that you deliver quality. You also have a good understanding of human psychology principles and how they apply to UX game design (asset); <br/><br/> • <strong>Informed</strong>: You‘ve kept up with the latest innovations in UX and you make it your business to stay up to date. You also are more than aware of the latest gaming trends. You follow the Call of Duty series closely and you understand its essence (asset); <br/><br/> • <strong>Versatile:</strong> You’re proficient with prototyping and rapid iterations based on feedback. You are especially at ease with Photoshop, Visio and other flowcharts, wireframes and functional mockups software. Photoshop and Substance Painter. You also have basic skills in scripting or programming (asset). <br/><br/> • <strong>Team player:</strong> You like to work in in collaboration with a multidisciplinary team. You communicate effectively with people of various backgrounds – both in English and French. <br/><br/> • <strong>Resourceful:</strong> You’re keen to learn how to use new internal tools and you don’t get discouraged when faced with regular change.</div> </div>  </div>  </div> </div> <br/>
Title: UX Designer

Job_Description: Unito.io is a work collaboration tool based in Montreal and one of BetaKit's top startups to watch in 2018. Were a VC-backed SaaS company that makes people happier, organizations more productive, and software more powerful, all over the world. <br/><br/> We are looking for someone who ...<br/><br/>What you will do:  <ul> <li>Design and improve the UX of Unitos app.</li><li>Translate concepts into wireframes and mockups that lead to intuitive user experiences.</li><li>Research, wireframe, prototype and mock up user experiences, using feedback to iterate and improve on them as you go.</li><li>Identify design problems and devise elegant solutions.</li><li>Make strategic design and user-experience decisions related to core and new functions and features.</li><li>Collaborate with other team members and stakeholders.</li><li>Take smart risks and champion new ideas.</li><li>Understand key features by interviewing stakeholders & prepare a UX wireframe before kickoff meetings to help anchor team discussions.</li><li>Incorporate user research and usability testing to iterate on product solutions.</li><li>Lead and participate in concept sessions leveraging ethnographic research and design thinking.</li><li>Balance customer frictions and needs with our clients business goals, market viability and technical feasibility.</li><li>Proven experience delivering concepts, personas, user journeys, storyboards, user flows, wireframes, prototypes, etc.</li><li>Partner with engineering to ensure designs are properly implemented.</li> </ul>  <strong>Requirements</strong>  <ul> <li>2+ years' experience of working on a UX Designer, UI Designer or other relevant position.</li><li>Have experience with UX on enterprise software.</li><li>Analyze and meet product specifications and user expectations.</li><li>Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with business-oriented approach.</li><li>Significant experience with design software and a solid portfolio of design projects.</li><li>Strong communication skills.</li> </ul>  It'd be nice if you  <ul> <li>Have a good knowledge of HTML/CSS.</li><li>Know React and Javascript.</li><li>Have experience in project management and research will be a bonus.</li> </ul>  Who we are<br/><br/>Unito is a fast-growing startup and winner of Founder Institute's Best Startup in Canada in 2017. If youre looking to build something youll be proud of and help shape the company, then youll fit right in! <br/><br/> Were taking on a major problem that people are passionate about solving: we make it easier to collaborate across teams. We don't make users learn new tools and change the way they work. By connecting work management tools, we allow managers, cross-functional teams, departments, and entire companies to benefit from seamless collaboration and improved communication. We sync projects across a number of tools, but our main focus is on Trello, Asana, JIRA, GitHub, and Wrike. This is a hard problem of semantics, synchronization, and APIs. <br/><br/> Our software is changing the collaborative work landscape and is the only software of its kind on the market. We pride ourselves in having one of the most talented and motivated teams in town. Weve acquired tens thousands of trial users, hundreds of paying customers, hired 16 people, and connected 9 different applications together. Were on a mission to change how collaboration works between teams for almost any company in the world, and weve shown so far that weve got what it takes to succeed.<br/><br/>Benefits  <ul> <li>Flexible work hours (many of us have kids, we know what its like...)</li><li>Group benefits plan</li><li>Convenient downtown location (Place Ville Marie)</li><li>Free coffee, tea, beer, and fruit-infused water</li><li>Gorgeous office space with common areas and kitchen</li><li>Wellness spending budget for self-improvement purposes</li> </ul>  Culture:<br/><br/>Our team is a family of humble and hungry individuals, varying in age, cultures, and backgrounds. We prefer to focus more on the quality of our work, and less on things like policies or rules. We trust our team and encourage them to make independent decisions, ask questions, share ideas, and voice opinions. Everyone's voice is heard. <br/><br/> Here at Unito, were huge on transparency, honesty, and execution. We have no tolerance for politics, and value flexibility, autonomy, fairness, and respect. We share achievements, and learn from failures together as a team. <br/><br/> Our team operates through areas of of responsibility, with no official job titles and a flat org chart. We like to joke that we don't have an open door policy because we don't even have doors. We are inclusive and welcoming, and dedicated to building a team of high performers. We want every employee to maximize his or her potential, learn, and grow within the company. <br/><br/> If this position sounds like a good fit, wed love to hear from you!
Title: UX Designer

Job_Description: About the UX Designer position<br/><br/>We are looking for a skilled UX Designer who will design our mobile applications and platforms to help meet our customers' needs. You will make our product more user-friendly and intuitive to attract and retain customers, by combining interfaces and workflows to enhance user experience. <br/><br/> A successful candidate should be an analytical and creative designer who is able to grasp user needs and solve problems. We also expect you to have strong portfolio of successful UX and other technical projects.<br/><br/>UX Designer responsibilities are:   <ul>    <li>Analyze and meet product specifications and user expectations</li>  <li>Perform concept and usability testing and gather feedback</li>  <li>Use special personas based on user research results</li>  <li>Create right interaction models and evaluate their success</li>  <li>Build wireframes and prototypes around customer needs</li>  <li>Solve UX problems, such as usability or findability, using creative approach</li>  <li>Collaborate with UI designers to implement attractive designs</li>  <li>Discuss design ideas and prototypes with developers</li>  <li>Stay informed about competitor products and industry trends</li>  </ul>  <br/> <strong>UX Designer requirements are:</strong>   <ul>    <li>2+ years' experience of working on a UX Designer, UI Designer or other relevant position</li>  <li>Significant experience with design software and a solid portfolio of design projects</li>  <li>Excellent knowledge of interaction design and information architecture</li>  <li>Good knowledge of Android and iOS Material Design</li>  <li>Experience in project management and research will be a bonus</li>  <li>Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with business-oriented approach</li>  <li>Strong communication skills</li>  <li>BSc in Design, Computer Science, Engineering or other related area</li> </ul>  <br/>
Title: UX Designer

Job_Description: Résumé et responsabilités du posteQui est notre client: <div>Crée depuis plus de 10 ans notre client fait partie des PME très bien établie Montréal. Leurs clients sont des entreprises renommés pour lesquels ils créent des expériences numériques créatives et intelligentes.
