Leur bureaux splendides sont au coeur du Vieux Montréal et lambiance est très casual.</div>Quel est le rôle:<br/><br/>Notre client recrute actuellement un designer UX expérimenté et créatif. Il validera le travail réalisé par les designers et guidera leurs décisions reliées au design des applications. Il sinvestira dans la mise en place de meilleures pratiques et procédures de travail au sein de son équipe. Il participera de façon proactive la création de contenu haut niveau.<br/><br/>Les tâches:  <ul> <li>Travailler en collaboration avec les gestionnaires de produits, les clients et les développeurs afin de cerner les besoins, organiser les contenus et déterminer les fonctionnalités des applications mobiles ;</li><li>Participer lanalyse des projets, la conception et au design dapplications mobiles et de site web ;</li><li>Conduire les séances de collecte dexigences avec les producteur numérique et/ou client ;</li><li>Intervenir dun point de vue graphique et ergonomique au niveau de lexpérience utilisateur (UX) ;</li><li>Concevoir des interfaces qui répondent aux objectifs des clients et aux meilleures règles dutilisabilité ;</li><li>Détailler les solutions proposées laide de wireframes, sommaires de navigation et prototypes ;</li><li>Contribuer au développement de modèles de contenus, de nomenclature et de taxonomie ;</li><li>Représenter la voix de lutilisateur pendant le cycle de développement de lapplication.</li> </ul>  <strong>ConditionsQuels sont les requis:</strong>  <ul> <li>Capacité créer les designs qui feront la différence auprès du client;</li><li>Expérience dau moins (5) ans en projets interactifs, allant de larchitecture dinformation lanalyse de scénarios dutilisabilité, wireframing et prototypage;</li><li>Expérience dau moins (2) ans dans lindustrie mobile;</li><li>Expérience en réalisation de diagrammes, wireframes, task flows, user flows et process flows (UX);</li><li>Expertise avec le logiciel Axure et autres logiciels de prototypage ;</li><li>Habileté vulgariser des requis complexes en solutions de design simples, innovantes et élégantes;</li><li>Capacité générer les visions densemble des phases précoces de conception dexpérience utilisateurs ;</li><li>Connaissance des lignes directrices et les conventions typiques pour iPhone, Android et web ;</li><li>Une bonne connaissance du design dinterface usager (UI) et de solides compétences en utilisabilité / expérience usager (UX);</li><li>Talent pour convaincre, influencer et guider les clients internes et externes ;</li><li>Excellente maîtrise de la langue anglaise et de la langue française ;</li><li>Une expérience de travail avec la méthodologie Agile/Scrum est aussi un atout.</li> </ul>  Avantages <br/> <div><strong>Les avantages:</strong></div><div>  <ul> <li>Salaire concurrentiel en fonction de lexpérience</li><li>Horaire flexible</li><li>Assurances collectives</li><li>Environnement de travail idéal qui conjugue vie professionnelle et vie personnelle</li><li>Ambiance décontractée, familiale qui allie plaisir et travail</li><li>Accès facile en transport en commun</li></ul></div>  <br/>
Title: designer UX

Job_Description: Electronic Arts Inc. is a leading global interactive entertainment software company. EA delivers games, content and online services for Internet-connected consoles, personal computers, mobile phones and tablets. <br/><br/> <strong>We are EA</strong> <br/> And we make games – how cool is that? In fact, we entertain millions of people across the globe with the most amazing and immersive interactive software in the industry. But making games is hard work. That’s why we employ the most creative, passionate people in the industry. <br/><br/> The EA Sports NHL series is a critically acclaimed sports video game franchise that has received numerous accolades over the past 20 years. The team is comprised of passionate, talented people that strive to create and deliver the most realistic simulation hockey experience available on the market today. <br/><br/> <strong>The Role: Lead UI Engineer</strong> <br/> The UI Engineer is a critical part of the game creation process. They are involved in architectural design, implementation, and debugging of UI features in partnership with Designers, Artists and other Engineers to solve complex problems. The successful candidate will need excellent leadership skills, as well as the ability to work with large and distributed teams. <br/><br/> <strong>Key Responsibilities</strong>   <ul> <li>Bring the vision of the UI Artist/Designer to life</li> <li>Design, author, maintain and document UI systems that meet all design, technical and schedule requirements</li> <li>Collaborate with technical leadership and other engineers to help establish overall technical design and architecture</li> <li>Collaborate with designers and content creators to brainstorm solutions that satisfy design and content requirements</li> <li>Troubleshoot any UI issues.</li> <li>Profile and optimize UI performances</li> <li>Work closely with the production staff in building and maintaining realistic schedules and identifying dependencies;</li> <li>Coordinate with QA and leads to ensure successful roll out of new features to the team and establish testing and maintenance of systems</li> <li>Collaborate with other disciplines (art, design, sound) in implementing the UI</li> <li>Identify technical and environmental risks/obstacles and generate solutions to overcome identified risks</li> <li>Work alongside QA and the UI Artist/Designer to react to feedback from focus groups and usability studies</li> </ul>  <strong>Required Technical Skills and Experience</strong>   <ul> <li>Bachelor’s degree in computer science or related field, or equivalent training and professional experience</li> <li>Proficiency with C++</li> <li>Experience in object-oriented design and implementation</li> <li>Experience developing complex UI systems for a published game.</li> <li>Experience with the release process including working on systems related to localization, certification and asset management.</li> <li>Demonstrated knowledge of good software programming practices</li> <li>Excellent detail-oriented, problem solving skills – must be able to quickly identify issues and resolve them</li> </ul>  <strong>Preferred Skills and Experience:</strong>   <ul> <li>The ideal candidate has designed and implemented major UI systems for at least one published video game title; and has a minimum of three years of technical experience in the video game or related industry</li> <li>Experience working with Flash based UI middleware, like Scaleform or GameSWF</li> <li>Experience with scripting languages (Perl, Python, Lua, Ruby) and interpreted languages (C#, Java)</li> <li>Avid gamer with a passion for creating top-quality games</li> <li>Understanding of UI ergonomics and how to make an interface intuitive.</li> </ul>  <strong>Performance Competencies (Non-Technical Skills)</strong>   <ul> <li>Excellent verbal and written communication skills</li> <li>Excellent decision-making capabilities</li> <li>Ability and desire to work with other game developers in a cooperative team environment</li> <li>Ability to quickly learn and apply new concepts, principles and solutions</li>  <strong><li>Demonstrates dependability and commitment to projects/tasks <br/><br/> <strong>Benefits:</li> </ul>  </strong> <br/> We are proud of the great perks we offer like comprehensive health and benefit packages, tuition reimbursement, pension with company match and, of course, free video games. We offer competitive compensation packages and a culture that thrives on creativity and individuality. <br/><br/> <strong>We Thought You Might Also Want to Know:</strong> <br/> More about our location: http://careers.ea.com/our-locations/burnaby-eav <br/> Contact me: Jesenka Duranovic, Senior Recruiter; jduranovic@ea.com
Title: NHL - Lead UI Engineer

Job_Description: UX Designer <br/><br/> Tribal Worldwide is a global creative agency, drawing on its expertise in digital innovation as well as its heritage of creativity and insights to craft effective marketing solutions that connect brands to people. <br/><br/> We are looking for a talented mid-level UX Designer to create clean, thoughtful and strategically sound user experiences within, but not limited to the digital and mobile space. The ideal candidate should have an eye for clean and artful design, possess superior UI skills and be able to translate high-level requirements into interaction flows and artifacts, and transform them into beautiful, intuitive, and functional user interfaces. <br/><br/> Responsibilities: <ul> <li>Ability to collaborate with both Brand strategy and Creative leads to define and implement innovative solutions for the product direction, visuals and experience.</li><li>Execute all visual design stages from concept to final hand-off to engineering</li><li>Conceptualize original ideas that bring simplicity and user friendliness to complex design roadblocks.</li><li>Create wireframes, storyboards, user flows, process flows and site maps to effectively communicate interaction and design ideas</li><li>Present and defend designs and key milestone deliverables to peers</li><li>Conduct user research and evaluate user feedback</li><li>Follow design guidelines, best practices and usability standards.</li><li>Candidate will report to the Creative Director of Experience</li>  </ul> Requirements <ul> <li>Minimum 3+ years of UI experience</li><li>Demonstrable UI design skills with a strong portfolio</li><li>Solid experience in creating wireframes, storyboards, user flows, process flows and site maps</li><li>Proficiency in Sketch, InVision, Adobe Suite</li><li>Excellent visual design skills with sensitivity to user-system interaction</li><li>Ability to present your designs and sell your solutions to various stakeholders</li><li>Ability to solve problems creatively and effectively</li><li>Up-to-date with the latest UI trends, techniques, and technologies</li><li>Experience working in an Agile/Scrum development process</li> </ul> We appreciate all expressed interest in this position, however, only the candidates selected for interview will be contacted. <br/><br/> Tribal Worldwide is an inclusive, equal opportunity employer that values diversity. We also offer reasonable accommodations to applicants with disabilities. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, please let us know when you submit your application.
Title: UX Designer

Job_Description: Graphic & Web Designer <br/><br/> MONEXgroup is seeking a Graphic & Web Designer in Toronto, ON <br/><br/> <strong>ABOUT MONEXgroup:</strong> <br/><br/> Established in 2001, MONEXgroup is a privately owned leading national independent Payment Processing provider located in North York, ON, directly on the subway line and close to the 401. MONEXgroup offers various payment acceptance platforms including e-Commerce, integrated, countertop, wireless & mobile, virtual, unattended and contactless only. <br/><br/> <strong>ROLE:</strong> <br/><br/> We are looking for an exceptionally talented and versatile Senior Graphic & Website Designer. You have a strong print and digital design portfolio, which demonstrates a powerful creative edge. A self-motivated person, you can comfortably manage several projects with conflicting priorities within a deadline-driven environment without compromising quality. Furthermore, you are a design jack-of-all-trades, with a combination of extensive corporate-level graphic design experience and proven web design abilities. You are highly creative, yet detail-oriented. Reporting to the Marketing Manager, the Designer is a team player who works well with others and is skilled in matching strategic direction with fantastic design results for all print and web-based initiatives. Additionally, you are someone who welcomes constructive criticism and channels it into better results. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities:</strong>  <ul>  	<li>Develop and maintain brand standards and guidelines</li>   <li>Build and execute marketing communications and creative for all channels, including emails, blogs, and social media</li>  <li>Create ads for online advertising campaigns; including several dimensions of static display and animated ads</li>  <li>Lead all print production projects, including die-cut flyers, brochures, large format displays, and product decals</li>  <li>Develop creative to support content for entire website, including home page sliders and lead generation form pages</li>  <li>Create and implement front-end web code and designs</li>  <li>Proactively present new and innovative ideas on messaging and creative, with an eye toward test & learn quick (A/B, multivariate), to improve ad response, social media engagement, and web experience, among other objectives</li>  <li>Ensure all digital assets reflect Search Engine Optimization (SEO) and lead generation best practice</li>  <li>Supervise interns, in conjunction with the Marketing Manager</li> </ul> <strong>Requirements:</strong>  <ul>  	<li>Well-versed in Adobe Creative Suite - InDesign, Photoshop, Illustrator, Dreamweaver</li>  <li>Min 3-5 years of graphic design and page-layout experience, video editing experience an asset</li>  <li>Proficient in HTML5 and CSS; other coding abilities such as JavaScript, PHP, and JQuery experience a plus</li>  <li>Experience working with CMS platforms, ideally WordPress</li>   <li>Cross-browser and mobile platform compatibility and responsive design experience</li>   <li>Strong working knowledge of digital marketing, including social media and SEO</li>   <li>Experience developing and maintaining brand standards and guidelines</li>  <li>Familiarity with marketing automation platforms, preferably HubSpot</li>   <li>Ability to create animated designs and ads through software, ideally Flexitive</li>   <li>Stays up-to-date with the latest trends and best practices in graphics, User Interface (UI), web marketing, and SEO</li>  <li>Thorough knowledge and experience in design and execution of print production; including digital, offset, die-cut, large format, and variable printing; ability to prepare pre-press print-ready files a must</li>  <li>Experience working directly with print vendors</li>  <li>Self-starter who takes initiative and can organize several simultaneous projects with competing priorities</li>  <li>Superior project management skills</li>  <li>Super creative, yet highly detailed-oriented and organized</li>  <li>Strong communicator who can present their ideas articulately and comfortable working with all levels of organization</li>  <li>Degree or Diploma in Graphic Design or similar</li>  </ul>
Title: Graphic & Web Designer

Job_Description: <p>At Intrigue Media, we believe that we need to build an organization full of people that want to strive to be their best and strive for excellence.</p> <p>Our team is expected to grow every day, every week, every month, and every year. We know that the only way that we will prosper in today's marketplace is by having people that believe in themselves, their team, and their organization. The way for us to do that is to grow as individuals and grow as leaders.</p> <p>We are not a faceless marketing agency for brands. We are a group of professionals focused on helping owners; people who have built businesses that need help getting the word out to find the right customers and the right team. We don't work with corporate budgets, we work with people's money. We are here to provide value and an honest environment to build trusted partnerships with our clients. We are designing a company to help thousands of leaders and we need leaders inside our four walls to help pave the way to making this a reality.</p> <p>This means that we need everyone to be a leader themselves. Only when each team member is a leader in their own right, are we able to lead ourselves, our clients, and our communities.</p> <p>This is not an easy process. This means that we all must read great books written by great people. This means that we push ourselves outside of our comfort zone on a regular basis. This means that we do what we are afraid of. This means that we fall down, we fail, and we pick ourselves up and move forward, growing along the way.</p> <p>If you want to experience what it's like to be a part of our team, we invite you to reach out to us and start a conversation.</p> <p>If you want to be a part of our team, you must consider the following:</p> <ol> <li>Am I willing to put in the effort to grow every day?</li> <li>Am I willing to study every week?</li> <li>Am I willing to purposefully put myself into uncomfortable situations?</li> <li>Do I have what it takes to better myself and work hard to do so?</li> <li>Am I willing to put in the long hours to learn my craft and become a leader in my own right?</li> </ol> <p>Our environment is professional, it is respectful, and it is disciplined. We also like to have fun. Life is too short not to have fun along the way. We have a work hard, play hard philosophy, and we focus on results.Our goal is to develop leaders. This is not an easy task. Are you up for it?</p> <p><strong>UX/UI Developer</strong></p> <p>We'll look to you to provide leadership and expertise in all areas of design and development.</p> <p>Core Responsibilities:</p> <p>You will be working collaboratively with our designers and developers to create seamless user experiences. You will be responsible for prototyping and building cross browser user interfaces with a creative flair for web design.</p> <ul> <li>Lead UX and design projects</li> <li>Work directly with our developers, giving them specs and assets</li> <li>Lead the development team on creating and reviewing wireframes and mockups that offer intuitive user experiences</li> <li>Formulate elegant solutions for design problems, working within brand guidelines</li> </ul> <ul> <li>Work closely with other members of the Intrigue Media team and provide thought leadership, strategic insight, and clear communication (written and verbal) to exceed KPIs and hit deadlines.</li> </ul> <p>Required Skills & Experience:</p> <ul> <li>2+ years of experience as a UX/UI Developer</li> <li>Exceptional knowledge of of UX/UI best practices</li> <li>Proven experience designing complex solutions for complete digital environments</li> <li>Passion for details and providing highly-polished, seamless user experiences under tight timelines, going beyond the research to find what actually delivers results for our clients</li> <li>Proficiency in Photoshop, Illustrator, Sketch, and InVision</li> <li>Processing</li> <li>Basic HTML/CSS</li> <li>Basic JavaScript</li> <li>Strong communication skills</li> <li>Experience communicating ideas to clients on a regular basis</li> </ul>
Title: UX/UI Developer

Job_Description: We are looking for a senior interactive designer for major international projects. The person we are looking for must really have a natural talent and a shining portfolio in the interactive environment, as our accomplishments go through mobile apps, websites and other connected interactions. <br/><br/> <strong>WHAT WE WILL CONFIRM YOU</strong> <br/><br/> Under the supervision of the creative director, you will collaborate with designers, project managers and developers. <br/> You will have to develop concepts and designs for different interfaces and / or interactive environments. <br/> Participate in generating concrete creative ideas related to the project objectives. <br/> Perform all stages of visual design, from the initial concept to the quality of the finished product. <br/><br/> <strong>YOU HAVE At least 5 years of experience</strong> <br/><br/> A diversified portfolio that demonstrates your digital expertise. <br/> A great ability to visually concretize an idea, a message or a narrative scheme. <br/> An excellent knowledge of Adobe's creative suite. <br/> Recognized skills for collaboration and brainstorming. <br/> Knowledge of the principles of usability. <br/> Experience in mobile application design (an asset). <br/> A very good knowledge of French and good communication skills in English. <br/> You are capable of versatility and autonomy. <br/> You must be on the lookout for trends and very curious. <br/> You have developed a great strength in photographic composition. <br/> You consider yourself fast and efficient. <br/><br/> <strong>What we’ll empower you with:</strong>  <ul> <li>Research, design, and prototype new user interface designs based on product requirements.</li> <li>Deliverables include design mockups, prototyping, production of visual assets, and documentation required for proper implementation.</li> <li>Collaborate with designers, product management and developers to define and implement innovative solutions.</li> <li>Execute all visual design stages from concept to final hand-off. Conceptualize original ideas that bring simplicity and user friendliness to complex UI design roadblocks.</li> <li>Create wireframes, storyboards, user journey maps and process flows to effectively communicate interaction and design ideas.</li> <li>Establish and promote design guidelines, best practices and standards.</li> </ul> <strong>Why we are a fantastic 360° digital agency:</strong>  <ul> <li>Yes, we offer breakfast, flexible schedules, beer on Friday and reimbursement of gym fees. And yes, you can come to work in shorts, sandals ... even crocs if you wish.</li> <li>In addition, our team is made up of enthusiastic people ready to help you push your limits.</li> <li>We work with prestigious clients from different industries, ensuring that you constantly act according to various mandates.</li> <li>You will have access to expertise and very advanced technology through our partnerships and in-house developed tools.</li> </ul>  <div><div><div></div><div><div><div><div><div>nventive <br/> 215 rue Saint-Jacques, bureau 500 <br/> Montréal, QC <br/> H2Y 1M6</div></div></div></div></div></div><div><div><div>+-</div></div><div><div>Leaflet | Map data © OpenStreetMap contributors</div></div></div></div>
Title: Senior UI Designer

Job_Description: Electronic Arts Inc. is a leading global interactive entertainment software company. EA delivers games, content and online services for Internet-connected consoles, personal computers, mobile phones and tablets. <br/><br/> <strong>Position Overview</strong> <br/><br/> BioWare, a member of the incredible family of EA studios, has created some of the world's best-selling titles (including the Mass Effect ™ and Dragon Age ™ series). <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities:</strong> <ul> <li>Create player-centered designs by considering player motivations, gameplay experiences, user research, and usability findings</li><li>Develop user flows, wireframes, and prototypes to effectively communicate game design requirements</li> <li>Develop and maintain detailed user-interface specifications and design patterns that align with an existing UI design system</li><li>Develop UX requirements with key stakeholders to define design objectives and to align with overarching goals</li><li>Work closely with game designers, UX designers and UI artists to execute design.</li><li>Present design work for review and feedback with ability to go over methods, explorations, and rationale.</li><li>Support your design decisions using data such as player feedback, and user research</li><li>Thrive in a fast paced work environment requiring independent self-direction with an aptitude for team collaboration and open communication</li>  </ul> <strong>Qualifications</strong> <ul> <li>An online portfolio or samples of work demonstrating experience creating great user-centered design solutions</li><li>Examples of wireframes, low to high fidelity prototypes and information architecture mapping</li> <li>Excellent communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills.</li><li>Ability to have a bias for action in a fast-paced, sometimes ambiguous environment with multiple stakeholders and / or conflicting needs</li> <li>Highly motivated self-starter; capable of operating with minimal management oversight.</li> <li>Knowledge of usability principles and techniques</li> <li>Working to a degree in Interaction Design, Psychology, Human Factors, Industrial Engineering or related HCI discipline, or demonstrated proficiency and experiences in the field of software user experience/interaction design.</li> <li>Proficiency in a variety of design tools such as Illustrator, Photoshop, Axure (or other flow + prototyping tools)</li><li>Experience in game development is a strong asset</li> <li>Passion for gaming</li> </ul> <br/><br/> <strong>About EA</strong> <br/><br/> It’s not easy building the world’s best digital playground. It’s hair-standing-up-on-end-exhilarating. It’s down-in-the-trenches-challenging. Its stroke-of-brilliance-at-midnight creative. It’s you—taking risks, challenging yourself, pursuing ideas, changing the way millions of people do something they love: Play. We’re EA—we’ve been making games for decades but you wouldn’t know that walking through our studios. We’re still buzzing with the same innovative spirit we began with, though we’ve learned enough to earn our rank as a leading developer, publisher and distributor of the world’s best games. What began as a small group of people determined to “put real life in a box” has become an 8,000-people strong, worldwide organization delivering on that very dream. If you’ve played The Sims lately, you know exactly what we mean. And if you’ve played Battlefield 1, maybe you’d say that we’ve done real life one better. <br/><br/> Whether you’re building Springfield on your mobile or your palms are sweaty from clutching your controller during intense games of FIFA 17, chances are you’ve played an EA game. And if you haven’t, well, what are you waiting for? In an industry that’s changing every day—whether it’s through new social channels, advancing technology, new audiences or unique opportunities for monetization—EA is positioned for growth thanks to smart business plans, strategic acquisitions, and most importantly, our creative people around the world who gather each day to unite the world through play. We take that last part very seriously, so if what you’re reading excites you as much as it does us, we invite you to get to know us better.
Title: Associate UX Designer co-op

Job_Description: <div> <div> <strong>UX Designer</strong> <br/> <strong>What We Are Looking For</strong><br/><br/>GlobalVision is looking for an experienced and ambitious UX Designer. A strong portfolio of successful UX and other technical projects is essential.<br/><br/><strong>Who We Are</strong><br/><br/>We are GlobalVision, a software and technology company founded in 1990 and headquartered in Montreal. We develop high-tech automated quality control solutions for international businesses. We are a global company and businesses everywhere use and depend on our software. We have a strong vision, and it’s carried out by a tight-knit, talented, and diverse team.<br/><br/><strong>Work Hard, Play Hard</strong><br/><br/>At GlobalVision balance is important to us. Growing our people is just as important as building the best products possible. We have carefully cultivated our team, and we are always looking for new talent to join our company.<br/><br/><strong>The day-to-day</strong>   <ul> <li>Understand product specifications and user psychology.</li> <li>Conduct concept and usability testing and gather feedback.</li> <li>Create personas through user research and data.</li> <li>Define the right interaction model and evaluate its success.</li> <li>Develop wireframes and prototypes around customer needs.</li> <li>Find creative ways to solve UX problems (e.g. usability, findability).</li> <li>Work with UI designers to implement attractive designs.</li> <li>Communicate design ideas and prototypes to developers.</li> <li>Keep abreast of competitor products and industry trends.</li> </ul>  <strong>Qualifications</strong>   <ul> <li>Proven experience as a UX Designer, UI Designer or similar role.</li> <li>Strong portfolio of design projects.</li> <li>Background in project management and research.</li> <li>Familiarity with interaction design and information architecture.</li> <li>Proficient in design software (e.g. UXPin, Balsamiq).</li> <li>Knowledge of HTML/CSS; JavaScript is a plus.</li> <li>Problem-solving aptitude.</li> <li>Analytical mind with a business acumen.</li> <li>Excellent communication skills.</li> <li>BSc in Design, Computer Science, Engineering or a related field.</li> </ul>  </div> </div>   <br/>
Title: UX Designer

Job_Description: You've read job posts that promise you'll change the world. Then you discover they're for yet another social media app, marketing agency, or consulting firm. You click away. And you wonder: "Aren't there opportunities where I can make a big impact? While I earn recognition and rewards for my efforts? And get to work with exceptional people on exciting new technology?" If that sounds like you, meet BenchSci. You will be a great fit. <br/><br/> <strong>About us</strong> <br/><br/> We use machine learning to accelerate drug discovery by helping scientists execute successful experiments. <br/><br/> <strong>We focus on a huge problem in drug discovery</strong> <br/><br/> Each year, biomedical researchers waste over a billion combined hours. The problem is with products they purchase to influence and measure proteins. There are millions of them, from hundreds of vendors. Finding the right products for specific experiments is tough. Researchers spend hours and sometimes days searching through published papers for guidance. But even then, many products they buy don't work. Some aren't right for a specific experiment. Others are poor quality. This delays scientific discoveries by weeks or months. And it slows availability of breakthrough treatments while making them more expensive. <br/><br/> <strong>We apply artificial intelligence to solve it</strong> <br/><br/> Thanks to improvements in machine learning, we can now solve this problem. We spent more than two years teaching a computer to read science papers like a human scientist. It decodes the information, which we present to researchers in an easy-to-use, web-based platform. They can then find products for experiments in minutes, not days, and see data that builds trust. The time and money they save has led to rapid adoption by top pharmaceutical companies and hundreds of academic institutions. <br/><br/> <strong>Product video</strong>: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fPs5xzYYHSs <br/><br/> <strong>News about us:</strong> https://www.theglobeandmail.com/business/article-alphabets-ai-venture-capital-firm-makes-first-investment-in-canada/ <br/><br/> <strong>About you</strong> <br/><br/> If our story excites you, let us describe who we would love on our team. You are passionate about machine learning, science, and making a positive impact. You are high-reaching, results-focused, and always learning. You act fast. You are open, honest, and transparent. You come to work inspired. You take your job seriously, but not yourself. You leave work satisfied. You wonder how to make every single day better than the last. For this specific role: <br/><br/> <strong>Your responsibilities:</strong> <br/><br/> As a UI Designer at BenchSci, you are a visual thinker who merges skills in visual design with your understanding of user experience to create delightful and usable interfaces. You translate and communicate complex information through understandable digital and printed visuals.  <ul>  <li>You will use your striking visual designs to make the BenchSci platform a world-class website for our scientist users</li>    <li>You will help the company communicate the platform’s value by creating stunning digital and printed assets like posters, decks, and booklets</li>    <li>Work with the Head of User Experience to guide the look, behavior, and feel of the platform by creating wireframes, mockups, and prototypes</li>    <li>Advance and implement BenchSci’s style guide to create a consistent and accessible platform for all scientists</li>    <li>Follow trends and best-practices in design, and ensure that BenchSci design tracks them closely</li>    <li>Collaborate with scientists from our team and user base to ensure designs are usable and intuitive</li>    <li>Work closely with front-end developers and QA to see designs through to production</li>    </ul> <strong>Qualifications:</strong>  <ul>  <li>2+ years experience in UI design with a strong portfolio of sample projects</li>    <li>1+ years of industry experience or summer internship</li>    <li>Excellent tactical visual design skills with a sensitivity to user experience</li>    <li>Able to prioritize projects, communicate progress, and deliver on time</li>    <li>Able to present your work and articulate the reasoning behind choices you made in the designs</li>    <li>Experience working in an Agile process</li>    <li>You can’t help but evaluate the user experience of both digital and non-digital products you encounter</li>    <li>You don’t compromise on your designs and don’t stop until you are proud</li>    <li>You are fearless, a fast learner, and thrive in fast-paced, collaborative environments</li>    <li>You love to learn about science and are always up to date with cutting-edge concepts and technologies</li>    <li>You think like a scientist - question your assumptions and strive for data-driven decisions</li>    <li>Proficient in HTML, CSS, and can explain how your designs will be implemented with code</li>    <li>You can skillfully employ both Photoshop and Illustrator</li>   <li>Proficiency in Sketch and InVision is a plus</li>   <li>Bachelor’s or Master’s level education in Graphic Design, Visual Design, Interactive Design, Human-Computer Interaction, Interaction Design, or related is a plus</li>    <li>Background in life sciences is a strong asset</li>   <li>Candidate must be eligible to work in Canada</li> </ul> <strong>What you get:</strong><ul> <li>Competitive salary and options at a well-funded startup</li>  <li>High-growth position in the early stage of a promising company</li>  <li>Key placement with important responsibilities in the organization</li>  <li>Benefits package that includes medical, vision, dental and life insurance</li>  <li>Alignment of your professional growth with the company’s growth</li>  <li>An opportunity to help transform and improve scientific research</li> </ul> <strong>How to apply</strong> <br/><br/> Please submit a resume, portfolio or a website link, and a short paragraph stating why you are interested in BenchSci. The deadline to apply is June 8th, but we review applicants on an ongoing basis so please apply ASAP. <br/><br/> <strong>A bit more about us</strong> <br/><br/> BenchSci was one of three finalists for "New Startup" in the sixth annual Canadian Startup Awards. As one of the leading machine learning startups in Canada, we raised over $2,700,000 in a seed round from preeminent Canadian and American venture capitalists. We are affiliated with top machine learning researchers at the University of Toronto, including advisor Richard Zemel, research director of the Vector Institute. Our office is located in downtown Toronto (aka “the 6”), near great coffee shops, restaurants, and summer patios. <br/><br/> <strong>At BenchSci we value the following:</strong>  <ul> <li>Freedom and accountability. We do not want or have time to micromanage.</li>  <li>Hard work. We have an amazing and rare opportunity to make an impact and we work hard to make sure we capture it.</li>  <li>Personal growth. We put aside a growth budget for each employee.</li>  <li>No bullshit. No politics. Just results.</li> </ul> BenchSci is an equal opportunity employer. We value diversity and are committed to fostering an inclusive environment. All four of our co-founders are immigrants to Canada, as are more than 75% of our employees. We welcome your fresh perspectives and ideas.
Title: UI Designer

Title: UI Developer

Job_Description: <div>At Sonova, our vision is straightforward. We foster a world in which there is a solution to every hearing loss and all people equally enjoy the delight of hearing. We are not just a company that makes products: we are a team on a mission to help people enjoy the delight of hearing. To enable a life without limitations, we – through our core brands Phonak, Unitron, Hansaton, Advanced Bionics and AudioNova – develop, design, manufacture and distribute solutions that push the limits of technology and redefine the future of our industry. Collectively, we aim to be the most respected hearing care company in the world. <br/><br/> In this role, you will have an opportunity to work with one of our innovative brands including Unitron headquartered right here in Kitchener, with individuals who share deep commitment to help improve the lives of people with hearing loss. Join our mission and become part of our amazing team! <br/><br/> <strong>Role Overview</strong> <br/><br/> In your role as User Experience Designer, you will use your research, design and innovation techniques to refine the Unitron user experience. Working closely with Product Management and Development teams, you will identify opportunities and design solutions that create a seamless and enjoyable experience for Unitron customers. <br/><br/> <strong>The Details:</strong><br/> <div>   <ul>   <li>Work closely with a team of Product Managers and Developers to create an intuitive, cohesive and seamless user experience across the Unitron product ecosystem</li> </ul>   </div> <br/> <div>   <ul>   <li>Collaborate with Product Management to influence product strategy and analyze how new products integrate optimally into the Unitron product ecosystem</li> </ul>   </div> <br/> <div>   <ul>   <li>Work with the Engineering team to ensure technical needs are met while maintaining a strong focus on the user experience</li> </ul>   </div> <br/> <div>   <ul>   <li>Distill complex problems and design simple and enjoyable solutions</li> </ul>   </div> <br/> <div>   <ul>   <li>Ability to influence a cross-functional team to achieve the best UX outcome</li> </ul>   </div> <br/> <div>   <ul>   <li>Partner with the brand team to ensure alignment of visual look and feel of product experience elements with the Unitron brand design values</li> </ul>   </div> <br/> <div>   <ul>   <li>Define, implement and document user experience guidelines</li> </ul>   </div> <br/> <div>   <ul>   <li>Perform other duties as assigned by Manager.</li> </ul>   </div> <br/><strong>The experience you bring:</strong>  <ul>  	<li>Bachelors degree in interaction design or other design related degrees</li> <li>5+ years designing user experiences and interaction design for B2C and B2B product experiences</li> <li>Advocate for UX strategy best practices, principles, and methodology</li> <li>Knowledge of emerging UX strategy trends and tools</li> <li>Creative thinker with an ability to use both data and intuition to inform decisions</li> <li>Able to translate findings into clear guidance for Product Managers and Developers</li> <li>Experience in conceptual development and rapid creative prototyping as well as tactical UI design and implementation.</li>   <li>Superior strategic thinking, influence and leadership skills.</li> <li>Excellent organizational, communication and interpersonal skills</li> </ul> We thank all applicants in advance; however only individuals selected for an interview will be contacted. All applications will be kept confidential. Sonova is an equal opportunity employer. Applicants who require reasonable accommodation to complete the application and/or interview process should notify the Director, Human Resources. <br/><br/> Sonova's hiring practices are aligned with human rights laws, which guarantee every person equal treatment in regard to employment and opportunity for employment, regardless of race, color, creed/religion, sex, sexual orientation, marital status, age, mental or physical disability</div>  <br/>
Title: UX Designer

Job_Description: <div>Great UX design opportunity! <br/><br/> Our Federal Government client is looking for an experienced UX Designer to join their team. There would be a possibility of offsite/part-time work. <br/><br/> <strong>Roles and Responsibilities</strong>   <ul> <li>Generating time estimates for the completion of tasks and deliverables</li> <li>Passionate about user-centered design practices and have an impeccable eye for detail and design</li> <li>Designing information/content architectures and experience flows</li> </ul>  <strong>Qualifications and Experience</strong>   <ul> <li>Minimum 2 years of UX design professional practice</li> <li>Experience with design and prototyping tools</li>   <li>Knowledge of capabilities of front-end development constraints of digital standards and platforms (HTML/CSS)</li> </ul>  If you qualify, please APPLY!!</div>
Title: UX Designer

Job_Description: <strong>About Pixel Tours</strong> <br/><br/> We’re a product strategy, design and development consultancy with a diverse portfolio of projects, from VR/AR to Early Child-hood Education to Financial Technology. We’re looking for people with sharp eyes, and even sharper minds to join our growing team. <br/><br/> <strong>A Bit About You</strong> <br/><br/> You are first and foremost a designer. A designer with a passion for creating elegant, highly usable interfaces. You are skilled with Sketch, InVision, Photoshop, Illustrator, and are capable of taking your pixel perfect designs and converting them to functional prototypes. You have at least 3 years of experience designing user interfaces for both responsive web, and mobile applications and understand Material Design and grid systems. You believe great design is more than just imagery, it's layout, margins, typography, and interactions all working together. <br/><br/> You like people, and understand that a good design isn't great until it has passed through real user validation. <br/><br/> You aspire to greatness—maybe for you that’s winning awards, presenting at a conference, or simply the satisfaction of knowing thousands, or millions (we have some large customers), of people had a better day because of something you made. <br/><br/> <strong>What You'll Do</strong> <ul>  <li>Design user interfaces in Sketch for web, iOS, and Android applications balancing system constraints and business objectives against industry best practices and user needs.</li> <li>Prepare user testable content through InVision or HTML/CSS/Javascript prototypes.</li></ul>   <ul>  <li>Leverage user insight, analytics, best practices, and competitor analysis to inform all design decisions.</li> <li>Continually socialize concepts, collecting feedback and iterating to achieve amazing results.</li> <li>Work with the development team to connect your interfaces into production systems.</li> <li>Collaborate with developers, product owners, user experience designers, and marketing.</li> </ul> We’re going to assume you can use a Mac as Sketch abilities are a requirement, you will be provided a laptop for portability loaded with all the latest design/prototyping tools. We’ll also hook you up with Slack, Skype, Toggl and a whole bunch of other tools so you can work from your favourite café from time to time. <br/><br/> Pixel Tours operates from two locations in Toronto (28 Logan Avenue and 151 Placer Court), this position will primarily work out of the Logan Ave location but will require occasional travel to the 151 Placer Court location or a customer site. <br/><br/> <strong>Requirements</strong> <ul>  <li>3+ years web and mobile design experience;</li> <li>Portfolio demonstrating expertise in typography, colour theory, illustration, and interactive design;</li> <li>Ability to take a concept from concept through sketches, wireframes, and high-fidelity mockups;</li> <li>Any passion for life-long learning;</li> <li>Great team collaboration and communication skills.</li> </ul> <strong>Benefits</strong> <ul>  <li>3 weeks vacation</li> <li>Benefits package</li> <li>Lunch & Learns</li> <li>Coffee & Snacks</li> <li>Hands on the latest AR and VR gear</li> </ul>
Title: UI Designer

Job_Description: <strong>About us</strong> <br/> We’re on a mission to improve the way people discover stories that matter. PressReader (www.about.pressreader.com) is a global platform that connects readers to the world’s best newspapers and magazines. <br/><br/> We’re all about choice. Using their phone or tablet, readers can browse online or download entire issues using the PressReader app. They can subscribe for unlimited access or get the full experience sponsored by one of our hotel, library, airline, cruise ship, or corporate partners. Our headquarters are in Vancouver, but we’ve got offices in Dublin and Manila, too. <br/><br/> PressReader works closely with some of the world’s biggest brands to create awesome digital experiences for their customers. We’ve got friends at Cathay Pacific, Air Canada, Bell Canada, AccorHotels, Forbes, The New York Times, The Guardian, Washington Post, Vogue, T3 and Cosmopolitan. We’re also really proud to be a forward-thinking employer that’s committed to creating an open, inclusive environment that gives great people the opportunity to do great things. <br/><br/> Lucky for you, we’re always growing. <br/><br/> <strong>The role</strong> <br/> We’re looking for a top-notch Senior UX/UI designer with deep experience working on mobile consumer products. Reporting to our Chief Technology Officer and playing a key role on our product team, the successful candidate will lead user experience audit, improvement and creation across all of our products. This person will work closely with our engineering, product, marketing and business teams to align the user experience with our goals. They’ll also act as a key member of our Cross-Functional Product Team, which plays a significant role in making strategic recommendations for the future of our product. <br/><br/> This is an excellent career building opportunity to lead UX, working with world-class colleagues on an industry-leading digital platform that serves millions of users every week. We’re at a really interesting time of rapid transformation, and this person will have the opportunity to meaningfully impact our product and contribute heavily to our product strategy. <br/><br/> <strong>Requirements</strong> <ul>  <li>Most importantly: design-first thinking with a solid understanding of information and user-centered design principles and techniques</li> <li>Next-level design sensibility – you stay on top of industry trends and have an excellent sense of taste</li> <li>Degree or diploma in UX/UI/Interaction design discipline or similar</li> <li>Minimum 5+ years of demonstrable industry experience with a strong emphasis on mobile web & apps</li> <li>Stand-out portfolio demonstrating UX process and deliverables in paper prototyping, wireframes, usability research/testing and more</li> <li>Collaborative mindset, able to work with diverse teams and stakeholders to find the best solution</li> <li>Sense of humour</li> <li>Stellar project management skills with ability to manage competing deadlines in a high-velocity environment</li> <li>Proven ability to write, execute and analyze usability research/tests, distilling into actionable insights and optimized user experience</li> <li>Excellent communication skills with the ability to present, persuade and influence at all decision making levels</li> <li>Strong proficiency with industry-standard tools like Sketch and Adobe Creative Suite</li> <li>Knowledge or experience with rapid prototyping and testing</li> <li>Ability to incorporate data and analytics insights into design solutions</li> <li>Ability to multitask and prioritize multiple concurrent assignments</li> <li>Ability to work independently <br/><br/> <strong>To apply:</strong> Please submit your CV and portfolio.</li> </ul> <strong>Benefits</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Our benefits package is extensive and covers you and your family. It includes:</strong> <ul>  <li>Extended Health Care with Dental and Vision</li> <li>Installments to BC Provincial Medical Services Plan</li> <li>Long-term disability, Life and AD&D insurance for the employee</li> <li>Up to 6 paid sick days per year</li> <li>Up to 5 paid bereavement days per year</li> <li>2 weeks paid vacation per year for start, followed by 3 weeks vacation after completion of 3 years of service</li> <li>Reimbursements for professional training and the membership in the professional associations</li> <li>Gym membership.</li> </ul> This is a full time permanent position working from our corporate office in Richmond, BC.
Title: Senior UX Designer - Vancouver, Canada

Job_Description: <div>     Jr. Designer/Developer      <div>    Type    <div>  Contract </div>    Location    <div>  Burnaby </div>    Wanted    <div>  <p>We are looking for a part-time Jr. Developer/Designer to support our expanding client projects. The Jr. Developer/Designer will help deliver projects on time and on budget with the business outcomes client expect while learning SMARTT’s unique integrated service model. If there’s a good fit, this can become a full time position for the right candidate.</p>  <p>We are looking for candidates that fit our culture of:</p>  <ul> 	<li>Being on time</li> 	<li>Communicating</li> 	<li>Producing work we are proud of</li> </ul>  <p>All while practicing Transparency, Leadership, and Collaboration.</p>  </div>    Key Responsibilities    <div>  <ul> 	<li>Design and code web sites, pages, and landing pages</li> 	<li>Develop pages either from scratch or using a CMS framework such as WordPress or Drupal</li> 	<li>Design graphical elements such as logos, icons and infographics as necessary</li> 	<li>Design and build marketing collateral – mostly web with some print (Example: web banners)</li> 	<li>Perform quality control on provided site content</li> 	<li>Ensure that sites are optimized for search engines before going live</li> 	<li>Actively test product outputs on IE, Firefox, Chrome, and Safari across PC, Mac, and mobile devices</li> 	<li>Proactively participate in QC and testing to ensure that websites and supporting features are working properly</li> 	<li>Follow design and code reviews and practice established Job_Description: Our team is looking for a Junior Web Designer. You would work directly with our Senior Web Designer to produce unique and compelling user experiences for a wide range of markets and industries. <br/><br/> This role requires a high degree of creativity, versatility and a sharp eye for detail. If you are passionate about design and are eager to learn, we'd like to meet you. <br/><br/> When applying, please provide links to any material you’d like to show us that demonstrates your approach to design. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities</strong> <ul>  <li>Understand project requirements and concepts</li> <li>Use various techniques to create drafts, models and prototypes</li> <li>Design and build beautiful web and mobile application UI’s using CSS</li> <li>Pitch creative ideas that enhance projects</li> <li>Collaborate with team members to launch designs</li> <li>Use feedback from leaders to improve work</li> </ul> <strong>Requirements</strong> <ul>  <li>Good intuition of best practices and tools used in user-centered interaction design</li> <li>Good understanding of the fundamentals of good design: visual hierarchy, layout, typography, color theory, etc</li> <li>Proven ability to design in Photoshop, Illustrator or similar</li> <li>Experience implementing designs using HTML5 and CSS3</li> <li>Excellent communication and teamwork skills</li> <li>A keen eye for detail</li> <li>Creativity skills and problem-solving aptitude</li> <li>Experience not required but an asset</li> </ul> <strong>Benefits</strong> <ul>  <li>Paid vacation</li> <li>Paid sick time</li> <li>Medical benefits</li> </ul>
Title: Junior Web Designer

Job_Description: <strong>About Our Company</strong> <br/><br/> UNIVERIS, headquartered in Toronto, Canada, is a privately held company and is the leader in enterprise wealth management for the Canadian market. Founded in 1991, UNIVERIS has over 100 staff and 15 leading financial services clients representing over 17,000 financial advisors on the platform. It offers the most comprehensive wealth management solution for financial advisors in the credit union, banking, insurance and investment dealer sectors. <br/><br/> UNIVERIS is a world-class technology platform that boasts a number of firsts in Canadian mutual fund distribution including real-time processing, web access, built-in compliance, plus GIC and segregated funds processing capabilities. Technology innovation is one of the cornerstones of UNIVERIS' product development strategy and through its Evergreen approach to technology, new features and capabilities transparently integrate into the platform. <br/><br/> <strong>About the Role</strong> <br/><br/> We are looking for a talented User-Experience Designer responsible for conceiving and conducting user research, interviews and surveys, and translating them into sitemaps, wireframes and prototypes. You will also make strategic design decisions for the overall functionality of the product and iterate upon it to ensure a great user experience. You will be creating and maintaining a design library for the persona(s) that you will be responsible for. If this sounds like what you are looking for, we are excited to meet you! <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities</strong>  <ul>  <li>Translate concepts into wireframes and mockups that lead to intuitive user experiences.</li> <li>Facilitate stakeholder’s product visions by researching, conceiving, wireframing, sketching, prototyping, and mocking up user experiences for digital products.</li> <li>Design and deliver lofi/hifi wireframes, user stories, user journeys, and mockups optimized for a wide range of devices and interfaces.</li> <li>Identify design problems and devise elegant solutions.</li> <li>Make strategic design and user-experience decisions related to core, and new, functions and features.</li> <li>Take a user-centered design approach and rapidly test and iterate your designs.</li> <li>Collaborate with other team members and stakeholders.</li> <li>Take smart risks and champion new ideas.</li> <li>Stay current with recent developments in the UX/UI design industry and community; and communicate any new insight to fellow designers</li> <li>Create, document and maintain design patterns and assets into a design library/style guide.</li> <li>Maintain the UX community within Univeris, to promote UX awareness across all platforms</li>  </ul> <strong>Requirements</strong>  <ul>  <li>Bachelor's Degree, College diploma OR relevant experience Experience: 3+ years.</li> <li>Expertise in UX software such as InVision, UXPin, Balsamiq, Framer.js, Quartz Composer, and the like is a must.</li> <li>Basic HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript skills.</li> <li>Ability to work with clients to understand detailed requirements and design complete user experiences that meet client needs and vision.</li> <li>Extensive experience in using UX design best practices to design solutions, and a deep understanding of mobile-first and responsive design.</li> <li>Experience designing Web and Hybrid Mobile apps</li> <li>A solid grasp of user-centered design and testing methodologies, subsystems, and usability and accessibility concerns.</li> <li>Ability to iterate your designs and solutions efficiently and intelligently.</li> <li>Ability to clearly and effectively communicate design processes, ideas, and solutions to teams and clients.</li> <li>A clear understanding of the importance of user-centered design.</li> <li>Be excited about collaborating and communicating closely with teams and other stakeholders via a distributed model to regularly deliver design solutions for approval.</li> <li>Be willing to help teammates, share knowledge and experience with them, and learn from them.</li> <li>Be open to receiving feedback and constructive criticism.</li> <li>Be passionate about all things UX and other areas of design and innovation. Research and showcase knowledge in the industry’s latest trends and technologies.</li> <li>A portfolio showcasing your UX skills, capabilities, and strong sense of user understanding and design</li> </ul>
Title: UX Designer

Job_Description: Therefore is seeking a qualified candidate to join our growing digital strategy department. The selected candidate will engage on projects and products with the strategy team in user experience research, strategy and design. <br/><br/> <strong>Requirements</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Experience</strong> <ul>  <li>A qualified candidate will have engaged in some or most of the following UX methodologies (or comparable methods).</li> <li>Experience with research methods, such as stakeholder interviews, user interviews, user personas, heuristic evaluation, competitive audit, etc.</li> <li>Experience with strategy methods such as value proposition canvas, customer journey mapping, and identifying KPI.</li> <li>Experience creating sitemaps, wireframes, user interface mockups, and prototypes.</li> <li>Experience engaging in validating methodologies such as A/B testing, user testing, or user survey.</li> </ul> <strong>Skills</strong> <ul>  <li>Organization and promptness (meet deadlines, be self motivated)</li> <li>Ability to engage and speak with clients, and their customers with confidence and subject matter authority</li> <li>Ability to receive feedback and guidance</li> <li>Ability to work collaboratively as part of a team</li> <li>Life learner</li> </ul> <strong>Special consideration</strong> <ul>  <li>A candidate will be given special consideration if they have demonstrable experience with the following:</li> <li>Experience working alongside Agile development teams.</li> <li>Experience in Agile project management or planning.</li> <li>Experience or education in marketing (strategy, or execution of marketing campaigns and deliverables).</li> <li>Experience or education in web development and/or solutions architecture (working knowledge of web technology, or advanced knowledge in systems design).</li> <li>Experience in graphic design, art direction and branding.</li> </ul> <strong>Benefits</strong> <ul>  <li>Work from a modern open-concept social atmosphere overlooking the city skyline from <strong>Liberty Village</strong></li>  <li> <strong>Getting to work</strong> - There are lots of ways to get to the office: bike, street car, bus, train…</li> <li> <strong>Pet projects</strong> - Have a great idea you want to explore? Want to learn about a new process, technology or related discipline? We give you the flexibility and encouragement you need to stay up-to-date and relevant.</li> <li> <strong>Hardware / Software</strong> - All of our machines are top-of-the-line. You want dual-monitor, or even triple, no problem. We’re currently using all Apple products and Atlassian product suite. Chairs are ergonomic high quality makes such as Herman Miller and Steelcase -- important stuff.</li> <li> <strong>Health</strong> - We provide a full featured health plan.</li> <li> <strong>Gym Membership</strong> - Gym membership in our building is free for all employees.</li> <li> <strong>Fuel</strong> - We keep the kitchen stocked with healthy snacks, drinks and of course, coffee and teas.</li> <li> <strong>High-Profile Clients</strong> - We work with amazing clients, many of which are household names. Our projects aren’t always public facing, but are very often challenging and complex. We work closely with our clients to build deeply integrated platforms and products.</li> <li> <strong>Conferences / Knowledge Sharing</strong> - We attend Drupal, JavaScript, Accessibility and Content Strategy meetups, conferences, camps and summits both local and around the world. We also contribute through sponsorships and by doing talks.</li> <li> <strong>Training and Learning</strong> - We have accounts with lots of online learning resources. Find a new one that we can benefits from? Let us know and we’ll hook it up.</li> </ul>
Title: UX Designer

Job_Description: <strong>Who we are:</strong> <br/><br/> PerfectMind makes some of the world’s leading online member management services. Our fresh approach to helping member-based organizations grow their business has achieved global recognition in martial arts, yoga, dance, music, and more. Our goal is to help community-oriented businesses manage the marketing and operations of their facilities, allowing them freedom to accomplish critical tasks, such as forming strong relationships with their community members. We’re expanding our team to meet new opportunities in the market. PerfectMind is proud to be listed on Canada’s Profit 100 and headquartered in beautiful Burnaby, Canada. <br/><br/> <strong>Our Culture:</strong> <br/><br/> We are a values-based company and the way we behave is important to us. At PerfectMind, we help to build strong meaningful communities that bring us all together, around the things we love the most. By helping community-driven businesses to prosper, we promote healthier, happier, connected lives and contribute to a more stable and supportive society. We are a relationship-motivated company.  <ul> <li>We are devoted to helping people evolve. We are encouraging.</li>   <li>We are bold and look for new ways to do things. We are creative.</li>   <li>We are relentlessly driven by high performance. We are committed.</li>   <li>We are always in pursuit of opportunity. We are entrepreneurial.</li>  </ul> KEY RESPONSIBILITIES <br/><br/> As a Senior UI Developer with PerfectMind, the ideal candidate will be someone who wants to be a part of the development of an innovative product. If you are interested in working with some challenging and complex code, and want to be a part of the next big product available to businesses please apply now! As a Microsoft shop, we are looking for developers with strong front-end experience to build the most amazing interface for our clients to use.  <ul> <li>Build out highly functional, user friendly and responsive web applications</li>   <li>Collaborate with Business Analysts, Product Managers, QA and other Software Developers while participating in daily scrum activities and working within project teams</li>   <li>Participate in the full Software Development Life Cycle</li>   <li>Contribute and add value to a growing company on a daily basis</li> </ul>   <ul> <li>Communicate & present ideas to internal and external business and technology stakeholders</li>   <li>Create wireframes, mockups and prototypes to showcase opportunities and guide developers</li>   <li>Build responsive web applications as per design comps for complex, high volume & scalable applications</li>   <li>Follow best practices and standards for accessibility and cross browser compatibility</li>   <li>Lead projects using agile methodology</li> </ul>   <ul> <li>Mentor and coach a team of UI developers</li>   <li>Initiate refactoring initiatives to streamline UI framework</li>   <li>Implement a UI unit test framework</li>  </ul> REQUIREMENTS  <ul> <li>6+ years web development experience writing custom (X)HTML, CSS, and JavaScript</li>   <li>Experienced in responsive web design and mobile first approach</li>   <li>Experience working with JavaScript libraries such as jQuery, Knockout.js, Angular.js</li> </ul>   <ul> <li>Experience in JavaScript refactoring and unit testing</li>   <li>Experienced with the SDLC within an Agile working environment</li>   <li>Familiarity with ASP.NET MVC and tools such as Jira, Confluence, TFS, Bitbucket</li>   <li>Experience with Sass, TypeScript, LESS framework and HTML5 Boilerplate</li>  </ul>
Title: Senior UI Developer

Job_Description: The designer UX acts at different levels within the nventive team. At the decision-making level, it validates the work done by designers and guides their decisions related to the design of applications. At the operational level, he is involved in putting in place best practices and working procedures within his team. Finally, at the level of deliverables, he proactively participates in the creation of content at the level. <br/><br/> <strong>Your mission will be:</strong> <br/><br/> Work collaboratively with product managers, customers, and developers to identify needs, organize content, and determine the functionality of mobile applications; <br/> Participate in project analysis, design and design of mobile and website applications; <br/> Conduct requirements gathering sessions with digital and / or client producers;Intervene graphically and ergonomically in the user experience (UX); <br/> Design interfaces that meet customer objectives and best usability rules; <br/> Detail the proposed solutions using wireframes, navigation summaries and prototypes; <br/> Contribute to the development of content models, nomenclature and taxonomy; <br/> Represent the user's voice during the development cycle of the application. <br/><br/> <strong>What we’ll empower you with:</strong>  <ul> <li>Research, design, and prototype new user interface designs based on product requirements. Deliverables include design mockups, prototyping, production of visual assets, and documentation required for proper implementation.</li> <li>Collaborate with designers, product management and developers to define and implement innovative solutions.</li> <li>Execute all visual design stages from concept to final hand-off.</li> <li>Conceptualize original ideas that bring simplicity and user friendliness to complex UI design roadblocks.</li> <li>Create wireframes, storyboards, user journey maps and process flows to effectively communicate interaction and design ideas.</li> <li>Establish and promote design guidelines, best practices and standards.</li> </ul> <strong> <br/> Why we are a fantastic mobile studio:</strong>  <ul> <li>Yes, we offer breakfast, flexible schedules, beer on Friday and reimbursement of gym fees. And yes, you can come to work in shorts, sandals ... even crocs if you wish.</li> <li>In addition, our team is made up of enthusiastic people ready to help you push your limits.</li> <li>We work with prestigious clients from different industries, ensuring that you constantly act according to various mandates.</li> <li>You will have access to expertise and very advanced technology through our partnerships and in-house developed tools.</li> </ul>  <div><div><div></div><div><div><div><div><div>nventive <br/> 215 rue Saint-Jacques, bureau 500 <br/> Montréal, QC <br/> H2Y 1M6</div></div></div></div></div></div><div><div><div>+-</div></div><div><div>Leaflet | Map data © OpenStreetMap contributors</div></div></div></div>

Vention works with flagship manufacturing companies across the world, empowering their engineers to design, order and assemble industrial equipment as fast as 3 days. <br/><br/> THE ROLE <br/> Reporting to the CTO, you will be responsible for crafting a user experience and building an engaging user interface for Vention e-Commerce website and 3D MachineBuilder. close attention to detail</li> <li>Excellent interpersonal, communication and team skills <br/><br/> ABOUT VENTION</li> <li>One of the fastest growing digital manufacturing platforms in US and Canada.</li> <li>Serves flagship clients in the automotive, aerospace, robotics and electronics industries</li> <li>Recently closed a $3.5M in seed investment round led by White Star Capital, alongside Real Ventures and Bolt.</li> <li>One of Montreal's top 10 tech companies to watch in 2018</li> <li>Has won 2nd place the Harvard Business School Startup competition in 2017</li> <li>Graduated from Creative Destruction Lab in Toronto, Laureate from Fondation de Montreal, Finalist at Automate 2017</div></li> </ul>  </div><br/>  <div> <div>Skills</div> <br/> <div> Javascript, PostgreSQL, UI/UX Design, Ruby on Rails, React.js</div><br/>  <div>Compensation</div> <br/> <div> <strong>$60K</strong> <br/> <strong>–</strong> <br/> <strong>$90K</strong> <br/> No Equity</div> </div><br/>  <div> <div> <div><div> <div> Applied</div> </div> </div> </div></div></div>
Title: UX/UI Developer

Job_Description: SimplyCast.com, a leading provider of interactive marketing software and services for organizations worldwide, is seeking a UX Designer to join its growing team located in Dartmouth, Nova Scotia.<br/><br/>About the Position<br/><br/>Do you have an excellent eye for design? Do you know great web UI when you see it and understand why it is so compelling? If so, we have an exciting career for you. <br/><br/> You need to be a Photoshop ninja, fluent in Illustrator, OmniGraffle, or any other software used to create wireframes. You should have at least a working knowledge of XHTML/CSS and if you can cut up your own comps, even better. <br/><br/> Finally, you should have a solid portfolio of web application designs to showcase. We want to see firsthand that you can build great web interfaces, not just great websites.<br/><br/>Benefits of Joining Team   <ul> <li>An office culture that is one-of-a-kind. A happy team is a hard working team.</li> <li>High focus on the health and wellness of our staff including flexible hours.</li> <li>A unique revenue sharing plan. As the company succeeds, so do you.</li> <li>Competitive salaries and accelerated promotions for those who go above and beyond.</li> <li>Dedication to hiring students and new graduates. It keeps us feeling young.</li> <li>Working in the heart of Silicon Dartmouth. The office is car, bike and bus friendly.</li> <li>A kitchen that is stocked with free coffee, tea and hot chocolate. We also provide snacks.</li> <li>Getting the chance to kick your coworker’s butt in a game of Foosball.</li> <li>A social committee that plans 3-4 fun events every year. Paint ball, BBQs, bowling and rock climbing have been done before.</li> <li>Lunch with the CEO and CEO appreciation days.</li> </ul>  Job Responsibilities   <ul> <li>Be a growth agent.</li> <li>Develop ambitious, dynamic user interfaces in HTML5 that enable our customers to deal with complex data in an intuitive and appealing manner.</li> <li>Analyze functional requirements and specifications in collaboration with Product Management.</li> <li>Contribute to product design and architectural decisions</li> <li>Develop product concepts and suggest product direction based on design research and functional analysis.</li> <li>Partner with engineering on the implementation of interactive techniques and technologies.</li> <li>Conduct U/X research and plan visual design enhancements.</li> <li>Create documentation for architectural, design, implementation and test activities.</li> <li>Follow company policies and marketing procedures effectively.</li> <li>Other duties as assigned.</li> </ul>  Job Requirements   <ul> <li>1+ years experience implementing user interfaces.</li> <li>Strong communication skills; spoken and written English required.</li> <li>Ability to prioritize and accomplish tasks in a fast-paced environment.</li> <li>Positive attitude, confident and competitive.</li> <li>Ability to be flexible and self sufficient.</li> <li>Ability to work well in a team environment.</li> <li>A good sense of humor goes a long way.</li> </ul> <strong>Benefits also include:</strong> Top tier Prescription and Dental coverage. Two weeks vacation and free parking. <br/><br/> SimplyCast is an equal opportunity employer. Our organization values the importance of diversity, fairness and trust.<br/><br/>About SimplyCast<br/><br/>SimplyCast.com is a leading provider of interactive marketing software and services for organizations worldwide. The company’s multi-channel marketing platform is a feature-rich solution used by thousands of customers in over 175 countries, including many of the most recognized brand names around the globe in retail, non-profit and hospitality industries. With thousands of organizations using SimplyCast solutions to automate email, survey, event, voice, SMS, Twitter, fax, Facebook, press release, landing pages and autoresponder marketing needs, they now have the power to effectively reach customers on their preferred mode of communication.
Title: UX Designer

Job_Description: The Senior UX Designer will collaborate across multidisciplinary teams to create insightful, empathetic, data-driven experiences for clients and their users. Utilizing design thinking and working within an agile process, you will conduct user research and testing, create user flow diagrams, build comprehensive wireframes in Sketch, as well as contribute to the rationale behind user-centred design decisions. <br/><br/> No one is an island — We believe in sharing work early and often, so you will work iteratively and collaboratively on rough notes and sketches, before hunkering down on detailed high-quality deliverables for our clients. <br/><br/> Located in the Mount Pleasant area of Vancouver, as part of the POWERSHiFTER team you will have access to some of the brightest minds in design, technology, strategy and data science. You will work in an environment that values people, process and performance, collaborating with team members. <br/><br/> <strong>Your Mission</strong> <br/><br/> We believe that when you start with empathy, amazing things can happen. You will champion this belief through the practice of design thinking and human-centred design principals (HCD) on both client and internal work. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities</strong>  <ul> <li>Work with senior team members to conceptualize and execute designs that will advance clients’ businesses.</li>  <li>Perform UX audits, help facilitate user testing, and present recommendations on major projects that involve user experience.</li>  <li>Participate in research, stakeholder interviews, and document your findings</li>  <li>Develop research-backed personas</li>  <li>Create user flow and site architecture diagrams to present the clearest path to user goal completion</li>  <li>Collaborate with the Digital Science team to assure design decisions are data-driven</li>  <li>Build wireframes in Sketch</li>  <li>Stay up to date on the latest UX and design trends and requirements for all current and emerging formats of digital UX design.</li>  <li>Work independently and efficiently to meet deadlines.</li>  <li>Actively contribute to internal programs and knowledge sharing.</li>  <li>Share acquired skills with team members through formal and informal channels.</li>  <li>Have fun!</li> </ul> <strong>Requirements</strong>  <ul> <li>Minimum education requirements: Relevant Bachelor Degree</li>  <li>Minimum experience requirements: 5+ Years</li> </ul> <strong>Benefits</strong>  <ul> <li>This is a contract position (time commitments can be negotiable)</li>  <li>An exciting, yet highly collaborative work environment with amazing peers</li>  <li>Flexible work/life balance</li> </ul>
Title: Senior UX Designer (Contract)

Job_Description: Our client is the world’s largest independent security software company and strives to make the world a safer place by protecting digital information. They offer solutions for consumers, businesses and governments that provide layered security to protect information on mobile devices, endpoints, gateways, servers and the cloud. Our client enables the smart protection of information, with innovative technology that is simple to deploy and manage, and security that fits an evolving ecosystem. Their solutions are supported by over 5000 employees in over 50 countries and powered by the world’s most advanced cloud-based, global threat intelligence network. <br/><br/> Our client is looking for an experienced and talented UI ninja to work with the UI designer and back end developers on a highly interactive and modern user experience. The ideal candidate will have experience building advanced UI’s that use back end REST services and work across browsers. Working with modern web development techniques, the ideal candidate will take UI designs and implement them with a high degree of interactivity and client-side input validation. The UI includes advanced visual interactions, charting and interactive workflow tools. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities</strong>   <ul> <li>Be a great team player, experienced in working with Agile teams.</li> <li>Ability to collaborate closely with developers and UI designers.</li> <li>Implements UI designs using REST, JavaScript, HTML and CSS.</li> <li>Optimize user interaction and intuitiveness of the interface.</li> <li>Work with the wireframes, prototypes, style guides, user flows, created by the UI designer and improve the overall end product.</li> <li>Continually keep yourself and the team updated with the latest changes in industry standards.</li> </ul>  <strong>Requirements</strong>   <ul> <li>Four or more years of experience and proven track record in user interface development.</li> <li>Very strong experience with JavaScript, HTML, CSS.</li> <li>Experience using AngularJS, React or other modern UI implementation tools.</li> <li>Strong portfolio to be presented and defended during interview.</li> <li>Creative with problem-solving mindset.</li> <li>Be open to receiving objective criticism and improving upon it.</li> <li>Collaborate with developers on best practices, code reviews, internal tools and process improvements.</li> <li>Experience using automation tools with the UI for regression.</li> <li>Ability to influence design of REST APIs to ensure an optimal UX.</li> <li>Experience with node.js, NoSQL is a plus.</li> </ul>  Applications from people with disabilities are welcomed and encouraged. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. <br/><br/> Our client provides equal employment opportunity for all applicants and employees. Our client does not unlawfully discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy and childbirth or related medical conditions, national origin, ancestry, age, physical or mental disability, medical condition, family care leave status, veteran status, marital status, sexual orientation, or gender identity.
