The ideal candidate should have an eye for clean and artful design, possess superior UI skills and be able to translate high-level requirements into interaction flows and artifacts, and transform them into beautiful, intuitive, and functional user interfaces.​ <br/><br/> Responsibilities: <ul> <li>Ability to collaborate with both Brand strategy and Creative leads to define and implement innovative solutions for the product direction, visuals and experience.</li><li>Execute all visual design stages from concept to final hand-off to engineering</li><li>Conceptualize original ideas that bring simplicity and user friendliness to complex design roadblocks.</li><li>Create wireframes, storyboards, user flows, process flows and site maps to effectively communicate interaction and design ideas</li><li>Present and defend designs and key milestone deliverables to peers</li><li>Conduct user research and evaluate user feedback</li><li>Follow design guidelines, best practices and usability standards.</li><li>Candidate will report to the Creative Director of Experience</li>  </ul> Requirements <ul> <li>Minimum 3+ years of UI experience</li><li>Demonstrable UI design skills with a strong portfolio</li><li>Solid experience in creating wireframes, storyboards, user flows, process flows and site maps</li><li>Proficiency in Sketch, InVision, Adobe Suite</li><li>Excellent visual design skills with sensitivity to user-system interaction​</li><li>Ability to present your designs and sell your solutions to various stakeholders</li><li>Ability to solve problems creatively and effectively</li><li>Up-to-date with the latest UI trends, techniques, and technologies</li><li>Experience working in an Agile/Scrum development process</li> </ul> We appreciate all expressed interest in this position, however, only the candidates selected for interview will be contacted. <br/><br/> Tribal Worldwide is an inclusive, equal opportunity employer that values diversity. We also offer reasonable accommodations to applicants with disabilities. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, please let us know when you submit your application.
Title: UX Designer

Candidates will be expected to provide expertise within an Advanced Agile Product Development environment performing various functions in the design, development and validation of new products. We offer you the opportunity to create state of the art user experiences, leveraging the latest tools and technologies, for customers supporting mission critical initiatives. <br/><br/> <strong>Fundamental skills required:</strong> <ul> <li>Design, build, and implement elegant front solutions</li><li>Improve user experience from design thru usability</li><li>Facilitate adoption of user experience design practices</li><li>Participate in the end-to-end software development lifecycle</li><li>Produce prototypes and effectively articulate design decisions</li><li>Gather and develop functional and technical requirements</li><li>Write clean code that is maintainable, scalable, and extensible</li><li>Experience with software development lifecycle</li><li>Integrate APIs, REST and Web services</li><li>Hands-on experience as front-end developer</li><li>Hands-on experience in User Experience (UX)</li><li>Proficiency in HTML, CSS, and JavaScript</li><li>Proficiency in JavaScript frameworks like Angular or React</li> </ul> <strong>Experience with the following preferred:</strong> <ul> <li>Android and iOS Mobile Application Development</li><li>Writing automated User Interface tests</li><li>Behavior Driven Development (BDD) Techniques</li> </ul> <strong>Minimum Qualifications:</strong> <ul> <li>Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or related field of study or an equivalent combination of education and experience from which comparable knowledge and skills may be acquired</li><li>At least 5 years of hands on experience with front end development technologies</li><li>Excellent analytical and problem solving skills</li><li>Communication skills catered to a wide variety of audiences. (e.g. written, verbal, presentation)</li><li>Flexibility to adapt to evolving needs and requirements</li> </ul> We seek software developers with demonstrable results in User Experience (UX) design and front end User Interface (UI) development. Candidates will be expected to provide expertise within an Advanced Agile Product Development environment performing various functions in the design, development and validation of new products. We offer you the opportunity to create state of the art user experiences, leveraging the latest tools and technologies, for customers supporting mission critical initiatives. <br/><br/> <strong>Fundamental skills required:</strong> <ul> <li>Design, build, and implement elegant front solutions</li><li>Improve user experience from design thru usability</li><li>Facilitate adoption of user experience design practices</li><li>Participate in the end-to-end software development lifecycle</li><li>Produce prototypes and effectively articulate design decisions</li><li>Gather and develop functional and technical requirements</li><li>Write clean code that is maintainable, scalable, and extensible</li><li>Experience with software development lifecycle</li><li>Integrate APIs, REST and Web services</li><li>Hands-on experience as front-end developer</li><li>Hands-on experience in User Experience (UX)</li><li>Proficiency in HTML, CSS, and JavaScript</li><li>Proficiency in JavaScript frameworks like Angular or React</li> </ul> <strong>Experience with the following preferred:</strong> <ul> <li>Android and iOS Mobile Application Development</li><li>Writing automated User Interface tests</li><li>Behavior Driven Development (BDD) Techniques</li> </ul> <strong>Minimum Qualifications:</strong> <ul> <li>Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or related field of study or an equivalent combination of education and experience from which comparable knowledge and skills may be acquired</li><li>At least 5 years of hands on experience with front end development technologies</li><li>Excellent analytical and problem solving skills</li><li>Communication skills catered to a wide variety of audiences. (e.g. written, verbal, presentation)</li><li>Flexibility to adapt to evolving needs and requirements</li></ul></div> </div></div></div></div>
Title: UI Developer

Job_Description: DevFacto is eagerly seeking a Senior Software Developer to join our team in Toronto! <br/><br/> Were looking for people with a broad range of skills. Bringing a clients vision to life means youll wear a lot of hats. This often means being able to dig into the details of their business, bring new ideas to the table, and be able to design then build solutions that blow their socks off. <br/><br/> DevFacto is looking for a Web Developer / UX Designer to join our team! <br/><br/> <strong>If you're looking to:</strong>  <ul> <li>Join a fast-growing company where you can have an impact</li> <li>Interact with and learn from other highly talented people</li> <li>Work with the latest tools and technologies</li> </ul> <strong>And you have:</strong>  <ul> <li>2-5 years of experience in front-end Web Development, Interactive Design or Visual design for web applications</li> <li>Advanced knowledge of HTML/HTML5, CSS/CSS3, Javascript and jQuery</li>   <li>Understanding of "best practice" UI/UX design patterns</li> <li>Understanding of what it takes to implement a visual design in a modern web application (Experience with SharePoint is an asset)</li> <li>Strong desire to develop new technical knowledge and professional skills on a continual basis</li> <li>Ability to work in a fast paced work environment to meet deliverable deadlines</li> <li>Strong interpersonal skills in a cross functional team based environment</li> <li>Excellent written and oral communication skills</li> </ul> <strong>DevFacto can offer you</strong>:  <ul> <li>Competitive salaries, group benefits, profit sharing</li> <li>Challenging projects and leading-edge technologies</li> <li>Extensive training</li> <li>Regular team social events including Friday happy-hours and monthly team outings</li> <li>A really cool award-winning culture!</li> </ul> If this sounds like a match made in heaven, we want to hear from you!
Title: Web Developer & UX Designer

Job_Description: Do you cringe at unintuitive menus and unresponsive controls? Do you have an eye for detail and polished experiences? Do you have strong, clear UI creation skills and a passion for gaming? <br/><br/> Then come help us by advancing the art and design of our products user interaction! <br/><br/> We are looking for a talented UI Artist to join our dynamic and growing team in <strong>Montreal.</strong> Be a part of the crew in charge of developing the most authentic and recognized poker game: <strong>World Series of Poker.</strong> You must be well versed in layout, typography and UI design for web and mobile applications. As our ideal candidate, you are able to develop and create concepts and visual ideas for online and mobile products that will be used in social and mobile games. <br/><br/> <u>About Playtika</u> <br/><br/> Playtika is a multiplatform social games developer. We are the #1 grossing Facebook game developer as well as a Top 10 grossing developer on iOS & Android worldwide. <br/><br/> Founded in 2010, Playtika immediately enjoyed skyrocketing growth and expanded quickly by acquiring other leading game titles. We now have 14 offices in 9 countries around the world with over 1,600 Playtikans. <br/><br/> Our business and our passion is to immerse people into a thrilling entertainment experience. Currently our games are enjoyed by more than 6 million users daily and over 20 million users monthly. <br/><br/> Sounds good, right? Come play with us! <br/><br/> <u>What youll be doing:</u> <ul> <li>Actively conceptualize UI designs for all aspects of the game</li><li>Work with the Game Designer and PO to create the UX wireframe</li><li>Work with the Art Director in defining and communicating the visual language and interface look and feel</li><li>Translate gameplay high level ideas into visual functional UI designs</li><li>Help elaborate research and prototype to bring ideas to life</li><li>Participate in visual comparisons and critiques</li><li>Competently assist in design of UI flow and function</li><li>Spec out art tasks and generate time estimates when needed</li><li>Contribute to art and tool pipeline improvements</li> </ul>  Requirements:<br/><br/><u>As our ideal candidate, you have:</u> <ul> <li>At least5 years experience as a UI Artist in the gaming industry</li><li>A strong background in fundamental art principles including excellent color theory, layout, typography, visual hierarchy and composition skills</li><li>Expertise with Photoshop</li><li>A thorough understanding of UI/UX flow and function design</li><li>A desire to challenge yourself to raise the barre on your own work and that of the company</li><li>Knowledge and curiosity about the latest trends in gaming and UI</li><li>A strong ability to communicate ideas visually and in writing</li><li>The ability to meet deadlines while handling multiple tasks</li><li>A College degree in Art, Animation, Design, or a related field (an asset)</li><li>Strong French/English written and verbal communication skills</li> </ul> <u>Its a total bonus if you have:</u> <ul> <li>Experience with Unity, Flash, After Effect and Illustrator</li> <li>Ability to create simple UI animations</li><li>Ability to crop and integrate art assets in Mobile and Web platforms</li>  </ul> If you think you have what it takes, we want to hear from you! <br/><br/> We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.<br/><br/>Division: <br/> <strong>WSOP</strong>
Title: UI Artist

Job_Description: <br/><br/>   <br/><br/> <strong>Requisition ID:</strong> 182793 <br/> <strong>Work Area:</strong> Software-Development Operations <br/> <strong>Expected Travel:</strong> 0 - 10% <br/> <strong>Career Status:</strong> Student <br/> <strong>Employment Type:</strong> Intern <br/><br/> <strong>COMPANY DESCRIPTION</strong> <br/> SAP started in 1972 as a team of five colleagues with a desire to do something new. Together, they changed enterprise software and reinvented how business was done. Today, as a market leader in enterprise application software, we remain true to our roots. That’s why we engineer solutions to fuel innovation, foster equality and spread opportunity for our employees and customers across borders and cultures. <br/><br/> SAP values the entrepreneurial spirit, fostering creativity and building lasting relationships with our employees. We know that a diverse and inclusive workforce keeps us competitive and provides opportunities for all. We believe that together we can transform industries, grow economics, lift up societies and sustain our environment. Because it’s the best-run businesses that make the world run better and improve people’s lives. <br/><br/>   <br/><br/> <strong>What is SAP iXp?</strong> <br/><br/> SAP’s Internship Experience Project is a paid program that gives university students the space to find purpose in their careers. We believe that through placing passionate people on the right teams, providing leadership and learning opportunities, and working on impactful projects, purpose is born. Piqued your interest?  <br/><br/>   <br/><br/> <strong>Three reasons to apply for SAP iXp:</strong> <ul> <li><strong>No more fetching coffee:</strong> Work on in-depth projects, emerging products and technologies that drive business results.</li><li><strong>Lifelong learning:</strong> Meet with mentors, make new friends, and attend learning sessions from diverse subject matter experts.</li><li><strong>Gain visibility:</strong> With iXp in your title, you’ll have a global network of SAP leaders, entrepreneurs, and career development opportunities at your fingertips.</li> </ul>   <br/><br/> <strong>What you’ll do:</strong> <ul> <li><strong>Position Title: UX Design Intern</strong></li></ul>  <ul> <li><strong>Location: Vancouver, BC</strong></li><li><strong>Expected start date to end date: Sep 4, 2018 – May 3, 2019</strong></li> </ul>   <br/><br/> <strong>What is the purpose and objective of position?</strong> <ul> <li>Design solutions for Enterprise Collaboration software that connects and engages people, content, business data and processes.</li><li>Design solutions that embody the core principles of the digital enterprise: mobile, intelligent, real-time, conversational, automated and connected</li><li>Your experience will cover a full-spectrum UX role: exposure to product strategy, requirements elaboration, design discovery, ideation and sketching, user journeys, wireframes and usability testing.</li> </ul>   <br/><br/> <strong>Who we are:</strong> <br/><br/> Our team designs and delivers SAP Jam Collaboration and Communities. These SaaS products have a global reach of over 34 million subscribers and help connect our customers’ employees with the right experts, content, business data and processes to make their lives at work more productive and enjoyable. <br/><br/>   <br/><br/> As SAP team members we operate within a company that puts design at the forefront of product development. Our UX team is highly collaborative and works daily with Engineers and Product Managers. We are customer-needs driven and data informed. <br/><br/>   <br/><br/> <strong>Who you are:</strong> <br/><br/> We’re looking for someone who can challenge the status quo and likes to stay curious. You enjoy working on meaningful projects and are energized by lifelong learning. <ul> <li>You possess outstanding visual communication skills to convey concepts to teammates and stakeholders.</li><li>You contribute proactively to our design culture of learning, critique, testing and research.</li><li>You demonstrate a sharp focus on user needs, problem solving, creativity, and passion for developing usable, engaging, and elegant designs.</li> </ul>   <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities:</strong> <ul> <li>Solve complex problems based on data, user needs and business goals in an agile and fast-paced environment.</li><li>Create storyboards, user flows, wireframes and prototypes to communicate your design to other stakeholders.</li><li>Work cross-functionally to design and deliver high-quality solutions through multiple releases.</li> </ul>   <br/><br/>   <br/><br/> <strong>Qualifications:</strong> <ul> <li>At least in 3rd year of a relevant degree in Interactive Arts, Digital Media, HCI, User Experience Design, Interaction Design, Graphic Design or equivalent.</li><li>Familiarity with the principles of Lean UX and a willingness to work in a collaborative team directly with developers for the implementation of your designs.</li><li>Experience working with UX related tools, primarily Sketch, Illustrator and Photoshop.</li><li>An online portfolio that communicates your design process and outcome of your work.</li></ul>  <ul> <li>Applied knowledge of UX design principles: task analysis, heuristics, wireframing, user flows, information architecture, interaction design and design related artifacts across solutions for mobile and web projects.</li><li>Excellent communication, organization, and time management skills.</li> </ul>   <br/><br/> <strong>What you can expect from us:</strong> <ul> <li>An internship packed full of events to ensure you understand our technologies, our competitive landscape, our culture and our leadership philosophy.</li><li>Community of mentors and volunteer engagement teams to join and lead.</li><li>Collaborative open-concept work environment in the heart of Yaletown.</li><li>Games room, fitness classes, massage therapist, and 24/7 access to onsite gym.</li><li>Well-stocked snacks, coffee, teas, sodas and candy.</li> </ul>   <br/><br/> <strong>#iXp</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>WHAT YOU GET FROM US</strong> <br/><br/> Success is what you make it. At SAP, we help you make it your own.A career at SAP can open many doors for you. If you’re searching for a company that’s dedicated to your ideas and individual growth, recognizes you for your unique contributions, fills you with a strong sense of purpose, and provides a fun, flexible and inclusive work environment – apply now<em>.</em> <br/><br/> <strong>SAP'S DIVERSITY COMMITMENT</strong>  <br/> To harness the power of innovation, SAP invests in the development of its diverse employees. We aspire to leverage the qualities and appreciate the unique competencies that each person brings to the company. <br/><br/> SAP is committed to the principles of Equal Employment Opportunity and to providing reasonable accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to Recruiting Operations Team (Americas: Careers.NorthAmerica@sap.com or Careers.LatinAmerica@sap.com, APJ: Careers.APJ@sap.com, EMEA: Careers@sap.com). <br/><br/> Successful candidates might be required to undergo a background verification with an external vendor. <br/><br/> <strong>Additional Locations</strong>:
Title: SAP iXp Intern - UX Designer

Job_Description: Vanilla is searching for a talented <strong>Graphic and UI Designer</strong> who wants to join a profitable and rapidly growing SaaS startup. As the sole full time designer at Vanilla, you would wear more than one hat and be part of both the product and marketing teams. <br/> Ideally, you have solid experience wireframing and mocking up user interfaces, as well as the capacity to product logos, graphics and other graphical assets for both product and marketing initiatives. You should be comfortable taking ownership of the visual brand as well as its aesthetics, and should be ready to enforce brand conformity throughout our messaging. <br/> Were a highly collaborative team of people that love what we do. Our open office format allows us to talk through solutions and brainstorm often, and were looking for someone that will actively contribute in that kind of environment. <br/> This position is located in <strong>Montreal, Quebec</strong> and reports to the <strong>Chief Product Officer</strong>. Remote workers will <strong>not</strong> be considered. <br/> <strong>RESPONSIBILITIES</strong>:  <ul> <li>Work with internal customers, briefing and advising them with regard to design style, format, print and web production, and timescales- Think creatively and develop new design concepts, graphics and layouts- Complete projects by coordinating with outside agencies, art services, printers, etc as needed- Work with a wide range of media and use graphic design software- Act as a company-wide artistic / graphic consultant to ensure consistent brand messaging- Amend final designs to clients comments and gain full approval<strong>SKILLS AND PERSONAL TRAITS</strong>:</li> <li>Graphic design skills- Layout skills- Strong customer focus- Creativity- Flexibility- Attention to detail- Deadline-oriented- Acute vision- Able to handle constructive criticism<strong>COMPENSATION AND PERKS</strong>:</li> <li>Competitive salary, performance based bonuses- Headroom for professional growth- Startup perks: ping pong, video games, snacks, drinks, etc.Vanilla helps organizations build unique online communities that are used by millions of people each month. What we do makes the internet more diverse, more useful and more fun. Were looking for passionate, hard working people who want to help us reinvent community forum software. We offer a casual work environment, health benefits, Mac (and Cintiq) gear, free snacks and a job that youll love! <br/> Vanilla is an <strong>equal opportunity employer</strong> and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. <br/> Job Types: Full-time, Permanent <br/> <strong>Experience:</li>  </strong> <br/> <strong><li>UI Design: 2 yearsEducation:</li>  </strong> <br/> <strong><li>High school or equivalentLocation:</li>  </strong> <br/> <strong><li>Montréal, QCLanguage:</li>  </strong>  <li>English</li> </ul>
Title: Graphic and UI Designer

Job_Description: <strong>Position Overview</strong> <br/><br/> BioWare, a member of the incredible family of EA studios, has created some of the world's best-selling titles (including the Mass Effect and Dragon Age series). <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities:</strong> <ul> <li>Create player-centered designs by considering player motivations, gameplay experiences, user research, and usability findings</li><li>Develop user flows, wireframes, and prototypes to effectively communicate game design requirements</li> <li>Develop and maintain detailed user-interface specifications and design patterns that align with an existing UI design system</li><li>Develop UX requirements with key stakeholders to define design objectives and to align with overarching goals</li><li>Work closely with game designers, UX designers and UI artists to execute design.</li><li>Present design work for review and feedback with ability to go over methods, explorations, and rationale.</li><li>Support your design decisions using data such as player feedback, and user research</li><li>Thrive in a fast paced work environment requiring independent self-direction with an aptitude for team collaboration and open communication</li>  </ul> <strong>Qualifications</strong> <ul> <li>An online portfolio or samples of work demonstrating experience creating great user-centered design solutions</li><li>Examples of wireframes, low to high fidelity prototypes and information architecture mapping</li> <li>Excellent communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills.</li><li>Ability to have a bias for action in a fast-paced, sometimes ambiguous environment with multiple stakeholders and / or conflicting needs</li> <li>Highly motivated self-starter; capable of operating with minimal management oversight.</li> <li>Knowledge of usability principles and techniques</li> <li>Working to a degree in Interaction Design, Psychology, Human Factors, Industrial Engineering or related HCI discipline, or demonstrated proficiency and experiences in the field of software user experience/interaction design.</li> <li>Proficiency in a variety of design tools such as Illustrator, Photoshop, Axure (or other flow + prototyping tools)</li><li>Experience in game development is a strong asset</li> <li>Passion for gaming</li> </ul> <br/><br/> <strong>About EA</strong> <br/><br/> Its not easy building the worlds best digital playground. Its hair-standing-up-on-end-exhilarating. Its down-in-the-trenches-challenging. Its stroke-of-brilliance-at-midnight creative. Its youtaking risks, challenging yourself, pursuing ideas, changing the way millions of people do something they love: Play. Were EAweve been making games for decades but you wouldnt know that walking through our studios. Were still buzzing with the same innovative spirit we began with, though weve learned enough to earn our rank as a leading developer, publisher and distributor of the worlds best games. What began as a small group of people determined to put real life in a box has become an 8,000-people strong, worldwide organization delivering on that very dream. If youve played The Sims lately, you know exactly what we mean. And if youve played Battlefield 1, maybe youd say that weve done real life one better. <br/><br/> Whether youre building Springfield on your mobile or your palms are sweaty from clutching your controller during intense games of FIFA 17, chances are youve played an EA game. And if you havent, well, what are you waiting for? In an industry thats changing every daywhether its through new social channels, advancing technology, new audiences or unique opportunities for monetizationEA is positioned for growth thanks to smart business plans, strategic acquisitions, and most importantly, our creative people around the world who gather each day to unite the world through play. We take that last part very seriously, so if what youre reading excites you as much as it does us, we invite you to get to know us better.
Title: Associate UX Designer co-op

Job_Description: <strong>What is the opportunity?</strong> <br/><br/> RBC Investor & Treasury Services (RBC I&TS) has developed a multi-year Business Transformation strategy that focuses on aligning our clients requirements with system enhancements designed to improve their overall experience, enhance operational efficiency and reduce risk. By investing in new talent, functionality and products, we envision technology services that deliver optimum support for our clients, whether for ongoing activities or in response to market or global regulatory change. <br/><br/> This role will be the lead in creating the portals overall user experience through establishing UX principles and driving alignment across a multi-geographic, multi-lab Agile program. Key deliverables will include establishing a common user experience by identifying areas where commonality is required; while at the same time enabling innovation and lab specific designs to address unique elements of the client set each lab is targeting. <br/><br/> <strong>What will you do?</strong> <ul> <li>Establish the overall UX strategy and UI guidelines for the digital services including the integration of both legacy and new applications and transition process of moving through UI evolutions</li><li>Work proactively with Product Owners to understand their roadmaps and feature needs and align work effort to maximize consistency and efficiency</li><li>Lead a team of 4-6 UI / UX designers across two geographies and build the necessary skillset within the group to support all current and upcoming needs and meet the overall RBC I&TS business goalsActs as a user experience advocate regarding principles of cumulative customer experience and user-centered design</li><li>Involved in usability testing along with Product Owner and Client Engagement where client users will experience the product offering and UX. Must have the ability to establish testing criteria, assess testing outcomes and work with project teams to adjust UX and functionality to meet the needs of the users.</li><li>Rationalize solutions and effectively communicate ideas/designs via sitemaps, userflows, wireframes, prototypes and high-fidelity design comps</li><li>Design multiple options, trust the iterative process, and understand that the first idea is not always the best</li><li>Present the user interface visually so information is easy to read, understand, and find.</li><li>Mindfully design for the users full portal experience including their activities on legacy elements and the needs to pass back and forth between applications.</li> </ul> <strong>What do you need to succeed?</strong> <br/><br/> <strong> Must-Haves</strong> <ul> <li>5+ years experience working in digital creative teams and 3+ years managing design team, ideal across multiple geographies.</li><li>Strong skills in using design tools (Adobe Photoshop and/or Sketch, Illustrator, and presentation software) and principles (typography, grid systems, visual hierarchy, colour, white space, etc.)</li><li>Strong experience in working through the entire design process using methods like sketching, storyboarding, diagramming, wire-framing, usability testing and prototyping for screen-based experiences. Ability to actively lead a team through zero-based design processes.</li><li>Strong skills in stakeholder management, strategic planning and roadmap delivery</li><li>Strong prototyping skills with tools like Axure and/or InVision</li><li>Fluent in communicating conceptual ideas and design rationale</li><li>Must have a recent portfolio of work samples showcasing UX and UI expertise</li><li>Must have an exceptional eye for detail and passion for quality, and provide quality assurance on creative deliverable</li> </ul> <strong>Nice-to-Haves:</strong> <ul> <li>Experience in Financial Services industry in association with multiple products</li><li>BA/BS degree in Design (e.g. interaction, graphic, visual communications, product, industrial), HCI, CS, or a related field or equivalent experience.</li><li>Knowledge and/or experience in the agile environment</li> </ul> <strong>Whats in it for you?</strong> <br/><br/> We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual. <ul> <li>A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable</li><li>4 weeks vacation</li><li>Work in an environment promoting continuous learning through learning session, study group, external event, online learning.</li><li>Become part of a team that thinks progressively and works collaboratively. We care about seeing each other reach full potential.</li><li>Working in a unique atmosphere dedicated to Innovation.</li><li>Ability to make a difference and lasting impact from a local-to-global scale</li><li>Work on Next Gen Technology to lead the way in Innovation</li><li>Work in a dynamic, collaborative, transparent, non-hierarchal and ego-free culture where your talent is valued over your role title.</li> </ul> SFDG <br/><br/> <strong>Learn more about RBC Tech Jobs</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>About RBC</strong> <br/> Royal Bank of Canada is Canadas largest bank, and one of the largest banks in the world, based on market capitalization. We are one of North Americas leading diversified financial services companies, and provide personal and commercial banking, wealth management, insurance, investor services and capital markets products and services on a global basis. We have over 80,000 full- and part-time employees who serve more than 16 million personal, business, public sector and institutional clients through offices in Canada, the U.S. and 37 other countries. For more information, please visit rbc.com. <br/><br/> <strong>Join our Talent Community</strong> <br/><br/> Stay in-the-know about great career opportunities at RBC. Sign up and get customized info on our latest jobs, career tips and Recruitment events that matter to you. <br/><br/> Expand your limits and create a new future together at RBC. Find out how we use our passion and drive to enhance the well-being of our clients and communities at rbc.com/careers. <br/><br/> <strong>Inclusion and Equal Opportunity Employment</strong> <br/> RBC is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We are pleased to consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veterans status, Aboriginal/Native American status or any other legally-protected factors. Disability-related accommodations during the application process are available upon request. <br/><br/> <u><strong>JOB SUMMARY</strong></u> <br/> <strong>City:</strong>  Toronto <br/> <strong>Address:</strong> 145 Wellington Street West <br/> <strong>Work Hours/Week:</strong> 37.5 <br/> <strong>Work Environment:</strong>  Office <br/> <strong>Employment Type:</strong> Permanent <br/> <strong>Career Level:</strong>  Experienced Hire/Professional <br/> <strong>Pay Type:</strong> Salary + Variable Bonus <br/> <strong>Required Travel(%):</strong> 0-25 <br/> <strong>Exempt/Non-Exempt:</strong> N/A <br/> <strong>People Manager:</strong>  Yes <br/> <strong>Application Deadline:</strong>  2018-05-31 <br/> <strong>Req ID:</strong> 163899 <br/><br/> <em>Posting Notes: [[mfield1]]</em>
Title: Sr. Manager, UX / UI Architect

Job_Description: <div> Designer d’interfaces et d’expériences utilisateur - UI/UX Designer <br/> <br/>  Montreal <br/> <strong>, QC </strong> <br/> <br/>  Apply now</div><br/>  <div><strong>Description du poste</strong> <ul> <li>Effectuer des recherches en technologies, en concepts et en meilleures pratiques d’interfaces utilisateur et faire part de ses recommandations à l’équipe de gestion;</li><li>Produire des prototypes rapides de nouvelles idées et les présenter aux développeurs et aux artistes;</li><li>Identifier les méthodes travail communes en production et développer des interfaces qui les optimisent;</li><li>Participer à la création d’un guide formel d’interfaces utilisateur qui puisse servir de référence pour tout développement logiciel, tant basé sur le web que sur Qt;</li><li>Élaborer des directives de design qui puissent s’adapter aux divers emplacements et contextes de l’entreprise;</li><li>Créer et organiser des éléments d’interface tels que des kits d’interface, des icônes, des éléments servant aux présentations publiques;</li><li>Créer de magnifiques designs d’interfaces qui contribueront à l’image de marque de l’entreprise.</li> </ul> <strong>Job Description</strong> <ul> <li>Research latest UI technologies, concepts and best practices and provide recommendations to the management team.</li><li>Rapidly prototype new ideas to present examples to both developers and artists.</li><li>Research common workflows of users in production and develop interface solutions to optimize their tasks.</li><li>Formalize Human Interface Guide as reference literature for all application development, both web and Qt based.</li><li>Work with multiple sites on a consistent, locally adaptable design guideline to address location specific differences.</li><li>Create and organize art assets like UI kits, icons and PR initiatives.</li><li>Brand and create beautiful UI designs for our internal products.</li>  </ul>  Requirements<br/><br/>The Moving Picture Company (MPC), dont les studios sont situés aux quatre coins du globe, est un des leaders mondiaux de l’industrie des effets spéciaux (VFX). <br/><br/> Notre reconnaissance mondiale dans le monde des effets visuels s’est construite par le développement de logiciels de pointe permettant à nos artistes de créer des effets visuels exceptionnels. Notre histoire est riche d’innovations technologiques et nous reconnaissons que c’est le mariage de celles-ci et d’une créativité hors pair qui produit les résultats les plus spectaculaires. La technologie est pour nous au service de la créativité et nous sommes toujours à la recherche de solutions permettant des résultats de meilleure qualité. Notre équipe est talentueuse et a été le berceau des meilleurs technologues de l’industrie. <br/><br/> Le développement de nouvelles techniques d’effets visuels et la création d’outils de productivité innovants sont essentiels au succès de MPC. Cette responsabilité incombe au département de R&D, qui est à la recherche d’un <strong>Designer d’interfaces et d’expériences utilisateur</strong>. Le candidat retenu concevra des interfaces et des expériences utilisateur parmi les plus intuitives, attrayantes et innovantes au monde. <br/><br/> Il s’agit d’une occasion sans pareil de travailler dans le monde dynamique des effets visuels. Vous êtes un designer d’interfaces et d’expériences utilisateur ambitieux qui cherche à travailler avec des technologies de pointe? Contactez-nous! <br/><br/> With offices all over the globe, the Moving Picture Company (MPC) is one of the world&apos;s leading visual effects studios, creating high-end VFX for the advertising and feature film industries. <br/><br/> Our status as a world-class visual effects facility has been achieved through the development of industry-leading software, which empowers our artists to create stunning visual effects. MPC has a rich history of technical innovation. We recognise that it’s the partnership of leading creativity and technology that delivers spectacular results. We are committed to technology in service of creativity and are constantly exploring new approaches to deliver higher quality. We have a talented team and many of the leading technologists in the industry started their careers at MPC. <br/><br/> Our Software team combines award winning, third party software with our own tools and technologies to create powerful and innovative solutions to the most challenging visual effects requirements. Our developers create software, which addresses the needs of clients in today’s constantly evolving visual effects environment. <br/><br/> You can see the result of our software being put through it’s paces as part of our stunning film showreel containing work completed in 2017 - the link’s at the end of this page.<br/><br/>Qualifications  <ul> <li>Baccalauréat ou maîtrise en interfaces humain-machine, en sciences cognitives, en design graphique ou l’équivalent;</li><li>3 ans ou plus d’expérience en design d’interfaces et d’interactivité;</li><li>Doit présenter un portfolio d’illustrations et de designs graphiques pertinents qui démontrent le niveau de qualité et de constance recherchés;</li><li>Connaissance des normes web et des meilleures pratiques en utilisabilité;</li><li>Bases solides en design et attention minutieuse aux détails visuels et d’interaction;</li><li>Compréhension de la conception axée sur l’utilisateur et habilités démontrées en design d’interaction;</li><li>Capacité à trouver des solutions créatives à des problèmes de design complexes;</li><li>Habilités de base en programmation (HTML, CSS, Javascript, Qt) et / ou la capacité de créer des prototypes est un atout;</li><li>Connaissance des outils de la suite d’Adobe.</li> </ul> <strong>Atouts supplémentaires</strong> <ul> <li>Expérience en conception d’applications logicielles de bureau;</li><li>Connaissance des logiciels de conception 3D (p.ex. Maya, Cinema 4D, ZBrush);</li><li>Expérience en animation (p.ex. Maya, After Effects, CSS, Javascript);</li><li>Connaissance des effets visuels ou des processus de production;</li><li>Design d’applications en réalité virtuelle.</li> </ul> <strong>Qualification</strong> <ul> <li>Bachelor&apos;s or Master&apos;s degree in Human Factors, HCI, cognitive science, graphic design or equivalent.</li><li>3+ years of UI design and interactive work.</li><li>Must provide a solid and consistent body of relevant illustration and graphic design work.</li><li>Knowledge of web standards & usability best practices.</li><li>A solid design background with an obsessive eye for visual and interaction details.</li><li>Understanding of user-centered design process and proven interaction design abilities.</li><li>Creativity to invent new solutions to complex design problems</li><li>Basic coding skills (HTML, CSS, Javascript, QT) and/or the ability to create prototypes is a plus.</li><li>Knowledgeable with Adobe Suite softwares.</li> </ul> <strong>Would be nice to have:</strong> <ul> <li>Experience designing desktop software applications.</li><li>Familiarity with 3D software (ex: Maya / Cinema 4D / ZBrush) applications.</li><li>Animation experience (ex: Maya, After Effects, CSS, Javascript).</li> <li>Knowledge of VFX or media production processes.</li><li>VR app design experience.</li></ul></div>  <br/>Apply now

Title: Designer d’interfaces et d’expériences utilisateur - UI/UX Designer

Job_Description: <strong><u>About Us</u></strong> <br/><br/> Do you want to be a part of something disruptive and change an entire industry? Do you want to be a part of a best-in-class culture? Do you want to be in the first wave of individuals to help shape the growth of a company? If you are excited about anything you just read, we'd love for you to be a part of the Upchain team! <br/><br/> At Upchain, we are looking to turn the PLM (Product Lifecycle Management) industry on its head. By 2021, many projects the SaaS PLM industry to be worth over $40 Billion USD, and we are driven to make our mark! We have the product, we have the vision, and we have the plannow we need a great team to execute! <br/><br/> <strong><u>Job Description</u></strong> <br/><br/> The Upchain UI/UX Architect is responsible for collaboration with users, designers, frontend developers and product managers to develop interfaces that excel the users' experience. The architect will develop conceptual models, wireframes, workflows and storyboards based on users' personas. Validation of the designs will through direct interaction of all stake holders including the end users. As part of our Architecture team, you will collaborate closely with other members of the Engineering and Product Management teams in order to address UI related issues and new functional improvements. <br/><br/> <strong><u>UX/UI Architect Responsibilities:</u></strong>  <ul>  	<li>Lead the UI Design and work collaboratively with all stake holders</li>  <li>Maintain design style guide and accountable for Frontend developers' UI implementation guidance</li>  <li>Utilize wireframe and prototyping tools such as InVision for conveying early designs</li>  <li>Create intuitive persona based workflow and UI navigation with number of clicks minimization</li>  <li>UI consistency across the applications and utilization of HTML/CSS</li>  <li>Design GUI elements across the application which include menus, tabs, widgets</li>  <li>Collaboration with Developers and Product Managers throughout the software development lifecycle</li>  <li>Establishment of best practices in UI design with reusable templates, components and designs</li>  <li>Providing technical support for UX field issues when needed</li> </ul> <strong><u>UX/UI Architect Qualifications & Skills:</u></strong>  <ul>  	<li>Bachelor's / Master's Degree in Computer Science preferably in HCI or related field</li>  <li>Over 5 years' experience in user interface and interaction design</li>  <li>Over 5 years' experience for Web application and nice to have Mobile experience</li>  <li>Over 3 years' experience in HTML and CSS</li> </ul>
Title: UX/UI Architect

Title: UI Developer

Job_Description: Busbud is the bus travel booking app and website with the largest sellable coverage. Users can search, compare and buy tickets from hundreds of bus companies in over 13,000 cities and more than 1M different bus routes. <br/><br/> We're working hard to make the bus, one of the most environmentally friendly and sustainable modes of transportation, a great travel option for customers in dozens of languages in over 70 different countries. Our platform unites travelers, partners and bus companies throughout the world to move an increasingly large share of the entire industry online to increase access and improve the travel experience. <br/><br/> Our people, technology and approach have been instrumental in getting us this far, but we have so much more to do, and that's where you come in. <br/><br/> <strong>What do we expect from you?</strong>  <ul> <li>Produce reproducible UI designs for all our products/platforms (mobile web, desktop web, iOS/Android apps, email);</li> <li>Identify UX problems and develop solutions with product managers and engineers;</li> <li>Create graphic designs for our landing pages and apps;</li> <li>Maintain, complete and improve a consistent, cross-platform style guide;</li> <li>Contribute to product planification, user research and integration efforts;</li> <li>Support marketing, brand, recruiting efforts.</li> </ul> <strong>How can you impress us?</strong>  <ul> <li>Capacity to leverage data (research, user feedback, benchmarking, analytics, market data) to formulate assumptions that explain your design choices;</li> <li>Capacity to consider multiple design options with pros and cons;</li>   <li>Attention to details and appreciation for quality in design, composition and implementation;</li> <li>Ability to contribute to product-related discussions;</li> <li>Ability to communicate clearly and efficiently with stakeholders;</li> <li>Good knowledge of UX/UI challenges in mobility, travel or e-commerce;</li> <li>Examples of previous digital design projects;</li> <li>Good understanding of HTML, CSS and a (or more) components-based Javascript framework;</li> <li>Good knowledge of Sketch;</li> <li>Up to date with the latest design guidelines and trends.</li> </ul> <strong>Whats in it for you?</strong>  <ul> <li>Compensation based on experience</li> <li>4 weeks of vacation (3 weeks + holiday season)</li> <li>Health Benefits</li> <li>Stock options</li> <li>Apple equipment</li> <li>Breakfast snacks, team lunch on Wednesdays, happy hour on Fridays</li> <li>Team events</li> </ul> <em>Visas and work permits</em>  <ul> <li>If you are not already authorized to live and work in Canada, we will sponsor the following work permits:</li> <li>R204(a) T23 (university graduates who are citizens of the U.S., Mexico, Chile, Peru, Colombia or South Korea)</li> <li>IEC Young Professionals (age and citizenship requirements)</li> <li>Employer-specific work permit</li> </ul> Busbud is committed to equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing its team members with a work environment free from discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at Busbud are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, regardless of race, colour, religion or belief, national, social or ethnic origin, sex, age, physical, mental or sensory disability, HIV status, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, marital, civil union or domestic partnership status, pregnancy, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. Learn more about why we care about diversity.
Title: Product Designer UI

Job_Description: Company Description<br/><br/>Basé Montréal, Behaviour Interactif est un des plus grands développeurs de jeux vidéo indépendants en Amérique du Nord. Ancré dans lindustrie depuis plus de 25 ans, son succès se caractérise par sa versatilité produire des jeux pour les plus grands acteurs du domaine et développer ses propriétés intellectuelles exclusives, et ce, sur toutes les grandes plateformes. Travailler chez Behaviour cest se joindre une entreprise québécoise dotée dune culture entrepreneuriale qui favorise les opportunités et le développement personnel, tout en donnant tous le sentiment de faire une différence.<br/><br/>Job Description<br/><br/><strong>Responsabilités :</strong> <ul> <li>Concevoir et créer le contenu visuel associé aux menus et aux interfaces de jeu ;</li><li>Créer les menus, le déroulement des menus, les différents éléments et fonctionnalités et la mise en page ;</li><li>Participer aux réunions déquipe et partager son savoir et ses idées ;</li><li>Compléter les recherches et recueillir linformation nécessaire avant dentreprendre une nouvelle tâche afin dassurer une gestion efficace de son temps ;</li><li>Atteindre les objectifs grâce une pleine compréhension des besoins graphiques du jeu, et ce, en ayant en main le matériel de référence nécessaire et une bonne compréhension de la direction artistique et des exigences techniques ;</li><li>Travailler en étroite collaboration avec léquipe de programmation;</li> </ul>  Qualifications<br/><br/><strong>Exigences :</strong> <ul> <li>Diplôme en design graphique ou disciplines connexes;</li><li>2 5 ans dexpérience en conception graphique (ou expérience équivalente), plus précisément en matière de développement dinterfaces et de conception de menus;</li><li>Expérience de conception UI et UX dans lindustrie du jeu vidéo;</li><li>Maitriser Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator, et Flash;</li><li>Avoir de très bonnes notions en typographie et en théorie de la couleur, en conception de la mise en page et en animation;</li><li>Être créatif, autonome et avoir une bonne capacité dadaptation aux différentes demandes;</li><li>Être en mesure de travailler dans une équipe multidisciplinaire;</li><li>Capacités identifier les forces et faiblesses des différentes interfaces;</li><li>Être passionné de jeux vidéos;</li><li>Avoir des connaissances en conception 3D et en création de sites web est considéré un atout;</li><li>Avoir de lexpérience avec lengin Unity est considéré un atout.</li> </ul>
Title: Concepteur UI - Dead by Daylight

Job_Description: <strong>About RED</strong> <br/><br/> RED Academy is a technology academy formed for the designers, creators, developers and digital marketers of tomorrow. Our purpose is to provide highly engaging, immersive learning programs for our students, that will provide them with the relevant technical skills and knowledge to succeed in today’s rapidly evolving workplace. <br/><br/> With schools open in Vancouver, Toronto and London UK, and 1000 students graduated in 18 months, the top 5 fastest growing tech company in Canada is continuing to grow. <br/><br/> We believe in autonomy, mastery and purpose, meaning that we encourage our staff to drive their own role, while we provide you with mentoring, training and personal development to support you in building a path you love and can truly connect with. <br/><br/> And best of all, all of our people share a deep passion for what they do: for design and technology, and finding the most forward-thinking ways of delivering a truly world-class learning experience for our students, all of which makes RED an amazing place to work. <br/><br/> In short, working at RED is unlike anything you will have experienced before. Aside from the deeply rewarding work of teaching and mentoring, we offer great holiday allocation & flexible working, benefits, health plan and a wide array of opportunities to be involved in the local tech and impact communities through our events and partnerships. <br/><br/> <strong>Who we are looking for</strong> <br/><br/> We’re on the lookout for a confident UX / UI designer with 4 years of experience to come join our growing team of instructors. <br/><br/> We look for people with a passion for sharing their knowledge who have significant real-world experience. Educational experience is a bonus, but all of our instructional team receive in-depth training in the latest instructional and educational approaches, and so this is much less important than your attitude, knowledge and portfolio. <br/><br/> You will be joining a team of designers to help shape and deliver our part-time UX and UI Programs. <br/><br/> Our classes are taught in small teams with a low ratio of students per instructor. The programs are designed to be relevant to the tech world of today with personalised, applied learning content, working on projects from our network of partners. <br/><br/> <strong>Skills and qualifications</strong>  <ul>  <li>You are the person that your colleagues naturally gravitate to when they are looking for guidance. You are a strong team leader with problem-solving and analytical thinking skills. You are proactive, autonomous and resourceful. You have at least 3-5 years of experience working in UX and UI design - designing and building digital products (although 3 years of varied experience is better than 1 years experience 5 times!).</li>    <li>You have fluency in some or all of the following topics: user experience design, user interface design, prototyping, ideation, digital marketing, creative thinking, logo design, visual communication, app & responsive web design. As well as experience with industry design tools like Sketch, Creative Suite and Prototyping tools such as InVision, Axure, Principle, Framer.js as well as some understanding of HTML/CSS.</li>    <li>Above all you have a great portfolio of work and a love for what you do.</li>    </ul> <br/><br/> <strong>Things that are not important to us</strong>  <ul>  <li>Professors, we are actually looking for professionals with strong design experience and expertise. Experience over ego please :)</li>    <li>A degree. Degrees are great fun, but not essential. RED is about lifelong learning.</li>    </ul> <br/><br/> <strong>Primary duties and responsibilities</strong>  <ul>  <li>Delivering an extraordinary student learning experience through passionate and informative teaching techniques and lesson delivery</li>    <li>Providing both verbal and written feedback during the student’s learning program to achieve NPS > 25</li>   </ul>    <ul>  <li>Collaboratively research and develop radically relevant programs, curriculum and educational approaches to ensure we are providing the highest possible quality of learner experience design to our students</li>   </ul>    <ul>  <li>Support admissions process to ensure school hits capacity each cohort, helping to design assets and regular attendance of promotional events</li>    <li>Continuous development of assessments and managing the graduation criteria through agreed processes and policies.</li>    </ul> <strong>Great, so where do I apply?</strong> <br/><br/> If you are interested in this role, please apply directly on this page with your CV and a covering letter, providing three key reasons why you feel you would be the perfect fit. We aim to get back to you within a week to confirm if you have passed our initial sift. <br/><br/> RED Academy is an equal opportunities employer and welcome applications from all.
Title: Lead Part-Time UX/UI Instructor

Job_Description: Lead UX Designer/Principal UX Designer <div> <div> <div> <div> <div><div><div>Lead UX Designer/Principal UX Designer</div></div></div><div> <div><strong>Careers Category:</strong></div><div><div>Art & User Experience</div></div></div><div> <div><strong>Careers Region:</strong></div><div><div>North America</div></div></div><div> <div><strong>Careers Location:</strong></div><div><div>Toronto, Canada</div></div></div><div><div><div><strong>PRINCIPAL UX DESIGNER</strong> <br/><br/> The Principal User Experience Designer assists Franchise Leads in developing the XD vision of a product(s) and executing upon that vision. This role leads the effort in innovative and ground breaking design solutions to create user-centered design solutions that promote ease of use, employ best-in-class game/interaction design, and optimize the user experience universally in response to user testing. <br/><br/> Lead all phases of the design process including conceptual design/development, graphic and interface design, interaction models, prototypes, user/task flows and art production. <br/><br/> Works closely with Franchise Stakeholders to establish and maintain the visual integrity, interaction methods, brand standards, and consistency for the game and collaborate with Product Management and Engineering for execution of design. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities:</strong>  <ul> <li>Able to identify needs for, design and conduct user experience research quickly and apply it to feature UX development</li> <li>Evaluates designs quickly and creates original high quality work. Owns the entire product UX and its features</li></ul>  <ul> <li>Possess excellent understanding of visual design principles, style guidelines, design processes, and creative workflow</li></ul>  <ul> <li>Develop UI, graphic design, and interaction specifications/guidelines</li></ul>  <ul> <li>Employ user-centered design practices to deliver world-class interactive game experiences</li></ul>  <ul> <li>Consistently generate creative ideas for products and can present and sell design concepts at the franchise and company level</li> <li>Persuasively recommends and promotes UX ideas with enthusiasm, conviction, and assertiveness.</li></ul>  <ul> <li>Interface, collaborate with team, studio and company stakeholders to ensure the user experience reflects player needs and consistency</li> </ul>  <strong>Required Skills:</strong>  <ul> <li>8+ years’ experience in the User Experience Design</li> <li>Shipped multiple successful mobile products end-to-end</li></ul>  <ul> <li>Mastery level skills in Adobe Photoshop and industry-standard prototyping tools</li></ul>  <ul> <li>Mastery understanding of UX principles</li></ul>  <ul> <li>Specialty in mobile, messaging and chat interface design</li></ul>  <ul> <li>Hands-on experience or knowledge of JavaScript coding and animation/motion design is a plus</li></ul>  <ul> <li>Ability to set direction, lead, train and mentor teams of designers</li> <li>Excellent written and verbal communication</li></ul>  <ul> <li>Passion for casual gaming and youth pop culture</li></ul>  <ul> <li>Master’s degree in graphic arts, interaction design, or equivalent industry experience in design field</li> </ul>  </div></div></div><div><div><div>Apply Now</div></div></div><div> <div><strong>Jobvite ID:</strong></div><div><div>oJAK6fwT</div></div></div><div> <div><strong>Requisition ID:</strong></div><div><div>P204811</div></div></div></div></div>  </div> </div>
Title: Lead UX Designer/Principal UX Designer

Job_Description: Company Description<br/><br/>The Moving Picture Company (MPC), dont les studios sont situés aux quatre coins du globe, est un des leaders mondiaux de lindustrie des effets spéciaux (VFX). <br/><br/> Notre reconnaissance mondiale dans le monde des effets visuels sest construite par le développement de logiciels de pointe permettant nos artistes de créer des effets visuels exceptionnels. Notre histoire est riche dinnovations technologiques et nous reconnaissons que cest le mariage de celles-ci et dune créativité hors pair qui produit les résultats les plus spectaculaires. La technologie est pour nous au service de la créativité et nous sommes toujours la recherche de solutions permettant des résultats de meilleure qualité. Notre équipe est talentueuse et a été le berceau des meilleurs technologues de lindustrie. <br/><br/> Le développement de nouvelles techniques deffets visuels et la création doutils de productivité innovants sont essentiels au succès de MPC. Cette responsabilité incombe au département de R&D, qui est la recherche dun <strong>Designer dinterfaces et dexpériences utilisateur</strong>. Le candidat retenu concevra des interfaces et des expériences utilisateur parmi les plus intuitives, attrayantes et innovantes au monde. <br/><br/> Il sagit dune occasion sans pareil de travailler dans le monde dynamique des effets visuels. Vous êtes un designer dinterfaces et dexpériences utilisateur ambitieux qui cherche travailler avec des technologies de pointe? Contactez-nous! <br/><br/> With offices all over the globe, the Moving Picture Company (MPC) is one of the world&apos;s leading visual effects studios, creating high-end VFX for the advertising and feature film industries. <br/><br/> Our status as a world-class visual effects facility has been achieved through the development of industry-leading software, which empowers our artists to create stunning visual effects. MPC has a rich history of technical innovation. We recognise that its the partnership of leading creativity and technology that delivers spectacular results. We are committed to technology in service of creativity and are constantly exploring new approaches to deliver higher quality. We have a talented team and many of the leading technologists in the industry started their careers at MPC. <br/><br/> Our Software team combines award winning, third party software with our own tools and technologies to create powerful and innovative solutions to the most challenging visual effects requirements. Our developers create software, which addresses the needs of clients in todays constantly evolving visual effects environment. <br/><br/> You can see the result of our software being put through its paces as part of our stunning film showreel containing work completed in 2017 - the links at the end of this page.<br/><br/>Job Description<br/><br/><strong>Description du poste</strong> <ul> <li>Effectuer des recherches en technologies, en concepts et en meilleures pratiques dinterfaces utilisateur et faire part de ses recommandations léquipe de gestion;</li><li>Produire des prototypes rapides de nouvelles idées et les présenter aux développeurs et aux artistes;</li><li>Identifier les méthodes travail communes en production et développer des interfaces qui les optimisent;</li><li>Participer la création dun guide formel dinterfaces utilisateur qui puisse servir de référence pour tout développement logiciel, tant basé sur le web que sur Qt;</li><li>Élaborer des directives de design qui puissent sadapter aux divers emplacements et contextes de lentreprise;</li><li>Créer et organiser des éléments dinterface tels que des kits dinterface, des icônes, des éléments servant aux présentations publiques;</li><li>Créer de magnifiques designs dinterfaces qui contribueront limage de marque de lentreprise.</li> </ul> <strong>Job Description</strong> <ul> <li>Research latest UI technologies, concepts and best practices and provide recommendations to the management team.</li><li>Rapidly prototype new ideas to present examples to both developers and artists.</li><li>Research common workflows of users in production and develop interface solutions to optimize their tasks.</li><li>Formalize Human Interface Guide as reference literature for all application development, both web and Qt based.</li><li>Work with multiple sites on a consistent, locally adaptable design guideline to address location specific differences.</li><li>Create and organize art assets like UI kits, icons and PR initiatives.</li><li>Brand and create beautiful UI designs for our internal products.</li>  </ul>  <strong>Qualifications</strong>  <ul> <li>Baccalauréat ou maîtrise en interfaces humain-machine, en sciences cognitives, en design graphique ou léquivalent;</li><li>3 ans ou plus dexpérience en design dinterfaces et dinteractivité;</li><li>Doit présenter un portfolio dillustrations et de designs graphiques pertinents qui démontrent le niveau de qualité et de constance recherchés;</li><li>Connaissance des normes web et des meilleures pratiques en utilisabilité;</li><li>Bases solides en design et attention minutieuse aux détails visuels et dinteraction;</li><li>Compréhension de la conception axée sur lutilisateur et habilités démontrées en design dinteraction;</li><li>Capacité trouver des solutions créatives des problèmes de design complexes;</li><li>Habilités de base en programmation (HTML, CSS, Javascript, Qt) et / ou la capacité de créer des prototypes est un atout;</li><li>Connaissance des outils de la suite dAdobe.</li> </ul> <strong>Atouts supplémentaires</strong> <ul> <li>Expérience en conception dapplications logicielles de bureau;</li><li>Connaissance des logiciels de conception 3D (p.ex. Maya, Cinema 4D, ZBrush);</li><li>Expérience en animation (p.ex. Maya, After Effects, CSS, Javascript);</li><li>Connaissance des effets visuels ou des processus de production;</li><li>Design dapplications en réalité virtuelle.</li> </ul> <strong>Qualification</strong> <ul> <li>Bachelor&apos;s or Master&apos;s degree in Human Factors, HCI, cognitive science, graphic design or equivalent.</li><li>3+ years of UI design and interactive work.</li><li>Must provide a solid and consistent body of relevant illustration and graphic design work.</li><li>Knowledge of web standards & usability best practices.</li><li>A solid design background with an obsessive eye for visual and interaction details.</li><li>Understanding of user-centered design process and proven interaction design abilities.</li><li>Creativity to invent new solutions to complex design problems</li><li>Basic coding skills (HTML, CSS, Javascript, QT) and/or the ability to create prototypes is a plus.</li><li>Knowledgeable with Adobe Suite softwares.</li> </ul> <strong>Would be nice to have:</strong> <ul> <li>Experience designing desktop software applications.</li><li>Familiarity with 3D software (ex: Maya / Cinema 4D / ZBrush) applications.</li><li>Animation experience (ex: Maya, After Effects, CSS, Javascript).</li> <li>Knowledge of VFX or media production processes.</li><li>VR app design experience.</li> </ul>  Additional Information<br/><br/>This is an exciting opportunity to work in the dynamic world of visual effects. If you are an ambitious software developer looking for an opportunity to work with cutting edge technology then we look forward to your application. <br/><br/> If youre still not quite sure and would like more information or to just ask someone about life as a technologists at MPC, then please do not hesitate to get in touch! We want to be able to answer all your questions to ensure you are fully engaged and informed on the opportunity you are applying for. Please direct your questions to our Global Head of Technology Recruitment, Satveer Aujla https://www.linkedin.com/in/satveeraujla/ and he will get back you! <br/><br/> All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.
Title: Designer dinterfaces et dexpériences utilisateur - UI/UX Designer

Job_Description: Do you cringe at unintuitive menus and unresponsive controls? Do you have an eye for detail and polished experiences? Do you have strong, clear UI creation skills and a passion for gaming? <br/><br/> Then come help us by advancing the art and design of our products user interaction! <br/><br/> We are looking for a talented UI Artist to join our dynamic and growing team in <strong>Montreal.</strong> Be a part of the crew in charge of developing the most authentic and recognized poker game: <strong>World Series of Poker.</strong> You must be well versed in layout, typography and UI design for web and mobile applications. As our ideal candidate, you are able to develop and create concepts and visual ideas for online and mobile products that will be used in social and mobile games. <br/><br/> <u>About Playtika</u> <br/><br/> Playtika is a multiplatform social games developer. We are the #1 grossing Facebook game developer as well as a Top 10 grossing developer on iOS & Android worldwide. <br/><br/> Founded in 2010, Playtika immediately enjoyed skyrocketing growth and expanded quickly by acquiring other leading game titles. We now have 14 offices in 9 countries around the world with over 1,600 Playtikans. <br/><br/> Our business and our passion is to immerse people into a thrilling entertainment experience. Currently our games are enjoyed by more than 6 million users daily and over 20 million users monthly. <br/><br/> Sounds good, right? Come play with us! <br/><br/> <u>What youll be doing:</u> <ul> <li>Actively conceptualize UI designs for all aspects of the game</li><li>Work with the Game Designer and PO to create the UX wireframe</li><li>Work with the Art Director in defining and communicating the visual language and interface look and feel</li><li>Translate gameplay high level ideas into visual functional UI designs</li><li>Help elaborate research and prototype to bring ideas to life</li><li>Participate in visual comparisons and critiques</li><li>Competently assist in design of UI flow and function</li><li>Spec out art tasks and generate time estimates when needed</li><li>Contribute to art and tool pipeline improvements</li> </ul>  Requirements:<br/><br/><u>As our ideal candidate, you have:</u> <ul> <li>At least5 years experience as a UI Artist in the gaming industry</li><li>A strong background in fundamental art principles including excellent color theory, layout, typography, visual hierarchy and composition skills</li><li>Expertise with Photoshop</li><li>A thorough understanding of UI/UX flow and function design</li><li>A desire to challenge yourself to raise the barre on your own work and that of the company</li><li>Knowledge and curiosity about the latest trends in gaming and UI</li><li>A strong ability to communicate ideas visually and in writing</li><li>The ability to meet deadlines while handling multiple tasks</li><li>A College degree in Art, Animation, Design, or a related field (an asset)</li><li>Strong French/English written and verbal communication skills</li> </ul> <u>Its a total bonus if you have:</u> <ul> <li>Experience with Unity, Flash, After Effect and Illustrator</li> <li>Ability to create simple UI animations</li><li>Ability to crop and integrate art assets in Mobile and Web platforms</li>  </ul> If you think you have what it takes, we want to hear from you! <br/><br/> We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.<br/><br/>Division: <br/> <strong>WSOP</strong>

Job_Description: Creative, talented and knowledgeable designer capable of producing stunning, user-centric web interfaces. <br/>  <br/> <strong>Duties:</strong>   <ul> <li>Develop state of the art, cloud ready, large scale C# .Net applications</li> <li>Direct the visual appearance of all new features and enhancements</li> <li>Initiate, suggest, and spearhead major UI re-factorings for a more intuitive user-experience</li> <li>Design elegant solutions to complex workflows.</li> </ul>  o “Design things that people will talk about”   <ul> <li>Act as the user-advocate during the development process, subjecting early-stage designs to usability testing or expert review, and offering implementation suggestions from a user-centered perspective</li> <li>Act as “go to” with in-depth knowledge of user interface best practices and standards.</li> </ul>  o Use research-related services, theories and methods to support your recommendations   <ul> <li>Take the initiative in providing input and feedback in both departmental discussions and on issues relating to other departments</li> <li>Develop wireframes, behavioral specifications and personas based on proposed release content and Marketing Requirements and best practices.</li> <li>Collaborate on user experience planning with Product Owner, Solution Owner and team</li> <li>Socialize designs with team and integrate suggestions and changes as appropriate.</li> <li>Identify and implement performance improvements in both database and application.</li> <li>Implement changes in a timely fashion and with high quality, consistent with standards for the group.</li> <li>Create testable software components to insure module-level functionality and data structure consistency.</li> <li>Resolve issues found during engineering test and QA in a timely manner, taking risk into account.</li> <li>Provide documentation as appropriate including design documentation, comments in code, inputs for External Specifications, Software Requirements Specifications, and end-user documentation.</li> <li>Consistent use of group tools such as Jira, Confluence, Git/GitHub/svn for tracking of defects and management of code.</li> <li>Participate in design and code reviews of other team members</li> <li>Independently manage time and prioritize tasks to achieve results within cost and schedule constraints.</li> <li>Gain awareness of complex product features and execution affecting product performance</li> <li>Coordinate with customer support teams to diagnose performance issues</li> <li>Provides work assistance to lower level engineers.</li> </ul>  <strong>Education:</strong> <br/> Bachelors in Computer Science or equivalent <br/>  <br/> <strong>Experience:</strong>   <ul> <li>5 to 10 years research and/or UI/UX development experience</li> <li>5 years of experience with relational database systems, including MS SQL, PostgreSQL, and MySQL</li> </ul>  <strong>Skills:</strong>   <ul> <li>In-depth knowledge of HTML5 and CSS3 and JavaScript</li> <li>Experience with user interface design patterns and standard UCD methodologies</li> <li>Good eye for aesthetics: layout, grid systems, color theory and typography</li> <li>Candidate must be in sync with recent design standards and trends</li> <li>Experience and expertise programming in .NET/C#</li> <li>Experience in C and/or Java an asset</li> <li>Experience in Android and/or iOS an asset</li> <li>Solid knowledge of scalability strategies.</li> <li>Experience with multi-site / multi-cultural team management</li> <li>Experience with SaaS technologies and infrastructures.</li> <li>Experience with Agile development practices.</li> <li>Excellent collaborative, communication, and interpersonal skills.</li> <li>Excellent analytical, communication and presentation skills.</li> <li>Understanding of enterprise application development, software as a service and enterprise security technologies</li> </ul>  ESSENTIAL DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES include, but are not limited, to, the following: (& of time) <br/>  <br/> 40> - Develop wireframes, behavioral specifications and personas following and participating with the team’s Scrum process then implementing them. <br/>  <br/> 30> - Collaborate on user experience planning with Product Owner, Solution Owner and team <br/>  <br/> 20> - Identify and implement performance improvements <br/>  <br/> 5> - Assists and/or provides less senior developers guidance with their daily work activities <br/>  <br/> 5> - Remains abreast of current technological progress to ensure company's products remain marketable and competitive <br/>  <br/> Other duties as assigned
