Job_Description: <strong>Location of Work:</strong> <br/><br/> 390 March Road, Kanata, Ontario K2K 0G7 <br/><br/> This is not a telecommuting position. The candidate must be able to work regular hours at our office in Ottawa. <br/><br/> <strong>Job Details:</strong> <br/><br/> Full-time; 37.5 hours per week <br/><br/> $29.33 hourly/ $55,000 per year; 10 days paid vacation per year <br/><br/> Employees are eligible to participate in the Companys standard group benefit plan which includes Disability Insurance, Dental Insurance, Extended Medical Insurance. <br/><br/> <strong>Job Summary:</strong> <br/><br/> InitLive is looking for a web developer for our cloud-based service. We require someone who wants to embrace the entrepreneurial experience and who possesses a passion for innovating and developing cloud and mobile technologies. You will work with a team of talented people to help design and build our patented mobile event service. <br/><br/> <strong>Job Responsibilities:</strong> <ul> <li>Participating in the full website development cycle, including conceptualization of website requirements to the implementation stage;</li> <li>Participating in sprint planning sessions, sign, code review and retrospectives;</li> <li>Participating in project and team meetings, interacting and collaborating with team members and other departments as appropriate;</li> <li>Creating and maintaining software documentation;</li> <li>Developing website architecture and determining hardware and software requirements;</li> <li>Working on all levels of website code from database interaction and core business logic up through data delivery and web interface;</li> <li>Planning, designing, modifying, integrating and testing web interface for our companys product;</li> <li>Writing high-quality and well-documented code according to accepted standards, based on user requirements;</li> <li>Working on bug fixes and improving web interface performance;</li> <li>Creating and optimizing content and code for the website using a variety of database, graphics and other software;</li> <li>Conducting tests and performing security and quality controls of website;</li> <li>Continuously discovering, evaluating and implementing new technologies and industry trends to enhance application and web interface and maximize development efficiency.</li> </ul> <strong>Minimum Skills Requirements</strong> <br/><br/> <u>Education</u>  Bachelors or completion of a college program in computer science is required. <br/><br/> <u>Experience</u> Must have minimum of three (3) years working with the following: HTML, AngularJS 1.58; CSS and responsive designing programming; user interface design patterns; JAVA/Spring; Node.JS/Express; PostgreSQL; Jira, BitBucket, Git. Experience with workforce management scheduling logic or event management software application coding is a highly desired asset. <br/><br/> <u>Skills</u>  Ability to learn rapidly and master diverse technologies and techniques. Ability to manage and execute tasks in a team-oriented, collaborative, high-pressure environment. Ability to research, organize and present verbal and written ideas in a clear and concise manner.
Title: Web Designer

Job_Description: Who is Thinking Big?  <p>We are a group of smart, and committed business analysts, technical writers, front-end designers, software developers, testers, and project managers. Some say geeks, some say nerds. We are ok with either...or both. We provide digital consulting services to government and corporations but we also build products. </p>  <p>Our team help guide clients, getting stuff done. We also do our own software product development. Think of this side of the business as technology start-up incubation where you get to learn and practice using the latest tech and tools.</p>   Passion + delivery  <p>We believe that owning your work and claiming responsibility are keys to satisfaction at work. Thinking Big has many projects, and we're always looking for the best people. Join us.</p>   Level up  <p>Your experience might get you in the door, but your journey doesn’t stop there. We provide our big thinkers opportunities to learn and grow; to focus on who you plan to become. It’s a central theme to the Thinking Big way of life and business.</p>   Honest criticism  <p>We want our work and our people to be better. Sharing ideas and communicating how we can improve is vital to our business. From code reviews to group discussions, we believe in an open environment where we can help each other grow and improve.</p>   Continuous learning  <p>There is a n00b inside all of us, and this allows us to learn and grow. “I don’t know” is not a bad thing to say or hear. It’s the beginning of something new, and we all love to go from n00b to pro.</p>   Responsibilities  <ul>  <li>Take a design through all stages, from getting out of the clients head, to handing it off to the development team to execute.</li>  <li>Understand the customer/client you are designing for</li>  <li>Create wireframes, storyboards, user flows, process flows and sitemaps to effectively communicate interaction and design ideas to your customers</li>  <li>Present and defend designs and key milestone deliverables to peers and executive level stakeholders</li>  <li>Help establish and promote design guidelines, best practices and standards</li>  </ul>   Qualifications  <ul>  <li>3+ years of web design and UX experience</li>  <li>Demonstrable graphic design skills with a strong portfolio</li>  <li>Solid experience in creating wireframes, storyboards, user flows, process flows and sitemaps</li>  <li>Proficiency in Photoshop, Illustrator, Sketch or other visual design and wire-framing tools</li>  <li>Proficiency in HTML and CSS for rapid prototyping (JavaScript a bonus)</li>  <li>Ability to solve problems creatively and effectively</li>  <li>Up-to-date with the latest Web trends, techniques, and technologies</li>  </ul>    Contact us hello@thinkingbig.net to apply or call toll free 1 (877) 733 3447.    <div>  <div>                                                  </div> </div> ;
Title: UX Designer

Job_Description: POSITION: Software Development Manager <br><br> <strong>HOW TO APPLY:</strong> <ul> <li>*Please apply through company online job postings only, candidates who do not follow this may be disqualified</li> <li>*No phone calls or emails please</li> <li>*Only qualified applicants will be contacted</li> </ul> <strong>COMPANY BACKGROUND:</strong> <br><br> With more than 20 people, having managed over 50+ software projects, Vog App Developers is an all Canadian app development team. Recognized as one of Canada's top 10 mobile app developers, we focus on building custom mobile applications for local businesses, entrepreneurs or anybody looking to innovate. Our entrepreneurial team works with a variety of Canadian clients, and continues to grow in size and reputation. "We build more than just apps, we build businesses." Please view our webpage for more information! <br><br> <strong>WHY WORK AT VOG?:</strong> <br><br> At Vog App Developers, teamwork is essential for the company to continue efficiently and effectively. We consider every individual to be unique and different from one another, which is why we drive and challenge staff members to innovate and share new ideas. Our team members enjoy the ability apply their skills in a supportive environment with knowledgeable software developers and designers. <br><br> BENEFITS: <ul> <ul> <li>Flexible work environment (work from home)</li> <li>Local team, so you don’t have to wait around for support</li> <li>Competitive pay</li> <li>Monthly team events</li> <li>Complimentary office food and beverage</li> <li>Training and mentorship</li> </ul> </ul> <ul> <li>Opportunity for growth within company</li> </ul> ROLE SUMMARY: <br><br> He/she will be responsible for working closely with sales to translate client needs into technical project requirements. Also, he/she will organize and maintain the efficient development of custom native mobile app (Android and iOS), Web App, and Website development. He/she will coordinate and manage a projects development starting from design to completion. He/she will balance their abilities in people and technical management in order to build innovate applications for our customers. <br><br> REPORTS TO: CEO/Owner <br><br> ESSENTIAL RESPONSIBILITIES: <ul> <li>Manage the development of more than one project at a time while under time constraints.</li> <li>Analyze and define project deliverables based on client needs.</li> <li>Research and implement competitive technologies.</li> <li>Develop a detailed project plan and track progress</li> <li>Create and maintain comprehensive project documentation.</li> <li>Manage changes and updates to scope of work.</li> <li>Consult with client regarding technical inquiries</li> <li>Define, prioritize, categorize, and monitor feature progress and backlogs.</li> <li>Forecast time required to complete tasks.</li> <li>Identify talent required to complete project while working with HR.</li> <li>Implement agile software management methodologies.</li> <li>Manage frontend and backend mobile/web developer progress and performance.</li> <li>Provide programming support and training when needed.</li> <li>Work closely with QA analyst to ensure.</li> <li>Work closely with account managers to define costs and timelines.</li> <li>Build and provide detailed project reports.</li> <li>Provide coaching to supervised team members.</li> <li>Audit developer time tracking and code.</li> <li>Perform risk management to minimize project risks</li> </ul> EXPERIENCE/SKILL REQUIREMENTS: <ul> <li>Previous experience leading a team, or working with a team that released an app to market considered an asset.</li> <li>2+ years developing for Android considered an asset.</li> <li>2+ years of back end development experience considered an asset.</li> <li>2+ years developing for iOS considered an asset.</li> <li>2+ years developing web applications or website considered an asset.</li> <li>2+ years of UI/UX design considered an asset.</li> <li>2+ years using relevant software development project management software considered an asset.</li> <li>1+ years using agile project management related to software development considered an asset.</li> <li>1+ years of software development team supervision considered an asset.</li> <li>Solid organizational skills including attention to detail and multi-tasking skills</li> <li>Excellent written and verbal English communication skills.</li> <li>Excellent client-facing and internal communication skills</li> <li>Confident and reliable leadership skills.</li> </ul> EDUCATIONAL REQUIREMENTS: <ul> <li>Bachelor’s or associate degree related to project management and/or computer science.</li> </ul> OTHER REQUIREMENTS: <ul> <li>Must be able to pass a criminal reference check if needed.</li> <li>Must have a valid SIN.</li> <li>Must be legally allowed to work in Canada.</li> <li>Ability to work in Calgary Office is an asset.</li> </ul>
Title: Project Manager (Mobile App Development)

Job_Description: Mixed Reality is predicted to shape the way people will work and our team is building the software to create this modern workplace. We are engaged with first line workers to develop innovative tools they can use to tackle new challenge or express their own ideas. <br/><br/> Our team uses deep customer research, observation and understanding paired with design thinking to concept, build, and ship products that will improve the way people get work done each day and help them break free from the limits of our current work environments. <br/><br/> We are looking for a talented User Interface Designer to help design and shape our unique mixed reality products and experiences. The ideal candidate will have experience collaborating with developers, technical artists, UX designers, project managers and copywriters. <br/><br/> You're a well-rounded individual with strong visual, motion, interaction, problem-solving abilities, and you possess the desire to create delightful, sophisticated and efficient user experiences. You are driven by curiosity and are an active learner.<br/><br/>Responsibilities  <ul> <li><div>Helping to define the visual language, and user interface for new enterprise offerings.</div></li><li><div>Producing high-quality visual designs – from concept to delivery.</div></li><li><div>Clearly rationalizing and justifying design work and advocating for the needs of users.</div></li><li><div>Creating a wide variety of 2D/3D assets.</div></li><li><div>Developing motion previsualizations (Adobe After Effects).</div></li><li><div>Working closely with Technical Artists and Software Developers on feature prototypes.</div></li><li><div>Prototyping visual targets on Mixed Reality devices (i.e.: HoloLens).</div> </li> </ul>  <strong>Qualifications</strong>  <ul> <li><div>Proficiency with Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, After Effects).</div></li><li><div>Proficiency in 3D packages a must, Unity and Maya experience are a plus.</div></li><li><div>Strong understanding of UI flow, typography, graphic / motion design and iconography.</div></li><li><div>Fundamental understanding of UX concepts.</div></li><li><div>Strong verbal, written, and visual communication skills.</div></li><li><div>Basic understanding of Mixed Reality technology.</div></li><li><div>Ability to write documentation/create style guides.</div></li><li><div>Experience with AR or VR a plus.</div></li><li><div>Unity experience a big plus.</div></li><li><div>A talent for creating without fear!</div></li><li><div>Interest in maker culture</div> </li> </ul> Please include URLs for an online portfolio in addition to resume. Submissions without a portfolio included will not be considered. <br/><br/> Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via the Accommodation request form. <br/><br/> Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work.
Title: UI Designer - Mixed Reality

Job_Description: <div>RealDecoy is seeking a UX/UI Strategist to join our Digital Services team. The successful candidate will work on production as a senior member of multiple project teams and will also collaborate with the Director of Digital at RealDecoy to define and grow the UX/UI practice.</div>  <br/> <strong><div>Specific responsibilities will include:</div> <br/> </strong>  <li>Leading customer strategy sessions, working directly with them to understand their business and how RealDecoy can design complete experiences to help them achieve the outcomes they want and need from their website or digital product experience.</li> <li>Production of taxonomies, sitemaps, wireframes, screen flows, content inventories/analyses, value propositions, user stories, journey maps (etc), either working independently or through delegating to a more junior team member and supervising to completion.</li> <li>Participation to various degrees in projects across all of RealDecoys service offerings, including but not limited to: Digital Marketing, Analytics, Custom Product Development, Web/CMS, Site Search and Conversion Rate Optimization</li> <li>Constant collaboration with members of RealDecoys Digital Services, Project Management and Engineering teams on project lifecycles that can range from a few days to more than one year.</li> <li>Working with Marketing, Sales and Account Management as a contributor to business development activities such as pitches, pre-sales calls and effort estimations.</li>  <br/> <div>RealDecoy is committed to inclusive, barrier-free recruitment processes and work environments. If contacted regarding this position, please advise us in a timely fashion, of any accommodation assistance you require to be assessed in a fair and equitable manner. Information received relating to accommodation measures will be addressed confidentially. We are an equal opportunity employer and encourage applications from women, members of a visible minority group, Aboriginal people and persons with disabilities</div>Your Personality:  <ul> <li>RealDecoy provides a dynamic, multi-project work environment for a broad base of customers across multiple different technologies and markets. The pace can be fast and our projects usually bring all sorts of novel challenges.</li> <li>	Youre a UX/UI professional with a strong grasp of the tools of your trade, but you have the adaptability and judgement to know how to tailor your approach to the needs of the project. Youre not a one-size-fits-all kind of person.</li><li>	You have a lot of real-word knowledge in general and with the Web and technology in particular: You find it easy to learn a new customers business, market and challenges and produce a cohesive and workable vision that you can articulate to the customer and to the project team</li> <li>	Youre comfortable providing mentoring and thought leadership to your colleagues, but youre willing to learn too.</li> <li>	Youre serious about your work but you dont take yourself too seriously. Youre aware of how you affect your colleagues and customers at all times.</li> <li>	The goal means more to you than the process.</li>  </ul>  <strong>Your Background, Skills and Experience:</strong>  <ul> <li>4+ years of professional UX/UI experience, with a strong focus on designing complex solutions for complete digital environments</li><li>Several years experience working directly with clients to translate their wants and needs into a cohesive vision (e.g. JAD sessions, collaboration meetings, etc)</li> <li>Demonstrable experience in delivering experiences youve designed to a real-world production environment</li><li>Experience in a mentorship, supervisory or managerial position with other team members in your fields</li><li>College or University degree in a relevant discipline (e.g. Degree or diploma in UX/UI, Design, HCI etc, OR related experience preferred);</li><li>Experience with prototyping and wireframing tools (InVision, Justinmind or UXPin, Adobe photoshop etc)</li><li>Several years experience in a multi-project environment.</li><li>Solid understanding of Web trends and concepts (e.g. SEO, analytics, best practices in design, layout and navigation) and how these are inter-related in a real-world Web setting</li><li>Basic knowledge of HTML, CSS and JavaScript is an asset but not required. This is not a development position.</li> </ul>  <div>Thats you, we hopecoming here as RealDecoys newest UX/UI Strategist</div><div>(Or, if you know someone you think would be ideal for this positioneven better suited than you aredo them a favour and tell them about this opportunity).</div><div>Send us your résumé, accompanied by a thoughtfully written cover letter to careers@realdecoy.com</div><br/> <div>If you have that star quality were looking for, well be in touch!</div><br/> <div>Deadline: April 30, 2018</div><br/>
Title: UX/UI Strategist

Job_Description: <div><div> <div>  <ul> <li>Experience with or background in visual design</li><li>Experience with ux design for complex workflows and/or for technical end users</li><li>Strong time management skills and the ability to be self-directed when needed.</li><li>Solid written and verbal communication skills with the ability to present a strong rationale for design decisions.</li><li>A bachelor's degree in interaction design, human-computer interaction (HCI), or related UX degree is ideal.</li><li>Demonstrated history of acquiring user data (e.g., conducting usability studies, performing user research) is a big plus.</li><li>Ability to prototype in HTML, JavaScript, & CSS is a plus.</li> </ul>  Amazon is an Equal Opportunity-Affirmative Action Employer – Minority / Female / Disability / Veteran / Gender Identity / Sexual Orientation.</div> </div> </div> <br/> <strong>.</strong>
Title: Senior UX Designer

Job_Description: <div> <div>Founded in 2001, ForeSee is the pioneering leader in Voice of Customer (VOC) solutions. More than 2,000 companies worldwide -- in retail, government, financial services, and other industries -- have transformed their customer experience (CX) into a strategic and rigorous business discipline that delivers economic impact. Only ForeSee offers a multi-patented algorithmic approach to CX measurement, access to an unmatched 175 million benchmarked experiences, and actionable insights from a team of 200 expert analysts that give certainty to CX improvements.</div> <br/> <div>ForeSee is in a period of rapid growth and is investing heavily in engineering, sales, and marketing to meet the evolving needs of our clients. The company offers competitive compensation and benefits packages and a culture that values respect, transparency, humility, unity, passion, and brilliance. A subsidiary of Answers Corporation, ForeSee is headquartered in Ann Arbor, MI and has offices in Mountain View, San Francisco, New York, St. Louis, Cleveland, Vancouver, and London. <br/><br/> <strong>What we are looking for:</strong> <br/><br/> A front end developer with strong Javascript skills who understands large single page applications, and has experience with common frameworks. <br/><br/> The ideal candidate will have experience with the React ecosystem, and opinions about popular libraries, and the role they play in building a successful application. <br/><br/> <strong>Your Impact in this role:</strong> <br/><br/> You will be part of a team building an industry leading analytics portal (ForeSee CX Suite) providing insights to our enterprise clients. You will take ownership of a product area within the suite, building the features needed to shape the vision for delivering new and exciting types of analysis. Were looking for people to help drive the team forward, as we continuously improve and modernize our codebase. <br/><br/> <strong>You will have ownership for delivering:</strong>  <ul> <li>Bringing up-to-date expertise in front-end web technologies to the team, and applying this to the development, execution, and improvement of our analytics platform.</li> <li>Supporting continuous improvement of our coding patterns, documentation, and process.</li> <li>Collaborating with the team to build and maintain a library of reusable components.</li> <li>Writing code thats easy to maintain.</li> </ul> <strong>Preferred skills needed for this role:</strong>  <ul> <li>3+ years experience in HTML5, JavaScript, CSS3, AJAX, and related technologies.</li> <li>Strong understanding of responsive design/development techniques and principles.</li> <li>2+ years experience with React, Angular or another Javascript framework.</li> <li>Experienced with GIT and related workflows.</li> <li>High attention to detail.</li> <li>Efficiency working with teams and independently; self-motivated, task oriented and organized.</li> <li>Some familiarity with modern JS Dev OPS tools (NPM, webpack, Babel, etc)</li> <li>Experience with some of ES6, NodeJS, Express JS, AWS or similar cloud solution.</li> </ul> <strong>Qualities that will make a difference:</strong>  <ul> <li>A passion for innovation</li> <li>Self-driven and takes initiative to get stuff done but thinks out of the box</li> <li>Product Engineering mindset.</li> <li>We provide a culture that values respect, transparency, humility, unity, passion, and brilliance.</li> </ul>  </div> </div> <br/><strong>Benefits & Perks</strong>  <ul> <li>Highly Competitive Salaries and Bonus Programs</li>   <li>Medical Insurance; 100% Principle Paid</li>   <li>Company Paid Dental / Vision / Rx Drugs Insurance</li>   <li>Paid Time Off (PTO) Policy 15 Days To Start</li>   <li>Pension Scheme, Company Match</li>   <li>Tuition Reimbursement Program</li>   <li>Maternity / Paternity / Adoption Leave</li>   <li>Snacks and beverages free to employees</li>   <li>Wellness Initiatives</li>   <li>Casual Dress</li>  </ul> ForeSee is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to, among other things, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, status as a protected veteran, or disability. <br/><br/> EOE/Vet/Disability
Title: UI Engineer

Job_Description: <div><strong>Product Manager</strong></div><div>Our client s looking for a talented and motivated individual to join their team as a Product Manager. As Product Manager, you will help us to continue to develop our next generation business management platform for health and wellness businesses. You will be joining a dynamic team of energetic individuals focused on delivering an innovative software solution for the fitness industry.</div><div>If you’ve got that spark and want to be a part of a dynamic team building something great, we look forward to hearing from you!</div><br/> <div><strong>Your Responsibilities</strong></div><div>As the Lead Product Manager, you will be the leader of the product team. Your primary responsibility will be to shape the product roadmap, and work with the UX/UI Designers, Customer Service, Onboarding, Sales and Engineering teams to ideate, collaborate and innovate great new features of our Platform. While the focus will be on the growth and development of the platform, there will always be opportunities to contribute in additional ways. In this role, you will play a major part in shaping the technology, growth and overall experience of the platform.</div><br/> <div>Skills and Requirements</div> <br/> <div><strong>Use these simply a guide; as a fit driven organization if this speaks to you, apply – we have (and will continue) to hire non-traditional candidates. You might have:</strong></div><div>· 2+ years of experience in a product manager role</div><div>· Proven expertise leading a product team, and growing revenue</div><div>· Experience developing B2B technologies, and/or SaaS products</div><div>· Strong analytic background in a product capacity</div><div>· Proven success at working with the business and building a backlog</div><div>· Proven performance working in an agile environment</div><div>· Solid understanding of responsive design, web standards, UI/UX best practices</div><div>· Technical knowledge in software development and understanding of Agile Development methodologies.</div><div>· Effective communication in layman terms to non-technical stakeholders while being able to understand tech lingo with the development team</div><div>· Make data-driven decisions and ask “what value does this change have on the users of our product”</div><div>· Experience with project management in a development environment and managing conflicting priorities</div>
Title: Product Manager

Job_Description: <div><div><div><div><div>Beenox is a video game development studio created in 2000. Located in beautiful Quebec City, Canada, Beenox is a wholly owned subsidiary of Activision Publishing Inc., one of the world’s top game developers. <br/><br/> The studio is proud to contribute to the development of the Call of Duty video game franchise. Beenox has also contributed to the resounding success of the Skylanders, Spider-Man, and Guitar Hero franchises. <br/><br/> As members of the Beenox family, we feel as if we’re part of a group of like-minded people who are great to work with. Our studio is a real open world where it’s easy to have discussions with everyone, including our studio co-heads. Here everyone brings their own unique touch to projects that showcase their talent on a global stage. <br/><br/> You could say that video games are in our blood!<br/> <div></div> <br/> <div><strong>HERE'S WHAT AWAITS YOU IN THIS JOB:</strong></div> <br/> <div></div> <br/>As a UX Designer, you’ll be asked to contribute to the creation of a top-quality user experience for our players. You will achieve this objective by promoting an approach centered around the user, based on human psychology principles user observations (user tests) and graphic design guidelines. <br/><br/> You’ll have to ensure that the experience and immersion of the user are aligned with the game design intents. Plus, you’ll oversee the identification of potentials friction points related to ergonomics or player communication, both from a visual and functional standpoint. You will be responsible for coming up with potential solutions to those issues.<br/>  <div><u>You’ll need to:</u></div> <br/>• Analyze the game’s UI/UX needs based on the type of user, game direction, market trends and industry standards and adapt it to find the right balance between innovation and conventions; <br/><br/> • Develop various game UI elements (HUDs, tutorials, menus…) while working closely with the UI and Design teams; <br/><br/> • Design the structure and user flow of interface elements while ensuring a good information hierarchy and a quality player communication; <br/><br/> • Document systems related to interfaces and user experience (UX) for the development team by creating flowcharts and wireframes; <br/><br/> • Work closely with Game Designers to complement the documentation of Game Design features and get a good understanding of the design intentions for the UI and player communication; <br/><br/> • Test various possible options of game UI elements by creating functional prototypes; <br/><br/> • Contribute to implementing and integrating in-game UI; <br/><br/> • Work closely with UI Designers and Programmers to ensure the quality of the product; <br/><br/> • Act as a leader regarding User Experience issues to the rest of the team; <br/><br/> • Participate actively in build reviews and iterate quickly based on the team’s feedback. <br/><br/> <strong>YOU ARE:</strong> <br/><br/> • <strong>Experienced:</strong> You have at least three (3) years of experience working in a video game studio or the equivalent, as a UX Designer, Game Designer, UI Designer or equivalent. You have experience in AAA or FPS development (asset). <br/><br/> • <strong>Competent:</strong> You know the video game development pipeline plus you are efficient and work meticulously. You have a great understanding of the technical constraints of game development (including game engines and game editors); <br/><br/> • <strong>Expert:</strong> You have a solid background in interactivity and User-centered interface design. You own complex tasks and ensure that you deliver quality. You also have a good understanding of human psychology principles and how they apply to UX game design (asset); <br/><br/> • <strong>Informed</strong>: You‘ve kept up with the latest innovations in UX and you make it your business to stay up to date. You also are more than aware of the latest gaming trends. You follow the Call of Duty series closely and you understand its essence (asset); <br/><br/> • <strong>Versatile:</strong> You’re proficient with prototyping and rapid iterations based on feedback. You are especially at ease with Photoshop, Visio and other flowcharts, wireframes and functional mockups software. Photoshop and Substance Painter. You also have basic skills in scripting or programming (asset). <br/><br/> • <strong>Team player:</strong> You like to work in in collaboration with a multidisciplinary team. You communicate effectively with people of various backgrounds – both in English and French. <br/><br/> • <strong>Resourceful:</strong> You’re keen to learn how to use new internal tools and you don’t get discouraged when faced with regular change.</div> </div>  </div>  </div> </div> <br/>
Title: UX Designer

Job_Description: <strong>Description</strong> <br><br> <b>Employer</b> <br><br>Mandarin Holidays <br><br> <b>Address</b> <br><br>7755 Warden Ave., Unit 3 – 1/F <br>Markham, ON, L3R 0N3 <br><br> <b>Website</b> <br><br>https://www.mandarinholidays.com/ <br><br> <b>Position</b> <br><br>Web Designer <br><br> <b>Salary</b> <br><br>$29.00 to $32.00 hourly for 35 hours per week <br><br> <b>Anticipated Start Date</b> <br><br>As soon as possible <br><br> <b>Terms of Employment</b> <br><br>Permanent Full time <br><br> <b>Number of positions</b> <br><br>1 <br><br><br> <strong>Job Requirements</strong> <br><br> <b>Languages</b> <br><br>English, Mandarin<br><br><b> Education</b> <br><br>College/CEGEP <br><br> <b>Experience</b> <br><br>1 year to less than 2 years <br><br><b> Specific Skills</b> <br><br>Source, select and organize information for inclusion and design the appearance, layout and flow of the Website; Create and optimize content for Website using a variety of graphics, database, animation and other software; Conduct tests and perform security and quality controls <br><br> <b>Applications</b> <br><br>Adobe Photoshop; Flash <br><br><b> Programming Languages</b> <br><br>XML; PHP; MySQL; Java; JSP; HTML; CSS; Ajax <br><br><b> Work Conditions and Physical Capabilities</b> <br><br>Fast-paced environment; Work under pressure; Repetitive tasks; Attention to detail; Tight deadlines <br><br><b> Computer and Technology Knowledge</b> <br><br>Word processing software; Unix; MS Windows; Linux; Internet; Database software; Image editing software; HTML editing software; C#; .NET; API <br><br><b> Personal Suitability</b> <br><br>Initiative; Effective interpersonal skills; Team player; Excellent oral communication; Excellent written communication; Dependability; Judgement; Organized <br><br><br> <strong>How to apply</strong> <br><br> <b>By email:</b> <br><br>Mandarinholidays.resume@gmail.com
Title: Web Designer

Job_Description: <strong>Position Overview</strong> <br/><br/> BioWare, a member of the incredible family of EA studios, has created some of the world's best-selling titles (including the Mass Effect and Dragon Age series). <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities:</strong> <ul> <li>Create player-centered designs by considering player motivations, gameplay experiences, user research, and usability findings</li><li>Develop user flows, wireframes, and prototypes to effectively communicate game design requirements</li> <li>Develop and maintain detailed user-interface specifications and design patterns that align with an existing UI design system</li><li>Develop UX requirements with key stakeholders to define design objectives and to align with overarching goals</li><li>Work closely with game designers, UX designers and UI artists to execute design.</li><li>Present design work for review and feedback with ability to go over methods, explorations, and rationale.</li><li>Support your design decisions using data such as player feedback, and user research</li><li>Thrive in a fast paced work environment requiring independent self-direction with an aptitude for team collaboration and open communication</li>  </ul> <strong>Qualifications</strong> <ul> <li>An online portfolio or samples of work demonstrating experience creating great user-centered design solutions</li><li>Examples of wireframes, low to high fidelity prototypes and information architecture mapping</li> <li>Excellent communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills.</li><li>Ability to have a bias for action in a fast-paced, sometimes ambiguous environment with multiple stakeholders and / or conflicting needs</li> <li>Highly motivated self-starter; capable of operating with minimal management oversight.</li> <li>Knowledge of usability principles and techniques</li> <li>Working to a degree in Interaction Design, Psychology, Human Factors, Industrial Engineering or related HCI discipline, or demonstrated proficiency and experiences in the field of software user experience/interaction design.</li> <li>Proficiency in a variety of design tools such as Illustrator, Photoshop, Axure (or other flow + prototyping tools)</li><li>Experience in game development is a strong asset</li> <li>Passion for gaming</li> </ul> <br/><br/> <strong>About EA</strong> <br/><br/> Its not easy building the worlds best digital playground. Its hair-standing-up-on-end-exhilarating. Its down-in-the-trenches-challenging. Its stroke-of-brilliance-at-midnight creative. Its youtaking risks, challenging yourself, pursuing ideas, changing the way millions of people do something they love: Play. Were EAweve been making games for decades but you wouldnt know that walking through our studios. Were still buzzing with the same innovative spirit we began with, though weve learned enough to earn our rank as a leading developer, publisher and distributor of the worlds best games. What began as a small group of people determined to put real life in a box has become an 8,000-people strong, worldwide organization delivering on that very dream. If youve played The Sims lately, you know exactly what we mean. And if youve played Battlefield 1, maybe youd say that weve done real life one better. <br/><br/> Whether youre building Springfield on your mobile or your palms are sweaty from clutching your controller during intense games of FIFA 17, chances are youve played an EA game. And if you havent, well, what are you waiting for? In an industry thats changing every daywhether its through new social channels, advancing technology, new audiences or unique opportunities for monetizationEA is positioned for growth thanks to smart business plans, strategic acquisitions, and most importantly, our creative people around the world who gather each day to unite the world through play. We take that last part very seriously, so if what youre reading excites you as much as it does us, we invite you to get to know us better.
Title: Associate UX Designer co-op

Job_Description: Axiom Zen is an award-winning venture studio that specializes in mainstream applications of emerging technologies. Products developed by Axiom Zen have touched 200+ million consumers and are used by the worlds leading organizations. Recent successes include CryptoKitties, the first mainstream application of blockchain technology outside cryptocurrency. <br/><br/> <strong>The role:</strong> <br/><br/> Were looking to welcome a Back End and Front End Engineering Intern to the team for Fall 2018. <br/><br/> <strong>The opportunity:</strong>  <ul> <li>Youll get the chance to work with emerging technologies such as blockchain and learn best practices from some of the worlds top software engineers.</li>   <li>Our engineering team thrives on solving user problems with the latest tools and techniques (some of which weve built ourselves!). Axioms hail from startups and tech leaders like Google, Apple, Baidu, EA, and Microsoft.</li>   <li>Cutting-edge technology: We use state-of-the-art machine learning techniques to build our own semantic analysis technology that helped the Timeline team put news in context.</li> <li>Amazing benefits! We want Axioms to be happy and thriving, and thats why we offer a competitive salary, unlimited vacation, holistic initiatives, active speakers budget and more!</li>  </ul> <strong>Our ideal candidate:</strong>  <ul> <li>Show us some of the projects youve worked on we're serious about this, and we'll look for sample projects in your application.</li> <li>Familiarity with agile software development methodologies</li> <li>Interest or knowledge of UX and UI design principles.</li> <li>Up-to-date knowledge of the latest technologies and you get excited about pushing the boundaries of what's possible on the web, mobile, and other emerging platforms.</li> <li>A completed or nearly completed BS/MS in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or equivalent experience.</li> </ul> <strong>How to apply:</strong>  <ul> <li>Please send us your resume or LinkedIn profile.</li> <li>Include your GitHub account.</li>  <strong><li>Please include a brief answer to:</strong> <br/> Whats an impressive engineering project youve worked on? Also, please specify if youre interested in a Front End or Back End position.</li> </ul> <strong>More about Axiom Zen:</strong> <br/><br/> Axiom Zen is also the team behind ZenHub, the worlds leading collaboration solution for technical teams; and the creator of Toby, tab management with personality recognized as Top Chrome Extension of the year by both Google and Product Hunt. Axiom Zens work has been featured in The New York Times, The Wall Street Journal, TIME, and Fast Company.
Title: Software Engineering Internship (Fall 2018)

Job_Description: <strong>Key Role</strong> <br/><br/> We are seeking an experienced Product Designer for our client who will be responsible for creating amazing user experiences (UX) within their suite of products. The ideal candidate should have an eye for clean user interface (UI) design and be able to collaborate with product managers to enhance existing products and help define future solutions. You are skilled at transforming product requirements and wireframes into intuitive design and prototypes to guide engineering throughout the software development lifecycle (SDLC). You will manage the human-centred design process, understanding real users – their goals, aptitudes, experiences, needs, and motivations. You will approach design from a user-perspective and balance user needs, business goals and technical capabilities. <br/><br/> <strong>Duties and Responsibilities</strong>  <ul>  <li>Collaborate with product management and engineering to define and implement innovative solutions for the product direction, visuals and experience;</li> <li>Conduct user research, evaluate analytics and assimilate user feedback;</li> <li>Conceptualize original ideas that bring simplicity and user friendliness to complex design roadblocks;</li> <li>Apply your design abilities to complex product problems with the goal of reducing user friction;</li> <li>Create storyboards, user flows, and high-fidelity prototypes across our suite of products that can be used by all teams during product development, including internal and external presentations as required;</li> <li>Execute all visual design stages from concept to final hand-off to engineering;</li> <li>Present and defend designs and key milestone deliverables to peers and executive level stakeholders;</li> <li>Oversee usability testing and ensure acceptance criteria are met;</li> <li>Establish and promote design guidelines, best practices and standards.</li> </ul> <strong>Requirements</strong> <ul>  <li>Diploma or degree in Digital Design, Interaction Design or Communications (or equivalent);</li> <li>Minimum 3 years of UX/UI design experience;</li> <li>Up-to-date with the latest UI trends, techniques, and technologies;</li> <li>Proficiency in Invision, Sketch, Axure, Adobe Creative Cloud, or other prototyping tools;</li> <li>Experience with HTML, CSS, JS and AngularJS an asset, but coding not required;</li>  <li>Solid experience in creating wireframes, storyboards, user flows, and process flows;</li> <li>Strong collaboration and negotiation skills, including getting and giving feedback, and managing stakeholders and stakeholder expectations;</li> <li>Excellent verbal and written communication skills, including strong presentation skills;</li> <li>Experience working in an Agile environment an asset;</li> <li>Domain experience in master data management, product information management, digital asset management, and/or digital retail solutions definite asset.</li> </ul> <strong>Benefits</strong> <br/><br/> Great Company Culture <br/><br/> Growth Opportunities <br/><br/> Work with a diverse and strong team
Title: UX Designer

Job_Description: <strong>UX Designer - Advanced Analytics and Visualization</strong><br/><br/>Fight Cybercrime and Design the Future UX at Rapid7 <br/><br/> <strong>Are you a UX Designer that thrives on the making sense of data and analytics and visualizing it to enhance the UX of products? Help us bring your design to life at Rapid7.</strong><br/><br/><strong>Who we are</strong><br/><br/>Rapid7 is the fastest growing cybercrime security company. <br/><br/> Our product protects Fortune 500 companies from cybercrimes in lots of clever ways and we need the right UX person to join a powerful team that helps everyday-users easily understand these complex problems, and helps them solve them efficiently and enjoyably.<br/><br/><strong>Your Opportunity</strong><br/><br/>We are seeking an user experience designer who is data savvy, analytics curious, and loves to visualize all the data. The position will be addressing Rapid7s most challenging business problems and opportunities in relation to delivering value to our customers in the form of insights and analytics. <br/><br/> The candidate will be working with leadership to establish a shared vision by building consensus on priorities leading to product execution. Collaboration with multidisciplinary teams with be key in order to drive the strategy. <br/><br/> The position requires a strong design thinker and leader as well as competencies in visual analytics, data curation, usability. The successful candidate should being comfortable with numbers, formulas and advanced analytics concepts. A solid understanding of the enterprise business domain is required <br/><br/> <strong>Is this role the right fit for you?</strong> <br/><br/> While were looking for a teammate with a passion for clean and elegant design, we also want to make sure that Rapid7 culture is a good fit for you, and that youre a good fit for us, of course! <br/><br/> Our UX team is a diverse and cohesive group, with each person complementing one another. When you join our team, we will be looking for a team player who is All In when it comes to a quality user experience. <br/><br/> To be a true Rapid7 culture fit, you need to embody our Core Values, established by a team of our own people and embraced by all who work here. These values allow us to scale and evolve; regardless of location, team, and role.<br/><br/><strong>Responsibilities</strong>    <ul> <li>Defining product goals, and core user-needs leveraging design thinking concepts.</li> <li>Lead and collaborate on new product development initiatives through building effective business cases that identify business value and recommend metrics to measure success at the product level.</li> <li>Plan and execute research to develop a solid understanding of users, translating into personas, user stories and story maps.</li> <li>Deliver superb experiences that will deliver on the user and business needs</li> <li>Work closely with business stakeholders to identify, clearly articulate, and prioritize scope and requirements and manage expectations.</li> </ul>  <strong>Requirements</strong>    <ul> <li>4+ years experience working in a firm where product/service strategies and innovation were a significant percentage of your time and focus.</li> <li>Bachelor's degree in information management, or visual design, or psychology a plus.</li> <li>Knowledge of, and experience with, Data visualisation or visual analytics</li> <li>Exceptional analytical, conceptual, and problem-solving abilities.</li> <li>Experience with applying Design Thinking methodologies</li>   <li>Excellent oral and written communication skills, and comfortable presenting (and interacting with) everyone from entry-level employees to vice presidents.</li> <li>Collaborative working style, willingness to flex roles and responsibilities when needed to support larger team goals and outcomes.</li> </ul>  <strong>What you will need</strong>   <ul> <li>A creative portfolio that demonstrates your talents</li> <li>Case Studies that demonstrate your direct business impact on the projects you have work.</li> </ul>
Title: UX Designer

Job_Description: Crowdlinker is seeking to hire an enthusiastic and motivated PM with a passion for product management and project management. <br/><br/> This position will suit someone who has experience as a developer or a designer, or anyone who has the soft skills this position needs and has demonstrated their passion for the software industry. You must have some technical proficiency in order to confidently be able to work with and assign work to developers. In addition, you will need natural communication abilities and poise, as you will be the point of contact for the clients whose projects you own and manage. <br/><br/> The ideal candidate has 1-2 years experience working as a product manager or project manager with a design/development agency, however, we are also interested in designers or developers who are looking to transition into product management. Individuals from other disciplines are welcome too, however as stated before you must be able to demonstrate your ability to work with a technical team and communicate technical requirements to a client. Tech entrepreneurs will likely excel in this position and we strongly encourage you to apply. <br/><br/> PM is not a one-fits-all job. Please only apply if you have a passion for the software industry and fit the job description. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities</strong>  <ul> <li>Lead local developers and designer to execute project deliverables.</li> <li>Organize collective work efforts, creating and allocating stories in Jira, managing backlogs, facilitating scrum and sprint review sessions, and helping the team meet their goals.</li> <li>Ensure that all projects are delivered on-time, within scope and within budget</li> <li>Translate product strategy into detailed requirements and prototypes, while also developing project scopes and objectives, involving all relevant stakeholders and ensuring technical feasibility</li> <li>Foster the relationship with the client. You are their representative within our walls and their point of contact. Know their business, know what they need and collaborate with them to determine product roadmap and strategy</li> <li>Spearhead client engagement by organizing weekly checkpoint meetings, updating on status/progress, requirements gathering and being the PM they never had.</li> <li>Create and maintain comprehensive project documentation</li> </ul> <strong>Skills And Experience</strong>  <ul> <li>Technical background, with understanding or hands-on experience in software development and web/app technologies.</li> <li>Excellent client-facing and internal communication skills.</li> <li>Outstanding written and verbal communication skills.</li> <li>High level of organization. We are looking for individuals with the ability to think on their feet and prioritize effectively.</li> <li>Empathy and passion. We need people who truly care about the client and their project.</li> <li>You have a strong vision. We are a product studio, we own all our work. We do not just take requirements and spit out a website. We think it through and create living breathing software products that drive business.</li> <li>Natural leadership and the ability to lead by influence. You will be working with developers and designers who probably know a lot more than you do, but you need to be able to guide them.</li> <li>Nice to have: UX/UI Design experience/background.</li> </ul> <strong>About Crowdlinker</strong> <br/><br/> Crowdlinker is an end-to-end digital product studio based in Toronto with a relentless focus on our customers. We connect people through technology by being the strongest link between companies, their ideas, and their clients. We do so by excelling at digital strategy, creative design, full-stack development of websites & web/mobile apps, and digital marketing (SEO, SEM, PPC, Marketing Automation). Our clients include large startups like Freshbooks, League and TopHat, as well as enterprises like Nestlé and Unilever. We excel at providing marketing and media solutions and other digital products requiring exceptional user experiences. <br/><br/> Crowdlinker is recognized as a leader in the local tech community, having just celebrated its 5 year anniversary. We are a 20-person company and are well funded, having raised $1 million to-date. We are growing quickly, which means there are always new and exciting challenges at Crowdlinker, with the opportunity for rapid advancement. <br/><br/> This is the exact opposite of a slow, boring enterprise job. We are looking for someone who is comfortable taking risks and solving burning problems. We embrace change, see challenges as opportunities and focus on solutions. We do offer great pay, benefits and potential stock options, but we won’t hire someone “just looking for a paycheck”. We hire people who want to build a career. We are confident that you will learn more and advance your career further by working with Crowdlinker and our many varied clients. Are you up for the challenge? <br/><br/> <strong>Perks & Benefits</strong>  <ul> <li>Learn and implement the latest and greatest tools and techniques in the industry. Learn from experienced peers and receive up to $10k to take relevant courses.</li> <li>Grow your career faster by working on a variety of client projects throughout the year.</li> <li>Competitive compensation, as well as the potential for stock in the company and revenue sharing.</li> <li>Comprehensive medical and dental plan, which includes $800 per practitioner (e.g. massage therapy, physiotherapy, orthotics, acupuncture, etc…)</li> <li>Downtown office in trendy King West area at 548 King Street West.</li> <li>Flexible hours with an option to work from home once a week.</li> <li>Up to 5 weeks paid vacation.</li> <li>Optional company GoodLife gym membership.</li> <li>Optional computer hardware.</li> <li>Optional company mobile hardware and phone plan.</li> </ul> <strong>More about Crowdlinker</strong> <br/><br/> To learn more about Crowdlinker, visit https://crowdlinker.com and https://crowdlinker.com/careers <br/><br/> <strong>How to Apply</strong> <br/><br/> Please apply by using the application feature on this page.
Title: Digital Product/Project Manager (Mid Level)

Job_Description: <div> <div>We are seeking a creative and detail-oriented individual to join our marketing team as a <strong>Graphic & Web Designer</strong> <br/><br/> This associate level position is responsible for graphic design of marketing related content. These include digital content and physical collateral. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities</strong>  <ul> <li>Work with the sales and marketing teams to design and edit digital and physical collateral in relation to product lines and the company as a whole</li> <li>Ensure details are consistent and that all work remains on brand and on message</li> <li>Create files and design elements for various uses in the company</li> <li>Work with the marketing team to produce appropriate graphics for email blasts, newsletters, social media posts, and web content</li> <li>Edit existing web pages and work with the marketing team to create additional web pages based on company needs</li> </ul> <strong>Requirements</strong>  <ul> <li>Post-Secondary design related degree/diploma or equivalent with portfolio</li> <li>Expert with graphic design software, adobe creative suite in particular</li> <li>Familiar with various website platforms and web development</li> <li>Self-motivated and great attention to detail</li> <li>Strong organization and communication skills</li> <li>Superb English skills with additional preferred proficiency in Mandarin Chinese</li> </ul> <strong>Compensation/Benefits</strong>  <ul> <li>$18-20 per hour starting salary, wage negotiable based on experience and skillset</li> <li>Eligible for comprehensive benefit program following 3 months of work</li> </ul> <strong>How to Apply/Basic Information:</strong> Interested candidates can apply by emailing your resume, cover letter, portfolio, and wage expectations to careers@drbee.ca with the subject line “Graphic Designer”. <br/><br/> To learn more about us, please visit our website at drbee.ca <br/><br/> Please note: Only short-listed applicants will be contacted, we look forward to hearing from you! <br/><br/> Job Type: Full Time <br/><br/> Job Location(s):  <ul> <li>Pitt Meadows, B.C.</li> </ul>  </div> </div> <br/>
Title: Graphic & Web Designer

Job_Description: <strong>Job Description:</strong> <br/><br/> The HTS Controls Group is seeking an enthusiastic, hard-working UI Designer who will work under the direction of the Programming Manager based in our Toronto Office. You will be responsible for creating custom BAS user interfaces for our Controls projects. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities:</strong>   <ul> <li>Gathers project documentation from the corporate server and other departments as required.</li> <li>Produces project specific user interfaces from engineered shop drawings, programming datasets and AutoCAD floor plans.</li> <li>Evaluates allocated time and reports any anticipated overruns.</li> <li>Completes projects within agreed timelines.</li> <li>Provides revisions as required based on feedback from field teams and clients.</li> <li>Develops HTS standard processes and interfaces and maintains existing graphics libraries.</li> <li>Participates in project meetings (internal and site) as required.</li> <li>Conducts user experience research and testing.</li> <li>Contributes to continual improvement initiatives.</li> <li>Other duties as assigned by management.</li> </ul>  <strong>Skills/Qualifications:</strong>   <ul> <li>Two-year degree in a related field.</li> <li>Detail oriented with strong organizational skills.</li> <li>Effective management of multiple projects with competing deadlines.</li> <li>Ability to receive, apply and provide constructive feedback.</li> <li>Self-motivated learner.</li> <li>Experience with JCI, Tridium, Alerton, Iconics or similar building automation systems would be a definite advantage.</li></ul>
Title: UI Designer

Job_Description: About the UX Designer position<br/><br/>We are looking for a skilled UX Designer who will design our mobile applications and platforms to help meet our customers' needs. You will make our product more user-friendly and intuitive to attract and retain customers, by combining interfaces and workflows to enhance user experience. <br/><br/> A successful candidate should be an analytical and creative designer who is able to grasp user needs and solve problems. We also expect you to have strong portfolio of successful UX and other technical projects.<br/><br/>UX Designer responsibilities are:   <ul>    <li>Analyze and meet product specifications and user expectations</li>  <li>Perform concept and usability testing and gather feedback</li>  <li>Use special personas based on user research results</li>  <li>Create right interaction models and evaluate their success</li>  <li>Build wireframes and prototypes around customer needs</li>  <li>Solve UX problems, such as usability or findability, using creative approach</li>  <li>Collaborate with UI designers to implement attractive designs</li>  <li>Discuss design ideas and prototypes with developers</li>  <li>Stay informed about competitor products and industry trends</li>  </ul>  <br/> <strong>UX Designer requirements are:</strong>   <ul>    <li>2+ years' experience of working on a UX Designer, UI Designer or other relevant position</li>  <li>Significant experience with design software and a solid portfolio of design projects</li>  <li>Excellent knowledge of interaction design and information architecture</li>  <li>Good knowledge of Android and iOS Material Design</li>  <li>Experience in project management and research will be a bonus</li>  <li>Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with business-oriented approach</li>  <li>Strong communication skills</li>  <li>BSc in Design, Computer Science, Engineering or other related area</li> </ul>  <br/>
Title: UX Designer

Job_Description: <div><div> <div><strong>Summary:</strong></div><div></div><div>Boeing Global Services is hiring for User Experience Designers within its Boeing Vancouver sites to help design, develop and optimize the future of analytics-driven products for the aviation industry. You will be involved in all phases of the solution innovation, development and delivery lifecycle within the Digital Aviation & Analytics business as it innovates and optimizes these solutions to enable the worlds flying fleet.</div><div>As part of the team, you will be working with internal business partners and outside customers to identify and define business problems, grow and apply aviation domain knowledge and communicate the value of solutions. As a User Experience Designer, you will empowered to conduct user research & testing and be a key contributor in the end-to-end design of complex software solutions, creating effective, user-focused user experiences. Given the tight coupling with data analytics teams for this role, opportunities in data visualization design and visual analytics will also be central.</div><div>The positions will report within the Commercial Services Analytics Portfolio organization. As the cross-functional teams and customers are located globally, the position will involve some travel, particularly to the USA.</div><div></div><div><strong>Essential Duties and Responsibilities:</strong></div><div></div>  <ul> <li><div>Work on a wide range of UX activities from concept through to deployment</div></li><li><div>Collaborate with product managers to document user stories and translate complex requirements and concepts into functional designs</div></li><li><div>Analyze requirements, identifying task sequences and workflows and creating user scenarios that clearly communicate key tasks.</div></li><li><div>Perform user research activities to uncover and define user needs and communicated them with the product team</div></li><li><div>Communicate the rationale for design approach with project teams and stakeholders</div></li><li><div>Work as part of the agile team to integrate design approaches on large scale projects, ensuring integration across complex platforms</div></li><li><div>Create wireframes, storyboards, user flows, process flows and site maps to effectively communicate interaction and design ideas</div></li><li><div>Apply formal and informal usability testing approaches to evaluate and validate design approaches</div></li><li><div>Maintain style guides and contribute to UI design standards and practices</div></li><li><div>Promote the benefits of the UX process and user-centered design to improve the usability of software</div></li> </ul>  <strong><div>Demonstrated Knowledge and Skills:</div> <br/> </strong>  <ul> <li><div>You can walk non-technical stakeholders through your design thought process</div></li><li><div>You are customer obsessed and data-driven</div></li><li><div>You have experience with data visualization, working on complex data driven apps and tools</div></li><li><div>You have experience with a variety of design tools (Adobe & Sketch experience preferred)</div></li><li><div>You have experience working on UI / UX solutions within an Agile development environment</div></li><li><div>You have experience in acquiring user data or working with a team responsible for gathering user data</div></li><li><div>Your conceptual and visual communication skills are strong</div></li><li><div>Basic HTML and CSS coding skills an asset</div></li><li><div>Experience operating in an environment with remote teams an asset</div></li><li><div>Passionate about sharing your portfolio of your previous body of work</div></li><li><div>You judge your success by customers feedback on the product</div></li><li><div>You love design trends who stays on top of all the latest trends</div></li><li><div>Great sense of humour we work extremely hard, and have fun doing it!</div></li><li><div>Activity participate in the design community, meetups and events to promote our brand</div></li> </ul>  <strong></div><div></div><div><strong>Education/Experience:</div> <br/> </strong>  <ul> <li><div>You have a degree in Human Factors, Visual Design, Computer Science, related UX / UI degree / certificate or have an equivalent combination of education and experience</div></li><li><div>You have 4+ years work experience as a UX / UI designer, with end-to-end experience working on complex projects</div></li></ul></div> <br/>
Title: User Experience Design Specialist 3

Job_Description: <p>Interested in being a part of a team that is leading the evolution of retail in Canada? </p><p><br></p><p>Embracing and driving change is critical to our success. The complexity and rate at which the retail industry is transforming has increased exponentially in recent years and we are committed to being a leader in the industry. As such we are relentlessly focused on innovating at every level of our business, investing in new technologies and products, and doubling down on the best talent to drive the company forward. It is an especially exciting time to join the Canadian Tire Family of Companies. </p><p><br></p><p>Our IT team plays a critical role in our evolution, specifically as we transition to an omni-retailer where digital complements the physical. Our commitment to being a world-class digital organization is evident in how we are using cutting-edge technologies to bring our digital strategy to life in-store, online and on your mobile devices, ultimately improving customer experiences, driving traffic, and boosting loyalty.</p><p><br></p><p>The App DevOps team enables our consumers to experience Canadian tire through new and emerging digital channels. Retail is changing in Canada and Canadian Tire is on the leading edge of this transformation. To us, culture comes first and is based on support and teamwork. </p><p><br></p><p>In Winnipeg, we are investing in creative people to build world-leading software to enhance the Canadian Tire retail experience and continue to support and augment them in an evolving industry. We expect our Winnipeg lab to refocus the lens retail is experienced through by revitalizing current applications and cultivate new digital experiences. </p><p><br></p><p><b>What you’ll do</b> </p><p></p><ul><li>To be a part of the team, you must have experience in building applications with high performance connecting to several backend Web Services exchanging data with complex systems. </li><li>Strong knowledge of modern best practices for professional software development including secure coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing, and operations.</li><li>Experience developing native mobile applications connecting to Secured Web Services and familiarity with security standards for API’s, SSL, and Tokens is highly preferred.</li><li>Design patterns while creating the functionality outlined in the requirement document and convert functional requirements into user interface designs and prototypes, and developed application(s). Work closely with the UI/UX design team to ensure feasibility of implementation of designs.</li><li>Utilize different languages & web platforms to create scalable web and mobile applications based on business requirements.</li><li>Interface with internal project owners, creative team members and developers to ensure that the applications, experiences and websites display and function as expected.</li><li>Able to code and develop features that leverage in-app purchases, eCommerce, engaging experiences and social media integration.</li><li>Convert Mobile App, Digital Display and Website design specifications (wireframes and mock-ups) into working software.</li><li>Provide recommendations and solutions that meet business needs while ensuring an intuitive and best-in-class end user experience.</li><li>Play an active role and take ownership of optimization and performance activities for our interactive digital experiences.</li><li>Collaborate within the App DevOps team and key stakeholders to incorporate the business requirements based on research informed solutions for both psychological and physical elements that will enhance the customer journey and overall experience</li><li>Participate at all phases of the software development life cycle and work with the team via Agile programming practices (such as Scrum or Kanban) to drive team delivery.</li><li>Leverage your past experience with version control software, such as Git or Perforce to communicate and enforce sound code control practices within the development team.</li><li>Effectively develops and encourages clean, well structured, easily maintainable code bases.</li><li>Executes a regular cadence of Code Reviews and shares feedback throughout the team.</li><li>Consult on browser capability and rendering to ensure that proposals and development will work on specified platforms.</li></ul><p></p><p><b>What you’ve done</b></p><p></p><ul><li>Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Engineering preferred or equivalent Software Development industry experience.</li><li>5 years of Web or App development experience.</li><li>Holds a passion for client-side development and a strong background in building highly dynamic web apps leveraging a Javascript stack with HTML5, REST, CSS3, jQuery, and working knowledge of Cordova. </li><li>Has practical knowledge and experience with Git, Gulp, and Node.JS.</li><li>Functional and practical understanding of JavaScript MVC frameworks leveraging Ionic and Angular.</li><li>Experience with CSS frameworks and pre-processor’s similar to Bootstrap, Sass or Less.</li><li>Development experience on server side JavaScript.</li><li>Experienced with software architecture and design patterns.</li><li>Adapted to leveraging a Scrum/Agile development methodology and is passionate about optimizing process to keep agility high.</li><li>Experience with testing frameworks, continuous integration and build tools (i.e. jUnit, DBUnit, Jenkins/Hudson)</li><li>Proficient in writing automated Unit tests (Jasmine / Karma).</li><li>Advanced knowledge of JavaScript Single Page Applications and related tools.</li><li>Experienced using and automating tests, documentation, builds and deployment.</li><li>Large scale application development an asset.</li><li>Experience developing reusable APIs, consuming web services (REST) and processing data (XML/JSON)</li><li>Experience with both iOS Objective-C and Swift 2.0 required, Swift 3.0 or Android Studio, Android SDK, and related languages (Java) a big plus!</li></ul><p></p><p><b>Why us</b></p><p><br></p><p>Canadian Tire is one of Canada’s most iconic and diversified companies. Our culture and values uphold our pledge to sustainable practices, and commitment to our local communities through Jumpstart cannot be beat. </p><p><br></p><p>To learn more about this team and the Canadian Tire Family of Companies follow us on LinkedIn.</p>  Canadian Tire is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace for all. We recognize that our future success depends on the perspectives and contributions of all our employees -- their diverse backgrounds, abilities and experiences make our business stronger. If you are contacted for a job opportunity, please advise us of any accommodations needed to ensure fair and equitable access throughout the recruitment and selection process. All accommodation information provided will be treated as confidential and used only for the purpose of providing an accessible candidate experience.
Title: Canadian Tire

Job_Description: <strong>Exigences ( English Below)</strong> <ul> <li>DEC dans un domaine pertinent (programmation, conception logicielle, web)</li><li>Au moins 3 ans d’expérience en développement logiciel</li><li>Expérience obligatoire en:  <ul> <li><strong>Programmation C++</strong></li></ul></li> </ul>   <ul> <li>Développment logiciel du web (HTML, CSS, JavaScript, REST API),
