Title: Développeur logiciel -- Software Developer

Job_Description: Job Description <br/> We are looking for a capable, hard working and efficient individual to join our team! <br/> Please note this is an "In-house" position at our Pickering office. <br/> The Graphic/Web Designer Duties Will Include:  <ul> <li>Prepares work to be accomplished by gathering information and materials. Plans concept by studying information and materials. Illustrates concept by designing rough layout of art and copy regarding arrangement, size, type size and style, and related aesthetic concepts. Obtains approval of concept by submitting rough layout for approval. Prepares finished copy and art by operating typesetting, printing, and similar equipment; purchasing from vendors. Prepares final layout by marking and pasting up finished copy and art. Ensures operation of equipment by completing preventive maintenance requirements; following manufacturer's instructions; troubleshooting malfunctions; calling for repairs; maintaining equipment inventories; evaluating new equipment. Completes projects by coordinating with outside agencies, art services, printers, etc. Maintains technical knowledge by attending design workshops; reviewing professional publications; participating in professional societies. Contributes to team effort by accomplishing related results as needed.Graphic Designer Skills and Qualifications: <br/> Graphic Design Skills, Layout Skills, Creative Services, Customer Focus, Creativity, Flexibility, Attention to Detail, Deadline-Oriented, Desktop Publishing Tools, Acute Vision, Handles Rejection <br/> We thank you for applying and we will be contacting those selected for interviews directly. <br/> Job Types: Full-time, Permanent <br/> <strong>Experience:</li>  </strong>  <li>Web Development: 3 years- Website Design: 3 years- Graphic Design: 3 years</li> </ul>
Title: Graphic Web Designer

Job_Description: Unito.io is a work collaboration tool based in Montreal and one of BetaKit's top startups to watch in 2018. Were a VC-backed SaaS company that makes people happier, organizations more productive, and software more powerful, all over the world. <br/><br/> We are looking for someone who ...<br/><br/>What you will do:  <ul> <li>Design and improve the UX of Unitos app.</li><li>Translate concepts into wireframes and mockups that lead to intuitive user experiences.</li><li>Research, wireframe, prototype and mock up user experiences, using feedback to iterate and improve on them as you go.</li><li>Identify design problems and devise elegant solutions.</li><li>Make strategic design and user-experience decisions related to core and new functions and features.</li><li>Collaborate with other team members and stakeholders.</li><li>Take smart risks and champion new ideas.</li><li>Understand key features by interviewing stakeholders & prepare a UX wireframe before kickoff meetings to help anchor team discussions.</li><li>Incorporate user research and usability testing to iterate on product solutions.</li><li>Lead and participate in concept sessions leveraging ethnographic research and design thinking.</li><li>Balance customer frictions and needs with our clients business goals, market viability and technical feasibility.</li><li>Proven experience delivering concepts, personas, user journeys, storyboards, user flows, wireframes, prototypes, etc.</li><li>Partner with engineering to ensure designs are properly implemented.</li> </ul>  <strong>Requirements</strong>  <ul> <li>2+ years' experience of working on a UX Designer, UI Designer or other relevant position.</li><li>Have experience with UX on enterprise software.</li><li>Analyze and meet product specifications and user expectations.</li><li>Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with business-oriented approach.</li><li>Significant experience with design software and a solid portfolio of design projects.</li><li>Strong communication skills.</li> </ul>  It'd be nice if you  <ul> <li>Have a good knowledge of HTML/CSS.</li><li>Know React and Javascript.</li><li>Have experience in project management and research will be a bonus.</li> </ul>  Who we are<br/><br/>Unito is a fast-growing startup and winner of Founder Institute's Best Startup in Canada in 2017. If youre looking to build something youll be proud of and help shape the company, then youll fit right in! <br/><br/> Were taking on a major problem that people are passionate about solving: we make it easier to collaborate across teams. We don't make users learn new tools and change the way they work. By connecting work management tools, we allow managers, cross-functional teams, departments, and entire companies to benefit from seamless collaboration and improved communication. We sync projects across a number of tools, but our main focus is on Trello, Asana, JIRA, GitHub, and Wrike. This is a hard problem of semantics, synchronization, and APIs. <br/><br/> Our software is changing the collaborative work landscape and is the only software of its kind on the market. We pride ourselves in having one of the most talented and motivated teams in town. Weve acquired tens thousands of trial users, hundreds of paying customers, hired 16 people, and connected 9 different applications together. Were on a mission to change how collaboration works between teams for almost any company in the world, and weve shown so far that weve got what it takes to succeed.<br/><br/>Benefits  <ul> <li>Flexible work hours (many of us have kids, we know what its like...)</li><li>Group benefits plan</li><li>Convenient downtown location (Place Ville Marie)</li><li>Free coffee, tea, beer, and fruit-infused water</li><li>Gorgeous office space with common areas and kitchen</li><li>Wellness spending budget for self-improvement purposes</li> </ul>  Culture:<br/><br/>Our team is a family of humble and hungry individuals, varying in age, cultures, and backgrounds. We prefer to focus more on the quality of our work, and less on things like policies or rules. We trust our team and encourage them to make independent decisions, ask questions, share ideas, and voice opinions. Everyone's voice is heard. <br/><br/> Here at Unito, were huge on transparency, honesty, and execution. We have no tolerance for politics, and value flexibility, autonomy, fairness, and respect. We share achievements, and learn from failures together as a team. <br/><br/> Our team operates through areas of of responsibility, with no official job titles and a flat org chart. We like to joke that we don't have an open door policy because we don't even have doors. We are inclusive and welcoming, and dedicated to building a team of high performers. We want every employee to maximize his or her potential, learn, and grow within the company. <br/><br/> If this position sounds like a good fit, wed love to hear from you!
Title: UX Designer

Job_Description: <div><strong>Must Have :</strong> <br/><br/> Front end Web dev <br/> <strong>HTML5/CSS3</strong> <br/> <strong>SCSS/LESS</strong> <br/> Automation tasks using Grunt / Gulp/web pack <br/> Implementing/using end to end testing <br/> UI tasks <br/><br/> <strong>Description:</strong> <ul> <li>Deep <br/> understanding of responsive design HTML5/CSS3, properties, features, <br/> compatibility</li> <li>Able to <br/> code multi-browser multiplatform platform and mobile-first components</li> <li>Good <br/> grasp on SCSS/LESS features such as mixins, nesting, partials, extends and <br/> inheritance and use these features daily.</li> <li>Used to <br/> creating his/her own automation tasks using Grunt / Gulp to optimize/compress <br/> code automatically and automate daily UI tasks, help us to migrated to web pack <br/> or other tool</li> <li>Efficient <br/> in building media-queries with respect to the breakpoints and overall viewport <br/> sizes.</li> <li>Understands <br/> high-level concepts such as 'loose coupling' and 'non-semantic' approach to <br/> building SPA and can properly apply these concepts daily.</li> <li>Able to <br/> provide an impact analysis to any modification to the SCSS/HTML code of large <br/> application</li> <li>Has <br/> experience implementing/using end to end testing to your html code using <br/> protractor.js (or other popular library).</li>  </ul>  Creates <br/> reusable components and styles across multiples apps</div>  <br/>About Cognizant<br/> <div>Cognizant is one of the world's leading professional services companies, transforming clients' business, operating and technology models for the digital era. Our unique industry-based, consultative approach helps clients envision, build and run more innovative and efficient businesses. Headquartered in the U.S., Cognizant, a member of the NASDAQ-100, is ranked 205 on the Fortune 500 and is consistently listed among the most admired companies in the world. Learn how Cognizant helps clients lead with digital at www.cognizant.com or follow us on Twitter: Cognizant.</div> <br/>
Title: Lead UI Developer

Job_Description: As a UX/UI Designer, you will play an active role in one of our products, doing tactical and strategic work. You should have strong UX skills and a passion for brainstorming, developing, and testing a wide range of design solutions. The ideal candidate should love nothing more than testing solutions with real users and iterating based on feedback.<br/><br/>Responsibilities  <ul>  <li>Collaborate with the Product Manager to implement and evolve the vision for the product</li> <li>Represent the design work and passionately advocate for user-centered needs</li> <li>Develop low-fidelity and high-fidelity prototypes that translate the product vision into clean and intuitive experiences</li> <li>Support/perform user research, story mapping sessions, and usability testing to understand behaviour and explore opportunities</li> <li>Design experiences that can effectively combine product and service offerings into a cohesive concept for our target personas</li> <li>Ensure consistency with the platform standards and cross-product dependencies</li> <li>Collaborates with team members and stakeholders to deliver a compelling and cohesive end-to-end user experience across all applications</li> <li>Manages relationships with internal and external stakeholders to ensure relevant information is shared, effectively communicated and issues are followed up and addressed</li> <li>Perform competitive analysis and keep up with usability standards</li>  </ul>  Skills and Qualifications  <ul>  <li>Experience with the process of building and testing UI prototypes</li> <li>Experience with user testing design solutions and gathering quantitative and qualitative feedback</li> <li>Experience with graphic design and common graphic design tools</li> <li>Knowledge of user research and usability testing techniques and methods, and applying user findings to UX design solutions</li> <li>Excellent feel for beautiful aesthetics of software user interfaces</li> <li>Strong conceptualization ability, strong visual communication ability, drawing skills and sketchbook technique</li> <li>Strong working knowledge and experience with user interface design patterns and methodologies</li> <li>Ability to work with product managers and teams to understand detailed requirements and design UX solutions that meet needs and vision</li> <li>Understanding of Agile; experience working directly in one or more Agile frameworks would be a plus (e.g., Scrum)</li> <li>Ability to work efficiently and meet/exceed deadlines under pressure</li>  </ul>  <strong> </strong>
Title: UXUI Designer

Job_Description: <div><div><div>...</strong></div> </li>  </ul>   </div> </div> <br/><strong>Date:</strong>  <br/>  Jan 17, 2018 <br/><br/> <strong>Location:</strong>  <br/>  Montreal, QC, CA, H3B 4G7<br/> <div>At Rogers we’re for supporting you on a journey to a rewarding career. Right now, we are looking for talented individuals to join our winning team where you will have a chance to innovate, grow and to do what really matters. <br/><br/> We are currently seeking unusually talented and highly versatile front-end developers who live and breathe HTML 5, CSS and javascript and either love or are willing to try a long-term relationship with Angular.js or React.js, with a bit of dabbling in other javascript frameworks from time to time. experience in building mobile responsive pages with javascript frameworks</li> <li>Experience with Social Media APIs (Facebook, Twitter, etc)</li> <li>Development using Scrum Agile methodologies is a plus</li> <li>Demonstrated ability to create single page applications, either through prior experience, school projects or special websites you have built to showcase your skills</li> <li>You truly love to code and build Digital experiences as evidenced by prior projects and experience</li> <li>Strong organizational and estimation skills</li> <li>Exceptional communications and presentation skills</li> </ul>  <div><strong>Schedule:</strong> Full Time</div><br/>  <div><strong>Shift:</strong> Day</div><br/>  <div><strong>Length of Contract:</strong> Not Applicable (Regular Position)</div><br/>  <div><strong>Work Location:</strong> 1200, avenue McGill College (179), Montreal, QC</div><br/>  <div><strong>Travel Requirements:</strong> Up to 10%</div><br/>  <div><strong>Posting Category/Function:</strong> Technology & Software Development</div><br/>  <div><strong>Requisition ID:</strong> 114234</div><br/>  <div><strong>WHY ROGERS?</strong></div><br/>  <div>As a proud Canadian company, we're dedicated to making things easier for our customers. Job_Description: <div>Location: Quebec- Canada</div> <div>Job ID: 18WD28648</div><br/> <div><strong>Position Overview</strong></div><div>Do you want to create engaging, helpful, and attractive websites that are frequented by millions of visitors worldwide? Autodesk’s Web Platform Engineering team is looking for a talented front-end engineer who is passionate about technology to join our globally distributed team and help us develop beautiful, personalized website experiences.</div><br/> <div>As part of the Web Platform Engineering team, you will be implementing exciting new features that engage and influence Autodesk customers. Our team faces a variety of unique and interesting challenges, from creating new and engaging end-user experiences, to digging into low-level performance details and helping streamline web experiences. To be successful in this role, you’ll need a solid foundation in JavaScript, CSS, and client-side web technologies, a passion for shaping conceptual ideas into a beautiful website, and a desire to tackle new challenges head-on. This is your chance to work with a team of experienced and talented individuals, participate in a fun and engaging workplace culture, and have your work seen and used by millions.</div><br/> <div><strong>Responsibilities</strong></div><div>  <ul> <li>Implement visual and interactive elements that engage users with when using a web application</li><li>Translate UI/UX design wireframes to top-quality, maintainable, cross-browser compliant HTML, CSS and JavaScript</li><li>Collaborate with cross-functional teams worldwide to develop compelling website features</li><li>Provide estimates, technical design and implementation solutions</li><li>Support and develops other engineers by providing code review, advice and coaching</li><li>Be a subject matter expert in specific parts of a system</li><li>Communicate effectively and responsibly in an Agile environment</li><li>Evaluate and recommend processes to improve efficiency, like documentation and testing</li><li>Evaluate and recommend engineering best practices, tools and techniques</li><li>Document implementation solutions in wiki pages, flowcharts, code comments and clear code</li><li>Address existing technical debt and develop strategies to minimize it over time</li><li>Optimize application for maximum speed and scalability</li></ul></div><br/>  <div><strong>Minimum Qualifications</strong> </div><div>  <ul> <li>Strong knowledge and experience with web technology stacks</li><li>Familiar understanding of web services, including REST</li><li>Experience developing efficient and reliable JavaScript (ES6/2015)</li><li>Full understanding of DOM scripting and web APIs</li><li>Experience creating and maintaining highly effective and maintainable CSS</li><li>Working knowledge of CSS preprocessors</li><li>Full understanding of Object-Oriented and Functional programming paradigms</li><li>Possess knowledge of industry best practices and good software architecture</li><li>An understanding of current trends in web and mobile development</li><li>Experience with JavaScript testing frameworks (Jasmine, mocha.js, etc.)</li><li>6 or more years of relevant programming experience</li><li>1 or more years of experience working in a modern web application stack (React, Backbone, Angular, Ember, etc.)</li> <li>Great communication skills and proven ability to work as part of a team</li><li>Provide feedback and guidance to peers</li><li>Proficiency in spoken and written English</li></ul></div><br/>  <div><strong>Preferred Qualifications</strong></div><div>  <ul> <li>eCommerce experience</li><li>Understanding of security best practices</li><li>Familiarity and experience with Adobe AEM (CQ) and related technologies</li><li>Production React experience</li><li>Experience with Node.js, npm, gulp, and webpack</li><li>Experience working with globally distributed teams</li><li>Experience working in the Agile methodology</li><li>Familiarity with responsive web design</li><li>Build reusable code and libraries for future use</li></ul></div><br/>  <div></div>
Title: Principal UI Engineer

Job_Description: Torstar Corporation is a broadly based, progressive media organization listed on the Toronto Stock Exchange (TS.B) with a long, proud history in newspapers and a passion for capitalizing on the fluid world of digital and mobile media. Torstar will be energized by a deep customer-centric obsession, continued journalistic excellence, advanced data-driven competency and a culture that is selfless, focused, agile, collaborative and results driven . You’ll be a champion of those priorities while you leverage Torstar’s wealth of data to drive revenues for a company that is poised and positioned to lead in all of its media ventures. <br/><br/> <strong>As A Member Of Our HIGH PERFORMANCE Team You Will:</strong> <ul> <li>Leverage rigorous design research and usability principles as well as your intuitive design sense to help understand our customers and their needs;</li><li>Plot and map user journeys from product discovery through enrollment, down multiple engagement routes and through to journey completion</li> <li>Create deliverables such as process flows, wireframes, mockups and functional prototypes to effectively communicate design strategies and detailed interaction behaviors</li><li>Contribute to the product roadmap with ideas helping evolve and iterate on the user experience based on quantitative data and qualitative user research</li><li>Consult with Product Owner, Scrum team, customers and users in decision making surrounding user flows, sitemaps, layout, styling and technical feasibility</li></ul>  <ul> <li>Design and conduct user experience research quickly and apply it to design sprints for both product and delivery teams</li><li>Possess excellent understanding of visual design principles, style guidelines, design processes, and creative workflow, merging design, data & consumer insights into immersive digital experiences</li></ul>  <ul> <li>Work as a member of the UX and Design team, helping to define and design clear, beautiful interfaces for the web and mobile devices;</li><li>Facilitate collaboration with the broader team along the way, and present the rationale behind decisions to client stakeholders;</li><li>Provide detailed specifications for UI developers to use.</li> </ul> <br/><br/> <strong>Who You Are…</strong> <ul> <li>Minimum 4 years’ experience designing responsive web or mobile software applications, with an emphasis on the ability to communicate using rapid visual design techniques</li><li>Online portfolio of work demonstrating clean user interface design, ability to solve complex design challenges, using a thoughtful design process.</li> <li>Expertise with Adobe Creative Suite, InVision and other prototyping and visualization software</li> <li>Strong ability in applying design thinking tenants and user centered design principles to design challenges</li><li>Experience building rich, interactive prototypes</li> </ul>  <ul> <li>Persuasively recommends and promotes UX principles with enthusiasm, conviction, and assertiveness.</li> <li>Interface, collaborate with team and company stakeholders to ensure the user experience reflects player needs and consistency</li> </ul>  <ul> <li>High level of technical acuity with a thorough understanding of front end technologies</li><li>Experience working in an Agile environment an asset;</li> </ul> <br/><br/> <strong>Why You’ll LOVE Working Here…</strong> <br/><br/> The opportunity to be part of an exciting company grounded in history while striving to be at the cutting edge of the digital media industry; you'll never get bored in our fast-paced, constantly evolving and challenging environment <ul> <li>We recognize that you have a life outside of work and we offer you real work/life balance</li><li>We provide individualized career plans and extensive ongoing development opportunities</li><li>We've got your health in mind; you'll get a comprehensive benefits package & group RSP (Extended Health Care, Dental, etc.) combined with a generous vacation plan</li> </ul> …And let’s not forget the <strong>AWESOME PEOPLE!</strong> <br/><br/> The Company is committed to providing an inclusive and barrier free recruitment process to applicants with accessibility needs in accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA). If you require an accommodation during this process, please inform The Company of your requirements

multidisciplinaire;</li><li>Capacités identifier les forces et faiblesses des différentes interfaces;</li><li>Être passionné de jeux vidéos;</li><li>Avoir des connaissances en conception 3D et en Title: Concepteur UI

Job_Description: <strong>Job Summary</strong> <br/><br/> We’re on the lookout for highly talented UX/UI Designer to come join our growing team of instructors in Toronto. <br/><br/> We look for people with a passion for sharing their knowledge who have significant real-world experience. Educational experience is a bonus, but all of our instructional team receive in-depth training in the latest instructional and educational approaches, and so this is much less important than your attitude, knowledge and portfolio. <br/><br/> You will be joining a team of designers to help develop and deliver our full-time UX/UI Design Program while working closely with a team of other instructors to help deliver a world-class curriculum. In parallel, you will also be part of RED Academy’s in-house creative team, working on building out RED Academy's ed tech projects, marketing efforts, and Community Projects. <br/><br/> Our classes are taught in small teams with a ratio of 7:1 students per instructor. The programs are designed to be relevant to the today’s fast paced tech industry with personalized and applied content, working on real-world web projects from our network of partners. <br/><br/> <strong>Why RED?</strong> <br/><br/> In short, working at RED is unlike anything you will have experienced before. Aside from the deeply rewarding work of teaching, we offer 4 weeks paid holiday, and everyone in our team spends 20% of their time working on personal and community projects that you get to choose so that your skills stay sharp and at the forefront of the industry. <br/><br/> We believe in autonomy, and so our people get to drive their own role, while we provide mentoring, training and personal development so you are building a career path you love and can truly connect with. <br/><br/> Above all, we are committed to providing a deeply engaging, truly dynamic and highly rewarding work environment, where our team can thrive and find the highest possible levels of personal and professional fulfillment and satisfaction. <br/><br/> And best of all - all of our people share a deep passion for what they do: for design and technology and finding the most forward-thinking ways of delivering a truly world-class learning experience for our students, all of which makes RED an amazing place to work. <br/><br/> We are in a very ambitious phase of growth, and in all of our people - we are looking for competent, hands-on team players. This is a pivotal role at one of Canada’s largest private technology academy, and you will play a central part in our continued growth and success. <br/><br/> <strong>Skills and Qualifications</strong>  <ul> <li>You are the person that your colleagues naturally gravitate to when they are looking for guidance.</li>  <li>You have at least 5 years of experience working in UX or UI design</li> </ul> You will be a subject matter expert with deep working experience in all of the areas of the UX and UI Design program, which includes the following areas:  <ul> <li>User Research (interviews, survey, task/competitive analysis)</li>  <li>Data analysis (persona creation, storyboards, use cases)</li>  <li>Business Analytics (conversion funnel, KPI’s, cohort analysis)</li>  <li>IA & Navigation (sitemaps, navigation design, card sorting, taxonomies)</li>  <li>User Flows</li>  <li>Wireframes</li>  <li>Rapid prototyping (sketches, paper prototypes, usability testing)</li>  <li>High-fidelity prototyping</li>  <li>Visual Design (Typography, Colour Theory, Composition)</li>  <li>Industry standard design software (Adobe Creative Suite, Invision, Axure, Sketch)</li>  <li>Brand Design</li>  <li>Mobile-first design</li>  <li>Native Mobile Design</li>  <li>Emerging tech (wearables, VR, AR)</li> </ul> Above all you have a great portfolio of work and a love for what you do. <br/><br/> <strong>Primary Duties & Responsibilities</strong>  <ul> <li>Delivering the immersive full-time design programs.</li>  <li>Facilitate a dynamic and collaborative classroom community</li>  <li>Assist students outside of class as necessary.</li>  <li>To work closely with other members of the instructional and operations team to develop our learning programs and curriculum to ensure we are providing the highest possible quality of learning to our students.</li>  <li>To work with the RED team on web projects and apps for our network of Community Partners and charities.</li>  <li>To assist with student admissions processes and policies where relevant, and support the ongoing management of student records, assessments, evaluations, certification processes and policies.</li>  <li>Communicating and negotiating with third party partners, associations and suppliers.</li>  <li>Develop new learning programs, curricula and learning approaches to ensure we remain relevant to the industry’s demand.</li> </ul> <strong>In Summary</strong> <br/><br/> As an Instructor, you will need to have a deep understanding of the subject matter and a passion to teach. Instructional experience in a technology related subject is a big plus, but the most important thing is being a great fit with our values, to be comfortable in a people facing role, and have a real passion for all things related to technology and education. <br/><br/> If you are interested in this role, please contact us with your resume and a cover letter, providing 3 key reasons why you feel you would be the perfect fit.
Title: Part Time UX Design Instructor

Job_Description: The Senior UX Designer will collaborate across multidisciplinary teams to create insightful, empathetic, data-driven experiences for clients and their users. Utilizing design thinking and working within an agile process, you will conduct user research and testing, create user flow diagrams, build comprehensive wireframes in Sketch, as well as contribute to the rationale behind user-centred design decisions. <br/><br/> No one is an island We believe in sharing work early and often, so you will work iteratively and collaboratively on rough notes and sketches, before hunkering down on detailed high-quality deliverables for our clients. <br/><br/> Located in the Mount Pleasant area of Vancouver, as part of the POWERSHiFTER team you will have access to some of the brightest minds in design, technology, strategy and data science. You will work in an environment that values people, process and performance, collaborating with team members. <br/><br/> Your Mission <br/><br/> We believe that when you start with empathy, amazing things can happen. You will champion this belief through the practice of design thinking and human-centred design principals (HCD) on both client and internal work. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities</strong>: <br/> Work with senior team members to conceptualize and execute designs that will advance clients businesses. <br/><br/> Perform UX audits, help facilitate user testing, and present recommendations on major projects that involve user experience. <br/><br/> Participate in research, stakeholder interviews, and document your findings <br/><br/> Develop research-backed personas <br/><br/> Create user flow and site architecture diagrams to present the clearest path to user goal completion <br/><br/> Collaborate with the Digital Science team to assure design decisions are data-driven <br/><br/> Build wireframes in Sketch <br/><br/> Stay up to date on the latest UX and design trends and requirements for all current and emerging formats of digital UX design. <br/><br/> Work independently and efficiently to meet deadlines. <br/><br/> Actively contribute to internal programs and knowledge sharing. <br/><br/> Share acquired skills with team members through formal and informal channels. <br/><br/> Have fun! <br/><br/> <strong>Requirements</strong>: <br/> <strong>Minimum education requirements</strong>: Relevant Bachelor Degree <br/><br/> <strong>Minimum experience requirements</strong>: 5+ Years <br/><br/> <strong>Benefits</strong>: <br/> This is a contract position (time commitments can be negotiable) <br/><br/> An exciting, yet highly collaborative work environment with amazing peers <br/><br/> Flexible work/life balance
Title: Senior UX Designer (contract)

Job_Description: <strong>Service:</strong> Financial Advisory <br/> <strong>Job Type:</strong> Permanent <br/> <strong>Primary Location:</strong> Toronto, Ontario, Canada <br/> <strong>All Available Locations:</strong> Calgary; Montreal; Toronto; Vancouver<br/> <div> External Posting Description <br/><br/> Deloitte’s <strong>Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning practice (AI and ML)</strong> practice is comprised of specialized experts with hands-on experience, and cutting-edge information assets that facilitate successful Artificial Intelligence (AI) transformations. We develop AI-enabled solutions to address all aspects of a client’s transformative journey with disciplined focus on business outcomes. <br/><br/> <strong>Your role at Deloitte</strong> <ul> <li>Be a well-rounded design enthusiast who focuses on design and user centric / data driven design principles</li> <li>Work closely with our Product Owners, Project Managers, Designers, and Technical teams to detail and create new products and new/update features for existing products</li><li>Own the creation of consistent experiences across platforms</li><li>Balance business goals with optimal user experience</li><li>Work closely with our development teams to implement your designs</li><li>Be able to articulate the thinking & strategy behind your work and why you’ve made certain design decisions</li> </ul> External Posting Qualifications <ul> <li>Are overall design generalists, love great typography, and want to build delightful experiences</li><li>Have worked on a client facing applications or products</li><li>Can execute on beautiful visual design as well as strategic UX thinking</li><li>Understands proactive (user research) and reactive (usability testing) user research</li><li>Understands task analysis and user workflows</li><li>Understands solution automation</li><li>Understands walk-through analysis - i.e. identify areas of interrupted flow, required knowledge, etc…, aside om highlighting UI related issues like, button colour, visual clutter, etc…</li><li>Believe simple is better, and like to create systems that complement each other</li><li>Value open communication and working on a small and exceptionally transparent team</li><li>Take ownership of product design and user experience while taking initiative to create the best products possible</li><li>Take on the responsibility of driving the product forward and take the initiative to receive feedback and iterate on design</li><li>3+ years in a similar role</li><li>Strong skills in the design tool of your choice</li><li>Demonstrated ability to design and present polished and well-thought-out experiences</li><li>Demonstrated ability to design for enterprise deployed applications</li><li>Bonus but not required: ability to code HTML and CSS / SASS</li> </ul> </div> <br/><strong>Why Deloitte?</strong> <br/><br/> Launch your career with The One Firm where you can make a greater impact than you ever thought possible. With endless opportunities at every turn, and a culture built to support and drive our people to be the very best they can be, Deloitte is The One Firm for you to learn, grow, create, and lead. <br/><br/> At Deloitte, we understand that everyone, and their career goals, are different. As a firm, we help create the conditions and opportunities that will enable our people to thrive – both professionally and personally. We do this by making three commitments to our people: <ul> <li><em><strong>You will lead at every level:</strong></em> We grow the world’s best leaders so you can achieve the impact you seek, faster.</li><li><em><strong>You can work your way:</strong></em> We give you the means to work how you want, and we have innovative spaces and the mindset to help you be wildly successful.</li><li><em><strong>You will feel included and inspired:</strong></em> We create a deep sense of belonging where you can bring your whole self to work.</li> </ul> Apply now and let us show you how to push your career to the next level at <em><strong>Deloitte. The One Firm. For You.</strong></em> <br/><br/> Deloitte is an inclusive employer dedicated to building a diverse workforce. We encourage applications from all qualified candidates and will accommodate applicants’ needs under the respective provincial human rights codes throughout all stages of the recruitment and selection process. Please advise the Recruiter to ensure your accessibility needs are accommodated throughout this process. Information received relating to accommodation will be addressed confidentially. <br/><br/> We thank all applicants in advance for their interest; however, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted <br/><br/> 35454

Title: Front-End/UX Developer

Job_Description: Cvent’s UI Development team is responsible for and focused on the implementation of all customer-facing User Interfaces and executing on the customer (CX) and user experience (UX) strategies. <br/><br/> As Manager, you will play an integral role and work collaboratively with various stakeholder groups to deliver enhancements to our enterprise applications. The ideal candidate must have a genuine passion for the latest developments in frontend technologies as well as be able to provide technical insight and expertise to the Product Design process. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities:</strong>  <ul>  	 <li>  Collaborate with Product Management, Design, and other Engineering teams to effectively align resources to meet goals and roadmap commitments.</li>   <li>  Measure your team's performance using KPI’s and KPO’s.</li>   <li>  Maintain a platform perspective and work closely with your leads and architects to ensure proper technical direction and identify best practices.</li>   <li>  Be a technologist, who understands the architecture and design decisions, including when tradeoffs must be made to meet business objectives.</li>   <li>  Be a people manager and cheerleader for your team. Coaching and planning individual growth and development.</li>   <li>  Some travel may be required to support distributed team members</li> </ul> <strong>Skills and Qualifications:</strong>  <ul>  	 <li>  Bachelors or Post Graduate Degree in Computer Science, Computer Information Systems, Human-Computer Interaction or related technical or design field.</li>   <li>  7+ year(s) developing user interfaces for large-scale applications.</li>   <li>  3+ year(s) as a team lead or manager for UI Development or Front End Engineering group.</li>   <li>  Expert level proficiency and ability to mentor others in HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, ES6/7.</li>   <li>  Experience using CSS pre-processors to author stylesheets.</li>   <li>  Experience in authoring UI for single page applications that meet WCAG 2.0 AA web accessibility standards to support customers who use assistive technologies.</li>   <li>  Expertise in version control systems such as GIT or Subversion.·</li>    <li>  Familiarity with build tools such Grunt, Gulp or Webpack.</li>   <li>  Strong written and verbal communication skills.</li> </ul>
Title: UI Development Manager

Job_Description: <div>Gestionnaire, Expérience utilisateurs (UX)-18-3127869-1</div> <div>Syndiqué : Non</div> <div><strong>Le poste : Gestionnaire – Expérience utilisateurs, produits (UX)</strong> <ul> <li>Vous aimez être au cœur de l'innovation pour bâtir en équipe l'avenir.</li><li>Vous êtes passionné par l’expérience utilisateur, curieux et inspirant.</li><li>Vous avez une capacité exceptionnelle à communiquer et à susciter l’adhésion de vos pairs</li> </ul>  <div><strong>L’équipe de Gestion de Produits a une place pour vous !</strong></div> <br/>Relevant du directeur de l’autonomie et expérience produits, vous serez responsable de l’expérience d’utilisation des produits de Vidéotron afin de répondre aux objectifs d'affaires de Vidéotron et de ses clients. <br/><br/> Vous serez également responsable de faire le lien entre les requis d’affaires et les équipes de développements (internes et externes) afin d’assurer la réussite, la livraison en temps et la meilleure expérience d’utilisation des produits de Vidéotron.<br/> <div><strong>Les principales responsabilités</strong></div>  <ul> <li>Analyser les besoins utilisateurs en combinant diverses méthodes qualitatives et quantitatives (observations, entrevues, tests utilisateurs, parcours client, analytique, tests A/B, etc.)</li><li>Animer des ateliers de co-création qui serviront à définir le mandat et donner l’orientation de l’expérience d’utilisation;</li><li>Établir une stratégie de conception de l’expérience d’utilisation conséquente du type de mandat;</li><li>Élaborer les flux d’utilisation principaux, l’architecture d’information des projets pour atteindre les objectifs d’affaires de Vidéotron et maximiser l’engagement de l’utilisateur;</li><li>Collaborer avec l’équipe développement de produits à l’élaboration de la portée du produit en général et de l’expérience d’utilisation en particulier;</li><li>Collaborer activement à la rédaction des «users stories» basée sur la portée du produit;</li><li>Présenter à différentes étapes de la conception de l’expérience d’utilisation aux différentes parties prenantes;</li><li>Concevoir et rédiger les spécifications destinées aux équipes de développement;</li><li>Fournir des recommandations à sa direction en prenant en considération l’expérience conçue, la réalité d’affaires et les contraintes technologiques du projet;</li><li>Assurer le support dans le développement de l’expérience d’utilisation avec les fournisseurs externes;</li><li>Briefer la direction artistique afin d’obtenir les visuels appropriés;</li><li>Assurer une cohérence fonctionnelle et comportementale entre les différents produits illico de Vidéotron;</li><li>Valider la pertinence des concepts UI/UX proposés à l’égard des objectifs d’affaires de la compagnie.</li><li>Mener une veille constante sur les méthodes, outils, tendances UX et être vecteur d’innovation.</li></ul></div> <br/> <div><div><strong>Pouvez-vous relever le défi?</strong></div>  <ul> <li>Formation dans un domaine approprié (design industriel ou graphique, ergonomie, science cognitive ou une autre discipline pertinente);</li><li>3 à 5 ans d’expérience en conception d’expérience d’utilisation et en design d’interface;</li><li>Expérience et portfolios dans les domaines, entre autres, du divertissement, développement d’applications, commerce de détails ou en ligne;</li><li>Excellente connaissance des méthodologies de conception UX, incluant les méthodes de recherche utilisateur;</li><li>Maîtrise du français et de l’anglais, autant à l’oral qu’à l’écrit;</li><li>Maîtrise d’Axure (ou équivalent);</li><li>Excellente aptitude de présentations visuelles et orales;</li><li>Maîtrise de Photoshop, Illustrator et/ou Indesign d’Adobe (atout);</li><li>Connaissance en programmation (html, java, etc) (atout).</li></ul></div> <br/> <div>Si votre candidature est retenue, vous serez contacté pour une entrevue téléphonique dans laquelle les prochaines étapes vous seront communiquées.</div> <div>Lieu de travail : <div>612 St-Jacques</div> <div> Montréal H3C 4M8</div></div><div>Horaire : Temps plein</div><div>Emplacement principal : Montréal</div><div> Nombre d'emplois vacants : 1</div><div>Statut de la fonction : Permanent</div><div> Vidéotron remercie tous les candidats et les candidates qui postuleront. La diversité est une pratique fondamentale dans notre processus de recrutement. Ainsi, nous souscrivons au principe d'équité en emploi et offrons des chances d'emploi égales à tous.<br/><br/><strong>Qui sommes-nous?</strong> <br/><br/> Chef de file canadien des télécommunications et du divertissement, Vidéotron s'impose au Québec par une vision orientée tant vers ses clients que vers ses employés. Entreprise dynamique elle est toujours à l'affût des technologies de pointe pour offrir la meilleure expérience et le meilleur divertissement possible à ses clients. Grâce à la culture d'excellence de ses employés, Vidéotron se différencie par la qualité de ses produits et services ainsi que par son service à la clientèle. Implantée au Québec depuis plus de 50 ans, Vidéotron a obtenu, et ce, pour une onzième année consécutive, le prestigieux titre d'entreprise de télécommunication la plus admirée des Québécois, décerné par le journal Les Affaires. <br/><br/> Joignez-vous à notre succès !</div>
Title: Gestionnaire, Expérience utilisateurs (UX)

Job_Description: Position Location: London, Ontario <br/><br/> Voices.com is the #1 Online Marketplace for Sourcing Voice Over Talent. <br/><br/> We are looking for a passionate and continuous learner who is capable of bringing innovative ideas to the table. You will be part of the entire product development experience, continually delivering value to our customers and stakeholders. We are looking for individuals with a strong affinity for creating amazing digital products and delivering outstanding experiences to our customers. <br/><br/> What you can bring:  <ul>   <li>3-5 years of UX strategy or digital strategy experience with a background in agency, corporate or consulting work</li> <li>2-3 years of experience in UX research, user testing and UX metrics</li> <li>Strong communication skills, written and verbal. The ability to facilitate workshops and present findings in a compelling way, to various types of audiences</li> <li>Ability to articulate your ideas efficiently and effectively to teammates, stakeholders and leadership</li> <li>Ability to collaborate with others to solve complex product challenges in a fast-paced startup culture environment</li> </ul> Even better if:  <ul>   <li>You have some basic familiarity of front-end technologies such as UI Frameworks, HTML/CSS and Javascript</li> <li>You have experience working with product management tools such as JIRA and SalesForce</li> <li>You have some basic familiarity with modern design systems and tools like Sketch, Invision and Adobe CC</li> </ul>  <br/> Your role will include the following responsibilities:   <ul>   <li>Working on a brand new product in a fast growing company using lean/agile principles</li> <li>Working with a cross-functional product team including Developers, Marketers, Product Managers and Product Designers</li> <li>Deliver strategic assets and documentation using a collaborative product management system and modern suite of tools</li> <li>Support the Product Manager in facilitating product discovery workshops with stakeholders to help define business objectives and key results</li> <li>Help to define and document customer journeys and personas</li> <li>Support the Product Manager to collect large amounts of information from across the company and develop a compelling, insightful product vision and strategy</li> <li>Schedule and participate in frequent user testing and research sessions to validate the effectiveness of the product strategy with real customers</li> <li>Collaborate with Product Designers to quickly sketch or wireframe concepts and ideas</li> <li>Complete competitive and market research that will be used in the product strategy</li> </ul>  <br/> Equal Employment Opportunities<br/><br/>Voices.com values diversity. We're proud to be an equal opportunity employer and consider qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, age, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital or family status, veteran status, medical condition or disability.<br/><br/>Accommodation<br/><br/>Voices.com is committed to providing accommodation for applicants with disabilities; please let us know if you require an accommodation during the recruitment process.
Title: UX Researcher

Job_Description: The Intermediate UX Designer will collaborate with Senior team members, and across multidisciplinary teams to create insightful, empathetic, data-driven experiences for clients and their users. Utilizing design thinking and working within an agile process, you will conduct user research and testing, create user flow diagrams, build comprehensive wireframes in Sketch, as well as contribute to the rationale behind user-centred design decisions. <br/><br/> No one is an island We believe in sharing work early and often, so you will work iteratively and collaboratively on rough notes and sketches, before hunkering down on detailed high-quality deliverables for our clients. <br/><br/> Located in the Mount Pleasant area of Vancouver, as part of the POWERSHiFTER team you will have access to some of the brightest minds in design, technology, strategy and data science. You will work in an environment that values people, process and performance, collaborating with team members in both Vancouver and Toronto. <br/> Your mission <br/><br/> We believe that when you start with empathy, amazing things can happen. You will champion this belief through the practice of design thinking and human-centred design principals (HCD) on both client and internal work. <br/> <strong>Responsibilities</strong>:</strong> <br/> Work with creative directors and senior team members to conceptualize and execute designs that will advance clients businesses. <br/><br/> Perform UX audits, help facilitate user testing, and present recommendations on major projects that involve user experience. <br/><br/> Participate in research, stakeholder interviews, and document your findings <br/><br/> Develop research-backed personas <br/><br/> Create user flow and site architecture diagrams to present the clearest path to user goal completion <br/><br/> Collaborate with the Digital Science team to assure design decisions are data-driven <br/><br/> Build wireframes in Sketch <br/><br/> Stay up to date on the latest UX and design trends and requirements for all current and emerging formats of digital UX design. <br/><br/> Work independently and efficiently to meet deadlines. <br/><br/> Actively contribute to internal programs and knowledge sharing. <br/><br/> Share acquired skills with team members through formal and informal channels. <br/><br/> Have fun! <br/><br/> <strong>Requirements</strong>: <br/> <strong>Minimum education requirements</strong>: Relevant Bachelor Degree <br/><br/> <strong>Minimum experience requirements</strong>: 2-3+ Years <br/><br/> <strong>Benefits</strong>: <br/> This is a full time, permanent position <br/><br/> Medical and dental benefits <br/><br/> An exciting, yet highly collaborative work environment with amazing peers <br/><br/> Flexible work/life balance <br/><br/> Extended long weekends during the summer <br/><br/> Paid December holiday office closure
Title: Intermediate UX Designer

Job_Description: For a banking client located in Scarborough we are recruiting for an independent contractor as a technical developer on a UI/UX Project. This is one-year contract. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities:</strong>  <ul> <li>Analyze highly complex business requirements; generate technical specifications</li> <li>Act as an expert technical resource for modeling, simulation and analysis efforts</li> <li>Leverage industry best practices to design, test, implement and support a solution</li> <li>Assure quality, security and compliance requirements are met</li> </ul>  <strong>Qualifications:</strong>  <ul> <li>7+ years related experience as a Developer</li> <li>EDF (Enterprise Data Framework) Usability prototyping experience</li> <li>Experience enhancing tailoring tools</li> <li>Microsoft Excel- Macros (Fixing files)</li> <li>Hands on experience in designing, developing and successful deployment of large scale projects from end-to-end</li> <li>Hands on experience in following the iterative and agile SDLC</li> </ul>  Having valid work authorization to work in Ontario, Canada and ability to work as independent (incorporated) contractor are mandatory requirements to apply. <br/><br/> Please apply with most current resume in MS Word format. This is time-sensitive need. <br/><br/>
Title: UI Developer

Job_Description: <b>Job Description:</b><br><p><strong>About Ribbon Communications: Sonus Networks, Inc. (d/b/a Ribbon Communications) is a company with two decades of leadership in real-time communications. Built on world class technology and intellectual property, the company delivers intelligent, secure, embedded real-time communications for today’s world. The company transforms fixed, mobile and enterprise networks from legacy environments to secure IP and cloud-based architectures, enabling highly productive communications for consumers and businesses. With 64 locations in 27 countries around the globe, the company’s innovative, market leading portfolio empowers service providers and enterprises with rapid service creation in a fully virtualized environment. The company’s Kandy Communications Platform as a Service (CPaaS) delivers a comprehensive set of advanced embedded communications capabilities that enables this transformation. To learn more, visit ribboncommunications.com.</strong><p><strong>Position Title: </strong>UI Engineer <p><strong>Location: Ottawa, ON</strong><p><strong>Position Summary:</strong><p>Ribbon Communications is looking for a hands-on UI Engineer to assist in the development of a next-generation application user interface. The ideal candidate will have experience in or interest and aptitude toward contemporary user interface design. <p><p>The position will be within an advanced CTO development team working on the latest technologies in the Big Data and Analytics space using contemporary data visualization and application configuration UI frameworks, as a front end to the latest Big Data platform engines such as Kubernetes/Containers, Hadoop, and Apache Spark within a virtualized, micro-services application architecture. <p><p><p><p><strong></strong><br>Required Experience:<br><p><strong>Required Skills:</strong><ul><li><p>Experience with Single-page Application (SPA) development </li><li><p>Expertise with modern Client MVC/MVP frameworks such as jQuery, Backbone.js, Node.js, Bootstrap, D3, Angular, or Embe </li><li><p>Familiarity with using complex backend RESTful APIs </li><li><p>Passion for emerging UI Technologies / Languages </li><li><p>UI Development experience, specifically in OO JavaScript </li><li><p>Solid experience with HTML5 / CSS3 </li><li><p>REST client development experience </li><li><p>Strong knowledge of OOP / OOD </li><li><p>Experience with Bootstrap V2.x or 3.x framework <p>Interested applicants should have 3-5 years in UI development, including coding in the frameworks mentioned above. Familiarity with Agile development processes is helpful. An ability to provide example UX design work to evaluate the candidate is suggested. Excellent oral, presentation, listening and written communication skills are expected. <p><strong>Education/Experience Requirements:</strong><p>BS in Telecommunications/Computer Science/Electrical Engineer or equivalent required. <p><strong>Please Note:</strong><p><em>&apos;All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, sex, color, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or on the basis of disability.&apos;</em><p>US Citizens and all other parties authorized to work in the US are encouraged to apply. <p></li></ul><br>Keyword: engineering,telecom,software<br>From: Ribbon Communications
Title: UI Engineer

Job_Description: <div><div><div><div><div><br>Co-op Student Position: Summer Term May to August 2018 - 4 months <br>Co-op Position: Visual Interaction Designer<br>No. of openings: 1<br><b><br></b>This position is limited to students that are registered in a recognized Co-Op or Intern Program at a Canadian College or University. <b><br><br>Nokia is a global leader in the technologies that connect people and things. With state-of-the-art software, hardware and services for any type of network, Nokia is uniquely positioned to help communication service providers, governments, and large enterprises deliver on the promise of 5G, the Cloud and the Internet of Things. Serving customers in over 140 countries, our research scientists and engineers continue to invent and accelerate new technologies that will increasingly transform the way people and things communicate and connect.</b><br><br>When collaborating with local universities, you can be certain to meet some inspiring, young talent. The relationships Nokia builds with students while offering internship opportunities are priceless, and recently was recognized when our Ottawa campus was nominated as a top co-op employer in the city. We look forward to continuing this great initiative.<br><br>Nokia IP/Optical Network group in Ottawa, Canada is growing and is looking for a passionate UI Visual Interaction Co-op designer to create great user experiences. <br><br>As a Co-op in the role of Visual Interaction designer, you are crafting the visual style of the application user interface. You will work closely with product management, interaction designers and developers. Your tasks will be to work with UI appearance and UX controls such as visual layout, icons, animation effects as well as UI flows and navigation. The ideal candidate should be a brilliant problem solver, quick study, self-starter and excellent communicator with a passion for great design and the ability to achieve it. <br><br><br><br><br><br>               <div>  Skills you need for this position:<br>- Experience designing web/desktop applications.<br>- A thorough understanding and a keen eye for graphical details.<br>- Superior creative and innovative problem-solving skills.<br>- Initiative and the ability to work independently and in a team with excellent collaborative skills.<br>- Excellent communication skills, written and verbal.<br>- A degree in interaction design, visual design, or equivalent.<br>- Expert knowledge of user-centered design principles.<br>- Ability to story tell around the experiences you create.<br>- Highly professional, with the ability to deliver solid work on tight schedules.<br>- Experience in InVision, Sketch, Photoshop and similar Adobe products.<br>- An exceptional eye for pixel-perfect detail.<br>- Have a great understanding of CSS, HTML. An understanding of java script is a bonus. <br>- Motion visual skills experience with After Effects or other animation software is a bonus.<br><br>If you are a creative, curious and fun-seeking person interested in working in a team of highly talented people, this could be the right position for you! <br><br><b>Nokia Canada is committed to building a skilled, diverse workforce reflective of Canadian society. As a result, we promote employment equity and encourage women, Aboriginal persons, and persons with a disability or members of a visible minority group to apply. </b><br>  </div>         <div>    </div>       </div>  </div>  </div>     </div> 	</div>
Title: Co-op: Visual Interaction Designer

Job_Description: <div><div><strong>Web Designer</strong> | Global Eagle Entertainment Inc. <br/><br/> Global Eagle is the leading satellite-based provider of connectivity and media for fast-growing mobility markets across air, land and sea. The company provides the industry’s most comprehensive and advanced global product and services platform to organizations and people on the move. <br/><br/> Our customers include commercial airlines, business jets, cruise and ferry lines, yachts, and commercial shippers. In addition, it provides products and services for the world’s most remote land-based natural resource energy operations, governments, non-governmental organizations, and mobile network operators. <br/> Supported by best-in-class and proprietary technologies, Global Eagle offers a fully integrated suite of solutions for connectivity and content, including Wi-Fi, on-demand video, multi-platform and multi-format entertainment content, interactive software, portable In Flight Entertainment solutions, content management services, ecommerce solutions, original content development, voice, cellular and 3G/LTE services, and mission-critical communications. <br/><br/> Find out more at www.globaleagle.com . Follow us on LinkedIn <br/><br/> <strong>Key responsibilities</strong> <br/><br/> The selected candidate will:  <ul> <li>Create web interfaces using brand guidelines provided by our client and external partners;</li>  <li>Apply a defined artistic direction to all remaining pages of our web and mobile applications;</li>  <li>Create experiences and interfaces that offer easy and intuitive browsing and attractive visuals;</li>  <li>Create visual assets (banners, tiles, logos, etc.);</li>  <li>Update existing designs with requested changes;</li>  <li>Work closely with the development team and/or as part of the delivery team if need be to develop and deliver UI theming for specific deliveries;</li>  <li>Work with project managers and other designers to constantly improve the quality of our applications (visuals) ;</li>  <li>Participate in discussion groups and brainstorming session.</li> </ul> <strong>Qualifications</strong>  <ul> <li>Diploma in a field related to web design, web programming, ergonomics or multimedia</li>   <li>5 years’ experience in web design, preferably for web or mobile applications</li>   <li>Proficiency in HTML, CSS and JavaScript</li>  <li>In-depth knowledge of Adobe Creative Suite and similar tools</li>   <li>Knowledge of best practices in design for web and mobile platforms</li>   <li>Knowledge of Zeplin</li>  <li>Knowledge of Axure an asset</li>  <li>Knowledge of Agile methodology and Jira / Confluence are an asset</li>  <li>Excellent communication and presentation skills</li>  <li>Bilingualism (English/French), spoken and written</li> </ul> <strong>Areas of interest and intrinsic competencies (general criteria)</strong>  <ul> <li>Self-reliant and resourceful</li>  <li>Able to work on several projects simultaneously</li>  <li>Strong interest in new technologies</li>  <li>Solid communication skills</li>  <li>Ability to listen and to accept criticism</li>  <li>Ability to manage priorities</li>  <li>Ability to be creative and pay attention to detail</li> </ul> <strong>We ask selected candidates to present a portfolio of their work to recruiters during the interview.</strong></div> </div><div></div>
Title: Web designer

Job_Description: As a UX/UI Designer, you will play an active role in one of our products, doing tactical and strategic work. You should have strong UX skills and a passion for brainstorming, developing, and testing a wide range of design solutions. The ideal candidate should love nothing more than testing solutions with real users and iterating based on feedback.<br/><br/>Responsibilities  <ul>  <li>Collaborate with the Product Manager to implement and evolve the vision for the product</li> <li>Represent the design work and passionately advocate for user-centered needs</li> <li>Develop low-fidelity and high-fidelity prototypes that translate the product vision into clean and intuitive experiences</li> <li>Support/perform user research, story mapping sessions, and usability testing to understand behaviour and explore opportunities</li> <li>Design experiences that can effectively combine product and service offerings into a cohesive concept for our target personas</li> <li>Ensure consistency with the platform standards and cross-product dependencies</li> <li>Collaborates with team members and stakeholders to deliver a compelling and cohesive end-to-end user experience across all applications</li> <li>Manages relationships with internal and external stakeholders to ensure relevant information is shared, effectively communicated and issues are followed up and addressed</li> <li>Perform competitive analysis and keep up with usability standards</li>  </ul>  Skills and Qualifications  <ul>  <li>Experience with the process of building and testing UI prototypes</li> <li>Experience with user testing design solutions and gathering quantitative and qualitative feedback</li> <li>Experience with graphic design and common graphic design tools</li> <li>Knowledge of user research and usability testing techniques and methods, and applying user findings to UX design solutions</li> <li>Excellent feel for beautiful aesthetics of software user interfaces</li> <li>Strong conceptualization ability, strong visual communication ability, drawing skills and sketchbook technique</li> <li>Strong working knowledge and experience with user interface design patterns and methodologies</li> <li>Ability to work with product managers and teams to understand detailed requirements and design UX solutions that meet needs and vision</li> <li>Understanding of Agile; experience working directly in one or more Agile frameworks would be a plus (e.g., Scrum)</li> <li>Ability to work efficiently and meet/exceed deadlines under pressure</li>  </ul>  <strong> </strong>
Title: UXUI Designer

Job_Description: <strong>Who we are</strong> <div>lululemon is a yoga-inspired technical apparel company up to big things. The practice and philosophy of yoga informs our overall purpose to elevate the world through the power of practice. We are proud to be a growing global company with locations all around the world, from Vancouver to Shanghai, and places in between. We owe our success to our innovative product, our emphasis on our stores, our commitment to our people, and the incredible connections we get to make in every community we are in. <br/><br/> <strong>About this team</strong></div><div>The User Experience team will be champions for user-centered design process, vision and standards across our organization. They will define and promote a consistent, intuitive user experience across all digital platforms. <br/><br/> <strong>A day in the life:</strong>  <ul> <li>Define the overall UX strategy and vision for the user experiences across all channels, aligning with our broader business strategies.</li><li>Ensure delivery of high quality UX and UI across multiple projects at any given time, providing oversight and guidance while empowering team members. Oversee the entire UX process from concept to prototyping to execution.</li><li>Build and maintain productive relationships with cross-functional teams spanning all organizational levels, working collaboratively with other teams, disciplines and third-party vendors.</li><li>Deliver guest experiences that are measurable and drive higher conversion and satisfaction across all digital platforms and products.</li><li>Plan, design and conduct in-field, remote and in-house user-centered research and usability testing sessions to support design and development.</li><li>Cleary communicate design, research findings and customer insights to large, global, cross-functional teams and senior stakeholders.</li><li>Recruit, hire, manage and mentor top digital UX/UI designers. Develop relationships with design firms and independent contractors.</li> </ul>  <strong>Qualifications:</strong>  <ul> <li>At least 10 years of progressive responsibility in a user experience design role.</li><li>BS or BA degree or equivalent experience: Information Sciences, Library Science, Graphic Arts, Computer Science, Marketing or a related area</li><li>Superior relationship-building, communication and negotiation skills within cross-functional teams and senior stakeholders.</li><li>Strong leadership, strategic thinking and practical organizational planning skills.</li><li>Possess a clear understanding of branding, strategic and marketing considerations, particularly in the digital arena.</li><li>Expertise across all facets of human-centered design and user experience, spanning UX strategy, experience/interaction design, user research/assessment, prototyping, visual design and user adoption.</li><li>Compelling presentation skills to build and share inspiring visual stories.</li><li>Practical understanding (including capabilities and limitations) of current technologies used to build rich experiences (HTML 5, CSS, Javascript).</li><li>Experience managing and designing for large, complex, global systems.</li><li>Experience translating user research, analytics and best practices into design decisions</li><li>Successful experience leading large team of UI/UX people (5-10)</li>  </ul>  <strong>Must haves:</strong>  <ul> <li>Acknowledges the presence of choice in every moment and takes personal responsibility for their life.</li><li>Possesses an entrepreneurial spirit and continuously innovates to achieve great results.</li> <li>Communicates with honesty and kindness, and creates the space for others to do the same.</li> <li>Leads with courage, knowing the possibility of greatness is bigger than the fear of failure.</li> <li>Fosters connection by putting people first and building trusting relationships.</li> <li>Integrates fun and joy as a way of being and working, aka doesn’t take themselves too seriously.</li>  </ul>  <strong>NOTE</strong>: Only those applicants under consideration will be contacted. Please accept our utmost appreciation for your interest. lululemon is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. Employment decisions are based on merit and business needs, and not on race, color, creed, age, sex, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, religion, marital status, medical condition, physical or mental disability, military service, pregnancy, childbirth and related medical conditions or any other classification protected by federal, state or provincial and local laws and ordinances. Reasonable accommodation is available for qualified individuals with disabilities, upon request. This Equal Employment Opportunity policy applies to all practices relating to recruitment and hiring, compensation, benefits, discipline, transfer, termination and all other terms and conditions of employment. While management is primarily responsible for seeing that lululemon equal employment opportunity policies are implemented, you share in the responsibility for assuring that, by your personal actions, the policies are effective.</div>  <br/>
Title: Director of User Experience (UX)

Job_Description: <div> <div> <div>Responsibilities: <br/><br/> • Work closely with the UX architect, other developers and product management <br/>  to collect requirements that will translate to clean, usable, and <br/>  modern user interfaces <br/><br/> • Implement new UI functionality using Web 2.0 technologies and industry-standard <br/>  frameworks such as angular.js and Wicket <br/><br/> • Implement user interfaces that work for both web and mobile clients <br/><br/> • Keep up-to-date with Web and UI technologies <br/><br/> • Translate design mock-ups into clean consistent user interfaces with <br/>  implementation that is modular, re-usable and high-performance <br/><br/> • Work with backend engineers to ensure high performance at the user <br/>  interface level <br/><br/> • Use test-driven methodologies and automation in the design and development <br/>  phase to ensure high-quality code before hand-off to Quality Assurance <br/>  teams <br/><br/> Required Skills: <br/><br/> • Bachelor’s degree in a technical subject (e.g., Computer Science) from <br/>  a top institute <br/><br/> • 5+ years development experience with web application development using <br/>  JavaScript and corresponding frameworks <br/><br/> • 3+ years with browser-side development (HTML, CSS, JavaScript) <br/><br/> • AngularJS expert <br/><br/> • Experience using CSS and HTML to produce interfaces from design mock-ups <br/>  Experience with cross-browser compatibility issues <br/><br/> • Experience with security vulnerability issues at the UI level <br/><br/> • Experience with Java <br/><br/> • Excellent knowledge of UI architectural patterns <br/><br/> • Excellent problem-solving and troubleshooting skills <br/><br/> • Knowledge and passion for solid software engineering practices, release <br/>  processes and project life cycles <br/><br/> • Excellent communications skills, both verbal and written. Must be able <br/>  to write clear functional specifications and design documents and <br/>  engage with customers on technical discussions. <br/><br/> • Self-directed; requires minimal supervision to work on products <br/><br/> • Strong team player. Willingness to proactively interact with the team <br/>  and achieve results in a dynamic small company environment</div>  </div>  </div> <br/>
Title: Sr. UI Engineer

Job_Description: <div><div> <div><strong>Summary:</strong></div><div></div><div>Boeing Global Services is hiring for User Experience Designers within its Boeing Vancouver sites to help design, develop and optimize the future of analytics-driven products for the aviation industry. You will be involved in all phases of the solution innovation, development and delivery lifecycle within the Digital Aviation & Analytics business as it innovates and optimizes these solutions to enable the worlds flying fleet.</div><div>As part of the team, you will be working with internal business partners and outside customers to identify and define business problems, grow and apply aviation domain knowledge and communicate the value of solutions. As a User Experience Designer, you will empowered to conduct user research & testing and be a key contributor in the end-to-end design of complex software solutions, creating effective, user-focused user experiences. Given the tight coupling with data analytics teams for this role, opportunities in data visualization design and visual analytics will also be central.</div><div>The positions will report within the Commercial Services Analytics Portfolio organization. As the cross-functional teams and customers are located globally, the position will involve some travel, particularly to the USA.</div><div></div><div><strong>Essential Duties and Responsibilities:</strong></div><div></div>  <ul> <li><div>Work on a wide range of UX activities from concept through to deployment</div></li><li><div>Collaborate with product managers to document user stories and translate complex requirements and concepts into functional designs</div></li><li><div>Analyze requirements, identifying task sequences and workflows and creating user scenarios that clearly communicate key tasks.</div></li><li><div>Perform user research activities to uncover and define user needs and communicated them with the product team</div></li><li><div>Communicate the rationale for design approach with project teams and stakeholders</div></li><li><div>Work as part of the agile team to integrate design approaches on large scale projects, ensuring integration across complex platforms</div></li><li><div>Create wireframes, storyboards, user flows, process flows and site maps to effectively communicate interaction and design ideas</div></li><li><div>Apply formal and informal usability testing approaches to evaluate and validate design approaches</div></li><li><div>Maintain style guides and contribute to UI design standards and practices</div></li><li><div>Promote the benefits of the UX process and user-centered design to improve the usability of software</div></li> </ul>  <strong><div>Demonstrated Knowledge and Skills:</div> <br/> </strong>  <ul> <li><div>You can walk non-technical stakeholders through your design thought process</div></li><li><div>You are customer obsessed and data-driven</div></li><li><div>You have experience with data visualization, working on complex data driven apps and tools</div></li><li><div>You have experience with a variety of design tools (Adobe & Sketch experience preferred)</div></li><li><div>You have experience working on UI / UX solutions within an Agile development environment</div></li><li><div>You have experience in acquiring user data or working with a team responsible for gathering user data</div></li><li><div>Your conceptual and visual communication skills are strong</div></li><li><div>Basic HTML and CSS coding skills an asset</div></li><li><div>Experience operating in an environment with remote teams an asset</div></li><li><div>Passionate about sharing your portfolio of your previous body of work</div></li><li><div>You judge your success by customers feedback on the product</div></li><li><div>You love design trends who stays on top of all the latest trends</div></li><li><div>Great sense of humour we work extremely hard, and have fun doing it!</div></li><li><div>Activity participate in the design community, meetups and events to promote our brand</div></li> </ul>  <strong></div><div></div><div><strong>Education/Experience:</div> <br/> </strong>  <ul> <li><div>You have a degree in Human Factors, Visual Design, Computer Science, related UX / UI degree / certificate or have an equivalent combination of education and experience</div></li><li><div>You have 4+ years work experience as a UX / UI designer, with end-to-end experience working on complex projects</div></li></ul></div> <br/>
Title: User Experience Design Specialist 3

Job_Description: Veeva is dedicated to building careers of new university graduates. Our downtown Toronto-based engineering team is looking for Associate UI Engineers that are excited by new challenges and want to grow their career at Veeva! <br/><br/> <strong>Job Summary</strong> <br/><br/> You are a talented UI developer with experience building real websites. Your CSS3, HTML5, and JavaScript skill set make you a strong candidate for this role. You’ve worked with most of the common frameworks and tools (Backbone, JavascriptMVC, JQuery, SCSS) and understand the concepts behind building a responsive site. You will be part of a team building a scalable Java-based SaaS solution that complements our existing solutions. This is a cool opportunity to innovate & deliver innovation in a startup environment with a lot of room for growth. <br/><br/> <strong>Your Impact</strong> <ul> <li>Design and build scalable, maintainable web-based front ends for Veeva customers, administrators, and operations teams</li><li>Work with Product management to design a user experience that solves the business needs</li><li>Integrate with Veeva backend systems using REST APIs and provide guidance when new services are required</li><li>Collaborate with other technical team members for solving complex problems</li><li>Documentation and unit tests for all of the above</li> </ul> <strong>Requirements</strong> <ul> <li>Strong knowledge of JavaScript, including JQuery framework</li><li>Prior experience with JavaScript MVC frameworks such as Backbone, Angular JS or JavaScript MVC</li><li>Strong HTML and CSS skills</li><li>Prior experience with SCSS</li><li>Experience building websites that rely heavily on REST services</li><li>Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics or a related technical field</li> </ul> <strong>At time of application, please attach the most updated version of your academic transcript</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Nice to Have</strong> <ul> <li>Prior experience developing large data-driven system software</li><li>Prior experience with relational database systems such as MySQL</li><li>UX design experience (mock generation, etc.)</li><li>Prior experience working with Java based solutions (JSP, JSTL)</li>  </ul> <strong>Our Office</strong> <ul> <li>Conveniently located in downtown Toronto</li><li>Snacks, beverages, and weekly lunches from local restaurants</li><li>Team events and rec league sports teams</li><li>Weekly yoga classes</li><li>Ping pong and other games</li>  </ul> <strong>About Veeva</strong> <br/><br/> Veeva Systems is a leader in cloud-based software for the global life sciences industry. Committed to innovation, product excellence, and customer success, Veeva has more than 550+ customers, ranging from the world's largest pharmaceutical companies to emerging biotechs. Veeva is headquartered in the San Francisco Bay Area, with offices in Europe, Asia, and Latin America. <br/><br/> Veeva Systems is an equal opportunity employer. Accordingly, we are committed to fair and accessible employment practices. Veeva Systems welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.
