All materials must adhere to the Brand Standard Guidelines to retain brand integrity and contribute to the achievement of Equitable Bank’s business objectives when required.<br/><br/>Main Activities:<br/><br/><strong>On-going responsibilities:</strong></li>  </ul>    <ul>  <li>  <strong>Be an integral part of the consumer experience and design as it comes to all customer marketing touchpoints</strong></li>  <br/> <li>  <strong>From brief to delivery, responsible for leading the stakeholder(s) and team to deliver the very best work, creating an environment of motivation, inspiration, trust and partnership</strong></li>  <br/> <li>  <strong>Design for various types of projects including brand identity, brands visual strategies, multiple types of collateral, advertising (traditional, online, outdoor, etc.) and more</strong></li>  <br/> <li>  <strong>Create strong and effective design communications within the guidelines of our brands and sub-brands, while working closely with the creative team on integrated campaigns to ensure design integrity and consistency throughout all communications</strong></li>  <br/> <li>  <strong>Strategize and brainstorm with the team to collectively produce strong creative designs</strong></li>  <br/> <li>  <strong>Show strong creative judgment and give clear and honest feedback</strong></li>  <br/> <li>  <strong>Be a champion for great creative work and actively seek opportunities to expand our output</strong></li>  <br/> <li>  <strong>Build, protect and manage digital content; including the production of optimized graphics and HTML5 animations across a variety of consumer-facing digital channels including social media, email marketing and website. This includes verifying and approving any external vendor or partnering material to match the visual guidelines of the bank</strong></li>  <br/> <li>  <strong>Ensure all content meets rigorous SEO guidelines through disciplined workflow and regular site audits</strong></li>  <br/> <li>  <strong>Provide QA and UAT support and create detailed outlines for change requests, bugs for design and user functionality</strong></li>  <br/> <li>  <strong>Create UI designs based on market analysis, internal and customer feedback and usability findings for the website or mobile platforms</strong></li> designers, developers, and sponsored partnerships to coordinate designs execution to spec and on time</li>  <br/> <li>  <strong>Maintain multiple marketing programs and brand integrity for the EQ Bank, Equitable Bank and STNCE brands</strong></li>  <br/> <li>  <strong>Support ad hoc marketing design requests across various channels</strong></li>  <br/> <li>  <strong>Manage version control of documents</strong></li>  <br/> <li>  <strong>Provide content and copywriting feedback</strong></li> </ul> <br/><br/> <strong>Develop production artwork (pre-press) of materials:</strong>  <ul>  <li>  <strong>Prepare accurate and production ready files for print</strong></li>  <br/> <li>  <strong>Check printer proofs for production errors</strong></li>  <br/> <li>  <strong>Supply files to vendors via FTP, email, USB or CD/DVD</strong></li>  <br/> <li>  <strong>Identify and correct problems before sending to print</strong></li>  <br/> <li>  <strong>Source images and relevant information to be used in printed materials and presentations</strong></li> </ul>  <br/><br/> <strong>Knowledge / Qualifications:</strong> <br/><br/> <ul>  <li>  Post-secondary education in Digital Graphics, Design, Marketing, animation or related experience</li>  <br/> <li>  4+ years of experience in a client-side or digital agency environment, designing, producing and publishing optimized web content</li>  <br/> <li>  Proficiency in HTML5 and CMS platforms such as Sitefinity, Salesforce and Wordpress, with a strong understanding of design possibilities</li>  <br/> <li>  Conceptual Ideation & art direction</li>  <br/> <li>  Strong Knowledge of typography, copywriting, illustration, colour theory, storyboarding, preflight practices and iconography</li>  <br/> <li>  Deep understanding and experience with responsive website design, UI design and web technologies</li>  <br/> <li>  Strong grasp of UI/UX fundamentals across desktop, tablet and mobile platforms with top-flight communication Experience in managing workflow and processes for a creative team</li>  <br/> <li>  Experience with Kanban methodology is an asset</li> </ul>  <br/><br/>
Title: Senior Graphic Designer

Job_Description: <strong>Company Description</strong> <br/><br/> null <br/> Job Description<br/><br/>Ubisoft Saguenay est votre recherche, vous les designers graphiques! <br/><br/> Ubisoft Saguenay est le prochain chapitre dans la vie dUbisoft au Québec, avec une ouverture récente le 9 février 2018 Chicoutimi. Ainsi, nous recherchons les pionniers passionnés qui assumeront les postes névralgiques de ce nouveau studio, dédié au développement de lexpertise online au sein dUbisoft. <br/><br/> Lorsque vous vous joignez Ubisoft, vous entrez dans une communauté de développeurs exceptionnels reliés par leur besoin dinnover, dêtre créatifs, et de travailler avec les technologies de pointe. Vous découvrirez un monde où les employés bénéficient dun avancement professionnel constant, dun cadre dapprentissage accueillant et de régimes de rémunération concurrentiels. <br/><br/> Plus que tout, vous travaillerez sur un grand nombre de titres denvergure et de grande qualité avec certains des plus grands talents de lindustrie, en collaboration avec les studios canadiens dUbisoft. Joignez-vous laventure! <br/><br/> <strong>Sommaire du poste :</strong> <br/><br/> Le titulaire de ce poste est responsable délaborer et de mettre en place de nouvelles expériences d&apos;interfaces utilisateurs au moyen de la création d&apos;éléments graphiques et de prototypes graphiques animés. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsabilités :</strong> <br/><br/> Les fonctions principales et habituelles de cet emploi sont : <br/><br/> <strong>PRE-PRODUCTION</strong> <br/> Création de captures décran, assurer lensemble de la navigation et de lexpérience utilisateur <ul> <li>Création dinterfaces (« wireframe, mockups, animatics »)</li><li>Prototypage : Mettre en place des solutions dutilisabilité rapidement dans lengin ou dans tout autre logiciel de prototypage (Flash, Pencil, FluidUI, etc)</li><li>Élaborer la signature visuelle des éléments dinterface: Objets intéractifs, « layout styleGuide », animation, et signature visuelle FX</li> </ul> PRODUCTION <ul> <li>Réalisation/Production grahique : Créer des éléments dinterface dexcellente qualité graphique ( laide de Photoshop, Illustrator, 3DSMax, etc)</li><li>Animation : Créer des animations sur timeline dun engin donné (de propriétés, de transform, gestion détats, etc</li><li>Optimisation; import/export déléments graphiques optimaux pour un engin donné, demeurer créatif et efficace selon les limitations techniques (compression graphique, nine-slice 2D, coloration dans lengin en addition et multiplication, etc)</li><li>Implémentation; connaissance du processus dintégration général des engins de jeux (import de textures et création dAtlas, instances « dassets et components, build process et changelists », etc)</li> </ul>  <strong>Qualifications<br/><br/><strong>Formation :</strong> <br/><br/> AEC en design graphique et multimédia ou toutes autres formations équivalentes. <br/><br/> <strong>Expérience pertinente :</strong>  <br/><br/> Minimum de 3 5 ans dexpérience reconnue dans la conception dinterfaces utilisateurs innovantes et intuitives. <br/><br/> <strong>Habiletés et connaissances :</strong> <ul> <li>Comprendre et respecter les lignes directrices créatives de la marque et du projet</li><li>Être créatif et réactif dans la recherche de solutions pour obtenir un UX de haute qualité</li><li>Être flexible au changement et vigilant dans le maintien de lhomogénéité du UX</li><li>Être en mesure de faire de la planification de développement multi-plateformes</li><li>Connaissance du processus de développement dun jeu vidéo, liens avec les différents corps de métier et étapes de production UI</li><li>Connaissance des principes de base (« build, data, engin »)</li><li>Connaissance en ergonomie/expérience navigation</li><li>Expérience en production graphique 2D/3D de qualité (photoshop, Illustrator, 3DS Max)</li><li>Connaissance du marché du jeu vidéo</li><li>Connaissance technique/graphique dun engin de jeu (compression, alpha et channels, Atlas)  <ul> <li>Connaissance des principes doptimisation et de réutilisation</li><li>« Scripts, components, Debugs</li></ul></li> </ul>

Job_Description: <div> <div> <div> <div>We value diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive workplace that inspires each of us to be the best we can be. Join our team and make a difference!</div>  </div> </div>  </div> <div> <div> Your Job</div>  </div> <div> <div> <div> <div><strong><em>About us</em></strong> <br/> Think insurance is boring? Were about to change your mind. At Intact Lab, insurance is fast-paced, innovative and fun (yeah, you read that right). <br/><br/> Intact Lab is the digital innovation hub of the Intact Financial Corporation, one of Canadas Top 100 Employers. We have the spirit of a start-up with the backing of big business. So what does that mean? It means we have the funding for top-notch technology and the freedom to create Insurtech products that don't exist, but should. That's where the fun comes in. <br/><br/> We work collaboratively to deliver customer-friendly digital experiences. Now we're looking for a talented service designer to complement our growing Design Thinking team. That's where you come in. <br/><br/> <strong><em>About you</em></strong> <br/> As a service designer, your quest is to demystify complex systems and create environments where innovation can take hold and scale. As a member of our Design Thinking team, you will be a custodian of customer journeys, helping identify opportunities that can elevate and transform our customer experiences. Reporting to the Manager, Design Thinking, your main responsibilities are:  <ul>   <li>Define the long-term vision of our customer experience and empower our customer-centric transformation by leveraging the Design Thinking methodology.</li>   <li>Lead our design thinking squads through all stages, from research and discovery to ideation, prototyping and design of new products and services.</li>   <li>Apply your UX, UI, Interaction Design, and HCI skills across all channels and products.</li>   <li>Produce UX artefacts such as customer journeys, user personas and service blueprints to create a shared understanding of the customer experience across all lines of business and brands.</li>   <li>Develop compelling stories and visual elements to communicate ideas, secure stakeholder buy-in and inspire teams.</li>   <li>Develop prototypes to test and validate solutions for refinement.</li>   <li>Create clear solution development plans to propel solutions through experimentation, testing and refinement based on learnings.</li>   <li>Participate in the solution development process for incremental, breakthrough and radical innovations.</li>   <li>Empathize with stakeholders and customers as they move through the innovation journey and help them understand how to navigate divergent and convergent phases of development.</li>   <li>Build on ideas, be open in ones thinking and identify concepts in a real, tangible way.</li>   <li>Promote design thinking initiatives to strengthen and build momentum for customer centricity across the organization.</li> </ul>   </div> </div> </div>  </div> <div> <div> Your Skills</div>  </div> <div> <div> <div> <div>   <ul>   <li>At least 3 years of experience in service design.</li>   <li>A strong portfolio showcasing user-centered design solutions.</li>   <li>Expertise in usability and user-centered design practices.</li>   <li>Experience with design tools (Sketch, Axure, InVision, Adobe Creative Suit, etc.).</li>   <li>Knowledge of UX research tools (UserTesting.com, Optimal Workshop, Survey Monkey, etc.).</li>   <li>Excellent verbal communications, strong graphic and visualization skills to communicate design ideas.</li>   <li>Bilingualism (English/French) is an asset.</li> </ul> <em><strong>You are</strong></em>  <ul>   <li>An innovative and strategic thinker who loves to solve complex problems.</li>   <li>Deeply passionate about design and the customer experience.</li>   <li>A team player who thrives in a collaborative environment and can provide and receive constructive feedback.</li>   <li>Proactive, comfortable working within a self-directed culture and navigating ambiguity.</li>   <li>A patient listener, effective communicator, engaging presenter and compelling storyteller.</li>   <li>Comfortable with interacting at different levels in the organization, from peers to senior management.</li> </ul> <em><strong>As a full-time employee your benefits include</strong></em>  <ul>   <li>35-hour workweek with flexible hours and telecommuting.</li>   <li>Financial perks that range from a performance bonus to stock options and pension plan.</li>   <li>Top-of-the-line insurance coverage (it's kind of our thing, you know).</li>   <li>Relaxed work atmosphere located in the heart of downtown Montreal with an onsite resto-café and outdoor patio.</li>   <li>Plus, access to industry conferences, computer purchase plan, fitness subsidy and partner discounts.</li> </ul>   </div> </div> </div>  </div> <div> <div> Closing Statement</div>  </div> <div> <div> <div> <div>This opportunity interests you? We look forward to meeting you! <br/><br/> Excellent benefits are offered: competitive salary, flexible benefits, flexible work arrangements, flexible leave, pension plan defined benefit, etc.. <br/><br/> As part of Intacts selection process, candidates may be requested to consent to background checks relevant to the role under consideration for, prior to receiving a job offer. These could include: work references, education and credential confirmation, employment verification, identity check, credit report, criminal offence and drivers license record. <br/><br/> Please note we may have identified other internal candidates through our Employee Development Program, and that the selection process may also be opened to external applicants. <br/><br/> <strong>This posting closes on June 02, 2018.</strong></div>  </div> </div>  </div> <div> <div> Eligibility to work in Canada</div>  </div> <div> <div> <div> <div>Applicants must be permanently eligible to work in Canada upon hire. Proof of eligibility for permanent roles may come in the form of a Canadian birth certificate, Canadian passport, Canadian citizenship certificate, permanent residence card or confirmation.</div>  </div> </div>  </div> <div> <div> Indeed Sponsored</div>  </div> <div> <div> <div> <div>IN-INEN</div>  </div> </div>  </div>
Title: Services Designer

Job_Description: <div>PointClickCare is the leading cloud-based software provider for the senior care market in North America. Driven by a passion for innovation and technology, we’re building solutions that have a true impact on people’s lives. Recently named one of Deloitte’s fastest growing technology companies and Canada’s best managed companies, PointClickCare provides vast opportunities and a great culture for our employees. PointClickCare is a dynamic environment to advance your career while performing meaningful work with great people. <br/><br/> <strong>Position Summary:</strong> <br/><br/> The role will be part of the UX team, will tackle selected PointClickCare solutions to communicate the intended experience through artifacts such as storyboards, wireframes, workflows and design specification. This role will work closely with product managers and design researchers to understand stakeholders, users and the markets in which they operate; and work closely with visual designers and front-end developers to ensure intended experiences are carried through. <br/><br/> <strong>Key Responsibilities:</strong>  <ul>  	<li>This is a highly collaborative role, and you will work closely with designers, product managers, front-end developers and other solution team members to flesh out the taskflow and user experience design.</li> <li>On a regular basis, you will design and communicate the intended experience through artifacts such as storyboards, wireframes, workflows and design specification.</li> <li>You will be responsible for defending design choices using previous user research, heuristics and usability standards; lobbying for and planning validation activities to ensure a delightful user experience.</li> <li>You will help to create and maintain our design standards, reference materials and visual signature guidelines.</li> </ul> <strong>Required Experience:</strong>  <ul>  	<li>Most importantly, we are looking for a highly motivated, results-driven person, who has a true passion for their work and desire to make their projects succeed</li> <li>Bachelor’s or Master degree in design, human computer interaction or related field</li> <li>Demonstrated ability to produce quick, low-fidelity sketches on tight schedules</li> <li>Demonstrated ability to synthesize real user feedback into designs</li> <li>Demonstrated knowledge of responsive design techniques for different form factors (desktop vs. mobile)</li> <li>Demonstrated written and verbal communication skills, including techniques to persuade and negotiate and the ability to articulate alternative approaches</li> <li>Demonstrated strong storytelling and presentation skills</li> <li>An understanding of interface & user experience design best practices for web and mobility devices</li> <li>At least 1 year of experience working in a collaborative team and directly with developers implementing designs</li> <li>Knowledge of key design tools such as Adobe Creative Cloud, Balamiq, Sketch and Invision</li> <li>Ability to work in a dynamic, team based environment</li> <li>Possess portfolio of previous work must be presented that demonstrate an understanding of UX design</li> </ul> Working at PointClickCare goes beyond the resume, because the work we perform makes a true difference in people’s lives. We build innovative healthcare technology for seniors and their caregivers that improve their quality of life and well-being on a daily basis. We believe work is so much more meaningful when you’re doing it with a higher purpose. <br/><br/> For more information on PointClickCare, please visit us on Glassdoor and LinkedIn. <br/><br/> <em>It is the policy of PointClickCare to ensure equal employment opportunity without discrimination or harassment on the basis of race, religion, national origin, status, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital or domestic/civil partnership status, disability, veteran status, genetic information, or any other basis protected by law.</em> <br/><br/> <em>PointClickCare welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.</em></div> <br/>
Title: UX Designer

Job_Description: <P><EM>Nokia is a global leader in the technologies that connect people and things. With state-of-the-art software, hardware and services for any type of network, Nokia is uniquely positioned to help communication service providers, governments, and large enterprises deliver on the promise of 5G, the Cloud and the Internet of Things. </EM><EM>Serving customers in over 100 countries, our research scientists and engineers continue to invent and accelerate new technologies that will increasingly transform the way people and things communicate and connect.</EM></P> <P><EM></EM> </P> <P>At Nokia, we’ll aim to provide you with the support to drive your own career and discover the countless opportunities available. That's why a career with Nokia is a perfect place for your advanced degree – and you.</P> <P> </P> <P><STRONG>Position Summary</STRONG></P> <DIV>As a tester in the UX Domain and a member of the Common Software Foundation team, you will be responsible for the testing of reusable UI-related components and services for use across the A&A product portfolio. You will ensure that these components are robust, high quality, easy to use and you will support the product teams as they integrate them into A&A software applications. Additionally, you will: </DIV> <UL> <LI>Take part in planning sessions with Dev and UX Design</LI> <LI>Design and execute test cases for new and existing UI components </LI> <LI>Develop automated regression tests for new and existing UI components</LI> <LI>Maintain and improve build infrastructure</LI></UL> <P><STRONG>Qualifications</STRONG></P> <UL> <LI>QA professional with 5 years of experience</LI> <LI>Proven experience testing Web Applications written using React / Angular</LI> <LI>Experience writing tests cases using mocha / enzyme</LI> <LI>Familiarity with wepback and gulp</LI> <LI>Good grasp of HTML, CSS, DOM</LI> <LI>Knowledge of JIRA, Confluence, GIT, Jenkins an asset </LI> <LI>Team player </LI> <LI>Excellent communication, analytical, and interpersonal skills </LI> <LI>Must have ability to deal with complex concepts and details </LI></UL> <P><STRONG><EM>Canada is committed to building a skilled, diverse workforce reflective of Canadian society. As a result, we promote employment equity and encourage women, aboriginal persons, persons with a disability or members of a visible minority group to apply.</EM></STRONG></P> <P></P> <P> </P> <P> </P>
Title: UI Tester, Common Software Foundation

Job_Description: Graphic & Web Designer <br/><br/> MONEXgroup is seeking a Graphic & Web Designer in Toronto, ON <br/><br/> <strong>ABOUT MONEXgroup:</strong> <br/><br/> Established in 2001, MONEXgroup is a privately owned leading national independent Payment Processing provider located in North York, ON, directly on the subway line and close to the 401. MONEXgroup offers various payment acceptance platforms including e-Commerce, integrated, countertop, wireless & mobile, virtual, unattended and contactless only. <br/><br/> <strong>ROLE:</strong> <br/><br/> We are looking for an exceptionally talented and versatile Senior Graphic & Website Designer. You have a strong print and digital design portfolio, which demonstrates a powerful creative edge. A self-motivated person, you can comfortably manage several projects with conflicting priorities within a deadline-driven environment without compromising quality. Furthermore, you are a design jack-of-all-trades, with a combination of extensive corporate-level graphic design experience and proven web design abilities. You are highly creative, yet detail-oriented. Reporting to the Marketing Manager, the Designer is a team player who works well with others and is skilled in matching strategic direction with fantastic design results for all print and web-based initiatives. Additionally, you are someone who welcomes constructive criticism and channels it into better results. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities:</strong>  <ul>  	<li>Develop and maintain brand standards and guidelines</li>   <li>Build and execute marketing communications and creative for all channels, including emails, blogs, and social media</li>  <li>Create ads for online advertising campaigns; including several dimensions of static display and animated ads</li>  <li>Lead all print production projects, including die-cut flyers, brochures, large format displays, and product decals</li>  <li>Develop creative to support content for entire website, including home page sliders and lead generation form pages</li>  <li>Create and implement front-end web code and designs</li>  <li>Proactively present new and innovative ideas on messaging and creative, with an eye toward test & learn quick (A/B, multivariate), to improve ad response, social media engagement, and web experience, among other objectives</li>  <li>Ensure all digital assets reflect Search Engine Optimization (SEO) and lead generation best practice</li>  <li>Supervise interns, in conjunction with the Marketing Manager</li> </ul> <strong>Requirements:</strong>  <ul>  	<li>Well-versed in Adobe Creative Suite - InDesign, Photoshop, Illustrator, Dreamweaver</li>  <li>Min 3-5 years of graphic design and page-layout experience, video editing experience an asset</li>  <li>Proficient in HTML5 and CSS; other coding abilities such as JavaScript, PHP, and JQuery experience a plus</li>  <li>Experience working with CMS platforms, ideally WordPress</li>   <li>Cross-browser and mobile platform compatibility and responsive design experience</li>   <li>Strong working knowledge of digital marketing, including social media and SEO</li>   <li>Experience developing and maintaining brand standards and guidelines</li>  <li>Familiarity with marketing automation platforms, preferably HubSpot</li>   <li>Ability to create animated designs and ads through software, ideally Flexitive</li>   <li>Stays up-to-date with the latest trends and best practices in graphics, User Interface (UI), web marketing, and SEO</li>  <li>Thorough knowledge and experience in design and execution of print production; including digital, offset, die-cut, large format, and variable printing; ability to prepare pre-press print-ready files a must</li>  <li>Experience working directly with print vendors</li>  <li>Self-starter who takes initiative and can organize several simultaneous projects with competing priorities</li>  <li>Superior project management skills</li>  <li>Super creative, yet highly detailed-oriented and organized</li>  <li>Strong communicator who can present their ideas articulately and comfortable working with all levels of organization</li>  <li>Degree or Diploma in Graphic Design or similar</li>  </ul>
Title: Graphic & Web Designer

Job_Description: The Creative Group's Oakville client, a technology leader unique in the North American Marketplace, is looking for a Senior Visual Designer (UX/UI) ($75K-$90K) to join their entrepreneurial team. <br/><br/> <strong>Are you someone who:</strong> <br/> Is a design thinker <br/> Has a superior "eye for detail" and an aptitude for narrating a design <br/> Has an innovative spirit and "can-do" attitude <br/><br/> The Sr. Visual Designer will be working with a small, cross-functional team on creating products and operating systems that cross the boundaries between Mobile, Tablet and TV's. <br/> Responsibilities include, but are not limited to: <br/><br/> Conceptualize, explore, evaluate solutions, and support their implementatio <br/> Ability to produce multiple stylistic approaches to a problem emphasizing structure, patterns and z-order <br/> Create visual designs to support wireframes and screen work flows <br/> Create simulations and or prototypes using low-fi or high-fi prototyping tools <br/> Assure designs meet all user experience and product requirements
Title: Visual Designer

Job_Description: We are looking for a senior interactive designer for major international projects. The person we are looking for must really have a natural talent and a shining portfolio in the interactive environment, as our accomplishments go through mobile apps, websites and other connected interactions. <br/><br/> <strong>WHAT WE WILL CONFIRM YOU</strong> <br/><br/> Under the supervision of the creative director, you will collaborate with designers, project managers and developers. <br/> You will have to develop concepts and designs for different interfaces and / or interactive environments. <br/> Participate in generating concrete creative ideas related to the project objectives. <br/> Perform all stages of visual design, from the initial concept to the quality of the finished product. <br/><br/> <strong>YOU HAVE At least 5 years of experience</strong> <br/><br/> A diversified portfolio that demonstrates your digital expertise. <br/> A great ability to visually concretize an idea, a message or a narrative scheme. <br/> An excellent knowledge of Adobe's creative suite. <br/> Recognized skills for collaboration and brainstorming. <br/> Knowledge of the principles of usability. <br/> Experience in mobile application design (an asset). <br/> A very good knowledge of French and good communication skills in English. <br/> You are capable of versatility and autonomy. <br/> You must be on the lookout for trends and very curious. <br/> You have developed a great strength in photographic composition. <br/> You consider yourself fast and efficient. <br/><br/> <strong>What we’ll empower you with:</strong>  <ul> <li>Research, design, and prototype new user interface designs based on product requirements.</li> <li>Deliverables include design mockups, prototyping, production of visual assets, and documentation required for proper implementation.</li> <li>Collaborate with designers, product management and developers to define and implement innovative solutions.</li> <li>Execute all visual design stages from concept to final hand-off. Conceptualize original ideas that bring simplicity and user friendliness to complex UI design roadblocks.</li> <li>Create wireframes, storyboards, user journey maps and process flows to effectively communicate interaction and design ideas.</li> <li>Establish and promote design guidelines, best practices and standards.</li> </ul> <strong>Why we are a fantastic 360° digital agency:</strong>  <ul> <li>Yes, we offer breakfast, flexible schedules, beer on Friday and reimbursement of gym fees. And yes, you can come to work in shorts, sandals ... even crocs if you wish.</li> <li>In addition, our team is made up of enthusiastic people ready to help you push your limits.</li> <li>We work with prestigious clients from different industries, ensuring that you constantly act according to various mandates.</li> <li>You will have access to expertise and very advanced technology through our partnerships and in-house developed tools.</li> </ul>  <div><div><div></div><div><div><div><div><div>nventive <br/> 215 rue Saint-Jacques, bureau 500 <br/> Montréal, QC <br/> H2Y 1M6</div></div></div></div></div></div><div><div><div>+-</div></div><div><div>Leaflet | Map data © OpenStreetMap contributors</div></div></div></div>
Title: Senior UI Designer

Job_Description: Join one of the fastest growing companies in high tech! Veeva was named among the top fastest growing public technology companies on Forbes annual Fast Tech 25 list. We build innovative SaaS solutions that include CRM, content management, and customer master data management for life sciences customers. <br/><br/> Follow us on Instagram @veevasystems or Twitter @VeevaCareers and read the buzz, see our videos, and hear from our team about the innovation, people, and #lifeatveeva. Are you ready to innovate, inspire, and shape the future of the industry cloud? Make your best career move here! <br/><br/> <strong>Job Summary:</strong> <br/><br/> You are a talented UI developer with experience building real websites. Your CSS3, HTML5 and Javascript skill set makes you a strong candidate for this role. Youve worked with most of the common frameworks and tools (Backbone, JavascriptMVC, JQuery, SCSS) and understand the concepts behind building a responsive site. <br/><br/> You will be part of a team building a scalable Java based SaaS solution that complements our existing solutions. This is a cool opportunity to innovate & deliver innovation in a startup environment with a lot of room for growth. <br/><br/> <strong>Whats in it for you?</strong> <ul> <li>You get to play with the latest technologies in the cloud and keep your skills current while you innovate</li><li>Increased opportunities for growth and recognition</li> <li>Work alongside a seasoned management team that has a great track record</li> </ul>  <strong>Responsibilities:</strong>  <ul> <li>Design and build scalable, maintainable web based front ends for Veeva customers, administrators, and operations teams</li><li>Work with Product management to design a user experience that solves the business needs</li><li>Integrate with Veeva backend systems using REST APIs and provide guidance when new services are required</li><li>Collaborate with other technical team members for solving complex problems</li><li>Documentation and unit tests for all of the above</li> </ul>  <strong>Requirements:</strong>  <ul> <li>Strong knowledge of Javascript, including JQuery framework</li><li>Prior experience with Javascript MVC frameworks such as Backbone, Angular JS or Javascript MVC</li><li>Strong HTML and CSS skills</li><li>Prior experience with SCSS</li><li>Experience building websites that rely heavily on REST services</li><li>3+ years of experience as a User Interface Engineer</li> </ul>  <strong>Nice to Have:</strong>  <ul> <li>Prior experience developing large data driven system software</li><li>Prior experience with relational database systems such as MySQL</li><li>UX design experience (mock generation, etc)</li><li>Prior experience working with Java based backends</li><li>Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics or a related technical field</li> </ul>  <div>   <ul> <li>LI-SM1<br/><br/>Veeva Systems is an equal opportunity employer. Accordingly, we are committed to fair and accessible employment practices. Veeva Systems welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.</div></li> </ul>
Title: Senior UI Engineer

Job_Description: ENGLISH FOLLOWS <br/><br/> La motivation nourrit notre industrie le désir de donner vie une idée, dinclure du jamais vu dans un jeu. Cest ce qui donne la force motrice de léquipe Motive. Nos seules limites sont celles de notre imagination. Motive est un nouveau studio créatif, dirigé par Jade Raymond et une équipe de vétérans de lindustrie. Le studio Motive vise redéfinir les jeux daction et proposer aux adeptes des jeux novateurs de qualité supérieure. Quoi de mieux que davoir la possibilité de créer la prochaine franchise succès, de collaborer un jeu Star Wars et de participer aux débuts dun tout nouveau studio? Si les jeux vous passionnent et que vous souhaitez repousser les limites de votre art, profitez de cette occasion unique. <br/><br/> Nous sommes la recherche dun artiste UI senior pour notre studio de Montréal. <br/><br/> <strong>Rôle de lartiste UI senior chez Motive</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Taches et responsabilités:</strong> <ul> <li>Collaborer étroitement avec le leadership de léquipe de jeu pour assurer des jeux AAA et une expérience de jeu de classe mondiale</li><li>Inspirer et motiver une équipe multidisciplinaire offrir son meilleur travail et lui communiquer une rétroaction efficace et constructive selon les objectifs de direction artistique et de jouabilité</li><li>Maîtriser la documentation et la communication pour assurer le partage de linformation et formuler les motifs appuyant les décisions liées lexpérience utilisateur auprès de léquipe de développement, de léquipe de leadership et des autres partenaires du studio</li><li>Collaborer avec les équipes externes/ distance, y compris les partenaires en convivialité, et communiquer et maintenir une vision uniforme</li><li>Encourager le développement artistique du personnel par la formation et le mentorat</li><li>En plus de maîtriser son art et dêtre expérimenté dans le domaine, contribuer au perfectionnement du personnel dans le recrutement, la formation et lorientation. Être jour dans les tendances de lindustrie et les expériences utilisateur, en proposant des solutions pour le développement venir</li><li>Comprendre et maîtriser la planification et le suivi de projet afin de sassurer que léquipe maintient le cap et que les priorités sont adaptées aux changements créatifs, le cas échéant</li> </ul> <strong>Exigences:</strong> <ul> <li>Au moins 8 ans dexpérience approfondie de lindustrie du jeu dans la livraison de titres AAA</li><li>Expérience avec des équipes regroupant de multiples disciplines et emplacements</li><li>Bonne connaissance de lengagement utilisateur/joueur</li><li>Développement de jeux pour console HD</li><li>Capacité de diriger une équipe et de déléguer efficacement, de communiquer des critiques efficaces et daccepter la rétroaction et les critiques</li><li>Démonstration de solides compétences globales en art et en conception tant 2D que 3D</li><li>Forte compréhension des jeux populaires, surtout les jeux de rôle et les jeux daction</li><li>Intérêt pour le RV</li><li>Passion, énergie et enthousiasme</li> </ul> <strong>Quavons-nous vous offrir ? Bonne question !</strong> <br/><br/> Nous adorons vanter les avantages que nous offrons comme des régimes dassurance-maladie et davantages sociaux complets, le remboursement des frais de cours, un régime dépargne-retraite avec cotisation équivalente et, bien sûr, plusieurs autres -côtés. Nous savons que pour créer des jeux de renommée mondiale, il nous faut des talents de classe mondiale. Cest pourquoi nous offrons une rémunération concurrentielle ainsi quune culture basée sur la créativité et lindividualité. Chez EA, nous incarnons le modèle « travail-loisir » chaque jour. <br/><br/> Plus sur notre emplacement : http://careers.ea.com/our-locations/montreal <br/><br/> Contactez notre recruteur: <strong>Audrey Berendsen</strong> aberendsen@ea.com <br/><br/> <strong>Motive vous offre les moyens et loccasion. Venez découvrir ce dont vous êtes capable!</strong> <br/><br/> Everyone in our industry has a Motive - an idea they want to bring to life, something theyve never seen before in a game that they want to make a reality. This is what drives everyone at Motive. The only limit here is the teams imagination. Motive is a new creative-driven studio, led by Jade Raymond and a team of industry veterans, Motive aims to redefine action games and bring the highest quality innovative games to players. What could be better than getting to create the worlds next block buster franchise, work on a Star Wars game and be part of building a brand-new studio from the ground up? If you are passionate about games and motivated to push your craft further this is the opportunity of a lifetime. <br/><br/> We are currently looking for a Senior UI Artist to join our Montreal studio. <br/><br/> <strong>What the Senior UI Artist will do at Motive</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Duties and responsibilities:</strong> <ul> <li>Collaborate closely with the Game Team leadership to deliver world-class AAA games and user experiences.</li><li>Inspires and motivate a cross discipline team to deliver their best work and provide effective and constructive feedback to them based on the Art Direction and Gameplay goals.</li><li>Proficiency in documentation and communication is essential in sharing information and articulating the rationale behind the UX decisions among the development team, leadership team, and other studio partners.</li><li>Works with external/remote teams including usability partners and is expected to communicate and maintain the vision on a consistent basis.</li><li>Encourage the artistic development of staff through training and mentorship.</li><li>As a master of their craft and experienced in this field, the Lead UX will help in staff development from recruiting, training, and guidance. Staying current with industry trends and user experiences, proposing solutions for future development.</li><li>Project planning and tracking skills & understanding are important to insure the team stays on track and priorities adapt to creative changes as needed.</li> </ul> <strong>Requirements</strong> <ul> <li>8 years extensive games industry experience in shipping AAA titles</li><li>Experience working with teams across multiple disciplines and locations</li><li>Good knowledge of User/Player engagement</li><li>HD console game development</li><li>Ability to effectively direct and delegate to team, able to give effective critiques and also take feedback & criticism</li><li>Demonstration of strong all-round art and design skills in both 2D and 3D</li><li>Solid understanding of popular games specifically in the RPG and Action genres.</li><li>Interest in VR.</li><li>Passion, energy and enthusiasm</li> </ul> <strong>Whats in it for you? Glad you asked!</strong> <br/><br/> We love to brag about our great perks like comprehensive health and benefit packages, tuition reimbursement, RRSP company match and, of course, many other perks! And since we realize it takes world-class people to make world-class games, we offer competitive compensation packages and a culture that thrives from creativity and individuality. At EA, we live the work hard/play hard credo every day. <br/><br/> More about our location: http://careers.ea.com/our-locations/montreal <br/><br/> Contact our recruiter: <strong>Audrey Berendsen</strong> aberendsen@ea.com <br/><br/> <strong>Motive has the means and opportunity. Come see what you can do!</strong>
Title: Motive: Artiste d'interface d'utilisateur senior / Senior UI Artist

Job_Description: Thinkingbox Toronto is looking to add a Sr. Digital Designer to our team. We are looking for someone with a strong strategic and artistic voice. You have a perfectionist eye for design and the ability to ideate and create stunning focused visual solutions across multiple customer touch points. The main responsibility of the role is to be a key creative engine for Thinkingbox. It’s no small task, we know! <br/><br/> We want you to love the idea of developing campaigns that spin on an axis of innovative digital thinking for some of the world’s most exciting brands. We see you succeeding by connecting the digital and physical, arriving at solutions that are both logical and emotional. Show us your track record of world-class work demonstrating your masterful use of new technologies to solve hard problems. More than just your design, we’re interested in your design approach and the thought process behind your work. We are looking for someone who is skillfully adept at developing ideas that people love. <br/>  <br/> <strong>RESPONSIBILITIES</strong>   <ul>   <li>Designing the look and feel of digital projects along with user interface elements</li><li>Defining user experience elements, info architecture, user flows, and wireframes</li><li>Developing interactive design elements and solutions</li><li>Contribute ideas and assist in designing pixel perfect artwork and assets</li><li>Developing solutions that respond to client parameters and project briefs</li><li>Collaborate and brainstorm with producers, and creative and development team</li><li>Work and collaborate on brainstorming sessions to produce new ideas and concepts</li><li>Collaborate on pitches and presentations</li><li>Estimating the time required to complete tasks</li><li>Presenting finalized ideas and concepts to supervisors and producers</li> </ul>  <strong>REQUIREMENTS</strong>   <ul>   <li>5+ yrs working experience at an agency or design studio</li><li>Diploma or degree in design</li><li>Knowledge of digital design, trends, and best practices across multiple platforms</li><li>Knowledge of UI/UX processes</li><li>Ability to design a project’s user experience that could live on multiple platforms</li><li>Understanding of OOH experiences, trends, and general best practices</li><li>Ability to execute visually appealing hifi mockups</li><li>Ability to take art direction and critique</li><li>Must have a keen eye for detail</li><li>Strong conceptual thinking</li><li>Strong understanding of typography and design</li><li>Interest in emerging technologies and design trends</li><li>Ability to collaborate with a team and also work autonomously</li><li>Understanding of digital production process and ability to deliver files to development team</li><li>Proficiency in Creative Suite</li> </ul>  <strong>BONUS POINTS</strong>   <ul>   <li>Experience with video / 3D</li><li>Experience with social media</li><li>Experience with Entertainment clients (TV, Film, Music)</li><li>Experience in creating sites that have won awards from reputable organizations such as FWA, Awwwards, or CSS Design Awards</li> </ul>  <strong>How to Apply:</strong>   <ul>   <li>Please send your resume and cover letter to career@thinkingbox.com</li> <li>In your cover letter, please include links to examples of relevant projects or demos</li> <li>No phone calls please</li> <li>Only successful candidates will be contacted</li></ul>
Title: Sr. Digital Designer

Job_Description: You've read job posts that promise you'll change the world. Then you discover they're for yet another social media app, marketing agency, or consulting firm. You click away. And you wonder: "Aren't there opportunities where I can make a big impact? While I earn recognition and rewards for my efforts? And get to work with exceptional people on exciting new technology?" If that sounds like you, meet BenchSci. You will be a great fit. <br/><br/> <strong>About us</strong> <br/><br/> We use machine learning to accelerate drug discovery by helping scientists execute successful experiments. <br/><br/> <strong>We focus on a huge problem in drug discovery</strong> <br/><br/> Each year, biomedical researchers waste over a billion combined hours. The problem is with products they purchase to influence and measure proteins. There are millions of them, from hundreds of vendors. Finding the right products for specific experiments is tough. Researchers spend hours and sometimes days searching through published papers for guidance. But even then, many products they buy don't work. Some aren't right for a specific experiment. Others are poor quality. This delays scientific discoveries by weeks or months. And it slows availability of breakthrough treatments while making them more expensive. <br/><br/> <strong>We apply artificial intelligence to solve it</strong> <br/><br/> Thanks to improvements in machine learning, we can now solve this problem. We spent more than two years teaching a computer to read science papers like a human scientist. It decodes the information, which we present to researchers in an easy-to-use, web-based platform. They can then find products for experiments in minutes, not days, and see data that builds trust. The time and money they save has led to rapid adoption by top pharmaceutical companies and hundreds of academic institutions. <br/><br/> <strong>Product video</strong>: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fPs5xzYYHSs <br/><br/> <strong>News about us:</strong> https://www.theglobeandmail.com/business/article-alphabets-ai-venture-capital-firm-makes-first-investment-in-canada/ <br/><br/> <strong>About you</strong> <br/><br/> If our story excites you, let us describe who we would love on our team. You are passionate about machine learning, science, and making a positive impact. You are high-reaching, results-focused, and always learning. You act fast. You are open, honest, and transparent. You come to work inspired. You take your job seriously, but not yourself. You leave work satisfied. You wonder how to make every single day better than the last. For this specific role: <br/><br/> <strong>Your responsibilities:</strong> <br/><br/> As a UI Designer at BenchSci, you are a visual thinker who merges skills in visual design with your understanding of user experience to create delightful and usable interfaces. You translate and communicate complex information through understandable digital and printed visuals.  <ul>  <li>You will use your striking visual designs to make the BenchSci platform a world-class website for our scientist users</li>    <li>You will help the company communicate the platform’s value by creating stunning digital and printed assets like posters, decks, and booklets</li>    <li>Work with the Head of User Experience to guide the look, behavior, and feel of the platform by creating wireframes, mockups, and prototypes</li>    <li>Advance and implement BenchSci’s style guide to create a consistent and accessible platform for all scientists</li>    <li>Follow trends and best-practices in design, and ensure that BenchSci design tracks them closely</li>    <li>Collaborate with scientists from our team and user base to ensure designs are usable and intuitive</li>    <li>Work closely with front-end developers and QA to see designs through to production</li>    </ul> <strong>Qualifications:</strong>  <ul>  <li>2+ years experience in UI design with a strong portfolio of sample projects</li>    <li>1+ years of industry experience or summer internship</li>    <li>Excellent tactical visual design skills with a sensitivity to user experience</li>    <li>Able to prioritize projects, communicate progress, and deliver on time</li>    <li>Able to present your work and articulate the reasoning behind choices you made in the designs</li>    <li>Experience working in an Agile process</li>    <li>You can’t help but evaluate the user experience of both digital and non-digital products you encounter</li>    <li>You don’t compromise on your designs and don’t stop until you are proud</li>    <li>You are fearless, a fast learner, and thrive in fast-paced, collaborative environments</li>    <li>You love to learn about science and are always up to date with cutting-edge concepts and technologies</li>    <li>You think like a scientist - question your assumptions and strive for data-driven decisions</li>    <li>Proficient in HTML, CSS, and can explain how your designs will be implemented with code</li>    <li>You can skillfully employ both Photoshop and Illustrator</li>   <li>Proficiency in Sketch and InVision is a plus</li>   <li>Bachelor’s or Master’s level education in Graphic Design, Visual Design, Interactive Design, Human-Computer Interaction, Interaction Design, or related is a plus</li>    <li>Background in life sciences is a strong asset</li>   <li>Candidate must be eligible to work in Canada</li> </ul> <strong>What you get:</strong><ul> <li>Competitive salary and options at a well-funded startup</li>  <li>High-growth position in the early stage of a promising company</li>  <li>Key placement with important responsibilities in the organization</li>  <li>Benefits package that includes medical, vision, dental and life insurance</li>  <li>Alignment of your professional growth with the company’s growth</li>  <li>An opportunity to help transform and improve scientific research</li> </ul> <strong>How to apply</strong> <br/><br/> Please submit a resume, portfolio or a website link, and a short paragraph stating why you are interested in BenchSci. The deadline to apply is June 8th, but we review applicants on an ongoing basis so please apply ASAP. <br/><br/> <strong>A bit more about us</strong> <br/><br/> BenchSci was one of three finalists for "New Startup" in the sixth annual Canadian Startup Awards. As one of the leading machine learning startups in Canada, we raised over $2,700,000 in a seed round from preeminent Canadian and American venture capitalists. We are affiliated with top machine learning researchers at the University of Toronto, including advisor Richard Zemel, research director of the Vector Institute. Our office is located in downtown Toronto (aka “the 6”), near great coffee shops, restaurants, and summer patios. <br/><br/> <strong>At BenchSci we value the following:</strong>  <ul> <li>Freedom and accountability. We do not want or have time to micromanage.</li>  <li>Hard work. We have an amazing and rare opportunity to make an impact and we work hard to make sure we capture it.</li>  <li>Personal growth. We put aside a growth budget for each employee.</li>  <li>No bullshit. No politics. Just results.</li> </ul> BenchSci is an equal opportunity employer. We value diversity and are committed to fostering an inclusive environment. All four of our co-founders are immigrants to Canada, as are more than 75% of our employees. We welcome your fresh perspectives and ideas.
Title: UI Designer

Job_Description: Hi! Were ecobee. <br/><br/> We are pioneers and innovators in the fast-emerging connected home and IoT industries. ecobee products are beautifully designed and incredibly smart. They are connected devices which automate your home while helping you save energy and money. Were headquartered in Toronto, and play on an international scale. <br/><br/> Were growing. In fact, were growing really fast. And, were looking for great people to join our hive. <br/><br/> <strong>Who Are You?</strong> <br/><br/> As a member of our UX team, you will be responsible for helping define the user experience for ecobees physical products; we are specifically looking for an<strong> intermediate or senior designer</strong> to focus on our newest commercial web portal and mobile application. <br/><br/> You have a critical thinking mindset, and the ability to imagine the future while considering the implications of your design decisions. With excellent communication skills, you are comfortable presenting your ideas through various media words, whiteboard, graphics or prototypes. <br/><br/> You will collaborate closely with our development and product management teams as well as others in the company. You are excited about working with a cutting edge team in the connected home market and can draw on past interactive and design experience to craft high quality experiences that solve real problems for our customers. <br/><br/> Still interested? Read on! <br/><br/> <strong>What Will You Do?</strong>  <ul> <li>Design user experiences and interfaces for ecobees commercial web portal and mobile applications.</li> <li>Collaborate closely with other designers, development teams, product management, and copywriters to recommend features, experiences, and UI implementations.</li> <li>Plan and run user research to learn about customers needs and goals and lifestyles, as well as synthesize results</li> <li>Consider customer pain points while investigating solutions to design problems, and validate design decisions with usability testing</li> <li>Assist with facilitating design charrettes (ideation workshops) with team members from various areas of the company to gain insights and develop rough concepts to move forward with</li> <li>Be comfortable communicating ideas to a group of internal stakeholders, explaining rationale behind design decisions</li> </ul> <strong>What Experience Do You Have?</strong>  <ul> <li>5+ years of industry experience, including design of native Android or iOS mobile apps and responsive web.</li> <li>Degree or diploma in UX/interactive/graphic design, or equivalent.</li> <li>Interaction design experience including responsive web, mobile app, information architecture, etc.</li> <li>Experience collaborating with cross-functional agile teams including development, and providing guidelines and assets required for implementation.</li> <li>Knowledge of facilitation, able to recommend ideation workshop activities and comfortable leading a room.</li> <li>Experience utilizing user research and testing to inform design decisions. Ability to prepare for and run unbiased user interviews, and contribute to synthesizing results.</li> <li>Thorough understanding of design patterns and best practices on mobile and web.</li> <li>Just so you know: our hired candidate will be required to complete a criminal background check.</li> </ul> Are you the one were looking for? If so, we would love to hear from you! <br/><br/> ecobee is committed to workplace diversity and will provide accommodation to applicants with disabilities throughout the hiring process.
Title: User Experience Designer

Job_Description: <div>Great UX design opportunity! <br/><br/> Our Federal Government client is looking for an experienced UX Designer to join their team. There would be a possibility of offsite/part-time work. <br/><br/> <strong>Roles and Responsibilities</strong>   <ul> <li>Generating time estimates for the completion of tasks and deliverables</li> <li>Passionate about user-centered design practices and have an impeccable eye for detail and design</li> <li>Designing information/content architectures and experience flows</li> </ul>  <strong>Qualifications and Experience</strong>   <ul> <li>Minimum 2 years of UX design professional practice</li> <li>Experience with design and prototyping tools</li>   <li>Knowledge of capabilities of front-end development constraints of digital standards and platforms (HTML/CSS)</li> </ul>  If you qualify, please APPLY!!</div>
Title: UX Designer

Job_Description: Specific Responsibilities <p>Buffalo David Bitton, une marque de renommée internationale avec une longue tradition de qualité et ayant son siège social à Montréal sur la rue Sauvé Ouest, cherche de nouveaux membres pour son équipe! Incarnant un style de vie unique, Buffalo David Bitton est une marque qui va au-delà des frontières. Créé en France et ensuite lancé à Montréal il y a plus de 30 ans, Buffalo David Bitton est une marque d’influence européenne qui s’étend maintenant à travers 18 pays et plus de 3000 points de vente. Nos principaux comptes clients incluent différentes grandes chaines américaines tels que Macy’s, Lord & Taylor, Dillard’s et la Baie d’Hudson au Canada, ainsi que des magasins spécialisés tels que Buckle, Jean Machine, Bootlegger, et bien plus encore. Buffalo David Bitton est une marque emblématique qui offre plusieurs styles de jeans, ainsi qu’une gamme complète de vêtements et d’accessoires modes. </p> <p>Nous sommes présentement à la recherche d’une personne au profil dynamique qui a le goût de faire partie d’une équipe enrichissante et encadrée plusieurs professionnels de renom dans le domaine depuis des années qui vous guideront, vous aideront à vous épanouir professionnellement et vous transmettront leur passion pour la mode. À qui l’opportunité de se joindre à nous?!</p> <p><strong>Designer Graphique Web </strong></p> <p> </p> <p>Le Designer Graphique Web aura la responsabilité de l'apparence, la disposition et les fonctionnalités du site Web. Le travail consiste à comprendre à la fois la conception graphique et la programmation informatique. Une fois les déclinaisons pour le site Web sont créées, le concepteur aide à la maintenance et aux ajouts du site Web. Il travaillera avec des équipes de développement ou des experts pour maintenir le site à jour et prioriser les besoins, entre autres tâches.</p> <p><strong> </strong></p> <p><strong>Responsabilités :</strong> </p> <ul>  <li>Collaborer à la création de tous les aspects créatifs du site web, ainsi que tous les <em>réseaux markéting externes, </em>y compris mais non limité aux bannières et aux promotions, et ce, selon les normes relatives à l’image de la marque;</li>  <li>Maintenir les normes de conception visuelle: la conception de mise en page, la typographie, les promotions, les CTA (Call-to-action) ainsi que l'apparence et la convivialité du site web;</li>  <li>Collaborer avec tous les partenaires d’affaires sur la réalisation graphique de tous les projets numériques;</li>  <li>Créer et finaliser des fichiers graphiques précis;</li>  <li>Respecter les délais de production;</li>  <li>Respecter l’organisation et assurer l’entretien des fichiers départementaux sur le serveur. Suivre la convention établie pour la nomenclature des fichiers;</li>  <li>Effectuer toute production graphique, ainsi que la mise à jour du site web selon les procédures à suivre;</li>  <li>Collaborer avec l'équipe de développement web pour la gestion du contenu graphique en ligne;</li>  <li>Exercer d’autres fonctions au besoin.</li> </ul> <p>***</p> <p> </p> <p>Buffalo David Bitton a global lifestyle brand with a long-standing tradition of quality located in Montreal is looking for new members for our team! Founded in France and brought to Montreal more than 30 years ago, to be developed with a European influence. The label now spans across 18 countries and more than 3000 locations. Key accounts include U.S. department stores Macy’s, Lord & Taylor, Dillards, Hudson Bay in Canada and specialty stores like Buckle, Jean Machine, Bootlegger and many more. Buffalo David Bitton is an iconic brand offering multiple denim styles and a full fashion collection. </p> <p>We are currently looking for a dynamic person who is in need to be part of an expert team, managed by several renowned professionals in the field that will guide you, help you grow in fashion and share their passion for fashion. Who will have the opportunity to join us?!</p> <p><strong> </strong></p> <p><strong>Web Graphic Designer</strong></p> <p> </p> <p>The Web Graphic Designer will create the look, layout, and features of a website. The job involves understanding both graphic design and computer programming. Once the website assets are created, the designer helps with maintenance and additions to the website. He will work with development teams or experts for keeping the site up-to-date and prioritizing needs, among other tasks. </p> <p><strong>Responsibilities:</strong></p> <ul>  <li>Assist in the creation of all creative aspects of the website, as well as all external marketing networks, including but not limited to banners and promotions, and this according to the standards for the image of Buffalo David Bitton;</li>  <li>Maintain visual design standards: web page layout design, typography, promotions, CTA (Call-to-Action) and the look and feel of the website;</li>  <li>Work with all business partners on the graphics of all digital projects;</li>  <li>Create and finalize specific graphic files;</li>  <li>Meet deadlines production;</li>  <li>Respect the organization and ensure the maintenance of departmental files on the server. Follow the established convention for the file naming; </li>  <li>Perform any graphic production, and update the website according to the procedures to follow;</li>  <li>Work with the web development team to manage the graphic content online; </li>  <li>Performs other duties as required.</li> </ul> Skills and Requirements <p><strong>Compétences </strong><strong>et aptitudes: </strong></p> <ul>  <li>Certification en conception web, en design graphique ou équivalent, niveau Baccalauréat ou diplôme collégial;</li>  <li>Une année ou plus d’expérience en conception web/design graphique dans le secteur du commerce au détail, dans un environnement lié au commerce électronique ou au développement web;</li>  <li>Bilingue parlé et écrit (français, anglais);</li>  <li>Connaissances approfondies d’Adobe Créative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign, etc.) et Microsoft Suite (Word, Excel, etc.);</li>  <li>Compréhension du codage HTML/CSS et familier avec ses utilisations. Connaissance du codage responsive;</li>  <li>Avoir de solides compétences dans les notions de base graphique et typographie;</li>  <li>Connaissances approfondies en développement web lié au commerce électronique, avec de fortes habilités en conception/design et un goût certain pour la mode;</li>  <li>Solides compétences en communication orale et écrite;</li>  <li>Capacité de gérer plusieurs tâches simultanément et de porter attention aux détails;</li>  <li>Connaissance des tendances web actuelles et des meilleures techniques de conception UX/UI; </li>  <li>Capacité de travailler dans un environnement au rythme rapide et en constante évolution. Capacité de s'adapter aux priorités changeantes selon les besoins organisationnels;</li>  <li>Capacité de toujours fournir un travail de haute qualité selon les échéances;</li>  <li>Avoir le sens de l'urgence-réactivité avec la capacité de gérer l’ambigüité;</li>  <li>Avoir un intérêt pour le domaine de la mode et de la vente, ainsi que le désir d'apprendre tous les aspects de la marque/entreprise; </li>  <li>Capacité à travailler en équipe avec des intervenants de différent niveau de connaissance.</li> </ul> <p><strong>Atouts :</strong></p> <ul>  <li>Connaissance avec le système de gestion de site web SAP/HYBRIS;</li>  <li>Connaissance des outils IBM;</li>  <li>Expérience en rédaction;</li>  <li>Expérience avec le montage audio et vidéo.</li> </ul> <p>***</p> <p> </p> <p><strong>Required skills and abilities: </strong></p> <ul>  <li>Certified in web design, graphic design or equivalent. Bachelor or Collegiate degree;</li>  <li>1 year or more of experience in web design / graphic design in the retail trade sector in a linked environment for electronic commerce or web development;</li>  <li>Bilingual spoken and written (French, English);</li>  <li>Extensive knowledge of Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign, etc.) and Microsoft Suite (Word, Excel, etc.);</li>  <li>Understanding of and at ease with HTML / CSS coding and familiar with its uses. Knowledge of responsive design coding;</li>  <li>Have strong design fundamentals and typography skills;</li>  <li>Advanced knowledge in web development related to e-commerce, with strong skills in design / trends and a taste for fashion;</li>  <li>Strong skills in oral and written communication;</li>  <li>Ability to handle multiple tasks simultaneously and attention to detail;</li>  <li>Knowledge of current web trends and best design techniques UX / UI;</li>  <li>Ability to work in a constantly changing fast-paced environment. Ability to adapt to changing priorities according to organizational needs;</li>  <li>Ability to always provide high quality work according to deadlines;</li>  <li>Have a sense of urgency-reactivity with the ability to handle ambiguity;</li>  <li>Have an interest in the field of fashion and sales, as well as the desire to learn all aspects of the brand / company;</li>  <li>Ability to work in team with stakeholders from different levels of knowledge.</li> </ul> <p><strong>Assets:</strong></p> <ul>  <li>Experience with SAP/HYBRIS user management system;</li>  <li>Experience using the IBM tools</li>  <li>Experience in copywriting</li>  <li><p>Experience with editing for audio/video</p></li> </ul> <p>*** AVANTAGES ***</p> <ul>  <li>Temps plein (35 heures/sem);</li>  <li>Congés de maladie;</li>  <li>Horaires flexibles;</li>  <li>Horaires d'été;</li>  <li>Assurances collectives après 6 mois;</li>  <li>Cadeau d'anniversaire;</li>  <li>Régime enregistré d'épargne-retraite (REER) et Régime de participation différée aux bénéfices (RPDB);</li>  <li>Environnement de travail moderne, à proximité des magasins et du transport en commun;</li>  <li>Code vestimentaire décontracté;</li>  <li>Rabais aux employés.</li> </ul> <p>*** ADVANTAGES ***</p> <ul>  <li>Full time (35 hours/week);</li>  <li>Sick days;</li>  <li>Flexible hours;</li>  <li>Summer hours;</li>  <li>Group insurance after 6 months;</li>  <li>Birthday present;</li>  <li>Registered Retirement Savings Plan (RRSP) and Deferred Profit Sharing Plan (DPSP);</li>  <li>Modern working environment, close to shops and public transport;</li>  <li>Casual dress code;</li>  <li>Employee Discounts.</li> </ul><br>Apply Now
Title: Designer Graphique Web / Web Graphic Designer

Job_Description: Our team is looking for a Junior Web Designer. You would work directly with our Senior Web Designer to produce unique and compelling user experiences for a wide range of markets and industries. <br/><br/> This role requires a high degree of creativity, versatility and a sharp eye for detail. If you are passionate about design and are eager to learn, we'd like to meet you. <br/><br/> When applying, please provide links to any material you’d like to show us that demonstrates your approach to design. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities</strong> <ul>  <li>Understand project requirements and concepts</li> <li>Use various techniques to create drafts, models and prototypes</li> <li>Design and build beautiful web and mobile application UI’s using CSS</li> <li>Pitch creative ideas that enhance projects</li> <li>Collaborate with team members to launch designs</li> <li>Use feedback from leaders to improve work</li> </ul> <strong>Requirements</strong> <ul>  <li>Good intuition of best practices and tools used in user-centered interaction design</li> <li>Good understanding of the fundamentals of good design: visual hierarchy, layout, typography, color theory, etc</li> <li>Proven ability to design in Photoshop, Illustrator or similar</li> <li>Experience implementing designs using HTML5 and CSS3</li> <li>Excellent communication and teamwork skills</li> <li>A keen eye for detail</li> <li>Creativity skills and problem-solving aptitude</li> <li>Experience not required but an asset</li> </ul> <strong>Benefits</strong> <ul>  <li>Paid vacation</li> <li>Paid sick time</li> <li>Medical benefits</li> </ul>
Title: Junior Web Designer

Job_Description: <strong>About Pixel Tours</strong> <br/><br/> We’re a product strategy, design and development consultancy with a diverse portfolio of projects, from VR/AR to Early Child-hood Education to Financial Technology. We’re looking for people with sharp eyes, and even sharper minds to join our growing team. <br/><br/> <strong>A Bit About You</strong> <br/><br/> You are first and foremost a designer. A designer with a passion for creating elegant, highly usable interfaces. You are skilled with Sketch, InVision, Photoshop, Illustrator, and are capable of taking your pixel perfect designs and converting them to functional prototypes. You have at least 3 years of experience designing user interfaces for both responsive web, and mobile applications and understand Material Design and grid systems. You believe great design is more than just imagery, it's layout, margins, typography, and interactions all working together. <br/><br/> You like people, and understand that a good design isn't great until it has passed through real user validation. <br/><br/> You aspire to greatness—maybe for you that’s winning awards, presenting at a conference, or simply the satisfaction of knowing thousands, or millions (we have some large customers), of people had a better day because of something you made. <br/><br/> <strong>What You'll Do</strong> <ul>  <li>Design user interfaces in Sketch for web, iOS, and Android applications balancing system constraints and business objectives against industry best practices and user needs.</li> <li>Prepare user testable content through InVision or HTML/CSS/Javascript prototypes.</li></ul>   <ul>  <li>Leverage user insight, analytics, best practices, and competitor analysis to inform all design decisions.</li> <li>Continually socialize concepts, collecting feedback and iterating to achieve amazing results.</li> <li>Work with the development team to connect your interfaces into production systems.</li> <li>Collaborate with developers, product owners, user experience designers, and marketing.</li> </ul> We’re going to assume you can use a Mac as Sketch abilities are a requirement, you will be provided a laptop for portability loaded with all the latest design/prototyping tools. We’ll also hook you up with Slack, Skype, Toggl and a whole bunch of other tools so you can work from your favourite café from time to time. <br/><br/> Pixel Tours operates from two locations in Toronto (28 Logan Avenue and 151 Placer Court), this position will primarily work out of the Logan Ave location but will require occasional travel to the 151 Placer Court location or a customer site. <br/><br/> <strong>Requirements</strong> <ul>  <li>3+ years web and mobile design experience;</li> <li>Portfolio demonstrating expertise in typography, colour theory, illustration, and interactive design;</li> <li>Ability to take a concept from concept through sketches, wireframes, and high-fidelity mockups;</li> <li>Any passion for life-long learning;</li> <li>Great team collaboration and communication skills.</li> </ul> <strong>Benefits</strong> <ul>  <li>3 weeks vacation</li> <li>Benefits package</li> <li>Lunch & Learns</li> <li>Coffee & Snacks</li> <li>Hands on the latest AR and VR gear</li> </ul>
Title: UI Designer

Job_Description: Myticas Consulting is looking for a strong Front-End/UI Developer, for a permanent opportunity within the Ottawa, Canada region. This opportunity offers plenty of room for growth, both on a career and financial level. <br/><br/> What you’ll be doing in this role:  <ul> <li>Creating up front architecture and technical documentation.</li> <li>Providing development estimates to the project manager in support of the project development plan.</li> <li>Producing design artifacts such as class diagrams and sequence diagrams for product features or client solutions.</li> <li>Implementing project features within a team using best practices to meet product or solution deliverables.</li> <li>Building reusable front-end code and libraries for future re-use.</li> <li>Ensuring the technical feasibility of proposed UI/UX designs.</li> <li>Implementing reusable unit tests to ensure the integrity of on-going product quality.</li> <li>Participating in stress tests, load tests, performance tests, making recommendations to improve performance and scalability.</li> <li>Preparing software packages and documentation for deployments that adhere to the defined standard deployment policies.</li> </ul> Qualifications would involve:  <ul> <li>Proven experience in technical software development.</li> <li>Strong front-end web development experience, HTML, CSS, JavaScript and jQuery.</li> <li>Must have experience with REACT.js, along with good knowledge of Redux, Angular, jQuery and Node.js.</li> <li>A nice-to-have skill would be SAP Hybris or Oracle ATG.</li> <li>Excellent communication skills.</li> </ul> If you’re looking to inquire further information, or to apply directly, be sure to send us a detailed model of your resume in confidence. Our IT recruitent team will follow up accordingly at the conclusion of the review process.
Title: Senior UI Developer

Job_Description: Therefore is seeking a qualified candidate to join our growing digital strategy department. The selected candidate will engage on projects and products with the strategy team in user experience research, strategy and design. <br/><br/> <strong>Requirements</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Experience</strong> <ul>  <li>A qualified candidate will have engaged in some or most of the following UX methodologies (or comparable methods).</li> <li>Experience with research methods, such as stakeholder interviews, user interviews, user personas, heuristic evaluation, competitive audit, etc.</li> <li>Experience with strategy methods such as value proposition canvas, customer journey mapping, and identifying KPI.</li> <li>Experience creating sitemaps, wireframes, user interface mockups, and prototypes.</li> <li>Experience engaging in validating methodologies such as A/B testing, user testing, or user survey.</li> </ul> <strong>Skills</strong> <ul>  <li>Organization and promptness (meet deadlines, be self motivated)</li> <li>Ability to engage and speak with clients, and their customers with confidence and subject matter authority</li> <li>Ability to receive feedback and guidance</li> <li>Ability to work collaboratively as part of a team</li> <li>Life learner</li> </ul> <strong>Special consideration</strong> <ul>  <li>A candidate will be given special consideration if they have demonstrable experience with the following:</li> <li>Experience working alongside Agile development teams.</li> <li>Experience in Agile project management or planning.</li> <li>Experience or education in marketing (strategy, or execution of marketing campaigns and deliverables).</li> <li>Experience or education in web development and/or solutions architecture (working knowledge of web technology, or advanced knowledge in systems design).</li> <li>Experience in graphic design, art direction and branding.</li> </ul> <strong>Benefits</strong> <ul>  <li>Work from a modern open-concept social atmosphere overlooking the city skyline from <strong>Liberty Village</strong></li>  <li> <strong>Getting to work</strong> - There are lots of ways to get to the office: bike, street car, bus, train…</li> <li> <strong>Pet projects</strong> - Have a great idea you want to explore? Want to learn about a new process, technology or related discipline? We give you the flexibility and encouragement you need to stay up-to-date and relevant.</li> <li> <strong>Hardware / Software</strong> - All of our machines are top-of-the-line. You want dual-monitor, or even triple, no problem. We’re currently using all Apple products and Atlassian product suite. Chairs are ergonomic high quality makes such as Herman Miller and Steelcase -- important stuff.</li> <li> <strong>Health</strong> - We provide a full featured health plan.</li> <li> <strong>Gym Membership</strong> - Gym membership in our building is free for all employees.</li> <li> <strong>Fuel</strong> - We keep the kitchen stocked with healthy snacks, drinks and of course, coffee and teas.</li> <li> <strong>High-Profile Clients</strong> - We work with amazing clients, many of which are household names. Our projects aren’t always public facing, but are very often challenging and complex. We work closely with our clients to build deeply integrated platforms and products.</li> <li> <strong>Conferences / Knowledge Sharing</strong> - We attend Drupal, JavaScript, Accessibility and Content Strategy meetups, conferences, camps and summits both local and around the world. We also contribute through sponsorships and by doing talks.</li> <li> <strong>Training and Learning</strong> - We have accounts with lots of online learning resources. Find a new one that we can benefits from? Let us know and we’ll hook it up.</li> </ul>
Title: UX Designer

Job_Description: <div>     Jr. Designer/Developer      <div>    Type    <div>  Contract </div>    Location    <div>  Burnaby </div>    Wanted    <div>  <p>We are looking for a part-time Jr. Developer/Designer to support our expanding client projects. The Jr. Developer/Designer will help deliver projects on time and on budget with the business outcomes client expect while learning SMARTT’s unique integrated service model. If there’s a good fit, this can become a full time position for the right candidate.</p>  <p>We are looking for candidates that fit our culture of:</p>  <ul> 	<li>Being on time</li> 	<li>Communicating</li> 	<li>Producing work we are proud of</li> </ul>  <p>All while practicing Transparency, Leadership, and Collaboration.</p>  </div>    Key Responsibilities    <div>  <ul> 	<li>Design and code web sites, pages, and landing pages</li> 	<li>Develop pages either from scratch or using a CMS framework such as WordPress or Drupal</li> 	<li>Design graphical elements such as logos, icons and infographics as necessary</li> 	<li>Design and build marketing collateral – mostly web with some print (Example: web banners)</li> 	<li>Perform quality control on provided site content</li> 	<li>Ensure that sites are optimized for search engines before going live</li> 	<li>Actively test product outputs on IE, Firefox, Chrome, and Safari across PC, Mac, and mobile devices</li> 	<li>Proactively participate in QC and testing to ensure that websites and supporting features are working properly</li> 	<li>Follow design and code reviews and practice established coding standards</li> </ul>  </div>    Education Level    <div>  Bachelor's degree </div>    Compensation    <div>  <p>$25/an hour based on a set contract of 20 hours a week</p>  </div>    About You    <div>  <ul> 	<li>Formal training/education in graphic design and/or web development</li> 	<li>High level of design skill and technical proficiency</li> 	<li>Ability to quickly build modern CSS layouts</li> 	<li>Outstanding skills in Photoshop</li> 	<li>Proficient with WordPress / Theme / Plugin installation, configuration and management</li> 	<li>Experience with Drupal an asset</li> 	<li>Experience with modern web standards required (semantic markup, HTML5, mobile web)</li> 	<li>JavaScript Development, JavaScript Libraries (JQuery), , Ajax, , HTML5, CSS, XML, XML Parsing.</li>
