	<li>Results / Quality / Process oriented</li> 	<li>Can effectively understand business requirements into features & functional outputs</li> 	<li>Excellent and pro-active written and verbal communication skills</li> 	<li>Experience working directly with customers to meet business objectives an asset</li> </ul>  </div>    Annual Salary    <div>  $24,000 (Part-Time) </div>    Years of Experience    <div>  1+ </div>    Job Title    <div>  Web Developer </div>  </div>      </div>
Title: r. Web Designer / Developer

Job_Description: theScore’s mission is to create highly-engaging digital products and content that empower the sports fan’s experience. Its flagship mobile app ‘theScore’ is one of the most popular multi-sport news and data apps in North America, serving millions of fans a month. The Company also creates innovative digital sports experiences through its web, social and esports platforms. <br/><br/> We’re looking for a user-centered design expert who understands people – who they are, what motivates them, how they interact with our products and what our audience expects from theScore. As a product design leader, you will lead the development, implementation, and maintenance of clear and intentional design processes that achieve results and foster the creativity, focus, and productivity of the team. You’ll Manage a small team of designers; provide feedback on their work and support their career goals by developing their technical and communication skills. <br/><br/> <strong>Typical Work Day at theScore:</strong>  <ul> <li>Contribute to a multidisciplinary team (developers, marketers, and product managers), to ship new products, features, and improvements based on business objectives, usability studies, and research metrics.</li> <li>Evaluate the feasibility of a feature from a design perspective, and help scope and phase the development of each feature.</li> <li>Ensure designers each have clear roles, objectives and priorities, consistent with business priorities and design/development processes.</li> <li>Take broad, conceptual ideas and turn them into something valuable for our users.</li> <li>Work with low fidelity designs & wireframes to produce flows that get the experience right.</li> <li>Create interaction prototypes to test out complex ideas and produce high fidelity designs.</li> <li>Guide the team to develop best practices for ensuring a high caliber of quality.</li> <li>Focus on the user and solving problems from their POV.</li> <li>Other duties as required.</li> </ul> <strong>Requirements:</strong>  <ul> <li>Bachelor’s degree, or equivalent knowledge and/or experience.</li> <li>6+ years as a UX/UI designer, including managing a team of designers.</li> <li>Experience in UI design with complex mobile applications.</li> <li>Experience using research and analytics to inform design.</li> <li>Ability to prototype rapidly in a variety of mediums and levels of fidelity.</li> <li>You have a talent for identifying and creating design processes and related team structures.</li> <li>You are experienced in empathetic, evidence and data-driven design, with demonstrated ability to tackle the complexity of an information-dense digital product.</li> <li>You’re an expert in information architecture, user flow, and micro-interactions, and have a solid understanding of mobile app design principles.</li> <li>Knowledge of coding to be able to contribute to technical discussions when required.</li> <li>Experience with industry standard design tools (Ex. Sketch, Illustrator, Photoshop).</li> <li>A portfolio that highlights examples of interaction design work.</li> <li>Excellent problem solver and familiarity with technical constraints of various mediums (mobile/desktop web, iOS, Android).</li> <li>Experience producing multiple visual directions and concepts.</li> <li>Other duties as required.</li> <li><strong>Nice to have:</strong> Front-end development (HTML, CSS, JavaScript), SVG animation.</li> </ul> <strong>What We Offer:</strong>  <ul> <li>Competitive salary with Employee Share Purchase Plan.</li> <li>Comprehensive Benefits package.</li> <li>Fun, relaxed work environment.</li> <li>Education and conference reimbursements.</li> <li>Located downtown Toronto; easily accessible by public transit.</li> <li>A/V club, Friday presentations, book library, and more.</li> <li>Snacks and drinks provided.</li> <li>Awesome patio with BBQ.</li> <li>Games room (bring your A game for our FIFA 18, ping pong and foosball tournaments!)</li> </ul> <em>We are an equal opportunity employer. Accommodation will be made upon request.</em>
Title: Lead Product Designer

Job_Description: About Blackhawk Network<br/><br/>At Achievers, our software delivers a powerful new way for companies to engage, align, and recognize employees enabling remarkable business success. Every day. <br/><br/> We hire ambitious professionals who thrive on their entrepreneurial spirit and want to <em>Change the Way the World Works.</em> As Achievers employees, we are passionate about disruptive technology, welcome constant change, and understand the value of employee success in the workplace. We enjoy coming to work every day because we believe in our product and L.O.V.E. our culture. Achievers is more than just a software company; we are industry leaders in the HR space.<br/><br/>Overview<br/><br/>If you are passionate about making products that people love, deeply care about humans, and have an empathic approach to design that helps you make it all come to life, we want to hear from you. We’re looking for a team member who has a contagious drive for learning, acquiring new skills and perspectives, and who cares about sharing their insights to learn and grow as a team – this is our secret weapon. <br/><br/> You have produced top-notch quality work. You have sound design intuition and believe in having a process from beginning to end – from wireframes, task flows, crystal clear mock ups, and interaction designs. Your portfolio should illustrate your achievements, and you believe that your best work is still ahead of you.<br/><br/>Responsibilities<br/><br/><strong>We might be a good match if...</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>You believe in craftsmanship and endeavor to create elegant and compelling designs, over and over.</strong>  <ul>   <li>Your portfolio has some best-in-class work. You're a walking encyclopedia of microinteractions in use (on mobile, web, desktop, etc), and have nuanced views on how to make many of them even better.</li> </ul> <strong> You’ve shipped product.</strong>  <ul>   <li>You’ve weathered release cycles and know what details matter at each stage, how to motivate engineers to get the fit and finish right, how to translate insights from user studies into meaningful action, and what’s most likely to go afoul at each stage. You can share several shining examples of real work you've shipped, and what you learned along the way.</li> <li>You have designed and shipped multiple apps, or have gone through multiple release cycles on a larger project.</li> </ul> <strong>Cross-platform is your style.</strong>  <ul>   <li>Hopefully you’ve shipped something across several platforms. You know what translates from desktop and what doesn’t, or why you’d opt for one solution for iOS and another on Android.</li> </ul> <strong>You know that a good design requires research and multiple iterations.</strong>  <ul>   <li>You are able to explain how your best work came to be, and you can show us the processes you went through.</li> <li>You know all modern design practices by heart and can be creative to come up with better solutions.</li> </ul> <strong>Prototyping is a key part of your toolset.</strong>  <ul>   <li>You’ve prototyped on multiple platforms. You’ve made last-minute tweaks between user studies. You know how to be all kinds of quick and dirty, but dream of better prototyping tools.</li> </ul> <strong>You substantially contribute to defining the 'what' as well as the 'how'.</strong>  <ul>   <li>You're a product manager's secret weapon. You thrive best when helping to define the requirements, not just translating them into designs. You facilitate and draw the best design ideas from teammates.</li> <li>You'll also be working with Engineering to design and implement beautiful, intuitive experiences. That means you'll need to not only be a great designer, but also be able to understand and write a little code.</li> </ul> <strong>You can think and talk about the bottom line.</strong>  <ul>   <li>Analytics don’t scare you, and you know which tools you can use to find the data you'd need to make a (design) decision, and are comfortable with searching our databases to get the data you need.</li> </ul> <strong>What will you do?</strong>  <ul>   <li>Design thoughtful user experiences and great looking product UI.</li> <li>Form the vision for winning application solutions, collaborating with Product Managers, Senior Management, Development, Professional Services, Customer Success and Marketing.</li> <li>Work closely with the Product team to create exceptional wireframes, process flows, mock-ups and other design documentation.</li> <li>Deeply understand and validate the needs of current and targeted customers through quantitative & qualitative customer research.</li> <li>Test and refine flows with internal & external stakeholders.</li> <li>Collaborate and share ideas and concepts as a strategic member of a dynamic product team.</li> <li>Work with the design team to define and refine the patterns, templates and components that are used across the platform.</li> </ul>  Qualifications<br/><br/><strong>Qualifications:</strong>  <ul>   <li>Extensive experience designing beautiful customer experiences for the web, iPhone, iPad or Android.</li> <li>4+ years experience that includes UI, UX, and interaction design.</li> <li>Solid portfolio (show us everything from rough sketches to high-fidelity designs).</li> <li>Excellent knowledge of the Adobe Creative Suite, Sketch and other graphic design / prototyping tools.</li> <li>Proficiency in HTML, CSS and JavaScript frameworks.</li> <li>You possess an intensely collaborative spirit. You share early and iterate quickly.</li> <li>Excellent written and verbal communication skills.</li> <li>Sharp attention to design detail.</li> </ul>
Title: Sr. User Experience Designer

Job_Description: <div> <div><strong>About the role:</strong></div><br/> <div>We’re looking for an experienced senior product designer to deliver high quality product experiences on our core product line. You will explore and understand complex merchant needs in order to build a vision for your product area and help your team work iteratively towards achieving it. You'll ship high fidelity designs of new features and quickly prototype solutions to visual and interaction problems. You’ll own your projects from start to finish, and collaborate with a multidisciplinary team of designers, content strategists, user researchers, developers, and product managers to deliver the best possible experience for our merchants.</div><br/> <div>As part of the Identity team, within the Core Product line, you'll work on the central features and functionality of the Shopify merchant experience. You'll partner with other designers and UX team members to design and build products used by millions of people around the world every day.</div><br/> <div><strong>About UX design at Shopify</strong></div><br/> <div>The UX design team creates tools that give even the most inexperienced entrepreneur the best chance to succeed. At the same time, we design solutions that help some of the world’s leading businesses manage enormous complexity. Making commerce better for everyone, no matter where they’re located or their level of experience, is our passion. It’s what we come to work every morning excited to tackle.</div><br/> <div>Our team is made up of over 250 designers, content strategists, researchers, and front-end developers across 5 offices. Although everyone who works at Shopify is responsible for building great experiences, the design team has a special role in building understanding and empathy for merchants. We believe in testing, iteration, and in giving people the room to experiment and grow.</div><br/> <div><div>Requirements for the role:</strong>  <ul>   <ul> <li>A deep understanding of the end to end iterative UX product design process, including how to develop and use personas, job stories, journey mapping, content modelling, wireframing and prototyping, user testing, and high fidelity visuals</li><li>Proficiency with current design tools including Sketch, Photoshop, etc.</li><li>Passion for solving core product problems while owning all facets of user experience (strategy, IA, art direction, interaction design and research)</li><li>Experience collaborating with multiple disciplines including product, engineering, content, research, and more</li><li>A deep empathy for the user</li><li>UI abilities shown in a portfolio of live projects</li></ul> </ul>  </div> <br/> <div><div>You'll be working on:</strong>  <ul>   <ul> <li>Shipping high fidelity designs of new features and quickly prototyping solutions to visual and interaction problems</li><li>Representing our merchants in product strategy and roadmap discussions</li><li>Advocating for good user experience across our teams and our platform</li><li>Contributing to our growing design system in an effort to cultivate a coherent look and feel across the entire Shopify platform</li><li>Sharing and revising your designs based on UX research, merchant interviews and peer feedback</li></ul> </ul>  </div> <br/> <div><div>Tools of our trade:</strong>  <ul>   <ul> <li>We work with industry-standard tools and software like Sketch, Invision, and good ol’ pen and paper to define work at low and high fidelity</li></ul> </ul>  </div> </div><div><div>We know that applying to a new role takes a lot of work and we truly value your time. Holly is looking forward to reading your application. If you’re interested in helping us shape the future of commerce, send us a few samples of your work: portfolio, wireframes, UX flows, publications, or whatever represents what you do best.</div> </div></div></div></div>
Title: Senior Product Designer, Identity

Job_Description: <strong><u>About Us</u></strong> <br/><br/> Do you want to be a part of something disruptive and change an entire industry? Do you want to be a part of a best-in-class culture? Do you want to be in the first wave of individuals to help shape the growth of a company? If you are excited about anything you just read, we'd love for you to be a part of the Upchain team! <br/><br/> At Upchain, we are looking to turn the PLM (Product Lifecycle Management) industry on it's head. By 2021, many project the SaaS PLM industry to be worth over $40 Billion USD, and we are driven to make our mark! We have the product, we have the vision, and we have the plannow we need a great team to execute! <br/><br/> <strong><u>Job Description</u></strong> <br/><br/> To do this we need the help of an experienced UX lead who has proven experience. You'll work with other talented team members to build our enterprise and cloud service that allows our customers to build their products at a global scale. <br/><br/> We are a well funded startup with a fun work culture that thrives on working with other smart and motivated people. <br/><br/> <strong><u>UX Lead Duties & Responsibilities:</u></strong>  <ul>  	<li>Translate concepts into wireframes and mockups that lead to intuitive user experiences.</li>  <li>Create and manage product visions by researching, conceiving, wireframing, sketching, prototyping, and mocking up user experiences for our product</li>  <li>Design and deliver wireframes, user stories, user journeys, and mockups optimized for a wide range of devices and interfaces.</li>  <li>Identify design problems and devise elegant solutions.</li>  <li>Make strategic design and user-experience decisions related to core, and new, functions and features.</li>  <li>Take a user-centered design approach and rapidly test and iterate your designs.</li>  <li>Collaborate with other team members and stakeholders.</li>  <li>Present ideas to stakeholders such as customers, engineering and executives</li>  <li>Work closely with product management to keep UX and product strategy ahead of development</li> </ul> <strong><u>UX Lead Qualifications & Skills:</u></strong>  <ul>  	<li>Proven experience in UX design. Ideally in enterprise applications</li>  <li>Expertise in UX software such as InVision, UXPin, Balsamiq, Framer.js, Quartz Composer</li>  <li>Ability to work with clients to understand detailed requirements and design complete user experiences that meet client needs and vision.</li>  <li>Extensive experience in using UX design best practices to design solutions, and a deep understanding of mobile-first and responsive design.</li>  <li>A solid grasp of user-centered design and testing methodologies, subsystems, and usability and accessibility concerns.</li>  <li>Ability to iterate your designs and solutions efficiently and intelligently.</li>  <li>Ability to clearly and effectively communicate design processes, ideas, and solutions to teams and clients.</li>  <li>A clear understanding of the importance of user-centered design.</li>  <li>Be excited about collaborating and communicating closely with teams and other stakeholders via a distributed model to regularly deliver design solutions for approval.</li>  <li>Be willing to help teammates, share knowledge and experience with them, and learn from them.</li>  <li>Be passionate about all things UX and other areas of design and innovation. Research and showcase knowledge in the industry's latest trends and technologies.</li> </ul> Ideally you would also have experience with:  <ul>  	<li>Experience in web UI technologies such as HTML5, CSS, Javascript, and Bootstrap</li> </ul>
Title: UX Lead

Job_Description: <div>Job Description - User Experience (UX) Specialist - Print and Marketing Services (1043798)</div><div>Job Description</div> <div><div> <div><div>User Experience (UX) Specialist - Print and Marketing Services: 1043798</div><div><div>Description</div> <div><div> <div><strong>PURPOSE <br/>  OF JOB</strong></div> <div>The User Experience specialist is responsible for delivering the <br/>  customer experience and creative execution for their respective projects and <br/>  products. You will be working closely <br/>  with multiple internal departments and vendors to maintain all aspects of our <br/>  online microsite <u>www.staplescopyandprint.ca.</u> You will be responsible <br/>  for leading initiatives around improving online web content/applications, assisting <br/>  in the improvement of new online applications, supporting marketing <br/>  initiatives, supporting customer service teams, stores and production centres <br/>  with all issues involving customer issues, site usability, print production <br/>  detail and backend dashboard.  <br/>  Communication of design concepts - through wire framing/ prototyping, <br/>  creating user journey maps. <br/><br/> This role requires a combination <br/>  of technical competence and business skills to help develop business requirements <br/>  and coordinate implementation. </div> <div><strong>PRIMARY <br/>  DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES</strong></div> <div> <div></div> <br/>  <div><strong>Project Management & New Web Development (25%)</strong></div> <br/>  <div></div> <br/>  <div><strong>Responsibilities</strong></div>  <ul> <li>Take lead role in new project planning/management and <br/>  timelines, usually managing 2-4 major projects at any given time</li><li>Co-ordinate with vendors and internal IT groups on new product <br/>  application development</li><li>Communicate testing results to project team and level-set <br/>  priorities and timing for vendors to make changes</li><li>Collaborate with internal I.T. team members to establish testing <br/>  and deployment strategies</li> <li>Co-ordinate/support creation of training material or tools for <br/>  stores/District copy managers</li><li>Ensure that appropriate UX tool and methodologies are employed <br/>  – wire framing, storyboards, customer journey mapping, A/B testing</li><li>Coordinate with merchants, marketing and creative teams</li> </ul>  <div></div> <br/>  <div><strong>Communication (25%)</strong></div> <br/>  <div></div> <br/>  <div><strong>Responsibilities</strong></div>  <ul> <li>Work in partnership with a wide cross-section of Staples and <br/>  vendor roles including graphic designers, developers, QA specialists, <br/>  I.T, Finance, Marketing, Production Specialist/Manager, Category <br/>  Specialists/Manager, District managers, <br/>  Operations and Customer Service in order to achieve online goals and <br/>  results</li><li>Establish regular and effective communication with stores, copy <br/>  production centres and key field operators through site visits, <br/>  conference calls, webinars, and internal portal releases</li> <li>Participate in national Copy Centre annual Training Symposium</li> </ul>  <div></div> <br/><strong>Functionality <br/>  Management/ Web Content (25%)</strong><br/> <div></div> <br/>  <div><strong>Responsibilities</strong></div>  <ul> <li>Work with the merchant, IT teams and vendors to manage all <br/>  online content, and end-to-end user experience</li> <li>Work with the print production team to monitor and maintain <br/>  integrity of print files and production instructions for all online <br/>  products</li><li>Work with online vendors to maintain and update store <br/>  information, dashboards, store production flagging process, and keep all <br/>  training information up-to-date</li> <li>Maintain and utilize reporting functions using site analytics <br/>  tools (i.e. Google analytics software) and provide regular reporting to <br/>  the internal teams</li><li>Maintain database of site performance issues and/or new <br/>  features and communicate to vendors.  <br/>  Manage priority level and timing for deployment</li><li>Analyze and update template performance results, as well as <br/>  seasonal product sales performance on an ongoing basis</li><li>Drive online sales, online <br/>  penetration/mix and gross margin by working with internal teams to drive <br/>  cross channel and/or online specific traffic, offers, and advertising</li><li>Work <br/>  with Category Manager on online projects and new applications</li> <li>Work <br/>  with Customer Service team and vendors to maintain online support SLA and <br/>  manage the issues that are being reported.  <br/>  Identify and prioritize site performance issues</li> <li>Co-ordinate <br/>  translation of all online content via approved translation vendors</li> </ul>  <div><strong>Reporting and analytics (15%)</strong></div> <br/>  <div></div> <br/>  <div><strong>Responsibilities</strong></div>  <ul> <li>Leveraging existing <br/>  engagement KPI’s investigate <br/>  opportunity areas to optimize  <br/>  page/category/sku specific performance</li> <li>As needed perform <br/>  small/medium scale usability tests (internal focus group or usability.com), and work with PNI Digital Media on larger <br/>  scale UX studies- (PNI is a Staples Company)</li><li>Ensure projects are on a <br/>  solid foundation from the start, by creating clear benchmarking tools such as <br/>  storyboards, customer journey mapping, and perform AB testing when appropriate</li> <li>All notable UX/UI changes <br/>  will require a post mortem snapshot of wins/losses & future <br/>  recommendations</li> <li>Use all sources of feedback- <br/>  including stores, customer support teams, internal stakeholders, onsite <br/>  search and customer service indexing tools</li><li>Deliver clear and meaningful <br/>  reporting on a regular basis for key initiatives</li> </ul>  <div><strong>Online Marketing Support (10%)</strong></div> <br/>  <div></div> <br/>  and functionality & appropriate landing environments prior to launch</li><li>Assist with the proofing of all advertising material when <br/>  required</li><li>Communicate with all 3rd party vendors regarding <br/>  promo banners</li> <li>Support testing/deployment and maintenance for online promotions <br/>  and pilot projects</li><li>Maintain integrity of sku/pricing info; such as updating online <br/>  coupons and promotions</li></ul></div> <br/> <div><strong>KNOWLEDGE <br/>  / SKILL REQUIREMENTS</strong></div> <div>  <ul> <li>Working knowledge of <br/>  Microsoft office <br/>  trends in ecommerce and merchandising</li><li>Quick learner and adapts <br/>  well to a rapidly changing environment</li> <li>Strong analytical and organizational skills, ability to multi-task, leaders</li><li>Strong communication and <br/>  interpersonal skills are necessary as there are frequent interactions <br/>  with multiple functional areas of the business and vendors</li> <li>Strong knowledge of User <br/>  Interface concepts and experience with search marketing</li><li>Strong verbal and <br/>  written communication skills</li> <li>Results oriented, <br/>  attention to details and ability to prioritize</li> </ul></div> <br/> <div><strong>PHYSICAL <br/>  DEMANDS / WORKING CONDITIONS</strong></div> <div>  <ul> <li>Office environment</li><li>Some travel may be required, less than 5% (periodic travel to local store/sites. Few overnight trips to US per year)</li></ul></div> </div> </div></div><div><div>Qualifications</div> <br/><strong>RECOMMENDED QUALIFICATIONS</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Experience:</strong>  <ul>   <li>1-3 years of experience <br/>  within an eCommerce environment, specifically in a retail, <br/>  direct-to-consumer business model is desired</li> <li>Experience <br/>  with site merchandising, including planning of feature placements and <br/>  promotions</li> <li>Experience <br/>  crafting Merchandising and Marketing strategies</li> </ul> ·  <br/> Experience supporting or <br/> running usability studies  <ul>   <li>On-the-job <br/>  or formal training project management experience</li>   <li>Project <br/>  coordination/management experience a plus</li> </ul> <strong>Education:</strong>  <ul>   <li>Post-secondary education in Business, <br/>  Communications, Marketing, eCommerce or equivalent working experience to <br/>  include up to 2 years of interactive experience, preferably in a Retail <br/>  environment</li> </ul>  <div> Staples is committed to providing accommodation to people with disabilities throughout the job application and interview process to the point of undue hardship. Title: User Experience (ux) Specialist - Print And Marketing Services

Job_Description: CAE is a global leader in training for the civil aviation, defence and security, and healthcare markets. Backed by a 70-year record of industry firsts, we continue to help define global training standards with our innovative virtual-to-live training solutions to make flying safer, maintain defence force readiness and enhance patient safety. We have the broadest global presence in the industry, with 8,000 employees, 160 sites and training locations in over 35 countries. Each year, we train more than 120,000 civil and defence crewmembers and thousands of healthcare professionals worldwide. www.cae.com<br/><br/>Chef conception et expérience client / Customer Experience (CX) Design Lead<br/><br/><strong>Position Type:</strong> <br/><br/> Regular<br/><br/><strong>Role and Responsibilities</strong> <br/><br/> Diriger la conception de l’expérience utilisateur de bout en bout, y compris la découverte, la conceptualisation, la conception, la conception détaillée, les prototypes et la validation pour de nombreux produits et domaines. <br/><br/> Créer et influencer la création d’expériences utilisateurs élégantes qui facilitent la saisie des incidences pour l’entreprise. <br/><br/> Travailler en étroite collaboration avec la direction de l’unité numérique et les chargés de produit du client ainsi qu’avec les marques, et les intervenants marketing et commerciaux afin de concevoir et d’exécuter des expériences utilisateurs axées sur la clientèle. <br/><br/> <u>Responsabilités<strong><strong>:</strong></strong></u> <ul> <li>Diriger une équipe de concepteurs de l’interface et de l’expérience utilisateur afin <br/> qu’ils offrent des expériences utilisateurs conviviales et intuitives pour des produits numériques (il s’agit peut-être plus d’un poste d’encadrement que d’un rôle de chef de file).</li><li>Diriger la recherche sur les utilisateurs, le développement d’image, la cartographie du parcours de l’utilisateur, les essais de convivialité, les examens contextuels et l’analyse des tâches.</li><li>Défendre des pratiques axées sur l’utilisateur lorsque l’on relève des défis ou répond à des demandes de conception.</li><li>Être en permanence à l’affût des analyses, des rétroactions des clients, des chefs de file du divertissement numérique et des pratiques exemplaires dans un souci d’optimisation et d’innovation s’appuyant sur les connaissances.</li><li>Collaborer avec les responsables de produits et les chargés de produits afin de comprendre la feuille de route et les exigences de leurs produits numériques et de garantir que l’expérience utilisateur est étroitement intégrée aux feuilles de route.</li><li>Collaborer avec les équipes interfonctionnelles de développement des produits afin d’établir des conceptions qui satisfont à ces exigences – y compris les documents relatifs aux spécifications de conception, les flux utilisateurs, les représentations fil de fer, les prototypes, etc.</li><li>Concevoir, communiquer et appliquer les lignes directrices relatives à l’expérience utilisateur pour chacune de nos solutions numériques.</li> </ul> <u>Compétences types et expérience:</u> <ul> <li>Vaste expérience de la conception dans un environnement de produits numériques et agiles.</li><li>Expérience de la conception de produits de consommation de qualité centrés sur le consommateur.</li><li>Candidat proactif et entrepreneurial motivé et joueur d’équipe offrant une présence professionnelle.</li><li>Compétences en conception visuelle et graphique, notamment expérience pratique de divers ensembles de logiciels tels que Sketch, Adobe suite, OmniGraffle, InVision ou d’autres outils pour la représentation fil de fer, le développement conceptuel, la conception visuelle et le prototypage.</li><li>Expérience de la recherche en matière de conception, de la réalisation d’étude qualitative individuelle auprès des utilisateurs, des essais conceptuels, des essais de convivialité, des tests A/B et du prototypage rapide.</li><li>Connaissance du processus de développement de logiciels Agile.</li><li>Diplôme universitaire en design ou d’une discipline équivalente.</li> </ul> *********************************************************************************** <br/><br/> Drive user experience design from end-to-end, including discovery, ideation, conception, detailed design, prototypes and validation across multiple products and areas. <br/><br/> Create and influence the creation of elegant user experiences that facilitate the capture of business impact. <br/><br/> Work closely with client digital unit leadership and Product Owners along with brands, marketing and business stakeholders to design and deliver customer-centric user experiences. <br/><br/> <u>Responsibilities</u>: <ul> <li>Lead a team of UX/UI Designers in providing engaging and intuitive user experiences for digital products (may be position as a coach and not a people leader).</li><li>Lead user research, persona development, user journey mapping, usability testing, <br/> contextual inquiry, and task analysis.</li><li>Champion user-centered design practices when solving design requests and challenges</li><li>Constantly monitor analytics, customer feedback, digital entertainment leaders and best practices in order to practice insight-driven optimization and innovation.</li><li>Collaboratively work with Product Leads, Product Owners to understand their digital product roadmaps and requirements and to ensure UX is tightly integrated into the roadmaps.</li><li>Work with cross-functional product development teams to build designs that meet those requirements – including design specification documents, user flows, wireframes, prototypes, etc.</li><li>Develop, communicate and enforce user experience guidelines for each of our digital solutions.</li> </ul> <u>Typical skills & background:</u> <ul> <li>Extensive design experience in a digital and Agile product environment.</li><li>Experience with designing quality customer-centric consumer products.</li><li>Entrepreneurial self-starter who is self-motivated, but also a team player with a professional presence.</li><li>Graphical and Visual design skills, including hands on experience with diverse set of software such as Sketch, Adobe suite, OmniGraffle, InVision or other tools for wireframing, concept development, visual design and prototyping.</li><li>Experience with Design Research, conducting 1:1 qualitative user research, concept testing, usability testing, A/B testing and rapid prototyping.</li><li>Knowledge of Agile software development process.</li><li>Bachelor’s degree in Design or equivalent area.</li> </ul> CAE thanks all applicants for their interest. However, only those whose background and experience match the requirements of the role will be contacted. <br/><br/> <strong>Equal Employment Opportunity</strong> <br/><br/> CAE is firmly committed to ensuring a positive and professional working environment in which all people are treated with dignity and respect. We aim to provide a fair and consistent method for filling job openings in support of equality of opportunity and cultural diversity within the company. <br/><br/> The masculine gender is used throughout this job description solely to make the text easier to read and therefore applies to both men and women.
Title: Chef conception et expérience client / Customer Experience (CX) Design Lead

Job_Description: <div> <div> <div> <div>Nous valorisons la diversité et avons cœur de créer un milieu de travail inclusif qui nous inspire tous donner le meilleur de nous-mêmes. Joignez-vous notre équipe et faites une différence!</div>  </div> </div>  </div> <div> <div> Votre poste</div>  </div> <div> <div> <div> <div><em><strong>Nous</strong></em> <br/> Vous pensez quon sennuie en assurance? Attendez-vous être surpris. Chez Intact Lab, lassurance est un domaine dynamique, innovateur et amusant (oui, vous avez bien lu). <br/><br/> Intact Lab est le centre dinnovation numérique dIntact Corporation financière, lun des 100 meilleurs employeurs au Canada. Nous combinons lesprit dune start-up et les ressources dune grande entreprise. Quest-ce que cela signifie? Cela veut dire que nous avons accès des technologies la fine-pointe et la liberté de créer des produits de linsurtech qui nexistent pas encore. Et cest l que le travail devient amusant. <br/><br/> Nous travaillons en collaboration offrir une expérience numérique conviviale pour le client. Nous sommes actuellement la recherche dun designer de services de talent pour compléter notre équipe Design Thinking croissante. Et cest l que vous intervenez. <br/><br/> <strong><em>Vous</em></strong> <br/> À titre de designer de services, votre quête consiste démystifier les systèmes complexes et créer des environnements propices limplantation et lévolution dinnovations. En tant que membre de léquipe Design Thinking, vous serez le gardien des parcours client et contribuerez identifier les occasions de rehausser et de transformer nos expériences client. Relevant du directeur, Design Thinking, vous aurez comme principales responsabilités :  <ul>   <li>Définir la vision long terme de notre expérience client et propulser notre transformation axée sur le client en tirant parti des méthodologies du Design Thinking.</li>   <li>Diriger nos squads Design Thinking dans toutes les étapes, de la recherche et la découverte lidéation, le prototypage et le design de nouveaux produits et services.</li>   <li>Appliquer vos compétences UX, UI, Interaction Design et HCI lensemble des canaux et des produits.</li>   <li>Produire des artefacts UX tels que les parcours client, les profils dutilisateur et les plans de service pour créer une compréhension commune de lexpérience utilisateur dans lensemble des secteurs dactivité et des marques.</li>   <li>Élaborer des histoires et des éléments visuels convaincants pour communiquer les idées, susciter ladhésion des intervenants et inspirer les équipes.</li>   <li>Développer des prototypes pour tester et valider des solutions de raffinement.</li>   <li>Créer des plans de développement de solutions clairs pour propulser les solutions par l'expérimentation, les tests et le perfectionnement en fonction des apprentissages.</li>   <li>Participer au processus de développement de solutions pour des innovations progressives, révolutionnaires et radicales.</li>   <li>Faire preuve dempathie envers les intervenants et les clients lors de leur démarche dinnovation et leur apprendre comment traverser les phases divergentes et convergentes du développement.</li>   <li>Exploiter les idées, avoir lesprit ouvert et identifier les concepts de manière réelle et concrète.</li>   <li>Promouvoir les initiatives de Design Thinking pour renforcer et propulser lorientation client travers lorganisation.</li> </ul>   </div> </div> </div>  </div> <div> <div> Vos compétences</div>  </div> <div> <div> <div> <div>   <ul>   <li>Minimum 3 années dexpérience en design de services.</li>   <li>Un portfolio robuste présentant des solutions de design axées sur lutilisateur.</li>   <li>Expertise en matière de convivialité et de pratiques de design axées sur l'utilisateur.</li>   <li>Expérience des outils de design (Sketch, Axure, InVision, Adobe Creative Suit, etc.).</li>   <li>Connaissance des outils de recherche UX (UserTesting.com, Optimal Workshop, Survey Monkey, etc.).</li>   <li>Excellentes communications verbales, solides compétences graphiques et de visualisation pour communiquer des idées de design.</li>   <li>Bilinguisme (français/anglais) un atout.</li> </ul> <em><strong>Vous êtes</strong></em>  <ul>   <li>Un esprit novateur et stratégique qui aime résoudre des problèmes complexes.</li>   <li>Profondément passionné par le design et lexpérience client.</li>   <li>Un joueur déquipe qui se démarque dans un environnement de collaboration et capable de partager et recevoir des commentaires constructifs.</li>   <li>Proactif, capable de travailler de manière autonome et de gérer lambiguïté.</li>   <li>À lécoute, un communicateur efficace, un présentateur intéressant et un conteur passionnant.</li>   <li>À laise dinteragir différents niveaux de lorganisation, des pairs la haute direction.</li> </ul> <em><strong>En tant que salarié temps plein, vous bénéficierez des avantages suivants :</strong></em>  <ul>   <li>Un horaire de 35 heures par semaine avec formules de travail flexible et de télétravail.</li>   <li>Des avantages financiers dont un boni de performance, des options dachat dactions et un régime de retraite.</li>   <li>Une couverture dassurance hors pair (cest notre spécialité après tout).</li>   <li>Une ambiance de travail décontractée en plein cœur du centre-ville de Montréal avec un resto-café sur place et un patio extérieur.</li>   <li>Vous aurez également accès diverses conférences de lindustrie, un programme dachat dordinateur, une subvention pour la forme physique et des rabais chez nos partenaires.</li> </ul>   </div> </div> </div>  </div> <div> <div> Énoncé fermeture</div>  </div> <div> <div> <div> <div>Cette opportunité vous intéresse? Nous avons très hâte de faire votre connaissance! <br/><br/> Dexcellents avantages sont offerts : salaire concurrentiel, avantages flexibles, aménagements de travail flexibles, congés mobiles, régime de retraite prestation déterminée, etc. <br/><br/> Dans le cadre du processus de sélection dIntact, les candidats peuvent être appelés donner leur consentement une vérification de leurs antécédents pertinente au poste pourvoir avant de recevoir une offre demploi. Celle-ci peut comprendre une confirmation des références demploi, des études et des titres de compétences, une vérification des emplois, de lidentité, des infractions criminelles et du permis de conduire ainsi quun rapport de crédit. <br/><br/> Une recherche de talents l'externe est menée parallèlement au recrutement l'interne. Veuillez donc prendre note que des candidats potentiels pourraient avoir été identifiés pour ce poste dans le cadre de leur plan de développement. <br/><br/> <em>*Veuillez noter que l'usage du masculin a comme but d'alléger le texte.</em> <br/><br/> <strong>Cet affichage prendra fin le 02 juin 2018.</strong></div>  </div> </div>  </div> <div> <div> Droit de travailler au Canada</div>  </div> <div> <div> <div> <div>Les personnes qui posent leur candidature un poste permanent doivent, dès leur embauche, avoir le droit de travailler au Canada de façon permanente. Les documents pouvant servir de preuve dans le cas des rôles permanents sont un certificat de naissance canadien, un passeport canadien, un certificat de citoyenneté canadienne, une carte de résident permanent ou une confirmation de son statut de résident permanent pour prouver quil a le droit de travailler au Canada.</div>  </div> </div>  </div> <div> <div> Indeed Commandité</div>  </div> <div> <div> <div> <div>IN-INFR</div>  </div> </div>  </div>
Title: Designer de services

Job_Description: <strong>The Role: Interface Designer</strong> <br/><br/> FIFA is currently looking for an Interface Designer with impeccable UI/Graphic Design skills, showcasing a strong comprehension and appreciation for innovative use of typography, color, and layout for digital media. <br/><br/> The process of design, including wireframing and sketching, allows a FIFA Interface Designer to deliver high-level concepts as well as polished high-fidelity screens. If you are a passionate creative who is motivated by working on a team that embodies design culture, then this is the role for you! <br/><br/> <strong>Who you are:</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Technical Requirements:</strong> <br/><br/> • You have 3+ years of experience of UI design experience, having worked on digital UI/UX space. Please provide an online portfolio and any relevant links to previous work.   <ul> <li>You are proficient with Adobe Creative Suite</li> <li>You have speedy production art skills (heavy-lifting - able to turn assets around quickly to a high quality)</li> <li>You have experience designing for the screen (user interface and info hierarchy/interaction design)</li> <li>You are comfortable following brand design guidelines, and it is a bonus if you have experience developing brand identity systems</li> <li>Post-secondary training or background in graphic design / user interface design <br/><br/> <strong>Non-Technical Requirements:</strong></li> <li>You like to work in a fast-paced and collaborative team environment.</li> <li>You have exceptional conceptual abilities; an eye for design, layout, color and detail.</li> <li>You are able to quickly learn and apply new concepts, principles and solutions.</li> <li>You are reliable and committed to projects/tasks.</li> <li>You have a solution-oriented mindset with a passion for visual problem-solving.</li> <li>You aim to present creative ideas clearly and concisely. <br/><br/> <strong>We Thought You Might Also Want to Know:</strong></li> </ul>  More about our location: http://careers.ea.com/our-locations/burnaby-eav <br/> Contact me: Jesenka Duranovic, Recruiter, jduranovic@ea.com; @jesenka088
Title: FIFA - Interface Designer

Job_Description: <div><p><strong>Service: </strong>Enabling Area <br><strong>Job Type: </strong>Permanent <br><strong>Primary Location: </strong>Kitchener, Ontario, Canada <br><strong>All Available Locations: </strong>Kitchener </p><div><p><p>External Posting Description</p><p><p> </p><p>Deloitte’s new Waterloo Region office is located in the heart of the KW innovation district. It serves as a place and platform to deliver immersive experiences for our clients and talent that will help ideas break-through to impact, and fuse thinking, technology with application by:</p><p><br>• bringing talent and networks together<br>• bridging discovery to commercialization<br>• authentically curating and applying technology to the client context<br>• purposefully designing and facilitating labs that lead to client impact.</p><p><br>Designing and facilitating immersive experiences starts with a client challenge, to which you will design and facilitate and investigative journey using exponential technologies, analytical and co-creation techniques and experiments with the objective to chart the path for commercialized solutions.<br>As the Lab Design and Facilitation Manager you will co-lead the design, planning, preparation and delivery of Greenhouse sessions and offerings. Individuals in this role, under the guidance of the Senior Manager, Greenhouse Client Experience, will work with lead client experience facilitators, clients, account teams and other key stakeholders to strategically shape the overall experience a customer has while engaged in a Greenhouse session. They will curate that experience based on the outlined objectives, and with the over-arching mission to create exceptional client experiences at Deloitte.</p><p><br>In moments that matter to our Clients, you will create the environment in our Greenhouse-enabled space to foster break-through ideas Together with the Client Experience Lead and the Technology Curator and co-create solutions between our market, industry and service teams and client teams.<br>The Deloitte Greenhouse™ is a place for cultivation – of ideas, relationships, opportunities – to help our clients and our people achieve breakthroughs, disrupt the status quo and incite productive action.</p><p> </p><p>General</p><p><br>• Being a Greenhouse ambassador- leading tours and educating teams on the Greenhouse Design process<br>• Supporting the scoping and planning calls with requestors and clients by taking notes, tracking action items and supporting or managing all session design/preparation activities<br>• Developing high quality deliverables such as confirmation packages, facilitation guides, success stories and other core Greenhouse materials. Ensuring these materials are shared with broader Deloitte teams when appropriate.<br>• Promoting knowledge sharing across Greenhouse teams through the development of session artifacts and documentation<br>• Developing the story board jointly with our digital, analytics and cyber leads, chart the arch of discovery and design exercises to conduct the labs<br>• Engaging broader resources and working with account teams to gather background information and collateral to support session design<br>• Coordinating with facilitators and other internal resources as needed to support the session<br>• Supporting the coordination and execution of pre-session, during session, and post-session activities and logistics<br>• Ensuring the minimum standards on client experience are being met</p><p> </p></p></p><p><p>External Posting Qualifications</p><p><p> </p><p>Session Delivery</p><p><br>• Working with Client Experience Lead and hospitality teams and to ensure all on-day operations are accurately executed including room set-up and catering.<br>• Introducing or facilitating session breakout activities under the mentorship and guidance of the Greenhouse leadership team and facilitation leads<br>• Ensure the facility is always presentable and supporting the logistics of session delivery, including planning and managing all session materials and tools<br>• Participating in the development of comprehensive documentation for each session, which includes capturing notes, synthesizing and organizing the information for documentation purposes<br>• Trouble shoot technology issues during events</p><p> </p><p>Session Design</p><p><br>• Supporting the coordination and execution of custom client session design and research activities<br>• Researching and piloting innovative client experience approaches that can be deployed in a Greenhouse environment<br>• Capturing notes from planning calls with requestors and translating into a design protocol or agenda<br>• Help curate our lab experiences for the Waterloo ecosystem<br> </p><p> </p><p>• Minimum of 5 years of experience in a client-facing, facilitative or investigate environment paired with customer service/ professional services, event management or related experience<br>• Proactive, self-starter, capable of working independently and operating effectively in ambiguous environments, but aware of when to reach out and connect with our client service leads and Greenhouse teams across the country<br>• 2-4 years UI/ UX design experience<br>• Excellent organizational and project management skills, outstanding written and verbal communication<br>• High attention to detail and task orientation with an ability to problem solve<br>• Ability to manage and appropriately escalate risks<br>• Creative and the ability to demonstrate an aptitude for developing and delivering unique client experiences<br>• Proven proficiency with technology and ability to learn about evolving technologies; e.g. SmartBoards and related software<br>• Understanding of data/analytics, innovation and digital principles with the ability to quickly get up to speed on Greenhouse technologies and tools</p><p> </p></p></p></div><p>Deloitte is an inclusive employer dedicated to building a diverse workforce. We encourage applications from all qualified candidates and will accommodate applicants’ needs under the respective provincial human rights codes throughout all stages of the recruitment and selection process. Please advise the Recruiter to ensure your accessibility needs are accommodated throughout this process. Information received relating to accommodation will be addressed confidentially.<br><br>We thank all applicants in advance for their interest; however, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.</p></div>
Title: Lab Designer and Facilitator (Manager)

Job_Description: About the role<br/>   <div>Shopify is on a fast-moving mission to make the best products for merchants around the globe. At Shopify Plus, our merchants are some of the biggest and fastest growing businesses in history. The problems we solve are as complex as the stakes are high. Ecobee, Fashion Nova, Rebecca Minkoff, Nestle, MVMT and Leesa are merchants that have seen the value Shopify Plus brings to their businesses through our understanding of commerce at scale. <br/><br/> We’re looking for a Senior Designer to join the Shopify Plus team in Waterloo. <br/><br/> As a UX team at Plus, we work on a product that empowers merchants to run their businesses and push the boundaries of commerce. Informed by research and data, we solve complex merchant needs and build iteratively toward our vision. We ship high-fidelity designs of new features and quickly prototype solutions. We own our projects from start to finish, and collaborate with a multidisciplinary team of developers, product managers, content strategists, user researchers, and marketers to deliver the best possible experience for our merchants.</div> <br/>  <div> <div> <div> You’ll be working on:<br/>   <div>  <ul> <li>Advocating for good user experience across our platform by representing our merchants in product strategy and roadmap discussions</li><li>Identifying the best UX methods and tools to use depending on project constraints</li><li>Prototyping solutions to solve for complex problems (i.e. managing product content, pricing, and discounts across multiple regions and languages)</li><li>Contributing to our growing design system of patterns in an effort to cultivate a cohesive look, feel, and user experience across the entire Shopify platform</li><li>Sharing and reviewing your designs based on peer feedback, user research, testing, and merchant feedback</li></ul></div> </div></div> <div> <div> Requirements for the role:<br/>   <div>  <ul> <li>Previous experience owning and executing on UX designs through collaborative decision making with front-end developers, engineers, researchers, content strategists, and other disciplines</li><li>A deep understanding of the end-to-end iterative UX process, including personas, scenarios, wireframing, content modelling, prototyping, user research, and design systems</li><li>Empathy and advocacy for merchants and their buyers, in all areas of our work</li><li>Experience using prototyping tools, as well as fundamental knowledge of front-end technologies to understand the constraints of design</li><li>Extraordinary UI design abilities that can be demonstrated through current projects</li></ul></div> </div></div></div> <br/>We know that applying to a new role takes a lot of work and we truly value your time. We are looking forward to reading your application! <br/><br/> If you’re interested in helping us shape the future of commerce, send us a few samples of your work: portfolio, wireframes, UX flows, publications, or whatever represents what you do best.
Title: Senior Product Designer, Shopify Plus

Job_Description: <div> <strong>About the Job</strong> <br/> We are changing the way people think about customer service by leveraging information technology, and we need your help!</div><br/>  <div> We are seeking a User Experience (UX) Designer to help guide and create frictionless experiences to our team of 10,000+ team members using our proprietary platforms and Artificial Intelligence (AI) tools. This role will own the UX vision and work with the Senior Director of Research & Development to execute on worldwide strategies. Were looking for an entrepreneurial mindset, a fearless attitude and a passion to take customer service UI to the next level.</div><br/>  <div> <strong>As User Experience Designer, You Will</strong></div><ul>  <li> Collaborate with the Product Manager & stakeholders to create solutions that reduce friction and increase the successful adoption and ongoing use of our tools across the workforce</li>  <li> Gather information, analyze data, make decisions and execute</li> <li> Have a deep understanding of UX theory and can shift gears and apply the data you have on hand to get the task completed in a timely manner</li> <li> Supply wireframes and prep solutions to transition to the development team smoothly</li> <li> Know where you are most impactful within the Software Development Cycle and can iterate and build upon the requests of multiple stakeholders</li> <li> Target the messaging of your UX solutions to teams that may not have an understanding of the why and supply appropriate data to support recommendations</li> </ul>  <br/> <div> <strong>As a User Experience Designer, You Have...</strong></div>  <ul>  <li> A high school diploma or equivalent (post-secondary schooling preferred)</li>  <li> 5+ years of experience in User Experience Design</li> <li> Ability to apply both UX <em>and</em> User Interface (UI) solutions depending on the needs at hand</li> <li> Strong verbal and written communication skills</li> <li> Strong problem solving and decision making skills</li> <li> Ability to work in a fast-paced, ever-changing environment and can handle a high volume of work</li> <li> Ability to organize and follow-up on multiple tasks/details with accuracy and timeliness</li> <li> Ability to effectively interact with employees at all levels of the organization and work with people from diverse backgrounds</li> <li> Ability to adapt to change and innovation</li> <li> Ability to plan and monitor results</li> <li> Ability to interface with internal and external stakeholders</li> </ul>
Title: User Experience Designer

Job_Description: The Senior UX Designer will collaborate across multidisciplinary teams to create insightful, empathetic, data-driven experiences for clients and their users. Utilizing design thinking and working within an agile process, you will conduct user research and testing, create user flow diagrams, build comprehensive wireframes in Sketch, as well as contribute to the rationale behind user-centred design decisions. <br/><br/> No one is an island — We believe in sharing work early and often, so you will work iteratively and collaboratively on rough notes and sketches, before hunkering down on detailed high-quality deliverables for our clients. <br/><br/> Located in the Mount Pleasant area of Vancouver, as part of the POWERSHiFTER team you will have access to some of the brightest minds in design, technology, strategy and data science. You will work in an environment that values people, process and performance, collaborating with team members. <br/><br/> <strong>Your Mission</strong> <br/><br/> We believe that when you start with empathy, amazing things can happen. You will champion this belief through the practice of design thinking and human-centred design principals (HCD) on both client and internal work. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities</strong>  <ul> <li>Work with senior team members to conceptualize and execute designs that will advance clients’ businesses.</li>  <li>Perform UX audits, help facilitate user testing, and present recommendations on major projects that involve user experience.</li>  <li>Participate in research, stakeholder interviews, and document your findings</li>  <li>Develop research-backed personas</li>  <li>Create user flow and site architecture diagrams to present the clearest path to user goal completion</li>  <li>Collaborate with the Digital Science team to assure design decisions are data-driven</li>  <li>Build wireframes in Sketch</li>  <li>Stay up to date on the latest UX and design trends and requirements for all current and emerging formats of digital UX design.</li>  <li>Work independently and efficiently to meet deadlines.</li>  <li>Actively contribute to internal programs and knowledge sharing.</li>  <li>Share acquired skills with team members through formal and informal channels.</li>  <li>Have fun!</li> </ul> <strong>Requirements</strong>  <ul> <li>Minimum education requirements: Relevant Bachelor Degree</li>  <li>Minimum experience requirements: 5+ Years</li> </ul> <strong>Benefits</strong>  <ul> <li>This is a contract position (time commitments can be negotiable)</li>  <li>An exciting, yet highly collaborative work environment with amazing peers</li>  <li>Flexible work/life balance</li> </ul>
Title: Senior UX Designer (Contract)

Job_Description: As a Visual Communications Designer, you will leverage your creative and technical talents to shape and communicate the WiderFunnel brand story. You will work closely with our Growth team to create a cohesive, enjoyable brand experience at every client touchpoint. You are creative and passionate about user experience and graphic design; youre keen to learn and share your own insights. <br/><br/> We are leaders in validation, known for delivering proven growth programs for our clients. We deliver results for clients fast, as a premium solution, with high touch service. <br/><br/> We are a diverse and inclusive team rooted in a foundation of respect and openness. Our company values grit, maverick, curiosity, integrity, and real are at the centre of how we hire, how we work, and how we treat one another. At WiderFunnel, you can bring your most authentic self to work, merging your personal and professional lives together. <br/><br/> <strong>Are you</strong>  <ul> <li>Imaginative, creative and an analytical thinker, with a strong motivation for finding solutions to complex or abstract problems?</li> <li>Systematic and patient, and introspective in the development of new ideas?</li> <li>Assertive, confident and direct when speaking about your area of specialization?</li> <li>Detail oriented and always achieving a high accuracy of work?</li>  </ul> <strong>Accountabilities:</strong>  <ul> <li>Manage ongoing design improvements to the WiderFunnel website (and other owned properties)</li> <li>Help bring new ideas for design and content creation to the team using your expertise and eye for great design</li> <li>Review current brand guidelines, and design cohesive campaign templates for current and future Growth campaigns</li> <li>Create templated brand assets for internal and external use, including prospect and client-facing presentations and other resources</li> <li>Create and maintain assets for each marketing channel (blog graphics, paid ads, social media assets, email templates, etc.)</li> <li>Create and maintain assets for special marketing events</li> <li>Collaborate with internal team members (such as but not limited to Developers, Project Managers, etc.) to bring ideas to life</li> </ul> <strong>Qualifications:</strong>  <ul> <li>BA/BS or equivalent degree in Design (Graphic or Web)</li> <li>2+ years as a professional web designer, with experience in UX and graphic design</li> <li>A portfolio that showcases high quality in design, creative solutions, and detail</li> <li>Expert proficiency in Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign). Sketch experience a plus.</li> <li>A fundamental understanding of HTML, CSS, JavaScript preferred</li> <li>Familiar with the latest UI web and mobile technology.</li> <li>Experience in layout and print design</li> <li>Excellent communicator and exceptional organizer.</li> </ul>
Title: Visual Communications Designer (part time)

Job_Description: <em>Wiivv creates custom fit footwear from your phone.</em> <br/><br/> <em>Wiivv is transforming how footwear and apparel is made today. We believe you are uniquefrom your anatomy to how you moveand that in order to truly move, feel, and live your best your footwear and apparel should be made to your unique spec. With just a few photos from your phone, we can digitally map each foot, create a custom product using 3D printing and other hybrid manufacturing techniques, and deliver it to your door in under 10 days.</em> <br/><br/> Be a part of a team of designers passionate about creating a great experience for our customers from web-to-app-to-feet. As a Wiivv <strong>Senior Product Designer</strong>, you will be involved in every aspect of the product development process, from brainstorming the next great product innovation to tweaking copy and pixels right before launch. You will be expected to utilize your full range of product design, interaction design, and visual design skills. This is a results-driven role, with the opportunity to work with a highly creative, high-performing team, with a ton of room for growth. This is a full-time position in Vancouver, BC. Visa sponsorship is an option for the right candidate. <br/><br/> At Wiivv we welcome all qualified applicants and seek diverse personal characteristics across our team, such as race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, genetic information, and other defining traits. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities</strong>  <ul> <li>Partner with PMs, engineers, e-commerce, and marketing to oversee the user experience of a product or feature from idea-to-launch-to-iteration.</li> <li>Establish and lead a design process for for the design team that can efficiently take broad, conceptual ideas and turn them into high-quality experiences that prove valuable for our customers and/or business partners.</li> <li>Rapidly ideate and validate designs through sketches, prototypes, and testing.</li> <li>Design flows and experiences that are incredibly simple and elegant.</li> <li>Contribute to high-level strategic decisions with the rest of the product and executive teams.</li> <li>Give and solicit feedback from other designers in order to continually raise our bar for quality.</li> </ul> <strong>Minimum Qualification</strong>  <ul> <li>3+ years of visual design</li> <li>3+ years of interaction design</li> <li>An outstanding portfolio showcasing examples of past design work</li> <li>Strong communication skills and experience presenting design decisions and rationale</li> <li>Demonstrated strategic product thinking and vision</li> <li>Experience in building and shipping applications or software</li> <li>Demonstrated experience with end-to-end (hybrid UX and UI) product design</li> <li>Expert in Sketch, InDesign, Illustrator and Photoshop</li> </ul> <strong>Preferred Qualifications</strong>  <ul> <li>Motion Graphics and/or 3D modelling experience is a plus!</li> <li>Experience leading user research and/or usability testing</li> <li>Experience with front-end programming</li> </ul> <strong>Perks and Benefits</strong>  <ul> <li>Work alongside a tight-knit, high-calibre, dedicated team of professionals working on changing the game and partnering with exciting brands while shipping world-class products</li> <li>High levels of technical and creative freedom with autonomy and responsibility</li> <li>Extended health benefits including medical, dental and vision</li> <li>Wellness allowance, dog-friendly office with healthy snacks on site</li> <li>Product sample, transportation, and professional development allowances</li> </ul> <strong>More About Wiivv</strong> <br/><br/> Wiivv is bringing custom footwear and apparel to the market in an easy, accessible, and scalable wayand were just getting started. <br/><br/> Our products (Wiivv Custom Insoles and Wiivv Custom Sandals) have broken records on Kickstarter and secured major strategic partnerships due to launch this summer. Our mobile app is award-winning and remains 4+ stars in the iOS and Android app stores. We are passionate about building a great customer experience from the digital products you use to customize and place your orderto the physical product you put on your feet and wear every day.
Title: Senior Designer

Job_Description: We’re looking for a Digital Designer with an eye for detail and the skills to craft award worthy, pixel-perfect digital products in a fast-paced & environment. Someone who is a self-motivated problem solver who isn’t shy about taking ownership of their work and is passionate about what they do. A deep understanding of typography, UI, illustration, photography, and digital culture is a must, along with a solid grasp of the possibilities of the modern and emerging tech. <br/><br/> You’ll be working within a small team, and reporting directly to the Creative Director, so being friendly, fun, enthusiastic, organized is essential. With that support, you’ll be directly responsible for the design a variety of and other digitally-led or digitally integrated experiences, from leading-edge web solutions, software, and mobile devices/applications to bespoke experiential interactions. To succeed you’ll need a strong understanding of UX and digital strategy. Conceptual skills would help you stand out, too. <br/><br/> Responsibilities <ul> <li>Working with the Creative Director and design team to create client-focused, creative design solutions, primarily in digital</li><li>Craft visually compelling designs that align with the creative direction and brand guidelines, and also appeal to the specified audiences</li><li>Designing mood boards, storyboards, and conceptual pitch material</li><li>Designing UI guides, page layouts, site grids and interface demos for responsive web plu all content, functional, and navigation specifications (with guidance and oversight)</li><li>Identifying opportunities to create business value and improve the user experience, based on user research (with guidance and oversight)</li><li>Participating in brainstorming sessions and conceptual development</li><li>Working with developers to ensure the quality of your projects through development</li><li>Photo retouching and compositing skills would be a big plus</li><li>Client presentation experience would be great too (or an eagerness to learn)</li> </ul> Requirements <ul> <li>Undergraduate degree in Design or related field or equivalent visual design experience required</li><li>2-3 years of industry experience</li><li>Solid portfolio and a keen interest in digital (interactive/mobile/social) design</li><li>Deep understanding of typography, illustration, photography, and culture</li><li>Well versed in user-centred design methods and techniques</li><li>Strong design, collaborative, and organizational skills, and great attention to detail</li><li>Excellent verbal and written communication skills</li><li>Canadian resident / possess a work permit</li><li>Excellent knowledge of macOS and the Adobe suite of creative tools</li><li>Working knowledge of Sketch and InVision tools would be advantageous</li> </ul> Location: Toronto preferred, but Vancouver is a possibility for the right candidate.
Title: Digital Designer

Job_Description: <br/><br/>   <br/><br/> <strong>Requisition ID:</strong> 182793 <br/> <strong>Work Area:</strong> Software-Development Operations <br/> <strong>Expected Travel:</strong> 0 - 10% <br/> <strong>Career Status:</strong> Student <br/> <strong>Employment Type:</strong> Intern <br/><br/> <strong>COMPANY DESCRIPTION</strong> <br/> SAP started in 1972 as a team of five colleagues with a desire to do something new. Together, they changed enterprise software and reinvented how business was done. Today, as a market leader in enterprise application software, we remain true to our roots. That’s why we engineer solutions to fuel innovation, foster equality and spread opportunity for our employees and customers across borders and cultures. <br/><br/> SAP values the entrepreneurial spirit, fostering creativity and building lasting relationships with our employees. We know that a diverse and inclusive workforce keeps us competitive and provides opportunities for all. We believe that together we can transform industries, grow economics, lift up societies and sustain our environment. Because it’s the best-run businesses that make the world run better and improve people’s lives. <br/><br/>   <br/><br/> <strong>What is SAP iXp?</strong> <br/><br/> SAP’s Internship Experience Project is a paid program that gives university students the space to find purpose in their careers. We believe that through placing passionate people on the right teams, providing leadership and learning opportunities, and working on impactful projects, purpose is born. Piqued your interest?  <br/><br/>   <br/><br/> <strong>Three reasons to apply for SAP iXp:</strong> <ul> <li><strong>No more fetching coffee:</strong> Work on in-depth projects, emerging products and technologies that drive business results.</li><li><strong>Lifelong learning:</strong> Meet with mentors, make new friends, and attend learning sessions from diverse subject matter experts.</li><li><strong>Gain visibility:</strong> With iXp in your title, you’ll have a global network of SAP leaders, entrepreneurs, and career development opportunities at your fingertips.</li> </ul>   <br/><br/> <strong>What you’ll do:</strong> <ul> <li><strong>Position Title: UX Design Intern</strong></li></ul>  <ul> <li><strong>Location: Vancouver, BC</strong></li><li><strong>Expected start date to end date: Sep 4, 2018 – May 3, 2019</strong></li> </ul>   <br/><br/> <strong>What is the purpose and objective of position?</strong> <ul> <li>Design solutions for Enterprise Collaboration software that connects and engages people, content, business data and processes.</li><li>Design solutions that embody the core principles of the digital enterprise: mobile, intelligent, real-time, conversational, automated and connected</li><li>Your experience will cover a full-spectrum UX role: exposure to product strategy, requirements elaboration, design discovery, ideation and sketching, user journeys, wireframes and usability testing.</li> </ul>   <br/><br/> <strong>Who we are:</strong> <br/><br/> Our team designs and delivers SAP Jam Collaboration and Communities. These SaaS products have a global reach of over 34 million subscribers and help connect our customers’ employees with the right experts, content, business data and processes to make their lives at work more productive and enjoyable. <br/><br/>   <br/><br/> As SAP team members we operate within a company that puts design at the forefront of product development. Our UX team is highly collaborative and works daily with Engineers and Product Managers. We are customer-needs driven and data informed. <br/><br/>   <br/><br/> <strong>Who you are:</strong> <br/><br/> We’re looking for someone who can challenge the status quo and likes to stay curious. You enjoy working on meaningful projects and are energized by lifelong learning. <ul> <li>You possess outstanding visual communication skills to convey concepts to teammates and stakeholders.</li><li>You contribute proactively to our design culture of learning, critique, testing and research.</li><li>You demonstrate a sharp focus on user needs, problem solving, creativity, and passion for developing usable, engaging, and elegant designs.</li> </ul>   <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities:</strong> <ul> <li>Solve complex problems based on data, user needs and business goals in an agile and fast-paced environment.</li><li>Create storyboards, user flows, wireframes and prototypes to communicate your design to other stakeholders.</li><li>Work cross-functionally to design and deliver high-quality solutions through multiple releases.</li> </ul>   <br/><br/>   <br/><br/> <strong>Qualifications:</strong> <ul> <li>At least in 3rd year of a relevant degree in Interactive Arts, Digital Media, HCI, User Experience Design, Interaction Design, Graphic Design or equivalent.</li><li>Familiarity with the principles of Lean UX and a willingness to work in a collaborative team directly with developers for the implementation of your designs.</li><li>Experience working with UX related tools, primarily Sketch, Illustrator and Photoshop.</li><li>An online portfolio that communicates your design process and outcome of your work.</li></ul>  <ul> <li>Applied knowledge of UX design principles: task analysis, heuristics, wireframing, user flows, information architecture, interaction design and design related artifacts across solutions for mobile and web projects.</li><li>Excellent communication, organization, and time management skills.</li> </ul>   <br/><br/> <strong>What you can expect from us:</strong> <ul> <li>An internship packed full of events to ensure you understand our technologies, our competitive landscape, our culture and our leadership philosophy.</li><li>Community of mentors and volunteer engagement teams to join and lead.</li><li>Collaborative open-concept work environment in the heart of Yaletown.</li><li>Games room, fitness classes, massage therapist, and 24/7 access to onsite gym.</li><li>Well-stocked snacks, coffee, teas, sodas and candy.</li> </ul>   <br/><br/> <strong>#iXp</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>WHAT YOU GET FROM US</strong> <br/><br/> Success is what you make it. At SAP, we help you make it your own.A career at SAP can open many doors for you. If you’re searching for a company that’s dedicated to your ideas and individual growth, recognizes you for your unique contributions, fills you with a strong sense of purpose, and provides a fun, flexible and inclusive work environment – apply now<em>.</em> <br/><br/> <strong>SAP'S DIVERSITY COMMITMENT</strong>  <br/> To harness the power of innovation, SAP invests in the development of its diverse employees. We aspire to leverage the qualities and appreciate the unique competencies that each person brings to the company. <br/><br/> SAP is committed to the principles of Equal Employment Opportunity and to providing reasonable accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to Recruiting Operations Team (Americas: Careers.NorthAmerica@sap.com or Careers.LatinAmerica@sap.com, APJ: Careers.APJ@sap.com, EMEA: Careers@sap.com). <br/><br/> Successful candidates might be required to undergo a background verification with an external vendor. <br/><br/> <strong>Additional Locations</strong>:
Title: SAP iXp Intern - UX Designer

Job_Description: <div><div><strong> <br/> Undergraduate/Graduate Research Assistant: Sustainable Product - Design, Testing & Evaluation</strong><br/>  <div> <div> Job Code <br/><br/> <strong>1374</strong> </div><br/>  <div> Job Category <br/><br/> <strong> <br/> Administration and Academic Support</strong> </div><br/>  <div> Employment Type <br/><br/> <strong> <br/> Temporary/Contract</strong> </div> </div> </div>  <br/>Apply Now</div><br/>  <div>This undergraduate/graduate research assistant position is an opportunity to work with a member of the Faculty of Design to conduct market and user research and develop iterative prototypes for the development of a sustainable consumer product. Candidates should have interest in small batch production and low volume manufacturing and have skills to develop physical and digital prototypes. The successful candidate will assist with user testing and participating in the early stages of market launch. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities:</strong>  <ul> <li>Working under the supervision of the Principal Investigator, Sarah Tranum, in support of the project’s research goals and objectives</li>  <li>Assisting with research on market opportunity/assessment and manufacturing processes</li>  <li>Assisting with 3D modeling, prototyping, and fabrication</li>  <li>Assisting with UX/UI design and creating wireframes and prototypes for game application</li>  <li>Assisting with user testing and prototype evaluation</li>  <li>Assisting with sustainability assessment</li>  <li>Assisting with the preparation of proposals, progress and final reports, as needed</li> </ul> <strong>Qualifications:</strong>  <ul> <li>Currently enrolled or graduate of a design/art program and/or equivalent training and professional experience</li>  <li>Interest in sustainable/ethical object design and UX/UI design</li>  <li>Proficiency in using Rhino 3D or equivalent 3D modeling program and preparing files for 3D printing; Interest in additive manufacturing/low volume production</li>  <li>Experience in UX/UI design and creation of wireframes and testable prototypes for a game applications</li>  <li>Competency creating projects using Arduino; Ability to apply this knowledge to incorporate LEDs and touch sensors within physical prototypes</li>  <li>Ability to fabricate physical prototypes using plastic/silicone and to experiment using other materials and techniques as required by an iterative prototype</li>  <li>Curious, self-driven, and ability to work independently</li>  <li>Strong organizational, interpersonal, oral and written communications and problem solving skills</li>  <li>Where relevant, sound knowledge of, and commitment to, healthy and safe work practices</li> </ul> <strong>Hours of Work:</strong> 10 hours per week (graduate level for students enrolled in full-time graduate studies) 20 hours per week (undergraduate level) over the period of Monday, July 2, 2018 to Friday, August 31, 2018 <br/><br/> <strong>Work Environment:</strong> Working remotely reporting to Principal Investigator with weekly meetings at 100 McCaul St, Toronto <br/><br/> <strong>Compensation:</strong> $18.74 (Undergraduate Rate) $29.70 (Graduate Rate) hourly, subject to qualifications, with an additional 4% in lieu of vacation and 6% in lieu of benefits <br/><br/> <strong>Please note the following:</strong>  <ul> <li>The period of
