employment may be extended, conditional upon continued funding of the Project by OCAD U’s external funding partner(s), and upon satisfactory execution of duties.</li>  <li>Full-time graduate students may not accept research assistantships or other university-related employment in excess of 10 hours per week (or 130 hours per semester), as mandated by the Ontario Council of Graduate Studies (OCGS).</li> </ul> <strong>Application Process:</strong> <br/><br/> Applications should include: a one-page covering letter explaining the candidate’s interest, a curriculum vitae, and contact information for three (3) referees <br/><br/> Interested applicants are invited to submit their application in confidence addressed to Sarah Tranum, Assistant Professor, Social Innovation Design, Faculty of Design online by clicking the “Apply Now” button below. <br/><br/> <strong>The review of applications will begin on June 15, 2018 and will continue until the position has been filled.</strong> <br/><br/> <em>As an employer committed to employment equity, we encourage applications from members of equity-seeking communities including women, racialized and Indigenous persons, persons with disabilities, and persons of all sexual orientations and gender identities/expressions.</em> <br/><br/> <em><strong>We encourage members of designated equity-seeking groups to self-identify within the voluntary Applicant Questionnaire.</strong></em> <br/><br/> <em>OCAD U is committed to providing an inclusive and barrier free experience to applicants with accessibility needs. Requests for accommodation can be made at any stage during the recruitment process. Please contact Human Resources for more information or refer to OCAD U’s Policy of Accommodation in Employment for Persons with Disabilities</em> <br/><br/> <em>All qualified persons are encouraged to apply; however, Canadians and permanent residents of Canada will be given priority. While we thank all candidates for their interest, only those short-listed will be contacted.</em></div> <br/>
Title: Undergraduate/Graduate Research Assistant: Sustainable Product - Design, Testing & Evaluation

Job_Description: Vanilla is searching for a talented <strong>Graphic and UI Designer</strong> who wants to join a profitable and rapidly growing SaaS startup. As the sole full time designer at Vanilla, you would wear more than one hat and be part of both the product and marketing teams. <br/> Ideally, you have solid experience wireframing and mocking up user interfaces, as well as the capacity to product logos, graphics and other graphical assets for both product and marketing initiatives. You should be comfortable taking ownership of the visual brand as well as its aesthetics, and should be ready to enforce brand conformity throughout our messaging. <br/> Were a highly collaborative team of people that love what we do. Our open office format allows us to talk through solutions and brainstorm often, and were looking for someone that will actively contribute in that kind of environment. <br/> This position is located in <strong>Montreal, Quebec</strong> and reports to the <strong>Chief Product Officer</strong>. Remote workers will <strong>not</strong> be considered. <br/> <strong>RESPONSIBILITIES</strong>:  <ul> <li>Work with internal customers, briefing and advising them with regard to design style, format, print and web production, and timescales- Think creatively and develop new design concepts, graphics and layouts- Complete projects by coordinating with outside agencies, art services, printers, etc as needed- Work with a wide range of media and use graphic design software- Act as a company-wide artistic / graphic consultant to ensure consistent brand messaging- Amend final designs to clients comments and gain full approval<strong>SKILLS AND PERSONAL TRAITS</strong>:</li> <li>Graphic design skills- Layout skills- Strong customer focus- Creativity- Flexibility- Attention to detail- Deadline-oriented- Acute vision- Able to handle constructive criticism<strong>COMPENSATION AND PERKS</strong>:</li> <li>Competitive salary, performance based bonuses- Headroom for professional growth- Startup perks: ping pong, video games, snacks, drinks, etc.Vanilla helps organizations build unique online communities that are used by millions of people each month. What we do makes the internet more diverse, more useful and more fun. Were looking for passionate, hard working people who want to help us reinvent community forum software. We offer a casual work environment, health benefits, Mac (and Cintiq) gear, free snacks and a job that youll love! <br/> Vanilla is an <strong>equal opportunity employer</strong> and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. <br/> Job Types: Full-time, Permanent <br/> <strong>Experience:</li>  </strong> <br/> <strong><li>UI Design: 2 yearsEducation:</li>  </strong> <br/> <strong><li>High school or equivalentLocation:</li>  </strong> <br/> <strong><li>Montréal, QCLanguage:</li>  </strong>  <li>English</li> </ul>
Title: Graphic and UI Designer

Job_Description: <div><div>Description du poste</div> <br/>  <div> <div> Relevant de la Chef d’équipe – Production design & expérience numérique, le Designer web est chargé de faire des propositions de maquettes UX/UI lors de projets d’amélioration des sites e-commerce de Kimpex. Il participe au développement de micro-sites marketing pour des produits et des événements spécifiques. Il est également responsable de créer des sites aux parcours ergonomiques pour nos différents utilisateurs.<br/><br/><strong> De manière plus précise, le Designer web réalise les défis suivants:</strong> <ul> <li>Fournir des maquettes UX / UI (wireframe) aux Développeurs web lors de projets d’amélioration d’interfaces des sites;</li> <li>Construire et intégrer des pages statiques de sites à l’aide d’outils HTML et CSS;</li> <li>Participer à la conception et à l’intégration des micro-sites WordPress Marketing;</li> <li>Intégrer et générer du contenu SEO friendly en collaboration avec l’équipe Web marketing;</li> <li>Cerner les opportunités d’amélioration, proposer les meilleures pratiques et suggérer des idées astucieuses de projets;</li> <li>Supporter l’équipe Web marketing à l’aide des sites: HubSpot, WordPress, FlippingBook, Cloudflare, SurveyMonkey;</li> <li>Effectuer des veilles de performance et de contenu sur les différents sites de Kimpex.</li></ul></div> </div>  </div> <br/>  <div> <div> <div> Exigences<div> <div>  <ul> <li>Expérience en design de parcours e-commerce, en intégration Front-End, en design Mobile et Responsive;</li> <li>Maîtrise du HTML (HTML5), CSS (CSS3) et de Javascript (jQuery);</li> <li>Connaissance d’Adobe Photoshop et de WordPress;</li> <li>Aisance avec le fonctionnement des critères SEO;</li> <li>Expérience dans l’environnement HubSpot (un atout);</li> <li>Connaissance du PHP (un atout).<strong>ADN du candidat rêvé</strong>Il est passionné par l’e-commerce, la navigation, l’ergonomie et il possède un bon sens de l’esthétisme. Il est soucieux des détails (peut-être même un peu perfectionniste), polyvalent, curieux et créatif. Il carbure sous pression et il est reconnu comme un excellent joueur d’équipe, toujours prêt à mettre l’épaule à la roue. Évidemment, il est mordu du Web et les nouvelles tendances numériques n’ont plus de secrets pour lui. Nous avons dressé ton portrait ? Ta recherche d’emploi se termine ici!<strong>Avantages</strong>Kimpex se démarque par sa présence sur le web et sa capacité à innover dans le domaine du Powersports. En plus d’évoluer dans un environnement de travail collaboratif, les employés bénéficient d’un régime d’assurance collective complet, d’un REER collectif, d’un choix d’horaire, de congés personnels payés, d’un PAE, de plans de développement, d’activités sociales rassembleuses, ainsi que de nombreux rabais à l’achat de nos produits.</li></ul></div> </div>  </div>  </div>  </div> <br/>  <div> <div> https://soucy.njoyn.com/CL4/xweb/xweb.asp?clid=72255&page=jobdetails&jobid=J1117-0664&BRID=59453&SBDID=1&LANG=2</div>  </div>
Title: Designer web e-commerce

Job_Description: <strong>Background:</strong> <br/><br/> Cerebra Health (based in Winnipeg, Canada; founded in 2015) is a digital health-tech company focused on developing and delivering technology to help people understand and improve their sleep. Cerebra’s approved medical devices are unique assets that differentiate the Company from competitors and have the potential to revolutionize the assessment and treatment of sleep disorders. The Company’s digital service platform provides unmatched capabilities for in-home sleep analysis, with a focus on improved user experience, state-of-the-art diagnosis, and increased efficiency for our customers. <br/><br/> <strong>Position Summary:</strong> <br/><br/> This position will be responsible for helping define the user experience and design for Cerebra Health’s digital products and services; including web, mobile and Android/iOS applications. The Web Designer will play a pivotal role in the launch of the Company’s various business segments. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities:</strong>  <ul> <li>Create and implement responsive websites, purchase pages, emails and other web-based assets.</li>  <li>Perform UI/UX testing and provide recommendations on design, layout and functionality to ensure an optimal user experience.</li>  <li>Apply user-centered design processes to define user needs, develop user flows, wireframes and visual designs for web applications.</li>  <li>Collaborate closely with other designers, development teams, product management, and copywriters to recommend features, experiences, and UI implementations.</li>  <li>Analyze website visitor data to improve website layouts and provide design suggestions.</li>  <li>Perform A/B landing page testing and implement improvements.</li> </ul> <strong>Required Skills & Qualifications:</strong>  <ul> <li>Post-secondary education, including completion of a graphic or digital media design, web design program at a recognized college; or an undergraduate degree in a related discipline.</li>  <li>2 or more years of experience in web design; experience in an e-commerce setting a plus.</li>  <li>Responsive web design, mobile web development and digital application development experience.</li>  <li>Solid web design and development skills (HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP and SQL).</li>  <li>Proficient working with modern design tools including Adobe CC, Sketch, InVision amongst others.</li>  <li>Knowledge of web and mobile user interface designs principles and best practice and standards.</li>  <li>A motivated and independent self-starter capable of leading and working with cross-functional teams to identify problems then drive design.</li>  <li>Skilled at managing input from multiple stakeholders.</li>  <li>Possess strong analytical skills to synthesize research findings and translate them into actionable user experiences.</li>  <li>Ability to ensure consistency among web, print, and other designs while complying with brand guidelines.</li>  <li>Creative, innovative thinker with a strong eye for layout and design.</li>  <li>Strong attention to detail and understanding of writing fundamentals including spelling, grammar and punctuation.</li>  <li>Willingness to learn and take constructive criticism well.</li>  <li>Excellent organizational skills and ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously.</li>   <li>Ability to work in a fast-paced environment, respond to requests quickly, and meet deadlines.</li>  <li>Excellent interpersonal skills and ability to work well with others.</li> </ul> <strong>Benefits:</strong> <br/><br/> At Cerebra Health, we offer a contemporary, fast based, growth-oriented work environment that affords equal opportunities and embraces diversity. We provide enriching and satisfying careers for our employees, work hard, and have fun in the process. A competitive compensation package, inclusive of insurance benefits and additional incentives will be offered to the successful candidate. For more information on Cerebra Health visit: www.cerebrahealth.com
Title: Web & Graphic Designer

Job_Description: Are you an artisan of design, a magician of user experience? Are you someone known for your thought leadership – the one who others turn to for fresh ideas and industry trends? Or are you a visionary wanting to make the world a better place for people all over the world? <br/><br/> <strong>We are Digitalist Group</strong> and we have a proposal for you. <br/><br/> We deliver imaginative digital experiences to the most compelling and high-profile brands in North America and beyond. We are not running just one leg of the race; we are one of the forerunners when it comes to digitalization. We have developed a unique approach to discovery, design and development to offer our clients the full package from start to finish. Our people are implementing fast-paced digital transformations, tapping into the latest technologies. <br/><br/> What we propose to you is a smart career move. A career move to an international company with a multicultural mix of professionals with diverse backgrounds. In a small team and flat organization you get to influence your own work and what our studio will look like in the future. With our Nordic roots and unparalleled American understanding of digitalization, we truly stand out from the crowd in the market. <br/><br/> Our strong international presence also means you get to travel to other locations to collaborate on our international projects from time to time. So how about joining forces with the brightest minds in the industry who all want to move the world forward by developing better digital services? <br/><br/> <strong>YOUR JOB IN A NUTSHELL</strong> <br/><br/> As a Senior Visual Designer, you’ll delight users with the design that inspires, engages, and excites them. You will be researching and benchmarking, designing pixel perfect UIs and creating consistent style guides across multiple platforms/devices and produce illustrations to communicate ideas and concepts. You will collaborate with UX designers and engineers in defining information and UI architectures, developing conceptual diagrams, wireframes and low fidelity prototypes, apply a holistic approach in understanding design strategies, translate them into design solutions, and ensure consistent quality up to the finest details of the design. You actively participate in design workshops and brainstorming sessions and communicate your ideas and design solutions through detailed design documentation. <br/><br/> Like us you understand the importance of seeing the big picture, being able to make decisions without wobbling on the details and having the stamina to work on long-term projects. With us, you get to build your professional brand, work with a fun and very skilled team and be a vital part of a design studio that produces some of the most exciting products and services. <br/><br/> <strong>GOT WHAT IT TAKES?</strong> <br/><br/> We are looking for someone with an overall positive outlook on life and work. You will fit right in if you believe in the power of teamwork, deliver on your promises and have the curiosity to continuously seek new approaches and ways to grow. We appreciate that you have a change agent’s mindset and are eager to embrace new technologies and design methodologies. We hope that you have the passion for design, a strong work ethic and nurture valuable connections in your field and community. <br/><br/> <strong>WHAT WE LOOK FOR IN AN IDEAL CANDIDATE</strong> <br/><br/> Key tasks and responsibilities <ul>  <li>Lead client engagement with support from the design leaders</li> <li>Engage in internal and external dialogue around the Visual Design practice area</li> <li>Great expert knowledge and practice of Visual Design methods and tools</li> <li>Experience creative design research methodologies, qualitative and quantitative</li> <li>Engage in client workshops and do visual facilitation</li> <li>Lead and conduct graphic design - typography, layout, branding and visual storytelling</li> <li>Communicate your designs and present them to clients</li> </ul> Client facing / Consultant work <ul>  <li>Build a strong and great mindset of customer-centric design to organizations</li> <li>Understand the importance of seeing the big picture and minimalist design</li> <li>Identify and act on opportunities within projects</li> <li>Analyse and respond to client briefs in a timely manner</li> <li>Effectively prioritise and deliver to deadlines</li> <li>Excellent interpersonal and communication skills</li> </ul> Design Skills and Expertise <ul>  <li>Great Industry experience and an outstanding online portfolio that will show a variety of user experience and visual design work for desktop and touch devices</li> <li>Deep expertise in visual design with a solid foundation in visual identity, visual guidelines, branding, screen layouts, colour palettes, typography, user interface elements and icons.</li> <li>Eager to embrace new technologies and new design methodologies</li> <li>Great personal time management</li> <li>Excellent understanding of mobile platforms (iOS, Android), digital tools, trends, and foundations</li> <li>Intimacy with Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign and Sketch</li> <li>Strong understanding of designing mobile, tablet, and web apps from site architecture, user interfaces, and navigation</li> <li>Ability to design motion graphics and animation effects</li> <li>Visual facilitation and digital illustration</li> </ul> <strong>HOW TO APPLY</strong> <br/><br/> Can you see yourself joining us at Digitalist? Fill in the application form and tell us about your skills and what motivates you. The deadline for applications is July 30th but the sooner we hear from you the better! <br/><br/> If you have any questions about this job or Digitalist as an employer, please contact Jane Vita for more information. You can reach Jane at jane.vita@digitalistgroup.com
Title: Senior Visual Designer - Vancouver

Job_Description: <div>  <div> Requirements   <ul>   <li>Execute all visual design stages from concept to final hand-off to development</li> <li>Create original web designs, bringing simplicity and user friendliness to complex roadblocks</li>   <li> Present designs and key deliverables to peers and key stakeholders</li> <li>Perform web updates while adhering to client brand guidelines, industry best practices and standards</li> <li>Ability to solve problems creatively and effectively</li> </ul>  </div>  <br/><div> Qualifications   <ul>   <li> 3+ years of professional design experience in a design firm, advertising agency or in an in-house designer role</li> <li>Proficiency in HTML, CSS, and JavaScript for rapid prototyping</li> <li> Familiarity with .NET languages preferred</li>   <li>Strong conceptual skills, high-level sense of design, color, layout, proportions, and typography</li>   <li>Experience with Adobe Creative Suite</li>   <li>Must be able to apply style guides creatively while upholding brand identity</li>   <li>Able to take projects from start to finish with moderate supervision</li> <li>Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously</li> <li>Strong problem solving and time management skills</li> <li>Highly adaptable, quick learner and team oriented</li>   <li>Great attention to detail, and passion for design</li> <li>Ability to work under pressure on multiple, time-sensitive projects in an internal or external team environments</li> <li>Excellent written and verbal communication skills</li> </ul>  </div>  <br/><div> Other   <ul>   <li>Hours of work 8:30 am – 4:30 pm</li>   <li>Strong acceptance and understanding of work-life balance</li> </ul>  </div>  </div>  <br/>
Title: Web Designer

Job_Description: <strong>DEPARTMENT SUMMARY:</strong> <br/><br/> The mandate of the Client Experience department is to envision, design, orchestrate, improve and measure the client experience at Tangerine in order to deliver forward banking to Canadians and deliver on Tangerine’s mandate of being a client-centric organization. Areas of focus for the department are: Research, Strategy, Innovation, and Design. <br/><br/> <strong>ROLE PURPOSE:</strong> <br/><br/> Do you love solving business and customer problems with great user interface design? Are you known for both your creativity and attention to detail? Do you constantly ask yourself how something can be done simpler, faster and better? Do you want to help build the next generation of banking in Canada? <br/><br/> We are looking for an Interaction Designer who brings with them a passion for experience design and a well-rounded background in human factors, information architecture, visual design and creative problem-solving. As a Interaction Designer on Tangerine’s Client Experience Design team, you’ll design and wireframe the customer experiences for web, mobile and tablet. You will collaborate with business and IT professionals to bring these experiences to life for our customers. You’ll tackle two key areas: customer experience (how people feel when they interact with Tangerine), and user experience (the process behind the customer experience). You will understand all key moments of truths for customers and deliver micro-experiences that reinforce the simplicity of banking with Tangerine that will “wow” our Clients. <br/><br/> <strong>ROLE ACCOUNTABILITIES:</strong> <ul> <li>Bring together a comprehensive understanding of UX best practices, information architecture, human factors and visual interaction design for web, mobile and tablet.</li><li>Act as design owner through conception, build and release of outcomes large and small</li><li>Conceive, design and prototype user experiences that are simple, useful, usable and compelling.</li><li>Translate business needs and user goals into simple yet meaningful customer experiences.</li><li>Inform solutions with data from multiple sources, including requirements, customer needs, technology constraints, usability studies, UX research and web analytics.</li><li>Create low/high fidelity wireframes, prototypes, visual mockups, and other user interface elements, along with interface specifications at a high level of quality and in keeping with company brand, style and UI guidelines.</li><li>Plan and conduct usability tests and improve the designed experience through iterative design that includes accepting and managing feedback and challenging conventional wisdom.</li><li>Ensure consistency of experience across multiple areas and products.</li><li>Embrace and champion a collaborative approach; offer multiple options and alternatives to design challenges.</li><li>Clearly communicate design recommendations to stakeholders; actively invite feedback and iterate on designs to create a stronger solution.</li><li>Other duties as assigned.</li> </ul> <strong>MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:</strong> <ul> <li>Education/Experience  <ul> <li>A Design Degree in one of the following fields – User Interface Design, Visual Communication (Graphic) Design, Interaction Design, HCI, Industrial Design or the equivalent experience and training in an area directly relevant to this position</li><li>5+ years of user interface design experience with responsive web, mobile, and tablet based products</li><li>Experience creating low and hi-fi wireframes, prototypes, visual mockups, sitemaps, flow diagrams and other UI deliverables</li><li>Strong design portfolio that demonstrates vision and innovation in wireframes, high fidelity mockups, conceptual explorations, etc.</li><li>Experience translating complex business problems to simple and engaging user-centered solutions</li><li>Experience in conducting usability testing</li><li>Experience in agile environment</li></ul></li> <li>Specialized Knowledge  <ul> <li>Working knowledge of user interface best practices for responsive web and mobile</li><li>Accessibility is a plus</li></ul></li> <li>Technical Skills  <ul> <li>In-depth knowledge of Invision, Axure, Sketch, Zeplin, Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, Acrobat)</li><li>Understand front end technologies (e.g. HTML, DHTML, JavaScript, CSS and the capabilities of web browsers, mobile and tablet applications and user interactions) limitations and constraints is a plus</li></ul></li> <li>Abilities  <ul> <li>Ability to clearly communicate and explain your designs</li><li>Ability to successfully multitask across multiple projects simultaneously</li><li>Ability to work collaboratively with business and technical teams</li><li>Ability to work in a self-guided manner</li></ul></li> <li>Attributes  <ul> <li>Strong collaborator; you welcome feedback and see team problem-solving as a natural part of the creative process</li></ul></li> </ul> <strong>WORKING CONDITIONS:</strong> <br/><br/> The UX/UI Designer will be working in a traditional office environment and may be subject to special working conditions as needed by the business. Special working conditions may cover a range of circumstances from weekend work to support builds, overtime, working with challenging clients. <br/><br/> <strong>DIRECT REPORTS:</strong> <br/><br/> No. <br/><br/> <strong>DISABILITY ACCOMMODATION:</strong> <br/><br/> Tangerine will make reasonable accommodations for the known physical or mental disabilities of an otherwise qualified employee or applicant for employment, unless undue hardship to Tangerine would result. Any applicant or employee who requires accommodation in order to perform the essential functions of a job should contact Human Resources or his or her supervisor. <br/><br/> Managing Risk: <br/><br/> All members of the Tangerine Team are responsible for managing risk and compliance within their departments. As such, employees should maintain and demonstrate the highest standards of integrity and ethical conduct in accordance with Tangerine policies, guidelines and directions. <br/><br/> <strong>MANAGING RISK:</strong> <br/><br/> All members of the Tangerine Team are responsible for managing risk and compliance within their departments. As such, employees should maintain and demonstrate the highest standards of integrity and ethical conduct in accordance with Tangerine policies, guidelines and directions. <br/><br/> Tangerine is an equal opportunity employer.
Title: Interaction Designer

Job_Description: <strong>Location of Work:</strong> <br/><br/> 390 March Road, Kanata, Ontario K2K 0G7 <br/><br/> This is not a telecommuting position. The candidate must be able to work regular hours at our office in Ottawa. <br/><br/> <strong>Job Details:</strong> <br/><br/> Full-time; 37.5 hours per week <br/><br/> $29.33 hourly/ $55,000 per year; 10 days paid vacation per year <br/><br/> Employees are eligible to participate in the Companys standard group benefit plan which includes Disability Insurance, Dental Insurance, Extended Medical Insurance. <br/><br/> <strong>Job Summary:</strong> <br/><br/> InitLive is looking for a web developer for our cloud-based service. We require someone who wants to embrace the entrepreneurial experience and who possesses a passion for innovating and developing cloud and mobile technologies. You will work with a team of talented people to help design and build our patented mobile event service. <br/><br/> <strong>Job Responsibilities:</strong> <ul> <li>Participating in the full website development cycle, including conceptualization of website requirements to the implementation stage;</li> <li>Participating in sprint planning sessions, sign, code review and retrospectives;</li> <li>Participating in project and team meetings, interacting and collaborating with team members and other departments as appropriate;</li> <li>Creating and maintaining software documentation;</li> <li>Developing website architecture and determining hardware and software requirements;</li> <li>Working on all levels of website code from database interaction and core business logic up through data delivery and web interface;</li> <li>Planning, designing, modifying, integrating and testing web interface for our companys product;</li> <li>Writing high-quality and well-documented code according to accepted standards, based on user requirements;</li> <li>Working on bug fixes and improving web interface performance;</li> <li>Creating and optimizing content and code for the website using a variety of database, graphics and other software;</li> <li>Conducting tests and performing security and quality controls of website;</li> <li>Continuously discovering, evaluating and implementing new technologies and industry trends to enhance application and web interface and maximize development efficiency.</li> </ul> <strong>Minimum Skills Requirements</strong> <br/><br/> <u>Education</u>  Bachelors or completion of a college program in computer science is required. <br/><br/> <u>Experience</u> Must have minimum of three (3) years working with the following: HTML, AngularJS 1.58; CSS and responsive designing programming; user interface design patterns; JAVA/Spring; Node.JS/Express; PostgreSQL; Jira, BitBucket, Git. Experience with workforce management scheduling logic or event management software application coding is a highly desired asset. <br/><br/> <u>Skills</u>  Ability to learn rapidly and master diverse technologies and techniques. Ability to manage and execute tasks in a team-oriented, collaborative, high-pressure environment. Ability to research, organize and present verbal and written ideas in a clear and concise manner.
Title: Web Designer

Job_Description: <div><strong>Service:</strong> Financial Advisory <br/> <strong>Job Type:</strong> Permanent <br/> <strong>Primary Location:</strong> Toronto, Ontario, Canada <br/> <strong>All Available Locations:</strong> Calgary; Montreal; Toronto; Vancouver<br/> <div> External Posting Description <br/><br/> Deloitte’s <strong>Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning practice (AI and ML)</strong> practice is comprised of specialized experts with hands-on experience, and cutting-edge information assets that facilitate successful Artificial Intelligence (AI) transformations. We develop AI-enabled solutions to address all aspects of a client’s transformative journey with disciplined focus on business outcomes. <br/><br/> We are looking for candidates that display initiative, creativity, out-of-the-box thinking and have a keen eye for problem solving, high design sensibility, attention to details and executing deliverables to a variety of clients. <br/><br/> <strong>Your role at Deloitte</strong> <ul> <li>Conducting detailed requirements gathering sessions and articulating client needs within briefing documentation</li><li>Brainstorming solutions and creative ideas to complex business problems through working sessions, wireframing and developing mockups</li><li>Developing static infographics, low and high-fidelity wireframes for interactive data visualizations and concept presentation deck</li><li>Conduct Information Design best practices, and effectively communicate business insights back to clients</li><li>Working through iterative cycles, incorporating feedback and completing user testing and quality checks</li><li>Collaborating extensively with clients and other Deloitte teams</li><li>Managing multiple project timelines and deliverables</li> </ul> External Posting Qualifications <ul> <li>Infographics, data visualization and/or annual reporting portfolio is a must</li><li>Persuasive communicator - able to explain complex concepts to stakeholders at all levels</li><li>University / college degree in disciplines of design, preferably graphic design</li><li>Extensive experience with Adobe Creative Suite (InDesign, Illustrator) specifically with publication /editorial design, website mockups</li><li>Versatile designer, who has ability to execute a variety of deliverables, even using out of non-traditional design tools such as Microsoft PowerPoint and Wor</li><li>Experience with in the application of Information Design best practices to create static or interactive visualizations for client deliverable</li><li>Excellent critical thinking and analysis skills</li><li>Experience with iterative development and agile competencies</li><li>Ability to convert ideas quickly into design artifacts</li><li>Ability to work conceptually and solve problems through white-boarding and creating mockups</li><li>Strong presentation and communication skills to convey ideas and solutions to various target groups in both business and technology sectors</li><li>Good listener - weighs input from multiple perspectives when forming opinions and recommendations</li><li>Strong design aesthetic: ability to apply graphic design best principles, understands importance of spatial dynamic, grid system, colour theory and typography</li><li>Ability to apply user interface (UI) and user experience (UX) principles</li><li>Keen eyes for systematic solution and attention to details</li><li>Collaborative and team-oriented work approach</li><li>Ability to create and execute concepts, visuals and/or design assets based on verbal and/or written direction</li><li>Solid understanding of user-centered design processes and ability to balance customer needs with business goals in developing solutions</li><li>Web design and/or knowledge of front end web development and prototyping is a plus</li><li>Experience working for consulting firms, financial institutions and public sector is a plus</li> </ul> </div> <br/><strong>Why Deloitte?</strong> <br/><br/> Launch your career with The One Firm where you can make a greater impact than you ever thought possible. With endless opportunities at every turn, and a culture built to support and drive our people to be the very best they can be, Deloitte is The One Firm for you to learn, grow, create, and lead. <br/><br/> At Deloitte, we understand that everyone, and their career goals, are different. As a firm, we help create the conditions and opportunities that will enable our people to thrive – both professionally and personally. We do this by making three commitments to our people: <ul> <li><em><strong>You will lead at every level:</strong></em> We grow the world’s best leaders so you can achieve the impact you seek, faster.</li><li><em><strong>You can work your way:</strong></em> We give you the means to work how you want, and we have innovative spaces and the mindset to help you be wildly successful.</li><li><em><strong>You will feel included and inspired:</strong></em> We create a deep sense of belonging where you can bring your whole self to work.</li> </ul> Apply now and let us show you how to push your career to the next level at <em><strong>Deloitte. The One Firm. For You.</strong></em> <br/><br/> Deloitte is an inclusive employer dedicated to building a diverse workforce. We encourage applications from all qualified candidates and will accommodate applicants’ needs under the respective provincial human rights codes throughout all stages of the recruitment and selection process. Please advise the Recruiter to ensure your accessibility needs are accommodated throughout this process. Information received relating to accommodation will be addressed confidentially. <br/><br/> We thank all applicants in advance for their interest; however, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted <br/><br/> 35460</div>
Title: Design Analyst, AI and ML Joint Venture

As you can see, we are a diverse bunch. <br/><br/> In case you’re curious, here’s what the industry <strong>thinks of us and some cool</strong> <strong>things we have done</strong>. <br/><br/> <strong>You as a UX Designer will be:</strong>  <ul> <li>Designing and validating new experiences via mockups, wireframes, flow diagrams, sketches, and other UX artifacts for our cloud-based applications</li> <li>Running frequent usability tests with real EllisDon users (online and/or in-person at job sites around the country)</li> <li>Collaborating with cross-functional product teams that include product managers, engineers and marketing managers to gain insight into project goals and feasibility</li> <li>Provide mentorship and leadership to the growing UX and Product teams</li> </ul> <strong>Is this the right role for you?</strong>  <ul> <li>2-4+ years of experience designing world-class apps with a strong portfolio of design work</li> <li>Is comfortable working closely with software development teams in an Agile environment</li> <li>Can combine business and end-user goals to solve real-world problems</li> <li>Passion for interaction design</li> </ul> EllisDon is proud to provide this unique career opportunity within a progressive environment with continuous learning and opportunity for growth, as well as a competitive compensation package. <br/><br/> <strong>Go ahead and be yourself. We'll pay you for it!</strong> <br/><br/> We are an equal opportunity employer. iterative cycles, incorporating feedback and completing user testing and quality checks</li><li>Collaborating extensively with clients and other Deloitte teams</li><li>Managing multiple project preferably graphic design</li><li>Extensive experience with Adobe Creative Suite (InDesign, Illustrator) specifically with publication /editorial design, website mockups</li><li>Versatile designer, who has ability to execute a variety of deliverables, even using out of non-traditional design tools such as Microsoft PowerPoint and Word</li><li>Experience with in the application of Information Design best practices to create static or interactive visualizations for client deliverables</li><li>Excellent critical thinking and analysis skills</li><li>Experience with iterative development and agile competencies</li><li>Ability to convert ideas quickly into design artifacts</li><li>Ability to work conceptually and solve problems through white-boarding and creating mockups</li><li>Strong when forming opinions and recommendations</li><li>Strong design aesthetic: ability to apply graphic design best principles, understands importance of spatial dynamic, grid system, colour theory and typography</li><li>Ability to apply user interface (UI) and user experience (UX) principles</li><li>Keen eyes for systematic solution and attention to details</li><li>Collaborative and team-oriented Title: Senior Designer, AI and ML joint venture

Job_Description: At Myant, we are creating the worlds first textile computing platform, integrating technology directly into the one thing that we use every day - clothing and textiles. The sensors and actuators embedded within our apparel connect your body to the digital world, creating what we call your Digital Identity. This data is uploaded to the cloud and can be shared with those who matter to you - your doctors, coaches, other IoT devices, your family members - without you consciously having to think about it. Imagine a world where you walk into your house and the temperature automatically adjusts to suit you, or the lights adjust to your mood, or your doctor is aware of the onset of a disease before you even visit. The line between the digital and physical world is becoming increasingly blurry, and we believe textile is the next medium to bridge that gap. Over the next 12-18 months, we are launching a dozen form factors that will cover your body from the neck down. This will give you continuous, bi-directional access to the body; creating an ambient link between you and others, and you and AI. <br/><br/> Myant is looking for people who believe in our mission to make wearable technology truly ubiquitous and convenient, so that everyone can benefit from it. We are a cross-functional team solving big challenges at the intersection of fashion, electronics, software, and data science.   <ul> <li>In-depth understanding of seamlessly knitted and flat knitted therapeutic accessories, design and function</li> <li>Able to forecast trends and interpret them as appropriate to the brand</li> <li>Establish seasonal color, materials, themes and trends for each season</li> <li>Set overall design vision for line each season</li> <li>Responsible for designing and overseeing the design of the product line, from concept to final execution of the samples</li> <li>Direct and manage design and technical teams to develop collections that are balanced between being fashion forward and commercially viable for target customer base</li> <li>Work with focus groups to determine UX/UI of product being designed</li> <li>Effectively manage and ensure adherence to design budget and calendar</li> <li>Ability be fully immersed in the entire process of the product development including integration of technology and fittings</li> <li>Must be able to understand the technology being integrated and be involved in the process</li> <li>Challenge and inspire the design and tech team to conceptualize and design core and innovative collections each season while maintaining a retail focus.</li> <li>Effectively establish and communicate each seasons focus and challenge, encouraging the team involved to meet those needs creatively</li> <li>Be able to lead and inspire a collaborative work environment and continually analyze the strengths and limitations of the design and tech team, creating strategies to maximize individual and team talent.</li> <li>Create post-mortems seasonally</li> <li>Constantly strive to improve processes to increase production efficiencies, and decrease production time</li> <li>Be highly aware of the wearable technology space</li> </ul>  <strong>Qualifications:</strong>   <ul> <li>10 years of experience in a Senior Designer or Design Director in therapeutic accessories</li> <li>Experience in manufacturing process</li> <li>Strong knowledge in fabrics and technical properties</li> <li>Good understanding of bio-mechanics and human physiology</li> <li>BA in From Art and Design College/University</li> <li>Proficient in Photoshop and Illustrator</li> <li>Experience managing a small/medium team</li> <li>Creative, detail-oriented</li> <li>Strong communications skills</li> <li>Proficient in Microsoft Office</li></ul>
Title: Senior Designer/Product Developer Therapeutic accessories

Job_Description: About Product Designer Position<br/><br/>We're looking for an experienced and talented Hybrid UX/UI Designer (Product Designer) to work independently with design oversight. Working in a user-centric design and agile development environment, the role will be to design digital experiences, adding new features from our product road map and improve existing features to better achieve both user and business goals. Through iterative design and development, the Product Designer will work diligently to incorporate user and stakeholder feedback into simple intuitive solutions in a highly-collaborative setting. The Product Designer will also be responsible for digital marketing design, including blogs, and digital advertisement. If you are sharp-minded, passionate and curious to work with the latest technologies, and enjoy working in a startup environment come work with us!<br/><br/>Responsibilities and Duties  <ul> <li>Design & Refine user interface and experience for our web platform.</li><li>Contribute to discovery activities, reviewing customer feedback and data analytics.</li><li>Create simple, intuitive and engaging experiences</li><li>Create end-to-end designs from low-fidelity sketching/wire framing through to high-fidelity pixel perfect visual design</li><li>Create interactive prototypes to communicate and demonstrate design concepts to internal stakeholders and clients</li><li>Collaborate with Product Owners to understand business requirements and support delivery within development sprint cycles</li><li>Present design solutions to business stakeholders with the ability to rationalize ideas using qualitative or quantitative data</li><li>Ensure consistency in the user experience by reusing established design patterns and styles</li><li>Participate in creating and updating the Intelocate Digital Style Guide & UI Pattern Library</li><li>Accountable for all elements of asset delivery to development teams</li><li>Work closely with developers to implement and perfect designs, with the goal of increasing collaboration and reducing documentation where we can</li> </ul>  Qualifications and Skills  <ul> <li>2+ years of experience in UX/UI digital design-related role such as Product Design,</li><li>Strong, clean visual design sense</li><li>Adobe suite (PS, Illustrator), Sketch, Invision</li><li>Strong design sense</li><li>Portfolio full of great work</li><li>Ambition</li><li>Interest in joining a quickly growing startup</li><li>Self starter</li> </ul>  <strong>Benefits</strong>  <ul> <li>Startup Experience</li><li>Fast pace growth</li><li>Agile Development experience</li><li>Competitive compensation package</li><li>A friendly working environment with opportunities to impact the company with your ideas and involvement</li><li>Freedom to work remotely</li> </ul>
Title: Product Designer

Job_Description: At Rogers we’re for supporting you on a journey to a rewarding career. Whether you’re a developer, an analyst, or a customer care consultant, Rogers is the place where ideas become reality. We embrace change, and find ways to do better. And we deliver on that commitment by fostering an environment of passion and innovation for all people. <br/><br/>   <br/><br/> Rogers is currently seeking a talented Experience Designer to join the Customer Experience UX/UI team. This individual will be well versed in the workflow and processes of UI design for both desktop and mobile experiences. Working with the larger UX/UI team, they will be providing day-to-day design assistance to the team regarding the creation of innovative and engaging online experiences. <br/><br/>   <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities and Accountabilities</strong> <ul> <li>Assist in the design of user interfaces that provide an interactive, informative and engaging experience</li><li>Provide support to business as usual (BAU) initiatives such as promotions, device launches, updates to existing experiences</li><li>Work closely with the user experience team to create online prototypes for usability testing</li><li>Work and collaborate with cross-functional teams in the development of projects, creation/refinement of presentation materials </li><li>Accountable for all elements of asset delivery to development teams</li><li>Maintain design style guides for desktop and mobile experiences</li><li>Communicate the functionality and components of interactive elements with cross functional teams including the development team and stakeholders</li><li>Provide support to Senior Visual Designers as needed</li> </ul>   <br/><br/> <strong>Skills and Experience</strong> <ul> <li>Design experience - College Design diploma or equivalent work experience</li><li>In depth knowledge and experience with Adobe Creative Suite</li><li>Strong knowledge of CSS/HTML</li><li>Desktop and mobile UI design experience including mobile (responsive design)</li><li>Proven ability to work with teams and stakeholders</li><li>Ability to work independently and under short deadlines</li> </ul>  <div> </div><div><strong>Schedule:</strong> Full Time</div><div><strong>Shift:</strong> Day</div><div><strong>Length of Contract:</strong> Not Applicable (Regular Position)</div><div><strong>Work Location: </strong>1200 Av. McGill College, # 1620 (904), Montreal, QC </div><div><strong>Travel Requirements:</strong> Up to 10%</div><div><strong>Posting Category/Function:</strong> Digital & Creative</div><div><strong>Requisition ID:</strong> 119428</div><div> </div><div><strong>WHY ROGERS?</strong></div><div> </div><div>As a proud Canadian company, we're dedicated to making things easier for our customers. We’ve been embracing and leading change for over 50-years, and we’ll continue to seek out new opportunities to bring our customers simple solutions for today and tomorrow.</div><div> </div> <br/> <div><strong>We recognize that success is determined by the strength and diversity of our people. We work together because we want to win together, and these five shared values guide and define our work:</strong></div><div> </div>  <ul> <li>Simplify and innovate</li><li>Take ownership of the what and the how</li><li>Equip people to succeed</li><li>Execute with discipline and pride</li><li>Talk straight, build trust, and over deliver</li> </ul>  <div> </div><div>Why Rogers? Because your tomorrow inspires our today.</div><div> </div><div>What makes us different makes us stronger. Rogers has a strong commitment to diversity and inclusion. Title: Experience Designer

Job_Description: Who is Thinking Big?  <p>We are a group of smart, and committed business analysts, technical writers, front-end designers, software developers, testers, and project managers. Some say geeks, some say nerds. We are ok with either...or both. We provide digital consulting services to government and corporations but we also build products. </p>  <p>Our team help guide clients, getting stuff done. We also do our own software product development. Think of this side of the business as technology start-up incubation where you get to learn and practice using the latest tech and tools.</p>   Passion + delivery  <p>We believe that owning your work and claiming responsibility are keys to satisfaction at work. Thinking Big has many projects, and we're always looking for the best people. Join us.</p>   Level up  <p>Your experience might get you in the door, but your journey doesn’t stop there. We provide our big thinkers opportunities to learn and grow; to focus on who you plan to become. It’s a central theme to the Thinking Big way of life and business.</p>   Honest criticism  <p>We want our work and our people to be better. Sharing ideas and communicating how we can improve is vital to our business. From code reviews to group discussions, we believe in an open environment where we can help each other grow and improve.</p>   Continuous learning  <p>There is a n00b inside all of us, and this allows us to learn and grow. “I don’t know” is not a bad thing to say or hear. It’s the beginning of something new, and we all love to go from n00b to pro.</p>   Responsibilities  <ul>  <li>Take a design through all stages, from getting out of the clients head, to handing it off to the development team to execute.</li>  <li>Understand the customer/client you are designing for</li>  <li>Create wireframes, storyboards, user flows, process flows and sitemaps to effectively communicate interaction and design ideas to your customers</li>  <li>Present and defend designs and key milestone deliverables to peers and executive level stakeholders</li>  <li>Help establish and promote design guidelines, best practices and standards</li>  </ul>   Qualifications  <ul>  <li>3+ years of web design and UX experience</li>  <li>Demonstrable graphic design skills with a strong portfolio</li>  <li>Solid experience in creating wireframes, storyboards, user flows, process flows and sitemaps</li>  <li>Proficiency in Photoshop, Illustrator, Sketch or other visual design and wire-framing tools</li>  <li>Proficiency in HTML and CSS for rapid prototyping (JavaScript a bonus)</li>  <li>Ability to solve problems creatively and effectively</li>  <li>Up-to-date with the latest Web trends, techniques, and technologies</li>  </ul>    Contact us hello@thinkingbig.net to apply or call toll free 1 (877) 733 3447.    <div>  <div>                                                  </div> </div> ;
Title: UX Designer

Job_Description: Description <br/>  <div> Company <br/>  <br/> Our client is a Canadian start-up, disrupting the future of how computers and humans will interact. Founded by 3 of the brightest Mechatronics Engineers from Waterloo, this company first appeared on Silicon Valley's radar with the launch of a 'first of it's kind' consumer electronic: a gesture controlled wearable. <br/><br/> If that fact alone doesn't have you already pressing the 'send' button to send us your resume, things only got better for our client when AMAZON'S ALEXA FUND and INTEL got together after seeing a prototype of their 2nd consumer experience currently operating in PROJECT X. <br/><br/> Together these 2 investment superpowers invested $160 MILLION to get that project built and launched. <br/><br/> And that's where OUR partnership story with this Unicorn begins..... <br/>  <br/> Mission <br/>  <br/> <strong>THE MISSION:</strong> <br/> (what you'll be doing) <br/><br/> Working title: Design Lead, Head of Design, VP Design, Design VP, you get the idea. <br/><br/> This role will be the single most critical hire of 2018. <br/><br/> Your mission is to inspire and influence what has been an engineering led start up with a CUSTOMER CENTRIC DESIGN THINKING methodology. <br/><br/> If that was all we told you, you wouldn't need more. You get it. Because you've done it. You're ready to do it again. <br/><br/> If you need a little more, here's a few more data points: <br/><br/> YOU WILL LEAD an existing team of UI/UX/ID Designers who have already done an awesome job getting things to where they are today. Take them further. Teach them to fly to places they don't even know exist. Then add a few more talented designers to the group. <br/><br/> YOU WILL CHAMPION design thinking across the company and across the entire CUSTOMER JOURNEY. Hardware, Software, Experiences, Retail, Web, Packaging: your decisions will impact every touchpoint of the customer/user experience. <br/><br/> YOU WILL BUILD a design esthetic that is recognizable globally and for a product that will become a household name. You will build a business which will create an entirely new CE category and who others will aspire to become. <br/>  <br/> Experience & Expertise <br/>  <br/> <strong>EXPERTISE & EXPERIENCE</strong> <br/> (what you need)   <ul> <li>You approach design from a customer centric design thinking methodology.</li> <li>You have led and launched new consumer experiences into the market.</li>   <li>You know what it is to launch version 1 of a consumer experience/product.</li> <li>You have probably worked for a top design studio such as IDEO or FROG, or have seriously considered it.</li> <li>You have experience influencing team members to accomplish great things.</li>   <li>Your approach to design is holistic.</li>   <li>Your work and approach embodies everything and anything as it relates to a customer journey and their experience. The experience is everything!</li>   <li>You are confident. You know you're damn good, yet you leave your ego at home.</li> <li>You crave to do interesting work, and for the challenge of designing what has never been done before.</li> <li>You DON'T care what your title is, you DO care what the scope of the role is.</li> <li>You are ready to step out of your "organization" to be THE ONE who puts a company on the world stage with version 1 of a new category.</li> <li>You are ready to be the next Jony Ive.</li>  </ul>  BONUS POINTS if you've worked on products for any of these consumer brands: Apple, Google, Samsung, Nokia, Tesla, IG, Facebook, AirBnB, Pinterest, Uber, Lyft, TomTom, Garmin, Amazon, GoPro, Snap Labs, Fossil, Frank & Oak, Warbly Parker, Foursquare, Wayz, Mapquest, Vue, Bose, Fitbit, Leap Motion, Leap Magic. <br/>  <br/> Compensation</div>
Title: Director of Product Design

Job_Description: The Person: <br/> You dream beyond the proverbial walls of what exists today and aspire to deliver exceptional ways to impress the consumer. Details like product education can be difficult to convey, however you possess a ‘whisperers’ talent that allows you to distill complexity to a level where the average consumer can quickly discover benefit. You thrive in cohesion and find deep satisfaction in sharing ideas and coaching others, particularly those in your field. You bring an aspirational headspace that is magnetic and inspiring. You have affinity towards technology and harness the latest platforms to elevate experiences and automate workflow. You obsess over the consumer and use scientific means (clickstream, heat map, surveys) to discover the true meaning of customer reaction. You are friendly and reliable, and generally hit your stride within the first few weeks of beginning a role. <br/><br/> Responsibilities    <ul> <li>From a creative lens, you will lead the roll out of four ecommerce websites, a mobile app, and several product customization tools</li> <li>You will partner with both product owners and brand folks to drive a consistent voice and feeling across consumer touchpoints</li> <li>You will join a community of designers who actively share ideas, crowdsource challenges, and propagate digital wisdom throughout the organization</li> <li>You will host User Experience planning events like journey mapping, card sorting, and digital focus groups to help shape digital pathways and unite our teams around a common view</li> <li>You will develop seasonal and annual tactical plans to promote design opportunities that are well supported by data, consumer sentiment, and/or market-trends</li> <li>You prefer to build photorealistic wireframes (or mockups) to showcase concepts and to offer more clarity around design and experience </li> <li>You will leverage platforms and data to test concepts before pushing to an always-active state</li> <li>You will monitor consumer pathways and make sure they align to the North American and International laws surrounding accessibility and inclusion</li> <li>You will seek out partners, internally and from agencies, and evaluate opportunities to elevate consumer experiences, improve processes, and enhance internal capabilities through digital means</li> </ul>  <div> <div> <div> <div><strong>Minimum Requirements</strong> </div></div><br/>  <div></div>   <ul> <li>7 to 10 years in a hands-on design capacity working for a digital agency, a publisher, or in a client-side creative studio</li>  <li>A portfolio chalked full of compelling and aspirational designs</li>  <li>Understanding of the latest digital experience frameworks; eg. Google’s Material Design</li>  <li>Basic understanding of the capabilities behind single page applications and web accelerators</li>  <li>Experience building in languages like react, angular or vue is a plus.</li>  <li>Excellent verbal and written communication skills</li>  <li>Ability to clearly understand challenges and concerns, and develop resolutions.</li>  <li>Work independently and cooperatively in a diverse group.</li>  <li>Exercise high degree of professionalism and confidentiality.</li>  <li>Demonstrated ability to lead and motivate others</li> </ul>  </div> </div><br/>  <div>Go Beyond. www.superiorjobs.com. <br/> EEO Employer - Minorities / Females / Disabled / Veterans / Sexual Orientation / Gender Identity.</div>
Title: Senior UI Design

Job_Description: <div>We are Systematix and we are looking for an enthusiastic <strong>UX Designer</strong> with Salesforce skills to fill a contract position with one of our key clientele.</div><div><strong>ABOUT THE PROJECT</strong></div><div>Our client is one of Canada’s leading Data service providers located in the Toronto area. In their efforts to streamline customer and business service levels, they are integrating a new cloud based payment processing tool, and require a creative mind to design the lopk and feel of their payment portal.</div>  <br/> <div><strong>Some of your responsibilities in this role will be:</strong></div><ul><li>Creating user interface designs and prototypes based on data and UX input</li><li>Collaborating with the team to imagine design approach for both full-site and feature-level execution</li><li>Eliciting constructive feedback from clients and interpreting that feedback into design solutions</li> </ul>  <div> <strong>ABOUT THE REQUIRED SKILLS</strong></div><ul> <li>3+ years of experience as a visual designer, user interface designer, interaction designer, or similar role.</li><li>Proficiency with Visualforce and Communities</li><li>Excellent interpersonal skills and presentation skills, including the ability to clearly articulate both design decisions/rationale to a variety of audiences</li> <li>Strong conceptualization ability, strong visual communication ability, drawing skills and sketchbook technique</li><li>Exceptional design skills, production value and attention to detail</li><li>Ability to create wireframes as well as visual design comps</li><li>Proficient with user interface design patterns and standard UCD methodologies</li><li>Able to integrate UX into Agile development practices.</li><li>Must be self-motivated, responsive, and dedicated to customer success.</li><li>Knowledge of Usability and Information Architecture</li><li>Demonstrated ability to learn quickly, be a team player, and manage change effectively.</li><li>Knowledge of eCommerce is a strong asset</li> </ul>  <div><strong>ABOUT THE ROLE</strong></div><div>This is a 6 month contract located in the west end of Toronto.</div><div></div><div><strong>APPLY NOW</strong></div><div>If you are interested in finding out more please contact us or submit your resume. Or, if willing to refer someone who is qualified, Systematix will offer a referral fee for successful placements.</div><div></div><div><strong>ABOUT SYSTEMATIX</strong></div><div>At Systematix, we pride ourselves in taking care of our consultant partnerships - by doing the little things that matter - like taking the time to get to know you, knowing when an opportunity is the perfect fit, informing you every step of the way, and building the foundation for long term relationships. We do the same with out clients, concerning ourselves more with the project than the position, so that we have the information you need to ensure an opportunity is right for you. We only work with people who enjoy making a difference.</div> <div>Systematix is one of Canada’s largest privately owned National Consulting and Resourcing firms. With offices across Canada, we provide the highest caliber consulting solutions to a diverse client base that includes all levels of Government and all Private Industry sectors.</div><div>At Systematix, we bring people and projects together!</div><br/>
Title: UX Designer
