Job_Description: We turn fashion into technical apparel for an active lifestyle, because we believe you should be able to do everything you do in a day without having to change your clothes. Inspired by the modern, active individual, we've created a clothing line that maximizes performance without sacrificing style. <br/> Were looking for a Graphic Designer with an intense passion for all kinds of design (including UX/UI) with depth in video editing to join our Marketing team. Based in Vancouver, this multifaceted role reports into the Marketing Manager and will be leading the vision and the strategy behind the visual brand, executing design work as well as leading, mentoring and overseeing junior design resources. <br/> <strong>Responsibilities</strong>:  <ul> <li>Lead the vision for the visual representation of the brands, working closely with marketing, design and senior leadership;</li> <li>Champion new and creative ways of visual storytelling;</li> <li>Perform best in class design work with compelling, creative and solution oriented design;</li> <li>Create UX frameworks for the website and work with the ecomm team and outside consultants to create compelling digital experiences;</li> <li>Ensure graphic deliverables across digital, print and out of home are on-brand, on-budget and on-time;</li> <li>Brainstorm, envision, formulate and present concepts to create/develop unique and compelling customer experiences in all areas;</li> <li>Create thoughtful graphic design elements blending strategic insights and collaborative creative inspiration;</li> <li>Edit videos for digital, social and out of home use;</li> <li>Work expertly across various mediums (digital, retail,, social, print, video, etc.) to create dynamic and compelling brand experiences;</li> <li>Present and share creative work with a strong ability to craft narrative around design rationale;</li> <li>Act as a leader within the department and champion a creative perspective, a hard working ethic, and grace under pressure.<strong>Who You Are</strong>:</li> <li>3-5 years of graphic design in-house or at an agency;</li> <li>World class portfolio of work that inspires and compels;</li> <li>Degree or diploma in Communication/Graphic Design or portfolio demonstrating equivalent work experience with excellence in visual and creative design- Experience in brand marketing, interactive design and art direction of mid-to-large scale website projects through to edgier campaigns, promotional materials and brand experiences;</li> <li>Knowledgeable and experienced in UX/UI principles and practices;</li> <li>Handy with video editing software;</li> <li>Giving your design decisions meaning through strong conceptual thinking;</li> <li>Understanding advertising, design, and creative principles for digital and print;</li> <li>Multitasking and working efficiently under pressure with careful attention to detail;</li> <li>Experienced managing people and projects;</li> <li>Advanced knowledge and up to date with industry leading software and technologies (In Design, Illustrator, Dreamweaver, Photoshop etc);</li> <li>Highly motivated - a self-starter who will flourish in a constantly changing, fast-paced environment.<strong>Bonus Points</strong>:</li> <li>Photography skills;</li> <li>The ability to act (or grow into) as Art or Creative Director, depending on the project;</li> <li>Experience with or knowledge of motion graphic design;</li>  <strong><li>Digital Illustration skills.<strong>About Dish and DUER</strong>:</strong> <br/> Dish and DUER is a performance denim line designed in the heart of Gastown in Vancouver, B.C. Combining crazy comfort with serious style, we make it easier lead a meaningful life full of adventure. <br/> Job Type: Full-time <br/> <strong>Experience:</li>  </strong>  <li>graphic design in-house or at an agency: 3 yearsEducation:</li>  <strong><li>Bachelor'sLocation:</li>  </strong>  <li>Vancouver, BC</li> </ul>
Title: Graphic Designer

Job_Description: <strong>WHY WE NEED YOU</strong> <br/><br/> We need an experienced UX Designer to own the experience for multiple product areas at BSM Technologies. BSM is embarking on a journey to consolidate multiple commercial telematics platforms and associated applications into a comprehensive product. You will be a key member of the team building a polished platform that is adaptable to the needs of customers, the market, and the business. <br/><br/> We need you because: <br/><br/> <strong>You are self-directed:</strong> you don’t wait for others to tell you what needs doing. <br/><br/> <strong>You self-align:</strong> you do what the company needs done when it needs to be done, without having to be asked. <br/><br/> <strong>You are accountable:</strong> you crave ownership of what you work on, take credit for your successes, and accept responsibility for your failures. <br/><br/> <strong>You are versatile:</strong> your broad range of skills allows you to help where you’re most needed, but your depth makes you the UX expert. <br/><br/> <strong>WHAT YOU’LL TELL YOUR FRIENDS YOU DO</strong> <br/><br/> “I am responsible for user experience and interaction design at BSM Technologies. We build products that help our customers manage their vehicle fleets as well as other assets.” <br/><br/> <strong>WHAT YOU’LL REALLY BE DOING</strong> <br/><br/> <em>Design</em>  <ul> <li>Creating the interaction design, information architecture, and visual design for BSM’s platform through web, Android, and iOS applications.</li> <li>Researching customer needs and testing designs using prototypes and incorporating the feedback to improve the design.</li> <li>Establishing proven design best practices within the product development team and with other designers at BSM.</li> </ul> <em>Product</em>  <ul> <li>Defining the user needs and problems for BSM’s products to help guide design decisions.</li> <li>Collaborating with Product Management and customers to define the BSM Roadmap.</li> <li>Turning the roadmap into an actionable design backlog by working alongside Product Management, Engineering, and other designers.</li> </ul> <em>Growth</em>  <ul> <li>Building awareness within BSM about the value that design brings to the organization.</li> <li>Owning the analytics gathered from the platform to drive improvements to the product.</li> <li>Continuously improving yourself, the team, the processes you use, and the company’s products.</li> </ul> <strong>WHO YOU’LL BE WORKING WITH</strong> <br/><br/> As a UX Designer, you’ll be:  <ul> <li>Working with other designers to define a common design vision for BSM’s products, and ensure designs continue to align with this vision.</li> <li>Collaborating with Engineers to deliver an experience that aligns with the BSM design vision and simultaneously respects the conventions of appropriate platforms.</li> <li>Collaborating with Product Managers, Engineering leads, Sales, and customers to identify priorities.</li> </ul> Our goal at BSM is to blend the benefits of co-located teams with distributed expertise. You’ll be working with team members in various sites across North America and Europe while building a local center of excellence. While teams may not always sit together physically, they place special emphasis on lifting each other up. <br/><br/> <strong>WHAT WE NEED YOU TO KNOW</strong>  <ul> <li>Deep knowledge of product design, including common interaction patterns used and associated trade-offs, and best practices for responsive web, Android, and iOS interfaces.</li> <li>Broad knowledge of product design across other spaces; you wouldn’t think twice about turning your attention to physical devices.</li> <li>Proficient with user interface and icon design, Sketch/Figma, prototyping tools like InVision/Principle, etc.</li> <li>Conversational knowledge of at least one software language (e.g., HTML/CSS, JavaScript, Java, Swift).</li> <li>Experience with usability testing.</li> <li>Experience interfacing directly with customers/users.</li> <li>An interest in mentoring and developing your teammates.</li> <li>An attitude of continuous learning.</li> <li>Professional oral and written communication skills.</li> </ul> What we offer: <br/><br/> Three weeks paid vacation per year <br/><br/> Fully covered extended health benefits <br/><br/> Employee Assistance Program <br/><br/> Sick days <br/><br/> Transit subsidy <br/><br/> Monthly lunches <br/><br/> Fun monthly social events <br/><br/> Employee Discounts <br/><br/> Recognition and awards <br/><br/> Tuition Assistance <br/><br/> Online learning (Lynda.com access; HR downloads) <br/><br/> Please send your cover letter, resume, and a link to your online portfolio to joinourteam@bsmtechnologies.com. Submissions without a portfolio included will not be considered. <br/><br/> BSM Technologies is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation during the application or interview process, please contact <strong>joinourteam@bsmtechnologies.com.</strong>
Title: UX Designer

Job_Description: The Creative Group is looking for a Intermediate- Senior Visual/Product Designer experience for a contract until the end of August for our agency client in Toronto, ON. This role would be fully remote but this candidate would need to be available full time during regular business hours. <br/><br/> They are looking for someone who has mobile design experience as you will be tasked with helping to design a mobile app. <br/><br/> If you are interested, please apply and we will be in contact.
Title: UX Designer

Job_Description: Did you spend countless hours debating the iOS7 redesign? Do you become obsessed with even the smallest detail of an interface design? Have you ever looked at an incredibly well-designed app and secretly wished you had done it? If the answers are yes, yes and hell yes, we want to hear from you. <br/><br/> Plastic Mobile is looking for a Mobile/Graphic Designer, with a hunger to fill their portfolios with best class apps for some of Canadas top tier brands. Youll join our creative team of usability architects, designers, art directors and strategists to create and conceptualize, iOs/Android apps, responsive/adaptive websites, as well as work for our mobile innovation lab. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities:</strong> <ul> <li>Collaborating with the team to support our website design and content</li><li>Contributing new ideas for design and content creation to the team using your expertise and eye for cutting-edge design.</li><li>Conceptualize and create intuitive and engaging mobile experiences for users</li><li>Push the boundaries on innovation through interface design</li><li>Translate requirements into highly engaging and compelling design concepts</li><li>Candidate must work well as part of a team and on their own</li><li>Detail-oriented, with an eye for thoroughness and accuracy</li><li>Work closely with our Art Directors and Creative Director</li> </ul>  <strong>Desired Skills & Experience</strong>  <ul> <li>3+ years' experience working in Graphic design</li><li>2+ years' experience working in Mobile design</li><li>Experience using Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign (Final Cut Pro and After Effects are a plus)</li><li>Experience working with wireframes.</li> <li>UX and UI experience is a plus</li><li>Experience with responsive layout grids and best practices</li><li>Knowledge of Axure, Visio, Omnigraffle is a bonus</li><li>Knowledge of common smartphone capabilities such as iOS and Android</li><li>Knowledge of common web browser capabilities</li><li>Must be self-directed and highly motivated with an ability to manage multiple projects with tight deadlines in a fast-paced environment</li><li>Must be able to work well under pressure</li> </ul> <strong>*Please include your portfolio along with one secret talent we should know about when applying for the position.</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Employee Perks:</strong><ul> <li>Comprehensive Health Benets</li><li>Fun, open environment</li> </ul>  <strong>Company Description</strong><br/><br/>Plastic Mobile, a Havas Company, is an agency dedicated to helping our clients create and launch successful mobile experiences. We exclusively work with companies that are looking to make a difference in the mobile space and make it an integral part of their customers' lives. We specialize in ideating, designing and engineering apps and sites for smartphones, tablets, and devices everywhere for commerce, loyalty, payment, wallets, location-based and transactional branded experiences. <br/><br/> Plastic Mobile is headquartered out of Toronto, Montreal New York City powered by the best creative minds, mobile strategists and software engineers designing and building world-class mobile experiences. <br/><br/> Find us on the Web: http://www.plasticmobile.com
Title: Graphic Designer (Mobile)

Job_Description: <div>A Web Designer is needed for our private sector client in Liberty Village. This is an exciting permanent opportunity for anyone who would like to grow their career in an entrepreneurial environment. The successful candidate will have at least 3 years' experience with designing client-facing web applications. <br/><br/> <strong>Roles and Responsibilities</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Assist in building/designing the following:</strong>   <ul> <li>A website for clients that syncs data with SalesForce</li> <li>A mobile solution to accompany the client website (iOS and Android).</li> <li>An e-commerce platform.</li>  </ul>  <strong>Qualifications and Experience</strong>   <ul> <li>Excellent design skills using Sketch, Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator, or XD.</li> <li>Experience taking designed layouts into HTML and CSS.</li> <li>Familiarity with version control, especially Git.</li> <li>Excellent communication skills, and able to collaborate with both leads and teammates.</li> <li>Takes ownership and responsibility for successful delivery of features.</li> </ul>  <strong>Nice to have:</strong>  <ul>    <ul> <li>Bootstrap 4 and 3.3</li> <li>Building custom themes for e-commerce platforms such as Shopify</li>   <li>Pardot or WordPress experience, or other CMS products.</li>   <li>Experience with mobile application design.</li> </ul>   </ul>  </div> <br/>
Title: Web Designer

Job_Description: About the role <br/><br/> Our User Experience (UX) Design team members are specialists in human-centered software design. They begin their work by understanding their audience in addition to all client and internal stakeholder objectives. By humanizing technology, the UX Design team empowers businesses to connect with their customers. <br/><br/> As Manager of UX Design, you will manage the delivery of UX project deliverables for specific clients and projects. Your focus will be on translating high-level client needs into specific UX designs and ensuring that the work is done with efficiency, effectiveness and at the highest quality. This work involves not only design oversight but daily management and mentoring of staff, timelines and budgets. <br/><br/> Day-to-day, you will: <ul>   <li>Lead UX project efforts from planning to analysis, design, build and test</li>   <li>Oversee, review and create architecture-focused deliverables for assigned projects (e.g., information architecture, taxonomy, content structures)</li>   <li>Lead and review client and industry research, including requirements gathering, data analysis, profile and persona development</li>   <li>Partner with cross-functional technology and design teams to integrate solutions and requirements into UX strategies</li>   <li>Coach, review and provide career guidance to junior UX Design team members</li>   <li>Raise client awareness of Experience Design solutions by developing customer case studies and representing Avanade in the larger UX community</li>   <li>Partner and manage offshore resources where required.</li>  </ul> About you <br/><br/> You have an eye for beauty in UX design and a way with people. You have a passion for technology done well, and understand well how to marry real-world client needs with stunning design. Your team will look to you for inspiration and leadership in accomplishing their work. <br/><br/> Your skillset likely includes: <ul>   <li>Extensive experience with UX disciplines such as UX research methods, information architecture, usability testing and content strategies</li>   <li>Knowledge of visual design capabilities and strategies</li>   <li>Leadership in strategy, execution, tools and active in the broader UX community</li>   <li>Translating requirements into design specifications</li>   <li>Working with cross-functional teams</li>   <li>Researching and designing solutions with mobile layouts in mind</li>   <li>Ability to understand and articulate technical feasibility assessments</li>  </ul> You likely have a Bachelors Degree in interaction design, human factors, computer interaction, behavioral psychology, human/computer interaction, or similar subject, though experience may substitute for a degree. A Masters Degree in a related discipline is a plus. You should have up to six years of UX experience and about two years of experience managing people and teams. <br/><br/> About Avanade <br/><br/> Avanade® Is An Equal Opportunity Employer. Avanade prohibits discrimination and harassment against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, age, religion, sex, national origin, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, disability, marital status or any other protected status. Avanade is also committed to providing accommodations for persons with disabilities in accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act. <br/><br/> Avanade leads in providing innovative digital services, business solutions and design-led experiences for its clients, delivered through the power of people and the Microsoft ecosystem. Our professionals combine technology, business and industry expertise to build and deploy solutions to realize results for clients and their customers. Avanade has 27,000 digitally connected people across 23 countries, bringing clients the best thinking through a collaborative culture that honors diversity and reflects the communities in which we operate. Majority owned by Accenture, Avanade was founded in 2000 by Accenture LLP and Microsoft Corporation. Learn more at www.avanade.com. <br/><br/> Qualifications <br/><br/> Years of Experience: <br/><br/> 6+ years relevant UX experience <br/><br/> Management Experience: <br/><br/> 2+ years managing people/teams <br/><br/> Education: <br/><br/> Bachelor's degree in Interaction Design, Human Factors, ComputerInteraction, Behavioral Psychology, Human/Computer Interaction, or similardegree; experience may substitute degree. Master's in related discipline a plus <br/><br/> Other Skills/Knowledge: <ul>  <li>Extensive experience with UX disciplines such as UX research methods, information architecture, usability testing, and content strategies</li> <li>Knowledge of visual design capabilities and strategies</li> <li>Leader in strategy, execution, tools, and an active UX community participant</li> <li>Experience translating requirements into design specifications</li> <li>Experience working with cross-functional teams</li> <li>Experience researching, designing and/or proposing solutions with mobile layouts in mind</li> <li>Capable of understanding and articulating technical feasibility of solutions</li> </ul> Required Certifications: N/A <br/><br/> Additional Area, Region or Service Line specific requirement: <br/><br/> <strong>Requisition ID - 53262</strong> <br/><br/> Avanade is the leading provider of innovative digital and cloud-enabling services, business solutions and design-led experiences, delivered through the power of people and the Microsoft ecosystem. Majority owned by Accenture, Avanade was founded in 2000 by Accenture LLP and Microsoft Corporation and has 30,000 professionals in 24 countries. Visit us at www.avanade.com.
Title: Manager, UX Design

Job_Description: As a User Experience Designer, you will: <br/><br/> <strong>Discover & Analyze</strong>  <ul> <li>Help plan and articulate UX project approaches</li> <li>Understand, define & articulate user behaviours, needs, motivations, and goals</li> <li>Collaborate closely with team members and clients to identify, communicate and document the business goals and objectives</li> <li>Participate in stakeholder interviews and workshops</li> <li>Lead reviews and evaluations on existing digital experiences</li> <li>Work with internal teams to strategize and recommend solutions that meet both business objectives and the target audience needs</li> <li>Define product features/functionality, usability requirements and feature roadmaps</li> <li>Collaborate with Digital Strategists to define digital strategy and content strategy</li> </ul> <strong>Create & Develop</strong>  <ul> <li>Produce elegant digital experiences across all digital touch points, ensuring that all responsive websites and apps are both usable, desirable, and striving to maximize user satisfaction</li> <li>Visualize and create high-level concepts quickly to demonstrate design ideas to clients and internal teams through wireframes, high-fidelity prototypes and other interactive representations</li> <li>Develop the information architecture, user tasks, user flows & content matrices for informational, promotional and transactional based sites and applications</li> <li>Ensure solutions support brand objectives, achieve business goals, and achieve or exceed defined KPIs & HVAs</li> <li>Collaborate with art directors, designers, copywriters and developers to create interfaces that are beautiful, user-friendly and technically feasible within the project constraints</li> </ul> <strong>Participate & Collaborate</strong>  <ul> <li>Actively contribute to internal discussions, brainstorms and ideation sessions</li> <li>Present and rationalize UX recommendations and solutions to clients</li> <li>Ensure that the strategy is articulated through every step of the design and development process</li> <li>Support project and account managers with estimating work effort, providing status updates, and flagging risks</li> </ul> <strong>You are an ideal candidate for this role if you:</strong>  <ul> <li>Think strategically in everything you do</li> <li>Are intrinsically-driven and celebrate every success</li> <li>Enjoy a variety of work</li> <li>Are a logical thinker with creative problem-solving skills</li> <li>Set high quality standards for yourself and aim to get every detail right</li> <li>Do what it takes to deliver on your commitments</li> <li>Enjoy working in a fast-paced, challenging, and rewarding environment</li> <li>Welcome and volunteer constructive feedback</li> <li>Thrive in a collaborative work environment</li> <li>Are able to maintain constant and effective communication within multidisciplinary project teams</li> <li>Want to share your knowledge with others & believe in continuous learning and improvement</li> </ul> <u><strong>Skills & Experience</strong></u> <br/><br/> <strong>Must have:</strong>  <ul> <li>Some experience working in a UX-related role. Expertise in of information architecture and/or interaction design is desired.</li> <li>Undergraduate degree or post-secondary certificate in marketing, business analysis, information technology, human factors, psychology, library sciences, industrial design, visual design, or any other UX-related field</li> <li>Proficiency in creating wireframes and prototypes using Axure RP Pro, Invision or Illustrator</li> <li>Experience designing responsive websites and applications for mobile and tablet devices</li> <li>Ability to define the target audience, tasks, user flows and diagrams</li> <li>Intermediate skills with Adobe Suite, Microsoft Office software, particularly in Word, Excel, and PowerPoint</li> <li>A portfolio of work showcasing your UX skills, capabilities, and strong sense of design</li> </ul> <strong>Nice to have:</strong>  <ul> <li>Professional certification in user experience or usability from Human Factors International, Akendi, or similar institution</li> <li>Agency or digital shop experience</li> <li>Experience in product design</li> <li>Experience in technical tools, content strategy, and/or content development process</li> <li>Technical acumen, particularly with HTML, CSS & Javascript</li> </ul>
Title: UX Designer

Job_Description: <strong>Snapshot:</strong> <br/><br/> Employment Term: Full-time <br/> Experience: 3+ years work experience <br/> Location: Toronto, ON <br/><br/> <strong>Overview:</strong> <br/><br/> We are looking for passionate and thoughtful product designers to help build and shape the Loopio platform and design culture. You will be responsible for bringing the features from your sketch pad to life in order to deliver outstanding experiences to our customers. <br/><br/> <strong>Details:</strong>  <ul> <li>Collecting and disseminating user feedback to guide your solutions</li> <li>Design visual components and understand how they fit together in a system</li> <li>Define how users will interact with design components</li> <li>Design visual hierarchies, layout, typography, and iconography</li> <li>Balance intuitiveness with innovation: make decisions on when to introduce new design patterns or rely on existing ones</li> <li>Contribute to and shape our UX team culture</li> <li>Contribute to and maintain our style guide and design principles</li> </ul> <strong>Experience/Skills:</strong>  <ul> <li>User experience research</li> <li>University degree or equivalent</li> <li>Past experience working on web applications</li> <li>Proficiency with current design and prototyping tools including Sketch, Illustrator, and Invision</li> <li>Comfortable whiteboarding and sketching thoughts, ideas, and problems</li> <li>Understand how and when to make tradeoffs, how to log design debt, and how to make incremental improvements</li> <li>Able to collaborate well and share ideas</li> <li>Constantly growing as a designer through feedback and reflection</li> </ul> <strong>Perks:</strong>  <ul> <li>You'll have a manager who coaches you through goal setting, frequent 1-on-1s, and real-time feedback</li> <li>Youll have tons of autonomy and responsibility; we have a results-driven environment</li> <li>Youll work in the heart of Torontos famous and trendy King West neighbourhood</li> <li>Youll learn more than you thought was possible; our team is obsessed with personal and professional growth (we even have a Loopio Book Club)</li> <li>Youll have a piece of the pie; every Loopio employee participates in our stock option plan!</li> <li>Youll participate in a health and benefits plan that kicks in on day one!</li> <li>The career growth opportunities are endless at a successful, early stage company</li> </ul>
Title: Senior UX Designer

Job_Description: <p>GALE is a business agency headquartered in New York with offices in Toronto and Bangalore. We’re passionate about delivering data-driven actionable insights, game changing creative, and top-tier technology to fuel great experiences. <br></p><p>Our team is connected by a set of core values that are important to us, and should be important to you. We’re driven by a passion to build something great, a desire to innovate, and a belief that our people should be treated like individuals, not resources.</p><p>We have killer office locations in New York, Toronto, and Bangalore. We offer an emphasis on growth and professional development, good benefits, and a flexible and fun working environment. We’re looking for great people to join our team!</p><strong>What you’ll be doing:</strong><ul> <li>Using a variety of tools and techniques brainstorm, iterate, and document multi-device ecosystems, user flows, and interactive prototypes.</li> <li>Design clear, beautiful interfaces for the web and mobile devices, facilitate collaboration with the broader team along the way, and present the rationale behind decisions to client stakeholders.</li> </ul><p><strong>Who you are:</strong></p><ul> <li>Love working with a team on a mission and are at your best when collaborating with technology and strategy folks to find elegant and practical solutions to tough design challenges.</li> <li>Love creating rough prototypes to generate ideas, and leave no detail unrefined in the finished product.</li> <li>By merging design, data & consumer insights into immersive digital experiences, you are always pushing your ideas beyond best practices. You love delivering innovation.</li> </ul><ul> <li>Academic background in design, research, technology, or a related field.</li> <li>Online portfolio of work demonstrating clean user interface design, ability to solve complex design challenges, and a thoughtful design process.</li> <li>Experienced in product design an asset. </li> <li>Minimum 4 years of experience designing digital experiences</li> </ul>
Title: Senior UX Designer

Job_Description: Evertz is looking for a user experience designer with strong interests and capabilities in the design and development of engaging user experiences. The ideal candidate will thrive in a work environment that requires strong problem solving skills and independent self-direction, combined with an aptitude for team collaboration and open communication. This individual shall excel at providing both highly analytical as well as highly creative ideas to a design engagement. The candidate will also have extensive experience in a fast-paced and innovative development environment and possess a thorough understanding of contemporary user-centered design methodologies. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities:</strong> <ul> <li>Design user workflows and experiences that are simple and elegant</li><li>Work closely with customers, design engineers and project management to create the best user experience possible</li><li>Design highly functional user interfaces using design research techniques, including in-field observations, customer feedback, usability testing, and other forms of design analytics</li><li>Build personas, storyboards, flowcharts, wireframes and prototypes</li><li>Effectively communicate conceptual ideas, detailed design, and design rationale both verbally and visually</li><li>Work closely with development teams to ensure that design specifications are implemented</li> </ul> <strong>Qualifications:</strong> <ul> <li>Bachelors Degree in Human-Computer Interaction, Interaction Design, or a related design discipline</li><li>Minimum 3 years experience creating impactful and attractive products</li><li>Solid understanding of visual design principles</li><li>Good communication skills to articulate creative and aesthetic choices to team members</li><li>Ability to multitask, prioritize projects, and communicate progress and expected milestones</li><li>Proven track record of maintaining quality of designs throughout all phases of a project</li><li>Proficiency with design and prototyping tools such as OmniGraffle, Axure or related tools</li> </ul> <strong>Desired Skills:</strong> <ul> <li>3D modeling, After Effects, Maya, Blender, rendering and animation</li><li>Model graphics design and production</li><li>Video and sound editing</li>  </ul>
Title: UX Designer

Job_Description: Buffalo David Bitton, une marque de renommée internationale avec une longue tradition de qualité et ayant son siège social à Montréal sur la rue Sauvé Ouest, cherche de nouveaux membres pour son équipe! Incarnant un style de vie unique, Buffalo David Bitton est une marque qui va au-delà des frontières. Créé en France et ensuite lancé à Montréal il y a plus de 30 ans, Buffalo David Bitton est une marque d’influence européenne qui s’étend maintenant à travers 18 pays et plus de 3000 points de vente. Nos principaux comptes clients incluent différentes grandes chaines américaines tels que Macy’s, Lord & Taylor, Dillard’s et la Baie d’Hudson au Canada, ainsi que des magasins spécialisés tels que Buckle, Jean Machine, Bootlegger, et bien plus encore. Buffalo David Bitton est une marque emblématique qui offre plusieurs styles de jeans, ainsi qu’une gamme complète de vêtements et d’accessoires modes. <br/><br/> Nous sommes présentement à la recherche d’une personne au profil dynamique qui a le goût de faire partie d’une équipe enrichissante et encadrée plusieurs professionnels de renom dans le domaine depuis des années qui vous guideront, vous aideront à vous épanouir professionnellement et vous transmettront leur passion pour la mode. À qui l’opportunité de se joindre à nous?! <br/><br/> <strong>Designer Graphique Web</strong> <br/><br/> Le Designer Graphique Web aura la responsabilité de l'apparence, la disposition et les fonctionnalités du site Web. Le travail consiste à comprendre à la fois la conception graphique et la programmation informatique. Une fois les déclinaisons pour le site Web sont créées, le concepteur aide à la maintenance et aux ajouts du site Web. Il travaillera avec des équipes de développement ou des experts pour maintenir le site à jour et prioriser les besoins, entre autres tâches. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsabilités :</strong> <ul> <li>Collaborer à la création de tous les aspects créatifs du site web, ainsi que tous les <em>réseaux markéting externes,</em> y compris mais non limité aux bannières et aux promotions, et ce, selon les normes relatives à l’image de la marque;</li><li>Maintenir les normes de conception visuelle: la conception de mise en page, la typographie, les promotions, les CTA (Call-to-action) ainsi que l'apparence et la convivialité du site web;</li><li>Collaborer avec tous les partenaires d’affaires sur la réalisation graphique de tous les projets numériques;</li><li>Créer et finaliser des fichiers graphiques précis;</li><li>Respecter les délais de production;</li><li>Respecter l’organisation et assurer l’entretien des fichiers départementaux sur le serveur. Suivre la convention établie pour la nomenclature des fichiers;</li><li>Effectuer toute production graphique, ainsi que la mise à jour du site web selon les procédures à suivre;</li><li>Collaborer avec l'équipe de développement web pour la gestion du contenu graphique en ligne;</li><li>Exercer d’autres fonctions au besoin.</li> </ul> *** <br/><br/> Buffalo David Bitton a global lifestyle brand with a long-standing tradition of quality located in Montreal is looking for new members for our team! Founded in France and brought to Montreal more than 30 years ago, to be developed with a European influence. The label now spans across 18 countries and more than 3000 locations. Key accounts include U.S. department stores Macy’s, Lord & Taylor, Dillards, Hudson Bay in Canada and specialty stores like Buckle, Jean Machine, Bootlegger and many more. Buffalo David Bitton is an iconic brand offering multiple denim styles and a full fashion collection. <br/><br/> We are currently looking for a dynamic person who is in need to be part of an expert team, managed by several renowned professionals in the field that will guide you, help you grow in fashion and share their passion for fashion. Who will have the opportunity to join us?! <br/><br/> <strong>Web Graphic Designer</strong> <br/><br/> The Web Graphic Designer will create the look, layout, and features of a website. The job involves understanding both graphic design and computer programming. Once the website assets are created, the designer helps with maintenance and additions to the website. He will work with development teams or experts for keeping the site up-to-date and prioritizing needs, among other tasks. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities:</strong> <ul> <li>Assist in the creation of all creative aspects of the website, as well as all external marketing networks, including but not limited to banners and promotions, and this according to the standards for the image of Buffalo David Bitton;</li><li>Maintain visual design standards: web page layout design, typography, promotions, CTA (Call-to-Action) and the look and feel of the website;</li><li>Work with all business partners on the graphics of all digital projects;</li><li>Create and finalize specific graphic files;</li><li>Meet deadlines production;</li><li>Respect the organization and ensure the maintenance of departmental files on the server. Follow the established convention for the file naming;</li> <li>Perform any graphic production, and update the website according to the procedures to follow;</li><li>Work with the web development team to manage the graphic content online;</li> <li>Performs other duties as required.</li> </ul> <strong>Compétences</strong> <strong>et aptitudes:</strong> <ul> <li>Certification en conception web, en design graphique ou équivalent, niveau Baccalauréat ou diplôme collégial;</li><li>Une année ou plus d’expérience en conception web/design graphique dans le secteur du commerce au détail, dans un environnement lié au commerce électronique ou au développement web;</li><li>Bilingue parlé et écrit (français, anglais);</li><li>Connaissances approfondies d’Adobe Créative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign, etc.) et Microsoft Suite (Word, Excel, etc.);</li><li>Compréhension du codage HTML/CSS et familier avec ses utilisations. Connaissance du codage responsive;</li><li>Avoir de solides compétences dans les notions de base graphique et typographie;</li><li>Connaissances approfondies en développement web lié au commerce électronique, avec de fortes habilités en conception/design et un goût certain pour la mode;</li><li>Solides compétences en communication orale et écrite;</li><li>Capacité de gérer plusieurs tâches simultanément et de porter attention aux détails;</li><li>Connaissance des tendances web actuelles et des meilleures techniques de conception UX/UI;</li> <li>Capacité de travailler dans un environnement au rythme rapide et en constante évolution. Capacité de s'adapter aux priorités changeantes selon les besoins organisationnels;</li><li>Capacité de toujours fournir un travail de haute qualité selon les échéances;</li><li>Avoir le sens de l'urgence-réactivité avec la capacité de gérer l’ambigüité;</li><li>Avoir un intérêt pour le domaine de la mode et de la vente, ainsi que le désir d'apprendre tous les aspects de la marque/entreprise;</li> <li>Capacité à travailler en équipe avec des intervenants de différent niveau de connaissance.</li> </ul> <strong>Atouts :</strong> <ul> <li>Connaissance avec le système de gestion de site web SAP/HYBRIS;</li><li>Connaissance des outils IBM;</li><li>Expérience en rédaction;</li><li>Expérience avec le montage audio et vidéo.</li> </ul> *** <br/><br/> <strong>Required skills and abilities:</strong> <ul> <li>Certified in web design, graphic design or equivalent. Bachelor or Collegiate degree;</li><li>1 year or more of experience in web design / graphic design in the retail trade sector in a linked environment for electronic commerce or web development;</li><li>Bilingual spoken and written (French, English);</li><li>Extensive knowledge of Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign, etc.) and Microsoft Suite (Word, Excel, etc.);</li><li>Understanding of and at ease with HTML / CSS coding and familiar with its uses. Knowledge of responsive design coding;</li><li>Have strong design fundamentals and typography skills;</li><li>Advanced knowledge in web development related to e-commerce, with strong skills in design / trends and a taste for fashion;</li><li>Strong skills in oral and written communication;</li><li>Ability to handle multiple tasks simultaneously and attention to detail;</li><li>Knowledge of current web trends and best design techniques UX / UI;</li><li>Ability to work in a constantly changing fast-paced environment. Ability to adapt to changing priorities according to organizational needs;</li><li>Ability to always provide high quality work according to deadlines;</li><li>Have a sense of urgency-reactivity with the ability to handle ambiguity;</li><li>Have an interest in the field of fashion and sales, as well as the desire to learn all aspects of the brand / company;</li><li>Ability to work in team with stakeholders from different levels of knowledge.</li> </ul> <strong>Assets:</strong> <ul> <li>Experience with SAP/HYBRIS user management system;</li><li>Experience using the IBM tools</li><li>Experience in copywriting</li> <li>Experience with editing for audio/video</li>  </ul> *** AVANTAGES *** <ul> <li>Temps plein (35 heures/sem);</li><li>Congés de maladie;</li><li>Horaires flexibles;</li><li>Horaires d'été;</li><li>Assurances collectives après 6 mois;</li><li>Cadeau d'anniversaire;</li><li>Régime enregistré d'épargne-retraite (REER) et Régime de participation différée aux bénéfices (RPDB);</li><li>Environnement de travail moderne, à proximité des magasins et du transport en commun;</li><li>Code vestimentaire décontracté;</li><li>Rabais aux employés.</li> </ul> *** ADVANTAGES *** <ul> <li>Full time (35 hours/week);</li><li>Sick days;</li><li>Flexible hours;</li><li>Summer hours;</li><li>Group insurance after 6 months;</li><li>Birthday present;</li><li>Registered Retirement Savings Plan (RRSP) and Deferred Profit Sharing Plan (DPSP);</li><li>Modern working environment, close to shops and public transport;</li><li>Casual dress code;</li><li>Employee Discounts.</li> </ul>
Title: Designer Graphique Web / Web Graphic Designer

Job_Description: TextNow is looking for a talented Sr. UX Designer to join our growing Design Team. Help us learn and understand our user’s needs, using those insights to craft powerful experiences used daily by millions of people. <br/><br/> <em><strong>Join us to make a BIG impact as part of the disrupting force that's changing telecommunications forever.</strong></em> <ul>  <li>Advocate for our users, obsessing over ways to make their experience intuitive and delightful.</li> <li>Research and utilize qualitative and quantitative data to inform design.</li> <li>Develop storyboards, wireframes, and prototypes to effectively communicate design ideas and interactions.</li> <li>Clearly communicate design rationale to product stakeholders.</li> <li>Refine existing products with a user-centric design approach.</li> </ul> <strong>Requirements</strong> <ul>  <li>A portfolio of design work that demonstrates experience taking complex tasks and turning them into intuitive products or features.</li>  <li>Experience designing interactions for iOS, Android, or Web.</li> <li>Degree in a design related field, or equivalent practical experience.</li> </ul> <strong>Preferred Qualifications</strong> <ul>  <li>Strong and clean visual design sense</li> <li>Demonstrated experience in designing usable interfaces for popular mobile-based products.</li> <li>Experience with A/B testing, analytics, marketing automation, and lifecycle campaigns.</li> <li>Experience with user research tools and processes</li> <li>Demonstrated passion for design with personal projects.</li> </ul> <strong>Feel like you can’t tick all the boxes above? If you have some of the skills and experience that we’re looking for and are willing to use your talent to learn the rest, we encourage you to apply!</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Benefits</strong> <ul>  <li>Impactful work</li> <li>Competitive total compensation package</li> <li>Catered breakfast & lunch</li> <li>Professional development</li> <li>Onsite personal trainer, massage therapist, and Yoga instructor!</li> </ul> <em>TextNow is committed to fostering a welcoming, accessible, respectful and inclusive environment ensuring equal access and participation for people with disabilities. We are committed to treating people with disabilities in a way that allows them to maintain their dignity and independence.</em> <br/><br/> <em>We believe in integration, and we are committed to meeting the needs of people with disabilities in a timely manner and creating a barrier-free environment. We will do so by removing and preventing barriers to accessibility and by meeting our accessibility requirements under Ontario’s accessibility laws. Please let us know if you have an accessibility need at accessibility@textnow.com</em>
Title: Senior UX Designer

Job_Description: <div><div></div></div><div><div><div>Intermediate Web Designer – Toronto, Canada | Freelance</div></div></div><div><div><div>Our client, a tech start up in downtown Toronto is seeking talented Web Designers/Developers for ongoing freelance work. This is a great opportunity for someone looking for steady freelance work with a possibility of working offsite (for the right candidate). This is also a great opportunity for someone looking to put some truly outstanding work in their portfolio and build a brand from the ground up. Design is more of the focus for this role but any Front End Development skills would be an asset. <br/><br/> <strong>Key Responsibilities:</strong>   <ul>  	<li>Lead the design for all web and mobile projects</li> <li>Create and implement visually appealing designs and interfaces</li> <li>Optimize your designs for usability and browser/server compatibility</li> </ul>  <strong>Required Qualifications:</strong>   <ul>  	<li>Expert knowledge in user experience, graphic design, and web standards</li> <li>Strong typography skills and a great eye for layout</li> <li>Experience in designing iOS interfaces</li> <li>Experience with coding in HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript</li> <li>Proficiency in Adobe Creative Suite</li> <li>Experience working on Agile teams</li> </ul>  <strong>The following skills would be a great addition:</strong>   <ul>  	<li>Awareness of Mercurial</li> <li>Awareness of Rails</li> <li>Know what LESS and SASS are and what they're about</li> </ul>  <strong>Please apply for this position through our Online Registration System.</strong> <br/><br/> We appreciate your interest but due to time constraints we can only contact candidates in consideration. Creative Niche is dedicated to matching outstanding communication, design and interactive professionals with the right companies. If you are not contacted for the current role(s) for which you have applied, please be confident that your application will be electronically filed for future searches. <br/><br/> In accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act, Creative Niche welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process for Ontario jobs. To request an accommodation, please contact Creative Niche.</div> </div></div><div></div>
Title: Intermediate Web Designer –

Job_Description: Are you interested in fintech, new technology and are passionate about solving complex problems? NestReady is building an innovative real estate platform that offers a personalized user experience for every step of the homebuying process. Together with financial institutions, we offer a seamless, convenient and empowering for the next generation of homebuyers. <br/><br/> NestReady is a well-funded startup, alumni of TechStars who were also awarded for “Best Startup in North America” from Next by Google Entrepreneur. <br/><br/> <strong>Who you are</strong> <br/><br/> We’re looking for individuals driven by growth and learning, and thrive in a fast-paced, sometimes ambiguous work environment. As NestReady, we are a dynamic team that values openness, dedication, excellence and fun in everything we do. For the right person, our environment is demanding, but ultimately very rewarding. If you’re up for the challenge we would love to hear from you. <br/><br/> <strong>What you’ll do</strong>  <ul>  <li>Become the user experience guru for our home buying web platform</li>    <li>Lead new feature creation targeted towards improving the homebuying experience</li>    <li>Analyze and optimize the product through user testing, A/B testing and UX research</li>    <li>Be part of the agile product design lifecycle, working with multiple stakeholders</li>    <li>Translate business requirements into simple flows/interactions and design interfaces</li>    <li>Create mockups, wireframes, prototypes, final visual design, and flows to represent your ideas</li>    <li>Ensure there is consistent design and UX language across products</li>    </ul> <strong>What you have</strong>  <ul>  <li>Genuine interest in startups, design and technology is a must</li>    <li>Experience is not mandatory, but passion, curiosity and drive are mandatory</li>    <li>Strong visual design skills and intuition towards user interface that people love</li>    <li>Ability to combine creative and analytical thinking to achieve design goals</li>    <li>Proficiency with Photoshop, Illustrator, InVision, Figma or other design tools</li>    <li>Ability to work well with ambiguity or when requirements are still in flux</li>    <li>Excellent communication and presentation skills that allow you to clearly communicate design decisions and write user specs</li>    </ul> <strong>It would be great if you had</strong>  <ul>  <li>Experience with InVision and Sketch or similar prototyping tool</li>    <li>Experience in UX research and user testing</li>    <li>Experience working with Google Analytics and A/B testing</li>    </ul> <strong>What we offer</strong>  <ul>  <li>Flexible work schedule</li>    <li>Additional paid week off between Christmas and New Years</li>    <li>Apple equipment</li>    <li>Referral Bonus</li>    <li>Open office environment with standing desks</li>    <li>Free coffee, snacks, and drinks</li>    <li>Company sponsored team events</li>    <li>Opportunity to grow your career</li>    </ul> <strong>We would love to see your work along with your application! Please provide a portfolio of 3-4 examples of the work you are most proud of.</strong> <br/><br/> ******************************************************************** <br/><br/> Êtes-vous intéressé par les fintech, les nouvelles technologies et êtes-vous passionné par la résolution de problèmes complexes? NestReady construit une plate-forme immobilière innovante qui offre une expérience utilisateur personnalisée pour chaque étape du processus d'achat d'une maison. En collaboration avec les institutions financières, nous offrons une solution transparente, pratique et habilitante pour la prochaine génération d'acheteurs. <br/><br/> NestReady est une start-up bien financée, des anciens élèves de TechStars qui ont également été récompensés pour la «Meilleure Startup en Amérique du Nord» par Next par Google Entrepreneur. <br/><br/> Nous recherchons des individus motivés par la croissance et l'apprentissage, et nous nous développons dans un environnement de travail rapide et parfois ambigu. En tant que NestReady, nous sommes une équipe dynamique qui valorise l'ouverture, le dévouement, l'excellence et le plaisir dans tout ce que nous faisons. Pour la bonne personne, notre environnement est exigeant, mais finalement très enrichissant. Si vous êtes prêt à relever le défi, nous aimerions avoir de vos nouvelles. <br/><br/> <strong>Vos tâches</strong>  <ul>  <li>Devenez le gourou de l'expérience utilisateur pour notre plateforme web d'achat de maison</li>    <li>Diriger la création de nouvelles fonctionnalités visant à améliorer l'expérience de l'achat d'une maison</li>    <li>Analyser et optimiser le produit à l'aide de tests utilisateur, de tests A / B et de recherche UX</li>    <li>Participez au cycle de vie de la conception de produits agiles, en travaillant avec plusieurs parties prenantes</li>    <li>Traduire les besoins métier en flux / interactions simples et en interfaces de conception</li>    <li>Créez des maquettes, des wireframes, des prototypes, un design visuel final et des flux pour représenter vos idées</li>    <li>Assurez-vous que la conception et le langage UX sont uniformes pour tous les produits</li>    </ul> <strong></strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Ce que nous recherchons</strong>  <ul>  <li>Un véritable intérêt pour les startups, le design et la technologie est un must</li>    <li>L'expérience n'est pas obligatoire, mais la passion, la curiosité et le dynamisme sont obligatoires</li>    <li>Fortes compétences en conception visuelle et intuition envers l'interface utilisateur que les gens aiment</li>    <li>Capacité à combiner la pensée créative et analytique pour atteindre les objectifs de conception</li>    <li>Maîtrise de Photoshop, Illustrator, InVision, Figma ou d'autres outils de conception</li>    <li>Capacité de bien travailler avec l'ambiguïté ou lorsque les besoins sont en constante évolution</li>    <li>Excellentes compétences de communication et de présentation qui vous permettent de communiquer clairement les décisions de conception et d'écrire les spécifications de l'utilisateur</li>    </ul> <strong>Les atouts qui vous placeront en tête</strong>  <ul>  <li>Expérience avec InVision et Sketch ou un outil de prototypage similaire</li>    <li>Expérience dans la recherche UX et les tests utilisateur</li>    <li>Expérience de travail avec Google Analytics et tests A / B</li>    </ul> Nous aimerions voir votre travail avec votre application! S'il vous plaît fournir un portefeuille de 3-4 exemples du travail dont vous êtes le plus fier. <br/><br/> <strong>Ce que nous offrons</strong>  <ul>  <li>Horaire de travail flexible</li>    <li>Congés payés supplémentaires entre Noël et le Nouvel An</li>    <li>Équipement Apple</li>    <li>Bonus de parrainage</li>    <li>Environnement de bureau ouvert avec des bureaux debout</li>    <li>Café gratuit, collations et boissons</li>    <li>Événements d'équipe sponsorisés par la société</li>    <li>Possibilité de faire croître votre carrière</li>    </ul>
Title: UX Designer / Designer UX

Job_Description: <strong>We are EA</strong> <br/> And we make games how cool is that? In fact, we entertain millions of people across the globe with the most amazing and immersive interactive software in the industry. But making games is hard work. Thats why we employ the most creative, passionate people in the industry. <br/><br/> The EA Sports NHL series is a critically acclaimed sports video game franchise that has received numerous accolades over the past 20 years. The team is comprised of passionate, talented people that strive to create and deliver the most realistic simulation hockey experience available on the market today. <br/><br/> <strong>The Role: Lead UI Engineer</strong> <br/> The UI Engineer is a critical part of the game creation process. They are involved in architectural design, implementation, and debugging of UI features in partnership with Designers, Artists and other Engineers to solve complex problems. The successful candidate will need excellent leadership skills, as well as the ability to work with large and distributed teams. <br/><br/> <strong>Key Responsibilities</strong>   <ul> <li>Bring the vision of the UI Artist/Designer to life</li> <li>Design, author, maintain and document UI systems that meet all design, technical and schedule requirements</li> <li>Collaborate with technical leadership and other engineers to help establish overall technical design and architecture</li> <li>Collaborate with designers and content creators to brainstorm solutions that satisfy design and content requirements</li> <li>Troubleshoot any UI issues.</li> <li>Profile and optimize UI performances</li> <li>Work closely with the production staff in building and maintaining realistic schedules and identifying dependencies;</li> <li>Coordinate with QA and leads to ensure successful roll out of new features to the team and establish testing and maintenance of systems</li> <li>Collaborate with other disciplines (art, design, sound) in implementing the UI</li> <li>Identify technical and environmental risks/obstacles and generate solutions to overcome identified risks</li> <li>Work alongside QA and the UI Artist/Designer to react to feedback from focus groups and usability studies</li> </ul>  <strong>Required Technical Skills and Experience</strong>   <ul> <li>Bachelors degree in computer science or related field, or equivalent training and professional experience</li> <li>Proficiency with C++</li> <li>Experience in object-oriented design and implementation</li> <li>Experience developing complex UI systems for a published game.</li> <li>Experience with the release process including working on systems related to localization, certification and asset management.</li> <li>Demonstrated knowledge of good software programming practices</li> <li>Excellent detail-oriented, problem solving skills must be able to quickly identify issues and resolve them</li> </ul>  <strong>Preferred Skills and Experience:</strong>   <ul> <li>The ideal candidate has designed and implemented major UI systems for at least one published video game title; and has a minimum of three years of technical experience in the video game or related industry</li> <li>Experience working with Flash based UI middleware, like Scaleform or GameSWF</li> <li>Experience with scripting languages (Perl, Python, Lua, Ruby) and interpreted languages (C#, Java)</li> <li>Avid gamer with a passion for creating top-quality games</li> <li>Understanding of UI ergonomics and how to make an interface intuitive.</li> </ul>  <strong>Performance Competencies (Non-Technical Skills)</strong>   <ul> <li>Excellent verbal and written communication skills</li> <li>Excellent decision-making capabilities</li> <li>Ability and desire to work with other game developers in a cooperative team environment</li> <li>Ability to quickly learn and apply new concepts, principles and solutions</li>  <strong><li>Demonstrates dependability and commitment to projects/tasks <br/><br/> <strong>Benefits:</li> </ul>  </strong> <br/> We are proud of the great perks we offer like comprehensive health and benefit packages, tuition reimbursement, pension with company match and, of course, free video games. We offer competitive compensation packages and a culture that thrives on creativity and individuality. <br/><br/> <strong>We Thought You Might Also Want to Know:</strong> <br/> More about our location: http://careers.ea.com/our-locations/burnaby-eav <br/> Contact me: Jesenka Duranovic, Senior Recruiter; jduranovic@ea.com
Title: NHL - Lead UI Engineer

Job_Description: BioWare's vision is to create, deliver, and evolve the most emotionally engaging games in the world. <br/><br/> BioWare is a division of EA. Currently announced projects at BioWare include the newly revealed IP Anthem: a shared-world action RPG, the ongoing support of the Mass Effect franchise: one of the highest rated video game series of all time, Dragon Age: Inquisition, the latest entry in the Dragon Age franchise, and Star Wars : The Old Republic: a story-driven massively multiplayer online game. <br/><br/> <strong>Principal UX Designer</strong> <br/><br/> The ideal candidate will have previous experience working within console or mobile applications and a strong understanding of current best practices for interface and interaction design. This candidate will also have experience working directly with Visual Designers and Engineers to translate high level product requirements into designs that deliver compelling user experiences. <br/><br/> Duties and responsibilities: <ul> <li>Oversee user experience (UX) design of features from conception to launch;</li><li>Collaborate closely with a growing global UX team;</li><li>Employ user-centered design practices to create world class interactive experiences;</li><li>Develop detailed wireframes, flowcharts, mockups, and other product deliverables to effectively communicate designs and produce requirements;</li><li>Mentor peers, stakeholders and teammates on user centered design principles and methodologies;</li><li>Observe usability testing and focus groups to validate interaction design and product direction;</li><li>Champion UX design team initiatives such as creation of design guidelines, process enhancements, toolkits, etc. fostering a user-centered culture;</li><li>Thrive in a fast-paced work environment requiring independent self-direction with an aptitude for team collaboration and open communication.</li> </ul> Qualifications <ul> <li>Bachelors degree in Interaction Design, Human Factors, Industrial Design/Engineering, Arts or related HCI discipline, or demonstrated proficiency and experiences in the field of software user experience / interaction design;</li><li>5+ years of relevant experience in UX design for console or mobile applications;</li><li>Experience in game development;</li><li>Proficiency in UX design tools;</li><li>Strong creative problem solver who challenges the status quo;</li><li>Highly motivated self-starter, capable of operating with minimal management oversight;</li><li>Strong passion for gaming.</li><li>English is the required language of work.</li> </ul> The ideal candidates portfolio will demonstrate: <ul> <li>Excellent conceptual and problem solving skills illustrating an iterative design process</li><li>Strong knowledge of interaction design process as applied to mobile and console products</li><li>Case studies highlighting user centered design research and its impact on design solutions</li><li>Examples of wireframes, low and high fidelity prototypes and information architecture mapping</li> </ul> Benefits: <br/> We are proud of the great perks we offer like comprehensive health and benefit packages, tuition reimbursement, pension with company match and, of course, free video games. We offer competitive compensation packages and a culture that thrives on creativity and individuality. <br/><br/> Health, Dental, Financial offered (ESPP and RRSP matching); Relocation assistance also offered. <br/> Eligible for salary increases, bonuses, and restricted stock units at companys discretion <br/><br/> More about our location: http://careers.ea.com/our-locations/edmonton <br/><br/> Contact me: Shanda Wood, shandaw@bioware.com 780-430-0164 ext 51718 <br/><br/> Address: BioWare ULC, Suite 200 4445 Calgary Trail, Edmonton, Alberta, T6H 5R7 <br/><br/> Salary offered: $90,000 to $120,000 <br/><br/> Full time, permanent position.
Title: Principle UX Designer*

Job_Description: <div> <strong>Company Description</strong> <br/> <div>Vlocity is a fast-growing enterprise applications company focused on bringing industry-specific business processes to the cloud. With 400 employees around the world and customers on six continents, Vlocity has been the fastest-growing independent software vendor on the Salesforce platform for two years running. Vlocity is currently shipping version 18 of its application suite, and has raised over $100MM in capital from investors including Salesforce.com, Accenture and Sutter Hill Ventures. <br/><br/> Vlocity develops software to help communications, media & energy providers, insurance carriers and government agencies digitally engage customers through their channels and devices of choice. We serve dozens of the worlds Fortune 5000 companies including Sky Italia, Telecom Italia, TELUS, 3, Telecom Argentina, Cellcom, New York Life, Farmers Insurance, Harvard Pilgrim, and Anthem. Our solutions run on our customers web sites, in their contact centers and on the mobile devices of their service and sales professionals providing a compelling, modern, omnichannel experience. Despite the complexity and sophistication of the enterprise business processes we enable, we believe the user experience should be as simple and compelling as a consumer application.</div>  <br/><strong>Job Description</strong> <br/> <div> <div> <div>Vlocity Inc is picking up speed and looking to expand its Customer Success team by hiring talented and enthusiastic UI Developers. <br/><br/> In the cloud, presentation is definitely king. Our customers expect easy-to-use applications that drive down agent handling times, enhance the user experience and integrate seamlessly with their other systems and tools. <br/><br/> And thats where you come in! Youll help us bring the wow factor to our customer deployments - enhancing the native UI of the Vlocity product to deliver user friendly, innovative and beautiful web and mobile apps that are tailored and branded for the specific customer. <br/><br/> Leveraging the powerful capabilities of the Vlocity toolkit, as well as the increasing palette of web development tools, youll be responsible for designing and implementing front-end functional deliverables that are highly usable, scalable, extensible, and maintainable. <br/><br/> You will be working closely with the customer to optimize and customize their UI flows, web design and front end development. <br/><br/> And youll be working with our Product and Engineering teams to help them drive innovation into future releases of Vlocity products.</div> <br/><strong><em>Qualifications</em></strong><br/> <div>   <ul> <li>Youll have 3+ years experience of working on deployment teams, ideally using Agile development techniques</li> <li>Youll have a proven track record of customer-centric development, with an emphasis on delivery</li> <li>Youll be passionate about developing apps that are both eye-catching and intuitive</li> <li>Ideally, you will have extensive experience of building applications in at least one of our industries - telecommunications, media, insurance, healthcare or public sector</li> <li>Youll be a self-starter, adept at picking up new skills and technologies, and eager to break new ground</li> <li>Youll have excellent communication skills, equally comfortable with crafting emails as leading a white-board discussion with customers, or delivering a functional demo</li> <li>Youll have the vision to help us take our company to the next level</li> </ul> <strong><em>Technical Skills</em></strong>  <ul> <li>AngularJS</li> <li>HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript and more</li> <li>Salesforce (Visualforce, Apex, Lightning)</li> </ul> <strong><em>Desired Certifications / Qualifications</em></strong>  <ul> <li>Bachelors or Masters degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering or a related field</li> <li>Salesforce Platform Developer / Platform App Builder</li> </ul>  </div> </div> </div> </div>  <br/>
Title: UI Developer (Salesforce/AngularJS)

Job_Description: <div><div><strong> <br/> Tenure-Track/Tenured, Assistant/Associate Professor, Advertising, Faculty of Design</strong><br/>  <div> <div> Job Category <br/>  <br/> <strong> <br/> Faculty and Non-Credit Instructors</strong> </div>  <br/><div> Job Code <br/>  <br/> <strong>1273</strong> </div> </div> </div>  <br/>Apply Now</div>  <br/><div>OCAD University (OCAD U), Canada’s university of the imagination, provides a vibrant and stimulating environment for its faculty and students. Committed to excellence and contemporary approaches to education, OCAD U offers seventeen undergraduate programs, seven graduate programs, and a variety of continuing education courses in art, media and design. OCAD U is currently seeking outstanding, creative researchers/practitioners and gifted, collaborative teachers to augment its professoriate in this tenure-track/tenured opportunity. It is an exciting time to join the OCAD U community as the University is at a key stage in its institutional transformation, with its Creative City Campus capital project and the implementation of its Academic Plan with six guiding principles: decolonization, diversity and equity, sustainability, valuing faculty, interdisciplinarity and health and wellness. <br/><br/> <strong>FACULTY OF DESIGN</strong> <br/> <strong>TENURE-TRACK/TENURED POSITION</strong> <br/> <strong>ASSISTANT/ASSOCIATE PROFESSOR: ADVERTISING</strong> <br/><br/> The Faculty of Design invites applications from outstanding Advertising practitioners/scholars for a full-time tenure-track/tenured faculty position at the Assistant to Associate Professor level in Advertising. With a focus on critical perspectives and application in Advertising, the position would support our current efforts to build a faculty with the practical, theoretical and methodological versatility to advance the program and contribute to our efforts to decolonize our practices. This position is to commence on August 1, 2018 and is subject to budgetary approval. <br/><br/> The Advertising program delivers a studio-based education, steeped in critical thinking in the fundamentals of advertising principles and theories, alongside effective solutions in the digital world. The Advertising curriculum at OCAD U engages students in design communication experiences in response to strategic business objectives. These are built upon strong research methods and contemporary digital studio practice. The vision of the program is to graduate advertising professionals capable of responding to a future where advertising communications are sustainable, responsible and ethical, messages that engage in issues of decolonization, diversity, inclusion and equity: what we describe as Respectful Design. The program has been developed to advance current Advertising study to meet the needs of varied industry and community-driven pathways such as integrated, digital, UX/UI, brand narratives, strategic planning, consumer research, influencer advertising, experiential design, art direction, content marketing, production, design copywriting, and social media. <br/><br/> The pedagogical focus of the candidate will be studio-based practice for undergraduates. The candidate will demonstrate critical understanding of historical and contemporary advertising practices and issues as they relate to decolonization, diversity, equity, and sustainability. <br/><br/> Candidates should submit their interest in response to one or more of the following categories of practice:   <ul> <li>Digital Advertising that builds on experience-based communication design strategies that embrace Indigenous and/or racialized communities;</li>  <li>Two and three-dimensional brand applications through UX/UI design, implementation and materialization, including computer supported design and digital fabrication that support communications to Indigenous and/or racialized communities;</li>  <li>Critical and decolonizing historical and contemporary media landscapes of convergent culture, consumer behavior, and social influence.</li> </ul>  <strong>SUMMARY OF RESPONSIBILITIES</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>The successful candidate will:</strong>   <ul> <li>teach primarily across multiple year levels in the Advertising Program with opportunities to teach across other undergraduate programs, and associated interdisciplinary graduate programs;</li>  <li>assume a key role in the ongoing development of the Advertising Program and cross-disciplinary curriculum, policies and promotion, participating in Faculty and Program meetings and initiatives;</li>  <li>maintain an active research program, professional practice and/or scholarship within relevant discipline;</li>  <li>perform course outline development, studio preparation, and course delivery, inclusive of lectures, critiques, grading, mid-term evaluations and final evaluations/reviews, including responsibility for health & safety and meeting academic and curricular requirements and deadlines;</li>  <li>provide service to the faculty and University-wide governance system, as well as participate in building the University community and promoting the quality of student life and University culture.</li> </ul>  <strong>QUALIFICATIONS</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>The ideal candidate will have:</strong>   <ul> <li>a Master’s degree in a related design or advertising fields or equivalent experiences; a PhD is considered an asset;</li>  <li>a proven record of at least two years teaching at the post-secondary level, or equivalent experiences, and demonstrated excellence in studio-based curriculum development in Advertising and communications; previous experience teaching in interdisciplinary programs, and teaching and supervising graduate students will be considered assets;</li>  <li>a critical knowledge of advertising history, theory and practice; within two or more of the categories of practice listed above;</li>  <li>have experience in Omni channel application of integrated messaging, narrative and brand storytelling across channels of influence and engagement in 2D and/or 3D brand applications;</li>  <li>a high level of expertise and national reputation in one or more of the fields of practice mentioned along with a recognized body of work demonstrating expertise in integrated contemporary advertising practices;</li>  <li>a proven record of professional practice and/or research relevant to qualifications, experience and discipline of tenure-track status;</li>  <li>experience proactively advancing decolonization, equity and sustainability in curriculum, teaching, scholarship, and creative/professional activities;</li>  <li>demonstrated understanding of the ways in which equity, Indigenous knowledge, and sustainability are fundamental to the quality of student experience, to innovative scholarship, and to integrated advertising communications;</li>  <li>a proven record of promoting a respectful and inclusive work and learning environment for students, staff, and faculty.</li> </ul>  <strong>REMUNERATION</strong> <br/><br/> Salary and rank will be commensurate with experience and qualifications with access to full benefits, and pension contribution after one year of service. <br/><br/> <strong>APPLICATION DEADLINE</strong> <br/><br/> Applications should include: a letter of intent stating the candidate’s interests in the areas of teaching, research/professional practice, and service to Faculty- and University-wide governance; a curriculum vitae; a statement of teaching philosophy that responds to the profile of the position; evidence of teaching effectiveness (such as sample assignments, student feedback, course evaluations, etc.); a digital portfolio of recent work/publications (if applicable); and the names and contact information of three referees. <br/><br/> Interested applicants are invited to submit their application in confidence, addressed to Chair, Advertising Tenured/Tenure-Track Search Committee, Faculty of Design online by licking the "Apply Now" button below <br/><br/> <strong>The review of applications will begin on Friday, February 2, 2018 and will continue until the position is filled.</strong> <br/><br/> As an institution committed to art, design, digital media and related scholarship, OCAD University (OCAD U) recognizes the profound and essential value that diversity brings to the creation, reception and circulation of creative practices and discourse. OCAD U understands that valuing diverse creative practices and forms of knowledge are essential to, and enrich the institution’s core mission and vision as an art and design university with a local and global scope. <br/><br/> As an employer committed to employment equity, we encourage applications from members of equity-seeking communities including women, racialized and Indigenous persons, persons with disabilities, and persons of all sexual orientations and gender identities/expressions. <strong>We encourage members of equity-seeking groups to self-identify within the voluntary Applicant Questionnaire.</strong> <br/><br/> <strong> In order to alleviate the under-representation of racialized and Indigenous tenured/tenure-track faculty, priority in hiring will be given to qualified racialized and Indigenous persons who self-identify as such in the application process. This initiative is a special program under the Ontario Human Rights Code.</strong> <br/><br/> OCAD U is committed to providing an inclusive and barrier free experience to applicants with accessibility needs. Requests for accommodation can be made at any stage during the recruitment process. Please contact Human Resources for more information or refer to OCAD U’s Policy of Accommodation in Employment for Persons with Disabilities <br/><br/> All qualified persons are encouraged to apply; however, Canadians and permanent residents of Canada will be given priority. While we thank all candidates for their interest, only those short-listed will be contacted.</div>
Title: Tenure-Track/Tenured, Assistant/Associate Professor, Advertising, Faculty of Design

Job_Description: Web UI Designer <br/> Long-term contract in Toronto <br/><br/> Texas Instruments is seeking a passionate Web UI Designer to join our growing studio team to enhance the customer experience for our engineering community. Your expertise in interaction design will bring value to our multiple teams focused on various aspects of our company B-to-B website including: application design, Pattern Library, template design and ecommerce. We empower our team to raise the bar for TI.com by having an open, collaborative environment that encourages growth, autonomy and leadership. <br/><br/> We look forward to meeting with you and sharing how our team has evolved into a valuable partner in the TI.com customer experience. Our office is conveniently located in downtown Toronto steps from Union Station. <br/><br/> <strong>You will be:</strong> <br/><br/> Designing customer-centric solutions for desktop and mobile <br/> Prototyping concepts in InVision and effectively communicating your ideas, listening to feedback, recognizing competing inputs and priorities, and evolving ideas <br/> Building designs/components with HTML and SASS/SCSS <br/> Managing tasks in an Agile environment <br/> Designing solutions that incorporate customer needs, business goals and industry best practices <br/> Building and evolving existing standards or creating new UI patterns to contribute to our Pattern Library <br/> Influencing and leading constructive dialogues with team members and stakeholders <br/> Communicating and working effectively with remote stakeholders and team members <br/> A design advocate, elevating the quality of work and adding design thinking into your practice <br/> Pushing for design excellence within project parameters <br/><br/> <strong>Must have:</strong> <br/><br/> 2+ years of recent interactive designexperience designing and building websites <br/> Intermediate to advanced HTML/CSS skills for cross-browser compatibility (Chrome, Firefox, and IE) <br/> Strong online portfoliodemonstrating a range of relevant work is essential. <br/> Solid understanding of user experience design principles <br/> Strong organizational skillsused to prioritize, multi-task, and meet tight deadlines. <br/> Excellent interpersonal skills with the ability to communicate and work in both a team setting and individually <br/> Be located in the Toronto area with the ability to work in the office. <br/><br/> All interested applicants should send their resume, portfolio link and cover letter to torontojobs@ti.com.
Title: Web UI Designer - contract
