Job_Description: <strong>A Little About Us:</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Making fans</strong> - Thats what were all about! Since our humble beginnings in 2011, these two words have driven <strong>Big Viking Games</strong> to become the successful company it is today. With over 100 Vikings already on board, and studios in both Toronto, ON and London, ON, we are focused on making our mark by building awesome free-to-play mobile and social games. Big Viking Games has proudly amassed millions of loyal fans across its many popular titles with no signs of slowing down anytime soon. We believe that by investing in our employees and in new technologies, such as HTML5, we can continue our success for years to come. With that in mind, we are on the hunt for exceptional talent to join our growing team, and thats where you come in! <br/><br/> <strong>The Nitty Gritty:</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Big Viking Games</strong> is looking to grow out our team of Artists with an Intermediate UI Designer If youre an experienced UI Designer and want to create assets for our Worlds division, you just may be the perfect match for our Viking Horde. Reporting to the Art Production Manager, this role can be based at either of our <strong>London, ON or Toronto, ON</strong> studios. <br/><br/> <strong>The Duties:</strong>  <ul> <li>Work closely with Product Managers, Producers, Art Director and Game Designers to develop UI workflow and design.</li> <li>Work with wireframes to create mockups and final designs for proper implementation.</li> <li>Create frontend user interface, in-game HUD, and additional in-game art.</li> <li>Prioritize deadlines while working on multiple projects simultaneously.</li> <li>Foster and maintain effective relationships with your teammates and fellow Vikings.</li> <li>Keep up to date with the latest UI design and usability trends and techniques.</li> </ul> <strong>The Must Haves:</strong>  <ul> <li>A minimum of 3 years working experience in the gaming industry, preference is given to those that have previously worked in the social gaming space.</li> <li>Previous experience creating UI assets/animations for mobile games using Adobe Animate (Flash) or equivalent GUI editor and pipeline.</li> <li>Graduate from a Design Program such as Graphic Design, Multimedia Design or equivalent experience.</li> <li>Skill in creating clean and clear iconography and typography.</li> <li>A strong background in graphic design and art fundamentals including excellent colour theory, layout, typography, visual hierarchy and composition skills.</li> <li>A portfolio that demonstrates a range of high-quality UI screens.</li> <li>Samples of wireframes and ability to understand the user interactions with screens/games</li> <li>Information hierarchy and data visualization samples in UI portfolio.</li> <li>Ability to adhere to the established creative direction and perform under pressure to meet deadlines.</li> <li>Strong understanding of mobile and interactive design fundamentals.</li> <li>Advanced communication and interpersonal skills.</li> <li>Strong working knowledge of the Adobe Creative Suite.</li> <li>A passion for games with an understanding of top grossing mobile gaming products.</li> </ul> <strong>The Nice to Haves:</strong>  <ul> <li>An understanding/passion for marketing and branding.</li> <li>Previously shipped games, ideally mobile.</li> <li>An understanding of statistics, analytics and AB testing.</li> <li>Familiarity with Agile work environments.</li> <li>Prototyping</li> <li>Clickable Wireframes</li> <li>Experience with Axure, Invision or similar</li> <li>Experience with HTML</li> </ul> <strong>The Loot:</strong>  <ul> <li>Competitive salary, Group Retirement Savings Plan matching, and participation in the Employee Stock Option Plan.</li> <li>Comprehensive benefits package (health, dental, and vision), including generous time off policies.</li> <li>Stocked kitchen, unlimited snacks and beverages, along with breakfast and daily hot lunches. Vikings can't work on an empty stomach!</li> <li>Lots of other great perks such as frequent company paid outings, events and get-togethers.</li> </ul> <strong>Becoming a Viking:</strong> <br/><br/> Does the idea of working for a gaming company doing what you love everyday sound exciting? Great, wed love to hear from you! Send us your resume and cover letter <br/><br/> Big Viking Games is committed to providing accommodations for people with disabilities. If you require an accommodation, we will work with you to meet your needs. Accommodation may be provided in all parts of the hiring process. For More information regarding accessibility, please visit our Accessibility webpage.
Title: UI Designer

Job_Description: <strong>Worker Sub-Type:</strong><br/><br/>Student (Fixed Term)<br/><br/><strong><strong><strong> Job Description:</strong></strong></strong> <br/><br/> <strong>POSITION SUMMARY</strong> <br/><br/> This student position will be part of the BlackBerry User Experience Design team. The successful candidate will support design activities in the areas of interaction design, visual design, motion design and user research. We are looking for someone who can thrive in a fast paced, collaborative environment with a high attention to detail and understands the value of a user centered design process. The successful candidate must be self-driven, a team player, a strong communicator and comfortable interfacing regularly with other teams. <br/><br/> Location: Waterloo, ON <br/><br/> Length of Term: 8 Months <br/><br/> <strong>ROLES AND RESPONSIBILITES</strong> <ul> <li>Ability to sketch out early design concepts and create wireframes that clearly demonstrate user experiences connected to defined problems and opportunity areas for various mobile applications</li><li>Translate early design concepts and wireframes into final design specifications following design guidelines</li><li>Support primary user research, usability and trends research to inform various design activities</li><li>Regular interaction with Product and Development organizations to understand needs, share and review design work and assess design feasibility.</li> </ul> <strong>SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS</strong> <ul> <li>Currently pursuing a post-secondary education in Design or related field of study</li><li>Proficiency in Adobe Creative Suite and Invision</li><li>Show user interface and/or visual design skills with a demonstrated portfolio</li><li>Demonstrate experience and/or knowledge of user research methods and analysis of research inputs</li><li>Ability to formulate and distill design rationale for your work</li><li>High attention to detail</li><li>Demonstrated ability to take initiative and responsibility in a fast paced team environment</li><li>Excellent verbal and written communication skills</li> </ul> <strong>ADDITIONAL ASSETS</strong> <ul> <li>Experience designing for mobile platforms.</li> </ul> <strong>Please include relevant portfolio materials with your application.</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Job Family Group Name:</strong><br/><br/>Business Practices & Operations<br/><br/><strong>Scheduled Weekly Hours:</strong><br/><br/>40
Title: UX Design Student - 8 Month Fall Term

Job_Description: RESPONSIBILITIES <ul> <li>Support the Director of Design and the Lead UX Designer with designing a well defined digital product for SSENSE</li> <li>Work closely with a team of Engineers and Product Managers in project sprints</li><li>Define and iterate UX with rapid prototyping</li><li>Create wireframes and mockups with multiple media size views</li><li>Propose innovative product features and interactions</li><li>Inform Design with analytics and other user data to create programmatic solutions</li><li>Ensure visibility on design problems on both a micro and macro level, from concrete tasks to higher-level abstract concerns</li><li>Collaborate with the Product, Technology and User Experience teams to provide Web and interaction design mockups for online projects and features</li><li>Work cross-functionally on all projects</li> </ul> REQUIREMENTS <ul> <li>Bachelor of Fine Arts or Bachelor of Design, an asset</li><li>A minimum of 1 years progressive experience in design for digital products</li><li>Agency or start-up experience preferred, e-commerce experience an asset</li><li>Solid experience in user-centered design, testing methodologies and subsystems, as well as usability and accessibility concerns</li><li>Experience in Sketch and the Adobe CC Suite</li><li>Experience with Framer.js, Origami, or other prototyping applications or frameworks, an asset</li><li>Passionate about all things UX and other areas of design and innovation</li><li>Research and showcase knowledge of the industry’s latest trends and technologies</li><li>Comprehensive understanding of internet standards and interactivity</li><li>Ability to work in a testing environment, subjecting design proposals to performance and user testing</li><li>Experience in highly creative industries, an asset</li><li>International experience, an asset</li> </ul> SKILLS <ul> <li>Mature appreciation of the balance between creativity, commerce and utility</li><li>Strong interest in fashion, an asset</li><li>Creative thinker with a proven track record for innovation</li><li>Ability to excel in a deadline-driven environment</li><li>Ability to articulate and present creative ideas</li><li>Team player</li> </ul> ---------- <br/><br/> Relevant du Directeur du design, le Designer UX se joindra à une équipe de concepteurs graphiques talentueux responsables du design et de la livraison de produits à l’équipe de développement. Il/Elle participera au design de produits numériques clairement définis et avant-gardistes pour SSENSE, avec un emphase particulier sur l’interface utilisateur, l’expérience utilisateur et le design visuel. <br/><br/> RESPONSABILITÉS <ul> <li>Soutenir le Directeur du design et le Designer UX principal dans la conception de produits numériques clairement définis pour SSENSE</li> <li>Travailler étroitement avec une équipe d’Ingénieurs et de Gestionnaires de produit sur des sprints e projet</li><li>Définir et itérer UX avec prototypage rapide</li><li>Créer des maquettes fonctionnelles avec de multiples spécifications selon les besoins de chaque écran</li> <li>Proposer de manière proactive des caractéristiques et interactions de produit novatrices</li> <li>Informer l’équipe du design des analyses et d’autres données utilisateurs pour créer des solutions programmatiques</li><li>Assurer la visibilité sur les problèmes de design au niveau micro et macro, des tâches concrètes aux inquiétudes abstraites de plus haut niveau</li> <li>Collaborer avec les équipes de Produit, Technologie et Expérience utilisateur afin de fournir des maquettes de design Web et d’interaction pour les projets et articles éditoriaux en ligne</li> <li>Travailler avec les autres départements sur divers projets</li> </ul> EXIGENCES <ul> <li>Baccalauréat en Beaux-arts ou en Design, un atout</li><li>Un minimum de 1 années d’expérience progressive en design pour des produits numériques</li> <li>Expérience en agence ou dans une entreprise en démarrage préférée, expérience e-commerce un atout</li><li>Solide expérience en design centré sur l’utilisateur, méthodes d’essai et sous-système, ainsi qu’avec les questions de convivialité et d’accessibilité</li> <li>Expérience avec Sketch et la suite Adobe CC</li> <li>Expérience avec Framer.js, Origami, ou d’autres applications ou systèmes de prototypage, un atout</li><li>Passionné de tout ce qui touche à l’expérience utilisateur (UX) et d’autres domaines du design et de l’innovation</li><li>Bonne connaissance des dernières tendances et technologies de l’industrie</li> <li>Solide compréhension des normes de l’internet et de l’interactivité</li><li>Capacité à travailler dans un environnement de test, soumettant des propositions de design à des essais utilisateur et de performance</li> <li>Expérience dans les industries hautement créatives, un atout</li><li>Expérience internationale, un atout</li> </ul> COMPÉTENCES <ul> <li>Appréciation mature de la balance entre la créativité, le commerce et l’utilité</li> <li>Intérêt marqué pour la mode, un atout</li> <li>Esprit créatif et antécédents avérés en termes d’innovation</li><li>Capacité à se surpasser dans un environnement axé sur les échéanciers</li> <li>Aptitude à bien s’exprimer et présenter des idées créatives</li> <li>Esprit d’équipe</li> </ul>
Title: UX Designer // Designer UX

Job_Description: Company Profile <br/><br/> Morgan Stanley is a global financial services firm and a market leader in investment banking, securities, investment management and wealth management services. With offices in more than 43 countries, the people of Morgan Stanley are dedicated to providing our clients the finest thinking, products and services to help them achieve even the most challenging goals. <br/><br/> As a market leader, the talent and passion of our people is critical to our success. We embrace integrity, excellence, team work and giving back. <br/><br/> Technology <br/><br/> The Technology division partners with our business units and leading technology companies to redefine how we do business in ever more global and dynamic financial markets. <br/><br/> Our sizeable investment in technology results in leading-edge tools, software, and systems. Our insights, applications, and infrastructure give a competitive edge to clients’ businesses—and to our own. <br/><br/> Institutional Securities Technology (IST) develops and oversees the overall technology strategy and bespoke technology solutions to drive and enable the Institutional businesses and enterprise-wide functions. Our clients include Fixed Income, Equities, Commodities, Investment Banking, Research and Global Capital Markets as well as Operations, HR and Corporate Services. <br/><br/> Position Description <br/><br/> This position focuses on reference data related to client documentation and client business rule calculation, identifying the different regulations needs that are required when onboarding a new client or creating a new account. As a UI Developer, the candidate will be involved in all the different projects related to the division, including a vast variety of applications such as client onboarding, account onboarding, document management, among others. <br/><br/> In support of these applications, the candidate will participate in creating rich UI interfaces that will be included across the division as independent components. Each component will have to be independent and reusable but at the same time they should be able to integrate to different application containers to support their flows. <br/><br/> Skills Required <br/><br/> - Bachelor degree in computer science or similar   <ul> <li>5 plus years in a similar role</li> <li>Angular 5 and HTML experience</li> <li>Bootstrap and CSS experience</li> <li>Java EE and Core Java</li> <li>Strong knowledge of algorithms, data structures, and design patterns</li> <li>Strong development skills with ability to understand technical design and translate the same into workable solution.</li> <li>Ability and willingness to learn new technologies and work on the same to meet business requirements.</li> <li>Strong problem solving <br/><br/> Skills Desired <br/><br/> - Experience with Web Service Development and Services Oriented Architecture</li> <li>XML Technologies such as JAXB</li> <li>Spring framework</li> <li>Working knowledge of Databases including Design, SQL proficiency, and Stored Procedure creation</li> <li>Experience with XML such XSLT, XPath, and XQuery</li> <li>Sybase</li> <li>Apache/Tomcat <br/><br/> Knowledge of French and English are required <br/><br/> Morgan Stanley is an equal opportunities employer. We work to provide a supportive and inclusive environment where all individuals can maximize their full potential.<br/><br/></li> </ul>
Title: UI Developer

Job_Description: Walmart Canada is looking for a web designer who is professional, thrives in a fast paced environment, takes initiative, can multi-task, prioritize and work both independently and as part of a team. Under the direction from the Online Studio Manager, you will design and build impactful campaigns that support our eCommerce initiatives and improve our customer experience.  <ul> <li>A diploma or degree in Web/Graphic Design, Digital Media or any related field, with relevant experiences and portfolios</li><li>Good interpersonal skills & ability to translate business and user requirements into impactful designs.</li><li>Basic understanding of coding languages (HTML, CSS, JS), purchase influencers, social media and other marketing tactics related to online marketing.</li><li>Experience designing mobile web, and/or on-device mobile applications.</li><li>Expertise with Adobe design tools</li><li>Strong listening skills with clear written and verbal communication ability</li><li>Able to respond to changing and sometimes conflicting demands while maintaining focus on strategic goals</li><li>Attention to detail and committed to flawless execution</li><li>Minimum College Certificate or Diploma required</li> <li>Minimum 1-3 years of experience</li>  </ul>
Title: Web Designer

Job_Description: Job Description<div>The<strong> Web Designer</strong><strong>’s</strong>main purpose is to propose and develop the frontend of websites and associated applications from in partnership with the Digital Marketing team and under the supervision of the Graphic Designer Supervisor / Senior. <br/><br/> If you are an enthusiastic self-starter, goal driven, love graphic design and have an interest in the pharmaceutical industry, then we are looking for you! <br/><br/> <strong>The opportunity:</strong> <br/><br/> · Strategize and plan a compelling and effective frontend design concept <br/><br/> · Create clean, unique and innovate frontend web interfaces based on internal guidelines and latest User Experience trends <br/><br/> · Create interfaces that guide the user naturally and encourage interaction according to specific goals <br/><br/> · Ensure mobile-friendly capabilities <br/><br/> · Collaborate with the web development team to ensure the best UX on websites <br/><br/> · Working with different content management systems <br/><br/> · Keep websites up to date according to defined strategies <br/><br/> · Stay informed and propose convenient web design changes according Title: Web Designer

Job_Description: <strong>Description:</strong> <br/><br/> IMP Digital is looking for a front-end web designer with at least 3 years of experience to become a part of our creative and innovative team. The web designer needs to wear many hats required to work on all aspects of a variety of projects including websites, landing pages, and digital marketing campaigns. Designers are highly creative problem solvers who use their solid understanding of design trends and principles to deliver highly polished concepts and designs through to production and completion. <br/><br/> <strong>Our Ideal Candidate Is:</strong>  <ul> <li>A team player</li>  <li>A creative thinker with big ideas</li>  <li>An experienced web designer with an understanding of the web and its nuances</li>  <li>Experienced with developing user-centered and appealing websites using Wordpress or Joomla</li>  <li>Experienced with conceptualizing and creating quality mockups and prototypes</li>  <li>Proficient in interpreting and executing designs from concept through to completion</li>  <li>Attentive to providing website maintenance and enhancements</li>  <li>An active problem solver</li>  <li>Organized and can manage multiple projects at once</li>  <li>Attentive to project goals and user needs</li>  <li>Ready to learn and adapt</li> </ul> <strong>Requirements</strong>  <ul> <li>Keen eye for design and an understanding of layout aesthetics</li>  <li>Proven work experience as a front-end designer</li>  <li>Proven knowledge of responsive web design and development</li>  <li>3+ years front end website development experience</li>  <li>Knowledge in HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript (with JQuery)</li>  <li>3+ years of Adobe Creative Suite experience</li>  <li>Have a strong understanding of W3C web design/coding standards / AODA</li> </ul> <strong>You get BROWNIE points if…</strong>  <ul> <li>You can build a WordPress or Joomla themes using YooTheme</li>  <li>You can demonstrate an ability to quickly self-learn and problem solve</li> </ul>

Title: Web Designer

Job_Description: <strong>Who we are</strong> <br/><br/> Aequilibrium is a fast-moving, and even faster growing software development company that focuses on creating unforgettable onboarding products and services for the Fintech world. We work with progressive companies that strive for change and excellence in their services and we help them achieve these goals then blow them out of the water with our talented team and service. Every aspect of our company from our hiring to internal team initiatives right through to our product development is thoughtfully designed and engineered to help us deliver the most elegant and delightful onboarding solution you can imagine. <br/><br/> We turn user experiences into life experiences. <br/><br/> <strong>Who you are</strong> <br/><br/> We're hunting, searching and even training (moderate weights, some cardio) to find the perfect Junior UI Designer to join our team of collaborative, cross-functional developers, digital designers and team leaders. We want your help in creating groundbreaking digital products that surpass project goals and objectives, challenge the norm of conventional design thinking, and result in pixel-perfect data-driven delivery. <br/><br/> Youll work directly with and be supported by our technology team and Director of Product Design! You should be comfortable executing on multiple platforms and have an innate understanding of mobile and web design standards from polished production components to translating wireframes, user stories and prototypes. <br/><br/> <strong>What You'll Be Getting Up To</strong>  <ul> <li>Work closely with the design department from concept to creation of digital products and solutions</li> <li>Collaborate with the technology team to understand and communicate functional requirements and address technical constraints</li> <li>Collaborate and produce visual brand assets for our energetic and fast-paced lead gen, growth hacking, and marketing leaders</li> <li>Contribute to client meetings, presentations, and process planning</li> <li>Ensure the team has a clear understanding of project context, constraints, and opportunities</li> <li>Understand and help define project goals and objectives, both internally and client-facing</li> <li>Ensure all deliverables are of the highest level of quality and precision</li> <li>Be a creative inspirer, foster positivity and awesomeness</li> </ul> <strong>What We're Looking For</strong>  <ul> <li>Experience in planning, prototyping, and designing for web, mobile/tablet, IoT products and other interactive experiences</li> <li>A strong portfolio of work that showcases your skill, craft, intuition, problem-solving and expertise</li> <li>Strong knowledge base of production tools such as Slack, GDrive, GitHub, Jira</li> <li>High level of proficiency with Sketch, Invision, Adobe CS, and Keynote</li>   <li>Working knowledge of UI design standards for web, mobile web, iOS, and Android</li> <li>Knowledge of web and mobile frameworks, languages, and tools</li> <li>Confident in speaking during presentations and client meetings, both internally and externally</li> <li>Attention to detail - every pixel counts</li> <li>Degree in design or communication an asset but not required</li> </ul> <strong>About Aequilibrium</strong> <br/><br/> Our office is located near Waterfront in the financial district, surrounded by pretty sweet coffee shops and eateries and educational accelerators like BrainStation. We are close to main bus routes and literally steps away from several skytrain access points. Our building is fully equipped with bike storage lockers and a full size gym on the ground floor. <br/><br/> If you feel youll thrive in this environment and make a difference, you should definitely apply! <br/><br/> <strong>Learn more about our team:</strong> <br/><br/> aequilibrium.ca/careers/
Title: Junior UI Designer

Job_Description: UI DESIGNER & DEVELOPER<br/><br/>We’re looking for a hybrid UI designer/developer with a passion for working in the design world to join our product team. This is a full-time, remote position for someone in the United States or Canada. As a UI designer/developer, here’s what you’ll be focused on: <br/><br/> <strong>WHAT YOU’LL BE DOING:</strong> <br/> <br/> <strong>–</strong> Collaborating with the product team to define and implement innovative solutions for the product direction, visuals and experience. <br/> <strong>–</strong> Executing all visual design stages from concept to final integration with engineering <br/> <strong>–</strong> Conceptualizing original ideas that bring simplicity and user friendliness to complex design roadblocks. <br/> <strong>–</strong> Creating, improving, and using wireframes, user flows, process flows and sitemaps to effectively communicate interaction and design ideas. <br/> <strong>–</strong> Eliciting constructive feedback and interpreting that feedback into design solutions. <br/><br/> <strong>YOU SHOULD BRING TO THE TABLE:</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>–</strong> College degree or equivalent experience <br/> <strong>–</strong> Great visual chops and a focus on simple, clear, responsive UI. <br/> <strong>–</strong> A strong understanding of front end development skills, and a solid working understanding of HTML5, CSS, and JavaScript. <br/> <strong>–</strong> Proficiency in Sketch or Figma, sketching ideas quickly and iterating. <br/> <strong>–</strong> Ownership: the Dribbble community will depend on you to deliver a quality experience. <br/> <strong>–</strong> You feel responsible for creating an excellent, end-to-end platform that supports the needs of our users. <br/> <strong>–</strong> Comfort with data: you know when you don’t know enough to make a design decision, and you seek out answers. <br/> <strong>–</strong> An interest in exploration: you think about what to build now and what to build in the future. <br/> <strong>–</strong> A solid perspective on how users engage with online communities. <br/> <strong>–</strong> Made useful prototypes and wireframes (send us samples!) and experience working with style guides. <br/> <strong>–</strong> A way with icons or illustration. <br/> <strong>–</strong> 5+ years of professional UI design experience. <br/> <strong>–</strong> Worked remote or want to give it a shot. <br/> <strong>–</strong> Used Dribbble and been active in the community. That’s not to say you’ve got to be famous, but we need someone who knows and loves (or at least likes) what we do.<br/><br/><strong>If you think you would enjoy working remotely on a small team that loves building products and helping designers share and find work, please consider joining us.</strong> <br/> <strong>Please send a cover letter/statement with your application. It doesn’t have to be long, but it’s really important. Team fit is critical for a company of our size, so help us get to know you a bit.</strong>
Title: UI DESIGNER & DEVELOPER

product features and interactions</li><li>Inform Design with analytics and other user data to create programmatic solutions</li><li>Ensure visibility on design problems on both a micro and macro level, from concrete tasks to higher-level abstract concerns</li><li>Collaborate with the Product, Technology and User Experience teams to provide Web and interaction design mockups for online visuel. <br/><br/> RESPONSABILITÉS <ul> <li>Soutenir le Directeur du design et le Designer UX principal dans la conception de produits numériques clairement définis pour SSENSE</li> <li>Travailler étroitement avec une équipe d’Ingénieurs et de Gestionnaires de produit sur des sprints e projet</li><li>Définir et itérer UX avec prototypage rapide</li><li>Créer des maquettes fonctionnelles avec de atout</li><li>Solide expérience en design centré sur l’utilisateur, méthodes d’essai et sous-système, ainsi qu’avec les questions de convivialité et d’accessibilité</li> <li>Expérience avec Sketch et la suite Adobe CC</li> <li>Expérience avec Framer.js, Origami, ou d’autres applications ou systèmes de prototypage, un atout</li><li>Passionné de tout ce qui touche à l’expérience utilisateur (UX) et Title: UX Designer // Designer UX

Job_Description: <strong>Job Description</strong> <br/> <strong>Who We Are</strong> <br/> Visualization is critical to discovering insights into your information and to effectively communicate that knowledge to others. The Hybrid Cloud design team provides a key component of design thinking for IBM Business Analytics products through cross platform interactions, visual design patterns and user experience best practices. This isn't about drawing old-fashioned pie charts, it's about visually understanding data in ways that have never been seen before. <br/><br/> Todays operating environment demands a stack thats responsive to the innovative enterprise one that can leverage all data types & access the latest technologies. By 2020, businesses will commit at least 50% of IT spend on cloud. Businesses are prioritizing the secure connection and extension mission-critical apps, and IBM Hybrid Cloud is a leader in providing these solutions. Heres the chance to become a part of the IBM Cloud Design team a well-established user interface design team designing integrated cloud services for IBM's premier cloud platform, on-premise, and enterprise software offerings. <br/><br/> <strong>The Position</strong>  <br/> We are seeking a <strong>Senior User Experience (UX) Design Lead</strong> with a proven record of delivering irresistible solutions that address our customers most challenging business problems and opportunities. The best candidate will have several years of experience collaborating effectively with Product Management and engineering in an agile and lean delivery context. The candidate must demonstrate leadership, technical curiosity, and tenacity to partner with some of the leading technologists in the field of cloud and cognitive computing. Ability to directly lead and mentor a team of User Experience designers is a must. Experience as a Design Manager is a definite asset. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities include but are not limited to</strong>  <ul> <li>Collaborate with designers, developers and product managers to create brilliant interface and user experience solutions from concept to final code</li><li>Deliver, review and critique the UX Designs of a multi-skilled design team to ensure effective and rich designs (great interaction, supreme visual styling, consistent and appropriate use of voice and tone, etc.)</li><li>Work with UX Designers, researchers and product managers to understand users needs and behaviors for the industries in which they work</li><li>Participate in and lead lean UX activities (in person and remote) in an Agile environment such as user/design research, interviews and workshops</li><li>Analyze and synthesize the findings; distilling the inherent complexity in the users experiences and identify the right problems to solve</li><li>Translate findings into usable, useful, effective and efficient user experiences</li><li>Clearly and quickly deliver ideas to cross-functional teams</li><li>Provide information verbally and visually through low and mid-fidelity renderings (starting with paper and pencil/whiteboard) and clickable prototypes</li><li>Test and validate working hypothesis with users through usability testing of wire frames, clickable prototypes and published product, and participate in design critique</li><li>Work with Visual Designers and Developers to bring concepts to life while maintaining UX best practices</li><li>Understand how to balance an insanely high personal bar of performance, yet still remember to have fun</li> </ul>  <strong>Who You Are</strong> <br/> We design visual analytics products. You are a top notch designer and highly motivated team player who isn't scared off by numbers, formulas and advanced analytics concepts. You are also creative, curious, questioning, open to take and provide critique and have a ton of initiative able to focus on design detail and ascertain user value and impact as part of their software experience. You possess experience solving complex design problems for Web interactions or software solutions, and are capable of translating research findings into complex interaction designs that provide usable, effective and efficient experiences to users. Your keen written and verbal communication skills include the ability to articulate alternative approaches. <br/><br/> This role will involve working with technology that is covered by embargo Export Regulations. If you are a Foreign National from any of the following embargoed countries (Cuba, Iran, North Korea, Sudan, and Syria) on a work permit, you are not eligible for employment in this position. <br/><br/> Required Technical and Professional Expertise  <ul> <li>At least 5 years of experience as a user experience designer</li><li>2 or more years leading, or managing, design teams</li><li>Produce and enhance low-fidelity sketches and medium fidelity wire frames to facilitate communication of recommended solutions</li><li>Ability to tell a meaningful story about the user through great presentation skills</li><li>Proven ability to inspire, lead, coach and mentor design team members</li><li>Experience providing feedback on designer performance, and identify opportunities for team members to sharpen and expand their skills</li><li>BA, BS or MS in Interaction Design, HCI or equivalent qualification</li><li><strong>Portfolio with work samples that illustrate your approach to UX problem solving</strong></li> </ul>  Preferred Tech and Prof Experience  <ul> <li>Some experience with or understanding of data visualization</li><li>Some experience with or understanding of advanced analytics</li><li>Knowledge of, and experience in, the enterprise domain</li><li>Experience as a Design Manager providing direct management to a small team of designers - giving them support, helping grow careers and actively helping them manage their work</li> </ul>  EO Statement <br/> IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status. <br/><br/>
Title: Senior User Experience (UX) Design Lead

Job_Description: *** WE ARE HIRING MULTIPLE *** INTERMEDIATE AND SENIOR LEVEL. FAST GROWING COMPANY WITH FORTUNE 500 CLIENTS. JOIN AN INNOVATIVE TEAM OF YOUNG AND HUNGRY DEVELOPERS!!!! <br/><br/> Be A Part Of is a rapidly growing eCommerce & Online Marketing Agency located in Toronto. We are looking for an experienced Web Developer to help develop custom websites/solutions & apps (not phone apps) for our clients. <br/><br/> The ideal candidate has a natural curiosity about technology and software development, and has a constant desire to learn about new technologies. We are looking for someone with strong communication skills that has the ability to succeed in a results driven environment. <br/><br/> Strong knowledge of CSS/HTML and JS are important skills. <br/><br/> <strong>Requirements</strong> <ul>  <li>General understanding and knowledge of front-end development</li> <li>Proficiency using modern web development technologies and techniques, including HTML5, CSS, JavaScript, Responsive Design, web services, etc.</li> <li>Foundation in Javascript</li> <li>Design skills, including active prototyping a plus</li> <li>General knowledge of e-commerce, marketing, and advertising is a plus</li> <li>You have strong communication skills - explaining complex technical concepts to designers, support, and other engineers is easy for you</li> <li>You have a desire to continuously learn and develop your skills</li> <li>You're hands on and like to be involved in all areas of a company</li> <li>You are a team player - you are always willing to lend a helping hand</li> <li>You enjoy working in a fast-paced, growing environment</li> <li>You are not complacent and you want an opportunity to grow and continue to develop your skills</li> </ul> <strong>Benefits</strong> <ul>  <li>Competitive salary</li> <li>Very friendly, comfortable, and flexible work environment</li> <li>Opportunity to grow with a growing company (lots of opportunities to move up the ladder)</li> <li>Opportunity to utilize your full skill-set on a daily basis</li> <li>Opportunity to use your creativity to create and implement your own designs</li> <li>Opportunity to learn and implement new skills</li> <li>Opportunity to "wear multiple hats" - work with many different aspect of our business</li> </ul>
Title: Web Designer & Developer (HTML/CSS/JS/ANGULAR/PHP)

Job_Description: <strong>Worker Sub-Type:</strong><br/><br/>Student (Fixed Term)<br/><br/><strong><strong><strong> Job Description:</strong></strong></strong> <br/><br/> <strong>POSITION SUMMARY</strong> <br/><br/> This student position will be part of the BlackBerry User Experience Design team. The successful candidate will support design activities in the areas of interaction design, visual design, motion design and user research. We are looking for someone who can thrive in a fast paced, collaborative environment with a high attention to detail and understands the value of a user centered design process. The successful candidate must be self-driven, a team player, a strong communicator and comfortable interfacing regularly with other teams. <br/><br/> Location: Waterloo, ON <br/><br/> Length of Term: 8 Months <br/><br/> <strong>ROLES AND RESPONSIBILITES</strong> <ul> <li>Ability to sketch out early design concepts and create wireframes that clearly demonstrate user experiences connected to defined problems and opportunity areas for various mobile applications</li><li>Translate early design concepts and wireframes into final design specifications following design guidelines</li><li>Support primary user research, usability and trends research to inform various design activities</li><li>Regular interaction with Product and Development organizations to understand needs, share and review design work and assess design feasibility.</li> </ul> <strong>SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS</strong> <ul> <li>Currently pursuing a post-secondary education in Design or related field of study</li><li>Proficiency in Adobe Creative Suite and Invision</li><li>Show user interface and/or visual design skills with a demonstrated portfolio</li><li>Demonstrate experience and/or knowledge of user research methods and analysis of research inputs</li><li>Ability to formulate and distill design rationale for your work</li><li>High attention to detail</li><li>Demonstrated ability to take initiative and responsibility in a fast paced team environment</li><li>Excellent verbal and written communication skills</li> </ul> <strong>ADDITIONAL ASSETS</strong> <ul> <li>Experience designing for mobile platforms.</li> </ul> <strong>Please include relevant portfolio materials with your application.</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Job Family Group Name:</strong><br/><br/>Business Practices & Operations<br/><br/><strong>Scheduled Weekly Hours:</strong><br/><br/>40
Title: UX Design Student - 8 Month Fall Term

Job_Description: Company Description<br/><br/>We are actively seeking a creative and passionate individual to join our team as a Lead UI Artist. <br/><br/> With over 300 employees and a variety of exciting licenses to be developed in the near future, theres never been a better time to join the Ludia family! <br/><br/> Ludia Inc. is a Montreal-based video game company that creates and distributes cross-platform digital games. Our innovative and high-quality product portfolio consists of original and world-recognized branded properties such as: Jurassic World: Alive, What&apos;s Your Story, Jurassic World: The Game, Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Legends, Dragons: Rise of Berk, Family Feud® 2 & Friends, Kung Fu Panda: Battle of Destiny, Waldo & Friends, and The Price Is Right. We are a member of the FremantleMedia family, one of the worlds leading content producers.<br/><br/>Job Description<br/><br/>Our ideal candidate would be adaptable, self-driven, curious and eager to share his findings with his team. If youre a match 3 lover its a definitive bonus!! <br/><br/> Key Responsibilities: <ul> <li>Develop the visual language of the games user interface from the concept phase to the final realization following the projects art direction</li><li>Handle communication with external partners</li><li>Conduct performance reviews and hold regular one-on-one interviews within the UI team</li><li>Supervise and plan the production process for the UI team on the project</li><li>Work with a multidisciplinary team of game designers, programmers and artists in the development of the gaming experience</li> </ul>  <strong>Qualifications</strong>  <ul> <li>You must have shipped a minimum of 3 mobile games</li><li>Degree in Fine Arts/Graphic Design or equivalent</li><li>Expert knowledge of Photoshop</li><li>Proficient at Unity</li><li>Good knowledge of After Effect</li><li>Solid understanding of business value when it comes to feature scoping</li><li>Demonstrate the ability to communication your concepts and vision to colleagues and various stakeholders</li><li>Solid design skills with a vast art background</li><li>Robust understanding of art production processes</li><li>Bilingualism FR/ENG</li> </ul>  <strong>Additional Information</strong>  <ul> <li>Work in the heart of Old Montreal</li><li>An open concept work environment with an employee game room, foosball, Ping-Pong and pool table, Tiki Lounge and more</li><li>A broad health and wellness plan that includes annual health assessments</li><li>Four weeks vacation, RRSP contributions, referral incentives, and an attractive bonus program</li><li>Free snacks, coffee and tea, as well as catered meals</li><li>A training budget with free language lessons in English and French</li><li>A free gym pass starting on day one and access to on-site massages</li><li>Happy Hour Fridays with beer and wine after work, including our own beer on tap: La Ludique</li><li>An amazing team of creative individuals who work hard and play hard! Check out this video to learn more:</li> </ul>
Title: Lead UI Artist

Job_Description: <div><div><div><div><div><EM>Nokia is a global leader in the technologies that connect people and things. With state-of-the-art software, hardware and services for any type of network, Nokia is uniquely positioned to help communication service providers, governments, and large enterprises deliver on the promise of 5G, the Cloud and the Internet of Things. Serving customers in over 100 countries, our research scientists and engineers continue to invent and accelerate new technologies that will increasingly transform the way people and things communicate and connect.</EM> <br/><br/> <STRONG>Position Summary:</STRONG> <br/><br/> This role will provide solution architecture, consulting, training and development support to BU's that are consuming components and blueprints from the Common Software Foundation.  <ul> <li>Assist in defining requirements based on the needs of portfolio applications as well as service solutions within the Services BU</LI>   <li>Provide inputs into the component development teams on road map items based on BU needs and product evolution</LI>   <li>Provide conduit for BU implementation issues back into R&D</LI>   <li>Provide design oversight for initial app development</LI>   <li>Serve as trusted advisor for the internal customer</LI> </ul> <div><strong>Qualifications:</strong>  <ul> <li>Strong communication skills with the ability to interact with multi-national teams</LI>   <li>Strong understanding and experience in the design of multi-tier applications</LI>   <li>Strong understanding of UI design and Single Page Application Architecture</LI>   <li>Development experience with the following technologies: JavaScript, React, Angular, CSS, HTML, Java</li> <li>Self starter capable of being productive on multiple simultaneous projects</LI> </ul> <strong>Canada is committed to building a skilled, diverse workforce reflective of Canadian society. As a result, we promote employment equity and encourage women, aboriginal persons, persons with a disability or members of a visible minority group to apply.</strong> </div> </div> </div>  </div>  </div> </div> <br/>
Title: UI Developer - Nokia Software CTO

Job_Description: <strong>**Takes one minute to apply & you can interview right away - no cover letter required!**</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Want to make an impact with your work? Read on below.</strong> <br/><br/> About NiceJob<br/><br/>Were changing the way people handle and grow their reputation. <br/><br/> Not that long ago (just 19 months) we were just a few developers with an app that automates the collection of customer reviews. Now were a rapidly growing startup (10-20% monthly recurring revenue growth every month) that serves hundreds of small businesses (and soon enterprises) across North America. Whether its software that helps prevent negative reviews, automation for collecting good ones, or using those reviews to get more referrals and sales, we use technology to give people products that ensure that their great work never goes unrecognized, unappreciated or unrewarded. <br/><br/> For the people who run their websites or local marketing on NiceJob, our app represents a solution they love. With NiceJob, skilled service providers no longer unreasonably have to also be digital marketing authorities to acquire new business. <br/><br/> And thats just what were doing today. Were thinking about the future, too. With our product team working on using things like natural language processing and machine learning to be able to surface reviews at the point of purchase, were reimagining how businesses influence purchase decisions. We're helping people be financially independent and able to continue to contribute to their community, their friends, and their families.<br/><br/>Job Summary<br/><br/>The most successful companies are brilliant storytellers. They can effectively engage with business, technical and consumer audiences alike, helping them understand the magic behind the products they use. Enthusiastic storytelling empowers customers to make informed decisions. It drives both awareness and usage of our products. <br/><br/> The Web Designer & Content Marketer is responsible for helping tell our customers' stories - helping them get the recognition they deserve, and helping people find great services and products. Its about building beautiful websites for key customer accounts, writing compelling content to help gain attention, while working with our customer success team to manage those client relationships. <br/><br/> In this role you will be responsible for helping to create and execute on a scalable strategy and system for our incredible popular product Convert Websites.<br/><br/>Problems & Projects<br/><br/><strong>You will be developing and exercising your skills in…</strong> <ul> <li>Analyzing website visitor data to improve website layouts and provide design suggestions</li> <li>Page laying of new websites using existing design patterns</li><li>Writing impactful content for new websites</li><li>Conversion rate optimizing</li><li>Optimizing websites we create and our own for SEO</li> </ul> <br/><br/> <strong>To help us tackle and build…</strong> <ul> <li>Our problem of having too much demand and too long of a build time for new website design requests</li><li>Conversion rate optimized websites</li><li>A great customer experience</li> </ul> <strong>How performance will be measured...</strong> <ul> <li>Conversion rates on the websites you build</li><li>Customer happiness with the completed website</li> </ul> Who we're looking for<br/><br/>You are... <ul> <li>Someone who's looking for a company to grow with, who plans to stick around for the long term in Vancouver (and reap all the benefits that entails)</li><li>Great eye for good UX design</li><li>Great at writing impactful copy</li><li>Could be described as passionate, creative, professional, analytical, intelligent, humble, and helpful.</li><li>Excellent written communication skills, and excellent emotional intelligence</li><li>As excited and passionate about the products we're making as we are</li><li>A willingness and ability to learn quickly, and hit the ground sprinting from day one</li><li>Meticulous attention to the details</li><li>Interest in data driven design patterns</li><li>Expert at HTML/CSS and/or Webflow</li><li>Thorough understanding of conversion optimizing</li><li>Thorough understanding of on-page SEO</li> </ul> And can provide... <ul> <li>Examples of design work</li><li>Examples of content writing</li><li>Examples of completed website projects</li> </ul>  Salary & Perks  <ul> <li>$45,000 Base Salary with team-wide bonuses for performance</li><li>0.15% Equity</li> <li>Flexible work hours and a Gastown office</li><li>Strong employee development (mentorship)</li><li>Ability to make an impact</li><li>Great benefit package is in the works (will do after we get our office)</li><li>Fast-track career path</li>  </ul> Proudly an Equal Opportunities Employer<br/><br/>At NiceJob, we dont just accept diversity—we celebrate it, we encourage it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. <ul> <li>We are committed to fostering belonging through a diverse and inclusive workplace.</li> <li>We do not discriminate against any race, gender, religious affiliation, ethnicity or any other demographic - instead, we celebrate diversity.</li> <li>We don't ask or pay people based on what they used to make. We pay people what they're worth. To resolve this, we benchmark positions against industry rates and then beat them to attract and retain the best talent.</li><li>Lastly, we hire for culture add, not culture fit so that we can gain unique skills, viewpoints, and ultimately innovation.</li> </ul>  About Vancouver<br/><br/>Gaining a reputation in recent years as a global startup and tech hub, Vancouver has become home to several large tech companies such as home-grown Hootsuite and Slack. Even Amazon, Facebook, Microsoft, IBM, and Google are opening up offices in the region, signalling the city's exciting future. <br/><br/> Local universities rank as high as top 30 in the world and provide a constant supply of high quality talent. <br/><br/> The diverse and accepting culture, exquisite cuisine throughout vibrant neighborhoods, the warm temperate weather, and the unlimited outdoor adventure near snow-capped mountains with breathtaking ocean views make this city not just one where people want to work, but one where they want to live.
Title: Web Designer & Content Marketer (Conversion Optimization)

Job_Description: BBG Management Corporation has an opportunity for a Web Designer/Front End Developer in Vancouver, BC. <br/><br/> The ideal candidate will join a company that is paving the way for software innovations in the entertainment industry. This corporation provides web-based casting tools that connect professionals in all areas of the industry with valuable resources and information. <br/><br/> <strong>Requirements:</strong>   <ul> <li>Experience with web design and front end development</li> <li>Skilled with HTML5, CSS3, Javascript, Adobe, and other relevant technologies/tools</li> </ul>  If you feel that you would be a good fit for this position, please contact Lem Jopio at lemuel.jopio@bbgmanagement.com. <br/><br/> <em>BBG Management welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations for disabilities in relation to the job selection process are available upon request.</em>
Title: Web Designer/Front End Developer

Job_Description: <strong>Come join us!</strong> <br/><br/> Assent Compliance “Assent” is the leader in cloud-based compliance automation software. We are a rapidly growing, energetic and exciting company with the mission to make the world a better place with our software. We are looking for a full-time, permanent Senior UX Designer to join our fast-paced Product Design Team. <br/><br/> The Senior UX Designer will have a key role in defining the product design vision and delivering the best possible user experiences to Assent’s customers while working to solve core business puzzles. From early concepts through to final delivery and launch, you’ll collaborate with Product Management, Engineering, QA, clients and many others, applying user-centered design methodologies to create innovative solutions that wow our customers. <br/><br/> <strong>What you will do:</strong>  <ul>  <li>Advocate for our users, continuously finding ways to delight them through a compelling, valuable and easy-to-use experiences;</li>    <li>Work quickly and iteratively to document, share and refine designs from concept through to delivery;</li>    <li>Lead design sessions, working with Designers, Product Managers, Engineers and other stakeholders to design solutions that support both customer needs and business objectives;</li>    <li>Drive research initiatives to acquire deep user understanding, validate design direction, evaluate usability and make data-driven decisions;</li>    <li>Champion user-centered design, using personas, journey and empathy maps, user flows diagrams and more to capture, share and address user needs;</li>    <li>Craft and communicate UX vision, visual design and specifications using everything from quick sketches and whiteboard masterpieces to static mockups and interactive prototypes;</li>    <li>Inspire design innovation by continuously researching and sharing design trends, mentoring team members and championing the adoption of user-centered methodologies;</li>    <li>Follow guidance set out by corporate security policies and standards;</li>    <li>Ensure departmental security processes and procedures are followed where applicable.</li>    </ul> <em>This is not an exhaustive list of duties. Responsibilities may be altered and/or added from time to time to meet business needs.</em> <br/><br/> <strong>What you should bring:</strong> <br/><br/> We strongly value your talent, energy and passion. It will also be valuable to Assent if you have the following qualifications,  <ul>  <li>At least 7 years experience working in a similar role;</li>    <li>A strong design portfolio demonstrating your design process and completed work;</li>    <li>Experience designing SaaS enterprise applications;</li>    <li>Expertise in UX design and research methodologies;</li>    <li>Excellent oral and written communication skills in English—you communicate clearly and concisely;</li>    <li>The ability to quickly understand and articulate interactions in a technical environment;</li>    <li>Strong analytical and problem solving skills, with the ability to conceptualize complex systems;</li>    <li>Passion for creating products that best serve the needs of the user;</li>    <li>Grit—you are conscientious, driven, and will always work towards providing solutions;</li>    <li>A metric-orientation—you take into account business drivers, key performance indices and conversion factors;</li>    <li>A highly adaptable and flexible approach with an ability to thrive in a fast-paced, ever-changing environment;</li>    <li>A strong ability to influence and convince various stakeholders and high motivation to effect change;</li>    <li>Excellent time management and organizational skills—ability to manage multiple priorities and timelines;</li>    <li>An insatiable thirst for knowledge - you consider yourself a lifelong learner and naturally curious about technology or how things work;</li>   </ul>    <ul>  <li>Superb interpersonal skills—you able to establish cross-functional relationships in a collaborative, team-based environment with a diverse group of stakeholders including employees and leaders.</li>    </ul> <strong>What We Offer You:</strong> <br/><br/> Assent has built a passionate workforce; our strong and vibrant culture is integral to our success. <br/><br/> We offer programs and rewards that one would expect from a highly successful and growing technology company in Ottawa:  <ul>  <li>A fantastic culture, team, energy and high growth success company</li>    <li>Competitive salary and benefits</li>    <li>An awesome workplace in Ottawa’s East End across from St. Laurent Shopping Centre</li>    <li>Free snacks, weekly catered lunches, social activities and the opportunity to provide a helping hand to the Ottawa community through our charitable work</li>    </ul>
Title: Senior UX Designer

Job_Description: <div><div><strong>WHY ECONOMICAL?</strong> <br/><br/> Because a changing industry calls for a new way of doing things. An ambitious, innovative and fast-paced company, we offer exceptional training and development programs, competitive pay, great benefits, company-matched RRSPs, and paid volunteer days — all within an engaging, fun, and collaborative work environment. <br/><br/> Founded more than 145 years ago, Economical is one of Canada’s leading property and casualty insurance companies. We rely on our national network of more than 800 independent brokers to sell a range of car, home, business, and farm insurance solutions. With Sonnet and Petline, we’re extending our reach through the direct-to-customer channel. With more than 2,400 active employees across the country and a commitment to rethinking the insurance experience, we’re poised for great things. <br/><br/> We’re now adding to our high-performance team to take us into the future. Let’s rethink insurance, together. <br/><br/> <strong>** Please note this is a 12-month replacement position to cover a maternity leave **</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>In this role, you will:</strong>  <ul> <li>Optimize the customer experience via an intuitive user interface and direct the visual appearance of all new features and enhancements on our websites</li>   <li>Design and draw the website's visual imagery and ensure it is in line with company branding policy or requirements</li>  </ul> <strong>Your Responsibilities:</strong> <br/><br/> <strong><em>Web Design</em> </strong>  <ul> <li>Drawing up website specifications and designing sample page layouts including text size and colours</li>  <li>Designing graphics, animations and manipulating digital photographs</li>  <li>Coding using a variety of software including Content Management Systems such as Sitefinity</li>  <li>Editing content, debugging code and re-designing web pages</li>  <li>Working with other web specialists including the Web Developer</li>  <li>Upgrade site by updating content and graphics, monitoring performance and results, identifying and evaluating improvement options, introducing new technology and maintaining links</li> </ul> <strong><em>User Experience Design</em> </strong>  <ul> <li>Acting as the user-advocate during the development process, subjecting early-stage designs to usability testing or expert review, and offering implementation suggestions from a user-centered perspective</li>  <li>Conducting usability research and providing recommendations for improvement</li>  <li>Determining user needs by conducting task-focused analyses</li>  <li>Developing wireframes, behavioral specifications and personas</li> </ul> <strong><em>Marketing</em> </strong>  <ul> <li>Assisting in concept development of advertising, marketing and promotional initiatives</li>  <li>Collaborating with various teams on online sales and customer service initiatives</li> </ul> <strong>Your Skills and Experience:</strong>  <ul> <li>Post-secondary degree in Web Development and/or graphic design, communications, marketing or equivalent combination of education and experience</li>  <li>HTML, Javascript, CSS, AJAX, JQuery, VB.NET/C# on NET 4.0</li>  <li>Visual Studio, Sitefinity would be an asset</li>  <li>Photoshop, Fireworks and/or Flash</li> </ul> At Economical, we all work together to come up with big ideas — then bring them to life. We focus on our customers first, we bring our best, and we’re stronger together. If you’ve got the passion and the desire to help us reinvent insurance, let’s talk. <br/><br/> <strong>HOW TO APPLY</strong> <br/><br/> Create a general profile <strong><u>here</u></strong><strong>.</strong> To complete the online application process, you’ll need to upload your resume before you apply for the role you’re interested in. Please note that only one document can be uploaded, so be sure to combine your resume and cover letter. <br/><br/> We are committed to providing an inclusive work environment that welcomes diversity and supports accessibility across the organization. If you require accommodation at any time during the recruitment process, please let us know by contacting: hrsharedservices@economical.com. <br/><br/> Visit economical.com to learn more about us and what we’re up to. <br/><br/> Economical Insurance includes the following companies: Economical Mutual Insurance Company, The Missisquoi Insurance Company, Perth Insurance Company, Waterloo Insurance Company, Family Insurance Solutions Inc., Sonnet Insurance Company, Petline Insurance Company.</div> </div><div></div>
Title: Web Designer - Petline (Contract)

Job_Description: <strong>Job Description</strong> <br/> <div><strong>Digital Business Automation Web Designer/Developer (Front-end Web Application Developer)</strong></div> <br/> Are you ready to create state-of-the-art products by combining leading user experience with exciting new technologies to help shape the way organizations automate their digital business on the cloud? Do you enjoy a lively, collaborative team environment? If you answered yes, then we may have the right opportunity for you! <br/><br/> IBM is empowering organizations to reinvent themselves and change the way they run their business, by applying automation and analytics to achieve digital transformation and to scale their business operations to become more flexible and competitive. Incorporating a host of tools, from machine learning to robotic process automation, the integrated IBM® Automation Platform for Digital Business is designed to improve employee productivity, deliver better end-to-end customer journeys while reducing the burden of governing your content and processes. <br/><br/> Join the Digital Business Automation Platform team for the chance to develop innovative and visually appealing products, as well as your career, with one of the world's largest software-makers. Hone your expertise alongside fellow talented professionals, where you'll develop some of the most exciting software solutions on the market. <br/><br/> This role will be responsible for combining form and function to create engaging and effective web-based business application using a mastery of creative techniques and applications, as well as a host of technologies such as JavaScript, HTML5, CSS, React, and more! In our agile development model, designers/developers participate in small, autonomous but aligned teams where they learn and perform a variety of roles, including design, development, test, automation and client interaction/support. <br/><br/> As an IBM Web Application Designer/Developer, you'll be responsible for ensuring that our software components are expertly designed, developed, debugged, verified, and ready for integration into IBM's best-of-breed solutions that help organizations improve their business outcomes in the global marketplace. <br/><br/> <strong>Key responsibilities include:</strong>  <ul> <li>Design engaging and delightful graphical user interfaces for web-based applications by combining graphic design and user experience design with front-end development.</li> <li>Build web-based software using a host of technologies and methodologies, especially JavaScript, HTML5, CSS, and ReactJS.</li><li>In our agile development model, participate in small, autonomous but aligned teams to learn and perform a variety of roles, including design, development, test, automation and client interaction/support.</li><li>Ensure that our software components are expertly designed, tested, debugged, verified and ready for integration into IBM's best-of-breed solutions that help organizations improve their business outcomes in the global marketplace.</li><li>Innovate and turn new ideas into reality</li><li>Work collaboratively across functional areas</li><li>Take ownership of assignments & drive them to completion.</li><li>Problem determination, debugging, and resolution</li> </ul>  If you are passionate about web user interface development in addition to the opportunity to be part of a team that is developing next generation digital business automation software, then this may be the opportunity for you. <br/><br/> Required Technical and Professional Expertise  <ul> <li>At least 2 years experience in web graphic design</li><li>At least 2 years experience with graphic design tools, such as Adobe Creative Suite</li><li>At least 2 years experienced with web user experience design</li><li>At least 2 years experience with JavaScript</li><li>At least 2 years experience with HTML5</li><li>At least 2 years experienced with CSS / LESS</li><li>Excellent communication skills (verbal and written)</li><li>Level of professionalism when working collaboratively across functional areas</li> </ul>  Preferred Tech and Prof Experience  <ul> <li>At least 2 years experience with React</li><li>Experience with Node.js</li><li>Experience with Dojo</li><li>Experience with GitHub</li> </ul>  EO Statement <br/> IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status. <br/><br/>
Title: Digital Business Automation Web Designer/Developer (Front-end)

Job_Description: <div><div>Questrade Technologies Group (QTG) acts as the back-bone for Questrade. They act as strategic partners with each business unit to help Questrade leverage technology to gain competitive advantage. The team is comprised of very skilled, very committed individuals working collaboratively. They collectively create a unique work environment that is fast-paced and challenging, but also very open and supportive. <br/><br/> <strong><em>And where does the Sr. UX Designer fit into this?</em></strong> <br/><br/> Questrade's UX Design team is looking for an experienced designer to work as a strategic partner on key initiatives with our technology and business teams. Our dream candidate is passionate about developing a better user experience using insights from real people. He or she has the proven skills and experience to turn these insights into beautifully-designed products (interactions and visuals), and to inspire our teams through prototypes and demonstrations before building final products. <br/><br/> <strong><em>What’s it like working as a Sr. UX Designer at Questrade?</em></strong> <br/><br/> As the Senior UX Designer, you'll take on complex challenges and transform them into intuitive, accessible and easy-to-use designs suited as much for the first-time user as the sophisticated expert. You'll work closely with other Designers, as well as Researchers, Engineers and Product Owners throughout the design process - from creating early concepts and user flows to building user interface mockups and prototypes. At each stage, you'll anticipate users' needs and goals, advocate for them and, through close collaboration with the implementation team, ensure that the final product is delightful to use. <br/><br/> <strong><em>Are YOU our next Sr. UX Designer? You are if...</em></strong> <br/><br/> ✔You have an online portfolio <br/><br/> ✔You have 5+ years in UX design <br/><br/> ✔You have strong knowledge of Axure <br/><br/> ✔You have the ability to lead projects from conception through to completion <br/><br/> ✔You have the ability to work well with others across the business <br/><br/> ✔You have the ability to work in a dynamic and fast-paced environment <br/><br/> ✔You have understanding of HTML/CSS/JS capabilities and limitations <br/><br/> ✔You have a sense of curiosity, continuously learning and an open-minded attitude <br/><br/> ✔You have the ability to conduct research and usability testing <br/><br/> ✔You have the ability to create wireframes, functional specs, high-fidelity mock-ups and prototypes of various complexity <br/><br/> <strong><em>Brownie points if you have…</em></strong> <br/><br/> ✔Knowledge of Adobe Product Suite <br/><br/> ✔Experience working in the financial industry <br/><br/> <strong><em><strong><em>Sounds like you? Click below to apply!</em></strong></em></strong><br/> <div><em>Questrade is committed to providing reasonable accommodation for people with disabilities. If you require an accommodation, we will work with you to meet your needs in all stages of the hiring process.</em></div></div> </div><div></div>
Title: Senior UX Designer
