Job_Description: <div><div> COMPETITION NUMBER: C17-18-RE-18</div> <div> POSITION: Teacher - Graphic and Web Design</div> <div>The college is seeking a part-time professor to teach a course within the <strong>Graphic and Web Design</strong> program in the fall 2018 term. <br/><br/> <strong>412-B18-HR Advertising Design and Copywriting</strong> <br/> 3 hours of teaching (2 hours of theory and 1 hour of lab) and 3 hours of availability per week <br/> August 17th, 2018 to February 14th, 2019 <br/><br/> This course introduces students to the design and production of advertising materials. Emphasis will be placed on creating concepts for promotional materials, planning the work, writing the copy and creating the visual elements, editing and improving the materials, and preparing the files for printing.</div> <br/>  <div> WORK LOCATION: 325 boul. de la Cité-des-Jeunes, Gatineau, Quebec, Canada, J8Y6T3</div> </div><div> SALARY RANGE: 41,390.00$ - 84,567.00$</div> <div> MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES : In a general way, the professor's teaching load shall include: preparation of course outline; preparation of classes, labs and fieldwork; teaching classes, labs and fieldwork; adaptation; support and supervision of students; preparation, invigilation and correction of examinations; revision of corrections at the students’ request; participation in pedagogical days organized by the College; participation in departmental meetings and required activities. May also include departmental coordination; program committee coordination; special support and supervision activities; participation in program activities; program development; implementation and evaluation; and institutional development.</div> <br/> <div> MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS REQUIRED: Minimum of a Bachelor's degree in Graphic and Web Design, NewMedia or in another related field. Several years of teaching experience at the undergraduate or college level is preferred. Fluency in English, both oral and written is required. Knowledge of software as per program requirements is necessary. <br/><br/> <strong><em><u>Ability to:</u></em></strong>   <ul>  	<li>Create a dynamic, challenging, and motivated learning environment.</li> <li>Adapt to a variety of student needs and provide appropriate academic and career development support.</li> <li>Utilize excellent communication and interpersonal skills.</li> <li>Demonstrate knowledge of subject matter through academic or non-academic experiences.</li> <li>Apply theoretical concepts to current workplace needs and skill requirements.</li> <li>Provide assistance and display leadership at Heritage College.</li> <li>Stay abreast of changes and new program requirements through regular professional development activities.</li> <li>Must be flexible as required by the department workloads. Must be willing to work collaboratively within the Faculty team.</li> </ul>  </div> <br/> <div><div> <strong>Interested candidates should submit their résumé, along with appropriate documentation ONLINE on our college website in the career page at http://www.cegep-heritage.qc.ca/manitou/.</strong> <br/><br/> Click on the job posting, then click on <strong>"APPLY".</strong> You will be able to create an account and upload your resume and cover letter. <br/><br/> <strong>Please note that only online applications will be considered.</strong> <br/><br/> N.B.: Candidates may be required to submit to selection tests. Only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.</div> <div> POSTING DATES: From 2018-05-16 10:16 to 2018-05-31 16:00</div> <div> <div><em><strong>Cégep Heritage College applies an Equal Access program and encourages women, aboriginal people, members of visible and ethnic minorities and handicapped persons to apply.</strong></em></div></div>  </div>
Title: Teacher - Graphic and Web Design

Job_Description: We’re on a mission: <br/><br/> Are you a curious thinker with innovative ideas and a passion for delivering market-leading digital customer experiences? Make your mark by helping us reimagine how we interact with our customers and create the experiences that matter to them. We’re building a team of passionate people, working collaboratively in Agile, to reimagine banking for the digital age. <br/><br/> Why now and why BMO? <br/><br/> We believe our customers’ lives are changing – and we need to change with them. From day-to-day life to the moments that matter, our customers are increasingly defining success in different ways and we need to be there to help. This means meeting our customers where and how they expect to bank. <br/><br/> At BMO, we believe we must respond to our customers by becoming a customer experience-led, digitally-enabled bank. Driven by a deep understanding of our customers and willingness to constantly challenge the status quo, we believe we can meet the challenge before us. <br/><br/> How? <br/><br/> We are building experience teams, combining people with different skills and knowledge, to accelerate our customer experience. These teams will work Agile, in a vibrant space, and embrace the latest methods, tools, and technologies to drive innovation and change. Self-managed and cross-functional, these teams will be empowered and have the resources and authority to drive a customer-led digital transformation. <br/><br/> As a Front-end Dev Lead, here’s what you will do:  <ul> <li>Acts as a thought leader in development, builds deeper relationships with key stakeholders, and demonstrates expert-level skills in coding across multiple languages, LOB's, and/or technology areas.   <li>Reviews and approves requirements and design for a domain   <li>Accountable for overall code quality, ensures code is reviewed, reusable and testable, meeting architectural-design and customer requirements..   <li>Leads workshops to develop solutions from a program perspective in association with all interdependent systems.   <li>Has expert knowledge to influence and set corporate direction for software development practice, concepts, technology and methodology.</LI> </ul> What makes you a great fit?  <ul> <li>Minimum of 5 years of work experience in IT or business environment and/or BS/BA or MBA/MS in computer science, engineering, information systems, math or business   <li>Background in banking or finance   <li>High levels of self-motivation and stamina   <li>A focus on delivering results with benefits to the customer   <li>An ability to think creatively but also pragmatically   <li>Strong interpersonal and communication skills   <li>Knowledge of DevOps tooling capabilities (Confluence, JIRA, BitBucket, Artifactory and Bamboo), and deployment and configuration management capabilities   <li>Experience of IaaS/PaaS technologies and cloud computing platforms</LI> </ul> Required technical skills:  <ul> <li>Core front-end web experience with HTML, JavaScript and CSS   <li>Skills in one or more frameworks such as AngularJS and Bootstrap   <li>Experience with integrating with REST/JSON services   <li>Understanding of API Security Best Practices   <li>Working experience on Agile based projects</LI> </ul>  <br/><br/>We’re here to help <br/><br/> At BMO we have a shared purpose; we put the customer at the centre of everything we do – helping people is in our DNA. For 200 years we have thought about the future—the future of our customers, our communities and our people. We help our customers and our communities by working together, innovating and pushing boundaries to bring them our very best every day. Together we’re changing the way people think about a bank. <br/><br/> As a member of the BMO team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. We strive to help you make an impact from day one – for yourself and our customers. We’ll support you with the tools and resources you need to reach new milestones, as you help our customers reach theirs. From in-depth training and coaching, to manager support and network-building opportunities, we’ll help you gain valuable experience, and broaden your skillset. <br/><br/> To find out more visit us at https://bmocareers.com/. <br/><br/> BMO is committed to an inclusive, equitable and accessible workplace. By learning from each other’s differences, we gain strength through our people and our perspectives. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.
Title: Lead UI Developer

Job_Description: Company Description<br/><br/>Nous sommes la recherche dune personne passionnée et créative pour joindre notre équipe titre dArtiste en Chef UI. <br/><br/> Avec plus de 300 employés et une variété de projets excitants, il ny a jamais eu de meilleur moment pour joindre laventure Ludia! <br/><br/> Ludia Inc. est une compagnie de jeux vidéo fondée Montréal, qui crée et distribue du contenu multi-plateforme de divertissement numérique. Notre portfolio innovateur et de haute qualité comprend des propriétés originales et de marques reconnues mondialement incluant : Jurassic World: Alive, What&apos;s Your Story, Jurassic World: The Game, Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Legends, Dragons: Rise of Berk, Family Feud® 2 & Friends, Kung Fu Panda: Battle of Destiny, Waldo & Friends et The Price Is Right. Nous faisons partie de la famille FremantleMedia, lun des producteurs de contenu les plus importants au monde.<br/><br/>Job Description<br/><br/>Notre candidat idéal doit démontrer une bonne capacité dadaptation, être proactif, curieux et doit avoir envie de partager ses trouvailles lensemble de léquipe. Si vous aimez les Match-3 cest encore mieux! <br/><br/> Responsibilités principales <ul> <li>Développer un langage visuel cohérent de la phase concept la réalisation finale en sappuyant sur la direction artistique du projet</li><li>Communiquer directement avec notre partenaire externe</li><li>Gestion de léquipe UI(évaluations de performance, coaching et mentorat, développement professionnel et planification du travail)</li><li>Travailler avec une équipe multidisciplinaire de designers de jeux, développeurs et dartistes dans le développement de lexpérience de jeu</li> </ul>  <strong>Qualifications</strong>  <ul> <li>Avoir travaillé sur un minimum de 3 jeux mobiles</li><li>Diplôme en arts visuels ou équivalent</li><li>Expert en Photoshop</li><li>Bonne maîtrise de lengin Unity</li><li>Solides compétences en After Effect</li><li>Compréhension approfondie de l&apos;attrait commercial des jeux, y compris en dehors de votre groupe démographique personnel de joueurs;</li><li>Succès démontré dans la communication de vos conceptions et de votre vision des collègues de différents milieux professionnels;</li><li>Expérience dans la conception de jeux casual;</li><li>Compréhension poussée des enjeux de production artistique</li><li>BilinguismeFR/ENG</li> </ul>  <strong>Additional Information</strong>  <ul> <li>Travailler en plein cœur du Vieux-Montréal, avec des installations pratiques pour votre confort (tel que : douches, aires de repos, supports vélo)</li><li>Un environnement de travail aire ouverte, avec une salle de jeux pour les employés, des tables de baby-foot, ping-pong, billard, Tiki Lounge et plus</li><li>Un plan de santé et de bien-être impressionnant qui comprend des évaluations de santé annuelles</li><li>REER collectif, primes de référence interne et un programme de bonification attrayant</li><li>Collations, café et thé gratuits, ainsi que des lunchs fournis chaque semaine</li><li>De la formation continue incluant des cours de français ou danglais gratuits</li><li>Un abonnement gratuit au gym du coin dès le 1er jour, activités physiques de groupes et massages sur place</li><li>Les 5 7 tous les vendredis dans notre Lounge avec notre propre bière pression: La Ludique</li><li>Une équipe extraordinaire de personnes créatives qui travaillent fort et samuse tout autant! Regardez cette vidéo pour en savoir plus:</li> </ul>
Title: UI Artiste en Chef

Job_Description: <div> <strong>Position ID:</strong> J0318-1251</div> <div> <strong>Job Type:</strong> Contractor</div> <div> <strong>Job Location:</strong> Toronto, Ontario, Canada</div> <div> <strong>Division:</strong> IT/IS</div> <div> <strong>Region:</strong> Head Office</div> <div> <strong>Job Category:</strong> IT</div> <div> <strong>Number of Positions</strong> 2</div> <br/><strong><strong>Keeping You Moving</strong>:</strong> <br/><br/> RSA is one of the world�s leading multinational insurance groups with over 300 years of experience and over 20 million customers worldwide.Our people are committed to building a dynamic internal culture where our people love what they do and feel motivated to keep things moving � for customers, for their colleagues and as part of their own growth and development. In RSA, employing positive people is how we achieve success. You will be working in an environment that encourages you to do great work and you constantly will be faced with fresh challenges that have a direct impact on our business. We believe your personality and passion will keep RSA and our business moving forward. At RSA we have a culture that supports and rewards high performance with a competitive reward policy for top performers. Our rewards package includes competitive compensation, work / life balance, opportunities to learn and the chance to make a difference working for a worldwide industry leader. <br/><br/> <strong>Position Overview:</strong> <br/><br/> The IA / UX / Design Lead will own the Digital customer and broker experience at RSA. This includes producing and coordinating the production of design deliverables (customer journeys, wireframes, prototypes, mood boards, high fidelity deliverables) and implementation recommendations. <br/><br/> <strong>Who you are:</strong> <br/><br/> Your enthusiasm is infectious. You challenge the status quo. You find solutions to problems. You go the extra mile to exceed customers� expectations. You get things done the right way. You represent our brand with passion and pride. You are a team player. You have fun and you make work fun for those working around you. <br/><br/> <strong>What you will achieve in this role:</strong> <br/><br/> �	Ensure a consistent on-brand experience for customers and brokers <br/> �	Execute user requirements gathering, conceptual modeling, onsite and offsite usability testing and competitive landscape analysis <br/> �	Design and specify user interfaces and information architecture using participatory and iterative design techniques including customer interviews, usability testing, and other forms of requirements discovery. <br/> �	Have experience in running, and participating in, Design Thinking workshops <br/> �	Produce user requirements specifications, personas, storyboards, scenarios, prototypes, wireframes, functional specifications, and design specifications <br/> �	Effectively communicate research findings, conceptual ideas and detailed design rationale both verbally and visually <br/> �	Help manage the interaction design process, drive decisions, track issues, and assist in estimating resource needs and schedules <br/> �	Participate as a contributor to an interdisciplinary team that includes visual designers, project managers, product strategists, and developers. <br/> �	Be a strong presenter and storyteller who can lead execution and delivery as well as be an advocate for emerging trends in design and usability, as the role interacts with RSA�s business units directly <br/> �	Govern the direction of our web properties, ensuring alignment and support of other Partners on foundational site elements such as navigation, responsiveness, content development, sales funnel and promotional campaigns <br/> �	Ensure the successful delivery of project design assets <br/> �	Coordinate deliverables between RSA, its contractors and agency partners <br/> �	Be the advocate for what is right for customers and brokers online (sometimes this may involve saying no) <br/> �	Have hands-on experience in wire framing and visual design (technical knowledge of web front end would be an asset <br/> �	Be comfortable leading others through a project � including delivery partners and stakeholders <br/> �	Have ability to look beyond explicit needs to uncover the implicit and latent needs of the customer <br/> �	Have excellent written and verbal communication skills <br/><br/> <strong>What you bring to this role:</strong> <br/><br/> �	7+ years� experience in IA, UX and Design practice <br/> �	Bachelor degree in Computer Science, Human-Computer Interaction, Psychology, Behavioural Science, or equivalent related experience <br/> �	Experience in Design Thinking, or similar customer engagement strategies <br/> �	Experience in UX design and tools (Adobe design suite, Axure/InVision, usability testing tools) <br/> �	Proven knowledge of design aesthetics, and a demonstrable portfolio of work <br/> �	Experience in directly managing and mentoring a team of IA, UX, and Design resources, including project resourcing projections and planning <br/><br/> <strong>Other Information:</strong> <br/><br/> Applicants agree that by providing personal information in response to this ad, and otherwise in any Job_Description: <strong>What is the opportunity?</strong> <br/><br/> The Corporate Systems Shared Services team is in the process of building and enhancing various "Golden Copy" data services for trade, position, client, issuer, counterparty, security, price, book and people reference data. The team has various data-centric projects that will leverage this consolidated data infrastructure. This position is dedicated specifically to the Client and Book Data Repositories. <br/><br/> You will report to the Development Manager and work very closely with him on the technical architecture and associated development activities. <br/><br/> The successful applicant will take a senior role in the development and enhancement of the Client and Book Reference Data platform. A key responsibility of this position is participating in analysis, design, coding and testing of the existing systems. The systems are data-centric so the candidate should have knowledge and experience in Capital Markets and client data management. <br/><br/> <strong>What will you do?</strong> <ul> <li>Articulate and document the technical design of applications to support associated business requirements.</li><li>Participate in the coding of applications; participate in code review.</li><li>Improve development best practices.</li><li>Participate in support activity.</li><li>Author technical specifications as required.</li><li>Create technical "system development life cycle artifacts", as required by projects.</li><li>Work with Project Management to adhere to schedule, budget and scope.</li> </ul> <strong>What do you need to succeed?</strong> <ul> <li><strong>Must-have</strong>  <ul> <li>Degree in computer science</li><li>7+ years of design and development experience in Java and J2EE; 5+ years of experience in SQL; 2+ years of experience in spring framework and JMS; 1+ years of experience in HTML5 or Angular JS</li><li>Senior expertise in at least one of: Sybase, MS SQL Server, Oracle</li><li>Software development life cycle knowledge</li><li>Excellent understanding of data representation and modeling</li></ul></li> <li><strong>Nice-to-have</strong>  <ul> <li>JIRA, Confluence and subversion</li><li>Broad understanding of Capital Markets</li></ul></li> </ul> <strong>Whats in it for you?</strong> <br/><br/> We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual. <ul> <li>A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable</li><li>Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities</li><li>Ability to make a difference and lasting impact</li> <li>Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team</li> <li>Opportunities to do challenging work</li><li>Opportunities to take on progressively greater accountabilities</li> <li>Opportunities to building close relationships with clients</li><li>Access to a variety of job opportunities across business and geographies</li> </ul> <strong>SFDB</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Learn more about RBC Tech Jobs</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>About RBC</strong> <br/> Royal Bank of Canada is Canadas largest bank, and one of the largest banks in the world, based on market capitalization. We are one of North Americas leading diversified financial services companies, and provide personal and commercial banking, wealth management, insurance, investor services and capital markets products and services on a global basis. We have over 80,000 full- and part-time employees who serve more than 16 million personal, business, public sector and institutional clients through offices in Canada, the U.S. and 37 other countries. For more information, please visit rbc.com. <br/><br/> <strong>Get Career Alerts</strong> <br/><br/> Stay in-the-know about great career opportunities at RBC. Sign up for Career Alerts and get customized info on our latest jobs, career tips and Recruitment events that matter to you. <br/><br/> Expand your limits and create a new future together at RBC. Find out how we use our passion and drive to enhance the well-being of our clients and communities at rbc.com/careers. <br/><br/> <strong>Inclusion and Equal Opportunity Employment</strong> <br/> RBC is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We are pleased to consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veterans status, Aboriginal/Native American status or any other legally-protected factors. Disability-related accommodations during the application process are available upon request. <br/><br/> <u><strong>JOB SUMMARY</strong></u> <br/> <strong>City:</strong>  Toronto <br/> <strong>Address:</strong> 155 Wellington Street West <br/> <strong>Work Hours/Week:</strong> 37.5 <br/> <strong>Work Environment:</strong>  Office <br/> <strong>Employment Type:</strong> Permanent <br/> <strong>Career Level:</strong>  Experienced Hire/Professional <br/> <strong>Pay Type:</strong> Salaried <br/> <strong>Required Travel(%):</strong> 0 <br/> <strong>Exempt/Non-Exempt:</strong> N/A <br/> <strong>People Manager:</strong>  No <br/> <strong>Application Deadline:</strong>  2018-02-16 <br/> <strong>Req ID:</strong> 154792 <br/><br/> <em>Posting Notes: [[mfield1]]</em><br/><br/>Apply Now!
Title: Senior Java Developer/HTML UI Developer, Reference Data

Job_Description: Rapid7 is the fastest growing cybercrime security company. We've got a fully functional and expanding UX team. Our product protects Fortune 500 companies from cybercrimes in lots of clever ways and we need the right UX person to join a powerful team that helps everyday-users easily understand these complex problems, and helps them solve them efficiently and enjoyably. If you want to work with a diverse & cohesive team, where each person is a complement to the others, this is the team to join. <br/><br/> <strong>You Are A Design Thinker And You Got Skills</strong>  <ul> <li>You have experience working on projects with multiple stakeholders, managing diverse opinions and driving to solutions that not only meet the user needs but also business goals as well</li> <li>You can ask the hard questions, synthesize the answers and produce great concepts that become reality, quickly</li> <li>You require working in a quick-paced environment, enhancing your leadership and design skills, and believe that design is the most important aspect of any product</li> <li>You have superb information design skills. You are good at creating annotated wireframes and mockups, and are thoughtful about how different users need similar yet different experiences</li> <li>You understand good interface and interaction design principles and have an opinion about what kind of process you think UX people should use</li> <li>You can distill complex problems into tangible solutions to prototype and validate with users</li>   <li>You can communicate clearly about your designs and can advocate for your opinions</li> <li>You are an independent worker and self starter</li> </ul> <strong>You Understand Users, Products And Business</strong>  <ul> <li>You understand the complex systems, processes, and relationships of people and products.</li> <li>You can translate strategy, business requirements, research findings and usability best practices into high quality, customer-centric and customer-validated design that support and reinforce product vision, brand, and business objectives</li> <li>You can balance user experience, business needs, technical feasibility and time-to-market to determine best product design</li> <li>You are not intimidated by complex cyber sec jargon</li> <li>You have at least 4-8 years of relevant experience</li> </ul> <strong>What you will need</strong>  <ul> <li>A creative portfolio that demonstrates your talents</li> <li>Case Studies that demonstrate your direct business impact on the projects you have work.</li> </ul>
Title: Sr. UX Designer

Job_Description: <em>// ENGLISH VERSION WILL FOLLOW ...//</em> <br/><br/> <strong>Poste: Concepteur UX</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Relève de: Producteur</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Projet: Hitman Sniper Franchise</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Fonctions:</strong> <ul> <li>Définir, concevoir et proposer des expériences utilisateur de premier ordre;</li><li>Travailler en étroite collaboration avec léquipe de développement afin dassurer une expérience utilisateur fluide et cohérente avec le jeu;</li><li>Mettre en place des tests dutilisabilité afin de comprendre le comportement du joueur et ses motivations;</li><li>Créer des livrables de haute qualité dans une gamme de fidélité (wireframes, maquettes, flux, prototypes);</li><li>Identifier les risques associés lexpérience du joueur et proposer des solutions efficaces et réalisables;</li><li>Présenter et promouvoir efficacement des solutions de conception pour léquipe et la direction.</li> </ul> <strong>Expérience et qualifications:</strong> <ul> <li>Diplôme détudes collégiales dans la conception ou tous autres domaines pertinentes du jeu vidéo;</li><li>Un minimum de 6 ans dexpérience en tant que concepteur UX;</li><li>Un minimum de 3 ans dexpérience dans le jeu mobile;</li><li>Connaissance approfondie des approches de conception centrées sur l'utilisateur et des meilleures pratiques;</li><li>Connaissance en méthodologie de recherche utilisateur (Méthodes danalyse quantitative et qualitative, Biométrie, Questionnaire utilisateur, etc.).</li> </ul> <strong>Habiletés techniques:</strong> <ul> <li>Compétence dans les outils de conception UX standard de l'industrie (OmniGraffle, Visio, Balsamiq, Sketch, Illustrator, etc.);</li><li>Maitrise des principes dergonomies appliquées aux jeux vidéo;</li><li>Capacité créer des prototypes fonctionnels;</li><li>Avoir le souci du détail et être centré sur la qualité;</li><li>Bonnes capacités organisationnelles;</li><li>Bonne maîtrise du français et de langlais parlé et écrit;</li> </ul> <strong>Qualités interpersonnelles:</strong> <ul> <li>Être capable de travailler au sein dune équipe et avec différents métiers (conception, animation et programmation);</li><li>Être autonome et proactif;</li><li>Avoir une bonne capacité bien exprimer ses idées;</li><li>Avoir de bonnes aptitudes en communication;</li><li>Être capable de sadapter aux changements et travailler sous pression tout en respectant les délais convenus;</li><li>Faire preuve de maturité pour donner et recevoir des critiques constructives.</li> </ul> <strong>Motivation et intérêts:</strong> <br/> Comprendre ce qui fait de bons jeux si particulier, et avoir lhabileté de choisir certains jeux et souligner ce qui fonctionne et ce qui ne fonctionne pas. <br/><br/> <strong>Title: UX Designer</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Reports to: Producer</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Project: Hitman Sniper Franchise</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Duties:</strong> <ul> <li>Define, design and deliver top-notch user experiences;</li><li>Work in close collaboration with the development team in order to ensure a fluid and coherent user experience with the game;</li><li>Implement usability tests in order to understand player behaviour and motivations;</li><li>Create high-quality deliverables in a range of fidelity (wireframes, mockups, flows, prototypes);</li><li>Identify the risks associated with user experience and propose solutions that are efficient and achievable;</li><li>Present and promote design Like the photoshop eyedropper in real life, it takes the real world and makes it digital, and then can help our users make it real again.What you’ll do?Design beautiful apps that work with our award-winning hardwareWork with our software development, hardware, and product teams to craft a seamless user experienceOwn the design of our core products and participate in shaping the direction of our future productsIterate, test, and release products as quickly as we can gather feedback from our users and customersEven help out with other aspects of product design like packaging, web, etc.What you’ll need?A compelling and interesting portfolio of projects that showcase your workExperience designing mobile apps, and even web and other types of media, front end, back end, consumer and cloud based experience is a bonusExperience using the latest design tools to facilitate wireframing, prototyping, user testing, and information architectureExperience using a design methodology to get product out the door fastThe ability to work in a fast paced, collaborative environment, alongside the rest of our dynamic teamWhat’s makes Nix a great place to work?You’ll be joining a company that’s backed by some of the best advisors and investors in CanadaWe’re growing quickly, and you’ll be helping to build the next great Canadian success storyYou’ll work with a highly motivated team that takes pride in creating amazing productsWhat’s next?Send us a note or message indicating your interestShowcase your work by sending us a portfolio and / or examples of prior projectsJob Type: Full-timeExperience:UI Design: 1 yearUX Design: 1 year

Job_Description: We are looking for an energetic designer to join our Penticton Development Team!At Windward Software we build software solutions that empower efficient business growth in small to medium businesses. From inventory control to payroll, and accounting, our solutions allow the entrepreneurs of today to grow their businesses for tomorrow. We have thousands of customers in 35 countries around the world processing over 1.5 billion in annual sales. We like to have fun while we also learn new skills and have several software development company awards to prove it.We are growing! Our solutions are moving to the cloud and we need a talented, creative UX/UI Designer to join our team. Is that you?You will learn to understand our business requirements and technical limitations, as well as be responsible for conceiving and conducting user research, interviews and surveys, and translating them into sitemaps, user flows, customer journey maps, wireframes, mock-ups and prototypes. The UX designer will also design the overall functionality of our software solutions.Working with C-level execs, development team and others in a collaborative environment, your key responsibility is to ensure a functionally sound and amazing user experience.You are passionate about design and innovation and take pride in staying on top of design trends, ensuring the Windward Software customers’ user experience is second to none.We don’t expect you to code on the job, but having that skill and knowing enough about technology and Agile development will allow you to participate in meaningful discussions with the team.Responsibilities and DutiesWorking closely with Windward customers, C-level executives, development team and others, you will be responsible for the UX strategy which is the blueprint that will help drive development, visual design and ultimately the customer experienceYou will be creating information architecture by researching, conceiving, wireframing, sketching, prototyping, and mocking up user experiences for our Windward Software products.Define how an application will look and work in different platforms and browsersMake strategic design and user-experience decisions related to core, and new, functions and featuresWork with the team to shape a project’s overall creative output and maintain qualityIntroduce, support and encourage compliance with UX/UI best practicesQualifications and Skills2 years’ experience in UX development, preferably within an Agile team environmentBachelor’s degree in Computer Science is required. Formal education in the fields of Visual Design, Communications, or Psychology are also beneficial.Expertise in standard UX software such as InVision , Axure, UXPin, Balsamiq, OmniGraffle and the like is a mustBig picture thinker, creative with strong collaborative and communication skillsAble to build low/high fidelity mock-ups for Web and Mobile applicationsPassionate about resolving user pain points through highly functional, visually appealing, designKnown for your keen attention to detail and skills in typography, iconography, visual design principles, readability, and legibilityYou love brainstorming and have a good nerf shot!Demonstrated knowledge of responsive design principles, user interaction design and experience and posses a clear understanding of the importance of user-centered designBasic HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript skills are a plusAbility to work effectively in a team setting including synthesizing abstract ideas into concrete design implicationsProven ability to regularly deliver design solutions for approval in a timely mannerAbility to rapidly produce multiple visual UI/UX concepts for comparison and prototypingWe offerA comprehensive benefit package.Lakes, beaches, wineries – all in our backyard! Take your lunch break at beautiful Skaha Beach – literally just a block away.We have a huge staff lounge area with gym equipment, pool table and showers on-site.Tickets for events at the South Okanagan Events Centre (SOEC).Social activities such as golf tournaments, holiday festivities, etc.Please note: At interview, we will be requesting, a portfolio of your work that demonstrates your creative and effective design skills, along with work in progress examples.Interested?Send your details to us and don’t forget a cover letter telling us why you are a great fit for this position. At this time, only candidates that have unrestricted ability to work in Canada can be considered.While we sincerely appreciate all interest, only those selected for further discussion will be contacted.Thank you!Job Type: Full-time

Title: UX/UI Designer

Job_Description: Reporting to the Senior Manager, Applications & Development, the incumbent is responsible for using methodologies in documenting business requirements and designing AODA compliant User Experience (UX) and User Interface (UI) for technology systems, websites and Web/mobile applications across the Faculty. The incumbent is also responsible for designing graphic elements, building navigation components, developing and documenting test plans, executing automated and manual test cases, test scenarios, and test scripts using System Requirements and System Design Documents.  The User Experience Designer designs and develops UX deliverables (personas, principles, guidelines, UX design patterns, wireframes, etc.); contributes to interim artifacts such as user data analysis, function maps, etc.; applies internationalization standards and accessibility standards to all aspects of user interface design; applies UX design patterns uniformly across all development nodes and within partner projects; designs, develops and conducts usability testing; and collaborates with and makes presentations to other teams and groups. The incumbent participates in and leads group discussions to establish current and future business requirements, translating the business requirements into technical specifications for development. The incumbent establishes close working relationships with team members, subject matter experts/clients, and technical partners within and outside the immediate project structure.   Qualifications: Minimum Qualifications: Education: Bachelor’s degree with concentration in Web design and Web development or an acceptable equivalent combination of education and experience. Experience: Minimum five (5) years’ of recent and related experience in the design of interactive Web based applications. Strong knowledge and experience applying usability and accessible Web design practices. Experience working with user centered design methodologies, including translating user research findings into functional requirements and developing functional specifications. Proven experience using a methodical approach to collecting requirements, developing interfaces, testing and validating designs. Experience applying analytical, abstract, creative, evaluative and synthesis abilities within a software development environment. Experience communicating complex ideas clearly, using diagrams, models, prototypes, pictures, and writing. Skills: Strong analytical skills, with the ability to take business requirements and abstract them into models and concepts. Expertise in current design practices and tools, (e.g. Axure, Adobe Illustrator, Photoshop, Dreamweaver, MS Visio, OmniGraffle). Excellent presentation and documentation skills. Excellent verbal written communication skills. Good understanding of UNIX and Linux. Other: Thorough understanding of Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA) requirements and proven ability to develop and test compliant interfaces that meet or exceed requirements. In-depth functional knowledge of student systems and higher education requirements are an asset. Able to identify and express business requirements in manner a developer will understand. Ability to work as a team or independently with minimal supervision.  Travel: None  Notes: A copy of the detailed job description is available upon request from the Faculty of Arts and Science HR office by emailing: hr.office@utoronto.ca  Employee Group: United Steelworkers (USW)  Appointment Type: Budget - Continuing  Schedule: Full-time  Pay Scale Group and Hiring Rate: USW Pay Band 16 - $83,966 with an annual step progression to a maximum of $107,378. Pay scale and job class assignment is subject to determination pursuant to the Job Evaluation/Pay Equity Maintenance Protocol.  Job Field: Information Technology  Job Posting: May 17, 2018  Job Closing: May 29, 2018, 10:59:00 PM
Title: User Experience Designer

Job_Description: Horizn Studios Inc . is currently looking to add a talented, and driven Junior UX/UI Designer to our cross-disciplinary team. As a UX/UI designer, you will play a key role in researching, conceptualizing and designing interface solutions for a wide range of interesting yet unique UX/UI challenges. A portfolio that demonstrates your passion for interactive design including work samples that show your process and attention to detail is a must.  About Horizn  Horizn helps financial services, technology companies and manufacturers accelerate market adoption of their new products and digital technology at speed and enterprise scale.  We do this by inciting employees, sales forces, and yes, customers to quickly become knowledgeable and digitally fluent on the companies latest products. Our revolutionary Go-To-Market mobile platform embraces the dynamics of micro-learning, social technologies, addictive game play and robust analytics to power employee performance, drive customer adoption and increase revenues.  Responsibilities  User & stakeholder research  Produce innovative and engaging user-interface design for websites, and native mobile applications  Create wireframes, storyboards, user flows and sitemaps to effectively communicate interaction and design.  Skills & Experience  Entry level, minimum 1-2 years of professional experience in UX/UI design  Strong understanding of current design standards for modern devices and browsers.  Proficiency in Sketch, Photoshop, Illustrator  Working knowledge of Axure and/or Balsamic, or other visual design and wireframing tools.  Up-to-date with the latest UI trends, techniques, and technologies.  Competencies  Strong passion for design and UX and desire to learn  Ability to work on multiple projects in a fast paced environment.  Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Title: Junior UX/UI Designer

Job_Description: Key Role We are seeking an experienced Product Designer for our client who will be responsible for creating amazing user experiences (UX) within their suite of products. The ideal candidate should have an eye for clean user interface (UI) design and be able to collaborate with product managers to enhance existing products and help define future solutions. You are skilled at transforming product requirements and wireframes into intuitive design and prototypes to guide engineering throughout the software development lifecycle (SDLC). You will manage the human-centred design process, understanding real users – their goals, aptitudes, experiences, needs, and motivations. You will approach design from a user-perspective and balance user needs, business goals and technical capabilities.  Duties and Responsibilities • Collaborate with product management and engineering to define and implement innovative solutions for the product direction, visuals and experience;  Conduct user research, evaluate analytics and assimilate user feedback; Conceptualize original ideas that bring simplicity and user friendliness to complex design roadblocks; Apply your design abilities to complex product problems with the goal of reducing user friction; Create storyboards, user flows, and high-fidelity prototypes across our suite of products that can be used by all teams during product development, including internal and external presentations as required; Execute all visual design stages from concept to final hand-off to engineering; Present and defend designs and key milestone deliverables to peers and executive level stakeholders; Oversee usability testing and ensure acceptance criteria are met; Establish and promote design guidelines, best practices and standards.  Requirements:  Diploma or degree in Digital Design, Interaction Design or Communications (or equivalent); Minimum 3 years of UX/UI design experience; Up-to-date with the latest UI trends, techniques, and technologies; Proficiency in Invision, Sketch, Axure, Adobe Creative Cloud, or other prototyping tools; Experience with HTML, CSS, JS and AngularJS an asset, but coding not required; Solid experience in creating wireframes, storyboards, user flows, and process flows; Strong collaboration and negotiation skills, including getting and giving feedback, and managing stakeholders and stakeholder expectations; Excellent verbal and written communication skills, including strong presentation skills; Experience working in an Agile environment an asset; Domain experience in master data management, product information management, digital asset management, and/or digital retail solutions definite asset.  Benefits: Great Company Culture Growth Opportunities Work with a diverse and strong team
Title: UX Designer

Technical and design production for internal RBC website properties and related communication activities Act as a subject matter expert for conceptual and technical design, development, and implementation Production design assistance with ongoing design projects, including the creation of graphic images and content to support Technology & Operations (T&O;) content and top stories Determine the scope, effort, complexity, resources, and technology required to enhance and evolve the Intranet, as well as drive users to intranet sites Support co-ordination and productivity measures of publishing workflow with focus on optimizing efficiency and effectiveness opportunities to enhance “ease of doing business” and client experience Proactively act in a consultant in supporting new and existing intranet content initiatives, focusing on content presentation and navigation, and review content to ensure alignment to standards Ensures communication needs and requirements are being met and are in line with site infrastructure Support the planning and facilitation of events and the creation of monthly and ad hoc project reports  What do you need to succeed? Network and build lasting relationships with students from diverse backgrounds from across Canada Participate in fun events and gamification challenges to help build your career tool kit while enjoying a work-life balance Leaders who support your development through coaching and learning opportunities Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive and highly performing team Ability to make a difference and lasting impact Enjoy a comfortable work environment with the option to dress casually  Learn more about RBC Tech Jobs  About RBC Royal Bank of Canada is Canada’s largest bank, and one of the largest banks in the world, based on market capitalization. We are one of North America’s leading diversified financial services companies, and provide personal and commercial banking, wealth management, insurance, investor services and capital markets products and services on a global basis. Job_Description: About the UX Designer position  We are looking for a skilled UX Designer who will design our mobile applications and platforms to help meet our customers' needs. You will make our product more user-friendly and intuitive to attract and retain customers, by combining interfaces and workflows to enhance user experience.  A successful candidate should be an analytical and creative designer who is able to grasp user needs and solve problems. We also expect you to have strong portfolio of successful UX and other technical projects.  UX Designer responsibilities are: Analyze and meet product specifications and user expectations  Perform concept and usability testing and gather feedback  Use special personas based on user research results  Create right interaction models and evaluate their success  Build wireframes and prototypes around customer needs  Solve UX problems, such as usability or findability, using creative approach  Collaborate with UI designers to implement attractive designs  Discuss design ideas and prototypes with developers  Stay informed about competitor products and industry trends  UX Designer requirements are: 2+ years' experience of working on a UX Designer, UI Designer or other relevant position  Significant experience with design software and a solid portfolio of design projects  Excellent knowledge of interaction design and information architecture  Good knowledge of Android and iOS Material Design  Experience in project management and research will be a bonus  Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with business-oriented approach  Strong communication skills  BSc in Design, Computer Science, Engineering or other related area

We’re a team of passionate engineers, science illustrators, designers and entrepreneurs and are backed by an incredible group of investors, including Y Combinator. We nerd out on cool science stuff and solving big problems. We work really hard and sweat the details to deliver a high impact product that our users love.Requirements:- Strong experience (3+ years) in digital product design- Bachelor's degree in design or related field- Front-end development skills (CSS, HTML5, Javascript)- Experience working in health/science related product development is a plus- Very detail oriented and have up-to-date knowledge on design trends- Passionate about design but always consider functionality over aesthetics- Be able to interface/collaborate with full-stack developer for seamless integration- Candidate must be eligible to work in CanadaProject details: - Work closely with our UX Researcher and full-stack developers to integrate feedback from users to take BioRender’s application interface design to the next level-Re-design the BioRender.io landing page (marketing site) to ensure cohesiveness with web app- Ensure that the web app design integrates well with the rest of the company’s supporting pages (sign-in page, email communication etc)- This is a 1-2 month contract position with possibility of extension- Assist with promotional design material as needed (conference material, etc)Apply: Please email jobs(at)biorender.iowith your resume, portfoliowith relevant samples, availability and a short blurb about yourself.Job Type: ContractExperience:UI Product Design: 3 yearsEducation:Bachelor'sLanguage:English
Title: UI/Product (web app) Designer

Job_Description: Job SummaryWe are looking for a UI designer to join and play an important role on our web development team. We are an established insurance broker with a leading online presence in the Canadian insurance space.This will be a good opportunity for you apply your design, UI and UX skills to help create innovative web and marketing solutions that deliver a positive user experience and meet business goals.This job is for you IF :You have strong creative and design skillsYou can program and trouble shoot front end interfacesYou are innovative and can think outside the boxYou like working in a start up environmentYou are self motivated and self sufficientYou are able to wear multiple hats - designer, front end development, UXResponsibilities and DutiesAs a UI designer you will work with team members and play a lead role in front end design and development activities. You will ensure our web solutions are stylish, fast and user friendly no matter what device is being used.Collaborating with internal teams, insurance companies and other 3rd party providersCreating design and front end requirements, assets and code to implement for various web based systems – website, customer service portal, ecommerce, quoting applications, crm, advertising campaigns, internal systems and more.Providing estimates for projectsCreating functional wireframes, mockups, story boards and style guidesCreating visual and styling elements – custom graphics, stock imagery and other look and feel elements.Creating high quality front end code that is fast, responsive and pixel perfectKeeping management up to date on progressQualifications and SkillsCollege or University Degree in Web Design or related disciplineMinimum 2+ years’ experience as UI designer-developerA strong portfolio demonstrating UI/UX design skillsProficiency in HTML5, CSS, Bootstrap, JSAdobe Creative Cloud (Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign), Sketch and other design toolsDeep understanding of design principles & best practicesAbility to develop front end solutions with a high degree of attention to user interfaces and knowledge of usability best practicesExperience developing responsive web pages for multiple platforms, mobile devices and browsers.Adaptable learning ability to work with and understand new technologies as new toolsEffective planning, writing and communication skillsUnderstanding of SEO is an assetExperience with video production and animation is an assetBenefitsHealth and Dental BenefitsFlexible Hours and Remote Working DaysUp to 3 weeks of vacationJob Type: Full-timeSalary: $50,000.00 to $65,000.00 /year
Title: Intermediate UI Designer

Job_Description: Job Description (EN)   Torstar Corporation is a broadly based, progressive media organization listed on the Toronto Stock Exchange (TS.B) with a long, proud history in newspapers and a passion for capitalizing on the fluid world of digital and mobile media. Torstar will be energized by a deep customer-centric obsession, continued journalistic excellence, advanced data-driven competency and a culture that is selfless, focused, agile, collaborative and results driven . You’ll be a champion of those priorities while you leverage Torstar’s wealth of data to drive revenues for a company that is poised and positioned to lead in all of its media ventures.  As A Member Of Our HIGH PERFORMANCE Team You Will: Leverage rigorous design research and usability principles as well as your intuitive design sense to help understand our customers and their needs; Plot and map user journeys from product discovery through enrollment, down multiple engagement routes and through to journey completion Create deliverables such as process flows, wireframes, mockups and functional prototypes to effectively communicate design strategies and detailed interaction behaviors Contribute to the product roadmap with ideas helping evolve and iterate on the user experience based on quantitative data and qualitative user research Consult with Product Owner, Scrum team, customers and users in decision making surrounding user flows, sitemaps, layout, styling and technical feasibility Design and conduct user experience research quickly and apply it to design sprints for both product and delivery teams Possess excellent understanding of visual design principles, style guidelines, design processes, and creative workflow, merging design, data & consumer insights into immersive digital experiences Work as a member of the UX and Design team, helping to define and design clear, beautiful interfaces for the web and mobile devices; Facilitate collaboration with the broader team along the way, and present the rationale behind decisions to client stakeholders; Provide detailed specifications for UI developers to use.  Who You Are… Minimum 4 years’ experience designing responsive web or mobile software applications, with an emphasis on the ability to communicate using rapid visual design techniques Online portfolio of work demonstrating clean user interface design, ability to solve complex design challenges, using a thoughtful design process. Expertise with Adobe Creative Suite, InVision and other prototyping and visualization software Strong ability in applying design thinking tenants and user centered design principles to design challenges Experience building rich, interactive prototypes Persuasively recommends and promotes UX principles with enthusiasm, conviction, and assertiveness. Interface, collaborate with team and company stakeholders to ensure the user experience reflects player needs and consistency High level of technical acuity with a thorough understanding of front end technologies Experience working in an Agile environment an asset;  Why You’ll LOVE Working Here… The opportunity to be part of an exciting company grounded in history while striving to be at the cutting edge of the digital media industry; you'll never get bored in our fast-paced, constantly evolving and challenging environment We recognize that you have a life outside of work and we offer you real work/life balance We provide individualized career plans and extensive ongoing development opportunities We've got your health in mind; you'll get a comprehensive benefits package & group RSP (Extended Health Care, Dental, etc.) combined with a generous vacation plan  …And let’s not forget the AWESOME PEOPLE!  The Company is committed to providing an inclusive and barrier free recruitment process to applicants with accessibility needs in accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA). If you require an accommodation during this process, please inform The Company of your requirements.
Title: UX Designer

Job_Description: SUMMARY  Top Drawer is a full-service ad agency specializing in engaging omni-channel campaigns for various brand categories, including health and wellness, financial services, specialty retail, not for profit and much more. Under one roof, we house creative, digital, media, strategy and account teams, all working together to deliver exceptional outcomes for our clients.  Top Drawer is also Canada’s first full-service ad agency to be certified as a B Corp. We are 100% carbon neutral certified and run on 100% green energy. Our team enjoys a supportive, employee-friendly work environment with unique perks, such as a bike-to-work subsidy, flex time, bonus summer days off, full benefits, great vacation package and more.  Top Drawer’s office is located on Queen Street East in Toronto’s Beach community, just a short walk from the waterfront. Our unique, collaborative workspace includes a video editing suite, photo studio, rooftop patio, full kitchen and stunning green roof. We are currently seeking a UX to be the next member of our talented team.  Description  Conducting user research and testing Create Information Architecture (sitemaps) Developing wireframes and task flows based on user needs Customer Journey Map Collaborating with Designers and Developers to create intuitive, user-friendly software Familiarity with interaction design and information architecture Create personas through user research and data Develop wireframes and prototypes around customer needs Understand product specifications and user psychology Conduct concept and usability testing and gather feedback Interpretation of google analytics for research Find creative ways to solve UX problems (e.g. usability, findability)  Qualifications  3+ years of proven experience as a UX Designer Communicate design ideas and prototypes to developers Work with UI designers to implement attractive designs Background in project management and research would be an asset Proficient in design software (e.g. ADOBE XD) Knowledge of HTML/CSS; JavaScript is a plus Understanding of Bootstrap and responsiveness design approach Problem-solving aptitude work independently and with teams Keep abreast of competitor products and industry trends  Please send include a cover letter and résumé with your application. We thank everyone for applying, however, only those candidates who have been selected will be contacted. No phone calls please.  Visit www.topdrawercreative.com to learn more about Top Drawer Inc.  Top Drawer welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.  We thank you for your interest in Top Drawer.
Title: UX Designer

Job_Description: About Our Company  UNIVERIS, headquartered in Toronto, Canada, is a privately held company and is the leader in enterprise wealth management for the Canadian market. Founded in 1991, UNIVERIS has over 100 staff and 15 leading financial services clients representing over 17,000 financial advisors on the platform. It offers the most comprehensive wealth management solution for financial advisors in the credit union, banking, insurance and investment dealer sectors.  UNIVERIS is a world-class technology platform that boasts a number of firsts in Canadian mutual fund distribution including real-time processing, web access, built-in compliance, plus GIC and segregated funds processing capabilities. Technology innovation is one of the cornerstones of UNIVERIS' product development strategy and through its Evergreen approach to technology, new features and capabilities transparently integrate into the platform.  About the Role  We are looking for a talented UUI/UX Designer responsible for conceiving and conducting user research, interviews and surveys, and translating them into sitemaps, wireframes and prototypes. You will also make strategic design decisions for the overall functionality of the product and iterate upon it to ensure a great user experience. You will be creating and maintaining a design systems library for all products in accordance with the persona(s) that you will be responsible for. If this sounds like what you are looking for, we are excited to meet you!  Responsibilities  Create, document and maintain design patterns and assets into a design library/style guide.  Collaborate with other team members and stakeholders.  Make strategic design and user-experience decisions related to core, and new, functions and features.  Lead the Design System initiative to bring consistency across all products.  Translate concepts into wireframes and mockups that lead to intuitive user experiences.  Facilitate stakeholder’s product visions by researching, conceiving, wireframing, sketching, prototyping, and mocking up user experiences for digital products.  Plan, create and manage methods of user testing and user feedback.  Design and deliver lofi/hifi wireframes and mockups optimized for a wide range of devices and interfaces (web, mobile, tablet, etc).  Identify design problems and devise elegant solutions.  Take a user-centered design approach and rapidly test and iterate your designs.  Take smart risks and champion new ideas.  Stay current with recent developments in the UX/UI design industry and community; and communicate any new insight to fellow designers  Maintain the UX community within Univeris, to promote UX awareness across all platforms  Requirements  Bachelor's Degree, College diploma OR relevant experience Experience: 3+ years.  Expertise in UX software such as Sketch, InVision, UXPin, Balsamiq, Zeplin, Marvel and/or Adobe CS and the like is a must.  A good understanding on design systems, how they work and how to utilize them across products.  Basic understanding of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript skills. (no actual coding required)  Ability to work with clients to understand detailed requirements and design complete user experiences that meet client needs and vision.  Extensive experience in using UX design best practices to design solutions, and a deep understanding of mobile-first and responsive design.  Experience designing Web and Hybrid Mobile apps.  A solid grasp of user-centered design and testing methodologies, subsystems, and usability and accessibility concerns.  Ability to iterate your designs and solutions efficiently and intelligently.  Ability to clearly and effectively communicate design processes, ideas, and solutions to teams and clients.  A clear understanding of the importance of user-centered design.  Be excited about collaborating and communicating closely with teams and other stakeholders via a distributed model to regularly deliver design solutions for approval.  Be willing to help teammates, share knowledge and experience with them, and learn from them.  Ability to present and promote design ideas to all stakeholders.  Be open to receiving feedback and constructive criticism.  Be passionate about all things UX and other areas of design and innovation. Research and showcase knowledge in the industry’s latest trends and technologies.  A portfolio showcasing your UX skills, capabilities, and strong sense of user understanding and design.
Title: UX Designer

Job_Description: Hi! We’re ecobee.  We are pioneers and innovators in the fast-emerging connected home and IoT industries. ecobee products are beautifully designed and incredibly smart. They are connected devices which automate your home while helping you save energy and money. We’re headquartered in Toronto, and play on an international scale.  We’re growing. In fact, we’re growing really fast. And, we’re looking for great people to join our hive.  Who Are You?  As a member of our UX team, you will be responsible for helping define the user experience for ecobee’s physical products; we are specifically looking for an intermediate or senior designer to focus on our newest commercial web portal and mobile application.  You have a critical thinking mindset, and the ability to imagine the future while considering the implications of your design decisions. With excellent communication skills, you are comfortable presenting your ideas through various media – words, whiteboard, graphics or prototypes.  You will collaborate closely with our development and product management teams as well as others in the company. You are excited about working with a cutting edge team in the connected home market and can draw on past interactive and design experience to craft high quality experiences that solve real problems for our customers.  Still interested? Read on!  What Will You Do?   Design user experiences and interfaces for ecobee’s commercial web portal and mobile applications. Collaborate closely with other designers, development teams, product management, and copywriters to recommend features, experiences, and UI implementations. Plan and run user research to learn about customers’ needs and goals and lifestyles, as well as synthesize results Consider customer pain points while investigating solutions to design problems, and validate design decisions with usability testing Assist with facilitating design charrettes (ideation workshops) with team members from various areas of the company to gain insights and develop rough concepts to move forward with Be comfortable communicating ideas to a group of internal stakeholders, explaining rationale behind design decisions  What Experience Do You Have?   5+ years of industry experience, including design of native Android or iOS mobile apps and responsive web. Degree or diploma in UX/interactive/graphic design, or equivalent. Interaction design experience including responsive web, mobile app, information architecture, etc. Experience collaborating with cross-functional agile teams including development, and providing guidelines and assets required for implementation. Knowledge of facilitation, able to recommend ideation workshop activities and comfortable leading a room. Experience utilizing user research and testing to inform design decisions. Ability to prepare for and run unbiased user interviews, and contribute to synthesizing results. Thorough understanding of design patterns and best practices on mobile and web. Just so you know: our hired candidate will be required to complete a criminal background check.  Are you the one we’re looking for? If so, we would love to hear from you!  ecobee is committed to workplace diversity and will provide accommodation to applicants with disabilities throughout the hiring process.
Title: User Experience Designer

Job_Description: At ThoughtWire, we are on a mission to orchestrate Industrial IoT for a healthier, cleaner and safer world. Using our award-winning Ambiant™ IIoT platform, we are dedicated to making hospitals smarter, buildings more automated and energy efficient, and workplaces safer, by inter-connecting and orchestrating people, workflows, data and things in real-time.  Who we’re looking for:  As we enter our next phase of growth, we are looking for a User Interface Designer to join the group delivering solutions to our customers. You will be responsible for helping ensure ThoughtWire applications crystallize complex and constantly changing information into actionable outcomes. You’ll work with a diverse group of smart and passionate developers to take advantage of the rich capabilities provided by our combination of contextual computing with an ever-expanding set of IoT devices. Use your creativity and skill to help define and create clean, clear and immediately usable displays and interactions.  Apply your passion for using design to incorporate rich information into usable interactions to create great outcomes for people. Create meaningful outcomes that directly affect the work our customers do from healthcare to manufacturing. ThoughtWire is at the leading edge of applying IoT to model complex environments and drive immediate action for people working in a wide range of roles. Nurses, doctors, building operations and manufacturing operators all benefit from their close collaboration with the machine intelligence at the heart of the Ambiant platform. Join us to help shape our users’ interaction with that intelligence to ensure it is a productive partnership for them.  You are great at:  Making complex and information rich concepts clear and easy to understand Identifying design problems and developing elegant solutions Working with the team to define and maintain UI/UX standards that promote a consistent identity for Ambiant products Researching and staying abreast of interaction/visual design trends and web design Simplifying complex user interactions within an intuitive, appealing user interface Designing great UI including layout, typography and graphic elements Designing the display of large quantities of dynamic information for clarity, usability and presentation Learning the constraints of a development platform and designing great outcomes within those constraints Executing a refined design and presentation without sacrificing clarity and usability Collaborating within an agile team to create great things together What it takes:  Exceptional design skills, production value and attention to detail Great visual communication skills Ability to create wireframes as well as visual design Expert knowledge of Photoshop, Illustrator or other visual design tools Experience with user-centered design and testing methodologies Experience creating production ready graphics for web and app use 3+ years web and mobile design experience 2+ years of design experience for enterprise software Ability to communicate product designs in a way that stakeholders can understand and relate to Why you want to work for us:  Great colleagues, mentorship, and meaningful socially impactful work Competitive salary Flexible hours Great office location in Toronto’s Market District, steps from St. Lawrence Market Short walk to Union Station or King Station Healthy snacks and free drinks Full benefits package from your start date - no waiting period! ThoughtWire is an open and inclusive environment that values diversity and invests in the skills and growth of all our team members. We offer a friendly and non-traditional career path by valuing the individual and their skills over the credentials they carry. ThoughtWire welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available upon request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.  Thank you to all who apply. We are only contacting applicants who are moving on to the next stage of the process. If you don’t hear from us, please check back for any future opportunities!  About ThoughtWire ThoughtWire’s Ambiant™ IIoT platform equips organizations with the capability to become smarter, safer, and more energy efficient by inter-connecting and orchestrating their people, workflows, data and things. Smart cities and buildings, advanced manufacturers and healthcare providers use Ambiant’s platform to achieve intelligent automation and provide real-time guidance to staff so they can predict and resolve issues, ensure safety, achieve energy efficiency and deliver optimal experiences to citizens, patients, customers and tenants. Founded in 2009, and based in Toronto, ThoughtWire earned a Frost & Sullivan Best Practices Award in 2017 and was ranked a Gartner Cool Vendor 2016. Learn more at www.thoughtwire.com.
Title: UI Designer

time-in-position (1 year) and performance management code requirements (M+, Meets Expectations and Consistently Demonstrates) Bachelor’s degree in Interaction Design, Web Design or a related field, or interaction design patterns and responsive design best practices Comfortable with complexity and ambiguity, with a passion for the challenges around ideating and organizing content and functionality Excellent visual design skills with sensitivity to user-system interaction Experience with atomic design and pattern libraries Able to think creatively while maintaining accuracy and attention to detail Understanding of accessibility design requirements and best practices Experience with Sketch or equivalent tools Ability to craft visual annotations and functional specifications for development team Proficiency in Photoshop, Illustrator, or other visual design tools Proficiency in HTML, CSS, and JavaScript Knowledge of Agile and Scrum processes Up-to-date with the latest UX and
