Title: User Interface Designer

Job_Description: ABOUT US TribalScale is an innovation firm that brings organizations - from the startup to the enterprise - into the future. We build digital products, transform teams, and grow startups. We’re headquartered in Toronto and have offices around the world. The future is bright, and we’re always looking for excited technologists to create with us. Some of the platforms that we work with: Mobile & Web (iOS, tvOS, Android) Voice User Interfaces (Amazon Alexa, Google Home) Connected Cars and Homes OTT (Roku, Fire TV) Beacon Solutions VR & AR ABOUT YOU You're excited about designing the connected world and want to join a team of ambitious, like-minded technologists. You're passionate about the intersection of design and technology and strive to explore new meaningful interactions between the physical and digital worlds. You want to have high impact, drive design innovation, and have a meaningful contribution to both our work environment and client work at TribalScale. You strive in fast-paced, collaborative environments and are able to quickly switch gears between client work, internal initiatives, and supporting your peers under minimal supervision.  WHAT YOU’LL DO Defining and leading digital transformations at a strategic level. Working with clients to determine where they need to go and how to get there Work closely with the Product Managers embedded with each team/projec Alignment of individual contributors up to the executive level in the client’s organization and our Working with clients as they are immersed with our teams, learning agile XP with lean methodologies. Measuring progress and while managing communications to an executive audience REQUIREMENTS Proficiency of UX design discipline – user flows, wireframes, mockups, prototypes, etc. Proficiency with the latest design tools and software (Adobe CS, Sketch) Experience with Roku and FireTV Self-motivated to take initiative and ownership of your work. Immaculate attention to detail, typography, and interactivity. Have a user-centric mindset throughout your design process. Consistently up to date with the latest design trends and best practices. Collaborate well with Product Mangers, Engineers, Sales, and everyone else in our Tribe. Help guide product decisions through user testing and iterative feedback loops. Rapidly iterate on design prototypes and working applications. Produce materials for clients and developers, including user flows, wireframes, mockups, prototypes, and assets. Open to new tools and methodologies, yet opinionated about best practices. A strong portfolio that demonstrates previous work samples. BONUS POINTS FOR VUI Voice skills Conversational interface design Experience with motion graphics / animation. Applied knowledge of user testing and validation techniques. Early adopter of new technology and gadgets. Familiar with Lean Startup Methodologies, Design Sprints, and Gamestorming. WHY YOU WANT TO BE AT TRIBALSCALE Our values: Meritocracy, empowerment, and transparency. Our skills: Our teams were at the front the mobile revolution, are expert builders in Voice tech, and now, they’re connecting the world. They’ve work with brands including the NBA, Twitter, ABC, the CBC, Autonomics, and tons more. You matter: Everyone sits at the table and brings value. We love to be challenged, are happy to go with the flow, and we trust our gut. Growth: We’re a rocketship ready to take-off, you’ll get your hands dirty in every aspect of the business and there are tremendous opportunities for personal and professional growth. Seize them. BENEFITS Stay Happy & Healthy Health benefits: 100% medical, dental and vision coverage Wealthsimple Group Retirement Savings Plan (GRSP) Generous maternity and paternity leave policies Daily hot breakfast Fully stocked kitchen: unlimited drinks and snacks Office fitness and social events Office closed over Winter holidays Corporate-discounted GoodLife membership Perkopolis: company perk plan Free Netflix membership Make Meaningful Connections Friday socials to cap off a great week Regular office activities: game nights, movie nights, group fitness, and more Quarterly team events: axe-throwing, beach day, and more Take your pick at a gaming break: Super Smash Bros, foosball, ping pong Discover Your Potential Tickets to local events, conferences & meet-ups Out-of-town conference subsidies $2000 annual professional development allowance Weekly Lunch & Learns with industry leaders $3000 referral bonus Want To See The World? Our employees have the opportunity to rotate through our offices, giving employees the chance to travel, experience new cultures and discover their full potential.
Title: UI/UX Designer

Job_Description: Think Research is a disruptive and rapidly growing software company that is changing the way healthcare is delivered across Canada, in the U.S. and EU. We are passionate about what we do, and even more so about the amazing people that help make what we do possible. We’re growing fast and we need all hands on deck. Hungry to make a change that will affect millions? Well grab a quick snack, we're looking for you. Why us? Be part of something special. It’s not every day that you get to change the way your friends and family are cared for Unbeatable downtown location right across the street from Union Station (and 30 seconds away from 17 different Starbucks locations!) Opportunity to join a rapidly growing team of high-energy, brilliant people who are passionate about their work and colleagues Mentorship from senior and c-level employees Exciting, collaborative, fast-paced and multidisciplinary environment Casual dress code Macbook with Creative Cloud, Sketch & Omnigraffle The kind of work you’d be doing: We’re seeking a talented intermediate to senior UX/UI Designer to join our team. We take a communicative and collaborative approach to product development. You’ll work alongside developers, product owners, and quality assurance in our integrated team. Our ideal candidate is highly motivated, loves learning, and is willing to take creative risks. As a UX/UI Designer at Think Research, you’ll touch every part of the design process – from user research to wireframing and testing, to designing high-fidelity user interfaces all in the pursuit of building amazing products. This includes, but is not limited to: Designing everything from small features to entirely new products Conducting user research and testing, gaining a full understanding of our users Creating user flows, information architecture and wireframes Working iteratively to develop ideas from sketches to high-fidelity designs Developing interactive design elements and solutions Thinking creatively to produce new ideas and concepts Collaborating with developers to craft designs that use modern standards and processes Collaborating with product owners to create seamless user experiences Ability to deliver high-quality work within a fast-paced environment Presenting finalized ideas and concepts to clients or product managers Your ideal qualifications: Diploma or degree in design Minimum 2-4 years of working experience Knowledge of UX design processes Experience in prototyping and user interviewing Keen eye for detail Self-starter who enjoys experimenting with ideas and approaches A love for learning about emerging design trends, standard, and technology Aptitude with Photoshop and/or Sketch and eagerness to learn new tools Nice to have's: Proficiency with HTML5, CSS3, especially their issues and quirks Experience with CSS preprocessors like LESS or SASS Ability to create motion graphics to demonstrate interface animations Aptitude with designing, wireframing and prototyping tools including Creative Cloud, Omnigraffle, Invision, etc. Resumes are useful, but they don’t say much about a designer’s skills or passion. We would love to see a web portfolio of design work with any wireframes or user flow sketches. Please include a link to your portfolio in your resume.
Title: UX/UI Designer

Job_Description: A Little About Us: Making fans - That’s what we’re all about! Since our humble beginnings in 2011, these two words have driven Big Viking Games to become the successful company it is today. With over 100 Vikings already on board, and studios in both Toronto, ON and London, ON, we are focused on making our mark by building awesome free-to-play mobile and social games. Big Viking Games has proudly amassed millions of loyal fans across its many popular titles with no signs of slowing down anytime soon. We believe that by investing in our employees and in new technologies, such as HTML5, we can continue our success for years to come. With that in mind, we are on the hunt for exceptional talent to join our growing team, and that’s where you come in! The Nitty Gritty: Big Viking Games is looking to add a UI/UX Designer to our Ventures Division (Mobile/Instant Games), who will collaborate with Game Designers and Developers to ship titles! Reporting to the Ventures Producer, this role will be based out of our Toronto, ON studio. The Duties: Work closely with Product Managers, Producers, Art Director and Game Designers to create an effective user experience Able to understand feature documentation and GDD and break out the User Interface tasks and scope Independently and collaboratively, work with the team in order to develop UI workflow and design Create annotated wireframes, clickable wireframes/prototypes, workflow diagrams, mockups and design specifications for proper implementation Maintain UX-related documentation as needed throughout the lifecycle of the project As a self-motivated individual and triage expert, you will prioritize deadlines while working on multiple projects simultaneously Deliver top quality work while working under tight deadlines Foster and maintain effective relationships with your teammates and fellow Vikings Orchestrate feedback loops including UI analytics and user testing, and respond to the results to improve on designs Ideate on game UI concepts Mentor junior artists  The Must Haves: A minimum of 4 years working experience in the gaming industry, preference is given to those that have additional experience working in the mobile space previously Previous experience creating UI for mobile games Strong understanding of mobile and interactive design fundamentals Advanced communications and interpersonal skills Expert Photoshop and Illustrator skills Axure and InVision A passion for games with a deep understanding of top grossing mobile gaming products The Nice to Haves: An understanding/passion for marketing and branding Proficiency in Zbrush, Mudbox or other 3D modelling suites Previously shipped games, ideally mobile An understanding of statistics, analytics, and AB testing Loot: Competitive salary, bonus program, Group Retirement Savings Plan matching, and participation in the Employee Stock Option Plan. Comprehensive benefits package (health, dental, and vision), including generous time off policies. Stocked kitchen, unlimited snacks and beverages, along with breakfast and daily hot lunches. Vikings can't work on an empty stomach! Lots of other great perks such as frequent company paid outings, events and get-togethers.  Becoming a Viking: Does the idea of working for a gaming company doing what you love everyday sound exciting? Great, we’d love to hear from you! Send us your resume and cover letter Big Viking Games is committed to providing accommodations for people with disabilities. If you require an accommodation, we will work with you to meet your needs. Accommodation may be provided in all parts of the hiring process. For More information regarding accessibility, please visit our Accessibility webpage.
Title: UI/UX Designer

Job_Description: Konrad Group Konrad Group is a next generation digital consultancy. We are dedicated to solving complex business problems for our global clients with creative and forward-thinking solutions. Our employees enjoy a culture built on innovation and a commitment to creating best-in-class digital products in use by hundreds of millions of consumers around the world. We hire exceptionally smart, analytical, and hard working people who are lifelong learners. UI/UX Designer Konrad Group is looking for a UI/UX Designer to join our Toronto team. You are responsible for designing compelling digital experiences from conception to delivery in a cross-functional environment. You will collaborate with creative, development and strategy teams to ship world-class digital experiences for leading companies and global brands. Responsibilities Develop a comprehensive understanding of project needs by attending design thinking workshops, performing user research, conducting user tests, and designing rich interactive experiences Identify areas of opportunities for clients and solve functional challenges through brainstorming, ideating, and designing digital solutions with other members of the team Work with developers and consultants to understand technology requirements and business objectives as they relate to the designs of the products Build industry-leading solutions by staying up to date with design best practices and latest technologies Contribute to Konrad’s overall design culture by learning emerging softwares, standards and processes Skills & Requirements 1-3 years of experience in digital design for web and mobile applications Strong conceptual thinking and design execution abilities in both visual and interaction design Intimate knowledge of Sketch, Adobe Creative Suite and prototyping tools Expertise in motion graphics and web or mobile development is a bonus Organization, interpersonal and communication skills, with a passion towards the digital space Bonus Points: Have you taken any courses at BrainStation? A lot of our design and development best practices and processes are taught during our courses - make sure to highlight this experience in your cover letter if you have! Konrad Group is committed to maintaining a diverse work environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants, regardless of race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status will receive consideration for employment. If you have any accessibility requirements or concerns regarding the hiring process or employment with us, please notify us so we can provide suitable accommodation. Please include a link to your online portfolio with the application. While we sincerely appreciate all applications, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

We also look for people who share our core values of generosity, inclusivity, curiosity, courage, and responsibility—the guiding principles we stand by and incorporate into our work every day.We know that a diverse team is what makes our work and culture great. That's why we're committed to building an inclusive and collaborative workplace that values equity and welcomes everyone. Our team members enjoy competitive salaries, purposeful perks, and a culture that gives back and has fun doing it. So come and join us, and let's change the world together.About the roleEmbedded within the Experience Design team in the Product Department, the UX/UI role is a generalist role which focuses on creating exceptional experiences across various product verticals.This role will also work closely with business development, research, marketing professionals, various subject matter experts and stakeholders to advance CHIMP through meaningful and refined experiences.Core responsibilitiesCreate world-class design solutions to various UX/UI problemsWork closely with Product Managers, stakeholders and subject matter experts to assess and understand requirements and work strategically on crafting solutionsWork closely with our Content Strategists and content-first design methodologiesWork seamlessly with different teams and departmentsCreate flows, wireframes, high-fidelity mock-ups and interactive prototypes for different digital productsConduct remote usability testing and observe best practices of solution validationAnalyze user feedback and activity, and iterate to enhance the experience for our usersProvide timelines and delivery estimatesWork closely with our Research departments to understand our audiences and how research and analytics translate into our everyday workWhat you’ll bringCreativity and passion for what you do5+ years of digital design experience, spanning the disciplines of UX, UI and visual designUndergraduate degree in a relevant disciplineMastery of industry-standard design tools (Adobe, Sketch, InVision, etc.)Experience working in a fast-paced environmentExcellent communication and presentation skillsAbility to simplify complexity and distill ideasAbility to both take high-level direction and have ownership over projects and specific pieces of workSolid understanding of design best practices and current design frameworksDesign thinking practice as a strategic problem-solving disciplineOur ideal candidateA resourceful, authentic and transparent creator and makerSomeone who cares about the same things we doIs a proactive communicator and someone who can work independentlyA lifelong learner who is curious and open-mindedPossesses a collaborative, team-focused working styleIs familiar with omni-channel- and research-driven approaches to designHas experience working with complex stakeholder groups and senior executives in fast-paced environmentsCan translate and express complex information into compelling and effective design solutionsPossesses strong project management skillsReports toDirector, Experience DesignStatusFull time regular (permanent), 40 hours per week. Based in Vancouver, BCSound interesting? Please apply directly on our website: https://chimp.net/careers.Due to the volume of applications we receive, we only review and respond to those who have applied via chimp.netMore about CHIMPCHIMP (Charitable Impact) was founded to radically transform how people experience giving. Our online platform makes it easy to support the causes you care about, raise money with others, and track your impact over time. We also help donors make their biggest impact by offering strategic giving support.By empowering people to give on their terms, we’ve helped Canadians donate more than $350 million to thousands of charities—and we’re just getting started!Job Types: Full-time, PermanentExperience:digital design: 5 yearsEducation:Bachelor'sLocation:Vancouver, BC
Title: UX/UI Designer

Job_Description: Travailler chez Genius Solutions c'est : Joindre une équipe passionnée et dynamique qui a à cœur le succès de l’entreprise. C’est également joindre une entreprise en constante évolution dans un environnement stimulant et dans un marché hautement compétitif .Vous avez de l’intérêt à travailler chez Genius? Assurez-vous de vous reconnaitre dans les valeurs de l’entreprise :Vous êtes énergique et passionné : pour atteindre le succès, nous avons besoin de gens avec une énergie débordante démontrant une passion pour leur travail.Vous êtes en mission : les défis sont grands pour nous et nos clients et nous devons faire face à plusieurs obstacles. Pour mener à bien notre mission, il est essentiel de garder le cap!Vous êtes un bon joueur d’équipe : nous croyons fermement que le respect et la confiance sont des ingrédients essentiels au succès.Vous valorisez la connaissance et l’expertise : Genius valorise grandement les gens qui veulent progresser, acquérir de nouvelles connaissances et développer leur expertise.Vous vous reconnaissez dans les valeurs de la compagnie? Oui?Continuons!Designer UX / UI chez Genius Solutions : Nous recherchons actuellement un designer UX/UI . Cette personne aura comme principale fonction la conception de l’interface utilisateur de la prochaine version web de notre application, Genius Manufacturing . La personne sélectionnée devra analyser l’expérience client actuelle, proposer des améliorations et présenter des concepts de maquettes (mockup). Elle devra également accompagner l’équipe de développement informatique tout au long du projet.Les tâches et responsabilités : Effectuer une analyse et une prise de besoins (clients et experts internes)Étudier et analyser les produits et tendances sur le marchéÉtablir des plans et concepts afin de les présenter au comité responsableDévelopper et documenter les outils qui seront utilisés à l’interneOffrir de formation et coaching à notre équipeConnaissances et profil recherchés : Expérience en design d’application web spécialiséeExpérience UX / UI3 à 5 années d’expérience pertinentesMaitrise des logiciels de maquettes (mockup)Niveau avancé de maitrise de la langue anglaise (parlé et écrit)Aimer travailler en mode agileConnaissance de logiciel de type ERP serait un atout importantConditions de travail : Une super équipeUn salaire compétitifUn horaire de travail flexibleVacances + 5 congés payés par annéeDes assurances collectivesDes activités socialesEt bien plus...Lieu de travail : QuébecMots clés : Web – Migration – Développement – Interface – Utilisateur – Expérience client – Mockup – Besoin – Designer – Amélioration – Analyse – ERP – Application – Logiciel – Navigation – Agile – Ergonomie – Graphique – Normes – Livrables – Architecture – Interaction – Interactivité – Solution – Numérique – Mobile – Utilisateur – Visuel – CréativitéType d'emploi : Temps Plein

Job_Description: Join Windsor's most innovative, fun and Silicon-Valley-esque development and innovation company, bringing world-class projects to Windsor. Help us build exciting technology like multiplayer game servers for Atari, social apps for Puma, high profile analytics engines for The PGA Tour, and cutting edge products like natural-language-processing chat-bots.As one of Windsor's most sought-after companies to work for, we offer flexible time, work-at-home days, a great benefits plan and in-office massage. We are located in the heart of Windsor's historic Walkerville. You must be willing to work in our office. We are not interested in off-shore or remote work.We are seeking talented interface designers who are looking to grow professionally and personally within a fast-growing company. You will work on a variety of marketing deliverables, including websites, prototypes, wireframes, business collateral and other design pieces.ResponsibilitiesWork on the design of user interfaces for web and mobile projectsAble to help with wireframing using tools like Adobe XD and BalsamiqAble to self-direct and work independently, to manage multiple, concurrent projects simultaneously from start to finishRequirements: Expertise in Adobe Creative Suite: Illustrator, Photoshop, InDesign, After Effects, EdgeKnowledge of responsive web designAbility to create interactive prototypesCustomer-obsessed, detail-oriented and comfortable working on highly technical teamsDemonstrated experience with building user interfaces across a range of platforms including desktop and mobile--- Please send examples of your design portfolio (specifically web design) when you apply. ---We look forward to meeting you!Job Type: Full-timeEducation:High school or equivalentLocation:Windsor, ON
Title: Web Designer / UI / UX

Job_Description: Nous valorisons la diversité et avons à cœur de créer un milieu de travail inclusif qui nous inspire tous à donner le meilleur de nous-mêmes. Joignez-vous à notre équipe et faites une différence!  Votre poste  Nous Comment imaginez-vous les bureaux d’une compagnie d’assurance? Et l’atmosphère de travail qui y règne? Nous gageons que si vous passez nous voir au Lab de Intact, vous serez très surpris! Situé au centre-ville de Montréal, nous sommes un laboratoire d’innovation dont la mission est de créer des produits à la fine-pointe de l’insurtech qui améliorent la vie de millions de Canadiens.  Mariant la convivialité et la vélocité d’une startup aux ressources et aux moyens d’une grande entreprise (vous disposerez de tous les outils dont vous avez toujours rêvé!), le Lab est un environnement jeune et dynamique, offrant des défis stimulants, des collègues inspirants et une carrière passionnante (chez un des top 100 employeurs au Canada). C’est l’endroit idéal pour parfaire vos compétences et faire évoluer votre carrière.  Vous Vous êtes passionné par le commerce électronique et l’innovation numérique? Vous avez un talent particulier pour traduire des exigences complexes en expériences utiles et agréables? Vous restez à l’affût des dernières tendances en matière de design et vous aimez expérimenter de nouveaux outils et de nouvelles méthodologies? Nous avons l’occasion parfaite pour vous!  Rôle À titre de designer UX/UI, vous jouerez un rôle essentiel dans la conception et l’évolution de notre écosystème numérique. Relevant du directeur principal, Innovations numériques, vous aurez comme principales responsabilités :  Concevoir des expériences captivantes en vue de réaliser les objectifs d’affaires  Valider la fonctionnalité et l’utilité par l’entremise de tests et de recherches auprès des utilisateurs  Produire des livrables UX et design pertinents au besoin  Piloter une feuille de route aux côté d’un directeur de produit et d’une équipe agile multidisciplinaire  Présenter le travail aux parties prenantes  Aider les ingénieurs à produire des interfaces de qualité et agréables  Prôner une conception axée sur l’utilisateur et les données  Vos compétences  Minimum trois années d’expérience  Expertise en matière de convivialité et de pratiques de conception centrées sur l'utilisateur  Maîtrise des outils de conception (Sketch, Axure, InVision, Illustrator, etc.)  Expérience des outils de recherche UX (usertesting.com, Optimal Workshop, etc.) un atout  Expérience dans la production de flux de processus, d’inventaires de contenu, etc.  Vous aimez travailler dans un environnement de collaboration qui accorde une importance primordiale au travail d’équipe, à l’innovation, à l’ouverture d’esprit et au plaisir  Veuillez inclure votre portfolio dans votre dossier de candidature.  Vous êtes  Une personne avec qui il est agréable de travailler  Créatif, analytique, curieux et ingénieux  Un joueur d’équipe capable de partager et recevoir des commentaires constructifs  Excellent pour expliquer vos idées à différents intervenants  Profondément passionné par le design et la qualité  Organisé et proactif  En tant que salarié temps plein, vous bénéficierez des avantages suivants :  Un salaire compétitif  Un boni de performance annuel  Un régime de retraite  Un horaire de travail flexible de 35 heures par semaine  Des assurances médicales et dentaires hors pair  Et plusieurs autres avantages et bénéfices (remboursement gym, conférences, etc.)  Énoncé fermeture  Cette opportunité vous intéresse? Nous avons très hâte de faire votre connaissance!  D’excellents avantages sont offerts : salaire concurrentiel, avantages flexibles, aménagements de travail flexibles, congés mobiles, régime de retraite à prestation déterminée, etc.  Dans le cadre du processus de sélection d’Intact, les candidats peuvent être appelés à donner leur consentement à une vérification de leurs antécédents pertinente au poste à pourvoir avant de recevoir une offre d’emploi. Celle-ci peut comprendre une confirmation des références d’emploi, des études et des titres de compétences, une vérification des emplois, de l’identité, des infractions criminelles et du permis de conduire ainsi qu’un rapport de crédit.  Vous pouvez soumettre votre candidature à un emploi affiché pourvu que vous occupiez vos fonctions actuelles depuis au moins douze mois et que votre performance soit jugée bonne ou que votre contrat temporaire arrive à son échéance. Une recherche de talents à l'externe est menée parallèlement au recrutement à l'interne Veuillez donc prendre note que des candidats potentiels pourraient avoir été identifiés pour ce poste dans le cadre de leur plan de développement.   Veuillez noter que l'usage du masculin a comme but d'alléger le texte.  Cet affichage prendra fin 02 juin 2018.  Prime de recommandation  CE POSTE EST SUJET À UNE PRIME DE RECOMMANDATION DE 3000$.  #li-qc  Droit de travailler au Canada  Les personnes qui posent leur candidature à un poste permanent doivent, dès leur embauche, avoir le droit de travailler au Canada de façon permanente. Les documents pouvant servir de preuve dans le cas des rôles permanents sont un certificat de naissance canadien, un passeport canadien, un certificat de citoyenneté canadienne, une carte de résident permanent ou une confirmation de son statut de résident permanent pour prouver qu’il a le droit de travailler au Canada.  Indeed Commandité  IN-INFR

Attitude is everything with us. We are a fun quirky group, but we love to work at what we do!EducationA college or university diploma/degree in something related is preferred.Also open to applicants who can demonstrate an amazing knowledge & Do-it-yourself spirit.Job Type: FreelanceJob Type: Freelance
Title: Wordpress Web Designer - Virtual 20 hours/week

Job_Description: Who we are: Creating a planet fueled by reliable, clean energy isn’t what keeps us up at night; it’s what gets us out of bed. At Opus One Solutions, we pursue solutions that will change how countries access and distribute electrical energy. From microgrids that keep things running in the event of an outage to how Tesla's latest batteries can help accelerate the integration of renewable energy. From how electric utilities can optimize their operations and reduce their carbon footprint to how every homeowner will feed energy into a power grid fueling the electrical sharing economy. At Opus One Solutions, we believe some of the best talent in the tech industry share our passion for delivering technology that matters and that will make a difference, in our lifetime and beyond. We want to work with people who love the complexities of software; who believe in its power to transform the world into a better place. Good people know that great ideas are everywhere and what matters most is practical execution. Turning vision into reality is the hard part. But, when it’s creating technical solutions that support access to renewable energy, it’s an engineering feat worth contributing to. The opportunity Opus One Solutions is looking for a UI/UX Designer who will be entrusted with guiding the development of our all-important UX. We need someone who is passionate about designing innovative, engaging products that deliver both business value and a great experience for users. A Designer who is able to build great relationships with subject matter experts and convert their knowledge of energy and power systems into actionable designs. Someone who has the maturity to champion their design choices while respecting the work and input of the experts. This is a role for a UI/UX Designer who wants to gather requirements, present ideas, make decisions and create rapid prototypes. Someone who approaches complex information with straightforward questions, who knows how to get detailed information from power systems people and how to drill down to the essence of what is needed. What is GridOS? Our flagship product, GridOS is a first-of-its-kind tool designed to empower utilities to take control of their grid and in the process accelerate the adoption of renewable energy. It combines a core analytics engine, a suite of I/O integrations and a rich web-based user interface to take a sea of real-world data and help utilities plan for optimally operated grids with modern energy resources. Who are you? You are a UI/UX Designer with a passion for transforming technical user stories into engaging and intuitive designs. You thrive in the role of UI/UX champion, representing both the voice of the end-user and the best practices in your field. You are looking for a company with a purpose, one that is in an exciting growth phase. You might be working at a large design or web consultancy, moving from one client project to another. Or, you might be at a late-stage startup where you are the one-stop-shop for design from wireframing to graphics; taking requirements to functional prototypes. You have a virtual artist’s palette and a toolbox of technologies you use to demonstrate your training and your instinct. What’s in it for you? Challenges. The electrical power grid is a lifeline to millions of people. It is also an incredibly complex network being controlled by archaic software that was designed decades before UX was a thing. Your challenge is taking power systems blueprints and real-time data about the grid and translate that into an intuitive and easy to understand UX. Think Google maps for electricity. A chance to make an impact. The projects you will work on will be not just local or national but global firsts-of-their-kind. You will set the tone for everything that follows. Personal and professional satisfaction. You want to do meaningful work. You don’t just want to build pretty mobile screens for e-commerce or B2B. You want to build technology solutions that matter. Here’s what our UI/UX Designer will do: Own it. You will take on responsibility for the UI and UX of the application, ensuring a clean, elegant interface with logical transitions and a user-friendly, intuitive workflow. Bring it to life. You will convert complex business requirements into pixel perfect designs; bringing them to life with a variety of usability techniques. Design. You will design intuitive interfaces, logical task workflows and responsive layouts that meet the needs and vision of the product team and the end-user. Create. You will provide insights and create wireframes, storyboards, user flows and sitemaps. You will present concepts that are scalable. Collaborate. You will work across teams, with in-house and offshore developers to ensure the design is aligned with the business needs and implemented as designed. Here’s what you bring: Award-winning user interface building experience. You have 3-5 years working on UI and UX design with an emphasis on creating rich user experiences with clean UI layout and responsive performance. Experience with B2B design is a bonus. A related degree is an asset. A portfolio of your recent work demonstrating your ability to deliver eye-catching, intuitive, and engaging customer experiences including responsive web applications. You understand accessibility design requirements and best practices. A virtual palette. You have used a range of tools and technologies: Adobe Creative Suite (expert) A workload prioritisation tool such as TFS A wireframing / prototyping tool such as Omnigraffle, Balsamiq, Axure, Visio, Gliffy, Invision, Sketch, Figma - whatever your preferred tool is; you have the expertise. Translation skills. You can translate client requirements and complex user journeys into clearly laid out user stories and graphical workflows. A stellar analytical process and a checklist that balances advanced UI development and UI frameworks against essential functionality and nice-to-have customization. Technical abilities and focus. You can create rapid prototypes, wireframes, mockups, and more. Drive. You are results-driven and you thrive in a fast-paced environment. All of the skills needed in an awesome team player: outstanding communication skills, attention to detail, flexibility, and a sense of ownership and responsibility. Innovation. You have the ability to anticipate problems and provide creative, quick - and reliable - solutions to complex problems. Why join Opus One Solutions? Opus One is growing! After spending the last four years under the radar focused on research and pilot projects we’re ready to shine as one of Canada’s top 10 game-changers named by CIX Cleantech! We are deploying exciting microgrid projects in North America and have partnerships with leading energy players such as Tesla and Advanced Microgrid Solutions. Collectively, we are fanatical about the work we do. Our leadership has assembled carefully selected teams with some of the best strategic visionaries - and executors - in technology and the clean energy space. From the newest team member to the company founders, we are all driven by one common goal: to accelerate the integration of clean and sustainable energy in North America and the world. As a team and a company, we are committed to working with like-minded people, with opinions and thoughts of their own that will contribute to our innovation and evolution. We equally want to work with people who like to get outside and spend time together on team outings, special events, to grab lunch or take part in off-site brainstorming retreats. There’s a lot of humility at Opus One Solutions. No one person is going to know it all – it’s too complicated. We must work and innovate together to get the job done. At Opus One Solutions we understand that not everyone develops their talent and hones their skills in a traditional way. Different paths and experiences are part of the diversity we know we need to succeed. If you feel you meet all or most of the qualifications we are seeking; and you are excited by the possibility of growing our company, take a chance and express your interest here. Opus One Solutions welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.
Title: UI / UX Designer

Job_Description: We are seeking a talented UX/UI Designer for an immediate start for either a freelance or a permanent opportunity with our client, located in downtown Toronto who will be: Gathering and evaluating user requirements, in collaboration with product managers and engineers Illustrating design ideas using storyboards, process flows and sitemaps Designing graphic user interface elements, like menus, tabs and widgets UI/UX Designer responsibilities include gathering user requirements, designing graphic elements and building navigation components. To be successful in this role, you should have experience with design software and wireframe tools. If you also have a portfolio of professional design projects that includes work with web/mobile applications, we’d like to meet you. Ultimately, you’ll create both functional and appealing features that address our clients’ needs and help them to grow their customer base. Responsibilities: Gather and evaluate user requirements in collaboration with product managers and engineers Illustrate design ideas using storyboards, process flows and sitemaps Design graphic user interface elements, like menus, tabs and widgets Build page navigation buttons and search fields Develop UI mockups and prototypes that clearly illustrate how sites function and look like Create original graphic designs (e.g. images, sketches and tables) Prepare and present rough drafts to internal teams and key stakeholders Identify and troubleshoot UX problems (e.g. responsiveness) Conduct layout adjustments based on user feedback Adhere to style standards on fonts, colors and images Requirements: Proven work experience as a UI/UX Designer or similar role Strong knowledge of accessibility and how it applies to desktop, web and mobile applications Portfolio of design projects Knowledge of wireframe tools (e.g. Wireframe.cc and InVision) Up-to-date knowledge of design software like Adobe Illustrator and Photoshop Team spirit; strong communication skills to collaborate with various stakeholders Strong time management skills Apply now for immediate consideration!
Title: UX/UI Designer

Job_Description: We are actively seeking a highly creative UI/UX Designer, for a Toronto client with multiple locations, to work in their mobile games division. With a proven track record of success in UI/UX Design, the successful candidate will collaborate with Game Designers and Developers to make amazing games.  Our client offers industry leading salaries and benefits, fantastic working environment, and opportunity to work with a world class team of exceptional game developers. This studio has amassed millions of loyal fans across its many popular titles with no signs of slowing down.  Your background includes:   3 plus years in game development creating UI for mobile games. Strong understanding of mobile and interactive design fundamentals. Advanced communications and interpersonal skills. Experience with Photoshop, Illustrator, Axure and, InVision. Knowledge of ZBrush, MudBox is a bonus. Must be passionate about games. At Creative Technology Resources (CTR), we have very high expectations of ourselves to consistently deliver quality to the client and candidates that we’re so fortunate to partner with every day. We deliver talented, driven individuals to our clients so that together we are building teams that thrive. Our clients are made up of teams of industry veterans whose expertise and interests are driving the creation of the world’s next great digital products & services. Together, we can create some of the best experiences ever made.  We value all applicants. This role is open to all qualified regardless of geographic location. Relocation assistance and foreign worker application process provided for any candidates outside Canada..  Please call 604-630-5750 for more information.
Title: UI/UX Designer

Job_Description: Job Description  You will applies a user-centered design approach to design, construct and implement the end user interface and overall experience aligned with users needs, preferences and motivations. You will also provides overall expertise and advocacy on user centered design. models, etc.), to create positive user experiences (UX) aligned to the users motivations, preferences and goals.Help plan, facilitate and lead design thinking & user centered design workshops and activities to align, anchor and move Teams forward with user experience in mind.Produce concept sketches, wireframes, high-fidelity mockups, prototypes and detailed specs to communicate the user experience design to the development team.Develop user profiles, provide product usability, evaluation and support to product development teamsAct as the primary end user/customer advocate, ensuring that the services/assets are designed with the end user’s core needs in mind versus other competing business needs (e.g., maximize profit).Develop solutions that best balance the different, sometimes competing needs/priorities between end user/customer desires, business goals and technical limitations.Inventory and assess user experience of existing technology assets and recommend options to enhance/improve the overall experience.Coordinate users inclusion during throughout the development process (e.g., design, construct, etc.) by using various techniques (e.g., rapid feedback, listening labs and usability testing).Finalize UI design artifacts and delivers them, ideally, ahead of the Sprint.Ensure user experience designs/plans match what is eventually built.Coordinate with appropriate resources to archive final artifacts  Shared Accountabilities: Facilitate and leads activities with the team to define, design and rapidly model the solution and end user experienceIn some cases, assist in developing and implementing UX design conceptsFacilitate design reviews with key stakeholdersCoordinate delivery of design elements (e.g. copy, assets, etc.) ready for Sprinting Qualifications  Required CompetenciesExceptional user interface design skills and producing the associated artefacts such as user storyboards, journey maps, mockups, and prototypes to effectively communicate interaction and design ideas.Experience planning and running design thinking/ideation workshops and applying the associated methodologies (e.g., divergent/convergent thinking).Proven ability to operate in and foster a collaborative working environment that encourages creativity and innovative thinking. QualitiesEmpathetic to end user needsVisual communicatorDesign drivenStrong communicator, collaborator and group leaderConflict resolution  Required CompetenciesExceptional user interface design skills and producing the associated artefacts such as user storyboards, journey maps, mockups, and prototypes to effectively communicate interaction and design ideas.Experience planning and running design thinking/ideation workshops and applying the associated methodologies (e.g., divergent/convergent thinking).Proven ability to operate in and foster a collaborative working environment that encourages creativity and innovative thinking.Excellent analytical and creative thinking abilities and the ability to apply these skills in design complex, interactive applications.Demonstrated experience in developing software user experience strategy and execution.Deep understanding of user experience design principles and investigative methodologies.Proficiency with designer (e.g., sketch, invision, Photoshop, Illustrator, etc.) and rapid prototyping tools (e.g., keynote)Strong communication, stakeholder management and presentation skills.  Preferred Technical and Professional ExperienceExperience with HTML, CSS and JavaScript.Experience working in an Agile/Scrum development process.Experience working with teams using continuous integration, continuous deployment, and automated testing toolsExperience working on AI/data science implementation projects.Significant experience working on teams implementing industrial application and/or Supply Chain Management, Logistics or Transportation related software applications would be a plus  Required ExperienceAt least 5 years of experience in visual design or interaction design for complex, rich interactive applications.At least 2 years of experience planning and/or conducting design thinking/ideation workshops.At least 2 year of experience designing the UX for intelligent/data-rich applications (e.g., analytics dashboards, interactive operational dashboards, intelligent chatbots, modern voice assistants, etc.). Title: UI/UX Designer

Job_Description: Position: UX Designer  Reports To: Senior Director, Product Management  Tier: Management  Department: Product Management  Company: GS1 Canada  Location: Toronto  Status: Full time, Contract (24 Months)  Job Number: 1215  Key Role We are seeking an experienced Product Designer who will be responsible for creating amazing user experiences (UX) within our suite of products. The ideal candidate should have an eye for clean user interface (UI) design and be able to collaborate with product managers to enhance existing products and help define future solutions. You are skilled at transforming product requirements and wireframes into intuitive design and prototypes to guide engineering throughout the software development lifecycle (SDLC). You will manage the human-centred design process, understanding real users – their goals, aptitudes, experiences, needs, and motivations. You will approach design from a user-perspective and balance user needs, business goals and technical capabilities.  Duties and Responsibilities Collaborate with product management and engineering to define and implement innovative solutions for the product direction, visuals and experience; Conduct user research, evaluate analytics and assimilate user feedback; Conceptualize original ideas that bring simplicity and user friendliness to complex design roadblocks; Apply your design abilities to complex product problems with the goal of reducing user friction; Create storyboards, user flows, and high-fidelity prototypes across our suite of products that can be used by all teams during product development, including internal and external presentations as required; Execute all visual design stages from concept to final hand-off to engineering; Present and defend designs and key milestone deliverables to peers and executive level stakeholders; Oversee usability testing and ensure acceptance criteria are met; Establish and promote design guidelines, best practices and standards. Required Knowledge, Skills, and Experience Diploma or degree in Digital Design, Interaction Design or Communications (or equivalent); Minimum 3 years of UX/UI design experience; Up-to-date with the latest UI trends, techniques, and technologies; Proficiency in Invision, Sketch, Axure, Adobe Creative Cloud, or other prototyping tools; Experience with HTML, CSS, JS and AngularJS an asset, but coding not required; Solid experience in creating wireframes, storyboards, user flows, and process flows; Strong collaboration and negotiation skills, including getting and giving feedback, and managing stakeholders and stakeholder expectations; Excellent verbal and written communication skills, including strong presentation skills; Experience working in an Agile environment an asset; Domain experience in master data management, product information management, digital asset management, and/or digital retail solutions definite asset.  GS1 Canada is an equal opportunity employer. If selected for an interview, please advise our Human Resources team if you require accommodation due to a disability during the interview and assessment process.
Title: UX Designer

Job_Description: theScore’s mission is to create highly-engaging digital products and content that empower the sports fan’s experience. Its flagship mobile app ‘theScore’ is one of the most popular multi-sport news and data apps in North America, serving millions of fans a month. The Company also creates innovative digital sports experiences through its web, social and esports platforms.  As a product designer, you will play an integral role in refining and shaping our digital products and be involved in every aspect of the product development process from ideation to pushing a few pixels prior to release.  Typical Work Day at theScore:  Work closely with product owners, developers and other product designers. Take broad, conceptual ideas and turn them into something valuable for our users. Work with low fidelity designs & wireframes to produce flows that get the experience right. Create interaction prototypes to test out complex ideas and produce high fidelity designs. Focus on the user and solving problems from their POV. Other duties as required. Requirements:  Bachelor’s degree, or equivalent knowledge and/or experience. Extensive experience in UI design on web and iOS/Android. Experience with industry standard design tools (Ex. Sketch, Illustrator, Photoshop). A portfolio that highlights examples of interaction design work. Excellent problem solver and familiarity with technical constraints of various mediums (mobile/desktop web, iOS, Android). Experience producing multiple visual directions and concepts. Nice to have: Front-end development (HTML, CSS, JavaScript), SVG animation, Mobile UX design experience, User testing experience, UX research What We Offer:  Competitive salary with Employee Share Purchase Plan. Comprehensive Benefits package. Fun, relaxed work environment. Education and conference reimbursements. Located downtown Toronto; easily accessible by public transit. A/V club, Friday presentations, book library, and more. Snacks and drinks provided. Awesome patio with BBQ. Top of the line office hardware. Parental leave top up. Opportunity for career progression and mentoring others. Games room (bring your A game for our FIFA 18, arcade, ping pong and foosball tournaments!) We are an equal opportunity employer. Accommodation will be made upon request.
Title: Product Designer (UX/UI)

Job_Description: User Experience Designer  Duration: 6 months Location: Toronto or Waterloo  As a leader in the financial industry, we are evolving many of our digital experiences into innovative, immersive and highly functional products delivering high value to our clients and partners. You will be directly involved in this exciting transformation. As a Designer on our User Experience team, you will be focused on our large consumer- and business-facing websites dedicated to our Group Benefits and Group Retirement Solutions areas, serving millions of Canadians. Working with a cross-functional team, you will deliver highly effective, well-crafted and evidence-based digital experiences through sketches, empathy maps, user flows, wireframes, and prototypes, and working with our UI designers to create the eventual UI/design assets as needed. You’ll be able to synthesize business requirements, research and design principles; solve problems; work within tight deadlines; and understand disparate audiences to ensure the final experiences cater to the uniqueness of the targeted individuals. You will need to identify and solve problems; simplify complicated ideas; explore different design solutions and articulate for the user in each case; and present to and collaborate with a wide range of project team members and stakeholders.  Key Accountabilities • Consume and understand business, functional and technical requirements • Design user interfaces by applying the fundamental principles of user experience design, research experience, industry best practices and balancing those against system constraints and business objectives • Create and revise user flows, sitemaps and wireframes based on specifications, goals, needs and limitations • Develop rapid interactional UX prototypes; verify design assumptions through concept and usability testing • Participate in design review sessions with project teams, acquiring consensus and approval on designs and documentation • Document detailed user experience specifications and provide to the development team; liaise to ensure final output matches UX specifications and visual design?  Experience & Skills Required • Minimum 4 years’ experience as a user experience designer or similar role • 1+ years of experience working on complex web projects with medium to large-sized teams • Strong portfolio demonstrating expertise in UX • Bachelor's degree in design or a related field (communication arts, computer science, human-computer interaction (HCI), etc.) • User-focussed and analytical; the ideal person for this role will have a deep understanding and appreciation of the process of identifying users’ needs, coupled with the ability to balance the pros and cons of different designs, backed by research and analytics • Excellent skills in creating flows, low and medium fidelity wireframes and prototypes for different screen breakpoints (responsive design) • Well versed in fundamental visual and interactive design disciplines & principles and user behavioural psychology • Highly comfortable presenting and substantiating design decisions (in both formal and informal settings), based on industry best-practice guidelines, personal experience and research findings • Excellent proficiency in Axure RP • Experience in related UX/UI design software desirable (e.g. Sketch, InVision) • Previous experience with Agile design/development methodology • Fastidious attention to detail • Strong communication skills and the ability to effectively articulate experiential principles • Experience in user research techniques (e.g. usability tests, focus groups) • Certification from an industry-recognized user experience design institution preferred • Solid understanding of web and mobile technologies
Title: User Experience Designer

Job_Description: Job Description IBM Global Business Services: Join a Leader. Consult with us. The UX/UI Designer is responsible for creating best-in-class user experiences and helps provide strategic direction for all aspects of the user experience. Specifically, the UX/UI Designer will design experiences, from journey maps to screen designs (wireframes, mockups, interactive prototypes, design libraries and patterns, style guide etc.) alongside a team of other high performing design practitioners. The UI/UX Designer will interface with key stakeholders, including clients, management, and architecture, to iteratively refine and improve designs to create the most appropriate possible user experience.  Additionally, the UI/UX Designer will interface with the development team throughout the development cycle to provide guidance on implementation of the designs and modify designs as requirements change. The successful candidate will be able to thrive in an Agile development environment, demonstrating ability to manage both time and scope to fit tasks into quick development iterations. Please provide a portfolio as well as a CV when applying for this vacancy. The portfolio can either be as a file or as a link to an online portfolio  Required Technical and Professional Expertise   Understanding of how content, design, user interface and technology work together to create an optimal user experience Strong knowledge of user-centered design principles Strong understanding of information architecture, user experience, and/or content strategy Demonstrated ability to do UX/UI work and create solutions based on business strategy and needs Ability to complete assigned work on time and on budget Background in all types of digital experiences, including mobile, tablet and responsive web design • Have experience with design tools such as Sketch, Adobe Experience, inVision, Adobe Illustrator, Adobe Indesign, Justinmind, Axure, OmniGraffle  Preferred Tech and Prof Experience  NA  EO Statement IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.
Title: User Experience Designer (UI/UX Designer)

Job_Description: Job Description  DEPARTMENT SUMMARY: The mandate of the Client Experience department is to envision, design, orchestrate, improve and measure the client experience at Tangerine in order to deliver forward banking to Canadians and deliver on Tangerine’s mandate of being a client-centric organization. Areas of focus for the department are: Research, Strategy, Innovation, and Design.  ROLE PURPOSE: Do you love solving business and customer problems with great user interface design? Are you known for both your creativity and attention to detail? Do you constantly ask yourself how something can be done simpler, faster and better? Do you want to help build the next generation of banking in Canada?  We are looking for an Interaction Designer who brings with them a passion for experience design and a well-rounded background in human factors, information architecture, visual design and creative problem-solving. As a Interaction Designer on Tangerine’s Client Experience Design team, you’ll design and wireframe the customer experiences for web, mobile and tablet. You will collaborate with business and IT professionals to bring these experiences to life for our customers. You’ll tackle two key areas: customer experience (how people feel when they interact with Tangerine), and user experience (the process behind the customer experience). You will understand all key moments of truths for customers and deliver micro-experiences that reinforce the simplicity of banking with Tangerine that will “wow” our Clients.  ROLE ACCOUNTABILITIES: Bring together a comprehensive understanding of UX best practices, information architecture, human factors and visual interaction design for web, mobile and tablet. Act as design owner through conception, build and release of outcomes large and small Conceive, design and prototype user experiences that are simple, useful, usable and compelling. Translate business needs and user goals into simple yet meaningful customer experiences. Inform solutions with data from multiple sources, including requirements, customer needs, technology constraints, usability studies, UX research and web analytics. Create low/high fidelity wireframes, prototypes, visual mockups, and other user interface elements, along with interface specifications at a high level of quality and in keeping with company brand, style and UI guidelines. Plan and conduct usability tests and improve the designed experience through iterative design that includes accepting and managing feedback and challenging conventional wisdom. Ensure consistency of experience across multiple areas and products. Embrace and champion a collaborative approach; offer multiple options and alternatives to design challenges. Clearly communicate design recommendations to stakeholders; actively invite feedback and iterate on designs to create a stronger solution. Other duties as assigned.  MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS: Education/Experience A Design Degree in one of the following fields – User Interface Design, Visual Communication (Graphic) Design, Interaction Design, HCI, Industrial Design or the equivalent experience and training in an area directly relevant to this position 5+ years of user interface design experience with responsive web, mobile, and tablet based products Experience creating low and hi-fi wireframes, prototypes, visual mockups, sitemaps, flow diagrams and other UI deliverables Strong design portfolio that demonstrates vision and innovation in wireframes, high fidelity mockups, conceptual explorations, etc. Experience translating complex business problems to simple and engaging user-centered solutions Experience in conducting usability testing Experience in agile environment Specialized Knowledge Working knowledge of user interface best practices for responsive web and mobile Accessibility is a plus Technical Skills In-depth knowledge of Invision, Axure, Sketch, Zeplin, Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, Acrobat) Understand front end technologies (e.g. HTML, DHTML, JavaScript, CSS and the capabilities of web browsers, mobile and tablet applications and user interactions) limitations and constraints is a plus Abilities Ability to clearly communicate and explain your designs Ability to successfully multitask across multiple projects simultaneously Ability to work collaboratively with business and technical teams Ability to work in a self-guided manner Attributes Strong collaborator; you welcome feedback and see team problem-solving as a natural part of the creative process  WORKING CONDITIONS: The UX/UI Designer will be working in a traditional office environment and may be subject to special working conditions as needed by the business. Special working conditions may cover a range of circumstances from weekend work to support builds, overtime, working with challenging clients.  DIRECT REPORTS: No.  DISABILITY ACCOMMODATION: Tangerine will make reasonable accommodations for the known physical or mental disabilities of an otherwise qualified employee or applicant for employment, unless undue hardship to Tangerine would result. Any applicant or employee who requires accommodation in order to perform the essential functions of a job should contact Human Resources or his or her supervisor. Managing Risk: All members of the Tangerine Team are responsible for managing risk and compliance within their departments. As such, employees should maintain and demonstrate the highest standards of integrity and ethical conduct in accordance with Tangerine policies, guidelines and directions.  MANAGING RISK: All members of the Tangerine Team are responsible for managing risk and compliance within their departments. As such, employees should maintain and demonstrate the highest standards of integrity and ethical conduct in accordance with Tangerine policies, guidelines and directions.  Tangerine is an equal opportunity employer.
Title: Interaction Designer

Job_Description: CGI, one of the largest IT and business consulting services firms globally, is at the forefront of transforming digital experiences. Through practical and strategic innovations, were helping drive value and greater efficiencies into commercial and government organizations around the world.  Were growing our team of passionate designers, architects and engineers in leading design and technical innovation across Global Wealth. Were looking for a talented and product-focused UI/UX designer who will execute interaction and interface design as part of a cross-functional agile team. Your future duties and responsibilities: In this role, you will  Work closely with product owners, business partners, developers, and data architects to understand business and functional requirements, as well as technical considerations.  Lead the ideation and experience design of complex applications for web and mobile.  Own the creation of consistent experiences across products and platforms through user-centered design processes, including competitor analysis, heuristic evaluations, personas, sitemaps, process flows, wireframes, mockups and interactive prototypes.  Collaborate with development teams to ensure the design quality is maintained down the stream.  Present and review designs with developers, product managers, and key stakeholders.  Be able to educate and articulate the thinking & strategy behind your work and design decisions.  Conduct and/or coordinate design walkthroughs, feedback sessions and usability testing to validate proposed design solutions with stakeholders and end users.  Ensure consistency across digital experiences and contribute in growing our library of components, interaction models and style guide.  Advocate for good user experience and design practices within the organization. Required qualifications to be successful in this role:  3+ years of experience bringing digital products to life (ideally in a financial environment).  Demonstrated proficiency in Sketch, Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator, Invision, etc.  Ego-less and objective attitude where you enjoy an iterative design process that includes accepting and managing feedback, and challenging conventional wisdom.  Passion for emerging technologies and desire to innovate.  A strong portfolio demonstrating a diversity of experience that encompasses UX expertise, interaction design, creativity and critical thinking.  Comfortable working in ambiguity and quickly iterating your way to a well, thought-out solution.  Able to adapt approach and process to fit project goals, timelines and other parameters.  Demonstrated ability to work as part of a highly collaborative team in an agile environment.  Strong understanding of user-centered design practices with a desire to understand the end user.  Solid understanding of front-end development and are comfortable talking to developers about the details of style sheets and CSS implementation.  Deep understanding of mobile-first and responsive design. What you can expect from us: Build your career with us.  It is an extraordinary time to be in business. As digital transformation continues to accelerate, CGI is at the center of this changesupporting our clients digital journeys and offering our professionals exciting career opportunities.  At CGI, our success comes from the talent and commitment of our professionals. As one team, we share the challenges and rewards that come from growing our company, which reinforces our culture of ownership. All of our professionals benefit from the value we collectively create.  Be part of building one of the largest independent technology and business services firms in the world.  Learn more about CGI at www.cgi.com.  No unsolicited agency referrals please.  CGI is an equal opportunity employer. In addition, CGI is committed to providing accommodations for people with disabilities in accordance with provincial legislation. Please let us know if you require a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during any aspect of the recruitment process and we will work with you to address your needs. Skills: UX requirements UX Strategy
Title: UX DESIGNER

Job_Description: Company Overview  Teranet is the exclusive provider of Ontario’s online property search and registration. We developed, own and operate the Ontario Electronic Land Registration System - one of the most advanced, secure and sophisticated land registration systems in the world. In Manitoba, Teranet owns and operates The Property Registry, providing certification of titles to land, maintains land records and offers reliable information of financial interests in personal property to the public. Teranet is owned by OMERS Infrastructure, a leading global infrastructure investment manager and the infrastructure arm of the Ontario Municipal Employee Retirement System.  Recent Awards  Teranet has been recognized as one of Greater Toronto’s Top Employers for 2018. Now in its 12th year, The Greater Toronto’s Top Employer list aims to determine which employers lead their industries by offering exceptional workplaces. To see the complete 2018 Greater Toronto’s Top Employer list, please visit http://www.canadastop100.com/toronto/  Job Description  We are looking for a User Experience & User Interface Designer with a strong interest in human-computer interactions and experience in the design of mobile and web applications with engaging user experiences. You should have strong analytical and problem-solving skills, the ability to make independent decisions, outstanding collaboration abilities, and creativity based on research findings and an eye for clean and minimalistic design.  You will work very closely with product owners, government partners and UX/UI Designers to create and govern the user interface and experience of our applications. You will collaborate with all teams (Product, Development, and Quality Assurance) throughout the entire lifecycle of design and development process.  A strong portfolio demonstrating some of your recent successes including work samples that shows your process and a high attention to detail is a must.  Primary Responsibilities  The UX/UI Design Specialist acts as a creative resource on a project(s), with responsibilities that include but are not limited to the following:  Responsible for the content layout, visual appearance and usability design of applications, websites, and projects. Creation of UI centered materials such as wireframing, style guides, interaction and behavior design requirements, and workflow diagrams Assist in the creation of UX centered materials such as user goal capturing, personas, user research studies, and overall usability specifications Incorporating accessibility (AODA / WCAG) guidelines and Inclusive Design principals into pertaining deliverables Strong concept development, graphic design ability and attention to details required Be able to seek opportunities to provide UX/UI improvements for businesses and clients Ensuring that all deliverables are provided on-time, on-specification with the project plan, as co-ordinated with project stakeholder (exercise good time and project self-management) Ensuring that all deliverables are produced to the highest standard in terms of: layout, visual appearance, branding requirements, and user experience / user interface best practices Being a strong communicator and an active listener. Providing and capturing feedback, details, and inputs, then demonstrating it in the work produced Strength in using the latest tools for interactive design and layout, including: Photoshop, Illustrator, Sketch and others Being a proactive problem solver, offering well thought out solutions and ideas to all challenges. Demonstrating professionalism at all times and being a great ambassador for UX/UI with partners, clients, and peers. Sharing knowledge, insight, resources, and materials that contribute to the success of teammates and/or the company.  Required Skills A strong related portfolio Proficient knowledge of Adobe Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, Dreamweaver, and InDesign is a plus) Excellent presentation skills Proficient knowledge in at least one Wireframing tool (Balsamiq, Illustrator, Axure, Sketch) Good understanding of web markup, including HTML5, CSS3 and modern front-end interface possibilities Good understanding of UX principals, testing, and research methods. Solid team and communication skills. Must have excellent problem solving skills and love UX challenges. Must be self-motivated and able to multi-task Ability to learn new tools and guidelines quickly Ability to understanding and design for multi-tier applications verses websites Knowledge of Web Accessibility (WCAG 2.0) and Inclusive Design principals are a plus  Required Experience Design related diploma or degree Minimum 5 years of related experience  Teranet Inc. is committed to accommodating the individual needs of all applicants with disabilities during the recruitment and selection process as required under the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act. Please inform us of any accommodation requirements you may require.
Title: UX/UI Designer

Job_Description: About MedChart: MedChart is a venture-backed Toronto healthcare and technology startup. We have just closed a fresh round of new funding and are launching a new round of rapid growth! We are building the world’s most comprehensive health information marketplace of patient-owned, accessible, compliant data using both Blockchain and AI. Our platform aggregates official health record data from all hospitals, doctors' offices and other healthcare facilities across North America on behalf of patients, lawyers, insurers, researchers and private medicine providers. Through AI, we functionalize these disparate health data sets and power insights for world-leading research and applications. What we're looking for: We are looking for an experienced UX/UI designer or design firm to help on a contractor/freelance basis with a product relaunch. In this project, the designer will work with MedChart and its clients to refresh an existing web application. RequirementsDesigner will optimize the web app UX for navigation, usability, and information usefulness based on designer’s own knowledge of best practices, MedChart’s input, and gathering feedback from select customers. You will facilitate co-design sessions with Product, Development, and Support stakeholders in an Agile UX and Lean UX environment. This involves conceiving and designing interfaces for users to enter data and manage settings, improving workflows, improving user notifications and notification cadence, data presentation, and reports or dashboards in which users can explore visualized data. Designer will also conduct a full UI redesign for the app to produce a more consistent, modern and brand-reinforcing visual theme. This will consist of working with MedChart and its branding team to define styles, fonts, and visual elements, followed by executing wireframes and finally working directly in our systems to create the CSS and other front-end code to implement the new UI. Advanced HTML/CSS, JavaScript, React.js, and Razor knowledge a plus. Our ideal candidates: Experience with end-to-end product design (from ideation to full production and prototyping skills), including supporting engineering with production design and creating CSS Experience defining requirements, not just translating existing requirements into designs Ability to simplify complex experiences elegantly Solid understanding and experience with designing effective data visualization tools and dashboards Can perform both interaction design as well as visual design A portfolio and website that demonstrates cross platform design experience creating responsive layouts for desktop, mobile, web and apps that exhibit excellent use of information architecture, layout, color and imagery (graphic design and typography skills a big plus) Lo-fi & hi-fi prototyping skills, using standard design tools i.e. Sketch, Framer, Adobe XD, Sketch, Principle, Flinto, Invision, etc. Working knowledge of HTML/CSS a must; React.js, JavaScript, and Razor desired; Should be comfortable with code for prototyping and UI pattern design Experience conducting semi-structured user interviews, contextual field visits, usability studies either live or remote e.g. Userzoom, usertesting.com, etc. Ability to translate insights from user studies into meaningful user flows that create a delightful user experience Experience in conversion centered design methodologies Great attention to detail Benefits Job Type: Contract/Freelance Contract Value: $6,000 - $15,000 Length: 2-3 months Note: Successful candidates may be asked to undergo a background check. MedChart is proud to be a diverse and equal opportunity employer and as such does not discriminate on the basis of race, colour, religion, sex, national origins, age, sexual orientation, disability or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws. Selection decisions are solely based on job-related factors.
Title: Contract/Freelance - Web App UX/UI and Product Design
