Job_Description: Nous valorisons la diversité et avons à cœur de créer un milieu de travail inclusif qui nous inspire tous à donner le meilleur de nous-mêmes. Joignez-vous à notre équipe et faites une différence!  Votre poste  Nous Comment imaginez-vous les bureaux d’une compagnie d’assurance? Et l’atmosphère de travail qui y règne? Nous gageons que si vous passez nous voir au Lab de Intact, vous serez très surpris! Situé au centre-ville de Montréal, nous sommes un laboratoire d’innovation dont la mission est de créer des produits à la fine-pointe de l’insurtech qui améliorent la vie de millions de Canadiens.  Mariant la convivialité et la vélocité d’une startup aux ressources et aux moyens d’une grande entreprise (vous disposerez de tous les outils dont vous avez toujours rêvé!), le Lab est un environnement jeune et dynamique, offrant des défis stimulants, des collègues inspirants et une carrière passionnante (chez un des top 100 employeurs au Canada). C’est l’endroit idéal pour parfaire vos compétences et faire évoluer votre carrière.  Vous Vous êtes passionné par le commerce électronique et l’innovation numérique? Vous avez un talent particulier pour traduire des exigences complexes en expériences utiles et agréables? Vous restez à l’affût des dernières tendances en matière de design et vous aimez expérimenter de nouveaux outils et de nouvelles méthodologies? Nous avons l’occasion parfaite pour vous!  Rôle À titre de designer UX/UI, vous jouerez un rôle essentiel dans la conception et l’évolution de notre écosystème numérique. Relevant du directeur principal, Innovations numériques, vous aurez comme principales responsabilités :  Concevoir des expériences captivantes en vue de réaliser les objectifs d’affaires  Valider la fonctionnalité et l’utilité par l’entremise de tests et de recherches auprès des utilisateurs  Produire des livrables UX et design pertinents au besoin  Piloter une feuille de route aux côté d’un directeur de produit et d’une équipe agile multidisciplinaire  Présenter le travail aux parties prenantes  Aider les ingénieurs à produire des interfaces de qualité et agréables  Prôner une conception axée sur l’utilisateur et les données  Vos compétences  Minimum trois années d’expérience  Expertise en matière de convivialité et de pratiques de conception centrées sur l'utilisateur  Maîtrise des outils de conception (Sketch, Axure, InVision, Illustrator, etc.)  Expérience des outils de recherche UX (usertesting.com, Optimal Workshop, etc.) un atout  Expérience dans la production de flux de processus, d’inventaires de contenu, etc.  Vous aimez travailler dans un environnement de collaboration qui accorde une importance primordiale au travail d’équipe, à l’innovation, à l’ouverture d’esprit et au plaisir  Veuillez inclure votre portfolio dans votre dossier de candidature.  Vous êtes  Une personne avec qui il est agréable de travailler  Créatif, analytique, curieux et ingénieux  Un joueur d’équipe capable de partager et recevoir des commentaires constructifs  Excellent pour expliquer vos idées à différents intervenants  Profondément passionné par le design et la qualité  Organisé et proactif  En tant que salarié temps plein, vous bénéficierez des avantages suivants :  Un salaire compétitif  Un boni de performance annuel  Un régime de retraite  Un horaire de travail flexible de 35 heures par semaine  Des assurances médicales et dentaires hors pair  Et plusieurs autres avantages et bénéfices (remboursement gym, conférences, etc.)  Énoncé fermeture  Cette opportunité vous intéresse? Nous avons très hâte de faire votre connaissance!  D’excellents avantages sont offerts : salaire concurrentiel, avantages flexibles, aménagements de travail flexibles, congés mobiles, régime de retraite à prestation déterminée, etc.  Dans le cadre du processus de sélection d’Intact, les candidats peuvent être appelés à donner leur consentement à une vérification de leurs antécédents pertinente au poste à pourvoir avant de recevoir une offre d’emploi. Celle-ci peut comprendre une confirmation des références d’emploi, des études et des titres de compétences, une vérification des emplois, de l’identité, des infractions criminelles et du permis de conduire ainsi qu’un rapport de crédit.  Vous pouvez soumettre votre candidature à un emploi affiché pourvu que vous occupiez vos fonctions actuelles depuis au moins douze mois et que votre performance soit jugée bonne ou que votre contrat temporaire arrive à son échéance. Une recherche de talents à l'externe est menée parallèlement au recrutement à l'interne Veuillez donc prendre note que des candidats potentiels pourraient avoir été identifiés pour ce poste dans le cadre de leur plan de développement.   Veuillez noter que l'usage du masculin a comme but d'alléger le texte.  Cet affichage prendra fin 02 juin 2018.  Prime de recommandation  CE POSTE EST SUJET À UNE PRIME DE RECOMMANDATION DE 3000$.  #li-qc  Droit de travailler au Canada  Les personnes qui posent leur candidature à un poste permanent doivent, dès leur embauche, avoir le droit de travailler au Canada de façon permanente. Les documents pouvant servir de preuve dans le cas des rôles permanents sont un certificat de naissance canadien, un passeport canadien, un certificat de citoyenneté canadienne, une carte de résident permanent ou une confirmation de son statut de résident permanent pour prouver qu’il a le droit de travailler au Canada. Title: Designer UX / UI

Job_Description: Role: UX/UI Designer Reports to: Director of Product Management Company: Fanxchange, https://www.fanxchange.com/ Location: Downtown Toronto Type: Full Time, Permanent  Company Fanxchange is an online ticket marketplace; home to millions of tickets to sports, concert and theater events across North America. Our marketplace enables fans to find the best deals available, see their favorite team, artist or show live and buy tickets with confidence as every order is backed by our guarantee. Whether on mobile or web, Fanxchange makes buying tickets a fun, simple and seamless experience. Fanxchange is also the B2B industry leader in powering white labeled live event ticketing solutions for major loyalty programs, financial institutions, travel providers, hotel operators, e-commerce marketplaces and distribution partners; providing their users access to tickets for all their favorite live events. Each Fanxchange employee plays an integral part in the success of our company. We truly care about providing our customers with the best service possible – from the newest, fastest technology to excellent customer care. We hire dynamic, innovative team players who are the best in their field. Does this sound like you? ROLE  You are an experienced, skilled, passionate and highly collaborative software user experience professional. You are empathetic towards user’s needs, and when defining an experience you are effective in both gathering feedback and inspiration from multiple sources as well as thinking outside the box to create your own innovative implementations. You're a pixel-perfectionist and you are a stickler for the details. When it comes to mockups and assets for internal review or development, you are precise, flexible and highly responsive, and you are always one step ahead of the crowd when it comes to options and alternatives. You have as much of an eye for beauty and symmetry as you do a mind for engagement and objective. You have an entrepreneurial spirit, are a self-starter and a critical thinker who is excited about the idea of not only helping to define the standards of an industry, but also being a key player in the rapid growth of an ambitious company. RESPONSIBILITIES  Along with the other members of the Product UX team, you will be ensuring that Fanxchange is an industry leader when it comes to all things interaction. On a daily basis, you can expect to: Collaborate with product managers, developers and other cross-functional team members to design best-in-class user experiences and information architecture Convey design ideas via sketches, storyboards, hi-fidelity mockups or prototypes Create iterative designs that meet product objectives, fit within design guidelines, and respond to feedback from usability testing Communicate interfaces in a strategic and experiential manner for product & stakeholder consideration and feedback Communicate designs in a technical manner for development & QA execution Work with the engineering team to ensure that execution matches the intention Drive the design direction of B2B and B2C products, internal tools and strategic communication to partners and prospects Requirements Approximately 3 to 5 years of experience in software product UX/UI design A portfolio of launched products (B2C), with balanced experience in both mobile and desktop applications Experience in solving for both B2B & B2C user experiences Leadership-level knowledge of product UX best practices & techniques Strong skills in graphic design; proficient with Photoshop, Illustrator, Sketch & InVision Knowledge of HTML, CSS and JavaScript well enough to communicate effectively with the development teams during handoff and execution Strong understanding of and experience with the software development process and application lifecycle management Experience with ALM and/or Project Management tools such as JIRA, TFS, Pivotal Tracker, etc. Strong oral and written communication skills in English Exceptional organization, time-management and task management skills Benefits Annual fitness allowance for gym memberships or towards other fitness activities $1,000 per year towards live event tickets Medical & dental benefits for employee and family members Endless amounts of coffee/soda Well-stocked pantry full of snacks Frequent team lunches and team events Newly renovated office (close to transit) in Downtown Toronto Competitive compensation packages, including equity
Title: UX / UI Designer

Job_Description: Evilnut Creative is a Vancouver and Toronto software company that provides affordable and professional digital solutions to your business.we strive to create professional, engaging and visually stimulating websites and mobile applications for business and entrepreneurs. Our team of specialists have a proven track record of delivering successful projects on-time and to your specifications. We provide a full service web design and development process, taking your business from conception to completion in the most efficient way possible. With a combination of IT support, such as web design, SEO and SEM, and mobile app developing, digital marketing is never been easier.  Responsibility: Participate in analyze, design mobile apps and business websites. Create UI/UX solutions for developers and clients. Implement UI/UX solutions by using standard methods, techniques and tools Coordinates with business analysts and users to help understanding requirements. Video and image designing Qualifications: A strong portfolio demonstrating UI/UX design skills An ability to produce wireframes, storyboards and communicate interaction models Proficiency with visual design software (Illustrator, Photoshop, AfterEffects,Sketch and more) Video production and Animation Previous experience in designing for mobile apps and websites (important) Previous experience with HTML5, JS, CSS, Bootstrap, JQuery (preferable, not essential) Job Type: Full-time
Title: UI/UX Designer

Job_Description: Are you up for the challenge of impacting, collaborating on, and designing an entire SUITE of industry-leading software? Have you always wanted to be part of a team during that rocketship phase from scrappy startup to international powerhouse? Have you dreamed of your designs impacting people's lives in a positive way and enabling them to live their best lives? Looking for that team and that mentorship that will really enable you to take your craft to the next level? If you’re a user-focused, ambitious Ui/UX designer with an entrepreneurial attitude, Jungle Scout is where you belong. We’re looking for a design padawan who has that magic combination of usability focus, creative passion, and inquisitive sensibility that makes an exceptional Jr designer. This is your chance to be step up to the plate, level up your skills, and be a critical component in how Jungle Scout defines the experience of its suite of tools and empowers its incredible (and exponentially growing) user base to become their own bosses. You will be a key player on the product design team, executing designs, collaborating on solutions, and cranking out features, flows, and Ui elements for our digital tools. Your work will require a considerate understanding of UX design best practices across platforms and a creative flare for Ui as well. You’ll need a holistic understanding of how people use software and how to execute designs in Sketch. You need to be a self-starter that is more focused on getting that MVP out the door than suffering from analysis paralysis when it comes to where exactly that button needs to be placed. Your Responsibilities: Work the with product design team to define and refine the user experience of the Jungle Scout suite of tools. Work closely with our team of amazing designers to maintain and enhance our design component library and overall aesthetic. Work collaboratively with other departments from product management, to customer support, and marketing to ensure we are serving our customers up the best solutions to their problems. Design, test, release, learn and repeat. Your Qualifications: You have a portfolio that displays a deep understanding of UX best practices and modern trends in Ui design. Have 1+ years experience as a UX or Ui designer in a startup, product, or agency setting. Have excellent communication skills, and ability to work across functional teams (engineering, product, marketing, customer success and more). Are entrepreneurial. You need to be a self-starter who is comfortable with ambiguity and defining your own direction. You can operate autonomously in a fast-paced environment with the capacity to make informed decisions and guide our customer’s success. Help build and follow processes and procedures that can scale as we grow. Why Jungle Scout: We are a fun-loving group of professionals, working remotely around the world while pursuing one goal: to help people launch and grow successful Amazon businesses. Jungle Scout has competitive compensation packages, a generous vacation policy, educational stipend, and the mindset that you should work when and where most suits your personality. We care about our culture and your continued development so twice a year we gather the entire team for Jungle Camp, an all-expense paid trip to a great location to foster learning, growth, fun and team bonding! Past Jungle Camps have been held in Bali, Rio de Janeiro, Budapest, and Bangkok.
Title: Junior UX/Ui Designer - Vancouver

Job_Description: Job Description  Ce que tu feras Rechercher, identifier et documenter les besoins des utilisateurs. Participer à l’élaboration de la stratégie de l’expérience numérique. Imaginer et designer des expériences fonctionnelles, élégantes et agréables, en produisant maquettes fil de fer, parcours utilisateurs, prototypes ou tout autre livrable approprié. Organiser et mener des sessions de recherche et de tests d’utilisabilité. Aider à définir et documenter les requis de développement en collaboration avec l’équipe d’analyse d’affaire. Itérer et collaborer avec l’équipe design, stratégie et technologie pour assurer la qualité du produit fini. Présenter et défendre ton travail en interne et auprès de nos clients. Gérer ton travail au jour le jour, comme la personne responsable et articulée que tu es. Qualifications  Ce que tu devras avoir Au moins cinq ans d’expérience en tant que designer d’expérience utilisateur autant dans la recherche, la conception que dans l’évaluation. Solide portfolio démontrant vos talents en UI/UX. Maitrise de Sketch, Axure, Omnigraffle et InVison. (Bonus si vous maitrisez la suite créative d’Adobe et/ou si vous savez coder en HTML/CSS) Capacité à produire des prototypes complexes (Par exemple : prototype navigable pouvant comprendre des formulaires, du design d’interaction, être lié à une base de données, être responsive, etc…) Excellentes connaissances des principes d’utilisabilité et d’interaction en web, tablette, mobile. Baccalauréat dans une discipline relative au design, à l’informatique, à la psychologie ou toute expérience de travail équivalente. Expérience en recherche utilisateur et en tests d’utilisabilité. Excellente capacité de présentation. Capacité de travailler en français et en anglais. Tes super pouvoirs Une vision périphérique : vous trouvez plusieurs solutions à un problème, dans le temps de le dire. Un amour de la justice : vous prenez la défense du UX parce que vous y croyez dur comme fer. Un côté sorcier : vous savez faire parler les données. En fait, vous les adorez. Un esprit rassembleur : votre définition du bonheur au travail? Travailler avec une équipe multidisciplinaire de designers, de rédacteurs et de développeurs. Une imagination débordante: le statu quo très peu pour vous. Une agilité d’acrobate: vous savez gérer votre temps et vous jonglez parfaitement avec les priorités. Additional Information  Tu vas aimer: Notre esprit de famille Notre localisation en plein centre-ville, animé par le quartier des spectacles Notre collaboration entre les bureaux internationaux et la possibilité d’y aller Notre équipe dynamique, diversifiée et tournée vers l’innovation Nos horaires d’été, le télétravail et les horaires flexibles Nos activités sociales organisées par le comité l’fun
Title: Designer d'expérience utilisateur UX

Job_Description: Visier is the gathering place for the smartest thinkers, brightest innovators, and creative masterminds. You are a self-starter. You like to roll up your sleeves and transform the ordinary into the extraordinary. Together, we can reinvent the field of analytics with brilliant & beautiful user experience!  With over 350 employees across our Vancouver and San Jose headquarters, we’re looking for new talent who are eager to join our dynamic, passion-driven environment. Our vision is ambitious – to redefine the field of Business Intelligence by creating domain-specific and beautiful end-user-centric analytic applications.  To achieve our goals, we require talented individuals who will thrive in an innovative environment, and who love rolling up their sleeves, being highly creative, and working with smart technology to achieve success. Since much of our technology is being built from the ground up, we also want people who are excited about innovating and creating new technology.  You will be responsible for helping define the visual design and user experience of our products. You will work closely with a world-class design and development team to define the visual language of our software and translate wireframes into pixel perfect designs. Apply now! What you’ll bring to the table…  Strong visual design background – you love to make things beautiful! Familiar with the latest trends in design, including mobile design Advantageous would be to have some knowledge in one of the following areas: – User interface conventions and UI pattern driven design – Motion design and prototyping – Business intelligence, analytics software, or data visualization Experience with Adobe Illustrator CS & Sketch a strong asset Self-starter with excellent attention to detail and a passion for creating innovative, usable, and beautiful software! Working towards a design, computer science, or engineering degree. User Interface Design or UX courses are a must-have What you value…  You are determined to succeed and committed to win. The opportunity for success is unrivaled here, but you need to supply the drive. Results matter. You are passionate about visual design and UX. We produce software that makes information beautiful, accessible, and engaging to our users. You are accountable. This is a small company and we take responsibility for our own successes and failures. You are disciplined. We do things the right way, we do not cut corners, we do not rely on smoke and mirrors; we are the real deal.
Title: Visual Designer Co—op (8 months)

Job_Description: What Is the Prescription For A Great Career?  At Rexall, we are community difference makers. Our hearts skip a beat when we meet talent who sees the bigger picture and wants to make an impact in our communities, our teams, and our business. This means finding even better ways to work, share ideas, and making a material difference in the Rexall journey.  We are leaders in health and wellness and a talent destination for over 8600 Rexall team members. We are proud to be part of the McKesson family, ranked fifth in the fortune 500. Together, we are defining better health through innovation, service, and living the “ICARE” values. Talk about a dream team!  The road ahead is one of adventure and heart. Are you our next all star?  The Mission: UX/UI Designer  Reporting to the Digital Solutions Manager, the UX/UI Designer will be experienced in conceptualizing and implementing innovative digital solutions – from process mapping to design recommendations. The analyst will address business needs by developing new solutions and enhancing existing digital properties.  Principal Responsibilities: Responsible for defining usability requirements and creative design guidelines for all digital properties - web, mobile, email, social, pharmacy applications etc.  Acting as the liaison between the business and the technical teams, the analyst will ensure that business requirements are documented and communicated accurately, and any technical challenges are relayed back in business context.  Document business requirements, functional specifications and acceptance criteria for both product and process enhancements  Review and assess business models and rules and their integration with technology  Meet with subject matter experts, systems owners and end users to capture business/technical problems and implement innovative solutions  Create detailed wireframes, user flows, mockups, story boards, site maps, prototypes  Develop UI/UX solutions and provide UI/UX guidance to external agencies  Analyze and improve customer experience on current and future digital platforms  Deliver presentations to business teams and facilitate workshops, ideation and design thinking sessions  Maintain positive, collaborative partnerships with key internal stakeholders and clients  Analyze usage stats and relevant data to observe patterns and recommend optimizations  Facilitate orientation and training of end users for new and modified systems  Research emerging approaches, technologies, solutions and techniques  Perform other duties as assigned to support Rexall Pharmacy Group Ltd. University degree preferred or 2-3-year College Diploma in an IT-related discipline  3 years working experience in a technical environment with working knowledge of web & mobile design/development best practices  3 years working experience with UI/UX design, using wireframes and prototypes to create intuitive interfaces and interaction layers  Experience with process mapping, requirements gathering and preparing deliverables  Strong command of visual design capabilities, including composition, layout information hierarchy, typography and color theory, grid layouts and responsive design  The analyst is required to have strong knowledge in web and mobile best practices and development.  Ability to provide front-end design direction and assets to development teams  Strong knowledge using diagraming applications (OmniGraffle, MS Visio etc)  Flexibility, adaptability and the speedy learning in a creative design and technical environment, while delivering quality work under tight deadlines, are key attributes of the Digital Business Analyst.  Strong knowledge using design and prototyping tools (Photoshop, Illustrator, Axure, InVision etc)  Familiarity with portals and e-commerce solutions (Liferay, SharePoint, Magento, Shopify etc)  Sound knowledge with programming languages (HTML, CSS, .NET, Java, Java Script, PHP, XML, SQL)  Familiarity will accessibility guidelines and standards as they relate to web/mobile technologies  Experience working in an Agile and Kanban environment  Experience working in a team-oriented, collaborative environment  Excellent written and oral communication skills  Excellent organization and time management skills  Strong customer service orientation  The Rexall DNA: Ready to make an impact - You are mission-driven and want to make a difference  Consensus - Your people-first mindset shows in all that you do  Embraces change - You move fast and change excites you  Drives achievement - You are wired to always exceed your personal best  Overcomes adversity - You see the world as glass half full and embrace a good challenge  Trail blazer - You love creating the path forward and being able to shape the future  Fun - You think laughter is the best medicine and your positive energy is contagious  Side effects may include: A closely connected culture  Competitive compensation, pension, benefits, personal days, employee discounts, and vacation time  Fully utilizing your talent  Professional growth and development via challenging projects and assignments  Warm and fuzzy feelings knowing you have helped your community, your team, the business and social causes through the Rexall Foundation  Are you #Allin ?  Rexall Pharmacy Group Ltd. is committed to providing an accessible environment for all of our customers, employees, and job applicants. Rexall Pharmacy Group Ltd. will make available to any selected applicants accommodations and/or accessible formats should he/she require. Candidates are encouraged to discuss any accommodation he/she may need in order to allow for the most effective selection process.
Title: UX/UI Designer

Job_Description: Who we are: BLENDER is an interactive agency specializing in investor marketing solutions. In the last decade, we have worked with over 500 publicly traded and private companies providing digital strategy, design, development and campaign management. Through the trusted Blender CMS and our Updates Team, we provide a full suite of web applications for TSX, NYSE and NASDAQ listed companies. We are also the aggregator and publisher of the Canadian Financing Bulletin (CFB) – one of the premier research publications on financing activities in the Canadian markets since 2005; the report is used by leading investment firms across North America. About The Role: Our head office in Coal Harbour Vancouver has an opening for a Digital Designer. In this role you’ll work with clients to build custom websites from start to finish. Throughout the whole process, you’ll discover their needs, present solutions, guide their design decisions, and work closely with our development team to transform a concept into reality. We love working with open-minded people who strive to make a difference and are proud of the work they do. If you’re entrepreneurial in spirit, love working in teams, and passionate about web design & online marketing this may be your fit. Core Responsibilities: Creating website designs Designing corporate presentations, documents Branding and logo designs Presenting design solutions to clients Display ads What You’ll Bring: 3-5 years working in an agency environment Master of UI and passionate about UX Mobile design experience and a passion for further growth in the space Higher understanding of how digital design relates to business and marketing In-depth knowledge of web design Expert knowledge of Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, inDesign) Experience with info-graphics and data visualization Ability to work in a fast-paced working environment Strong sense of time management and ability to promise on timelines Must be able to immediately prioritize work for multiple ongoing projects High ability to multi-task Ideal Candidate: Strong communication skills with the ability to clearly present design ideas to a non-technical room Strong communication for client interaction Writing skills Animation skills (After Effects or other) Front-end development knowledge or skills (Base level knowledge of CSS and HTML) Illustration skills Must be obsessed with details Experience with project documentation and processes How to apply: If you’re excited about this opportunity and believe it’s the right one for you, send us a link to your portfolio and resume at careers@blendermedia.com. We’re excited to hear from you!
Title: Digital Designer

Signifi Solutions design and develops unique solutions that are used by retailers and corporate customers to either sell products or manage assets. We are a 12-year-old company with fortune 500 customers all over the world. We develop elegant, functional, and highly technical automated retail experiences for customers.We are growing and have an excellent opportunity for an individual to build a career at Signifi.RESPONSIBILITIESWork with the Team Lead to design and develop commercial user-centric applications using HTML5, CSS3 and JavaScript (DoneJS framework)Create design solutions that address business & user requirementsCreate wireframes, user flows, storyboards, prototypes and other UX deliverablesReport and estimate on development status within small teamsWork effectively as part of a development team to identify, design, develop and test re-usable code and objectsDocument coding and design activitiesQualifications & SkillsPortfolio of work supporting your UI/UX design skills and historyExpert level experience with HTML5, CSS3 and JQueryExperience with building CSS3 layout/templates conforming to all popular web browsers (IE 10+, Chrome, Firefox, iOS/Android)Expert knowledge of graphic design tools (Adobe Graphic suite, Sketch etc.)Working knowledge of GitGood English verbal, written and communication skillsNice To HaveExperience with frontend Javascript libraries/frameworks (DoneJS, AngularJS, ReactJS)COMPETENCIES: Highly motivated individual with excellent interpersonal and communication skillsGood attention to detailCan adapt well to shifting priorities and schedulesMust possess good communication skills and be effective working independentlyJob Type: Full-time

Job_Description: UI / UX DesignerSail bridges the gap between practitioners, patients, and registered vendors as a trusted medical resource that simplifies the cannabis journey by providing secure, clinical & peer-to-peer data driven solutions.About UsSail Cannabis is a HIPAA compliant healthcare platform solving a global issue of access patients. Sail helps patients find, qualify and connect with physicians securely through telemedicine or in clinic to navigate the cannabis prescription process. Sail connects patients to the industry with an extensive database of regulated suppliers and a listing of tested and verified strains.What We’re Looking ForWe’re looking for a self-starting Junior UI / UX Designer who will report to the Design Director and support the community manager, sales team, and business development team in the execution of various digital experiences across multiple platforms. The ideal candidate is familiar with the start-up life and is a master task-manager who is able to successfully work on multiple projects at once. UI / UX and product design experience are highly desired.Responsibilities and DutiesCollaborate with the team in discussing business objectives and requirements for design material from conception to completion.Work with the Design Director and other designers to maintain and evolve the visual design system within the company.Manage workload according to business priorities.Create a wide variety of digital user experiences by successfully executing user research, sketching and wireframing all the way through to high fidelity or interactive mockups for a variety of user experiences including landing pages, websites, digital products, apps, and email campaigns.Present creative internally and be open to receiving critical feedback.Soft SkillsWork well independently under tight timelines and be able to multi-task like a champ.Be able to stay zen while making your 20th revision on the same project.Sweat the details.Know the latest and greatest about industry trends and be able to apply it to your work.Be comfortable working in the healthcare industry and with medical cannabis in particular.Strong communication and problem solving skills.Technical SkillsStrong online design portfolio is a must.Master level skills using Adobe Creative Suite (particularly Illustrator and Photoshop).Master level skills in Sketch, Zeplin & Invision.Knowledge of interaction design principles (UI / UX)Good understanding of typography and color theory.Experience with Mailchimp.Basic experience hand coding HTML / CSS.Understanding of how a design system works within a company, and how it needs to be maintained.Bonus RequirementsStrong illustration skills.Experience with Asana & Jira.Experience with print design would be helpful.Interested? Send Us YourResumeOnline portfolio.Any other links you’d like us to see (Dribbble, Behance, etc).Job Type: Full-time
Title: UI / UX Designer

Job_Description: About VersaPay Corporation  VersaPay is a Fintech company and leading provider of cloud-based invoice-to-cash solutions, enabling businesses to provide a superior customer experience, get paid faster, streamline financial operations, and dramatically reduce DSO and costs.  Why VersaPay?  VersaPay is a fast-growing, FinTech software company located in the heart of downtown Toronto, a world-renowned technology hub. We have been around for 10+ years, but we believe in operating with a start-up mindset. We work hard, building innovative technology that is revolutionizing the accounts receivable space, and make sure we have fun while doing so! If you’re ready for a challenge and want a great opportunity to work alongside other like minded people, join VersaPay, the next Canadian technology success story!  What we Offer  Team environment: organized monthly activities (local baseball, basketball or hockey game; playing sports as a team; team potluck, monthly birthday celebrations)  Constant learning opportunities: from experts in the field. You will be challenged with projects that have a real impact, creating an experience like no other for accelerating your career  Central location: headquarters located in the heart of downtown Toronto  Work-life balance: our flexible working environment promotes work-life balance allowing employees to effectively manage responsibilities at work, at home, and in their community  Competitive salary: we are building a team with the best of the best and offer competitive compensation to ensure we attract and retain the best talent  Vacation: all employees start at a minimum of three weeks of paid vacation  Incredible health benefits: after one month of employment, employees are eligible for an incredible health benefits package including dental, medical, vision and more  No dress code: no dress code policy to promote the diverse personalities of our people  Job Summary  The UI/UX Product Designer will report into the Director of Product Management and will gather product ideas and requirements from various stakeholders, collaborate with stakeholders and product development team to design user flows, customer journey maps, wireframes, high fidelity designs and prototypes. The UX designer will also be expected to design the overall functionality of the product, and in order to ensure a great user experience, iterate upon it.  Key Responsibilities  Participate in Agile Scrum development process and daily standups  Gathering feature requirements from stakeholders and customers  Translate concepts into user flows, wireframes, high fidelity designs and prototypes that lead to intuitive user experiences  Facilitate the product vision by researching, conceiving, sketching, prototyping and testing experiences for digital products  Design and deliver wireframes, user stories, user journeys, and high fidelity designs optimized for a wide range of devices and interfaces  Identify design problems and devise elegant solutions  Create and maintain graphical style guidelines for the product  Make strategic design and user-experience decisions related to core, and new, functions and features.  Take a user-centered design approach and rapidly test and iterate your designs.  Collaborate with other team members and stakeholders and Engineering.  Help QA design and prepare high level test cases to aid in test team’s planning and perform feature reviews  Work closely with development and test teams to ensure software releases deliver product management’s objectives on time and on budget  Undertake knowledge transfer and create training, operational, and support materials, in order to ensure seamless transition from product management to sales, client services and production support  Investigate problems independently and through collaboration with the development and test teams  Skills & Qualifications  B.Sc. in Computer Science, Graphical Design, Visual Design, Interaction Design, or equivalent  3+years of UI/UX design experience. Preference will be given to candidates who have experience designing complex applications  2+ years of Agile/Scrum experience writing user stories, working directly with a development team is a plus  Be passionate about resolving user pain points through great design  Be passionate about all things UX and other areas of design and innovation. Research and showcase knowledge in the industry’s latest trends and technologies  Solid track record in requirements analysis to drive UI/UX product design described in user flows, user journeys, etc  Ability to clearly and effectively communicate design processes, ideas, and solutions to teams and clients  A clear understanding of the importance of user-centered design and design thinking  Extensive experience in using UX design best practices to design solutions for usability, and a deep understanding of mobile-first and responsive design to improve user experience  Ability to work with clients to understand detailed requirements and design complete user experiences that meet client needs and vision  A solid grasp of user-centered design (UCD), planning and conducting user research, user testing, A/B testing, rapid prototyping, heuristic analysis, usability and accessibility concerns  Domain expertise in accounts payable and/or accounts receivable or related FinTech a plus  Excellent verbal and written communication & organizational skills  Sufficient technical background to provide highly-credible interaction with technical teams, and to objectively evaluate complex project issues and risks  Self-motivation and drive; ability to execute with minimal daily supervision  Be open to receiving feedback and constructive criticism  Be excited about collaborating and communicating closely with teams and other stakeholders via a distributed model, to regularly deliver design solutions for approval  Expertise in standard UX software such as Sketch, OmniGraffle, Axure, InVision, UXPin, Balsamiq, Framer, and the like is a must. Basic HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript skills are a plus.  Experience with Project Management tools such as Jira, Rally, VersionOne or equivalent  Experience working with a startup or SaaS company is an asset  At VersaPay, we are committed to providing an environment that is inclusive and accessible. VersaPay is an equal opportunity employer and considers all applicants for employment without discrimination to race, colour, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veterans status, Aboriginal/Native American status. Please let us know if accommodation for the recruitment/interview process is required and we will work with you to make sure your needs are meet.
Title: UI/UX Product Designer

Job_Description: Did you spend countless hours debating the iOS7 redesign? Do you become obsessed with even the smallest detail of an interface design? Have you ever looked at an incredibly well-designed app and secretly wished you had done it? If the answers are yes, yes and hell yes, we want to hear from you. Plastic Mobile is looking for a Mobile/Graphic Designer, with a hunger to fill their portfolios with best class apps for some of Canada’s top tier brands. You’ll join our creative team of usability architects, designers, art directors and strategists to create and conceptualize, iOs/Android apps, responsive/adaptive websites, as well as work for our mobile innovation lab. Responsibilities: Collaborating with the team to support our website design and content Contributing new ideas for design and content creation to the team using your expertise and eye for cutting-edge design. Conceptualize and create intuitive and engaging mobile experiences for users Push the boundaries on innovation through interface design Translate requirements into highly engaging and compelling design concepts Candidate must work well as part of a team and on their own Detail-oriented, with an eye for thoroughness and accuracy Work closely with our Art Directors and Creative Director Desired Skills & Experience 3+ years' experience working in Graphic design 2+ years' experience working in Mobile design Experience using Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign (Final Cut Pro and After Effects are a plus) Experience working with wireframes. UX and UI experience is a plus Experience with responsive layout grids and best practices Knowledge of Axure, Visio, Omnigraffle is a bonus Knowledge of common smartphone capabilities such as iOS and Android Knowledge of common web browser capabilities Must be self-directed and highly motivated with an ability to manage multiple projects with tight deadlines in a fast-paced environment Must be able to work well under pressurePlease include your portfolio along with one secret talent we should know about when applying for the position. Employee Perks:  Comprehensive Health Beneﬁts Fun, open environment Company Description Plastic Mobile, a Havas Company, is an agency dedicated to helping our clients create and launch successful mobile experiences. We exclusively work with companies that are looking to make a difference in the mobile space and make it an integral part of their customers' lives. We specialize in ideating, designing and engineering apps and sites for smartphones, tablets, and devices everywhere for commerce, loyalty, payment, wallets, location-based and transactional branded experiences. Plastic Mobile is headquartered out of Toronto, Montreal New York City powered by the best creative minds, mobile strategists and software engineers designing and building world-class mobile experiences. Find us on the Web: http://www.plasticmobile.com
Title: Graphic Designer (Mobile)

Job_Description: Job Details Description As a UI Designer, you’ll work with an inclusive, hands-on, collaborative group to create digital experiences that are that are appealing and functional to our members. You’ll always be learning, and there’s a good chance your co-workers will inspire you to try something new, like riding in a Fondo, bouldering or paddleboarding.  What you do:  Design beautiful and usable interfaces for while maintaining a consistent aesthetic and user experience Turn ideas into strong visual designs that are functional and appealing to our customers. Collaborate with internal team members (such as but not limited to Developers, Digital Product Managers etc.) to bring ideas to life. Use design best practices to recommend creative solutions for UI challenges Create deliverables including production ready assets, specs, mock-ups and style guidelines as required Follow, establish and document design standards as required Work with our development team to prototype, test and iterate on designs Be an active member within cross-functional Agile teams throughout the design and development process Blow our minds with creative solutions that are strategic and on-brand Collaborate with marketing, brand engagement and design teams to create meaningful experiences for our members What you bring:  3-5 years of experience doing visual/UI design for web Passion for online retail and have worked on ecommerce sites in the past An eye for clean and artful design A portfolio that showcases high quality in design, creative solutions and detail Expert proficiency with Sketch and fundamental understanding of HTML, CSS, JavaScript - enough to work in tandem with a Front End Developer to refine the UI Familiar with the latest UI web and mobile technology trends Demonstrated ability to work in cross-functional teams and communications with various stakeholders (Technical and non-technical) Ability to present ideas and concepts in a clear, effective, professional manner which is appropriate to the audience level Confidence, clarity, and the power of persuasion Flexibility and a positive spirit You aren’t afraid to think big or try something new Great communication skills – you listen first, then share knowledge Self-motivation. You get the job done well, without wasting time, and without being asked You’re stoked on something. Maybe you live and breathe design, build trails, crave water, organize hut trips, or ride to work. Bonus points if you…  Can name at least 7 flavours of Clif bars UX and web development experience
Title: User Interface Designer

Job_Description: We are currently seeking Graphic Designer for an in-house marketing team in Toronto to work on exciting and creative promotions! This is a 1 Year Contract on site. The Graphic Designer will be designing projects within established brand standards and style guides for both print and digital media platforms.  Responsibilities include; -Developing creative concepts for marketing initiatives -Working on designs for multi-page documents, multi-touchpoint campaigns, print and digital collateral, as well as graphics for social media -Update and maintain graphics on all digital and web entities including their corporate website, microsites and landing pages - Manage other design needs that span the entire company – such as presentations, signage and trade show collateral as needed.  Must Haves: - previous 3+ years’ work experience as a Graphic Designer using updated software and tools (Adobe Creative Suite, MS Office etc.) - Strong design portfolio of print and online work (link preferred to view) - Passion for design and eagerness to collaborate with client - Web Design exposure, UX/UI experience would be an asset - Self-motivated, organized and accountable - Certification or Degree from an accredited Graphic Design Program  Don’t miss a challenging and rewarding opportunity or at least the best interview ever! If you are interested or you know of someone who might be (MoD offers an amazing referral fee) please contact linda.fernandes@marketersondemand.com aka "The VP of First Impressions & Recruitment"
Title: Graphic Designer, 1 Year Contract

Job_Description: *Please note this is an unpaid internship, however travel costs will be covered**Job/Position Summary:*As a UX Designer you will be using your experience in creating exceptional user-centered web applications to contribute to enhancing the visualization and user experience of new and existing applications. You will contribute to innovative and high quality User Interface design solutions for various business applications and tools.Organizational Status: Working closely with the PMO, You will understand business requirements and apply fundamental design principals to propose UI/UX design solutions. You will also work with the development team members to assess feasibility and coordinate for designing and implementing solutions. Specifically as an intern you'll get the opportunity to learn the real world applications of your unique skill setResponsibilities Include: Design easy-to-use, intuitive user experiences and interfaces for a variety of projects and applications with consideration to end-user platforms/browsersWork with the PMO & clients to understand business requirements and processes in relation to contextual user behavior for superior design proposals.Slice & dice images quickly and on a regular basisWork closely with development team to gauge the feasibility of proposed designs and ensuring support of business requirements while conforming to proposed Design StandardsPresent designs for review and positively accept constructive feedback to be able maintain fast-paced design-build cyclesCollaborate with the business /clients to understand needs, prototype ideas and provide mockups with ongoing revisions based on feedbackDesign web images for web pages, banner ads, icons, logos, marketing fliersApply knowledge of HTML/CSS and an understanding of how compositions translate to code in order to deliver feasible designs.The ideal candidate has: Received or is working towards a degree/diploma in Computer Science, design, human-computer interaction (HCI), or related discipline. Students coming out of Boot camp programs are more than welcome!Eagerness to gain experience in designing innovative and forward thinking digital productsKnowledge of Axure/Sketch/Photoshop/ Illustrator/CSS/HTMLPractical understanding of HTML5/CSS, and/or other web/native code.Excellent communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills and ability to gracefully defend your design decisions to clientsA thorough understanding of typography, layout, color and user interfaceDesire to learn and continuously get better, bringing a can do attitude to the challenges of working in a fast pace environmentJob Type: Internship
Title: Internship UX/UI Designer

Job_Description: We’re looking for a designer who’s passionate about creating meaningful experiences through beautifully designed products. You will partner with startups to shape and bring their dreams to life and help enterprises redefine the way they work and deliver value to their customers. You’ll bring your empathy of people, continuous improvement, and learning to the table. And collaborate with everyone from sales through development, design and QA to deliver great digital experiences for our partners and their customers. What we'd like to see You can develop wireframes and create digital prototypes (e.g. Invision) You can research and empathize with the user to create personas, experience / journey maps You have experience in organizing and participating in user testing You can visualize experiences from static comps to fully fledged animations You understand digital design principles and elements, can work with existing atomic design / style guides. Bonus: have experience designing brand identities You’re proficient in Sketch, Invision, Photoshop and other design tools You have experience designing for mobile and can translate designs across native platforms (iOS and Android) You like to be in a super-collaborative environment, working alongside talented developers, designers, QA analysts, delivery managers and business partners throughout the lifecycle of a project You can simultaneously see the bigger picture and focus on the finer details You independently adopt new technologies and practices (e.g. tools, platforms, features, etc.) You love digital and keep your eye on best practices and emerging trends in web and mobile design You are capable in prioritizing and managing design tasks, can work independently while also recognizing when to ask for help Now a little about us Established in 2010, we’re a closely knit team of developers, designers, QA Analysts and leaders who truly love what we do day in and day out. We’ve designed and developed products with companies such as PayPal, Tumblr, TELUS, Microsoft and YogaGlo. We work with early stage startups to help bring their first version products to market, and find product-market fit. We also work with large organizations to teach them how move quickly and create quality products by adopting startup cultures and habits. No matter the scale of the project, our goal is to create products and services that will help our partners further develop their business and deliver an application that people will enjoy using. Joining Nascent means being able to work on products used by millions of people every day. You’ll be working in an open, honest and engaging environment in downtown Toronto. We offer great opportunities, competitive benefits and a ton of fun. Go on apply! Nascent’s a great place to work, and we’d love for you to find out firsthand. To apply, e-mail us at careers@nascentdigital.com. Please include your resume or CV, a link to your online portfolio and the position for which you’re applying in the subject line. We look forward to hearing from you!  < See all postings
Title: Intermediate UX/UI Designer

Job_Description: iComply Investor Services is a leading Regulatory Technology (RegTech) company based in Vancouver, BC, Canada. At iComply, we believe that there is an abundance of capital that remains untapped. Our platform aims to build a cohesive ecosystem that fundamentally changes the way capital is distributed globally. Together, we will democratize capital and create a new financial economy with greater security, trust, integrity, and investor protection.  The Role The UI/UX Designer will define and implement effective solutions for the product direction, visuals and experience. The ideal candidate will be inventive and resourceful at problem-solving while communicating clearly and effectively with a diverse group of stakeholders and executive level leadership. iComply is seeking an individual who can effectively and efficiently translate user research into sitemaps, wireframes, mockups and prototypes with consideration of user/system interaction.  Duties and Responsibilities  Deliver mock-ups for all stages of a design process (modern web applications)  Develop UI assets using Photoshop, Illustrator, Sketch, and XD  Conduct requirement gather sessions with stakeholders and evaluate user feedback  Establish design guidelines, best practices, and standards  Key Requirements  Bachelor’s degree in computer science or related field  5+ years of experience in web design & development  Proficient in HTML5, CSS3, Bootstrap, JavaScript, jQuery and Git  Previous experience in E-Commerce with Payment Gateways  Effective Verbal and Written Communication Skills  Expertise in modern web standards  Knowledge of web UI frameworks  Working knowledge in creating wireframes, storyboards, user flows, process flows and sitemaps  Fast learner, ability to work with a team, a strong sense of responsibility, and exceptional time management skills.  BONUS : experience "re-skinning" already build web applications (Bootstrap)  Demonstrate Understanding and Experience with the Following  HTML5  LESS/SASS  Javascript / Jquery  Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign, DreamWeaver)  Source Control (GIT, SVN etc)  **ATTENTION**  We will only consider those who meet all of the requirements listed under Key Requirements.
Title: UX / UI Designer

Job_Description: Unito.io is a work collaboration tool based in Montreal and one of BetaKit's top startups to watch in 2018 . We’re a VC-backed SaaS company that makes people happier, organizations more productive, and software more powerful, all over the world.  We are looking for someone who ...  What you will do: Design and improve the UX of Unito’s app. Translate concepts into wireframes and mockups that lead to intuitive user experiences. Research, wireframe, prototype and mock up user experiences, using feedback to iterate and improve on them as you go. Identify design problems and devise elegant solutions. Make strategic design and user-experience decisions related to core and new functions and features. Collaborate with other team members and stakeholders. Take smart risks and champion new ideas. Understand key features by interviewing stakeholders & prepare a UX wireframe before kickoff meetings to help anchor team discussions. Incorporate user research and usability testing to iterate on product solutions. Lead and participate in concept sessions leveraging ethnographic research and design thinking. Balance customer frictions and needs with our client’s business goals, market viability and technical feasibility. Proven experience delivering concepts, personas, user journeys, storyboards, user flows, wireframes, prototypes, etc. Partner with engineering to ensure designs are properly implemented. Requirements  2+ years' experience of working on a UX Designer, UI Designer or other relevant position. Have experience with UX on enterprise software. Analyze and meet product specifications and user expectations. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with business-oriented approach. Significant experience with design software and a solid portfolio of design projects. Strong communication skills. It'd be nice if you  Have a good knowledge of HTML/CSS. Know React and Javascript. Have experience in project management and research will be a bonus. Who we are  Unito is a fast-growing startup and winner of Founder Institute's “Best Startup in Canada” in 2017. If you’re looking to build something you’ll be proud of and help shape the company, then you’ll fit right in!  We’re taking on a major problem that people are passionate about solving: we make it easier to collaborate across teams. We don't make users learn new tools and change the way they work. By connecting work management tools, we allow managers, cross-functional teams, departments, and entire companies to benefit from seamless collaboration and improved communication. We sync projects across a number of tools, but our main focus is on Trello, Asana, JIRA, GitHub, and Wrike. This is a hard problem of semantics, synchronization, and APIs.  Our software is changing the collaborative work landscape and is the only software of its kind on the market. We pride ourselves in having one of the most talented and motivated teams in town. We’ve acquired tens thousands of trial users, hundreds of paying customers, hired 16 people, and connected 9 different applications together. We’re on a mission to change how collaboration works between teams for almost any company in the world, and we’ve shown so far that we’ve got what it takes to succeed. Benefits  Flexible work hours (many of us have kids, we know what it’s like...) Group benefits plan Convenient downtown location (Place Ville Marie) Free coffee, tea, beer, and fruit-infused water Gorgeous office space with common areas and kitchen Wellness spending budget for self-improvement purposes  Culture: Our team is a family of humble and hungry individuals, varying in age, cultures, and backgrounds. We prefer to focus more on the quality of our work, and less on things like policies or rules. We trust our team and encourage them to make independent decisions, ask questions, share ideas, and voice opinions. Everyone's voice is heard.  Here at Unito, we’re huge on transparency, honesty, and execution. We have no tolerance for politics, and value flexibility, autonomy, fairness, and respect. We share achievements, and learn from failures together as a team.  Our team operates through areas of of responsibility, with no official job titles and a flat org chart. We like to joke that we don't have an open door policy because we don't even have doors. We are inclusive and welcoming, and dedicated to building a team of high performers. We want every employee to maximize his or her potential, learn, and grow within the company.  If this position sounds like a good fit, we’d love to hear from you!
Title: UX Designer

Job_Description: About Us  Do you want to be a part of something disruptive and change an entire industry? Do you want to be a part of a best-in-class culture? Do you want to be in the first wave of individuals to help shape the growth of a company? If you are excited about anything you just read, we’d love for you to be a part of the Upchain team!  At Upchain, we are looking to turn the PLM (Product Lifecycle Management) industry on its head. By 2021, many projects the SaaS PLM industry to be worth over $40 Billion USD, and we are driven to make our mark! We have the product, we have the vision, and we have the plan…now we need a great team to execute!  Job Description  The Upchain UI/UX Architect is responsible for collaboration with users, designers, frontend developers and product managers to develop interfaces that excel the users’ experience. The architect will develop conceptual models, wireframes, workflows and storyboards based on users’ personas. Validation of the designs will through direct interaction of all stake holders including the end users. As part of our Architecture team, you will collaborate closely with other members of the Engineering and Product Management teams in order to address UI related issues and new functional improvements.  UX/UI Architect Responsibilities:  Lead the UI Design and work collaboratively with all stake holders Maintain design style guide and accountable for Frontend developers’ UI implementation guidance Utilize wireframe and prototyping tools such as InVision for conveying early designs Create intuitive persona based workflow and UI navigation with number of clicks minimization UI consistency across the applications and utilization of HTML/CSS Design GUI elements across the application which include menus, tabs, widgets Collaboration with Developers and Product Managers throughout the software development lifecycle Establishment of best practices in UI design with reusable templates, components and designs Providing technical support for UX field issues when needed  UX/UI Architect Qualifications & Skills:  Bachelor's / Master’s Degree in Computer Science preferably in HCI or related field Over 5 years’ experience in user interface and interaction design Over 5 years’ experience for Web application and nice to have Mobile experience Over 3 years’ experience in HTML and CSS
Title: UX/UI Architect

Job_Description: Job Description  Description du poste Effectuer des recherches en technologies, en concepts et en meilleures pratiques d’interfaces utilisateur et faire part de ses recommandations à l’équipe de gestion; Produire des prototypes rapides de nouvelles idées et les présenter aux développeurs et aux artistes; Identifier les méthodes travail communes en production et développer des interfaces qui les optimisent; Participer à la création d’un guide formel d’interfaces utilisateur qui puisse servir de référence pour tout développement logiciel, tant basé sur le web que sur Qt; Élaborer des directives de design qui puissent s’adapter aux divers emplacements et contextes de l’entreprise; Créer et organiser des éléments d’interface tels que des kits d’interface, des icônes, des éléments servant aux présentations publiques; Créer de magnifiques designs d’interfaces qui contribueront à l’image de marque de l’entreprise. Job Description Research latest UI technologies, concepts and best practices and provide recommendations to the management team. Rapidly prototype new ideas to present examples to both developers and artists. Research common workflows of users in production and develop interface solutions to optimize their tasks. Formalize Human Interface Guide as reference literature for all application development, both web and Qt based. Work with multiple sites on a consistent, locally adaptable design guideline to address location specific differences. Create and organize art assets like UI kits, icons and PR initiatives. Brand and create beautiful UI designs for our internal products. Qualifications  Baccalauréat ou maîtrise en interfaces humain-machine, en sciences cognitives, en design graphique ou l’équivalent; 3 ans ou plus d’expérience en design d’interfaces et d’interactivité; Doit présenter un portfolio d’illustrations et de designs graphiques pertinents qui démontrent le niveau de qualité et de constance recherchés; Connaissance des normes web et des meilleures pratiques en utilisabilité; Bases solides en design et attention minutieuse aux détails visuels et d’interaction; Compréhension de la conception axée sur l’utilisateur et habilités démontrées en design d’interaction; Capacité à trouver des solutions créatives à des problèmes de design complexes; Habilités de base en programmation (HTML, CSS, Javascript, Qt) et / ou la capacité de créer des prototypes est un atout; Connaissance des outils de la suite d’Adobe. Atouts supplémentaires Expérience en conception d’applications logicielles de bureau; Connaissance des logiciels de conception 3D (p.ex. Maya, Cinema 4D, ZBrush); Expérience en animation (p.ex. Maya, After Effects, CSS, Javascript); Connaissance des effets visuels ou des processus de production; Design d’applications en réalité virtuelle. Qualification Bachelor's or Master's degree in Human Factors, HCI, cognitive science, graphic design or equivalent. 3+ years of UI design and interactive work. Must provide a solid and consistent body of relevant illustration and graphic design work. Knowledge of web standards & usability best practices. A solid design background with an obsessive eye for visual and interaction details. Understanding of user-centered design process and proven interaction design abilities. Creativity to invent new solutions to complex design problems Basic coding skills (HTML, CSS, Javascript, QT) and/or the ability to create prototypes is a plus. Knowledgeable with Adobe Suite softwares. Would be nice to have: Experience designing desktop software applications. Familiarity with 3D software (ex: Maya / Cinema 4D / ZBrush) applications. Animation experience (ex: Maya, After Effects, CSS, Javascript). Knowledge of VFX or media production processes. VR app design experience. Additional Information  This is an exciting opportunity to work in the dynamic world of visual effects. If you are an ambitious software developer looking for an opportunity to work with cutting edge technology then we look forward to your application. If you’re still not quite sure and would like more information or to just ask someone about life as a technologists at MPC, then please do not hesitate to get in touch! We want to be able to answer all your questions to ensure you are fully engaged and informed on the opportunity you are applying for. Please direct your questions to our Global Head of Technology Recruitment, Satveer Aujla https://www.linkedin.com/in/satveeraujla/ and he will get back you! All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

You will work on a variety of marketing deliverables, including websites, prototypes, wireframes, business collateral and other design pieces.ResponsibilitiesWork on the design of user interfaces for web and mobile projectsAble to help with wireframing using tools like Adobe XD and BalsamiqAble to self-direct and work independently, to manage multiple, concurrent projects simultaneously from start to finishRequirements: Expertise in Adobe Creative Suite: Illustrator, Photoshop, InDesign, After Effects, EdgeKnowledge of responsive web designAbility to create interactive prototypesCustomer-obsessed, detail-oriented and comfortable working on highly technical teamsDemonstrated experience with building user interfaces across a range of platforms including desktop and mobile--- Please send examples of your design portfolio (specifically web design) when you apply. ---We look forward to meeting you!Job Type: Full-timeEducation:High school or equivalentLocation:Windsor, ON

Job_Description: Si vous aimez transformer de bonnes idées en expériences usager concrètes, si vous aimez améliorer l’expérience usager et résoudre des enjeux d’interfaces et de parcours utilisateur, si vous avez de l’intérêt pour les objets connectés et la réalité augmentée, vous êtes la personne que nous recherchons.  En tant que designer d’expérience utilisateur, vous travaillerez en étroite collaboration avec les concepteurs d’interface utilisateur, les concepteurs de jeux ainsi qu’avec diverses équipes multidisciplinaires pour définir la stratégie UX de jeux mobiles et sites Web.  RESPONSABILITÉS PRINCIPALES : Projets en amont  Travailler en étroite collaboration avec l’équipe pour mettre en œuvre une expérience utilisateur optimale basée sur les meilleures pratiques de l’industrie Préparer des documents détaillant votre vision, y compris le flux d’utilisateurs, wireframes interactifs, documents fonctionnels, présentations clients, etc. Participer à stratégie et planification de tests usager. Présenter votre stratégie et vision UX en interne et aux clients Au quotidien  Participer aux scrums du projet S’assurer que les produits sont développés en fonction de l’expérience d’utilisateur souhaitée, en termes de flux d’utilisateurs et d’ergonomies Identifier les problèmes de UX potentiels et fournir des solutions viables Effectuer des tests usager, analyser les résultats et implémenter les changements Travailler en étroite collaboration avec l’équipe de production pour s’assurer que les solutions UX sont correctement intégrées En continu  Assister à des conférences et des événements de l’industrie Partager vos connaissances et les dernières tendances UX avec vos collègues par le biais d’ateliers, de déjeuners-conférences ou d’autres réunions EXIGENCES : Posséder un diplôme d’études collégiales dans un domaine connexe Avoir un minimum de 3 ans d’expérience en design UX, architecture d’information, UI designer, ou rôle similaire. Expérience concrète en design UX pour les jeux mobiles Maîtriser les logiciels de documentation (Axure, Word, Excel, PowerPoint) Être axé sur l’utilisateur Comprendre de la culture du jeu Posséder de bonnes aptitudes de communication (écrite et parlée) pour expliquer clairement ses concepts et idées Démontrer des compétences en gestion de temps (capacité à respecter des délais serrés) Être ouvert d’esprit, avant-gardiste, autocritique et capacité à travailler en équipe Nous offrons pour ce poste une rémunération concurrentielle et un environnement de travail dynamique. Si ce poste vous intéresse, veuillez nous faire parvenir votre curriculum vitae ainsi qu’une lettre d’intention : recrutement@bkom.com  L’emploi du masculin générique dans le texte vise le seul but d’en alléger la forme. Nous souscrivons au principe de l’équité en matière d’emploi.  Nous vous remercions de l’intérêt que vous témoignez envers BKOM. Cependant, nous communiquerons seulement avec les candidats retenus en présélection.
Title: UX Designer

Job_Description: Our client, a leader in the burgeoning Cannabis industry, is hiring a Graphic Designer, temporary to start with very likely potential to turn into a permanent, full-time opportunity. Working in the marketing department, this designer will get a chance to work on a large variety of creative projects from beginning to end. The Role: Assist, define and design for packaging in collaboration with agencies and suppliers Create brand marketing materials to support the business such as newsletter, event collateral, sell sheets, presentations, etc. Work in collaboration with the digital team to design key content for online such as social, web and email Bring best practices in design, branding, and digital design and stay on top of trends within the industry Participate, lead and shoot product photography or videos as required Edit, retouch and finesse images for packaging, digital and social assets Manage image and artwork database of inventory and assets Work collaboratively with cross collaborative departments and external vendors or suppliers Work on a number of projects and meet deadlines Requirements: A Degree in Design, Art or Advertising at college or university level A minimum of 2 years of professional work experience as a Graphic Designer Expert knowledge of Adobe Creative Suite and excellent sense of design and typography Technical experience with CMS (WordPress, etc.), Email Templates (MailChimp, etc) and hands on HTML, CSS and JavaScript is a desired asset Knowledge of UX/UI best practices, and experience with responsive design Ability to prepare working files for print and working directly with suppliers to ensure quality Excellent communication skills and proven ability to work collaboratively with a cross functional team in a fast-paced environment Experience working with set brand guidelines and ability to ensure accuracy and attention to detail A beautiful portfolio showcasing your range of design capabilities Apply today!
Title: Graphic Designer

Job_Description: We are currently looking for a Graphic Designer to join our design team and help us tackle a constant stream of projects - each one presenting its own unique challenges. As a design team member, you will help manage our brand identity and marketing materials while also assisting our developer teams with web and software application design. With endless opportunities to expand and apply your talents, strong communication skills, initiative and diligence will help you be successful in this role. Responsibilities: Designing and managing our corporate and product suite brand identities across print and digital media Taking ownership of brand identity and marketing design projects from conception to production, including interfacing with stakeholders and external suppliers Assisting fellow designers and developers in web and software application design from wireframes to UI mockups Providing status updates on your projects and being able to offer and receive constructive feedback during design critiques Delivering on commitments in a timely manner while working independently on your projects and as part of a small agile team supporting larger design initiatives  Required Skills & Experience: Post-secondary education in design (or equivalent) with a strong portfolio incorporating modern aesthetics Proficiency in Adobe Suite and other relevant design software (proficiency in Figma is a plus) Knowledge of HTML & CSS Strong layout abilities with keen attention to detail Current knowledge of design culture and industry trends The ability to switch gears quickly in response to changing company priorities Patience, diligence and curiosity to help you understand client needs Strong teamwork and relationship-building skills Inspired and incisive copywriting skills is considered an asset Knowledge or experience in Information/Data Visualization, User Experience (UX) design, User Interface (UI) design, or Human-Computer Interaction are huge assets  To work at Uncharted, you must be able to meet Security Clearance requirements and a Police Background Check.
