Title: Graphic Designer

Job_Description: Job Description  Ubisoft Saguenay est à votre recherche, vous les designers graphiques! Ubisoft Saguenay est le prochain chapitre dans la vie d’Ubisoft au Québec, avec une ouverture récente le 9 février 2018 à Chicoutimi. Ainsi, nous recherchons les pionniers passionnés qui assumeront les postes névralgiques de ce nouveau studio, dédié au développement de l’expertise online au sein d’Ubisoft. Lorsque vous vous joignez à Ubisoft, vous entrez dans une communauté de développeurs exceptionnels reliés par leur besoin d’innover, d’être créatifs, et de travailler avec les technologies de pointe. Vous découvrirez un monde où les employés bénéficient d’un avancement professionnel constant, d’un cadre d’apprentissage accueillant et de régimes de rémunération concurrentiels. Plus que tout, vous travaillerez sur un grand nombre de titres d’envergure et de grande qualité avec certains des plus grands talents de l’industrie, en collaboration avec les studios canadiens d’Ubisoft. Joignez-vous à l’aventure! ﻿Sommaire du poste :  Le titulaire de ce poste est responsable d’élaborer et de mettre en place de nouvelles expériences d'interfaces utilisateurs au moyen de la création d'éléments graphiques et de prototypes graphiques animés.  Responsabilités :  Les fonctions principales et habituelles de cet emploi sont :  PRE-PRODUCTION  Création de captures d’écran, assurer l’ensemble de la navigation et de l’expérience utilisateur Création d’interfaces (« wireframe, mockups, animatics ») Prototypage : Mettre en place des solutions d’utilisabilité rapidement dans l’engin ou dans tout autre logiciel de prototypage (Flash, Pencil, FluidUI, etc) Élaborer la signature visuelle des éléments d’interface: Objets intéractifs, « layout styleGuide », animation, et signature visuelle FX  PRODUCTION Réalisation/Production grahique : Créer des éléments d’interface d’excellente qualité graphique (à l’aide de Photoshop, Illustrator, 3DSMax, etc) Animation : Créer des animations sur timeline d’un engin donné (de propriétés, de transform, gestion d’états, etc Optimisation; import/export d’éléments graphiques optimaux pour un engin donné, demeurer créatif et efficace selon les limitations techniques (compression graphique, nine-slice 2D, coloration dans l’engin en addition et multiplication, etc…) Implémentation; connaissance du processus d’intégration général des engins de jeux (import de textures et création d’Atlas, instances « d’assets et components, build process et changelists », etc…) Qualifications  Formation :  AEC en design graphique et multimédia ou toutes autres formations équivalentes.  Expérience pertinente :  Minimum de 3 à 5 ans d’expérience reconnue dans la conception d’interfaces utilisateurs innovantes et intuitives.  Habiletés et connaissances : Comprendre et respecter les lignes directrices créatives de la marque et du projet Être créatif et réactif dans la recherche de solutions pour obtenir un UX de haute qualité Être flexible au changement et vigilant dans le maintien de l’homogénéité du UX Être en mesure de faire de la planification de développement multi-plateformes Connaissance du processus de développement d’un jeu vidéo, liens avec les différents corps de métier et étapes de production UI Connaissance des principes de base (« build, data, engin ») Connaissance en ergonomie/expérience navigation Expérience en production graphique 2D/3D de qualité (photoshop, Illustrator, 3DS Max) Connaissance du marché du jeu vidéo Connaissance technique/graphique d’un engin de jeu (compression, alpha et channels, Atlas) Connaissance des principes d’optimisation et de réutilisation « Scripts, components, Debugs Additional Information  null
Title: Designer graphique

Job_Description: MANDATE  The Web and Graphic Designer Specialist, Employee Technology Experience and Communication (ETEC) is accountable to the ETEC team and the Enterprise Technology Employee Experience (ETEE) organization in helping technology deliver a great employee and customer experience. They bring a variety of capabilities to enable and support a range of technology projects, services & initiatives and behalf of all employees for the best technology experience.  The Web and Graphic Designer Specialist provides subject matter expertise that balances technical skill with design capability across a range of work types. They support clear and compelling communication across the enterprise by designing, developing and delivering artifacts that are engaging, functional and visually beautiful. They also continually strive and advocate to ensure that all deliverables are fully accessible for all BMO employees.  The Web and Graphic Designer Specialist is: Technical: Expert level knowledge of the key Web/Graphics tools and technologies used at BMO and a view of other industry-leading ones that should be considered Artistic: Strong visual aesthetic and design capability with a passion to create beautiful work that is functional and displays a high level of polish Adaptable: Comfortable navigating a fast-moving environment that includes regular technological/organizational changes and emerging priorities A problem solver who is comfortable working with a variety of stakeholders from within their functional team and beyond – often who do not have strong background in graphic or web design An effective and professional communicator across a range of organizational levels, ability to present/facilitate iterative discussion on complex ideas in order to identify key design requirements and criteria and to synthesize these into wireframes and prototypes An individual with strong verbal and written communication skills. Ability to draft, design (sometimes in partnership with other ETEC SMEs) and deliver quality content  Key Accountabilities Maintain and (in concert with various stakeholders) develop web portals within BMO environment Contribute to online, email and in-hand employee communications (banners, posters, backgrounds etc.) Convert employee communications into engaging designs, produce creative presentations Support ‘centre of excellence’ for web and graphics design with ETEE group Qualifications Core Knowledge and Skills: University degree or college diploma in Graphic/Web Design 3-5 years of work experience as a Web Designer Excellent working knowledge of Dreamweaver, Illustrator, Photoshop, InDesign, Word, PowerPoint. Experience with SharePoint 2013 Proficient with HTML coding and experience with HTML5, proficient with CSS. Familiar with JavaScript programming and JQuery Knowledge of cross-browser web authoring standards, and the challenges in cross-browser compatibility Knowledge of best practices around UI/UX design and Understanding of working with corporate brands, physical and digital design guidelines Ability to work with limited supervision, Is able to work autonomously within a remote team Self-starter, reliable, team player, detail oriented, ability to multi-task, organized, and work in a fast-paced, constantly changing environment We’re here to help  At BMO we have a shared purpose; we put the customer at the centre of everything we do – helping people is in our DNA. For 200 years we have thought about the future—the future of our customers, our communities and our people. We help our customers and our communities by working together, innovating and pushing boundaries to bring them our very best every day. Together we’re changing the way people think about a bank.  As a member of the BMO team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. We strive to help you make an impact from day one – for yourself and our customers. We’ll support you with the tools and resources you need to reach new milestones, as you help our customers reach theirs. From in-depth training and coaching, to manager support and network-building opportunities, we’ll help you gain valuable experience, and broaden your skillset.  To find out more visit us at https://bmocareers.com .  BMO is committed to an inclusive, equitable and accessible workplace. By learning from each other’s differences, we gain strength through our people and our perspectives. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. Job  Information Technology Primary Location  Canada-Ontario-Toronto Organisation  Technology-X000068 Schedule  full-time Job Posting  05/16/18 Unposting Date  05/23/18
Title: Web and Graphic Designer Specialist

Job_Description: User Experience Designer Montreal, QC The Challenge  Us LVL’ers share an ambitious goal: to reinvent how consumers enjoy digital entertainment – from the way one discovers and watches TV shows and movies, to the way one unearths and listens to music, plays online games and more! Critical to our success is having the ability to fully comprehend and relate to consumer needs and behaviours so that we can ensure that every product experience we design meets both our clients’ and consumers’ expectations. This is where you come in! We’re seeking an experienced UX designer to research, map out, create and improve product experiences for a variety of mandates. The Team  Reporting to our Creative Director, you will be a member of LVL’s Creative Department – a lively team of experienced UI and UX Designers that are as creative as they are committed to designing leading solutions and experiences. You will also have opportunities to collaborate with some of our developers, depending on the mandate at hand! The Role  You will draw upon your full range of design skills, including product and interaction design, to create awesome experiences enjoyed by millions of consumers! In other words, you will be responsible for…  Conducting research and analysis Developing product strategies for various clients Developing information architecture Wireframing Prototyping Providing UX documentation to our Dev team The Profile  You have a minimum of 3 years of interaction design experience related to consumer apps You are able to define a product design strategy based on a list of requirements and constraints You know when to rely on competitive analysis, user research and testing, user journeys, wireframes, information architecture and other UX tools You can quickly grasp business requirements and user insights You have prototyping experience You have the foresight required to identify the various stages of product develop, from minimum viable product to maximally buyable product You see the “big picture” and have the ability to write and fight for innovative concepts You are passionate about new developments and trends in technology and this curiosity is what colours your proposals You have an eye for aesthetic In other words, you are creative, independent, meticulous and professional. You are considered an asset to any team and have no trouble planning and managing priorities while working under pressure.  The Nice-To-Haves  You are familiar with TV app design You are familiar with the Service Design approach You understand the benefits and complexities of interactive media Sound Like You? Apply Now!  If you're creative, motivated and have a genuine interest in contributing to the advancement of media and entertainment technology, you could be the perfect fit!  If you’re interested in this position but do not meet all of the requirements, we’d still love to hear from you. In addition to your résumé, make sure to send us a letter detailing why you think you’d excel in this position to careers@lvlstudio.com.  Don't forget to follow us on LinkedIn and Facebook to stay up to date on any new LVL job opportunities!  Why Join LVL Studio?  Located in Montreal’s vibrant AI hub, LVL prides itself on fostering a friendly and dynamic working environment where innovation is at the heart of everything we do.  Join LVL and find your place within our team of expert strategists, designers and software engineers who provide major media and entertainment companies with the tools required to better reach, engage and retain audiences. From powerful entertainment platforms to leading products and services, our solutions make their way into the hands of millions of people, allowing our clients to refine the content discovery and consumption experiences they offer based on consumer trends and needs.  Check out our project portfolio  Apply to careers@lvlstudio.com
Title: User Experience Designer

Job_Description: Job Description  Le ou la designer UI devra assurer la conception et la production pour des maquettes visuelles déclinées sur plusieurs plateformes. Participer aux ateliers de développement de concepts ; Comprendre et appliquer un guide de normes graphiques à travers différentes plateformes et médias ; Assurer la mise en place de la direction artistique des projets sur plusieurs plateformes ; Créer des prototypes fixes et animés ; Travailler de concert avec : directeur artistique, rédacteur et designer UX Coordonner le travail avec le front-end ; Veiller à la qualité du produit fini ; Présenter les concepts et les maquettes aux clients ; Assurer une veille permanente des nouvelles pratiques et outils disponibles. Qualifications   Études dans une discipline pertinente au design ; Avoir un minimum de 3 ans d’expérience ; Solide portfolio démontrant vos talents en design d’interfaces ; Passion et maîtrise des outils de design (Sketch, Flinto, Principle, InVision, Adobe, etc.) ; Passion et maîtrise de création de design system ; Capacité à produire des prototypes complexes ; Bonnes notions de motion design appliqué au numérique ; Connaissance des technologies et langages front-end Capable de transmettre ses idées aux développeurs ; Maîtrise du français et de l’anglais, tant à l’oral qu’à l’écrit; Un poste idéal pour ceux qui possèdent: Geek : fort intérêt pour tout ce qui est numérique Trendsetter : être au courant des nouveaux outils et savoir les apprendre rapidement Qualité : produire des maquettes et prototypes qui se démarquent avec un souci du détail, de la rigueur et minutie Joueur d’équipe : la collaboration ça va juste de soi Efficace : réfléchir et prendre les bonnes décisions rapidement Organisation : livrer ses projets dans les temps Humain : s’intégrer tout naturellement dans l’équipe  Additional Information  Tu vas aimer: Notre esprit de famille Notre localisation en plein centre-ville, animé par le quartier des spectacles Notre collaboration entre les bureaux internationaux et la possibilité d’y aller Notre équipe dynamique, diversifiée et tournée vers l’innovation Nos horaires d’été, le télétravail et les horaires flexibles Nos activités sociales organisées par le comité l’fun Nos avantages sociaux compétitifs
Title: Designer UI

Job_Description: Job Description Change the world at IBM. There aren’t many companies who can say they have been an integral part of the global business landscape for more than a century. While the world has changed considerably over the past 100 years, IBM, our people and our offerings have continuously led the way with business and technology innovation.  Today, we are more than a hardware, software and services provider, yet we remain true to our heritage as a team of collaborative forward-thinkers, focused on making business and society work better. We are part of the fabric of everyday life and stand for world-changing progress.  Join a company where you can make an impact and literally change the world. With so many different opportunities available – the sky is the limit!   This position resides in Ottawa, Ontario and is a 4 (co-op) month work term commencing September 2018 . It is mandatory that all applicants are enrolled in full-time studies at a post-secondary institution and returning to full-time studies upon completion of the work term.  What IBM Offers You?  Work directly on product and services that affect our clients, while having access to cutting edge software technology Work on projects which are challenging, innovative and rewarding A business casual dress code and flexible work hours, to ensure work-life balance Access to the Future Blue Community - IBM’s large student community that provides networking opportunities, sporting and social events.  It is a mandatory requirement for students to apply online at www.ibm.com/jobs  Closing Date: Open Until Filled  Job description for the UX/UI Designer is: Brainstorm and collaborate with some of IBM’s brightest minds comprising of designers, developers and product managers Demonstrate a clear pride of ownership by communicating design strategies to assist with product development and goals Iterate quickly and actively participate in an agile development process within the team to incorporate new concepts and test designs Create wireframe and interaction prototypes using hi and low fidelity design tools Understand how to focus on a job, yet still remember to have fun  Required Technical and Professional Expertise  Co-op or internship program enrollment is mandatory Knowledge and experience with interactive design domain Demonstrated abilities in a number of UX wireframe and prototyping design tools such as (but not limited to) InVision, Sketch, Axure, and Adobe Creative Suite Exceptional verbal, visual and written communication skills to articulate UX logic and reasoning across disciplines Ability to collaborate with a team of designers and work well with cross-functional teams Must be highly motivated and enjoy working in a fluid and agile environment with fast approaching release dates Portfolio (School OK) with work samples and stories  Preferred Tech and Prof Experience  Familiarity with the interactive design process Experience with research methodologies, creating personas, user scenario flows, usability testing, task analysis and information architecture Appreciation of the user’s experience when interacting with software Ability to collaborate within a multi-disciplinary team  EO Statement IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.
Title: UX/UI Designer - Coop (Ottawa, ON)

Job_Description: ROLES DESCRIPTION We're looking for 4 different types of roles: - UX Team Leader - UX Designer - UI Team Leader - UI Designer All of them will work for a specific client: a Canadian multinational banking and financial services corporation. The scope of work covers existing and new projects of the Bank across different products and needs. The team will be composed by designers, product managers, developers and business SMEs. The minimum duration of this position is 6 months. Roles’ details, according to the case at hand (UI or UX): Work closely with different stakeholders on the research, specification, prototyping, and implementation of designs and ideas. Support the visual design team to become best in class, inspiring them with fresh ideas, tools and approaches. Create UX flows that transform complex problems into easy steps. Produce pixel-perfect mockups and layouts that developers can use to style finished projects. Passion for mentoring and coaching others. Previous experience with supporting professional development of team. Coordination and integration on remote teams. MAIN REQUIREMENTS Fluency in English Good communication skills and the ability to pitch your ideas confidently Great online portfolio that exhibits expertise in visual & interaction design, UI/UX, and applications Mastery of visual design (type, color theory, etc) High level of skill with design software (Sketch, InVision required) Passion for designing products with simple and intuitive experiences Able to cultivate a culture of transparency, communicating effectively across the project and wider team Enjoy collaborating across the team, from UX to developers and business development Interest and knowledge by the finance industry Ability to travel to Canada WHERE Toronto for the Team Leaders Remote/Toronto for the Designers (once every month for 2-3 days) ABOUT TORONTO, CANADA Toronto, capital city of Ontario, is the biggest Canadian city. A striving multicultural community and a strong cultural, artistic, and historical foundation make it one of the most cosmopolitan cities in the world where everyone is respected and cherished. Toronto is the home of TSE (Toronto Stock Exchange) and the 5 biggest Canadian banks. Situated on the shore of lake Ontario it’s in close proximity to the United States. With a vibrant downtown scene with many cuisines, bars, museums, theatres, and sports arenas, Toronto makes up for a good city to enjoy life and work.
Title: UX & UI Designers

Job_Description: What you'll do: Primary user research when needed to validate use cases and user needs. Create user flows, wireframe, high-fidelity mockups and prototype using tools like Sketch and InVision. Collaborate with product manager to continuously improve UX and UI of Tulip apps. Oversee implementation of the designs by working closely with the development team. Gather feedback from end users by conducting / participating in usability studies and user interviews. Keep up-to-date on mobile design trends, sharing leading practices with our teams and our clients. Help building and improving tulip UI library and interaction design patterns. What you have: 3+ years of hands-on product design experience Proven experience in designing iOS applications Ability to review and adhere to technical documents and brand guidelines, respectfully challenging when there's a better way Ability to be versatile and take both leading and supporting roles Extremely detail and process oriented The ability to write and present eloquently and communicate clearly Proficient in using Sketch to design wireframes and high-fidelity mockups for web and iOS devices. Proficient in building prototype using Invision. Excellent visual design skills, typography, layout, colour, and photography usage Bonus Skills! Knowledge of HTML and CSS Expertise with Apple Human Interface Guidelines Experience in UI interaction and animation design We offer: An environment passionate about growth and learning Flexible hours for our early risers and night owls Medical and Dental Insurance Paid parental leave Paid sick days 15 days of paid vacation Corporate gym rate Weekly team lunches with halal and vegetarian options Healthy (and less healthy) snacks and gourmet espresso Breathtaking Toronto office on the waterfront and close to Union station Creative community space in our Communitech home in Kitchener What we do: Tulip Retail is the first mobile platform built exclusively for store associates. Leading retailers like Saks Fifth Avenue, Coach, and Chanel believe in enabling the next generation of store associates with mobile technology using Tulip. We’re a team of experts who have worked with and for retailers over the past 20 years and are driven to build a company whose mission is to enable one of the world’s largest job markets. By placing Tulip-enabled iPads into the hands of associates, our goal is to provide them with instant and reliable access to product information while also being able to transact, communicate, and collaborate in an omnichannel world.  We encourage applications from candidates of colour, women, queer candidates, candidates with family caregiving responsibilities, immigrant candidates, transgender candidates, and candidates with disabilities.  Feel like you can’t tick all the boxes above? If you have some of the skills and experience that we’re looking for and are willing to use your talent to learn the rest, we encourage you to apply.
Title: Product Designer

Title: UI/UX Designer

Job_Description: About the Company: VASCO is a global leader in delivering trust and business productivity solutions to the digital market. VASCO develops next generation technologies that enable more than 10,000 customers in 100 countries in financial, enterprise, government, health care and other segments to achieve their digital agenda, deliver an enhanced customer experience and meet regulatory requirements. More than half of the top 100 global banks rely on VASCO® solutions to protect their online, mobile and ATM channels. VASCO’s solutions combine to form a powerful trust platform that empowers businesses by incorporating identity, fraud prevention, electronic signatures, mobile application protection and risk analysis.  Summary: If you are an analytical, methodical, and creative person, equally left and right brained, if you live, dream, and breathe to design great user experiences then you are the one we need. The UI/UX Lead will drive and define standards and guidelines, research, information architecture, interaction and visual design efforts across the company to create interactive solutions that aim to deliver unique customer experiences, achieved with high performance user interfaces, that always take into account both business objectives and the user’s point of view. You will work very closely with product management, R&D;, and other functions who are all equally passionate about delighting our customers and users with great products and experiences.  Key responsibilities and duties:  A portfolio and work samples that proves interaction and visual design: from concept generation to use case-definition, from interaction model definition to user flow and design specs Ability to illustrate and communicate design concepts using a variety of techniques and formats: interactive prototypes, storyboards, sketches, videos, animations, and photography. Lead research such as heuristics, focus groups, analytics, benchmark, field study and usability testing Excellent verbal and written communication skills, fluent in English  Qualifications:  Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience 10 years of professional experience in UI and UX design Experience defining UI/UX standards and guidelines across multiple product lines. Stays up to date with the latest industry trends Experience leading and driving design projects, leading junior designers. Equally comfortable leading design efforts and being hands-on Experience shipping solutions geared towards business users, technical administrators, and consumers  Why VASCO: We offer unlimited potential with a leader in delivering trust and business productivity solutions. VASCO offers the ideal setting for ambitious professionals looking for more than just a job. Our international team is comprised of dedicated and resourceful people who are building an incredible success story in the digital world. We offer a competitive compensation and benefits packages including health, dental, vision, life, AD&D;, short-term, and long-term disability insurances, tuition reimbursement, company contribution on 401(K), Employee Assistance Program, free use of onsite fitness center in some locations, and a casual work environment among other benefits. If you are an ambitious professional who is looking to help push VASCO to the next level, we would be interested in hearing from you.
Title: Lead UX/UI Designer

Job_Description: Catallaxy is looking for a UX/designer who can create beautiful websites and intuitive interfaces for blockchain applications and education materials. You should be able to build an engaging website from sketches to html.  You will work directly with the Head of Product and the Lead Developer.  Job Location : Montreal, Quebec, Canada  Job type : Part Time, starting immediately  Requirements : strong design skills strong UX skills html, css (and/or css preprocessor like LESS, SASS, etc) experience with javascript experience with react.js or willingness to learn excellent communication skills (in English and/or French) understanding of mobile/responsive design good understanding of best practices for mobile design and web apps ability to teach complex concepts in simple terms results-oriented good sense of esthetic attention to detail love for clean and elegant web applications  Bonus: interest in blockchain technologies like bitcoin git you've tried storybook.js or similar tool familiarity with i18n and a11y marketing attitude  When applying, please include a link to your porfolio (or equivalent).  About Catallaxy  With more than 15 Montreal-based experts and nearly 50 strategic partners worldwide, our service offering combines the technical expertise of the best core Blockchain talents and the strategic consulting power of Raymond Chabot Grant Thornton. Our objective is to prepare businesses for their blockchain transformation.  Catallaxy is also launching the Blockhouse. The Blockhouse is a unique innovation center bringing together the most influential players in the blockchain community. Strategically based in Montréal, the Blockhouse is a unique international showcase for decentralized and distributed technologies.
Title: UI/UX/Designer

Job_Description: Mission  We're on a mission to help Canadians achieve their financial goals.  Problem  Managing personal finances is complicated, confusing, time consuming and for many, inaccessible.  Solution  Mylo automatically rounds up your purchases and invests the spare change. Mylo also uses transactional data and artificial intelligence (AI) to provide personalized insights and recommendations to help you optimize your finances.  Helping tens of thousands of Canadians achieve their financial goals Acquired Tactex Asset Management Pitched on Dragons' Den Named Top Apps Made in Quebec by Journal de Montréal Featured as "Apps We Love" by Apple Featured in Globe & Mail, Financial Post, CBC, Les Affaires, Techvibes, etc. Raised a $2.65M seed from Desjardins, Ferst Capital Partners, and other great investors  We have fantastic investors and an amazing team, and we’re growing quickly. We’re looking for talented people to help us shape the next wave of innovation in financial services. If you enjoy working with talented folks, solving big problems and delighting users - come join us in helping Canadians achieve their financial goals.  Role  Your role is to design and deliver a world-class user experience to millions of Canadians.  You'll collaborate with Product, Marketing, Customer Success, etc., and are responsible for the design of the Mylo brand, visuals, website, web app and mobile apps.  Responsibilities  Conduct customer research / interviews via phone call, face-to-face interviews or in-app chat Design, develop and maintain design artifacts (brand guidelines, style guides, user journey, empathy maps, jobs-to-be-done, personas, etc.) Lead design sessions and sprints Sketch, build and validate designs and prototypes Identify and solve design issues Support marketing initiatives (website, visual content, email templates, participate in strategic / creative discussions, etc.)  Must-have  3+ years experience with a portfolio showcasing past work. An expert in design software Sketch (mainly), Illustrator and Photoshop An expert in prototyping software (i.e. InVision, Principle, etc.) Artistic ability: You are talented. You pump out great ideas quickly. Style: Your design is fun, friendly and has a lot of character. Research: You follow design trends and love to test-drive new apps. Inspiration: You know who / what inspires you. User-centered design: This is not a buzzword to you - it's what matters. Curiosity: Your favourite question when chatting with users is "Why?" Approach: You despise complexity - simple is beautiful. Conversationalist : You are a great listener and are deeply empathetic. Data: You understand the power of data, but understand its limitations. Scientific : You want to validate / invalidate your assumptions quickly. Self-aware: You recognize and plan for biases in the design process Patient: You don't always get it right. You reiterate until it is. Fun: You don't take yourself too seriously and can be a goof sometimes. Interest in startups . Interest in personal finance . Download and use Mylo to stay super close to the user experience.  Nice-to-have  Bilingual (English and French) Previous startup experience  What We Offer  Our open-concept offices at FCP FinTech Studio (dogs are welcome!) Awesome and comprehensive health benefits package Generous vacation policy as well as flexible work hours and location Support with continuing your skills development, developing your industry knowledge and achieving your career and personal development goals Team activities and get-togethers like our annual oyster shucking Christmas party A casual environment where you will work with smart and passionate people  We believe in being an equal opportunity employer and we celebrate diversity and differences of perspectives at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.
Title: Mylo - UI/UX Designer

Job_Description: We’re looking for a talented designer to join our Penticton Development Team!  At Windward Software we build software solutions that empower efficient business growth in small to medium businesses.From inventory control to payroll, and accounting, our solutions allow the entrepreneurs of today to grow their businesses for tomorrow.We have thousands of customers in 35 countries around the world processing over 1.5 billion in annual sales.We like to have fun while we also learn new skills and have several software development company awards to prove it. We are growing! Our solutions are moving to the cloud and we need a talented, creative UX/UI Designer to join our team.  You will learn to understand our business requirements and technical limitations, as well as be responsible for conceiving and conducting user research, interviews and surveys, and translating them into sitemaps, user flows, customer journey maps, wireframes, mock-ups and prototypes. The UX designer will also design the overall functionality of our software solutions.  Working with C-level execs, development team and others in a collaborative environment, your key responsibility is to ensure a functionally sound and amazing user experience. You are passionate about design and innovation and take pride in staying on top of design trends, ensuring the Windward Software customers’ user experience is second to none. We don’t expect you to code on the job, but having that skill and knowing enough about technology and Agile development will allow you to participate in meaningful discussions with the team. Responsibilities and Duties Working closely with Windward customers, C-level executives, development team and others, you will be responsible for the UX strategy which is the blueprint that will help drive development, visual design and ultimately the customer experience You will be creating information architecture by researching, conceiving, wireframing, sketching, prototyping, and mocking up user experiences for our Windward Software products Define how an application will look and work in different platforms and browsers Make strategic design and user-experience decisions related to core, and new, functions and features Work with the team to shape a project’s overall creative output and maintain quality Introduce, support and encourage compliance with UX/UI best practices 2 years’ experience in UX development, preferably within an Agile team environment Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science is required.Formal education in the fields of Visual Design, Communications, or Psychology are also beneficial Expertise in standard UX software such as InVision , Axure, UXPin, Balsamiq, OmniGraffle and the like is a must Big picture thinker, creative with strong collaborative and communication skills Able to build low/high fidelity mock-ups for Web and Mobile applications Passionate about resolving user pain points through highly functional, visually appealing, design Known for your keen attention to detail and skills in typography, iconography, visual design principles, readability, and legibility You love brainstorming and have a good nerf shot! Demonstrated knowledge of responsive design principles, user interaction design and experience and posses a clear understanding of the importance of user-centered design Basic HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript skills are a plus Ability to work effectively in a team setting including synthesizing abstract ideas into concrete design implications Proven ability to regularly deliver design solutions for approval in a timely manner Ability to rapidly produce multiple visual UI/UX concepts for comparison and prototyping  Qualifications and Skills  2 years’ experience in UX development, preferably within an Agile team environment Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science is required.Formal education in the fields of Visual Design, Communications, or Psychology are also beneficial. Expertise in standard UX software such as InVision , Axure, UXPin, Balsamiq, OmniGraffle and the like is a must Big picture thinker, creative with strong collaborative and communication skills Able to build low/high fidelity mock-ups for Web and Mobile applications Passionate about resolving user pain points through highly functional, visually appealing, design Known for your keen attention to detail and skills in typography, iconography, visual design principles, readability, and legibility You love brainstorming and can aim a nerf cannon like it's an extension of yourself Demonstrated knowledge of responsive design principles, user interaction design and experience and posses a clear understanding of the importance of user-centered design Basic HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript skills are a plus Ability to work effectively in a team setting including synthesizing abstract ideas into concrete design implications Proven ability to regularly deliver design solutions for approval in a timely manner Ability to rapidly produce multiple visual UI/UX concepts for comparison and prototyping We offer: A comprehensive benefit package.Lakes, beaches, wineries – all in our backyard! Take your lunch break at beautiful Skaha Beach – literally just a block away.We have a huge staff lounge area with gym equipment, pool table and showers on-site.Tickets for events at the South Okanagan Events Centre (SOEC).Social activities such as golf tournaments, holiday festivities, etc. Please note: If you are selected for an interview, please prepare and bring a portfolio of your work that demonstrates your creative design skills, along with completed or work-in-progress examples.  Interested?  Send your details to careers@windwardsoftware.com and don’t forget a cover letter! While we appreciate all interest, only those selected for further discussion will be contacted. Thank you.
Title: UX/UI Designer

Job_Description: This is not your average UX/UI Designer role. From mobile applications to AR/VR, Artificial Intelligence, home robots, and IoT products, this is your opportunity to make a difference and see your designs impact millions of people around the globe. We are seeking an enthusiastic, creative, driven, and energetic UX/UI Designer to join our award-winning team in Port Coquitlam, BC.  As a UX/UI Designer at Finger Food, you will have the opportunity to embody true ownership in your work. Collaborate with diverse teams on numerous projects and help design and solve problems across multiple industries. In the past few years we have been the featured keynotes showcased at Google I/O, Microsoft Build and Apple's WWDC.  Responsibilities: Develop UX wireframes, flows and interactive prototypes Collaborate closely with key stakeholders and members of our design team and deliver visual treatment specifications for the user interface Ability to work in a fast-paced and sometimes ambiguous environment Collaborate on user experience planning and usability research Design products through their entire lifecycle while maintaining deadlines Research and design new user experiences based on product requirements Develop human-centric design that is intuitive, usable, and delightful Take projects through from concept to deliverable with a high level of craft and polish  Qualifications: A strong portfolio demonstrating graphic design principles and technical expertise  At least 2 years of relevant experience exclusively in a UI/UX Design role  Proficient in AE, Flinto, or Framer animations Experience designing interfaces for physical product outside of mobile web and desktop Proficient in Adobe Creative Suite and Sketch Ability to communicate technical concepts to technical and non-technical audiences at various levels of the organization Capable of translating designs across all devices and screen sizes Able to translate complex information into user-friendly designs Provide creative solutions consistent with industry trends, demonstrating ability to problem-solve Pixel-perfect layouts with a strong sense of colour theory and typography Have a clean, timeless, and focused visual design style  Nice-to-Haves: AR / VR Experience Proficient in 3D Modelling  To Apply  All candidates must be willing and able to work onsite. Please ensure that you are eligible to work in Canada prior to sending your application. Please submit your resume to uxuidesigner@fingerfoodstudios.com including your first & last name as the subject. We thank all applicants for their interest, however, regret to inform only short-listed candidates will be contacted.
Title: UX/UI Designer

Job_Description: About [24]7 [24]7 is redefining the way companies interact with consumers. Using artificial intelligence and machine learning to understand consumer intent, [24]7’s technology helps companies create a personalized, predictive and effortless customer experience across all channels. The world’s largest and most recognizable brands are using intent-driven engagement from [24]7 to assist several hundred million visitors annually, through more than 1.5 billion conversations, most of which are automated. The result is an order of magnitude improvement in digital adoption, customer satisfaction, and revenue growth. For more information, visit: http://www.247-inc.com. The role of UX/UI Designer The UI/UX Designer is a key role to realize the mission of Technical Product Marketing which is to show the value of the [24]7.ai product portfolio by delivering demos that showcase our products and unique differentiators. You will work with a wide range of functions including Product Marketing, Sales, Product Management, Creative, and Web Marketing. We are looking for a UI/UX Designer with a solid design/web background and a standout portfolio of work who will: Develop stories and build demos to depict consumer and user journeys that let customers easily see how [24]7.ai brings effective solutions to their digital presence. Plan and lead projects accounting for requirements from Marketing and Sales, and coordinate delivery of information and content from multiple teams. Act as a critical member of our technical marketing organization, bringing [24]7.ai products to life through journeys demonstrating key features and measurable benefits. Design and build video clips of new products and product features, showcasing the advancement in our technology. Make demos simple to learn and deliver to customers through their design and scripting.  Qualifications and requirements: 7+ years of experience designing for brand and marketing. Display a positive and collaborative attitude. Skilled at presenting ideas to colleagues of all levels. Provide strategic insight. Solid skills in design tools, including: Illustrator, InDesign, Photoshop, Sketch, After Effects, and PowerPoint. A strong portfolio that demonstrates thoughtful design approach, creative visual concepts, and confident storytelling skills. Ability to craft impactful visual assets and narratives. Outstanding attention to detail. Ability to communicate and work collaboratively with people across the global organization. Thrive on working with tight deadlines across a variety of functional teams in a fast-moving dynamic setting; juggle multiple tasks and projects All candidates should include a link to their online portfolios or PDFs with samples of their digital work and resumes #LI-SP1
Title: UX/UI Designer - Technical Marketing

Job_Description: Nous valorisons la diversité et avons à cœur de créer un milieu de travail inclusif qui nous inspire tous à donner le meilleur de nous-mêmes. Joignez-vous à notre équipe et faites une différence!  Votre poste  Nous Comment imaginez-vous les bureaux d’une compagnie d’assurance? Et l’atmosphère de travail qui y règne? Nous gageons que si vous passez nous voir au Lab de Intact, vous serez très surpris! Situé au centre-ville de Montréal, nous sommes un laboratoire d’innovation dont la mission est de créer des produits à la fine-pointe de l’insurtech qui améliorent la vie de millions de Canadiens.  Mariant la convivialité et la vélocité d’une startup aux ressources et aux moyens d’une grande entreprise (vous disposerez de tous les outils dont vous avez toujours rêvé!), le Lab est un environnement jeune et dynamique, offrant des défis stimulants, des collègues inspirants et une carrière passionnante (chez un des top 100 employeurs au Canada). C’est l’endroit idéal pour parfaire vos compétences et faire évoluer votre carrière.  Vous Vous êtes passionné par le commerce électronique et l’innovation numérique? Vous avez un talent particulier pour traduire des exigences complexes en expériences utiles et agréables? Vous restez à l’affût des dernières tendances en matière de design et vous aimez expérimenter de nouveaux outils et de nouvelles méthodologies? Nous avons l’occasion parfaite pour vous!  Rôle À titre de designer UX/UI, vous jouerez un rôle essentiel dans la conception et l’évolution de notre écosystème numérique. Relevant du directeur principal, Innovations numériques, vous aurez comme principales responsabilités :  Concevoir des expériences captivantes en vue de réaliser les objectifs d’affaires  Valider la fonctionnalité et l’utilité par l’entremise de tests et de recherches auprès des utilisateurs  Produire des livrables UX et design pertinents au besoin  Piloter une feuille de route aux côté d’un directeur de produit et d’une équipe agile multidisciplinaire  Présenter le travail aux parties prenantes  Aider les ingénieurs à produire des interfaces de qualité et agréables  Prôner une conception axée sur l’utilisateur et les données  Vos compétences  Minimum trois années d’expérience  Expertise en matière de convivialité et de pratiques de conception centrées sur l'utilisateur  Maîtrise des outils de conception (Sketch, Axure, InVision, Illustrator, etc.)  Expérience des outils de recherche UX (usertesting.com, Optimal Workshop, etc.) un atout  Expérience dans la production de flux de processus, d’inventaires de contenu, etc.  Vous aimez travailler dans un environnement de collaboration qui accorde une importance primordiale au travail d’équipe, à l’innovation, à l’ouverture d’esprit et au plaisir  Veuillez inclure votre portfolio dans votre dossier de candidature.  Vous êtes  Une personne avec qui il est agréable de travailler  Créatif, analytique, curieux et ingénieux  Un joueur d’équipe capable de partager et recevoir des commentaires constructifs  Excellent pour expliquer vos idées à différents intervenants  Profondément passionné par le design et la qualité  Organisé et proactif  En tant que salarié temps plein, vous bénéficierez des avantages suivants :  Un salaire compétitif  Un boni de performance annuel  Un régime de retraite  Un horaire de travail flexible de 35 heures par semaine  Des assurances médicales et dentaires hors pair  Et plusieurs autres avantages et bénéfices (remboursement gym, conférences, etc.)  Énoncé fermeture  Cette opportunité vous intéresse? Nous avons très hâte de faire votre connaissance!  D’excellents avantages sont offerts : salaire concurrentiel, avantages flexibles, aménagements de travail flexibles, congés mobiles, régime de retraite à prestation déterminée, etc.  Dans le cadre du processus de sélection d’Intact, les candidats peuvent être appelés à donner leur consentement à une vérification de leurs antécédents pertinente au poste à pourvoir avant de recevoir une offre d’emploi. Celle-ci peut comprendre une confirmation des références d’emploi, des études et des titres de compétences, une vérification des emplois, de l’identité, des infractions criminelles et du permis de conduire ainsi qu’un rapport de crédit.  Vous pouvez soumettre votre candidature à un emploi affiché pourvu que vous occupiez vos fonctions actuelles depuis au moins douze mois et que votre performance soit jugée bonne ou que votre contrat temporaire arrive à son échéance. Une recherche de talents à l'externe est menée parallèlement au recrutement à l'interne Veuillez donc prendre note que des candidats potentiels pourraient avoir été identifiés pour ce poste dans le cadre de leur plan de développement.   Veuillez noter que l'usage du masculin a comme but d'alléger le texte.  Cet affichage prendra fin 02 juin 2018.  Prime de recommandation  CE POSTE EST SUJET À UNE PRIME DE RECOMMANDATION DE 3000$.  #li-qc  Droit de travailler au Canada  Les personnes qui posent leur candidature à un poste permanent doivent, dès leur embauche, avoir le droit de travailler au Canada de façon permanente. Les documents pouvant servir de preuve dans le cas des rôles permanents sont un certificat de naissance canadien, un passeport canadien, un certificat de citoyenneté canadienne, une carte de résident permanent ou une confirmation de son statut de résident permanent pour prouver qu’il a le droit de travailler au Canada.  Indeed Commandité  IN-INFR
Title: Designer UX/UI

Job_Description: Position Overview: The role of the web UX & UI designer & developer is to create the user experience vision and successfully develop, monitor and improve users’ overall experience when they visit our websites. The individual should have the skills and knowledge to create memorable experiences that are true to the brand while balancing seamless interactivity, ease of navigation and conversion.Reporting to the Director, Marketing & Communications, the Web UX& UI Designerwill be the champion of the users’ needs, and create intuitive user experiences and interface designs. The role will be responsible for the end-to-end online construction, maintenance and experience for: TPH.ca, RHGroup.ca, RGStore.ca, TheGlobeRestaurant.ca, the Intranet, and others as required.The UX & UI Designer will create wireframes and storyboards that map the customer journey, user flows, process flows, information architecture, site maps, porotypes and A/B testing to effectively communicate
