Job_Description: Join Windsor's most innovative, fun and Silicon-Valley-esque development and innovation company, bringing world-class projects to Windsor. Help us build exciting technology like multiplayer game servers for Atari, social apps for Puma, high profile analytics engines for The PGA Tour, and cutting edge products like natural-language-processing chat-bots.As one of Windsor's most sought-after companies to work for, we offer flexible time, work-at-home days, a great benefits plan and in-office massage. We are located in the heart of Windsor's historic Walkerville. You must be willing to work in our office. We are not interested in off-shore or remote work.We are seeking talented interface designers who are looking to grow professionally and personally within a fast-growing company. You will work on a variety of marketing deliverables, including websites, prototypes, wireframes, business collateral and other design pieces.ResponsibilitiesWork on the design of user interfaces for web and mobile projectsAble to help with wireframing using tools like Adobe XD and BalsamiqAble to self-direct and work independently, to manage multiple, concurrent projects simultaneously from start to finishRequirements: Expertise in Adobe Creative Suite: Illustrator, Photoshop, InDesign, After Effects, EdgeKnowledge of responsive web designAbility to create interactive prototypesCustomer-obsessed, detail-oriented and comfortable working on highly technical teamsDemonstrated experience with building user interfaces across a range of platforms including desktop and mobile--- Please send examples of your design portfolio (specifically web design) when you apply. ---We look forward to meeting you!Job Type: Full-timeEducation:High school or equivalentLocation:Windsor, ON
Title: Web Designer / UI / UX

Job_Description: Nous valorisons la diversité et avons à cœur de créer un milieu de travail inclusif qui nous inspire tous à donner le meilleur de nous-mêmes. Joignez-vous à notre équipe et faites une différence!  Votre poste  Nous Comment imaginez-vous les bureaux d’une compagnie d’assurance? Et l’atmosphère de travail qui y règne? Nous gageons que si vous passez nous voir au Lab de Intact, vous serez très surpris! Situé au centre-ville de Montréal, nous sommes un laboratoire d’innovation dont la mission est de créer des produits à la fine-pointe de l’insurtech qui améliorent la vie de millions de Canadiens.  Mariant la convivialité et la vélocité d’une startup aux ressources et aux moyens d’une grande entreprise (vous disposerez de tous les outils dont vous avez toujours rêvé!), le Lab est un environnement jeune et dynamique, offrant des défis stimulants, des collègues inspirants et une carrière passionnante (chez un des top 100 employeurs au Canada). C’est l’endroit idéal pour parfaire vos compétences et faire évoluer votre carrière.  Vous Vous êtes passionné par le commerce électronique et l’innovation numérique? Vous avez un talent particulier pour traduire des exigences complexes en expériences utiles et agréables? Vous restez à l’affût des dernières tendances en matière de design et vous aimez expérimenter de nouveaux outils et de nouvelles méthodologies? Nous avons l’occasion parfaite pour vous!  Rôle À titre de designer UX/UI, vous jouerez un rôle essentiel dans la conception et l’évolution de notre écosystème numérique. Relevant du directeur principal, Innovations numériques, vous aurez comme principales responsabilités :  Concevoir des expériences captivantes en vue de réaliser les objectifs d’affaires  Valider la fonctionnalité et l’utilité par l’entremise de tests et de recherches auprès des utilisateurs  Produire des livrables UX et design pertinents au besoin  Piloter une feuille de route aux côté d’un directeur de produit et d’une équipe agile multidisciplinaire  Présenter le travail aux parties prenantes  Aider les ingénieurs à produire des interfaces de qualité et agréables  Prôner une conception axée sur l’utilisateur et les données  Vos compétences  Minimum trois années d’expérience  Expertise en matière de convivialité et de pratiques de conception centrées sur l'utilisateur  Maîtrise des outils de conception (Sketch, Axure, InVision, Illustrator, etc.)  Expérience des outils de recherche UX (usertesting.com, Optimal Workshop, etc.) un atout  Expérience dans la production de flux de processus, d’inventaires de contenu, etc.  Vous aimez travailler dans un environnement de collaboration qui accorde une importance primordiale au travail d’équipe, à l’innovation, à l’ouverture d’esprit et au plaisir  Veuillez inclure votre portfolio dans votre dossier de candidature.  Vous êtes  Une personne avec qui il est agréable de travailler  Créatif, analytique, curieux et ingénieux  Un joueur d’équipe capable de partager et recevoir des commentaires constructifs  Excellent pour expliquer vos idées à différents intervenants  Profondément passionné par le design et la qualité  Organisé et proactif  En tant que salarié temps plein, vous bénéficierez des avantages suivants :  Un salaire compétitif  Un boni de performance annuel  Un régime de retraite  Un horaire de travail flexible de 35 heures par semaine  Des assurances médicales et dentaires hors pair  Et plusieurs autres avantages et bénéfices (remboursement gym, conférences, etc.)  Énoncé fermeture  Cette opportunité vous intéresse? Nous avons très hâte de faire votre connaissance!  D’excellents avantages sont offerts : salaire concurrentiel, avantages flexibles, aménagements de travail flexibles, congés mobiles, régime de retraite à prestation déterminée, etc.  Dans le cadre du processus de sélection d’Intact, les candidats peuvent être appelés à donner leur consentement à une vérification de leurs antécédents pertinente au poste à pourvoir avant de recevoir une offre d’emploi. Celle-ci peut comprendre une confirmation des références d’emploi, des études et des titres de compétences, une vérification des emplois, de l’identité, des infractions criminelles et du permis de conduire ainsi qu’un rapport de crédit.  Vous pouvez soumettre votre candidature à un emploi affiché pourvu que vous occupiez vos fonctions actuelles depuis au moins douze mois et que votre performance soit jugée bonne ou que votre contrat temporaire arrive à son échéance. Une recherche de talents à l'externe est menée parallèlement au recrutement à l'interne Veuillez donc prendre note que des candidats potentiels pourraient avoir été identifiés pour ce poste dans le cadre de leur plan de développement.   Veuillez noter que l'usage du masculin a comme but d'alléger le texte.  Cet affichage prendra fin 02 juin 2018.  Prime de recommandation  CE POSTE EST SUJET À UNE PRIME DE RECOMMANDATION DE 3000$.  #li-qc  Droit de travailler au Canada  Les personnes qui posent leur candidature à un poste permanent doivent, dès leur embauche, avoir le droit de travailler au Canada de façon permanente. Les documents pouvant servir de preuve dans le cas des rôles permanents sont un certificat de naissance canadien, un passeport canadien, un certificat de citoyenneté canadienne, une carte de résident permanent ou une confirmation de son statut de résident permanent pour prouver qu’il a le droit de travailler au Canada.  Indeed Commandité  IN-INFR
Title: Designer UX/UI

Job_Description: About [24]7 [24]7 is redefining the way companies interact with consumers. Using artificial intelligence and machine learning to understand consumer intent, [24]7’s technology helps companies create a personalized, predictive and effortless customer experience across all channels. The world’s largest and most recognizable brands are using intent-driven engagement from [24]7 to assist several hundred million visitors annually, through more than 1.5 billion conversations, most of which are automated. The result is an order of magnitude improvement in digital adoption, customer satisfaction, and revenue growth. For more information, visit: http://www.247-inc.com. The role of UX/UI Designer The UI/UX Designer is a key role to realize the mission of Technical Product Marketing which is to show the value of the [24]7.ai product portfolio by delivering demos that showcase our products and unique differentiators. You will work with a wide range of functions including Product Marketing, Sales, Product Management, Creative, and Web Marketing. We are looking for a UI/UX Designer with a solid design/web background and a standout portfolio of work who will: Develop stories and build demos to depict consumer and user journeys that let customers easily see how [24]7.ai brings effective solutions to their digital presence. Plan and lead projects accounting for requirements from Marketing and Sales, and coordinate delivery of information and content from multiple teams. Act as a critical member of our technical marketing organization, bringing [24]7.ai products to life through journeys demonstrating key features and measurable benefits. Design and build video clips of new products and product features, showcasing the advancement in our technology. Make demos simple to learn and deliver to customers through their design and scripting.  Qualifications and requirements: 7+ years of experience designing for brand and marketing. Display a positive and collaborative attitude. Skilled at presenting ideas to colleagues of all levels. Provide strategic insight. Solid skills in design tools, including: Illustrator, InDesign, Photoshop, Sketch, After Effects, and PowerPoint. A strong portfolio that demonstrates thoughtful design approach, creative visual concepts, and confident storytelling skills. Ability to craft impactful visual assets and narratives. Outstanding attention to detail. Ability to communicate and work collaboratively with people across the global organization. Thrive on working with tight deadlines across a variety of functional teams in a fast-moving dynamic setting; juggle multiple tasks and projects All candidates should include a link to their online portfolios or PDFs with samples of their digital work and resumes #LI-SP1
Title: UX/UI Designer - Technical Marketing

Job_Description: WE ARE A TRANSFORMATIONAL PARTNER We create impactful and custom digital experiences that connect brands with consumers in relevant and memorable interactions. We partner in the digital strategy, design and execution transforming the world’s leading global businesses.  Our digital studios are worldwide, yet we are one collaborative global team who recognize the demand for all software and technology products to engage users through compelling design.  Our people are 'full stack’ hustler’s - digital citizens connected to the world of design and technology with stand out skills and business savvy - but most importantly, who like to get their hands dirty experimenting and learning.  We operate across many sectors but specialize in retail and financial services, healthcare.  Our Team: Our Vancouver office is staffed with a mix of User Interface/User Experience Designers and top-notch engineering talent working on exciting projects. We work with a different of technologies and tools, spanning from frontend web and mobile to backend and hardware.  We are looking for an exceptional UX/UI Designer to join our team of dreamers and builders. Here is a bit more about how this position impacts our organization and the experience/skills to do it:  Key Qualifications:  Strong knowledge of user interface design process and methodology Strong conceptual thinker Ability to run “Discovery” workshops on site to help a client determine features, requirements and vision on what they want to build Ability to give design estimates and scope a client project Ability to lead projects and delegate tasks within your team Ability to manage 1 to 2 designers Demonstrates strong visual design skill, ability to solve UX problems, ability to work within an existing visual system. Able to take broad, conceptual ideas and turn them into something useful and valuable for its users with supervision from a Design Manager Develops a UX process that is repeatable and shareable. Works well within existing visual and UX patterns. Contribute to high-level strategic decisions with the rest of the design team Identifies scenarios where data would be helpful for making design decisions. Ability to understand customer needs, motivation and behaviors and translate them into actionable deliverables Strong client management skills. You can articulate and lead discussions around your process, explorations and conclusions. Solid up to date understanding of best practices, development and trends in web, mobile, iOS and Material Design  Additional:  Detail-oriented and highly developed organization skills including the ability to prioritize tasks and meet deadlines Must be a self-starter who will bring original ideas and fresh approaches to each project they work on. Must be an ego-free, thick skinned person who can take and give clear feedback Detail oriented Strong self-management skills as well as the ability to work as a contributing member of a multi-discipline team Ability to collaborate with other designers and developers to envision and integrate concepts Shares work frequently with their feature teams, product groups and with the design team Ability to provide thoughtful constructive feedback to other team members Taking initiatives in coming up with ideas/ processes to improve internal process Advanced proficiency with design and prototyping tools such as, Sketch and Invision Ability to juggle multiple projects + task at any given time Agency experience is a plus  Ideally, you will also:  Value teamwork: demonstrated ability to collaborate with cross-functional and distributed teams, including designers, developers and QA engineers Demonstrate skill and commitment to building and maintaining relationships Work enthusiastically: have passion for the work and the role; can-do attitude Remain calm under pressure Communicate efficiently and carefully both verbally and in written form Be meticulously organized Plan and schedule in an effective and productive manner, maintaining focus on key priorities  We are a thriving Community of top technology talent that is globally connected. We Engage, Make, Run and Evolve the technology that makes many brands that you know and love. So let’s take this journey together. No matter where you are on your digital career roadmap, we can help you grow and have fun doing it.  At this time, Softvision LLC will not sponsor a new applicant for employment authorization for this position. Relocation assistance is available. Softvision LLC is an Equal Opportunity Employer. No 3rd Party Agency Candidates, please.
Title: UX Designer

Job_Description: Do you have an excellent eye for design? Do you know great web UI when you see it and understand why it is so compelling? If so, we have an exciting career for you.  You need to be a Photoshop ninja, fluent in Illustrator, OmniGraffle, or any other software used to create wireframes. You should have at least a working knowledge of XHTML/CSS and if you can cut up your own comps, even better.  Finally, you should have a solid portfolio of web application designs to showcase. We want to see firsthand that you can build great web interfaces, not just great websites.  Benefits of Joining Team An office culture that is one-of-a-kind. A happy team is a hard working team. High focus on the health and wellness of our staff including flexible hours. A unique revenue sharing plan. As the company succeeds, so do you. Competitive salaries and accelerated promotions for those who go above and beyond. Dedication to hiring students and new graduates. It keeps us feeling young. Working in the heart of Silicon Dartmouth. The office is car, bike and bus friendly. A kitchen that is stocked with free coffee, tea and hot chocolate. We also provide snacks. Getting the chance to kick your coworker’s butt in a game of Foosball. A social committee that plans 3-4 fun events every year. Paint ball, BBQs, bowling and rock climbing have been done before. Lunch with the CEO and CEO appreciation days. Job Responsibilities Be a growth agent. Develop ambitious, dynamic user interfaces in HTML5 that enable our customers to deal with complex data in an intuitive and appealing manner. Analyze functional requirements and specifications in collaboration with Product Management. Contribute to product design and architectural decisions Develop product concepts and suggest product direction based on design research and functional analysis. Partner with engineering on the implementation of interactive techniques and technologies. Conduct U/X research and plan visual design enhancements. Create documentation for architectural, design, implementation and test activities. Follow company policies and marketing procedures effectively. Other duties as assigned. Job Requirements 1+ years experience implementing user interfaces. Strong communication skills; spoken and written English required. Ability to prioritize and accomplish tasks in a fast-paced environment. Positive attitude, confident and competitive. Ability to be flexible and self sufficient. Ability to work well in a team environment. A good sense of humor goes a long way. Benefits also include: Top tier Prescription and Dental coverage. Two weeks vacation and free parking.  SimplyCast is an equal opportunity employer. Our organization values the importance of diversity, fairness and trust.  We thank all applicants for their interest, however only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.
Title: UX Designer

Job_Description: The Kabam UX team is looking for a new teammate to join us in delivering exciting titles such as Marvel Contest of Champions and Transformers Forged to Fight.  As a UX designer, you have a good understanding of design principles and design thinking methodology. You are the type of person who loves to learn new things, whether it be software, design methods or simply how your newly-made friends work day-to-day. Although your leads will show you the ropes and help organize your tasks, you are proactive and seek out opportunities to help your team while contributing to the project. Having a leader-mentality is critical; you own your tasks, features, and overall project. You excel under pressure and find creative solutions to the problems at hand. Design process excites you and collaborating with others is your second nature. You believe that honest and genuine communication is the main ingredient for success, and are happy to openly share feedback with others.  Our values are simple - you must have have Nerd Passion! This means  being curious, creative, enthusiastic, reasonably joyful, self-motivated and inspiring. We value challenging  assumptions, advocating  for UX design and always  striving to understand our players. As a team member, you must adhere to “We-before-Me” philosophy -  this means collaborating and sharing your passions.  Our team crafts both the user experience and interface designs for the titles we work on. We consider UI design to be part of UX design, and breakdown our work by feature. One UX designer is responsible for each feature, from the beginning to the end. This allows us to stay actively engaged with a project, while also focusing on a variety of interests throughout the development cycle.  What would my day look like?  Identifying and defining the goals and requirements of features, and assessing the impact of those features on other parts of your project Determining user-targets, creating user-flows and wireframes, and building annotated documentation Designing mockups and polishing the final product Engaging in and leading conversations with stakeholders to communicate your design solutions Learning and sharing best practices with the team Pro-actively finding ways to improve our games and processes Supporting other UX designers - promoting collaboration and helping with any extra workload Working closely with different discipline members, such as:   Game designers to discuss and define game features and user-stories Engineers to review technical requirements, annotations and implementation Live Operations members to ensure all planned events and activities are supported Back-end programming to determine further technical requirements QA analysts to ensure the quality and accuracy of the product is delivered and maintained What are the credentials?  2+ years of experience as a professional UI and/or UX designer Education background in a HCI, UX, or a communication design related field A strong portfolio demonstrating effective user experience flows, wireframes and interaction design work Having an iterative design process that allows for fast iteration to ensure the best solutions are delivered Ability to take complex information and turn it into user-friendly UI design solutions A passion for solving human-centered design challenges and graphic design communication problems Understanding of “free-to-play” business models, including customer acquisition, retention, and monetization Being an active gamer - experience working on mobile games is a plus! Bonus points if you have experience working with Unity While you don’t need to be a hard-core mobile gamer, we do expect you to play the games that you work on, and understand the competitive landscape. After all, if you don’t know your product, you cannot design for it.  Excited by this opportunity? We invite you to apply and start the conversation with us!
Title: UX Designer

Job_Description: As the world’s leading hearing care provider, we are not just a company that makes products: we are a team on a mission to help people enjoy the delight of hearing. To enable a life without limitations, we – through our core brands Phonak, Unitron, Hansaton, Advanced Bionics and AudioNova – develop, design manufacture and distribute solutions that push the limits of technology and redefine the future of our industry.At Unitron, a division of Sonova Canada we work hard to be the hearing company that defines great customer experience and provide products that make a difference in people’s lives. In a life without sound, our work provides meaning. Join our mission and become part of our amazing team!Your task:Work closely with a team of Product Managers and Developers to create an intuitive, cohesive and seamless user experience across the Unitron product ecosystemCollaborate with Product Management to influence product strategy and analyze how new products integrate optimally into the Unitron product ecosystemWork with the Engineering team to ensure technical needs are met while maintaining a strong focus on the user experience.Distill complex problems and design simple and enjoyable solutionsAbility to influence a cross-functional team to achieve the best UX outcomePartner with the brand team to ensure alignment of visual look and feel of product experience elements with the Unitron brand design valuesDefine, implement and document user experience guidelinesPerform other duties as assigned by Manager.To be successful in this role, you will have:A Bachelors degree in interaction design or other design related degrees5+ years designing user experiences and interaction design for B2C and B2B product experiencesAn understanding for UX strategy best practices, principles, and methodologyKnowledge of emerging UX strategy trends and toolsThe ability to think creatively and use both data and intuition to inform decisionsExperience in conceptual development and rapid creative prototyping as well as tactical UI design and implementation.Superior strategic thinking, influence and leadership skills.The ability to translate findings into clear guidance for Product Managers and DevelopersExcellent organizational, communication and interpersonal skillsWe thank all applicants in advance; however only individuals selected for an interview will be contacted. All applications will be kept confidential. Sonova is an equal opportunity employer. Applicants who require reasonable accommodation to complete the application and/or interview process should notify the Director, Human Resources.Job Type: Full-time
Title: UX Designer

Job_Description: Electronic Arts Inc. is a leading global interactive entertainment software company. EA delivers games, content and online services for Internet-connected consoles, personal computers, mobile phones and tablets. Position Overview  BioWare, a member of the incredible family of EA studios, has created some of the world's best-selling titles (including the Mass Effect ™ and Dragon Age ™ series).  Responsibilities:  Create player-centered designs by considering player motivations, gameplay experiences, user research, and usability findings Develop user flows, wireframes, and prototypes to effectively communicate game design requirements Develop and maintain detailed user-interface specifications and design patterns that align with an existing UI design system Develop UX requirements with key stakeholders to define design objectives and to align with overarching goals Work closely with game designers, UX designers and UI artists to execute design. Present design work for review and feedback with ability to go over methods, explorations, and rationale. Support your design decisions using data such as player feedback, and user research Thrive in a fast paced work environment requiring independent self-direction with an aptitude for team collaboration and open communication Qualifications  An online portfolio or samples of work demonstrating experience creating great user-centered design solutions Examples of wireframes, low to high fidelity prototypes and information architecture mapping Excellent communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills. Ability to have a bias for action in a fast-paced, sometimes ambiguous environment with multiple stakeholders and / or conflicting needs Highly motivated self-starter; capable of operating with minimal management oversight. Knowledge of usability principles and techniques Working to a degree in Interaction Design, Psychology, Human Factors, Industrial Engineering or related HCI discipline, or demonstrated proficiency and experiences in the field of software user experience/interaction design. Proficiency in a variety of design tools such as Illustrator, Photoshop, Axure (or other flow + prototyping tools) Experience in game development is a strong asset Passion for gaming About EA  It’s not easy building the world’s best digital playground. It’s hair-standing-up-on-end-exhilarating. It’s down-in-the-trenches-challenging. Its stroke-of-brilliance-at-midnight creative. It’s you—taking risks, challenging yourself, pursuing ideas, changing the way millions of people do something they love: Play. We’re EA—we’ve been making games for decades but you wouldn’t know that walking through our studios. We’re still buzzing with the same innovative spirit we began with, though we’ve learned enough to earn our rank as a leading developer, publisher and distributor of the world’s best games. What began as a small group of people determined to “put real life in a box” has become an 8,000-people strong, worldwide organization delivering on that very dream. If you’ve played The Sims lately, you know exactly what we mean. And if you’ve played Battlefield 1, maybe you’d say that we’ve done real life one better.  Whether you’re building Springfield on your mobile or your palms are sweaty from clutching your controller during intense games of FIFA 17, chances are you’ve played an EA game. And if you haven’t, well, what are you waiting for? In an industry that’s changing every day—whether it’s through new social channels, advancing technology, new audiences or unique opportunities for monetization—EA is positioned for growth thanks to smart business plans, strategic acquisitions, and most importantly, our creative people around the world who gather each day to unite the world through play. We take that last part very seriously, so if what you’re reading excites you as much as it does us, we invite you to get to know us better. EA is an equal opportunity employer. All employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, national origin, ancestry, sex, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, genetic information, religion, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, marital status, family status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. EA also makes workplace accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities as required by applicable law.
Title: Associate UX Designer co-op

Job_Description: Designer UX Montréal, QC Le défi  Chez LVL, nous partageons un objectif ambitieux : réinventer la manière de consommer le divertissement numérique, qu’il s’agisse de découvrir des films, de visionner des séries télé, d’écouter les plus récents succès musicaux, de jouer à des jeux en ligne et plus encore!  Notre succès repose sur notre compréhension complète des besoins et des habitudes des consommateurs. Ainsi, chaque expérience que nous concevons doit satisfaire à la fois les attentes de nos clients et celles du public. Et c’est ici que votre expertise entre en jeu!  Nous recherchons un ou une designer UX qui saura effectuer les recherches requises pour planifier, créer et optimiser l’expérience de nos produits, en relevant les différents défis qui lui seront proposés.  L’équipe  À titre de membre de notre département de création, sous la supervision du directeur de création, vous intégrerez une équipe de designers UI et UX hautement qualifiés, énergiques et déterminés à concevoir des solutions innovantes. En fonction du projet en cours, vous aurez aussi l’opportunité de collaborer avec nos développeurs!  Le rôle  Vous utiliserez votre palette de compétences créatives, y compris en design d’interfaces et de produits interactifs, pour concevoir des solutions hors du commun, utilisées par des millions de personnes! Vos responsabilités consisteront à :  Effectuer des recherches et des analyses Développer des stratégies de produit pour une variété de clients Développer l’architecture de l’information Concevoir des maquettes fonctionnelles Procéder au prototypage Fournir la documentation UX à notre équipe de développement Le profil  Vous possédez idéalement les qualifications suivantes :  Un minimum de trois ans d’expérience en design UX d’applis interactives destinées au grand public Capacité d’établir une stratégie de design de produit à partir d’une liste de besoins et de contraintes Aptitude à utiliser de manière stratégique les études concurrentielles, les recherches et les essais d’utilisation, les parcours d’utilisateurs, les maquettes fonctionnelles, l’architecture de l’information et les autres outils UX Compréhension rapide des exigences opérationnelles et des besoins de l’utilisateur Expérience en prototypage Anticipation et identification adéquate des stades de développement d’un produit, de sa version minimale à la plus complète à mettre en marché Excellente vue d’ensemble et capacité à défendre des concepts innovants Un bon sens esthétique Autrement dit, vous saurez faire preuve de créativité, d’autonomie, de minutie et de professionnalisme. Votre sens de la planification et des priorités ainsi que votre capacité à travailler sous pression feront de vous une personne très convoitée, dans n’importe quelle équipe.  Autres atouts  Avoir des notions en design d’applications télé Connaître l’approche du design de services Comprendre les bénéfices et les subtilités des médias interactifs Ça vous ressemble? Postulez maintenant!  Vous êtes une personne créative et motivée et vous souhaitez participer activement à la transformation numérique de l’industrie des médias et du divertissement ? C’est justement ce que nous recherchons ! Si ce poste vous intéresse, mais ne correspond pas exactement à votre expérience, nous serions ravis de mieux vous connaître. En plus de transmettre votre CV à careers@lvlstudio.com, écrivez-nous pourquoi vous pensez être la meilleure personne pour ce poste.  N’oubliez pas de nous suivre sur LinkedIn et Facebook pour rester à l’affût des nouveaux postes offerts chez LVL !  Pourquoi LVL Studio?  Située à Montréal, pôle de référence en intelligence artificielle, LVL est fière d’offrir un environnement de travail convivial et dynamique, où l’innovation s’inscrit au cœur de chaque projet. Nous espérons que notre équipe de stratèges, de concepteurs et de développeurs pourra compter sur votre talent afin de fournir aux géants des communications et du divertissement les outils dont ils ont besoin pour mieux rejoindre, engager et fidéliser leurs auditoires.  Qu’il s’agisse de robustes plateformes de divertissement ou de produits et services de pointe nos solutions sont utilisées par des millions d’utilisateurs, permettant à nos clients d’ajuster l’expérience de découverte et de consommation de contenu qu’ils proposent à leurs consommateurs, en fonction des besoins et tendances du marché.  Avons-nous mentionné que LVL offrait un ensemble de bénéfices concurrentiels, une banque de vacances démarrant à trois semaines par année et des heures de travail flexibles?  Allez voir notre portfolio !  Postulez à careers@lvlstudio.com
Title: Designer UX

Job_Description: Mixed Reality is predicted to shape the way people will work and our team is building the software to create this modern workplace. We are engaged with first line workers to develop innovative tools they can use to tackle new challenge or express their own ideas.  Our team uses deep customer research, observation and understanding paired with design thinking to concept, build, and ship products that will improve the way people get work done each day and help them break free from the limits of our current work environments. We are looking for a talented User Interface Designer to help design and shape our unique mixed reality products and experiences. The ideal candidate will have experience collaborating with developers, technical artists, UX designers, project managers and copywriters.  You're a well-rounded individual with strong visual, motion, interaction, problem-solving abilities, and you possess the desire to create delightful, sophisticated and efficient user experiences. You are driven by curiosity and are an active learner. Responsibilities Helping to define the visual language, and user interface for new enterprise offerings. Producing high-quality visual designs – from concept to delivery. Clearly rationalizing and justifying design work and advocating for the needs of users. Creating a wide variety of 2D/3D assets. Developing motion previsualizations (Adobe After Effects). Working closely with Technical Artists and Software Developers on feature prototypes. Prototyping visual targets on Mixed Reality devices (i.e.: HoloLens). Qualifications Proficiency with Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, After Effects). Proficiency in 3D packages a must, Unity and Maya experience are a plus. Strong understanding of UI flow, typography, graphic / motion design and iconography. Fundamental understanding of UX concepts. Strong verbal, written, and visual communication skills. Basic understanding of Mixed Reality technology. Ability to write documentation/create style guides. Experience with AR or VR a plus. Unity experience a big plus. A talent for creating without fear! Interest in maker culture Please include URLs for an online portfolio in addition to resume. Submissions without a portfolio included will not be considered.  Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via the Accommodation request form.  Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work.
Title: UI Designer - Mixed Reality

Job_Description: Beenox is a video game development studio created in 2000. Located in beautiful Quebec City, Canada, Beenox is a wholly owned subsidiary of Activision Publishing Inc., one of the world’s top game developers.  The studio is proud to contribute to the development of the Call of Duty video game franchise. Beenox has also contributed to the resounding success of the Skylanders, Spider-Man, and Guitar Hero franchises.  As members of the Beenox family, we feel as if we’re part of a group of like-minded people who are great to work with. Our studio is a real open world where it’s easy to have discussions with everyone, including our studio co-heads. Here everyone brings their own unique touch to projects that showcase their talent on a global stage.  You could say that video games are in our blood!  HERE'S WHAT AWAITS YOU IN THIS JOB: Conceptualize the visuals and movements of the UI elements in collaboration with the Art Director and the development team; Develop the interactions and gameplay features relative to interfaces in collaboration with UX Designers and the development team; Own and ensure the readability, enjoyability, and ergonomics of the user interface within the technical constraints of the projects; Participate in build reviews with your teammates and stakeholders. YOU ARE: Experienced: You have at least two (2) completed projects in Video games or other relevant industries as UI Artist, UI Designer, UX Designer, Motion or Graphic Designer or equivalent. You have experience in AAA game development (asset); Competent: You know the video game development pipeline and you are efficient with game engines and game editors; Versatile: You’re an expert in Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, After Effects, InDesign, etc) and you can adapt to various tools, including internal ones. You have good understanding of 3D environments. You also have basic skills in scripting or programming (asset); Talented: You’re able to present an exceptional portfolio to showcase your expertise in graphic design and excellent artistic sense; Informed: You have a good understanding of game art development and newest features. You are also aware of technical constraints and features related to the field; Organized: You like to work in in collaboration with your team and you can achieve quality within the established deadlines.
Title: UI Designer - Beenox - Applicant bank

Job_Description: Half water and half flame, a perfect mix of technique and aesthetic. One that Writes poem with codes, paints web designs with passion and creativity and endlessly seeks for newer and better resolutions.  General Duties Typical work activities A web designer is responsible for web design, coding of a website that have a high visual impact. Involved with the technical and graphical aspects of a website - how the site works and how it looks. They can also be involved with the maintenance, update, and promote of an existing site. The role also involves listening to clients and understanding their needs before making design decisions. The work demands creative flair, up-to-date knowledge of industry software and a professional approach to time, costs and deadlines.  All other duties assigned by employer under reasonable grounds. A web designer's job may involve managing more than one web design brief at a time and allocating the relevant amount of time according to the value of the job. Typical activities include: meeting with clients, project co-ordinator for account managers to discuss the marketing objectives and requirements of the job; Write the programming code, either from scratch or by adapting existing website software and graphics packages to meet business requirements Test the website and identify any technical problems Upload the site onto a server and register it with different search engines. Have skills in web site and web application programming and graphic design have creativity and imagination be adaptable and able to pick up new techniques have good interpersonal and communication skills keep up to date with advances in computer technology and how this affects the business environment interpreting the client's business needs and developing a concept to suit their purpose; estimating the time required to complete the work and providing quotes for clients; developing design briefs by gathering information and data through research; thinking creatively to produce new ideas and concepts; using innovation to redefine a design brief within the constraints of cost and time; presenting finalized ideas and concepts to clients or account managers; working with a wide range of media, including photography and videography; proofreading to produce accurate and high-quality work; contributing ideas and design artwork to the overall brief; demonstrating illustrative skills with rough sketches; keeping abreast of emerging technologies in new media, particularly design programs such as Adobe Illustrator, Photoshop, Indesign, Acrobat, Dreamweaver and Flash; keeping abreast of emerging technologies and programming languages, such as PHP, Mysql, Wordpress, Opencart, Muse developing interactive design, UI and UX commissioning printers, illustrators, photographers, and videographers; working as part of a team with graphic designer, copywriters, photographers, stylists, illustrators, other designers, account executives, web developers and marketing specialists.
Title: Web Designer

Job_Description: News360 employs state-of-the-art natural language processing and personalisation algorithms to build content personalisation and analysis product for consumers and businesses, including the award-winning News360 mobile app, and the NativeAI publisher analytics suite. We provide personalised news recommendations tracking millions of different interests, and build publisher analytics tools that drive content strategies reaching millions of readers every day. We are looking for a talented UX/UI Designer to join our team. News360 is built with a design-centric approach, and usability and elegance are a big part of our DNA - we are committed to creating products that stand out from the rest and we want your passion for design excellence. You have demonstrated your abilities and strive to create an elegant user experience working alongside a cross-functional team. Responsibilities: Conceptualizing and creating intuitive, engaging, and consistent experiences on all platforms relevant to News360. Immersing yourself in data and customer/business needs to best visualize data. Designing dashboards and data visualizations for analytics tools used by leading news organizations and brands. Sharing product ownership, and participating in the development process from conceptualization, through design, development, testing, release, and maintenance. Researching and tracking advancements in mobile application design patterns. Following and understanding trends in the mobile and web industries. Requirements 1+ years experience designing web and mobile apps with portfolio of design samples. Bachelor's degree in visual design, human factor and interaction design (or equivalent experience). A deep appreciation for clean, simple, usable interfaces. Solid skills in visual design, with an eye for typography, intuitive layout, and a pixel-level attention to detail. Deeply creative with a thirst for understanding, and is outcome-focused. Knowledge of Bohemian Coding Sketch Bonus Points: You have strong skills in visualizing data Portfolio with complex dashboards or analytics tools is a big plus Understanding of mobile UX principles including iOS and Android guidelines You're a news junkie Benefits Choose your own hardware when you join Great insurance package 15 vacation days Flexible hours - we track performance, not butts-in-seats A team of top developers in their fields Millions of happy users that love News360 Always fresh fruit and tasty coffee
Title: UX/UI Designer

Job_Description: Soshal is a creative and marketing agency. We design and market products and experiences for some of the worlds top brands and local underdogs. You have passion and a desire to contribute to the creation of design solutions. You love the craft of design and user experience and you labour over the details. You enjoy following design systems and directions but embrace the opportunity to craft something new. You are eager to learn and grow and are willing to do what is necessary to ensure your work is something you can be proud of. You expect the same of those who surround you. Your role: Contribute to various digital projects including websites, brand development, campaigns, and more; Engage with clients through the design process through working sessions, presentations, and feedback sessions; Ensure work executed is solving problems, and speaking to audiences outlined in creative briefs; Collaborate with content specialists, marketers, and developers to craft the best possible solution; Work with project managers to ensure that your projects are on track; Constantly be learning and growing; Follow and support the constant iteration and improvement of our processes and standards. What you'll bring: 2+ years of design experience; Confidence in presenting to stakeholders at all levels; Knowledge of visual design, experience design, brand development, and design thinking; Ability to collaborate with internal teams, gather and accept feedback; An ability to find simple solutions to complex problems; A strong attention to detail; A comfort in working with flexible processes, knowing when to shift paths when necessary; A passion for the craft of design; What you'll get: A great team to work with that is dedicated to doing amazing work; Flexible work hours: be in the office when you need to be, work from home (or wherever you want) when you don't; Comprehensive benefits that cover you from dental to massages Five weeks of paid time off; A great location close to coffee shops, bakeries, and lots of lunch spots (and a stocked beer fridge in the lunch room); How to apply: If you're interested in this position, apply now online, and be sure to include links to stuff you're proud of: your portfolio, sites you've designed (even if they're experimental or personal projects), a link to your Dribbble account (or Behance, or other showcases).
Title: UI/UX Designer

Job_Description: Cyber attacks and data breaches are threatening the bottom line. Organizations of all sizes struggle to navigate the complexity of Cyber Security. This is even more challenging for organizations that can’t attract and/or budget for top Cyber Security talent. Securicy is a web-based platform that enables organizations to easily navigate the complex process of implementing, maintaining, and demonstrating that they have compliant Cyber Security Practices in place.  At Securicy we value open and honest communication, as well as, fresh perspectives and different backgrounds. If you’re the type of person who has a desire to solve problems, share your ideas, and deliver results, you will enjoy our company culture.  What You’ll be Responsible For: Building storyboards, wireframes, and production screens based on written and verbal specifications Creating prototypes for usabilityUX testing Developing and maintaining a UI Kit/Design system that will be used across the organization Actively iterating/improving UI based on user feedback/usability test data Effective communication on how/why a design solution answers user's needs and business goals Collaboration with the Development and UX research teams to ensure consistent quality is met Regular communication with our Development Lead and Product Manager to ensure compatibility between design, development, and business goals   What You’ll Need: An up-to-date portfolio that demonstrates the full scope of your skill set A strong understanding of HTML and CSS Experience with Javascript (Not mandatory but a huge plus) A solid understanding of responsive design The ability to effectively collaborate with the team and meet deadlines A strong design sense with a passion for creating beautiful, user-centered, products. Experience using modern design tools to facilitate wire-framing, designing, and prototyping A strong understanding of Material Design is a bonus Professional experience with motion graphics and print design is not mandatory but is a huge asset   What’s in it for you: Competitive salary Health/Dental plan A forward-thinking learning culture that encourages and supports your professional development You’ll be joining a company that’s backed by the Techstars International Accelerator Program We’re growing quickly and you’ll be playing a major role in building something great You’ll work with a highly motivated team that takes pride in creating an amazing product   What’s Next? Send us a note or message indicating your interest Showcase your work by sending us a portfolio that includes examples of prior projects as well as a detailed outline of your role in said project

Job_Description: Company Overview Every day, Imagine Communications is delivering billions of media moments all over the world — anywhere, anytime and on any device.  Imagine Communications delivers innovative, end-to-end media software and networking solutions to over 3,000 customers in more than 185 countries, including the top broadcast facilities and the most technologically advanced sports and live-event venues. Today, we’re driving an industry transformation by investing deeply in a new generation of media enabled by IP, virtualization, cloud infrastructure and software-defined networks.  At Imagine Communications, groundbreaking work is part of our everyday environment. All our employees play a vital role in our organization, helping the media industry enable instant access to moments that matter. Wherever your skills fit in our business — from engineering and sales to service and support — you’ll find you gain much more than just a job. At Imagine Communications, you’ll gain the opportunity to contribute to the transformation that’s taking place in the way the world is consuming media.  If you’re looking to join a market leader and take your career to the next level, contact us today!  Specific duties include but are not limited to The User Experience team is looking for a new UX/UI Designer with a passion for good design and technology. You must have a strong understanding of web design and production. To be successful on this team you must:  Have a passion for design, web and all things digital Thrive in a lean, fast paced and changing environment Grasp the importance of collaboration within the design process See things clearly from the perspective of a customer Fully utilize the power of data to inform your design decisions Showcase a strong portfolio of web and mobile projects. Responsibilities  Reporting to the UX Manager you will lead the design effort on a number of projects and be the lead role for helping produce web and mobile projects in a highly collaborative, fast-paced environment. Successfully communicate conceptual ideas, rationale and sell your team’s designs Evangelize the importance of good user experience across the whole organization Mentor other UX designers and team members, with an emphasis on constant team collaboration and knowledge sharin Works closely with developers and project teams to establish and ensure compliance with an organizational design strategy. Lead the effort with product managers and development staff to understand and define project requirements. Works closely with other members of the project team to negotiate implementation issues and supports the development effort. Maintain, improve and audit UI specifications and guidelines against existing products and competitor products. Research into design and usability best practices to maintain best of breed. Qualifications Required Skills  5+ years experience with a Diploma or Degree in Graphic or Information Design, Computer Sciences and/or industry experience. Proven design experience using Adobe Illustrator, InDesign, Photoshop, Dreamweaver, Flash Experience with HTML5, CSS3, and ability to handle cross-browser compatibility Knows and applies W3C Standards and established best practices Experience working with responsive design infrastructures Familiarity with social media best practices Good working relationship with web developers and programmers Strong organizational skills and ability to meet tight deadlines and changing priorities Ability to perform effectively in a multitasking environment Require minimal supervision, organized, work well in a team Proven aptitude for problem solving, technical thinking with attention to detail Strong professional attitude and a drive to get things done Have strong interpersonal, as well as written and verbal skills in the English language Nice to Have  Experience using JQuery, JavaScript, Twitter Bootstrap, Wordpress, CMS & ecommerce applications Experience with mobile apps design Experience handling videos Experience with source control such as CVS, Subversion, or related Practiced and delivered User Centered Design deliverables in an end-to-end product development lifecycle for software Experience with RUP or other types of use case/requirements definitions Experience designing and specifying user interfaces for Windows based software products within the Broadcast Industry Knowledge of industry standards and guidelines for developing applications Experience in designing using XAML
Title: UX/UI Designer

Job_Description: Tactio is the unique and highly specialized software developer of TactioRPM, a cloud-based platform helping leading healthcare organizations design, build and launch patient-centered digital health programs. Working at Tactio is the opportunity to create the future of healthcare with an exclusive access into the world’s most advanced digital health programs while working from the stylish comfort of Old Montreal with multi-disciplinary teams of smart, dedicated and passionate professionals. We’re looking for a creative problem-solver, detail-oriented and highly energetic UX/UI Designer to design and develop highly engaging user experiences for beautiful patient/healthcare professional solutions running on TactioRPM, working with a laser-sharp focus on simplicity, elegance and accessibility for elederly/non-technical users. Responsibilities :  Team up with sales & marketing to analyse customer requirements, define user stories, design and implement complete solutions including functionalities, visuals, and app experience; Follow-up on your design throughout development by participating in sprint planning, daily standups and technical meetings, keeping operations aligned with design objectives; Create user stories (we call them “patient journeys”), wireframes, storyboards, process flows, interaction prototypes, and site maps to communicate interaction and design ideas; Design and code the markup, conduct user testing, and perform other user-facing activities to validate the design, and interaction; Provide final detailed design specifications and assets for front-end developers to implement; Develop mobile and cross-browser compatible responsive front-end interfaces; Conduct user research and evaluate user feedback. Qualifications  Three (3) + years UX/UI working experience; Portfolio showing skills and passion for beautiful, functional user interfaces; Experience with Adobe Creative Suite and/or other wireframing tools; Proficiency creating storyboards, user/process flows, interaction prototypes, and site maps; Front-end programming knowledge, and experience working in Agile/Scrum; Bilingual (English & French) with excellent oral and written communication skills.  If you like what you see, reach out to rh@tactiohealth.com (subject line UX/UI Designer) with your CV and portfolio. No need for a cover letter with any usual yada yada. We’d like to see what you’re proud of and hear about how you can contribute to Tactio and our clients.

Job_Description: Travailler chez Genius Solutions c'est : Joindre une équipe passionnée et dynamique qui a à cœur le succès de l’entreprise. C’est également joindre une entreprise en constante évolution dans un environnement stimulant et dans un marché hautement compétitif .Vous avez de l’intérêt à travailler chez Genius? Assurez-vous de vous reconnaitre dans les valeurs de l’entreprise :Vous êtes énergique et passionné : pour atteindre le succès, nous avons besoin de gens avec une énergie débordante démontrant une passion pour leur travail.Vous êtes en mission : les défis sont grands pour nous et nos clients et nous devons faire face à plusieurs obstacles. Pour mener à bien notre mission, il est essentiel de garder le cap!Vous êtes un bon joueur d’équipe : nous croyons fermement que le respect et la confiance sont des ingrédients essentiels au succès.Vous valorisez la connaissance et l’expertise : Genius valorise grandement les gens qui veulent progresser, acquérir de nouvelles connaissances et développer leur expertise.Vous vous reconnaissez dans les valeurs de la compagnie? Oui?Continuons!Designer UX / UI chez Genius Solutions : Nous recherchons actuellement un designer UX/UI . Cette personne aura comme principale fonction la conception de l’interface utilisateur de la prochaine version web de notre application, Genius Manufacturing . La personne sélectionnée devra analyser l’expérience client actuelle, proposer des améliorations et présenter des concepts de maquettes (mockup). Elle devra également accompagner l’équipe de développement informatique tout au long du projet.Les tâches et responsabilités : Effectuer une analyse et une prise de besoins (clients et experts internes)Étudier et analyser les produits et tendances sur le marchéÉtablir des plans et concepts afin de les présenter au comité responsableDévelopper et documenter les outils qui seront utilisés à l’interneOffrir de formation et coaching à notre équipeConnaissances et profil recherchés : Expérience en design d’application web spécialiséeExpérience UX / UI3 à 5 années d’expérience pertinentesMaitrise des logiciels de maquettes (mockup)Niveau avancé de maitrise de la langue anglaise (parlé et écrit)Aimer travailler en mode agileConnaissance de logiciel de type ERP serait un atout importantConditions de travail : Une super équipeUn salaire compétitifUn horaire de travail flexibleVacances + 5 congés payés par annéeDes assurances collectivesDes activités socialesEt bien plus...Lieu de travail : QuébecMots clés : Web – Migration – Développement – Interface – Utilisateur – Expérience client – Mockup – Besoin – Designer – Amélioration – Analyse – ERP – Application – Logiciel – Navigation – Agile – Ergonomie – Graphique – Normes – Livrables – Architecture – Interaction – Interactivité – Solution – Numérique – Mobile – Utilisateur – Visuel – CréativitéType d'emploi : Temps Plein
Title: Designer UX / UI

Job_Description: Position Overview: The role of the web UX & UI designer & developer is to create the user experience vision and successfully develop, monitor and improve users’ overall experience when they visit our websites. The individual should have the skills and knowledge to create memorable experiences that are true to the brand while balancing seamless interactivity, ease of navigation and conversion.Reporting to the Director, Marketing & Communications, the Web UX& UI Designerwill be the champion of the users’ needs, and create intuitive user experiences and interface designs. The role will be responsible for the end-to-end online construction, maintenance and experience for: TPH.ca, RHGroup.ca, RGStore.ca, TheGlobeRestaurant.ca, the Intranet, and others as required.The UX & UI Designer will create wireframes and storyboards that map the customer journey, user flows, process flows, information architecture, site maps, porotypes and A/B testing to effectively communicate interaction and design ideas & design each screen or page with which a user interacts.The ideal candidate should have an eye for clean design, possess superior UI & UX skills and be able to translate stakeholder requirements into logical interaction flows and a user interface that is intuitive, visually stimulating and converts.Responsibilities: Be guided by human-centric design by identifying user needs, and leveraging those insights to guide you through the design and testing processesUnderstand the research methods and approaches to recognize and deconstruct the expectation of our usersEstablish design best practices and guidelines through creation of conceptual campaigns and design of a great visual identity and cohesive style-guide ensuring that a consistent design language is applied across sites incorporating logo, corporate colours, typographic rules, etc.Maintaining consistency in visual elements and defining behaviorCreate website that are designed and optimized for all screen sizes (including mobile, tablet, and desktop) with a mobile-first mentality, with specific technologies and platforms in mindLead conversations to facilitate conceptual thinking that takes stakeholder considerations into the processCreate clickable prototypes in Testing of websites and that effortlessly lets the users accomplish their goalsOther duties and responsibilities as assignedQualifications: 3-5 years of proven web designer experienceDemonstrable UI & UX design skills with a strong portfolioSolid experience in creating wireframes and storyboards, user flows, process flows, information architecture, site maps, prototypes and A/B testing to effectively communicate interaction and design ideas & design each screen or page with which a user interactsExperience working with a .Net CMS and e-commerce, knowledge of DotNetNuke (DNN) is preferredProficiency in Creative Design Software (specifically Photoshop, Illustrator, and other visual design and wire-framing tools)Proficiency in: HTML, CSS, JavaScript and JQuery, Media Queries/Bootstrap, Version Control (SVN)Explore various usability testing methods to help inform and optimize designs to create more effective experiencesUnderstand on-page, off-page and technical SEO practices and how to best implement these strategies on the websitesImplement Google Analytics, Tag Manager and Optimize to apply fundamental concepts like performance measurement, comparison and optimization.Experience providing feedback on designer performance, and identifying improvement opportunitiesAbility to present your designs and sell your solutions to various stakeholdersAbility to solve problems creatively and effectivelyUp-to-date with the latest UI trends, techniques, and technologiesExperience working in an Agile/Scrum development processExcellent communication skills and the ability to multi-task, and work well under pressure while juggling several competing prioritiesJob Type: Full-timeExperience:.Net: 1 yearAdobe Creative Suite: 1 yearWeb Design: 3 yearsLocation:Toronto, ON
Title: Web UX & UI Designer

Job_Description: Join Windsor's most innovative, fun and Silicon-Valley-esque development and innovation company, bringing world-class projects to Windsor. Help us build exciting technology like multiplayer game servers for Atari, social apps for Puma, high profile analytics engines for The PGA Tour, and cutting edge products like natural-language-processing chat-bots.As one of Windsor's most sought-after companies to work for, we offer flexible time, work-at-home days, a great benefits plan and in-office massage. We are located in the heart of Windsor's historic Walkerville. You must be willing to work in our office. We are not interested in off-shore or remote work.We are seeking talented interface designers who are looking to grow professionally and personally within a fast-growing company. You will work on a variety of marketing deliverables, including websites, prototypes, wireframes, business collateral and other design pieces.ResponsibilitiesWork on the design of user interfaces for web and mobile projectsAble to help with wireframing using tools like Adobe XD and BalsamiqAble to self-direct and work independently, to manage multiple, concurrent projects simultaneously from start to finishRequirements: Expertise in Adobe Creative Suite: Illustrator, Photoshop, InDesign, After Effects, EdgeKnowledge of responsive web designAbility to create interactive prototypesCustomer-obsessed, detail-oriented and comfortable working on highly technical teamsDemonstrated experience with building user interfaces across a range of platforms including desktop and mobile--- Please send examples of your design portfolio (specifically web design) when you apply. ---We look forward to meeting you!Job Type: Full-timeEducation:High school or equivalentLocation:Windsor, ON
Title: Web Designer / UI / UX

Job_Description: Navigator Marketingis an award-winning, full-service marketing agency that provides cutting-edge marketing strategy that produce results. We work with companies all over North America.Services: Web Design, Mobile Web Design, Monthly Marketing Strategy & Implementation, Social Media Management.Our Mission: Helping business owners grow their businesses from where they are now to where they want them to be.How We Do This: We increase a business' PROFILE, LEADS & SALES. We are a fun, talented & driven team who work at the intersection technology and consumer behaviour generating sales.Position Description: We are looking for an amazing & fun Web & UI/UX Developerto add to our team to assist with designing, coding and modifying websites, from layout to function. This person will strive to create visually appealing sites that feature user-friendly design and clear navigation. This person will also work closely with our designers & team members to execute & bring to life new ideas & projects in a team approach.The successful candidate will also be working on keeping websites up to date, landing pages, mobile optimization, analytics and much more. These tasks will require you to be comfortable and efficient with Google Developer Tools, and coding in HTML5, CSS, Javascript and PHP.We are looking for someone with minimum of one year experience in the field who can hit the ground running. Training will be minimal as we need someone to help us out immediately with our current projects. You should enjoy solving problems independently and keeping up to date with the newest trends.Qualifications: Amazing attention to detail.Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator skills an asset.HTML(5), CSS, JavaScript + jQuery, PHP .Setting up WordPress websites from scratch, working with plugins & some ecommerce.Familiarity with cPanel, Server / IT knowledge an asset.Experience with media queries and building responsive websites.Excellent at solving the challenges of cross browser rendering (desktop [IE, FF, Chrome, Safari] and mobile [iOS, Android])Ability to write iOS applications is an asset.Great problem solving skills.Additional Information: Key TraitsYou are passionate and love what you do.Work well under pressureAble to move from project to project quicklyGreat memory skillsExcellent communications skills.Strong analytical and problem solving skills.Superior teamwork and interpersonal skills.Strong organizational, prioritization, time management skills & work well under pressure.The ability to effectively handle multiple tasks and projects and to meet deadlines.Your upbeat & enthusiastic! Attitude is everything with us. We are a fun quirky group, but we love to work at what we do!EducationA college or university diploma/degree in something related is preferred.Also open to applicants who can demonstrate an amazing knowledge & Do-it-yourself spirit.Job Type: FreelanceJob Type: Freelance
Title: Wordpress Web Designer - Virtual 20 hours/week

Job_Description: About Nix Sensor Ltd.We create amazing products that help colour professionals and consumers demystify the world of colour. If you’ve never used a Nix Color Sensor, it’s a magical experience. Like the photoshop eyedropper in real life, it takes the real world and makes it digital, and then can help our users make it real again.What you’ll do?Design beautiful apps that work with our award-winning hardwareWork with our software development, hardware, and product teams to craft a seamless user experienceOwn the design of our core products and participate in shaping the direction of our future productsIterate, test, and release products as quickly as we can gather feedback from our users and customersEven help out with other aspects of product design like packaging, web, etc.What you’ll need?A compelling and interesting portfolio of projects that showcase your workExperience designing mobile apps, and even web and other types of media, front end, back end, consumer and cloud based experience is a bonusExperience using the latest design tools to facilitate wireframing, prototyping, user testing, and information architectureExperience using a design methodology to get product out the door fastThe ability to work in a fast paced, collaborative environment, alongside the rest of our dynamic teamWhat’s makes Nix a great place to work?You’ll be joining a company that’s backed by some of the best advisors and investors in CanadaWe’re growing quickly, and you’ll be helping to build the next great Canadian success storyYou’ll work with a highly motivated team that takes pride in creating amazing productsWhat’s next?Send us a note or message indicating your interestShowcase your work by sending us a portfolio and / or examples of prior projectsJob Type: Full-timeExperience:UI Design: 1 yearUX Design: 1 year
Title: UX UI Designer

Job_Description: You're the Picasso of tech. You have a strong desire to make things look good and feel right. You have a deep appreciation for the complexity of simplicity. You have a passion for creating great user experiences and get excited by the opportunity to craft a unique identity for our brand.
Title: UI/UX Designer

Job_Description: Nous valorisons la diversité et avons à cœur de créer un milieu de travail inclusif qui nous inspire tous à donner le meilleur de nous-mêmes. Joignez-vous à notre équipe et faites une différence!  Votre poste  Nous Comment imaginez-vous les bureaux d’une compagnie d’assurance? Et l’atmosphère de travail qui y règne? Nous gageons que si vous passez nous voir au Lab de Intact, vous serez très surpris! Situé au centre-ville de Montréal, nous sommes un laboratoire d’innovation dont la mission est de créer des produits à la fine-pointe de l’insurtech qui améliorent la vie de millions de Canadiens.  Mariant la convivialité et la vélocité d’une startup aux ressources et aux moyens d’une grande entreprise (vous disposerez de tous les outils dont vous avez toujours rêvé!), le Lab est un environnement jeune et dynamique, offrant des défis stimulants, des collègues inspirants et une carrière passionnante (chez un des top 100 employeurs au Canada). C’est l’endroit idéal pour parfaire vos compétences et faire évoluer votre carrière.  Vous Vous êtes passionné par le commerce électronique et l’innovation numérique? Vous avez un talent particulier pour traduire des exigences complexes en expériences utiles et agréables? Vous restez à l’affût des dernières tendances en matière de design et vous aimez expérimenter de nouveaux outils et de nouvelles méthodologies? Nous avons l’occasion parfaite pour vous!  Rôle À titre de designer UX/UI, vous jouerez un rôle essentiel dans la conception et l’évolution de notre écosystème numérique. Relevant du directeur principal, Innovations numériques, vous aurez comme principales responsabilités :  Concevoir des expériences captivantes en vue de réaliser les objectifs d’affaires  Valider la fonctionnalité et l’utilité par l’entremise de tests et de recherches auprès des utilisateurs  Produire des livrables UX et design pertinents au besoin  Piloter une feuille de route aux côté d’un directeur de produit et d’une équipe agile multidisciplinaire  Présenter le travail aux parties prenantes  Aider les ingénieurs à produire des interfaces de qualité et agréables  Prôner une conception axée sur l’utilisateur et les données  Vos compétences  Minimum trois années d’expérience  Expertise en matière de convivialité et de pratiques de conception centrées sur l'utilisateur  Maîtrise des outils de conception (Sketch, Axure, InVision, Illustrator, etc.)  Expérience des outils de recherche UX (usertesting.com, Optimal Workshop, etc.) un atout  Expérience dans la production de flux de processus, d’inventaires de contenu, etc.  Vous aimez travailler dans un environnement de collaboration qui accorde une importance primordiale au travail d’équipe, à l’innovation, à l’ouverture d’esprit et au plaisir  Veuillez inclure votre portfolio dans votre dossier de candidature.  Vous êtes  Une personne avec qui il est agréable de travailler  Créatif, analytique, curieux et ingénieux  Un joueur d’équipe capable de partager et recevoir des commentaires constructifs  Excellent pour expliquer vos idées à différents intervenants  Profondément passionné par le design et la qualité  Organisé et proactif  En tant que salarié temps plein, vous bénéficierez des avantages suivants :  Un salaire compétitif  Un boni de performance annuel  Un régime de retraite  Un horaire de travail flexible de 35 heures par semaine  Des assurances médicales et dentaires hors pair  Et plusieurs autres avantages et bénéfices (remboursement gym, conférences, etc.)  Énoncé fermeture  Cette opportunité vous intéresse? Nous avons très hâte de faire votre connaissance!  D’excellents avantages sont offerts : salaire concurrentiel, avantages flexibles, aménagements de travail flexibles, congés mobiles, régime de retraite à prestation déterminée, etc.  Dans le cadre du processus de sélection d’Intact, les candidats peuvent être appelés à donner leur consentement à une vérification de leurs antécédents pertinente au poste à pourvoir avant de recevoir une offre d’emploi. Celle-ci peut comprendre une confirmation des références d’emploi, des études et des titres de compétences, une vérification des emplois, de l’identité, des infractions criminelles et du permis de conduire ainsi qu’un rapport de crédit.  Vous pouvez soumettre votre candidature à un emploi affiché pourvu que vous occupiez vos fonctions actuelles depuis au moins douze mois et que votre performance soit jugée bonne ou que votre contrat temporaire arrive à son échéance. Une recherche de talents à l'externe est menée parallèlement au recrutement à l'interne Veuillez donc prendre note que des candidats potentiels pourraient avoir été identifiés pour ce poste dans le cadre de leur plan de développement.   Veuillez noter que l'usage du masculin a comme but d'alléger le texte.  Cet affichage prendra fin 02 juin 2018.  Prime de recommandation  CE POSTE EST SUJET À UNE PRIME DE RECOMMANDATION DE 3000$.  #li-qc  Droit de travailler au Canada  Les personnes qui posent leur candidature à un poste permanent doivent, dès leur embauche, avoir le droit de travailler au Canada de façon permanente. Les documents pouvant servir de preuve dans le cas des rôles permanents sont un certificat de naissance canadien, un passeport canadien, un certificat de citoyenneté canadienne, une carte de résident permanent ou une confirmation de son statut de résident permanent pour prouver qu’il a le droit de travailler au Canada.  Indeed Commandité  IN-INFR
Title: Designer UX/UI
