Title: Designer UX/UI

Job_Description: Gaargle Solutions is currently seeking a talented UI/UX Designer to join our Product Development team. Reporting to the CTO, the successful candidate will be responsible for producing user interface elements at all stages of the development process to ensure that our products are easy to use, intuitive and visually stunning for users.  Primary Responsibilities:  Work closely with the development team and other stakeholders to build storyboards, proof-of-concept mock-ups, demos and prototypes Produce UI design elements to bring features and products to market Collaborate on the definition of user interface design standards, optimize ease-of-use and achieve an integrated and consistent look and feel Conduct ongoing research of UI development best practices Conduct usability tests, task analyses and user surveys Create wireframes and prototypes for testing and quick feedback Interact directly with software developers to define application workflows and screen layouts Help to establish design guidelines & standards Provide creative consultation & solutions for a variety of interactive design related requests Champion user experience within the development team Requirements:  3 – 5 years of UI/UX design experience Ability to design layout/UI storyboards and process flow charts Ability to annotate designs and UI for development (in CSS or other formats) Ability to understand technical implementations and limitations Education in Human Computer Interaction or related design program, or equivalent experience Prior experience in prototyping techniques and user-centred design principals on commercially available products Prior experience performing user interviews and product testing Proven experience using user research methodologies and creating brief documents
Title: UI/UX Designer

Job_Description: We're seeking a UI/UX Designer to join our dynamic team. We are located in the middle of the Old Port. We work in an open and collaborative environment, and we make a point to display our company culture very publicly (you can actually read it all on our website). We respect each other and help one another. Who we are is what makes us unique, and this is why we have the opportunity to work on amazing projects with great clients.  FULL TIME POSITION Salary: Based on skill and experience Hours: 9AM - 5PM Monday through Friday Now, are you passionate about web design and user experience? Do you get a thrill when you witness a user go through the flow of a site you have designed and strategized for, in the exact way you have planned? Do you enjoy meeting with clients directly, and working with a team behind you? This position might be just perfect for you! Let's get right into the fun stuff, as a Design Shopp team member, you will benefit from group insurance, including health and dental. You will have VIP access to our game room (video games, board games, Netflix, and more) and work in a lively and open work environment. You will always have the support of a young and passionate team and limitless cuddles from Charlie the Dog (aka Vice President of Happiness / aka Sandwich Thief). We have a gym in our building, and we can hook you up with a group discount membership the day you start. Since this is a job posting, let’s get right to it! As a UI/UX Designer at Design Shopp, you will be meeting with clients, along with a Project Manager, during initial creative briefs. You will then strategize an ideal flow for each client’s responsive website, by developing the sitemap and wireframes. You will also be conceptualizing intuitive and compelling designs with the Web team. You and the Project Manager will be presenting your wireframes and designs to the client throughout the design stage of each project. Your responsibility will be to ensure consistency with branding and marketing efforts of each of your projects, and perform quality control on the designs during the creation phase as well as during the development phase. We're looking for a dedicated designer, with a passion for well-crafted websites that ultimately convert into sales for our clients. You will be working with other designers on the team. You will be developing many websites at a time, with different clients from various industries. We are looking for someone who is organized and versatile, and who can easily adapt their design style to different types of industries. We’re looking to hire as quickly as possible so we hope to hear from you soon! Make sure to include a personal note about yourself and sample work depicting your UI and UX abilities. We want to see how well you understand wireframing, and design. If we select your application, you can expect a first phone interview where we will get to know you a bit better and discuss salary, as we will base it on your experience and skillset.  What we’re looking for: 3+ years experience designing websites and interfaces with a solid portfolio to demonstrate your skillset A perfectly bilingual candidate with excellent oral and written communication skills in French and English (Because you will often be in direct communication with clients) Someone with experience in creating responsive website wireframes Someone with experience in creating App wireframes Experience with Magento as well as general e-commerce best UX practices for conversions Someone with basic understanding of HTML, CSS (But you will not be required to write any code, no worries.) Experience collaborating with a team A true team player; someone who will stay current on the latest web and mobile design trends, and will maintain design guidelines and process enhancements to be shared with the rest of the design team
Title: UI/UX Designer

Job_Description: Role  Design is critical to us because our customers use and rely on SEDNA all day, every day, all year round and we care deeply about providing them with a dependable, relevant, and intuitive experience.  You are a skilled interface designer with experience in designing user interfaces and experiences for the web and mobile. You will be in a unique position to help define the shape and vision of a young and sought after product because the design team touches all aspects of the product – from onboarding interfaces to copywriting, micro-interactions to broad user flows - all in the process of developing and documenting the visual direction of the product. You can dig into the nitty gritty details of a feature from a customer’s perspective. You are comfortable working and thinking out loud, documenting your process and working iteratively.  At heart, our philosophy is about honest design. SEDNA is a complex product that solves a very ingrained communication pain point - that of trust. The people who use our platform need to trust that they can access information reliably, accurately, quickly and securely. The industries our users operate in depend upon being able to instantly recognize who has access to what information at any given time. The solutions we design should strive to present users with information and feedback that is accurate and truthful. Designing with honesty will foster trust.  Responsibilities  Plan the integration of product-wide design systems.  Provide intermittent design support for the marketing of our product.  Create both low and high fidelity design deliverables including prototypes.  Dissect current features and speculate on the future direction of the product.  Work with product and development teams to give feedback on planning and features.  Work with developers to implement your designs, while understanding technical limitations and liberties.  Design user interfaces and experiences for the web and mobile with a strong sense of balance and composition in short, iterative cycles.  Present (and sell) design to others by clearly articulating an elegant solution to address a specific problem through storytelling and documentation.  Requirements  You have 3+ years of experience in an individual contributor role, on a Product Design team for desktop and mobile.  You are self-directed toward excellent work outcomes, comfortable working in a startup, and pragmatic about your solutions.  You have a solid and up to date understanding of best practices, developments and trends in web and mobile.  You take a human-centered approach to design and know how to clearly articulate a user’s troubles, and are comfortable going out into the world to find inspiration for it.  You are optimistic, generative, and open to new ideas and ways of working and understand the value of fun in building a team and product.  You have excellent written and verbal English communication skills – we document our work daily.  You are comfortable using modern design and prototyping tools (Sketch, Principle, Framer, Studio, InVision, etc) as well as comfort working with version control (bonus points if it’s Abstract)  You have an outstanding portfolio, showcasing a foundation in Typography, Colour, Interaction and Visual Design, Ideation and Documentation.  You have experience working with Product Managers to develop the strategy and rationale for features.  You have experience with prototyping as a means of exploring and conveying design solutions.  You are familiar and comfortable with modern front-end web technologies, including HTML/CSS and Javascript .  Bonus  You have prior experience in a similar role in a startup environment.  You are familiar with the principles of Material design  You are familiar with the principles and values of design systems  You have experience designing for React or other component-based frameworks  SEDNA  At SEDNA, we help some of the biggest companies in the world manage their day-to-day transactions with a team inbox. We’re doing this by building an enterprise product that helps our customers work faster, better together, and more securely. SEDNA provides you with trust, support, guidance, and an opportunity to grow within the organization. We are a small company doing something disruptive. Our culture is one of trust, experimentation, helpfulness, working out loud, asking ‘what does the data say?’, and letting people self-serve. www.sedna.com
Title: UI / UX Designer

Title: Senior UI/UX Designer

Job_Description: Creating delightful experiences for users is at the very heart of our company’s DNA. No joke - the founders are both designers. Before we even wrote the first line of code we agonized over our UIs and the delivery of value to our customers. And we continue to do it every day. We’re looking for a “T-shaped” UX Designer. Sounds painful, no? Here’s what we mean - we need a talented and skilled UX generalist who can not only move a project forward from start to finish, but who also has deep understanding and experience with Interaction Design. Our mission is simple; help teams in small and mid-sized organizations stay in control of the health and performance of their business by monitoring the data they need to make quick, informed decisions. If you’re ready to help us get there, this could be the right opportunity for you. Responsibilities: Synthesize a deep understanding of users (their jobs, tasks, pains, and aspirational outcomes) and business and development needs to ideate on new solutions and opportunities. Communicate new interfaces-from flows and pattern implementations to novel, complex interactions-via sketches, wireframes, mockups, prototypes, and specifications to create mediums for feedback and testing. Collaborate with designers, researchers, developers, product managers, writers, marketers and others to design, challenge, iterate, and optimize your work. Work closely with visual designers to collectively enhance the aesthetic value and brand alignment of your interfaces. Requirements: 2+ years practical experience with web-based interaction design. Solid aptitude for the following UX sub disciplines outside of interaction design: visual design; usability; information architecture; content; research; and prototyping. Fluency in modern best practices for interaction design and exceptional familiarity with design patterns for the web and mobile. Solid understanding of the concepts behind HTML, CSS, and UI frameworks. Self-motivated and detail-oriented. Proficiency with Photoshop and Illustrator or other relevant wireframing/prototyping tools. The ability to articulate the rationale for design decisions. Strong aesthetic sensibility and appreciation of good visual design. Understanding of the design process and ability to showcase relevant experience. Send your resume and a link to your portfolio to careers@klipfolio.com. Ensure the subject line of your email contains "Interaction Designer". If you are selected for an interview, you will be contacted within a week or two to confirm a date and time.
Title: Interaction Designer

Job_Description: Creating delightful experiences for users is at the very heart of our company’s DNA. No joke - the founders are both designers. Before we even wrote the first line of code we agonized over our UIs and the delivery of value to our customers. And we continue to do it every day. We’re looking for a “T-shaped” UX Designer. Sounds painful, no? Here’s what we mean - we need a talented and skilled UX generalist who can not only move a project forward from start to finish, but who also has deep understanding and experience with Visual Design. Our mission is simple; help teams in small and mid-sized organizations stay in control of the health and performance of their business by monitoring the data they need to make quick, informed decisions. Work with marketing to develop, refine, translate, and communicate the Klipfolio visual identity as a visual language for our application UIs. Contribute to the expansion and evolution of the Klipfolio UI Style Guide and Design System. Use established information design principles to build incredible dashboards for customers and internal projects. Experience designing for multiple contexts such as mobile, desktop, tablet and TV. Self-motivated and detail-oriented. Proficiency with Photoshop, Illustrator, or other relevant visual design tools. Solid communication skills and the ability to articulate the rationale for design decisions. 1+ year practical experience with web or mobile visual design. CSS/HTML/JS skills are an asset. Experience with design guides and design systems/frameworks an asset. Send your resume and a link to your portfolio to careers@klipfolio.com. Job_Description: Maltem Consulting Group est un cabinet de conseil qui existe depuis une quinzaine d'année, spécialisé en gestion des projets autours des SI. Notre premier métier c'est le tertiaire financier pour ensuite développer une expertise de la Data et du Digital.Nous sommes aujourd'hui autour de 1000 personnes présentes principalement sur Paris, Bruxelles, Luxembourg, Honk Kong, Singapour, Montréal, New York, Casablanca..Pour répondre aux besoins croissants de nos clients, nous sommes à la recherche d'un «concepteur et développeur Web UX-UI».Qui cherchons-nous?Vous êtes passionné par le Web et le développement mobile en utilisant des méthodologies réactives et adaptatives.Vous possédez des compétences UI / UX supérieures et êtes capable de traduire les exigences de haut niveau en flux d'interaction, puis de les transformer en interfaces utilisateur belles, intuitives et fonctionnelles.Vous êtes responsable de la collaboration avec la gestion des produits et l'ingénierie pour définir et mettre en œuvre des solutions innovantes pour la direction du produit, les visuels et l'expérience.Votre objectif principal est d'exécuter toutes les étapes de la conception visuelle, du concept au transfert final en passant par l'ingénierie, et de conceptualiser des idées originales qui apportent simplicité et convivialité à des obstacles de conception complexes. Vous créez également des filaires, des storyboards, des flux d'utilisateurs, des flux de processus et des plans de site pour communiquer efficacement des idées d'interaction et de conception.Vous pouvez présenter et défendre des conceptions et des produits livrables clés aux pairs et aux parties prenantes de niveau exécutif.Vous êtes en mesure de présenter vos conceptions et de vendre vos solutions à différentes parties prenantes.Vous avez déjà une expérience en tant que Designer et Développeur UX-UI pendant au moins trois ans sur des plates-formes PC et Mobile (IOS / Android) dans des environnements bancaires, d'assurances, de télécommunications, de distribution, etc.Vous êtes familier avec HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, Ajax, Angular JS ... mais aussi avec Photoshop, Illustrator, Axure ou d'autres outils de design visuel et wire-frame.Être à l'aise avec JSP est un atout.Vous êtes curieux, proactif, créatif, flexible avec un fort appétit d'apprentissage et un esprit collaboratif fort («Pensez d'abord au problème»).Vous parlez couramment le français et anglais.Pourquoi devriez-vous nous rejoindre ?Valeurs et culture d'entreprise fortes: Discussions, Attention, Dynamisme et Expertise.Une équipe polyvalente et passionnée uniquement dédiée à cette expertise.Notre résultat? Un support proche et personnalisé.Projets, événements et ateliers dédiés tout au long de l'année, source d'échanges, de perspectives de carrière et de formation (Agility, Lean Management ...)Un package salarial attractif et évolutif.Missions à forte valeur ajoutée au sein de clients prestigieux.Un accès à notre base de données de connaissances importantes et à notre centre de formation.Un soutien de nos experts ... qui vous aidera à devenir un expert et à continuer à grandir avec nous.Type d'emploi : Freelance / Pigiste, PermanentExpérience:UX UI DESIGNER: 3 ansLangue:FrançaisAnglais

Job_Description: About usAt Osedea we are a small, but a very resourceful team. Our client portfolio is diverse so the projects we work on are always different. Every day we work hard, we learn and we’re having a blast. Because we are a small but fast-growing team, there are tons of opportunities to make important decisions and impact the future of the company. This is represented through some of the following programs: i) Discovery Fridays - time allocated on Fridays to experiment new programming tools and fun projects outside of your daily work; ii) Pair programming - to enable you to learn quickly and level up faster; iii) Helping our local community by running a programming school for struggling teenagers. Title: UX/UI Designer

Job_Description: Are you a well-seasoned designer with an innovative mind and the passion to create cutting-edge digital experiences?Founded in 2002, Ballistic Arts Media Studios is a full-service creative agency in Coquitlam, BC providing design, web development, and video production services to local and national clients in a variety of industries. Our designers work on diverse projects from brand logos to websites to expansive interactive presentation centres. To keep up with our growing business, we’re looking for an experienced UX/UI Designerto join our team!As a UX/UI designer, you’ll get to work alongside the talented folks on our design team to create amazing digital experiences through a thoughtful collaborative process! You’ll be responsible for taking part in our creative process from start to finish: collaborative brainstorming, producing wireframes, and creating design prototypes, mockups and assets. The work is fast-paced and challenging, promoting teamwork and individual growth. We work for a variety of different industries and clients, keeping the work diverse and interesting.The position is for a UI / UX designer to work from our Coquitlam office- we are not looking to hire contractors or people that work remotely. The position starts with a probationary 3-month period with a performance review conducted at the end to discuss options.We’re a small team (there’s less than 30 of us!) that likes to have fun; our outgoing crew loves thoughtful conversations over lunch, Smash Bros. tournaments, and occasionally hitting local breweries together after work. We’re also always looking for ways to give back, whether it’s spending an afternoon cleaning up the creek near our building, or holding a workshop with kids from a nearby school!We offer a supportive work environment with a great company culture. We are dedicated to the success of our projects, clients, and team members.Job DescriptionKey Responsibilities: Conceptualize and create a range of wireframes, prototypes, and mockups for various web projects and in support of marketing strategiesCollaborate with project managers and creative leads to produce user experiences that support our clients goals and visions while considering the end-userFocus on current best practices while looking for opportunities to push for new methodologies and technical advancesCommunicate the intended user-experience with research, user stories, wireframes, style-frames, module design, prototypes, and mockupsCollaborate with our skilled web development team to realize the intended user-experience and provide required visual assetsDesign for a varied instances such as: websites, email campaigns, intranets and client portals, interactive displays, mobile devices and desktopsSkills and Experience: Knowledgeable on current best practices and trends in user experience/user interfaces.Advanced knowledge of Adobe Photoshop CCA diverse and visually stunning portfolio of past web-based design projectsExperience preparing briefs, wireframes and creative mock-upsExceptionally organized with great attention to detailGreat communication skillsWilling to accept and provide directionCommitted self-starter, self-responsible, independent workerStrong time management skillsPositive attitude and an ability to provide and receive constructive feedbackComfortable with spontaneous outbursts of singing and a fan of all-you-can-eat Indian foodJob Type: Full-timeExperience:Design: 2 years

Job_Description: Groupe Dynamite is a global fashion retailer with two brands at the heart of its success, Garage and Dynamite. We operate close to 400 stores in Canada and worldwide, and employ over 6,000 people. We have our roots planted firmly in the terrain of fashion’s retail landscape.As Canadian leaders in the international retail landscape, the Garage and Dynamite banners continue to stand out in an increasingly saturated market. Our passionate team continues to lead the expansion of the business in new markets, including E-commerce, while always leveraging our shared values.We are proud to hire and retain inspiring leaders, motivated by their desire to achieve great things and recognized for their entrepreneurial spirit.Role Summary: Reporting to the Sr. Manager, Digital Products, the Senior User Experience UX/UI Designer, Web, will be the ultimate guardian of the digital experience on all of Groupe Dynamite’s web-based platforms. You will also guard and protect the integrity of the digital experience to ensure the highest level of consumer satisfaction.You will work alongside top talent product managers, product owners and developers to help shape the design of new and existing initiatives to reach their potential for both of our brands, Dynamite and Garage. You will also collaborate with our Senior UX/UI Designer, App, to ensure consistency of the online experience across platforms. This opportunity will position you as an early contributor to help shape a growing user experience practice within Groupe Dynamite.Our Senior User Experience (UX/UI) Designer, Web, needs to be able to solve problems, simplify complicated ideas, work within tight deadlines and understand the needs of the audience to ensure that the final experience caters to the uniqueness of our target audience. Hence, you will need to understand and reconcile users’ needs with business goals and KPI targets.Main responsabilities: User ExperienceLead the development of the UX/UI strategy on Groupe Dynamite’s desktop, tablet and mobile platforms;Translate business product vision into a cohesive user experience by reconciling user needs with business goals, technical capabilities and best practices in interaction design and usability;Facilitate design brainstorming and working sessions with business stakeholders, andE-comm and Marketing teams through the use of collaboration techniques, interactive prototypes, wireframing of user flows and visual mock-ups;Facilitate project kick-off session with our technical team, bringing a strong rationale behind design decisions;Conduct research into competitor products and UX to identify opportunities in digital products and designs that provide a competitive edge;Work with the Web Analytics Manager and Product Managers to establish performance indicators and measure business value and return of the developed products.Product Development and EnhancementWork with E-commerce and Creative teams as well as Product Managers to define customer experience, aligned with business objectives and target KPIs;Monitor the competitive landscape and emerging technologies in order to stay up-to-date with the evolution of industry best practices in order to create recommendations for state-of-the-art technological improvements to drive innovation;Conduct research on the satisfaction and expectations of users, and conduct usability testing of key initiatives;Ensure compliance with external standards (e.g.: WCAG) and internal brand guidelines for use by Product Managers, brand, E-comm and technical teams;Ensure high quality UX and UI deliverables, including information architecture, working models, designs and interactive prototypesQualifications and Competencies: Education (include professional designation)Bachelor's degree in Graphic Design, Communication Arts, Computer Science, or Human-computer Interaction (HCI), or at least five (5) years of related work experience as a User Interface Designer, User Interaction Designer or User Experience Designer.Experience:At least five (5) years of experience in web and mobile design with an outstanding portfolio demonstrating the successful delivery of multiple innovative mobile and web interface design solutions. Preferably in e-commerce space;Experience working in the retail industry a strong asset;Experience working in an Agile development environment a strong asset.Technical SkillsA strong working knowledge of interaction design, user-centered experience design, brand identity management, digital marketing and the creative process;Proficiency in wireframing user flows;Strong knowledge and experience with web-responsive design;Experience with mobile web commerce designs and best practices;Excellent visual design skills; attention to details and a demonstrated mastery of typography, colour and layout;Expert -level proficiency with design tools: Sketch, Zeplin, and Adobe Creative Suite (Flinto, Visio, Axure and InVision an asset);Ability to use prototyping tools to convey interactive design;Well-versed in fundamental visual and interactive design disciplines and principles, and user behavioural psychology;Extensive experience working in a fast-paced and innovative development environment, and a thorough understanding of cross-platform user interface design patterns and user-centric design methodologies;Ability to stand by your designs and provide solid rationale to back up your decision with data analysis;Lead testing and validation of UX decisions through A/B testing, customer interviews and user testing;Experience in user research techniques an asset (e.g., surveys, usability tests, field interviews, focus groups);Experience presenting and substantiating (both quantitatively and qualitatively) design decisions;In-depth familiarity with the latest trends in web and mobile user experience and responsive design;Experience and understanding of product management and the Agile process, namely Scrum and MVP;Familiarity with the retail environment and e-commerce is a strong asset.Experience in app design an asset;Experience with Jira/Confluence an asset.CompetenciesHighly self-motivated individual;Prepared to give and take constructive feedback on a daily basis;Ability to recognize that process is your friend, but not afraid to question why something is done a certain way or to identify opportunities when noticed;Enjoy partnering with business stakeholders to determine the best approach to meet at the intersection of user needs and business goals;Champion of user-centered design thinking, who understands that the best products are designed when the team embraces a collaborative and Agile culture and process;Advocate of user research and understands how to synthesize data into actionable solutions;Continuously looks to grow skill set and understanding of UX methodologies;Ability to thrive while working in a fast-paced, retail and innovative development environment;Strong communication skills across disciplines and the ability to effectively articulate experiential principles based on industry best practice guidelines, personal experience and research findings;Ability to define and execute best practices for user-centered design throughout the project life cycle;Ability to thrive in a work environment that requires strong problem solving skills and independent self-direction, coupled with an aptitude for team collaboration and open communication;User-focused and analytical; you will have a deep understanding and appreciation of the process of identifying users’ needs, coupled with the ability to balance the pros and cons of different designs, backed by research and analytics.Benefits: You will be rewarded for your contribution and dedication with a competitive salary and a bonus plan. We also offer a registered retirement savings plan in Canada and a flexible group insurance plan that meets all your needs thanks to personalized coverage, as well as an employee discount in our stores.Groupe Dynamite is committed to employment equity. Only those candidates who have been retained will be contacted for an interview.Job Type: Full-timeLocation:Montréal, QC
Title: UX/UI Designer

Job_Description: The Canadian-Muslim Vote is seeking a Digital Graphic Designer (DGD). You’ll work as part of our nonprofit team, servicing multiple grassroots projects based in the GTA, with reach across Canada. Typical duties would include but are not limited to the following: Designing, developing and producing web promotions, web content, external collateral including but not limited to new and existing launches Designing graphic elements, infographics, visual designs, image/content updates, newsletters and publications Building an inventory of publication templates Creating and editing other social media collateral Assisting with editing photos to be used on web pages, emails, social media, etc.  Skills Required: Advanced skills and creativity in graphic design (advanced skills in Photoshop, InDesign, Illustrator, etc.) Working knowledge of coding, UI/UX design, JAVA Script, HTML, CSS. Experience with responsive design is a plus. Artistic aptitude; excellent sense of design and typography Creative photography/video developing and editing skills Nationbuilder experience is an asset Experience in coding email campaigns is an asset Highly knowledgeable about different social media platforms (Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, WordPress, etc.) Political knowledge is an asset Bilingualism (French) preferred but not mandatory  Qualifications: Must have flexible working hours Performs duties under minimal supervision Proven ability to work effectively both independently and in a team-based environment Demonstrated willingness to be flexible and adaptable to changing priorities as an enthusiastic self-starter Strong organizational skills, and the ability to prioritize effectively and meet deadlines Ability to process suggestions, corrections and feedback professionally  How to apply: Interested candidates can apply by sending a cover letter and resume to hiring@canadianmuslimvote.ca with the subject line "Digital Creative Officer - [FULL NAME]".  Part-time and contract options are available. Compensation will be determined based on skills and experience.  TCMV is committed to access and equity and is an equal opportunity employer.
Title: Digital Graphic Designer

Job_Description: Product Designer (UI Designer)_______________________________________________________Flextrack - www.flextrackservices.comFlextrack's global mission is to be relentless in the development and delivery of the best possible solutions and services to help our clients improve their contingent staffing efficiency and business profitability. Our systems are designed with over 30 years of agency and vendor management experience, and our software is used by over 400 clients!Flextrack is looking for a Visual Designer with expertise in the mobile software design space to visualize and design the future of our Enterprise Client and Consultant Management tools.Product Designer (UI Designer)As a leader in the mobile-based software design space, the UI Designer will collaborate with our multi-disciplinary business and technology teams to design beautiful and intuitive multi-platform software products. Responsibilities include:Design delightful and beautiful visual elements for our suite of workforce management applications utilizing a Lean UX frameworkCollaborate with senior stakeholders to translate business and product requirements into wire frames, graphics, layouts, screen treatments, mobile design elements, and design templatesTranslate functional user requirements and experience parameters into wire frames, pixel-perfect mock-ups, story boards, wire frames and prototypesCollaborate with UX Thinkers, contributing to visualizing, designing and conceptualizing user experiencesPlan, coordinate and build high fidelity prototypes for user testingDesign a range of iterations, receive feedback and meet tight deadlines within a fast-paced environmentApply design principles to color, typography, layout and image choices appropriately to create visual solutions that meet business and user needsProvide quality assurance of creative deliverablesProduct Designer (UI Designer) - Must Have SkillsLean UX experience including participation in the creation of design templatesExperience designing beautiful and effective enterprise software products with an emphasis on mobile first and/or responsive designKnowledge of how front-end technologies (HTML, CSS) impact design decisionsPossess an online portfolio or samples of work demonstrating experience creating great end-to-end, user-centered design solutions and patterns, across desktop and mobile devicesExperience working across teams to synthesize feedback and input from product management, engineering, and customersGreat communication skills – ability to effectively pitch design concepts and articulate design decisions to senior managementStrong working knowledge of: Sketch, Photoshop, Axure, Illustrator, InDesign, Fireworks and associated design toolsExperience with, and comfortable in, an Agile environmentProduct Designer (UI Designer) - Nice to Have SkillsExperience working on dashboards, data visualization and applications with messaging/activity management functionsKnowledge of JavaScript based MVVM frameworks such as Angular.JS is a plusBachelor’s or Master’s degree in a relevant field of studyProduct Designer (UI Designer) - AdvantagesFlexible work hoursSilo free & flat work environmentFlexible dress codeTrue agile environment – daily stand ups – no red tapeWith 1 day a week work from home optionsLocation, location, location! - don't want to go outside in the winter? We’ve got you coveredCompetitive compensation and benefits packagesProduct Designer (UI Designer) - Start DateASAPProduct Designer (UI Designer) - Employment StatusPermanentProduct Designer (UI Designer) - Work LocationMid-town, TorontoJob Type: Full-timeSalary: $75,000.00 to $100,000.00 /yearExperience:UI Design: 3 years
Title: Product Designer (UI Designer)

Job_Description: Nous valorisons la diversité et avons à cœur de créer un milieu de travail inclusif qui nous inspire tous à donner le meilleur de nous-mêmes. Joignez-vous à notre équipe et faites une différence!  Votre poste  Nous Comment imaginez-vous les bureaux d’une compagnie d’assurance? Et l’atmosphère de travail qui y règne? Nous gageons que si vous passez nous voir au Lab de Intact, vous serez très surpris! Situé au centre-ville de Montréal, nous sommes un laboratoire d’innovation dont la mission est de créer des produits à la fine-pointe de l’insurtech qui améliorent la vie de millions de Canadiens.  Mariant la convivialité et la vélocité d’une startup aux ressources et aux moyens d’une grande entreprise (vous disposerez de tous les outils dont vous avez toujours rêvé!), le Lab est un environnement jeune et dynamique, offrant des défis stimulants, des collègues inspirants et une carrière passionnante (chez un des top 100 employeurs au Canada). C’est l’endroit idéal pour parfaire vos compétences et faire évoluer votre carrière.  Vous Vous êtes passionné par le commerce électronique et l’innovation numérique? Vous avez un talent particulier pour traduire des exigences complexes en expériences utiles et agréables? Vous restez à l’affût des dernières tendances en matière de design et vous aimez expérimenter de nouveaux outils et de nouvelles méthodologies? Nous avons l’occasion parfaite pour vous!  Rôle À titre de designer UX/UI, vous jouerez un rôle essentiel dans la conception et l’évolution de notre écosystème numérique. Relevant du directeur principal, Innovations numériques, vous aurez comme principales responsabilités :  Concevoir des expériences captivantes en vue de réaliser les objectifs d’affaires  Valider la fonctionnalité et l’utilité par l’entremise de tests et de recherches auprès des utilisateurs  Produire des livrables UX et design pertinents au besoin  Piloter une feuille de route aux côté d’un directeur de produit et d’une équipe agile multidisciplinaire  Présenter le travail aux parties prenantes  Aider les ingénieurs à produire des interfaces de qualité et agréables  Prôner une conception axée sur l’utilisateur et les données  Vos compétences  Minimum trois années d’expérience  Expertise en matière de convivialité et de pratiques de conception centrées sur l'utilisateur  Maîtrise des outils de conception (Sketch, Axure, InVision, Illustrator, etc.)  Expérience des outils de recherche UX (usertesting.com, Optimal Workshop, etc.) un atout  Expérience dans la production de flux de processus, d’inventaires de contenu, etc.  Vous aimez travailler dans un environnement de collaboration qui accorde une importance primordiale au travail d’équipe, à l’innovation, à l’ouverture d’esprit et au plaisir  Veuillez inclure votre portfolio dans votre dossier de candidature.  Vous êtes  Une personne avec qui il est agréable de travailler  Créatif, analytique, curieux et ingénieux  Un joueur d’équipe capable de partager et recevoir des commentaires constructifs  Excellent pour expliquer vos idées à différents intervenants  Profondément passionné par le design et la qualité  Organisé et proactif  En tant que salarié temps plein, vous bénéficierez des avantages suivants :  Un salaire compétitif  Un boni de performance annuel  Un régime de retraite  Un horaire de travail flexible de 35 heures par semaine  Des assurances médicales et dentaires hors pair  Et plusieurs autres avantages et bénéfices (remboursement gym, conférences, etc.)  Énoncé fermeture  Cette opportunité vous intéresse? Nous avons très hâte de faire votre connaissance!  D’excellents avantages sont offerts : salaire concurrentiel, avantages flexibles, aménagements de travail flexibles, congés mobiles, régime de retraite à prestation déterminée, etc.  Dans le cadre du processus de sélection d’Intact, les candidats peuvent être appelés à donner leur consentement à une vérification de leurs antécédents pertinente au poste à pourvoir avant de recevoir une offre d’emploi. Celle-ci peut comprendre une confirmation des références d’emploi, des études et des titres de compétences, une vérification des emplois, de l’identité, des infractions criminelles et du permis de conduire ainsi qu’un rapport de crédit.  Vous pouvez soumettre votre candidature à un emploi affiché pourvu que vous occupiez vos fonctions actuelles depuis au moins douze mois et que votre performance soit jugée bonne ou que votre contrat temporaire arrive à son échéance. Une recherche de talents à l'externe est menée parallèlement au recrutement à l'interne Veuillez donc prendre note que des candidats potentiels pourraient avoir été identifiés pour ce poste dans le cadre de leur plan de développement.   Veuillez noter que l'usage du masculin a comme but d'alléger le texte.  Cet affichage prendra fin 02 juin 2018.  Prime de recommandation  CE POSTE EST SUJET À UNE PRIME DE RECOMMANDATION DE 3000$.  #li-qc  Droit de travailler au Canada  Les personnes qui posent leur candidature à un poste permanent doivent, dès leur embauche, avoir le droit de travailler au Canada de façon permanente. Les documents pouvant servir de preuve dans le cas des rôles permanents sont un certificat de naissance canadien, un passeport canadien, un certificat de citoyenneté canadienne, une carte de résident permanent ou une confirmation de son statut de résident permanent pour prouver qu’il a le droit de travailler au Canada.  Indeed Commandité  IN-INFR
Title: Designer UX/UI

Job_Description: Travailler chez Genius Solutions c'est : Joindre une équipe passionnée et dynamique qui a à cœur le succès de l’entreprise. C’est également joindre une entreprise en constante évolution dans un environnement stimulant et dans un marché hautement compétitif .Vous avez de l’intérêt à travailler chez Genius? Assurez-vous de vous reconnaitre dans les valeurs de l’entreprise :Vous êtes énergique et passionné : pour atteindre le succès, nous avons besoin de gens avec une énergie débordante démontrant une passion pour leur travail.Vous êtes en mission : les défis sont grands pour nous et nos clients et nous devons faire face à plusieurs obstacles. Pour mener à bien notre mission, il est essentiel de garder le cap!Vous êtes un bon joueur d’équipe : nous croyons fermement que le respect et la confiance sont des ingrédients essentiels au succès.Vous valorisez la connaissance et l’expertise : Genius valorise grandement les gens qui veulent progresser, acquérir de nouvelles connaissances et développer leur expertise.Vous vous reconnaissez dans les valeurs de la compagnie? Oui?Continuons!Designer UX / UI chez Genius Solutions : Nous recherchons actuellement un designer UX/UI . Cette personne aura comme principale fonction la conception de l’interface utilisateur de la prochaine version web de notre application, Genius Manufacturing . La personne sélectionnée devra analyser l’expérience client actuelle, proposer des améliorations et présenter des concepts de maquettes (mockup). Elle devra également accompagner l’équipe de développement informatique tout au long du projet.Les tâches et responsabilités : Effectuer une analyse et une prise de besoins (clients et experts internes)Étudier et analyser les produits et tendances sur le marchéÉtablir des plans et concepts afin de les présenter au comité responsableDévelopper et documenter les outils qui seront utilisés à l’interneOffrir de formation et coaching à notre équipeConnaissances et profil recherchés : Expérience en design d’application web spécialiséeExpérience UX / UI3 à 5 années d’expérience pertinentesMaitrise des logiciels de maquettes (mockup)Niveau avancé de maitrise de la langue anglaise (parlé et écrit)Aimer travailler en mode agileConnaissance de logiciel de type ERP serait un atout importantConditions de travail : Une super équipeUn salaire compétitifUn horaire de travail flexibleVacances + 5 congés payés par annéeDes assurances collectivesDes activités socialesEt bien plus...Lieu de travail : QuébecMots clés : Web – Migration – Développement – Interface – Utilisateur – Expérience client – Mockup – Besoin – Designer – Amélioration – Analyse – ERP – Application – Logiciel – Navigation – Agile – Ergonomie – Graphique – Normes – Livrables – Architecture – Interaction – Interactivité – Solution – Numérique – Mobile – Utilisateur – Visuel – CréativitéType d'emploi : Temps Plein
Title: Designer UX / UI

Job_Description: Join Windsor's most innovative, fun and Silicon-Valley-esque development and innovation company, bringing world-class projects to Windsor. Help us build exciting technology like multiplayer game servers for Atari, social apps for Puma, high profile analytics engines for The PGA Tour, and cutting edge products like natural-language-processing chat-bots.As one of Windsor's most sought-after companies to work for, we offer flexible time, work-at-home days, a great benefits plan and in-office massage. We are located in the heart of Windsor's historic Walkerville. You must be willing to work in our office. We are not interested in off-shore or remote work.We are seeking talented interface designers who are looking to grow professionally and personally within a fast-growing company. You will work on a variety of marketing deliverables, including websites, prototypes, wireframes, business collateral and other design pieces.ResponsibilitiesWork on the design of user interfaces for web and mobile projectsAble to help with wireframing using tools like Adobe XD and BalsamiqAble to self-direct and work independently, to manage multiple, concurrent projects simultaneously from start to finishRequirements: Expertise in Adobe Creative Suite: Illustrator, Photoshop, InDesign, After Effects, EdgeKnowledge of responsive web designAbility to create interactive prototypesCustomer-obsessed, detail-oriented and comfortable working on highly technical teamsDemonstrated experience with building user interfaces across a range of platforms including desktop and mobile--- Please send examples of your design portfolio (specifically web design) when you apply. ---We look forward to meeting you!Job Type: Full-timeEducation:High school or equivalentLocation:Windsor, ON
Title: Web Designer / UI / UX

Title: Designer UX / UI

Job_Description: User Experience Designer  ABOUT IT AT CN  CN harnesses the power of information every minute of every day to make better decisions. Almost every aspect of our business relies on technology; this is why CN invests around $100 million every year on IT projects and infrastructure. And with close to 1,000 in-house employees, CN’s IT team is more than a first-class technology shop – they’re railroaders, dedicated to enabling our people to work better and to helping our trains run safely.  WHY YOU WANT THIS JOB  The User-Experience Designer play a key role in enabling user/technology adoption, improving user engagement and trust in the application. This person is responsible to learn and understand how users work for producing creative user-centric experiences and application interfaces. Their role is to understand user pain points and areas of concern to match people’s needs with what is technologically feasible to provide maximum business and user values. As a User Experience Designer, you are conducting user research, creating journey maps and wireframes to define optimal system usability. You are also responsible to produce high fidelity Mock-ups, visual prototypes as well as initial UI code framework for front-end efficiency and cohesive backend integration. You collaborate with application and data designers to understand underneath business rules and data flow that needs to be consider for user interface design, support code development, and insure that product meets client need by conducting usability testing with Business.  You want this job because you advocate, at all time, user experience to improve user/technology adoption, reduce usability problem and increase user effectiveness in their day-to-day work. You have a solid experience in creating wireframes, storyboards, high fidelity mock-up and prototype. You have a technical background that enable you to support the front-end developers that are responsible for coding the UI framework. You are driven by innovation and up-to-date with the latest UI trends, techniques, and technologies with deep understanding of mobile-first and responsive design.  RESPONSIBILITIES Conduct user workshops and stakeholder interview to discover range of opportunities for experience improvement Facilitate client vision leading user experience workshops to determine target audiences, user needs, data requirements and compile them into user flows and storyboards Understand business rules, user-system interaction, data models and flows, to ideate and translate concept to begin laying out interfaces (wireframes) Understand and work with various technologies to determine the appropriate framework to produce the application Produce High-Fidelity Mockups and Prototypes Produce visual assets such as icons and visual style guide elements Improve proposed model through usability sessions and user feedback Document user interface behavior and interaction patternsCollaborate with UI developers to provide integration solutions for applications; ensuring the usability interface components are optimally performing well with dynamic data Drive usability testing with the business and adjust product to improve user experience REQUIREMENTS  Bachelor degree inComputer sciences or Software Engineering with a focus on Front-End Engineering and User Experience Design OR Bachelor degree in Graphic / Visual design (or equivalent training) Gradutate level education in human computer interaction or cognitive ergonomics is considered an asset Minimum of 5-7 years of relevant experience in using UX design best practices to design solutions, and a deep understanding of mobile-first, responsive design and Front-End Development Experience with Front-End Framework libraries, and custom integration using HTML5, CSS3 and Preprocessors (Both LESS and SASS), JavaScript (jQuery) Experience with vector-based and/or prototyping applications (Adobe Illustrator, Adobe Interactive Design, Sketch, Axure, MarvelApp, inVision) Familiar with Agile and Waterfall project methodologies Ability to work with business clients to understand detailed requirements and design complete user experiences that meet client needs and vision Understand the importance of user-centered design Bilingualism with high proficiency in English (spoken and written)   CN is an employment equity employer and we encourage all qualified candidates to apply. We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only candidates under consideration will be contacted. Please monitor your email on a regular basis, as communication is primarily made through email.
Title: User Experience Designer

Job_Description: Imagine New Horizons…  As the user-experience designer intern within a team dedicated to make a Vision about Virtual Ergonomics come to life through a new product, you will help in conceiving and conducting user research, interviews and surveys, as well as translating them into wireframes and prototypes. You will also help to design the overall functionality of a new product and iterate upon it to ensure a great user experience.  We are seeking a curious and motivated student currently enrolled in a recognized UX/UI Designer program, preferably at Master level, for a 4 months internship.  Do you have dreams? Do you enjoy challenges? Here at Dassault Systèmes, we empower people with passion to change the world.  Shape your career with3DS! #WeAre3DS  What will your role be?  Help the UX/UI Designer to: Translate concepts into wireframes and prototypes that lead to intuitive user experiences Facilitate client’s product visions by researching, conceiving, wireframing, sketching, prototyping, and mocking up user experiences for digital products Identify design problems and devise elegant solutions Make strategic design and user-experience decisions related to new functions and features Take a user-centered design approach and rapidly test and iterate your designs Collaborate with other team members and stakeholders Take smart risks and champion new ideas  Your challenges ahead: Ability to work with clients to understand detailed requirements A grasp of user-centered design and testing methodologies, subsystems, and usability and accessibility concerns Ability to iterate your designs and solutions efficiently and intelligently Ability to clearly and effectively communicate design processes, ideas, and solutions to teams and clients Clear understanding of the importance of user-centered design Be excited about collaborating and communicating closely with teams and other stakeholders via a distributed model to regularly deliver design solutions for approval Be willing to help teammates, share knowledge and experience with them, and learn from them Be open to receiving feedback and constructive criticism Research and showcase knowledge in the industry’s latest trends and technologies Your key success factors  Actively enrolled in a recognized UX/UI Designer program, preferably at Master level Having completed at least one project or internship in an industrial environment Be passionate about UX and other areas of design and innovation Expertise in UX software such as InVision, UXPin, Balsamiq, Framer.js, Quartz Composer, and the like Extensive experience in using UX design best practices to design solutions Fluency in French and English, both orally and in writing
Title: UX Designer Virtual Ergonomics Team Internship, September -...

Job_Description: LawDepot.com is currently expanding and looking to recruit a UX Designer in Edmonton, Alberta. Working with the Marketing team, you will be responsible for designing web content and delivering an excellent user experience for LawDepot products and websites. This is a full time permanent position, working 37.5 hours per week. Primary Responsibilities Deliver user-focused design best practices to improve real business processes Refine and redesign our website to create simple, beautiful user experiences for all screen types Create wireframes, storyboards and prototypes, then turn them into fully-realized mockups Manage, document and analyze requirements to translate business needs into an engaging user experience Collaborate with Marketing, Product and Legal team members to define design objectives Work with the Development department to create specs and efficient implementation plans Knowledge and Skill Requirements Post-secondary education in a Design related program Experience in a User Experience (UX) Designer, User Interface (UI) Designer, Web Designer or Graphic Designer role Impressive design portfolio showcasing UI/UX design for a variety of screen types Familiarity with the following UX disciplines: interaction design, information architecture, user research, storyboarding, wireframe creation, concept design and prototyping Extensive, up-to-date knowledge of web design best practices Proficiency with Adobe Creative Suite Why You Should Join the LawDepot Team Excellent total compensation package Comprehensive health and dental benefits, plus an additional Health Care Spending Account Flexible work hours Paid vacation plus bonus personal days Access to continuous learning opportunities, including a subscription to LinkedIn Learning Company share plan Free weekly catered lunch for the entire office Casual work environment Top of the line Microsoft Surface Studio workstation Access to Adobe Creative Cloud
Title: User Experience (UX) Designer

Job_Description: Beenox is a video game development studio created in 2000. Located in beautiful Quebec City, Canada, Beenox is a wholly owned subsidiary of Activision Publishing Inc., one of the world’s top game developers.  The studio is proud to contribute to the development of the Call of Duty video game franchise. Beenox has also contributed to the resounding success of the Skylanders, Spider-Man, and Guitar Hero franchises. As members of the Beenox family, we feel as if we’re part of a group of like-minded people who are great to work with. Our studio is a real open world where it’s easy to have discussions with everyone, including our studio co-heads. Here everyone brings their own unique touch to projects that showcase their talent on a global stage. You could say that video games are in our blood! HERE'S WHAT AWAITS YOU IN THIS JOB:  As a UX Designer, you’ll be asked to contribute to the creation of a top-quality user experience for our players. You will achieve this objective by promoting an approach centered around the user, based on human psychology principles user observations (user tests) and graphic design guidelines.  You’ll have to ensure that the experience and immersion of the user are aligned with the game design intents. Plus, you’ll oversee the identification of potentials friction points related to ergonomics or player communication, both from a visual and functional standpoint. You will be responsible for coming up with potential solutions to those issues.  You’ll need to: Analyze the game’s UI/UX needs based on the type of user, game direction, market trends and industry standards and adapt it to find the right balance between innovation and conventions; Develop various game UI elements (HUDs, tutorials, menus…) while working closely with the UI and Design teams; Design the structure and user flow of interface elements while ensuring a good information hierarchy and a quality player communication; Document systems related to interfaces and user experience (UX) for the development team by creating flowcharts and wireframes; Work closely with Game Designers to complement the documentation of Game Design features and get a good understanding of the design intentions for the UI and player communication; Test various possible options of game UI elements by creating functional prototypes; Contribute to implementing and integrating in-game UI; Work closely with UI Designers and Programmers to ensure the quality of the product; Act as a leader regarding User Experience issues to the rest of the team; Participate actively in build reviews and iterate quickly based on the team’s feedback.   YOU ARE:  Experienced: You have at least three (3) years of experience working in a video game studio or the equivalent, as a UX Designer, Game Designer, UI Designer or equivalent. You have experience in AAA or FPS development (asset). Competent: You know the video game development pipeline plus you are efficient and work meticulously. You have a great understanding of the technical constraints of game development (including game engines and game editors); Expert: You have a solid background in interactivity and User-centered interface design. You own complex tasks and ensure that you deliver quality. You also have a good understanding of human psychology principles and how they apply to UX game design (asset); Informed: You‘ve kept up with the latest innovations in UX and you make it your business to stay up to date. You also are more than aware of the latest gaming trends. You follow the Call of Duty series closely and you understand its essence (asset); Versatile: You’re proficient with prototyping and rapid iterations based on feedback. You are especially at ease with Photoshop, Visio and other flowcharts, wireframes and functional mockups software. Photoshop and Substance Painter. You also have basic skills in scripting or programming (asset). Team player: You like to work in in collaboration with a multidisciplinary team. You communicate effectively with people of various backgrounds – both in English and French. Resourceful: You’re keen to learn how to use new internal tools and you don’t get discouraged when faced with regular change.
Title: UX Designer - Beenox - Applicant Bank

Job_Description: Description  The UX Designer is responsible for designing a seamless and minimalist user experience for Sofdesk’s market leading products in roofing and solar. In collaboration with our lead developers and subject matter experts, you will spearhead the design of web & mobile applications that will help small & medium entrepreneurs grow their business. By joining Sofdesk, you will be part of a fast-growing startup focused on developing innovative solutions to accelerate the adoption of green technologies.  Responsibilities  Understand product specifications, application domain and user psychology  Develop wireframes and prototypes around customer needs  Conduct concept and usability testing and gather feedback  Find creative ways to solve UX problems (e.g. usability, efficiency)  Communicate design ideas and prototypes to developers  Keep abreast of competitor products and industry trends  Requirements  Proven experience as a UX Designer, UI Designer or similar role  Strong portfolio of design projects in web and mobile  Familiarity with interaction design and information architecture  Proficient in design software (e.g. Axure, Balsamiq, InVision)  Analytical mind with a business acumen  Excellent communication skills  Benefits  You'll join a young organization that focuses on renewable energy in the heart of the Atwater Market and succeeds by bringing out the best in its people. You'll be part of a supportive, inclusive team that shares common values - including a fundamental respect for each other.  Working at Sofdesk is being part of a dynamic team that evolves every day. We focus on self-improvement. The schedules are flexible and there is always room to bring new ideas, technical or business.  Foosball competitions, a dart board, a soccer turf, hockey, games, lots of sun, free coffee and popcorn are all part of the deal : )  ---  Mandat  Le Concepteur UX est responsable de concevoir un design épuré et une expérience utilisateur fluide pour les produits de Sofdesk dans les domaines du solaire et de la toiture. En collaboration avec les développeurs principaux et les experts en la matière, vous dirigerez le design d'applications web et mobiles qui aident les entrepreneurs de petite et moyenne taille à faire croitre leur entreprise. En vous joignant à Sofdesk, vous ferez partie d'une start-up dédiée à la mise en oeuvre de solutions innovatrices pour accélérer l'adoption d'énergies vertes.  Responsabilités  Comprendre les spécifications du produit, le domaine d'affaires et la psychologie de l'utilisateur  Développer des canvas et des prototypes en lien avec les besoins des utilisateurs  Mener des tests d'utilisabilité et recueillir les rétroactions  Résoudre de manière créative des problèmes UX (ie. utilisabilité, efficience)  Communiquer les éléments de design et les prototypes aux développeurs  Se garder à l'affut des produits concurrents et des tendances de l'industrie  Qualifications  Expérience pertinente en tant que Designer UX/UI ou rôle similaire  Portfolio solide de projets web et mobile  Familier avec le design d'interactions et l'architecture de l'information  Maîtrise des outils de design (e.g. Axure, Balsamiq, InVision)  Esprit analytique et sens des affaires  Excellent aptitudes en communication  Bénéfices  Vous joindrez une organisation qui oeuvre dans le secteur des énergies renouvelables et qui est située au coeur du marché Atwater. Vous ferez partie d'une équipe inclusive qui vous supportera et qui partage des valeurs communes - incluant un respect fondamental de tous et chacun.  Travailler chez Sofdesk c'est faire partie d'une équipe dynamique qui évolue à tous les jours. On met la priorité sur le développement des employés. Les horaires sont flexibles et il y a toujours de la place pour amener de nouvelles idées, qu'elles soient pour le côté affaires ou le côté technique.  Parties de baby-foot, un jeu de darts, mini-terrain de soccer/hockey, PS4, beaucoup de soleil, café et pop-corn gratuit font partie de l'expérience!
Title: UX Designer / Concepteur UX

Job_Description: Busbud is the bus travel booking app and website with the largest sellable coverage. Users can search, compare and buy tickets from hundreds of bus companies in over 13,000 cities and more than 1M different bus routes. We're working hard to make the bus, one of the most environmentally friendly and sustainable modes of transportation, a great travel option for customers in dozens of languages in over 70 different countries. Our platform unites travelers, partners and bus companies throughout the world to move an increasingly large share of the entire industry online to increase access and improve the travel experience. Our people, technology and approach have been instrumental in getting us this far, but we have so much more to do, and that's where you come in.   What do we expect from you? Produce reproducible UI designs for all our products/platforms (mobile web, desktop web, iOS/Android apps, email); Identify UX problems and develop solutions with product managers and engineers; Create graphic designs for our landing pages and apps; Maintain, complete and improve a consistent, cross-platform style guide; Contribute to product planification, user research and integration efforts; Support marketing, brand, recruiting efforts.   How can you impress us? Capacity to leverage data (research, user feedback, benchmarking, analytics, market data) to formulate assumptions that explain your design choices; Capacity to consider multiple design options with pros and cons; Attention to details and appreciation for quality in design, composition and implementation; Ability to contribute to product-related discussions; Ability to communicate clearly and efficiently with stakeholders; Good knowledge of UX/UI challenges in mobility, travel or e-commerce; Examples of previous digital design projects; Good understanding of HTML, CSS and a (or more) components-based Javascript framework; Good knowledge of Sketch; Up to date with the latest design guidelines and trends. What’s in it for you? Compensation based on experience 4 weeks of vacation (3 weeks + holiday season) Health Benefits Stock options Apple equipment Breakfast snacks, team lunch on Wednesdays, happy hour on Fridays Team events  Visas and work permits If you are not already authorized to live and work in Canada, we will sponsor the following work permits: R204(a) T23 (university graduates who are citizens of the U.S., Mexico, Chile, Peru, Colombia or South Korea) IEC Young Professionals (age and citizenship requirements) Employer-specific work permit   Busbud is committed to equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing its team members with a work environment free from discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at Busbud are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, regardless of race, colour, religion or belief, national, social or ethnic origin, sex, age, physical, mental or sensory disability, HIV status, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, marital, civil union or domestic partnership status, pregnancy, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. Learn more about why we care about diversity.

Job_Description: Job Description (EN)      Data Visualization and Editorial Designer  The Toronto Star’s award-winning Editorial Design team is adding another talented Data Visualization and Editorial Designer to design and develop compelling visual narratives and amazing interactive graphics.  You are excited to provide enhanced visual storytelling and reporting for the web, as well as sourcing, cleaning, interpreting and presenting data. You will help with sourcing and are keenly passionate about using the best data tools available. You have a diverse background and bring a familiarity with various data formats and associated techniques such as access-to-information requests, scraping, graphics and mapping. You also have a strong understanding of the fundamentals of news reporting, including accuracy, fairness and issues involving privacy.  The applicant should possess strong design skills and remain current with technology and digital storytelling methods and trends, with a particular focus on mobile presentation.  You are able to successfully blend design, data and programming skills with a journalism sensibility!  What You Will Do… Designing news stories by leveraging a combination of typography, photos, videos and motion Designing data visualizations and maps based on datasets and data analysis for tight deadlines Familiarity with open-data portals and other sources of public data Helping to build data visualization tools that can be used across the newsroom  Why You Will Be Successful: A university degree with minimum 2 years’ experience in data visualization Strong conceptualization and visual communication abilities Working knowledge of web technologies (HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, APIs, etc.) Experience with data visualizations libraries such as d3.js Knowledge of mapping applications (Mapbox, Google Maps or Leaflet) Expertise in Adobe Photoshop and Illustrator Proficiency with UX, UI and social media Work within tight deadlines for breaking news  Why You’ll LOVE Working Here… The opportunity to be part of an exciting company grounded in history while striving to be at the cutting edge of the digital media industry; you'll never get bored in our fast-paced, constantly evolving and challenging environment We recognize that you have a life outside of work and we offer you real work/life balance We provide individualized career plans and extensive ongoing development opportunities We've got your health in mind; you'll get a comprehensive benefits package & group RSP (Extended Health Care, Dental, etc.) combined with a generous vacation plan  …And let’s not forget the AWESOME PEOPLE!  The company is committed to providing an inclusive and barrier free recruitment process to applicants with accessibility needs in accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA). If you require an accommodation during this process, please inform the company of your requirements.
Title: Data Visualization and Editorial Designer (Digital Designer)

Job_Description: The Software Engineering team at AbacusNext has a career opportunity for a UX/IU Designer specializing in text analytics located in Toronto.  WHO WE ARE  AbacusNext® helps businesses with stringent security and compliance needs grow by providing Compliance-Ready™ turnkey technology solutions, allowing our clients to leverage the power of cloud computing without the added challenges and expenses of managing complex IT infrastructures on their own. As an end-to-end solutions provider, our products and services portfolio includes virtual desktop (DaaS), private cloud, case management software (CMS), email hosting services, security endpoint protection, business continuity (BCP), and on premise solutions. Since 1983, we have delivered on-demand services to over 500,000 businesses worldwide, and recognized by Forbes as one of America’s fastest growing companies.  We were founded on one simple concept: improving the lives of professionals through the use of technology. Its competencies serve to simplify the adoption, implementation, and management of technology to quickly increase revenues, reduce costs, and maximize efficiencies, while keeping security and compliance at the forefront.  WHAT WE DO  We serve clients at every level of their organization, in whatever capacity we can be most useful, whether as a trusted advisor to large firm executive management or as a hands-on coach for sole practitioners. Target verticals include lawyers, general counsel, accounting firms, CPAs, government, and other private professional service organizations. For every engagement, we propose a solution tailored to meet their unique business needs and provide the utmost care in the implementation process.  No matter the challenge, we focus on delivering practical and enduring results, and equipping our clients to grow and lead. We partner with clients to put solution recommendations into practice and grow their businesses through the leverage of highly secure, compliant and functional business systems.  THE POSITION  Do you believe that all digital products should benefit from the principles and processes of a user-centred design? That the business tools that people use daily should adhere to the same standards of design and usability as the other tools in their digital lives? Do you want to take ownership of a product, be involved in all stages of its development, and help define and drive UX design strategy for a whole company? Do you know your Segoe from your San Francisco?  We are seeking a User Experience Designer to join our product development team in Edinburgh, servicing teams in Edinburgh and the U.S. You should be motivated by the responsibilities and benefits of sound design practice, and be a passionate advocate for the processes and results by which these principles are expressed (the kind of person who experiences acute professional frustration on discovering pull handles on a door that can only be pushed).  Working alongside our Agile development teams as we expand our core enterprise desktop and cloud products, you will have a portfolio that demonstrates proven experience in user research methods, design prototyping and user-testing, with a keen eye for detail, elegant design and layout, from initial wireframe to final implementation. Our culture embraces doing what is best for others — clients, colleagues, and the community — while taking a long-term perspective on the organisations success.  REQUIREMENTS  Bachelor’s degree in design, HCI or UCD-related field Familiarity with technical considerations of design for desktop and web Experience of working in an Agile development environment Fluency in the conventions and best practices of interaction design and usability Excellent analytical and communication skills – can you present to persuade? Familiarity with the usual UX design tool suspects: Adobe CS, Balsamiq, Sketch, Axure, InVision etc. Proven projects with portfolio of previous work  PERSONAL QUALITIES  A passion for all things design, visual and product – eat it, live it, breath it The flexibility and the ability to dynamically multi-task – you’ll be working across different teams and products The ability to communicate and justify design decisions to technical and business audiences – just why is that subtle animated cue so vital? PERKS  Competitive salary Paid Vacations Full Health/Dental/Vision/Life benefits Paid time off for training and certifications Weekly paid lunches Company provided beverages and snacks Casual dress code Quarterly company outings Equal Employment Opportunity  AbacusNext is an Equal Opportunity, Affirmative Action Employer.
Title: UX/UI Designer Toronto

We offer career growth, a competitive compensation package, and a collaborative environment.Job Type: Full-timeSalary: $80,000.00 to $120,000.00 /yearExperience:B2B Web Application: 2 yearsUI: 4 yearsUX: 3 yearsEducation:Bachelor'sLocation:Toronto, ON
Title: Senior UI/UX Product Designer

Job_Description: Not your everyday designer position. Challenging and fast moving, yet friendly and supportive: a career you will look forward to every day. Work with intelligent people in an exciting environment where every month is different.Positions Available:UI/UX DesignerOther Positions: We are also hiring for other positions (front-end developer, digital advertising specialist, media and marketing communications, marketing project manager, business analyst, account manager, infrastructure analyst, software developer, and more). You may apply for multiple positions separately. If you know someone in any of these areas, please do them a quick and friendly favour by letting them know about this posting.Position Overview:Full time and permanentFast movingin terms of variety of work and expectations.Flexible hours(for example: choose to start your day between 6am and 10am, work late some days and shorter on others).80% internalprojects (for multiple product lines), 20% client projectsGain valuable career experience with campaigns from mature departmentsto early stage start-up departments, and from patented disruptive products to more routine competitive sectors.Gain valuable career experience in a variety of platforms(for example: web, responsive web, native mobile phone, tablet, and maybe even kiosk).Gain experience with both simple and highly complex projects.Responsible for ensuring a world-class user experiencein terms of clarity of meaning, discovery of features, and speed of use.Will get to know our brandover the long-term to produce deep insight "wow" results that continue our brand's fast growth.Interviewing stakeholdersto determine the purpose and goals of new software, or starting from business requirement documents.Informal usability studieslike watching in-person or video usage of software to discover areas needing improvement.Formal usability studies (fairly rare).Creating wireframes, interactive mockups, and innovative concept proposals.Collaborating with the marketing team and front-end developers.Engage in constructive debateto challenge designs; we care about employee health.Free onsite massagetherapy.Private nap roomsfor isolated thinking time or for taking a nap if you didn’t sleep well last night.Atrium to enjoy the sun during lunch.Social events worth remembering(fencing competitions, curling, video game or board game parties, coding competitions, commando combat training, robotics clubcoming soon, etc).An example of our culture: Lunch togetheris in a very comfy sofa room, and even the quiet types are comfortable there.Unlimited access to pillage our kitchens for caffeine, sugar, healthy snacks, soups, and more : )Additional perks that are cost-shared like motorized sit-stand desks.Task focused: everyone in the company heavily uses centralized to-do lists to stay organized, prioritize, and coordinate.Fast pacedConsistent work/life balance: mandatory overtime is very rare.About The Company:Pleasant Solutions is a dynamic company headquartered in Edmonton, a large satellite office in Toronto/Vancouver, and small satellite offices across Canada and the USA (including in Calgary, Ottawa, Saskatoon, New York, Denver, Boston, etc)Silicon Valley kind of excitementand growth potential.Fast growth: One of the 200 fastest growing technology companies in North America with 955% growth over 5 years (based on growth rates in published rankings of the 2014 Profit 500 and 2013 Deloitte Technology Fast 500).
