Title: UI / UX Designer (Exciting user experience opportunity with...

Job_Description: Job Description  Summary: The incumbent contributes to the development of game ergonomics through application projects, tools, accessibility and signs and feedback. The incumbent will work in close collaboration with the UI team, user research laboratory, 3C team and level design team. Responsibilities:  The main and routine tasks of this position are to: Design logic, layout and flow the game’s user interfaces including HUD, menus, and lobby based on information architecture and accessibility principles; Ensure that signs and feedback clearly communicate the game information based on best practices in accessibility; Ensure optimal interaction feedback and minimal control latency; Advise and collaborate with game designers to determine the best controls and inputs to support game features for a fluid and consistent player experience;Create functional prototypes for rapid iterations on key elements;Implement an optimal interface layout plan;Ensure that the interface arrangement accounts for localization constraints;Account for user feedback and the efficient use of user research services to optimize the game experience;Carry out all other related tasks.  Training: Attestation of collegial studies (AEC) in video game design or equivalent video game background. Relevant experience: Minimum two years’ relevant experience in the video game industry, specifically as a game designer, a UX designer, a UI designer, an industrial designer, an ergonomist or a 3C programmer. Qualifications  Skills and knowledge: Solid grasp of ergonomic principles applied to video games; Ability to create functional prototypes; Knowledge of information architecture and industrial design; Strong communication and presentation skills; Ability to innovate and design exceptional user experiences; Understanding of lean UX concepts and the ability to work within a continuous flow environment (ability to think holistically while building and learning iteratively); Ability to rely on a user-focused business design approach. The incumbent is expected to possess expertise in the following field:  User interface and user research Ability to create computer-human interaction guides; Knowledge of interface programming an asset; Ability to autonomously create functional, highly interactive prototypes (gamepad, animations, transitions) that convincingly simulate UI/HUD widgets; Knowledge of user research methodology (quantitative and qualitative analysis methods, biometrics, user questionnaires, etc.). Additional Information  null
Title: User Experience (UX) Designer

Job_Description: Job brief Muse websites provide users the information they are looking for, presented in a way that makes their experience easy and enjoyable. User Experience(UX) and User Interface(UI) are a priority for all Muse websites. Great design helps convey the story in a logical and compelling order, making sure that the most important messages are easy to find and short enough to keep the user’s attention.  We are looking for an experienced Web Designer with a diverse skill set, positive attitude, and desire to grow creatively and professionally with the Muse team. You are a problem solver with the drive to develop and improve best practices in your work.  Our Web Designer will be responsible for creative brand concepts and the execution of deliverables. Working with a collaborative and multi-disciplinary team, you will balance creative thinking, excellent communication skills and leadership.  Responsibilities: Design, development and implementation of powerful brand experiences for the web UX, UI, wireframes, mockups, sitemaps Responsive web pages for mobile, tablet, and desktop Collaboration with marketing team, senior management, designers, and other project stakeholders Participate in strategic brainstorming, concept development, creative brief development and creative execution Work on multiple projects simultaneously Contribute to innovative development with our creative team Participate in new business initiatives Requirements: BA/BS degree or equivalent working experience 3+ years experience, preferably in a digital agency Strong background with HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, and jQuery Expertise in UI/UX best practices An exceptional design portfolio
Title: Web Designer

Job_Description: Raison dêtre En partenariat avec léquipe Production design & Expérience numérique, le Designer Full-stack est impliqué dans plusieurs phases des projets numériques, de la conception à lintégration. Il est chargé dadapter et décliner les contenus sur les différentes plateformes, tout en respectant les spécificités du client interne et en tenant compte des habitudes et contextes dutilisation des consommateurs. Il apporte son expertise aux projets damélioration des sites e-commerce de Kimpex et participe au développement de micro-sites marketing. Défis à relever  Décliner des concepts graphiques en versions numériques adaptées aux diverses plateformes et aux consommateurs  Adapter et intégrer des landing pages à laide de CMS tel que WordPress, HubSpot et autres CMS internes  En collaboration avec léquipe Marketing web, optimiser et intégrer les contenus pour améliorer les performances SEO  Fournir des maquettes UX/UI wireframe aux développeurs web lors de projets damélioration dinterfaces des sites  Supporter léquipe Marketing web avec les plateformes HubSpot, WordPress, FlippingBook, Cloudflare, SurveyMonkey  Cerner les opportunités damélioration et suggérer des idées astucieuses alignées aux meilleures pratiques du web  Effectuer des veilles de performance et de contenu sur les différents sites de Kimpex   Exigences et compétences recherchées : ADN du candidat rêvé Il est passionné par le-commerce, la navigation, lergonomie et il possède un bon sens de lesthétisme. Il est soucieux des détails (peut-être même un peu perfectionniste), polyvalent, curieux et créatif. Il carbure sous pression et il est reconnu comme un excellent joueur déquipe, toujours prêt à mettre lépaule à la roue. Évidemment, il est mordu du Web et les nouvelles tendances numériques nont plus de secrets pour lui.  Expertise recherchée  Combinaison de formations axées sur le design, le développement front-end, et le marketing numérique (web, média)  Maîtrise du HTML (HTML5), CSS (CSS3) et de Javascript (jQuery)  Aisance avec le fonctionnement des critères SEO  Expérience en design de parcours e-commerce, en intégration Front-End, en design Mobile et Responsive  Connaissance de la suite Adobe (XD, Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign) et de WordPress  Expérience dans lenvironnement HubSpot (un atout)  Connaissance du PHP (un atout)  La vie dans le groupe Soucy  En plus de bénéficier de conditions demploi des plus concurrentielles, le groupe Soucy toffre aussi:  La possibilité dexercer une réelle influence sur les décisions et davoir un impact direct sur notre visibilité web  Lopportunité doccuper un poste multidisciplinaire dans une équipe pluridisciplinaire passionnée et à lécoute  Un environnement de travail dynamique, stimulant et agile  Travailler chez Soucy, cest travailler pour une entreprise qui se démarque à tous les points de vue, comme le démontre notre nomination à titre dEmployeur de lannée en 2018 aux Mercuriades! Title: Web Designer

Job_Description: UI & UX Designer  Our team is looking for a forward thinking, motivated and energetic UI & UX Designer with an exceptional sense of design and deep understanding of what drives user interactions. We’re seeking experienced and talented UI & UX designer candidates who are passionate about consumer software, building delightful user experiences and who love all things digital.  At Adaware, we are building the next generation of smart monetization solutions for smart consumers. As a member of our Product Team, you will actively contribute to product UI design ideas. As a UI & UX designer, you will be expected to develop functional UI designs compatible with our values of integrity, transparency and our goal to make the Internet a safer and better place.  You’re curious, always challenging yourself and your coworkers with new ideas. You have an ability to effectively interact with stakeholders; and to turn insights and data, along with your ideas into functional and delightful UI & UX design.  Above all, you’re results-driven and know what it takes to turn an idea into reality.  The Challenge:  As a UI & UX Designer, you will work with account managers, project managers and product owners to deliver delightful user interfaces across a range of products, offers and websites. Contribute to Adaware’s UI design style guide Work with the account managers to assess the impact of any UI changes to partners offers and suggest improvements that will drive conversions. Work with the UX manager to ensure any UI design changes help to compliment the overall user experience and increase conversions Maintain and develop a bank of templates for publishers and advertisers Help create UI design wireframes, mock ups and final designs across all desktop and mobile Stay up to date with the latest UI design and usability trends Actively propose new ideas and solutions to design related tasks or issues You have:  Curiosity Passion Experience in a marketing environment Strong knowledge of Adobe Creative Suite Very strong attention to detail 2-4 years of experience in software, web or mobile UI design A strong portfolio Knowledge of HTML, CSS and some javascript (a big plus) Understanding of the basics of prototyping and wireframing A strong understanding of user experience design best practices Ability to work in a fast paced environment with tight deadlines Ability to manage multiple requests at the same time An Internet-savvy perspective, with a genuine interest for and a good understanding of computer software and new technologies; you must be able to understand our products and their markets;  Location This position is located in Montreal.  Company benefits Employees at Adaware enjoy a full range of benefits, such as:  3 weeks of vacation plus 1 week at Christmas; Health insurance with dental; Life insurance; Public transportation card; RRSP contribution match program. Lunch & Learn monthly Fruits and Bagels A weekly masseuse Catered Meals Free parking  We also offer a friendly and comfortable work environment with flexible hours, 5-a-7 – and more!

You won't just be designing an app - you'll be designing a system of products involving consumers, merchants, couriers and dispatchers to make deliveries happen at scale. That means you'll be involved in designing for every step of the delivery process: from the interface that the consumers use to place their order to the dispatching systems to the final physical delivery experience.  WHO YOU ARE: Ability to initiate, own and lead big design projects Master of user-centred design process involving all stakeholders Strong sketching and rapid prototyping skills Experience designing mobile and web apps Proficient with Adobe Creative suite HTML/CSS/JS experience an asset Able to work independently and have an entrepreneurial spirit 2+ years of UI design and interactive work  WHAT WE CAN OFFER YOU: Experience in one of North America’s fastest growing companies, located in Winnipeg Very high level of responsibilities from day one Exposure to a wide array of the latest technologies Exciting opportunities for advancements for superstar performers A refreshingly meaningful and rewarding work environment Opportunity to participate in the development a world-class startup Be part of an incredible team of highly motivated people set to change day-to-day lives in North America

The individual should have the skills and knowledge to create memorable experiences that are true to the brand while balancing seamless interactivity, ease of navigation and conversion.Reporting to the Director, Marketing & Communications, the Web UX& UI Designerwill be the champion of the users’ needs, and create intuitive user experiences and interface designs. The role will be responsible for the end-to-end online construction, maintenance and experience for: TPH.ca, RHGroup.ca, RGStore.ca, TheGlobeRestaurant.ca, the Intranet, and others as required.The UX & UI Designer will create wireframes and storyboards that map the customer journey, user flows, process flows, information architecture, site maps, porotypes and A/B testing to effectively communicate interaction and design ideas & design each screen or page with which a user interacts.The ideal candidate should have an eye for clean design, possess superior UI & UX skills and be able to translate stakeholder requirements into logical interaction flows and a user interface that is intuitive, visually stimulating and converts.Responsibilities: Be guided by human-centric design by identifying user needs, and leveraging those insights to guide you through the design and testing processesUnderstand the research methods and approaches to recognize and deconstruct the expectation of our usersEstablish design best practices and guidelines through creation of conceptual campaigns and design of a great visual identity and cohesive style-guide ensuring that a consistent design language is applied across sites incorporating logo, corporate colours, typographic rules, etc.Maintaining consistency in visual elements and defining behaviorCreate website that are designed and optimized for all screen sizes (including mobile, tablet, and desktop) with a mobile-first mentality, with specific technologies and platforms in mindLead conversations to facilitate conceptual thinking that takes stakeholder considerations into the processCreate clickable prototypes in Testing of websites and that effortlessly lets the users accomplish their goalsOther duties and responsibilities as assignedQualifications: 3-5 years of proven web designer experienceDemonstrable UI & UX design skills with a strong portfolioSolid experience in creating wireframes and storyboards, user flows, process flows, information architecture, site maps, prototypes and A/B testing to effectively communicate interaction and design ideas & design each screen or page with which a user interactsExperience working with a .Net CMS and e-commerce, knowledge of DotNetNuke (DNN) is preferredProficiency in Creative Design Software (specifically Photoshop, Illustrator, and other visual design and wire-framing tools)Proficiency in: HTML, CSS, JavaScript and JQuery, Media Queries/Bootstrap, Version Control (SVN)Explore various usability testing methods to help inform and optimize designs to create more effective experiencesUnderstand on-page, off-page and technical SEO practices and how to best implement these strategies on the websitesImplement Google Analytics, Tag Manager and Optimize to apply fundamental concepts like performance measurement, comparison and optimization.Experience providing feedback on designer performance, and identifying improvement opportunitiesAbility to present your designs and sell your solutions to various stakeholdersAbility to solve problems creatively and effectivelyUp-to-date with the latest UI trends, techniques, and This person will strive to create visually appealing sites that feature user-friendly design and clear navigation. These tasks will require you to be comfortable and efficient with Google Developer Tools, and coding in HTML5, CSS, Javascript and PHP.We are looking for someone with minimum of one year experience in the field who can hit the ground running. Attitude is everything with us. We are a fun quirky group, but we love to work at what we do!EducationA college or university diploma/degree in something related is preferred.Also open to applicants who can demonstrate an amazing knowledge & Do-it-yourself spirit.Job Type: FreelanceJob Type: Freelance
Title: Wordpress Web Designer - Virtual 20 hours/week

Job_Description: Join Windsor's most innovative, fun and Silicon-Valley-esque development and innovation company, bringing world-class projects to Windsor. Help us build exciting technology like multiplayer game servers for Atari, social apps for Puma, high profile analytics engines for The PGA Tour, and cutting edge products like natural-language-processing chat-bots.As one of Windsor's most sought-after companies to work for, we offer flexible time, work-at-home days, a great benefits plan and in-office massage. We are located in the heart of Windsor's historic Walkerville. You must be willing to work in our office. We are not interested in off-shore or remote work.We are seeking talented interface designers who are looking to grow professionally and personally within a fast-growing company. You will work on a variety of marketing deliverables, including websites, prototypes, wireframes, business collateral and other design pieces.ResponsibilitiesWork on the design of user interfaces for web and mobile projectsAble to help with wireframing using tools like Adobe XD and BalsamiqAble to self-direct and work independently, to manage multiple, concurrent projects simultaneously from start to finishRequirements: Expertise in Adobe Creative Suite: Illustrator, Photoshop, InDesign, After Effects, EdgeKnowledge of responsive web designAbility to create interactive prototypesCustomer-obsessed, detail-oriented and comfortable working on highly technical teamsDemonstrated experience with building user interfaces across a range of platforms including desktop and mobile--- Please send examples of your design portfolio (specifically web design) when you apply. ---We look forward to meeting you!Job Type: Full-timeEducation:High school or equivalentLocation:Windsor, ON
Title: Web Designer / UI / UX

Job_Description: Nous valorisons la diversité et avons à cœur de créer un milieu de travail inclusif qui nous inspire tous à donner le meilleur de nous-mêmes. Joignez-vous à notre équipe et faites une différence!  Votre poste  Nous Comment imaginez-vous les bureaux d’une compagnie d’assurance? Et l’atmosphère de travail qui y règne? Nous gageons que si vous passez nous voir au Lab de Intact, vous serez très surpris! Situé au centre-ville de Montréal, nous sommes un laboratoire d’innovation dont la mission est de créer des produits à la fine-pointe de l’insurtech qui améliorent la vie de millions de Canadiens.  Mariant la convivialité et la vélocité d’une startup aux ressources et aux moyens d’une grande entreprise (vous disposerez de tous les outils dont vous avez toujours rêvé!), le Lab est un environnement jeune et dynamique, offrant des défis stimulants, des collègues inspirants et une carrière passionnante (chez un des top 100 employeurs au Canada). C’est l’endroit idéal pour parfaire vos compétences et faire évoluer votre carrière.  Vous Vous êtes passionné par le commerce électronique et l’innovation numérique? Vous avez un talent particulier pour traduire des exigences complexes en expériences utiles et agréables? Vous restez à l’affût des dernières tendances en matière de design et vous aimez expérimenter de nouveaux outils et de nouvelles méthodologies? Nous avons l’occasion parfaite pour vous!  Rôle À titre de designer UX/UI, vous jouerez un rôle essentiel dans la conception et l’évolution de notre écosystème numérique. Relevant du directeur principal, Innovations numériques, vous aurez comme principales responsabilités :  Concevoir des expériences captivantes en vue de réaliser les objectifs d’affaires  Valider la fonctionnalité et l’utilité par l’entremise de tests et de recherches auprès des utilisateurs  Produire des livrables UX et design pertinents au besoin  Piloter une feuille de route aux côté d’un directeur de produit et d’une équipe agile multidisciplinaire  Présenter le travail aux parties prenantes  Aider les ingénieurs à produire des interfaces de qualité et agréables  Prôner une conception axée sur l’utilisateur et les données  Vos compétences  Minimum trois années d’expérience  Expertise en matière de convivialité et de pratiques de conception centrées sur l'utilisateur  Maîtrise des outils de conception (Sketch, Axure, InVision, Illustrator, etc.)  Expérience des outils de recherche UX (usertesting.com, Optimal Workshop, etc.) un atout  Expérience dans la production de flux de processus, d’inventaires de contenu, etc.  Vous aimez travailler dans un environnement de collaboration qui accorde une importance primordiale au travail d’équipe, à l’innovation, à l’ouverture d’esprit et au plaisir  Veuillez inclure votre portfolio dans votre dossier de candidature.  Vous êtes  Une personne avec qui il est agréable de travailler  Créatif, analytique, curieux et ingénieux  Un joueur d’équipe capable de partager et recevoir des commentaires constructifs  Excellent pour expliquer vos idées à différents intervenants  Profondément passionné par le design et la qualité  Organisé et proactif  En tant que salarié temps plein, vous bénéficierez des avantages suivants :  Un salaire compétitif  Un boni de performance annuel  Un régime de retraite  Un horaire de travail flexible de 35 heures par semaine  Des assurances médicales et dentaires hors pair  Et plusieurs autres avantages et bénéfices (remboursement gym, conférences, etc.)  Énoncé fermeture  Cette opportunité vous intéresse? Nous avons très hâte de faire votre connaissance!  D’excellents avantages sont offerts : salaire concurrentiel, avantages flexibles, aménagements de travail flexibles, congés mobiles, régime de retraite à prestation déterminée, etc.  Dans le cadre du processus de sélection d’Intact, les candidats peuvent être appelés à donner leur consentement à une vérification de leurs antécédents pertinente au poste à pourvoir avant de recevoir une offre d’emploi. Celle-ci peut comprendre une confirmation des références d’emploi, des études et des titres de compétences, une vérification des emplois, de l’identité, des infractions criminelles et du permis de conduire ainsi qu’un rapport de crédit.  Vous pouvez soumettre votre candidature à un emploi affiché pourvu que vous occupiez vos fonctions actuelles depuis au moins douze mois et que votre performance soit jugée bonne ou que votre contrat temporaire arrive à son échéance. Une recherche de talents à l'externe est menée parallèlement au recrutement à l'interne Veuillez donc prendre note que des candidats potentiels pourraient avoir été identifiés pour ce poste dans le cadre de leur plan de développement.   Veuillez noter que l'usage du masculin a comme but d'alléger le texte.  Cet affichage prendra fin 02 juin 2018.  Prime de recommandation  CE POSTE EST SUJET À UNE PRIME DE RECOMMANDATION DE 3000$.  #li-qc  Droit de travailler au Canada  Les personnes qui posent leur candidature à un poste permanent doivent, dès leur embauche, avoir le droit de travailler au Canada de façon permanente. Les documents pouvant servir de preuve dans le cas des rôles permanents sont un certificat de naissance canadien, un passeport canadien, un certificat de citoyenneté canadienne, une carte de résident permanent ou une confirmation de son statut de résident permanent pour prouver qu’il a le droit de travailler au Canada. Title: Designer UX/UI

Job_Description: Help make our products world class. You won't just be designing an app - you'll be designing a system of products involving consumers, merchants, couriers and dispatchers to make deliveries happen at scale. That means you'll be involved in designing for every step of the delivery process: from the interface that the consumers use to place their order to the dispatching systems to the final physical delivery experience.  WHO YOU ARE: Ability to initiate, own and lead big design projects Master of user-centred design process involving all stakeholders Strong sketching and rapid prototyping skills Experience designing mobile and web apps Proficient with Adobe Creative suite HTML/CSS/JS experience an asset Able to work independently and have an entrepreneurial spirit 2+ years of UI design and interactive work  WHAT WE CAN OFFER YOU: Experience in one of North America’s fastest growing companies, located in Winnipeg Very high level of responsibilities from day one Exposure to a wide array of the latest technologies Exciting opportunities for advancements for superstar performers A refreshingly meaningful and rewarding work environment Opportunity to participate in the development a world-class startup Be part of an incredible team of highly motivated people set to change day-to-day lives in North America
Title: UI/UX Designer

Job_Description: About Purple Lion Based in Vancouver, we help businesses with Marketing and HR, so they can focus on what matters most – running their business. Having been part of growing businesses throughout our careers, the team at Purple Lion understands the challenges they face, and we work with them every day to find talent and attract more customers.  Purple Lion is hiring a reliable, self-motivated individual to join our team in Vancouver. Our guiding principle is that by helping our customers we help our business. As a designer in our team you’ll be a key part of the idea generation process, working in a small startup-like group which takes full ownership of their role, and takes on whatever challenges arise. You’ll work with developers, product owners, and copywriters to conceive, analyse, code & test your ideas.  About You You love solving problems and believe that simplicity is the ultimate sophistication. Your portfolio should represent the terrific work you’ve done and businesses you’ve helped along the way. Most importantly, you’re an equal blend of engineer and artist. You create, you think outside the box, and you’re as comfortable in front of a customer as you are in front of a screen.  The ideal candidate will bring: Confidence and enthusiasm Simplicity in their design. Collaboration: You’ll be working alongside a team striving to create elegant user experiences; you should thrive on feedback, critique and iteration. Visual Design: Photoshop, Fireworks, Keynote, MS Paint – whatever works for you. Your process is your own; you get to decide which tools you use. HTML/CSS: You’ll be given full ownership of your ideas, and so you’ll be required to both create beautiful mockups/wireframes/prototypes – and implement them.  Required Experience You have a minimum of 2 years UX design experience You’ve Mastered front-end technologies: HTML and CSS Our Offer Competitive salary and bonus scheme Opportunities to attend conferences, internal and external trainings, workshops, etc. Terrific team Interested? We offer a competitive salary plus bonuses, with opportunities for career progression within our fast growing company. This position is open to all candidates who meet and exceed the criteria listed above.  If you are interested in applying for this opportunity, please forward your resume and cover letter to resumes@purplelion.ca.
Title: UI/UX Designer

Job_Description: Summary: Boeing Global Services is hiring for User Experience Designers within its Boeing Vancouver sites to help design, develop and optimize the future of analytics-driven products for the aviation industry. You will be involved in all phases of the solution innovation, development and delivery lifecycle within the Digital Aviation & Analytics business as it innovates and optimizes these solutions to enable the world’s flying fleet. As part of the team, you will be working with internal business partners and outside customers to identify and define business problems, grow and apply aviation domain knowledge and communicate the value of solutions. As a User Experience Designer, you will empowered to conduct user research & testing and be a key contributor in the end-to-end design of complex software solutions, creating effective, user-focused user experiences. Given the tight coupling with data analytics teams for this role, opportunities in data visualization design and visual analytics will also be central. The positions will report within the Commercial Services Analytics Portfolio organization. As the cross-functional teams and customers are located globally, the position will involve some travel, particularly to the USA. Essential Duties and Responsibilities: Work on a wide range of UX activities from concept through to deployment Collaborate with product managers to document user stories and translate complex requirements and concepts into functional designs Analyze requirements, identifying task sequences and workflows and creating user scenarios that clearly communicate key tasks. Perform user research activities to uncover and define user needs and communicated them with the product team Communicate the rationale for design approach with project teams and stakeholders Work as part of the agile team to integrate design approaches on large scale projects, ensuring integration across complex platforms Create wireframes, storyboards, user flows, process flows and site maps to effectively communicate interaction and design ideas Apply formal and informal usability testing approaches to evaluate and validate design approaches Maintain style guides and contribute to UI design standards and practices Promote the benefits of the UX process and user-centered design to improve the usability of software Demonstrated Knowledge and Skills: You can walk non-technical stakeholders through your design thought process You are customer obsessed and data-driven You have experience with data visualization, working on complex data driven apps and tools You have experience with a variety of design tools (Adobe & Sketch experience preferred) You have experience working on UI / UX solutions within an Agile development environment You have experience in acquiring user data or working with a team responsible for gathering user data Your conceptual and visual communication skills are strong Basic HTML and CSS coding skills an asset Experience operating in an environment with remote teams an asset Passionate about sharing your portfolio of your previous body of work You judge your success by customers feedback on the product You love design trends who stays on top of all the latest trends Great sense of humour – we work extremely hard, and have fun doing it! Activity participate in the design community, meetups and events to promote our brand  Education/Experience: You have a degree in Human Factors, Visual Design, Computer Science, related UX / UI degree / certificate or have an equivalent combination of education and experience You have 4+ years work experience as a UX / UI designer, with end-to-end experience working on complex projects
Title: User Experience Design Specialist 3

Title: User Experience Design Specialist 3

Job_Description: We’re looking for an experienced UX Designer whose work reflects a deep passion for empowering people to create world-class content, a deep curiosity for exploring new product paradigms, an affinity for designing cohesive experiences, a sensible and thorough pursuit of user-delight, and a track record for delivering thoughtful and iconic products. Being highly creative and enthusiastic with a love for solving design problems at all levels - from big picture thinking, to interactive prototypes, to detailed design - is a must. We need a designer who leads by doing, someone who likes to take on challenging problems, effectively collaborate across disciplines, tell moving stories, and inspire our organization.  The UX Designer is a thought leader and creative problem solver. Experience with and understanding how a productivity/creation tool works across multiple product areas is key. They must be an organized yet creative thinker with a good sense of the overall UX goal and principles of a tool like Unity and then able to collaboratively develop the roadmap to achieving it.  The UX Designer is an excellent verbal and visual communicator, with the flexibility and patience to try new things. They must understand the way creators use Unity today and identify opportunities for holistically improve the overall user experience.  Responsibilities   Work with other designers, engineers, and product managers to holistically create a friendly and intuitive user experience Identify, distill, and curate common UX patterns and work with peers and stakeholders to cross-pollinate and drive them into the product Partner with design leaders across the company to evolve Unity’s Design System and apply it to the Unity Editor as needed Work with user research to continually pursue customer satisfaction with usability studies and testing Create user-focused designs informed by market analysis, customer feedback, and user research insights  Requirements   5+ years of experience in UX design in technical domains, e.g. productivity or developer tools Proven track record of successfully delivering results in an agile development environment Bachelor's degree in design, human-computer interaction, cognitive science, etc., or equivalent work experience Demonstrated excellence in UX architecture, user scenarios, interaction and visual design Must know industry best practices for desktop application design and usability Must be a capable leader who can motivate others to follow the UX team's vision and follow through on delivery Must be diplomatic and capable of resolving disputes in a responsible manner in line with the company culture and values  Who We Are // About Unity  Unity is the creator of the world’s most widely-used real-time 3D (RT3D) development platform, providing content creators around the world with the tools they need to build rich, interactive 2D, 3D, VR and AR experiences. In fact, apps made with Unity reach 2.7 billion devices worldwide, and were installed more than 24 billion times in the last 12 months.  The global engineering team keeps Unity at the forefront of technology and — working alongside partners like Magic Leap, Google, Facebook, Oculus and Microsoft — ensures optimized support for the latest technology and platforms. Unity is powering the real-time revolution, expanding beyond games and breaking into other industries including automotive, film, architecture, engineering, construction and more.  Unity is an equal opportunity employer committed to fostering an inclusive, innovative environment with the best employees. Therefore, we provide employment opportunities without regard to age, race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, disability, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, or any other protected status in accordance with applicable law. If there are preparations we can make to help ensure you have a comfortable and positive interview experience, please let us know.  Nous recherchons un concepteur UI/UX expérimenté dont le travail reflète une passion pour la recherche permettant aux gens de créer du contenu de classe mondiale. Quelqu’un avec une curiosité profonde pour l’exploration de nouveaux produits, un intérêt pour la conception d’expériences cohérentes, ainsi que l’habitude de livrer des produits réfléchis et exceptionnels. Nous recherchons un concepteur avec de la créativité et de l’enthousiasme, avec un amour pour la résolution de problèmes de conception à tous les niveaux – de la vue d’ensemble aux prototypes interactifs, en passant par la conception détaillée. Nous avons besoin d’un concepteur qui est motivé par l’action, quelqu’un qui aime relever des défis difficiles, collaborer efficacement avec les autres disciplines, raconter des histoires émouvantes et inspirer notre organisation.  Le concepteur UX est un leader d’opinion et quelqu’un qui sais résoudre des problèmes créatif. Avoir de l’expérience avec un outil de productivité ou de création dans plusieurs domaines de produits et la compréhension de son fonctionnement sont essentielles. Il doit être un penseur organisé, mais créatif, qui comprend bien l’objectif global du UI et du UX ainsi que les principes d’un outil comme Unity pour ensuite élaborer de manière collaborative la feuille de route pour y parvenir.  Le concepteur UI/UX est un excellent communicateur verbal et visuel, avec la flexibilité et la patience requises pour essayer de nouvelles choses. Il doit comprendre comment les créateurs utilisent Unity aujourd’hui et repérer les occasions d’améliorer de manière holistique l’expérience utilisateur générale.  Responsabilités   Travailler avec d’autres concepteurs, développeurs et gestionnaires de produits pour créer de manière holistique une expérience utilisateur conviviale et intuitive Définir, analyser et organiser les modèles UI/UX courants et travailler avec ses pairs et parties prenantes pour les croiser et les intégrer dans le produit Collaborer avec les responsables de la conception de l’entreprise pour faire évoluer le système de conception d’Unity et l’appliquer à l’éditeur Unity en fonction des besoins Travailler avec les recherches sur les utilisateurs pour viser continuellement la satisfaction de la clientèle au moyen de tests et d’études de convivialité Créer des conceptions axées sur l’utilisateur en fonction de l’analyse du marché, des commentaires des clients et des résultats des recherches sur les utilisateurs  Exigences   Plus de cinq ans d’expérience en conception UI/UX dans des domaines techniques, par exemple d’outils de productivité ou de développement Antécédents confirmés d’obtention de bons résultats dans un environnement de développement agile Baccalauréat dans les domaines de la conception, de l’interaction homme-machine, des sciences cognitives, etc., ou expérience de travail équivalente Excellence démontrée avec l’architecture d’UX, les scénarios d’utilisateur, l’interaction et la conception visuelle Connaissance des pratiques exemplaires de l’industrie en ce qui concerne la conception et la convivialité des applications de bureau Capacités de leader apte à motiver les autres pour qu’ils suivent la vision de l’équipe de UI et de UX et réussissent à respecter les livraisons Diplomatie et compétences de résolution des conflits de manière responsable dans le respect de la culture et des valeurs de l’entreprise  Qui sommes-nous // À propos de Unity  Unity est le créateur de la plate-forme de développement en temps réel 3D la plus utilisée au monde, offrant aux créateurs de contenu du monde entier les outils pour créer des expériences 2D, 3D, VR et AR riches et interactives. Notre équipe d'ingénierie de plus de 800 personnes maintient Unity à la pointe de la technologie en travaillant avec des partenaires tels que Magic Leap, Google, Facebook, Oculus et Microsoft pour assurer un support optimisé pour les dernières versions et plates-formes.  Les applications réalisées avec Unity atteignent 2,7 milliards d'appareils dans le monde et ont été installées plus de 24 milliards de fois au cours des 12 derniers mois. Unity alimente la révolution en temps réel, en allant au-delà des jeux et en pénétrant dans d'autres secteurs, notamment l'automobile, le cinéma, l'architecture, l'ingénierie, la construction et bien d'autres.  Unity est un employeur axé sur l'égalité des chances qui s'engage à favoriser un environnement inclusif et novateur avec les meilleurs employés. Par conséquent, nous fournissons des opportunités d'emploi sans tenir compte de l'âge, la race, la couleur, l'ascendance, l'origine nationale, la religion, le handicap, le sexe, l'identité sexuelle ou l'expression, l'orientation sexuelle ou tout autre statut protégé. S'il y a des préparatifs que nous pouvons faire pour vous aider à avoir une expérience d'entrevue confortable et positive, veuillez nous le faire savoir.  #LI-ER1
Title: UX Designer / Concepteur UX

Job_Description: Do you want to take your career to the next level as part of one of the big five IT and Business Consulting firms in the world? If you are committed to excellent work and a passion for software development, CGIs Global Wealth & Capital Markets group is looking for a talented UI Developer. This is an opportunity to join our CGIs Wealth360 team which delivers a sophisticated and flexible portfolio management solution that supports all facets of portfolio and investment management. For more than 35 years, CGIs portfolio management solution has provided investment advisors, portfolio managers, and fund accountants with a comprehensive suite of wealth-management functionality designed to meet their front-, middle-, and back-office requirements. Wealth360 covers onboarding, account management, transactional and positional recordkeeping, rebalancing and trading, performance measurement, billing, statement generation and much more. Your future duties and responsibilities: An opportunity exists for an experienced User Interface (UI) Developer to work with CGIs clients and there will be significant opportunity towards creating successful improvements to their digital journey.  Developing and maintaining high-quality client software using Angular and TypeScript  Working with other like-minded high performers within an Agile environment  Working with Product Managers and UI/UX Designers to refine scope  Working with others on architecture and system design  Writing unit tests and automation tests to prevent regressions  Occasionally assisting with the investigation and resolution of support issues  Using your deep understanding of cross-browser compatibility issues to find ways to work around them  Using your experience to contribute to the continuous improvement of our processes and culture Required qualifications to be successful in this role:  A degree in computer science, math, engineering or a similar discipline  5-7+ years of experience working as a Front End / UI Developer  Expert level knowledge of modern web development standards, HTML/CSS, JavaScript frameworks (jQuery, Angular, React, etc.) and libraries  Experience with any front end framework  HTML, CSS3, Unit Testing and Automation, AngularJS, Angular, Coding  A solid understanding of the full web technology stack (e.g. HTTP, cookies, headers, asset loading and caching)  Working experience using RESTful APIs  A proficient understanding of distributed version control tools and source control strategies  Excellent communications skills What you can expect from us: Build your career with us.  It is an extraordinary time to be in business. As digital transformation continues to accelerate, CGI is at the center of this changesupporting our clients digital journeys and offering our professionals exciting career opportunities.  At CGI, our success comes from the talent and commitment of our professionals. As one team, we share the challenges and rewards that come from growing our company, which reinforces our culture of ownership. All of our professionals benefit from the value we collectively create.  Be part of building one of the largest independent technology and business services firms in the world.  Learn more about CGI at www.cgi.com.  No unsolicited agency referrals please.  CGI is an equal opportunity employer. In addition, CGI is committed to providing accommodations for people with disabilities in accordance with provincial legislation. Please let us know if you require a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during any aspect of the recruitment process and we will work with you to address your needs. Job_Description: As a UX/UI Designer/Developer, you will be part of a team dedicated to designing and developing a unified user interface for a suite of wood processing applications.  Using the latest web technologies, and your knowledge of human factors and usability, you’ll help design user experiences that:  - make complex workflows usable for a wide variety of user types  - render on-the-fly detailed 3-D representations of real-world items (for example, logs and boards)  - present a large amount of data in a consumable manner for real-time performance tracking and for longterm analytics, for display on desktop, mobile devices, and kiosks  - …and much more. Our work is varied and interesting.   Qualifications  Experience with ASP.NET MVC, C#, JavaScript and jQuery, and HTML/CSS, preferably in the development of web applications. A working knowledge of WebGL/Three.js. Responsive design experience (for example, Material Design or BootStrap). An understanding of networking, multi-threaded applications, 3-D vision systems, and machine control. A computer science degree with a focus on interactive design is preferred, although a diploma and relevant experience will be considered. Experience using Microsoft Visual Studio and Team Foundation Server is an asset. Proven ability to collaborate successfully within a multi-disciplinary team. Demonstrated interpersonal communication skills, both oral and written. Must have a valid passport or be eligible to obtain one.  Responsibilities  Design interactive web applications, navigation, dialogs, and other screens; solicit internal user feedback, and implement proposed UI designs. Work with project managers, field technicians, and customers to better understand the needs and motivations of our users Provide feedback to other UI designers and developers following an internal review process Work with UI and documentation staff to produce UI design documents that follow USNR design standards; contribute to the ongoing development of these standards Provide support during installation and commissioning of new features at customer sites worldwide

Job_Description: We are looking for a Lead UX Designer to join our team to drive the design behind PayByPhone's next-gen parking applications.  You are a passionate UX Designer with a keen eye for what makes a great experience. Your creative background allows you to build engaging user experiences while meeting product requirements. You enjoy breaking down complex problems and transforming them into simple, intuitive interactions.  As a key member of our Design team, you will:  Drive the design vision for the PayByPhone app and web products Create new app experience components and interaction standards for mobile and desktop Validate new interactions and design decisions with the appropriate audiences Work closely with other designers across product teams to ensure there is consistency in how the design vision is realized Lead critique, design reviews and general design planning and become an active mentor for the team Work cross-functionally with Product and Engineer teams to support design decisions and aid in delivery of planned releases Own the skill to synthesize information into usable insights and lead the organization into research activities  You have:  5+ years’ experience designing in front end applications, preferably 1+ years as a design lead Strong portfolio that demonstrates fundamentals and design realization for interaction, information and UI design. Expert skills with Adobe Photoshop/Illustrator, Sketch and prototyping tools such as InVision Experience collaborating with diverse and remote teams in a dynamic, rapid growth environment. Experience with prototyping to convey design solutions and deep understanding of user-focused, human centric designs Strong written and verbal communication skills  It would be nice if you had:  Experience in Service Design tools and techniques Experience in the more technical side of design work, for example building HTML/CSS prototypes Experience in the internationalisation of SaaS platforms  Sound like you? Apply today with your online portfolio.  About the Company  PayByPhone is one of the fastest-growing mobile payment companies in the world. We process over 70 million parking, transit, and bike-share transactions a year in cities across North America, Europe and Australia. PayByPhone helps millions of consumers easily and securely pay for parking and transportation without the hassles of waiting in line, carrying change, or risking costly fines.  Cities such as San Francisco, Seattle, Miami, Vancouver, London, and Paris have entrusted PayByPhone with driving their parking operations forward, through unrivaled uptime and reliability, 24/7/365 customer support, seamless integrations, and deep data insights. With our recent acquisition by Volkswagen Financial Services, part of the largest auto manufacturing group in the world, PayByPhone has access to unmatched marketing resources, funding and drivers.  By helping transportation agencies and parking operators tap into the latest advancements in secure mobile payment, data analysis, and location technologies, PayByPhone reduces costs while increasing revenue. To learn more, visit www.paybyphone.com, or download our app for iOS or Android.
Title: Lead UX Designer

Job_Description: Nurun recherche un designer UI expérimenté, allumé, mordu de web et de design, qui sait trouver des solutions créatives et exploiter toutes les possibilités qu’offre l’interactivité. Ta mission : En étroite collaboration avec le co-directeur de création, les designer UX et les développeurs Front-End, le designer UI sénior fait progresser des concepts et solutions graphiques créatives pour des projets d’envergure (plateformes numériques, sites e-com, applications tablette et mobile, etc…) avec le souci de répondre aux exigences de l’utilisateur tout étant conscient du besoin d’affaires de nos clients. Il produit des maquettes communiquant et illustrant efficacement les concepts et possède les aptitudes nécessaires pour bien les présenter, c’est-à-dire les expliquer autant que les vulgariser, tant à l’interne qu’à l'externe.  Les méthodes et processus de travail au sein de l’équipe créative sont en constante évolution et nous recherchons un créatif ouvert aux techniques HTML / CSS (prototypes) et aux nouveaux outils tels que Sketch, Invision, Abstract, etc…  Qui tu es : 6 à 8 années d’expérience en design Web; Détenir un DEC en design multimédia ou une expérience équivalente; Agir à titre de référence UI pour l'équipe; Avoir une bonne connaissance des technologies courantes et des enjeux multi-plateformes; Savoir incorporer des notions de design UX dans ses argumentaires; Être autonome, proactif, collaborateur, et dynamique; Doter d’une grande créativité et sens poussé du design; Avoir un grand souci du détail visuel; Être excellent communicateur et présentateur; Maîtrise des outils de design UI (Photoshop, Sketch, Illustrator); Bonnes connaissances des environnements de développement HTML-CSS; Maîtrise du français et de l’anglais (parlés et écrits).  Qu'est-ce que nous offrons ? Bureaux lumineux et modernes au centre-ville (Square Victoria) et bientôt des bureaux neufs au Mile-Ex!! Belle gamme d'avantages sociaux offerts au premier jour Environnement de travail informel et dynamique Déjeuners offerts et fruits frais livrés au bureau Projets internationaux à haute visibilité
Title: Designer UI sénior

experience with grid frameworks (bootstrap) an assetStrong ability to communicate design ideas and collaboratePassion for maintaining design consistency across the entire product and brand stackStrong attention to detail, highly organized and diligently designs for all possibilitiesAlways staying on top of web design trends and the latest UI innovationsHas a sense of humour, with an appreciation for constructive criticismQualifications:A strong portfolio demonstrating your keen eye for UI design and problem-solvingExpert proficiency with Adobe Photoshop, Adobe Illustrator, Sketch or other design toolsBachelor's degree in communication design, interaction design or equivalent fieldExperience developing web and mobile interfaces and appsA proficient understanding of human-computer interaction and user flowAn understanding of the design-related issues surrounding responsive webActive on social media with a strong understanding of all major networksExperience working in a startup or other small team environment is an assetBenefitsTradable Bits Bonuses:We offer a competitive salary and full extended benefitsYou get to design interfaces used by Fortune 500 companies in entertainmentBeautiful open-concept office in the Westin Bayshore (pool, gym + hot tub)Team-oriented environment with snacks, coffee, drinks and Friday happy hoursCreative freedom, flexible working environment and ownership over your projectsJob type: Full time permanentJob Type: Full-timeExperience:user interface design: 1 yearEducation:Bachelor's

Job_Description: Handles the design, development and support of print and electronic media resources. Along with the Centre for Innovative Pedagogies and Digital Learning (CIPDL) team (instructional designers, educational developers, web developers and multimedia designers), works with clients to understand their business requirements in terms of digital strategy for online teaching and learning, branding, marketing and user interfaces. Applies graphic design, user interface and user experience design principles (UI/UX) to inform user experience across digital platforms, including web and mobile, electronic media and print resources for pedagogical and promotional materials. Works with web designers to develop wireframes, look and feel, colour palettes and content interaction to support the overall project vision. Collaborates with instructional designers to pilot test usability decisions. Ensures that all design work, marketing and communication materials (conferences, reports, special projects, workshops, special events, publicity for open houses for faculty, etc.) is consistent with the Teaching and Learning Support Service and University of Ottawa brands. Employs effective user experience practices, working with the CIPDL team and professors to design, develop and evaluate material. Plan and organize own work and priorities in regular daily activities. Initiative: Demonstrate creativity and initiative to suggest improvements and encourage positive results. Be proactive and self-starting. Show availability and willingness to go above and beyond expectations whenever possible. Service Excellence: Reflect a positive attitude, demonstrate competence and professionalism, treat members of the community with respect, exercise care, devote full attention and find solutions. (Visit the section "Useful links" on the home page to read the detailed definition). Teamwork and Cooperation: Cooperate and work well with other members of the team to reach common goal. Accept and give constructive feedback. Adjust own behaviour to reach team goals. Note All qualified candidates are invited to apply; however, preference will be given to Canadian citizens and permanent residents. The University of Ottawa is an equal opportunity employer. We strongly encourage applications from women, Aboriginal peoples, persons with disabilities and members of visible minorities. If you are invited to continue the selection process, please notify us of any particular adaptive measures you might require.  Applications from employees belonging to the bargaining unit SSUO will be considered first. Priority will be given to employees who have an entitlement as defined by their collective agreement or university policies. The University also accepts external applications; they will be selected in second place. Schedule with an average of 35hrs/week. Workshops offered by Leadership, Learning and Organizational Development that you have taken may be considered an asset if you apply for a position at the University. Dont forget to list them on your CV. We thank all candidates for applying. We will only contact candidates selected for further consideration. Any information you send us will be handled respectfully and in complete confidence. Remember to upload a copy of your diploma(s) or a certificate of merit as well as a current version of your CV into the My documents section of your career profile (please include the job ID number, i.e. J0000-0000, in the title of your document).
Title: UI UX Design Specialist

Job_Description: About MedChart: MedChart is a venture-backed Toronto healthcare and technology startup embarking on a period of rapid growth! We are building the world’s most comprehensive health information marketplace of patient-owned, accessible, compliant data using both Blockchain and AI. Our platform aggregates official health record data from all hospitals, doctors' offices and other healthcare facilities across North America on behalf of patients, lawyers, insurers, researchers and private medicine providers. Through AI, we functionalize these disparate health data sets and power insights for world-leading research and applications. What's in it for you: MedChart is growing 10X over the next 12 months and offers an opportunity to become an early stage team member. You will help drive MedChart and influence the product, architecture and user experience. You will work on challenging high-impact problems in an agile fast-paced and exciting startup environment located in the heart of downtown Toronto. Finally, your opportunities for advancement will continue to grow as we rapidly expand across North America and build a huge company! What we're looking for: We are seeking a User Experience Designer/Developer to join our growing team onsite in Downtown Toronto. You will collaborate with our tight-knit team of passionate Product, Development, and Support to design, build, and optimize MedChart’s platform. If you’re a seasoned creative and analytical UX/UI professional with a passion for synthesizing efficient, effective, and enjoyable software solutions, we’d love to hear from you! Requirements Responsibilities: Facilitate co-design sessions with Product, Development, and Support stakeholders in an Agile UX and Lean UX environment. Translate product requirements into static and interactive prototypes for internal reviews and user tests Conduct user tests and collect structured information to inform smart decisions. Focus on user empathy & experience with conducting lightweight user research and persona development Iterate designs as needed to arrive at innovative and elegant solutions Translate design prototypes into functional UI solutions using HTML/CSS, JavaScript and React.js; A plus if you also know ASP.NET Razor and TypeScript Work alongside engineering to ensure the requirements are built to spec, deployed to a quality level, and provide the results you predicted Lead design sessions around new and innovative features Ability to clearly and convincingly communicate design decisions and trade-offs Research and monitor current trends and best practices related to user interaction and experience design Our ideal candidates: Strong background in visual and interaction design/development for web-based SaaS companies, 5+ years experience; experience with Agile UX and Lean UX a plus Experience taking ideas from conception to release for SaaS products Quantitative and user behavior analysis skills Critical thinker - Ability to identify root causes of problems Strong communications skills - from ideation to requirements gathering, building consensus across teams, and driving product execution Extensive experience working with Engineering and Growth teams Experience working in a startup and iterating in quick cycles Monitoring performance and advising any necessary changes Proficient in Adobe Creative Suite, especially Adobe Photoshop and Illustrator Strong working knowledge of design/prototyping tools using Sketch or similar tools Well-rounded knowledge of UX and design principles and techniques Working knowledge of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript a must; React.js and Razor desired; Should be comfortable with code Team player who welcomes peer review and collaborates well with others Highly organized and ability to be self-managed Great attention to detail Thrive in a fast-paced iterative development environment Great to have: Experience in conversion centered design methodologies BenefitsHealth and Lifestyle benefit spending accounts Employee discounts to gyms and fitness Agile project-oriented work environment, open PTO policy Frequent team lunches and events Annual retreat! Amazing offices located in the heart of Downtown Toronto Fashion District A positive, diverse and growth-oriented team environment Active in the local tech and startup community with optional after-hours events and meetups Job Type: Full-time, Permanent Salary: $60,000 - $90,000 Equity: 0.1%-0.25% Note: Successful candidates may be asked to undergo a background check. MedChart is proud to be a diverse and equal opportunity employer and as such does not discriminate on the basis of race, colour, religion, sex, national origins, age, sexual orientation, disability or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws. Selection decisions are solely based on job-related factors.

Title: UI/UX developer or programmer

Job_Description: The Scoop: Based in downtown Toronto you will be a core member of the internal team that brings the clients’ brand to life on all digital screens.  You’ll work with cross-functional teams to deliver irresistible digital experiences, designing for an ever-changing interactive world.  A quickie about the job: – Problem solve day-to-day usability issues, supporting the Digital Marketing team and collaborating with designers and developers – Design and define the user experience for everything from landing pages, conversion flows, mobile apps, banners, emails and more. – Create wireframes, front-end prototypes and supporting documents to effectively communicate proposed structure, layout, navigation, controls and content prioritization. – Ensure every user experience not only looks its best, but uses best in class usability practices and enforces, maintains and evolves the digital style guide. – Develop innovative and creative online campaign elements to drive Member engagement through unique Member experiences.  Key Stuff: – Work as a Member of a collaborative design team to solve creative challenges. – Convert complex briefs into simple and effective digital elements and user experiences – Minimize errors in work so development process is as smooth as possible – Identify and understand key elements that align with marketing goals – Deliver on strategy, on time and on budget in a fast-paced industry. (But no pressure or anything.)  Do you fit the part? – You’re passionate about user experience and designing for a changing world. – You crave to be part of a dynamic and collaborative creative group of people who have a passion for delivering work that is right on the mark – People love working with you because they can count on you and enjoy interacting with you – You are able to think outside of the box – You can manage complete processes – Problem Solving and creativity are your jams – You have a keen eye design and a razor-sharp attention for detail – You can multi-task, multi-task, and multi-task like a pro. Did we mention you’d need to multi-task?  The “Must Haves” – A Degree or equivalent post-secondary education in Design, Multimedia, Fine Arts or a related discipline. – 5+ years of professional web, digital, UX or interactive design experience – Rock solid knowledge of web and mobile usability and design principles for intuitive site functionality, interaction, information architecture, user interfaces, and navigation – Experience designing to meet HTML, CSS and JS standards for responsive design on multiple screens – Able to work with grid systems, wireframing and prototyping tools. – Proficient in Adobe Creative Cloud, Sketch and InVision – Learn quickly and are able to adapt in a fast-paced environment. – Possess strong organization skills. – Able to handle the pressure of meeting tight deadlines and quick turnaround while juggling multiple projects – You know how to have fun while getting stuff done.

Bringing a client’s vision to life means you’ll wear a lot of hats. This often means being able to dig into the details of their business, bring new ideas to the table, and be able to design then build solutions that blow their socks off. DevFacto is looking for a Web Developer / UX Designer to join our team! If you're looking to: Join a fast-growing company where you can have an impact Interact with and learn from other highly talented people Work with the latest tools and technologies And you have: 2-5 years of experience in front-end Web Development, Interactive Design or Visual design for web applications Advanced knowledge of HTML/HTML5, CSS/CSS3, Javascript and jQuery Understanding of "best practice" UI/UX design patterns Understanding of what it takes to implement a visual design in a modern web application (Experience with SharePoint is an asset) Strong desire to develop new technical knowledge and professional skills on a continual basis Ability to work in a fast paced work environment to meet deliverable deadlines Strong interpersonal skills in a cross functional team based environment Excellent written and oral communication skills DevFacto can offer you: Competitive salaries, group benefits, profit sharing Challenging projects and leading-edge technologies Extensive training Regular team social events including Friday happy-hours and monthly team outings A really cool award-winning culture! Title: Web Developer & UX Designer

Job_Description: Description  Are you looking for unlimited opportunities to develop and succeed? With work that challenges and makes a difference and a flexible and supportive environment, we can help our customers achieve their dreams and aspirations. Job Summary: As a leader in the financial industry, Manulife is evolving many of our digital experiences into innovative, immersive and highly functional products delivering high value to our clients and partners. As UX Design Manager, you will be directly involved in this exciting transformation. As part of the leadership of the growing team, you will actively contribute in building and maturing the User Experience practice within the organization. You believe that the discipline of UX can be used not only to improve the experiences of our customers, but also drive tangible business results in adoption, growth, revenue and retention. You live, love and breathe UX. You’ll have a deep drive to create highly effective, well-crafted and beautiful digital experiences based on evidence, research, data and best practices. You will be confident and convincing in presenting your work, or that of your team, to a wide range of project members, stakeholders and senior leaders - but also humble, collaborative and pragmatic. As a leader, the challenge of engaging and motivating a team of highly talented, enthusiastic UX practitioners is one you relish. You’re comfortable in a large organization, interacting with myriad people (both remotely and in-person). Your entrepreneurial attitude means you’re always seeking to improve yourself and those surrounding you; and you’re always among the first to pitch in get things done. You’re highly capable of being hands-on in delivering highly effective, well-crafted and evidence-based digital experiences through sketches, user flows, wireframes, prototypes, and eventual UI/design assets as needed. You’ll be able to synthesize business requirements, research and design principles; solve problems; work within tight deadlines; and understand disparate audiences to ensure the final experiences cater to the uniqueness of the targeted individuals. You will need to identify and solve problems; simplify complicated ideas; explore different design solutions and articulate for the user in each case. Key Accountabilities: People Leadership Responsibilities (approximate 50%) Aid in the formation of a strong, centralized UX team and contribute to building the maturity of UX within the organization by evolving our practices and processes, and assisting in recruiting exceptional talent with varying degrees of experience Engages the UX team and creates opportunities for team members to help deliver large projects from vision to execution over multiple phases Develop talent; s/he will be adept at identifying areas of opportunity and helping individuals reach their maximum potential Coaches the team in how to deliver inspiring designs by participating in their design critiques and iterations; oversee the output from team members to ensure a consistently exceptional calibre of work Contributes to the continual evolution and improvement of the team’s workflow and processes Creates an inclusive culture that maximizes collaboration and innovation across user experience, visual design and strategy, the latter two areas as an influencer without direct accountability Flexibly and iteratively collaborates with a variety of internal stakeholders (Project Managers, Marketing Managers, Product Owners, Developers, etc.) Additional Daily Responsibilities (approximate 50%) This is a hands-on role; the Manager will take on accountability for the UX delivery of specific projects, creating artefacts such as sketches, sitemaps, userflows, journeys, personas, wireframes and potentially finalized visual design mockups and UI assets Represents the voice of our UX designers in collaboration with other teams, executives, managers, and peers Evangelizes for User Experience within the company, offering insights as new developments arise within the industry Collaborates with our internal Research area to solicit insights into user behaviour and feedback on designs, to develop a continual feedback loop for ongoing improvement This individual will also share responsibility for maintaining / updating our User Experience Standards, ensuring these standards incorporate emerging best practices and align to Manulife’s internal Brand guidelines Qualifications  Job Requirements (Education, Experience, Knowledge, Skills and Competencies): 6+ years’ experience in UX roles, including hands-on as a user experience designer or similar role, with some management experience preferred 3+ years of experience working on complex web projects with medium to large-sized teams Strong portfolio demonstrating a high degree of UX/UI/visual design proficiency (design portfolio / work samples to be provided for reference) Bachelor's and/or Master’s degree in User Experience, Design or a related field (communication arts, computer science, human-computer interaction (HCI), psychology, etc.) Certification or working on certification from an industry-recognized user experience design institution desirable (NN/g, HFI) Sound experience and knowledge of UX process, methods and artefact creation, including digital styleguides and annotations User-focused and analytical; the ideal person for this role will have a deep understanding and appreciation of the process of identifying users’ needs, coupled with the ability to balance the pros and cons of different designs, backed by research and analytics Well versed in fundamental visual and interactive design disciplines & principles and user behavioural psychology Strong knowledge of modern web technologies such as HTML5, CSS3, Bootstrap, JavaScript, AngularJS, React, JQuery; ability to code in HTML/CSS/JS is a nice-to-have Strong experience in UX/UI design for Mobile UI (Android & iOS) and Web Experience in responsive design techniques to support multiple devices Excellent understanding of (and experience creating interfaces complying to) accessibility standards, specifically AODA/WCAG 2.0 Highly comfortable presenting and substantiating design decisions (in both formal and informal settings), based on industry best-practice guidelines, personal experience and research findings Highly conversant in industry best practices Fastidious attention to detail Excellent proficiency in a variety of UX/design tools such as Sketch, Axure, Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator), InVision, Zeplin, Principle, Framer and/or other software Previous involvement working within Agile/Lean UX design/development methodology Exposure or involvement in user research techniques (e.g. user interviews, usability tests, focus groups, conducting quantitative studies) and heuristic / qualitative evaluations Extensive experience with business requirement gathering, site assessment, competitive analysis, and primary and secondary research Proven ability as a strategic thinker. A demonstrated ability to create presentations for Senior Management teams a bonus An excellent communicator, this person must be able to build strong cross-functional relationships, both internally and externally The ability to manage your time and deadlines, as well as those of your team in a fast-paced, ever-changing environment About Manulife Manulife Financial Corporation is a leading international financial services group that helps people achieve their dreams and aspirations by putting customers' needs first and providing the right advice and solutions. We operate as John Hancock in the United States and Manulife elsewhere. We provide financial advice, insurance, as well as wealth and asset management solutions for individuals, groups and institutions. At the end of 2016, we had approximately 35,000 employees, 70,000 agents, and thousands of distribution partners, serving more than 22 million customers. As of June 30, 2017, we had over $1 trillion (US$780 billion) in assets under management and administration, and in the previous 12 months we made $26.7 billion in payments to our customers. Our principal operations are in Asia, Canada and the United States where we have served customers for more than 100 years. With our global headquarters in Toronto, Canada, we trade as 'MFC' on the Toronto, New York, and the Philippine stock exchanges and under '945' in Hong Kong. Manulife is committed to supporting a culture of diversity and accessibility across the organization. It is our priority to remove barriers to provide equal access to employment. A Human Resources representative will consult with applicants contacted to participate at any stage of the recruitment process who request an accommodation. Information received regarding the accommodation needs of applicants will be addressed confidentially.  Category: Marketing
Title: Manager, UX Design

Job_Description: At Rogers we’re for supporting you on a journey to a rewarding career. Whether you’re a developer, an analyst, or a customer care consultant, Rogers is the place where ideas become reality. We embrace change, and find ways to do better. And we deliver on that commitment by fostering an environment of passion and innovation for all people.  Rogers is currently seeking a talented Experience Designer to join the Customer Experience UX/UI team. This individual will be well versed in the workflow and processes of UI design for both desktop and mobile experiences. Working with the larger UX/UI team, they will be providing day-to-day design assistance to the team regarding the creation of innovative and engaging online experiences.  Responsibilities and Accountabilities Assist in the design of user interfaces that provide an interactive, informative and engaging experience Provide support to business as usual (BAU) initiatives such as promotions, device launches, updates to existing experiences Work closely with the user experience team to create online prototypes for usability testing Work and collaborate with cross-functional teams in the development of projects, creation/refinement of presentation materials Accountable for all elements of asset delivery to development teams Maintain design style guides for desktop and mobile experiences Communicate the functionality and components of interactive elements with cross functional teams including the development team and stakeholders Provide support to Senior Visual Designers as needed  Skills and Experience Design experience - College Design diploma or equivalent work experience In depth knowledge and experience with Adobe Creative Suite Strong knowledge of CSS/HTML Desktop and mobile UI design experience including mobile (responsive design) Proven ability to work with teams and stakeholders Ability to work independently and under short deadlines Schedule: Full Time Shift: Day Length of Contract: Not Applicable (Regular Position) Work Location: 1200 Av. McGill College, # 1620 (904), Montreal, QC Travel Requirements: Up to 10% Posting Category/Function: Digital & Creative Requisition ID: 119428 WHY ROGERS? As a proud Canadian company, we're dedicated to making things easier for our customers. We’ve been embracing and leading change for over 50-years, and we’ll continue to seek out new opportunities to bring our customers simple solutions for today and tomorrow. We recognize that success is determined by the strength and diversity of our people. We work together because we want to win together, and these five shared values guide and define our work: Simplify and innovate Take ownership of the what and the how Equip people to succeed Execute with discipline and pride Talk straight, build trust, and over deliver Why Rogers? Because your tomorrow inspires our today. What makes us different makes us stronger. Rogers has a strong commitment to diversity and inclusion. Everyone who applies for a job will be considered. We recognize the business value in creating a workplace where each team member has the tools to reach their full potential. At Rogers, we value the insights and innovation that diverse teams bring to work. We work with our candidates with disabilities throughout the recruitment process to ensure that they have what they need to be at their best. Please reach out to our recruiters and hiring managers to begin a conversation about how we can ensure that you deliver your best work. You can also reach out to our team at RogersRecruiting@rci.rogers.com to begin a conversation about your individual accessibility needs throughout the hiring process.
