Title: Experience Designer

Job_Description: DescriptionSenior UX/UI DesignerWe're currently looking for a Senior Graphic Designer to join our Communications team on a contract basis. The ideal candidate will have a solid portfolio of relevant work that showcases their work across a variety of online and digital materials.Responsibilities/Accountabilities: Design websites, landing pages, web forms, emails, social media graphics, and a variety of marketing print assets that align with GITRM and enterprise branding requirementsResponsible for conceptualization and implementation of web, events (town halls) and print (Power Point) design solutions that meet GITRM’s strategies.Skill includes delivering on a cohesive web, intranet and internet presence leveraging brand building and brand management.This individual is a best-practice and service standards expert who possesses authority in decision-making and mentors graphic and associate graphic designers to promote quality design and influence creative innovation.This position requires a highly specialized knowledge of methods and techniques of graphic design and layout.The candidate should demonstrate a high level of proficiency in the Adobe Creative Suite and a solid foundation in web design.The scope of work flows between designing for new business and special projects and reviewing others’ work and providing direction. The ideal candidate is a strong communicator who is able to build and foster relationships, as well as mentor internal team members through active communication.The candidate must be able to coordinate and manage multiple, varied projects that may range from a single day to many months.The candidate also should possess basic HTML/CSS skills with proficiency for lower-level coding projects.The candidate also should understand Web trends and technologies.Responsible for releasing 8-12 design deliverables a year including town halls, SharePoint updates and decks.Design and create compelling material that has the chance of bringing positive change to people's views on information security.Handle web content including blogs, marketing material, and websites.Qualifications: A minimum of 5-7 years of experience working as a graphic designerHighly proficient with Adobe Creative Suite, HTML/CSS language skillsA very strong background designing a wide range of digital marketing materials.A very strong background in designing logos and establishing branding guidelines.Highly specialized knowledge of methods and techniques of graphic design layoutA solid understanding of copy writing and editing, as it relates to marketing materials.The constant desire to be collaborative and work closely with everyone on our team.The willingness to learn, as well as both take and give direction when necessary.The ability to work towards tight deadlines when necessary.The ability to communicate and work with clients and vendors, both in-person and over the phone.Some understanding of information Security best practicesJob Type: ContractExperience:UX/UI Designer: 7 years

Title: UX/UI Designer

Job_Description: Specific Responsibilities Buffalo David Bitton, une marque de renommée internationale avec une longue tradition de qualité et ayant son siège social à Montréal sur la rue Sauvé Ouest, cherche de nouveaux membres pour son équipe! Incarnant un style de vie unique, Buffalo David Bitton est une marque qui va au-delà des frontières. Créé en France et ensuite lancé à Montréal il y a plus de 30 ans, Buffalo David Bitton est une marque d’influence européenne qui s’étend maintenant à travers 18 pays et plus de 3000 points de vente. Nos principaux comptes clients incluent différentes grandes chaines américaines tels que Macy’s, Lord & Taylor, Dillard’s et la Baie d’Hudson au Canada, ainsi que des magasins spécialisés tels que Buckle, Jean Machine, Bootlegger, et bien plus encore. Buffalo David Bitton est une marque emblématique qui offre plusieurs styles de jeans, ainsi qu’une gamme complète de vêtements et d’accessoires modes. Nous sommes présentement à la recherche d’une personne au profil dynamique qui a le goût de faire partie d’une équipe enrichissante et encadrée plusieurs professionnels de renom dans le domaine depuis des années qui vous guideront, vous aideront à vous épanouir professionnellement et vous transmettront leur passion pour la mode. À qui l’opportunité de se joindre à nous?! Designer Graphique Web  Le Designer Graphique Web aura la responsabilité de l'apparence, la disposition et les fonctionnalités du site Web. Le travail consiste à comprendre à la fois la conception graphique et la programmation informatique. Une fois les déclinaisons pour le site Web sont créées, le concepteur aide à la maintenance et aux ajouts du site Web. Il travaillera avec des équipes de développement ou des experts pour maintenir le site à jour et prioriser les besoins, entre autres tâches.  Responsabilités : Collaborer à la création de tous les aspects créatifs du site web, ainsi que tous les réseaux markéting externes, y compris mais non limité aux bannières et aux promotions, et ce, selon les normes relatives à l’image de la marque; Maintenir les normes de conception visuelle: la conception de mise en page, la typographie, les promotions, les CTA (Call-to-action) ainsi que l'apparence et la convivialité du site web; Collaborer avec tous les partenaires d’affaires sur la réalisation graphique de tous les projets numériques; Créer et finaliser des fichiers graphiques précis; Respecter les délais de production; Respecter l’organisation et assurer l’entretien des fichiers départementaux sur le serveur. Suivre la convention établie pour la nomenclature des fichiers; Effectuer toute production graphique, ainsi que la mise à jour du site web selon les procédures à suivre; Collaborer avec l'équipe de développement web pour la gestion du contenu graphique en ligne; Exercer d’autres fonctions au besoin. ***  Buffalo David Bitton a global lifestyle brand with a long-standing tradition of quality located in Montreal is looking for new members for our team! Founded in France and brought to Montreal more than 30 years ago, to be developed with a European influence. The label now spans across 18 countries and more than 3000 locations. Key accounts include U.S. department stores Macy’s, Lord & Taylor, Dillards, Hudson Bay in Canada and specialty stores like Buckle, Jean Machine, Bootlegger and many more. Buffalo David Bitton is an iconic brand offering multiple denim styles and a full fashion collection. We are currently looking for a dynamic person who is in need to be part of an expert team, managed by several renowned professionals in the field that will guide you, help you grow in fashion and share their passion for fashion. Who will have the opportunity to join us?!  Web Graphic Designer  The Web Graphic Designer will create the look, layout, and features of a website. The job involves understanding both graphic design and computer programming. Once the website assets are created, the designer helps with maintenance and additions to the website. He will work with development teams or experts for keeping the site up-to-date and prioritizing needs, among other tasks. Responsibilities: Assist in the creation of all creative aspects of the website, as well as all external marketing networks, including but not limited to banners and promotions, and this according to the standards for the image of Buffalo David Bitton; Maintain visual design standards: web page layout design, typography, promotions, CTA (Call-to-Action) and the look and feel of the website; Work with all business partners on the graphics of all digital projects; Create and finalize specific graphic files; Meet deadlines production; Respect the organization and ensure the maintenance of departmental files on the server. Follow the established convention for the file naming; Perform any graphic production, and update the website according to the procedures to follow; Work with the web development team to manage the graphic content online; Performs other duties as required. Skills and Requirements Compétences et aptitudes: Certification en conception web, en design graphique ou équivalent, niveau Baccalauréat ou diplôme collégial; Une année ou plus d’expérience en conception web/design graphique dans le secteur du commerce au détail, dans un environnement lié au commerce électronique ou au développement web; Bilingue parlé et écrit (français, anglais); Connaissances approfondies d’Adobe Créative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign, etc.) et Microsoft Suite (Word, Excel, etc.); Compréhension du codage HTML/CSS et familier avec ses utilisations. Connaissance du codage responsive; Avoir de solides compétences dans les notions de base graphique et typographie; Connaissances approfondies en développement web lié au commerce électronique, avec de fortes habilités en conception/design et un goût certain pour la mode; Solides compétences en communication orale et écrite; Capacité de gérer plusieurs tâches simultanément et de porter attention aux détails; Connaissance des tendances web actuelles et des meilleures techniques de conception UX/UI; Capacité de travailler dans un environnement au rythme rapide et en constante évolution. Capacité de s'adapter aux priorités changeantes selon les besoins organisationnels; Capacité de toujours fournir un travail de haute qualité selon les échéances; Avoir le sens de l'urgence-réactivité avec la capacité de gérer l’ambigüité; Avoir un intérêt pour le domaine de la mode et de la vente, ainsi que le désir d'apprendre tous les aspects de la marque/entreprise; Capacité à travailler en équipe avec des intervenants de différent niveau de connaissance. Atouts : Connaissance avec le système de gestion de site web SAP/HYBRIS; Connaissance des outils IBM; Expérience en rédaction; Expérience avec le montage audio et vidéo. ***  Required skills and abilities: Certified in web design, graphic design or equivalent. Bachelor or Collegiate degree; 1 year or more of experience in web design / graphic design in the retail trade sector in a linked environment for electronic commerce or web development; Bilingual spoken and written (French, English); Extensive knowledge of Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign, etc.) and Microsoft Suite (Word, Excel, etc.); Understanding of and at ease with HTML / CSS coding and familiar with its uses. Knowledge of responsive design coding; Have strong design fundamentals and typography skills; Advanced knowledge in web development related to e-commerce, with strong skills in design / trends and a taste for fashion; Strong skills in oral and written communication; Ability to handle multiple tasks simultaneously and attention to detail; Knowledge of current web trends and best design techniques UX / UI; Ability to work in a constantly changing fast-paced environment. Ability to adapt to changing priorities according to organizational needs; Ability to always provide high quality work according to deadlines; Have a sense of urgency-reactivity with the ability to handle ambiguity; Have an interest in the field of fashion and sales, as well as the desire to learn all aspects of the brand / company; Ability to work in team with stakeholders from different levels of knowledge. Assets: Experience with SAP/HYBRIS user management system; Experience using the IBM tools Experience in copywriting Experience with editing for audio/video *** AVANTAGES *** Temps plein (35 heures/sem); Congés de maladie; Horaires flexibles; Horaires d'été; Assurances collectives après 6 mois; Cadeau d'anniversaire; Régime enregistré d'épargne-retraite (REER) et Régime de participation différée aux bénéfices (RPDB); Environnement de travail moderne, à proximité des magasins et du transport en commun; Code vestimentaire décontracté; Rabais aux employés. *** ADVANTAGES *** Full time (35 hours/week); Sick days; Flexible hours; Summer hours; Group insurance after 6 months; Birthday present; Registered Retirement Savings Plan (RRSP) and Deferred Profit Sharing Plan (DPSP); Modern working environment, close to shops and public transport; Casual dress code; Employee Discounts.
Title: Designer Graphique Web / Web Graphic Designer

Job_Description: Job Description (EN)   Torstar Corporation is a broadly based, progressive media organization listed on the Toronto Stock Exchange (TS.B) with a long, proud history in newspapers and a passion for capitalizing on the fluid world of digital and mobile media. Torstar will be energized by a deep customer-centric obsession, continued journalistic excellence, advanced data-driven competency and a culture that is selfless, focused, agile, collaborative and results driven. You’ll be a champion of those priorities while you leverage Torstar’s wealth of data to drive revenues for a company that is poised and positioned to lead in all of its media ventures.  What You Will Do… Work as a member of the UX and Design team, helping to define and design clear, beautiful interfaces for the web and mobile devices; Create intelligent design solutions for mobile and web Design cross-platform user interfaces, interactive page layouts and UI prototypes Visualize and verbalize your creative ideas and vision, as well as rationalize solutions with the team and clients Gather design requirements and consolidate input from multiple stakeholders Collaborate with core team to create a better user experience Visually present information so it’s easy to read, understand and find. Constantly explore ways to create a more cohesive story and enhanced usability. Simplify, and systematize interactions and experiences across our products Maintain and drive the visual design identity through specs, style guides, libraries and processes Design digital product solutions that meet or exceed strategic objectives Create highly usable interface solutions focused on user experience Test concepts and iterate as findings help define deeper insights Balance creative requirements with client business requirements Provide quality assurance on creative deliverables  Why You Will Be Successful: You have a digital portfolio showcasing exceptional and impactful digital customer experience solutions leveraging human-centered design. Experience designing outstanding web-based products Proven ability to communicate conceptual ideas and design rationale, all within a user-centered design process Able to prioritize and manage workload and meet critical project milestones and deadlines Excellent problem-solving skills Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to build good working relationships Knowledge and/or experience in the agile process Experience with responsive/adaptive design principles Minimum 4+ years of working experience in graphic design and using a variety of platforms such as Mac, Windows and mobile (iOS/Android) Strong knowledge and experience designing wireframes and interactive prototypes using industry software (e.g. Axure, Sketch, Invision, Illustrator, Photoshop). Solid knowledge around user experience methods and deliverables such as wireframes, storyboarding, user flows, analyzing user stories, accessibility basics and pattern libraries Expert level proficiency in Sketch and Adobe Creative Suite A passion for clean, functional, and elegant interfaces Deep knowledge of design principles and methods Curiosity and commitment to testing new ideas and innovating to drive business results Knowledge of current digital UX related standards and trends including design thinking. Ability to multitask in a high-paced work environment. Ability to work independently as well collaboratively part of a team.  Why You’ll LOVE Working Here… The opportunity to be part of an exciting company grounded in history while striving to be at the cutting edge of the digital media industry; you'll never get bored in our fast-paced, constantly evolving and challenging environment We recognize that you have a life outside of work and we offer you real work/life balance We provide individualized career plans and extensive ongoing development opportunities We've got your health in mind; you'll get a comprehensive benefits package & group RSP (Extended Health Care, Dental, etc.) combined with a generous vacation plan  …And let’s not forget the AWESOME PEOPLE!  The Company is committed to providing an inclusive and barrier free recruitment process to applicants with accessibility needs in accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA). If you require an accommodation during this process, please inform the Company of your requirements.
Title: Senior UI Designer

Job_Description: Canada Drives is a young, dynamic, and fast growing company. We work with dealerships and finance partners across Canada to ensure that every customer, regardless of bad credit or no credit, has access to the auto financing they need. Our office is located in the heart of downtown Vancouver and we want you to join our growing team!  What You’ll be Doing  Working as part of our creative team, designing everything from corporate identities and websites to display banners and social media ads.  Taking responsibility for projects from conceptualization to completion, demonstrating the ability to conduct research, keep up with current trends, while delivering precise, error-free work.  Managing multiple projects of various sizes at any given time.  Showcasing a constant desire to learn, thinking outside the box, constantly trying to improve everything design related at Canada Drives.  What You Should Already Have  A degree or diploma in Graphic Design.  At least 2 years experience in a Graphic Design position.  Experience with digital and print design with examples of both in your portfolio.  A strong understanding of Adobe programs including Photoshop, Indesign, and Illustrator.  Video, Animation, and Photography experience is an asset.  Experience with web design and UX/UI design (coding skills not necessary).  A team-first attitude and the willingness to work on all projects big or small.  A strong attention to detail.  What We Will Give You: Comprehensive health, dental and vision coverage  Company paid monthly MSP premiums  Company Paid Monthly Transit Pass (even if you live in the burbs!)  A variety of food and snacks while you work (seriously, lots of options)  A fulfilling, challenging adventure of a workplace located in the heart of beautiful downtown Vancouver! (We’re located by the Burrard sky-train station!)  Check out our company culture at www.instagram.com/canadadrives  Check out our company culture at www.instagram.com/canadadrives
Title: Graphic Designer

Job_Description: We are looking for bright and passionate people to be founding members of Great-West Life’s new Digital Labs. Do you have a passion for creating compelling and meaningful digital experiences? Do you ALWAYS think about the customer first? Are you a creative problem-solver and communicator? Do you want to help lead the transformation of a company and an industry? If you answered a wholehearted yes to all these questions, we want to talk to you.  ABOUT GWL’S DIGITAL LABS Great-West Life is embarking on a transformation that will change the way we work and how we help our customers. In our Digital Labs, we are designing, coding and delivering new products improving the lives of millions of Canadians. We are changing the way a trusted institution operates by acting as a start-up, bringing human centered design, agile and modern web development practices to life. Our multi-functional teams of Designers, Developers, Scrum Masters and Product Owners all huddle together because we have an open, innovative and inclusive culture which is focused on us – talented individuals.  OVERVIEW As our Customer Experience & Design Lead you are responsible for three core activities: Defining requirements for a coherent and attractive user experience taking into account brand fit and data from other channels Creating task flows and high-fidelity artifacts representing system behavior (e.g., wireframes, prototypes, etc.) managing the user research plan and execution (e.g., conducting panels, surveys, interviews), and playing back the results to the lab. WHAT YOU’LL DO Define the experience strategy facilitating work sessions with client teams and users to define key design goals and requirements Auditing the landscape competitively and comparatively for inspiration as well as design ideas that can be utilized in the current design process Lead the user experience and interface design efforts for the team, ensuring the delivery of a consumer quality product Create mockups , wireframes and prototypes for both mobile and web pages Conduct user research utilizing methods such as remote usability testing, A/B testing, 1:1 interviews, rapid contextual inquiries, etc. WHO YOU ARE Experience in a Design Lead or Director role, leading and coaching multifunctional teams of design strategists, researchers, UX/UI designers and visual designers You have several years of experience designing delightful consumer quality products on both web on mobile platforms You love to design clear and creative artifacts (e.g., task flows, wireframes, mockups and prototype) Have visual design skills, including use of a diverse set of software (e.g. Invision, Adobe suite, Sketch, OmniGraffle, Balsamiq, Axure) Experience with planning and conducting user research, user testing, A/B testing and rapid prototyping Have solid knowledge and expertise in UX design, preferably in an Agile environment Have strong communication skills with ability to articulate and optimize design based on the value to the user and the business Discover your opportunity….Apply today!  Great-West Life offers competitive compensation, great benefits such as medical, dental, life insurance, wellness account and personal days not to mention onsite cafeteria and fitness facilities. If you’d like to join our team submit your information online and introduce yourself.  Together Great-West Life, London Life and Canada Life serve the financial security needs of more than 13 million people across Canada, with additional operations in Europe and the United States. As members of the Power Financial Corporation group of companies, we’re one of Canada’s leading insurers with interests in life insurance, health insurance, investment and retirement savings. We offer a broad portfolio of financial and benefit plan solutions for individuals, families, businesses and organizations.  We are committed to providing an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of the communities in which we live, and to creating an environment where every employee has the opportunity to reach their potential.  Great-West Lifeco would like to thank all applicants, however only those who qualify for an interview will be contacted.  Apply for this job online Refer this job to a friend  Share on your newsfeed
Title: Design Lead

Job_Description: About Product Designer Position  We're looking for an experienced and talented Hybrid UX/UI Designer (Product Designer) to work independently with design oversight. Working in a user-centric design and agile development environment, the role will be to design digital experiences, adding new features from our product road map and improve existing features to better achieve both user and business goals. Through iterative design and development, the Product Designer will work diligently to incorporate user and stakeholder feedback into simple intuitive solutions in a highly-collaborative setting. The Product Designer will also be responsible for digital marketing design, including blogs, and digital advertisement. If you are sharp-minded, passionate and curious to work with the latest technologies, and enjoy working in a startup environment come work with us! Responsibilities and Duties  Design & Refine user interface and experience for our web platform. Contribute to discovery activities, reviewing customer feedback and data analytics. Create simple, intuitive and engaging experiences Create end-to-end designs from low-fidelity sketching/wire framing through to high-fidelity pixel perfect visual design Create interactive prototypes to communicate and demonstrate design concepts to internal stakeholders and clients Collaborate with Product Owners to understand business requirements and support delivery within development sprint cycles Present design solutions to business stakeholders with the ability to rationalize ideas using qualitative or quantitative data Ensure consistency in the user experience by reusing established design patterns and styles Participate in creating and updating the Intelocate Digital Style Guide & UI Pattern Library Accountable for all elements of asset delivery to development teams Work closely with developers to implement and perfect designs, with the goal of increasing collaboration and reducing documentation where we can Qualifications and Skills  2+ years of experience in UX/UI digital design-related role such as Product Design, Strong, clean visual design sense Adobe suite (PS, Illustrator), Sketch, Invision Strong design sense Portfolio full of great work Ambition Interest in joining a quickly growing startup Self starter Benefits  Startup Experience Fast pace growth Agile Development experience Competitive compensation package A friendly working environment with opportunities to impact the company with your ideas and involvement Freedom to work remotely
Title: Product Designer

Job_Description: Senior UI/Web Designer  Duration: 4 months  Location: Downtown Toronto  Responsibilities Responsible for executing stunning front end design work, including creating visual mockups for static and dynamic pagesDevelops site design by coordinating with UX specialists, copywriters, content publishers, developers and business stakeholdersDesigns engaging interactive experiences including the selection or creation of imagery and animationLead design review sessions with project teams, acquiring consensus and approvalCreate final visual mockups against wireframes, in keeping with the brand standards, UX guidelines and accessibility legislation (AODA/WCAG)Provide final design assets and documentation to the development team; liaise and support development team to the ensure final output matches the intended visual designCollaborates with other web designers & the UX team in the latest technologies and trends for efficient and aesthetically pleasing web design, as well as the development of the brand's internal digital style guide and design processes  Requirements Diploma or degree in Graphic or Web Design, Visual Communications or equivalentA superb creative portfolio that demonstrates a variety of work in different stylesMinimum 4 years’ experience in web & UI design or digital art directionStrong visual eye and attention to detailHighly proficient with design and prototyping tools such as Sketch, Photoshop, Illustrator, Principle, InVision, ZeplinStrong knowledge of HTML, CSS, JavaScript, front-end frameworks (e.g. Bootstrap) and other technologies — although this is not a web development roleA continual energy and enthusiasm for exploring the latest web technology trends and design techniques to evolve your skillset and work you produceSolid communication skills – ability to effectively communicate design concepts and decisionsA team player who welcomes and seeks out collaboration – you understand that giving/getting feedback from your design and UX colleagues is crucial in the development of your work and your own career growthResourcefulness and hustle under pressure; must be able to work smart through adversity and deadlinesHighly organized with great time management skills — you’ll be able to juggle multiple priorities at onceNice to have: ability to write content, and/or French language capability
Title: Senior UI/Web Designer

Job_Description: DesignerDuration: 6 Months+ (potential to convert to full-time based on performance)Career Level: Associate (2-3years exp)Project Overview: Digital Product Innovation and Commerce Design for several long-term implementations for global retail client.Position Overview:  Mobile and responsive design expert, but able to help on all design streams. Deep knowledge of UX. Client facing. Collaborative nature and cool under pressure. “Sketch” experience is a must.Responsibilities: Works under the direction of a project design lead to develop holistic design systems, including page layouts, site grids, typography, and coloursResponsible for asset creation, production, photo retouching and enhancementsImplements website accessibility standardsHas a strong knowledge of technology and user interface theoryExperienced in mobile app design, and familiar with Google Material Design and Apple’s Human Interface GuidelinesDesigns solutions that meet or exceed the project’s stated objectivesMaintains high quality on creative deliverablesAssists creative lead in research and presentation materialsPresents work internallyJob Type: Contract
Title: UX/UI Product Designer

Job_Description: As a Visual Communications Designer, you will leverage your creative and technical talents to shape and communicate the WiderFunnel brand story. You will work closely with our Growth team to create a cohesive, enjoyable brand experience at every client touchpoint. You are creative and passionate about user experience and graphic design; you’re keen to learn and share your own insights. We are leaders in validation, known for delivering proven growth programs for our clients. We deliver results for clients — fast, as a premium solution, with high touch service. We are a diverse and inclusive team rooted in a foundation of respect and openness. Our company values – grit, maverick, curiosity, integrity, and real – are at the centre of how we hire, how we work, and how we treat one another. At WiderFunnel, you can bring your most authentic self to work, merging your personal and professional lives together. Are you Imaginative, creative and an analytical thinker, with a strong motivation for finding solutions to complex or abstract problems? Systematic and patient, and introspective in the development of new ideas? Assertive, confident and direct when speaking about your area of specialization? Detail oriented and always achieving a high accuracy of work? Accountabilities: Manage ongoing design improvements to the WiderFunnel website (and other owned properties) Help bring new ideas for design and content creation to the team using your expertise and eye for great design Review current brand guidelines, and design cohesive campaign templates for current and future Growth campaigns Create templated brand assets for internal and external use, including prospect and client-facing presentations and other resources Create and maintain assets for each marketing channel (blog graphics, paid ads, social media assets, email templates, etc.) Create and maintain assets for special marketing events Collaborate with internal team members (such as but not limited to Developers, Project Managers, etc.) to bring ideas to life Qualifications: BA/BS or equivalent degree in Design (Graphic or Web) 2+ years as a professional web designer, with experience in UX and graphic design A portfolio that showcases high quality in design, creative solutions, and detail Expert proficiency in Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign). Sketch experience a plus. A fundamental understanding of HTML, CSS, JavaScript preferred Familiar with the latest UI web and mobile technology. Experience in layout and print design Excellent communicator and exceptional organizer.
Title: Visual Communications Designer (part time)

Job_Description: Job Description  The UI Designer will be responsible for the graphical creation and production of the video games’ menus and interfaces. Well organized and structured, the UI Designer must streamline and communicate the relevant information using visual means in order to lead the player through a gratifying gaming experience. This individual will work in close collaboration with the Art Director, the game’s creator, and the Programming department. Responsibilities: Conceive and create the visual content associated with a game’s menus and interfaces; Create the menus’ flow, layout, and assets; Participate in meetings in order to share ideas and knowledge; Complete research and gather data before taking on a new task in order to insure efficient management and reaching the objectives through a proper understanding of the game’s graphical requirements, by having at hand the necessary reference material, and by clearly understanding the artistic direction and the technical requirements; Work in close collaboration with the programming team. Qualifications  Requirements:  Diploma in Graphic Design or related area; 2 to 5 years of experience in graphic design (or equivalent), more specifically in the development of interfaces and menu stylization; Strong experience designing UI and UX for videogames; Master Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator, and Flash; Have a good understanding of typography, colour theory, layout design, and animation; Creative, autonomous, ability to adapt to requests; Able to work in a multidisciplinary group; Able to clearly identify interface strength and weaknesses; Passionate about video games; Having some knowledge of 3D modeling and web design is considered an asset; Experience with the Unity Engine is a plus. Additional Information  null

Title: UI Designer - Dead by Daylight

Job_Description: You believe design is at the heart of everything. That just a few milliseconds after the Big Bang cracked open the universe open… Design was born. Your friends say you’re a perfectionist. Your enemies say you’re hyper-critical. But behind every Unsolicited Design Critique™ is the desire to restore order, simplicity, and elegance to the universe. It fills you with a sense of purpose—and it’s why you love being a designer, so damn much. You love the idea of working at Transit because it has a tangible impact on cities and how people get around them. You want a job that’s more than prettifying pixels: you want the chance to reform cities. To revitalize urban transportation. To make it more seamless than ever. And that’s why we need you at Transit. Here are some examples of design projects you'd tackle: Design a bike navigation assistant that lets people get from A to B without touching their phone. Reshape our BIXI signup flow to make it easier for people to get going. Identify the perfect moment to notify the user when to get off their bus. Ping! Imagine a system that can passively crowdsource a transit delay. Find an icon system to communicate crowding of transit vehicles. If you're interested, here’s what we need on your end: Requirements Strong UX and UI skills. Separating the 2 would be a sin. Experience designing at least one mobile app. Maniacal obsession to details like font sizes, margins, colors and their consistency across screens. Be sharp, be smart, be creative. Here, there’s no such thing as "I tried everything". Be humble, listen to feedback, and accept criticism. The design is at fault, not the user. Passionate about cities, urbanism, public transit, design, technology, or all the above. Would-be-great-if section da Vinci-level Sketch skills (if only… ) Experience with prototyping and user testing. Experience designing web applications. Compensation & Benefits Competitive salary and stock options Comprehensive medical and dental coverage 4 weeks vacation Apple laptop and display Spend your days surrounded by first-rate teammates + the best view of Montreal Monthly STM pass and BIXI pass, on us We believe in the importance of an inclusive and diverse team. We welcome people of all ages, genders, ethnicities, orientations and backgrounds to apply. Ready to apply? Send us your résumé, portfolio and why is it that you want to work at Transit to: jobs+design@transitapp.com.
Title: Product Designer

Job_Description: The Mobify design team believes in being human, communicating clearly, delivering value, keeping it simple, and exhibiting craftsmanship. If you share these design principles, then this role might be a wonderful fit for you.  The designer role on Mobify’s Partner Success team is unique: we use a mix of UX design, service design, and visual design skills to ensure our customers’ PWAs (progressive web apps) ship with a best-in-case shopping experience. We facilitate design thinking across the organization and between our partners and customers by ensuring the shopper is at the center of all our decisions. We spend much of our time helping our sales, customer success, and marketing teams create assets such as UX analysis, decks, videos, booths, and website content to ensure our product messaging is super clear. As a designer at Mobify, you’ll learn from and share your knowledge with a diverse team of talented and enthusiastic individuals across the organization. People from all across Mobify practice design thinking and value the user experience, caring deeply about the products and services we deliver to retailers.  Your performance will be measured against your skill in crafting solutions of the highest standard; your willingness to use research to test your assumptions; your desire to lead and instill a human centred design approach; and your ability to step away from the tactical and think strategically about why you're doing what you're doing. What You'll Do In Your First 90 Days Learn everything about Mobify, our processes, and our customers through a rigorous (and fun!) onboarding process Meet our phenomenal partners and help them better understand the capabilities of the Mobify Platform, the Mobify SDK, and the Mobify UI Kit Act as a mobile UX authority, educating our partners and customer on Mobify’s industry’s best practices as PWA builds progress Use service design and other user centered techniques to continually iterate on the Mobify partner and customer experience Master the Mobify brand standards and design system to create sales materials, marketing assets, internal resources, and contribute to our product experience Chip in to the myriad discussions about UX and ecommerce, and present at weekly design syncs and periodic all-hands meets Participate in reviews, critiques, and feedback sessions with our cross-department design team, and speak to shopping experience with product Have regular 1:1s with the design director to discuss your growth Feel included in our many fun-filled company-wide events, retreats, and meet ups Who You Are We are looking for a designer who is currently working as a junior or intermediate designer who has excellent communication and problem-solving skills This role requires you to work on-location at our stylish headquarters in the heart of downtown Vancouver, Canada so you will need to be willing to relocate if you live outside of the lower mainland You have 3+ years of experience crafting, functional user experiences in a related role, whether it was as a product designer, communication designer, experience designer, visual designer, or interaction designer You value craft and relish the full spectrum of the design process from research to prototyping, through to finished mockups and execution You are a natural teacher able to clearly communicate concepts and ideas You have a portfolio that showcases the research and rationale behind your design decisions and showcases an understanding of micro and macro interactions You love having ownership over your work from start to finish You are a kind human who believes that everyone’s voice is important You Might Also... You have experience designing for ecommerce, particularly if those experiences are creative and new-to-market You are the first to try the latest design tools but know the ins and outs and intricacies of Sketch You love creating animations, videos and motion graphics to tell your story You have an understanding of scalable design systems You understand how to make UI fixes with HTML and CSS You get the basics of JavaScript, particularly React and NodeJS You have taught or facilitated workshops, courses, or presented to groups of designers You are seriously enthusiastic about anything at all — typography, photography, fine arts, cooking, or any number of creative disciplines that involve honing your craft or one of your processes You are not only aware, but passionate about fixing the myriad social issues facing the design and tech industries (we’re committed to making Mobify a diverse and inclusive place to work)
Title: Intermediate Designer

Job_Description: 7Geese is growing! We're seeking a passionate and talented Product Designer with experience in designing web and mobile applications. We're an ambitious, youthful startup building a disruptive platform to help people, teams, and companies perform their best. We believe that the future of work is realtime, connected, and transparent — and we're building an application to make that belief a reality.  We love to work with people that thrive in a work environment that requires strong problem-solving skills and independent self-direction, coupled with an aptitude for team collaboration and open communication. We're in need of a bright product designer that is capable of providing both highly analytical as well as highly creative ideas to help us build the future of work. Sound like you? That's awesome. We want to hear from you. Please share a portfolio of your recent work with us! Our ideal candidate must have: At least 2-3 years of experience working with SaaS product teams A passion for creating simple, elegant, beautiful solutions to wicked problems Expert knowledge of UI design best practices and techniques Experience building prototypes and mockups with modern design apps such like Sketch and Principle Knowledge of UX best practices and ability to implement solutions to remove friction from imperfect workflows You understand code (HTML, CSS and JavaScript) well enough to communicate effectively with the dev team during handoff Extra points: You're a pixel-perfectionist. We pride ourselves on beautiful design work! You already use the same tools and apps we use: Sketch, Principle, Invision Experience with setting up, executing, and acting on user validation and usability studies Experience using data to measure the impact of your design and iterating Experience with designing for Mobile (Android and iOS) and Tablet Your key responsibilities would be to: Design, build, and refine new and existing product features in collaboration with other designers, developers, and product managers. Take ownership of specific product areas to improve and innovate the design and associated workflows. Review and discuss new design work with the product design team weekly Conduct usability studies to identify issues with different workflows and come up with solutions. There is a fair amount of autonomy involved with this role, so we're looking for somebody that takes initiative and can multi-task like a boss! What's in it for you? Be a part of building an exciting, innovative product in a hot industry! Competitive salary, comprehensive health benefits plan, flexible work hours Work from our trendy brick Gastown office with free snacks (and coffee...) Weekly catered lunch and learns with the whole team An opportunity to grow your career at a rapid pace You get to work with some of the most talented designers and engineers in Vancouver in a fun and supportive environment Note: this is a full-time role based in Vancouver, BC. At this time we're not looking to hire remotely.
Title: Product Designer

Job_Description: Voices.com is the #1 Online Marketplace for Sourcing Voice Over Talent.  We are looking for a passionate and continuous learner who is capable of bringing innovative ideas to the table. You will be part of the entire product development experience, continually delivering value to our customers and stakeholders. We are looking for individuals with a strong affinity for creating amazing digital products and delivering outstanding experiences to our customers.  What you can bring: 3-5 years of UX strategy or digital strategy experience with a background in agency, corporate or consulting work  2-3 years of experience in UX research, user testing and UX metrics  Strong communication skills, written and verbal. The ability to facilitate workshops and present findings in a compelling way, to various types of audiences  Ability to articulate your ideas efficiently and effectively to teammates, stakeholders and leadership  Ability to collaborate with others to solve complex product challenges in a fast-paced startup culture environment  Even better if: You have some basic familiarity of front-end technologies such as UI Frameworks, HTML/CSS and Javascript  You have experience working with product management tools such as JIRA and SalesForce  You have some basic familiarity with modern design systems and tools like Sketch, Invision and Adobe CC  Your role will include the following responsibilities: Working on a brand new product in a fast growing company using lean/agile principles  Working with a cross-functional product team including Developers, Marketers, Product Managers and Product Designers  Deliver strategic assets and documentation using a collaborative product management system and modern suite of tools  Support the Product Manager in facilitating product discovery workshops with stakeholders to help define business objectives and key results  Help to define and document customer journeys and personas  Support the Product Manager to collect large amounts of information from across the company and develop a compelling, insightful product vision and strategy  Schedule and participate in frequent user testing and research sessions to validate the effectiveness of the product strategy with real customers  Collaborate with Product Designers to quickly sketch or wireframe concepts and ideas  Complete competitive and market research that will be used in the product strategy  Equal Employment Opportunities  Voices.com values diversity. We're proud to be an equal opportunity employer and consider qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, age, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital or family status, veteran status, medical condition or disability. Accommodation  Voices.com is committed to providing accommodation for applicants with disabilities; please let us know if you require an accommodation during the recruitment process.
Title: UX Researcher

Job_Description: Nous valorisons la diversité et avons à cœur de créer un milieu de travail inclusif qui nous inspire tous à donner le meilleur de nous-mêmes. Joignez-vous à notre équipe et faites une différence!  Votre poste  Nous Comment imaginez-vous les bureaux d’une compagnie d’assurance? Et l’atmosphère de travail qui y règne? Nous gageons que si vous passez nous voir au Lab de Intact, vous serez très surpris! Situé au centre-ville de Montréal, nous sommes un laboratoire d’innovation dont la mission est de créer des produits à la fine-pointe de l’insurtech qui améliorent la vie de millions de Canadiens.  Mariant la convivialité et la vélocité d’une startup aux ressources et aux moyens d’une grande entreprise (vous disposerez de tous les outils dont vous avez toujours rêvé!), le Lab est un environnement jeune et dynamique, offrant des défis stimulants, des collègues inspirants et une carrière passionnante (chez un des top 100 employeurs au Canada). C’est l’endroit idéal pour parfaire vos compétences et faire évoluer votre carrière.  Vous Vous êtes passionné par le commerce électronique et l’innovation numérique? Vous avez un talent particulier pour traduire des exigences complexes en expériences utiles et agréables? Vous restez à l’affût des dernières tendances en matière de design et vous aimez expérimenter de nouveaux outils et de nouvelles méthodologies? Nous avons l’occasion parfaite pour vous!  Rôle À titre de designer UX/UI, vous jouerez un rôle essentiel dans la conception et l’évolution de notre écosystème numérique. Relevant du directeur principal, Innovations numériques, vous aurez comme principales responsabilités :  Concevoir des expériences captivantes en vue de réaliser les objectifs d’affaires  Valider la fonctionnalité et l’utilité par l’entremise de tests et de recherches auprès des utilisateurs  Produire des livrables UX et design pertinents au besoin  Piloter une feuille de route aux côté d’un directeur de produit et d’une équipe agile multidisciplinaire  Présenter le travail aux parties prenantes  Aider les ingénieurs à produire des interfaces de qualité et agréables  Prôner une conception axée sur l’utilisateur et les données  Vos compétences  Minimum trois années d’expérience  Expertise en matière de convivialité et de pratiques de conception centrées sur l'utilisateur  Maîtrise des outils de conception (Sketch, Axure, InVision, Illustrator, etc.)  Expérience des outils de recherche UX (usertesting.com, Optimal Workshop, etc.) un atout  Expérience dans la production de flux de processus, d’inventaires de contenu, etc.  Vous aimez travailler dans un environnement de collaboration qui accorde une importance primordiale au travail d’équipe, à l’innovation, à l’ouverture d’esprit et au plaisir  Veuillez inclure votre portfolio dans votre dossier de candidature.  Vous êtes  Une personne avec qui il est agréable de travailler  Créatif, analytique, curieux et ingénieux  Un joueur d’équipe capable de partager et recevoir des commentaires constructifs  Excellent pour expliquer vos idées à différents intervenants  Profondément passionné par le design et la qualité  Organisé et proactif  En tant que salarié temps plein, vous bénéficierez des avantages suivants :  Un salaire compétitif  Un boni de performance annuel  Un régime de retraite  Un horaire de travail flexible de 35 heures par semaine  Des assurances médicales et dentaires hors pair  Et plusieurs autres avantages et bénéfices (remboursement gym, conférences, etc.)  Énoncé fermeture  Cette opportunité vous intéresse? Nous avons très hâte de faire votre connaissance!  D’excellents avantages sont offerts : salaire concurrentiel, avantages flexibles, aménagements de travail flexibles, congés mobiles, régime de retraite à prestation déterminée, etc.  Dans le cadre du processus de sélection d’Intact, les candidats peuvent être appelés à donner leur consentement à une vérification de leurs antécédents pertinente au poste à pourvoir avant de recevoir une offre d’emploi. Celle-ci peut comprendre une confirmation des références d’emploi, des études et des titres de compétences, une vérification des emplois, de l’identité, des infractions criminelles et du permis de conduire ainsi qu’un rapport de crédit.  Vous pouvez soumettre votre candidature à un emploi affiché pourvu que vous occupiez vos fonctions actuelles depuis au moins douze mois et que votre performance soit jugée bonne ou que votre contrat temporaire arrive à son échéance. Une recherche de talents à l'externe est menée parallèlement au recrutement à l'interne Veuillez donc prendre note que des candidats potentiels pourraient avoir été identifiés pour ce poste dans le cadre de leur plan de développement.   Veuillez noter que l'usage du masculin a comme but d'alléger le texte.  Cet affichage prendra fin 02 juin 2018.  Prime de recommandation  CE POSTE EST SUJET À UNE PRIME DE RECOMMANDATION DE 3000$.  #li-qc  Droit de travailler au Canada  Les personnes qui posent leur candidature à un poste permanent doivent, dès leur embauche, avoir le droit de travailler au Canada de façon permanente. Les documents pouvant servir de preuve dans le cas des rôles permanents sont un certificat de naissance canadien, un passeport canadien, un certificat de citoyenneté canadienne, une carte de résident permanent ou une confirmation de son statut de résident permanent pour prouver qu’il a le droit de travailler au Canada.  Indeed Commandité  IN-INFR
Title: Designer UX/UI

Job_Description: Travailler chez Genius Solutions c'est : Joindre une équipe passionnée et dynamique qui a à cœur le succès de l’entreprise. C’est également joindre une entreprise en constante évolution dans un environnement stimulant et dans un marché hautement compétitif .Vous avez de l’intérêt à travailler chez Genius? Assurez-vous de vous reconnaitre dans les valeurs de l’entreprise :Vous êtes énergique et passionné : pour atteindre le succès, nous avons besoin de gens avec une énergie débordante démontrant une passion pour leur travail.Vous êtes en mission : les défis sont grands pour nous et nos clients et nous devons faire face à plusieurs obstacles. Pour mener à bien notre mission, il est essentiel de garder le cap!Vous êtes un bon joueur d’équipe : nous croyons fermement que le respect et la confiance sont des ingrédients essentiels au succès.Vous valorisez la connaissance et l’expertise : Genius valorise grandement les gens qui veulent progresser, acquérir de nouvelles connaissances et développer leur expertise.Vous vous reconnaissez dans les valeurs de la compagnie? Oui?Continuons!Designer UX / UI chez Genius Solutions : Nous recherchons actuellement un designer UX/UI . Cette personne aura comme principale fonction la conception de l’interface utilisateur de la prochaine version web de notre application, Genius Manufacturing . La personne sélectionnée devra analyser l’expérience client actuelle, proposer des améliorations et présenter des concepts de maquettes (mockup). Elle devra également accompagner l’équipe de développement informatique tout au long du projet.Les tâches et responsabilités : Effectuer une analyse et une prise de besoins (clients et experts internes)Étudier et analyser les produits et tendances sur le marchéÉtablir des plans et concepts afin de les présenter au comité responsableDévelopper et documenter les outils qui seront utilisés à l’interneOffrir de formation et coaching à notre équipeConnaissances et profil recherchés : Expérience en design d’application web spécialiséeExpérience UX / UI3 à 5 années d’expérience pertinentesMaitrise des logiciels de maquettes (mockup)Niveau avancé de maitrise de la langue anglaise (parlé et écrit)Aimer travailler en mode agileConnaissance de logiciel de type ERP serait un atout importantConditions de travail : Une super équipeUn salaire compétitifUn horaire de travail flexibleVacances + 5 congés payés par annéeDes assurances collectivesDes activités socialesEt bien plus...Lieu de travail : QuébecMots clés : Web – Migration – Développement – Interface – Utilisateur – Expérience client – Mockup – Besoin – Designer – Amélioration – Analyse – ERP – Application – Logiciel – Navigation – Agile – Ergonomie – Graphique – Normes – Livrables – Architecture – Interaction – Interactivité – Solution – Numérique – Mobile – Utilisateur – Visuel – CréativitéType d'emploi : Temps Plein

Job_Description: Position Overview: The role of the web UX & UI designer & developer is to create the user experience vision and successfully develop, monitor and improve users’ overall experience when they visit our websites. The individual should have the skills and knowledge to create memorable experiences that are true to the brand while balancing seamless interactivity, ease of navigation and conversion.Reporting to the Director, Marketing & Communications, the Web UX& UI Designerwill be the champion of the users’ needs, and create intuitive user experiences and interface designs. The role will be responsible for the end-to-end online construction, maintenance and experience for: TPH.ca, RHGroup.ca, RGStore.ca, TheGlobeRestaurant.ca, the Intranet, and others as required.The UX & UI Designer will create wireframes and storyboards that map the customer journey, user flows, process flows, information architecture, site maps, porotypes and A/B testing to effectively communicate interaction and design ideas & design each screen or page with which a user interacts.The ideal candidate should have an eye for clean design, possess superior UI & UX skills and be able to translate stakeholder requirements into logical interaction flows and a user interface that is intuitive, visually stimulating and converts.Responsibilities: Be guided by human-centric design by identifying user needs, and leveraging those insights to guide you through the design and testing processesUnderstand the research methods and approaches to recognize and deconstruct the expectation of our usersEstablish design best practices and guidelines through creation of conceptual campaigns and design of a great visual identity and cohesive style-guide ensuring that a consistent design language is applied across sites incorporating logo, corporate colours, typographic rules, etc.Maintaining consistency in visual elements and defining behaviorCreate website that are designed and optimized for all screen sizes (including mobile, tablet, and desktop) with a mobile-first mentality, with specific technologies and platforms in mindLead conversations to facilitate conceptual thinking that takes stakeholder considerations into the processCreate clickable prototypes in Testing of websites and that effortlessly lets the users accomplish their goalsOther duties and responsibilities as assignedQualifications: 3-5 years of proven web designer experienceDemonstrable UI & UX design skills with a strong portfolioSolid experience in creating wireframes and storyboards, user flows, process flows, information architecture, site maps, prototypes and A/B testing to effectively communicate interaction and design ideas & design each screen or page with which a user interactsExperience working with a .Net CMS and e-commerce, knowledge of DotNetNuke (DNN) is preferredProficiency in Creative Design Software (specifically Photoshop, Illustrator, and other visual design and wire-framing tools)Proficiency in: HTML, CSS, JavaScript and JQuery, Media Queries/Bootstrap, Version Control (SVN)Explore various usability testing methods to help inform and optimize designs to create more effective experiencesUnderstand on-page, off-page and technical SEO practices and how to best implement these strategies on the websitesImplement Google Analytics, Tag Manager and Optimize to apply fundamental concepts like performance measurement, comparison and optimization.Experience providing feedback on designer performance, and identifying improvement opportunitiesAbility to present your designs and sell your solutions to various stakeholdersAbility to solve problems creatively and effectivelyUp-to-date with the latest UI trends, techniques, and technologiesExperience working in an Agile/Scrum development processExcellent communication skills and the ability to multi-task, and work well under pressure while juggling several competing prioritiesJob Type: Full-timeExperience:.Net: 1 yearAdobe Creative Suite: 1 yearWeb Design: 3 yearsLocation:Toronto, ON
Title: Web UX & UI Designer

Job_Description: Navigator Marketingis an award-winning, full-service marketing agency that provides cutting-edge marketing strategy that produce results. We work with companies all over North America.Services: Web Design, Mobile Web Design, Monthly Marketing Strategy & Implementation, Social Media Management.Our Mission: Helping business owners grow their businesses from where they are now to where they want them to be.How We Do This: We increase a business' PROFILE, LEADS & SALES. We are a fun, talented & driven team who work at the intersection technology and consumer behaviour generating sales.Position Description: We are looking for an amazing & fun Web & UI/UX Developerto add to our team to assist with designing, coding and modifying websites, from layout to function. This person will strive to create visually appealing sites that feature user-friendly design and clear navigation. This person will also work closely with our designers & team members to execute & bring to life new ideas & projects in a team approach.The successful candidate will also be working on keeping websites up to date, landing pages, mobile optimization, analytics and much more. These tasks will require you to be comfortable and efficient with Google Developer Tools, and coding in HTML5, CSS, Javascript and PHP.We are looking for someone with minimum of one year experience in the field who can hit the ground running. Training will be minimal as we need someone to help us out immediately with our current projects. You should enjoy solving problems independently and keeping up to date with the newest trends.Qualifications: Amazing attention to detail.Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator skills an asset.HTML(5), CSS, JavaScript + jQuery, PHP .Setting up WordPress websites from scratch, working with plugins & some ecommerce.Familiarity with cPanel, Server / IT knowledge an asset.Experience with media queries and building responsive websites.Excellent at solving the challenges of cross browser rendering (desktop [IE, FF, Chrome, Safari] and mobile [iOS, Android])Ability to write iOS applications is an asset.Great problem solving skills.Additional Information: Key TraitsYou are passionate and love what you do.Work well under pressureAble to move from project to project quicklyGreat memory skillsExcellent communications skills.Strong analytical and problem solving skills.Superior teamwork and interpersonal skills.Strong organizational, prioritization, time management skills & work well under pressure.The ability to effectively handle multiple tasks and projects and to meet deadlines.Your upbeat & enthusiastic! Attitude is everything with us. We are a fun quirky group, but we love to work at what we do!EducationA college or university diploma/degree in something related is preferred.Also open to applicants who can demonstrate an amazing knowledge & Do-it-yourself spirit.Job Type: FreelanceJob Type: Freelance
Title: Wordpress Web Designer - Virtual 20 hours/week

Job_Description: About Nix Sensor Ltd.We create amazing products that help colour professionals and consumers demystify the world of colour. If you’ve never used a Nix Color Sensor, it’s a magical experience. Like the photoshop eyedropper in real life, it takes the real world and makes it digital, and then can help our users make it real again.What you’ll do?Design beautiful apps that work with our award-winning hardwareWork with our software development, hardware, and product teams to craft a seamless user experienceOwn the design of our core products and participate in shaping the direction of our future productsIterate, test, and release products as quickly as we can gather feedback from our users and customersEven help out with other aspects of product design like packaging, web, etc.What you’ll need?A compelling and interesting portfolio of projects that showcase your workExperience designing mobile apps, and even web and other types of media, front end, back end, consumer and cloud based experience is a bonusExperience using the latest design tools to facilitate wireframing, prototyping, user testing, and information architectureExperience using a design methodology to get product out the door fastThe ability to work in a fast paced, collaborative environment, alongside the rest of our dynamic teamWhat’s makes Nix a great place to work?You’ll be joining a company that’s backed by some of the best advisors and investors in CanadaWe’re growing quickly, and you’ll be helping to build the next great Canadian success storyYou’ll work with a highly motivated team that takes pride in creating amazing productsWhat’s next?Send us a note or message indicating your interestShowcase your work by sending us a portfolio and / or examples of prior projectsJob Type: Full-timeExperience:UI Design: 1 yearUX Design: 1 year
Title: UX UI Designer

Job_Description: Nous valorisons la diversité et avons à cœur de créer un milieu de travail inclusif qui nous inspire tous à donner le meilleur de nous-mêmes. Joignez-vous à notre équipe et faites une différence!  Votre poste  Nous Vous pensez qu’on s’ennuie en assurance? Attendez-vous à être surpris. Chez Intact Lab, l’assurance est un domaine dynamique, innovateur et amusant (oui, vous avez bien lu).  Intact Lab est le centre d’innovation numérique d’Intact Corporation financière, l’un des 100 meilleurs employeurs au Canada. Nous combinons l’esprit d’une start-up et les ressources d’une grande entreprise. Qu’est-ce que cela signifie? Cela veut dire que nous avons accès à des technologies à la fine-pointe et la liberté de créer des produits de l’insurtech qui n’existent pas encore. Et c’est là que le travail devient amusant.  Nous travaillons en collaboration à offrir une expérience numérique conviviale pour le client. Nous sommes actuellement à la recherche d’un designer de services de talent pour compléter notre équipe Design Thinking croissante. Et c’est là que vous intervenez.  Vous À titre de designer de services, votre quête consiste à démystifier les systèmes complexes et à créer des environnements propices à l’implantation et l’évolution d’innovations. En tant que membre de l’équipe Design Thinking, vous serez le gardien des parcours client et contribuerez à identifier les occasions de rehausser et de transformer nos expériences client. Relevant du directeur, Design Thinking, vous aurez comme principales responsabilités :  Définir la vision à long terme de notre expérience client et propulser notre transformation axée sur le client en tirant parti des méthodologies du Design Thinking.  Diriger nos squads Design Thinking dans toutes les étapes, de la recherche et la découverte à l’idéation, le prototypage et le design de nouveaux produits et services.  Appliquer vos compétences UX, UI, Interaction Design et HCI à l’ensemble des canaux et des produits.  Produire des artefacts UX tels que les parcours client, les profils d’utilisateur et les plans de service pour créer une compréhension commune de l’expérience utilisateur dans l’ensemble des secteurs d’activité et des marques.  Élaborer des histoires et des éléments visuels convaincants pour communiquer les idées, susciter l’adhésion des intervenants et inspirer les équipes.  Développer des prototypes pour tester et valider des solutions de raffinement.  Créer des plans de développement de solutions clairs pour propulser les solutions par l'expérimentation, les tests et le perfectionnement en fonction des apprentissages.  Participer au processus de développement de solutions pour des innovations progressives, révolutionnaires et radicales.  Faire preuve d’empathie envers les intervenants et les clients lors de leur démarche d’innovation et leur apprendre comment traverser les phases divergentes et convergentes du développement.  Exploiter les idées, avoir l’esprit ouvert et identifier les concepts de manière réelle et concrète.  Promouvoir les initiatives de Design Thinking pour renforcer et propulser l’orientation client à travers l’organisation.  Vos compétences  Minimum 3 années d’expérience en design de services.  Un portfolio robuste présentant des solutions de design axées sur l’utilisateur.  Expertise en matière de convivialité et de pratiques de design axées sur l'utilisateur.  Expérience des outils de design (Sketch, Axure, InVision, Adobe Creative Suit, etc.).  Connaissance des outils de recherche UX (UserTesting.com, Optimal Workshop, Survey Monkey, etc.).  Excellentes communications verbales, solides compétences graphiques et de visualisation pour communiquer des idées de design.  Bilinguisme (français/anglais) un atout.  Vous êtes  Un esprit novateur et stratégique qui aime résoudre des problèmes complexes.  Profondément passionné par le design et l’expérience client.  Un joueur d’équipe qui se démarque dans un environnement de collaboration et capable de partager et recevoir des commentaires constructifs.  Proactif, capable de travailler de manière autonome et de gérer l’ambiguïté.  À l’écoute, un communicateur efficace, un présentateur intéressant et un conteur passionnant.  À l’aise d’interagir à différents niveaux de l’organisation, des pairs à la haute direction.  En tant que salarié temps plein, vous bénéficierez des avantages suivants :  Un horaire de 35 heures par semaine avec formules de travail flexible et de télétravail.  Des avantages financiers dont un boni de performance, des options d’achat d’actions et un régime de retraite.  Une couverture d’assurance hors pair (c’est notre spécialité après tout).  Une ambiance de travail décontractée en plein cœur du centre-ville de Montréal avec un resto-café sur place et un patio extérieur.  Vous aurez également accès à diverses conférences de l’industrie, à un programme d’achat d’ordinateur, une subvention pour la forme physique et des rabais chez nos partenaires.  Énoncé fermeture  Cette opportunité vous intéresse? Nous avons très hâte de faire votre connaissance!  D’excellents avantages sont offerts : salaire concurrentiel, avantages flexibles, aménagements de travail flexibles, congés mobiles, régime de retraite à prestation déterminée, etc.  Dans le cadre du processus de sélection d’Intact, les candidats peuvent être appelés à donner leur consentement à une vérification de leurs antécédents pertinente au poste à pourvoir avant de recevoir une offre d’emploi. Celle-ci peut comprendre une confirmation des références d’emploi, des études et des titres de compétences, une vérification des emplois, de l’identité, des infractions criminelles et du permis de conduire ainsi qu’un rapport de crédit.  Une recherche de talents à l'externe est menée parallèlement au recrutement à l'interne. Veuillez donc prendre note que des candidats potentiels pourraient avoir été identifiés pour ce poste dans le cadre de leur plan de développement.   Veuillez noter que l'usage du masculin a comme but d'alléger le texte.  Cet affichage prendra fin le 02 juin 2018.  Droit de travailler au Canada  Les personnes qui posent leur candidature à un poste permanent doivent, dès leur embauche, avoir le droit de travailler au Canada de façon permanente. Les documents pouvant servir de preuve dans le cas des rôles permanents sont un certificat de naissance canadien, un passeport canadien, un certificat de citoyenneté canadienne, une carte de résident permanent ou une confirmation de son statut de résident permanent pour prouver qu’il a le droit de travailler au Canada. Title: Designer de services

Job_Description: Nous valorisons la diversité et avons à cœur de créer un milieu de travail inclusif qui nous inspire tous à donner le meilleur de nous-mêmes. Joignez-vous à notre équipe et faites une différence!  Votre poste  Nous Vous pensez qu’on s’ennuie en assurance? Attendez-vous à être surpris. Chez Intact Lab, l’assurance est un domaine dynamique, innovateur et amusant (oui, vous avez bien lu).  Intact Lab est le centre d’innovation numérique d’Intact Corporation financière, l’un des 100 meilleurs employeurs au Canada. Nous combinons l’esprit d’une start-up et les ressources d’une grande entreprise. Qu’est-ce que cela signifie? Cela veut dire que nous avons accès à des technologies à la fine-pointe et la liberté de créer des produits de l’insurtech qui n’existent pas encore. Et c’est là que le travail devient amusant.  Nous travaillons en collaboration à offrir une expérience numérique conviviale pour le client. Nous sommes actuellement à la recherche d’un designer de services de talent pour compléter notre équipe Design Thinking croissante. Et c’est là que vous intervenez.  Vous À titre de designer de services, votre quête consiste à démystifier les systèmes complexes et à créer des environnements propices à l’implantation et l’évolution d’innovations. En tant que membre de l’équipe Design Thinking, vous serez le gardien des parcours client et contribuerez à identifier les occasions de rehausser et de transformer nos expériences client. Relevant du directeur, Design Thinking, vous aurez comme principales responsabilités :  Définir la vision à long terme de notre expérience client et propulser notre transformation axée sur le client en tirant parti des méthodologies du Design Thinking.  Diriger nos squads Design Thinking dans toutes les étapes, de la recherche et la découverte à l’idéation, le prototypage et le design de nouveaux produits et services.
