Title: Designer de services

Job_Description: Job Description (EN)   Torstar Corporation is a broadly based, progressive media organization listed on the Toronto Stock Exchange (TS.B) with a long, proud history in newspapers and a passion for capitalizing on the fluid world of digital and mobile media. Torstar will be energized by a deep customer-centric obsession, continued journalistic excellence, advanced data-driven competency and a culture that is selfless, focused, agile, collaborative and results driven. You’ll be a champion of those priorities while you leverage Torstar’s wealth of data to drive revenues for a company that is poised and positioned to lead in all of its media ventures.  What You Will Do… Work as a member of the UX and Design team, helping to define and design clear, beautiful interfaces for the web and mobile devices; Create intelligent design solutions for mobile and web Design cross-platform user interfaces, interactive page layouts and UI prototypes Visualize and verbalize your creative ideas and vision, as well as rationalize solutions with the team and clients Gather design requirements and consolidate input from multiple stakeholders Collaborate with core team to create a better user experience Visually present information so it’s easy to read, understand and find. Constantly explore ways to create a more cohesive story and enhanced usability. Simplify, and systematize interactions and experiences across our products Maintain and drive the visual design identity through specs, style guides, libraries and processes Design digital product solutions that meet or exceed strategic objectives Create highly usable interface solutions focused on user experience Test concepts and iterate as findings help define deeper insights Balance creative requirements with client business requirements Provide quality assurance on creative deliverables  Why You Will Be Successful: You have a digital portfolio showcasing exceptional and impactful digital customer experience solutions leveraging human-centered design. Experience designing outstanding web-based products Proven ability to communicate conceptual ideas and design rationale, all within a user-centered design process Able to prioritize and manage workload and meet critical project milestones and deadlines Excellent problem-solving skills Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to build good working relationships Knowledge and/or experience in the agile process Experience with responsive/adaptive design principles Minimum 4+ years of working experience in graphic design and using a variety of platforms such as Mac, Windows and mobile (iOS/Android) Strong knowledge and experience designing wireframes and interactive prototypes using industry software (e.g. Axure, Sketch, Invision, Illustrator, Photoshop). Solid knowledge around user experience methods and deliverables such as wireframes, storyboarding, user flows, analyzing user stories, accessibility basics and pattern libraries Expert level proficiency in Sketch and Adobe Creative Suite A passion for clean, functional, and elegant interfaces Deep knowledge of design principles and methods Curiosity and commitment to testing new ideas and innovating to drive business results Knowledge of current digital UX related standards and trends including design thinking. Ability to multitask in a high-paced work environment. Ability to work independently as well collaboratively part of a team.  Why You’ll LOVE Working Here… The opportunity to be part of an exciting company grounded in history while striving to be at the cutting edge of the digital media industry; you'll never get bored in our fast-paced, constantly evolving and challenging environment We recognize that you have a life outside of work and we offer you real work/life balance We provide individualized career plans and extensive ongoing development opportunities We've got your health in mind; you'll get a comprehensive benefits package & group RSP (Extended Health Care, Dental, etc.) combined with a generous vacation plan  …And let’s not forget the AWESOME PEOPLE!  The Company is committed to providing an inclusive and barrier free recruitment process to applicants with accessibility needs in accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA). If you require an accommodation during this process, please inform the Company of your requirements.
Title: Senior UI Designer

Job_Description: We are looking for bright and passionate people to be founding members of Great-West Life’s new Digital Labs. Do you have a passion for creating compelling and meaningful digital experiences? Do you ALWAYS think about the customer first? Are you a creative problem-solver and communicator? Do you want to help lead the transformation of a company and an industry? If you answered a wholehearted yes to all these questions, we want to talk to you.  ABOUT GWL’S DIGITAL LABS  Great-West Life is embarking on a transformation that will change the way we work and how we help our customers. In our Digital Labs, we are designing, coding and delivering new products improving the lives of millions of Canadians. We are changing the way a trusted institution operates by acting as a start-up, bringing human centered design, agile and modern web development practices to life. Our multi-functional teams of Designers, Developers, Scrum Masters and Product Owners all huddle together because we have an open, innovative and inclusive culture which is focused on us – talented individuals.  OVERVIEW  As our Customer Experience & Design Lead you are responsible for three core activities:  Defining requirements for a coherent and attractive user experience taking into account brand fit and data from other channels Creating task flows and high-fidelity artifacts representing system behavior (e.g., wireframes, prototypes, etc.) managing the user research plan and execution (e.g., conducting panels, surveys, interviews), and playing back the results to the lab. WHAT YOU’LL DO  Define the experience strategy facilitating work sessions with client teams and users to define key design goals and requirements Auditing the landscape competitively and comparatively for inspiration as well as design ideas that can be utilized in the current design process Lead the user experience and interface design efforts for the team, ensuring the delivery of a consumer quality product Create mockups , wireframes and prototypes for both mobile and web pages Conduct user research utilizing methods such as remote usability testing, A/B testing, 1:1 interviews, rapid contextual inquiries, etc. WHO YOU ARE  Experience in a Design Lead or Director role, leading and coaching multifunctional teams of design strategists, researchers, UX/UI designers and visual designers You have several years of experience designing delightful consumer quality products on both web on mobile platforms You love to design clear and creative artifacts (e.g., task flows, wireframes, mockups and prototype) Have visual design skills, including use of a diverse set of software (e.g. Invision, Adobe suite, Sketch, OmniGraffle, Balsamiq, Axure) Experience with planning and conducting user research, user testing, A/B testing and rapid prototyping Have solid knowledge and expertise in UX design, preferably in an Agile environment Have strong communication skills with ability to articulate and optimize design based on the value to the user and the business Discover your opportunity….Apply today!  Great-West Life offers competitive compensation, great benefits such as medical, dental, life insurance, wellness account and personal days not to mention onsite cafeteria and fitness facilities. If you’d like to join our team submit your information online and introduce yourself.  Together Great-West Life, London Life and Canada Life serve the financial security needs of more than 13 million people across Canada, with additional operations in Europe and the United States. As members of the Power Financial Corporation group of companies, we’re one of Canada’s leading insurers with interests in life insurance, health insurance, investment and retirement savings. We offer a broad portfolio of financial and benefit plan solutions for individuals, families, businesses and organizations.  We are committed to providing an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of the communities in which we live, and to creating an environment where every employee has the opportunity to reach their potential.  Great-West Lifeco would like to thank all applicants, however only those who qualify for an interview will be contacted.  Apply for this job online Refer this job to a friend Share on your newsfeed
Title: Design Lead

Job_Description: We are looking for an exceptionally organized, detail-oriented, and effective communicator that wants to work with talented individuals in a digital creative agency in Coquitlam, BC. Ballistic Arts Media Studios Inc. is seeking an office and administrative assistant to work with Management and Operations in a wide-variety of tasks helping daily operations and helping us make this fun and engaging workplace even better.  Our ideal candidate is someone looking to make a difference at a workplace by being involved in: human resources data tracking and maintenance and social / cultural activities; general office needs such as equipment and material procurement; report, proposal, and social media post writing; and, working with the Operations Management on workplace programs, both current and generating new ideas. Job Description Administrative Assistant Responsibilities:  Helping organize and maintain staff files. Performing general office clerk duties and errands. Assist coordinating events and social activities. Research and data entry on a variety of reports. Research and data entry for proposals and case studies. Maintaining social media channels and our blog and e-newsletter. Assistant to Chief Operations Officer. Maintaining supply inventory and office equipment as needed. Assist Project Managers when required for writing or coordination tasks. Handling incoming calls and other communications. Managing various software utilized for daily operations such as time tracking and communication. Involved in research, proposing, writing, and implementing process and procedural changes and improvements.  Skills and Experience Requirements:  High school diploma or associate’s degree. Experience as an office assistant, or a position in a related field. Ability to write clearly and help with word processing and data entry. Strong communication skills. Interest in marketing. Coachable and wants to learn and grow. Works great with a team and want to support others in a warm supportive environment. Can work under pressure in a fast-paced environment. Brings a positive attitude to a fun and challenging workplace.
Title: Hiring for Experienced Intermediate UI / UX Designer

Job_Description: MindGeek is the largest, privately held company in our industry developing unparalleled technologies for high traffic, high volume online properties. Our exceptional team consist of experts in every functional area of business and they are the key to our position as leaders in content delivery. We strive to innovate on a daily basis to ensure we continue to grow and create new revenue opportunities and cutting edge technology. If you are passionate about taking your career to the next level, then join the MindGeek team and be a part of something big. Responsibilities: As a marketing designer, you will work with the marketing team on marketing campaign, website layout mockups, web graphics, infographics, content images and illustrations. Other tasks include: Rendering graphic elements using traditional tools, multimedia, image processing and design software Image retouching and image manipulation, logo conception and basic icon illustration Conceptualize marketing banners for landing pages and social media pages Develop photo and video tagging and watermark standards for the entire team Create graphics and illustrations for content team on articles and editorials Collaborate with designers and product managers Perform usability and perform quality control on designs Task management using Ticketing system Requirements: 2- 5 years of relevant professional experience including website design experience and marketing design. College diploma in related field please attach your portfolio or a link to your online portfolio; this should specifically include web design, not solely print work Expert knowledge of Photoshop, Illustrator and Indesign Experience with UX/UI and visual Design Broad range of web design from cartoon to realistic Ability to design full web pages and web sites/ design templates Strong artistic approach Illustrations capability Balance multiple projects simultaneously Strong command of the English language. Spoken French  What we offer: Competitive compensation Stay sharp by taking part at one of our Hackathons, Engineering retreats, Lunch & Learns or Leadership Seminars. Free breakfast daily as well as monthly lunches Flex time and summer hour schedule A 500$ fitness allowance Epic parties throughout the year including summer BBQ, Halloween costume party, Holiday bash and 5 a 7s Opportunity to give back to the community through our Pay it Forward Program, Ronald Macdonald House visits and supporting the MindGeek Scholarship Fund for Dans la Rue A chance to work with a first-class team ! We thank all applicants for their interest, however only candidates under consideration will be contacted. No telephone calls please. No agency calls or emails.
Title: Marketing Designer

Job_Description: Senior UI/Web Designer  Duration: 4 months  Location: Downtown Toronto  Responsibilities Responsible for executing stunning front end design work, including creating visual mockups for static and dynamic pagesDevelops site design by coordinating with UX specialists, copywriters, content publishers, developers and business stakeholdersDesigns engaging interactive experiences including the selection or creation of imagery and animationLead design review sessions with project teams, acquiring consensus and approvalCreate final visual mockups against wireframes, in keeping with the brand standards, UX guidelines and accessibility legislation (AODA/WCAG)Provide final design assets and documentation to the development team; liaise and support development team to the ensure final output matches the intended visual designCollaborates with other web designers & the UX team in the latest technologies and trends for efficient and aesthetically pleasing web design, as well as the development of the brand's internal digital style guide and design processes  Requirements Diploma or degree in Graphic or Web Design, Visual Communications or equivalentA superb creative portfolio that demonstrates a variety of work in different stylesMinimum 4 years’ experience in web & UI design or digital art directionStrong visual eye and attention to detailHighly proficient with design and prototyping tools such as Sketch, Photoshop, Illustrator, Principle, InVision, ZeplinStrong knowledge of HTML, CSS, JavaScript, front-end frameworks (e.g. Bootstrap) and other technologies — although this is not a web development roleA continual energy and enthusiasm for exploring the latest web technology trends and design techniques to evolve your skillset and work you produceSolid communication skills – ability to effectively communicate design concepts and decisionsA team player who welcomes and seeks out collaboration – you understand that giving/getting feedback from your design and UX colleagues is crucial in the development of your work and your own career growthResourcefulness and hustle under pressure; must be able to work smart through adversity and deadlinesHighly organized with great time management skills — you’ll be able to juggle multiple priorities at onceNice to have: ability to write content, and/or French language capability
Title: Senior UI/Web Designer

Job_Description: A product based company that specializes in security and protection software is looking for an UX/UI Designer. This is an ideal opportunity for a high-performing, ambitious individual that is looking for an entrepreneurial and team-oriented professional environment. The role requires close collaboration with the company's CTO and Director of Operations. Your main responsibility would be to:  Required Skills & Experience  Experience with UX tools such as Axure or Framer.js  Develop Interactive prototypes using rapid prototyping tools.  Understanding of HTML5, CSS3 and/or React Framework  The ability to work with stakeholders to understand the user experience and information architecture for the different web applications  Desired Skills & Experience  Significant UI/UX experience  Previous experience designing web applications with complex data visualizations, dashboards and reports  Previous experience working with B2B systems  Benefits & Perks  Competitive compensation package
Title: UX/UI Designer

Job_Description: We are currently recruiting for a Visual Designer located in Toronto for an on-going contract. Our ideal candidate has 3 years of experience as a Visual Designer with a focus on graphics. You will be working for a fast growing company with a dynamic culture and excellent benefits. This is a great opportunity for an energetic individual who is looking to grow both in this field and their personal career.  Visual Designer Responsibilities include:  create elegant, responsive web layouts for desktop, tablet and mobile. design and evolve existing components for our content management system. work alongside developers to bring our visual standards to life. employ a user-centered design process to support our business strategy. stay on top of emerging UI standards and trends. produce engaging animations, illustrations, iconography, and infographics. collaborate on end-to-end iterative UX projects, including persona creation, experience mapping, wireframing, and high-fidelity prototyping.  Visual Designer Qualifications:  Must have a portfolio of visual design work samples for web and mobile applications that demonstrates a proven track record of beautiful and simple design solutions. Must have a passion for solving design problems while understanding that great experiences come from collaborative decision-making. Have the ability to use pencil and paper for sketching ideas and lo-fi prototypes, and knowledge of digital design and prototyping tools. Have an appetite for technology and desire to stay on top of evolving visual design best practices and global mobile product trends. knowledge of user-centered design practices, usability, and accessibility. a soft spot for typography (kerning/tracking/leading are words you use on a daily basis).  If you are interested in this Visual Designer job in Toronto, Ontario apply by clicking apply now. If you would like to speak with me further about this opportunity please call 905 896 8225 and ask for Michael B2500
Title: Visual Designer

Job_Description: Nous sommes actuellement à la recherche d’un.e Designer Web. Votre rôle consistera à la production (conception et déclinaison) de différents éléments graphiques pour les projets Web de nos clients (évolution artistique, campagne Web et communicationnelle, et bien plus…). Le.la titulaire de ce poste travaillera conjointement avec les directeurs artistiques pour déterminer l’orientation créative des projets et pour la production de ceux-ci.  Vos responsabilités Concevoir, adapter et réaliser des contenus Web selon les concepts et normes définis par l'équipe, dans le respect des attentes du client et de l'échéancier; Conceptualiser, créer et décliner le design des bannières numérique; Assurer une continuité dans l’aspect visuel tout au long des projets d’un même client; Générer des idées créatives, innovatrices et pertinentes; Présenter les concepts et les maquettes aux clients; Profil recherché Essentiel : Talent créatif; 3 à 4 ans d’expérience dans un poste similaire; Bonne maîtrise des notions UX/UI; Maîtriser les logiciels Photoshop, Sketch et Illustrator; Connaissance des normes IAB / W3; Connaissance en HTML 5/CSS3 et expérience avec des outils tels que Adobe Animate; Autonome; Capacité à présenter et expliquer vos démarches créatives et votre travail à vos collègues et aux clients; Bonne capacité à gérer son stress; Habilité à effectuer plusieurs tâches et à traiter plusieurs projets à la fois avec de courtes échéances; Dynamisme, sens des responsabilités, polyvalence; Esprit d'équipe; Souci du détail; Rapidité d'exécution; Bilingue;  Atout : Expérience en design d’interaction; Expérience en motion design/montage; Expérience comme AdOps; L'équipe de travail L’équipe des technologies réunit une trentaine de professionnels geeks et assumés : si le débat Star Trek c. Star Wars vous intéresse, que rien ne vaut une bonne blague de binaire et que vous aimez les shakes protéinés, vous vous intégrerez comme un chef Travailler chez Tink Chez Tink, mille et une activités enjolivent notre quotidien. Entourée de pistes cyclables et de bornes Bixi, notre agence a tout pour mettre du punch à vos journées : une équipe authentique travaillant en synergie, des food trucks l’été à deux pas du bureau, un accès au bord du fleuve, des formations interactives UTink et des 5 à 7 festifs. L’ambiance est incomparable!
Title: Designer Web - Marketing (intermédiaire)

Job_Description: You will be responsible to plan and redesign Dakis??? Software Interfaces and User Interfaces to meet today???s modern look and feel, and to provide a great user experience.  Since we are developing a lot of new software, you will be highly involved and contribute in the making of these new products with your passion to create user stories, sketching out designs and by putting the finishing touch on the final product interface. Your implication in all product lifecycle phases will have a great impact on interfaces??? look and fell, planning of requirements, features, user experience, branding and much more. Main qualifications and desired skills  Skilled in UI/UX design Passion to create user stories and sketching out designs Empathetic and able to see the world from the eyes of a user Good communicator and team player Staying abreast of UI technology development and user experience best practices (UX); Attention to details and strong commitment to quality   Complementary skill set  Web programming skills not necessary but an asset. Title: UI/UX Designer (Software and User Interfaces)

Job_Description: Do you love games, and are an expert in creating polished, yet functional UX? -----------------------------------------------------------------------------  Are you a human-centric designer who is focused on crafting world-class in-game experiences? --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------  If so, our Lead UX/UI Designer role might be the perfect fit for you! --------------------------------------------------------------------------  Relic Entertainment, a wholly owned studio of SEGA, is the award-winning RTS developer of Homeworld, Dawn of War, Company of Heroes, (and now!) Age of Empires IV and we’re on the hunt for a Lead UX/UI Designer to work in our Vancouver studio. This soon to be Relican will join our UX/UI team supporting our exciting unannounced project. As a studio, our role is to create a workplace where people are energized and empowered to not only do their best work but to continually surpass their best. We’ll push you out of your comfort zone to become the best version of you by giving you the ownership and creative freedom to solve our most challenging problems.  This leadership role requires an individual who is excited to drive our UI/UX team forward, share genuine enthusiasm and interest in video games, human-centred design and learning about (and share!) emerging UI technology and trends.  As our Lead UX/UI Designer, you will… --------------------------------------------   Lead the UX/UI team from a creative, technical, schedule and day-to-day perspective. Liaise with the art director, production and UR - ensuring all UI milestones and goals are met on time. Ensure and deliver on an innovative, attractive, and functional user experience – you’ll work closely with our artists, game designers, engineers and UR to achieve this. Communicate the vision of the franchise’s UI and provide feedback to our teams – providing feedback will be essential in ensuring the visual quality of your designs comes together in the finished experience. Conceptualize and prototype – you’ll partner with artists, game designers, engineers, and UR to drive and test the game’s user interface. Act as a HUD interactions expert, specifying both front-end and in-game HUD interactions through wireframes, prototypes, user journeys and more. Be our architect of where information lives and how it's presented to the player. Collaborate with game designers and UR to communicate the intent of game features to the players. Balance the needs of game design, art, marketing, player expectations, and more, to create an engaging & seamless product. Have a natural ability to understand the intent of our game design and how to make that design come to life through UI. Understand the importance of (and be able to action) giving feedback to other areas - Art, Audio, FX, etc. - on how their work is or isn’t meeting UX requirements.  We’re looking for someone who has… -----------------------------------------------   5+ years of relevant experience in a Lead role with at least 1 shipped AAA title. Post-secondary education in Interaction Design, Visual Design, UX, HCI or related fields. A portfolio of work that showcases UX and interaction design skills, and high-level problem-solving. Please include this portfolio link in the application below! Expert knowledge of Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator or other visual design tools. Rapid prototyping skills, the ability to bring interfaces to life with usability in mind. Familiar with high and low fidelity prototyping tools, such as Sketch, Framer, Origami or similar. Familiarity with display types and the ability to support a variety of screen resolutions. Deep understanding of UX principles and a how to apply them to games. Experience using various UX design methods - contextual inquiry, card sorting, user journeys, personas, stakeholder interviews, wireframes, etc.  It’s a bonus if you have…   Experience with WPF, XAML and Microsoft Blend Knowledge of 3D tools such as Maya, 3D Max, C4D or similar. Traditional 2D sketching, illustration, and strong conceptual art skills. Experience with data analysis and visualization in tools like Excel, Tableau, etc. Exceptional visual design skills (i.e., composition, layout, typography, color theory.) Conducted user testing, survey design/analyst and other research methodologies. Comfortable working with 3D assets, basic lighting, and positioning models.  What’s in it for you? ---------------------------------  You will become part of the SEGA family (includes Creative Assembly ( http://www.creative-assembly.com/ ), Sports Interactive ( http://www.sigames.com/ ), Hardlight Studio ( http://www.hardlightstudio.com/ ), and Amplitude Studios ( http://www.amplitude-studios.com/ )) which means you’ll have an opportunity to work on AAA games and learn a ton. We also offer top-notch benefits and perks, including an extensive extended health benefits plan, retirement savings plan, and support for any required relocation or immigration efforts. On top of that, we realize it takes world-class people to make world-class games so we offer competitive total compensation packages.  Interested? -----------------  Please apply through this portal - you'll find the application below! Make sure to tell us a bit about yourself, provide your portfolio details and let us know why YOU would be a great fit for our team!  Next Steps? -----------------  Regrettably, we are unable to interview all applicants. Please be patient while we review every application. We will get in touch with the applicants that best fit what we’re looking for, so please make sure you tell us about yourself and how you would like to contribute to our team.  Note: We are currently only able to accept applications from individuals who are legally qualified to work in Canada.  Have you heard? We’re making Age of Empires IV! -----------------------------------------------------  Check out the trailer here ( https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RYwZ6GZXWhA ) and follow along on social:  Facebook ( http://fb.com/relicentertainment ) | Twitter ( http://twitter.com/relicgames ) | Instagram ( http://instagram.com/relicentertainment )
Title: Lead UX/UI Designer

Job_Description: Background: Cerebra Health (based in Winnipeg, Canada; founded in 2015) is a digital health-tech company focused on developing and delivering technology to help people understand and improve their sleep. Cerebra’s approved medical devices are unique assets that differentiate the Company from competitors and have the potential to revolutionize the assessment and treatment of sleep disorders. The Company’s digital service platform provides unmatched capabilities for in-home sleep analysis, with a focus on improved user experience, state-of-the-art diagnosis, and increased efficiency for our customers.  Position Summary: This position will be responsible for helping define the user experience and design for Cerebra Health’s digital products and services; including web, mobile and Android/iOS applications. The Web Designer will play a pivotal role in the launch of the Company’s various business segments.  Responsibilities: Create and implement responsive websites, purchase pages, emails and other web-based assets.  Perform UI/UX testing and provide recommendations on design, layout and functionality to ensure an optimal user experience.  Apply user-centered design processes to define user needs, develop user flows, wireframes and visual designs for web applications.  Collaborate closely with other designers, development teams, product management, and copywriters to recommend features, experiences, and UI implementations.  Analyze website visitor data to improve website layouts and provide design suggestions.  Perform A/B landing page testing and implement improvements.  Required Skills & Qualifications: Post-secondary education, including completion of a graphic or digital media design, web design program at a recognized college; or an undergraduate degree in a related discipline.  2 or more years of experience in web design; experience in an e-commerce setting a plus.  Responsive web design, mobile web development and digital application development experience.  Solid web design and development skills (HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP and SQL).  Proficient working with modern design tools including Adobe CC, Sketch, InVision amongst others.  Knowledge of web and mobile user interface designs principles and best practice and standards.  A motivated and independent self-starter capable of leading and working with cross-functional teams to identify problems then drive design.  Skilled at managing input from multiple stakeholders.  Possess strong analytical skills to synthesize research findings and translate them into actionable user experiences.  Ability to ensure consistency among web, print, and other designs while complying with brand guidelines.  Creative, innovative thinker with a strong eye for layout and design.  Strong attention to detail and understanding of writing fundamentals including spelling, grammar and punctuation.  Willingness to learn and take constructive criticism well.  Excellent organizational skills and ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously.  Ability to work in a fast-paced environment, respond to requests quickly, and meet deadlines.  Excellent interpersonal skills and ability to work well with others.  Benefits: At Cerebra Health, we offer a contemporary, fast based, growth-oriented work environment that affords equal opportunities and embraces diversity. We provide enriching and satisfying careers for our employees, work hard, and have fun in the process. A competitive compensation package, inclusive of insurance benefits and additional incentives will be offered to the successful candidate. For more information on Cerebra Health visit: www.cerebrahealth.com
Title: Web & Graphic Designer

Job_Description: Job Description  Sommaire :  Le titulaire de ce poste participe au développement de l’ergonomie du jeu par des chantiers, outils, accessibilité et les interfaces et rétroactions (signs & feedback).  Il/elle travaille en étroite collaboration avec l’équipe UI, le laboratoire recherche utilisateur, l’équipe 3C et l’équipe de conception de niveau (level design).  Responsabilités :  Les fonctions principales et habituelles de cet emploi sont :  Conceptualiser la logique, la disposition et le déroulement de toutes les interfaces utilisateur dans le jeu, y compris l’affichage tête haute (HUD), les menus et le lobby en appliquant les principes d’architecture de l’information et d’accessibilité; S’assurer que les différentes interfaces et la rétroaction (signs & feedback) communiquent clairement l’information du jeu au travers des meilleures pratiques d’accessibilité; Garantir une réactivité optimale des interactions et une latence minimale des contrôles; Conseiller les concepteurs de jeu (game designer) et travailler en étroite collaboration avec eux pour identifier les contrôles et les entrées qui servent d’appui aux interactions, le tout dans le but d’assurer une expérience utilisateur fluide et cohérente; Développer des prototypes fonctionnels qui permettent d’itérer rapidement sur les interactions clés; Mettre en place une disposition optimal des interfaces; Assurer que l’agencement de l’interface réponde aux contraintes de localisation ; Application des retours utilisateurs et de l’utilisation efficace des services de recherche utilisateur pour optimiser l’expérience du jeu; Effectuer toutes autres tâches connexes.  Formation :  Diplôme d’études collégiales dans la conception ou tous autres domaines pertinentes du jeu vidéo.  Expérience pertinente :  2 années minimum d’expérience pertinente dans le domaine du jeu vidéo, et particulièrement : concepteur de jeu, concepteur UX, concepteur UI, concepteur industriel, ergonome ou programmeur 3C. Qualifications  Habiletés et connaissances :  Maitrise des principes d’ergonomies appliquées aux jeux vidéo; Capacité à créer des prototypes fonctionnels; Connaissance en architecture de l’information et design industriel; Aptitudes à communiquer et à faire des présentations; Capacité à innover et à créer une expérience utilisateur exceptionnelle; Compréhension des concepts UX « lean » et capacité à travailler dans un environnement en flux continu et à penser en termes holistiques tout en créant et en apprenant de façon itérative; Capacité à se fier à une approche conceptuelle d’affaires centrée sur l’utilisateur.  Dans le domaine du jeu vidéo on attend particulièrement une expertise dans cette branche :  Interface Utilisateur et Recherche Utilisateur  Capacité à créer des guides d’interaction homme machine (IHM); Connaissance en programmation d’interface est souhaitable; Capacité et autonomie à créer des prototypes fonctionnels et hautement interactifs (gamepad, animations, transitions) qui simulent de manière convainquant les divers widget de UI/HUD; Connaissance en méthodologie de recherche utilisateur (Méthodes d’analyse quantitative et qualitative, Biométrie, Questionnaire utilisateur, etc.). Additional Information  null
Title: Concepteur expérience utilisateur (UX)

Job_Description: YOUR NEXT OPPORTUNITY IS WITH US  ruby is a global technology company that is home to the world’s most unique dating web sites. Like relationships, ruby is complex and multifaceted. Ashley Madison , the flagship brand of ruby , is revolutionizing the way millions of people located around the world connect and meet. As a Canadian technology company driven by analytics and user centric design, we care about our customer experience and are continuously looking for ways to make it better!  Life is short, be agile and step out of the box. Does the idea of working creatively every day with the ability to dig deeper and solve huge problems intrigue you? Do you envision yourself working with smart people in a collaborative, fast-paced, environment using the latest technology tools? Have you always dreamed about working for a company where you can apply your great talents and continue to learn and grow throughout your career? If you answered “Yes” to all of these questions then ruby is the place for you!  We work hard, play hard and have fun. We foster a culture where you can be yourself and where diversity workforce, thought, and opinion is expected.  Lead UX & Visual Designer  We’re looking for a Lead UX & Visual Designer to help us make our sites even more vibrant!  The Challenge  Reporting to the VP, Creative & Design you’ll join an elite team working on Ashley Madison and be involved in all stages of developing our products. You’ll help create new product ideas, guide the product roadmap and spec out what the next generation of products will look like. We look for individuals who thrive in an environment where they will work creatively, take initiative and deliver on commitments.  Here’s what you’ll do  Design sexy apps and websites  Come up with innovative UX solutions  Work closely with and help lead the Creative Team  Provide mentorship for the Creative Team in emerging technologies and UX/UI best practices  Work with the Development Team and share best practices  Create and maintain design guidelines and style guides  Here’s what you’ll need  Passion for good user experience and visual design  8 plus years of experience with UX/UI design  3+ years experience designing for mobile web and apps  A high awareness of industry trends and best practices  Experience creating mockups, high-fidelity wireframes and UX documents  Experience designing responsive layouts  Experience designing and prototyping mobile web and native applications including interactions  Experience defining & creating modern style guides, design guidelines & UI kits  Expert level experience with design software such as Sketch, Photoshop, Illustrator  Ability to work under little supervision  Excellent organizational skills  Innovative problem solving skills  It would be awesome if you had  Up to date Front-End, HTML5, CSS3, Responsive coding skills  Experience with modern JS & CSS frameworks: React, Bootstrap, Pure, Backbone, Node, etc.  Experience with motion graphics and or video editing  Experience optimizing page load time and performance  Knowledge of product design  Qualified candidates should send a resume, cover letter, and portfolio to hr@rubylife.com. In the e-mail subject line please reference “ Lead UX & Visual Designer “.  We thank all applicants for their interest in ruby; however only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.  ruby Life Inc. is an equal opportunity employer and strongly supports diversity in the workplace. Please note that ruby is committed to complying with the Accessibility for Ontarian’s with Disabilities Act, 2005, and has policies in place to accommodate candidates with disabilities during the selection process. Should you require accommodation or have a question regarding any of these policies, please contact hr@rubylife.com .
Title: Lead UX & Visual Designer

Job_Description: About Us: WOKE is a design studio that works at the intersection of digital and physical products.We're an agile team of senior designers working in diverse disciplines ranging from UX/UI to Industrial Design to Apparel/Softgoods design.We like working on cutting edge problems and look for technologies that are new to the world that we can help craft to have a positive impact on people’s lives.  About the Role: We are in search of a seasoned Interaction Designer capable of managing projects as well as executing on designing beautiful experiences and interfaces.In this role, you get exposure to and involvement with all parts of the design process: project scoping, client relationship development, user research, concept development, wireframing, prototyping, visual design and design stewardship.We’re looking for someone who is equally excited about designing beautiful interfaces as they are taking people’s feedback as a source of inspirationComfortable working on very different types of projects and product categories.  Example Projects: Desigining the UX for smart light switch system to help create more beautiful light at home.Creating a new mobile advertising platform that will help subsidize people’s phone plansDesigning a health tracking platform that uses science to help people actually live longer.Designing a meditation app that connects to smart yoga pants to help a new generation get centered.  Your Profile: You have 5+ years of working experience in designing digital product, service, and experience from ideation to implementation.You’re a confident and flexible leader, able to manage small teams and freelancers.You can relate to individuals and nurture talent. You give and solicit feedback from other designers in order to continually raise the bar for quality.You have a point of view and you are able to distinguish between “good” and “great” work.You can make sense of complex information, user interaction flows and system architecture.You can create beautiful user interfaces and love working on design details just as much as thinking about big ideas.You know what it takes to bring a software product to market.You understand Human Centered Design Practices as well as Agile Product Development practice.Ability to convey concepts through wireframes, flows and mockupsFluent in visual design tools, such as Photoshop, Sketch, IllustratorFluent in prototyping (ie, AfterEffects, Flinto, Principle, etc.)A big plus is that you can code for web and/or mobile app experience  Additional Skills: You’re comfortable presenting infront of a big group.You’re a natural relationship builder. We've got a nice incentive structure set up to reward you for bringing in new client work.This position may either be based in Vancouver or San Francisco as we built out our San Francisco studio.  Perks: Generous education budget to spend on your professional and self-developmentBe set up for success, equipped with the latest and greatest hardwareMaking it a point to put our pencils down, decompress and have a few beers together on a weekly basis.Drink as much coffee as you can handle.Giving you a chance to work side by side with people form different disciplines like industrial designers, apparel designers and engineers. Compensation is flexible right now and based on experience – pay range from $80K to $120K, depending on experience, plus business development commission. If this job description gets you genuinely excited, please email us your CV and portfolio at: careers@woke.co
Title: Interaction Design Lead/Senior Designer

Job_Description: Position Overview:  A Front Web Developer plays a central role in the design, development, and delivery of user-facing features for Canada Goose’s web products. Create high-quality user experiences by working closely with product owners, UI/UX designers and other developers. Build dynamic web pages using capabilities of Salesforce Commerce Cloud (Demandware), HTML5, CSS3 and JavaScript. Work with a small, collaborative team of other Senior Web Developers, Product Managers, and Designers and effectively communicate, prioritize and deliver.  Key Responsibilities:   Design and develop applications per requirements captured in Business Requirement Documents and requirements gathering sessions Collaborate with other Web Developers, Project Managers, Business Partners, End Users and other Development and Operations Teams to identify and implement innovative solutions to business challenges Resolve problems, identify causes, and anticipate implications Work with Vendors as required Assist in special projects and perform other duties as required  Education, Qualifications and Experience A post-secondary education in Computer Science or Information Management or relevant experience 2+ years building high-quality, high visibility web sites using ecommerce platforms like Demandware, Magento, etc. 3+ hands-on working experience JavaScript, HTML, CSS Experience developing using JavaScript frameworks like AngularJS, Ember, React, etc. 2+ years of experience building responsive web applications using frameworks like Bootstrap, Foundation, etc. Experience building products for international audiences and optimized for various Search Engines  Knowledge, Skills and Attributes Brand Ambassador for promoting continuous technical improvements and innovations Strong organizational, writing, interpersonal and communication skills Exceptional attention to detail and a high degree of accuracy Possess excellent time and project management skills Ability to work in a fast-paced environment with a high degree of change Ability to work efficiently under pressure A team player who builds strong relationships based on trust and integrity Entrepreneurial spirit Passionate and determined Egoless nature A continuous learner Follow through consistently on work commitments  Working Conditions Usually work regular business hour Work in offices May require travel to local or international sites, conferences and/or seminars    We truly thank all applicants for their interest in joining the Goose Team, but only those candidates considered for an initial interview will be contacted.  Canada Goose Inc. is committed to delivering and improving accessibility in employment for all persons with disabilities. Accommodation is available, upon request, in the application and interview process and in the course of all other methods of selection of employees. Successful candidates for employment will be introduced to and trained in respect of all of Canada Goose Inc.’s human rights, accommodation and accessibility polices.
Title: Front End Developer

Job_Description: At Versett, a developer is a broad sweeping term for a technical consultant, strategist, and finally, implementor of solutions for the products we create. A Front-end Developer's role focuses on the UI and UX of web products and applications and integrating them with backend systems and APIs. You should be equipped with an ever-shifting tool belt based on latest best practices, up-to-date standards, and most importantly a strong understanding of the problem at hand and what best solves it.  Worried about frameworks, build systems, transpilers and other beasts? Don't be. While we do have preferences that we adjust and align on as a team, in our opinion tools are easier to teach and learn than concepts (but we encourage teaching and learning those, too).  Requirements Your core competencies as a front-end developer rely on a strong understanding of CSS, HTML, and Javascript (web and Node). You have a foundational understanding of modern patterns and methodologies, a solid grasp of latest specifications, and an awareness of accessibility and performance pitfalls. You are flexible and strive to better yourself and the company. You have a collaborative mindset, and most importantly, you have empathy for your users, clients, and co-workers.  'Front-end' is a broad term and doesn't have to be all-encompassing, if you feel like you fit some of the following you should get in touch: You have worked with a designer or solo to build out a styleguide/style system/UI kit. You have rolled your own BEM, OOCSS, SMACSS-esque css architecture, for better or worse. You have built a SPA or two using one or more JS frameworks and it went really well. You have built a SPA or two using one or more JS frameworks and it went really badly. You've built out a website or web-app that met WCAG AA compliance. You are used to letting a build system do the heavy lifting. You have had conversations around state management, immutability, and unidirectional flow.   Is Versett the right place for you? We are a small and growing development team that is constantly looking to improve process and quality with every project we do. If you are looking to make an impact and have continued input into how a company operates, this is probably the place for you.  Our goal is to give our developers the opportunity to explore and learn new technologies and constantly expand their toolbelts and professional capabilities, whether that is through different client projects or our internal Alpha projects.  Here are examples of tools and technologies we currently work with:  React, Redux Flow Jest, Jasmine WebPack, Babel npm SCSS NodeJS  Travis Heroku AWS  We currently have openings for Front-end Developer in Toronto, Calgary, and New York.  About Versett Versett is a product design and engineering studio in Calgary, Toronto, and New York. Founded in 2011, we specialize in websites and mobile products.  Why work at Versett Our team is tight-knit and built on the philosophy of "Small, but Mighty". Versett was founded on a shared vision of a place where we can create meaningful work collaboratively, while continuing to grow and learn as individuals.  Perks? We’ve got perks:  Team events and retreats Competitive salary and benefits The hardware/software setup you need "Take the time you need" vacation policy Flexible hours Casual environment Diverse team Friday team lunches
Title: Developer - Front-end

Job_Description: Do you cringe at unintuitive menus and unresponsive controls? Do you have an eye for detail and polished experiences? Do you have strong, clear UI creation skills and a passion for gaming?  Then come help us by advancing the art and design of our product’s user interaction!  We are looking for a talented UI Artist to join our dynamic and growing team in Montreal. Be a part of the crew in charge of developing the most authentic and recognized poker game: World Series of Poker. You must be well versed in layout, typography and UI design for web and mobile applications. As our ideal candidate, you are able to develop and create concepts and visual ideas for online and mobile products that will be used in social and mobile games.  About Playtika  Playtika is a multiplatform social games developer. We are the #1 grossing Facebook game developer as well as a Top 10 grossing developer on iOS & Android worldwide.  Founded in 2010, Playtika immediately enjoyed skyrocketing growth and expanded quickly by acquiring other leading game titles. We now have 14 offices in 9 countries around the world with over 1,600 Playtikans.  Our business and our passion is to immerse people into a thrilling entertainment experience. Currently our games are enjoyed by more than 6 million users daily and over 20 million users monthly. Sounds good, right? Come play with us!  What you’ll be doing: Actively conceptualize UI designs for all aspects of the game Work with the Game Designer and PO to create the UX wireframe Work with the Art Director in defining and communicating the visual language and interface look and feel Translate gameplay high level ideas into visual functional UI designs Help elaborate research and prototype to bring ideas to life Participate in visual comparisons and critiques Competently assist in design of UI flow and function Spec out art tasks and generate time estimates when needed Contribute to art and tool pipeline improvements  Requirements: As our ideal candidate, you have: At least 5 years’ experience as a UI Artist in the gaming industry A strong background in fundamental art principles including excellent color theory, layout, typography, visual hierarchy and composition skills Expertise with Photoshop A thorough understanding of UI/UX flow and function design A desire to challenge yourself to raise the barre on your own work and that of the company Knowledge and curiosity about the latest trends in gaming and UI A strong ability to communicate ideas visually and in writing The ability to meet deadlines while handling multiple tasks A College degree in Art, Animation, Design, or a related field (an asset) Strong French/English written and verbal communication skills  It’s a total bonus if you have: Experience with Unity, Flash, After Effect and Illustrator Ability to create simple UI animations Ability to crop and integrate art assets in Mobile and Web platforms If you think you have what it takes, we want to hear from you!  We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.  Division: WSOP
Title: UI Artist

Job_Description: We are looking for bright and passionate people to be founding members of Great-West Life’s new Digital Labs. Do you have a passion for creating compelling and meaningful digital experiences? Do you ALWAYS think about the customer first? Are you a creative problem-solver and communicator? Do you want to help lead the transformation of a company and an industry? If you answered a wholehearted yes to all these questions, we want to talk to you.  ABOUT GWL’S DIGITAL LABS Great-West Life is embarking on a transformation that will change the way we work and how we help our customers. In our Digital Labs, we are designing, coding and delivering new products improving the lives of millions of Canadians. We are changing the way a trusted institution operates by acting as a start-up, bringing human centered design, agile and modern web development practices to life. Our multi-functional teams of Designers, Developers, Scrum Masters and Product Owners all huddle together because we have an open, innovative and inclusive culture which is focused on us – talented individuals.  OVERVIEW As a UX Designer, you are an integral part of a team of passionate people who are transforming the design and product vision into seamless and engaging user experiences. You will support the strategic design of customer experience solutions throughout the entire design lifecycle. You will collaborate with business partners, scrum teams and other internal stakeholders to help turn business requirements, user needs and creative strategy into engaging experiences.  WHAT YOU’LL DO Create and effectively present UX deliverables (flows, sketches, wireframes, journey maps, prototypes, etc.) to stakeholders and teams Assess data from multiple sources (UX research, SEO, product requirements, tech constraints, analytics) and synthesize it to develop efficient user scenarios, taxonomies, navigation systems, design patterns, etc. Stay current on emerging trends in user-centered methodologies, accessibility, UI design patterns, usability principles and web technologies Work collaboratively with User Experience, Digital Customer Experience and Strategic Customer Marketing teams and act as an advocate for the user WHO YOU ARE A few years of professional experience in a UX/UI or Interaction Design role and preferably some experience in a previous role where you have acted as the UX/UI project lead A demonstrable portfolio of work that exhibits your process for solving design problems Clear ability to simplify complex concepts and requirements in presentation, design and implementation Experience with industry tools such as Sketch, InVision, Axure, Adobe CC Excellent communicator with ability to effectively convey design processes, ideas, and solutions to teams and stakeholders Passionate about user experience and all things digital Discover your opportunity….Apply today!  Great-West Life offers competitive compensation, great benefits such as medical, dental, life insurance, wellness account and personal days not to mention onsite cafeteria and fitness facilities. If you’d like to join our team submit your information online and introduce yourself.  Together Great-West Life, London Life and Canada Life serve the financial security needs of more than 13 million people across Canada, with additional operations in Europe and the United States. As members of the Power Financial Corporation group of companies, we’re one of Canada’s leading insurers with interests in life insurance, health insurance, investment and retirement savings. We offer a broad portfolio of financial and benefit plan solutions for individuals, families, businesses and organizations.  We are committed to providing an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of the communities in which we live, and to creating an environment where every employee has the opportunity to reach their potential.  Great-West Lifeco would like to thank all applicants, however only those who qualify for an interview will be contacted.  Apply for this job online Refer this job to a friend  Share on your newsfeed
Title: Senior UX Designer

Job_Description: Join Windsor's most innovative, fun and Silicon-Valley-esque development and innovation company, bringing world-class projects to Windsor. Help us build exciting technology like multiplayer game servers for Atari, social apps for Puma, high profile analytics engines for The PGA Tour, and cutting edge products like natural-language-processing chat-bots.As one of Windsor's most sought-after companies to work for, we offer flexible time, work-at-home days, a great benefits plan and in-office massage. We are located in the heart of Windsor's historic Walkerville. You must be willing to work in our office. We are not interested in off-shore or remote work.We are seeking talented interface designers who are looking to grow professionally and personally within a fast-growing company. You will work on a variety of marketing deliverables, including websites, prototypes, wireframes, business collateral and other design pieces.ResponsibilitiesWork on the design of user interfaces for web and mobile projectsAble to help with wireframing using tools like Adobe XD and BalsamiqAble to self-direct and work independently, to manage multiple, concurrent projects simultaneously from start to finishRequirements: Expertise in Adobe Creative Suite: Illustrator, Photoshop, InDesign, After Effects, EdgeKnowledge of responsive web designAbility to create interactive prototypesCustomer-obsessed, detail-oriented and comfortable working on highly technical teamsDemonstrated experience with building user interfaces across a range of platforms including desktop and mobile--- Please send examples of your design portfolio (specifically web design) when you apply. ---We look forward to meeting you!Job Type: Full-timeEducation:High school or equivalentLocation:Windsor, ON
Title: Web Designer / UI / UX

Job_Description: Nous valorisons la diversité et avons à cœur de créer un milieu de travail inclusif qui nous inspire tous à donner le meilleur de nous-mêmes. Joignez-vous à notre équipe et faites une différence!  Votre poste  Nous Comment imaginez-vous les bureaux d’une compagnie d’assurance? Et l’atmosphère de travail qui y règne? Nous gageons que si vous passez nous voir au Lab de Intact, vous serez très surpris! Situé au centre-ville de Montréal, nous sommes un laboratoire d’innovation dont la mission est de créer des produits à la fine-pointe de l’insurtech qui améliorent la vie de millions de Canadiens.  Mariant la convivialité et la vélocité d’une startup aux ressources et aux moyens d’une grande entreprise (vous disposerez de tous les outils dont vous avez toujours rêvé!), le Lab est un environnement jeune et dynamique, offrant des défis stimulants, des collègues inspirants et une carrière passionnante (chez un des top 100 employeurs au Canada). C’est l’endroit idéal pour parfaire vos compétences et faire évoluer votre carrière.  Vous Vous êtes passionné par le commerce électronique et l’innovation numérique? Vous avez un talent particulier pour traduire des exigences complexes en expériences utiles et agréables? Vous restez à l’affût des dernières tendances en matière de design et vous aimez expérimenter de nouveaux outils et de nouvelles méthodologies? Nous avons l’occasion parfaite pour vous!  Rôle À titre de designer UX/UI, vous jouerez un rôle essentiel dans la conception et l’évolution de notre écosystème numérique. Relevant du directeur principal, Innovations numériques, vous aurez comme principales responsabilités :  Concevoir des expériences captivantes en vue de réaliser les objectifs d’affaires  Valider la fonctionnalité et l’utilité par l’entremise de tests et de recherches auprès des utilisateurs  Produire des livrables UX et design pertinents au besoin  Piloter une feuille de route aux côté d’un directeur de produit et d’une équipe agile multidisciplinaire  Présenter le travail aux parties prenantes  Aider les ingénieurs à produire des interfaces de qualité et agréables  Prôner une conception axée sur l’utilisateur et les données  Vos compétences  Minimum trois années d’expérience  Expertise en matière de convivialité et de pratiques de conception centrées sur l'utilisateur  Maîtrise des outils de conception (Sketch, Axure, InVision, Illustrator, etc.)  Expérience des outils de recherche UX (usertesting.com, Optimal Workshop, etc.) un atout  Expérience dans la production de flux de processus, d’inventaires de contenu, etc.  Vous aimez travailler dans un environnement de collaboration qui accorde une importance primordiale au travail d’équipe, à l’innovation, à l’ouverture d’esprit et au plaisir  Veuillez inclure votre portfolio dans votre dossier de candidature.  Vous êtes  Une personne avec qui il est agréable de travailler  Créatif, analytique, curieux et ingénieux  Un joueur d’équipe capable de partager et recevoir des commentaires constructifs  Excellent pour expliquer vos idées à différents intervenants  Profondément passionné par le design et la qualité  Organisé et proactif  En tant que salarié temps plein, vous bénéficierez des avantages suivants :  Un salaire compétitif  Un boni de performance annuel  Un régime de retraite  Un horaire de travail flexible de 35 heures par semaine  Des assurances médicales et dentaires hors pair  Et plusieurs autres avantages et bénéfices (remboursement gym, conférences, etc.)  Énoncé fermeture  Cette opportunité vous intéresse? Nous avons très hâte de faire votre connaissance!  D’excellents avantages sont offerts : salaire concurrentiel, avantages flexibles, aménagements de travail flexibles, congés mobiles, régime de retraite à prestation déterminée, etc.  Dans le cadre du processus de sélection d’Intact, les candidats peuvent être appelés à donner leur consentement à une vérification de leurs antécédents pertinente au poste à pourvoir avant de recevoir une offre d’emploi. Celle-ci peut comprendre une confirmation des références d’emploi, des études et des titres de compétences, une vérification des emplois, de l’identité, des infractions criminelles et du permis de conduire ainsi qu’un rapport de crédit.  Vous pouvez soumettre votre candidature à un emploi affiché pourvu que vous occupiez vos fonctions actuelles depuis au moins douze mois et que votre performance soit jugée bonne ou que votre contrat temporaire arrive à son échéance. Une recherche de talents à l'externe est menée parallèlement au recrutement à l'interne Veuillez donc prendre note que des candidats potentiels pourraient avoir été identifiés pour ce poste dans le cadre de leur plan de développement.   Veuillez noter que l'usage du masculin a comme but d'alléger le texte.  Cet affichage prendra fin 02 juin 2018.  Prime de recommandation  CE POSTE EST SUJET À UNE PRIME DE RECOMMANDATION DE 3000$.  #li-qc  Droit de travailler au Canada  Les personnes qui posent leur candidature à un poste permanent doivent, dès leur embauche, avoir le droit de travailler au Canada de façon permanente. Les documents pouvant servir de preuve dans le cas des rôles permanents sont un certificat de naissance canadien, un passeport canadien, un certificat de citoyenneté canadienne, une carte de résident permanent ou une confirmation de son statut de résident permanent pour prouver qu’il a le droit de travailler au Canada.  Indeed Commandité  IN-INFR

Job_Description: Navigator Marketingis an award-winning, full-service marketing agency that provides cutting-edge marketing strategy that produce results. We work with companies all over North America.Services: Web Design, Mobile Web Design, Monthly Marketing Strategy & Implementation, Social Media Management.Our Mission: Helping business owners grow their businesses from where they are now to where they want them to be.How We Do This: We increase a business' PROFILE, LEADS & SALES. We are a fun, talented & driven team who work at the intersection technology and consumer behaviour generating sales.Position Description: We are looking for an amazing & fun Web & UI/UX Developerto add to our team to assist with designing, coding and modifying websites, from layout to function. This person will strive to create visually appealing sites that feature user-friendly design and clear navigation. This person will also work closely with our designers & team members to execute & bring to life new ideas & projects in a team approach.The successful candidate will also be working on keeping websites up to date, landing pages, mobile optimization, analytics and much more. These tasks will require you to be comfortable and efficient with Google Developer Tools, and coding in HTML5, CSS, Javascript and PHP.We are looking for someone with minimum of one year experience in the field who can hit the ground running. Training will be minimal as we need someone to help us out immediately with our current projects. You should enjoy solving problems independently and keeping up to date with the newest trends.Qualifications: Amazing attention to detail.Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator skills an asset.HTML(5), CSS, JavaScript + jQuery, PHP .Setting up WordPress websites from scratch, working with plugins & some ecommerce.Familiarity with cPanel, Server / IT knowledge an asset.Experience with media queries and building responsive websites.Excellent at solving the challenges of cross browser rendering (desktop [IE, FF, Chrome, Safari] and mobile [iOS, Android])Ability to write iOS applications is an asset.Great problem solving skills.Additional Information: Key TraitsYou are passionate and love what you do.Work well under pressureAble to move from project to project quicklyGreat memory skillsExcellent communications skills.Strong analytical and problem solving skills.Superior teamwork and interpersonal skills.Strong organizational, prioritization, time management skills & work well under pressure.The ability to effectively handle multiple tasks and projects and to meet deadlines.Your upbeat & enthusiastic! Attitude is everything with us. We are a fun quirky group, but we love to work at what we do!EducationA college or university diploma/degree in something related is preferred.Also open to applicants who can demonstrate an amazing knowledge & Do-it-yourself spirit.Job Type: FreelanceJob Type: Freelance
Title: Wordpress Web Designer - Virtual 20 hours/week

Job_Description: Work on teams that are transforming our world! Start your career with CGI and Unleash Your Inner Awesome!  From Day 1, our new grads are assigned work and explore opportunities that promote continuous learning. Our New Grad program builds your core competencies and technical skills through workshops, case studies, CSR initiatives, as well as through classroom, online and on-the-job training.  Our new grad program is anything but typical. As well as real, career-worthy work from Day 1, heres what you can expect as a New Grad at CGI:   Professional roles in IT, business development, consulting and administration  Regular coaching and mentorship from leaders and peers  Networking and social events with fellow new grads and senior leaders  Frequent access and exposure to senior leadership  Continuous training and development throughout your career  Constant feedback to help you continuously learn and grow  Competitive compensation and benefits  Three weeks of paid vacation  Share purchase plan  Profit participation program  Social club access  Oxygen  CGIs Health and Wellness Program  Corporate Discount Rates  Learn more at www.cgi.com/startmycareer  Types of New Grad Roles we are hiring for:   Project Control Officers  Business Analysts  Business Systems Analysts  Technical Analysts  Data Analysts  Developers  UX/UI Designers  QA/Automation Test Engineers  Application/Production Support Your future duties and responsibilities:  Duties and responsibilities will vary based on your role Required qualifications to be successful in this role: Strong communication and interpersonal skills - both verbal and written Ability to work both individually and with teams Attention to detail and capacity to demonstrate continual learning Ability to be flexible and handle change What you can expect from us: Build your career with us.  It is an extraordinary time to be in business. As digital transformation continues to accelerate, CGI is at the center of this changesupporting our clients digital journeys and offering our professionals exciting career opportunities.  At CGI, our success comes from the talent and commitment of our professionals. As one team, we share the challenges and rewards that come from growing our company, which reinforces our culture of ownership. All of our professionals benefit from the value we collectively create.  Be part of building one of the largest independent technology and business services firms in the world.  Learn more about CGI at www.cgi.com.  No unsolicited agency referrals please.  CGI is an equal opportunity employer. In addition, CGI is committed to providing accommodations for people with disabilities in accordance with provincial legislation. Please let us know if you require a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during any aspect of the recruitment process and we will work with you to address your needs.
Title: NEW GRAD PROGRAM - July 2018

Job_Description: Job Description  Sommaire : Le titulaire de ce poste participe au développement de l’ergonomie du jeu par des chantiers, outils, accessibilité et les interfaces et rétroactions (signs & feedback).  Il/elle travaille en étroite collaboration avec l’équipe UI, le laboratoire recherche utilisateur, l’équipe 3C et l’équipe de conception de niveau (level design).  Responsabilités : Les fonctions principales et habituelles de cet emploi sont :  Conceptualiser la logique, la disposition et le déroulement de toutes les interfaces utilisateur dans le jeu, y compris l’affichage tête haute (HUD), les menus et le lobby en appliquant les principes d’architecture de l’information et d’accessibilité; S’assurer que les différentes interfaces et la rétroaction (signs & feedback) communiquent clairement l’information du jeu au travers des meilleures pratiques d’accessibilité; Garantir une réactivité optimale des interactions et une latence minimale des contrôles; Conseiller les concepteurs de jeu (game designer) et travailler en étroite collaboration avec eux pour identifier les contrôles et les entrées qui servent d’appui aux interactions, le tout dans le but d’assurer une expérience utilisateur fluide et cohérente; Développer des prototypes fonctionnels qui permettent d’itérer rapidement sur les interactions clés; Mettre en place une disposition optimal des interfaces; Assurer que l’agencement de l’interface réponde aux contraintes de localisation ; Application des retours utilisateurs et de l’utilisation efficace des services de recherche utilisateur pour optimiser l’expérience du jeu; Effectuer toutes autres tâches connexes.  Formation : Diplôme d’études collégiales dans la conception ou tous autres domaines pertinentes du jeu vidéo.  Expérience pertinente : 2 années minimum d’expérience pertinente dans le domaine du jeu vidéo, et particulièrement : concepteur de jeu, concepteur UX, concepteur UI, concepteur industriel, ergonome ou programmeur 3C. Qualifications  Habiletés et connaissances : Maitrise des principes d’ergonomies appliquées aux jeux vidéo; Capacité à créer des prototypes fonctionnels; Connaissance en architecture de l’information et design industriel; Aptitudes à communiquer et à faire des présentations; Capacité à innover et à créer une expérience utilisateur exceptionnelle; Compréhension des concepts UX « lean » et capacité à travailler dans un environnement en flux continu et à penser en termes holistiques tout en créant et en apprenant de façon itérative; Capacité à se fier à une approche conceptuelle d’affaires centrée sur l’utilisateur.  Dans le domaine du jeu vidéo on attend particulièrement une expertise dans cette branche :  Interface Utilisateur et Recherche Utilisateur  Capacité à créer des guides d’interaction homme machine (IHM); Connaissance en programmation d’interface est souhaitable; Capacité et autonomie à créer des prototypes fonctionnels et hautement interactifs (gamepad, animations, transitions) qui simulent de manière convainquant les divers widget de UI/HUD; Connaissance en méthodologie de recherche utilisateur (Méthodes d’analyse quantitative et qualitative, Biométrie, Questionnaire utilisateur, etc.).  Additional Information  null
Title: Concepteur expérience utilisateur (UX)

Job_Description: About Blackhawk Network: At Achievers, our software delivers a powerful new way for companies to engage, align, and recognize employees enabling remarkable business success. Every day.  We hire ambitious professionals who thrive on their entrepreneurial spirit and want to Change the Way the World Works. As Achievers employees, we are passionate about disruptive technology, welcome constant change, and understand the value of employee success in the workplace. We enjoy coming to work every day because we believe in our product and L.O.V.E. our culture. Achievers is more than just a software company; we are industry leaders in the HR space. Overview: If you are passionate about making products that people love, deeply care about humans, and have an empathic approach to design that helps you make it all come to life, we want to hear from you. We’re looking for a team member who has a contagious drive for learning, acquiring new skills and perspectives, and who cares about sharing their insights to learn and grow as a team – this is our secret weapon. You have produced top-notch quality work. You have sound design intuition and believe in having a process from beginning to end – from wireframes, task flows, crystal clear mock ups, and interaction designs. Your portfolio should illustrate your achievements, and you believe that your best work is still ahead of you. Responsibilities: We might be a good match if... You believe in craftsmanship and endeavor to create elegant and compelling designs, over and over. Your portfolio has some best-in-class work. You're a walking encyclopedia of microinteractions in use (on mobile, web, desktop, etc), and have nuanced views on how to make many of them even better.  You’ve shipped product. You’ve weathered release cycles and know what details matter at each stage, how to motivate engineers to get the fit and finish right, how to translate insights from user studies into meaningful action, and what’s most likely to go afoul at each stage. You can share several shining examples of real work you've shipped, and what you learned along the way. You have designed and shipped multiple apps, or have gone through multiple release cycles on a larger project. Cross-platform is your style. Hopefully you’ve shipped something across several platforms. You know what translates from desktop and what doesn’t, or why you’d opt for one solution for iOS and another on Android. You know that a good design requires research and multiple iterations. You are able to explain how your best work came to be, and you can show us the processes you went through. You know all modern design practices by heart and can be creative to come up with better solutions. Prototyping is a key part of your toolset. You’ve prototyped on multiple platforms. You’ve made last-minute tweaks between user studies. You know how to be all kinds of quick and dirty, but dream of better prototyping tools. You substantially contribute to defining the 'what' as well as the 'how'. You're a product manager's secret weapon. You thrive best when helping to define the requirements, not just translating them into designs. You facilitate and draw the best design ideas from teammates. You'll also be working with Engineering to design and implement beautiful, intuitive experiences. That means you'll need to not only be a great designer, but also be able to understand and write a little code. You can think and talk about the bottom line. Analytics don’t scare you, and you know which tools you can use to find the data you'd need to make a (design) decision, and are comfortable with searching our databases to get the data you need. What will you do? Design thoughtful user experiences and great looking product UI. Form the vision for winning application solutions, collaborating with Product Managers, Senior Management, Development, Professional Services, Customer Success and Marketing. Work closely with the Product team to create exceptional wireframes, process flows, mock-ups and other design documentation. Deeply understand and validate the needs of current and targeted customers through quantitative & qualitative customer research. Test and refine flows with internal & external stakeholders. Collaborate and share ideas and concepts as a strategic member of a dynamic product team. Work with the design team to define and refine the patterns, templates and components that are used across the platform. Qualifications: Qualifications:  Extensive experience designing beautiful customer experiences for the web, iPhone, iPad or Android. 4+ years experience that includes UI, UX, and interaction design. Solid portfolio (show us everything from rough sketches to high-fidelity designs). Excellent knowledge of the Adobe Creative Suite, Sketch and other graphic design / prototyping tools. Proficiency in HTML, CSS and JavaScript frameworks. You possess an intensely collaborative spirit. You share early and iterate quickly. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Sharp attention to design detail.
Title: Sr. User Experience Designer
