You believe in craftsmanship and endeavor to create elegant and compelling designs, over and over. Your portfolio has some best-in-class work. You're a walking encyclopedia of microinteractions in use (on mobile, web, desktop, etc), and have nuanced views on how to make many of them even better.  You’ve shipped product. You’ve weathered release cycles and know what details matter at each stage, how to motivate engineers to get the fit and finish right, how to translate insights from user studies into meaningful action, and what’s most likely to go afoul at each stage. You can share several shining examples of real work you've shipped, and what you learned along the way. You have designed and shipped multiple apps, or have gone through multiple release cycles on a larger project. Cross-platform is your style. Hopefully you’ve shipped something across several platforms. You know what translates from desktop and what doesn’t, or why you’d opt for one solution for iOS and another on Android. You know that a good design requires research and multiple iterations. You are able to explain how your best work came to be, and you can show us the processes you went through. You know all modern design practices by heart and can be creative to come up with better solutions. Prototyping is a key part of your toolset. You’ve prototyped on multiple platforms. You’ve made last-minute tweaks between user studies. You know how to be all kinds of quick and dirty, but dream of better prototyping tools. You substantially contribute to defining the 'what' as well as the 'how'. You're a product manager's secret weapon. You thrive best when helping to define the requirements, not just translating them into designs. You facilitate and draw the best design ideas from teammates. You'll also be working with Engineering to design and implement beautiful, intuitive experiences. That means you'll need to not only be a great designer, but also be able to understand and write a little code. You can think and talk about the bottom line. Analytics don’t scare you, and you know which tools you can use to find the data you'd need to make a (design) decision, and are comfortable with searching our databases to get the data you need. What will you do? Design thoughtful user experiences and great looking product UI. Form the vision for winning application solutions, collaborating with Product Managers, Senior Management, Development, Professional Services, Customer Success and Marketing. Work closely with the Product team to create exceptional wireframes, process flows, mock-ups and other design documentation. Deeply understand and validate the needs of current and targeted customers through quantitative & qualitative customer research. Test and refine flows with internal & external stakeholders. Collaborate and share ideas and concepts as a strategic member of a dynamic product team. Work with the design team to define and refine the patterns, templates and components that are used across the platform. QUALIFICATIONS: Qualifications:  Extensive experience designing beautiful customer experiences for the web, iPhone, iPad or Android. 4+ years experience that includes UI, UX, and interaction design. Solid portfolio (show us everything from rough sketches to high-fidelity designs). Excellent knowledge of the Adobe Creative Suite, Sketch and other graphic design / prototyping tools. Proficiency in HTML, CSS and JavaScript frameworks. You possess an intensely collaborative spirit. You share early and iterate quickly. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Sharp attention to design detail.
Title: Sr. User Experience Designer

Job_Description: At TradeRev, we know that our greatest asset is our people; they are and will always be the driving force behind our success. Whether that comes in the form of building a unique sales solution or innovating and evolving our product...we look to our employees to disrupt the norm and make their mark on the world.  We are looking for a talented Senior UI/UX Designer who will work closely with product managers and key stakeholders to help discover project requirements while translating customer needs into great user experiences to which developers can execute on. You will prototype and build interaction models and work hand-in-hand with a UX Researcher as a part of a larger multidisciplinary scrum (Agile) team. This gives you the opportunity to impact product strategies from the earliest stages, ensuring the user experience aligns with our brand and our customer expectations. You will be an integral member of the product team and report to the Chief Creative Officer.  Our Core Values: Fun. Honest. Accountable. Brave.  Take a look at our other benefits here: http://work.traderev.com/  How We Support You: With great skills comes great responsibilities. We understand that in order to attain and maintain amazing skills, it needs to be continually up to date, so we make sure you're all covered when it comes to any professional development, conferences, and licenses. It's on us. Why choose us?  Be part of an innovative company that is truly disrupting an industry  Opportunity to lead UX design and make a direct impact on a product that is used globally  Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, high performing and talented team  Flexible work hours and good work-life balance  Competitive pay and a fun place to work  Use cutting edge technologies  Opportunities for continuous learning and professional growth Responsibilities: Define practical user experiences (e.g., storytelling, personas, process flows, etc.) and create design assets. We want you to not only create great experiences but make them look fantastic as well. Lead the ideation and experience design of complex web & mobile solutions, which involves defining data architecture and interfaces, and determining business rules, design interactions, and client flows Consult stakeholders in decision making for user flows, sitemaps, design, and feasibility Plan, execute and present wireframe, prototypes and proof of concepts to stakeholders to ensure needs and expectations are met, and sell the vision behind user experiences Act as main point of contact for all project UX related status, including but not limited to presenting status during stand-ups and demos Identify, discuss, and execute opportunities for improvements to the client experience, products, tools, etc., and actively improve scope of knowledge, refine designs, and recommend improved solutions through market research and customer data Analyze industry best practices, client feedback, new vendor offerings, learnings from metrics tracking, and market competitive analyses Work closely with UX Researcher to monitor client behaviour metrics and determine ongoing improvements to our solutions Ensure the product team empathize with our users and understand their needs and pain points Your journey so far: A diploma or degree in a related field (UX Design, Graphic Design, Interdisciplinary Design, Interaction Design) or relevant work experience At least 3 years experience leading the design/execution of user experiences in a UI/UX role Experience working with multi-member UI/UX design teams on complex User Experience centric initiatives within an Agile team environment and methodologies Working within the software development/digital products/service industry or other relevant professional experience Experience designing and executing creative user experiences, with track record of implementing responsive designs for medium to high complexity solutions, as well as experience working in a team-based, fast paced Agile development environment Exceptional skill in UI and graphic design. A solid online portfolio demonstrating experience creating design solutions with emphasis on web and/or mobile applications Bonus if you've worked with: Origami (prototyping software) After effects (motion graphics software) Adobe XD (prototyping software) Adobe creative suite We thank all applicants for their interest. Only candidates selected for an interview who are legally authorized to work in Canada will be considered.  TradeRev is committed to providing employment in accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act. Any assessment and selection materials or processes used during the recruitment process will be available in an accessible format to applicants with disabilities, upon request. If contacted for an interview, please advise Human Resources if you require disability-related accommodation.
Title: Senior UI/UX Designer

Job_Description: Our Client is looking for a Senior UIUX Designer to work on an initial 3 month contract on a Financial Services project  Duties: Uses the design assets and colour palette of Illustrator to create a website design Create digital assets for production Work collaboratively with the developer and project stakeholders iterating and finalizing the design Works with the developer and team on implementation, testing and iteration Participates in user testing of the design Deliverables Design mockups Digital assets Quality assurance of the design implementation, including bugs User testing summaries Other documentation as required  Qualifications 10+ years experience as a senior user experience designer experience leading a visual design and UX processes a demonstration of creativity and effective design through your portfolio awareness of web accessibility implications to design previous experience designing interactive experiences for children Skills makes sound, evidence-based decisions promotes effective collaboration, communication and information sharing thinks strategically when integrating complex or conflicting analysis from a range of sources to provide balanced advice knowledge of HTML and JS used to help shape how design ideas are implemented outstanding oral and written communication skills
Title: Senior UI/UX Designer

Job_Description: We’re looking for a designer who’s passionate about creating meaningful experiences through beautifully designed products. You should have a proven record leading product design from concept to completion and working collaboratively with your clients and your team. You’re also interested in constantly learning and growing—both building your own skill set and helping develop the people around you. What we'd like to see You’re a strategic thinker and can translate strategy into products that have real impact You understand user needs and can identify business opportunities You can develop wireframes and build prototypes You have the ability to communicate and collaborate effectively with the business partners You can simultaneously see the bigger picture and focus on the finer details You can provide mentorship to other members of the design team, helping them push their boundaries and build their skill sets You like to be in a super-collaborative environment, working alongside talented developers, designers, QA analysts and delivery managers throughout the lifecycle of a project You can visualize experiences from static comps to fully fledged animations. You’re proficient in Sketch, Invision, Photoshop and other design tools You love digital and keep your eye on best practices and emerging trends in web and mobile design You independently adopt new technologies and practices (e.g. tools, platforms, features, etc.) You’re a fearless advocate. You inspire confidence and educate others around design methods that create great products Now a little about us Established in 2010, we’re a closely knit team of developers, designers, QA Analysts and leaders who truly love what we do day in and day out. We’ve designed and developed products with companies such as PayPal, Tumblr, TELUS, Microsoft and YogaGlo. We work with early stage startups to help bring their first version products to market, and find product-market fit. We also work with large organizations to teach them how move quickly and create quality products by adopting startup cultures and habits. No matter the scale of the project, our goal is to create products and services that will help our partners further develop their business and deliver an application that people will enjoy using. Joining Nascent means being able to work on products used by millions of people every day. You’ll be working in an open, honest and engaging environment in downtown Toronto. We offer great opportunities, competitive benefits and a ton of fun. Go on apply! Nascent’s a great place to work, and we’d love for you to find out firsthand. To apply, e-mail us at careers@nascentdigital.com. Please include your resume or CV, a link to your online portfolio and the position for which you’re applying in the subject line. We look forward to hearing from you!  < See all postings
Title: Senior UX/UI Designer

Job_Description: Konrad Group Konrad Group is a next generation digital consultancy. We are dedicated to solving complex business problems for our global clients with creative and forward-thinking solutions. Our employees enjoy a culture built on innovation and a commitment to creating best-in-class digital products in use by hundreds of millions of consumers around the world. We hire exceptionally smart, analytical, and hard working people who are lifelong learners. Senior UI/UX Designer Konrad Group is looking for a Senior UI/UX Designer to join our Toronto team. You will play a key role in leading large-scale innovation and digital solutions for consumer brands and enterprise clients. You will collaborate with creative, development and strategy teams to ship world-class digital experiences for leading companies and global brands. Responsibilities Lead design research, ideation and creation of digital interfaces across multiple platforms and devices Facilitate discussions and design thinking / feedback sessions with clients and project stakeholders Ensure successful delivery of multiple projects by managing design deliverables and timelines Mentor designers by providing clear design guidance and actionable suggestions Inspire all members of the creative team by fostering a culture of constant learning and professional growth Skills & Requirements Minimum of 3 years experience in leading the design of interactive experiences Solid understanding of creating user-centered experiences with complex requirements Driven to innovate and lead creative workflows and processes for the team Excellent communication skills during client engagements and presentations Proficient knowledge of Sketch, Adobe Creative Suite and prototyping tools Expertise in motion graphics and web or mobile development is a bonus Bonus Points: Have you taken any courses at BrainStation? A lot of our design and development best practices and processes are taught during our courses - make sure to highlight this experience in your cover letter if you have! Konrad Group is committed to maintaining a diverse work environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants, regardless of race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status will receive consideration for employment. If you have any accessibility requirements or concerns regarding the hiring process or employment with us, please notify us so we can provide suitable accommodation. Please include a link to your online portfolio with the application. While we sincerely appreciate all applications, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.
Title: Senior UI/UX Designer

Job_Description: ABOUT US TribalScale is an innovation firm that brings organizations - from the startup to the enterprise - into the future. We build digital products, transform teams, and grow startups. We’re headquartered in Toronto and have offices around the world. The future is bright, and we’re always looking for excited technologists to create with us. Some of the platforms that we work with: Mobile & Web (iOS, tvOS, Android) Voice User Interfaces (Amazon Alexa, Google Home) Connected Cars and Homes OTT (Roku, Fire TV) Beacon Solutions VR & AR ABOUT YOU You're excited about designing the connected world and want to join a team of ambitious, like-minded technologists. You're passionate about the intersection of design and technology and strive to explore new meaningful interactions between the physical and digital worlds. You want to have high impact, drive design innovation, and have a meaningful contribution to both our work environment and client work at TribalScale. You strive in fast-paced, collaborative environments and are able to quickly switch gears between client work, internal initiatives, and supporting your peers under minimal supervision. Your previous work experience has given you a holistic understanding of how digital products are conceived, built, and managed. You don't necessarily know how to code, but you have a general understanding of the infrastructure that makes up an application. You are able to meet with potential clients and understand their business goals, their users' desires, and are able to identify opportunities where design can bring their ideas to the next level while putting the needs of their users first. WHAT YOU’LL DO Apply a user centred approach to design problems. Work collaboratively engineers, Project Managers, and fellow designers in supporting the TribalScale marketing projects. Assist in preparation of presentation and as required make presentations. Prepare print ready art files for flyers, posters signs, etc. Proof publications for spelling and grammar. Create graphic designs as directed by Director of Design, Marketing Manager or as a creative assignment. Ability to clearly communicate ideas and take direction. Assists all departments with graphic requests as needed. Attend meetings with marketing team, design team, or leadership team to get requirements for work. REQUIREMENTS 4+ Years of professional work experience in UI/UX related positions. Oversee and ensure that our team produces best-in-class designs for the projects we work on. Continuously work to improve our design process by testing and implementing new tools, and leading initiatives that elevate our design practice. Comfortable with being client-facing with the ability to understand and articulate business goals & talk design strategy. Proficiency of UX design discipline – user flows, wireframes, mockups, prototypes, etc. Proficiency with the latest design tools and software (Adobe CS, Sketch) Self-motivated to take initiative and ownership of your work. Immaculate attention to detail, typography, and interactivity. Have a user-centric mindset throughout your design process. Consistently up to date with the latest design trends and best practices. Collaborate well with Product Mangers, Engineers, Sales, and everyone else in our Tribe. Help guide product decisions through user testing and iterative feedback loops. Rapidly iterate on design prototypes and working applications. Produce materials for clients and developers, including user flows, wireframes, mockups, prototypes, and assets. Open to new tools and methodologies, yet opinionated about best practices. A strong portfolio that demonstrates previous work samples. BONUS POINTS FOR Experience with motion graphics / animation. Applied knowledge of user testing and validation techniques. Early adopter of new technology and gadgets. Familiar with Lean Startup Methodologies, Design Sprints, and Gamestorming. WHY YOU WANT TO BE AT TRIBALSCALE Our values: Meritocracy, empowerment, and transparency. Our skills: Our teams were at the front the mobile revolution, are expert builders in Voice tech, and now, they’re connecting the world. They’ve work with brands including the NBA, Twitter, ABC, the CBC, Autonomics, and tons more. You matter: Everyone sits at the table and brings value. We love to be challenged, are happy to go with the flow, and we trust our gut. Growth: We’re a rocketship ready to take-off, you’ll get your hands dirty in every aspect of the business and there are tremendous opportunities for personal and professional growth. Seize them. BENEFITS Stay Happy & Healthy Health benefits: 100% medical, dental and vision coverage Wealthsimple Group Retirement Savings Plan (GRSP) Generous maternity and paternity leave policies Daily hot breakfast Fully stocked kitchen: unlimited drinks and snacks Office fitness and social events Office closed over Winter holidays Corporate-discounted GoodLife membership Perkopolis: company perk plan Free Netflix membership Make Meaningful Connections Friday socials to cap off a great week Regular office activities: game nights, movie nights, group fitness, and more Quarterly team events: axe-throwing, beach day, and more Take your pick at a gaming break: Super Smash Bros, foosball, ping pong Discover Your Potential Tickets to local events, conferences & meet-ups Out-of-town conference subsidies $2000 annual professional development allowance Weekly Lunch & Learns with industry leaders $3000 referral bonus Want To See The World? Our employees have the opportunity to rotate through our offices, giving employees the chance to travel, experience new cultures and discover their full potential.
Title: Senior UI/UX Designer - Toronto

Job_Description: This Opportunity Based in our Toronto studio as part of the Global Marketing and Business Development team and reporting to the Director Creative & Graphic Design based in Seattle, the Graphic Designer – is responsible for supporting the creative and graphic design needs of our studios, while ensuring B+H global brand compliance and standards. This position will work closely with B+H Principals and Directors, Proposals Managers, the Marketing Communications and Graphic Design team members based in Toronto and other studios.  The successful candidate has experience in a fast-paced, design focused atmosphere and thrives in an international, collaborative virtual team environment.  Key Responsibilities Creative and innovative graphic design execution for a range of branding, business development, marketing communications and internal initiatives and activities, includes but not limited to: Presentations; Digital and Printed, Advertising, Email Campaigns, Signage, Branded Business Collateral, Events, Signage and Award Submissions  Manages deadlines and project details through regular and ongoing communication with project management to keep project on track and on schedule and assists with timeline development Collaborate to develop, maintain and adhere to processes and standards, to ensure that marketing materials are consistent, up to date and accurate. Interface with and manage print vendors through all phases of work; from estimates to pre-press to production to finished project. Coordinate, direct or assist photography efforts for projects, people and events Source and manage imagery, complying with all applicable copyright laws Represent and provide insight into local market requirements and nuances, during the development of creative for global campaigns Position Requirements Post-secondary diploma or degree in Graphic Design or related field 3 – 5 years’ experience in a design firm, agency or in-house design group Must be proficient using MAC and PC operating systems and applications Must have advanced proficiency in the most current Adobe Creative Cloud design and production software tools Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite, focusing on Word, PowerPoint Experience in Brand Identity and development. Strong knowledge of printing production and processes Experience and interest in the Planning, Architecture or Interior Design industry Knowledge of UI/UX design, HTML, CSS, and CMS WordPress is an asset Interest or knowledge in Motion utilizing Adobe Flash, AfterEffects, or Premiere Interest or knowledge in Environmental Graphic Design Digital marketing experience considered an asset Experience working in other parts of Asia considered an asset Strong communication skills Attention to detail Ability to prioritize, work under pressure and manage multiple deadlines Positive, hands-on attitude with willingness to perform other tasks and assignments assigned A portfolio of work is needed to be considered for this position
Title: Graphic Designer – Mid/Senior Level

Job_Description: Equitable Bank is one of Canada's Platinum Standard Best Employers for 2017 named by Aon Hewitt.  Why Equitable Bank? If you're looking for a workplace where employees are passionate about their work environment, then read on. What sets Equitable Bank apart from other companies is its culture. We celebrate and embrace the fabric of diversity, the employee engagement process and collectively take pride in our business successes. Our commitment to our customers, our partners and our employees creates a stimulating and exciting atmosphere that generates innovative products and outstanding service quality.  About Equitable Bank Equitable Bank is Canada's ninth largest independent Schedule I bank, serving Canadians coast to coast. It offers a diverse suite of residential lending, commercial lending and savings solutions, including high-interest savings products and GICs. Through its proven branchless approach and customer service focus, Equitable Bank has grown to approximately $17 billion in assets under management. Most recently, Equitable Bank launched a digital banking operation, EQ Bank, and introduced the EQ Bank Savings Plus Account. Equitable Bank currently employs over 500 employees across the country.  Within Equitable Bank's Core Lending business, Single Family Lending Services funds mortgages for owner-occupied and investment properties across Canada, while Commercial Lending Services provides mortgages on a variety of commercial properties on a national basis.  Equitable's Securitization Financing business originates and securitizes insured residential mortgages under the Canada Mortgage and Housing ("CMHC") administered National Housing Act.  Equitable Bank also offers a range of deposit products including short-term, long-term and Cashable GICs, available in non-registered or Tax Free Savings Account ("TFSA") across Canada. And it offers a High Interest Savings Account, available from authorized investment advisors through the FundServ network.  Equitable Bank is a growing Canadian financial services business and a wholly owned subsidiary of Equitable Group. It was founded in 1970 as The Equitable Trust Company.  Job Title: Senior Graphic Designer Department: Marketing Reports To: Manager, Creative Services  ***PLEASE SUBMIT YOUR PORTFOLIO ALONG WITH YOUR APPLICATION*** Job Description  Equitable Bank is seeking a Senior Graphic Designer to join the in-house Creative Services Team with the execution of digital, print, advertising, promotions, web and email projects. The ideal candidate possesses up to 4 years of real work experience, who is looking for an opportunity to work with a team of marketing professionals.  The Senior Graphic Designer is responsible for designing digital and print artwork for marketing collateral and publications from concept to completion. All materials must adhere to the Brand Standard Guidelines to retain brand integrity and contribute to the achievement of Equitable Bank’s business objectives when required.  Main Activities:On-going responsibilities:  Be an integral part of the consumer experience and design as it comes to all customer marketing touchpoints From brief to delivery, responsible for leading the stakeholder(s) and team to deliver the very best work, creating an environment of motivation, inspiration, trust and partnership Design for various types of projects including brand identity, brands visual strategies, multiple types of collateral, advertising (traditional, online, outdoor, etc.) and more Create strong and effective design communications within the guidelines of our brands and sub-brands, while working closely with the creative team on integrated campaigns to ensure design integrity and consistency throughout all communications Strategize and brainstorm with the team to collectively produce strong creative designs Show strong creative judgment and give clear and honest feedback Be a champion for great creative work and actively seek opportunities to expand our output Build, protect and manage digital content; including the production of optimized graphics and HTML5 animations across a variety of consumer-facing digital channels including social media, email marketing and website. This includes verifying and approving any external vendor or partnering material to match the visual guidelines of the bank Ensure all content meets rigorous SEO guidelines through disciplined workflow and regular site audits Provide QA and UAT support and create detailed outlines for change requests, bugs for design and user functionality Create UI designs based on market analysis, internal and customer feedback and usability findings for the website or mobile platforms Publish across a variety of consumer-facing digital channels via CMS platforms Work directly with business stakeholders, managers, writers, other designers, developers, and sponsored partnerships to coordinate designs execution to spec and on time Maintain multiple marketing programs and brand integrity for the EQ Bank, Equitable Bank and STNCE brands Support ad hoc marketing design requests across various channels Manage version control of documents Provide content and copywriting feedback  Develop production artwork (pre-press) of materials:  Prepare accurate and production ready files for print Check printer proofs for production errors Supply files to vendors via FTP, email, USB or CD/DVD Identify and correct problems before sending to print Source images and relevant information to be used in printed materials and presentations  Knowledge / Qualifications:  Post-secondary education in Digital Graphics, Design, Marketing, animation or related experience 4+ years of experience in a client-side or digital agency environment, designing, producing and publishing optimized web content Proficiency in HTML5 and CMS platforms such as Sitefinity, Salesforce and Wordpress, with a strong understanding of design possibilities Conceptual Ideation & art direction Strong Knowledge of typography, copywriting, illustration, colour theory, storyboarding, preflight practices and iconography Deep understanding and experience with responsive website design, UI design and web technologies Strong grasp of UI/UX fundamentals across desktop, tablet and mobile platforms with top-flight communication skills Experience with social media networks/communities Proficiency in Adobe Creative Suite CC (Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign, Dreamweaver), knowledge of Adobe Premiere and After Effects is an asset Proficiency in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook) Excellent command of the English Language (speaking & writing), bilingualism with French is an asset Excellent time management and organization skills Ability to handle emergencies, solve problems and work under pressure Strong communication and people skills High attention to detail Self-starter, able to conceptualize and execute on focused messaging in order to drive brand awareness Image editing and optimization Effective verbal and written technical communication skills required Disciplined typography and layout skills Must have a strong and high quality portfolio demonstrating creativity, design expertise, strategic thinking, and software competence Experience in managing workflow and processes for a creative team Experience with Kanban methodology is an asset  Equitable Bank is an equal opportunity employer and encourages applications from all qualified candidates. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. All candidates considered for hire must successfully pass a criminal background check and credit check to qualify for hire. While we appreciate your interest in applying, an Equitable recruiter will only contact leading candidates whose skills and qualifications closely match the requirements of the position.
Title: Senior Graphic Designer

Job_Description: About Us: WOKE is a design studio that works at the intersection of digital and physical products.We're an agile team of senior designers working in diverse disciplines ranging from UX/UI to Industrial Design to Apparel/Softgoods design.We like working on cutting edge problems and look for technologies that are new to the world that we can help craft to have a positive impact on people’s lives.  About the Role: We are in search of a seasoned Interaction Designer capable of managing projects as well as executing on designing beautiful experiences and interfaces.In this role, you get exposure to and involvement with all parts of the design process: project scoping, client relationship development, user research, concept development, wireframing, prototyping, visual design and design stewardship.We’re looking for someone who is equally excited about designing beautiful interfaces as they are taking people’s feedback as a source of inspirationComfortable working on very different types of projects and product categories.  Example Projects: Desigining the UX for smart light switch system to help create more beautiful light at home.Creating a new mobile advertising platform that will help subsidize people’s phone plansDesigning a health tracking platform that uses science to help people actually live longer.Designing a meditation app that connects to smart yoga pants to help a new generation get centered.  Your Profile: You have 5+ years of working experience in designing digital product, service, and experience from ideation to implementation.You’re a confident and flexible leader, able to manage small teams and freelancers.You can relate to individuals and nurture talent. You give and solicit feedback from other designers in order to continually raise the bar for quality.You have a point of view and you are able to distinguish between “good” and “great” work.You can make sense of complex information, user interaction flows and system architecture.You can create beautiful user interfaces and love working on design details just as much as thinking about big ideas.You know what it takes to bring a software product to market.You understand Human Centered Design Practices as well as Agile Product Development practice.Ability to convey concepts through wireframes, flows and mockupsFluent in visual design tools, such as Photoshop, Sketch, IllustratorFluent in prototyping (ie, AfterEffects, Flinto, Principle, etc.)A big plus is that you can code for web and/or mobile app experience  Additional Skills: You’re comfortable presenting infront of a big group.You’re a natural relationship builder. We've got a nice incentive structure set up to reward you for bringing in new client work.This position may either be based in Vancouver or San Francisco as we built out our San Francisco studio.  Perks: Generous education budget to spend on your professional and self-developmentBe set up for success, equipped with the latest and greatest hardwareMaking it a point to put our pencils down, decompress and have a few beers together on a weekly basis.Drink as much coffee as you can handle.Giving you a chance to work side by side with people form different disciplines like industrial designers, apparel designers and engineers. Compensation is flexible right now and based on experience – pay range from $80K to $120K, depending on experience, plus business development commission. If this job description gets you genuinely excited, please email us your CV and portfolio at: careers@woke.co
Title: Interaction Design Lead/Senior Designer

Job_Description: Located in the heart of downtown Toronto, we’re the strategic services arm of Symbility Solutions, one of Canada’s rare 100 Million+ publicly traded technology companies. We work with startups, gaming companies, technology giants, and fortune 100 clients.  A day at Symbility Intersect is never the same.  As our Senior Product & UX Designer, you will be a team player who enjoys working in a collaborative environment to produce and deliver smart and innovative applications for a dynamic and varied client base.  Contribute product design thinking to enable creation of user-driven success-focused digital experiences Partner with Strategy and Engineering teams to solve problems and identify trends and opportunities Work with the executives and larger strategy team to support existing and new client strategy-related efforts Research and understand all facets of our clients’ businesses and provide insights that can be created into measurable analytics. Inform, influence, support, and execute our product decisions Must have documentation skills to produce and maintain specification documents, text strings, flowcharts, wireframes and other documentation that define the user experience. The ability to create process flows, site maps, wire frames, screen prototypes and functional specifications. Must be able to create client experiences and advocate for the client in the experience workflow. Familiarity with business requirement gathering, site assessment, competitive analysis, and secondary research. Brainstorm and collaborate with other user interface and graphic designers and with engineers on multiple projects. Diagram site architectures and user interfaces using sitemaps and wireframes. Work from given business requirements and creative concepts to create IA documentation. Work with developers to help create high-level prototypes as necessary. Inclusive design philosophy with a strong editorial sense. Will support continuous improvement of user experience tools, documentation and process. Requirements  As our Senior Product & UX Designer you will possess the following skills, attributes and experience  3+ Years of UX design experience. Successful launch of web, mobile, and/or software applications. Familiar with Native App, HTML, JavaScript, and CSS design capabilities Fluent in responsive design, mobile/tablet UI UX Fluent in Material Design and Human Interface Design Guidelines  Benefits  Life at Intersect: FLEXIBLE HOURS AND UNLIMITED VACATION POLICY  Need a break? No problem. Employees can take time off in the way that works best for them and their teams. Work remotely when you need to.  HEALTH AND WELLNESS  Comprehensive extended health care coverage, energy pod, and standing desks. Take care of yourself.  FUN  Off-site adventures, ping-pong, unique traditions, monthly birthday celebrations, Fancy Fridays, Lunch and Learns.  OFFICE MEALS  Catered lunches, healthy snacks, freshly-ground coffee, and Beer O’clock  TOWN HALL  To stay connected we have weekly town halls to celebrate milestones, share updates, welcome new hires, present apps of the week, and crown the QA Star of the Week.  WORKATION  We like to work hard and play hard, and as such we offer yearly Workations for employees to unwind and spend non-work time with coworkers.  Want to learn more?  https://www.themuse.com/companies/symbilityintersect  Our Culture: https://www.symbilitysolutions.com/symbility-intersect/careers/  Check out our 3D office tour: https://www.symbilitysolutions.com/symbility-intersect/360-office-tour/  Symbility Intersect is a Toronto based strategic innovation company that works with forward-thinking global brands and disruptive entrepreneurs. Our team focuses on strategy, design, and development of mobile, web and data products. Our approach solves tough problems, overcomes complicated challenges and creates opportunities through innovation. Our deliverables are products and thinking that creates long-term value for our clients, not campaigns that disappear as quickly as their impact.  Symbility Intersect welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.  If you’re interested in being on the bleeding edge of technology, tackling exciting problems from different industries, and constantly being pushed to learn - apply below!
Title: Senior UX Designer

Job_Description: Do you cringe at unintuitive menus and unresponsive controls? Do you have an eye for detail and polished experiences? Do you have strong, clear UI creation skills and a passion for gaming?  Then come help us by advancing the art and design of our product’s user interaction!  We are looking for a talented UI Artist to join our dynamic and growing team in Montreal. Be a part of the crew in charge of developing the most authentic and recognized poker game: World Series of Poker. You must be well versed in layout, typography and UI design for web and mobile applications. As our ideal candidate, you are able to develop and create concepts and visual ideas for online and mobile products that will be used in social and mobile games.  About Playtika  Playtika is a multiplatform social games developer. We are the #1 grossing Facebook game developer as well as a Top 10 grossing developer on iOS & Android worldwide.  Founded in 2010, Playtika immediately enjoyed skyrocketing growth and expanded quickly by acquiring other leading game titles. We now have 14 offices in 9 countries around the world with over 1,600 Playtikans.  Our business and our passion is to immerse people into a thrilling entertainment experience. Currently our games are enjoyed by more than 6 million users daily and over 20 million users monthly. Sounds good, right? Come play with us!  What you’ll be doing: Actively conceptualize UI designs for all aspects of the game Work with the Game Designer and PO to create the UX wireframe Work with the Art Director in defining and communicating the visual language and interface look and feel Translate gameplay high level ideas into visual functional UI designs Help elaborate research and prototype to bring ideas to life Participate in visual comparisons and critiques Competently assist in design of UI flow and function Spec out art tasks and generate time estimates when needed Contribute to art and tool pipeline improvements  Requirements: As our ideal candidate, you have: At least 5 years’ experience as a UI Artist in the gaming industry A strong background in fundamental art principles including excellent color theory, layout, typography, visual hierarchy and composition skills Expertise with Photoshop A thorough understanding of UI/UX flow and function design A desire to challenge yourself to raise the barre on your own work and that of the company Knowledge and curiosity about the latest trends in gaming and UI A strong ability to communicate ideas visually and in writing The ability to meet deadlines while handling multiple tasks A College degree in Art, Animation, Design, or a related field (an asset) Strong French/English written and verbal communication skills  It’s a total bonus if you have: Experience with Unity, Flash, After Effect and Illustrator Ability to create simple UI animations Ability to crop and integrate art assets in Mobile and Web platforms If you think you have what it takes, we want to hear from you!  We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.  Division: WSOP
Title: UI Artist

Job_Description: Senior UX/UI Designer  What is the opportunity? The UX Designer will help create a ‘Best in Class’ user experience across a variety of diverse web based user interfaces within Capital Markets Front Office FX Technology including the flagship RBC Capital Markets single dealer platform used by thousands of clients and internal sales and trading applications used the front office.  What will you do? Designing and evolving the UX for the next generation HTML5 Single Dealer Platform. Designing the next generation of HTML5 sales and trading user interfaces for Front Office. Work closely with Product Owners and Development teams to ensure user interfaces built receive excellent feedback from end users as a result of well thought out and pragmatic user interface design. Create wireframes, storyboards, user flows and site maps to effectively communicate interaction and design ideas, using standard design software e.g. Adobe Creative Suite, Sketch and work closely with developers to ensure a shared vision is delivered Facilitate in cross line of business process design. Influence cross discipline teams on next generation user experience . Identify continuous improvement opportunities and drive project progress and benefits. Help drive organizational discipline and ensure accountability.  What do you need to succeed? Must-have Strong understanding and multiyear (6+) experience of UX design methodologies gained through exposure to design house or similar relevant experience with knowledge of how modern web applications are built (knowledge of HTML, CSS and JavaScript etc) Proven background within commercial design, user experience, user interface design and brand philosophy and values. Good relationship building skills with ability to interact with different people at all levels across the business and externally. Excellent written and spoken communication skills; an ability to communicate with impact, ensuring complex information is articulated in a meaningful way to a wide and varied audience. Excellent attention to detail, highly organised with a proactive approach.  Nice to have Hands-on ability to implement UX designs  Special Conditions: The work environment will involve visits to a trading floor which can be a high stress environment that requires quick turnaround, decision making and constant communication. Working with the trading floor staff requires meticulous attention to detail and the ability to “think outside the box” in, what at often times, is a chaotic environment. Will involve travel to US and Canada RBC offices.  What’s in it for you? We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual. A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team Flexible work/life balance options Opportunities to do challenging work  SFDG  About RBC Royal Bank of Canada is Canada’s largest bank, and one of the largest banks in the world, based on market capitalization. We are one of North America’s leading diversified financial services companies, and provide personal and commercial banking, wealth management, insurance, investor services and capital markets products and services on a global basis. We have over 80,000 full- and part-time employees who serve more than 16 million personal, business, public sector and institutional clients through offices in Canada, the U.S. and 37 other countries. For more information, please visit rbc.com .  Join our Talent Community Stay in-the-know about great career opportunities at RBC. Sign up and get customized info on our latest jobs, career tips and Recruitment events that matter to you. Expand your limits and create a new future together at RBC. Find out how we use our passion and drive to enhance the well-being of our clients and communities at rbc.com/careers .  Inclusion and Equal Opportunity Employment RBC is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We are pleased to consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veterans status, Aboriginal/Native American status or any other legally-protected factors. Disability-related accommodations during the application process are available upon request. Title: Senior UX/UI Designer (Capital Markets)

Job_Description: Senior UI/UX Designer (Wealth Management Digital)  What is the opportunity? The UX Designer executes interaction and visual design as a part of a multi-disciplinary scrum (Agile) team. Working closely with the product owner to translate brand requirements and customer needs into experiences that the developers can execute on, the UX Designer impacts the strategy for products from the earliest stages ensuring the user experience align with customer expectations and follow style guide and look-and-feel conventions.  Digital Client Experience is becoming the main focus in RBC and as such we are looking to build our UI/UX design practice within the Wealth Management business and technology  What will you do? Design delivery - Lead the ideation and experience design of complex web, mobile and cloud solutions Define data architecture and interfaces – from visioning to production/execution Determine the business rules, design interactions and client flows for the client experience and support the documentation of business requirements Define practical user experiences, including storytelling, personas, process flows and interactions; create design assets including user scenarios, user ecosystem diagrams, competitor analyses, and wireframes Consult with Product Owner, Scrum team, customers and users in decision making surrounding user flows, sitemaps, layout, styling and technical feasibility Stakeholder management and communications : - Plan, execute and present wireframe mock-ups and proof of concepts to stakeholders to ensure their needs and expectations are met and sell the vision behind user experiences to key stakeholders Act as single point of contact for all project UX related status, including but not limited to presenting status during stand-ups and demos Perform required analytics to monitor client behavior metrics (Google, tracking tags, web trends, browser, AB/multivariate testing, etc.) and implement tags to provide information and determine ongoing improvements to our solutions  What do you need to succeed? Must-have 3+ years leading the design/execution of user experiences 1-2 years of working with multi member UX/UI design teams on complex User Experience centric initiatives 2-5 years of software development / digital industry and other relevant professional experience A diploma or degree (Bachelor’s or Master’s degree, etc.) in Fine Arts, Liberal Arts, Interdisciplinary Design, Media Arts, Computer Science (Human Computer Interaction),Interaction Design, Digital Media or any related field, with relevant experiences and portfolios Experience designing and executing creative user experiences with track record of implementing responsive designs for medium to high complexity solutions Experience working in a team-based, fast-paced Agile development environment  Nice-to-have Experience working in the Financial industry specifically with Wealth Management  What’s in it for you? We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual. Challenging work, dealing with multiple areas within Wealth Management Technology High level of autonomy and flexible work life balance Build relationships within IT and Business in Wealth and across the bank Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team  SFDG  Learn more about RBC Tech Jobs  About RBC Royal Bank of Canada is Canada’s largest bank, and one of the largest banks in the world, based on market capitalization. We are one of North America’s leading diversified financial services companies, and provide personal and commercial banking, wealth management, insurance, investor services and capital markets products and services on a global basis. We have over 80,000 full- and part-time employees who serve more than 16 million personal, business, public sector and institutional clients through offices in Canada, the U.S. and 37 other countries. For more information, please visit rbc.com.  Get Career Alerts Stay in-the-know about great career opportunities at RBC. Sign up for Career Alerts and get customized info on our latest jobs, career tips and Recruitment events that matter to you. Expand your limits and create a new future together at RBC. Find out how we use our passion and drive to enhance the well-being of our clients and communities at rbc.com/careers . Job_Description: Located in the heart of downtown Toronto, we’re the strategic services arm of Symbility Solutions, one of Canada’s rare 100 Million+ publicly traded technology companies. We work with startups, gaming companies, technology giants, and fortune 100 clients.  A day at Symbility Intersect is never the same. As our Senior Product Designer, you will drive the creative process for innovative and effective design solutions for mobile and web apps. It's your role to understand complex business requirements, personas and product features to produce wireframes, As our Senior Product Designer you will be the creative force behind innovative and effective design solutions for mobile and web apps. Your mission, should you choose to accept it, is to take complex business requirements, personas, and product features and transform them into seamless wireframes, beautiful user interface mockups, awe-inducing prototypes, and sexy style guides. Reporting to the VP of Design, you will be responsible for leading design execution, quality control, and fighting for the end user. You will be collaborating closely with Product Managers, UI/UX Designers, Copywriters, Product Strategists, and Engineers. You’ll also be in charge of: Contributing to product definition and features Working closely with the Product Team to infuse designs with strategic objectives Generating user interfaces, prototypes, mockups, style guides and component guides Creating mockups for mobile, tablet (iOS and Android) and responsive web Incorporating brand guidelines when required Working with stakeholders to ensure goals and needs are met within design Collaborating with mobile and web application developers to ensure successful development Presenting proposed solutions to external stakeholders and internal teams Working within project schedules and multi-tasking like a boss to meet deadlines On-going communication with the Product Team Lead Monitoring deliverables against timelines Ensuring day-to-day deliverables are met Advocating for the user experience Requirements Experience-wise, this is what we’re looking for: 5+ years of work experience as an Interface Designer / UX Designer Experience managing client relationships Experience with Sketch, InVision and Zeplin Strong portfolio of mobile and responsive web apps Excellent understanding of best practices for UX as well as current design trends in technology Awareness of best practices for accessibility (WCAG 2.0 AA) across native and responsive apps Strong understanding of atomic design principles and systems design Excellent attention to detail Passion for design Advanced proficiency in Adobe Creative Suite Working knowledge of HTML/CSS and an understanding of JavaScript Excellent understanding of composition, colour, imagery, and typography Excellent communication, organization, and leadership skills Benefits FLEXIBLE HOURS AND UNLIMITED VACATION POLICY Need a break? No problem. Employees can take time off in the way that works best for them and their teams. Work remotely when you need to. HEALTH AND WELLNESS Comprehensive extended health care coverage, energy pod, and standing desks. Take care of yourself. FUN Off-site adventures, ping-pong, unique traditions, monthly birthday celebrations, Fancy Fridays, Lunch and Learns. OFFICE MEALS Catered lunches, healthy snacks, freshly-ground coffee, and Beer O’clock TOWN HALL To stay connected we have weekly town halls to celebrate milestones, share updates, welcome new hires, present apps of the week, and crown the QA Star of the Week. WORKATION We like to work hard and play hard, and as such we offer yearly Workations for employees to unwind and spend non-work time with coworkers. Want to learn more? Our Culture: https://www.symbilitysolutions.com/symbility-intersect/careers/ Check out our 3D office tour: https://www.symbilitysolutions.com/symbility-intersect/360-office-tour/  Symbility Intersect is a Toronto based strategic innovation company that works with forward-thinking global brands and disruptive entrepreneurs. Our team focuses on strategy, design, and development of mobile, web and data products. Our approach solves tough problems, overcomes complicated challenges and creates opportunities through innovation. Our deliverables are products and thinking that creates long-term value for our clients, not campaigns that disappear as quickly as their impact.  Symbility Intersect welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. If you’re interested in being on the bleeding edge of technology, tackling exciting problems from different industries, and constantly being pushed to learn - apply below!
Title: Senior Product Designer

Job_Description: You make the complex simple. Data driven decisions help you navigate workflow heavy business challenges for exciting clients. You believe design has a scientific intent, and that you can measure your success based on the business value you create. As an advocate for design, you are no stranger to sharing its value with senior client executives; you are iterating, educating, and influencing along the way. Mentoring and supporting other designers is important to you. You will join our growing Toronto office and be a part of a quickly growing team of Product Managers, Product Designers, and Engineers. Professional level portfolio showing the depth and breadth of your skills is required as part of the application submission. Key Responsibilities Your primary responsibility will be to work as part of a cross-functional team of engineers, product managers, and designers in a dual-track Scrum workflow, building large, complex digital products You will help manage client relationships within the context of the product design process, such as leading workshops and design reviews Contribute to the product design process for Devbridge, your fellow Product Design colleagues, and our clients including: research, user personas, sitemaps, user-flows, wireframes, user testing plans, interface designs, style guides, and more Requirements 5 to 8 years of UX and/or UI design experience working with digital products Proficient with Sketch and InVision, and always evaluating the right tools for the job Experience working in an Agile environment Agency, large consultancy, or product company background a plus Experience developing and executing user testing initiatives a plus Ability to travel 20% of the time Benefits A digital products focused company with a variety of challenging engagements with upper mid-market and Fortune organizations Ability to work as part of an engaged, young, and energetic management team Sponsored participation in professional improvement events Competitive salary and performance based bonuses Three weeks paid vacation plus standard Canadian holidays Maternity/Paternity leave benefit Health/Dental/Vision benefit insurance Gym membership Team building events, Friday lunches and a stocked kitchen Employee referral program
Title: Senior Product Designer

The UI Graphic Designer will be responsible for creating digital assets and web design that goes beyond standard design and takes our supporters on a journey.Who we’re looking for: We are searching for a creative UI graphic designer who has experience working with UX designers. The candidate will join our marketing team and be an advocate for CWF’s digital design presence and brand. pitching innovative, dynamic and engaging solutionsDevelop design rules to create consistency and structure through CWFs various brandsProvides graphic and markup assets to developers for implementation and active in the QA in order to keep design intactAids in video development and supports Graphic Designer as neededSeeks out and remains on top of the latest creative and digital trendsAttends meetings, adheres to creative process and produce multiple comps for relevant stakeholders from concept to conceptionDesired Skills and Experience: Post-secondary education in graphic design, web design, new media or equivalent3 - 5 years relevant experience in an advertising agency, non-profit or marketing departmentStrong understanding of cross-browser/cross-device design and how to create fluidity between all displays using effective markup languageSolid understanding of UI best practices and experience working with UXProgram HTML, HTML5, CSS, CSS3, XML, Actionscript V2, 3Understand the need and uses of javascript, MySQL and Mobile iSO developmentFluent in the Adobe Suite programs, especially Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign, Fireworks, DreamweaverSolid working knowledge of a responsive framework such as BootstrapExperience designing and working with WordPressStrong understanding of data, insights and technology inspired creative executionExperience with large, integrated multi-platform campaignsBilingual is a strong assetExperience in the non-profit sector a strong assetBenefits: Competitive salary1 year contract with the opportunity to change to full time employment.Application Deadline:  May 27, 2018Job Type: Full-timeExperience:working with UX designers: 3 yearsEducation:Bachelor'sLanguage:bilingual

Job_Description: About Nix Sensor Ltd.We create amazing products that help colour professionals and consumers demystify the world of colour. If you’ve never used a Nix Color Sensor, it’s a magical experience. Like the photoshop eyedropper in real life, it takes the real world and makes it digital, and then can help our users make it real again.What you’ll do?Design beautiful apps that work with our award-winning hardwareWork with our software development, hardware, and product teams to craft a seamless user experienceOwn the design of our core products and participate in shaping the direction of our future productsIterate, test, and release products as quickly as we can gather feedback from our users and customersEven help out with other aspects of product design like packaging, web, etc.What you’ll need?A compelling and interesting portfolio of projects that showcase your workExperience designing mobile apps, and even web and other types of media, front end, back end, consumer and cloud based experience is a bonusExperience using the latest design tools to facilitate wireframing, prototyping, user testing, and information architectureExperience using a design methodology to get product out the door fastThe ability to work in a fast paced, collaborative environment, alongside the rest of our dynamic teamWhat’s makes Nix a great place to work?You’ll be joining a company that’s backed by some of the best advisors and investors in CanadaWe’re growing quickly, and you’ll be helping to build the next great Canadian success storyYou’ll work with a highly motivated team that takes pride in creating amazing productsWhat’s next?Send us a note or message indicating your interestShowcase your work by sending us a portfolio and / or examples of prior projectsJob Type: Full-timeExperience:UI Design: 1 yearUX Design: 1 year

Job_Description: Join Windsor's most innovative, fun and Silicon-Valley-esque development and innovation company, bringing world-class projects to Windsor. Help us build exciting technology like multiplayer game servers for Atari, social apps for Puma, high profile analytics engines for The PGA Tour, and cutting edge products like natural-language-processing chat-bots.As one of Windsor's most sought-after companies to work for, we offer flexible time, work-at-home days, a great benefits plan and in-office massage. We are located in the heart of Windsor's historic Walkerville. You must be willing to work in our office. We are not interested in off-shore or remote work.We are seeking talented interface designers who are looking to grow professionally and personally within a fast-growing company. You will work on a variety of marketing deliverables, including websites, prototypes, wireframes, business collateral and other design pieces.ResponsibilitiesWork on the design of user interfaces for web and mobile projectsAble to help with wireframing using tools like Adobe XD and BalsamiqAble to self-direct and work independently, to manage multiple, concurrent projects simultaneously from start to finishRequirements: Expertise in Adobe Creative Suite: Illustrator, Photoshop, InDesign, After Effects, EdgeKnowledge of responsive web designAbility to create interactive prototypesCustomer-obsessed, detail-oriented and comfortable working on highly technical teamsDemonstrated experience with building user interfaces across a range of platforms including desktop and mobile--- Please send examples of your design portfolio (specifically web design) when you apply. ---We look forward to meeting you!Job Type: Full-timeEducation:High school or equivalentLocation:Windsor, ON
Title: Web Designer / UI / UX

Job_Description: Nous valorisons la diversité et avons à cœur de créer un milieu de travail inclusif qui nous inspire tous à donner le meilleur de nous-mêmes. Joignez-vous à notre équipe et faites une différence!  Votre poste  Nous Comment imaginez-vous les bureaux d’une compagnie d’assurance? Et l’atmosphère de travail qui y règne? Nous gageons que si vous passez nous voir au Lab de Intact, vous serez très surpris! Situé au centre-ville de Montréal, nous sommes un laboratoire d’innovation dont la mission est de créer des produits à la fine-pointe de l’insurtech qui améliorent la vie de millions de Canadiens.  Mariant la convivialité et la vélocité d’une startup aux ressources et aux moyens d’une grande entreprise (vous disposerez de tous les outils dont vous avez toujours rêvé!), le Lab est un environnement jeune et dynamique, offrant des défis stimulants, des collègues inspirants et une carrière passionnante (chez un des top 100 employeurs au Canada). C’est l’endroit idéal pour parfaire vos compétences et faire évoluer votre carrière.  Vous Vous êtes passionné par le commerce électronique et l’innovation numérique? Vous avez un talent particulier pour traduire des exigences complexes en expériences utiles et agréables? Vous restez à l’affût des dernières tendances en matière de design et vous aimez expérimenter de nouveaux outils et de nouvelles méthodologies? Nous avons l’occasion parfaite pour vous!  Rôle À titre de designer UX/UI, vous jouerez un rôle essentiel dans la conception et l’évolution de notre écosystème numérique. Relevant du directeur principal, Innovations numériques, vous aurez comme principales responsabilités :  Concevoir des expériences captivantes en vue de réaliser les objectifs d’affaires  Valider la fonctionnalité et l’utilité par l’entremise de tests et de recherches auprès des utilisateurs  Produire des livrables UX et design pertinents au besoin  Piloter une feuille de route aux côté d’un directeur de produit et d’une équipe agile multidisciplinaire  Présenter le travail aux parties prenantes  Aider les ingénieurs à produire des interfaces de qualité et agréables  Prôner une conception axée sur l’utilisateur et les données  Vos compétences  Minimum trois années d’expérience  Expertise en matière de convivialité et de pratiques de conception centrées sur l'utilisateur  Maîtrise des outils de conception (Sketch, Axure, InVision, Illustrator, etc.)  Expérience des outils de recherche UX (usertesting.com, Optimal Workshop, etc.) un atout  Expérience dans la production de flux de processus, d’inventaires de contenu, etc.  Vous aimez travailler dans un environnement de collaboration qui accorde une importance primordiale au travail d’équipe, à l’innovation, à l’ouverture d’esprit et au plaisir  Veuillez inclure votre portfolio dans votre dossier de candidature.  Vous êtes  Une personne avec qui il est agréable de travailler  Créatif, analytique, curieux et ingénieux  Un joueur d’équipe capable de partager et recevoir des commentaires constructifs  Excellent pour expliquer vos idées à différents intervenants  Profondément passionné par le design et la qualité  Organisé et proactif  En tant que salarié temps plein, vous bénéficierez des avantages suivants :  Un salaire compétitif  Un boni de performance annuel  Un régime de retraite  Un horaire de travail flexible de 35 heures par semaine  Des assurances médicales et dentaires hors pair  Et plusieurs autres avantages et bénéfices (remboursement gym, conférences, etc.)  Énoncé fermeture  Cette opportunité vous intéresse? Nous avons très hâte de faire votre connaissance!  D’excellents avantages sont offerts : salaire concurrentiel, avantages flexibles, aménagements de travail flexibles, congés mobiles, régime de retraite à prestation déterminée, etc.  Dans le cadre du processus de sélection d’Intact, les candidats peuvent être appelés à donner leur consentement à une vérification de leurs antécédents pertinente au poste à pourvoir avant de recevoir une offre d’emploi. Celle-ci peut comprendre une confirmation des références d’emploi, des études et des titres de compétences, une vérification des emplois, de l’identité, des infractions criminelles et du permis de conduire ainsi qu’un rapport de crédit.  Vous pouvez soumettre votre candidature à un emploi affiché pourvu que vous occupiez vos fonctions actuelles depuis au moins douze mois et que votre performance soit jugée bonne ou que votre contrat temporaire arrive à son échéance. Une recherche de talents à l'externe est menée parallèlement au recrutement à l'interne Veuillez donc prendre note que des candidats potentiels pourraient avoir été identifiés pour ce poste dans le cadre de leur plan de développement.   Veuillez noter que l'usage du masculin a comme but d'alléger le texte.  Cet affichage prendra fin 02 juin 2018. Les documents pouvant servir de preuve dans le cas des rôles permanents sont un certificat de naissance canadien, un passeport canadien, un certificat de citoyenneté canadienne, une carte de résident permanent ou une confirmation de son statut de résident permanent pour prouver qu’il a le droit de travailler au Canada.
