Job_Description: Job Description  The UI Designer will be responsible for the graphical creation and production of the video games’ menus and interfaces. Well organized and structured, the UI Designer must streamline and communicate the relevant information using visual means in order to lead the player through a gratifying gaming experience. This individual will work in close collaboration with the Art Director, the game’s creator, and the Programming department. Responsibilities: Conceive and create the visual content associated with a game’s menus and interfaces; Create the menus’ flow, layout, and assets; Participate in meetings in order to share ideas and knowledge; Complete research and gather data before taking on a new task in order to insure efficient management and reaching the objectives through a proper understanding of the game’s graphical requirements, by having at hand the necessary reference material, and by clearly understanding the artistic direction and the technical requirements; Work in close collaboration with the programming team. Qualifications  Requirements: Diploma in Graphic Design or related area; 2 to 5 years of experience in graphic design (or equivalent), more specifically in the development of interfaces and menu stylization; Strong experience designing UI and UX for videogames; Master Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator, and Flash; Have a good understanding of typography, colour theory, layout design, and animation; Creative, autonomous, ability to adapt to requests; Able to work in a multidisciplinary group; Able to clearly identify interface strength and weaknesses; Passionate about video games; Having some knowledge of 3D modeling and web design is considered an asset; Experience with the Unity Engine is a plus. Additional Information  null
Title: UI Designer - Unannounced Mobile Project

Job_Description: What you'll do: Do primary user research when needed to validate use cases and user needs. Develop and iterative on user flows, wireframe, and mockups using tools like Sketch and InVision. Collaborate with product managers to understand user needs, pain points, and business goals. Propose best UX solutions and user flows. Create pixel-perfect designs and showcase them to stakeholders for reviews & feedback. Oversee implementation of the designs by working closely with the development team. Collaborate and mentor other designers on the team. Gather feedback from end users by conducting/participating in usability studies and user interviews. Keep up-to-date on mobile design trends, sharing leading practices with our teams and our clients. Show off a well-considered body of UX, service design and product strategy work. Help to build and improve Tulip UI library and interaction design patterns. What you have: 5+ years of hands-on design experience Proven experience in designing Mobile iOS applications Ability to review and adhere to technical documents and brand guidelines, respectfully challenging when there's a better way Ability to be versatile and take both leading and supporting roles Extremely detail and process oriented The ability to write and present eloquently and communicate clearly Expert in Sketch and InVision Bonus Skills! Experience in retail (understand store associate tasks, priorities, and functions and how it links to business performance) Knowledge of HTML and CSS Expertise with Apple Human Interface Guidelines Experience in design animated and interactive user interfaces by using prototyping tools. (e.g.Adobe XD, Principle) We offer: An environment passionate about growth and learning Flexible hours for our early risers and night owls Medical and Dental Insurance Paid parental leave Paid sick days 15 days of paid vacation Corporate gym rate Weekly team lunches with halal and vegetarian options Healthy (and less healthy) snacks and gourmet espresso Breathtaking Toronto office on the waterfront and close to Union station Creative community space in our Communitech home in Kitchener What we do: Tulip Retail is the first mobile platform built exclusively for store associates. Leading retailers like Saks Fifth Avenue, Coach, and Chanel believe in enabling the next generation of store associates with mobile technology using Tulip. We’re a team of experts who have worked with and for retailers over the past 20 years and are driven to build a company whose mission is to enable one of the world’s largest job markets. By placing Tulip-enabled iPads into the hands of associates, our goal is to provide them with instant and reliable access to product information while also being able to transact, communicate, and collaborate in an omnichannel world.  We encourage applications from candidates of colour, women, queer candidates, candidates with family caregiving responsibilities, immigrant candidates, transgender candidates, and candidates with disabilities.  Feel like you can’t tick all the boxes above? If you have some of the skills and experience that we’re looking for and are willing to use your talent to learn the rest, we encourage you to apply.
Title: Senior Product Designer

Job_Description: About the role   About the role: We’re looking for an experienced senior product designer to deliver high quality product experiences on our core product line. You will explore and understand complex merchant needs in order to build a vision for your product area and help your team work iteratively towards achieving it. You'll ship high fidelity designs of new features and quickly prototype solutions to visual and interaction problems. You’ll own your projects from start to finish, and collaborate with a multidisciplinary team of designers, content strategists, user researchers, developers, and product managers to deliver the best possible experience for our merchants. As part of the Identity team, within the Core Product line, you'll work on the central features and functionality of the Shopify merchant experience. You'll partner with other designers and UX team members to design and build products used by millions of people around the world every day. About UX design at Shopify The UX design team creates tools that give even the most inexperienced entrepreneur the best chance to succeed. At the same time, we design solutions that help some of the world’s leading businesses manage enormous complexity. Making commerce better for everyone, no matter where they’re located or their level of experience, is our passion. It’s what we come to work every morning excited to tackle. Our team is made up of over 250 designers, content strategists, researchers, and front-end developers across 5 offices. Although everyone who works at Shopify is responsible for building great experiences, the design team has a special role in building understanding and empathy for merchants. We believe in testing, iteration, and in giving people the room to experiment and grow. Requirements for the role: A deep understanding of the end to end iterative UX product design process, including how to develop and use personas, job stories, journey mapping, content modelling, wireframing and prototyping, user testing, and high fidelity visuals Proficiency with current design tools including Sketch, Photoshop, etc. Passion for solving core product problems while owning all facets of user experience (strategy, IA, art direction, interaction design and research) Experience collaborating with multiple disciplines including product, engineering, content, research, and more A deep empathy for the user UI abilities shown in a portfolio of live projects You'll be working on: Shipping high fidelity designs of new features and quickly prototyping solutions to visual and interaction problems Representing our merchants in product strategy and roadmap discussions Advocating for good user experience across our teams and our platform Contributing to our growing design system in an effort to cultivate a coherent look and feel across the entire Shopify platform Sharing and revising your designs based on UX research, merchant interviews and peer feedback Tools of our trade: We work with industry-standard tools and software like Sketch, Invision, and good ol’ pen and paper to define work at low and high fidelity We know that applying to a new role takes a lot of work and we truly value your time. Holly is looking forward to reading your application. If you’re interested in helping us shape the future of commerce, send us a few samples of your work: portfolio, wireframes, UX flows, publications, or whatever represents what you do best.
Title: Senior Product Designer, Identity

Job_Description: CAE is a global leader in training for the civil aviation, defence and security, and healthcare markets. Backed by a 70-year record of industry firsts, we continue to help define global training standards with our innovative virtual-to-live training solutions to make flying safer, maintain defence force readiness and enhance patient safety. We have the broadest global presence in the industry, with 8,000 employees, 160 sites and training locations in over 35 countries. Each year, we train more than 120,000 civil and defence crewmembers and thousands of healthcare professionals worldwide. www.cae.com     Analyste experience utilisateur - User Experience Analyst   Position Type:  Regular  Role and Responsibilities Qualifications Baccalauréat en génie, informatique, design ou équivalent Maitrise en ergonomie ou interaction humain-machine ou équivalent Connaissance du design centré utilisateur Expérience en design d’applications mobiles ou de bureau (maquettes fil-de-fer, storyboards, workflows) Experience avec des outils de prototypage (Axure, JustinMind ou equivalent) Connaissance des methods de validation UX (tests d’utilisabilité, évaluations heuristiques) Capacité d'effectuer plusieurs tâches à la fois, souci du détail, capacité de faire preuve d'initiative et d'effectuer les tâches avec un minimum de supervision Aptitude à travailler en équipe avec les designers UI, les développeurs et autres parties prenantes Bon communicateur Connaissance des domaines de l’aviation et/ou des soins de santé un atout Connaissance en programmation et des méthodes de génie logiciel (Agile) un atout Connaissance de l’ergonomie physique un atout Compétence en design graphique un atout Disponible pour voyager à l’occasion 3-10 ans d’expérience pertinente   Responsabilités Definir les concepts d’opération et l’expérience utilisateur de nombreux logiciels développés par ou en collaboration avec le groupe Ingénierie – Expérience de formation (simulateurs de vol, simulateurs chirurgicaux, simulateurs de patients humains, outils d’ingénierie…) pour des plateformes mobiles, web, du bureau ou embarquées, et/ou en réalité virtuelle/augmentée. Collaborer avec les responsables de produit et l’ingénierie pour définir les requis clients Développer des scénarios d’utilisation afin de supporter la définition et le design des applications Communiquer les designs à l’aide de diagrammes, spéficications détaillées et prototypes interactifs Reccueillir des données sur l’utilisation des produits, par exemple à l’aide d’entrevues ou de sondages Évaluer des interfaces, par exemple avec des tests dutilisabilité, des évaluations heuristiques ou des walkthroughs. Collaborer en mode Agile avec les équipes de développement pour l’implémentation des interfaces utilisateur Participer aux activités de gouvernance du groupe Expérience de formation Contribuer à l’élaboration des normes d’interface en spécifiant des patterns et contrôles UI.  -  Qualifications Bachelor's degree in engineering, computing, design or the equivalent Master's degree in human-computer interaction or cognitive ergonomics or the equivalent Good knowledge of user-centered design. Experience in interaction design for mobile and desktop applications (wireframes, storyboards, workflows) Experience with UI prototyping tools (Axure, JustinMind or equivalent) Knowledge of validation methods in user experience such as usability testing and heuristic evaluation. Ability to multi-task, detail oriented, self motivator who can complete tasks with minimal supervision. Ability to work as part of a team with UI designers, developpers and other stkeholders Good communication skills. Knowledge of aviation and/or healthcare an asset. Knowledge of programming and software engineering methods is an asset. Knowledge of physical ergonomic is an asset. Skills in graphic design is an asset. Ready to travel on occasion. 3-10 years of pertinent work experience required.   Position Profile / Responsibilities Be responsible for the definition of the operational concepts and the user experience of various software applications developed by, or in collaboration with the Training Experience engineering organization. This may include flight simulators, medical simulators and engineering tools, for all platform types from mobile, desktop, embedded and AR/VR. Gather user data (using various research methods) at both a high level (workflow, needs) and a detailed level (specific user interfaces). Perform surveys and interviews with resident field experts, task analysis and user’s observation in their work environment. Work closely with product managers to identify and clarify customer requirements. Develop user scenarios to support software application definition and design. Communicate designs to development teams through diagrams, drawings, detailed specifications and interactive prototypes. Resolve trade-offs between designs and implementation issues. Design user interaction models. Design user interaction cross-cutting concerns common to more than one software application. Design user interfaces based on functional requirements, user needs and task analysis. Evaluate user interfaces through heuristic evaluation, expert reviews and usability testing (when appropriate). Collaborate in Agiile mode the development teams in their implementation of the user interfaces. Participate in the governance activities of the Training Experience engineering organization Contribute to the redaction of the Human Interface Guidelines and to the specification of custom/advanced UI controls to be included in the common UI control library. Conduct expert reviews on user interfaces that were designed outside of the team and provide recommendations for improvements    CAE thanks all applicants for their interest. However, only those whose background and experience match the requirements of the role will be contacted.   Equal Employment Opportunity CAE is firmly committed to ensuring a positive and professional working environment in which all people are treated with dignity and respect. We aim to provide a fair and consistent method for filling job openings in support of equality of opportunity and cultural diversity within the company.  The masculine gender is used throughout this job description solely to make the text easier to read and therefore applies to both men and women.
Title: Analyste experience utilisateur - User Experience Analyst

Job_Description: Company Description -------------------  Vlocity is a fast-growing enterprise applications company focused on bringing industry-specific business processes to the cloud. With 400 employees around the world and customers on six continents, Vlocity has been the fastest-growing independent software vendor on the Salesforce platform for two years running. Vlocity is currently shipping version 18 of its application suite, and has raised over $100MM in capital from investors including Salesforce.com, Accenture and Sutter Hill Ventures.  Vlocity develops software to help communications, media & energy providers, insurance carriers and government agencies digitally engage customers through their channels and devices of choice. We serve dozens of the world’s Fortune 5000 companies including Sky Italia, Telecom Italia, TELUS, 3, Telecom Argentina, Cellcom, New York Life, Farmers Insurance, Harvard Pilgrim, and Anthem. Our solutions run on our customers’ web sites, in their contact centers and on the mobile devices of their service and sales professionals – providing a compelling, modern, omnichannel experience. Despite the complexity and sophistication of the enterprise business processes we enable, we believe the user experience should be as simple and compelling as a consumer application.  Job Description ---------------  Vlocity, Inc. is recruiting best in class Technical Architects (pre-sales) to help sell our vertical industry applications. Our Industry Cloud Architects are deep product & platform experts, and work closely with our field sales and products teams to develop customer strategies, assist in building exceptional demos and POCs and overcome the most challenging technical obstacles encountered during a sales cycles. This role requires effective technical cloud architecture experience, problem-solving and proactive communication skills, and a mastery of enterprise applications.  Responsibilities   Have a strong UX design sensibility Be an expert in Vlocity’s platform and related technologies Gather customer UX requirements for web and mobile Educate customers on Vlocity’s UX capabilities Develop cutting edge UX demonstrations using Vlocity’s toolset Build and Curate great looking, reusable UI templates and design patterns Serve as liaison with UX product management and designers throughout company Provide customer feedback to the product management and engineering teams to capture new customer requirements and enhancements Provide recommendations for overcoming technical sales objections Contribute to building a positive, can-do, high-performance culture  Experience   Expertise with enterprise CRM technical sales and/or implementations, with a focus on front-end development Proven track record of being able to sell technical products as a Sales Engineer  Technical Skills   Proficiency with Salesforce’s Visualforce, Lightning, and Apex, or with comparable technologies Expertise with HTML, JavaScript, CSS, and frameworks like React, Angular, etc. Mastery of the architectural principles of web based platforms including SaaS, multi-tenancy, multi-tiered infrastructure and application servers. Understanding of competitive cloud offerings in the market and ability to discuss cloud architectures A solid understanding of enterprise application integration, including SOA, ESB, EAI, ETL environments and an understanding of integration considerations such as process orchestration, customer data integration and master data management Understanding of the security processes, standards & issues involved in multi-tier, multi-tenant web applications Principles of network, application and information security  Desirable Certifications / Qualifications   Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Business or a related field, or equivalent experience

Title: Graphic Designer

Job_Description: Front-End Web Designer/Developer  FULL TIME  Toronto, ON (North York/Scarborough) Company  Established 10 years ago, the client we are looking to recruit a full-time, permanent Front-End Web Designer for one of Canada’s fastest growing digital marketing agencies who has thrived on building digital products and digital campaigns for companies across North America. In order to be considered, the candidate must be a Canadian PR or Citizen. About the position  Our Client is currently looking for a full-time Front-End (UX/UI) Web Designe r. The ideal candidate must have experience developing websites using HTML, CSS, and Javascript . Some additional things that we would like to see but are not required: Experience with CSS Preprocessors like Sass , static site generators like Jekyll , and version control systems like Git is a plus. The ideal candidate will also need in-depth knowledge of Photoshop or other graphic design tools to produce appealing designs for banner ads and website mockups. Skills  Our clients focus is to create clean, simple and attractive websites and banners that convert at a higher than normal rate. Given our focus, the ideal candidate will be held to a high standard to design banner ads and websites that strongly represent a company’s brand, and then convert those designs into a website that loads quickly and looks consistent across all modern browsers. A working knowledge of Git, and comfort with using command line tools like npm, gulp, and bower will get you up to speed faster.  In addition to the above technical skills, a member of our team must possess the following skills:  Strong multitasking skills to manage multiple projects simultaneously Delivery high quality, well-tested work in a timely manner An understanding of what makes a design attractive from a customer’s perspective Enjoy working in a fast-paced, growing company that has a lot of fun!  If you are qualified and interested in exploring the opportunity further… Please send your resume and past web projects to msharman@hellojagger.com
Title: Front-End Web Designer (Photoshop, HTML, CSS)

Job_Description: Senior UX Designer - Oracle Marketing Cloud Eloqua-180008G6 Preferred Qualifications Senior UX Designer – Marketing Cloud Oracle Headquarters - Redwood Shores, CA and Toronto, Canada Oracle Marketing Cloud is looking for a passionate and talented User Experience Designers to join our team in Redwood City, California, US and Toronto, Canada. Responsibilities In your role as User Experience Designer, you will be responsible for designing and implementing, easy to use, intuitive and delightful Experiences for our products. You are a strong thinker and a problem solver who can approach the design of our products at a conceptual level as well at the UI level. You should be able to understand user’s mental models and design products based on a strong understanding of user goals, user journeys, use cases and user behaviors. You should be able to translate this thinking into UI that boast of efficient Information and Interaction design with a strong sense of visual aesthetics. Working in close coordination with designers, user researchers, engineering, and product management, you will produce concept sketches, wireframes, high-fidelity mockups and prototypes, detailed specs, and production assets. In addition, you may develop user profiles, provide product usability, evaluation and support to product development teams, and may assist in developing and implementing design concepts. If you specialize in Visual Design your will be involved in design of data visualizations, dashboards and will help build and maintain a design language system Ideal Background that will help you succeed in this role 5+ years of experience in visual design or interaction design within complex, rich interactive web applications, with a strong understanding of mobile or responsive design concepts. You should have experience working in an Agile/Scrum development process.- Your experience will show an ability to both follow and establish practices and guidelines for designing user interfaces. Your portfolio and your interviews should demonstrate that you can effectively articulate ideas through effective visual and oral presentation. You should have strong verbal and written communication skills. Your portfolio should demonstrate that you have excellent analytical and creative thinking abilities and the ability to apply these skills in a rational way to complex systems You’ll need a great attitude and the ability to get things done, whether working independently or collaborating with a team  Proficiency with the designer tools expected. E.g sketch, invision, Photoshop, Illustrator, etc. You'll get bonus points for experience with HTML, CSS and Javascript. Experience working in enterprise software, Email Solution Providers, Marketing Automation, and/or -CRM solutions is highly desirable. About Oracle Marketing Cloud As the leader in modern marketing, the Oracle Marketing Cloud enables innovative marketing automation solutions to help modern marketers target the right buyers, easily execute campaigns across different channels like Email, text messaging and social media to help convert leads to sales and deliver the highest return on your marketing investment. Check out more about our products at https://www.oracle.com/marketingcloud/products.html A Detailed Description and Job Requirements  Responsible for creating, evaluating and modifying prototypes to support evolving hardware and software application development.  As a member of the User Experience team, you will develop and apply software design/usability processes in the investigation of technical problems. May develop user profiles, with emphasis on human error control, display issues, visual interaction, physical manipulation and task and objective analyses. Provide product usability, evaluation and support to product development teams, including the analysis and investigation of applications/systems including tactile methods, visual graphics, web, multimedia, voice response and conversational user interaction. May assist in developing design concept and implementation, providing input on user design considerations. May produce specifications describing user needs and internal structures for product in development.  Duties and tasks are varied and complex utilizing independent judgment. Fully competent in own area of expertise. May have project lead role and or supervise lower level personnel. BS or MS degree or equivalent experience relevant to functional area. Typically four years of software engineering or related experience needed.

Job_Description: Position Overview: The role of the web UX & UI designer & developer is to create the user experience vision and successfully develop, monitor and improve users’ overall experience when they visit our websites. The individual should have the skills and knowledge to create memorable experiences that are true to the brand while balancing seamless interactivity, ease of navigation and conversion.Reporting to the Director, Marketing & Communications, the Web UX& UI Designerwill be the champion of the users’ needs, and create intuitive user experiences and interface designs. & UI Designer will create wireframes and storyboards that map the customer journey, user flows, process flows, information architecture, site maps, porotypes and A/B testing to effectively communicate interaction and design ideas & design each screen or page with which a user interacts.The ideal candidate should have an eye for clean design, possess superior UI & UX skills and be able to translate stakeholder requirements into logical interaction flows and a user interface that is intuitive, visually stimulating and converts.Responsibilities: Be guided by human-centric design by identifying Job_Description: Travailler chez Genius Solutions c'est : Joindre une équipe passionnée et dynamique qui a à cœur le succès de l’entreprise. Job_Description: Tier1CRM’s advanced CRM solutions help our clients to compete more effectively through faster access to relevant information, improved communication and higher levels of workflow automation.Our focus is on creating innovative vertically specialized applications which run on Salesforce’s Force.com.We currently have an opportunity a software development savvy, creative and detailed oriented individual who has a passion for User Experience and User Interface design and a flair for communicating with business analysts and software developers alike.Our perfect candidate comes from a software development environment with a graphic design origin story and loves turning functional design requirements into smooth, intuitive workflows users can’t live without.Seeing your hard work come to fruition and hearing clients are excited by the new features is what you live for so designing solutions to complex workflows is something you take pride in giving it a 360° scrutiny.Who are you?We have found people who work in our product design and development department come from a diverse set of backgrounds. To be a fit for this position you should:have an understanding of how a user will interact with an application (UX)come from a design / graphics background developing a passion for user experience (UI/UX)have a good sense of design and style (UI/Graphic Design)possess the ability to pick up software skills quickly and easily (adaptability and ability to learn new things)possess a lack of intimidation when it comes to highly complex software (technical savvy – come from a software product development background is highly useful)have the ability to cover all the “what if’s” when designing workflows and interfaces (detail oriented and thorough)be able to work independently with little direction and be self-motivated (you get stuff done!)Competencies: Expert understanding of UI / UX design methodology and practices with demonstrated design capabilities and skills backed by a solid portfolio is a must.Ability to create design deliverables such as sketches, wireframes, design comps, user flows, and associated documentation and to iterate on those based on feedback.Ability to solve problems creatively and effectively.Be able to conceptualize designs and collaborate well with other team members ensuring overall design is implemented as intended.Ability to present your designs and evangelize your solutions to various stakeholders with an ability to accept feedback/critiques and adjust your designs to resolve issues.Always up-to-date with the latest UI trends, techniques, and technologies only recommending those with solid design principals that support Job_Description: L’équipe de Connect&GO; est en pleine croissance et nous recherchons un(e) designer graphique (web et imprimé) qualifié(e) pour rejoindre les rangs! Nous avons besoin de quelqu’un pour aider à la conception des actifs pour les applications mobiles, les sites Web ainsi que d’autres documents numériques et imprimés. Le/la candidat(e) ideal(e) a une bonne compréhension de la méthodologie et des pratiques de conception UI / UX, avec des capacités de conception et des compétences soutenues par un portfolio.  Tâches : Crée des outils marketing à l’image de la marque pour le site web tels que, publicité, outils multimédias, création de pubs pour réseaux sociaux et newsletter. Établit et conçoit des pages tendances pour le site Web à l’aide d’interfaces graphiques faciles d’utilisation respectant les objectifs stratégiques. Crée des documentations de vente, des manuels de formation et d’autres documentations internes pour aider les divers départements. Collabore avec l’équipe de commerce électronique et d’intégration lors de la conceptualisation des designs pour supporter les initiatives marketing, lancements, etc. Effectue des recherches de marché sur les e-mails marketing, graphistes et les tendances de sites Web. Établit et maintien des relations de travail professionnelles avec l’équipe lors de la production de matériel à l’intérieur des délais convenus et spécifications pour chaque tâche individuelle.  Exigences : Bilinguisme anglais et français (oral et écrit) Diplôme d’études post-secondaire en design graphique Minimum de deux (2) années d’expérience en conception web et graphique Solides connaissances en graphisme interactif, environnement web et applications Connaissance approfondie de l’environnement MAC et d’Adobe Creative Cloud (InDesign, Photoshop, Illustrator, Dreamweaver, etc.) Très forte créativité avec une passion pour le design interactif Fortes capacités d’écoute et de communication Orienté vers le détail, excellentes compétences organisationnelles, capacité de travailler dans un environnement dynamique et de respecter des délais serrés Aime travailler sur divers projets pour le web et l’imprimer Portefolio incluant des exemples de conception Web et / ou mobile Forte compréhension des forces et des faiblesses des différentes méthodes de recherche, y compris quand et comment les appliquer pendant chaque phase du produit Connaissance solide des principes de conception (typographie, systèmes de grille, hiérarchie visuelle, couleur, remplissage, etc.) Capacité à hiérarchiser les priorités et à gérer la charge de travail afin de respecter les échéances critiques du projet  Pour postuler, rendez-vous sur le site du Grenier aux Emplois : https://www.grenier.qc.ca/emplois/37856/designer-graphique-web-et-imprime
Title: Designer graphique (Web et Imprimé)

Job_Description: Saint Elizabeth is a national health care provider that has been opening the door to new possibilities and care experiences for more than a century. Recognized as Canada’s largest social enterprise, we employ 8,000 people and visit 18,000 clients every day. Through the Saint Elizabeth Research Centre, our Health Career Colleges and the Saint Elizabeth Foundation, we are helping to make the future of health care brighter and stronger. Learn more at www.saintelizabeth.com or find us on Twitter at @StElizabethSEHC. Position Summary: This role will be responsible for the design and user experience of Saint Elizabeth web properties. The web design associate will collect ideas and direction from stakeholders and translate them into wireframes, user flows and mockups based on user research, trends and creative decisions consistent with brand standards. They will work alongside Front End Development Specialist to ensure the website build is consistent with their vision, and conduct regular QA and design audits to drive website maintenance sprints. Responsibilities: UI/UX design, creation of mockups for new pages and websites Present and demo concepts to internal and external stakeholders Work alongside Front-End Developer and external vendors to develop/revamp/optimize current web properties Assist with content publishing, browser and screen compatibility testing and QA Audit current websites to identify design and UX improvements Project manage internal & external web design projects Requirements: College diploma in web/graphic design or interactive media One – three years’ experience in a similar role Proven success in web design projects (portfolio is a must) Experience with Sketch and Adobe Photoshop Understanding of UI/UX; site functionality, interaction, site architecture, navigation Understanding of conversion optimization and landing page design Mastery of Responsive Design Experience with HTML 5, CSS JavaScript and jQuery is a plus Experience working in a CMS, experience with Kentico is a plus Knowledge of WCAG 2.0/AODA requirements is a plus A professional and organized approach to work and a strong team player  Saint Elizabeth is committed to the success of all its employees. If you feel you need accommodations because of illness or disability, please do not hesitate to contact Human Resources at hresources@saintelizabeth.com at your earliest convenience.
Title: Web Designer

This is an exciting role where you will be working on the website, offline graphics and the main ecommerce system! This is a crucial role for the company where you can develop new skills and provide adequate designs for e-marketing, events, software applications and more! What You Will Be Doing  Tech Breakdown  50% Design  50% Strategy  Daily Responsibilities  80% Hands On  20% Team Collaboration  The Offer  Competitive Salary: Up to $60K/year, DOE  You will receive the following benefits: Statutory Vacation  Holiday Pay  Applicants must be currently authorized to work in Canada on a full-time basis now and in the future. Title: UI/UX Designer

Job_Description: Job Description  You will applies a user-centered design approach to design, construct and implement the end user interface and overall experience aligned with users needs, preferences and motivations. You will also provides overall expertise and advocacy on user centered design and acts as coach to UX designers.  Individual Accountabilities: Apply user-centered design principles and methodologies, which includes qualitative and quantitative investigative/testing methods (e.g., user journeys, personas, task models, etc.), to create positive user experiences (UX) aligned to the users motivations, preferences and goals.Plan, facilitate and lead design thinking & user centered design workshops and activities to align, anchor and move Teams forward with user experience in mind.Be responsible for the overall user experience strategy and execution including governance around brand and accessibility.Produce concept sketches, wireframes, high-fidelity mockups, prototypes and detailed specs to communicate the user experience design to the development team.Develop user profiles, provide product usability, evaluation and support to product development teamsAct as the primary end user/customer advocate, ensuring that the services/assets are designed with the end user’s core needs in mind versus other competing business needs (e.g., maximize profit).Develop solutions that best balance the different, sometimes competing needs/priorities between end user/customer desires, business goals and technical limitations.Inventory and assess user experience of existing technology assets and recommend options to enhance/improve the overall experience.Coordinate users inclusion during throughout the development process (e.g., design, construct, etc.) by using various techniques (e.g., rapid feedback, listening labs and usability testing).Coordinate finalization of UI design artifacts and delivers them, ideally, ahead of the Sprint.Ensure user experience designs/plans match what is eventually built.Coordinate with appropriate resources to archive final artifacts.  Shared Accountabilities: Facilitate and leads activities with the team to define, design and rapidly model the solution and end user experienceIn some cases, assist in developing and implementing UX design conceptsFacilitates design reviews with key stakeholders Coordinates delivery of design elements (e.g. copy, assets, etc.) ready for Sprinting Qualifications  QualitiesEmpathetic to end user needsVisual communicatorDesign drivenStrong communicator, collaborator and group leaderConflict resolution  Required CompetenciesExceptional user interface design skills and producing the associated artefacts such as user storyboards, journey maps, mockups, and prototypes to effectively communicate interaction and design ideas.Extensive experience planning and running design thinking/ideation workshops and applying the associated methodologies (e.g., divergent/convergent thinking).Proven ability to operate in and foster a collaborative working environment that encourages creativity and innovative thinking.Excellent analytical and creative thinking abilities and the ability to apply these skills in design complex, interactive applications.Demonstrated experience in developing software user experience strategy and execution.Deep understanding of user experience design principles and investigative methodologies.Proficiency with designer (e.g., Sketch, InVision, Photoshop, Illustrator, etc.) and rapid prototyping tools (e.g., Framer, Orgami)Strong communication, stakeholder management and presentation skills.  Preferred Technical and Professional ExperienceExperience with HTML, CSS and JavaScript.Experience working in an Agile/Scrum development process.Experience working with teams using continuous integration, continuous deployment, and automated testing toolsExperience working on AI/data science implementation projects.Significant experience working on teams implementing industrial application and/or Supply Chain Management, Logistics or Transportation related software applications would be a plus  Required ExperienceAt least 8 years of experience in visual design or interaction design for complex, rich interactive applications.At least 3 years of experience planning and/or conducting design thinking/ideation workshops.At least 3 years of experience designing the UX for intelligent/data-rich applications (e.g., analytics dashboards, interactive operational dashboards, intelligent chatbots, modern voice assistants, etc.). Additional Information  We are inviting you to come to meet us at the : https://www.siliconmilkroundabout.com/ 19 and 20 may 2018 - Truman Brewery, London http://journeesquebec.gouv.qc.ca/ 26 and 27 may 2018 - Paris
Title: UI/UX Lead-Senior

Job_Description: CGI's Wealth Management Services team are currently working with all of the largest financial institutions in Canada and 23 of the top 25 banks in the Americas. CGI owns a comprehensive suite of industry leading products supported by a variety of consulting service offerings. We are in the midst of a multi-million dollar investment in transforming and growing our products, services and clients and require the services of a proven Lead UI Designer. Your future duties and responsibilities: Successful candidates will work with clients within the financial services industry, to help define, develop and deploy industry leading Wealth Management solutions. We are looking for an energetic and passionate UI Designer who shares our vision of building outstanding products. As a Lead UI Designer, you will collaborate with a multi-discipline team to apply a combination of design and technology skills to create compelling and interactive mobile-friendly web experiences that people want to use. You will have access to the latest technologies and tools, and robust processes including agile methodologies.  Job Responsibilities:   Lead the UI team in the design and implementation of UI component libraries to be consumed by multiple products across the Wealth Management solutions  Collaborate with UX Team to assess feasibility of the design and ensure functional features meet best practices, methodologies and standards  Develop creative solutions that are maintainable, scalable and fast  Participate in code reviews to ensure quality code  Collaborate in an Agile team in story point estimations, collaborative design sessions, iterative development, and work closely with QA on build-test-fix cycle  Work with product owners, business analysts and product architects to review user stories and specifications, implement complex business functionality, while maintaining high quality of technical and architectural standards  Craft responsive web experiences that are secure, fast and high performing while ensuring a cohesive experience across different browsers can devices  Advocate the use of unit testing and test driven development to drive design and development changes Required qualifications to be successful in this role: o Proven experience with design and/or development of mid-to-large scale web applications in a modern MVC web framework o A self-starter who is able to keep improving their skill set and stay on top of the ever-evolving web and mobile development trends o Be a creative and out-of-the box thinker to help improve our products and platform o Experienced and passionate in UX/UI design o Able to develop and test across multiple mobile and desktop browsers o A flexible thinker and multitasker who is able to work in an agile team to meet a common goal o Very good knowledge of front-end development, including HTML, CSS, Javascript o demonstrated experience with front-end libraries and frameworks such as JQuery and AngularJS o Have a strong understanding of programming principles (OOP, REST, MVC, etc.), as well as problem solving skills o Test driven development is an asset o Full-stack development experience is an asset  Technical Requirements:   Javascript or ES6  COMPASS/SASS  AngularJS  AngularJS2 (Nice to have)  RESTFUL Services  Bootstrap  Jasmine/Karma/Protractor What you can expect from us: Build your career with us.  It is an extraordinary time to be in business. As digital transformation continues to accelerate, CGI is at the center of this changesupporting our clients digital journeys and offering our professionals exciting career opportunities.  At CGI, our success comes from the talent and commitment of our professionals. As one team, we share the challenges and rewards that come from growing our company, which reinforces our culture of ownership. All of our professionals benefit from the value we collectively create.  Be part of building one of the largest independent technology and business services firms in the world.  Learn more about CGI at www.cgi.com.  No unsolicited agency referrals please.  CGI is an equal opportunity employer. In addition, CGI is committed to providing accommodations for people with disabilities in accordance with provincial legislation. Please let us know if you require a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during any aspect of the recruitment process and we will work with you to address your needs. Job_Description: Sr. UX+UI Designer  Client is looking for an experienced UX+UI Designer who gets excited creating world-class web experiences which work equally well across mobile and desktop. Your mission is to help our team of designers raise their game, meeting your standards, as well as satisfying both customer and business requirements In return, you’ll be working in a highly collaborative, fast-paced environment with an awesome team.  Responsibilities   Generate sketches, wireframes and prototypes for user interactions, ensuring that business, brand, and user goals are met Maintain a strong working relationship with the client Digital design team Mentor and guide the Jr. designers Meet with internal stakeholders to better understand and discuss requirements Develop and maintain brand/design specifications, user scenarios, personas, user flows, navigation maps, UX/UI patterns, and other design documents Ensure work is compliant with WCAG 2.0 web accessibility standards Validate your ideas through formal and informal user testing Interpret and review research findings for presentations to the design team and to client leadership Maintain an awareness of current trends in technology, design, customer experience and marketing to identify opportunities to enhance the client web site experience Occasionally support releases on evenings or weekends, if required  Required Knowledge & Skills   Minimum 2 years’ experience as a manager or team lead Excellent relationship building and negotiation skills, required to obtain commitment from cross-functional teams to support and deliver on priorities Ability to train others and ensure we have the right skillsets, culture and practices Self-motivated to prioritize and manage workload and meet critical project milestones and deadlines Excellent verbal and written presentation skills  Required Professional Designation/Certification:  University degree or certification in User Experience related field At least 5 - 7 years’ work experience  Must have skills: (please at least 3 skills/exp): 1. Title: Graphic Designer 3 / Designer graphique 3 (11788)

Job_Description: Job Type: Permanent Primary Location: Montreal, Quebec, Canada All Available Locations: Montreal  Description  Our Canadian Delivery Centre (CDC) team is based out of Montreal and helps multiple clients replace, upgrade or maintain their information systems. As a Solution Designer in the CDC, you will be part of a team that delivers new technology solutions or upgrades to our clients. We expect that you will help clients define their requirements and provide solutions for any gaps identified, design, develop or configure solutions independently to meet the requirements, provide configuration insights to clients based on previous experience, troubleshoot errors found during testing, etc. Basically, we expect you to play a key solution delivery role across the entire implementation cycle. As you become more senior, we will also turn to you to lead project workstreams and coordinate with other streams, take leadership in mentoring and training junior staff, and act as a focal point when queries arise regarding solution capabilities and functionalities. In our view, the best solution or senior solution designers are passionate about new and leading Cloud technology solutions, and are driven to learn about them and keep up with market evolution. They possess strong problem-solving and analytical skills, are comfortable working remotely with colleagues and clients, enjoy working with and coaching junior staff, and have an understanding of software development and/or configuration principles.  We have: Leading methods and tools Top professionals to coach and develop you An open mind for new ideas Opportunities to work with leading Canadian and global companies Partnerships with top software providers A dynamic and energetic workplace  Qualifications  You have: A bachelor degree with 3 years of experience or a college degree with 6 years of experience in a relevant field (Management Information Systems, Computer Science, Software Engineering, other IT discipline) Strong knowledge of Salesforce platform, Apex development, Visualforce and Lightning development Strong Knowledge in integration pattern with Salesforce (Middleware, Salesforce APIs, SOAP, REST) Strong Knowledge in UI / UX (JavaScript framework[Angular, jQuery], HTML5,CSS) Strong Knowledge in DevOps solutions and techniques (Environment Management, Version and Source Control, Continuous Integration, Continuous Testing) Strong Knowledge with Object Oriented Programming or Java programming languages or similar Knowledge around Architecture Design and Coding Design Patterns We also value (Do not hesitate if you only possess some of these): An additional 3-4 years of relevant experience that would position you as a Senior Solution Designer Ability to work in French A demonstrated ability to manage, mentor and collaborate with more junior staff Experience with software development support tools (e.g. JIRA tracking software) Experience with Salesforce Service Cloud, Sales Cloud, Community Cloud Salesforce Certifications (Platform Developer II, Domain Specialist) If you believe you have what it takes to be a successful member of our team please apply now. We know your career is important to you and it's important to us, too. As a Solution Designer or Senior Solution Designer, you will have plenty of opportunities to grow personally and professionally in your field of interest and expertise. The time is right for you to join Deloitte. This could be your most rewarding move. We thank all applicants in advance for their interest; however, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.  Why Deloitte? Job_Description: PRINCIPAL UX DESIGNER The Principal User Experience Designer assists Franchise Leads in developing the XD vision of a product(s) and executing upon that vision. This role leads the effort in innovative and ground breaking design solutions to create user-centered design solutions that promote ease of use, employ best-in-class game/interaction design, and optimize the user experience universally in response to user testing. Lead all phases of the design process including conceptual design/development, graphic and interface design, interaction models, prototypes, user/task flows and art production. Works closely with Franchise Stakeholders to establish and maintain the visual integrity, interaction methods, brand standards, and consistency for the game and collaborate with Product Management and Engineering for execution of design. Responsibilities: Able to identify needs for, design and conduct user experience research quickly and apply it to feature UX development Evaluates designs quickly and creates original high quality work. Owns the entire product UX and its features Possess excellent understanding of visual design principles, style guidelines, design processes, and creative workflow Develop UI, graphic design, and interaction specifications/guidelines Employ user-centered design practices to deliver world-class interactive game experiences Consistently generate creative ideas for products and can present and sell design concepts at the franchise and company level Persuasively recommends and promotes UX ideas with enthusiasm, conviction, and assertiveness. Interface, collaborate with team, studio and company stakeholders to ensure the user experience reflects player needs and consistency Required Skills: 8+ years’ experience in the User Experience Design Shipped multiple successful mobile products end-to-end Mastery level skills in Adobe Photoshop and industry-standard prototyping tools Mastery understanding of UX principles Specialty in mobile, messaging and chat interface design Hands-on experience or knowledge of JavaScript coding and animation/motion design is a plus Ability to set direction, lead, train and mentor teams of designers Excellent written and verbal communication Passion for casual gaming and youth pop culture Master’s degree in graphic arts, interaction design, or equivalent industry experience in design field

Job_Description: Are you an experienced Digital Graphic Designer looking for a new challenge? If you understand how to integrate all formats of design with digital technology and are excited to improve user experience by putting your stamp on mobile-first solutions, this job could be just what you’ve been searching for! Think of this as working for an internal agency – the best of both worlds. Our client, a downtown Vancouver-based organization and world leader in their field, is looking for a Digital Graphic/UX/UI Designer. This individual will be responsible for developing brand guidelines and maintaining visual consistency across multiple touchpoints. As lead designer, you'd collaborate with marketing, sales and operations teams, and effectively communicate designs with the small but mighty, nimble team. Our client is committed to: Fostering a supportive, collaborative and energetic working environment Development and growth opportunities Mentorship and empowerment What the Digital Graphic/UX/UI Designer does: Execute all design processes, such as drafting user-flows and building and testing interface prototypes Collaborate with marketing, sales, and operations teams to conceptualize ideas and boost the company’s brand presence Understand project requirements, budget, schedule and technical constraints Define the process for gathering all website or marketing visuals Production duties such as videos, graphics, sales support materials, web updates and email campaigns What is expected of you: 5+ years’ experience as a Digital/Interactive Art Director/Designer Experience in designing responsive websites and user interfaces Proficient with Adobe Creative suite (including After Effects) and Sketch Stellar written and verbal communication skills Interpersonal skills and excellent problem-solving abilities Self-directed with an entrepreneurial mindset Ability to adapt design to a wide variety of target audiences What you can expect in return: $50,000 - $60,000 salary based on experience A positive and collaborative work environment Growth opportunities If you are interested in this exciting opportunity, contact Nancy Bracey by pressing "Apply Now". Only candidates already eligible in Canada will be reviewed. Only qualified candidates will be contacted. Fit is important to us and it’s important to the companies we partner with. At The Headhunters, we understand that finding your next dream role is not just about aligning your skills with a job description. It is about knowing your personality, workstyle and career goals. Learn more about our specialized recruitment services at www.theheadhunters.ca.

Job_Description: Why autoTRADER.ca?  autoTRADER.ca is Canada's #1 Automotive Marketplace, with the #1 App and is one of Canada's most iconic brands. We are a leader in the automotive industry and one of Canada’s largest digital businesses with unrivaled consumer and dealer brand recognition. Our technology solutions help our dealers drive their business forward and helps Canadians to buy and sell like pros. autoTRADER.ca traffic has tripled over the last 3 years, generating more than 5.5 million unique visitors a month. It’s where Canadians Click with Cars!  What does autoTRADER.ca offer you?  The opportunity to work with some of the Industry's best minds  Benefits from day one!  Casual Dress Environment  Free Membership to On-Site Gym  Free Parking  Tuition Reimbursement  Regular Employee Appreciation Events  Employee Vehicle Purchase Discounts  We recognize that each employee brings a unique set of skills and experience to help us achieve success. We want to hear your story.  This role will be responsible for executing and leading the user experience (UX) for high profile desktop and mobile initiatives for the Marketplace team. Will solve complex problems, design creative user-focused solutions and drive experience strategies. Provide vision and planning on how to evolve and grow the UX/UI in line with business plans. Direct and/or undertake appropriate research and analysis with users and stakeholders to validate user needs. Provide subject matter expertise and assistance. A wizard with rapid prototyping and UI design, this role will produce designs within a level of detail that can be used to produce functional requirements for development.  Work directly with Product Leads, Technical Leads and UI/UX designers to create requirements and provide design recommendations based on best practice and standards  Experienced with agile UX including usability testing including remote, multivariate and A/B platforms to guide design solutions  Produces test scenarios, success metrics and can evaluate and communicate research findings  Makes data driven design decisions through understanding and interpreting metrics captured by Google Analytics and testing  A champion for the user, you make persuasive arguments that influence UX output and final product decisions  Shows a solid portfolio of successful, high traffic, e-commerce and/or editorial based sites and can speak to the core UX engagement metrics driving the success  Champion our respectful, collaborative based culture that celebrates our work and successes as a team University Degree or equivalent work experience  5+ years' experience working within user experience, user research and UI design for mobile and desktop web  2+ years' experience working in high traffic, large scale websites either in house or agency/consulting firm  2+ years' experience with user-centered design methods, best practices and techniques  Experience working with remote team members and management  Expert knowledge of the UX tools of the trade: InVision, Sketch, Adobe CS, Axure for Mac OS or PC environment  Worked within a fast paced, agile, commercial on-line environment

Title: UX/UI Designer

Job_Description: BBTV’s new Interactive group is connecting content creators with their audiences in exciting new ways. We are looking for a Designer to join our fast-growing team!  As a Designer, you are always aware of the market, able to analyze the competition and identify ways to attract, retain, and engage users. You are able to design products in service of our overall strategy and work with our development partners to bring the vision to life.  As our ideal candidate, you have experience with the entire mobile game life cycle, from pre-production through live ops, and know what to focus on. You have experience with many areas of design, including concept, gameplay, systems, and economy. You are an expert at free to play mobile games and understand how to design to maximize KPI’s while improving the player experience.  You are a team player who thrives in an entrepreneurial environment, someone who wants to work with great people on great products. Experience working with external or remote development teams is a major plus. Key Responsibilities:  Own product design from concept identification through post-launch Write and collaborate on design documents for internal and external stakeholders to align the team on a clear vision  Work with external developers to guide design and ensure execution of product vision Analyze and understand influencers and their audiences in order to make intelligent decisions about product Understand and predict market movements, trends, and competition to ensure our products are successful across all KPI’s Utilize analytics and player feedback to make product improvements after launch Work closely with the Producer to ensure proper definition of scope and prioritization of features Provide clear and concrete design feedback on all aspects of product Review builds throughout development to ensure quality execution, providing timely feedback and guidance as needed Key Skills and Requirements:   5+ years of full cycle experience in the mobile game industry Bachelor’s degree or relevant education combined with experience; game design degree is a definite plus Direct experience designing commercially successful free to play mobile games Direct experience creating concepts, writing GDD’s, and communicating with other disciplines (art, engineering, QA, etc.) Ability to create wireframes and provide UI/UX feedback Experience setting KPI’s, interpreting analytics, and making informed decisions Direct experience designing game economies and tuning/balancing game systems Deep knowledge of retention, engagement, and monetization, and how to design for them across different genres and target players Positive attitude with the desire to drive initiatives across the finish line Excellent organizational skills paired with strong attention to detail, and the ability to multitask Strong verbal and written communication skills with proven track record of communicating effectively with stakeholders at all levels Resourceful in making decisions in a timely manner, with the ability to empower the team to troubleshoot and problem solve Experience working with external development teams is a strong plus Experience working with PC/console is a plus Exhibiting your design and communication skills with examples of written or visual design documentation will help us assess candidates.  About BBTV  At BBTV, our team is everything. We offer competitive compensation packages, rapid career advancement, flexible hours, and operate on a horizontal management structure that rewards creativity and values transparency. Our state-of-the-art open concept office is built to give you the perfect balance of work-and-play.  From the fully stocked games room, lounge spaces, movie theatre, and in-house automated barista, to healthy snacks, gym passes, and a culture committee (in charge of frequent outings and team-building events), we’re not your typical 9-5 gig. Today, we are the third largest video property on the planet (behind only Google and Facebook), and have built digital networks alongside the likes of the NBA and The Huffington Post. So if you love collaborating, innovating, and pushing yourself to excellence, let’s talk!  To all recruitment agencies, BBTV does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, BBTV employees or any other company location. BBTV is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.
Title: Designer/Sr. Designer, BBTV Interactive

Job_Description: Ubersmith is a global leader in subscription business management software for organizations of all sizes. The company’s suite of usage-based billing, sales quoting, order management, infrastructure management and help desk ticketing solutions is integrated, open and intuitive. Ubersmith is an INAP (NASDAQ: INAP) company. Hundreds of companies in twenty countries rely on Ubersmith to better serve their customers, run their businesses, shorten time-to-market and boost overall efficiency. We serve the SaaS, Cloud/Hosting, Datacenter, Telco/ISP, Managed Services and Enterprise/All Other markets. Our product is used by CEOs, IT, Finance, Sales, Support, Operations and other user types. Ubersmith is growing and profitable and has exciting plans for the future. It is a great time to be at the company. About the Position The Engineering Team at Ubersmith, comprised of development, UX, and UI is responsible for all the client-facing application and the appliance management system. Utilizing a growing range of tools and programming languages (including PHP, InfluxDB, Redis, Memcache, JavaScript, and MySQL) we continually achieve the best subscription business suite on the market for organizations of all sizes. We are a small, tight team so you will have the opportunity to take ownership of meaningful projects that will help to shape the success of our business. It is a great opportunity to work on a popular product that has enormous potential. Strong candidates will bring solid technical aptitude with the ability act quickly on new features and bug fixes. You will be based in Montreal, Canada, and will report to the Director of Engineering at Ubersmith.  Examples of problems you’ll be solving: Building a Node.js micro-service offering a REST API and interacting with an MQ bus, based on frameworks like Moleculer, Koa or LoopBack. Refactoring existing or legacy PHP code to meet modern standards and practices while preserving functionality. Creating new responsive user interfaces with modern tools like Vue.JS. We’re looking for someone who is awesome because: You have solid software engineering experience and are comfortable coding in PHP and JavaScript. You are passionate about building clean, maintainable, efficient code. You love working closely with a small agile team of developers and designers. You are able to take responsibility for projects from idea to completion. You care about keeping up-to-date with product and industry knowledge. Other people at companies you worked for wanted you on their projects (and/or team). Life with Ubersmith It’s a small (but growing) team of full-time people that love what they do. Competitive salary Flexible and generous paid time off, based on your experience rather than your seniority Flexible work hours, including opportunities to work remotely Company outing once a year Opportunities to continue your professional development The best technology to get your job done: a new MacBook Pro Retina, dual monitors, and (practically) whatever else you need.
Title: Full Stack Developer (Junior), Ubersmith

Job_Description: We are a young, energetic and innovative team of creative minds. We’re all working towards the common goal of helping photographers create and run successful businesses.What is Sprout Studio?Sprout Studio is the photography industry’s first all-in-one business management system, and we’d love for you to be a part of building this game-changing web-software.Sprout Studio is built on PHP, MySQL, AngularJS, NodeJS, HTML5 and CSS3.What's the position: A full-stack web developer, in-house, 37.5 hrs/week. Position is alongside our full-time team, crushing bugs, improving our modern web software, and contributing through our GitHub repo.If you are a: Passionate, meticulous, independent web developer that enjoys working in a team, has great attention to detail, and loves learning new things and teaching others;With these skills: JavaScript wizard, with advanced knowledge of web languages (jQuery, AJAX, HTML5, and CSS3)Strong working knowledge of PHP and MySQLDemonstrate knowledge of MVC frameworksClean code, optimized for performance, load times and maintainabilityExperience with Git or other SCMAnd if you also have the following bonus skills (not required but considered an asset): Working knowledge of AngularJS or ReactJSUnderstanding of UI and UX design fundamentalsZurb Foundation 5 or newer and SASSExperience with Apache/NGINX server configurationPlus, if this looks appealing: Working in an modern, collaborative-style, office in Downtown St. CatharinesJoining a team of customer advocates, photographers, marketers, designers, and developersWorking onsite, full-time, (37.5 hours per week)Starting salary of $35,100–$42,900 based on experience, including 2 weeks vacation and 3 complimentary personal days per yearThen we want you!Job Type: Full-timeSalary: $35,100.00 to $42,900.00 /yearExperience:Web Developement: 2 years
Title: Web Developer

Job_Description: We are looking for a passionate and forward-thinking UX/UI Designer and Analyst to not only design engaging and interactive experiences and solutions that address business requirements; but to incorporate analytics and leverage behavioral trends and patterns Working with a small agile development team, you will: Create Prototypes and Wireframes Write functional specifications Champion reporting and analytics - create reports and incorporate findings into design  Qualifications Excellent problem-solving, time management, and organizational skills Strong verbal and written communication skills People-oriented with a demonstrated ability to interact at all levels with tact and diplomacy, while maintaining employee confidentiality Self-directed and able to work autonomously and as part of a team Knowledge of Front End Coding ability, such as ECMAScript-5 JavaScript, HTML5, jQuery/jqMobile, AngularJS, KnockoutJS, CSS3, responsive CSS frameworks such as Bootstrap, Pure, or Foundation, and other modern front-end libraries/technologies (ex. Underscore, SASS/LESS, TypeScript) An understanding of Graphic Design
Title: UX/UI Developer

Job_Description: Join Windsor's most innovative, fun and Silicon-Valley-esque development and innovation company, bringing world-class projects to Windsor. Help us build exciting technology like multiplayer game servers for Atari, social apps for Puma, high profile analytics engines for The PGA Tour, and cutting edge products like natural-language-processing chat-bots.As one of Windsor's most sought-after companies to work for, we offer flexible time, work-at-home days, a great benefits plan and in-office massage. We are located in the heart of Windsor's historic Walkerville. You must be willing to work in our office. We are not interested in off-shore or remote work.We are seeking talented interface designers who are looking to grow professionally and personally within a fast-growing company. You will work on a variety of marketing deliverables, including websites, prototypes, wireframes, business collateral and other design pieces.ResponsibilitiesWork on the design of user interfaces for web and mobile projectsAble to help with wireframing using tools like Adobe XD and BalsamiqAble to self-direct and work independently, to manage multiple, concurrent projects simultaneously from start to finishRequirements: Expertise in Adobe Creative Suite: Illustrator, Photoshop, InDesign, After Effects, EdgeKnowledge of responsive web designAbility to create interactive prototypesCustomer-obsessed, detail-oriented and comfortable working on highly technical teamsDemonstrated experience with building user interfaces across a range of platforms including desktop and mobile--- Please send examples of your design portfolio (specifically web design) when you apply. ---We look forward to meeting you!Job Type: Full-timeEducation:High school or equivalentLocation:Windsor, ON
Title: Web Designer / UI / UX

Job_Description: Nous valorisons la diversité et avons à cœur de créer un milieu de travail inclusif qui nous inspire tous à donner le meilleur de nous-mêmes. Joignez-vous à notre équipe et faites une différence!  Votre poste  Nous Comment imaginez-vous les bureaux d’une compagnie d’assurance? Et l’atmosphère de travail qui y règne? Nous gageons que si vous passez nous voir au Lab de Intact, vous serez très surpris! Situé au centre-ville de Montréal, nous sommes un laboratoire d’innovation dont la mission est de créer des produits à la fine-pointe de l’insurtech qui améliorent la vie de millions de Canadiens.  Mariant la convivialité et la vélocité d’une startup aux ressources et aux moyens d’une grande entreprise (vous disposerez de tous les outils dont vous avez toujours rêvé!), le Lab est un environnement jeune et dynamique, offrant des défis stimulants, des collègues inspirants et une carrière passionnante (chez un des top 100 employeurs au Canada). C’est l’endroit idéal pour parfaire vos compétences et faire évoluer votre carrière.  Vous Vous êtes passionné par le commerce électronique et l’innovation numérique? Vous avez un talent particulier pour traduire des exigences complexes en expériences utiles et agréables? Vous restez à l’affût des dernières tendances en matière de design et vous aimez expérimenter de nouveaux outils et de nouvelles méthodologies? Nous avons l’occasion parfaite pour vous!  Rôle À titre de designer UX/UI, vous jouerez un rôle essentiel dans la conception et l’évolution de notre écosystème numérique. Relevant du directeur principal, Innovations numériques, vous aurez comme principales responsabilités :  Concevoir des expériences captivantes en vue de réaliser les objectifs d’affaires  Valider la fonctionnalité et l’utilité par l’entremise de tests et de recherches auprès des utilisateurs  Produire des livrables UX et design pertinents au besoin  Piloter une feuille de route aux côté d’un directeur de produit et d’une équipe agile multidisciplinaire  Présenter le travail aux parties prenantes  Aider les ingénieurs à produire des interfaces de qualité et agréables  Prôner une conception axée sur l’utilisateur et les données  Vos compétences  Minimum trois années d’expérience  Expertise en matière de convivialité et de pratiques de conception centrées sur l'utilisateur  Maîtrise des outils de conception (Sketch, Axure, InVision, Illustrator, etc.)  Expérience des outils de recherche UX (usertesting.com, Optimal Workshop, etc.) un atout  Expérience dans la production de flux de processus, d’inventaires de contenu, etc.  Vous aimez travailler dans un environnement de collaboration qui accorde une importance primordiale au travail d’équipe, à l’innovation, à l’ouverture d’esprit et au plaisir  Veuillez inclure votre portfolio dans votre dossier de candidature.  Vous êtes  Une personne avec qui il est agréable de travailler  Créatif, analytique, curieux et ingénieux  Un joueur d’équipe capable de partager et recevoir des commentaires constructifs  Excellent pour expliquer vos idées à différents intervenants  Profondément passionné par le design et la qualité  Organisé et proactif  En tant que salarié temps plein, vous bénéficierez des avantages suivants :  Un salaire compétitif  Un boni de performance annuel  Un régime de retraite  Un horaire de travail flexible de 35 heures par semaine  Des assurances médicales et dentaires hors pair  Et plusieurs autres avantages et bénéfices (remboursement gym, conférences, etc.)  Énoncé fermeture  Cette opportunité vous intéresse? Nous avons très hâte de faire votre connaissance!  D’excellents avantages sont offerts : salaire concurrentiel, avantages flexibles, aménagements de travail flexibles, congés mobiles, régime de retraite à prestation déterminée, etc.  Dans le cadre du processus de sélection d’Intact, les candidats peuvent être appelés à donner leur consentement à une vérification de leurs antécédents pertinente au poste à pourvoir avant de recevoir une offre d’emploi. Celle-ci peut comprendre une confirmation des références d’emploi, des études et des titres de compétences, une vérification des emplois, de l’identité, des infractions criminelles et du permis de conduire ainsi qu’un rapport de crédit.  Vous pouvez soumettre votre candidature à un emploi affiché pourvu que vous occupiez vos fonctions actuelles depuis au moins douze mois et que votre performance soit jugée bonne ou que votre contrat temporaire arrive à son échéance. Une recherche de talents à l'externe est menée parallèlement au recrutement à l'interne Veuillez donc prendre note que des candidats potentiels pourraient avoir été identifiés pour ce poste dans le cadre de leur plan de développement.   Veuillez noter que l'usage du masculin a comme but d'alléger le texte.  Cet affichage prendra fin 02 juin 2018.  Prime de recommandation  CE POSTE EST SUJET À UNE PRIME DE RECOMMANDATION DE 3000$.  #li-qc  Droit de travailler au Canada  Les personnes qui posent leur candidature à un poste permanent doivent, dès leur embauche, avoir le droit de travailler au Canada de façon permanente. Les documents pouvant servir de preuve dans le cas des rôles permanents sont un certificat de naissance canadien, un passeport canadien, un certificat de citoyenneté canadienne, une carte de résident permanent ou une confirmation de son statut de résident permanent pour prouver qu’il a le droit de travailler au Canada.  Indeed Commandité  IN-INFR
Title: Designer UX/UI

Job_Description: Navigator Marketingis an award-winning, full-service marketing agency that provides cutting-edge marketing strategy that produce results. We work with companies all over North America.Services: Web Design, Mobile Web Design, Monthly Marketing Strategy & Implementation, Social Media Management.Our Mission: Helping business owners grow their businesses from where they are now to where they want them to be.How We Do This: We increase a business' PROFILE, LEADS & SALES. We are a fun, talented & driven team who work at the intersection technology and consumer behaviour generating sales.Position Description: We are looking for an amazing & fun Web & UI/UX Developerto add to our team to assist with designing, coding and modifying websites, from layout to function. This person will strive to create visually appealing sites that feature user-friendly design and clear navigation. This person will also work closely with our designers & team members to execute & bring to life new ideas & projects in a team approach.The successful candidate will also be working on keeping websites up to date, landing pages, mobile optimization, analytics and much more. These tasks will require you to be comfortable and efficient with Google Developer Tools, and coding in HTML5, CSS, Javascript and PHP.We are looking for someone with minimum of one year experience in the field who can hit the ground running. Training will be minimal as we need someone to help us out immediately with our current projects. You should enjoy solving problems independently and keeping up to date with the newest trends.Qualifications: Amazing attention to detail.Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator skills an asset.HTML(5), CSS, JavaScript + jQuery, PHP .Setting up WordPress websites from scratch, working with plugins & some ecommerce.Familiarity with cPanel, Server / IT knowledge an asset.Experience with media queries and building responsive websites.Excellent at solving the challenges of cross browser rendering (desktop [IE, FF, Chrome, Safari] and mobile [iOS, Android])Ability to write iOS applications is an asset.Great problem solving skills.Additional Information: Key TraitsYou are passionate and love what you do.Work well under pressureAble to move from project to project quicklyGreat memory skillsExcellent communications skills.Strong analytical and problem solving skills.Superior teamwork and interpersonal skills.Strong organizational, prioritization, time management skills & work well under pressure.The ability to effectively handle multiple tasks and projects and to meet deadlines.Your upbeat & enthusiastic! Attitude is everything with us. We are a fun quirky group, but we love to work at what we do!EducationA college or university diploma/degree in something related is preferred.Also open to applicants who can demonstrate an amazing knowledge & Do-it-yourself spirit.Job Type: FreelanceJob Type: Freelance
