Job_Description: About Nix Sensor Ltd.We create amazing products that help colour professionals and consumers demystify the world of colour. If you’ve never used a Nix Color Sensor, it’s a magical experience. Like the photoshop eyedropper in real life, it takes the real world and makes it digital, and then can help our users make it real again.What you’ll do?Design beautiful apps that work with our award-winning hardwareWork with our software development, hardware, and product teams to craft a seamless user experienceOwn the design of our core products and participate in shaping the direction of our future productsIterate, test, and release products as quickly as we can gather feedback from our users and customersEven help out with other aspects of product design like packaging, web, etc.What you’ll need?A compelling and interesting portfolio of projects that showcase your workExperience designing mobile apps, and even web and other types of media, front end, back end, consumer and cloud based experience is a bonusExperience using the latest design tools to facilitate wireframing, prototyping, user testing, and information architectureExperience using a design methodology to get product out the door fastThe ability to work in a fast paced, collaborative environment, alongside the rest of our dynamic teamWhat’s makes Nix a great place to work?You’ll be joining a company that’s backed by some of the best advisors and investors in CanadaWe’re growing quickly, and you’ll be helping to build the next great Canadian success storyYou’ll work with a highly motivated team that takes pride in creating amazing productsWhat’s next?Send us a note or message indicating your interestShowcase your work by sending us a portfolio and / or examples of prior projectsJob Type: Full-timeExperience:UI Design: 1 yearUX Design: 1 year
Title: UX UI Designer

Job_Description: Job Description Collaborative, assertive, flexible, passionate, driven, inspired. These aren’t just nice words, they’re the start of every great Fluidigm career. We are a growing community of thinkers and creators, dedicated to pursuing the fundamental truths of biology. We seek to empower and inspire our customers and each other to push limits and envision ever more creative answers to “what if…?” As the industry pioneer and leader in revolutionary single-cell technology, we are committed to enabling biological exploration at every level.  And if you’re into all that too, we’re ready to commit to you.  We’re looking for an experienced Senior UX / UI Designer to revamp the user experience of our cutting-edge scientific software products. As our first UX hire, you’ll have the opportunity to build our software UX framework from the ground up. This includes creating a UX vision, conducting customer research, selecting design and prototyping tools, building UI prototypes & mock-ups, implementing feedback processes, and integrating the discipline of design into our development process. This is a greenfield activity, and you’re in the driver’s seat.  This is a 9 months contract with possibility of extension. This position is based in Markham, ON  About You  You are deeply curious about people. You are genuinely interested in interviewing internal stakeholders and customers, conducting usability tests, and sharing important insights with the team. You know how to translate findings into compelling stories and actionable recommendations that stick with teammates. These guideposts help others make decisions, implement features, and greenlight projects that make our products more delightful.  You are a self-starter. As our first UX hire, you will be helping the team define the best practices for integrating UX into a software team, to best enable design and collaboration. You should be comfortable in proactively establishing a UX direction.  You love to collaborate. You understand successful design doesn’t happen in a vacuum or in secret. You believe in sharing work early, openly, and often. You know how to work across functions (software, product management, support and engineering) to create a single, consistent UX vision. You help teams determine the research methods that will best answer their questions. You involve others throughout the research lifecycle and make it easy for them to participate in the process.  You know how design impacts development. You’ve built multiple products before, and you understand the technical complexities a design might introduce, and can work through them with your teammates. You don’t believe in “tossing designs over the wall,” and would dread doing so. You love the challenge of making complicated things simpler and easier. Fluidigm gives world-class researchers and scientists the tools to make their next medical breakthrough, and we do so with complex products that involve both data acquisition and analysis components. Your work will help directly shape the direction of the product, and you flourish in the mission to give each scientist a simple yet powerful experience that enable and expedite their work.  Responsibilities:  Collaborate with cross-functional stakeholders, both inside and outside Fluidigm, to proactively gather product requirements and create a high-level UX vision for our next gen desktop product Work within a team of software developers, testers, scientists and technical writer to create and deliver new software products and features that help advance scientific understanding Produce UI designs of various fidelity, ranging from quick sketches to mock-ups to detailed prototypes Strive to create an intuitive and engaging user experience with a modern, clean and sophisticated aesthetic sense, one that goes beyond just good design into actually delighting users Learn about mass cytometry and how it aids scientists in their quest to better understand cell characteristics and interactions within medical fields such as oncology, immunology and hematology Establish and maintain detailed usability and design guidelines for the software development team, based on design trends, industry best practices and competitive benchmarking Plan and conduct user research and usability tests, documenting, communicating and acting upon the results Build relationships with customers and other functional groups to ensure alignment on UX vision During crunch times, be open to participating in software testing, technical writing, and/or software development activities (if you have a development background)  Skills & Experiences: 7+ years of hands-on UI and UX design experience, ideally with a mix of desktop and web/mobile products A genuine interest in science, and willingness to go out of your comfort zone to learn about concepts of biology, chemistry and physics A strong understanding of current design trends in desktop, web and mobile applications Proficiency in various research and design techniques such as qualitative research methods, personas, wireframing, task analysis, sketching, prototyping, usability testing, etc. Experience with prototyping and workflow tools such as Sketch, InVision, Balsamiq, Adobe XD, etc. An eye for nuance and details. You’re often praised for spotting usability issues that no one else can. Experience in agile software development using a Scrum, XP or Kanban methodology, and an understand of software development project lifecycles Strong negotiation, influencing and communication skills. This is critical as you’ll be interacting with stakeholders and customers who are experts and pioneers in their fields. Excellent communications skills. You can distill complex topics into simple discussions. A great attitude towards work. You work hard, and enjoy working in a close-knit team environment with a diverse range of personalities. Nice-to-Haves: In addition to the basic skills needed for being successful, the following could set you apart from the pack! A software development background. Ability to prototype your designs in working C# WPF code. Experience designing scientific software products and/or those that interface with scientific instrumentation or hardware equipment Education Background: As our products are of a scientific nature, ideally you have a Science or Engineering degree in Biology, Chemistry or Physics Candidates with Visual Design or Computer Science/Engineering degrees with a demonstrated interest in science will be considered We Will: Value your contribution, enlist your feedback, and support you in your ongoing development and contribution both as an employee and a person Provide you with a fun, modern, sun-filled work environment in Markham, Ontario, near Rouge River walking trails and just 5 minutes drive off of Highway 404, 407 or highway 7 Host excellent company-wide events multiple times a year Offer onsite yoga classes, espresso and fruits, ping pong and foosball tables, board games, samosa socials, walking and running clubs, an outstanding working environment and, seriously, a lot more How to Apply:  For this position, please submit: Your resume and cover letter A portfolio of your best work, so that we can get a sense of your design experience and aesthetic direction Answers to the following questions: What are some examples of great UX/UI that you admire today? How do they elevate the user experience? What is one change you’d make about them? Anything else that will let us know more about your skills and experiences that you’d be willing to share, ie. your blog, Twitter, Behance, Dribbble, GitHub, etc.  The Company is committed to providing an inclusive and barrier free recruitment process to applicants with accessibility needs in accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA). If you require an accommodation during this process, please inform The Company of your requirements. We are an equal opportunity employer.
Title: Senior UX / UI Designer - contract

Job_Description: We’re on a mission to build the relationship-focused bank of the future and we’re looking for the passionate collaborators, innovators, advisors, and leaders who can get us there. Our distinct culture is built on a shared commitment to do what’s right for our clients, our people, and our communities, and we strive for excellence in everything we do. Because life at CIBC is not only what you do, but how you do it. To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com What You’ll Be Doing You’ll be joining a collaborative team that is transforming the face of banking in North America. Innovation and collaboration aren’t just buzzwords, they’re the job description. You’ll be preparing for the future of banking by shaping it. We have opportunities to build your career in digital, tech and data – we call these roles transformational. Together, we can create an experience that’s faster, easier and built around our clients.  How You’ll Succeed  Digital - As part of the Client Connectivity group, you will play a key role in defining and leading digital design strategy as well as managing collaboration with partner groups. In addition, you will be hands-on in creating innovative and compelling digital experiences and drive innovation and strategy backed by a strong knowledge of research, data, and best practices. Key Digital roles include: UX Designer, UI Developer, Process Engineering Specialist, Digital Analytics roles. Technology - Various technology teams are all contributing in helping CIBC achieve its goal of being #1 in customer experience. Transformational talent with experience in mobile development, payments, enterprise architecture, Cloud, Agile, and information security will leverage new technologies, enhance collaboration & decision making and improve client experience and efficiencies through different exciting projects and initiatives. Key transformational technology roles including but not limited to: Mobile Developer, Front/Back-end Developer, Agile Coach, Business System Consultant for Payments/Mobile Development, Scrum Master, Information Security Consultant, Cloud Engineer, Enterprise Architect, etc. Data - CIBC's Enterprise Advanced Analytics team is a central hub of data science expertise within CIBC, and is leading the way in applying the best practices in machine learning, leveraging massive datasets and the latest in big data technology platforms. You will apply your knowledge and experience of data modelling to solve challenging business problems and bringing innovative solutions. You’ll interact with groups across the organization from client facing to operational, risk and capital markets. You’ll work with real world structured and unstructured datasets to produce end-to-end solutions, taking models from experiment to deployment. We collaborate with the most exciting new companies in the space of AI and machine learning, and engage in collaborations with leading academic researchers to promote the exchange of ideas and enrich our talent. Key data related roles in CDO: Data Scientist, Senior Data Scientist, Data Engineer and Big Data Hadoop Developer.  Who You Are  You can demonstrate experience in one of the areas including digital, data, mobile development, Agile, information security, Cloud, Block chain and Enterprise Architecture. You embrace and champion change. You'll continuously evolve your thinking and the way you work in order to deliver your best. You're driven by collective success. You know that collaboration can transform a good idea into a great one. You understand the power of an inclusive team that enjoys working together to create a shared vision. You look beyond the moment. You make decisions and take actions that will make a difference today and tomorrow. You proactively seek new opportunities to define what's possible. You love to learn. You're passionate about growing your knowledge, and you know that there is no limit to what you can achieve. Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values - trust, teamwork, and accountability.  What CIBC Offers At CIBC, our people are our greatest asset. You’ll become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s unique talents, and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client, and to do it well. As part of our team, you will: Thrive: Benefit from an open and approachable culture that provides the flexibility and support you need to integrate your life at work and at home Connect: Work in a place where the right technology and infrastructure fosters innovation, collaboration and creativity Develop: Grow your skills and career through our best-in-class onboarding experience, ongoing learning opportunities, and individual development planning Prosper: Share in our collective success with a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, health benefits program, and employee share purchase plan What You Need to Know  CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation during the application or interview process, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com You need to be legally eligible to work in Canada at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit
Title: Transformational Talent - Digital, Tech & Data

Job_Description: The Strategyzer team wants you to join us in building the operating system for strategy for leading global companies. We want to destroy the mess of powerpoint, excel, and word docs currently “managing” strategy, and create one clear, simple system.  You will spend each day collaborating with product managers, thinkers, and developers to turn our customers’ needs into beautiful tools they can’t live without. If you are looking to apply your design skills to a challenging and exciting product, we want to hear from you. Job Title  Senior Product Designer (100%)  Location: Toronto Job Description / Responsibilities  Develop design concepts addressing validated problems and user-stories from the product manager Validate concepts with customers and stakeholders Continuously improve pattern library Develop fully fleshed out designs and prototypes Spec for production and co-ordinate with development team Provide critique and guidance for intermediate Product Designer Coordinate with other designer stakeholders to develop visual look and feel for this product that integrates with larger product suite Help define the processes and culture of a growing company  Qualifications  5+ years digital product design experience Great communication skills A deep empathy for the user Experience working across the UX/UI stack, not just focus on UI. Experience validating design solutions with users Self-starter Working with a remote team experience is a plus Experience with industry standard design tools Desire to make incredible products that really work and improve users lives and work – not just making nice dribbble shots An obsession with what makes a great product Get-things-done attitude an absolute must. No BS, no politics, cheerful attitude, relentless focus on customer value and marketplace success. We have a strict “no asshole rule”, based on Bob Sutton’s bestseller. We only hire people who are great, yet humble, and strive to do the best work of their career as part of a supportive team  What’s in it for you  Turn a decently designed product into an amazing one Lead a paradigm shift in strategy and innovation in the world’s leading enterprises. Be part of a highly visible, world-famous organization. Working with the creators of Business Model Generation and the leading training material in the area of business model innovation and value proposition design. Work with and report directly to a co-founder of the company. Competitive salary, health benefits, and $2500 personal development budget. Two amazing offsites each year (Muskoka, Cuba, Burgundy, Tunisia, Switzerland, Lisbon) Flexible hours from our sunny downtown Toronto office with remote work opportunities. Autonomy and accountability to do your job your way. Opportunity to grow a young “base hit” product and turn it into a “home run”. Define how things are done for the future with room for growth Join a world-class team doing their best work with joy and enthusiasm.  What we’ve done and where we’re going: Strategyzer was founded by a designer and a lover of design – so there are high expectations for this role. Our initial success came from the tight coupling of design and content to create a differentiated product. We’ve been pushing hard to raise the bar ever since. Our work has touched millions to date and we’re hoping to have even more of an impact in the years to come.  We published Business Model Generation and Value Proposition Design, two visual books that broke the mold for business books and sold over 1.5 Million copies in 30+ languages. We built a top 10 charting iPad app (business category), a world tour of training workshops, an industry leading conference, a huge online community, multiple conceptual tools used by millions. We’re continuing our journey platform supporting an online course, facilitated online courses for large enterprises, and a web-app that we’re hoping will become the OS of Strategy.  We focus on helping our customers figure out what’s next in their business strategy through better tools. Our ideal future is one where our customers and team members both do the best work of their careers and thoroughly enjoy doing it!
Title: Senior Product Designer

Job_Description: At reebee we are building the best shopping experience. Over 3 million Canadians rely on reebee to save money, discover products, and plan and organize their shopping. About the Role: In this unique opportunity you will have the ability to directly impact all of our consumer and customer facing technologies. With a blank canvas to work with, and a lot of creative freedom, you'll be guiding the reebee brand and visual experience across all of our properties. We are looking for an A-player designer with mobile, web, and physical media experience. Responsibilities: Connect the reebee brand to people through excellence in UI, marketing materials, and user experience Using data and user research, analyze and design interactions to support key growth metrics Partner with engineers, content strategists, and marketers to oversee the user experience from conception to launch Lead internal and external activities with partners, from early design exploration, to prototyping, to product launch Execute in a fast-paced and highly fluid environment Requirements: 5+ years experience in UI and UX design Degree / Diploma in Design, Graphic Design, User Experience Design, related field, or equivalent work experience Experience designing data-rich interfaces alongside an engineering department Experience with Photoshop, Illustrator, and Sketch Experience with standard design processes, and wireframing tools Knowledge of current and upcoming interaction design and UX trends Sketching, visualizing, and prototyping skills Please include portfolio with application To apply, please submit your cover letter and resume here
Title: UI / UX Director

Job_Description: **Only local candidates please**Our leading financial client is looking for a UX designer to join their User Experience team.As a Designer on our User Experience team, you will be focused on our large consumer- and business-facing websites dedicated to our Group Benefits and Group Retirement Solutions areas, serving millions of Canadians.Working with a cross-functional team, you will deliver highly effective, well-crafted and evidence-based digital experiences through sketches, empathy maps, user flows, wireframes, and prototypes, and working with our UI designers to create the eventual UI/design assets as needed.You’ll be able to synthesize business requirements, research and design principles; solve problems; work within tight deadlines; and understand disparate audiences to ensure the final experiences cater to the uniqueness of the targeted individuals.You will need to identify and solve problems; simplify complicated ideas; explore different design solutions and articulate for the user in each case; and present to and collaborate with a wide range of project team members and stakeholders. Key AccountabilitiesConsume and understand business, functional and technical requirementsDesign user interfaces by applying the fundamental principles of user experience design, research experience, industry best practices and balancing those against system constraints and business objectivesCreate and revise user flows, sitemaps and wireframes based on specifications, goals, needs and limitationsDevelop rapid interactional UX prototypes; verify design assumptions through concept and usability testingParticipate in design review sessions with project teams, acquiring consensus and approval on designs and documentationDocument detailed user experience specifications and provide to the development team; liaise to ensure final output matches UX specifications and visual design? Experience & Skills RequiredMinimum 4 years’ experience as a user experience designer or similar role1+ years of experience working on complex web projects with medium to large-sized teamsStrong portfolio demonstrating expertise in UXbachelor’s degree in design or a related field (communication arts, computer science, human-computer interaction (HCI), etc.)User-focused and analytical; the ideal person for this role will have a deep understanding and appreciation of the process of identifying users’ needs, coupled with the ability to balance the pros and cons of different designs, backed by research and analyticsExcellent skills in creating flows, low and medium fidelity wireframes and prototypes for different screen breakpoints (responsive design)Well versed in fundamental visual and interactive design disciplines & principles and user behavioral psychologyHighly comfortable presenting and substantiating design decisions (in both formal and informal settings), based on industry best-practice guidelines, personal experience and research findingsExcellent proficiency in Axure RPExperience in related UX/UI design software desirable (e.g. Sketch, InVision)Previous experience with Agile design/development methodologyFastidious attention to detailStrong communication skills and the ability to effectively articulate experiential principlesExperience in user research techniques (e.g. usability tests, focus groups)Certification from an industry-recognized user experience design institution preferredSolid understanding of web and mobile technologiesJob Type: Full-timeExperience:experience as a user: 5 yearsLocation:Kitchener-Waterloo, ON
Title: UX Designer

Title: FREELANCE Web Designer/Developer

Job_Description: If you want to work on a product that encourages exploration, imagination and discovery then the Sago Mini World team wants to hear from you! Launched in May 2017, Sago Mini World is an award-winning subscription app for preschoolers. It combines our entire collection of 26+ games into one magical experience. Features of the app include user on-boarding & customization, interactive navigation, and fun surprises. This is a technically complex product, and we're looking for an experienced Unity Developer to help us reach new, ambitious milestones. You will join a cross-functional team of developers, artists, animators, and play designers driven to create amazing play experiences for kids. Responsibilities Partner with our UX lead to architect and build out new features. Be part of the team that is shaping the future of the product. Work with the team and other developers to quickly prototype new ideas. Stay up to date with the latest Unity best practices and features. Requirements 3+ years using Unity and C# to develop cross-platform mobile apps. Strong understanding of computer science fundamentals and able to write clear and reusable code. Proficient building user interfaces with Unity UI. A borderline unhealthy obsession with the details that take a user experience from good enough to great. A love for making beautiful things with code. Are able to work collaboratively with designers and artists. Also important Candidates should keep in mind that this is not a gameplay programmer role. How to apply If this sounds like a job for you, then don’t be shy and reach out and say ‘Hello’, https://goo.gl/XAZVTx. Tell us about work that you're proud of, your hobbies, and what excites you about working at Sago Mini. About us Sago Mini is an award-winning company devoted to play. With over 26 million downloads, 25 apps and a new line of physical toys, Sago Mini brings thoughtful design to life for preschoolers and parents worldwide. Based in Toronto, Sago Mini is a subsidiary of Toca Boca, the No. 1 mobile-first kids brand in the App Store. We offer an exceptional workplace in downtown Toronto and competitive compensation. We hire humble, collaborative, and ambitious people who care about about doing great work. Sago Mini is an equal opportunity employer. We value diversity at our company.
Title: Unity Developer

Job_Description: Playtika is a multiplatform social games developer. We are the #1 grossing Facebook game developer as well as a Top 10 grossing developer on iOS & Android worldwide.  Founded in 2010, Playtika immediately enjoyed skyrocketing growth and expanded quickly by acquiring other leading game titles. We now have 14 offices in 9 countries around the world with over 1,600 Playtikans.  Our business and our passion is to immerse people into a thrilling entertainment experience. Currently our games are enjoyed by more than 6 million users daily and over 20 million users monthly. Sounds good, right? Come play with us! We are looking for an a talented 2D Artist to join our dynamic and growing team in Montreal. Be a part of the crew in charge of developing the most authentic and recognized poker game: World Series of Poker.  Job description: This position requires illustration skills with particular attention to UX/UI. We’re looking for someone who knows the Adobe Creative Suite platform like the back of their hand!  You will: Work closely with the production team to brainstorm ideas and create new concepts that spark users’ interest Work with the artistic director Produce art for the game’s assets (tournaments, events, logos, icons, etc.) in Photoshop Design concepts for the mobile and web platforms Contribute to the visual display and branding for various features  Requirements: As our ideal candidate, you have: Post-secondary qualifications in graphic arts Solid experience in illustration and graphic design Knowledge of the current trends in the mobile gaming sector Excellent communication and interpersonal skills for working with other departments (other artists, designers, developers, QA) The ability to produce high-quality work The ability to work under pressure to meet tight, fixed deadlines A sharp sense of organization and attention to detail The ability to take on a variety of tasks and prioritize while remaining flexible and comfortably moving from one task to the next as needed Strong problem solving skills, the ability to work independently and an insatiable curiosity in how you approach your work  Assets: Experience using Illustrator and After Effects Experience in animation A passion for poker A compelling portfolio showing exemplary work in graphic design Knowledge and understanding of social games on mobile platforms and Facebook (especially the social casino genre) Good understanding of and experience with UI/UX If you think you have what it takes, we want to hear from you! Please include a link to your portfolio.  We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status or disability status.  Division: WSOP  Sub Department: None

Job_Description: DESCRIPTIONStreetText is a Facebook lead generation and nurturing platform for real estate agents. We're a fast-paced award-winning startup based in Kelowna, BC with a mission to help others grow their businesses. We're looking for an individual who shares our desire to serve our customers well, produce great quality work and have fun along the way.About the job: As a member of the product team, you will bridge the gap between brainstorming and development. A successful candidate is an artist, builder, and collaborator who understands the big picture and cares about the user. You will take a hands-on approach to how the application looks, functions and is built. The Front-end Developer / UX Designer will work with multiple internal and external stakeholders to create a product that exceeds our goals.Responsibilities: Collaborate with stakeholders (team and users) to design and build new customer-facing featuresFacilitate the product vision by researching, conceiving, wireframing, prototyping and mocking up user experiencesDesign, code, and conduct user testingPerform other user-facing activities to validate the design and interactionContribute to design, technical and functional documentation such as detailed architectural and design documents as requestedExcel as a designer/developer and be a productive member of the team where leadership is a behavioral trait, not a titleQualifications: Degree in Computer Science, Fine Arts or related technical field or equivalent working experienceExperience in JavaScript, HTML, and CSSAn eye for design and empathy towards the user experienceFamiliarity with code versioning systems (SVN, GIT)Good understanding of page speed optimization principles and tools.An understanding of SEO basicsAbout us: We're a fun bunch of people that enjoy a highly motivated environment, being part of a team that wants to do their best, and want the customers to do their best too. Oh, and we started in 2010.Looking forward to meeting you!Job Type: Full-timeExperience:JaveScript, HTML, CSS: 4 yearsEducation:Bachelor'sLocation:Kelowna, BC
Title: UI/UX Front-End Designer/Developer

Job_Description: ExPretio is a private company based in Montreal, active since 2007, that offers revenue management solutions for passenger transport companies. It has been built on more than 20 years of academic research on pricing and income optimization methods. Its flagship product, Appia, is now used by the largest European rail companies to optimize their revenue.The missionAs part of the next launch of a new revenue management solution in the field of transportation, ExPretio is looking for a web app designer to design the UX and UI.It is a web application for PC and tablet that will be used daily by professionals (especially revenue management analysts) to optimize their revenue related to passenger transport. It includes visualization screens (e.g. consult aggregated KPIs at different levels), operational screens (e.g. setting up price strategies) and monitoring screens (e.g. alerts).One of the challenges of the mission will be to make readable and understandable the features that require sometimes complex settings and involve a lot of data.DeliverablesUser workflow design to ensure the application (UX) is logical and fluidModel of the various screens and overall visual design (UI)To facilitate the integration, deliverables are expected in CSS format or equivalent.Time frameA complete review of screens with features already present is expected by July 2018.To reach this target, a first version of the user workflow and the overall style guide are expected by the end of May. Then, prototyping screens with already existing features will be made in June and July in conjunction with the UI development team.Other deliverables will then be expected regularly whenever new features are specified by the product team or updates are made to existing ones.Required skillsWeb App Designer (PC and tablet) with sensitivity to integration issuesExperienced in UX / UI design of complex software or applications involving a lot of dataExperienced with professional applications (B2B)Language: French and EnglishBased in the Montreal area (regular in-person meetings to plan)DurationAbout 12 months.A strong investment of time is expected during the first 3-4 months of the project to meet the deadline of the first delivery, and then lower for the progressive addition of new features or their updates.Type d'emploi : Temps Partiel, Contractuel, Freelance / PigisteSalaire : 40,00$ à 50,00$ /heureExpérience:B2B Application Design: 2 ansWeb Design: 3 ansLieu:Montréal, QCLangue:EnglishFrancais

Job_Description: IUGO, one of Vancouver's leading mobile game developers, responsible for smash successes such as The Walking Dead: Road to Survival and Knights & Dragons, is currently seeking a Senior UX Designer. The right candidate will aid in building best practices backed by analytics and play-testing data, guiding the team on interdisciplinary projects to establish a holistic, consistent player experience. You will create collaborative relationships with stakeholders, establishing a strong UX vision and evangelizing player experience design. Refining and optimizing user experience and team processes, utilizing the UX research team and resources you have to hand. The ideal candidate should be highly self-motivated and display exceptional organizational and methodological skills.  RESPONSIBILITIES  Drive UX excellence for the game, and discover opportunities for further research, improvement and innovation  Seek out and leverage the insights of the team's playtesting and player research to inform your game and feature designs  Define and implement standards that help the team create a consistent, quality experience for its players across iOS and Android mobile platforms  Design and audit system architecture and business processes for the project team  Create wireframes and user flows, ensuring that iterative feedback is incorporated into the development process  Collaborate with design teams on in-game feature planning and implementation  Lead a UI/UX team guiding style consistency, and working with internal & external stakeholders  Mentoring and supporting the career development of the UI/UX team  REQUIREMENTS  5+ years of experience delivering innovative results in mobile UX design  Expert in process flow development, journey mapping and user requirements analysis  Familiarity with F2P, RPG games on iOS and Android platforms  Knowledge of standard UX design tools for wireframing, prototyping, flow-charts, etc.  Familiarity with monetization strategies for in-app purchases and free-to-play games  Strong communication skills (verbal and written)  Excellent organizational and methodological skills, with high attention to detail  Expert in integrating new processes, tactical resources for the team (project and disciplinary team)  Understanding of game production pipelines  Proven portfolio demonstrating entire UX process including research, problem, solution and reasonings  A passion for games  BONUS  BA/BS in related discipline or technical equivalent  Working knowledge of analytics, cluster analysis, A/B testing  Previous experience with the development and shipment of AAA titles  PERKS OF WORKING AT IUGO!  Fully stocked kitchen (half of Costco is in our kitchen)  Catered lunch every Friday  Comprehensive benefits package, premiums paid in full by IUGO (including MSP Coverage)  Wellness program (in-studio RMT sessions, gym subsidies)  RRSP Matching  Games tables & consoles  Company socials & team events  Massage chair & relaxation room  IUGO Guilds  Beer Fridays  Vitamix (who doesn’t love a Vitamix?!)  What Happens Next? Our team reviews all applications, however, because we receive such high volumes of talent, we are only able to reach out to those who closely match our needs. If you are not contacted right away, don’t be discouraged as we keep all applications on file, and will contact you should a suitable role open up. Thanks for your interest in IUGO!  Please keep an eye out for our opportunities on our careers page: http://www.iugome.com/careers.html  Follow Us! Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/iugomobile/ Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/iugome/?hl=en Twitter: https://twitter.com/iugome
Title: Senior UX Designer - F2P Mobile Games

Job_Description: Eagle is currently seeking a UX/UI Designer . This is a six (6) month, contract position scheduled to start in May.  Key Responsibilities  The successful candidate will be responsible for: Problem solving day-to-day usability issues, supporting the Digital Marketing team and collaborating with designers and developers;  Designing and defining the user experience for everything from landing pages, conversion flows, mobile apps, banners, emails and more;  Creating wireframes, front-end prototypes and supporting documents to effectively communicate proposed structure, layout, navigation, controls and content prioritization;  Ensuring every user experience not only looks its best, but uses best in class usability practices and enforces, maintains and evolves the digital style guide;  Developing innovative and creative online campaign elements to drive Member engagement through unique Member experiences;  Working as a Member of a collaborative design team to solve creative challenges;  Converting complex briefs into simple and effective digital elements and user experiences;  Minimizing errors in work so development process is as smooth as possible;  Identifying and understanding key elements that align with marketing goals; and,  Delivering on strategy, on time and on budget in a fast-paced industry.  Skills and Qualifications  The qualified candidate must have: Degree or equivalent post-secondary education in Design, Multimedia, Fine Arts or a related discipline;  Five plus (5+) years of professional web, digital, UX or interactive design experience;  ENTERPRISE experience;  Solid knowledge of web and mobile usability and design principles for intuitive site functionality, interaction, information architecture, user interfaces, and navigation;  Experience designing to meet HTML, CSS and JS standards for responsive design on multiple screens;  Ability to work with grid systems, wireframing and prototyping tools;  Proficiency in Adobe Creative Cloud, Sketch and InVision;  Ability to adapt in a fast-paced environment and be a quick learner;  Strong organization skills; and,  Ability to handle the pressure of meeting tight deadlines and quick turnaround while juggling multiple projects.  Don’t miss out on this opportunity, apply online today!  Eagle is an equal opportunity employer and will provide accommodations during the recruitment process upon request. We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only candidates under consideration will be contacted. Please note that your application does not signify the beginning of employment with Eagle and that employment with Eagle will only commence when placed on an assignment as a temporary employee of Eagle.
Title: UX/UI Designer

Job_Description: Start: May 2018 Join a Bay Area start up as a Product Designer. In this role, you will work closely with the Engineering & Product teams to build simple, intuitive web experiences. You will be responsible for the new website interface and get the opportunity to shape and design the user experience right from the start! Making their customers happy will be a primary focus. Required: 3+ years designing exceptional experiences with a portfolio that showcases your ability to move fluidly between user experience design, interface design and visual design A passion for design and continual experimentation, iteration and optimization Ability to make sound design decisions with data and user testing as vital tools Experience with wireframing and prototyping tools, such as Sketch, Invision, Photoshop/Illustrator/InDesign A strong sense of ownership About Annex Annex Consulting Group is a full-service IT and management consulting firm, specializing in staff augmentation contracting, permanent staffing, and outsourced solutions. Candidates must be legally entitled to work in location advertised. Not interested but know someone who is a fit for this role? Check out the award-winning Annex Referral Program. Contact Jaime Oetter for further information. Leaders in IT. Advisors in Business. Partners in Solutions.
Title: UI/UX Designer

Job_Description: The user interface designer will be responsible for creating and designing web elements that optimize user interaction and experience on a large-scale ecommerce platform. The ideal candidate will have a creative, yet organized approach to bringing requirements, wireframes and prototypes to life with visual design.   The Developer is responsible and accountable for ensuring project delivery in an effective and efficient manner. The developer will actively participate in all phases of the project life cycle, including: analyzing, designing, modeling, testing and deploying suitable and appropriate business oriented solutions  The individual must be quality focused and understand that the key to long term success with clients is delivering significant value throughout all stages of the engagement. Key Duties and Responsibilities  Develop user interface for customer-facing mobile and desktop web e-commerce applications using HTML5, CSS, JavaScript, and JQuery Analyze, design, code, debug, test (UAT), document, deploy and provide ongoing support for all web applications.  Deliver project assignments on time, within budget and with high quality.   Assist client with strategizing, designing and implementing effective ecommerce solutions  Participate in Agile development activities including sprint planning, stand-ups, retrospectives and demos.  Adhere to the clients design standards by following the digital style guide for all elements, such as buttons, fonts, forms, tables, colors, icons, navigation etc.  Communicate and work with people of all levels in a team environment o Collaborate with UX analysts and designers, copywriters, product managers on scenarios, end-to-end experiences, and screen designs  o Review user interface designs with teams to obtain feedback and sign-off  o Review the designs with the developers and coach them on how to translate them into working application code  o Work closely with UX, product and IT project team members to understand the business process and requirements in order to design the most effective user interfaces  Contribute to the development, maintenance, and continuous improvement of efficient and effective usability processes, documentation and workflow  Define visual design & product elements for user interfaces, taking into consideration user research, UX design and industry & design best practices  Required Skills and Qualifications  Thorough understanding of front-end technologies and platforms; JavaScript, HTML5, and CSS3  Proficiency with code versioning tools and deployment strategies  A proven ability to build and maintain strong and positive client and peer relationships  Strong verbal and written communication skills  Must be able to work independently with little to no supervision.  Work authorization which does not require sponsorship by the employer  Experience with responsive web design strongly preferred.  Experience working on large scale, custom built, customer facing web applications strongly preferred.  2 of 2   J o b D e s c r i p t i o n – F r o n t E n d / U I D e v e l o p e r  Demonstrated proficiencies with the following: Jquery  JavaScript: Advanced - AMD modules/Common JS Modules HTML5: Advanced - Microdata, Semantics, Accessibility CSS: Animation , Flexbox, CSS: SASS or LESS or PostCSS, CSS: BEM or OOCSS or SMACSS  Strong knowledge of web design best practices  Experience with visual & interface design, front-end development and UI experience with multiple client/project exposure Proficient in the theory and application of Mobile First, Lean UX and responsive design principles  Proficiency in Photoshop, Illustrator, or other visual design tools  Portfolio or Github profile with examples of UI / Front end work Up-to-date with the latest UX and visual design trends, techniques, and technologies  Addit ional Nice to Have Sk i l ls /Knowledge:   Promises and Deferred Object  Angular 2.0+, Angular JS (1.0)  React  Component Based Development  Adobe AEM / CQ5/CQ6 or other Enterprise CMS  Understanding of dynamic web technologies  Web Performance / Front End Optimization: Work Experience, Best Practice knowledge  Jira/Confluence Experience  Bamboo / Stash / GIT experience (Development tools)  Photoshop (slicing, editing page elements)  Previous ecommerce or Retail Web experience considered an asset  Personality, Behavior and Attitude  Approach problems in a methodical and logical manner. Use analytical thinking, research and effective communication Consultants must be trustworthy and punctual. Exhibit a high degree of technical and professional competence. Excellent leadership, communication (written and oral), and interpersonal skillsProven success in both team-oriented and individual environments   About CONTAX  CONTAX is an SAP Gold Channel Partner and one of the fastest growing and dynamic partners in the SAP Ecosystem. Our clients include some of the most prestigious and well-known companies in the world. With clients in USA, Canada and Europe, CONTAX is aggressively expanding our geographical scope and presence in the SAP marketplace.  Our rapid growth and expansion creates challenging, rewarding and interesting career opportunities for career-minded professionals wanting to expand their horizons and take their careers to the next level.  CONTAX is an equal opportunity employer. We foster a culture of respect for every individual in the workplace and value the importance of diversity, fairness, and trust. Our goal is to attract, develop, and engage employees with exceptional ability and diverse backgrounds. We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.
Title: Front End UI Developer

Job_Description: Position Overview: The role of the web UX & UI designer & developer is to create the user experience vision and successfully develop, monitor and improve users’ overall experience when they visit our websites. The individual should have the skills and knowledge to create memorable experiences that are true to the brand while balancing seamless interactivity, ease of navigation and conversion.Reporting to the Director, Marketing & Communications, the Web UX& UI Designerwill be the champion of the users’ needs, and create intuitive user experiences and interface designs. The role will be responsible for the end-to-end online construction, maintenance and experience for: TPH.ca, RHGroup.ca, RGStore.ca, TheGlobeRestaurant.ca, the Intranet, and others as required.The UX & UI Designer will create wireframes and storyboards that map the customer journey, user flows, process flows, information architecture, site maps, porotypes and A/B testing to effectively communicate interaction and design ideas & design each screen or page with which a user interacts.The ideal candidate should have an eye for clean design, possess superior UI & UX skills and be able to translate stakeholder requirements into logical interaction flows and a user interface that is intuitive, visually stimulating and converts.Responsibilities: Be guided by human-centric design by identifying user needs, and leveraging those insights to guide you through the design and testing processesUnderstand the research methods and approaches to recognize and deconstruct the expectation of our usersEstablish design best practices and guidelines through creation of conceptual campaigns and design of a great visual identity and cohesive style-guide ensuring that a consistent design language is applied across sites incorporating logo, corporate colours, typographic rules, etc.Maintaining consistency in visual elements and defining behaviorCreate website that are designed and optimized for all screen sizes (including mobile, tablet, and desktop) with a mobile-first mentality, with specific technologies and platforms in mindLead conversations to facilitate conceptual thinking that takes stakeholder considerations into the processCreate clickable prototypes in Testing of websites and that effortlessly lets the users accomplish their goalsOther duties and responsibilities as assignedQualifications: 3-5 years of proven web designer experienceDemonstrable UI & UX design skills with a strong portfolioSolid experience in creating wireframes and storyboards, user flows, process flows, information architecture, site maps, prototypes and A/B testing to effectively communicate interaction and design ideas & design each screen or page with which a user interactsExperience working with a .Net CMS and e-commerce, knowledge of DotNetNuke (DNN) is preferredProficiency in Creative Design Software (specifically Photoshop, Illustrator, and other visual design and wire-framing tools)Proficiency in: HTML, CSS, JavaScript and JQuery, Media Queries/Bootstrap, Version Control (SVN)Explore various usability testing methods to help inform and optimize designs to create more effective experiencesUnderstand on-page, off-page and technical SEO practices and how to best implement these strategies on the websitesImplement Google Analytics, Tag Manager and Optimize to apply fundamental concepts like performance measurement, comparison and optimization.Experience providing feedback on designer performance, and identifying improvement opportunitiesAbility to present your designs and sell your solutions to various stakeholdersAbility to solve problems creatively and effectivelyUp-to-date with the latest UI trends, techniques, and technologiesExperience working in an Agile/Scrum development processExcellent communication skills and the ability to multi-task, and work well under pressure while juggling several competing prioritiesJob Type: Full-timeExperience:.Net: 1 yearAdobe Creative Suite: 1 yearWeb Design: 3 yearsLocation:Toronto, ON

Job_Description: Join Windsor's most innovative, fun and Silicon-Valley-esque development and innovation company, bringing world-class projects to Windsor. Help us build exciting technology like multiplayer game servers for Atari, social apps for Puma, high profile analytics engines for The PGA Tour, and cutting edge products like natural-language-processing chat-bots.As one of Windsor's most sought-after companies to work for, we offer flexible time, work-at-home days, a great benefits plan and in-office massage. We are located in the heart of Windsor's historic Walkerville. You must be willing to work in our office. We are not interested in off-shore or remote work.We are seeking talented interface designers who are looking to grow professionally and personally within a fast-growing company. You will work on a variety of marketing deliverables, including websites, prototypes, wireframes, business collateral and other design pieces.ResponsibilitiesWork on the design of user interfaces for web and mobile projectsAble to help with wireframing using tools like Adobe XD and BalsamiqAble to self-direct and work independently, to manage multiple, concurrent projects simultaneously from start to finishRequirements: Expertise in Adobe Creative Suite: Illustrator, Photoshop, InDesign, After Effects, EdgeKnowledge of responsive web designAbility to create interactive prototypesCustomer-obsessed, detail-oriented and comfortable working on highly technical teamsDemonstrated experience with building user interfaces across a range of platforms including desktop and mobile--- Please send examples of your design portfolio (specifically web design) when you apply. ---We look forward to meeting you!Job Type: Full-timeEducation:High school or equivalentLocation:Windsor, ON
Title: Web Designer / UI / UX

Job_Description: Travailler chez Genius Solutions c'est : Joindre une équipe passionnée et dynamique qui a à cœur le succès de l’entreprise. C’est également joindre une entreprise en constante évolution dans un environnement stimulant et dans un marché hautement compétitif .Vous avez de l’intérêt à travailler chez Genius? Assurez-vous de vous reconnaitre dans les valeurs de l’entreprise :Vous êtes énergique et passionné : pour atteindre le succès, nous avons besoin de gens avec une énergie débordante démontrant une passion pour leur travail.Vous êtes en mission : les défis sont grands pour nous et nos clients et nous devons faire face à plusieurs obstacles. Pour mener à bien notre mission, il est essentiel de garder le cap!Vous êtes un bon joueur d’équipe : nous croyons fermement que le respect et la confiance sont des ingrédients essentiels au succès.Vous valorisez la connaissance et l’expertise : Genius valorise grandement les gens qui veulent progresser, acquérir de nouvelles connaissances et développer leur expertise.Vous vous reconnaissez dans les valeurs de la compagnie? Oui?Continuons!Designer UX / UI chez Genius Solutions : Nous recherchons actuellement un designer UX/UI . Cette personne aura comme principale fonction la conception de l’interface utilisateur de la prochaine version web de notre application, Genius Manufacturing . La personne sélectionnée devra analyser l’expérience client actuelle, proposer des améliorations et présenter des concepts de maquettes (mockup). Elle devra également accompagner l’équipe de développement informatique tout au long du projet.Les tâches et responsabilités : Effectuer une analyse et une prise de besoins (clients et experts internes)Étudier et analyser les produits et tendances sur le marchéÉtablir des plans et concepts afin de les présenter au comité responsableDévelopper et documenter les outils qui seront utilisés à l’interneOffrir de formation et coaching à notre équipeConnaissances et profil recherchés : Expérience en design d’application web spécialiséeExpérience UX / UI3 à 5 années d’expérience pertinentesMaitrise des logiciels de maquettes (mockup)Niveau avancé de maitrise de la langue anglaise (parlé et écrit)Aimer travailler en mode agileConnaissance de logiciel de type ERP serait un atout importantConditions de travail : Une super équipeUn salaire compétitifUn horaire de travail flexibleVacances + 5 congés payés par annéeDes assurances collectivesDes activités socialesEt bien plus...Lieu de travail : QuébecMots clés : Web – Migration – Développement – Interface – Utilisateur – Expérience client – Mockup – Besoin – Designer – Amélioration – Analyse – ERP – Application – Logiciel – Navigation – Agile – Ergonomie – Graphique – Normes – Livrables – Architecture – Interaction – Interactivité – Solution – Numérique – Mobile – Utilisateur – Visuel – CréativitéType d'emploi : Temps Plein

Job_Description: About Nix Sensor Ltd.We create amazing products that help colour professionals and consumers demystify the world of colour. If you’ve never used a Nix Color Sensor, it’s a magical experience. Like the photoshop eyedropper in real life, it takes the real world and makes it digital, and then can help our users make it real again.What you’ll do?Design beautiful apps that work with our award-winning hardwareWork with our software development, hardware, and product teams to craft a seamless user experienceOwn the design of our core products and participate in shaping the direction of our future productsIterate, test, and release products as quickly as we can gather feedback from our users and customersEven help out with other aspects of product design like packaging, web, etc.What you’ll need?A compelling and interesting portfolio of projects that showcase your workExperience designing mobile apps, and even web and other types of media, front end, back end, consumer and cloud based experience is a bonusExperience using the latest design tools to facilitate wireframing, prototyping, user testing, and information architectureExperience using a design methodology to get product out the door fastThe ability to work in a fast paced, collaborative environment, alongside the rest of our dynamic teamWhat’s makes Nix a great place to work?You’ll be joining a company that’s backed by some of the best advisors and investors in CanadaWe’re growing quickly, and you’ll be helping to build the next great Canadian success storyYou’ll work with a highly motivated team that takes pride in creating amazing productsWhat’s next?Send us a note or message indicating your interestShowcase your work by sending us a portfolio and / or examples of prior projectsJob Type: Full-timeExperience:UI Design: 1 yearUX Design: 1 year
Title: UX UI Designer

Job_Description: Regular Full Time Position Type: Regular Full Time  Clinic: Job Application  Position Type: Regular Full Time DEPARTMENT: Information Technology REPORTS: Director of IT LOCATION: Toronto Head Office SALARY: $35,000-$70,000 SUMMARY STATEMENT: The Web Developer and Designer will be responsible for the design, layout, coding and support of the existing web infrastructure. Maintain all web sites and Bernstein App technologies, including web portal, POS and EMR web integrated applications. Designs, develops, tests and publishes new web pages and web sites in compliance with company standards. Works closely with the web team and reports progress clearly and accurately to management. Trouble-shoot, test and validate software issues. Trouble-shoot and debug development and production issues. Ensures that systems are stable, well designed, effective to use, up-to-date, and properly maintained. Deadlines are crucial. Self-motivation is key. Strong desire to learn new technologies and a commitment to customer service excellence is essential. RESPONSIBILITIES/DUTIES: Develops designs and delivers, tests, implements and maintains web pages and multimedia design using appropriate web publishing, editing and graphic applications. Implements design standards and styles that ensure a high level of design and coding efficiency consistent with current standards. Designs HTML templates and supporting graphics that are consistent with company design standards. Design graphical user interfaces for web-based applications on organization’s web sites. Creating content for External and Internal websites. Posting completed work using FTP and various publishing software. Investigates web and app issues and coordinates resolutions with web team. Monitors and reports web statistics and makes recommendations to manager to improve visibility and usability of web site. Oversees implementation of major site-wide upgrades. Maintains technical expertise in web design tools and acts as technical resource for web related software. Must have experience with current CMS versions of Drupal and WordPress technologies. Participates in regular meeting related to web and app content and development. Assist other members of the department with Clinic related issues and helpdesk issues when required. REQUIREMENTS/QUALIFICATIONS: A degree or diploma from a recognized post-secondary institution in a field related to computer programming technology. 3+ Years of experience with PHP , JavaScript, HTML5, CSS, jQuery, AJAX, XML, JSON/REST API’s, NodeJS 3+ Years of experience with Frameworks such as WordPress, Drupal, Symfony. Knowledge of languages such as C+ and Perl is advantageous. 3+ years - strong experience with MySQL & MSSQL . Must have experience with Adobe Photoshop. Comfortable with Google Play Store and iTunes Connect Create Android and iOS Application based on UI/UX Experience with source and version control Git & GitHub. Front and Back end web design experience. Experience working with E-commerce platforms. Advanced understanding of responsive web design. Proficiency in Linux & Windows environments. Web performance optimization such as Google Analytics SEO and SEM experience as asset. Nice to haves: Knowledge of UNIX systems and related commands. Some knowledge of Networking, Active Directory, VM Technology) Ability to work independently and efficiently complete tasks. Good communication skills, interpersonal and writing skills. Clearly and politely, communicate with customers. Enjoys helping people. Ability to organize and manage multiple priorities.
Title: Web Developer/Designer

Job_Description: Informco is seeking a Microsoft Web/App Developer with the following: Experience: Strong application designer/developer with front-end UX/UI experience. .NET web services and MS SQL database development experience. B2B and B2C eCommerce solutions and an understanding of the related workflows and data. JavaScript, HTML/CSS, XML, AJAX libraries like AJAX.NET and JQuery. Nice to have: Variable data processing and document composition tools including manipulation of PDFs and postscript files. Exposure to a transaction processing environments such as invoices, statements, tax slips, policy or cheque processing. Familiarity with virtualization and network management. An appreciation for mainframe environments and data structures in addition to OOP. Job Requirements: Bachelor's degree or higher in an area of technology study. 3+ yrs experience. Join our team on a contract-to-permanent basis (initial 3 month contract) You Need to Take the Next Step The pace is fast, the client expectations are high and the work is highly varied. If you can thrive in this kind of environment, and are interested in developing new and innovative products and services for our clients, submit your resume and a cover letter outlining how your skills fit with our needs to itcareers@informco.com.
Title: Microsoft Web/App Developer

Job_Description: Adecco Technologies est présentement à la recherche d'un Intégrateur Front-End / Designer UX-UI qui soit en mesure de comprendre les besoins de clients, des utilisateurs et des possibilités du logiciel, pour concevoir le fonctionnement de nos logiciels de personnalisation de produits. Celui-ci aura une participation active au sein de l'équipe de développement en effectuant l'intégration de ses réalisations en ce qui a trait au design de l'interface (icônes, couleurs, etc.) avec LESS. Une compréhension de base du développement de logiciels est donc requise pour permettre au concepteur d'être agile, et pouvoir ajuster l'expérience à mesure que l'information est disponible.  Notre application est développée avec AngularJS, TypeScript et LESS. Elle fonctionne sur tous les OS majeurs, et s'adapte intelligemment aux résolutions de téléphones intelligents, de tablettes et de PC (responsive design). C'est une application très riche, et qui présente de grands défis dans sa conception.  Évoluant dans un cadre de développement Agile, utilisant la méthode Scrum, nous cherchons constamment à améliorer nos pratiques et nos outils de travail afin d'assurer la qualité et l'efficacité de ce que nous développons.  Responsabilités " Conception de l'expérience utilisateur (UX). " Conception d'interfaces utilisateurs (UI). " Intégration des designs (CSS) des applications. " Veille de la compétition et des tendances (bonnes pratiques). " Conception de maquettes et prototypes. " Travailler étroitement avec le propriétaire de produit (P.O.) à l'élaboration et la maintenance du carnet de produit (Backlog). " Contacter les clients et les parties prenantes internes (ventes, marketing, affaires…) pour valider les hypothèses et comprendre les besoins. " Participation à la planification et à l'implémentation des fonctionnalités (développement dans une équipe multidisciplinaire). " Participation à l'accumulation de statistiques (analytics) et l'analyse de l'expérience utilisateur. " Tests des hypothèses et de l'application avec les utilisateurs (en personne et par des outils). " Conception et maintenance d'un guide des styles (style guide). ? Expérience " Requis : Maîtrise de CSS et LESS " Requis : Création de maquettes/prototypes " Requis : Design d'interfaces utilisateurs " Requis : Maîtrise de Photoshop, Illustrator (ou équivalent) " Requis : Expérience dans le domaine du développement logiciel " Requis : Être un joueur d'équipe " Requis : Autonomie et sens de l'organisation " Atout : Utilisation de GIT " Atout : Développement web (HTML5, JavaScript, Angular) " Atout : Maîtrise d'Axure (ou équivalent) " Atout : Expérience avec le développement dans un cadre Agile " Atout : Connaissance et expérience avec le LEAN UX
Title: Intégrateur Front-End / Designer UX-UI à Montréal

Job_Description: Adbank is looking for a UX, UI Designer / Front End Developer to join our blockchain team in the heart of Collingwood! The Front End Developer / Designer will be passionate about web technology, web design and collaborating with an agile team to create a brand enhancing and business goal optimized web experience for adbank.network. This position will focus on front end development, as well as collaborate on front end design and UX. The Front End Developer / Designer will provide leadership for our front end technology stack, communicate standards, and ensure that the vision of the Adbank brand comes alive. This is an opportunity to make an impact, and to ultimately help create the future of Adbank. SCOPE AND RESPONSIBILITIES: Deliver best-in-class HTML5/CSS3/JavaScript/ES6/Nodejs front end code for use within a responsive framework across mobile, tablet and desktop devices to meet or exceed digital business goals. Rapid prototyping, development and deployment of new or updated UI elements. Development support for A/B tests to continually optimize conversion rates, overall site and/or campaign performance. Develop, test and troubleshoot across multiple browsers, platforms and devices, including tablets and smartphones, to support a consistent and positive customer experience. Partner with web design to continually refine and document front-end development best practices that will smoothly integrate with back-end technology. Collaborate with digital designers, marketing analysts, web analysts and business leaders to help guide strategy and user-centric design. We are looking for smart, passionate engineers/thinkers/creators to take up new challenges.  As a Front-End Developer, you will be responsible for all front-end architecture/implementation, and be a key player across all areas of the engineering life cycle, including eliciting requirements from customers, defining the feature with UI designers and product managers, building the experience by writing the code, shipping it with quality and on time, and sustaining it through its maturity. Duties/Responsibilities   Build modern front-end solution with best practices Build reusable front-end code and libraries for future use Ensure the technical feasibility of proposed UI/UX designs Participate in stress tests, load tests, performance tests, making recommendations to improve performance and scalability Prepare software packages and documentation for deployment that adhere to the defined standard deployment policies Be highly responsive to critical production issues providing timely and effective solutions Collaborate and help team members in the development life cycle  Required Skills & Experience   At least 4 years of hands on experience in front end web development Deep experience with front-end architecture, packing, best practices, dev process Deep experience with JavaScript and JavaScript frameworks, e.g. jQuery, ReactJs, Node.js, KnockoutJS, BackboneJS, etc. Up to date knowledge of current Web UI best practices and usability concepts Expert level (or at least) strong working knowledge of current HTML/CSS Extensive understanding of asynchronous AJAX processes, communication with back-end via WebAPI/json Extensive understanding of web security Extensive understanding of front-end routing Deep experience with DOM - Knowledge of design patterns (MVC, Strategy, Factory, Singleton) and general design considerations Excellent communication (verbal/written) including the ability to distill technical details into human terms  Nice-to-Haves   Previous development experience using SQL server Previous development experience using NoSQL databases (e.g. Cassandra, Mongo DB, Couch DB) Experience with UI automated testing frameworks (e.g. Selenium, Karma, Protractor) Experience with Cloud like: Azure, AWS

Job_Description: Cyber attacks and data breaches are now a huge threat to the bottom line of small and medium-sized enterprises (SME). Organizations need to have cybersecurity practices in place and demonstrate that they are strictly followed. If they don’t they are at risk of losing valuable business opportunities, or worse, witnessing the massive damage a breach can cause to their brand.  At Securicy our mission is to deliver a web-based platform that enables organizations to efficiently implement, maintain and demonstrate that they have strong cybersecurity practices in place. Our success is in building tools to provide services that help our clients be successful. Joining Securicy means that you are walking into a company that values open and honest communication as well as fresh perspectives and different backgrounds. If you’re the type of person who has a desire to solve problems, share your ideas, and deliver results you will feel at home with Securicy. We are looking for a Front End Web Developer who is motivated to combine the art of design with the art of programming. Responsibilities will include implementing visual elements and their behaviours with user interactions. You will work with our UX designer and team of developers to build client-side logic for all Securicy products. You will also be bridging the gap between the visual elements and the server-side infrastructure and taking an active role on both sides.  Responsibilities include but are not limited to:  Develop new user-facing features Translate UX/UI wireframes into visual elements Build reusable code and libraries for future use Ensure the technical feasibility of UI/UX designs Optimize applications for maximum speed and scalability Assure that all user input is validated before submitting to back-end services Develop and utilise unit tests (CICD) Collaborate with other team members and stakeholders   Skills and Qualifications  Strong understanding of JavaScript and ES6 as well as their quirks and workarounds Strong understanding of web markup, including HTML5 and CSS3 Strong understanding of source versioning tools, such as Git Good understanding of Ruby and Ruby on Rails Good understanding of RSpec Good understanding of jQuery, Bootstrap Good understanding of asynchronous request handling, partial page updates, and AJAX Proficient understanding of cross-browser compatibility issues and ways to work around such issues Familiarity with front-end build tools, such as Grunt and Gulp Good understanding of browser rendering behaviour and performance We’re looking for someone who is  A strong team player Passionate and focused on customer needs and the user-experience Thoughtful, fast, and disciplined in their execution Committed to continuous improvement Relentless in their drive to win
Title: Front-End Developer
