Job_Description: WHO WE ARE: Founded in 2017, Petradise values the support of the sharing economy to build the pet industry into one community, and assist local and individual businesses expand. As an online website and application platform, Petradise aims to connect local groomers and sitters with pet-owners, who are looking for safe, excellent, trustworthy care for their furry friends.If you value human’s best friend as much as we do, be our UX Senior Designerto lead in the development of our design.WHAT YOU'LL DO: Work with the user experience and interface designers, researchers, product and content managers to understand the users’ needs and behavior for the industries in which they work.Ensure that designs are technically feasible and comprehensible.Create and deliver high-level crafted, polished products from initial concept to product.Review and critique the website designs of a versatile, skilled design team to ensure effective and vivid designs for the website and function.Participate and lead UX/UI activities such as user/design research, interviews, workshops, and demos.Develop user experience resources from scratch, such as streamlined scenarios, storyboards, information structure, wireframes, flows and interactive prototypes.Analyze the research and findings; find and discover the essential problems in user experiences, and identify the relevant problems to solve.Deliver ideas clearly and quickly to the various teamsVerbally and visually deliver information using a variety of options (paper/pen to clickable templates, mock-ups).Testing and working closely with users through prototypes, alpha/beta versions, published the product, while participating in the critique of the design.Balancing a high-standard of performance and quality results, while bringing in a team-first, fun mindset.WHO YOU ARE: Product portfolio that doesn’t only show polished work — we want to see work in-progress that illustrates (show your sketches, tests, and iterations) your involvement throughout the project process. Preferably, any recent work that displays product design with operational user systems.BA or equivalent education from a design or tech program.5+ years of experiencein UX design role, user research and user interface (UI) design for mobile and desktop web app.Advanced knowledge and proficient with various UX/UI tools, applications and platforms such as Adobe Creative Suite, Sketch, AE, Flinto, etc. for wireframing/prototyping designs.Experience mentoring and teaching junior designers.Ability to communicate technical concepts to technical and non-technical audiences at various levels of the organization.Capable of translating designs across all devices and screen sizes.Experience with how content strategy relates to design layout and interaction.Expert knowledge of current design, patterns and trends, different perspectives to industry and competitor strategies, and proactive in problem-solving.Able to translate complex information into user-friendly designs.Comfortable in receiving and giving constructive criticism to peers.IT WOULD BE REALLY COOL IF YOU HAD : Experience designing interfaces for physical product outside of mobile web and desktop.Familiar with shared economy companies/businesses.Knowledge of consumer psychology/behavior.BENEFITS: Competitive compensationStock optionsCompetitive benefits package (medical, dental, vision, and life insurance)Gym membership (if needed)Regular team activities including happy hours, game nights, and moreHoliday payPaid time offOffice located downtown Vancouver, easily accessible via transit.Sound like you? We’d love to hear from you, so please apply now with a resume and portfolio that demonstrates what's listed above.We thank everyone that applies, but only those shortlisted will be contacted to move forward in the process.Job Type: Full-timeExperience:UX Design: 3 yearsLocation:Vancouver, BC
Title: Senior UX Designer

Job_Description: Product Design Lead / Digital Creative Director (Digital Customer Experience & Design Team)  What is the opportunity? We’re looking for a Creative Director / Digital Product Design Lead with strong leadership qualities that will be responsible for managing and directing design operations to define, ideate and execute a specific RBC digital product. As product design lead, you will be a hub of activity; you will collaborate with leaders across multiple disciplines and lines of business, manage stakeholder requirements and expectations, drive design activities with your dedicated design team while always upholding design as a problem-solving discipline that brings measurable value to the business. You will influence stakeholders to remove subjectivity and make better product decisions by gathering evidence to gain insights through research and testing with users, and you will champion the users’ needs and represent those needs in all your conversations. You understand the end-to-end product design lifecycle, and can manage the entire process while leaning heavily on your team of designers. You will coordinate efforts with delivery, PMO, QA and Development, bringing your considerable experience in Waterfall and/or Agile methods to meet requirements and deadlines while fostering a culture of Design Thinking, learning and innovation with all stakeholders.  As a member of the design team, you will collaborate with other product design leads to find a shared vision and common goals, and uncover repeatable and predictable processes and outcomes. You will work collaboratively with the Frameworks team to document and disseminate UI patterns and elements to ensure scalable design solutions, a cohesive experience across all RBC products and coherent approach to operationalizing RBC design standards. You want to work for Canada’s most valuable brand, but you’re realistic about the challenges and complexity involved with working in a matrixed enterprise environment. You’re professionally mature and you understand the need to play a long game to create a design culture at RBC we can solve problems for the bank and for the millions of Canadians who use RBC digital products every day.  What will you do? Manage, motivate and provide mentorship to the design team; become engaged with career development of the team Represent the design practice with product teams; provide Design Thinking thought leadership; challenge and refine Agile workflow Spearhead multiple and numerous simultaneous activities pertaining to design definition, execution and delivery of the “right” product Conduct just enough research to collect evidence to effectively minimize subjective decision-making by putting the user at the centre Collaborate with the Design Practice, Product Team, Delivery, PMO, Development, LOBs, and other critical stakeholders to coordinate efforts Participate in planning product roadmap to articulate a broad narrative with other PDLs around all RBC products to align experiences across products and LOBs Participate in the definition of overarching strategies while championing the users’ needs to achieve business goals and support the RBC brand Share knowledge, provide accept critiques and feedback, participate in regular collaboration sessions with the larger team of Product Design Leads  What do you need to succeed? Must-have 10+ years of experience in Digital Product Design or related field - 5+ years of people management experience BA/BS in Design (e.g. interaction, graphic, visual communications, product, industrial), HCI, CS, or equivalent work experience; Portfolio review of best-in-class product design is mandatory Experience managing small to medium teams of designers, ability to identify the right expertise needed, experience assigning resources, recruiting new team members and providing mentorship and direction to help grow their careers Multidisciplinary approach; Broad experience in user-centred design and Design Thinking methods; Experience facilitating collaborative workshops; Ability to communicate conceptual ideas and design rationale grounded in evidence-based decisions Facility with User testing and User Research; Ability to leverage strategic learnings to shape product definition and product roadmaps; Keen interest in workshopping workflow to eliminate subjectivity to find repeatable and predictable methods and outcomes Strong interpersonal, presentation and communication skills; Leadership mentality with ability to manage stakeholders to uphold the value that design brings to product design at every stage of the product design lifecycle  Nice-to-have Industry vertical expertise is preferred; Experience working in Agile workflow in a Lean UX mindset is an asset Experience working in a matrixed, Enterprise environment dealing with those specific challenges is an asset  What’s in it for you? We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual. Comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities Ability to make a difference and lasting impact Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team Opportunities to take on progressively greater accountabilities  SFDG  About RBC Royal Bank of Canada is Canada’s largest bank, and one of the largest banks in the world, based on market capitalization. We are one of North America’s leading diversified financial services companies, and provide personal and commercial banking, wealth management, insurance, investor services and capital markets products and services on a global basis. We have over 80,000 full- and part-time employees who serve more than 16 million personal, business, public sector and institutional clients through offices in Canada, the U.S. and 37 other countries. For more information, please visit rbc.com .  Get Career Alerts Stay in-the-know about great career opportunities at RBC. Sign up for Career Alerts and get customized info on our latest jobs, career tips and Recruitment events that matter to you. Expand your limits and create a new future together at RBC. Find out how we use our passion and drive to enhance the well-being of our clients and communities at rbc.com/careers .  Inclusion and Equal Opportunity Employment RBC is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We are pleased to consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veterans status, Aboriginal/Native American status or any other legally-protected factors. Disability-related accommodations during the application process are available upon request.  JOB SUMMARY City: Toronto Address: 88 Queens Quay W Work Hours/Week: 37.5 Work Environment: Office Employment Type: Permanent Career Level: Experienced Hire/Professional Pay Type: Salary + Variable Bonus Required Travel (%): 0 Exempt/Non-Exempt: N/A People Manager: Yes Application Deadline: 2018-06-30 Req ID: 163492 Posting Notes: [[mfield1]]
Title: Product Design Lead

Job_Description: Nous valorisons la diversité et avons à cœur de créer un milieu de travail inclusif qui nous inspire tous à donner le meilleur de nous-mêmes. Joignez-vous à notre équipe et faites une différence!  Votre poste  Nous Comment imaginez-vous les bureaux d’une compagnie d’assurance? Et l’atmosphère de travail qui y règne? Nous gageons que si vous passez nous voir au Lab de Intact, vous serez très surpris! Situé au centre-ville de Montréal, nous sommes un laboratoire d’innovation dont la mission est de créer des produits à la fine-pointe de l’insurtech qui améliorent la vie de millions de Canadiens.  Mariant la convivialité et la vélocité d’une startup aux ressources et aux moyens d’une grande entreprise (vous disposerez de tous les outils dont vous avez toujours rêvé!), le Lab est un environnement jeune et dynamique, offrant des défis stimulants, des collègues inspirants et une carrière passionnante (chez un des top 100 employeurs au Canada). C’est l’endroit idéal pour parfaire vos compétences et faire évoluer votre carrière.  Vous Vous êtes passionné par le commerce électronique et l’innovation numérique? Vous avez un talent particulier pour traduire des exigences complexes en expériences utiles et agréables? Vous restez à l’affût des dernières tendances en matière de design et vous aimez expérimenter de nouveaux outils et de nouvelles méthodologies? Nous avons l’occasion parfaite pour vous!  Rôle À titre de designer UX/UI, vous jouerez un rôle essentiel dans la conception et l’évolution de notre écosystème numérique. Relevant du directeur principal, Innovations numériques, vous aurez comme principales responsabilités :  Concevoir des expériences captivantes en vue de réaliser les objectifs d’affaires  Valider la fonctionnalité et l’utilité par l’entremise de tests et de recherches auprès des utilisateurs  Produire des livrables UX et design pertinents au besoin  Piloter une feuille de route aux côté d’un directeur de produit et d’une équipe agile multidisciplinaire  Présenter le travail aux parties prenantes  Aider les ingénieurs à produire des interfaces de qualité et agréables  Prôner une conception axée sur l’utilisateur et les données  Vos compétences  Minimum trois années d’expérience  Expertise en matière de convivialité et de pratiques de conception centrées sur l'utilisateur  Maîtrise des outils de conception (Sketch, Axure, InVision, Illustrator, etc.)  Expérience des outils de recherche UX (usertesting.com, Optimal Workshop, etc.) un atout  Expérience dans la production de flux de processus, d’inventaires de contenu, etc.  Vous aimez travailler dans un environnement de collaboration qui accorde une importance primordiale au travail d’équipe, à l’innovation, à l’ouverture d’esprit et au plaisir  Veuillez inclure votre portfolio dans votre dossier de candidature.  Vous êtes  Une personne avec qui il est agréable de travailler  Créatif, analytique, curieux et ingénieux  Un joueur d’équipe capable de partager et recevoir des commentaires constructifs  Excellent pour expliquer vos idées à différents intervenants  Profondément passionné par le design et la qualité  Organisé et proactif  En tant que salarié temps plein, vous bénéficierez des avantages suivants :  Un salaire compétitif  Un boni de performance annuel  Un régime de retraite  Un horaire de travail flexible de 35 heures par semaine  Des assurances médicales et dentaires hors pair  Et plusieurs autres avantages et bénéfices (remboursement gym, conférences, etc.)  Énoncé fermeture  Cette opportunité vous intéresse? Nous avons très hâte de faire votre connaissance!  D’excellents avantages sont offerts : salaire concurrentiel, avantages flexibles, aménagements de travail flexibles, congés mobiles, régime de retraite à prestation déterminée, etc.  Dans le cadre du processus de sélection d’Intact, les candidats peuvent être appelés à donner leur consentement à une vérification de leurs antécédents pertinente au poste à pourvoir avant de recevoir une offre d’emploi. Celle-ci peut comprendre une confirmation des références d’emploi, des études et des titres de compétences, une vérification des emplois, de l’identité, des infractions criminelles et du permis de conduire ainsi qu’un rapport de crédit.  Vous pouvez soumettre votre candidature à un emploi affiché pourvu que vous occupiez vos fonctions actuelles depuis au moins douze mois et que votre performance soit jugée bonne ou que votre contrat temporaire arrive à son échéance. Une recherche de talents à l'externe est menée parallèlement au recrutement à l'interne Veuillez donc prendre note que des candidats potentiels pourraient avoir été identifiés pour ce poste dans le cadre de leur plan de développement.   Veuillez noter que l'usage du masculin a comme but d'alléger le texte.  Cet affichage prendra fin 02 juin 2018.  Prime de recommandation  CE POSTE EST SUJET À UNE PRIME DE RECOMMANDATION DE 3000$.  #li-qc  Droit de travailler au Canada  Les personnes qui posent leur candidature à un poste permanent doivent, dès leur embauche, avoir le droit de travailler au Canada de façon permanente. Les documents pouvant servir de preuve dans le cas des rôles permanents sont un certificat de naissance canadien, un passeport canadien, un certificat de citoyenneté canadienne, une carte de résident permanent ou une confirmation de son statut de résident permanent pour prouver qu’il a le droit de travailler au Canada. Job_Description: Navigator Marketingis an award-winning, full-service marketing agency that provides cutting-edge marketing strategy that produce results. We work with companies all over North America.Services: Web Design, Mobile Web Design, Monthly Marketing Strategy & Implementation, Social Media Management.Our Mission: Helping business owners grow their businesses from where they are now to where they want them to be.How We Do This: We increase a business' PROFILE, LEADS & SALES. We are a fun, talented & driven team who work at the intersection technology and consumer behaviour generating sales.Position Description: We are looking for an amazing & fun Web & UI/UX Developerto add to our team to assist with designing, coding and modifying websites, from layout to function. This person will strive to create visually appealing sites that feature user-friendly design and clear navigation. This person will also work closely with our designers & team members to execute & bring to life new ideas & projects in a team approach.The successful candidate will also be working on keeping websites up to date, landing pages, mobile optimization, analytics and much more. These tasks will require you to be comfortable and efficient with Google Developer Tools, and coding in HTML5, CSS, Javascript and PHP.We are looking for someone with minimum of one year experience in the field who can hit the ground running. Training will be minimal as we need someone to help us out immediately with our current projects. You should enjoy solving problems independently and keeping up to date with the newest trends.Qualifications: Amazing attention to detail.Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator skills an asset.HTML(5), CSS, JavaScript + jQuery, PHP .Setting up WordPress websites from scratch, working with plugins & some ecommerce.Familiarity with cPanel, Server / IT knowledge an asset.Experience with media queries and building responsive websites.Excellent at solving the challenges of cross browser rendering (desktop [IE, FF, Chrome, Safari] and mobile [iOS, Android])Ability to write iOS applications is an asset.Great problem solving skills.Additional Information: Key TraitsYou are passionate and love what you do.Work well under pressureAble to move from project to project quicklyGreat memory skillsExcellent communications skills.Strong analytical and problem solving skills.Superior teamwork and interpersonal skills.Strong organizational, prioritization, time management skills & work well under pressure.The ability to effectively handle multiple tasks and projects and to meet deadlines.Your upbeat & enthusiastic! Attitude is everything with us. We are a fun quirky group, but we love to work at what we do!EducationA college or university diploma/degree in something related is preferred.Also open to applicants who can demonstrate an amazing knowledge & Do-it-yourself spirit.Job Type: FreelanceJob Type: Freelance
Title: Wordpress Web Designer - Virtual 20 hours/week

Job_Description: Travailler chez Genius Solutions c'est : Joindre une équipe passionnée et dynamique qui a à cœur le succès de l’entreprise. C’est également joindre une entreprise en constante évolution dans un environnement stimulant et dans un marché hautement compétitif .Vous avez de l’intérêt à travailler chez Genius? Assurez-vous de vous reconnaitre dans les valeurs de l’entreprise :Vous êtes énergique et passionné : pour atteindre le succès, nous avons besoin de gens avec une énergie débordante démontrant une passion pour leur travail.Vous êtes en mission : les défis sont grands pour nous et nos clients et nous devons faire face à plusieurs obstacles. Pour mener à bien notre mission, il est essentiel de garder le cap!Vous êtes un bon joueur d’équipe : nous croyons fermement que le respect et la confiance sont des ingrédients essentiels au succès.Vous valorisez la connaissance et l’expertise : Genius valorise grandement les gens qui veulent progresser, acquérir de nouvelles connaissances et développer leur expertise.Vous vous reconnaissez dans les valeurs de la compagnie? Oui?Continuons!Designer UX / UI chez Genius Solutions : Nous recherchons actuellement un designer UX/UI . Cette personne aura comme principale fonction la conception de l’interface utilisateur de la prochaine version web de notre application, Genius Manufacturing . La personne sélectionnée devra analyser l’expérience client actuelle, proposer des améliorations et présenter des concepts de maquettes (mockup). Elle devra également accompagner l’équipe de développement informatique tout au long du projet.Les tâches et responsabilités : Effectuer une analyse et une prise de besoins (clients et experts internes)Étudier et analyser les produits et tendances sur le marchéÉtablir des plans et concepts afin de les présenter au comité responsableDévelopper et documenter les outils qui seront utilisés à l’interneOffrir de formation et coaching à notre équipeConnaissances et profil recherchés : Expérience en design d’application web spécialiséeExpérience UX / UI3 à 5 années d’expérience pertinentesMaitrise des logiciels de maquettes (mockup)Niveau avancé de maitrise de la langue anglaise (parlé et écrit)Aimer travailler en mode agileConnaissance de logiciel de type ERP serait un atout importantConditions de travail : Une super équipeUn salaire compétitifUn horaire de travail flexibleVacances + 5 congés payés par annéeDes assurances collectivesDes activités socialesEt bien plus...Lieu de travail : QuébecMots clés : Web – Migration – Développement – Interface – Utilisateur – Expérience client – Mockup – Besoin – Designer – Amélioration – Analyse – ERP – Application – Logiciel – Navigation – Agile – Ergonomie – Graphique – Normes – Livrables – Architecture – Interaction – Interactivité – Solution – Numérique – Mobile – Utilisateur – Visuel – CréativitéType d'emploi : Temps Plein
Title: Designer UX / UI

Job_Description: Position Overview: The role of the web UX & UI designer & developer is to create the user experience vision and successfully develop, monitor and improve users’ overall experience when they visit our websites. The individual should have the skills and knowledge to create memorable experiences that are true to the brand while balancing seamless interactivity, ease of navigation and conversion.Reporting to the Director, Marketing & Communications, the Web UX& UI Designerwill be the champion of the users’ needs, and create intuitive user experiences and interface designs. The role will be responsible for the end-to-end online construction, maintenance and experience for: TPH.ca, RHGroup.ca, RGStore.ca, TheGlobeRestaurant.ca, the Intranet, and others as required.The UX & UI Designer will create wireframes and storyboards that map the customer journey, user flows, process flows, information architecture, site maps, porotypes and A/B testing to effectively communicate interaction and design ideas & design each screen or page with which a user interacts.The ideal candidate should have an eye for clean design, possess superior UI & UX skills and be able to translate stakeholder requirements into logical interaction flows and a user interface that is intuitive, visually stimulating and converts.Responsibilities: Be guided by human-centric design by identifying user needs, and leveraging those insights to guide you through the design and testing processesUnderstand the research methods and approaches to recognize and deconstruct the expectation of our usersEstablish design best practices and guidelines through creation of conceptual campaigns and design of a great visual identity and cohesive style-guide ensuring that a consistent design language is applied across sites incorporating logo, corporate colours, typographic rules, etc.Maintaining consistency in visual elements and defining behaviorCreate website that are designed and optimized for all screen sizes (including mobile, tablet, and desktop) with a mobile-first mentality, with specific technologies and platforms in mindLead conversations to facilitate conceptual thinking that takes stakeholder considerations into the processCreate clickable prototypes in Testing of websites and that effortlessly lets the users accomplish their goalsOther duties and responsibilities as assignedQualifications: 3-5 years of proven web designer experienceDemonstrable UI & UX design skills with a strong portfolioSolid experience in creating wireframes and storyboards, user flows, process flows, information architecture, site maps, prototypes and A/B testing to effectively communicate interaction and design ideas & design each screen or page with which a user interactsExperience working with a .Net CMS and e-commerce, knowledge of DotNetNuke (DNN) is preferredProficiency in Creative Design Software (specifically Photoshop, Illustrator, and other visual design and wire-framing tools)Proficiency in: HTML, CSS, JavaScript and JQuery, Media Queries/Bootstrap, Version Control (SVN)Explore various usability testing methods to help inform and optimize designs to create more effective experiencesUnderstand on-page, off-page and technical SEO practices and how to best implement these strategies on the websitesImplement Google Analytics, Tag Manager and Optimize to apply fundamental concepts like performance measurement, comparison and optimization.Experience providing feedback on designer performance, and identifying improvement opportunitiesAbility to present your designs and sell your solutions to various stakeholdersAbility to solve problems creatively and effectivelyUp-to-date with the latest UI trends, techniques, and technologiesExperience working in an Agile/Scrum development processExcellent communication skills and the ability to multi-task, and work well under pressure while juggling several competing prioritiesJob Type: Full-timeExperience:.Net: 1 yearAdobe Creative Suite: 1 yearWeb Design: 3 yearsLocation:Toronto, ON
Title: Web UX & UI Designer

Job_Description: Join Windsor's most innovative, fun and Silicon-Valley-esque development and innovation company, bringing world-class projects to Windsor. Help us build exciting technology like multiplayer game servers for Atari, social apps for Puma, high profile analytics engines for The PGA Tour, and cutting edge products like natural-language-processing chat-bots.As one of Windsor's most sought-after companies to work for, we offer flexible time, work-at-home days, a great benefits plan and in-office massage. We are located in the heart of Windsor's historic Walkerville. You must be willing to work in our office. We are not interested in off-shore or remote work.We are seeking talented interface designers who are looking to grow professionally and personally within a fast-growing company. You will work on a variety of marketing deliverables, including websites, prototypes, wireframes, business collateral and other design pieces.ResponsibilitiesWork on the design of user interfaces for web and mobile projectsAble to help with wireframing using tools like Adobe XD and BalsamiqAble to self-direct and work independently, to manage multiple, concurrent projects simultaneously from start to finishRequirements: Expertise in Adobe Creative Suite: Illustrator, Photoshop, InDesign, After Effects, EdgeKnowledge of responsive web designAbility to create interactive prototypesCustomer-obsessed, detail-oriented and comfortable working on highly technical teamsDemonstrated experience with building user interfaces across a range of platforms including desktop and mobile--- Please send examples of your design portfolio (specifically web design) when you apply. ---We look forward to meeting you!Job Type: Full-timeEducation:High school or equivalentLocation:Windsor, ON
Title: Web Designer / UI / UX

Title: Designer UX/UI

Job_Description: WHO WE ARE: Founded in 2017, Petradise values the support of the sharing economy to build the pet industry into one community, and assist local and individual businesses expand. As an online website and application platform, Petradise aims to connect local groomers and sitters with pet-owners, who are looking for safe, excellent, trustworthy care for their furry friends.If you value human’s best friend as much as we do, be our UX Senior Designerto lead in the development of our design.WHAT YOU'LL DO: Work with the user experience and interface designers, researchers, product and content managers to understand the users’ needs and behavior for the industries in which they work.Ensure that designs are technically feasible and comprehensible.Create and deliver high-level crafted, polished products from initial concept to product.Review and critique the website designs of a versatile, skilled design team to ensure effective and vivid designs for the website and function.Participate and lead UX/UI activities such as user/design research, interviews, workshops, and demos.Develop user experience resources from scratch, such as streamlined scenarios, storyboards, information structure, wireframes, flows and interactive prototypes.Analyze the research and findings; find and discover the essential problems in user experiences, and identify the relevant problems to solve.Deliver ideas clearly and quickly to the various teamsVerbally and visually deliver information using a variety of options (paper/pen to clickable templates, mock-ups).Testing and working closely with users through prototypes, alpha/beta versions, published the product, while participating in the critique of the design.Balancing a high-standard of performance and quality results, while bringing in a team-first, fun mindset.WHO YOU ARE: Product portfolio that doesn’t only show polished work — we want to see work in-progress that illustrates (show your sketches, tests, and iterations) your involvement throughout the project process. Preferably, any recent work that displays product design with operational user systems.BA or equivalent education from a design or tech program.5+ years of experiencein UX design role, user research and user interface (UI) design for mobile and desktop web app.Advanced knowledge and proficient with various UX/UI tools, applications and platforms such as Adobe Creative Suite, Sketch, AE, Flinto, etc. for wireframing/prototyping designs.Experience mentoring and teaching junior designers.Ability to communicate technical concepts to technical and non-technical audiences at various levels of the organization.Capable of translating designs across all devices and screen sizes.Experience with how content strategy relates to design layout and interaction.Expert knowledge of current design, patterns and trends, different perspectives to industry and competitor strategies, and proactive in problem-solving.Able to translate complex information into user-friendly designs.Comfortable in receiving and giving constructive criticism to peers.IT WOULD BE REALLY COOL IF YOU HAD : Experience designing interfaces for physical product outside of mobile web and desktop.Familiar with shared economy companies/businesses.Knowledge of consumer psychology/behavior.BENEFITS: Competitive compensationStock optionsCompetitive benefits package (medical, dental, vision, and life insurance)Gym membership (if needed)Regular team activities including happy hours, game nights, and moreHoliday payPaid time offOffice located downtown Vancouver, easily accessible via transit.Sound like you? We’d love to hear from you, so please apply now with a resume and portfolio that demonstrates what's listed above.We thank everyone that applies, but only those shortlisted will be contacted to move forward in the process.Job Type: Full-timeExperience:UX Design: 3 yearsLocation:Vancouver, BC
Title: Senior UX Designer

Job_Description: Product Design Lead / Digital Creative Director (Digital Customer Experience & Design Team)  What is the opportunity? We’re looking for a Creative Director / Digital Product Design Lead with strong leadership qualities that will be responsible for managing and directing design operations to define, ideate and execute a specific RBC digital product. As product design lead, you will be a hub of activity; you will collaborate with leaders across multiple disciplines and lines of business, manage stakeholder requirements and expectations, drive design activities with your dedicated design team while always upholding design as a problem-solving discipline that brings measurable value to the business. You will influence stakeholders to remove subjectivity and make better product decisions by gathering evidence to gain insights through research and testing with users, and you will champion the users’ needs and represent those needs in all your conversations. You understand the end-to-end product design lifecycle, and can manage the entire process while leaning heavily on your team of designers. You will coordinate efforts with delivery, PMO, QA and Development, bringing your considerable experience in Waterfall and/or Agile methods to meet requirements and deadlines while fostering a culture of Design Thinking, learning and innovation with all stakeholders.  As a member of the design team, you will collaborate with other product design leads to find a shared vision and common goals, and uncover repeatable and predictable processes and outcomes. You will work collaboratively with the Frameworks team to document and disseminate UI patterns and elements to ensure scalable design solutions, a cohesive experience across all RBC products and coherent approach to operationalizing RBC design standards. You want to work for Canada’s most valuable brand, but you’re realistic about the challenges and complexity involved with working in a matrixed enterprise environment. You’re professionally mature and you understand the need to play a long game to create a design culture at RBC we can solve problems for the bank and for the millions of Canadians who use RBC digital products every day.  What will you do? Manage, motivate and provide mentorship to the design team; become engaged with career development of the team Represent the design practice with product teams; provide Design Thinking thought leadership; challenge and refine Agile workflow Spearhead multiple and numerous simultaneous activities pertaining to design definition, execution and delivery of the “right” product Conduct just enough research to collect evidence to effectively minimize subjective decision-making by putting the user at the centre Collaborate with the Design Practice, Product Team, Delivery, PMO, Development, LOBs, and other critical stakeholders to coordinate efforts Participate in planning product roadmap to articulate a broad narrative with other PDLs around all RBC products to align experiences across products and LOBs Participate in the definition of overarching strategies while championing the users’ needs to achieve business goals and support the RBC brand Share knowledge, provide accept critiques and feedback, participate in regular collaboration sessions with the larger team of Product Design Leads  What do you need to succeed? Must-have 10+ years of experience in Digital Product Design or related field - 5+ years of people management experience BA/BS in Design (e.g. interaction, graphic, visual communications, product, industrial), HCI, CS, or equivalent work experience; Portfolio review of best-in-class product design is mandatory Experience managing small to medium teams of designers, ability to identify the right expertise needed, experience assigning resources, recruiting new team members and providing mentorship and direction to help grow their careers Multidisciplinary approach; Broad experience in user-centred design and Design Thinking methods; Experience facilitating collaborative workshops; Ability to communicate conceptual ideas and design rationale grounded in evidence-based decisions Facility with User testing and User Research; Ability to leverage strategic learnings to shape product definition and product roadmaps; Keen interest in workshopping workflow to eliminate subjectivity to find repeatable and predictable methods and outcomes Strong interpersonal, presentation and communication skills; Leadership mentality with ability to manage stakeholders to uphold the value that design brings to product design at every stage of the product design lifecycle  Nice-to-have Industry vertical expertise is preferred; Experience working in Agile workflow in a Lean UX mindset is an asset Experience working in a matrixed, Enterprise environment dealing with those specific challenges is an asset  What’s in it for you? We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual. Comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities Ability to make a difference and lasting impact Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team Opportunities to take on progressively greater accountabilities  SFDG  About RBC Royal Bank of Canada is Canada’s largest bank, and one of the largest banks in the world, based on market capitalization. We are one of North America’s leading diversified financial services companies, and provide personal and commercial banking, wealth management, insurance, investor services and capital markets products and services on a global basis. We have over 80,000 full- and part-time employees who serve more than 16 million personal, business, public sector and institutional clients through offices in Canada, the U.S. and 37 other countries. For more information, please visit rbc.com .  Get Career Alerts Stay in-the-know about great career opportunities at RBC. Sign up for Career Alerts and get customized info on our latest jobs, career tips and Recruitment events that matter to you. Expand your limits and create a new future together at RBC. Find out how we use our passion and drive to enhance the well-being of our clients and communities at rbc.com/careers .  Inclusion and Equal Opportunity Employment RBC is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We are pleased to consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veterans status, Aboriginal/Native American status or any other legally-protected factors. Disability-related accommodations during the application process are available upon request.  JOB SUMMARY City: Toronto Address: 88 Queens Quay W Work Hours/Week: 37.5 Work Environment: Office Employment Type: Permanent Career Level: Experienced Hire/Professional Pay Type: Salary + Variable Bonus Required Travel (%): 0 Exempt/Non-Exempt: N/A People Manager: Yes Application Deadline: 2018-06-30 Req ID: 163492 Posting Notes: [[mfield1]]
Title: Product Design Lead

Job_Description: Senior UX/UI Designer, Digital Experience Groupe Dynamite is a global fashion retailer with two brands at the heart of its success, Garage and Dynamite. We operate close to 400 stores in Canada and worldwide, and employ over 6,000 people. We have our roots planted firmly in the terrain of fashion’s retail landscape. As Canadian leaders in the international retail landscape, the Garage and Dynamite banners continue to stand out in an increasingly saturated market. Our passionate team continues to lead the expansion of the business in new markets, including E-commerce, while always leveraging our shared values. We are proud to hire and retain inspiring leaders, motivated by their desire to achieve great things and recognized for their entrepreneurial spirit. Role Summary: Reporting to the Digital Experience Product Owner, the Senior UX/UI Designer will be a key player driving the digital experience for Groupe Dynamite’s native iOS and Android mobile applications and web experiences (mobile, tablet, desktop). You will be mandated to enhance and protect the integrity of the customer’s experience and to ensure the highest level of consumer satisfaction.  You will work alongside top talent product managers and product owners, developers, architects, support engineers and business analysts to help shape the design of new and existing initiatives to reach their potential for one of our brands (Dynamite, Garage). Specifically, on top of driving some original projects, you will team up with the Product Owners to extract MVP from major strategic initiatives qualified by Marketing. This opportunity will position you as an early contributor to help shape a growing user experience practice within Groupe Dynamite. Our Senior UX/UI Designer needs to be able to solve problems, simplify complicated ideas, work within tight deadlines and understand the needs of the audience to ensure the final experience caters to the uniqueness of our target audience. Main Reponsabilities: User Experience: Contribute to the development of the UX/UI strategy for one of our banner’s digital initiatives; Translate business product vision into a cohesive user experience by reconciling user needs with business goals, technical capabilities and best practices in interaction design and usability; Extract MVP from major strategic initiatives and build associated roadmap; Participate in UI/UX brainstorming and working sessions with business stakeholders and the Marketing and Digital teams through the use of collaboration techniques, interactive prototypes, visual mock-ups and interface demos; Conduct research into competitor products and UX to identify opportunities in digital products and designs that provide a competitive edge; Understand and help identify key performance indicators to measure business value and return on investment of the developed products and features; Ensure compliance with external standards (e.g.: WCAG) and internal brand guidelines for use by product owners, brand teams, and IT departments.  Product development and enhancement Contribute to design development throughout the entire lifecycle, from initial explorations through final design deliverables; Push creativity, challenge established thinking, and discover new ways of solving a problem; Develop visual design prototypes ranging from compositions to interactive mock-ups; Effectively communicate design rationale to key stakeholders; Collaborate with cross-functional teams to create compelling visual designs of interactive experiences; Develop the visual interface specifications; Work closely with the Digital team to deliver the final product; Have a deep understanding of platform and device requirements such as form factors, screen resolutions, pixel density and aspect ratios.  Qualifications and competencies: Education (include professional designation) Bachelor's degree in Graphic Design, Communication Arts, Computer Science, or Human-computer Interaction (HCI), or at least five (5) years of related work experience as a Mobile User Interface Designer, Mobile User Interaction Designer or Mobile User Experience Designer.  Experience At least five (5) years of experience in mobile design, including mobile web and applications; An outstanding portfolio demonstrating the successful delivery of multiple innovative mobile and web interface design solutions for iOS and Android. Preferably in e-commerce space; A strong working knowledge of interaction design, user-centered experience design, brand identity management, digital marketing and the creative process; Demonstrated expert-level knowledge in mobile platforms (iOS and Android); Experience with mobile web commerce designs and best practices; Excellent visual design skills; attention to detail and a demonstrated mastery of typography, colour and layout; Experience and understanding of product management and the Agile process, namely Scrum and MVP; Expert-level proficiency with design tools in Adobe Creative Suite, Sketch and InVision; Ability to stand by your designs and provide solid rationale to back up your decision with data analysis; Lead testing and validation of UX decisions through A/B testing, customer interviews and user testing; In-depth familiarity with the latest trends in mobile user experience; Ability to use prototyping tools to convey design intent; Demonstrate knowledge in designing for a mobile product across multiple platforms and countries; Operational understanding of accessibility and ability to incorporate accessibility in the mobile designs; Familiarity with the retail environment and e-commerce is an asset.  Competencies Highly self-motivated individual; Strong communication skills (written and spoken); Prepared to give and take constructive feedback on a daily basis; Champion of user-centered design thinking, who understands that the best products are designed when the team embraces a collaborative and Agile culture and process; Enjoys partnering with business stakeholders to determine the best approach to meet at the intersection of user needs and business goals; Advocate of user research and understands how to synthesize data into actionable solutions; Continuously looks to grow skill set and understanding of UX methodologies; Ability to thrive while working in a fast-paced retail and innovative development environment; Strong communication skills across disciplines and the ability to effectively articulate experiential principles based on industry best practice guidelines, personal experience and research findings; Ability to define and execute best practices for user-centered design throughout the project life cycle; Ability to thrive in a work environment that requires strong problem solving skills and independent self-direction, coupled with an aptitude for team collaboration and open communication; User-focused and analytical; you will have a deep understanding and appreciation of the process of identifying users’ needs, coupled with the ability to balance the pros and cons of different designs, backed by research and analytics.  Benefits: You will be rewarded for your contribution and dedication with a competitive salary and a bonus plan. We also offer a registered retirement savings plan in Canada and a flexible group insurance plan that meets all your needs thanks to personalized coverage, as well as an employee discount in our stores.  Groupe Dynamite is committed to employment equity. Only those candidates who have been retained will be contacted for an interview.
Title: Senior UX/UI Designer, Digital Experience

Job_Description: You have outstanding, rigorous credentials, expertise and experience in User Experience Design. You are highly adept in guiding and collaborating with teams to develop user centric processes and interactions that enhance business application, increase user engagement and increase brand loyalty. You effectively utilize your solid understanding of business goals and user behaviour in designing the overall functionality of the product to ensure a great user experience. Our client is committed to: Providing a respectful, fair and ethical work environment that values innovation, collaboration and drive for excellence. Reporting to the Manager, Application Delivery, as User Experience Designer, you will: Design and develop user interfaces and user flows based on requirements and feedback from stakeholder groups. Create UI wireframes, mockups and interactive prototypes. Provide end to end analysis of our digital platforms with the user needs in mind. Work directly with Analysts to review requirements and provide feedback on documentation. Participate in planning activities as needed. Develop HTML and CSS templates for digital applications. Work directly with development teams to provide HTML and CSS templating and support. Diagnose, troubleshoot and resolve browser and device-based display issues. Estimate and track progress on work tasks. Interact with the Customer Experience (CX) team to ensure alignment with the latest customer and user trends. Interact with Communications and Marketing teams to ensure brand alignment and consistency. Improve upon and ensure the adherence to the established practices, processes, and guidelines. Develop UI documentation and UI templates for use by other groups. Mentor junior UX team members. What the successful candidate will bring: Degree or diploma in Graphic Design, Digital Media or equivalent experience with 2+ years of experience in planning, developing and integrating user interfaces Demonstrated experience using design and prototyping tools, such as the Adobe Suite, UXPin, Mockflow and InVision. Strong HTML and CSS skills and the ability to trouble shoot browser and device display issues. Good working knowledge of JavaScript. Experience with JavaScript frameworks such as Angular, React, or Vue is considered an asset. Detail-oriented with analytical and problem-solving skills to identify and resolve issues in a timely and effective manner. Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to communicate in a clear and concise manner to a wide-range of audience (business partners, customers and stakeholders). Exceptional planning, organizational, multi-tasking and prioritization skills. Proven leadership skills, with the ability to foster and encouraging high team morale utilizing effective coaching strategies. Sound decision-making skills, with the ability to direct team members to achieve goals through clear instruction. Certifications in relevant technology or processes is considered an asset. In return, what you can expect: Competitive salary and benefits package. If you are interested in the position of User Experience Designer, please submit your resume to Ryan den Teuling by pressing “Apply Now”. Only candidates already eligible to work in Canada will be reviewed. Only qualified candidates will be contacted. Fit is important to us and it’s important to the companies we partner with. At The Headhunters, we understand that finding your next dream role is not just about aligning your skills with a job description. It is about knowing your personality, workstyle and career goals. Learn more about our specialized recruitment services at www.theheadhunters.ca.

Title: Senior UX/UI Designer

Job_Description: Groupe Dynamite est un détaillant de mode mondial ayant deux marques, Garage et Dynamite, au cœur de son succès. Nous possédons plus de 400 magasins au Canada et à travers le monde, et comptons à notre actif plus de 6 000 employés. Nous sommes solidement enracinés dans le paysage de la mode au détail.À titre de leaders canadiens dans le paysage international du détail, les bannières Garage et Dynamite continuent à se démarquer dans un marché toujours plus saturé. Notre équipe passionnée poursuit son expansion vers de nouveaux marchés, y compris le commerce électronique, tout en misant sur nos valeurs communes.Nous sommes fiers d’embaucher et de retenir des leaders inspirants, motivés par leur désir de réaliser de grandes choses et reconnus pour leur fougue entrepreneuriale.APERÇU DU RÔLE: Relevant du Gestionnaire senior, Produits numériques, le Designer senior, Expérience utilisateur (UX/UI) Web sera le principal gardien de l’expérience numérique pour toutes les plateformes Web de Groupe Dynamite. Vous maintiendrez et protégerez également l’intégrité de l’expérience numérique pour optimiser le niveau de satisfaction de notre clientèle.Vous travaillerez avec des gestionnaires de produit, des responsables de produit et des développeurs de grand talent pour aider à concevoir le design des initiatives actuelles et nouvelles afin qu’elles atteignent leur plein potentiel pour nos deux marques, Dynamite et Garage. Vous collaborerez également avec notre Designer senior, UX/UI - Applications afin d’assurer l’uniformité de l’expérience en ligne à travers toutes les plateformes. Cette opportunité vous positionnera comme contributeur initial participant à la mise en œuvre d’une pratique d’expérience utilisateur croissante chez Groupe Dynamite.Le Designer senior, Expérience utilisateur/Interface utilisateur (UX/UI) Web doit pouvoir résoudre des problèmes, simplifier des idées complexes, travailler selon des échéanciers serrés et comprendre les exigences de la clientèle afin de s’assurer que l’expérience finale réponde aux besoins uniques de nos publics cibles. Title: Designer UX/UI Senior

Job_Description: SUMMARYWe are looking for an experienced UX/UI Designer responsible for conceptualizing and creating insightful and intuitive interfaces for the CareCru platform. The preferred candidate will be comfortable collaborating across functions to generate analytics dashboards with segmentation capabilities. You will gain valuable experience working for a rapid-growth, early-stage Vancouver startup with a highly experienced management team and cutting edge software. Please include a URL for your online portfolio in addition to your resume.RESPONSIBILITIESWork with the marketing and product team to create insightful analytics and reporting dashboards with segmentation capabilitiesGenerate intuitive, engaging interfacesCraft scenarios, user flows, wireframes, and working prototypes that clearly communicate design intent to everyone, designers and non-designers alikeCreate user experiences that feel simple and straightforwardAdhere to the CareCru philosophy of automate, automate, automate, in both interface design and design processAlways be thinking about ways to scale our design team. Where should we go next?Foster healthy design practice by giving and receiving feedback with maturity and perspectiveWork with us as we coach and mentor impressionable, excited new designersDESIRED QUALIFICATIONA strong understanding of user experience best practices, IA, interaction and visual designAt least 3 years of web UX experience and mobile responsive design, ideally for a B2B SaaS productExperience creating analytics and reporting dashboards with segmentation capabilitiesExperience working in a fast-paced, user-centered design processPortfolio of UX-focused work samples for web applications.High degree of experience with Sketch and/or Adobe, and familiarity with prototyping tools such as InVisionFluent with best practices for user-centered design, UX principles and techniques, information architecture, and user interface web patternsAbility to speak and write in English fluentlyYOU WANT TO TALK TO US IF...You love technology and working in a SaaS business.You bring enthusiasm, a strong work ethic and a positive attitude.You are comfortable un d er pressure and are adept at creative problem solving, setting and maintaining appropriate expectations, and communicating complex concepts.You are highly ambitious and motivated by disrupting the norm.You have a sense of humor and take your profession seriously, but not yourself.You are all about constructive feedback - you can dish it out and you can take it.You thrive in the frenetic energy of a startupWHAT WE OFFERCompetitive salary and bonus structureStock OptionsOpportunity to work for proven leadership with successful startup experienceExcellent benefits package including health, dental and visionStrong growth will lead to many opportunities to grow within the companyA great entrepreneurial team that works hard and has fun doing itJob Type: Full-timeExperience:web UX: 3 yearsEducation:AssociateLocation:Vancouver, BCLanguage:English

Title: Intermediate UX Designer to work on a complex web project wi...

Job_Description: About you  Are you passionate about human behaviour and digital innovation? Are you skilled at translating complex requirements into usable and delightful experiences? Do you keep on top of the latest trends in design and love experimenting with new tools and methodologies? Do you like to dig into data in search of new solutions? We've got the perfect opportunity for you in downtown Montreal!  Join our team and help us shape the future digital experience of Canada's leading insurance brand. We can't wait to meet you!  Your role  As a Senior UX/UI Designer, you play a mission critical role in conceiving and evolving our digital ecosystem. Reporting to the Manager, Digital Platforms, your main responsibilities are:  Conceiving compelling experiences that help achieve business objectives. Validating usability and usefulness via user testing and user research. Producing relevant UX and design deliverables where required. Presenting work to stakeholders. Helping developers produce quality, delightful interfaces. Helping conceive experiments to optimize the platforms (A/B testing and more) Being an advocate for user-centered, data-driven design.  Your Skills  Bachelor degree in a relevant program At least 5 years of experience in a similar role Expertise in usability and user-centered design practices Mastery of design tools (Sketch, Axure, Photoshop, Illustrator, etc.) Experience with UX research (ie. user tests) Knowledge of testing and experimentation (experience with Adobe Target an asset) Experience in producing wireframes, process flows, prototypes, etc You love working in a collaborative environment that has a strong focus on teamwork, innovation, open minds and having fun  Please include your portfolio in your application.  You are  Creative, analytical, curious and ingenious A team player that can share and receive constructive feedback You excel at explaining your ideas to different stakeholders Deeply passionate about design and quality A leader who takes initiatives Organized and proactive  As a full-time employee your benefits include : A competitive salary An annual performance bonus A pension plan Flexible work hours and a 35 hour work week Top of the line medical and dental insurance And many more benefits (gym refunds, paid conferences, etc.)  Closing Statement  As part of Intact’s selection process, candidates may be requested to consent to background checks relevant to the role under consideration for, prior to receiving a job offer. These could include: work references, education and credential confirmation, employment verification, identity check, credit report, criminal offence and driver’s license record.  This posting closes on April 25, 2018.  Eligibility to work in Canada  Proof of eligibility for permanent roles may come in the form of a Canadian birth certificate, Canadian passport, Canadian citizenship certificate, permanent residence card or confirmation. Applicants must be permanently eligible to work in Canada upon hire.
Title: Senior UX/UI Designer

Job_Description: Sengled Canada is looking for a smart and talented Senior UX/UI Designer to join our team in Vancouver, BC.  Are you excited by the latest cutting edge gadgets? Are you interested in Internet of Things? At Sengled Canada, we are at the frontier of Internet of Things. Come and join us to change the future of smart homes!  Sengled currently sells a complete line of smart LED light bulbs with sensors and speakers built in. Sengled products have won numerous innovation awards at CES 2015, CES 2016 and CES 2017. We have offices in five countries including China, US, Canada, Germany and Australia. Sengled Canada is located in Vancouver, BC. Although we are part of a bigger company, we are a small office that encourages a collaborative and relaxed startup-like working environment.  This role is a great opportunity for a UI/UX designer that is looking for a new professional challenge. You will have the chance to grow and hone your leadership skills, flex your creative skills, and have a direct impact on the direction of the company.  Be a part of a smart and friendly team that works hard and has a lot of fun. Free coffee, snacks and a fridge that's always stocked with beverages!  Why we love working at Sengled Canada: Competitive salary with frequent compensation review Competitive annual bonuses with the possibility of partial bonus payouts after each milestone Full coverage of MSP, extended health, dental and travel insurance for you and your family Convenient downtown location  Responsibilities: Oversee the design and delivery of effective user interfaces across a range of corporate websites and mobile apps Create, improve and use wireframes, prototypes, style guides, user flows, and effectively communicate your interaction ideas using any of these methods Manage and maintain a library of design components across multiple projects Update existing UI design style guide for use across the company Conduct research by talking to customers and validating design assumptions Think big picture strategy but also roll up your sleeves for detailed pixel perfect design work  Key Skills/Experience: A strong portfolio which demonstrates a range of skills with tools and techniques History of consistently delivering considerable ROI for a range of clients Experience with agile environment (Kanban and Scrum) Ability to collaborate closely with developers, copywriters, product managers, other designers and graphic artists An expert knowledge of UI design principles and techniques A strong working knowledge of UX and Interaction Design A strong working knowledge of Information Architecture A strong understanding of e-commmerce UX design principles Experience leading a team of junior designers Ability to handle feedback graciously and professionally and also provide constructive feedback to peers A strong working knowledge of mobile UI design principles Experience with responsive design and grid systems Working knowledge of HTML and CSS3 (including the Bootstrap framework) Strong working knowledge of Figma, Sketch and Zeplin, Photoshop and Illustrator, InVision, Marvel, or Axure, Flinto, Principle, or Framer Experience delivering UI design projects to budget and deadlines Ability to clearly and effectively present ideas to team and stakeholders Strong time management skills and reliably setting and meeting deadlines  Preferred Requirements At least 4 years of relevant experience exclusively in a UI/UX Design role Experience working with distributed teams. Being fluent in Mandarin Chinese is a plus but not required
Title: Senior UI/UX Designer

Job_Description: Nous valorisons la diversité et avons à cœur de créer un milieu de travail inclusif qui nous inspire tous à donner le meilleur de nous-mêmes. Joignez-vous à notre équipe et faites une différence!  Votre poste  Nous  Comment imaginez-vous les bureaux d’une compagnie d’assurance? Et l’atmosphère de travail qui y règne? Nous gageons que si vous passez nous voir au Intact Lab, vous serez surpris! Mariant la convivialité et la vélocité d’une startup aux ressources et les moyens d’une grande entreprise, Intact Lab est un environnement jeune et dynamique, offrant des défis stimulants, des collègues inspirants et une carrière passionnante (chez un des top 100 employeurs au Canada!).  Situé aux centres-villes de Montréal et de Toronto, nous sommes un laboratoire d’innovation responsable de créer des produits et services à la fine-pointe de la #insuretech. Joignez-vous à notre équipe et participez à concevoir la prochaine génération des expériences numériques des plus grandes marques d’assurances au pays… nous avons hâte de vous rencontrer!  Vous  Êtes-vous un passionné du e-commerce et de l'innovation numérique? Vous vous délectez de traduire des problèmes complexes en expériences élégantes? Vous êtes à l’affut des dernières tendances en design et n’hésitez pas à expérimenter avec des nouveaux outils? Nous avons une opportunité parfaite pour vous!  Votre rôle  En tant que Designer UX/UI senior, vous jouerez un rôle crucial dans la conception et l’évolution de notre écosystème numérique. Relevant de la Directrice, design et sciences comportementales, vous aurez comme principales responsabilités:  Concevoir des expériences nous permettant d’atteindre nos objectifs de performance.  Valider l’utilisabilité et l’utilité des solutions à l’aide de recherche et tests utilisateurs.  Produire les livrables UX nécessaires aux projets.  Diriger la feuille de route en tandem avec un gestionnaire de produit et une équipe agile.  Présenter le travail aux parties prenantes.  Accompagner les ingénieurs dans la création d’interfaces agréables et de qualité.  Être un ambassadeur de la conception centré utilisateur et axé sur les données.  Vos compétences  Minimum de 7 années d'expérience dans un rôle similaire  Maitrise des meilleures pratiques en utilisabilité et en conception centrée utilisateur  Maitrise des outils de design (Sketch, Axure, InVision, Illustrator, etc.)  Expérience en recherche utilisateur (ex. tests utilisateurs)  Expérience à produire des wireframes, flux de processus, prototypes, etc.  Baccalauréat dans une discipline pertinente  Vous adorez œuvrer dans des environnements collaboratifs avec un focus sur le travail d’équipe, l’innovation, l’ouverture et s’amuser!  Svp inclure votre portfolio dans votre application.  Vous êtes  Créatif, esprit analytique, curieux et ingénieux  Joueur d’équipe prêt à contribuer et recevoir de la rétroaction  Excellent vulgarisateur capable d’expliquer ses idées à divers intervenants  Passionné par le design et la qualité  Leader qui n'hésite pas à prendre des initiatives  Organisé et proactif  En tant que salarié temps plein, vous bénéficierez de : Un salaire compétitif  Un boni annuel  Un fond de pension  Un horaire de travail flexible et une semaine de 35 heures  Des assurances médicales et dentaires hors pair  Un MacBook Pro neuf  Et plusieurs autres avantages et bénéfices (remboursement gym, conférences, etc.)  Énoncé fermeture  Cette opportunité vous intéresse? Nous avons très hâte de faire votre connaissance!  D’excellents avantages sont offerts : salaire concurrentiel, avantages flexibles, aménagements de travail flexibles, congés mobiles, régime de retraite à prestation déterminée, etc.  Dans le cadre du processus de sélection d’Intact, les candidats peuvent être appelés à donner leur consentement à une vérification de leurs antécédents pertinente au poste à pourvoir avant de recevoir une offre d’emploi. Celle-ci peut comprendre une confirmation des références d’emploi, des études et des titres de compétences, une vérification des emplois, de l’identité, des infractions criminelles et du permis de conduire ainsi qu’un rapport de crédit.  Vous pouvez soumettre votre candidature à un emploi affiché pourvu que vous occupiez vos fonctions actuelles depuis au moins douze mois et que votre performance soit jugée bonne ou que votre contrat temporaire arrive à son échéance. Une recherche de talents à l'externe est menée parallèlement au recrutement à l'interne Veuillez donc prendre note que des candidats potentiels pourraient avoir été identifiés pour ce poste dans le cadre de leur plan de développement.   Veuillez noter que l'usage du masculin a comme but d'alléger le texte.  Cet affichage prendra fin le 02 juin 2018.  Droit de travailler au Canada  Les personnes qui posent leur candidature à un poste permanent doivent, dès leur embauche, avoir le droit de travailler au Canada de façon permanente. Les documents pouvant servir de preuve dans le cas des rôles permanents sont un certificat de naissance canadien, un passeport canadien, un certificat de citoyenneté canadienne, une carte de résident permanent ou une confirmation de son statut de résident permanent pour prouver qu’il a le droit de travailler au Canada.
