Title: Designer UX/UI senior

Job_Description: Skip is growing at a rapid pace and with that, we will need to expand our elite team of creative and design professionals to advance the innovation and improvements of our existing technology. We’re looking for a leader who excels in creative problem-solving and delivering an exceptional experience to each of our network users. People need to eat so Skip never sleeps, and that means the show runs around the clock. We’re looking for people who want the chance of contributing to build a world-class tech company right here in the Canadian Prairies. What you’ll be doing: Create beautiful experiences alongside an agile team of innovative problem-solvers Deliver creative technology-driven solutions to operational and logistical issues Collaborate with end users and the Software Development team for project implementation Maintain in-depth knowledge of network functionality in order to sustain the hurdles of a constantly growing, and therefore evolving, environment. Create a seamless and exciting user experience for internal and external stakeholders People we’re looking for: Have a great attitude and are proven self-starters Keep hustling and are able to work through rejection Thrive in a rapidly changing environment Understand that a startup is not a 9-5 job, it's a lifestyle! What it’s like to work at Skip: Fast paced entrepreneurial environment Casual dress attire, we focus on results, not wearing suits Exposure to leading-edge technology Advancement opportunities for high contributors Merit-based compensation & benefits
Title: Senior UI/UX Designer

Job_Description: Senior UX/UI Designer - Digital Music (Montreal, Quebec)   PlayNetwork helps brands engage consumers through entertainment media, in-store and beyond. These experiences add emotion to omni-channel touch points that strengthen the connection with customers and influence lifetime value. Clients work with PlayNetwork for creative strategy development, branded music curation and global licensing, original video production, messaging, audio/visual systems engineering and installation, technology and software development, and more. They partner with 425+ brands across 110,000+ locations in 125+ countries, reaching more than 100 million people every day. For more information visit www.playnetwork.com. In 2017, PlayNetwork and Touchtunes joined forces forming the Octave Group . TouchTunes is the largest in-venue interactive music and entertainment platform, featured in over 75,000 bars and restaurants across North America and Europe. Together we’ve created a global market leader for music and media services, with boundless opportunities for our team members to learn, contribute and grow. We’re entrepreneurs, finance professionals, engineers, designers, marketers, creatives and visionaries. We are guided by our core values that serve as a compass for how we act and guide our approach to every aspect of our business every day. We are passionate about developing exciting and engaging products that impact consumers and generate emotional connections across our network of over 185,000 stores, restaurants, bars and other social spaces around the world.  The Senior UX/UI Product Designer will lead a key PlayNetwork background music initiative, collaborating closely with the development team to ensure that all client requirements are implemented to spec. This includes creating interactive prototypes, user flows and developing a deep understanding of our client’s needs by leveraging analytics and user testing.  Responsibilities:  Partner with product management, engineering, and creative leadership Take nebulous ideas and translate them into rapid prototypes for user testing Set the creative strategy to ensure a cohesive user experience Justify and prioritize the design pipeline to be in line with our KPIs, user feedback, and the overall product strategy Take a user-centered approach, attempting to understand how users interact with all aspects of the product, and design a user experience in accordance with this understanding Producing pixel-perfect mock-ups and redlines for use by various team members for the purposes of development and testing Keep all application mock-ups up-to-date based on the latest designs and copy Acquire and maintain a solid understanding of PlayNetwork’s products and services, in order to produce more relevant designs Pair with software developers to help implement designs Directly collaborate on user experience planning with product manager and production teams   Required Qualifications: 5+ years of experience as a UX/UI designer with substantial experience designing for various digital platforms, e.g., Web, Mobile, etc. Able to provide samples of work that showcase thoughtful UX solutions, strong visual design and solid information architecture Full knowledge of the Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop and After Effects should be a no brainer) Sketch and HTML/CSS Experience working with cross-functional teams to drive strategy, vision, and execution Proven track record of shipping high quality consumer facing products Operates with a user-centric approach to design Ability to do rapid prototyping and enthusiasm for working in an iterative design process Knowledge of UI design cues and standards on Web and Mobile design experience An appreciation for analytics, in order to better understand how UIs are actually used   Required Skills/Competencies: Leads by example and exemplifies the company’s Core Values in actions and behaviors. Deep empathy for users and cares about the users’ wants and needs Able to function independently and in a team environment with excellent collaboration skills Able to multi-task, meet deadlines, and work well under pressure Good time management and grace under fire Good communication skills, with a positive and proactive attitude Good with collaborating, while remaining able to work independently when required A passion for music is a must   Special Position Requirements: Ability to travel to New York occasionally   Preferences:  An ability to code/script interactive prototypes is a plus Enthusiasm for new technologies and new media A passion for music in general is a plus   Work Requirements:  Deductive Reasoning — the ability to apply general rules to specific problems to produce answers that make sense. Written Comprehension — the ability to read and understand information and ideas presented in writing. Inductive Reasoning — the ability to combine pieces of information to form general rules or conclusions (includes finding a relationship among seemingly unrelated events). Oral Comprehension — the ability to listen to and understand information and ideas presented through spoken words and sentences. Oral Expression — the ability to communicate information and ideas in speaking so others will understand. Ability to perform primarily sedentary work, frequently using a computer (visual acuity, fine motor skills) and telephone (talking/hearing). Must be authorized to work in the Canada.
Title: Senior Designer - UX/UI - Montreal

Job_Description: Are you up for the challenge of impacting, defining, and designing an entire SUITE of industry-leading software? Have you always wanted to be part of a team during that rocketship phase from scrappy startup to international powerhouse? Have you dreamed of your designs impacting people's lives in a positive way and enabling them to live their best lives? If you’re a user-focused, ambitious Ui/UX designer with an entrepreneurial attitude, Jungle Scout is where you belong. We’re looking for a design wizard who has that magic combination of usability focus, creative passion, and artisanal craftsmanship that is rooted in the best practices of digital experience design. This is your chance to be a critical component in how Jungle Scout defines the experience of its suite of tools and empowers its incredible (and exponentially growing) user base to become their own bosses. You will be a key player on the product design team, translating business needs and customer desires into features, flows, and digital tools. Your work will require deep expertise with UX design best practices across platforms and a creative flare for Ui as well. You’ll need a holistic understanding of how people use software and how to translate ideas into intuitive experiences for our customers. You need to be a self-starter that is more focused on getting that MVP out the door than suffering from analysis paralysis when it comes to where exactly that button needs to be placed. Your Responsibilities: Work the with product design team to define and refine the user experience of the Jungle Scout suite of tools. Work closely with our team of amazing designers to maintain and enhance our design component library and overall aesthetic. Work collaboratively with other departments from product management, to customer support, and marketing to ensure we are serving our customers up the best solutions to their problems. Design, test, release, learn and repeat. Your Qualifications You have a portfolio that displays a deep understanding of UX best practices and modern trends in Ui design. Have 3+ years experience as a UX or Ui designer in a startup, product, or agency setting. Have excellent communication skills, and ability to work across functional teams (engineering, product, marketing, customer success and more). Are entrepreneurial. You need to be a self-starter who is comfortable with ambiguity and defining your own direction. You can operate autonomously in a fast-paced environment with the capacity to make informed decisions and guide our customer’s success. Help build and follow processes and procedures that can scale as we grow. Why Jungle Scout: We are a fun-loving group of professionals, working remotely around the world while pursuing one goal: to help people launch and grow successful Amazon businesses. Jungle Scout has competitive compensation packages, a generous vacation policy, educational stipend, and the mindset that you should work when and where most suits your personality. We care about our culture and your continued development so twice a year we gather the entire team for Jungle Camp, an all-expense paid trip to a great location to foster learning, growth, fun and team bonding! Past Jungle Camps have been held in Bali, Rio de Janeiro, Budapest, and Bangkok.
Title: Senior UX/Ui Designer - Vancouver

Job_Description: As Senior UI/UX Designer you will be responsible for developing and deploying our Integrated Solutions Package for customers seeking to source, create, and measure compelling web and mobile applications in the Financial Services space. You are inquisitive by nature and passionate about users’ motivations while delivering the highest level product possible to clients. You thrive at synthesizing varied information to make decisions. You excel at communicating priorities and results with business, technical, design, and executive stakeholders. You have experience effectively mentoring other UI/UX Designers. You have an inventor’s spirit, highly refined aesthetic sensibilities, an eye for every pixel, and a track record of producing world class user experiences. Join our growing UX team and make a significant impact on our business growth while influencing the design direction for existing and new clients. Help us change the perception of how "typical" internal tools are designed by creating innovative interfaces that inject beauty and delight into our customer's day-to-day experiences. Your Main Responsibilities: Work closely with the Director of Product Design to relentlessly simplify and distill complex business processes into intuitive and elegant product experience Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand and communicate functional requirements, address technical constraints, and define best-in-class user experiences Collaborate and produce visual brand assets for our energetic and fast-paced lead gen, growth hacking, and marketing team Collaborate and contribute to client meetings, presentations, discovery sessions and process planning Ensure the UI/UX team has a clear understanding of client project context, constraints, and opportunities Help define project goals and objectives, both internally with department leads and clients Ensure all deliverables are of the highest level of quality and precision Be a creative inspirer, foster positivity and awesomeness Assist in the development and evaluation of personas, user stories, persona modeling and customer journeys Handle multiple projects in an agile, fast-paced environment  What We're Looking For: An established in-production portfolio of work that demonstrates your skills, craft, intuition, problem-solving and expertise Minimum 5 years of experience as a User Experience Designer and Team Lead Ability to prioritize and manage multiple parallel-path projects A working knowledge of UI design standards for web, mobile web, iOS, and Android and wearables Knowledge of web and mobile frameworks, languages, and tools (basic understanding of fundamental build tools such as XCode, CSS/HTML High-level of proficiency with Sketch, Invision, Adobe CS, Zeplin, Framer and Keynote Confident in speaking during presentations and client meetings, both internally and externally Attention to detail—every pixel counts Strong knowledge base of production tools such as Slack, GitHub, Jira Experience working in a collaborative team and working directly with software development engineers for implementation of designs Report to the Director of Product Design on a recurring basis, distilling project efficiency outcomes, gaps, KPI’s and opportunities for improvements Demonstrated history of acquiring user data, hypothetical analysis and creation (e.g., conducting usability studies, performing user research) then processing and delivering data findings to departmental team members and clients Resource planning, interview and recruiting process knowledge  Bonus Points For: Experience with FinTech as it relates to Tier 1-2 banking institutions and credit union space Solid written and verbal communication skills with the ability to present a strong rationale for design decisions  Education: Bachelor's Degree in Design, HCI, related field or equivalent agency/work experience  About Aequilibrium: Craftsmanship and speed. That’s something we’re known for around here. Aequilibrium helps financial institutions and Fintechs create seamless and personalized digital experiences that attract and retain customers. We have domain and technical expertise to accelerate digital innovation and transform user experiences into life experiences. By building rich and immersive digital solutions, our team empowers FIs to deliver more intelligent and meaningful interactions across every customer touchpoint. With a perfect pairing of code and design, we want you to create products and solutions that you’re visually and technically proud of. Ones that the users will love. We plan, design, architect and build technology platforms and products—delivering world-class technology solutions for companies such as Hootsuite, BuildDirect.com, Central 1 Credit Union, Kit and Ace, BackBase, Monexa and more. Aequilibrium is proud to have been selected as a Top 5 Finalist for the Small Business BC Best Employer Awards for 2 consecutive years. We have a casual and collaborative working environment and support flexible schedules. We're big on technology and creativity, and we believe that through teamwork (whether that manifests itself in your daily work or your next ping pong challenge) we can reach amazing feats together. Our office is located near Waterfront in the financial district, surrounded by pretty sweet coffee shops and eateries and educational accelerators like BrainStation. We are close to main bus routes and literally steps away from several skytrain access points. Our building is fully equipped with bike storage lockers and a full size gym on the ground floor. If you feel you’ll thrive in this environment and make a difference, you should definitely apply!  The Perks: aequilibrium.ca/careers Get Social With Us! Twitter | Blog | LinkedIn
Title: Senior UI/UX Designer

Job_Description: Atimi is seeking a senior UX/UI designer with experience across multiple platforms. We have a great opportunity for a talented full-time designer who will bring innovative ideas and fresh approaches to each project – collaboratively building on-brand design solutions with compelling experiences. It’s going to be loud & over-stimulated working here, so the Atimi UX team needs the candidates to have a minimum of 5 years’ UX experience performing interaction design, and shipping products preferably for mobile tech. While we recognize and value all UX experience, our hiring priority have to focus on designers with substantial mobile app experience. Must Have We will be looking for a candidate that gives us a strong feeling that they are really committed to design excellence throughout the project, especially during execution across platforms. A portfolio that demonstrates clear, thoughtful, and coherent problem solving abilities A portfolio demonstrates graphic and motion graphics craftsmanship and attention to detail Able to depict a design solution convincingly – verbally, illustratively, and interactively Solid understanding of mobile UX principles including iOS & Android UX guidelines Advanced understanding of usability principles and ideation techniques for Mobile UX Able to work independently and lead design projects Expertise in Sketch, Photoshop, Illustrator, and Invision Nice to Have Experience in scaling mobile UX across devices and platforms In-depth understanding of mobile UX principles including iOS & Android UX guidelines Experience in reconciling iOS & Android platform differences Skills implementing designs in Interface Builder editor to hand-off to developers This job is open to all candidates in Canada, but preference is given to those who can work out of our Vancouver office. Relocation support is not provided. Please submit your resume and cover letter for review along with links and/or screenshots to apps/code you have developed by emailing them to jobs@atimi.com. All applications will be reviewed, but only those who are able to demonstrate the right skills will be contacted for an in-person interview. Why Work for Atimi? Find the work-life balance you have been craving with a flexible schedule, generous time off and convenient commute to work or option to work from home. Join a team where fun is encouraged with team building activities and Company events. You can also expect generous compensation along with awesome benefits so come to work in your comfy clothes, make yourself a cup of fresh ground coffee, and dive into your amazing career. About Atimi Software Hello, we’re Atimi. If you’ve got a smart phone or a computer, you’ve seen our work. You may not know our name, but you use our software – whether it’s on Apple or Android devices; Blackberry or Windows, you’re already familiar with what we do, you just don’t know it yet. We work with high profile companies that want to extend their brand reach. Our clients hire us to do the flagship work for major brands. We know what it takes to get noticed: over 60% of our apps have been featured by Apple in TV ads, iTunes advertising, in-store or in print ads. We work with Fortune 500 companies who want to be recognized for being innovative and want to ensure a true brand experience at every customer touch-point. Fundamentally, Atimi believes in compensating people based on the value they provide. All of us are evaluated on the core skills we are able to demonstrate when doing our job. Once you demonstrate new skills there’s no reason that shouldn’t be recognized. We want to provide our staff with fast moving, cutting edge projects where everybody has a voice and nobody is concerned with ego or internal politics, so all of us are challenged to constantly improve.
Title: Senior UI/UX Designer

Job_Description: This opportunity is available via The Creative Group and is ideal for a creative thinker who enjoys working independently as well as collaborating with colleagues. Based in the Mississauga, Ontario area, this Front-end Designer/Developer position would be a short term temporary-to-fulltime opportunity. Talented, ambitious, and experienced individuals are encouraged to apply for the position today! - Strong front-end development skills - HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, Json, Angular.js, jQuery  Some experience with analytics like SEO markup/tagging  Nice to have:  Experience with Enterprise level CMS's (AEM, SiteCore, OpenText) Experience with Open Source CMS's WordPress Joomla Design and UX/UI would be a strong asset assets - UX, UI, wireframes, prototyping
Title: Front End Developer

Job_Description: Mastercard Labs as a Service is a leading edge global innovation practice, delivering a range of innovation programs which incorporate the best in design thinking and agile development processes. We help customers and partners extend their innovation agenda through the delivery of innovation programs, processes and applications.  Labs as a Service supports our customers and partners with Innovation and R&D consultation - delivering customized innovation programs, products and support - tailored to meet client-specific business challenges. Labs as a Service is a joint venture alliance between Mastercard Labs and Mastercard Advisors Labs as a Service will help customers create effective solutions to real problems in a compressed timeframe using cost effective innovative processes In this role, you will be a key member of a highly agile team working to build product prototypes and pilots, in collaboration with global brands in commerce Are you a talented Full Stack Developer with a passion for technology development and innovation? Do you love coding and enjoy fast paced dynamic environments? Do you have a strong track record in rapid prototyping and delivering new and exciting projects, and learning new technologies (e.g. Wearable Computing, Big Data, Internet of Things) ? Do you have a passion for product design and technology innovation and have a high energy, can-do attitude and strong sense of ownership / desire to succeed?  Role  You will work with highly-skilled multi-disciplinary teams around the world to shape, plan and deliver front end technology that enables our clients to deliver an optimal digital experience, along with building fully functional pilots for these new products. Collaborate with UX designers, QA and Product Owners to define, size and implement user stories Exploring how different technologies (e.g. Wearable Computing, Big Data, Internet of Things, AR/VR) can be used to solve client business problems. Ensure all projects are completed on time and to world class standards with clean, well designed code. Think creatively and contribute new ideas to the team in terms of best practices, patterns and technologies that would lead to delivery efficiencies.  All About You  Full stack Developer with a strong UI/UX sense and a natural flair for aesthetics and usability. Advanced level knowledge of React Native Advanced level knowledge of Node.js Knowledgeable in Redux and container technologies Knowledgeable in SQL and NoSQL Experience with cloud computing platforms such as Pivotal Cloud Foundry Experience with chatbots, Alexa, robotics, and/or wearables is a plus Experience in rapid prototyping Strong interpersonal skills with a passion for collaboration and teamwork. Demonstrated ability to take responsibility and work in a self-directed manner. Excellent self-starter who always thinks MVP first with the ability to work in a small, startup-style, agile and fast-paced team. Examples of work on GitHub is helpful Experience in both start-up and corporate environments is a plus Experience in consumer fintech applications and payment protocols is a plus Willingness to travel (30-35%) Mastercard is an inclusive Equal Employment Opportunity employer that considers applicants without regard to gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, ethnicity, disabled or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.
Title: Mobile, Web & IOT Development - Consultant

Job_Description: You are a gamer. Whether it’s board , PC, or mobile games, your focus is on creating memorable, positive experiences for people. You enjoy working closely with a wide range of skill sets and personalities and never shy away from contributing your vision to the team. Always looking to take your work from sufficient to mind-blowing - you thrive in a high-feedback culture where you can grow, innovate and iterate until perfection. You are a natural leader and enjoy providing guidance and mentorship as much as you enjoy sharing your day’s learnings. And finally, you’re looking for more fun, passionate and creative people to work with!  Sound like a match? Kabam Vancouver is looking for a Senior UX Designer to join us!  We don’t just make games, we play and love them too.  You will contribute by:  Driving features from beginning to end by presenting work, guiding conversations, coordinating with producers to work on timelines Working collaboratively with other discipline members such as: Game designers to discuss game features, create wireframes, and produce screen mockups and assets Engineers to review technical requirements and implementations of screens QA analysts to deliver all functionality annotations and answer questions Live Operations team members to ensure all planned events are supported Back-end programming team to discuss technical requirements Mentoring and coaching junior UI/UX Designers Learning and sharing best practices of UI and UX design with the team Advocating for UX design in the studio At Kabam, we’re constantly raising the bar of excellence in free-to-play mobile gaming. We hire for passion and diversity so that together as a team we can triumph in our collective skill. Our teams are made up of a fusion of personalities and interests bound together by a collaborative nature, fun-loving culture and drive to do what it takes to make great games.  And this is where you come in..  Your background includes:  5+ years of experience as a professional UI/UX Designer Ability to take complex information and turn it into user-friendly UI design Ability to produce high quality work quickly, iterating toward the best solution Strong skills in crafting effective user experience flows, wireframes and interactions Strong passion for human-centered design challenges and graphic design challenges Strong passion for gaming - Experience working on mobile games is a plus! A strong portfolio showcasing User Interface Design, User Experience, Graphic Design, etc. Understanding of “freemium” business model, including customer acquisition, retention, and monetization Bonus points if you have experience in working with Unity Join a fun and funky group of creative artists who are committed to providing exceptional UI/UX depth to Kabam’s games. Always laughing and always learning, you’ll contribute to the fun and exploration while keeping the team on track to build world-class free-to-play mobile games.  Excited by this opportunity? We invite you to apply and start the conversation with us.  Together, we can create and support some of the best games ever made.  About Kabam  Kabam is a world leader of massively multiplayer games for mobile devices. Console quality graphics and next generation technology are the hallmark of Kabam games. Kabam merges the art of game design and the science of consumer behaviour to create immersive games enjoyed by players around the world. Kabam’s games have generated hundreds of millions of downloads including Marvel Contest of Champions and Transformers: Forged to Fight and won several awards including Apple Editor’s Choice and Google Play’s Best Game of the Year. Kabam has studios and offices in Vancouver, San Francisco and Austin. Kabam is a wholly-owned subsidiary of Netmarble Games.

Job_Description: About Nix Sensor Ltd.We create amazing products that help colour professionals and consumers demystify the world of colour. If you’ve never used a Nix Color Sensor, it’s a magical experience. Like the photoshop eyedropper in real life, it takes the real world and makes it digital, and then can help our users make it real again.What you’ll do?Design beautiful apps that work with our award-winning hardwareWork with our software development, hardware, and product teams to craft a seamless user experienceOwn the design of our core products and participate in shaping the direction of our future productsIterate, test, and release products as quickly as we can gather feedback from our users and customersEven help out with other aspects of product design like packaging, web, etc.What you’ll need?A compelling and interesting portfolio of projects that showcase your workExperience designing mobile apps, and even web and other types of media, front end, back end, consumer and cloud based experience is a bonusExperience using the latest design tools to facilitate wireframing, prototyping, user testing, and information architectureExperience using a design methodology to get product out the door fastThe ability to work in a fast paced, collaborative environment, alongside the rest of our dynamic teamWhat’s makes Nix a great place to work?You’ll be joining a company that’s backed by some of the best advisors and investors in CanadaWe’re growing quickly, and you’ll be helping to build the next great Canadian success storyYou’ll work with a highly motivated team that takes pride in creating amazing productsWhat’s next?Send us a note or message indicating your interestShowcase your work by sending us a portfolio and / or examples of prior projectsJob Type: Full-timeExperience:UI Design: 1 yearUX Design: 1 year

Job_Description: Travailler chez Genius Solutions c'est : Joindre une équipe passionnée et dynamique qui a à cœur le succès de l’entreprise. C’est également joindre une entreprise en constante évolution dans un environnement stimulant et dans un marché hautement compétitif .Vous avez de l’intérêt à travailler chez Genius? Assurez-vous de vous reconnaitre dans les valeurs de l’entreprise :Vous êtes énergique et passionné : pour atteindre le succès, nous avons besoin de gens avec une énergie débordante démontrant une passion pour leur travail.Vous êtes en mission : les défis sont grands pour nous et nos clients et nous devons faire face à plusieurs obstacles. Pour mener à bien notre mission, il est essentiel de garder le cap!Vous êtes un bon joueur d’équipe : nous croyons fermement que le respect et la confiance sont des ingrédients essentiels au succès.Vous valorisez la connaissance et l’expertise : Genius valorise grandement les gens qui veulent progresser, acquérir de nouvelles connaissances et développer leur expertise.Vous vous reconnaissez dans les valeurs de la compagnie? Oui?Continuons!Designer UX / UI chez Genius Solutions : Nous recherchons actuellement un designer UX/UI . Cette personne aura comme principale fonction la conception de l’interface utilisateur de la prochaine version web de notre application, Genius Manufacturing . La personne sélectionnée devra analyser l’expérience client actuelle, proposer des améliorations et présenter des concepts de maquettes (mockup). Elle devra également accompagner l’équipe de développement informatique tout au long du projet.Les tâches et responsabilités : Effectuer une analyse et une prise de besoins (clients et experts internes)Étudier et analyser les produits et tendances sur le marchéÉtablir des plans et concepts afin de les présenter au comité responsableDévelopper et documenter les outils qui seront utilisés à l’interneOffrir de formation et coaching à notre équipeConnaissances et profil recherchés : Expérience en design d’application web spécialiséeExpérience UX / UI3 à 5 années d’expérience pertinentesMaitrise des logiciels de maquettes (mockup)Niveau avancé de maitrise de la langue anglaise (parlé et écrit)Aimer travailler en mode agileConnaissance de logiciel de type ERP serait un atout importantConditions de travail : Une super équipeUn salaire compétitifUn horaire de travail flexibleVacances + 5 congés payés par annéeDes assurances collectivesDes activités socialesEt bien plus...Lieu de travail : QuébecMots clés : Web – Migration – Développement – Interface – Utilisateur – Expérience client – Mockup – Besoin – Designer – Amélioration – Analyse – ERP – Application – Logiciel – Navigation – Agile – Ergonomie – Graphique – Normes – Livrables – Architecture – Interaction – Interactivité – Solution – Numérique – Mobile – Utilisateur – Visuel – CréativitéType d'emploi : Temps Plein

Job_Description: Position Overview: The role of the web UX & UI designer & developer is to create the user experience vision and successfully develop, monitor and improve users’ overall experience when they visit our websites. The individual should have the skills and knowledge to create memorable experiences that are true to the brand while balancing seamless interactivity, ease of navigation and conversion.Reporting to the Director, Marketing & Communications, the Web UX& UI Designerwill be the champion of the users’ needs, and create intuitive user experiences and interface designs. The role will be responsible for the end-to-end online construction, maintenance and experience for: TPH.ca, RHGroup.ca, RGStore.ca, TheGlobeRestaurant.ca, the Intranet, and others as required.The UX & UI Designer will create wireframes and storyboards that map the customer journey, user flows, process flows, information architecture, site maps, porotypes and A/B testing to effectively communicate interaction and design ideas & design each screen or page with which a user interacts.The ideal candidate should have an eye for clean design, possess superior UI & UX skills and be able to translate stakeholder requirements into logical interaction flows and a user interface that is intuitive, visually stimulating and converts.Responsibilities: Be guided by human-centric design by identifying user needs, and leveraging those insights to guide you through the design and testing processesUnderstand the research methods and approaches to recognize and deconstruct the expectation of our usersEstablish design best practices and guidelines through creation of conceptual campaigns and design of a great visual identity and cohesive style-guide ensuring that a consistent design language is applied across sites incorporating logo, corporate colours, typographic rules, etc.Maintaining consistency in visual elements and defining behaviorCreate website that are designed and optimized for all screen sizes (including mobile, tablet, and desktop) with a mobile-first mentality, with specific technologies and platforms in mindLead conversations to facilitate conceptual thinking that takes stakeholder considerations into the processCreate clickable prototypes in Testing of websites and that effortlessly lets the users accomplish their goalsOther duties and responsibilities as assignedQualifications: 3-5 years of proven web designer experienceDemonstrable UI & UX design skills with a strong portfolioSolid experience in creating wireframes and storyboards, user flows, process flows, information architecture, site maps, prototypes and A/B testing to effectively communicate interaction and design ideas & design each screen or page with which a user interactsExperience working with a .Net CMS and e-commerce, knowledge of DotNetNuke (DNN) is preferredProficiency in Creative Design Software (specifically Photoshop, Illustrator, and other visual design and wire-framing tools)Proficiency in: HTML, CSS, JavaScript and JQuery, Media Queries/Bootstrap, Version Control (SVN)Explore various usability testing methods to help inform and optimize designs to create more effective experiencesUnderstand on-page, off-page and technical SEO practices and how to best implement these strategies on the websitesImplement Google Analytics, Tag Manager and Optimize to apply fundamental concepts like performance measurement, comparison and optimization.Experience providing feedback on designer performance, and identifying improvement opportunitiesAbility to present your designs and sell your solutions to various stakeholdersAbility to solve problems creatively and effectivelyUp-to-date with the latest UI trends, techniques, and technologiesExperience working in an Agile/Scrum development processExcellent communication skills and the ability to multi-task, and work well under pressure while juggling several competing prioritiesJob Type: Full-timeExperience:.Net: 1 yearAdobe Creative Suite: 1 yearWeb Design: 3 yearsLocation:Toronto, ON

Job_Description: Job Description  SGI is looking for a talented and experienced Senior UX Designer to build exciting, innovative and accessible interfaces for our games. UX Designer works directly with the Art Director and Game Design team, helping to define player facing aspects of our games. This individual has the knowledge and sensibility of what makes an interface intuitive and how to employ visual presentation principles to create user-centric experiences. UX Designer has impeccable conceptual and problem-solving skills with a strong understanding of information architecture and how large amounts of information can be visually and functionally transformed into attractive, intuitive user interfaces. The ideal candidate thrives in a collaborative work culture, is a self-starter with initiative to solve problems and excellent follow through. Strong written and verbal communication skills are critical for the internal cross-department collaboration.  Responsibilities Drive one or more game titles UX / UI design from feature conception to implementation of UI, and support beyond ship date Collaborate with the Game Designers to translate game systems and gameplay user experience goals into intuitive interfaces that support and enhance the game experience. Work closely with the Art Director to understand and document the artistic style and goals to help define UX guidelines and build beautiful, user-centric experience Conceptualize UI/UX designs through wireframes, flow diagrams, interactive mocks, in-game prototyping, pre-visualization clips while ensuring that iterative feedback from stakeholders is incorporated Communicate designs and design rationale clearly, to the team and to management or others as needed Produce final wireframes and art mock-ups for design specs, including detailed asset requirements and use cases for UI implementation Assist artists, game designers, and programmers to fully integrate the aesthetic, mechanical, and technical elements of the product's user interface according to specifications Orchestrate feedback loops including team's play testing and player research , and respond to the results to improve on designs Observe and interpret results of usability testing and live game metrics, sharing conclusions with the team that help increase accessibility and inform design decision making game-wide Maintain UX standards and related documentation to help the company create a consistent, quality experience for its players across mobile platforms and PC Qualifications   3+ years of UX/UI experience with interactive media and ideally in mobile development Game experience on either traditional/console, Facebook, and/or mobile Bachelor's degree in Interactive Design, Graphic Design, or a related field, or equivalent work experience Diverse portfolio of UX / UI for Games, Apps, Prototypes or otherwise Strong passion for human-centered design challenges and graphic design challenges Willingness and ability to take ownership of the creation of a user experience from the concept stage, thru iteration and testing , all the way to the execution of a functional interface Awareness of trends in hardware and operating systems, mobile interface design, interactive design, and competitive software to help identify opportunities for innovation. Excellent analytical and problem solving skills and a solid understanding of user-centered design principles to design a complete interface for all game features that is functional, usable, appealing, and accessible. Mastery of Adobe Photoshop, Flash, other Creative Suite software and proficiency in tools for visual prototyping and creation of pre-visualizations and motion graphics Ability and willingness to learn new programs and pipelines Sense of humor, passion for your work, and desire to grow yourself and those around you  Additional Information  null
Title: Senior UX Designer

Job_Description: At Eventbase, design and user experience (UX) are at the forefront of everything we do. Our Eventbase Product Design Team creates visually engaging, user-centric designs that clearly differentiate and empower our event technology for the largest events around the World.  As a Senior User Experience Designer, you will be involved in every aspect of the product development process. You’ll work with a cross-functional, highly capable team of designers, product managers and engineers, inventing and iterating on end-to-end workflows and product experiences. You will utilize your full range of product design, interaction design, and visual design skills, and you will be responsible for the experience for a wide area of our product. This is a full-time position working in our Vancouver head office.  ABOUT EVENTBASE Eventbase is the leading mobile event technology platform for premium brands. Our proven product powers intelligent mobile apps that shape personalized journeys and deliver exceptional attendee experiences. Large companies can better understand their customers by using an Enterprise Event App and Eventbase Data Stream for every event in their portfolio, including their largest conferences and smaller regional events. Eventbase’s current customers include technology companies like IBM, Cisco and Microsoft, leading brands like Disney, Mercedes-Benz and AT&T, as well as large consumer events like SXSW, CES, Sundance and three Olympic Games.  Our team pioneers the latest in *intelligent* event technology, from advanced chat bots and AI recommendation engines, to the use of proximity beacons for hyper-local networking and 3D mapping. It’s no wonder we’ve been named “Best Event App” four years running.  Are you ready to join the best? WHAT YOU'LL DO Partner with PMs, engineers, researchers and content strategists to lead the user experience of a product from conception until launch (and then some) Lead the Design Process across the disciplines, taking into account business objectives and technical capabilities Understand the array of technical constraints, user goals and business requirements that shape current and future products Participate in the discovery and planning of new products and features while helping drive the design vision across our product suite Develop high level and/or detailed storyboards, mockups, and prototypes to effectively communicate interaction and design ideas Gauge the usability of new and existing products, and making constructive suggestions for change Design elegant user experiences in the creation of new features, innovation concepts and improvements in our product offering Plan and conduct user research including persona development and usability studies Create IA and UI/visual design deliverables for our mobile event products (including concept sketches, user flows, prototypes, wireframes and design specs), and ensure quality and creativity Be a company-wide advocate for design innovation, user-centered design thinking and design process Examine use metrics to understand user behaviour and inform subsequent designs Craft design experiments to understand impact of design on users WHO YOU ARE A meticulous sense of detail and ability to seek out simple solutions to complex design challenges Deep understanding with user scenarios, task flows, conceptual models, competitor analysis, and heuristic analysis 5+ years of interaction design, with experience planning and crafting complex interfaces, mobile applications and websites 5+ years of visual design 5+ years of application design BS/BA in Interactive Design, HCI or related degree preferred Agile/Kanban training preferred Experience with usability practices (persona creation, research, A/B testing, observational studies) Experience with mobile-specific IA and UX and best practices in user-centered design Strong UX/UI visual design prototyping and production skills, with expert proficiency in industry-standard software (Adobe CC, Invision, UXPin) Experience working with partners and leading project requirements in an energizing environment Excellent organizational, leadership, influencing, negotiation and communication skills Knowledge and passion about new technologies, industry and design trends WHAT WE OFFER  At Eventbase we work hard and smart, and take time to celebrate our wins. From casual team outings and Thirsty Thursdays to our themed holiday parties and annual summer talent show, we make sure we have fun.  Our team enjoys a range of professional development opportunities including our unique Ticket to Ride program, letting you experience our apps in action at world class events. Our Yaletown office provides a relaxed work environment with spaces to meet, collaborate, work quietly and enjoy our in-house cafe. It’s also dog-friendly, so bring your pal (and meet our current canine team online - #dogsofeventbase).  We’re proud of our diverse team: the Eventbasers hail from all over the world, with many different backgrounds, cultures and interests. We actively promote women working in technology both internally and by partnering with women in tech organizations externally. We do not discriminate based on race, religion, color, national or ethnic origin, gender or gender identity and/or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital or family status, veteran status, or disability status.  To Apply Please complete our online form and attach your resume and cover letter with responses to the following questions
Title: Senior UX Designer

Job_Description: Branton Advertising is a well-established advertising agency with 30 years of service located in London, Ontario. We are growing and looking to support this growth by adding an Intermediate or Senior Graphic Designer to our amazing creative team.If you are a seasoned graphic designer with a strong portfolio of work in the advertising industry, we’d love to hear from you. We also offer competitive wages and benefits package.The successful candidate must have: Degree or diploma in Graphic Design4+ years of graphic design experience (preferably in an agency role)Proven design capabilities as demonstrated in a portfolioAn ability to multi-task and manage multiple projects at the same timeExtensive knowledge of specialized design concepts to develop comprehensive layouts and produce marketing collateralHighly proficient in Adobe CC Suite (Illustrator, Photoshop, InDesign, Acrobat)Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite including Word and ExcelAn ability to interact with clients in a professional mannerAssets that would set a successful candidate apart include :Web design and development capabilitiesVideo editing and post-production experience (Ex. – Adobe After Effects)UX/UI design experienceCore competencies: Well-established design and conceptual skillsEffective written and verbal communication skillsTime management for deadline-sensitive environmentCreative and innovative thinkingDevelopment and continual learningProblem solvingAbility to provide, accept, and integrate constructive feedbackSelf-starter who can also work in a collaborative environmentInterested applicants should apply with résumé, cover letter, and online portfolio link.Branton Advertising would like to thank all applicants for their interest in the position. Please note that only short-listed candidates will be contacted for an interview.Job Type: Full-timeExperience:Graphic Design: 1 yearEducation:High school or equivalent
Title: Intermediate/Senior Graphic Designer

Job_Description: About RED  RED Academy is a technology school formed for the designers, creators, developers and digital marketers of tomorrow. Our purpose is to provide highly engaging, immersive learning programs for our students, that will provide them with the relevant technical skills and knowledge to succeed in today’s rapidly evolving workplace.  With schools open in Vancouver, Toronto and London UK, and 1000 students graduated in 18 months, the top 5 fastest growing tech company in Canada is continuing to grow.  We believe in autonomy, mastery and purpose, meaning that we encourage our staff to drive their own role, while we provide you with mentoring, training and personal development to support you in building a path you love and can truly connect with.  And best of all, all of our people share a deep passion for what they do: for design and technology, and finding the most forward-thinking ways of delivering a truly world-class learning experience for our students, all of which makes RED an amazing place to work.  In short, working at RED is unlike anything you will have experienced before. Aside from the deeply rewarding work of teaching and mentoring, we offer great holiday allocation & flexible working, benefits, health plan and a wide array of opportunities to be involved in the local tech and impact communities through our events and partnerships.  Who we are looking for  We’re on the lookout for a confident UX designer with 3-5 years of experience to come join our growing team of instructors.  We look for people with a passion for sharing their knowledge who have significant real-world experience. Educational experience is a bonus, but all of our instructional team receive in-depth training in the latest instructional and educational approaches, and so this is much less important than your attitude, knowledge and portfolio.  You will be joining a team of designers to help shape and deliver our part-time UX and UI Programs.  Our classes are taught in small teams with a low ratio of students per instructor. The programs are designed to be relevant to the tech world of today with personalised, applied learning content, working on projects from our network of partners.  Skills and qualifications  You are the person that your colleagues naturally gravitate to when they are looking for guidance. You are a strong team leader with problem-solving, communication and analytical thinking skills. You are proactive, autonomous and resourceful.  A diploma, certificate or a degree in the design field + 2 years of industry experience OR 10 years of industry experience.  You have fluency in some or all of the following topics: user experience design, user interface design, prototyping, ideation, digital marketing, mobile app & responsive web design, user research, user testing. As well as experience with industry design tools like Sketch, InVision, Axure, Principle, Framer.js as well as some understanding of HTML/CSS.  Above all you have a great portfolio of work and a love for what you do.  Primary duties and responsibilities  Delivering an extraordinary student learning experience through passionate and informative teaching techniques and lesson delivery  Providing both verbal and written feedback during the student’s learning program to achieve NPS > 25  Collaboratively research and develop radically relevant programs, curriculum and educational approaches to ensure we are providing the highest possible quality of learner experience design to our students  Sourcing Community Partners for student projects  Support admissions process to ensure school hits capacity each cohort, helping to design assets and regular attendance of promotional events  Continuous development of assessments and managing the graduation criteria through agreed processes and policies.  Great, so where do I apply?  If you are interested in this role, please apply directly on this page with your CV and a covering letter, providing three key reasons why you feel you would be the perfect fit. We aim to get back to you within a week to confirm if you have passed our initial sift.  RED Academy is an equal opportunities employer and welcome applications from all.
Title: UX Design Instructor

Title: UI & Communication Design Instructor

Job_Description: Think Research is looking for a creative and highly motivated Product Manager to join our in house Product Management team. The Product Manager will drive business requirements, analyze market opportunities, and support both the Sales and IT teams. The Product Manager will act as the ‘CEO’ for our Long Term Care product lines, managing the complete life-cycle from conception. This role will require an individual with a strong ability to be client-facing and take a big picture perspective on the market. What will you be doing? Design and manage the plan for development of clinical products to match identified market opportunities. Define product requirements using user stories and work alongside business analysts and UI/UX designers to meet customer and market needs Support business development and marketing activities Build, grow and maintain trusted relationships customers and partners Subject matter expert on our clinical products, core competencies, applicable markets, and competition Serve as a liaison between the Product team, Sales, IT and Clinical Research and Development Requirements: Minimum 2-3 years’ experience in a Product Management or related role. Experience delivering Enterprise product is an asset Clinical or healthcare/health tech expertise is an asset; exposure to the Long Term Care sector is highly valued Prior experience leading software products through the entire software development lifecycle and leading cross-functional teams (without formal authority) to solve complex problems Proven ability to communicate effectively with internal and external stake holders, both orally and in writing Experience generating product ideas, innovation, vetting ideas, and developing and executing on a product roadmap Strong technical background in related technologies; ability to participate in high-level discussions on technology strategy and approach Working knowledge of rocket science Bachelor’s Degree
Title: Product Manager

Job_Description: UX/UI Designer Do you enjoy working with teams to come up with intuitive and user friendly, visually delightful experiences? Do you bring passion and aesthetic excellence to the digital space? Do you like to execute new ideas, and drive projects through to completion? Our UX/UI Designers play an integral role in the development of our applications. If you are looking for an opportunity to have your passion for design, and expertise in user experience heard, read on to see how Flextrack may be a fit for you. UX/UI Designer Job Details As a leader in the mobile-based software design space, the Digital Designer will collaborate with our multi-disciplinary business and technology teams to design beautiful and intuitive multi-platform software products. Responsibilities include: Design delightful and beautiful visual elements for our suite of workforce management applications utilizing a Lean UX framework Collaborate with senior stakeholders to translate business and product requirements into wire frames, graphics, layouts, screen treatments, mobile design elements, and design templates Translate functional user requirements and experience parameters into wire frames, pixel-perfect mock-ups, story boards, wire frames and prototypes Collaborate with UX Thinkers, contributing to visualizing, designing and conceptualizing user experiences Plan, coordinate and build high fidelity prototypes for user testing Design a range of iterations, receive feedback and meet tight deadlines within a fast-paced environment Apply design principles to color, typography, layout and image choices appropriately to create visual solutions that meet business and user needs Provide quality assurance of creative deliverables UX/UI Designer - Must Have Skills Lean UX experience including participation in the creation of design templates Expert level abilities with HTML, HTML 5, CSS AND CSS3 Experience designing beautiful and effective enterprise software products with an emphasis on mobile first and/or responsive design Possess an online portfolio or samples of work demonstrating experience creating great end-to-end, user-centered design solutions and patterns, across desktop and mobile devices Experience working across teams to synthesize feedback and input from product management, engineering, and customers Great communication skills – ability to effectively pitch design concepts and articulate design decisions to senior management Strong working knowledge of: Sketch, Photoshop, Axure, Illustrator, InDesign, Fireworks and associated design tools Experience with, and comfortable in, an Agile environment UX/UI Designer - Nice to Have Skills Experience working on dashboards, data visualization and applications with messaging/activity management functions Knowledge of JavaScript based MVVM frameworks such as Angular.JS is a plus Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in a relevant field of study UX/UI Designer - Advantages Flexible work hours Silo free & flat work environment Flexible dress code True agile environment – daily stand ups – no red tape With 1 day a week work from home options Location, location, location! - don't want to go outside in the winter? We’ve got you covered Competitive compensation and benefits packages UX/UI Designer - Start Date ASAP UX/UI Designer - Employment Status Permanent UX/UI Designer - Work Location Mid-town, Toronto
Title: UX/UI Designer - 251668

Job_Description: Tasks Develop web-based interface for existing native iOS and Android applications in a LAMP environment. Develop web interfaces to assist in configuration and maintenance tasks both internally and externally. Develop web interfaces to better understand system usage and performance. Work closely with product management, user experience designers and users. Rapidly identify and solve problems proactively. Research and evaluate the latest web industry trends and technologies. Work with other developers to improve and standardize our design and development process. Work across a wide range of projects, each with specific functional and feature requirements. Take responsibility and ownership for the code you deliver. Job Requirements 5-10 years of relevant experience. Passion and appreciation for great design and exceptional UI/UX. Appreciation of the beautiful. Attention to detail. Proficient in HTML5, CSS3, JSON, Javascript and other Javascript librairies (jQuery, AngularJS, Bootstrap). Full knowledge of responsive design techniques for desktop, tablets & mobile. An impeccable eye for detail with the ability to match your UI to any design in a cross-browser environment. Basic knowledge of PHP. Experience with web application frameworks. Expert ability to get things done with a small team. Self-motivated but does well in a team-based environment. Strong initiative and enthusiasm. Highly responsible, self-disciplined, self-managed, self-motivated, able to work with little supervision. Bilingual: French & English. Good communication skills, spoken and written. If you like what you see, reach out to us with your CV and a few words about something you like or you did (a portfolio is extra nice) by clicking on the button below. No need for a cover letter; we’ll consider everyone who takes the time to apply.
Title: Front-End WEB Developer

Job_Description: We're seeking a Front-end Web Developer to join our dynamic team. We are located in the middle of the Old Port. We work in an open and collaborative environment, and we make a point to display our company culture very publicly (you can actually read it all on our website). We respect each other and help one another. Who we are is what makes us unique, and this is why we have the opportunity to work on amazing projects with great clients.  FULL TIME POSITION Salary: Based on skill and experience Hours: 9AM - 5PM Monday through Friday Flex Schedule is also an option (ex: 8AM – 4PM, 8:30AM – 4:30PM, etc.) Now, are you skilled in HTML, CSS, SASS and Javascript? Do you have a passion for UI, UX, and beautiful websites? Are you able to bring web designs to life? If you're experienced in building interactive and responsive websites, we can’t wait to meet you!  Let's get right into the fun stuff, as a Design Shopp team member, you will benefit from group insurance, including health and dental. You will have VIP access to our game room (video games, board games, Netflix, and more) and work in a lively and open work environment. You will always have the support of a young and passionate team and limitless cuddles from Charlie the Dog (aka Vice President of Happiness / aka Sandwich Thief). We have a gym in our building, and we can hook you up with a group discount membership the day you start.  Since this is a job posting, let’s get to it. As a Front-end Web Developer at Design Shopp, you will program HTML templates with clean and concise code based on a mocked-up design while working closely with designers, information architects, and back-end developers. We're looking for a dedicated Front-end Web Developer who stays up to date on the latest web development standards. You will ultimately be helping us create beautiful and engaging web experiences.  Experience using responsive frameworks such as Bootstrap or Foundation is a must, and experience coding for CMS and shopping carts like Magento or Wordpress is a plus.  That’s it in a nutshell, a pretty big nutshell. We’re looking to hire as quickly as possible so we hope to hear from you soon! Make sure to include a personal note about yourself and sample work so we can see how great you are.  If we select your application, you can expect a first phone interview where we will get to know you a bit better and discuss salary, as we will base it on your experience and skillset.  What we’re looking for: 4+ years experience coding in HTML, CSS, and jQuery, with a passion for front-end interfaces Someone with a passion for web design The ability to review designs and provide a time estimate for your work Someone who can deliver high quality code while adhering to web development best practices Experience writing SEO friendly code Experience using CSS preprocessors such as SASS or LESS Experience using grid-based frameworks such as Bootstrap or Foundation Experience collaborating with a team  Nice-to-have, but not required: Experience in web or interface design Experience with Wordpress, Magento, or other CMS and shopping cart systems Experience in PHP and MySQL Experience using Github Agency experience
Title: Front-end Web Developer

Job_Description: WE ARE A TRANSFORMATIONAL PARTNER We create impactful and custom digital experiences that connect brands with consumers in relevant and memorable interactions. We partner in the digital strategy, design and execution transforming the world’s leading global businesses.  Our digital studios are worldwide, yet we are one collaborative global team who recognize the demand for all software and technology products to engage users through compelling design.  Our people, are 'full stack’ hustler’s - digital citizens connected to the world of design and technology with stand out skills and business savvy - but most importantly, who like to get their hands dirty experimenting and learning.  We operate across many sectors, but specialize in retail and financial services, healthcare.  Purpose  To assist the VP Design in initiating and managing projects and lead the team forward in daily design tasks which include conducting workshops, user testing and prototyping.  Key responsibilities   Lead the UX, UI and conceptual creative aspects of all digital projects, oversee the selection of techniques and tools, and provide evaluation criteria to discover users’ needs. Create digital strategy and product roadmaps with our clients. Facilitate workshops with internal and external teams to deliver innovative and appropriate solutions. Synthesize qualitative and quantitative data to derive personas, use cases, concepts, user journeys and information architecture. Present research findings and creative work to DUXD and clients. Understand and incorporate complex technical and business requirements into compelling UX designs. Create prototypes based on high-level business, functional, and technical requirements. Collaborate with Engineering and Product Management to ensure the best creative solutions are realized, implemented and delivered. Keep abreast of latest practices, techniques and emerging technologies within the industry and employ these to develop ideas and inspire creative concepts. Act as a design and UX advocate internally and externally.  Experience   Bachelor’s degree or equivalent. Senior UX designer with 5-10 years work experience working for respected clients as a user experience designer, interaction designer, information architect, or similar role. Understanding of UX processes Has applied service design methods with client projects Experience in interface design for desktop, tablet, and mobile. Experience of working in an Agile environment is desired. Experience of working to strict deadlines. Proven design track record and design agency experience. Experience in designing user flows, wireframes and implementation instructions. Ability to define key metrics and evaluate project success. Portfolio of UX and design work.  Skills   World class UX / interface design Strong proof of concept, rapid prototyping, storyboarding and technical skills. Excellent communication skills, written and oral. Excellent presentation skills. Ability to quickly turn around detailed wireframes and mock-ups in an iterative environment. Proficiency in Adobe CS, Axure, etc. An understanding of HTML, CSS, JavaScript and other key web technologies.  We are a thriving Community of top technology talent that is globally connected. We Engage, Make, Run and Evolve the technology that makes many brands that you know and love. So let’s take this journey together. No matter where you are on your digital career roadmap, we can help you grow and have fun doing it.  At this time, Softvision LLC will not sponsor a new applicant for employment authorization for this position. Relocation assistance is available. Softvision LLC is an Equal Opportunity Employer. No 3rd Party Agency Candidates, please.

Job_Description: Location: Downtown Toronto, 111 Queen Street East  Job Type: Full-time (35 hours per week)  Experience: Director  Industry: Marketing and Advertising, Technology Overview Nurun Toronto is a division of Publicis Toronto specializing in the strategy, design and delivery of human-centered digital products, services, and platforms for a connected world. We’re looking for a driven and inspirational UX Practice Lead to join our growing team! You’re the hybrid between a player and a coach, getting your hands dirty in the day-to-day while providing guidance and motivation to a team of top talent professionals You apply empathy, strategic thinking, and craftsmanship into the holistic experience of your work, designing simple, customer-centric solutions for complex systems You act as the connective tissue between experience, design, research, and technology, encouraging harmonious collaboration across teams to deliver truly impactful work You have a passion for understanding what drives businesses and customers and excel at joining their goals As the UX Practice Lead, you’ll provide thought leadership, identifying clients’ business objectives and help champion a vision of how users interact with their brands. You’re an inspiring leader with a highly collaborative spirit and the ability to strategize and oversee creative and technically innovative solutions utilizing design thinking methodologies. The right candidate has led and developed a UX or XD team servicing clients in an agency setting, is comfortable envisioning and articulating experiences, and has top-notch communication, workshop facilitation and presentation skills. And yes, you’ll need to (and love to) get your hands dirty with research design and facilitation, creating interactive experience maps, user flows and personas, and generating clickable prototypes. Along with leading and delivering best-in-class Experience Design work, you’ll be expected to evangelize the benefits of UX both internally and externally, and generate opportunities to expand the team’s footprint within your portfolios. You’ll work closely with our strategists, creatives, analytics and technology teams to bring design to life. As the workload grows, team growth and mentorship opportunities will emerge. Responsibilities As the UX Practice Lead, you will: Lead & Manage Oversee the User Experience team (comprised of 4-6 designers, architects, and strategists) Oversee the Creative team (comprised of 7-10 copywriters, art directors and designers) Plan, assign and balance resourcing assignments and team workload Support team development through performance evaluations and reviews, mentorship and coaching Discover & Analyze Lead, plan and articulate UX project approaches Understand, define & articulate user behaviours, needs, motivations, and goals Collaborate closely with clients to identify, communicate and document business goals and objectives Lead stakeholder interviews and workshops Lead reviews and evaluations on existing digital experiences Work with internal teams to strategize and recommend solutions that meet both business objectives and the target audience needs Define product features/functionality, usability requirements and feature roadmaps Collaborate with Digital Strategists to define digital strategy and content strategy Create & Develop Produce elegant digital experiences across all digital touch points, ensuring that all responsive websites and apps are both usable, desirable, and striving to maximize user satisfaction Visualize and create high-level concepts quickly to demonstrate design ideas to clients and internal teams through wireframes, high-fidelity prototypes and other interactive representations Develop the information architecture, user tasks, user flows & content matrices for informational, promotional and transactional based sites and applications Ensure solutions support brand objectives, achieve business goals, and achieve or exceed defined KPIs & HVAs Create interfaces that are beautiful, user-friendly and technically feasible within the project constraints Participate & Collaborate Lead internal discussions, brainstorms and ideation sessions, including knowledge sharing sessions to help educate and inform internal teams on UX-related topics and trends Present and rationalize UX recommendations and solutions to clients Ensure that strategy is articulated through every step of the design and development process Support project and account managers with estimating work effort, building timelines, scoping work, providing status updates, and flagging risks Skills & Experience You are an ideal candidate for this role if you: Think strategically in everything you do Enjoy a variety of work Are a logical thinker with creative problem-solving skills Do what it takes to deliver on your commitments Enjoy working in a fast-paced, challenging, and rewarding environment Welcome and volunteer constructive feedback Thrive in a collaborative work environment Maintain constant and effective communication within multidisciplinary project teams Here’s what we’re looking for: A tangible and infectious passion for designing extraordinary, empathetic omnichannel experiences An ability to execute on best-in-class UX thinking, demonstrating unending curiosity and creative energy to achieve great outcomes, sometimes in non-obvious ways An ability to ensure that XD asset designs and interactions are accurately developed in the final product for optimal support of user goals and brand objectives A hunger to foster collaboration across internal and external teams Proven experience organizing and facilitating activities such as design thinking workshops, experience mapping and usability testing Awesome presentation skills with a natural ability to inspire confidence both internally and in front of clients A strong desire to mentor and lead others Advanced information architecture and interface/interaction design skills Deep understanding of underlying web technologies and usability principles across desktop, touch, and mobile platforms Must have: Bachelor’s degree in Interaction Design, Visual Design, HCI, or a related discipline 5+ years of professional UX, IA, XD or UI experience, with prior roles in a leadership or management position Online portfolio showcasing experience with complex problem-solving for sophisticated digital products including responsive web, native applications, product and service design, or data visualization Exceptional writing, verbal communication, organization and presentation skills Expertise with industry standard tools such as Sketch, Axure, InVision, Adobe CC Previous experience with agile teams, agile methodologies and accessibility compliance Fluent in the requirements of the design process, with an expert understanding of the time and resources needed to produce quality work Ability to multitask and meet deadlines under pressure Ability to engage customers and ask them the right questions Attention to detail and the tenacity to make sure quality standards are high Proficiency in creating wireframes and prototypes using Axure RP Pro, Invision or illustrator Experience designing responsive websites and applications for mobile and tablet devices Ability to define the target audience, tasks, user flows and diagrams Intermediate to expert skills in the Adobe Suite, Microsoft Office software, particularly in Word, Excel, and PowerPoint A portfolio of work showcasing your UX skills, capabilities, and strong sense of design Nice to have: Graduate degree or professional certification in UX or usability from Human Factors International, Akendi, or similar institution Experience in product design Experience in technical tools, content strategy, and/or content development process Technical acumen, particularly with HTML, CSS & Javascript Benefits Here’s what we have to offer: Competitive salary based on experience Phone subsidies Group benefits plan (medical, dental, travel and disability insurance) Opportunity to build and grow your own team(s) Convenient downtown location A fun and diverse team Impressive client roster, including FCA (Fiat Chrysler Automobiles), OLG (Ontario Lottery and Gaming), Canada Post, RBC, Rogers, Merck, TTC Learn more about Nurun Toronto at https://www.nurun.com/en/careers/toronto/ and Publicis Toronto at https://www.publicis.ca/ Publicis is an equal opportunity employer and
