Title: UX Practice Lead (Director)

Job_Description: About working at CHIMP  At CHIMP (Charitable Impact), we know that everyone has something to give. That's why we’re leading the movement to make giving a part of everyday living for everyone.  We love working with talented, creative, and open-minded people who strive to make a difference. We also look for people who share our core values of generosity, inclusivity, curiosity, courage, and responsibility—the guiding principles we stand by and incorporate into our work every day.  We know that a diverse team is what makes our work and culture great. That's why we're committed to building an inclusive and collaborative workplace that values equity and welcomes everyone. Our team members enjoy competitive salaries, purposeful perks, and a culture that gives back and has fun doing it. So come and join us, and let's change the world together.  About the role  Embedded within the Experience Design team in the Product Department, the UX/UI role is a generalist role which focuses on creating exceptional experiences across various product verticals.  This role will also work closely with business development, research, marketing professionals, various subject matter experts and stakeholders to advance CHIMP through meaningful and refined experiences.  Core responsibilities  Create world-class design solutions to various UX/UI problems  Work closely with Product Managers, stakeholders and subject matter experts to assess and understand requirements and work strategically on crafting solutions  Work closely with our Content Strategists and content-first design methodologies  Work seamlessly with different teams and departments  Create flows, wireframes, high-fidelity mock-ups and interactive prototypes for different digital products  Conduct remote usability testing and observe best practices of solution validation  Analyze user feedback and activity, and iterate to enhance the experience for our users  Provide timelines and delivery estimates  Work closely with our Research departments to understand our audiences and how research and analytics translate into our everyday work  What you’ll bring  Creativity and passion for what you do  5+ years of digital design experience, spanning the disciplines of UX, UI and visual design  Undergraduate degree in a relevant discipline  Mastery of industry-standard design tools (Adobe, Sketch, InVision, etc.)  Experience working in a fast-paced environment  Excellent communication and presentation skills  Ability to simplify complexity and distill ideas  Ability to both take high-level direction and have ownership over projects and specific pieces of work  Solid understanding of design best practices and current design frameworks  Design thinking practice as a strategic problem-solving discipline  Our ideal candidate  A resourceful, authentic and transparent creator and maker  Someone who cares about the same things we do  Is a proactive communicator and someone who can work independently  A lifelong learner who is curious and open-minded  Possesses a collaborative, team-focused working style  Is familiar with omni-channel- and research-driven approaches to design  Has experience working with complex stakeholder groups and senior executives in fast-paced environments  Can translate and express complex information into compelling and effective design solutions  Possesses strong project management skills  Reports to  Director, Experience Design  Status  Full time regular (permanent), 40 hours per week. Based in Vancouver, BC  More about CHIMP  CHIMP (Charitable Impact) was founded to radically transform how people experience giving. Our online platform makes it easy to support the causes you care about, raise money with others, and track your impact over time. We also help donors make their biggest impact by offering strategic giving support.  By empowering people to give on their terms, we’ve helped Canadians donate more than $350 million to thousands of charities—and we’re just getting started!
Title: UX/UI Designer

Job_Description: Does it excite you to apply your product design skills to help people around the world get home safely after a hard day’s work, and to help elite sports teams gain insight into a critical component of athlete readiness?  If it does, then we’d love to meet you. We are looking for a Senior Product UI/UX Designer to join our Product team. Reporting directly to our Product leader, you’ll work closely with Product, Engineering, and the extended team to create tools and experiences for our web and mobile products. You will also have ample opportunity to design product tests, talk to customers and observe how the product is used in the real world.  Position Responsibilities  Work together with Product to turn ideas into briefs that describe problems and opportunities, embark on prototyping, flesh out and deliver specs, ultimately shepherding ideas from conception to market and beyond  Work directly with Engineering, QA, and other stakeholders, from beginning to end, supporting the implementation of your designs, each step of the way  Use big data insights as part of our decision making, when it makes sense, or make insights from big data the centrepiece of a solution  Look for even better ways to nurture user engagement for daily active use  Turn complex data, calculations, and technical concepts into easy to use tools  Craft scenarios, user flows, wireframes, and working prototypes that clearly communicate design intent to everyone, designers and non-designers alike  Position Requirements  A rich portfolio of design work that speaks to your UX and visual design skills and a track record of delivering products to market  Leadership skills. You are comfortable owning the solution and being the voice for design. As a ~30 person company, we’ll expect you to flex your wings and lead us in your area of expertise  Experience designing data visualizations and/or analytics-based products  Desire to build and create. You have the ability to prototype rapidly, be it with paper, hand-coded HTML/JavaScript, Principle, Axure, Keynote, or whatever  Demonstrate the ability to think critically about data-heavy concepts and make them accessible and delightful to all users, including those who are not themselves data-savvy  Passion for learning, sharing and collaboration: new design tools and processes, new technical areas, better ways to get things done  Collaboration skills and willingness to do what’s needed. A team player, flexible and open while designing, discussing, and presenting your work  Ability to get it done. You work fast and generate a wide variety of high-quality solutions  Experience with software development and/or designing multi-system products and services are a big plus  Education and Experience  Bachelors or higher degree in User Experience related field (UX design, HCI, Graphic design).  5-8+ years of UX/visual/other applicable product and design experience, which may include work as a UX designer, UX architect, creative director, or industrial designer. Solid understanding of the design process and best practices.  We appreciate your interest in this role. The best way to apply for this position is through this site, please refrain from calling our office. Thanks!  About Fatigue Science  Founded in 2006 and based in Vancouver, BC, Fatigue Science is the leader in sleep and performance analytics. We work with amazing clients, like Rio Tinto, Goldcorp, Vancouver Canucks and Seattle Seahawks, to provide actionable insight into the extent and sources of fatigue within their operations. Our Readiband System can help organizations achieve a higher level of effectiveness during game time or while performing high-risk job functions and improve overall employee health, safety, and performance - We are committed to ensuring our clients’ success in these goals.  We offer the opportunity to be a part of an exciting and buzz-generating technology business and a place to continue growing your career. We have a bright, open concept office located in the heart of downtown Vancouver. If you have a proven track record and share a passion for technology we want to hear from you.
Title: Senior Product UX/UI Designer

Job_Description: Who we are At Procurify, our team is reinventing the way companies spend - Procurify is a powerful spend management software that helps businesses achieve greater visibility into their company's spend, track purchases across their organization, and report on their financial data with certainty. As a Senior Product Designer (UI/UX), you’ll be working in a squad of amazing, empowered people who specialize in Front End and Back End Development, Product Design, and Quality Assurance. Together, you will collaborate throughout the development process to gather requirements and deliver polished features for the world to see!  We value great user experience design and prioritize it across everything we do at Procurify. We are constantly on a mission to provide beautifully designed business software that not only transforms organizations, but empowers people to work with a software that they love to use.  If you're a teammate who is passionate about mastering your craft and solving real world problems for our users, we're looking for you.  What you'll do  Analyze, understand, and solve functional problems for users by designing user-friendly and intuitive experiences.  Translate business requirements, customer needs, and technology constraints into simple user-centered design solutions.  Define feature requirements into user stories, wireframes, user flows, mockups and acceptance criterias to efficiently communicate the intended design direction for web and mobile applications.  Carry out acceptance testing before feature deployment.  Establish and promote design guidelines, best practices and standards throughout the company and the brand  What you'll need  We are an equal opportunity employer, and truly believe your potential and value are not solely based on your background. We are looking for phenomenal people who can diversify our team with new skills and specializations, however, the following will help propel your success as a Senior Product Designer (UI/UX).  Professional experience in designing for web and mobile applications.  Proficiency in Sketch, Invision and the willingness to adopt new tools as needed.  Experience partnering with Product Owners to develop strategy and requirements for features.  Strong typographic skills and a clean visual design sense.  Able to handle multiple priorities and meet tight deadlines without compromising quality.  Great understanding about UX principles and best practices.  Passion for design and innovation with a good understanding of the industry’s latest trends and technologies.  Alone you can go fast, together you can go far  As a self-proclaimed group of “misfits that fit”, our team is made up of remarkable, creative humans from all walks of life (truly, we welcome everyone from ex-boat-captains, to swing-dancers, to competitive gamers and novelists.) Everyone has a story, but no matter how different our lives outside the office may be, we all share the core values: humility, fearlessness, inspiration, empowerment, empathy, and, of course, teamwork, that drive us to work together to find happiness and purpose in our work. We work for each other so that we can celebrate together.  Procurify is a place where your personal growth is a real priority; where our values help us make big decisions, mistakes are expected, being true to yourself is encouraged, and our goal to improve people’s work lives isn’t just a catchy phrase, because it actually guides everything we do. We also offer a couple of awesome things for you to enjoy:  Uncapped responsible time off, parental leave, flexible working hours, and the opportunity to work from home when it makes balancing life easier.  Extended health, dental, and vision benefits.  Fun office treats, which include snacks, company lunches and events, and gym & transit subsidies.  The ability to grow your knowledge by taking courses, classes, or attending events that you are passionate about, covered by Procurify.  Misfits that fit  We appreciate unique people and with that, we appreciate a unique approach. We are looking for a video or cover letter that stands out amongst the rest. Please take this opportunity to tell us why you believe Procurify is an important business tool for organizations.  Want to Learn More?  Get to know some of our Product Team through our Meet Us Monday videos: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=j9l4_U6I6QQ  Check out what our clients are saying about us: https://www.procurify.com/testimonials
Title: Senior Product Designer (UI/UX)

Job_Description: You have outstanding, rigorous credentials, expertise and experience in User Experience Design. You are highly adept in guiding and collaborating with teams to develop user centric processes and interactions that enhance business application, increase user engagement and increase brand loyalty. You effectively utilize your solid understanding of business goals and user behaviour in designing the overall functionality of the product to ensure a great user experience. Our client is committed to: Providing a respectful, fair and ethical work environment that values innovation, collaboration and drive for excellence. Reporting to the Manager, Application Delivery, as User Experience Designer, you will: Design and develop user interfaces and user flows based on requirements and feedback from stakeholder groups. Create UI wireframes, mockups and interactive prototypes. Provide end to end analysis of our digital platforms with the user needs in mind. Work directly with Analysts to review requirements and provide feedback on documentation. Participate in planning activities as needed. Develop HTML and CSS templates for digital applications. Work directly with development teams to provide HTML and CSS templating and support. Diagnose, troubleshoot and resolve browser and device-based display issues. Estimate and track progress on work tasks. Interact with the Customer Experience (CX) team to ensure alignment with the latest customer and user trends. Interact with Communications and Marketing teams to ensure brand alignment and consistency. Improve upon and ensure the adherence to the established practices, processes, and guidelines. Develop UI documentation and UI templates for use by other groups. Mentor junior UX team members. What the successful candidate will bring: Degree or diploma in Graphic Design, Digital Media or equivalent experience with 2+ years of experience in planning, developing and integrating user interfaces Demonstrated experience using design and prototyping tools, such as the Adobe Suite, UXPin, Mockflow and InVision. Strong HTML and CSS skills and the ability to trouble shoot browser and device display issues. Good working knowledge of JavaScript. Experience with JavaScript frameworks such as Angular, React, or Vue is considered an asset. Detail-oriented with analytical and problem-solving skills to identify and resolve issues in a timely and effective manner. Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to communicate in a clear and concise manner to a wide-range of audience (business partners, customers and stakeholders). Exceptional planning, organizational, multi-tasking and prioritization skills. Proven leadership skills, with the ability to foster and encouraging high team morale utilizing effective coaching strategies. Sound decision-making skills, with the ability to direct team members to achieve goals through clear instruction. Certifications in relevant technology or processes is considered an asset. In return, what you can expect: Competitive salary and benefits package. If you are interested in the position of User Experience Designer, please submit your resume to Ryan den Teuling by pressing “Apply Now”. Only candidates already eligible to work in Canada will be reviewed. Only qualified candidates will be contacted. Fit is important to us and it’s important to the companies we partner with. At The Headhunters, we understand that finding your next dream role is not just about aligning your skills with a job description. It is about knowing your personality, workstyle and career goals. Learn more about our specialized recruitment services at www.theheadhunters.ca.
Title: User Experience Designer - 3543

Job_Description: This opportunity is available via The Creative Group and is ideal for a creative thinker who enjoys working independently as well as collaborating with colleagues. Based in the Mississauga, Ontario area, this Front-end Designer/Developer position would be a short term temporary-to-fulltime opportunity. Talented, ambitious, and experienced individuals are encouraged to apply for the position today! - Strong front-end development skills - HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, Json, Angular.js, jQuery  Some experience with analytics like SEO markup/tagging  Nice to have:  Experience with Enterprise level CMS's (AEM, SiteCore, OpenText) Experience with Open Source CMS's WordPress Joomla Design and UX/UI would be a strong asset assets - UX, UI, wireframes, prototyping
Title: Front End Developer

Job_Description: Atecna te permettra de travailler en tant que Consultant UX-UI dans tout type d’organisation et de projet, de répondre à des stratégies multiples et complémentaires, avec un fil conducteur : le e-Commerce.  Immergé(e) au cœur des projets stratégiques de l’un de nos clients grands comptes, tu feras partie intégrante de l’équipe challengée pour la conception du projet – web, mobile ou applicatif – au travers du périmètre fonctionnel mais également en échange avec les utilisateurs et l’existant sur le marché (benchmark…). Tu mettras en place une démarche, avec méthode et organisation adaptée en fonction des délais, de la maturité client, de la qualité attendue et des contraintes. Tu enrichiras l’expérience du service, en faciliteras l’accès et le rendras le plus désirable possible. Tant par ton travail d’ergonome que par tes talents de designer. Qu’il s’agisse d’optimiser un tunnel de conversion, refondre un site institutionnel, concevoir un nouveau service en responsive design, tu procéderas par étapes itératives en gardant constamment à l’esprit deux dimensions indissociables : besoins utilisateurs et enjeux business. Définir la Stratégie UX (UX Map, principes design…). Concevoir les interfaces (PDD, Mock-up, AI, Wireframe, prototype fonctionnel, spécifications). Mener des tests utilisateurs, des observations terrains, animer des ateliers. Votre profil De formation BAC +2/5, tu évolues depuis plus de 4 ans en web agency ou chez l’annonceur, sur des problématiques e-business que ce soit en site, mobile, ou applicatif. Et tu recherches aujourd’hui un poste en adéquation avec ton profil, évolutif et ambitieux. Tu as une vraie démarche d’ergonome UX alliée à des talents de designer UI pour offrir aux utilisateurs la meilleure expérience online. Autonome, tu souhaites évoluer dans un environnement e-business, entouré des technologies les plus récentes sur des projets passionnants d’envergure. Pré-requis Expériences d’animations d’ateliers, d’expressions de besoins, d’observations terrains. Maîtriser les outils de la chaine UX : Axure, Invision, Sktech, Photoshop et Illustrator pour la conception de prototypes. Être au fait des nouvelles tendances technos web et design graphique ainsi que des meilleures pratiques en expérience utilisateur (UX) / Connaître les usages spécifiques aux différents types de terminaux. Savoir évoluer dans des organisations et des méthodes projets différentes (cycle V, méthode agile, lean,…). Savoir convaincre et justifier vos choix auprès des décideurs. Anglais lu, écrit et parlé. Sens du service orienté client. Etre éligible au VIE. https://www.civiweb.com/FR/le-volontariat-international/conditions-du-VIE.aspx
Title: Consultant UX / UI – H/F – en embauche V.I.E

Job_Description: Join Windsor's most innovative, fun and Silicon-Valley-esque development and innovation company, bringing world-class projects to Windsor. Help us build exciting technology like multiplayer game servers for Atari, social apps for Puma, high profile analytics engines for The PGA Tour, and cutting edge products like natural-language-processing chat-bots.As one of Windsor's most sought-after companies to work for, we offer flexible time, work-at-home days, a great benefits plan and in-office massage. We are located in the heart of Windsor's historic Walkerville. You must be willing to work in our office. We are not interested in off-shore or remote work.We are seeking talented interface designers who are looking to grow professionally and personally within a fast-growing company. You will work on a variety of marketing deliverables, including websites, prototypes, wireframes, business collateral and other design pieces.ResponsibilitiesWork on the design of user interfaces for web and mobile projectsAble to help with wireframing using tools like Adobe XD and BalsamiqAble to self-direct and work independently, to manage multiple, concurrent projects simultaneously from start to finishRequirements: Expertise in Adobe Creative Suite: Illustrator, Photoshop, InDesign, After Effects, EdgeKnowledge of responsive web designAbility to create interactive prototypesCustomer-obsessed, detail-oriented and comfortable working on highly technical teamsDemonstrated experience with building user interfaces across a range of platforms including desktop and mobile--- Please send examples of your design portfolio (specifically web design) when you apply. ---We look forward to meeting you!Job Type: Full-timeEducation:High school or equivalentLocation:Windsor, ON
Title: Web Designer / UI / UX

Job_Description: Nous valorisons la diversité et avons à cœur de créer un milieu de travail inclusif qui nous inspire tous à donner le meilleur de nous-mêmes. Joignez-vous à notre équipe et faites une différence!  Votre poste  Nous Comment imaginez-vous les bureaux d’une compagnie d’assurance? Et l’atmosphère de travail qui y règne? Nous gageons que si vous passez nous voir au Lab de Intact, vous serez très surpris! Situé au centre-ville de Montréal, nous sommes un laboratoire d’innovation dont la mission est de créer des produits à la fine-pointe de l’insurtech qui améliorent la vie de millions de Canadiens.  Mariant la convivialité et la vélocité d’une startup aux ressources et aux moyens d’une grande entreprise (vous disposerez de tous les outils dont vous avez toujours rêvé!), le Lab est un environnement jeune et dynamique, offrant des défis stimulants, des collègues inspirants et une carrière passionnante (chez un des top 100 employeurs au Canada). C’est l’endroit idéal pour parfaire vos compétences et faire évoluer votre carrière.  Vous Vous êtes passionné par le commerce électronique et l’innovation numérique? Vous avez un talent particulier pour traduire des exigences complexes en expériences utiles et agréables? Vous restez à l’affût des dernières tendances en matière de design et vous aimez expérimenter de nouveaux outils et de nouvelles méthodologies? Nous avons l’occasion parfaite pour vous!  Rôle À titre de designer UX/UI, vous jouerez un rôle essentiel dans la conception et l’évolution de notre écosystème numérique. Relevant du directeur principal, Innovations numériques, vous aurez comme principales responsabilités :  Concevoir des expériences captivantes en vue de réaliser les objectifs d’affaires  Valider la fonctionnalité et l’utilité par l’entremise de tests et de recherches auprès des utilisateurs  Produire des livrables UX et design pertinents au besoin  Piloter une feuille de route aux côté d’un directeur de produit et d’une équipe agile multidisciplinaire  Présenter le travail aux parties prenantes  Aider les ingénieurs à produire des interfaces de qualité et agréables  Prôner une conception axée sur l’utilisateur et les données  Vos compétences  Minimum trois années d’expérience  Expertise en matière de convivialité et de pratiques de conception centrées sur l'utilisateur  Maîtrise des outils de conception (Sketch, Axure, InVision, Illustrator, etc.)  Expérience des outils de recherche UX (usertesting.com, Optimal Workshop, etc.) un atout  Expérience dans la production de flux de processus, d’inventaires de contenu, etc.  Vous aimez travailler dans un environnement de collaboration qui accorde une importance primordiale au travail d’équipe, à l’innovation, à l’ouverture d’esprit et au plaisir  Veuillez inclure votre portfolio dans votre dossier de candidature.  Vous êtes  Une personne avec qui il est agréable de travailler  Créatif, analytique, curieux et ingénieux  Un joueur d’équipe capable de partager et recevoir des commentaires constructifs  Excellent pour expliquer vos idées à différents intervenants  Profondément passionné par le design et la qualité  Organisé et proactif  En tant que salarié temps plein, vous bénéficierez des avantages suivants :  Un salaire compétitif  Un boni de performance annuel  Un régime de retraite  Un horaire de travail flexible de 35 heures par semaine  Des assurances médicales et dentaires hors pair  Et plusieurs autres avantages et bénéfices (remboursement gym, conférences, etc.)  Énoncé fermeture  Cette opportunité vous intéresse? Nous avons très hâte de faire votre connaissance!  D’excellents avantages sont offerts : salaire concurrentiel, avantages flexibles, aménagements de travail flexibles, congés mobiles, régime de retraite à prestation déterminée, etc.  Dans le cadre du processus de sélection d’Intact, les candidats peuvent être appelés à donner leur consentement à une vérification de leurs antécédents pertinente au poste à pourvoir avant de recevoir une offre d’emploi. Celle-ci peut comprendre une confirmation des références d’emploi, des études et des titres de compétences, une vérification des emplois, de l’identité, des infractions criminelles et du permis de conduire ainsi qu’un rapport de crédit.  Vous pouvez soumettre votre candidature à un emploi affiché pourvu que vous occupiez vos fonctions actuelles depuis au moins douze mois et que votre performance soit jugée bonne ou que votre contrat temporaire arrive à son échéance. Une recherche de talents à l'externe est menée parallèlement au recrutement à l'interne Veuillez donc prendre note que des candidats potentiels pourraient avoir été identifiés pour ce poste dans le cadre de leur plan de développement.   Veuillez noter que l'usage du masculin a comme but d'alléger le texte.  Cet affichage prendra fin 02 juin 2018.  Prime de recommandation  CE POSTE EST SUJET À UNE PRIME DE RECOMMANDATION DE 3000$.  #li-qc  Droit de travailler au Canada  Les personnes qui posent leur candidature à un poste permanent doivent, dès leur embauche, avoir le droit de travailler au Canada de façon permanente. Les documents pouvant servir de preuve dans le cas des rôles permanents sont un certificat de naissance canadien, un passeport canadien, un certificat de citoyenneté canadienne, une carte de résident permanent ou une confirmation de son statut de résident permanent pour prouver qu’il a le droit de travailler au Canada.  Indeed Commandité  IN-INFR
Title: Designer UX/UI

Job_Description: Travailler chez Genius Solutions c'est : Joindre une équipe passionnée et dynamique qui a à cœur le succès de l’entreprise. C’est également joindre une entreprise en constante évolution dans un environnement stimulant et dans un marché hautement compétitif .Vous avez de l’intérêt à travailler chez Genius? Assurez-vous de vous reconnaitre dans les valeurs de l’entreprise :Vous êtes énergique et passionné : pour atteindre le succès, nous avons besoin de gens avec une énergie débordante démontrant une passion pour leur travail.Vous êtes en mission : les défis sont grands pour nous et nos clients et nous devons faire face à plusieurs obstacles. Pour mener à bien notre mission, il est essentiel de garder le cap!Vous êtes un bon joueur d’équipe : nous croyons fermement que le respect et la confiance sont des ingrédients essentiels au succès.Vous valorisez la connaissance et l’expertise : Genius valorise grandement les gens qui veulent progresser, acquérir de nouvelles connaissances et développer leur expertise.Vous vous reconnaissez dans les valeurs de la compagnie? Oui?Continuons!Designer UX / UI chez Genius Solutions : Nous recherchons actuellement un designer UX/UI . Cette personne aura comme principale fonction la conception de l’interface utilisateur de la prochaine version web de notre application, Genius Manufacturing . La personne sélectionnée devra analyser l’expérience client actuelle, proposer des améliorations et présenter des concepts de maquettes (mockup). Elle devra également accompagner l’équipe de développement informatique tout au long du projet.Les tâches et responsabilités : Effectuer une analyse et une prise de besoins (clients et experts internes)Étudier et analyser les produits et tendances sur le marchéÉtablir des plans et concepts afin de les présenter au comité responsableDévelopper et documenter les outils qui seront utilisés à l’interneOffrir de formation et coaching à notre équipeConnaissances et profil recherchés : Expérience en design d’application web spécialiséeExpérience UX / UI3 à 5 années d’expérience pertinentesMaitrise des logiciels de maquettes (mockup)Niveau avancé de maitrise de la langue anglaise (parlé et écrit)Aimer travailler en mode agileConnaissance de logiciel de type ERP serait un atout importantConditions de travail : Une super équipeUn salaire compétitifUn horaire de travail flexibleVacances + 5 congés payés par annéeDes assurances collectivesDes activités socialesEt bien plus...Lieu de travail : QuébecMots clés : Web – Migration – Développement – Interface – Utilisateur – Expérience client – Mockup – Besoin – Designer – Amélioration – Analyse – ERP – Application – Logiciel – Navigation – Agile – Ergonomie – Graphique – Normes – Livrables – Architecture – Interaction – Interactivité – Solution – Numérique – Mobile – Utilisateur – Visuel – CréativitéType d'emploi : Temps Plein
Title: Designer UX / UI

Job_Description: Position Overview: The role of the web UX & UI designer & developer is to create the user experience vision and successfully develop, monitor and improve users’ overall experience when they visit our websites. The individual should have the skills and knowledge to create memorable experiences that are true to the brand while balancing seamless interactivity, ease of navigation and conversion.Reporting to the Director, Marketing & Communications, the Web UX& UI Designerwill be the champion of the users’ needs, and create intuitive user experiences and interface designs. The role will be responsible for the end-to-end online construction, maintenance and experience for: TPH.ca, RHGroup.ca, RGStore.ca, TheGlobeRestaurant.ca, the Intranet, and others as required.The UX & UI Designer will create wireframes and storyboards that map the customer journey, user flows, process flows, information architecture, site maps, porotypes and A/B testing to effectively communicate interaction and design ideas & design each screen or page with which a user interacts.The ideal candidate should have an eye for clean design, possess superior UI & UX skills and be able to translate stakeholder requirements into logical interaction flows and a user interface that is intuitive, visually stimulating and converts.Responsibilities: Be guided by human-centric design by identifying user needs, and leveraging those insights to guide you through the design and testing processesUnderstand the research methods and approaches to recognize and deconstruct the expectation of our usersEstablish design best practices and guidelines through creation of conceptual campaigns and design of a great visual identity and cohesive style-guide ensuring that a consistent design language Job_Description: QHR is seeking a Senior UX / UI Designer in Vancouver. We are looking for a design All-star that can bridge the gap between the design lead and our awesome designers to help produce outstanding digital products that stand out. If you aspire to designing digital products like Slack, Asana, Googles Allo, Docs or Apples Health, Calendar or FaceTime then this job could be for you. This designer will need to have the experience and the skills to partner with their design lead. and product team members to help turn the company’s insights into a beautifully designed product, that would satisfy a premium Canadian employer.  This is an amazing opportunity for a designer to work from our downtown Vancouver office, and to be a part of a growing design team that leaves ego at the door. Our design team has found its self at a fast growing company that truly recognizes the value that design can bring in creating products that at their heart wants to make a real difference to its users, from the start of a project, to the end and beyond!  About You: You are a Senior UX/UI Design All-star that has a portfolio that stands out!  Your confidence, experience and capacity allows you to take on products that have large market and brand aspirations.  As a product designer you have experience at working alongside product managers, product owners and business analysts to help bring clarity from the products core value proposition to improve the products experience  As a well-rounded Designer, you love being part of a team that designs in the world of responsive design and mobile apps.  The UX designer in you loves to take on complex tasks and transform them into intuitive, accessible, and easy-to-use designs that consider mobile standard practices.  The UI designer in you loves to bring the designs alive with iconography, typography, color, motion, and space to help the users successfully navigate our products branded experience.  The seasoned and commercial designer in you will possess the production skills that will support preparing designs for the developers through the build process.  As you progress through the products design lifecycle you will naturally think about how to utilize and evolve the design principles, form, and maintain interactive consistency through patterns and a branded style.  You have experience at decoding user feedback and insights sessions.  You naturally seek satisfaction by hitting deadlines and knowing when to be creative and when to be practical. The idea of project momentum should resonate with you and you take full ownership of your work.  You are up-to-date with the latest design tools that support cleaner work flow. Tools such as the Adobe Creative Cloud, Sketch, In-vision, Axure and Zeplin.  You have experience working in an agile environment, planning, and delivering your work in sprint based cycles.  You have a great attitude that thrives on openness and you’re always open to feedback from design leadership, team members and stakeholders.  Essential Functions: Work in sketch to produce concepts, user journeys, prototypes, screens to create great, human-centered products that put our users first Plan, facilitate and decode user tests and proactively use these learnings to influence the products design principles and direct new features and improvements moving forwards Present designs to the team and use feedback to direct design Work with business and technology stakeholders to understand features cost, quality, and time tradeoffs Effectively communicate and support the development team to ensure implementation details are met Contribute to an innovative and principled design culture across the whole product team Build strong relationships with internal stakeholders  Qualifications: Proven and relevant 7+ year(s) experience as a rounded and robust Senior UX/UI Designer  Experience working in corporate environment as well as startups is an asset  Experience working on lifestyle or health and wellness products is an asset  BA Hons degree in design or related Education  Outstanding design portfolio highlighting your talent on web and mobile including responsive design and native apps  In-depth responsive & native app design experience  The ability to think outside the box to solve problems. Be the 'eyes of the customer' and balance customers' needs with business requirements while considering technical constraints  Excellent written and verbal skills to communicate complex interaction design concepts at all levels  An individual that is both a self-starter and can self-organize  An insatiable appetite for design and a willingness to learn new skills  Ability to work in a fast-paced environment  Great communication skills  A love of design and design delivery  Sound interesting? Ready for the challenge? So, if you believe you have all the design chops and experience needed, why not consider joining our team to make the difference!  Next steps: Please provide a brief explanation in your application of why you are excellent for this role, while highlighting your portfolio  Please provide your portfolio in your application. Give us an introduction to some of your best work so we can see what drives your creative thinking
Title: Senior UX/ UI Product Designer

Job_Description: Wiivv creates custom fit footwear from your phone. Wiivv is transforming how footwear and apparel is made today. We believe you are unique–from your anatomy to how you move–and that in order to truly move, feel, and live your best your footwear and apparel should be made to your unique spec. With just a few photos from your phone, we can digitally map each foot, create a custom product using 3D printing and other hybrid manufacturing techniques, and deliver it to your door in under 10 days. Be a part of a team of designers passionate about creating a great experience for our customers from web-to-app-to-feet. As a Wiivv Senior Product Designer, you will be involved in every aspect of the product development process, from brainstorming the next great product innovation to tweaking copy and pixels right before launch. You will be expected to utilize your full range of product design, interaction design, and visual design skills. This is a results-driven role, with the opportunity to work with a highly creative, high-performing team, with a ton of room for growth. This is a full-time position in Vancouver, BC. Visa sponsorship is an option for the right candidate. At Wiivv we welcome all qualified applicants and seek diverse personal characteristics across our team, such as race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, genetic information, and other defining traits.   Responsibilities Partner with PMs, engineers, e-commerce, and marketing to oversee the user experience of a product or feature from idea-to-launch-to-iteration. Establish and lead a design process for for the design team that can efficiently take broad, conceptual ideas and turn them into high-quality experiences that prove valuable for our customers and/or business partners. Rapidly ideate and validate designs through sketches, prototypes, and testing. Design flows and experiences that are incredibly simple and elegant. Contribute to high-level strategic decisions with the rest of the product and executive teams. Give and solicit feedback from other designers in order to continually raise our bar for quality.   Minimum Qualification 3+ years of visual design 3+ years of interaction design An outstanding portfolio showcasing examples of past design work Strong communication skills and experience presenting design decisions and rationale Demonstrated strategic product thinking and vision Experience in building and shipping applications or software Demonstrated experience with end-to-end (hybrid UX and UI) product design Expert in Sketch, InDesign, Illustrator and Photoshop  Preferred Qualifications Motion Graphics and/or 3D modelling experience is a plus! Experience leading user research and/or usability testing Experience with front-end programming  Perks and Benefits Work alongside a tight-knit, high-calibre, dedicated team of professionals working on changing the game and partnering with exciting brands while shipping world-class products High levels of technical and creative freedom with autonomy and responsibility Extended health benefits including medical, dental and vision Wellness allowance, dog-friendly office with healthy snacks on site Product sample, transportation, and professional development allowances  More About Wiivv Wiivv is bringing custom footwear and apparel to the market in an easy, accessible, and scalable way–and we’re just getting started. Our products (Wiivv Custom Insoles and Wiivv Custom Sandals) have broken records on Kickstarter and secured major strategic partnerships due to launch this summer. Our mobile app is award-winning and remains 4+ stars in the iOS and Android app stores. We are passionate about building a great customer experience from the digital products you use to customize and place your order–to the physical product you put on your feet and wear every day.
Title: Senior Designer

Job_Description: Business driven, creative and accountable UX Designer looking to put their mark on new creative challenges. Successful applicants have an impressive portfolio and are passionate about using design principles to achieve a business objective. They are impeccable at communicating ideas, excel at working with other technical professionals and enjoy working with clients. The successful candidate will have the opportunity to work in a professional agency environment with corporate clients as well as collaborate with an international, cross-functional team. The work here is challenging and rewarding with opportunities for personal development and growth. We're looking for someone who likes to lead, learn by tackling challenges, and wants to grow their technical and project management skills. Superb CSS skills are a must. Key Responsibilities Website Planning and Preparation: Interpret user research for best design approach, provide estimates for UX component of projects, develop Information Architecture, assist in planning of site structure, and sketch basic layouts and wireframes Website Design: Ensure website projects are visually effective, easy to access, and meet client business or internal objectives Website Build: Assist in creation of HTML/CSS site templates and CMS templates and themes Website Maintenance: Edit and update existing websites as needed Marketing Collateral and Print Graphics Design: Design promotional material, graphic elements, branding standards documents Reporting: Create weekly summary reports to document achievements Education Level Bachelor's degree Compensation $55,000 - $75,000 per year, depending on experience Extended health and dental 18 paid days off per year Free at home internet connection Unparalleled growth opportunities About You Minimum of 3 years experience as a web designer and front end developer Strong technical knowledge of HTML, CSS, AJAX, SASS, UI Design, IA Principles Experience with JIRA, SVN Understanding of project planning stages and development cycles Experience creating/customizing Wordpress and Drupal themes and templates Fluency in current graphic design and web development software such as Adobe Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, Dreamweaver, etc.) Strong design style, including creative design solutions within the constraints of the internet Strong conceptual skills, including online software concepts and online experience concepts Solid ability to convert requirements into deliverables & take responsibility for them Understanding of, and experience in, corporate branding, layout, colour theory, and typography in both print and digital media Self-motivated with a high level of initiative, internal motivation, and a sense of urgency Familiarity with agile, specifically scrum and kanban is an asset Desire to learn and improve
Title: Sr. User Experience Designer

Job_Description: Ceridian. Makes Work Life Better™ This is our promise. Not only for our customers, but our employees as well. Ceridian is a cloud company powered by people. Join us as we transform the world of work for millions of employees around the world. Our products help employees be paid on time, apply for promotions, grow their careers, and support their work/life fit. Our solutions and our people work together to help organizations control costs, save time, optimize their workforce, minimize risk and grow their businesses. As a software company specializing in human capital management (HCM), Ceridian has not only invested heavily in cloud software development but in its people as well. We have a variety of career growth (Top Talent, Career Pathing, Tuition Reimbursement, & Job Rotation) and Diversity/Inclusion (YOUnity and Ceridian’s Women Network) programs to support your career journey at Ceridian. We are looking for fun, intelligent, team oriented people who believe in our values: Customer Focus, Transparency, Diligence, Optimism, and Agility. Find out why Ceridian employees declare Ceridian a Great Place to Work® in 2017, a Glassdoor Best Places to Work in 2017, and one of Canada’s Top 100 Employers for 2017!  Job Overview The Dayforce UI/UX design team is looking for a senior UI/UX designer. Our designs set industry standards in providing engaging user experiences that are both functional and intuitive. As part of a large UI/UX design team you will define the user experience of web and mobile applications used by hundreds of thousands of employees around the world.  Responsibilities:  Lead the user-centered design process Collaborate with product management and development throughout the design and development process Create designs and produce storyboards Present designs to internal and external stakeholders and audiences Conduct user research throughout the design process Analyze competitor products Acquire a thorough understanding of the domain Contribute to design guidelines and best practices  Minimum Qualifications:  A degree in a relevant discipline plus 5+ years related experience or equivalent Excellent communication and collaboration skills A passion for delivering outstanding products A track record of creating successful user experiences  Preferred Qualifications:  Experience working in an agile development environment Experience designing enterprise SaaS application  Ceridian combines the excitement of a startup environment, with the growth opportunities of a large organization. We believe our employees should be happy and healthy, with peace of mind and a sense of fulfillment. We provide our employees with comprehensive benefits for various life circumstances and needs, great opportunities for career development, and a balanced lifestyle to achieve personal and professional success.  Ceridian is fueled by the diversity of our talented employees. We are an equal opportunity employer and embrace all individuals and what makes them unique. We consider all applicants, regardless of age, religion, race, color, ancestry, gender, gender identity, disability, national origin, race, sexual orientation, military or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, provincial or local laws. We enthusiastically encourage all individuals to apply for positions that fit their passions. Come join our inclusive team and start collaborating with us on award winning projects!  Connect with us on Twitter @CeridianCareers or Facebook CeridianCareers  We thank all applicants in advance for their interest in this position, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Job_Description: Are you a dynamic go getter with an entrepreneurial spirit? Do you love to learn new things every day? Do you have a passion for health & fitness and technology?  PerfectMind make some of the world’s leading online member management services. Our fresh approach to helping member-based organizations grow their business has achieved global recognition in martial arts, yoga, dance, music, and more. We’re expanding our team to meet new opportunities in the market. PerfectMind is proud to be listed on Canada’s Profit 100 and headquartered in Burnaby, B.C, Canada.  Our Culture: We are a values-based company and the way we behave is important to us. At PerfectMind, we help to build strong meaningful communities that bring us all together, around the things we love the most. By helping community-driven businesses to prosper, we promote healthier, happier, connected lives and contribute to a more stable and supportive society. We are a relationship-motivated company.  We are devoted to helping people evolve. We are encouraging.  We are bold and look for new ways to do things. We are creative.  We are relentlessly driven by high performance. We are committed.  We are always in pursuit of opportunity. We are entrepreneurial.  Our Mission: PerfectMIND’s mission is to become the business management platform of choice for small and midsized businesses by continuing to develop innovative, intelligent, robust, and cutting edge software solutions.  What you’ll be doing: We are looking for a Front-End Web Developer who is motivated to combine the art of design with the art of programming. Responsibilities will include translation of the UI/UX design wireframes to actual code that will produce visual elements of the application. You will work with the UI/UX designer and bridge the gap between graphical design and technical implementation, taking an active role on both sides and defining how the application looks as well as how it works.  Responsibilities  Develop new user-facing features  Build reusable code and libraries for future use  Ensure the technical feasibility of UI/UX designs  Optimize application for maximum speed and scalability  Assure that all user input is validated before submitting to back-end  Collaborate with other team members and stakeholders on design and UX  What you bring to the table: Proficient understanding of web markup, including HTML5, CSS3  Basic understanding of server-side CSS pre-processing platforms, such as LESS and SASS  Proficient understanding of client-side scripting and JavaScript frameworks, including jQuery  Good understanding AngularJS, KnockoutJS , Kendo  Good understanding of asynchronous request handling, partial page updates, and AJAX  Basic knowledge of image authoring tools, to be able to crop, resize, or perform small adjustments on an image. Familiarity with tools such as as Gimp or Photoshop is a plus.  Familiarity with Zeppelin is a plus  Proficient understanding of cross-browser compatibility issues and ways to work around them.  Proficient understanding of code versioning tools, TFS  Good understanding of SEO principles and ensuring that application will adhere to them.  Must be legally entitled to work in Canada.  Perks & Extras: Extended health and wellness benefits to all employees and their families  Summer BBQs, group events and Friday social hour  An entertainment room with PS4 and table tennis  A casual, comfortable dress code  If you have what it takes to thrive in a start-up mentality where rolling up your sleeves and being a self-starter is key, then we want to hear from you!  Thanks for your interest in PerfectMind, but only those candidates with a skill set that match our requirements will be contacted.
Title: UI Developer

Job_Description: What is the opportunity?  RBC Investor & Treasury Services (RBC I&TS;) has developed a multi-year Business Transformation strategy that focuses on aligning our clients’ requirements with system enhancements designed to improve their overall experience, enhance operational efficiency and reduce risk. By investing in new talent, functionality and products, we envision technology services that deliver optimum support for our clients, whether for ongoing activities or in response to market or global regulatory change.  This role will be the lead in creating the portal’s overall user experience through establishing UX principles and driving alignment across a multi-geographic, multi-lab Agile program. Key deliverables will include establishing a common user experience by identifying areas where commonality is required; while at the same time enabling innovation and lab specific designs to address unique elements of the client set each lab is targeting.  What will you do?  Establish the overall UX strategy and UI guidelines for the digital services including the integration of both legacy and new applications and transition process of moving through UI evolutions Work proactively with Product Owners to understand their roadmaps and feature needs and align work effort to maximize consistency and efficiency Lead a team of 4-6 UI / UX designers across two geographies and build the necessary skillset within the group to support all current and upcoming needs and meet the overall RBC I&TS; business goalsActs as a user experience advocate regarding principles of cumulative customer experience and user-centered design Involved in usability testing along with Product Owner and Client Engagement where client users will experience the product offering and UX. Must have the ability to establish testing criteria, assess testing outcomes and work with project teams to adjust UX and functionality to meet the needs of the users. Rationalize solutions and effectively communicate ideas/designs via sitemaps, userflows, wireframes, prototypes and high-fidelity design comps Design multiple options, trust the iterative process, and understand that the first idea is not always the best Present the user interface visually so information is easy to read, understand, and find. Mindfully design for the user’s full portal experience including their activities on legacy elements and the needs to pass back and forth between applications.  What do you need to succeed?  Must-Have’s 5+ years’ experience working in digital creative teams and 3+ years managing design team, ideal across multiple geographies. Strong skills in using design tools (Adobe Photoshop and/or Sketch, Illustrator, and presentation software) and principles (typography, grid systems, visual hierarchy, colour, white space, etc.) Strong experience in working through the entire design process using methods like sketching, storyboarding, diagramming, wire-framing, usability testing and prototyping for screen-based experiences. Ability to actively lead a team through zero-based design processes. Strong skills in stakeholder management, strategic planning and roadmap delivery Strong prototyping skills with tools like Axure and/or InVision Fluent in communicating conceptual ideas and design rationale Must have a recent portfolio of work samples showcasing UX and UI expertise Must have an exceptional eye for detail and passion for quality, and provide quality assurance on creative deliverable  Nice-to-Have’s: Experience in Financial Services industry in association with multiple products BA/BS degree in Design (e.g. interaction, graphic, visual communications, product, industrial), HCI, CS, or a related field or equivalent experience. Knowledge and/or experience in the agile environment  What’s in it for you? We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual. A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable 4 weeks’ vacation Work in an environment promoting continuous learning through learning session, study group, external event, online learning. Become part of a team that thinks progressively and works collaboratively. We care about seeing each other reach full potential. Working in a unique atmosphere dedicated to Innovation. Ability to make a difference and lasting impact from a local-to-global scale Work on Next Gen Technology to lead the way in Innovation Work in a dynamic, collaborative, transparent, non-hierarchal and ego-free culture where your talent is valued over your role title.  SFDG  Learn more about RBC Tech Jobs  About RBC Royal Bank of Canada is Canada’s largest bank, and one of the largest banks in the world, based on market capitalization. We are one of North America’s leading diversified financial services companies, and provide personal and commercial banking, wealth management, insurance, investor services and capital markets products and services on a global basis. We have over 80,000 full- and part-time employees who serve more than 16 million personal, business, public sector and institutional clients through offices in Canada, the U.S. and 37 other countries. For more information, please visit rbc.com.  Join our Talent Community Stay in-the-know about great career opportunities at RBC. Sign up and get customized info on our latest jobs, career tips and Recruitment events that matter to you. Expand your limits and create a new future together at RBC. Find out how we use our passion and drive to enhance the well-being of our clients and communities at rbc.com/careers .  Inclusion and Equal Opportunity Employment RBC is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We are pleased to consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veterans status, Aboriginal/Native American status or any other legally-protected factors. Disability-related accommodations during the application process are available upon request. Title: Sr. Manager, UX / UI Architect

Job_Description: What you’ll do: We are looking for a passionate and motivated Automation Tester to join one of our delivery teams to provide unwavering leadership in Quality Assurance and collaborate across the team to advocate and evangelize testing best practices, such as Exploratory Testing, Test Driven Development (TDD), Continuous Integration (CI) and Continuous Delivery (CD).  You will guard the quality of our products and ensure we have short feedback loops in our delivery cycles, allowing us to understand the quality of our web and mobile experiences at all stages, always challenging norms and communicating risks to quality.  In this role, you will drive all aspects of testing, with an emphasis on using your automation and QA expertise to help our delivery teams design, develop, and maintain sustainable automated test suites, as well as incorporate Exploratory testing into our delivery process.  What you’ll be responsible for: You will work closely with developers and product owners to understand full scope of features and pair with developers to advise and build automation scripts (unit, integration, end-to-end, UI) ensuring code coverage and quality You will create, execute, improve and maintain automation test scripts through best practices, closely monitor test results for swift feedback, and participate in peer code reviews You will advocate and evangelize good testing practices, like pair programming, code reviews, Test Driven Development (TDD), Exploratory Testing, Behaviour-Driven Development (BDD), Continuous Integration (CI), and Continuous Delivery (CD) You will engage in all phases of the agile development cycle, clearly and actively voice out concerns and strive to tackle technical debt with the team You will identify, analyze, report and document defects, questionable functions and inconsistencies in product content and outlook during the design and implementation phase You will review code commits and ensure the right level of tests are included You will conduct Manual testing when required and lead and conduct Exploratory Testing sessions with the team  What you’ll need to be successful: You have a strong ability to learn and adapt in a fast paced changing environment You have solid programming background, experience with Javascript, Ruby, Java, or similar You have an understanding of QA methodologies and strong ‘hands on’ experience developing test scripts for functional, performance, and regression testing that include automated, ad-hoc, and manual testing elements You have experience with Continuous Integration, Continuous Build, Continuous Delivery Practices, Test Automation and related tool-sets (such as Selenium, Jenkins, NightwatchJS, etc) You possess demonstrable leadership thinking and expertise with testing methods, strategies, and tools You have experience with testing within an Agile development environment You have experience in both web and mobile testing You demonstrate a passion for continuous improvement of existing processes and tools, as well as documentation of standards and best practices You are adept at communicating and collaborating with both technical and non-technical team members  About TELUS Digital: We’re a customer-driven and product-minded team within TELUS, responsible for our company’s digital evolution. We simplify the path to production so teams can focus on what matters most.  TELUS Digital’s mission is to make life easier for millions of customers – and for our team. We build smart, customer-centric and data-driven experiences for telus.com, business.telus.com and the My Account app.  Our team includes a passionate group of strategists, UX and visual designers, full stack developers, content managers, scrum masters, testers, product owners, people experience specialists, and other digital experts.  We’re looking for team members who: Share our passion for all things digital  Thrive in an agile, lean and fast-paced environment Clearly see things from the perspective of our customers Are curious, experiment and never stop learning Embrace diversity and new ideas  What you can expect from us: An environment where you’re encouraged to share and act on your ideas  Flexible work hours in a central downtown location A welcoming, relaxed office with a casual dress code A culture committed to giving; every year we donate time and resources in our communities Team lunches with a generous supply of healthy snacks A fun, dynamic team that works and plays every day; great ideas can come as easily during an impromptu hallway soccer match or social team outing  We aspire to build the best products. We’re always a work in progress and looking for people to join us and help digitize the telco. Learn about our team at telus.com/digital .  Accessibility  At TELUS, we are committed to diversity and equitable access to employment opportunities based on ability.  Bonus points  Check out labs.telus.com/blog to see how we solve challenging problems for millions of customers with innovative tools.

Title: UX/UI Lead Developer

Job_Description: Requisition ID: 26664 Branch / Department: IT - Enterprise Technology Transit Number: 52522  We are committed to investing in our employees and helping you continue your career at Scotiabank.  Scotiabank Digital Transformation  Scotiabank has a clear and well-supported digital mandate to transform banking, by reimagining the customer experience, fostering innovation to deliver new digital value propositions and enabling our teams to drive significant changes across the organization and for our customers. Product Mangers bridge the technical and business worlds, and will lead cross functional teams to deliver innovative digital products to transform the bank. You will be responsible for the customer voice as you work with design, technical and business leaders to set strategy and define the product. You will be called on to balance the business needs with technical constraints. You are a product management expert, with a relentless pursuit to identify, define and build innovative digital Products and experiences for customers.  About this Role: Director, Mobile Digital Product Management  The Director, Digital Product Management is responsible for leading a team mandated with assuming the end-to-end product ownership for the mobile banking application. They will be working with cross functional development teams to define and implement business strategies, requirements, product roadmaps, services, offerings and new features. They will lead a team who will gather, research and define product and business requirements, write detailed functional specifications, and coordinate efforts to scope, schedule, and deploy new feature sets, innovations and opportunities based on specific market segments and targeted customers.  They will establish goals and metrics to optimize and grow the business and derive actionable recommendations to meet business objectives. Manage strategic projects and use data mining techniques and applied business concepts to develop sophisticated business intelligence models and effective metrics to identify and implement optimal solutions that improve the company’s long term profitability.  They have the ability to organize and motivate teams, and will work closely with the financial product lines, engineers, designers, sales, marketing, finance, and others to create a cohesive product vision. They possess a bias toward action and can break down complex problems into steps that drive fast-paced product development at Scotiabank. In this role, the Director of Digital Product Management will help to build and mentor a team of Digital Product Managers and partner with software engineering, design and data & analytics to manage the products through the software development lifecycle within an agile framework.  Responsibilities  Lead a team of product managers to drive innovation and excellence in Scotiabank’s next generation of mobile products and services Lead the definition of the mobile banking product strategy and roadmap, including feature set, launch and beta testing. Support the definition of the overall Digital Retail product strategy and roadmap requirements to drive P&L; goals for specific Digital Retail product lines. Develop and present business case justification for new product initiatives and enhancements. Define, lead, and execute a cohesive strategy related to a specific product or set of products, collaborating as needed across regions, product areas and functions. Owns vision and product roadmap and feature prioritization. Participates in establishing feature acceptance criteria and collaborative design sessions. Provides the team with definition, clarification and acceptance of features. Engage closely with the engineering + design teams to help determine the best technical implementation methods as well as a reasonable implementation schedule to launch products on a regular basis. Work with external partners, customers and/or vendors to understand business process and flows to deliver software solutions that meet business needs Collects and analyzes data on customer preferences and needs to identify potential markets and factors affecting product demand. Conducts market research that will assist in driving feature prioritization. Maintain an understanding of financial services markets and customer/user requirements. Understand customer needs and gather product requirements  Preferred Qualifications  7-10 years of relevant work experience: working with software engineering teams on complex systems experience in software product management, with progressive growth and demonstrated success managing and delivering software products Experience launching a mobile application + ongoing deployments Must have excellent critical thinking skills: using logic and reasoning to identify the strengths and weaknesses of alternative solutions, conclusions or approaches to problems. Strong data and analytical skills Demonstrated ability to achieve strategic goals in an innovative and fast-paced environment. Ability to evolve product strategy based on research, data and industry trends. Sound inductive reasoning required: the ability to combine pieces of information to form general rules or conclusions (includes finding a relationship among seemingly unrelated events). Knowledge of multiple functional areas such as Product Management, Engineering, UX/UI, Sales, Customer Support, Finance or Marketing. Previous experience with Scrum and/or Agile methodologies Experience in the following software strongly desired: JIRA, Confluence, MS Excel (Advanced), Location(s): Canada : Ontario : Toronto As Canada’s International Bank, we are a leader when it comes to inclusion. We are a diverse and global team, speaking more than 100 languages with backgrounds from more than 120 countries. We value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. Candidates selected for an interview will be contacted directly. If you require accommodation during the recruitment and selection process, please let us know. We will work with you to provide as seamless a recruitment experience as possible.  ALL POSTINGS IN ME@SCOTIABANK WILL REMAIN LIVE FOR A MINIMUM OF 5 DAYS.
Title: Director, Mobile Digital Product Management

Job_Description: Mylo’s Senior Graphic Designer / Art Director will be responsible for ensuring a cohesive brand experience across all communication touch points and channels including ads, websites and landing pages, app store listings, in-app, email, videos, digital content, social media and traditional marketing channels.  With 7+ years experience, preferably with agency background and track record of developing B2C brand communications, you’ll work hands on to conceive, design and produce creative materials.  The successful candidate will work collaboratively with product teams to ensure consistency in brand appearance, voice and tone in the Mylo app.  You’ve got strong digital chops and understanding of how creative adapts to unique digital platforms and media types. You’re tech savvy, not only in your use of digital tools for creative development and collaboration, but you’re typically an early adopter of new technology trends, apps and digital platforms.  As one of the first members of a growth & marketing team in a quickly growing startup, your experience building and leading creative and design teams will be a valuable asset.  Bonus Points: Experience in product and app design (UX / UI) Video production expertise Knowledge of personal finance and fintech Previous working experience in a startup Bilingual  You Get: Competitive salary commensurate with experience and skill Work out of our spacious, open-concept offices with tons of windows (and ping-pong) in St.Henri (dogs are welcome!) Comprehensive health benefits package Generous vacation policy, flexible work hours and remote-work Support with continuing your skills development, developing your industry knowledge and achieving your career and personal development goals A casual environment where you will work with smart and passionate people  Mylo is an equal opportunity employer and we celebrate diversity and differences of perspectives at our company. We don’t discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. If you want to work with us, you had better not, either!
Title: Mylo - Senior Graphic Designer / Art Director

Promote the interfacing and control of the organization's present technology and the dissemination of technological information across the technology teams  Technical Analysis - Analyze functional and non-functional requirements for development projects involving Programming frameworks as well as commerce, experience management, search, content management and analytics  Technical Design – Create application design documentation for the development team with an understanding of current state and future enhanced state. Architecture diagrams, Interface/Integration specification artifacts, extracting features from existing functionality, coordination with development SMEs  Primary Responsibilities Provide thought leadership and keeping current on industry trends Responsible for delivering while working with various technology teams in establishing current and long-range direction of technology aimed at keeping the organization on the forefront of change. Design, Architect, and Implement next generation digital architecture and solutions and improve Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery environments Work closely with UX/UI designers, developers and platform operations to help them understand the constraints of internal and/or 3rd party applications to produce a frictionless desktop and mobile experience Own and lead initiatives to define, design, and implement digital solutions which includes reference architectures, estimates, and costing. Provide technical leadership, project guidance, and business development in various digital technology areas Advise business and technology delivery leadership on how to translate business requirements into executable technology solutions. Lead workshops and proof of concept exercises with business and technology teams and provide presentations of the proposed solution. Acts as a technical liaison between business, technology delivery teams and production support Define common business and development processes, platform and tools usage for solutions and delivery Conduct reviews and audits of existing solution, design and system architecture Create technical documentation  Qualifications University degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Business or any combination of education and experience, which would provide an equivalent background. 8+ years working on large, complex software projects 3+ years of experience working in Agile environments Broad knowledge of software development and software testing methodologies along with change and configuration management practices in Linux based environments Strong knowledge of software delivery life cycles including agile methodologies Strong knowledge of cloud environments/services and solutions Strong knowledge of JEE and related frameworks Strong knowledge of web authoring languages such as AngularJS, Play/Akka framework, Java, XML, Strong knowledge of Big Data tools - Hadoop, Spark, Apache HBase, KafKa Strong scripting knowledge - Python, Ruby, Perl, R, Spark Proficient with Agile development management tools - JIRA, Confluence, and ALM preferred Experience with automated deployment, continuous integration, and release engineering tools - Jenkins, Groovy, Bitbucket, Jira, Nagios, Zabbix, Cacti, New Relic, Graphite Strong knowledge of infrastructure automation tools - Puppet, Chef, Ansible Strong knowledge of AWS services, working knowledge of Google or Azure is a plus Working knowledge in DevOps solution delivery and strategy Familiar with network architecture, security architecture and network topologies Solid knowledge of design patterns and refactoring concepts Practical expertise in performance tuning and optimization, bottleneck problems analysis Active community member and contributor to open source projects is a plus Ability to work in fast changing environment Ability to lead a large technical team to identify and solve technical problems Media industry experience is preferred   The company is committed to providing an inclusive and barrier free recruitment process to applicants with accessibility needs in accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA). Job_Description: Our team is looking for a top notch Front End Developer that loves combining the art of design with the art of programming. You will implement the UI/UX design to actual code that will produce visual elements of the application and work hand in glove with our UI/UX designer to bridge the gap between graphical design and technical implementation. Taking an active role on both sides and defining how the application looks as well as how it works is something that gets you out of bed in the morning. You have an eye for perfection and can spot a pixel missing miles away.You have a passion for adopting new technology and love to release early and release often. Taking an agile approach to development is critical, so we continually gain user feedback and incorporate it into future versions of the platform. Driven by a combination of gut instinct, creative ideas, analytics and user feedback, we’re aiming to improve the way people experience buying and selling real estate.Position Responsibilities: Develop new user-facing featuresBuild reusable code and libraries for future useEnsure the technical feasibility of UI/UX designsOptimize application for maximum speed and scalabilityAssure that all user input is validated before submitting to back-endCollaborate with other team members and stakeholdersDesired Skills / Experience: Proficient understanding of web markup, including HTML5, CSS3Basic understanding of server-side CSS pre-processing platforms, such as LESS and SASSGood understanding of JavaScript libraries and frameworks, such as AngularJS,ReactJS, KnockoutJS, BackboneJS.Good understanding of asynchronous request handling, partial page updates, and AJAXBasic knowledge of image authoring tools, to be able to crop, resize, or perform small adjustments on an image. Familiarity with tools such as as Gimp or Photoshop is a plus.Proficient understanding of cross-browser compatibility issues and ways to work around them.Proficient understanding of code versioning tools, such as Git.Good understanding of SEO principles and ensuring that application will adhere to them.The Big Picture: The Rennie Group is building an in-house digital team to innovate and improve the online experience for home buyers and sellers. This team will conceive and create easy-to-use online tools for our Real Estate Advisors to connect with prospective buyers and sellers and enhance existing communication with clients. Taking a data-driven approach to product design the team will leverage a combination of internal and external resources. New ideas will be rapidly developed, released and reworked ensuring a current and relevant product is delivered to our customers. We will toggle between our own creative ideas and user feedback to find a balanced recipe for success. As a core member of the team, you are tired of status quo experience and want to be part of a group that is not okay being just good, you expect Great. Your personal drive is superceded only by your collaborative team approach and you are ready to help change an industry. If “wowing” users is one of the things that gets you up in the morning, then this is going to be a great fit for you.Job Type: Full-time
