At a minimum, code reviews, unit testing, and system testing should ensure all requirements have been addressed, all basic functionality works, and errors are handled properly.If you answer ‘yes’ to the following, you’d be a great fit for Front End Devloper positionBasic knowledge ASP .NET and page life cycleProficient understanding of web markup, including HTML5, CSS3Proficient understanding of adaptive and responsive designs and tools such as BootstrapProficient understanding of client-side scripting and JavaScript frameworks, including jQueryGood understanding of advanced JavaScript libraries and frameworks, such as AngularJS, React, or Ember etc., or JS-based build tools like Grunt, Gulp, and BowerBasic understanding of server-side CSS pre-processing platforms, such as LESS and SASSGood understanding of asynchronous request handling, partial page updates, and AJAXProficient understanding of cross-browser compatibility issues and ways to work around them.Proficient understanding of code versioning tools, such as GITTools and Languages: Version Control (e.g., GIT), Visual Studio 2015+, ASP.NET / MVC, Data formats (e.g., JSON, XML), Data APIs (e.g. Restful API), Web Font Embedding, Scalable Vector Graphics (aka SVG), Responsive Web Design, Object-Oriented Programming, JavaScript Animation, CSS Animation, Charts / Graphs, UI Widgets, Code Quality Testing, Integration Testing, Templating Strategies, Templating Engines, Single Page Applications, XHR Requests (AJAX), Web/Browser Security, HTML Semantics, Browser Developer ToolsExperience working with graphic designers and UI/UX requirementsKnowledge of SOAP and REST APIJob Type: Full-timeLocation:Montréal, QC

Job_Description: Description  PURPOSE OF JOB  The User Experience specialist is responsible for delivering the customer experience and creative execution for their respective projects and products. You will be working closely with multiple internal departments and vendors to maintain all aspects of our online microsite www.staplescopyandprint.ca. You will be responsible for leading initiatives around improving online web content/applications, assisting in the improvement of new online applications, supporting marketing initiatives, supporting customer service teams, stores and production centres with all issues involving customer issues, site usability, print production detail and backend dashboard. Communication of design concepts - through wire framing/ prototyping, creating user journey maps. This role requires a combination of technical competence and business skills to help develop business requirements and coordinate implementation.  PRIMARY DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES   Project Management & New Web Development (25%)  Responsibilities Take lead role in new project planning/management and timelines, usually managing 2-4 major projects at any given time Co-ordinate with vendors and internal IT groups on new product application development Communicate testing results to project team and level-set priorities and timing for vendors to make changes Collaborate with internal I.T. team members to establish testing and deployment strategies Co-ordinate/support creation of training material or tools for stores/District copy managers Ensure that appropriate UX tool and methodologies are employed – wire framing, storyboards, customer journey mapping, A/B testing Coordinate with merchants, marketing and creative teams  Communication (25%)  Responsibilities Work in partnership with a wide cross-section of Staples and vendor roles including graphic designers, developers, QA specialists, I.T, Finance, Marketing, Production Specialist/Manager, Category Specialists/Manager, District managers, Operations and Customer Service in order to achieve online goals and results Establish regular and effective communication with stores, copy production centres and key field operators through site visits, conference calls, webinars, and internal portal releases Participate in national Copy Centre annual Training Symposium  Functionality Management/ Web Content (25%)  Responsibilities Work with the merchant, IT teams and vendors to manage all online content, and end-to-end user experience Work with the print production team to monitor and maintain integrity of print files and production instructions for all online products Work with online vendors to maintain and update store information, dashboards, store production flagging process, and keep all training information up-to-date Maintain and utilize reporting functions using site analytics tools (i.e. Google analytics software) and provide regular reporting to the internal teams Maintain database of site performance issues and/or new features and communicate to vendors. Manage priority level and timing for deployment Analyze and update template performance results, as well as seasonal product sales performance on an ongoing basis Drive online sales, online penetration/mix and gross margin by working with internal teams to drive cross channel and/or online specific traffic, offers, and advertising Work with Category Manager on online projects and new applications Work with Customer Service team and vendors to maintain online support SLA and manage the issues that are being reported. Identify and prioritize site performance issues Co-ordinate translation of all online content via approved translation vendors  Reporting and analytics (15%)  Responsibilities Leveraging existing engagement KPI’s investigate opportunity areas to optimize page/category/sku specific performance As needed perform small/medium scale usability tests (internal focus group or usability.com), and work with PNI Digital Media on larger scale UX studies- (PNI is a Staples Company) Ensure projects are on a solid foundation from the start, by creating clear benchmarking tools such as storyboards, customer journey mapping, and perform AB testing when appropriate All notable UX/UI changes will require a post mortem snapshot of wins/losses & future recommendations Use all sources of feedback- including stores, customer support teams, internal stakeholders, onsite search and customer service indexing tools Deliver clear and meaningful reporting on a regular basis for key initiatives  Online Marketing Support (10%)  Responsibilities Support all marketing initiatives online including regular e-blasts, banners, keyword buys Test all eblasts for content and functionality & appropriate landing environments prior to launch Assist with the proofing of all advertising material when required Communicate with all 3rd party vendors regarding promo banners Support testing/deployment and maintenance for online promotions and pilot projects Maintain integrity of sku/pricing info; such as updating online coupons and promotions    KNOWLEDGE / SKILL REQUIREMENTS   Working knowledge of Microsoft office (Word, PowerPoint, Excel, Outlook) Expert knowledge of current wire framing & other related mockup design programs such as Axure, Balsamiq, other In touch with current trends in ecommerce and merchandising Quick learner and adapts well to a rapidly changing environment Strong analytical and organizational skills, ability to multi-task, work independently and on tight deadlines and perform well under pressure Ability to think strategically and to discuss strategic plans/information with business leaders Strong communication and interpersonal skills are necessary as there are frequent interactions with multiple functional areas of the business and vendors Strong knowledge of User Interface concepts and experience with search marketing Strong verbal and written communication skills Results oriented, attention to details and ability to prioritize    PHYSICAL DEMANDS / WORKING CONDITIONS  Office environment Some travel may be required, less than 5% (periodic travel to local store/sites. Few overnight trips to US per year)   Qualifications  RECOMMENDED QUALIFICATIONS Experience: 1-3 years of experience within an eCommerce environment, specifically in a retail, direct-to-consumer business model is desired Experience with site merchandising, including planning of feature placements and promotions Experience crafting Merchandising and Marketing strategies  Experience supporting or running usability studies On-the-job or formal training project management experience Project coordination/management experience a plus  Education: Post-secondary education in Business, Communications, Marketing, eCommerce or equivalent working experience to include up to 2 years of interactive experience, preferably in a Retail environment  Staples is committed to providing accommodation to people with disabilities throughout the job application and interview process to the point of undue hardship. If you require an accommodation during the application or interview process, please contact a Customer Care Representative at 1-866-782-7537.  Job: eCommerce Location(s): CA-ON-Richmond Hill Schedule: Full-time : : :  Employment Statement Staples Canada is committed to the principle of equity in employment. We welcome diversity and encourage applications from all qualified women and men, including persons with disabilities, members of visible minorities & Aboriginal People.

Job_Description: Nous valorisons la diversité et avons à cœur de créer un milieu de travail inclusif qui nous inspire tous à donner le meilleur de nous-mêmes. Joignez-vous à notre équipe et faites une différence!  Votre poste  Nous Comment imaginez-vous les bureaux d’une compagnie d’assurance? Et l’atmosphère de travail qui y règne? Nous gageons que si vous passez nous voir au Lab de Intact, vous serez très surpris! Situé au centre-ville de Montréal, nous sommes un laboratoire d’innovation dont la mission est de créer des produits à la fine-pointe de l’insurtech qui améliorent la vie de millions de Canadiens.  Mariant la convivialité et la vélocité d’une startup aux ressources et aux moyens d’une grande entreprise (vous disposerez de tous les outils dont vous avez toujours rêvé!), le Lab est un environnement jeune et dynamique, offrant des défis stimulants, des collègues inspirants et une carrière passionnante (chez un des top 100 employeurs au Canada). C’est l’endroit idéal pour parfaire vos compétences et faire évoluer votre carrière.  Vous Vous êtes passionné par le commerce électronique et l’innovation numérique? Vous avez un talent particulier pour traduire des exigences complexes en expériences utiles et agréables? Vous restez à l’affût des dernières tendances en matière de design et vous aimez expérimenter de nouveaux outils et de nouvelles méthodologies? Nous avons l’occasion parfaite pour vous!  Rôle À titre de designer UX/UI, vous jouerez un rôle essentiel dans la conception et l’évolution de notre écosystème numérique. Relevant du directeur principal, Innovations numériques, vous aurez comme principales responsabilités :  Concevoir des expériences captivantes en vue de réaliser les objectifs d’affaires  Valider la fonctionnalité et l’utilité par l’entremise de tests et de recherches auprès des utilisateurs  Produire des livrables UX et design pertinents au besoin  Piloter une feuille de route aux côté d’un directeur de produit et d’une équipe agile multidisciplinaire  Présenter le travail aux parties prenantes  Aider les ingénieurs à produire des interfaces de qualité et agréables  Prôner une conception axée sur l’utilisateur et les données  Vos compétences  Minimum trois années d’expérience  Expertise en matière de convivialité et de pratiques de conception centrées sur l'utilisateur  Maîtrise des outils de conception (Sketch, Axure, InVision, Illustrator, etc.)  Expérience des outils de recherche UX (usertesting.com, Optimal Workshop, etc.) un atout  Expérience dans la production de flux de processus, d’inventaires de contenu, etc.  Vous aimez travailler dans un environnement de collaboration qui accorde une importance primordiale au travail d’équipe, à l’innovation, à l’ouverture d’esprit et au plaisir  Veuillez inclure votre portfolio dans votre dossier de candidature.  Vous êtes  Une personne avec qui il est agréable de travailler  Créatif, analytique, curieux et ingénieux  Un joueur d’équipe capable de partager et recevoir des commentaires constructifs  Excellent pour expliquer vos idées à différents intervenants  Profondément passionné par le design et la qualité  Organisé et proactif  En tant que salarié temps plein, vous bénéficierez des avantages suivants :  Un salaire compétitif  Un boni de performance annuel  Un régime de retraite  Un horaire de travail flexible de 35 heures par semaine  Des assurances médicales et dentaires hors pair  Et plusieurs autres avantages et bénéfices (remboursement gym, conférences, etc.)  Énoncé fermeture  Cette opportunité vous intéresse? Nous avons très hâte de faire votre connaissance!  D’excellents avantages sont offerts : salaire concurrentiel, avantages flexibles, aménagements de travail flexibles, congés mobiles, régime de retraite à prestation déterminée, etc.  Dans le cadre du processus de sélection d’Intact, les candidats peuvent être appelés à donner leur consentement à une vérification de leurs antécédents pertinente au poste à pourvoir avant de recevoir une offre d’emploi. Celle-ci peut comprendre une confirmation des références d’emploi, des études et des titres de compétences, une vérification des emplois, de l’identité, des infractions criminelles et du permis de conduire ainsi qu’un rapport de crédit.  Vous pouvez soumettre votre candidature à un emploi affiché pourvu que vous occupiez vos fonctions actuelles depuis au moins douze mois et que votre performance soit jugée bonne ou que votre contrat temporaire arrive à son échéance. Une recherche de talents à l'externe est menée parallèlement au recrutement à l'interne Veuillez donc prendre note que des candidats potentiels pourraient avoir été identifiés pour ce poste dans le cadre de leur plan de développement.   Veuillez noter que l'usage du masculin a comme but d'alléger le texte.  Cet affichage prendra fin 02 juin 2018.  Prime de recommandation  CE POSTE EST SUJET À UNE PRIME DE RECOMMANDATION DE 3000$.  #li-qc  Droit de travailler au Canada  Les personnes qui posent leur candidature à un poste permanent doivent, dès leur embauche, avoir le droit de travailler au Canada de façon permanente. Les documents pouvant servir de preuve dans le cas des rôles permanents sont un certificat de naissance canadien, un passeport canadien, un certificat de citoyenneté canadienne, une carte de résident permanent ou une confirmation de son statut de résident permanent pour prouver qu’il a le droit de travailler au Canada. Job_Description: Join Windsor's most innovative, fun and Silicon-Valley-esque development and innovation company, bringing world-class projects to Windsor. Help us build exciting technology like multiplayer game servers for Atari, social apps for Puma, high profile analytics engines for The PGA Tour, and cutting edge products like natural-language-processing chat-bots.As one of Windsor's most sought-after companies to work for, we offer flexible time, work-at-home days, a great benefits plan and in-office massage. We are located in the heart of Windsor's historic Walkerville. You must be willing to work in our office. We are not interested in off-shore or remote work.We are seeking talented interface designers who are looking to grow professionally and personally within a fast-growing company. You will work on a variety of marketing deliverables, including websites, prototypes, wireframes, business collateral and other design pieces.ResponsibilitiesWork on the design of user interfaces for web and mobile projectsAble to help with wireframing using tools like Adobe XD and BalsamiqAble to self-direct and work independently, to manage multiple, concurrent projects simultaneously from start to finishRequirements: Expertise in Adobe Creative Suite: Illustrator, Photoshop, InDesign, After Effects, EdgeKnowledge of responsive web designAbility to create interactive prototypesCustomer-obsessed, detail-oriented and comfortable working on highly technical teamsDemonstrated experience with building user interfaces across a range of platforms including desktop and mobile--- Please send examples of your design portfolio (specifically web design) when you apply. ---We look forward to meeting you!Job Type: Full-timeEducation:High school or equivalentLocation:Windsor, ON

Job_Description: About Nix Sensor Ltd.We create amazing products that help colour professionals and consumers demystify the world of colour. If you’ve never used a Nix Color Sensor, it’s a magical experience. Like the photoshop eyedropper in real life, it takes the real world and makes it digital, and then can help our users make it real again.What you’ll do?Design beautiful apps that work with our award-winning hardwareWork with our software development, hardware, and product teams to craft a seamless user experienceOwn the design of our core products and participate in shaping the direction of our future productsIterate, test, and release products as quickly as we can gather feedback from our users and customersEven help out with other aspects of product design like packaging, web, etc.What you’ll need?A compelling and interesting portfolio of projects that showcase your workExperience designing mobile apps, and even web and other types of media, front end, back end, consumer and cloud based experience is a bonusExperience using the latest design tools to facilitate wireframing, prototyping, user testing, and information architectureExperience using a design methodology to get product out the door fastThe ability to work in a fast paced, collaborative environment, alongside the rest of our dynamic teamWhat’s makes Nix a great place to work?You’ll be joining a company that’s backed by some of the best advisors and investors in CanadaWe’re growing quickly, and you’ll be helping to build the next great Canadian success storyYou’ll work with a highly motivated team that takes pride in creating amazing productsWhat’s next?Send us a note or message indicating your interestShowcase your work by sending us a portfolio and / or examples of prior projectsJob Type: Full-timeExperience:UI Design: 1 yearUX Design: 1 year
Title: UX UI Designer

Job_Description: CaseWare has embarked on an ambitious new path of innovative, cloud-based technology solutions, building on our successful, proven track record of delivering global accounting and auditing solutions to the Windows Desktop. The Practice Management team, comprises 3 squads that are focused on the design, development and delivery of the platform used as the entry point for the CaseWare Cloud ecosystem. As the Collaborate Product Owner, you will have end-to-end responsibility for the work undertaken by your squad including client portal, client and engagement management and document management functionality. Working closely with your squad of developers, designers and QA, your goal is to keep the squad focused on building innovative solutions that exceed client expectations. You will work closely with users and stakeholders to understand their pain points and create relevant products and features that meet user’s needs. Primary Responsibilities: Working with the Product Lead, ensure that the roadmap aligns with the overall product and company vision. Be an expert on the domain, the market, and the trends. Evangelize the vision constantly so all stakeholders are aligned, have context, and understand where we are going. Represent the customer. Be the champion and voice of customers. Build impactful, personal customer relationships. Bring the customer's voice into the creation process. Own requirements, specifications, and release plans. Research and apply regulations and governing standards to product requirements Foster an environment that promotes innovation. Think beyond what the customers is asking for and design what the customer hasn't even considered. Strive for the best customer experience possible. Work closely with UX and design developers to develop, test (validate), and deliver requirements to the squad. Drive the end to end feature delivery cycle. Lead and manage backlog refinement, sprint planning sessions and drive solutions to completion working with Agile teams Measure success. Measure everything. A feature's release does not indicate success. Define what success means for each feature and each function before it even goes to development. Develop ways to constantly define and monitor success. Collaborate across teams. We win or lose as a team. Product plays a critical role in creating alignment between engineering teams and stakeholders. A collaborative attitude is essential to the job. Requirements The ideal candidate will be a highly motivated proactive contributor and subject matter expert on the product. Working knowledge of audit, review and compilation engagements performed in a public accounting practice, or the ability to quickly learn. Demonstrated success in creating innovative products Outstanding communication and interpersonal skills Detail-oriented and organized, with proven ability to establish priorities and achieve results Capable of decomposing a big vision into bite-size milestones Excellent verbal and written communication skills; presentation, customer service, business, and negotiation skills. Demonstrated passion for technology Nice-to-have: Experience with Atlassian tools (Jira, Confluence) Experience developing, managing, and launching modern web applications Trained in Agile development methodology with experience as product owner/backlog owner Experience with UI/UX design 2+ years designing and delivering B2B software products
Title: Product Owner - Collaborate

Job_Description: Product Manager, Short-Form Video (English Services) - TOR06352  Job Family Media Production Primary Location Toronto Position Language Requirement English Only Language Skill Levels (Reading / Writing / Speaking) - - - Status of Employment Permanent Work schedule(s) Full-time  Description  What it’s like working at CBC/Radio-Canada CBC Digital Operations is the country’s biggest digital startup, taking on the challenges of innovating how media is made, sent and received. We are also part of Canada’s oldest and truest broadcasting company. We are trying new things. We are growing. As an entity of our own. As a voice for our country. As a team. Digital is a part of our present and all of our future. CBC’s strategy is focused on becoming a digital-first organization that provides a digital platform for storytellers. Our mission is to engage our audience with stories they care about. The opportunity We have a mission. With hundreds of hours of short-form video ranging from news clips, explanatory videos, makeup tutorials, home decor how-tos, cooking demonstration, comedy bites and concert clips we need to create a digital product experience. This mission, a platform that hosts our short-form video content and makes it accessible to our audience, needs a Product Manager. Someone to guide the creation, lead an Agile team of product designers and developers and oversee the design, development and launch of this new product. If you're passionate about Canada and you love technology, learning and bringing out the best in others, you’ll love working at CBC. Who you are and where are you now? You are a Digital or Interactive Content Producer. You may be working at a digital advertising agency or in media and entertainment. You have expertise blending the creative with the analytical. You want a chance to lead a team that is as passionate about possibilities as they are about engaging products that deliver snappy, quick video bites of content that enlightens, informs and entertains all Canadians. You are looking for an opportunity to channel your enthusiasm for all forms of media and digital product development to take your creative ideas from concept and design to development and launch. As a thoughtful leader, you can inspire the work of your team and encourage collaboration to shape their contributions and bring your vision to life. What’s in it for you? Clean slate. You will have the opportunity to combine your creativity with your technical knowledge. This is a new product for CBC, with a focus on creating an engaging experience for short-form content to millions of Canadians across the country. Belonging. You will forge internal relationships across teams. You will pitch concepts and deliverables to senior leadership and work closely with internal stakeholders to enable evidenced-based decision making. You will collaborate across the organization - with the AV Platform team, Media solutions advertising, News content producers, strategy people - to support the creation and promotion of content and resources for the Canadian public. Career growth. You will deepen your skills as a Product Manager, a technologist, a leader and a relationship builder as you work with the size and scale of our content, our data and the demands of our audience. You will be given a chance to build out your team, participating in the end-to-end hiring process. How you will make a difference:  Be an influencer in the creation of CBC’s new audience-facing digital video experience. You will lead an Agile team of developers and designers to create inclusive and engaging product experiences that reflect CBC’s mandate to inform, entertain and enlighten.  Articulate the vision. You will develop the product strategy and roadmap. You will research current platforms (e.g., YouTube, SnapChat, Instagram). You will manage, review, and assess vendor services and tools as it relates to the product activities.  Nurture a culture of collaboration, learning, creativity and fun. You will guide the work of a cross-functional team providing mentorship and direction. You will empower your team to propose new concepts.  Be a champion. You will promote the CBC at recognized conferences, events and educational institutions. You will support the creation and promotion of content and resources for the Canadian public. Why join us? CBC/Radio-Canada reflects the Canadian identity and promotes democracy. We strive to represent the voices of the country and support social and economic innovation. Our values - collaboration, learning and continuous improvement- embody who we are as a people-focused, digital-forward employer. We offer a rare-in-tech work-life balance with flexible schedules, an excellent benefits package and a pension plan noted as one of the best in the country; we want to ensure you are happy in and out of the office. Collaboration. We follow lean startup principles and use an Agile approach. Our dedicated people managers work closely with every individual to ensure we are leveraging their strengths, championing their ideas and supporting their pursuit of new skills and career progression. Learning. From simply buying a book or recommending a course to one-on-ones, our leadership team is focused on creating an atmosphere where people feel fulfilled. Our team members are given opportunities to learn and work cross-functionally across multiple projects. Continuous improvement. What can you innovate in 8 hours a week? Our Digital department at CBC recognizes just how smart, creative and inventive our team members are. From prototyping new UI/UX to setting up dev environments to experiment on and learning new programming languages to creating improved search functions for our media. Wherever your interests lie, your 20% time is yours to allocate in a productive and professionally gratifying way.  Qualifications  What you bring:  The education. A University degree in IT, Business Management or a related field preferred, but we know not everyone gains their skills this way.  The expertise. You have 3-5 years of experience in a similar role delivering complex, web-based projects in an Agile or Lean environment. You have successfully delivered ad-supported video to a variety of Internet-connected platforms and devices. You can:  Scope and plan projects on time and on budget.  Communicate and present product roadmaps with clarity around success, failures, and learnings to senior leaders.  Travel once or twice a year across Canada to meet face-to-face with our short-form content producers.  The leadership experience. You have a deep understanding of how to bring together and focus a team. You can both inspire and guide the work of a team and champion their success across the organization.  The analytical and content knowledge. You are a strategic thinker and an idea-generator. You can make sense of, and apply, metadata, tagging and controlled vocabularies to describe video related content. As an added bonus, you may be familiar with online video technologies (players, encoding, delivery, analytics, advertisements). To apply: Think this job is meant for you but worried you don’t have it all? At CBC we know that not everyone takes the same path when it comes to building their skills. You can read about the various backgrounds the talented people that make up our team bring to us here. Hands-on experience, intelligence, innovation, a passion for learning and a team-focused approach can combine to form the best set of qualifications. If you feel you meet all or most of the qualifications we are seeking; and you are excited by the possibility of growing our company, take a chance and express your interest by clicking on this link to apply: https://bit.ly/2I5Pbqq  Candidates may be subject to skills and knowledge testing.  In becoming the leader in expressing Canadian culture and enriching democratic life, we need to be as diverse in every way as the country we serve, both within our workforce and on air. As an employer, we value equal opportunity and nurture an inclusive workplace where our individual differences are not only recognized and valued, but also extend to and pervade all the services we provide as Canada's public broadcaster.  For more information, visit the Talent and Diversity section of our website. If you have accommodation needs at this stage of the recruitment process, please inform us as soon as possible by sending an e-mail to recruitment@cbc.ca.  If this sounds interesting, please apply online! We thank all applicants for their interest, but only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.  You are invited to consult and familiarize yourself with our Code of Conduct, which can be found on our corporate website. All employees must adhere to the Code as a condition of employment. We also invite you to take a look at our policy on conflicts of interest. In the event that you become an employee, it will be important to inform us, as quickly as possible, of any situation that, because of your hiring, constitutes or could appear to constitute a conflict of interest.  Job Posting Date Apr 5, 2018, 7:00:00 AM Unposting Date May 31, 2018, 6:59:00 AM
Title: Product Manager, Short-Form Video (English Services)

Job_Description: About RED  RED Academy is a technology academy formed for the designers, creators, developers and digital marketers of tomorrow. Our purpose is to provide highly engaging, immersive learning programs for our students, that will provide them with the relevant technical skills and knowledge to succeed in today’s rapidly evolving workplace.  With schools open in Vancouver, Toronto and London UK, and 1000 students graduated in 18 months, the top 5 fastest growing tech company in Canada is continuing to grow.  We believe in autonomy, mastery and purpose, meaning that we encourage our staff to drive their own role, while we provide you with mentoring, training and personal development to support you in building a path you love and can truly connect with.  And best of all, all of our people share a deep passion for what they do: for design and technology, and finding the most forward-thinking ways of delivering a truly world-class learning experience for our students, all of which makes RED an amazing place to work.  In short, working at RED is unlike anything you will have experienced before. Aside from the deeply rewarding work of teaching and mentoring, we offer great holiday allocation & flexible working, benefits, health plan and a wide array of opportunities to be involved in the local tech and impact communities through our events and partnerships.  Who we are looking for  We’re on the lookout for a confident UX / UI designer with 4 years of experience to come join our growing team of instructors.  We look for people with a passion for sharing their knowledge who have significant real-world experience. Educational experience is a bonus, but all of our instructional team receive in-depth training in the latest instructional and educational approaches, and so this is much less important than your attitude, knowledge and portfolio.  You will be joining a team of designers to help shape and deliver our part-time UX and UI Programs.  Our classes are taught in small teams with a low ratio of students per instructor. The programs are designed to be relevant to the tech world of today with personalised, applied learning content, working on projects from our network of partners.  Skills and qualifications  You are the person that your colleagues naturally gravitate to when they are looking for guidance. You are a strong team leader with problem-solving and analytical thinking skills. You are proactive, autonomous and resourceful. You have at least 3-5 years of experience working in UX and UI design - designing and building digital products (although 3 years of varied experience is better than 1 years experience 5 times!).  You have fluency in some or all of the following topics: user experience design, user interface design, prototyping, ideation, digital marketing, creative thinking, logo design, visual communication, app & responsive web design. As well as experience with industry design tools like Sketch, Creative Suite and Prototyping tools such as InVision, Axure, Principle, Framer.js as well as some understanding of HTML/CSS.  Above all you have a great portfolio of work and a love for what you do.  Things that are not important to us  Professors, we are actually looking for professionals with strong design experience and expertise. Experience over ego please : )  A degree. Degrees are great fun, but not essential. RED is about lifelong learning.  Primary duties and responsibilities  Delivering an extraordinary student learning experience through passionate and informative teaching techniques and lesson delivery  Providing both verbal and written feedback during the student’s learning program to achieve NPS > 25  Collaboratively research and develop radically relevant programs, curriculum and educational approaches to ensure we are providing the highest possible quality of learner experience design to our students  Support admissions process to ensure school hits capacity each cohort, helping to design assets and regular attendance of promotional events  Continuous development of assessments and managing the graduation criteria through agreed processes and policies.  Great, so where do I apply?  If you are interested in this role, please apply directly on this page with your CV and a covering letter, providing three key reasons why you feel you would be the perfect fit. We aim to get back to you within a week to confirm if you have passed our initial sift.  RED Academy is an equal opportunities employer and welcome applications from all.
Title: Lead Part-Time UX/UI Instructor

Job_Description: As a Senior UX Designer, you have both the technical skills and empathy for your users that allows for creation of highly effective interactive experiences. IA, UX, User Research are skills you consider as your craft. Simplicity isn’t enough; clarity is where your design is at. You think about how people interpret the objects on the screen. What they think about, what moves them, what frustrates them, what makes them happy. You know that the right design decision can make all the difference. You can effectively discuss the values of having form labels either above or to the left of fields because you know and care about the difference. And then turn around and discuss overall product flow. You’re excited to discover a better solution, even well into the process. You don’t mind throwing something out in favour of a better idea or implementation. You thrive on designing highly complex interactions which drive revenue for while maintaining the needs of the user. You understand how to balance the needs of the business while keeping the user at the heart of your design process. You are an educator and an advocate for UCD and Design thinking.   WHAT YOU'LL BE DOING... Defining the UX strategy, vision and customer journey for the product in-conjunction with the Product Owner. Contributing to the product road map with ideas for evolving and iterating the user experience based on quantitative data and user research. Clearly communicate design rationale to cross-functional team members to help educate on the value of UCD. Working collaboratively with developers, product owners, business stakeholders, and UI designers to build scalable solutions to improve the user experience. Creating deliverables such as process flows, wire frames, and functional prototypes to effectively communicate design strategies and detailed interaction behaviours. Navigating a fast-paced Agile environment requiring independent self-direction with an aptitude for team collaboration and open communication. Working with the product owners and cross-functional teams to come up with test options to validate design solutions. Ensuring that stakeholders are consulted with at the right time and are kept up-to-date.  WHAT YOU'VE DONE... 8+ years of experience in UX Design. 2+ years of coaching team members in an Agile scrum environment. Experience in eCommerce, Retail. Advanced skills in interaction design, information architecture, usability evaluation, and user research. Ability to quickly grasp goals and requirements from light specifications. Familiarity with Accessibility standards and how to apply them.   WHY WORK WITH US? Employer-matching pension plan Employer-matching stock purchase plan Health spending account 24-hour gym facility In-house catering and coffee bar On-site postal service On-site car wash service On-site dry cleaning service SkyTrain shuttle service Flexible work schedule Tuition reimbursements Employee discount purchase plan
Title: Senior User Experience (UX) Designer BurnabyHead Office

Job_Description: Principal UX Designer - Oracle Marketing Cloud Eloqua-180008G1 Preferred Qualifications Senior UX Designer – Marketing Cloud Oracle Headquarters - Redwood Shores, CA and Toronto, Canada Oracle Marketing Cloud is looking for a passionate and talented User Experience Designers to join our team in Redwood City, California, US and Toronto, Canada. Responsibilities In your role as User Experience Designer, you will be responsible for designing and implementing, easy to use, intuitive and delightful Experiences for our products. You are a strong thinker and a problem solver who can approach the design of our products at a conceptual level as well at the UI level. You should be able to understand user’s mental models and design products based on a strong understanding of user goals, user journeys, use cases and user behaviors. You should be able to translate this thinking into UI that boast of efficient Information and Interaction design with a strong sense of visual aesthetics. Working in close coordination with designers, user researchers, engineering, and product management, you will produce concept sketches, wireframes, high-fidelity mockups and prototypes, detailed specs, and production assets. In addition, you may develop user profiles, provide product usability, evaluation and support to product development teams, and may assist in developing and implementing design concepts. If you specialize in Visual Design your will be involved in design of data visualizations, dashboards and will help build and maintain a design language system Ideal Background that will help you succeed in this role 10+ years of experience in visual design or interaction design within complex, rich interactive web applications, with a strong understanding of mobile or responsive design concepts. You should have experience working in an Agile/Scrum development process.- Your experience will show an ability to both follow and establish practices and guidelines for designing user interfaces. Your portfolio and your interviews should demonstrate that you can effectively articulate ideas through effective visual and oral presentation. You should have strong verbal and written communication skills. Your portfolio should demonstrate that you have excellent analytical and creative thinking abilities and the ability to apply these skills in a rational way to complex systems You’ll need a great attitude and the ability to get things done, whether working independently or collaborating with a team  Proficiency with the designer tools expected. E.g sketch, invision, Photoshop, Illustrator, etc. You'll get bonus points for experience with HTML, CSS and Javascript. Experience working in enterprise software, Email Solution Providers, Marketing Automation, and/or -CRM solutions is highly desirable. About Oracle Marketing Cloud As the leader in modern marketing, the Oracle Marketing Cloud enables innovative marketing automation solutions to help modern marketers target the right buyers, easily execute campaigns across different channels like Email, text messaging and social media to help convert leads to sales and deliver the highest return on your marketing investment. Check out more about our products at https://www.oracle.com/marketingcloud/products.html Detailed Description and Job Requirements  Responsible for creating, evaluating and modifying prototypes to support evolving hardware and software application development.  As a member of the User Experience team, you will develop and apply software design/usability processes in the investigation of technical problems. May develop user profiles, with emphasis on human error control, display issues, visual interaction, physical manipulation and task and objective analyses. Provide product usability, evaluation and support to product development teams, including the analysis and investigation of applications/systems including tactile methods, visual graphics, web, multimedia, voice response and conversational user interaction. May assist in developing design concept and implementation, providing input on user design considerations. May produce specifications describing user needs and internal structures for product in development.  Work is non-routine and very complex, involving the application of advanced technical/business skills in area of specialization. Leading contributor individually and as a team member, providing direction and mentoring to others. BS or MS degree or equivalent experience relevant to functional area. Typically seven years of software engineering or related experience needed.
Title: Principal UX Designer - Oracle Marketing Cloud Eloqua

Job_Description: Position Overview:  The Product Owner, eCommerce combines his/her knowledge of global operations, business processes, data, web analytics, user behavior and market requirements balanced with business rules to craft user stories and manage product backlog for the sustainability and growth of Canada Goose’s eCommerce business. The PO is the key contact and serves as a bridge between development team, design and business stakeholders, the PO will support various stages of the eCommerce platform product development life cycle.  Key Responsibilities:  Conducts business requirement gathering and elicitation for: ecommerce business operations, digital channel enhancements, new market entry, custom projects as required Create user stories, diagrams, screen/interface designs annotations, functional specs and maintain product backlogs. Create UAT plans, UAT cases, training material to facilitate UAT. Maintain existing documentations and knowledge base Works with designers and digital agencies alike to develop, annotating and test UX/ UI Be the bridge between design and development Conducts user acceptance testing for digital channels and necessary training Tracks and prioritizes defects and releases to production Provide timely support to business regarding system configurations, settings and workflow management, provide training to business team for Salesforce Commerce Cloud platforms Collaborates within the organization and continuously shares user insights to relevant lines of business Special projects as required  Experience, Education and Designations: A post-secondary degree in Business, Computer Science or Engineering or the equivalent experience demonstrated by progressive responsibilities 5+ years’ experience in a business analysis or e-commerce operations role Solid understanding of Agile methodologies, CSM, CSPO as assets Proficient technical knowledge of ecommerce technologies and web development  Knowledge, Skills and Attributes: Excellent analytical and problem solving skills Extremely strong interpersonal skills with the ability to interact with global business partners, other team members, and various levels of management Influencing and persuasion skills Understanding of company organization, products and related industry knowledge Ability to juggle conflicting priorities while completing projects successfully Rich experience in the following fields: web technologies, business requirement gathering and elicitation, User story and product backlog management, retail processes, SalesForce commerce cloud or equivalent platforms Excellent skills with Confluence, JIRA, MS Office, Visio or equivalent diagraming software Exposure to formal Quality Assurance (QA) procedures Motivated self-starter that has the ability to work independently with minimal supervision as well as in a team environment. Excellent verbal and written communication skills and the ability to interact professionally with a diverse group, executives, managers, and subject matter  Working Condition: Office environment    We truly thank all applicants for their interest in joining the Goose Team, but only those candidates considered for an initial interview will be contacted. Job_Description: Our client s looking for a talented and motivated individual to join their team as a Product Manager. As Product Manager, you will help us to continue to develop our next generation business management platform for health and wellness businesses. You will be joining a dynamic team of energetic individuals focused on delivering an innovative software solution for the fitness industry.  If you’ve got that spark and want to be a part of a dynamic team building something great, we look forward to hearing from you!  Your Responsibilities  As the Lead Product Manager, you will be the leader of the product team. Your primary responsibility will be to shape the product roadmap, and work with the UX/UI Designers, Customer Service, Onboarding, Sales and Engineering teams to ideate, collaborate and innovate great new features of our Platform. While the focus will be on the growth and development of the platform, there will always be opportunities to contribute in additional ways. In this role, you will play a major part in shaping the technology, growth and overall experience of the platform.  Skills and Requirements  Use these simply a guide; as a fit driven organization if this speaks to you, apply – we have (and will continue) to hire non-traditional candidates. You might have:   2+ years of experience in a product manager role Proven expertise leading a product team, and growing revenue Experience developing B2B technologies, and/or SaaS products Strong analytic background in a product capacity Proven success at working with the business and building a backlog Proven performance working in an agile environment Solid understanding of responsive design, web standards, UI/UX best practices Technical knowledge in software development and understanding of Agile Development methodologies. Effective communication in layman terms to non-technical stakeholders while being able to understand tech lingo with the development team Make data-driven decisions and ask “what value does this change have on the users of our product” Experience with project management in a development environment and managing conflicting priorities
Title: Product Manager

Job_Description: Senior User Experience (UX/UI) Designer, Web Groupe Dynamite is a global fashion retailer with two brands at the heart of its success, Garage and Dynamite. We operate close to 400 stores in Canada and worldwide, and employ over 6,000 people. We have our roots planted firmly in the terrain of fashion’s retail landscape. As Canadian leaders in the international retail landscape, the Garage and Dynamite banners continue to stand out in an increasingly saturated market. Our passionate team continues to lead the expansion of the business in new markets, including E-commerce, while always leveraging our shared values. We are proud to hire and retain inspiring leaders, motivated by their desire to achieve great things and recognized for their entrepreneurial spirit. Role Summary: Reporting to the Sr. Manager, Digital Products, the Senior User Experience UX/UI Designer, Web, will be the ultimate guardian of the digital experience on all of Groupe Dynamite’s web-based platforms. You will also guard and protect the integrity of the digital experience to ensure the highest level of consumer satisfaction.  You will work alongside top talent product managers, product owners and developers to help shape the design of new and existing initiatives to reach their potential for both of our brands, Dynamite and Garage. You will also collaborate with our Senior UX/UI Designer, App, to ensure consistency of the online experience across platforms. This opportunity will position you as an early contributor to help shape a growing user experience practice within Groupe Dynamite. Our Senior User Experience (UX/UI) Designer, Web, needs to be able to solve problems, simplify complicated ideas, work within tight deadlines and understand the needs of the audience to ensure that the final experience caters to the uniqueness of our target audience. Hence, you will need to understand and reconcile users’ needs with business goals and KPI targets. Main responsabilities: User Experience Lead the development of the UX/UI strategy on Groupe Dynamite’s desktop, tablet and mobile platforms; Translate business product vision into a cohesive user experience by reconciling user needs with business goals, technical capabilities and best practices in interaction design and usability; Facilitate design brainstorming and working sessions with business stakeholders, and E-comm and Marketing teams through the use of collaboration techniques, interactive prototypes, wireframing of user flows and visual mock-ups; Facilitate project kick-off session with our technical team, bringing a strong rationale behind design decisions; Conduct research into competitor products and UX to identify opportunities in digital products and designs that provide a competitive edge; Work with the Web Analytics Manager and Product Managers to establish performance indicators and measure business value and return of the developed products.  Product Development and Enhancement Work with E-commerce and Creative teams as well as Product Managers to define customer experience, aligned with business objectives and target KPIs; Monitor the competitive landscape and emerging technologies in order to stay up-to-date with the evolution of industry best practices in order to create recommendations for state-of-the-art technological improvements to drive innovation; Conduct research on the satisfaction and expectations of users, and conduct usability testing of key initiatives; Ensure compliance with external standards (e.g.: WCAG) and internal brand guidelines for use by Product Managers, brand, E-comm and technical teams; Ensure high quality UX and UI deliverables, including information architecture, working models, designs and interactive prototypes Qualifications and Competencies: Education (include professional designation) Bachelor's degree in Graphic Design, Communication Arts, Computer Science, or Human-computer Interaction (HCI), or at least five (5) years of related work experience as a User Interface Designer, User Interaction Designer or User Experience Designer.   Experience: At least five (5) years of experience in web and mobile design with an outstanding portfolio demonstrating the successful delivery of multiple innovative mobile and web interface design solutions. Preferably in e-commerce space; Experience working in the retail industry a strong asset; Experience working in an Agile development environment a strong asset.  Technical Skills A strong working knowledge of interaction design, user-centered experience design, brand identity management, digital marketing and the creative process; Proficiency in wireframing user flows; Strong knowledge and experience with web-responsive design; Experience with mobile web commerce designs and best practices; Excellent visual design skills; attention to details and a demonstrated mastery of typography, colour and layout; Expert -level proficiency with design tools: Sketch, Zeplin, and Adobe Creative Suite (Flinto, Visio, Axure and InVision an asset); Ability to use prototyping tools to convey interactive design; Well-versed in fundamental visual and interactive design disciplines and principles, and user behavioural psychology; Extensive experience working in a fast-paced and innovative development environment, and a thorough understanding of cross-platform user interface design patterns and user-centric design methodologies; Ability to stand by your designs and provide solid rationale to back up your decision with data analysis; Lead testing and validation of UX decisions through A/B testing, customer interviews and user testing; Experience in user research techniques an asset (e.g., surveys, usability tests, field interviews, focus groups); Experience presenting and substantiating (both quantitatively and qualitatively) design decisions; In-depth familiarity with the latest trends in web and mobile user experience and responsive design; Experience and understanding of product management and the Agile process, namely Scrum and MVP; Familiarity with the retail environment and e-commerce is a strong asset. Experience in app design an asset; Experience with Jira/Confluence an asset.  Competencies Highly self-motivated individual; Prepared to give and take constructive feedback on a daily basis; Ability to recognize that process is your friend, but not afraid to question why something is done a certain way or to identify opportunities when noticed; Enjoy partnering with business stakeholders to determine the best approach to meet at the intersection of user needs and business goals; Champion of user-centered design thinking, who understands that the best products are designed when the team embraces a collaborative and Agile culture and process; Advocate of user research and understands how to synthesize data into actionable solutions; Continuously looks to grow skill set and understanding of UX methodologies; Ability to thrive while working in a fast-paced, retail and innovative development environment; Strong communication skills across disciplines and the ability to effectively articulate experiential principles based on industry best practice guidelines, personal experience and research findings; Ability to define and execute best practices for user-centered design throughout the project life cycle; Ability to thrive in a work environment that requires strong problem solving skills and independent self-direction, coupled with an aptitude for team collaboration and open communication; User-focused and analytical; you will have a deep understanding and appreciation of the process of identifying users’ needs, coupled with the ability to balance the pros and cons of different designs, backed by research and analytics.  Benefits: You will be rewarded for your contribution and dedication with a competitive salary and a bonus plan. We also offer a registered retirement savings plan in Canada and a flexible group insurance plan that meets all your needs thanks to personalized coverage, as well as an employee discount in our stores. Groupe Dynamite is committed to employment equity. Only those candidates who have been retained will be contacted for an interview.
Title: Senior User Experience (UX/UI) Designer, Web

Job_Description: WE ARE A TRANSFORMATIONAL PARTNER We marry design and engineering language in ways that produce impactful and memorable experience journeys. We partner all the way to continuously improve our clients’ digital maturity. Our Studio network brings the optimal combination of skill, scale, and cost for each stage of the product development lifecycle. And to do this we need great transformational people that want to impact the projects and organizations that they work with.  We are looking for an exceptional GUI/UX Designer to work with our cross-functional team, and join our world-class community of talented experts. Core to this need are expertise in:   GUI and UX designing front-end solutions Working with proof of concept dashboards. Building a new dashboard application that will provide the information for employees to use when working with customer requirements  Ideally you will also have:  Undergraduate Degree in Computer Science, Physics or Mathematics (Graduate Degree always is a plus) 7-10 years experience in UI Design and Development An Agile mindset with experience working in Agile environment A spirit of collaboration and transparent communication A natural curiosity for new scripting languages , frameworks and technologies High personal code/development standards (peer testing, unit testing, documentation, etc)  We are a thriving Community of top technology talent that is globally connected. We Engage, Make, Run and Evolve the technology that makes many brands that you know and love. So let’s take this journey together. No matter where you are on your digital career roadmap, we can help you grow and have fun doing it.  Pack and move relocation available. Softvision LLC is an Equal Opportunity Employer. No 3rd Party Agency Candidates.

Job_Description: CAE is a global leader in training for the civil aviation, defence and security, and healthcare markets. Backed by a 70-year record of industry firsts, we continue to help define global training standards with our innovative virtual-to-live training solutions to make flying safer, maintain defence force readiness and enhance patient safety. We have the broadest global presence in the industry, with 8,000 employees, 160 sites and training locations in over 35 countries. Each year, we train more than 120,000 civil and defence crewmembers and thousands of healthcare professionals worldwide. www.cae.com     Chef conception et expérience client / Customer Experience (CX) Design Lead   Position Type:  Regular  Role and Responsibilities Diriger la conception de l’expérience utilisateur de bout en bout, y compris la découverte, la conceptualisation, la conception, la conception détaillée, les prototypes et la validation pour de nombreux produits et domaines.  Créer et influencer la création d’expériences utilisateurs élégantes qui facilitent la saisie des incidences pour l’entreprise.  Travailler en étroite collaboration avec la direction de l’unité numérique et les chargés de produit du client ainsi qu’avec les marques, et les intervenants marketing et commerciaux afin de concevoir et d’exécuter des expériences utilisateurs axées sur la clientèle.  Responsabilités : Diriger une équipe de concepteurs de l’interface et de l’expérience utilisateur afin  qu’ils offrent des expériences utilisateurs conviviales et intuitives pour des produits numériques ( il s’agit peut-être plus d’un poste d’encadrement que d’un rôle de chef de file ). Diriger la recherche sur les utilisateurs, le développement d’image, la cartographie du parcours de l’utilisateur, les essais de convivialité, les examens contextuels et l’analyse des tâches. Défendre des pratiques axées sur l’utilisateur lorsque l’on relève des défis ou répond à des demandes de conception. Être en permanence à l’affût des analyses, des rétroactions des clients, des chefs de file du divertissement numérique et des pratiques exemplaires dans un souci d’optimisation et d’innovation s’appuyant sur les connaissances. Collaborer avec les responsables de produits et les chargés de produits afin de comprendre la feuille de route et les exigences de leurs produits numériques et de garantir que l’expérience utilisateur est étroitement intégrée aux feuilles de route. Collaborer avec les équipes interfonctionnelles de développement des produits afin d’établir des conceptions qui satisfont à ces exigences – y compris les documents relatifs aux spécifications de conception, les flux utilisateurs, les représentations fil de fer, les prototypes, etc. Concevoir, communiquer et appliquer les lignes directrices relatives à l’expérience utilisateur pour chacune de nos solutions numériques.  Compétences types et expérience: Vaste expérience de la conception dans un environnement de produits numériques et agiles. Expérience de la conception de produits de consommation de qualité centrés sur le consommateur. Candidat proactif et entrepreneurial motivé et joueur d’équipe offrant une présence professionnelle. Compétences en conception visuelle et graphique, notamment expérience pratique de divers ensembles de logiciels tels que Sketch, Adobe suite, OmniGraffle, InVision ou d’autres outils pour la représentation fil de fer, le développement conceptuel, la conception visuelle et le prototypage. Expérience de la recherche en matière de conception, de la réalisation d’étude qualitative individuelle auprès des utilisateurs, des essais conceptuels, des essais de convivialité, des tests A/B et du prototypage rapide. Connaissance du processus de développement de logiciels Agile. Diplôme universitaire en design ou d’une discipline équivalente.  ***********************************************************************************  Drive user experience design from end-to-end, including discovery, ideation, conception, detailed design, prototypes and validation across multiple products and areas.  Create and influence the creation of elegant user experiences that facilitate the capture of business impact.  Work closely with client digital unit leadership and Product Owners along with brands, marketing and business stakeholders to design and deliver customer-centric user experiences.  Responsibilities : Lead a team of UX/UI Designers in providing engaging and intuitive user experiences for digital products ( may be position as a coach and not a people leader ). Lead user research, persona development, user journey mapping, usability testing,  contextual inquiry, and task analysis. Champion user-centered design practices when solving design requests and challenges Constantly monitor analytics, customer feedback, digital entertainment leaders and best practices in order to practice insight-driven optimization and innovation. Collaboratively work with Product Leads, Product Owners to understand their digital product roadmaps and requirements and to ensure UX is tightly integrated into the roadmaps. Work with cross-functional product development teams to build designs that meet those requirements – including design specification documents, user flows, wireframes, prototypes, etc. Develop, communicate and enforce user experience guidelines for each of our digital solutions.  Typical skills & background: Extensive design experience in a digital and Agile product environment. Experience with designing quality customer-centric consumer products. Entrepreneurial self-starter who is self-motivated, but also a team player with a professional presence. Graphical and Visual design skills, including hands on experience with diverse set of software such as Sketch, Adobe suite, OmniGraffle, InVision or other tools for wireframing, concept development, visual design and prototyping. Experience with Design Research, conducting 1:1 qualitative user research, concept testing, usability testing, A/B testing and rapid prototyping. Knowledge of Agile software development process. Bachelor’s degree in Design or equivalent area.    CAE thanks all applicants for their interest. However, only those whose background and experience match the requirements of the role will be contacted.   Equal Employment Opportunity CAE is firmly committed to ensuring a positive and professional working environment in which all people are treated with dignity and respect. We aim to provide a fair and consistent method for filling job openings in support of equality of opportunity and cultural diversity within the company.  The masculine gender is used throughout this job description solely to make the text easier to read and therefore applies to both men and women.
