Job_Description: Are you an Experienced UI / UX Designer looking to create amazing digital experiences? Ballistic Arts Media Studio is searching for an Experienced UI / UX Designer to join our team in Coquitlam, BC. Ballistic Arts works on diverse creative projects in several industries. The ideal candidate will work with us to create amazing digital experiences through a thoughtful collaborative process and be responsible for producing wireframes, designed prototypes and mock-ups, and assets.  We are a down-to-earth group of professionals who are passionate about what we do! We have seen a steady increase of work over 15+ years in business and are looking for someone to join our team and increase our work load capacity. The position is for a UI / UX designer to work from our Coquitlam office and we are not looking to hire contractors or people that work satellite. The position starts with a probationary for a 3-month period with a performance review conducted at the end to discuss options.  We offer a supportive work environment with a great company culture. We are dedicated to the success of our projects, clients, and team members.  The work is fast-paced and challenging, promoting team work and individual growth. We work for a variety of different industries and clients, keeping the work diverse and interesting.  We look forward to hearing from you. Job Description Key Responsibilities:  Conceptualize and create a range of wireframes, prototypes, and mock-ups for various web projects and in support of marketing strategies. Collaborate with project managers and creative leads to produce user experiences that support our clients goals and visions while considering the end-user. Focus on current best practices while looking for opportunities to push for new methodologies and technical advances. Communicate the intended user-experience with research, user stories, wire-frames, style-frames, module design, prototypes, and mock-ups. Collaborate with our skilled web development team to realize the intended user-experience and provide required visual assets. Design for a varied instances such as: websites; email campaigns; intranets and client portals; interactive displays; and, mobile devices and desktops. Skills and Experience Skills and Experiences:  Extremely knowledgeable on current best practices and trends in user experience / user interfaces. Advanced knowledge with Adobe Photoshop CC A varied and visually stunning portfolio of past web-based design projects. Experienced preparing briefs, wireframes and creative mock-ups Exceptionally organized with great attention to detail Great communication skills Willing to accept and provide direction and handle multiple tasks Committed independent and responsible worker Strong time management skills and able to meet deadlines Positive attitude and an ability to provide and receive constructive criticism Likes to have fun!
Title: Video Editor

Job_Description: Responsibilities:  Correct errors by making appropriate changes and then rechecking the program to ensure that the desired results are produced. Conduct trial runs of programs and software applications to be sure they will produce the desired information and that the instructions are correct. Compile and write documentation of program development and subsequent revisions, inserting comments in the coded instructions so others can understand the program. Write, update, and maintain computer programs or software packages to handle specific jobs, such as tracking inventory, storing or retrieving data, or controlling other equipment. Consult with managerial, engineering, and technical personnel to clarify program intent, identify problems, and suggest changes.  Perform or direct revision, repair, or expansion of existing programs to increase operating efficiency or adapt to new requirements. Write, analyze, review, and rewrite programs, using workflow chart and diagram, and applying knowledge of computer capabilities, subject matter, and symbolic logic. Write or contribute to instructions or manuals to guide end users. Investigate whether networks, workstations, the central processing unit of the system, and/or peripheral equipment are responding to a program's instructions. Prepare detailed workflow charts and diagrams that describe input, output, and logical operation, and convert them into a series of instructions coded in a computer language. Perform systems analysis and programming tasks to maintain and control the use of computer systems software as a systems programmer. Consult with and assist computer operators or system analysts to define and resolve problems in running computer programs. Assign, coordinate, and review work and activities of programming personnel. Collaborate with computer manufacturers and other users to develop new programming methods. Train subordinates in programming and program coding. Requirements:  Candidate must posses hold bachelor's degrees At least 2 year(s) of working experience in the related field is required for this position Ability to write computer programs for various purposes ability to arrange things or actions in a certain order or pattern according to a specific rule or set of rules (e.g., patterns of numbers, letters, words, pictures, mathematical operations). Innovative is a MUST skill to have Must be creative, and resourceful English is an asset Must wiling to travel and work long hours Have a knowledge of circuit boards, processors, chips, electronic equipment, and computer hardware and software, including applications and programming Have a knowledge of design techniques, tools, and principles involved in production of precision technical plans, blueprints, drawings, and models. Ability to determine how a system should work and how changes in conditions, operations, and the environment will affect outcomes
Title: Senior Web UI/UX Designer

Job_Description: Front End/UI Developer  Avrij is a data analytics company, working with university and professional sports teams, to help manage and understand the ever-growing stream of information affecting their organizations.  We are currently looking for a Front-end developer to join our product team. In this role, you will be involved in designing, implementing and reviewing UI mockups & prototypes, analyzing feedback on your prototypes, and incorporating design and feedback into production end-user interfaces.  If you’re interested in working on a new project, joining a growing team, expanding your experience with new technologies, and creating an intuitive interface for our users, then this opportunity is for you. We want to have a driven individual, who is curious and excited about new digital technologies and aspires to combine usability with visual design.  Requirements for this position include: Bachelor’s in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or equivalent  2+ years of proven work experience as a Front-end developer  2+ years Experience with JavaScript, CSS and jQuery  1+ years experience with agile development practices, source control platforms, IDE development platforms (IntelliJ, Eclipse, Github)  Knowledge of Javascript frameworks (Ember, Angular, React, etc) in a production environment, experience with D3.JS  Experience with RESTful APIs  Experience with browser testing extensions and debugging tools  In-depth understanding of web development processes (design, development and deployment)  An ability to perform well in a fast-paced environment  Excellent analytical and multitasking skills  Highly desired, but not required skills would include: Experience working with Amazon Web Services  Experience with UI/UX design principles  Working experience with CI/CD development  Understanding of layout aesthetics  Familiarity with software like Adobe Suite, Photoshop and content management systems  Other areas of work will include: Coordinating and collaborating with back-end developers and web designers to improve usability and efficiency  Working with other developers on implementation and code reviews  Integrating user feedback into product designs, and implementing into future releases  Write functional requirement documents and guides  Ensure high quality graphic standards and brand consistency  Stay up-to-date on emerging technologiesPosition: Full  Start Date: June 2018
Title: Front End Developer

Job_Description: CaseWare has embarked on an ambitious new path of innovative, cloud-based technology solutions, building on our successful, proven track record of delivering global accounting and auditing solutions to the Windows Desktop. The Data Services team is comprised of 2 squads that are focused on the design, development and delivery of the platform used to extract, transform and load (ETL) data into the consuming applications and/or into our data warehouse for machine learning purposes. As one of the Data Services Product Owners, you will have end-to-end responsibility for the work undertaken by your squad within the team. Working closely with your squad of developers, designers and QA, your goal is to keep the squad focused on building innovative solutions that exceed client expectations. You will work closely with product leads, users and stakeholders to understand their pain points and create relevant products and features that meet user needs. Primary Responsibilities: Working with Product Lead, ensure that the roadmap aligns with the overall product and company vision. Be an expert on the domain, the market, and the trends. Evangelize the vision constantly so all stakeholders are aligned, have context, and understand where we are going. Represent the customer. Be the champion and voice of customers. Build impactful, personal customer relationships. Bring the customer's voice into the creation process. Own requirements, specifications, and release plans. Research and apply regulations and governing standards to product requirements Foster an environment that promotes innovation. Think beyond what the customers is asking for and design what the customer hasn't even considered. Drive for the best customer experience possible. Work closely with UX and design developers to develop, test (validate), and deliver requirements to the squad. Drive the end to end feature delivery cycle. Lead and manage backlog refinement and sprint planning sessions and drive solutions to completion working with Agile teams Measure success. Measure everything. A feature's release does not indicate success. Define what success means for each feature and each function before it even goes to development. Develop ways to constantly define and monitor success. Collaborate across teams. We win or lose as a team. Product plays a critical role in creating alignment between engineering teams and stakeholders. A collaborative attitude is essential to the job. Requirements The ideal candidate will be a highly motivated proactive contributor and subject matter expert on the product. Working knowledge of audit, review and compilation engagements performed in a public accounting practice, or the ability to quickly learn. Demonstrated success in creating innovative products Outstanding communication and interpersonal skills Detail-oriented and organized, with proven ability to establish priorities and achieve results Capable of decomposing a big vision into bite-size milestones Excellent verbal and written communication skills; presentation, customer service, business, and negotiation skills. Demonstrated passion for technology Nice-to-have: Experience with Atlassian tools (Jira, Confluence) Experience developing, managing, and launching modern web applications Trained in Agile development methodology with experience as product owner/backlog owner Experience with UI/UX design 2+ years designing and delivering world-class software products
Title: Product Owner - Data Services platform

Job_Description: Lead UX/UI Designer - Telecommunications On behalf of our client in the Telecommunications Sector, PROCOM is looking for a Lead UX/UI Designer. Lead UX/UI Designer - Telecommunications - Job Description Generate sketches, wireframes and prototypes for user interactions, ensuring that business, brand, and user goals are met Maintain a strong working relationship with the Digital design team Mentor and guide the Jr. designers Meet with internal stakeholders to better understand and discuss requirements Develop and maintain brand/design specifications, user scenarios, personas, user flows, navigation maps, UX/UI patterns, and other design documents Ensure work is compliant with WCAG 2.0 web accessibility standards Validate your ideas through formal and informal user testing Interpret and review research findings for presentations to the design team and to Leaders Maintain an awareness of current trends in technology, design, customer experience and marketing to identify opportunities to enhance the web site experience Occasionally support releases on evenings or weekends, if required Lead UX/UI Designer - Telecommunications -Mandatory Skills 5+ years related experience Minimum 2 years’ experience as a manager or team lead Excellent relationship building and negotiation skills, required to obtain commitment from cross-functional teams to support and deliver on priorities Ability to train others and ensure we have the right skill sets, culture and practices Self-motivated to prioritize and manage workload and meet critical project milestones and deadlines Excellent verbal and written presentation skills University degree or certification in User Experience related field Strong communication and presentation skills Lead UX/UI Designer - Telecommunications - Assignment Start Date ASAP - 12 months to start Lead UX/UI Designer - Telecommunications - Assignment Location Downtown Toronto, Ontario
Title: Lead UX / UI Designer - 253032

Job_Description: Our client requires a Front-end Developer/Designer with proven results and experience who is a highly motivated individual. This is a twelve (12) month contract with a top tier organization, scheduled to begin in immediately.  Main Accountabilities: Supporting two organizations;  Delivery projects;  Turn the design into the front-end code and partnering with Technology for the back-end;  Collaborating with vendors, UX Designers and Backend Programmers;  Concept Design (wireframes and final mock-ups) and Concept Development (FE-HTML, Analysis Tagging, HTML Mock-ups (HTML, CSS), GUI Specification created by the UI Designer);  Interacting with stakeholders, UX Designers, back-end developers, PMs, QAs, translators, etc.  Do you have?  Undergraduate Business Degree or equivalent;  Four (4) to six (6) years of related experience;  Possesses both a media and corporate background;  Strong communication skills as they will interacting with several people on a daily basis;  Self-starter and ability to define the process;  Previous experience with Financial Institution would be beneficial but not mandatory;  Previous experience working with vendors an asset;  Web design principles and best practices;  Experience with UI/UX Responsive design, HTML5, CSS3, Adobe CS, Wire-Framing, Accessibility (AODA), and JavaScript;  Excel skills (basic formula and importing data, and pivot tables);  Working understanding of AngularJS and Agular 2+;  Experience with integrating with REST/JSON services;  Understanding of API Security Best Practices; and  Previous experience with Agile would be an asset.  Don’t miss out on this excellent career opportunity, Give us a call now @ 1-800-281-2339 and quote Job ID# 53163 or apply online today!  Eagle is an equal opportunity employer and will provide accommodations during the recruitment process upon request. We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only candidates under consideration will be contacted. Please note that your application does not signify the beginning of employment with Eagle and that employment with Eagle will only commence when placed on an assignment as a temporary employee of Eagle.
Title: Front-end Developer/Designer

Job_Description: Are you passionate about shipping digital products of uncompromized quality? Do you constantly look for ways to innovate and expand on testing methodologies and processes? Is data-driven recommendations and decision-making a way of life for you? Then you may be ready to take on the responsibility of a professional QA analyst at Apply Digital.  ABOUT YOU  You have 4+ years of experience of working in a QA analyst position You come with significant experience working in software development teams and using software QA methodologies and tools in a consulting or professional services company You possess solid experience in writing clear, concise and comprehensive test plans and test cases Understanding of Agile/Scrum development principles Experience with performance (load and stress) and/or security testing will be a bonus  ABOUT THE JOB  We expect you to be able to provide the means and also the measures for testing all software solutions, both functionally and technically, in order to meet the requirements and overall quality of the solutions before shipping the product for clients. This includes iOS applications, Android applications, Web application, Voice Recognition, AR, IoT, and any other digital to human interfaces. The products should be tested in terms of functionality, performance, reliability, stability and compatibility with the supported devices, browsers, user interfaces. This will require you to:  Prepare detailed, comprehensive and well-structured test plans and test cases from specifications or verbal communications Provide timely and meaningful feedback to requirement, specifications and technical design artefacts Plan and coordinate testing activities, thoroughly identifying and documenting bugs Where required, build and execute automation scripts using open source tools Organize testing processes for new and existing products to meet client needs Collaborate with internal teams (e.g. product managers, developers, UI and UX designers) to identify system requirements Review debugging process results Track quality assurance metrics, like defect densities and open defect counts Analyze the causes of non-conforming software and provide team members detailed and specific information to implement solutions Maintain relevant knowledge about new testing tools and test strategies  ABOUT APPLY  Apply is a digital product studio started by Blast Radius and Atimi executives, Gautam Lohia , Chris Coghlan , and Scott Michaels .  Apply partners with Fortune 1000 companies to create smart, software-enabled products and services that provide utility to end users.  www.applydigital.c
Title: QA Analyst

Job_Description: You stand out because of your strong problem-solving abilities and your aptitude for learning new technologies as well as your solid interpersonal and communication skills?  You are able to work within a cross functional team and have a strong knowledge of web analytics, iPerceptions offers you a position as Fullstack Developer at our Montreal headquarter.  Apply and join our dynamic company!  You will be responsible for: Design, code and implement the web applications and API using the Microsoft development platform and open standards technologies while respecting coding standards; Work with the UX/UI Designer to implement new user-facing features; Manage, develop and implement high-quality applications based on the requirements provided by the Product Owner in an Agile environment; Perform component and unit-level testing and debugging and provide support; Collaborate with the development team in the execution of projects; Maintain the highest level of data integrity and confidentiality. You have:  +3 years of work experience in web development. Experience in HTML5, CSS, JavaScript, and JQuery. Knowledge of Bootstrap, and KnockoutJS or AngularJS. Experience with ASP.Net MVC, C#, Visual Studio 2017 and Visual Studio Online. Knowledge of MS SQL, MongoDB. Knowledge of the software development life cycle, coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build processes and testing. Bachelor’s degree in computer science or equivalent. Excellent communication skills in English, French is an asset. We offer: Flexible hours for a better work-life balance. A “Choose Your Own Device” program. A Corporate insurance plan. A personal and career development via our Training Program. (Lunch and Learn, regular online training, etc). A Happy Hour every Thursday. A fully stocked kitchen with free breakfast/snacks provided. A friendly environment with ping pong tables, gaming room, etc. A few minutes’ walk from the metro. If you are motivated by this challenge, please forward your cv to Estelle Tancrez from the Human Resources Department at careers@iperceptions.com.  We offer equal career opportunities to all applicants.
Title: Fullstack Developer

Job_Description: Nous valorisons la diversité et avons à cœur de créer un milieu de travail inclusif qui nous inspire tous à donner le meilleur de nous-mêmes. Joignez-vous à notre équipe et faites une différence!  Votre poste  Nous Comment imaginez-vous les bureaux d’une compagnie d’assurance? Et l’atmosphère de travail qui y règne? Nous gageons que si vous passez nous voir au Lab de Intact, vous serez très surpris! Situé au centre-ville de Montréal, nous sommes un laboratoire d’innovation dont la mission est de créer des produits à la fine-pointe de l’insurtech qui améliorent la vie de millions de Canadiens.  Mariant la convivialité et la vélocité d’une startup aux ressources et aux moyens d’une grande entreprise (vous disposerez de tous les outils dont vous avez toujours rêvé!), le Lab est un environnement jeune et dynamique, offrant des défis stimulants, des collègues inspirants et une carrière passionnante (chez un des top 100 employeurs au Canada). C’est l’endroit idéal pour parfaire vos compétences et faire évoluer votre carrière.  Vous Vous êtes passionné par le commerce électronique et l’innovation numérique? Vous avez un talent particulier pour traduire des exigences complexes en expériences utiles et agréables? Vous restez à l’affût des dernières tendances en matière de design et vous aimez expérimenter de nouveaux outils et de nouvelles méthodologies? Nous avons l’occasion parfaite pour vous!  Rôle À titre de designer UX/UI, vous jouerez un rôle essentiel dans la conception et l’évolution de notre écosystème numérique. Relevant du directeur principal, Innovations numériques, vous aurez comme principales responsabilités :  Concevoir des expériences captivantes en vue de réaliser les objectifs d’affaires  Valider la fonctionnalité et l’utilité par l’entremise de tests et de recherches auprès des utilisateurs  Produire des livrables UX et design pertinents au besoin  Piloter une feuille de route aux côté d’un directeur de produit et d’une équipe agile multidisciplinaire  Présenter le travail aux parties prenantes  Aider les ingénieurs à produire des interfaces de qualité et agréables  Prôner une conception axée sur l’utilisateur et les données  Vos compétences  Minimum trois années d’expérience  Expertise en matière de convivialité et de pratiques de conception centrées sur l'utilisateur  Maîtrise des outils de conception (Sketch, Axure, InVision, Illustrator, etc.)  Expérience des outils de recherche UX (usertesting.com, Optimal Workshop, etc.) un atout  Expérience dans la production de flux de processus, d’inventaires de contenu, etc.  Vous aimez travailler dans un environnement de collaboration qui accorde une importance primordiale au travail d’équipe, à l’innovation, à l’ouverture d’esprit et au plaisir  Veuillez inclure votre portfolio dans votre dossier de candidature.  Vous êtes  Une personne avec qui il est agréable de travailler  Créatif, analytique, curieux et ingénieux  Un joueur d’équipe capable de partager et recevoir des commentaires constructifs  Excellent pour expliquer vos idées à différents intervenants  Profondément passionné par le design et la qualité  Organisé et proactif  En tant que salarié temps plein, vous bénéficierez des avantages suivants :  Un salaire compétitif  Un boni de performance annuel  Un régime de retraite  Un horaire de travail flexible de 35 heures par semaine  Des assurances médicales et dentaires hors pair  Et plusieurs autres avantages et bénéfices (remboursement gym, conférences, etc.)  Énoncé fermeture  Cette opportunité vous intéresse? Nous avons très hâte de faire votre connaissance!  D’excellents avantages sont offerts : salaire concurrentiel, avantages flexibles, aménagements de travail flexibles, congés mobiles, régime de retraite à prestation déterminée, etc.  Dans le cadre du processus de sélection d’Intact, les candidats peuvent être appelés à donner leur consentement à une vérification de leurs antécédents pertinente au poste à pourvoir avant de recevoir une offre d’emploi. Celle-ci peut comprendre une confirmation des références d’emploi, des études et des titres de compétences, une vérification des emplois, de l’identité, des infractions criminelles et du permis de conduire ainsi qu’un rapport de crédit.  Vous pouvez soumettre votre candidature à un emploi affiché pourvu que vous occupiez vos fonctions actuelles depuis au moins douze mois et que votre performance soit jugée bonne ou que votre contrat temporaire arrive à son échéance. Une recherche de talents à l'externe est menée parallèlement au recrutement à l'interne Veuillez donc prendre note que des candidats potentiels pourraient avoir été identifiés pour ce poste dans le cadre de leur plan de développement.   Veuillez noter que l'usage du masculin a comme but d'alléger le texte.  Cet affichage prendra fin 02 juin 2018.  Prime de recommandation  CE POSTE EST SUJET À UNE PRIME DE RECOMMANDATION DE 3000$.  #li-qc  Droit de travailler au Canada  Les personnes qui posent leur candidature à un poste permanent doivent, dès leur embauche, avoir le droit de travailler au Canada de façon permanente. Les documents pouvant servir de preuve dans le cas des rôles permanents sont un certificat de naissance canadien, un passeport canadien, un certificat de citoyenneté canadienne, une carte de résident permanent ou une confirmation de son statut de résident permanent pour prouver qu’il a le droit de travailler au Canada.  Indeed Commandité  IN-INFR
Title: Designer UX/UI

Job_Description: Navigator Marketingis an award-winning, full-service marketing agency that provides cutting-edge marketing strategy that produce results. We work with companies all over North America.Services: Web Design, Mobile Web Design, Monthly Marketing Strategy & Implementation, Social Media Management.Our Mission: Helping business owners grow their businesses from where they are now to where they want them to be.How We Do This: We increase a business' PROFILE, LEADS & SALES. We are a fun, talented & driven team who work at the intersection technology and consumer behaviour generating sales.Position Description: We are looking for an amazing & fun Web & UI/UX Developerto add to our team to assist with designing, coding and modifying websites, from layout to function. This person will strive to create visually appealing sites that feature user-friendly design and clear navigation. This person will also work closely with our designers & team members to execute & bring to life new ideas & projects in a team approach.The successful candidate will also be working on keeping websites up to date, landing pages, mobile optimization, analytics and much more. These tasks will require you to be comfortable and efficient with Google Developer Tools, and coding in HTML5, CSS, Javascript and PHP.We are looking for someone with minimum of one year experience in the field who can hit the ground running. Training will be minimal as we need someone to help us out immediately with our current projects. You should enjoy solving problems independently and keeping up to date with the newest trends.Qualifications: Amazing attention to detail.Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator skills an asset.HTML(5), CSS, JavaScript + jQuery, PHP .Setting up WordPress websites from scratch, working with plugins & some ecommerce.Familiarity with cPanel, Server / IT knowledge an asset.Experience with media queries and building responsive websites.Excellent at solving the challenges of cross browser rendering (desktop [IE, FF, Chrome, Safari] and mobile [iOS, Android])Ability to write iOS applications is an asset.Great problem solving skills.Additional Information: Key TraitsYou are passionate and love what you do.Work well under pressureAble to move from project to project quicklyGreat memory skillsExcellent communications skills.Strong analytical and problem solving skills.Superior teamwork and interpersonal skills.Strong organizational, prioritization, time management skills & work well under pressure.The ability to effectively handle multiple tasks and projects and to meet deadlines.Your upbeat & enthusiastic! Attitude is everything with us. We are a fun quirky group, but we love to work at what we do!EducationA college or university diploma/degree in something related is preferred.Also open to applicants who can demonstrate an amazing knowledge & Do-it-yourself spirit.Job Type: FreelanceJob Type: Freelance
Title: Wordpress Web Designer - Virtual 20 hours/week

Job_Description: Travailler chez Genius Solutions c'est : Joindre une équipe passionnée et dynamique qui a à cœur le succès de l’entreprise. C’est également joindre une entreprise en constante évolution dans un environnement stimulant et dans un marché hautement compétitif .Vous avez de l’intérêt à travailler chez Genius? Assurez-vous de vous reconnaitre dans les valeurs de l’entreprise :Vous êtes énergique et passionné : pour atteindre le succès, nous avons besoin de gens avec une énergie débordante démontrant une passion pour leur travail.Vous êtes en mission : les défis sont grands pour nous et nos clients et nous devons faire face à plusieurs obstacles. Pour mener à bien notre mission, il est essentiel de garder le cap!Vous êtes un bon joueur d’équipe : nous croyons fermement que le respect et la confiance sont des ingrédients essentiels au succès.Vous valorisez la connaissance et l’expertise : Genius valorise grandement les gens qui veulent progresser, acquérir de nouvelles connaissances et développer leur expertise.Vous vous reconnaissez dans les valeurs de la compagnie? Oui?Continuons!Designer UX / UI chez Genius Solutions : Nous recherchons actuellement un designer UX/UI . Cette personne aura comme principale fonction la conception de l’interface utilisateur de la prochaine version web de notre application, Genius Manufacturing . La personne sélectionnée devra analyser l’expérience client actuelle, proposer des améliorations et présenter des concepts de maquettes (mockup). Elle devra également accompagner l’équipe de développement informatique tout au long du projet.Les tâches et responsabilités : Effectuer une analyse et une prise de besoins (clients et experts internes)Étudier et analyser les produits et tendances sur le marchéÉtablir des plans et concepts afin de les présenter au comité responsableDévelopper et documenter les outils qui seront utilisés à l’interneOffrir de formation et coaching à notre équipeConnaissances et profil recherchés : Expérience en design d’application web spécialiséeExpérience UX / UI3 à 5 années d’expérience pertinentesMaitrise des logiciels de maquettes (mockup)Niveau avancé de maitrise de la langue anglaise (parlé et écrit)Aimer travailler en mode agileConnaissance de logiciel de type ERP serait un atout importantConditions de travail : Une super équipeUn salaire compétitifUn horaire de travail flexibleVacances + 5 congés payés par annéeDes assurances collectivesDes activités socialesEt bien plus...Lieu de travail : QuébecMots clés : Web – Migration – Développement – Interface – Utilisateur – Expérience client – Mockup – Besoin – Designer – Amélioration – Analyse – ERP – Application – Logiciel – Navigation – Agile – Ergonomie – Graphique – Normes – Livrables – Architecture – Interaction – Interactivité – Solution – Numérique – Mobile – Utilisateur – Visuel – CréativitéType d'emploi : Temps Plein

Job_Description: Position Overview: The role of the web UX & UI designer & developer is to create the user experience vision and successfully develop, monitor and improve users’ overall experience when they visit our websites. The individual should have the skills and knowledge to create memorable experiences that are true to the brand while balancing seamless interactivity, ease of navigation and conversion.Reporting to the Director, Marketing & Communications, the Web UX& UI Designerwill be the champion of the users’ needs, and create intuitive user experiences and interface designs. The role will be responsible for the end-to-end online construction, maintenance and experience for: TPH.ca, RHGroup.ca, RGStore.ca, TheGlobeRestaurant.ca, the Intranet, and others as required.The UX & UI Designer will create wireframes and storyboards that map the customer journey, user flows, process flows, information architecture, site maps, porotypes and A/B testing to effectively communicate interaction and design ideas & design each screen or page with which a user interacts.The ideal candidate should have an eye for clean design, possess superior UI & UX skills and be able to translate stakeholder requirements into logical interaction flows and a user interface that is intuitive, visually stimulating and converts.Responsibilities: Be guided by human-centric design by identifying user needs, and leveraging those insights to guide you through the design and testing processesUnderstand the research methods and approaches to recognize and deconstruct the expectation of our usersEstablish design best practices and guidelines through creation of conceptual campaigns and design of a great visual identity and cohesive style-guide ensuring that a consistent design language is applied across sites incorporating logo, corporate colours, typographic rules, etc.Maintaining consistency in visual elements and defining behaviorCreate website that are designed and optimized for all screen sizes (including mobile, tablet, and desktop) with a mobile-first mentality, with specific technologies and platforms in mindLead conversations to facilitate conceptual thinking that takes stakeholder considerations into the processCreate clickable prototypes in Testing of websites and that effortlessly lets the users accomplish their goalsOther duties and responsibilities as assignedQualifications: 3-5 years of proven web designer experienceDemonstrable UI & UX design skills with a strong portfolioSolid experience in creating wireframes and storyboards, user flows, process flows, information architecture, site maps, prototypes and A/B testing to effectively communicate interaction and design ideas & design each screen or page with which a user interactsExperience working with a .Net CMS and e-commerce, knowledge of DotNetNuke (DNN) is preferredProficiency in Creative Design Software (specifically Photoshop, Illustrator, and other visual design and wire-framing tools)Proficiency in: HTML, CSS, JavaScript and JQuery, Media Queries/Bootstrap, Version Control (SVN)Explore various usability testing methods to help inform and optimize designs to create more effective experiencesUnderstand on-page, off-page and technical SEO practices and how to best implement these strategies on the websitesImplement Google Analytics, Tag Manager and Optimize to apply fundamental concepts like performance measurement, comparison and optimization.Experience providing feedback on designer performance, and identifying improvement opportunitiesAbility to present your designs and sell your solutions to various stakeholdersAbility to solve problems creatively and effectivelyUp-to-date with the latest UI trends, techniques, and technologiesExperience working in an Agile/Scrum development processExcellent communication skills and the ability to multi-task, and work well under pressure while juggling several competing prioritiesJob Type: Full-timeExperience:.Net: 1 yearAdobe Creative Suite: 1 yearWeb Design: 3 yearsLocation:Toronto, ON
Title: Web UX & UI Designer

Job_Description: Join Windsor's most innovative, fun and Silicon-Valley-esque development and innovation company, bringing world-class projects to Windsor. Help us build exciting technology like multiplayer game servers for Atari, social apps for Puma, high profile analytics engines for The PGA Tour, and cutting edge products like natural-language-processing chat-bots.As one of Windsor's most sought-after companies to work for, we offer flexible time, work-at-home days, a great benefits plan and in-office massage. We are located in the heart of Windsor's historic Walkerville. You must be willing to work in our office. We are not interested in off-shore or remote work.We are seeking talented interface designers who are looking to grow professionally and personally within a fast-growing company. You will work on a variety of marketing deliverables, including websites, prototypes, wireframes, business collateral and other design pieces.ResponsibilitiesWork on the design of user interfaces for web and mobile projectsAble to help with wireframing using tools like Adobe XD and BalsamiqAble to self-direct and work independently, to manage multiple, concurrent projects simultaneously from start to finishRequirements: Expertise in Adobe Creative Suite: Illustrator, Photoshop, InDesign, After Effects, EdgeKnowledge of responsive web designAbility to create interactive prototypesCustomer-obsessed, detail-oriented and comfortable working on highly technical teamsDemonstrated experience with building user interfaces across a range of platforms including desktop and mobile--- Please send examples of your design portfolio (specifically web design) when you apply. ---We look forward to meeting you!Job Type: Full-timeEducation:High school or equivalentLocation:Windsor, ON
Title: Web Designer / UI / UX

D’excellents avantages sont offerts : salaire concurrentiel, avantages flexibles, aménagements de travail flexibles, congés mobiles, régime de retraite à prestation déterminée, etc.  Dans le cadre du processus de sélection d’Intact, les candidats peuvent être appelés à donner leur consentement à une vérification de leurs antécédents pertinente au poste à pourvoir avant de recevoir une offre d’emploi. Celle-ci peut comprendre une confirmation des références d’emploi, des études et des titres de compétences, une vérification des emplois, de l’identité, des infractions criminelles et du permis de conduire ainsi qu’un rapport de crédit.  Vous pouvez soumettre votre candidature à un emploi affiché pourvu que vous occupiez vos fonctions actuelles depuis au moins douze mois et que votre performance soit jugée bonne ou que votre contrat temporaire arrive à son échéance. Une recherche de talents à l'externe est menée parallèlement au recrutement à l'interne Veuillez donc prendre note que des candidats potentiels pourraient avoir été identifiés pour ce poste dans le cadre de leur plan de développement.   Veuillez noter que l'usage du masculin a comme but d'alléger le texte.  Cet affichage prendra fin 02 juin 2018.  Prime de recommandation  CE POSTE EST SUJET À UNE PRIME DE RECOMMANDATION DE 3000$.  #li-qc  Droit de travailler au Canada  Les personnes qui posent leur candidature à un poste permanent doivent, dès leur embauche, avoir le droit de travailler au Canada de façon permanente. Les documents pouvant servir de preuve dans le cas des rôles permanents sont un certificat de naissance canadien, un passeport canadien, un certificat de citoyenneté canadienne, une carte de résident permanent ou une confirmation de son statut de résident permanent pour prouver qu’il a le droit de travailler au Canada. Title: Designer UX/UI

Job_Description: Who we are: We are a leading developer of professional 3D modeling, painting, animation and rendering solutions. Our products Cinema 4D and BodyPaint 3D are used by professionals every day in the fields of film, broadcasting, advertising and games to create fantastic new worlds. Notable companies such as The Walt Disney Company, BMW, Sony Pictures Imageworks, FOX, NBC and many more rely on our award-winning software solutions in their workflow pipelines.  Meeting and exceeding our customer needs is a challenge that we meet on a daily basis. To help us meet future challenges we are looking for a Junior C++ Developer (m/f) proficient in Modeling to join our growing team.  What you will do: You will be responsible for developing new functions and technologies for our flagship product, Cinema 4D. Your primary responsibilities will be:  Maintain, optimize and develop existing and new modeling tools for Cinema 4D Adapt the latest research results into practical, production-quality code Development with a focus on high-performance, multi-threading, scalability and robustness Analyze and optimize system performance Work closely with our development team, product managers, UX designers and QA department  What we are looking for: A junior software developer with a very good and broad understanding of 2D/3D Computer graphics technologies.  You must also have: A good understanding of 3D modeling, algorithms and data structures 1-5 years of experience in professional software development Strong C++ 11 skills Dependable team player who enjoys working in an international team Ability to work independently and meet deadlines Very good communications skills and English language skills Reliability, goal-oriented, sense of responsibility and a quality-focused mindset OSX (Xcode) or Windows (Visual Studio) skills  Desirable: Knowledge of recent developments and advancements in the area of computer graphics, especially 3D modeling Knowledge of OpenGL Experience with UI workflows Experience in other languages such as Python Good skills in translating technical and research papers into code  What we offer: You will be given a permanent contract to work at our office in Montreal, Canada. You will be part of a growing team that is very enthusiastic about their work and the products we produce, and have fun doing so. We have employees from all over the world and offer a very positive working environment, which allows us to shape the future together. Interested in joining our team? Then send us your electronic CV (.pdf) with your desired salary and earliest starting date. We’re looking forward to hearing from you!  Logiciels MAXON Canada Inc. | MAXON Computer Canada Inc. · Attn. Mrs. Lan-Chi M. Tran · jobs_dev(at)maxon(dot)net
Title: Junior C++ Developer (m/f) – (Modeling)

Job_Description: Autodata Solutions is looking for a Senior Front-End Web Developer in our London, ON office! We are looking for a Front-End Web Developer who is motivated to combine the art of design with the art of programming. This is an opportunity for a Senior Leader manage both sides and define not only how the application looks, but how it works. You will translate the UI/UX design wireframes to actual code that will produce visual elements of the application while integrating SEO principals into your design. Through collaboration with our backend developers, you will integrate REST service endpoints to the UI through AJAX calls and design the expected output from the services. MUST have solid previous experience with ReactJS to join this project. Responsibilities: Develop new user-facing features while buiding reusable code and libraries for future use Ensure the technical feasibility of UI/UX designs Optimize application for maximum speed and scalability Integrate user interfaces with backend REST services Execute effectively in a high-volume, fast-changing work environment while managing multiple time-critical issues Act as technical advisor to business owners, project management, UX Designers Troubleshoot issues with code, integrations, and other related website properties  Qualifications: 2+ years of hands-on experience designing and building React.js applications 7+ years experience with web markup, including HTML5, CSS3, and Javascript up to and including ECMAScript 6 Demonstrable experience implementing SEO principles and ensuring that the application will adhere to them Good understanding of build tools, including Gulp, Bower, Webpack, and Yeoman Proficient understanding of client-side scripting and JavaScript frameworks, including jQuery Good understanding of other advanced JavaScript libraries and frameworks, such as AngularJS (vs 1 and 2), KnockoutJS, BackboneJS, Meteor, DurandalJS etc. Good understanding of asynchronous request handling, partial page updates, and AJAX Basic knowledge of image authoring tools, to be able to crop, resize, or perform small adjustments on an image. Familiarity with tools such as Gimp or Photoshop is a plus Working knowledge of NodeJS, including Express, Meteor, and other modules Proficient understanding of code versioning tools, such as Git / Mercurial / SVN  For more information about Autodata, please visit our company website: www.autodata.net. We thank all applicants for their interest however only those selected for an interview will be notified. Autodata Solutions is an equal opportunity employer. We are compliant with AODA legislation; if you require work related accommodations, please specify.
Title: Front-End Web Developer

Job_Description: We're seeking a Magento Developer to join our dynamic team. We are located in the middle of the Old Port. We work in an open and collaborative environment, and we make a point to display our company culture very publicly (you can actually read it all on our website). We respect each other and help one another. Who we are is what makes us unique, and this is why we have the opportunity to work on amazing projects with great clients.  FULL TIME POSITION Salary: Based on skill and experience Hours: 9AM - 5PM Monday through Friday Are you a Magento mage? Do you constantly look to optimize your code and keep up with the latest web practices and developments? If you love the Magento back-end just as much as it loves you, we want to meet you! Let’s get right into the fun stuff, as a Design Shopp team member you will benefit from group insurance, including health and dental. You will have VIP access to our game room (video games, board games, Netflix, and more) and work in a lively and open work environment. You will always have the support of a young and passionate team and limitless cuddles from Charlie the Dog (aka Vice President of Happiness / aka Sandwich Thief). We have a gym in our building, and we can hook you up with a group discount membership the day you start. Since this is a job posting, let’s get right to it! As a Magento Developer at Design Shopp, you’ll be joining forces with designers and creative directors to build the architecture that will hold up their creations, and you’ll collaborate with project managers to establish/work within development deadlines. You’ll have the opportunity to get your hands dirty setting up Magento websites and building Magento themes from HTML templates for clients of all types and sizes. We’re out to find an e-commerce and MVC champion with solid experience in launching large-scale web projects. We need you to be comfortable versioning your work and collaborating with other developers and team members. Flexibility in working with different frameworks is a big plus! We’re looking to fill this position ASAP, so we hope to hear from you soon! Make sure to include a personal note about yourself as well as some examples of projects you’ve worked on in the past, and your role for each one. We want to see all of your potential. If we select your application, you can expect a preliminary phone interview where we can discuss salary, as it will be based on your experience and skillset.  What we’re looking for: Intermediate knowledge and 2+ years experience building Magento websites Advanced PHP and MySQL knowledge Knowledge of MVC frameworks (such as Zend, Laraval, Symfony etc.) Experience mapping out large-scale web projects Experience building websites from HTML and CSS documents Experience coding semantically, and optimizing code for speed, SEO, and performance Experience launching websites on cPanel server environments Experience working with versioning software (such as SVN or Git) Always looking out for best practices and new technology  Nice-to-have but not required: Ractive.js and AngularJS experience Experience in UI/UX design
Title: Magento Developer

Job_Description: ABOUT US: We’re a talented team of product managers, digital marketers, developers, and product designers building Canada’s leading financial product comparison platform, Ratehub.ca (think Expedia, but for financial products). We compare mortgage rates, credit card rewards, deposit returns and insurance quotes.  We love helping Canadians save money by empowering them with the tools to make smart financial decisions. We believe in financial transparency, product innovation, entrepreneurship, and community. That’s our modus operandi.  THE ROLE: We are looking for a passionate web developer to join the Ratehub team who will play a central role in the keeping Ratehub’s web interfaces up-to-date and looking beautiful. The ideal candidate will work closely with skilled product owners, UI/UX designers and other engineers to build applications that exceed customers expectations and improve the way they find financial products.  Creating elegant and responsive web interfaces that work across a range of browsers and devices using HTML5, CSS3, ES6, React, and Webpack  Maintaining and extending our blog and content management systems  Building integration points between systems using web services and leveraging external web services to provide functionality  Working with support, marketing, business and other team members to identify product and process improvements, suggest implementation options, trade-off alternatives, and make engineering decisions  As a growing, late-stage startup, we look for self-starters who thrive in a fast-paced, agile environment – which means wearing many hats, being able to change direction quickly, and showing an eagerness to learn new technologies as the need arises. And most importantly – we look for people who can prioritize, multitask, and deliver – because it’s a lot more fun to get things done.  Ratehub offers a friendly, innovative and collaborative work environment and our engineering team is based in downtown Kingston, ON. Our talented team drives our success, and we support each individual in fulfilling his or her potential.  CULTURE FIT: High performer: You’re not a 9-to-5er but a project completer  Passionate: You inspire others with your thirst for excellence  Resourceful: You don’t have all the answers, but you know how to get them  Meticulous: You’re borderline obsessive about quality of work and ensuring users get the best possible experience  YOUR QUALIFICATIONS: 2+ years experience building web and mobile-optimized websites  Proficiency with HTML and CSS, and experience implementing complex layouts with a high degree of fidelity to designs; experience with SASS  A high degree of comfort with JavaScript; experience with a modern JS application framework (React/Flux, Ember, Angular, etc.) a strong plus  Knowledge of content management systems (CMS) and experience customizing/extending CMSes to provide web applications  Experience with source version control; Git strongly preferred  Familiarity with Linux, MacOS or another Unix-like operating system; feeling at home in the terminal  Excellent verbal and written communication skills  JOB PERKS: Competitive salary: Our people are our most important asset  Medical & dental coverage: Health is wealth  Continuing education: Conference and learning budget  Casual dress code: If it’s good enough for you, it’s good enough for us  HOW TO APPLY: Please submit your resume or a link to your LinkedIn profile.
Title: Front-end Web Developer

Company: HomeX Labs - a division of Home Experience LLC
Job_Description: We're looking for a mobile developer with elite skills, someone who is passionate about building stellar user experiences and great products. Working closely with an interaction designer and product manager, you will be helping to build new customer-facing and technician-facing web applications and mobile apps. You will have a key role in translating our company and customer needs into functional and appealing interactive mobile applications. We expect you to be a tech-savvy professional who is curious about new digital technologies and aspires to combine usability with visual design. Ultimately, you should be able to create a functional, attractive and inventive digital face to make innovative user experiences come to life. WHAT TO EXPECT You will be empowered to invent and innovate and given clear ownership of engineering problems and solutions in a technology-led environment. You will have the chance to be involved in the early stages of a company dedicated to re-inventing an experience with universal reach. You will have the opportunity to work with intensity but without the burndown charts or limited runway of a conventional start-up. WHAT YOU WILL DO Develop a great product experience, while leveraging the latest web technologies Work closely with other team members to develop industry leading solutions for the home services market Develop state-of-the art user experiences using your experience with React-Native as well as other web and native technologies Leverage best UI/UX practices to build an industry leading, cutting edge and award-winning product Be an integral part of an elite, energetic team of Architects, Product Managers, Developers, Business Analysts where collaboration across all groups is integral to success Requirements Minimum 2-3 years relevant full-time hands-on experience in creating, developing and deploying innovative mobile apps BSc degree in Computer Science or related field, or equivalent experience Agile/Scrum experience Strong collaboration skills, whether working with backend developers, interaction designers, product managers, or architects Extensive experience in React development and build tooling Experience creating mobile applications with React Native Experience with native mobile development for iOS and Android Benefits Greenfield development - collaborate with other talented people to build something great from the ground up Fun and positive working environment Experienced, people-first leaders with a clear plan and a track record of success Competitive compensation and performance-based incentives Full health care benefits Transportation allowance Complimentary snacks and beverages Beautiful offices in the heart of Toronto's entertainment district Unlimited vacation Our solid foundation, ambitious vision and experienced leadership team give us the means to quickly but uncompromisingly create experiences that will transform an entire industry. Are you as excited as we are!? Apply today
Title: Mobile Developer

Job_Description: The CompanyTandm is a rapidly growing digital agency start-up, based in Toronto, that enables organizations to compete in local, national, and international markets by leveraging various forms of digital media and digital customer acquisition channels.We believe that every business deserves a chance to succeed in today’s fast-moving, connected economy. That’s why we set out to reinvent the way businesses incorporate digital channels into their media mix — and why we need forward-thinking people just like you.The PositionTandm is looking for a motivated go-getter to join our Creative team as Senior Web Designer. Skilled in UX/UI design, the individual will play a critical role in creating breathtaking digital experiences that will be seen and consumed by millions of individuals each year. We need your help bringing clients' visions to life by creating human-centered, enterprise-level experiences that are elegant, refined, and seamless.The ideal candidate:Is comfortable with ambiguityBreaks from the traditionalDoesn't always use off-the-shelf patterns and solutionsThinks critically about existing frameworksDevelops new models and frameworksLoves to collaborateCan transform ideas from stakeholders into inspired designsEnjoys leading design discussionsCan effectively explain ideas and methodologyDoesn't run away from adversity when being challengedIs a team leader that likes taking chargeFinds solutions, not problemsIs comfortable working autonomouslyLives to make their team shineCan hit the ground runningHas a kick-ass web design portfolioIs proficient at creating Google Display AdsHas designed creatives for all ad formats & placements on FacebookDesigns websites to exacting industry best practices and standardsCreates converting landing pages and understands the principles of CROHas experience designing whitepapers and other forms of premium contentHas created WordPress, HubSpot, Magento, & Shopify website designsAre you a trailblazer? Do you embrace and drive change by inspiring people to try new things? Are you willing to learn and level-up your career? Apply by sending us your resume and portfolio.Job Type: Full-timeExperience:Web Design: 3 years
Title: Senior Web Designer

Job_Description: Concepteur d’Interface Utilisateur Junior  Notre équipe est à la recherche d'un concepteur d'interface utilisateur Junior, motivé et énergique, doté d'un sens exceptionnel du design et d'une compréhension profonde de ce qui motive les interactions des utilisateurs. Nous recherchons des candidats designers expérimentés et talentueux qui sont passionnés par les logiciels grand public, qui créent des expériences utilisateur agréables et qui aiment tout ce qui est numérique.  Chez Adaware, nous construisons la prochaine génération de solutions de monétisation intelligente pour les consommateurs intelligents. En tant que membre de notre équipe produit, vous contribuerez activement aux idées de conception de l'interface utilisateur du produit. En tant que concepteur d'interface utilisateur junior, vous devrez développer des conceptions d'interface utilisateur fonctionnelles compatibles avec nos valeurs d'intégrité, de transparence et notre objectif de faire d'Internet un endroit plus sûr et meilleur.  Vous êtes curieux, toujours vous et vos collègues avec de nouvelles idées. Vous avez la capacité d'interagir efficacement avec les parties prenantes; et pour transformer les idées et les données, ainsi que vos idées en design d'interface utilisateur fonctionnel et agréable.  Surtout, vous êtes axé sur les résultats et savez ce qu'il faut pour transformer une idée en réalité.  Le Défi   • En tant que concepteur d'interface utilisateur junior, vous travaillerez avec les directeurs de comptes, les chefs de projet et les propriétaires de produits pour fournir des interfaces utilisateur attrayantes à travers une gamme de produits, d'offres et de sites Web.  Contribuer au guide de style de conception de l'interface utilisateur d'Adaware  Travaillez avec les responsables de compte pour évaluer l'impact de toute modification de l'interface utilisateur sur les offres des partenaires et proposer des améliorations qui entraîneront des conversions.  Travailler avec le gestionnaire UX pour s'assurer que les modifications apportées à la conception de l'interface utilisateur contribuent à compléter l'expérience utilisateur globale et à augmenter les conversions  Maintenir et développer une banque de modèles pour les éditeurs et les annonceurs  Aide à créer des wireframes, des maquettes et des conceptions finales de conception d'interface utilisateur sur tous les ordinateurs de bureau et mobiles. Tenez-vous au courant des dernières tendances en matière de conception et d'utilisation de l'interface utilisateur  Proposer activement de nouvelles idées et solutions pour concevoir des tâches ou des problèmes connexes  Notre candidat idéal Curiosité La passion Expérience dans un environnement de marketing Solide connaissance d'Adobe Creative Suite Très grande attention aux détails 2 à 4 ans d'expérience dans le domaine de la conception d'interfaces logicielles, Web ou mobiles Un portfolio solide Connaissance du HTML, CSS et du javascript (un gros plus) Compréhension des bases du prototypage et du wireframing Une bonne compréhension des meilleures pratiques de conception de l'expérience utilisateur Capacité à travailler dans un environnement où les activités se déroulent à un rythme rapide et avec des délais serrés Possibilité de gérer plusieurs demandes en même temps Une perspective Internet-savvy, avec un véritable intérêt pour et une bonne compréhension des logiciels et des nouvelles technologies; vous devez être capable de comprendre nos produits et leurs marchés;  Location Le poste est situé à Montréal, ville Saint-Laurent   Ce que nous offrons 3 semaines de vacances plus 1 semaine à Noël; Avantages sociaux complets avec soins dentaires; Assurance-vie; Stationnement gratuit Rabais de 25% sur le transport en commun; Programme de cotisations REER. Fruits et Bagels Une massothérapeute hebdomadaire Service de Traiteur pour le midi  Nous offrons également un environnement de travail convivial et zen avec des heures flexibles, 5-a-7 - et plus encore!
Title: Concepteur UI et UX

Job_Description: Service: Enabling Area Job Type: Permanent Primary Location: Kitchener, Ontario, Canada All Available Locations: Kitchener  External Posting Description  Deloitte’s new Waterloo Region office is located in the heart of the KW innovation district. It serves as a place and platform to deliver immersive experiences for our clients and talent that will help ideas break-through to impact, and fuse thinking, technology with application by:   bringing talent and networks together bridging discovery to commercialization authentically curating and applying technology to the client context purposefully designing and facilitating labs that lead to client impact.  Designing and facilitating immersive experiences starts with a client challenge, to which you will design and facilitate and investigative journey using exponential technologies, analytical and co-creation techniques and experiments with the objective to chart the path for commercialized solutions. As the Lab Design and Facilitation Manager you will co-lead the design, planning, preparation and delivery of Greenhouse sessions and offerings. Individuals in this role, under the guidance of the Senior Manager, Greenhouse Client Experience, will work with lead client experience facilitators, clients, account teams and other key stakeholders to strategically shape the overall experience a customer has while engaged in a Greenhouse session. They will curate that experience based on the outlined objectives, and with the over-arching mission to create exceptional client experiences at Deloitte.  In moments that matter to our Clients, you will create the environment in our Greenhouse-enabled space to foster break-through ideas Together with the Client Experience Lead and the Technology Curator and co-create solutions between our market, industry and service teams and client teams. The Deloitte Greenhouse™ is a place for cultivation – of ideas, relationships, opportunities – to help our clients and our people achieve breakthroughs, disrupt the status quo and incite productive action.  General   Being a Greenhouse ambassador- leading tours and educating teams on the Greenhouse Design process Supporting the scoping and planning calls with requestors and clients by taking notes, tracking action items and supporting or managing all session design/preparation activities Developing high quality deliverables such as confirmation packages, facilitation guides, success stories and other core Greenhouse materials. Ensuring these materials are shared with broader Deloitte teams when appropriate. Promoting knowledge sharing across Greenhouse teams through the development of session artifacts and documentation Developing the story board jointly with our digital, analytics and cyber leads, chart the arch of discovery and design exercises to conduct the labs Engaging broader resources and working with account teams to gather background information and collateral to support session design Coordinating with facilitators and other internal resources as needed to support the session Supporting the coordination and execution of pre-session, during session, and post-session activities and logistics Ensuring the minimum standards on client experience are being met  External Posting Qualifications  Session Delivery   Working with Client Experience Lead and hospitality teams and to ensure all on-day operations are accurately executed including room set-up and catering. Introducing or facilitating session breakout activities under the mentorship and guidance of the Greenhouse leadership team and facilitation leads Ensure the facility is always presentable and supporting the logistics of session delivery, including planning and managing all session materials and tools Participating in the development of comprehensive documentation for each session, which includes capturing notes, synthesizing and organizing the information for documentation purposes Trouble shoot technology issues during events  Session Design   Supporting the coordination and execution of custom client session design and research activities Researching and piloting innovative client experience approaches that can be deployed in a Greenhouse environment Capturing notes from planning calls with requestors and translating into a design protocol or agenda Help curate our lab experiences for the Waterloo ecosystem Minimum of 5 years of experience in a client-facing, facilitative or investigate environment paired with customer service/ professional services, event management or related experience Proactive, self-starter, capable of working independently and operating effectively in ambiguous environments, but aware of when to reach out and connect with our client service leads and Greenhouse teams across the country 2-4 years UI/ UX design experience Excellent organizational and project management skills, outstanding written and verbal communication High attention to detail and task orientation with an ability to problem solve Ability to manage and appropriately escalate risks Creative and the ability to demonstrate an aptitude for developing and delivering unique client experiences Proven proficiency with technology and ability to learn about evolving technologies; e.g. SmartBoards and related software Understanding of data/analytics, innovation and digital principles with the ability to quickly get up to speed on Greenhouse technologies and tools  Deloitte is an inclusive employer dedicated to building a diverse workforce. We encourage applications from all qualified candidates and will accommodate applicants’ needs under the respective provincial human rights codes throughout all stages of the recruitment and selection process. Please advise the Recruiter to ensure your accessibility needs are accommodated throughout this process. Information received relating to accommodation will be addressed confidentially.  We thank all applicants in advance for their interest; however, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.
Title: Lab Designer and Facilitator (Manager)

Job_Description: You find yourself dissecting the progression, monetization, or gameplay systems for great action RPGs? You are intrigued by seeing how the modifications you’ve made change the way people play. You see the world of gaming as so much more than a hobby. Working on a new project, you’re excited by working cross-functionally, partnering closely with Engineers, Designers and others.  Kabam is looking for skilled Systems Designers to elevate our Design team on some exciting new projects We don’t design games, we play them and love them, and are fans of the IP’s we work on.  As a Systems Designer, you will:  Collaborate with an extremely talented team of Engineers, UI/UX artists, Data Scientists, QA and LiveOps to create addictive, compelling player experiences that will delight users for years Provide input on the game’s vision and help champion that vision to other team members Design rules and parameters for features and systems Design, implement, tune, and balance game systems, economies, and progression Create design docs, drawings, diagrams, flowcharts, and any other necessary documents to communicate design functionality and vision Continually iterate, balance and tune features and gameplay based on feedback from the game teams, user testing and the broader player community Build free-to-play mobile games that the world loves to play At Kabam, we’re constantly raising the bar of excellence in free-to-play mobile gaming. We hire for passion and diversity so that together as a team we can triumph in our collective skill. Our teams are made up of a fusion of personalities and interests bound together by a collaborative nature, fun-loving culture and drive to do what it takes to make great games. And this is where you come in…  Your background includes:  3+ years of game design experience on commercially successful properties Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience with an emphasis on game design, economics, math, or psychology Ultimate problem solving, critical thinking, logical, and analytical skills Spreadsheet wizardry Deep familiarity with RPG, BCG, and action genres on mobile, PC, console, and pen-and-paper platforms Interested? Tell us what you’re looking for - in your application, tell what games have influenced you?  Apply now and start the conversation with us. Together, we can create some of the best games ever made.
Title: Systems Designer

Job_Description: Position Summary: The chosen candidate will be responsible for analyzing BI and reporting requirements, developing value-added BI solutions, quality assurance and providing support to internal clients.This position will also deliver more complex BI solutions following the development of the life cycle process, provide data analysis review of data to identify behavioral trends and patterns and partner with business units to deliver BI solutions that add value. In this role, you must be able to work closely with business sponsors at all levels.Additionally, this person will work to understand various insurance processes, capture business requirements, develop/implement solutions and ensure quality results by leveraging our clients BI platform, MS power BI and applied systems bulk data extract.Experience and Skills: 3 to 5+ years’ experience in BI development that directly aligns with the responsibilities for this role.3 to 5+ years’ experience in data analytics.Advanced application of SQL queries and other BI solutions required.A demonstrated track record of consistently meeting and/or exceeding performance expectations.Excellent communication skills – verbal and written.Strong analytical and problem solving skills.Experience in dealing with all levels of business and technical personnel.Experience working with teams composed of consultants, sub-contractors, and full-time employees.Database Technology: SQL Server or equivalent.Required Skills and Experience: At least 2 years hands-on work experience with Microsoft Power BI.Experience in optimizing Microsoft Power BI dashboards with a focus on usability, performance, flexibility, testability, and standardization.Intermediate to advanced understanding of the DAX (data analysis expressions) language in Power BI.Creates DAX columns and measures over data models for the purpose of enhancing Power BI visuals.Has familiarity using DAX functions for formatting numbers, dates, or texts.Creating Row level security with Power BI.Experience in Microsoft SQL Server Analysis Services and SQL Server Reporting Services.Must have very good UX experience to build report/UI mock ups.Preferred Skills and Experience: Experience in other BI tools such as Tableau Desktop/Server or Microstrategy.3+ years with various forms of data modeling, including relational and star schema; semantic layer design and development.Experience with meta data management, data strategies and assessments.Experience in designing and developing advanced analytics solutions.Experience in writing multi directional expression queries.Job Type: Permanent
Title: Power BI Designer/ Developer

Job_Description: Helping Albertans achieve their dreams by turning the complex world of banking into brilliantly simple solutions. That’s ATB. Is that you? Web Developer Channel 21 – ATB Financial The Web Developer works as a key contributor to our internal awarding winning agency Channel 21 and is responsible for the construction of web pages and sites including wireframing and storyboarding, functional prototypes and translating mockups to fully functional, and responsive finished products. This role understands the importance of combining the art of design with the art of programming. This person will work with other creatives, Web Designers and UX Visual Designers to bridge the gap between visual design and technical implementation. The individual will take an active role on both sides to define how the application looks as well as how it works. A solid background in server-side development, with knowledge of industry-standard CMS platforms like Wordpress (theme and plugin development) and similar constructs would be a huge asset. About you: As a Web Developer, you will have an extraordinary amount of curiosity. The successful candidate will have an Intermediate level of proficiency in HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. An understanding of JavaScript libraries like React, Vue, Angular, jQuery, Gulp, and Grunt would be a wonderful asset as well. You are a self-starter with amazing communication and problem solving skills. You enjoy the process of discovery and appreciate corporate culture and working with constraints. Must Haves: Develop new user-facing features Build reusable code and libraries for future use Ensure the technical feasibility of UI/UX designs Optimize application for maximum speed and scalability Contribute to overall creative & graphic design governance for ATB’s Internal Agency; Propose tools and make recommendations as needed for ATB’s Intranet/Internet website budget Design, build and monitor applications for ATB’s Internet/Intranet websites Research and plan for changing user requirements and technology advances Keep current with other financial institutions’ Internet and Intranet web sites and development practices Develop interactive marketing tools to support business Provide assistance in other marketing reporting needs Determine and recommend the resources necessary for web operations Job Requirements As the ideal candidate you possess: Proficient understanding of web markup, including HTML5, CSS3 Good understanding of server-side CSS pre-processing platforms, such as LESS and SASS Proficient understanding of JavaScript frameworks, including React, Vue, Angular, jQuery, Gulp, and Grunt. Good understanding of asynchronous request handling. Familiar with LAMP, MAMP, and PHP frameworks like Laravel and CodeIgniter. Basic knowledge of image authoring tools, to be able to crop, resize, or perform minor adjustments on an image. Proficient understanding of cross-browser compatibility issues and ways to work around them Proficient understanding of code versioning tools, such as Git or SVN Good understanding of SEO principles and ensuring that application will adhere to them Basic knowledge of secure web services: privacy, firewalls, encryption, and SSL Excellent communication skills; Self-Starter; Highly-Organized; Detail-Oriented; Efficient Experience with database structures and custom metrics reporting Ability to work with both a team and independently Customer-focused and results driven University degree, or post-secondary accreditation in a related field and 3-5 years of experience in the field or in a related area About us As for us, we’re the biggest Alberta financial institution, and we have more than 5,000 employees, yet we’re literally the kind of place where you can talk about voice and tone with the CEO. (You’ll like him.) Our entire mandate is about transforming our industry, and we’re a company that is focused on telling stories. We’re on every Best Employer in Canada list that counts, because we’ve taken the notion of putting our employees first, elevated it out of the realm of corporate cliché, and made it real So what can ATB Financial offer you? Imagine paying less for your everyday banking, mortgages, loans and investments. Throw in an excellent benefits and pension package, opportunities for career advancement, and a financial institution that’s leading the way in change – now you’re talking about a career with a company that allows you to grow. As an award-winning employer-of-choice – we have the best of the best working for Albertans. Sound like a team you want to be a part of? If you want to know more, read our employer reviews visit our Glassdoor page. Online applications are preferred. ATB Financial is an equal opportunity employer.
