Job_Description: gdR is recruiting a Sr. UX/UI Designer for a fast-growing startup making waves in the retail space. By using technology, to blend together the online and physical worlds, they help some of the world's leading brands deliver an exceptional customer experience.  About the Company:  Offices in Toronto and Waterloo; 150 total employees. Motto is "Not just a company, but a community". Company values are focused on inclusivity and diversity. Clients include major retailers such as Kate Spade, Michael Kors, and Toys R Us. Tech stack includes: PHP, Angular, React, Golang, MYSQL, Redis and OData. Compensation package includes competitive salary, benefits and stock options.  Why Join?  The company has a mobile-first product that follows Apple design principles. It’s a great opportunity to make a huge impact on the business and learn from great leaders. You’ll be reporting directly into the VP.  You’re the ideal Sr. UX/UI Designer if you have:  7+ years of design experience, with a focus on iOS development. A well rounded portfolio of previous design work (required). Some experience leading and supporting design teams. A technical background (bonus).  As the Sr. UX/UI Designer here’s how you’ll make an impact:  Conduct research and design wireframes using Sketch and InVision. Design customer facing applications on mobile iOS platforms. Facilitate and oversee the implementation process of designs.  Apply today for the Sr. UX/UI Designer role or contact Samantha Colaco, Talent & Client Manager, at samantha AT grossmandorland DOT com to learn more.  About gdR | Grossman Dorland Recruiting  Founded in 2007, Grossman Dorland Recruiting (gdR) s objective is to grow the leadership capacity and capabilities of people and companies in the Canadian tech ecosystem through Executive Recruiting, Individual Contributor Level Recruiting and Leadership Coaching & Development.  We’re actively involved in the community by creating opportunities for people to connect and learn from one another e.g. Canadian Tech at Scale (in partnership with Shopify & Pivotal), which brings 120+ engineering leaders.  gdR values inclusion in Canada’s tech ecosystem and partners with employers that provide equal opportunities for individuals from diverse groups. If you’re interested in moving to Canada, although we can’t sponsor you here are some resources to help you with your journey.  Follow gdR on LinkedIn , Twitter and Facebook for updates on new roles in tech.
Title: Sr. UX/UI Designer

Job_Description: At Rogers we’re for supporting you on a journey to a rewarding career. Whether you’re a developer, an analyst, or a customer care consultant, Rogers is the place where ideas become reality. We embrace change, and find ways to do better. And we deliver on that commitment by fostering an environment of passion and innovation for all people.  Imagine working for an exciting entrepreneurial company whose employees are committed to meeting the big challenges and making a real difference. That’s Rogers. A leading communications and media company where people come to do great work. Right now, we are looking for talented individuals to join our winning team where you will have a chance to innovate, grow and to do what really matters.  We are currently seeking unusually talented and highly versatile front-end developers who live and breathe HTML 5, CSS and javascript and either love or are willing to try a long-term relationship with Angular.js or React.js, with a bit of dabbling in other javascript frameworks from time to time. You ideally believe that single page applications are the future of Digital and are eager to work with server side developers to ensure they produce well-designed REST services for you to consume. We strongly value deep technical skills, an eye for UI design and UX intuition, willingness to learn, and desire to work in an intensive, highly productive environment.  Primary Function: Develop interactive web applications (in CMS or single page applications) that include browse, shop and self-service functions and customer friendly capabilities. A key responsibility is to use your creativity to produce highly responsive and enjoyable web-based user interfaces. The customer should never be confused about what is happening or become frustrated because they don’t know what to do next.  What you will be doing: Creating highly interactive single page applications using Angular.js and React.js that respond to all user actions in fractions of a second Creating attractive experiences in content management that delight and inspire the customer Creating, maintaining, debugging and optimizing javascript, HTML and CSS Taking an active role in structuring our single page applications to make them easy to maintain and to ensure they are highly modularized Creating optimized HTML, CSS and javascript with breakpoints that work well on mobile browsers Working closely the architects and back end services team to ensure that that we have a useful set of REST services Working closely with UX and UI designers to help them understand the constraints of single page applications and development frameworks so that they produce usable designs  What you bring: Bilingualism is a requirement for this role A university degree in arts, design, engineering, science, math or computer science is highly desirable Experience in javascript, jQuery, CSS 3, and HTML 5 and in optimizing for fast rendering 5+ years experience in building mobile responsive pages with javascript frameworks Experience with Social Media APIs (Facebook, Twitter, etc) Development using Scrum Agile methodologies is a plus Demonstrated ability to create single page applications, either through prior experience, school projects or special websites you have built to showcase your skills You truly love to code and build Digital experiences as evidenced by prior projects and experience Strong organizational and estimation skills Exceptional communications and presentation skills  Schedule: Full Time Shift: Day Length of Contract: Not Applicable (Regular Position) Work Location: 1200, avenue McGill College (179), Montreal, QC Travel Requirements: Up to 10% Posting Category/Function: Technology & Software Development Requisition ID: 114234 WHY ROGERS? As a proud Canadian company, we're dedicated to making things easier for our customers. We’ve been embracing and leading change for over 50-years, and we’ll continue to seek out new opportunities to bring our customers simple solutions for today and tomorrow. We recognize that success is determined by the strength and diversity of our people. We work together because we want to win together, and these five shared values guide and define our work: Simplify and innovate Take ownership of the what and the how Equip people to succeed Execute with discipline and pride Talk straight, build trust, and over deliver Why Rogers? Because your tomorrow inspires our today. What makes us different makes us stronger. Rogers has a strong commitment to diversity and inclusion. Everyone who applies for a job will be considered. We recognize the business value in creating a workplace where each team member has the tools to reach their full potential. At Rogers, we value the insights and innovation that diverse teams bring to work. We work with our candidates with disabilities throughout the recruitment process to ensure that they have what they need to be at their best. Please reach out to our recruiters and hiring managers to begin a conversation about how we can ensure that you deliver your best work. You can also reach out to our team at RogersRecruiting@rci.rogers.com to begin a conversation about your individual accessibility needs throughout the hiring process. Posting Notes: Information Technology & Engineering || Canada (CA) || QC || Montreal || SF: LI-TM1 ||

Job_Description: Looking for an opportunity that will propel your career to the next level? Interested in working with an organization that is fun and dynamic? No need to look further, you’ve come to the right place! Productions TMV is a Montreal based leading technology company specializing in ecommerce and digital content delivery. We develop tools and applications that are revolutionizing the way media is consumed over the web. We are currently seeking a Media Streaming Engineer that will report directly to the Director of Engineering. Responsibilities: Video Streaming: You'll be part of a growing team who will be specializing in video streaming technologies and software development Inventing: You'll be an integral part of us implementing cutting-edge video features such as live metadata sync, synchronized video across multiple clients, efficient simultaneous multi-video playback, and instant multi-channel video switching. Creating: You'll also assist with developing video features for end-users and building tools to assist the backend, and our support team utilize these features internally. Collaborating: Within our fun Agile environment you can fully expect to collaborate with our Product Managers, Project Managers, UX/UI Designers, Business Analysts, Quality Assurance Analysts and Software Engineers regularly. Scaling: Developing solutions to challenge our streaming infrastructure and enabling us to scale up and service several thousand clients worldwide. What you will bring: Minimum of 5 years experience in software development Distribution of streaming media Audio/video compression/decompression for streaming Delivering live video streaming events at scale Video/Data Multiplexing and switching H.264, HLS, Smooth Streaming, Dash encoding/decoding technologies Low latency video streaming formats/protocols such as RTP, RTSP, RTMP and WebRTC What we offer: A dynamic and collaborative work environment Competitive vacation packages Competitive salary Free breakfast and lunch Flex and summer hours Access to onsite Ping-Pong tables Renowned corporate events

Job_Description: Job Title: User Experience Designer – Native iOS Apps  Duration: 12/011/2017 to 05/25/2018  Location: Toronto  Group Employee Interactive Solutions  Job Responsibilities: Senior UX/UI designer needs to be competent in all of facets of the design process, and exceptionally talented and skilled in Interaction and Information Architecture Design. A well-rounded UX/UI professional who connects the dots between business needs, target users, innovation, developers, Product Owner, Business Analysts, and good design. Fluent in iOS Native Tablet UI UX and should be able to provide complete screen designs and assets to the developers for quick and easy implementation. Experienced at driving a user experience from start-to-finish that delivers results. Obsessed with good user-centered design practices and have an eye for detail. Passionate about understanding (and keeping the team and clients in formed about) current and emerging UX/UI trends. 5 to 10 years of UX design experience (and the portfolio to prove it) as a key, hands- on interaction/visual designer of a UI/UX team through the product development  Candidate Requirements/Must Have Skills: 1) 5-10 years overall- (Can lead) 2) Native IOS design within tablet (IOS native on phone side okay)- at least 4 years 3) agile environment 4) Great communication skills 5) previous retail banking project experience would be great  Degrees or certifications: Bachelor's degree or Post-Secondary education-  Additional notes: The manager requires a senior (Lead) UX Designer within Canadian Banking. This resource will be an integral part of the universal banker project. Native IOS design within tablet is absolutely mandatory (Native IOS on phone is okay). This resource will, provide retail banking functionality within banks (enterprise), credit cards used by employees to on-board new bankers/ update profiles, fund their credit card. The group needs to increase the usage of tablets vs desktop version, this resource should be very strong communication wise to be able to connect the dots with business requirements and implementation. They will be on continuous communication with the product owner, BA, end users, scrum master, solution architect as well as the tech team so there can’t be any miscommunication as this role is very critical. The manager doesn’t want to see UI experience with browsers/ web, they need to be experienced with native IOS, preferably within tablet.  Manager wants someone hands on with Native IOS. The candidates must be able to design IOS native screen as per IOS native.

Job_Description: Nous valorisons la diversité et avons à cœur de créer un milieu de travail inclusif qui nous inspire tous à donner le meilleur de nous-mêmes. Joignez-vous à notre équipe et faites une différence!  Votre poste  Nous Comment imaginez-vous les bureaux d’une compagnie d’assurance? Et l’atmosphère de travail qui y règne? Nous gageons que si vous passez nous voir au Lab de Intact, vous serez très surpris! Situé au centre-ville de Montréal, nous sommes un laboratoire d’innovation dont la mission est de créer des produits à la fine-pointe de l’insurtech qui améliorent la vie de millions de Canadiens.  Mariant la convivialité et la vélocité d’une startup aux ressources et aux moyens d’une grande entreprise (vous disposerez de tous les outils dont vous avez toujours rêvé!), le Lab est un environnement jeune et dynamique, offrant des défis stimulants, des collègues inspirants et une carrière passionnante (chez un des top 100 employeurs au Canada). C’est l’endroit idéal pour parfaire vos compétences et faire évoluer votre carrière.  Vous Vous êtes passionné par le commerce électronique et l’innovation numérique? Vous avez un talent particulier pour traduire des exigences complexes en expériences utiles et agréables? Vous restez à l’affût des dernières tendances en matière de design et vous aimez expérimenter de nouveaux outils et de nouvelles méthodologies? Nous avons l’occasion parfaite pour vous!  Rôle À titre de designer UX/UI, vous jouerez un rôle essentiel dans la conception et l’évolution de notre écosystème numérique. Relevant du directeur principal, Innovations numériques, vous aurez comme principales responsabilités :  Concevoir des expériences captivantes en vue de réaliser les objectifs d’affaires  Valider la fonctionnalité et l’utilité par l’entremise de tests et de recherches auprès des utilisateurs  Produire des livrables UX et design pertinents au besoin  Piloter une feuille de route aux côté d’un directeur de produit et d’une équipe agile multidisciplinaire  Présenter le travail aux parties prenantes  Aider les ingénieurs à produire des interfaces de qualité et agréables  Prôner une conception axée sur l’utilisateur et les données  Vos compétences  Minimum trois années d’expérience  Expertise en matière de convivialité et de pratiques de conception centrées sur l'utilisateur  Maîtrise des outils de conception (Sketch, Axure, InVision, Illustrator, etc.)  Expérience des outils de recherche UX (usertesting.com, Optimal Workshop, etc.) un atout  Expérience dans la production de flux de processus, d’inventaires de contenu, etc.  Vous aimez travailler dans un environnement de collaboration qui accorde une importance primordiale au travail d’équipe, à l’innovation, à l’ouverture d’esprit et au plaisir  Veuillez inclure votre portfolio dans votre dossier de candidature.  Vous êtes  Une personne avec qui il est agréable de travailler  Créatif, analytique, curieux et ingénieux  Un joueur d’équipe capable de partager et recevoir des commentaires constructifs  Excellent pour expliquer vos idées à différents intervenants  Profondément passionné par le design et la qualité  Organisé et proactif  En tant que salarié temps plein, vous bénéficierez des avantages suivants :  Un salaire compétitif  Un boni de performance annuel  Un régime de retraite  Un horaire de travail flexible de 35 heures par semaine  Des assurances médicales et dentaires hors pair  Et plusieurs autres avantages et bénéfices (remboursement gym, conférences, etc.)  Énoncé fermeture  Cette opportunité vous intéresse? Nous avons très hâte de faire votre connaissance!  D’excellents avantages sont offerts : salaire concurrentiel, avantages flexibles, aménagements de travail flexibles, congés mobiles, régime de retraite à prestation déterminée, etc.  Dans le cadre du processus de sélection d’Intact, les candidats peuvent être appelés à donner leur consentement à une vérification de leurs antécédents pertinente au poste à pourvoir avant de recevoir une offre d’emploi. Celle-ci peut comprendre une confirmation des références d’emploi, des études et des titres de compétences, une vérification des emplois, de l’identité, des infractions criminelles et du permis de conduire ainsi qu’un rapport de crédit.  Vous pouvez soumettre votre candidature à un emploi affiché pourvu que vous occupiez vos fonctions actuelles depuis au moins douze mois et que votre performance soit jugée bonne ou que votre contrat temporaire arrive à son échéance. Une recherche de talents à l'externe est menée parallèlement au recrutement à l'interne Veuillez donc prendre note que des candidats potentiels pourraient avoir été identifiés pour ce poste dans le cadre de leur plan de développement.   Veuillez noter que l'usage du masculin a comme but d'alléger le texte.  Cet affichage prendra fin 02 juin 2018.  Prime de recommandation  CE POSTE EST SUJET À UNE PRIME DE RECOMMANDATION DE 3000$.  #li-qc  Droit de travailler au Canada  Les personnes qui posent leur candidature à un poste permanent doivent, dès leur embauche, avoir le droit de travailler au Canada de façon permanente. Les documents pouvant servir de preuve dans le cas des rôles permanents sont un certificat de naissance canadien, un passeport canadien, un certificat de citoyenneté canadienne, une carte de résident permanent ou une confirmation de son statut de résident permanent pour prouver qu’il a le droit de travailler au Canada.  Indeed Commandité  IN-INFR

Job_Description: Blueprint provides industry-leading software solutions that help large organizations build better business applications. Our products - Blueprint Storyteller for Agile, Blueprint Automate for DevOps and Blueprint RegTech for Compliance – resolve many of the time-consuming, costly, and error-prone challenges that IT organizations face when driving digital transformation for their businesses.  We ensure that large-scale mission critical projects are completed successfully, on time and on budget. Organizations across the globe use Blueprint solutions to better align IT with their business by ensuring regulatory compliance, speeding transition to Agile, and automating their end to end BizDevOps toolchain. Nearly half of all Fortune 100 companies choose Blueprint to de-risk and accelerate their software projects.  We work as a team to deliver an outstanding, reliable and scalable solution. We rely on a group of brilliant, motivated engineers that understand that “getting it right” means working hard, taking ownership and depending on the other smart people on their team. We follow an agile process and use the latest Microsoft development tools and platform technologies. As a senior member of the team you will take significant ownership of a feature area, including: Developing and maintaining high-quality client software using Angular and TypeScript Working with other like-minded high performers within an Agile environment Working with Product Managers and UI/UX Designers to refine scope Working with others on architecture and system design Writing unit tests and automation tests to prevent regressions Occasionally assisting with the investigation and resolution of support issues Using your deep understanding of cross-browser compatibility issues to find ways to work around them Using your experience to contribute to the continuous improvement of our processes and culture As a Sr. Front-End Developer you will have: A degree in computer science, math, engineering or a similar discipline At least 5 years of experience with JavaScript OOP (scopes, closures, inheritance, etc.) Expert level knowledge of modern web development standards, HTML/CSS, JavaScript frameworks (jQuery, Angular, React, etc.) and libraries A solid understanding of the full web technology stack (e.g. HTTP, cookies, headers, asset loading and caching) Working experience using RESTful APIs Some experience shipping commercial enterprise software using an Agile methodology A proficient understanding of distributed version control tools and source control strategies A commitment to excellent work and a tangible passion for software development Excellent communications skills As a member of our dynamic team it would be an asset if you also had: Experience with Angular 2 and later Familiarity with TypeScript Familiarity with Jasmine and Karma or similar JavaScript unit test frameworks If you thrive on working in a dynamic and exciting environment then this is the role for you! We offer a competitive salary and benefits package coupled with a casual and fast paced work environment.  We strive to meet the accommodation needs of persons with disabilities. Applicants are encouraged to make their needs for accommodation known in advance during the application process.

Job_Description: You have outstanding, rigorous credentials, expertise and experience in User Experience Design. You are highly adept in guiding and collaborating with teams to develop user centric processes and interactions that enhance business application, increase user engagement and increase brand loyalty. You effectively utilize your solid understanding of business goals and user behaviour in designing the overall functionality of the product to ensure a great user experience. Our client is committed to: Providing a respectful, fair and ethical work environment that values innovation, collaboration and drive for excellence. Reporting to the Manager, Application Delivery, as User Experience Designer, you will: Design and develop user interfaces and user flows based on requirements and feedback from stakeholder groups. Create UI wireframes, mockups and interactive prototypes. Provide end to end analysis of our digital platforms with the user needs in mind. Work directly with Analysts to review requirements and provide feedback on documentation. Participate in planning activities as needed. Develop HTML and CSS templates for digital applications. Work directly with development teams to provide HTML and CSS templating and support. Diagnose, troubleshoot and resolve browser and device-based display issues. Estimate and track progress on work tasks. Interact with the Customer Experience (CX) team to ensure alignment with the latest customer and user trends. Interact with Communications and Marketing teams to ensure brand alignment and consistency. Improve upon and ensure the adherence to the established practices, processes, and guidelines. Develop UI documentation and UI templates for use by other groups. Mentor junior UX team members. What the successful candidate will bring: Degree or diploma in Graphic Design, Digital Media or equivalent experience with 2+ years of experience in planning, developing and integrating user interfaces Demonstrated experience using design and prototyping tools, such as the Adobe Suite, UXPin, Mockflow and InVision. Strong HTML and CSS skills and the ability to trouble shoot browser and device display issues. Good working knowledge of JavaScript. Experience with JavaScript frameworks such as Angular, React, or Vue is considered an asset. Detail-oriented with analytical and problem-solving skills to identify and resolve issues in a timely and effective manner. Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to communicate in a clear and concise manner to a wide-range of audience (business partners, customers and stakeholders). Exceptional planning, organizational, multi-tasking and prioritization skills. Proven leadership skills, with the ability to foster and encouraging high team morale utilizing effective coaching strategies. Sound decision-making skills, with the ability to direct team members to achieve goals through clear instruction. Certifications in relevant technology or processes is considered an asset. In return, what you can expect: Competitive salary and benefits package. If you are interested in the position of User Experience Designer, please submit your resume to Ryan den Teuling by pressing “Apply Now”. Only candidates already eligible to work in Canada will be reviewed. Only qualified candidates will be contacted. Fit is important to us and it’s important to the companies we partner with. At The Headhunters, we understand that finding your next dream role is not just about aligning your skills with a job description. It is about knowing your personality, workstyle and career goals. Learn more about our specialized recruitment services at www.theheadhunters.ca.

Digital experience 2. Job_Description: Nous sommes actuellement à la recherche d’un.e Designer Web. Votre rôle consistera à la production (conception et déclinaison) de différents éléments graphiques pour les projets web de nos clients (conception d’écosystème numérique, évolution artistique de site web, campagne web et communicationnelle, et bien plus…). Le.la titulaire de ce poste travaillera conjointement avec les directeurs artistiques pour déterminer l’orientation créative des projets et pour la production de ceux-ci. Vos responsabilités Concevoir, adapter et réaliser des contenus Web selon les concepts et normes définis par l'équipe, dans le respect des attentes du client et de l'échéancier; Conceptualiser, créer et décliner le design des bannières numérique; Assurer une continuité dans l’aspect visuel tout au long des projets d’un même client; Générer des idées créatives, innovatrices et pertinentes; Présenter les concepts et les maquettes aux clients; Profil recherché Essentiel : Talent créatif; 5 à 7 ans d’expérience dans un poste similaire; Bonne maîtrise des notions UX/UI; Maîtriser les logiciels Photoshop, Sketch, InVision et Illustrator; Connaissance des normes IAB; Connaissance en HTML 5/CSS et expérience avec des outils tels que Google Web Designer ou Adobe Animate; Autonome; Capacité à présenter et expliquer vos démarches créatives et votre travail à vos collègues et aux clients; Bonne capacité à gérer son stress; Habilité à effectuer plusieurs tâches et à traiter plusieurs projets à la fois avec de courtes échéances; Dynamisme, sens des responsabilités et polyvalence; Rapidité d'exécution; Bilingue;  Atout Expérience en design d’interaction; Expérience en motion design; Expérience comme AdOps; Connaissance du design atomique  L'équipe de travail L’équipe de stratégie et conseil de Tink réunit une faune éclectique. Si vous aimez rire et rouler avec style en Westfalia ou êtes un adepte de la plongée sous-marine ou de la photographie, ce sera le coup de foudre! Travailler chez Tink Chez Tink, mille et une activités enjolivent notre quotidien. Entourée de pistes cyclables et de bornes Bixi, notre agence a tout pour mettre du punch à vos journées : une équipe authentique travaillant en synergie, des food trucks l’été à deux pas du bureau, un accès au bord du fleuve, des formations interactives UTink et des 5 à 7 festifs. L’ambiance est incomparable!

Job_Description: Do you want to be part of a team that's building applications and services that will revolutionize the management experience in thousands of apartments worldwide? Do you want to help to shape the future of real estate property management as well as communication? Do you want to be part of a team with a startup and a hackathon culture?  Domum Link™ is an online residential property management platform designed from the ground up to be intuitive and easy to use. Our goals are big and impactful and the work is fun and rewarding. We are looking for smart, passionate engineers/thinkers/creators to take up new challenges.  As a Front-End Developer, you will be responsible for all front-end architecture/implementation, and be a key player across all areas of the engineering life cycle, including eliciting requirements from customers, defining the feature with UI designers and product managers, building the experience by writing the code, shipping it with quality and on time, and sustaining it through its maturity.  The candidate should have strong communication skills, both written and verbal. We also expect the candidate to display a bias for action in implementing new disruptive ideas, show a desire to make our team better, and to learn and adapt quickly.  Duties/Responsibilities   Build modern front-end solution with best practices Build reusable front-end code and libraries for future use Ensure the technical feasibility of proposed UI/UX designs Participate in stress tests, load tests, performance tests, making recommendations to improve performance and scalability Prepare software packages and documentation for deployment that adhere to the defined standard deployment policies Be highly responsive to critical production issues providing timely and effective solutions Collaborate and help team members in the development life cycle  Required Skills & Experience   At least 4 years of hands on experience in front end web development Deep experience with front-end architecture, packing, best practices, dev process Deep experience with JavaScript and JavaScript frameworks, e.g. jQuery, ReactJs, Node.js, KnockoutJS, BackboneJS, etc. Up to date knowledge of current Web UI best practices and usability concepts Expert level (or at least) strong working knowledge of current HTML/CSS Extensive understanding of asynchronous AJAX processes, communication with back-end via WebAPI/json Extensive understanding of web security Extensive understanding of front-end routing Deep experience with DOM - Knowledge of design patterns (MVC, Strategy, Factory, Singleton) and general design considerations Excellent communication (verbal/written) including the ability to distill technical details into human terms  Nice-to-Haves   Previous development experience using SQL server Previous development experience using NoSQL databases (e.g. Cassandra, Mongo DB, Couch DB) Experience with UI automated testing frameworks (e.g. Selenium, Karma, Protractor) Experience with Cloud like: Azure, AWS

Job_Description: CAE is a global leader in training for the civil aviation, defence and security, and healthcare markets. Backed by a 70-year record of industry firsts, we continue to help define global training standards with our innovative virtual-to-live training solutions to make flying safer, maintain defence force readiness and enhance patient safety. We have the broadest global presence in the industry, with 8,000 employees, 160 sites and training locations in over 35 countries. Each year, we train more than 120,000 civil and defence crewmembers and thousands of healthcare professionals worldwide. www.cae.com     Analyste experience utilisateur / User Experience Analyst   Position Type:  Regular  Role and Responsibilities Responsabilités: Definir les concepts d’opération et l’expérience utilisateur de nombreux logiciels développés par ou en collaboration avec le groupe Ingénierie – Expérience de formation (simulateurs de vol, simulateurs chirurgicaux, simulateurs de patients humains, outils d’ingénierie…) pour des plateformes mobiles, web, du bureau ou embarquées, et/ou en réalité virtuelle/augmentée. Collaborer avec les responsables de produit et l’ingénierie pour définir les requis clients Développer des scénarios d’utilisation afin de supporter la définition et le design des applications Communiquer les designs à l’aide de diagrammes, spéficications détaillées et prototypes interactifs Reccueillir des données sur l’utilisation des produits, par exemple à l’aide d’entrevues ou de sondages Évaluer des interfaces, par exemple avec des tests dutilisabilité, des évaluations heuristiques ou des walkthroughs. Collaborer en mode Agile avec les équipes de développement pour l’implémentation des interfaces utilisateur Participer aux activités de gouvernance du groupe Expérience de formation Contribuer à l’élaboration des normes d’interface en spécifiant des patterns et contrôles UI.  Qualifications Baccalauréat en génie, informatique, design ou équivalent Maitrise en ergonomie ou interaction humain-machine ou équivalent 3-10 ans d’expérience pertinente Connaissance du design centré utilisateur Expérience en design d’applications mobiles ou de bureau (maquettes fil-de-fer, storyboards, workflows) Experience avec des outils de prototypage (Axure, JustinMind ou equivalent) Connaissance des methods de validation UX (tests d’utilisabilité, évaluations heuristiques) Capacité d'effectuer plusieurs tâches à la fois, souci du détail, capacité de faire preuve d'initiative et d'effectuer les tâches avec un minimum de supervision Aptitude à travailler en équipe avec les designers UI, les développeurs et autres parties prenantes Bon communicateur Connaissance des domaines de l’aviation et/ou des soins de santé un atout Connaissance en programmation et des méthodes de génie logiciel (Agile) un atout Connaissance de l’ergonomie physique un atout Compétence en design graphique un atout Disponible pour voyager à l’occasion  ***********************************************************************************  Position Profile / Responsibilities Be responsible for the definition of the operational concepts and the user experience of various software applications developed by, or in collaboration with the Training Experience engineering organization. This may include flight simulators, medical simulators and engineering tools, for all platform types from mobile, desktop, embedded and AR/VR. Gather user data (using various research methods) at both a high level (workflow, needs) and a detailed level (specific user interfaces). Perform surveys and interviews with resident field experts, task analysis and user’s observation in their work environment. Work closely with product managers to identify and clarify customer requirements. Develop user scenarios to support software application definition and design. Communicate designs to development teams through diagrams, drawings, detailed specifications and interactive prototypes. Resolve trade-offs between designs and implementation issues. Design user interaction models. Design user interaction cross-cutting concerns common to more than one software application. Design user interfaces based on functional requirements, user needs and task analysis. Evaluate user interfaces through heuristic evaluation, expert reviews and usability testing (when appropriate). Collaborate in Agile mode the development teams in their implementation of the user interfaces. Participate in the governance activities of the Training Experience engineering organization Contribute to the redaction of the Human Interface Guidelines and to the specification of custom/advanced UI controls to be included in the common UI control library. Conduct expert reviews on user interfaces that were designed outside of the team and provide recommendations for improvements  Qualifications Bachelor's degree in engineering, computing, design or the equivalent Master's degree in human-computer interaction or cognitive ergonomics or the equivalent 3-10 years of pertinent work experience required. Good knowledge of user-centered design. Experience in interaction design for mobile and desktop applications (wireframes, storyboards, workflows) Experience with UI prototyping tools (Axure, JustinMind or equivalent) Knowledge of validation methods in user experience such as usability testing and heuristic evaluation. Ability to multi-task, detail oriented, self motivator who can complete tasks with minimal supervision. Ability to work as part of a team with UI designers, developpers and other stakeholders Good communication skills. Knowledge of aviation and/or healthcare an asset. Knowledge of programming and software engineering methods is an asset. Knowledge of physical ergonomic is an asset. Skills in graphic design is an asset. Ready to travel on occasion.    CAE thanks all applicants for their interest. However, only those whose background and experience match the requirements of the role will be contacted.   Equal Employment Opportunity CAE is firmly committed to ensuring a positive and professional working environment in which all people are treated with dignity and respect. We aim to provide a fair and consistent method for filling job openings in support of equality of opportunity and cultural diversity within the company.  The masculine gender is used throughout this job description solely to make the text easier to read and therefore applies to both men and women.
Title: Analyste experience utilisateur / User Experience Analyst

Job_Description: Our Mission is to impact people’s lives by uncovering the truth and empowering others to make a difference. We do this by equipping examiners and investigators with the best digital forensics tools available, so they can accomplish their mission: Fighting crime. Protecting company assets. Guarding national security.  We are proud to be ranked in the top 30 on the 29th annual PROFIT 500, the definitive ranking of Canada’s Fastest-Growing Companies.  Who are we? We build software that automates the recovery of digital forensic evidence, helping thousands of forensics professionals around the world find, analyze, and report on the digital evidence from computers, smartphones, and tablets.  Our flagship software, Magnet AXIOM, has revolutionized the work of digital forensics investigators in law enforcement and government agencies, and has been essential in use cases involving child exploitation, murder, terrorism, and more.  How we work: We are a dynamic team who are passionate about the work we do. We are inspired because our work makes a difference and there is a shared sense of purpose in our culture.  We work in cross functional teams to regularly experiment, iterate, and deliver on new goals, pushing the boundaries in everything we do to bring world class digital forensics tools to law enforcement, government agencies, and corporations.  What we are looking for: A passionate, self-motivated technical writer to create and maintain customer-facing documentation for the Magnet Forensics line of products. As part of the Product Management organization, you’ll work closely with product managers, UX designers, developers, testers, forensic examiners, and technical support reps to produce technical content for forensic examiners.  Role Responsibilities: Design, write, and revise product documentation, including user guides, reference guides, and release notes for regular product releases. Work closely with UX designers to provide input into a globalized product by writing and reviewing UI strings. Prioritize feedback from product management, forensic examiners, and technical support to improve documentation based on the needs of our customers. Liaise with Agile teams by attending daily standups, retros, sprint planning sessions, and more. Perform peer edits and proofreading to make sure documentation follows Magnet Forensics style guide and that language is clear, concise, and correct. Requirements: Bachelor’s degree in English Rhetoric and Professional Writing or equivalent practical experience 5+ years experience writing for software products Strong understanding of DITA and minimalism Outstanding attention to detail Knack for translating difficult concepts into plain language Strong sense of teamwork, personal integrity, and accountability Ability to work with cross-functional teams Ability to manage multiple competing priorities in a fast-paced environment Self-starter with excellent problem-solving skills Familiar with standard issue tracking and source control software like JIRA, Git, and Gerrit Experience with XML and CSS is a plus  We want to hear from you…. Email us today at hr@magnetforensics.com  Magnet Forensics Inc. is an equal opportunity employer. It is Magnet Forensics policy to recruit and select applicants for employment solely on the basis of their qualifications, with emphasis on selecting the best-qualified person for the job. Magnet Forensics Inc. does not discriminate against applicants based on race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin, or disability or any other status or condition protected by applicable law.
Title: Technical Writer – Waterloo, ON

Job_Description: Located in vibrant downtown Montreal, eXplorance is a rapidly growing software company recognized for its unique workplace culture.As part of our accelerated growth, we are looking for a Front-End Developer who always strives for software excellence and continuous improvement. This individual will work in accordance with the company’s software development lifecycle to design and develop both new features and enhancements to software applications that meet business specification. Primary responsibilities include wire framing and frontend implementation, user experience, usability, CSS layout, DOM manipulation, progressive enhancement / graceful degradation, cross-browser testing, unit testing, accessibility, user interaction and user interface design. If you think you’ll enjoy working in a result-driven laid-back environment with flexible hours, then keep reading.What you will do as our new Front End DeveloperImprove the quality of the existing UI and develop new user-facing featuresEnsure the technical feasibility of UI/UX designsOptimize application for maximum speed and scalabilityReorganizing the software flow to uplift the user experienceBuild reusable code and libraries for future useCollaborate with other team members and stakeholdersPerform code reviews, unit testing, and system testing as needed for other developers’ efforts. At a minimum, code reviews, unit testing, and system testing should ensure all requirements have been addressed, all basic functionality works, and errors are handled properly.If you answer ‘yes’ to the following, you’d be a great fit for Front End Devloper positionBasic knowledge ASP .NET and page life cycleProficient understanding of web markup, including HTML5, CSS3Proficient understanding of adaptive and responsive designs and tools such as BootstrapProficient understanding of client-side scripting and JavaScript frameworks, including jQueryGood understanding of advanced JavaScript libraries and frameworks, such as AngularJS, React, or Ember etc., or JS-based build tools like Grunt, Gulp, and BowerBasic understanding of server-side CSS pre-processing platforms, such as LESS and SASSGood understanding of asynchronous request handling, partial page updates, and AJAXProficient understanding of cross-browser compatibility issues and ways to work around them.Proficient understanding of code versioning tools, such as GITTools and Languages: Version Control (e.g., GIT), Visual Studio 2015+, ASP.NET / MVC, Data formats (e.g., JSON, XML), Data APIs (e.g. Restful API), Web Font Embedding, Scalable Vector Graphics (aka SVG), Responsive Web Design, Object-Oriented Programming, JavaScript Animation, CSS Animation, Charts / Graphs, UI Widgets, Code Quality Testing, Integration Testing, Templating Strategies, Templating Engines, Single Page Applications, XHR Requests (AJAX), Web/Browser Security, HTML Semantics, Browser Developer ToolsExperience working with graphic designers and UI/UX requirementsKnowledge of SOAP and REST APIJob Type: Full-timeLocation:Montréal, QC
Title: Front End Developer

Job_Description: Front End/UI Developer  Avrij is a data analytics company, working with university and professional sports teams, to help manage and understand the ever-growing stream of information affecting their organizations.  We are currently looking for a Front-end developer to join our product team. In this role, you will be involved in designing, implementing and reviewing UI mockups & prototypes, analyzing feedback on your prototypes, and incorporating design and feedback into production end-user interfaces.  If you’re interested in working on a new project, joining a growing team, expanding your experience with new technologies, and creating an intuitive interface for our users, then this opportunity is for you. We want to have a driven individual, who is curious and excited about new digital technologies and aspires to combine usability with visual design.  Requirements for this position include: Bachelor’s in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or equivalent  2+ years of proven work experience as a Front-end developer  2+ years Experience with JavaScript, CSS and jQuery  1+ years experience with agile development practices, source control platforms, IDE development platforms (IntelliJ, Eclipse, Github)  Knowledge of Javascript frameworks (Ember, Angular, React, etc) in a production environment, experience with D3.JS  Experience with RESTful APIs  Experience with browser testing extensions and debugging tools  In-depth understanding of web development processes (design, development and deployment)  An ability to perform well in a fast-paced environment  Excellent analytical and multitasking skills  Highly desired, but not required skills would include: Experience working with Amazon Web Services  Experience with UI/UX design principles  Working experience with CI/CD development  Understanding of layout aesthetics  Familiarity with software like Adobe Suite, Photoshop and content management systems  Other areas of work will include: Coordinating and collaborating with back-end developers and web designers to improve usability and efficiency  Working with other developers on implementation and code reviews  Integrating user feedback into product designs, and implementing into future releases  Write functional requirement documents and guides  Ensure high quality graphic standards and brand consistency  Stay up-to-date on emerging technologiesPosition: Full  Start Date: June 2018
Title: Front End Developer

Job_Description: We are looking for a digital Graphic Designer for a 4-month contract, with possibility of permanence.ResponsibilitiesManage the production of different project deliverables, from the design phase to the delivery to the market in connection with the internal team and the agencies.Design and integrate the content of social media platforms.Create responsive digital designs for computers, mobile devices and tablets. Participate in quality assurance on all these platforms.Conceptualize, create and manage the performance of newsletters in MailChimp and coordinate the targeting of mailing lists.Research digital trends and keep abreast of changes in the e-commerce world in terms of digital design in order to keep a constant improvement in the customer experience and the website conversion rate. newsletters.Make minor touch ups on product photos.Participate in trend research and creation of inspirational paintings.Assist in the creation of catalogs and packaging.QualificationsUniversity degree, graphic design5 years experience in a similar positionBilingual (English / French)In-depth knowledge of MailChimp, WordPress and ShopifyMastery of InDesign, Photoshop, Illustrator and Microsoft SuiteUnderstanding of HTML / CSS coding.Knowledge of current web trends and best UX / UI design techniques.Knowledge in photography / video are assets.Salary: based on experienceJob Type: Full-timeExperience:Digital Marketing: 5 years
Title: Digital Graphic Designer (Contract)

Job_Description: Are you the best? Are you ready for the most exciting and challenging opportunity of your career? Do you have a passion for software development that sets the standard and that other programmers look up to for well-designed, implemented, tested, documented and robust code?Do you want towork for a cutting edge company,which is well funded,thrives on being the leader ininnovationfordigital marketing? Do you want to bepart of thisdynamic engineering team?If so, this is the opportunity to for you.  Title: iOS Developer Level: Intermediate/Senior Level (2+ yrs in mobile development) Main Skills: Development and design of our next-generation apps for iOS, UI/UX, Objective-C Location: Toronto (GTA WEST) Salary Range: $90,000 - $100,000  As a iOS developer, youll be responsible for helping launch a UX focused consumer facing flyer mobile platform that will help save millions of consumers money across all of North America. Youll work with our entire team to disrupt the $18 billion print flyer market and help retailers connect with their customers through our cutting edge platform.  Accountability & Duties Work on our mobile apps that will be downloaded by millions of users Youll be working on one of our core products and help us develop next-generation apps for iOS (iPhone & iPad), optimizing for multiple device screen sizes and OS versions With small screen sizes and unique usability patterns, the successful candidate enjoys the challenge of solving user experience issues inherent to the mobile space. This often involves writing custom controls, which the candidate will be required to design and create in a reusable way Use cutting-edge native APIs from Apple and Google Collaborate with our Designers to prototype user interfaces and create engaging user experiences for our consumer-facing apps and design efficient UI/UX layouts You will be working on our new mobile application that will help our already large user base find the best deals online. We have millions of monthly users, so your impact on driving innovation in the retail technology space will be large You will be responsible for integration and development of some critical parts of our leading edge retail software platform Solving difficult programming challenges, finding more efficient ways to code and working as a team to roll out new versions are just some of the daily activities youll encounter Implement new features with usability and performance in mind Working within an Agile environment, we pride ourselves on quickly innovating and improving our software, so we can serve our retail clients better Learning new technology. We are doing things that havent been done in the market, sometimes that means learning new languages or researching ways to solve interesting problems - being efficient, scalable and writing clean code are high on our list Actively participate in the engineering and design process We move quickly, so if youre keen, we will introduce you to new projects and areas  Requirements Bachelors degree in Computer Science or equivalent experience 3+ years of software development experience (we are open to different kinds of skills Ex. Java, PHP, Ruby on Rails, .NET, etc.) 1+ years experience with architecture, design and development of iOS applications Solid understanding of Objective-C, Xcode, JSON, XML and REST/Web APIs Proven experience delivering iOS applications (apps in the App Store) Experience in Object-oriented design (OOD) and Model-View-Controller (MVC) architecture Familiarity with the latest iOS SDK and Apple development tools Solid understanding of iOS/OSX application development process from beginning to end HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, & iPhone/iPad Interfacing would be an asset Able to learn quickly and easily adapt to a wide variety of programming challenges Excellent communication skills leadership role for assigned tasks Highly organized time management skills A passion for constant improvement - always looking to do things better (both personally, as part of a team and for the company) A problem solver with a positive attitude and excellent relationship management skills
Title: iOS Developer

Job_Description: Job description: Full Stack developer  Uni3t Group is a young and dynamic IT company that is active in life science and pharmaceuticals.  The Uni3T Group was born of a desire to bring together and unify a comprehensive expertise in the field of life sciences under one roof. Uni3T Group’s mission is to improve access to public health care and products by providing consulting services, technology solutions, to life sciences companies.  Our approach is based on three main services. All of our missions start with obtaining a strategic vision that is highly aligned with the needs of our customers. We work with customers on transforming their processes to unleash their full organizational potential. Finally, technologies can be deployed to optimize the Business value chain through the automation of key processes.  We are looking for a Full Stack Web Developer who is motivated to combine the art of design with the art of programming. Responsibilities will include translation of the UI/UX design wireframes to actual code that will produce visual elements of the application. You will work with the UI/UX designer and bridge the gap between graphical design and technical implementation, taking an active role on both sides and defining how the application looks as well as how it works.  If you think you can be part of our team, join us now!  Responsibilities: D evelop new user-facing features.  Serve as functional lead to develop projects plans and accomplish goals.  Create, integrate and maintain responsive design.  Collaborate in an agile environment along with a dynamic team composed of software developers, architects, product managers and quality assurance specialists.  Optimize and improve website user experience (UX).  Recommend and apply best Web practices.  Collaborate with other team members and stakeholders.  Qualifications : Specialized college level diploma (DEC) or equivalent in Web Development or Multimedia Integration or related.  2+ years’ experience in a similar position.  Proficiency with integration.  Proficiency with web technology.  Excellent knowledge of web technologies, especially HTML, HTML 5, JavaScript, Ajax, JSON, JQuery.  Good understanding server-side CSS pro-processing platforms, such as LESS and SASS.  Good knowledge of multi-browser and multi-platform development.  Knowledge of Frameworks.  Critical spirit related to Visual Design.  Basic knowledge of Adobe Photoshop and Illustrator applications.  Skills: A detail oriented person.  Excellent verbal and written English communication skills.  Strong analytical and problem solving skills.  Strong sense of organization and prioritizing.  Ability to communicate, write and synthesize information.  Ability to work as a team player in a consulting environment.  Being able to work as a team member or independent.  Ability to work under pressure.  Basic knowledge as a Full Stack Developer.  Benefits: Competitive base salary + bonus (based on company, team and individual efforts);  Comprehensive insurance coverage by Sunlife;  Great company culture with career development opportunities!  Permanent full time position;  Located between Griffintown and the Old Montreal, in the Cité du Multimédia neighborhood, now part of Montreal’s holistic hub for innovation, education, and entrepreneurship: Le Quartier de l’Innovation.
Title: Full stack developer

Job_Description: Ubersmith is a global leader in subscription business management software for organizations of all sizes. The company’s suite of usage-based billing, sales quoting, order management, infrastructure management and help desk ticketing solutions is integrated, open and intuitive. Ubersmith is an INAP (NASDAQ: INAP) company. Hundreds of companies in twenty countries rely on Ubersmith to better serve their customers, run their businesses, shorten time-to-market and boost overall efficiency. We serve the SaaS, Cloud/Hosting, Datacenter, Telco/ISP, Managed Services and Enterprise/All Other markets. Our product is used by CEOs, IT, Finance, Sales, Support, Operations and other user types. Ubersmith is growing and profitable and has exciting plans for the future. It is a great time to be at the company. About the Position The Engineering Team at Ubersmith, comprised of development, UX, and UI is responsible for all the client-facing application and the appliance management system. Utilizing a growing range of tools and programming languages (including PHP, InfluxDB, Redis, Memcache, JavaScript, and MySQL) we continually achieve the best subscription business suite on the market for organizations of all sizes. We are a small, tight team so you will have the opportunity to take ownership of meaningful projects that will help to shape the success of our business. It is a great opportunity to work on a popular product that has enormous potential. Strong candidates will bring solid technical aptitude with the ability act quickly on new features and bug fixes. You will be based in Montreal, Canada, and will report to the Director of Engineering at Ubersmith.  Examples of problems you’ll be solving: Building a Node.js micro-service offering a REST API and interacting with an MQ bus, based on frameworks like Moleculer, Koa or LoopBack. Refactoring existing or legacy PHP code to meet modern standards and practices while preserving functionality. Creating new responsive user interfaces with modern tools like Vue.JS. We’re looking for someone who is awesome because: You have solid software engineering experience and are comfortable coding in PHP and JavaScript. You are passionate about building clean, maintainable, efficient code. You love working closely with a small agile team of developers and designers. You are able to take responsibility for projects from idea to completion. You care about keeping up-to-date with product and industry knowledge. Other people at companies you worked for wanted you on their projects (and/or team). Life with Ubersmith It’s a small (but growing) team of full-time people that love what they do. Competitive salary Flexible and generous paid time off, based on your experience rather than your seniority Flexible work hours, including opportunities to work remotely Company outing once a year Opportunities to continue your professional development The best technology to get your job done: a new MacBook Pro Retina, dual monitors, and (practically) whatever else you need.
Title: Full Stack Developer (Junior), Ubersmith

Job_Description: About Nix Sensor Ltd.We create amazing products that help colour professionals and consumers demystify the world of colour. If you’ve never used a Nix Color Sensor, it’s a magical experience. Like the photoshop eyedropper in real life, it takes the real world and makes it digital, and then can help our users make it real again.What you’ll do?Design beautiful apps that work with our award-winning hardwareWork with our software development, hardware, and product teams to craft a seamless user experienceOwn the design of our core products and participate in shaping the direction of our future productsIterate, test, and release products as quickly as we can gather feedback from our users and customersEven help out with other aspects of product design like packaging, web, etc.What you’ll need?A compelling and interesting portfolio of projects that showcase your workExperience designing mobile apps, and even web and other types of media, front end, back end, consumer and cloud based experience is a bonusExperience using the latest design tools to facilitate wireframing, prototyping, user testing, and information architectureExperience using a design methodology to get product out the door fastThe ability to work in a fast paced, collaborative environment, alongside the rest of our dynamic teamWhat’s makes Nix a great place to work?You’ll be joining a company that’s backed by some of the best advisors and investors in CanadaWe’re growing quickly, and you’ll be helping to build the next great Canadian success storyYou’ll work with a highly motivated team that takes pride in creating amazing productsWhat’s next?Send us a note or message indicating your interestShowcase your work by sending us a portfolio and / or examples of prior projectsJob Type: Full-timeExperience:UI Design: 1 yearUX Design: 1 year
Title: UX UI Designer

Job_Description: Travailler chez Genius Solutions c'est : Joindre une équipe passionnée et dynamique qui a à cœur le succès de l’entreprise. C’est également joindre une entreprise en constante évolution dans un environnement stimulant et dans un marché hautement compétitif .Vous avez de l’intérêt à travailler chez Genius? Assurez-vous de vous reconnaitre dans les valeurs de l’entreprise :Vous êtes énergique et passionné : pour atteindre le succès, nous avons besoin de gens avec une énergie débordante démontrant une passion pour leur travail.Vous êtes en mission : les défis sont grands pour nous et nos clients et nous devons faire face à plusieurs obstacles. Pour mener à bien notre mission, il est essentiel de garder le cap!Vous êtes un bon joueur d’équipe : nous croyons fermement que le respect et la confiance sont des ingrédients essentiels au succès.Vous valorisez la connaissance et l’expertise : Genius valorise grandement les gens qui veulent progresser, acquérir de nouvelles connaissances et développer leur expertise.Vous vous reconnaissez dans les valeurs de la compagnie? Oui?Continuons!Designer UX / UI chez Genius Solutions : Nous recherchons actuellement un designer UX/UI . Cette personne aura comme principale fonction la conception de l’interface utilisateur de la prochaine version web de notre application, Genius Manufacturing . La personne sélectionnée devra analyser l’expérience client actuelle, proposer des améliorations et présenter des concepts de maquettes (mockup). Elle devra également accompagner l’équipe de développement informatique tout au long du projet.Les tâches et responsabilités : Effectuer une analyse et une prise de besoins (clients et experts internes)Étudier et analyser les produits et tendances sur le marchéÉtablir des plans et concepts afin de les présenter au comité responsableDévelopper et documenter les outils qui seront utilisés à l’interneOffrir de formation et coaching à notre équipeConnaissances et profil recherchés : Expérience en design d’application web spécialiséeExpérience UX / UI3 à 5 années d’expérience pertinentesMaitrise des logiciels de maquettes (mockup)Niveau avancé de maitrise de la langue anglaise (parlé et écrit)Aimer travailler en mode agileConnaissance de logiciel de type ERP serait un atout importantConditions de travail : Une super équipeUn salaire compétitifUn horaire de travail flexibleVacances + 5 congés payés par annéeDes assurances collectivesDes activités socialesEt bien plus...Lieu de travail : QuébecMots clés : Web – Migration – Développement – Interface – Utilisateur – Expérience client – Mockup – Besoin – Designer – Amélioration – Analyse – ERP – Application – Logiciel – Navigation – Agile – Ergonomie – Graphique – Normes – Livrables – Architecture – Interaction – Interactivité – Solution – Numérique – Mobile – Utilisateur – Visuel – CréativitéType d'emploi : Temps Plein
Title: Designer UX / UI

Job_Description: Position Overview: The role of the web UX & UI designer & developer is to create the user experience vision and successfully develop, monitor and improve users’ overall experience when they visit our websites. The individual should have the skills and knowledge to create memorable experiences that are true to the brand while balancing seamless interactivity, ease of navigation and conversion.Reporting to the Director, Marketing & Communications, the Web UX& UI Designerwill be the champion of the users’ needs, and create intuitive user experiences and interface designs. The role will be responsible for the end-to-end online construction, maintenance and experience for: TPH.ca, RHGroup.ca, RGStore.ca, TheGlobeRestaurant.ca, the Intranet, and others as required.The UX & UI Designer will create wireframes and storyboards that map the customer journey, user flows, process flows, information architecture, site maps, porotypes and A/B testing to effectively communicate interaction and design ideas & design each screen or page with which a user interacts.The ideal candidate should have an eye for clean design, possess superior UI & UX skills and be able to translate stakeholder requirements into logical interaction flows and a user interface that is intuitive, visually stimulating and converts.Responsibilities: Be guided by human-centric design by identifying user needs, and leveraging those insights to guide you through the design and testing processesUnderstand the research methods and approaches to recognize and deconstruct the expectation of our usersEstablish design best practices and guidelines through creation of conceptual campaigns and design of a great visual identity and cohesive style-guide ensuring that a consistent design language is applied across sites incorporating logo, corporate colours, typographic rules, etc.Maintaining consistency in visual elements and defining behaviorCreate website that are designed and optimized for all screen sizes (including mobile, tablet, and desktop) with a mobile-first mentality, with specific technologies and platforms in mindLead conversations to facilitate conceptual thinking that takes stakeholder considerations into the processCreate clickable prototypes in Testing of websites and that effortlessly lets the users accomplish their goalsOther duties and responsibilities as assignedQualifications: 3-5 years of proven web designer experienceDemonstrable UI & UX design skills with a strong portfolioSolid experience in creating wireframes and storyboards, user flows, process flows, information architecture, site maps, prototypes and A/B testing to effectively communicate interaction and design ideas & design each screen or page with which a user interactsExperience working with a .Net CMS and e-commerce, knowledge of DotNetNuke (DNN) is preferredProficiency in Creative Design Software (specifically Photoshop, Illustrator, and other visual design and wire-framing tools)Proficiency in: HTML, CSS, JavaScript and JQuery, Media Queries/Bootstrap, Version Control (SVN)Explore various usability testing methods to help inform and optimize designs to create more effective experiencesUnderstand on-page, off-page and technical SEO practices and how to best implement these strategies on the websitesImplement Google Analytics, Tag Manager and Optimize to apply fundamental concepts like performance measurement, comparison and optimization.Experience providing feedback on designer performance, and identifying improvement opportunitiesAbility to present your designs and sell your solutions to various stakeholdersAbility to solve problems creatively and effectivelyUp-to-date with the latest UI trends, techniques, and technologiesExperience working in an Agile/Scrum development processExcellent communication skills and the ability to multi-task, and work well under pressure while juggling several competing prioritiesJob Type: Full-timeExperience:.Net: 1 yearAdobe Creative Suite: 1 yearWeb Design: 3 yearsLocation:Toronto, ON
Title: Web UX & UI Designer

Job_Description: Join Windsor's most innovative, fun and Silicon-Valley-esque development and innovation company, bringing world-class projects to Windsor. Help us build exciting technology like multiplayer game servers for Atari, social apps for Puma, high profile analytics engines for The PGA Tour, and cutting edge products like natural-language-processing chat-bots.As one of Windsor's most sought-after companies to work for, we offer flexible time, work-at-home days, a great benefits plan and in-office massage. We are located in the heart of Windsor's historic Walkerville. You must be willing to work in our office. We are not interested in off-shore or remote work.We are seeking talented interface designers who are looking to grow professionally and personally within a fast-growing company. You will work on a variety of marketing deliverables, including websites, prototypes, wireframes, business collateral and other design pieces.ResponsibilitiesWork on the design of user interfaces for web and mobile projectsAble to help with wireframing using tools like Adobe XD and BalsamiqAble to self-direct and work independently, to manage multiple, concurrent projects simultaneously from start to finishRequirements: Expertise in Adobe Creative Suite: Illustrator, Photoshop, InDesign, After Effects, EdgeKnowledge of responsive web designAbility to create interactive prototypesCustomer-obsessed, detail-oriented and comfortable working on highly technical teamsDemonstrated experience with building user interfaces across a range of platforms including desktop and mobile--- Please send examples of your design portfolio (specifically web design) when you apply. ---We look forward to meeting you!Job Type: Full-timeEducation:High school or equivalentLocation:Windsor, ON
Title: Web Designer / UI / UX

Job_Description: Nous valorisons la diversité et avons à cœur de créer un milieu de travail inclusif qui nous inspire tous à donner le meilleur de nous-mêmes. Joignez-vous à notre équipe et faites une différence!  Votre poste  Nous Comment imaginez-vous les bureaux d’une compagnie d’assurance? Et l’atmosphère de travail qui y règne? Nous gageons que si vous passez nous voir au Lab de Intact, vous serez très surpris! Situé au centre-ville de Montréal, nous sommes un laboratoire d’innovation dont la mission est de créer des produits à la fine-pointe de l’insurtech qui améliorent la vie de millions de Canadiens.  Mariant la convivialité et la vélocité d’une startup aux ressources et aux moyens d’une grande entreprise (vous disposerez de tous les outils dont vous avez toujours rêvé!), le Lab est un environnement jeune et dynamique, offrant des défis stimulants, des collègues inspirants et une carrière passionnante (chez un des top 100 employeurs au Canada). C’est l’endroit idéal pour parfaire vos compétences et faire évoluer votre carrière.  Vous Vous êtes passionné par le commerce électronique et l’innovation numérique? Vous avez un talent particulier pour traduire des exigences complexes en expériences utiles et agréables? Vous restez à l’affût des dernières tendances en matière de design et vous aimez expérimenter de nouveaux outils et de nouvelles méthodologies? Nous avons l’occasion parfaite pour vous!  Rôle À titre de designer UX/UI, vous jouerez un rôle essentiel dans la conception et l’évolution de notre écosystème numérique. Relevant du directeur principal, Innovations numériques, vous aurez comme principales responsabilités :  Concevoir des expériences captivantes en vue de réaliser les objectifs d’affaires  Valider la fonctionnalité et l’utilité par l’entremise de tests et de recherches auprès des utilisateurs  Produire des livrables UX et design pertinents au besoin  Piloter une feuille de route aux côté d’un directeur de produit et d’une équipe agile multidisciplinaire  Présenter le travail aux parties prenantes  Aider les ingénieurs à produire des interfaces de qualité et agréables  Prôner une conception axée sur l’utilisateur et les données  Vos compétences  Minimum trois années d’expérience  Expertise en matière de convivialité et de pratiques de conception centrées sur l'utilisateur  Maîtrise des outils de conception (Sketch, Axure, InVision, Illustrator, etc.)  Expérience des outils de recherche UX (usertesting.com, Optimal Workshop, etc.) un atout  Expérience dans la production de flux de processus, d’inventaires de contenu, etc.  Vous aimez travailler dans un environnement de collaboration qui accorde une importance primordiale au travail d’équipe, à l’innovation, à l’ouverture d’esprit et au plaisir  Veuillez inclure votre portfolio dans votre dossier de candidature.  Vous êtes  Une personne avec qui il est agréable de travailler  Créatif, analytique, curieux et ingénieux  Un joueur d’équipe capable de partager et recevoir des commentaires constructifs  Excellent pour expliquer vos idées à différents intervenants  Profondément passionné par le design et la qualité  Organisé et proactif  En tant que salarié temps plein, vous bénéficierez des avantages suivants :  Un salaire compétitif  Un boni de performance annuel  Un régime de retraite  Un horaire de travail flexible de 35 heures par semaine  Des assurances médicales et dentaires hors pair  Et plusieurs autres avantages et bénéfices (remboursement gym, conférences, etc.)  Énoncé fermeture  Cette opportunité vous intéresse? Nous avons très hâte de faire votre connaissance!  D’excellents avantages sont offerts : salaire concurrentiel, avantages flexibles, aménagements de travail flexibles, congés mobiles, régime de retraite à prestation déterminée, etc.  Dans le cadre du processus de sélection d’Intact, les candidats peuvent être appelés à donner leur consentement à une vérification de leurs antécédents pertinente au poste à pourvoir avant de recevoir une offre d’emploi. Celle-ci peut comprendre une confirmation des références d’emploi, des études et des titres de compétences, une vérification des emplois, de l’identité, des infractions criminelles et du permis de conduire ainsi qu’un rapport de crédit.  Vous pouvez soumettre votre candidature à un emploi affiché pourvu que vous occupiez vos fonctions actuelles depuis au moins douze mois et que votre performance soit jugée bonne ou que votre contrat temporaire arrive à son échéance. Une recherche de talents à l'externe est menée parallèlement au recrutement à l'interne Veuillez donc prendre note que des candidats potentiels pourraient avoir été identifiés pour ce poste dans le cadre de leur plan de développement. Prime de recommandation  CE POSTE EST SUJET À UNE PRIME DE RECOMMANDATION DE 3000$.  #li-qc  Droit de travailler au Canada  Les personnes qui posent leur candidature à un poste permanent doivent, dès leur embauche, avoir le droit de travailler au Canada de façon permanente. Les documents pouvant servir de preuve dans le cas des rôles permanents sont un certificat de naissance canadien, un passeport canadien, un certificat de citoyenneté canadienne, une carte de résident permanent ou une confirmation de son statut de résident permanent pour prouver qu’il a le droit de travailler au Canada.
