Title: Designer UX/UI

Job_Description: The Opportunity  The Product Owner in charge of cross product integration leads the Product Team in charge of the design, development and delivery of new member facing tools (products) that will enhance the experience of Aeroplan members and improve the profitability of the business. The Product Owner will be responsible for implementing transformational products and practices as part of Aeroplan’s reinvention. Working in an agile environment, the product owner will develop new solutions related to both web and mobile app products.  Roles and responsibilities Identify, evaluate and lead the product development efforts for different sections of the aeroplan web and mobile app products. Evaluate market trends and competitive landscape analyses to support the development new products. Evaluate internal and external requests for improvements to Aeroplan’s digital products (web and mobile). Clearly articulate and communicate the product vision to stakeholders at every levels of the organization. Identify and implement new products to drive innovation and support Aeroplan’s transformation. Understand agile product development methodologies to foster continuous improvements on the product set. Drive innovation by being the business lead and product owner of the new consumer products working closely with the UX/UI designer and Tech leads to test and execute new products and strategies. Establish and deliver product-specific KPI’s. Drive cross-functional collaboration by leading a product team and collaborating with key internal and external stakeholders (marketing, operations, analytics, technology teams, IT suppliers, legal, etc.) to define the product development strategies, develop the new value proposition and ensure compliance with business plan objectives and KPIs. Work closely with various product teams to develop and implement best in class products and member offerings. Implement transformational organizational policies and innovations.  Qualifications Minimum 5 years’ experience in product management with at least 2 years in product ownership. Superior communication skills/ability to convey ideas at different levels of the organization Experience in working on best in class digital platforms (Web/Mobile app) Proven track record of innovation and transformation. Bachelor’s degree in marketing, engineering or related field required. Experience working in an agile setting for product development and management required Strong ability to analyze primary and secondary data, translate results into marketing strategies Superior organizational and time management skills; ability to manage long term projects Ability to influence others with strong interpersonal and relationship management skills Strong leadership and results-oriented Ability to multi-task and work on several initiatives at one time, in a fast moving and evolving business Keen sense and awareness of latest trends and best practices Bilingual (English/French) an asset
Title: Product Owner

Job_Description: Product Manager Montreal, QC The Challenge  Now that Over-the-Top and TV Everywhere apps are dominating the market, vying for consumer attention has never been more challenging. To stand out from the competition and to effectively build stronger relationships with today’s consumers, network operators and other premium content providers must invest in future-proofed solutions that place the right content, in front of the right consumer in a way that exceeds their expectations time and time again.  As LVL’s Product Manager, you will oversee the long and short-term evolution of the E2 Platform – our innovative solution that facilitates the rapid development and deployment of multiplatform OTT and TVE apps, and that leverages Unity® to target smart TVs, smartphones and gaming consoles. The Team  LVL’s Product Manager interacts with all of our product stakeholders! Reporting directly to the CTO, not only will you work closely with LVL’s product team of 20+ software developers, you will also work with our management, sales and design departments. The Role  Working with the CTO and product team, you will be responsible for overall product direction all the while ensuring that the product roadmap is defined and adjusted as necessary, and maintained across all ranks.  General responsibilities include:  Conduct competitive analysis of LVL competitors for product area responsibility Conduct market and industry trend analysis Identify potential business partners Participate in product pricing discussions Act as our product team’s Scrum Master More specifically, our Product Manager will be tasked with managing LVL’s product suite. As such, you will…  Gage and meet internal stakeholder expectations Gage and meet LVL client expectations Define business and technical requirements, and adjust the product roadmap accordingly Define new features to address competitive threats and market trends Write and groom product backlogs Assist in product sprint estimations to ensure developers understand what features to develop Guide developers and designers to ensure features meet acceptance criteria Define and track KPIs for new product features Ensure that product features are instrumented for KPI analysis The Profile  In addition to your exceptional collaborative and analytical skills, you are a hands-on type of person that is self-motivated and results-oriented. You also have either an MBA, a Master’s or a Bachelor’s Degree in Software Engineering or Computer Science. Additional profile requirements include:  5+ years of experience working for a product-oriented company Great verbal and written communication skills (in English) Strong analytical skills Strong cross-team collaboration skills Experience in cloud-based SAAS business environments Familiarity with Agile/Scrum development cycles A proven track record of delivering high-quality software on time Digital marketing knowledge Experience working with UX and UI design teams Experience in mobile application development Familiarity with A/B web testing tools An understanding of product instrumentation / analytics tools Mastery of service-oriented architecture, object-oriented design, functional programming and unity testing in a test-driven environment The ability to work in a fast-paced Agile environment The Nice-To-Haves  An innate ability to drive development teams to deliver engaging products A keen interest in product optimization and A/B testing Sound Like You? Apply Now!  If you are creative, motivated and have a genuine interest in contributing to the advancement of media and entertainment technology, you could be the perfect fit!  If you’re interested in this position but do not meet all of the requirements, we’d still love to hear from you. In addition to your résumé, make sure to send us a letter detailing why you think you’d excel in this position to careers@lvlstudio.com.  Also, be sure to check out our open-source libraries and follow us on LinkedIn and Facebook to stay up to date on any new LVL job opportunities.  Why Join LVL Studio?  Located in Montreal’s vibrant AI hub, LVL prides itself on fostering a friendly and dynamic working environment where innovation is at the heart of everything we do.  Join LVL and find your place within our team of expert strategists, designers and software engineers who provide major media and entertainment companies with the tools required to better reach, engage and retain audiences. From powerful entertainment platforms to leading products and services, our solutions make their way into the hands of millions of people, allowing our clients to refine the content discovery and consumption experiences they offer based on consumer trends and needs.  Did we mention that LVL offers a competitive benefits package, a base vacation bank starting at three weeks per year as well as flexible working hours? Check out our portfolio Apply to careers@lvlstudio.com
Title: Product Manager

Job_Description: David Aplin Group, one of Canada's Best Managed Companies, has partnered with our client to recruit a User Experience (UX) Design Lead based in Edmonton, AB.  Our client, a large scale e-commerce business and four-time PROFIT 500 ranked organization, is currently expanding and looking to recruit a UX Design Lead in Edmonton, Alberta. Working with the Marketing team, you will be responsible for managing projects and leading the design team in delivering an excellent user experience for the products and websites. You will have flexible work hours, Excellent compensation, excellent health and dental benefits, access to continuous learning opportunities and more! Join one of the fastest growing companies in Canada!  Primary Responsibilities   Lead a team of designers working to create simple, beautiful user experiences for all screen types Collaborate with Marketing, Product and Legal team members to define design objectives Champion design team initiatives such as the creation of design guidelines, asset libraries, process improvements and tools Prioritize projects, set schedules and assign resources Mentor team members to develop a high-performance culture Deliver user-focused design best practices to improve key performance indicators Create wireframes, storyboards and prototypes, then turn them into fully-realized mockups Manage, document and analyze requirements to translate business needs into an engaging user experience Work with the Development department to create specs and efficient implementation plans  Knowledge and Skill Requirements   Post-secondary education in a Design related program 5+ years of experience in a User Experience (UX) Designer, User Interface (UI) Designer, Web Designer or Graphic Designer role Previous management experience would be an asset Impressive design portfolio showcasing UI/UX design for a variety of screen types Familiarity with the following UX disciplines: interaction design, information architecture, user research, storyboarding, wireframe creation, concept design and prototyping Extensive, up-to-date knowledge of web design best practices Proficiency with Adobe Creative Suite  If you are interested in this position and meet the above criteria, please click the Apply button to send your resume in confidence directly to Suzanne Gosse, Consultant, Aplin Sales & Marketing. Visit our website at www.aplin.com to view our job opportunities, career tips and tools. We thank all applicants; however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.  WE APPRECIATE YOUR INTEREST IN DAVID APLIN GROUP.  If this is your first introduction to us, we invite you to become one of our satisfied candidates. David Aplin Group has been Canadian owned since 1975. Our professional consultants are passionate about helping you find a fulfilling job or career and ensuring your complete satisfaction with our process. Our proven track record, nearly four decades long, is largely due to our team of highly skilled and successful specialists. Through superior service and a commitment to long-term relationships, we provide deep specialization in core areas for complete recruiting and HR solutions across Canada - all from one source. We look forward to exceeding your expectations!  Learn more about David Aplin Group and view all of our current job opportunities, career tips, and tools at www.aplin.com.
Title: User Experience (UX) Design Lead

Job_Description: About Us: Stellar Labs is redefining the world of private aviation, a $30B+ industry in dire need of new, cutting-edge technology, full of fleet operators striving for a better way to run their businesses and highly-discerning customers looking for a better travel experience. Our products and people are what will make this exciting transformation possible. Powered by an all cloud infrastructure, we connect the business aviation industry on the ground and in the sky. Our integrated platform delivers the first real-time sourcing, pricing, booking, payment, and analytics solutions to enable the world’s most demanding jet operators and air travelers.  Responsibilities: Our Front-End Engineers work closely with designers, product managers and backend teams to build the user experiences of our enterprise and consumer web applications. They utilize state-of-the-art web technologies to ensure our products look and work great on all screen sizes, are intuitive and easy to use. We are looking for an experienced developer to join our Front-End development team.   Collaborate with Product, Design and Backend teams to create responsive performance web applications Develop and maintain UI Component Library Collaborate and help drive utilization of RESTful backend services Participate in scrum ceremonies such as backlog grooming, sprint planning, sprint review and retrospectives Participate in full-stack scrum teams (FE, BE, Product Owners, QA) to deliver working software frequently Create and maintain FE unit tests  Who We're Looking For:  Experienced Angular 4+ Front-End Web Developer who is passionate in combining the art of design with the art of programming. Responsibilities will include translation of the UI/UX design wireframes to actual code that will produce visual elements of the application. You will work with the UI/UX designer and bridge the gap between graphical design and technical implementation, taking an active role on both sides and defining how the application looks as well as how it works. Someone who is motivated and highly productive in creating working software Someone who can contribute to discussions but will respect and fully support decisions made by the team Someone who will help others and also knows when to ask for help in order to meet the team's sprint goals  Your Background:  Experience developing with Angular 4+ (highly preferred) or Angular 2 framework Experience with TypeScript 3+ years of experience with JavaScript, HTML5, and CSS3 skills. BS in Computer Science or equivalent Data visualization experience using D3.js, SVG, Canvas, etc. Experience with modular, component based UI development (Web Components) Knowledge of native DOM and Event API's Knowledge of browser quirks and their remedies Experience building front-end code with server-side technology Familiarity and comfort with command-line applications, source control, testing frameworks and other aspects of developing in large, distributed software teams Familiarity with HATEOS and HAL concepts Knowledge of (and a passion for) current trends and best practices in front-end architecture, including performance, accessibility, security and usability Knowledge of browser internals like Javascript engines and ways to tune code for best performance  Bonus Points for:  Experience with Flux, Redux, and/or RxJS Backend Java Serverside experience or exposure (e.g. SpringBoot)  Perks:  Flexible vacation policy Competitive salary & equity based on experience Comprehensive health, dental, and vision coverage Life and AD&D; insurance EAP Snacks, Drinks and Lunches* Company Social Events Get in on the ground floor of a highly-collaborative, rapidly growing start-up disrupting the aviation industry  Note: Currently we offer in-office lunches 3 times a week. All perks are subject to change in company discretion
Title: Front End Engineer - Angular 4+

Job_Description: A leader and pioneer in the medical space is looking to take on a Senior UX/UI Designer to join their team. They do not have an extensive design team so they are really looking for someone who can build UX frameworks from scratch, building UI prototypes, selecting prototyping tools and implementing feedback process.  This is would be a 9-month contract with the possibility of extension and their office is located in the North York/Markham area.  Required Skills & Experience  5+ years of hands on design experience on web, mobile, and desktop applications  Prior experience working at a medical device company  Experience working with prototyping and workflow tools like InVision, Sketch, Adobe XD, Sketch  Excellent attention to detail  Science or Engineering degree in Biology, Chemistry, or Physics  Desired Skills & Experience  Prior experience in an Agile environment  Software development background  Understanding of various research and design techniques  Excellent written and verbal skills  What You Will Be Doing  Tech Breakdown  50% Design  50% Strategy  Daily Responsibilities  80% Hands On  20% Team Collaboration  The Offer  Competitive Pay: Up to $65/hour, DOE  Contract Duration: 9 Months with potential to extend  You will receive the following benefits: Statutory Vacation  Holiday Pay  Applicants must be currently authorized to work in Canada on a full-time basis now and in the future.  This position does not offer sponsorship.  Jobspring Partners, part of the Motion Recruitment network, provides IT Staffing Solutions (Contract, Contract-to-Hire, and Direct Hire) across 10 major North American markets. Our unique expertise in today’s highest demand tech skill sets, paired with our deep networks and knowledge of our local technology markets, results in an exemplary track record with candidates and clients.
Title: Senior UX/UI Designer

Job_Description: Looking to be a part of something disruptive? Interested in changing the status quo in an industry that has been reluctant to change until now? We are currently looking for a Senior UX/UI Designer to come and join our team that is shaking up the way things are done in our industry!  Job Summary? The UX/UI Designer is a senior level role within the Business Architecture group and responsible for defining all user experience and human factor designs which align to Product strategy and roadmap. The individual is expected to collaborate with internal subject matter experts, and engineering teams to create solutions that will enhance our clients' ability to provide industry leading care and comply with regulations. The designer had direct interaction with multiple department stakeholders. Responsibilities? Develop and oversee the UX/UI domain practice within the Business Architecture group? Be passionate about all things UX and other areas of design and innovation. Research and showcase knowledge in the industry's latest trends and technologies? Drive the overall UX and human factor strategies for the company in alignment with Product solution channels including Web, Mobile, and other future paradigms? Translate concepts into user flows, wireframes, mockups and prototypes that lead to intuitive user experiences that are measured and tied to key Product KPIs? Using high and low fidelity design tools, deliver the appropriate interface designs including prototypes, mockups, wireframes, user stories, user journeys, optimized for a wide range of devices and interfaces supporting the CareLogic user persona and configurations? Make strategic design and user-experience decisions related to core, and forthcoming functions and features that maintain a consistent user interface across all product offerings? Take a user-centered design approach and rapidly test and iterate the design solutions. Drive and participate in usability testing across the Business portfolio? Collaborate with other team members and department stakeholders including Business Analysis, Product, UI Engineering, and Client Support.? ?Qualifications? ?BA/BS degree in Design (e.g. interaction, graphic, visual communications, product, industrial), HumanComputer Interaction (HCI), Computer Science (CS), or a related field, or equivalent practical experience? 3 years of UX design work experience in a related field and industries? Demonstrated experience with high fidelity UX software such as iRise, InVision, Axure, Sketch, Balsamiq, Framer to develop usable interfaces for Mobile first, and Web based products? Demonstrated HTML knowledge, up to HTML5? Strong clean visual design sense with the ability to work with clients to understand detailed requirements and design complete user experiences that meet client needs and vision? Hands-on experience in using UX design best practices to design solutions, and a deep understanding of mobile-first and responsive design solutions? A solid grasp of user-centered design (UCD), planning and conducting user research, user testing, A/B testing, rapid prototyping, heuristic analysis, usability and accessibility concerns? Ability to iterate designs and solutions efficiently and intelligently.? Ability to clearly and effectively communicate design processes, ideas, and solutions to teams and clients? A clear understanding of the importance of user-centered design and design thinking? Ability to work effectively in a team setting including synthesizing abstract ideas into concrete design implications? ?Excellent leadership, communication and teamwork skills? Be excited about collaborating and communicating closely with teams and other stakeholders via a distributed model, to regularly deliver design solutions for approval? Be open to receiving feedback and constructive criticism? Good to have:? ?Basic HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript skills are a plus for rapid prototyping?
Title: Senior UX/UI Designer (Start-up)

Job_Description: Are you looking for an opportunity to accelerate your career and work with a team of friendly, creative people? Upland Software offers a collaborative work environment full of smart, positive, and passionate people who are respected for their unique talents and empowered to do their jobs well. As a member of this close-knit team, you are encouraged to take good ideas and run with them, pursuing the best outcome for our customers while having fun along the way. If these things are important to you and you're driven by delighting customers, we want to talk with you!  Opportunity Summary: The Product Manager is internally and externally recognized as an expert. Has broad and detailed domain knowledge, functional and/or technical understanding of the product’s capabilities and those of our competitors. Drives the direction of the product by interacting with internal teams as well as customers to prioritize areas of investment to maximize return and stakeholder satisfaction. Primary Responsibilities: Conduct market research to identify trends and patterns in the PPM, Supply Chain and Financial IT software industries. Assess product strengths in comparison to competitor products and provide recommendations on product direction based on assessment. Define market strategies and roadmaps to satisfy market requirements and internal objectives. Collaborate with other Product Managers within the Upland Software product lines for cross-product initiatives and market strategies. Coordinate and perform the full SDLC such as kickoff, business analysis, requirements elicitation, design, UAT and release activities ensuring compliance with Upland Software’s methodology Work in an agile environment using scrum framework and acting as a product owner Gather business and technical requirements from internal and external clients. Define and prioritize product backlog in user stories based on elicited requirements. Conduct release and sprint planning for software development iterations. Collaborate on product design with UI/UX designers. Collaborate with development team during iteration cycles, including but not limited to requirement clarifications, test plan and test case review, desk checks and feature approval Provide regular project status and schedule updates. Provide product information and material for use by marketing and sales, training, deployment and consulting departments. Host internal and external presentations to inform stakeholders of upcoming features Requirements: 5+ years’ experience working in software industry Experience as a Business Analyst / Product Owner / Product Manager working in web or mobile applications Experience with developing Cloud based software an asset. Strong analytical skills to understand business requirements and to capture, analyze and document detailed requirements. Experience within the Project and Portfolio management (PPM), Supply Chain or IT & Financial management industries are assets Ability to work with diverse resource groups to get consensus on defining features Ability to assess opportunity cost and trade-offs when developing product strategies Experience working in an agile framework Experience with the Atlassian product suite (Jira, Confluence, etc) or similar software an asset Effective communication skills; listening, written and verbal; ability to communicate complex concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders Ability to work autonomously and balance multiple priorities Ability to work in a collaborative team environment to solve business problems  About Upland Upland Software (Nasdaq: UPLD) is an enterprise cloud software company that provides award-winning solutions in Project and IT Management, Workflow Automation and Digital Engagement. Our goal is 100% customer success, achieved through a unified operating platform that delivers the performance, scalability and support that over 2,500 Upland customers worldwide demand every day. We offer a casual and collaborative work environment, a generous benefits package and significant growth opportunities. Upland is publicly traded software company based in Austin, TX with offices in the US, Canada and the UK.
Title: Product Manager

Job_Description: Define the vision and strategy for multiple software products, develop positioning and strategic roadmap that outlines expend existing markets and enhance user acquisition Work with product management team and marketing team to establish product feature set definitions, scope of project and work, timeline and version planning Work closely with smart developers and engineers oversea to deliver features that grow app functionalities Collaborate with designers to integrate product UX/UI Demonstrate ownership of both desktop software and mobile app products, stay ahead of industry updates, be aware of new enhancements to existing applications and competing solutions Coordinates with individuals in other department as needed for quality testing, reviews and associated materials Eager to obtain marketing knowledge and skills to grow into product marketing specialty Experience with UUID, internal marketing platform building or business data analysis products highly preferred; 5+ years' progressive experience in product management, B2C desktop software and mobile app technology industry preferred; Keen eye for product feature design and sensitive to user retention; Passionate about video editing, photography or YouTube community engagement; Able to adapt to fast-pace work environment; Strong communication skills, able to present complex workflow and collaborate with multiple teams oversea.
Title: Product Manager

Job_Description: About Us: Clearbridge Mobile is an award-winning full stack mobile application development studio. We understand what it takes to build apps that provide the best user experience. With our skilled team of product owners, UX, UI designers and engineers, we’ve built end-to-end custom mobile applications for an extensive list of premium clients.  The Position: You will need to understand the product from the customer perspective and steer the team towards achieving that vision. You will act as the bridge between the partner and the team, you carry the responsibility of ensuring that the deliverables are in-scope and of high quality with a focus on customer satisfaction. You are an excellent communicator and have the ability to collaborate with a cross functional team of developers, designers and quality assurance. You are an agile expert, well versed in the agile sprint-based methodology.  Product Design  Lead product design sprints in order to derive the best features for our client’s mobile product.  Research competitor landscape in order to assist clients to develop a great product strategy.  Work with UX Design to create great user flow and experience within mobile app.  Negotiate between development team and client to deliver as many high value features as possible within given timeframe  Product Development  Create user stories that are clear and follow the INVEST principles  Lead sprint grooming sessions with client and development teams  Research competitor landscape and client industry in order to assist clients build and maintain short and long term product roadmap.  Product Delivery  Assess product success by analyzing metrics and data  What we’re looking for: Service-oriented personality  Ability to work well with others  Ability to influence others internally and externally  Ability to problem solve  Good understanding of mobile application development process  Great understanding of UX Design for mobile products  Ability to translate data into meaningful information  Ability to communicate effectively  Ability to research and gain domain/industry knowledge  Nice-to Have  Ability to identify sales opportunities  What makes us so great?  The Career Directory 2017 selected us as one of Canada's Best Employers which says it all, but if you need more convincing, we offer:  Competitive salary with benefits  Frequently catered breakfast and lunch  All the delicious snacks and drinks you can consume  A games lounge that features a variety of fun activities, such as video games, ping pong, foosball, etc.  Team events such as knife throwing, laser tag, escape rooms, and more  Conveniently located in Toronto and/or Vaughan  And the best perk of all, working with a rockstar team!  Who are we?  We’re a young company and have formed great connections both internally and externally – together; this creates a culture of both teamwork and fun. Why is our culture so important to us? Because work and life intersect and we believe it’s important to be happy and healthy in both! And we’re not going to sugar coat it – sometimes we work long hours. But we also work hard to make sure you get downtime.  Conveniently located right off Highway 400 and only 15 minutes from Yorkdale, Clearbridge Mobile offers a collaborative, team-oriented environment where your contributions will make a huge impact. Enter the Clearbridge world, and you won’t look back! Yes, we rhymed that on purpose.  To further the convenience of our staff, we will be opening a second office in Downtown Toronto shortly.  It’s our mission to build to not only hire but to retain the best team.  Clearbridge Mobile welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. We thank all those interested, however only only shortlisted candidates will be contacted for further discussion.  To learn more about us, check us out on LinkedIn or Facebook , and make sure to read our reviews on Glassdoor !
Title: Mobile Product Owner

Job_Description: Kabam is looking for a Lead Designer to lead the charge on an exciting new project. A natural leader, you’re ambitious yet humble and eager to work with a collaborative and diverse group across multiple sites. You’re not afraid to get hands-on in inspiring a team towards that see the world of gaming as so much more than a hobby.  Elevating our design team as whole, you’ll bring in new ideas, iterate among colleagues and collaborate with interdisciplinary teams to innovate and iterate player-focused design.  As a Lead Designer, you will:  Work interdisciplinary among two sites to lead the charge on a new project for Kabam Mentor and grow a team of curious and highly skilled game designers, advocating for growth, ownership and self-leadership Collaborate with an extremely talented team of Engineers, UI/UX artists, Data Scientists, QA and LiveOps to create addictive, compelling player experiences that will delight users for years Provide input on the game’s vision and help champion that vision to other team members Design rules and parameters for features and systems Design, implement, tune, and balance game systems, economies, and progression Create design docs, drawings, diagrams, flowcharts, and any other necessary documents to communicate design functionality and vision Build free-to-play mobile games that the world loves to play At Kabam, we’re constantly raising the bar of excellence in free-to-play mobile gaming. We hire for passion and diversity so that together as a team we can triumph in our collective skill. Our teams are made up of a fusion of personalities and interests bound together by a collaborative nature, fun-loving culture and drive to do what it takes to make great games. And this is where you come in…  Your background includes:  5+ years of game design and production experience on commercially successful properties Experience leading a game team, preferably across multiple sites An inherent desire to solve exciting and challenging problems Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience with an emphasis on game design, economics, math, or psychology Ultimate problem solving, critical thinking, logical, and analytical skills Spreadsheet wizardry Deep familiarity with RPG, BCG, and action genres on mobile, PC, console, and pen-and-paper platforms Interested? Tell us what you’re looking for - in your application, tell what games have influenced you?  Apply now and start the conversation with us. Together, we can create some of the best games ever made.
Title: Lead Game Designer

Job_Description: Opening: Technical Product Owner  Who we are  DeepLearni.ng is a technology company transforming the way enterprises work with AI around the world. Based in Toronto, we work with enterprise leaders to collaboratively build and deploy customized AI systems that solve real business problems. DeepLearni.ng’s creation of enterprise AI systems is powered by our end-to-end platform Frontiers, designed to optimize team collaboration on enterprise AI systems.  We are also an active player in the AI community, and have partnerships with industry leaders including NVIDIA, the Vector Institute and Amazon Web Services. In 2017, we were named AI Company of the Year by the DFI Institute and received Series A funding.  A few examples of our work: Reinforcement learning for the credit risk areas of retail banking Image classification for insurance adjudication and claims processing Self-optimizing environmental controls for vertical farming Machine vision for robot warehouse navigation  What is the opportunity?  We are looking for a Technical Product Owner who is passionate about driving product management activities in all facets of the product life-cycle while working closely with the development team in a fast-paced Agile environment. Prior hands-on experience in software product development as a hands-on Software Engineer or Developer is required to be successful in this role.  Working with a diverse range of technologies and clients across industry verticals, you will have the opportunity to become a leading expert in delivering transformative machine learning solutions to industry designed for real-world results. As part of a vibrant and growing team, you will be at the frontier of the AI revolution.  What will you do?  Translate pieces of functionality that are prioritized in the product roadmap into fully fleshed out features Identify comprehensive lists of use cases and define acceptance criteria to support iterative releases Translate user needs into story details and acceptance criteria Facilitate two-way communication between the engineering and product teams Work with the engineering team to understand technical complexities, dependencies, and costs of proposed solutions Work with designers on integrating feature enhancements and new features eloquently into the UI Conduct user acceptance testing to ensure that the product meets and maintains an exceptional user experience Document new features for implementation and write release notes Attend scrum and sprint meetings including standups, retrospectives, and demos to give feedback on sprint achievement to the larger team, as well as to the scrum team Participate in customer-facing demos and gather customer feedback Conduct primary and secondary research to identify user needs and pain-points Conduct market research to use as input into the product strategy  What do you need to succeed?  Must have: 3+ years of hands-on experience as a Software Engineer or Developer in addition to 1+ years of experience as a Product Owner/Product Manager/Scrum master, OR 5+ years of hands-on experience as a Software Engineer or Developer in pursuit of a transition into a Product Management role An Engineering, Computer Science, Physics, Math, or other quantitative degree Full-stack web development and REST API experience, combined with a strong appreciation for UI/UX design and empathy for different users’ needs and concerns Understanding of data science, data engineering, distributed computing, or big data technologies such as Hadoop, Spark, Flink, Kafka, etc. Experience with any of the following languages and technologies: Python, R, Scala, Ruby, Javascript, SQL, AWS/Azure/Google cloud infrastructure, Kubernetes, NumPy, NoSQL databases (Cassandra, MongoDB), Docker, Puppet, Chef, Ansible  Strong technical knowledge in systems design, architecture, and information security  Experience producing high quality technical documentation Strong problem-solving and analytical abilities to dissect problems and projects into manageable tasks and assess trade-offs Experience working with Agile and Scrum development processes throughout the SDLC Proficient with JIRA, VersionOne, or similar agile management tools Understanding of Version Control, Continuous Integration, and Continuous Deployment concepts and tools Ability to work on a diverse team or with a diverse range of people, and in a rapidly changing multi-disciplinary work environment  Nice to have: Familiarity with AI, machine learning, deep learning, and related tools such as Tensorflow, Keras, PyTorch, MXNet, Scikit-learn, etc. Experience with data-related products and/or projects and knowledge in statistics, data modeling, big data, data science, and/or data analytics tools Experience working in one or more of the following sectors: banking, insurance, telecommunications  What’s in it for you?  Work with purpose: contribute to deploying machine learning models that drive real business impact across industry verticals Opportunity to work with leading machine learning experts on cutting-edge problems Opportunities to develop relationships with a variety of industry decision-makers, subject-matter experts, software developers, and machine learning specialists  Split time between your work duties and pursuing personal machine learning passion projects with mentoring from our machine learning experts Participate in feats of strength and lively company events that build your career toolkit while also enjoying a work-life balance  Enjoy a comfortable company work environment located in downtown Toronto that encourages self-expression, creativity, honesty, and learning Amazing quality of life benefits: healthy snacks, gym memberships, travel accommodations, great health benefits, and more! Stock options possible after you have proven your impact on the job As needed: sponsorship for work visas  How to apply  We look forward to receiving your application! Please apply directly online by sending your resume and cover letter addressed to the Hiring Manager. Please note that we will be in touch with applicants that make it to the next phase of the interview process directly.  By submitting your CV and application to this role, you authorize DeepLearni.ng to store your information in our internal recruitment database and to reach out to you as necessary for the purpose of further evaluating your qualifications for this or other career opportunities at the company.  We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.
Title: Technical Product Owner

Job_Description: At ThoughtWire, we are on a mission to orchestrate Industrial IoT for a healthier, cleaner and safer world. Using our award-winning Ambiant™ IIoT platform, we are dedicated to making cities smarter, buildings more automated and energy efficient, and workplaces safer, by inter-connecting and orchestrating people, workflows, data and things in real-time.  Who we’re looking for: We are looking for a passionate Project Manager to join our Solutions Delivery team. As a PM, you will collaborate with our world-class teams in the delivery of solutions to improve our customer’s business outcomes. Your solutions will leverage a range of systems, interfaces and connected sensors applying leading-edge IoT patterns.  As a Project Manager you will be in front of our clients in the thick of solution delivery applying our leading edge platform that combines the best of machine intelligence, situational awareness and workflow automation. You will review, analyze and evaluate business systems, processes and user needs. You will be part of agile, design thinking workshops to determine scope and needs for the client solution. Reports to Director of Client Delivery.  What you’ll be doing: With our customers:  Interface with client resources on a daily basis to clarify requirements, negotiate decisions, handle feature issues, provide an escalation point, and to perform project and risk management; Understand customer’s building control systems and contribute to integration strategies; Author the following project artifacts as needed: Project schedule, risk registry, issues list, user stories, features list, training documentation; Lead end-user workshops using agile delivery and design thinking approach; Ensure solution documentation is complete, accurate and up to date; Ensure all resources are aligned to meet scheduled milestones and deployments; Provide post-launch support along with other project team members. With our Development, UI/UX and Test teams:  Contribute to overall solution designs; Translate business and technical requirements into implementable stories for each sprint and manage the project backlog; Participate in story estimation for each sprint during a project; Monitor progress towards completion (burndown); Work with our Test team to ensure test coverage meets solution scope and client usage patterns; Work with the UX/UI designers to ensure customer experience is paramount. What you’ll need:  University degree or equivalent; 2+ years of enterprise project management; Strong consulting skills with a high degree of professionalism; Strong self-management and time management skills in a multi-project environment; Customer focused with a track record of taking initiative and driving projects to completion; Strong data analysis skills is an asset. Bonus points for:  Degree in mechanical or electrical engineering BAS hands-on experience Experience working collaboratively as part of software solution team Understanding of technical concepts is an asset (ie. network, API, database, mobile app, system integration etc) Why you want to work for us:  Great colleagues, mentorship, and meaningful socially impactful work; Competitive salary; Flexible hours; Great office location in Toronto’s Market District, steps from the St Lawrence Market; Short walk to Union Station or King Station; Healthy snacks and free drinks; Full benefits package that includes extended healthcare, dental and vision.  ThoughtWire is an open and inclusive environment that values diversity and invests in the skills and growth of all our team members. ThoughtWire welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available upon request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.  Thank you to all who apply. We are only contacting applicants who are moving on to the next stage of the process. If you don’t hear from us, please check back for any future opportunities!  About ThoughtWire ThoughtWire’s Ambiant™ IIoT platform equips organizations with the capability to become smarter, safer, and more energy efficient by inter-connecting and orchestrating their people, workflows, data and things. Smart cities and buildings, advanced manufacturers and healthcare providers use Ambiant’s platform to achieve intelligent automation and provide real-time guidance to staff so they can predict and resolve issues, ensure safety, achieve energy efficiency and deliver optimal experiences to citizens, patients, customers and tenants. Founded in 2009, and based in Toronto, ThoughtWire earned a Frost & Sullivan Best Practices Award in 2017 and was ranked a Gartner Cool Vendor 2016. Learn more at www.thoughtwire.com.
Title: Project Manager, Smart Building Solutions

Job_Description: Crowdlinker is seeking to hire an enthusiastic and motivated PM with a passion for product management and project management.  This position will suit someone who has experience as a developer or a designer, or anyone who has the soft skills this position needs and has demonstrated their passion for the software industry. You must have some technical proficiency in order to confidently be able to work with and assign work to developers. In addition, you will need natural communication abilities and poise, as you will be the point of contact for the clients whose projects you own and manage.  The ideal candidate has 1-2 years experience working as a product manager or project manager with a design/development agency, however, we are also interested in designers or developers who are looking to transition into product management. Individuals from other disciplines are welcome too, however as stated before you must be able to demonstrate your ability to work with a technical team and communicate technical requirements to a client. Tech entrepreneurs will likely excel in this position and we strongly encourage you to apply.  PM is not a one-fits-all job. Please only apply if you have a passion for the software industry and fit the job description.  Responsibilities  Lead local developers and designer to execute project deliverables.  Organize collective work efforts, creating and allocating stories in Jira, managing backlogs, facilitating scrum and sprint review sessions, and helping the team meet their goals.  Ensure that all projects are delivered on-time, within scope and within budget  Translate product strategy into detailed requirements and prototypes, while also developing project scopes and objectives, involving all relevant stakeholders and ensuring technical feasibility  Foster the relationship with the client. You are their representative within our walls and their point of contact. Know their business, know what they need and collaborate with them to determine product roadmap and strategy  Spearhead client engagement by organizing weekly checkpoint meetings, updating on status/progress, requirements gathering and being the PM they never had.  Create and maintain comprehensive project documentation  Skills And Experience  Technical background, with understanding or hands-on experience in software development and web/app technologies.  Excellent client-facing and internal communication skills.  Outstanding written and verbal communication skills.  High level of organization. We are looking for individuals with the ability to think on their feet and prioritize effectively.  Empathy and passion. We need people who truly care about the client and their project.  You have a strong vision. We are a product studio, we own all our work. We do not just take requirements and spit out a website. We think it through and create living breathing software products that drive business.  Natural leadership and the ability to lead by influence. You will be working with developers and designers who probably know a lot more than you do, but you need to be able to guide them.  Nice to have: UX/UI Design experience/background.  About Crowdlinker  Crowdlinker is an end-to-end digital product studio based in Toronto with a relentless focus on our customers. We connect people through technology by being the strongest link between companies, their ideas, and their clients. We do so by excelling at digital strategy, creative design, full-stack development of websites & web/mobile apps, and digital marketing (SEO, SEM, PPC, Marketing Automation). Our clients include large startups like Freshbooks, League and TopHat, as well as enterprises like Nestlé and Unilever. We excel at providing marketing and media solutions and other digital products requiring exceptional user experiences.  Crowdlinker is recognized as a leader in the local tech community, having just celebrated its 5 year anniversary. We are a 20-person company and are well funded, having raised $1 million to-date. We are growing quickly, which means there are always new and exciting challenges at Crowdlinker, with the opportunity for rapid advancement.  This is the exact opposite of a slow, boring enterprise job. We are looking for someone who is comfortable taking risks and solving burning problems. We embrace change, see challenges as opportunities and focus on solutions. We do offer great pay, benefits and potential stock options, but we won’t hire someone “just looking for a paycheck”. We hire people who want to build a career. We are confident that you will learn more and advance your career further by working with Crowdlinker and our many varied clients. Are you up for the challenge?  Perks & Benefits  Learn and implement the latest and greatest tools and techniques in the industry. Learn from experienced peers and receive up to $10k to take relevant courses.  Grow your career faster by working on a variety of client projects throughout the year.  Competitive compensation, as well as the potential for stock in the company and revenue sharing.  Comprehensive medical and dental plan, which includes $800 per practitioner (e.g. massage therapy, physiotherapy, orthotics, acupuncture, etc…)  Downtown office in trendy King West area at 548 King Street West.  Flexible hours with an option to work from home once a week.  Up to 5 weeks paid vacation.  Optional company GoodLife gym membership.  Optional computer hardware.  Optional company mobile hardware and phone plan.  More about Crowdlinker  To learn more about Crowdlinker, visit https://crowdlinker.com and https://crowdlinker.com/careers  How to Apply  Please apply by using the application feature on this page.
Title: Digital Product/Project Manager (Mid Level)

Job_Description: Hey! We’re Radical I/O Technology, a people-first software development lab & consultancy that loves to mix interesting tech with doing good in the world. We attract clients and employees who share many of our same values of integrity, honesty, approachability, quality, community, and collaboration. We're currently looking for an Android mobile app developer (intermediate or senior) to work with us on a freelance/contractor or a fixed term employee basis (part-time to start; full-time possible after trial period). You'll be working on enhancements and new features for our BeThere360 app (also used by the BC Lions). We'd particularly love to work with you if: you consider an app's usability with the end user in mind, you contribute your ideas to making a digital product better, and you collaborate well with designers.  Initially we will need your help part-time; however, we will be doing a bigger product roll-out over the next few months, and so we anticipate the role will turn into a full-time one. This is a great opportunity to use this time to see if we all work well together.  Requirements To become an Android Developer with Radical I/O, we'd love to see your experience in:  Android app development using Android Studio and Android SDK possessing strong Java skills working with remote data APIs via REST and JSON optimizing data performance with tools like Realm and SQLite crafting great UI with keeping Material UI guidelines in mind distributing apps to Google Play using Git repos as your version control of choice staying on top of best practices and latest trends in Android development Bonus/nice to haves (these skills are not required but, if you do have any of them, be sure to let us know): iOS and/or hybrid web (React Native or Ionic) development working with Cordova/PhoneGap plugins UX/UI design We also look for people who:  write clean code, have written unit tests, and who adhere to effective software design principles have worked within agile processes like Scrum or Kanban, and used tools like JIRA or similar are comfortable working professionally with clients in varying industries are continuously learning communicate and collaborate well and often want to build community and/or make a difference in the world (be sure to include more info about this in the summary section or your cover letter) THE OTHER STUFF  Local Vancouver, BC applicants are preferred, particularly those who can work in our office at least 50% of the time.  We are actively working towards changing the gender imbalance in the tech industry (see our work with App Camp For Girls), and we highly encourage devs whose identities are under-represented in this field to apply. If you don’t match 100% of the job requirements, but are passionate about what you do and eager to learn, we want to hear from you.  Please only apply if you are authorized to work full-time in Canada for any employer. We welcome applicants on working holiday visas and post-graduate work permits. Recruiters, please don't contact this job poster. Do not contact us with unsolicited services or offers. Benefits We offer a flexible and inclusive space to work where we welcome your unique self, including: Inviting office in downtown Vancouver at Beatty and Robson, close to all skytrain lines, shopping, restaurants, the seawall, and entertainment. Encouraging participation in professional events, meetups, conferences, and giving back to the community. Regular team social events and meals, including unlimited daily drinks and snacks. Excellent time off policy and flexibility. Whether you're very experienced or new to the field, we look beyond cookie-cutter requirements and instead focus on your potential. We hire skilled teammates who are hungry to learn and grow, and who really care about the quality of work they produce. We want you to be proud of working on our team, and we want to feel privileged to know you.
Title: Android Mobile App Developer

Job_Description: Front-End Developer Wanted  We’re a team of strategists, designers, and technologists, driven by a shared passion for creating thoughtful digital platforms, products, and services that span web, mobile, and connected spaces. Based in Vancouver and New York City, we’re focused on changing how organizations connect with users in an increasingly digital world. If you’re up for that challenge, you should join us.  The Role  As an Intermediate Front-End Developer, you’ll lead the planning and development of web and mobile platforms, products, and UI systems, producing deliverables that bring the UX and Design group’s work to life through interaction and motion. You work with the project team to define the best approach to implementing fluid, functional, and high-performance interfaces and modular layouts, blending best practices with the latest tools, technologies, and trends in the field of UI development.  Responsibilities  Lead, support, and collaborate in planning, development, testing, and delivery/deployment of solid, structured, and standards-compliant web and mobile interfaces with JS, HTML, and CSS Understand scope, project goals, and requirements, and provide input towards practical solutions, innovations, and time estimation Participate in ideation sessions, workshops, and roadmapping, contributing a perspective on improved production and development approaches, tools, and techniques Collaborate in strategic planning of web and mobile websites, web apps, and native mobile apps assessing opportunities for driving innovation from a development perspective Test, refactor, and optimize code to achieve the best performance, and strive for flawless and bug free deliverables by making quality assurance a top priority Follow industry best practices, and coding standards developed by the agency and contribute to internal and external knowledge sharing Understand our clients’ business, their needs, and the technical opportunities and challenges that exist within their categories Required Skills & Experience  3-5 years experience in mobile-first responsive and adaptive web development working within a team dynamic, delivering pixel perfect code through CSS3/HTML5, Canvas, and SVG Experience planning, prototyping, developing, and testing for web, mobile/tablet, SaaS products, connected devices, and other interactive experiences Experience with current tools, processes, and standards including Git, Gulp, Sass, KSS, Browserify, BEM, Webpack, Node, Sketch, and styleguide driven development Experience with JavaScript including ES6, ReactJS, React Native, JQuery, JQuery plugin development Working knowledge of GA, Mixpanel, Hotjar, and Crazy Egg, and web performance and speed optimization (zero latency) techniques Knowledge of usability, accessibility, industry standards, and testing tools Familiarity with WordPress, Adobe Experience Manager, Squarespace, Shopify, and Magento Familiarity with Laravel, PHP, MySQL, Ruby, and web services integration via JSON and REST APIs (nice to have) Experience working in an agile environment, scoping and roadmappping, and self-management Digital agency or startup team experience preferred Degree in Web Development or Computer Science preferred but not required Candidates should be a resident of Vancouver or willing to relocate and able to travel Benefits  In addition to an exceptional company culture, we offer the following benefits to all employees:  A welcome kit, a brand new MacBook, and all the tools you need on day one Personal learning budget for classes, events, and conferences, and access to General Assembly, Treehouse, Udemy, and One Month to help you expand your skills Winter holiday break in addition to 3 weeks vacation time to start Office snacks, coffee, tea, beer, and monthly birthday lunches Holiday parties, happy hours, and team building activities Health and dental coverage Offices in two of the best cities in the world – Vancouver and New York City An incredible global client list including some of the most recognized brands Focused yet casual work environment in downtown Vancouver and close to public transit How to Apply  If this sounds like a fit, please apply through our online application form. Only candidates with an online portfolio or work samples may be shortlisted and contacted. Please clearly state your personal contribution to each project submitted. If you have a Github profile, blog, or other online projects, please send those URLs along too. Extra attention will be given to creative candidates who are active online.  No recruiters, agencies, or phone calls please.  Visit us at www.enginedigital.com
Title: Front-End Developer (Intermediate)

Job_Description: Position Overview:  A Web Developer plays a central role in the design, development, and delivery of user-facing features for Canada Goose’s web products. Create high-quality user experiences by working closely with product owners, UI/UX designers and other developers. Build dynamic web pages using capabilities of Salesforce Commerce Cloud (Demandware), HTML5, CSS3 and JavaScript. Work with a small, collaborative team of other Senior Web Developers, Product Managers, and Designers and effectively communicate, prioritize and deliver.  Key Responsibilities:  Design and develop applications per requirements captured in Business Requirement Documents and requirements gathering sessions Collaborate with other Web Developers, Project Managers, Business Partners, End Users and other Development and Operations Teams to identify and implement innovative solutions to business challenges Resolve problems, identify causes, and anticipate implications Work with Vendors as required Assist in special projects and perform other duties as required Proactively promote continuous improvements within SDLC processes and engineering practices Help and coach other team members to promote leading practices and technology  Experience, Education and Designations: A post-secondary education in Computer Science or Information Management or relevant experience 5+ years building high-quality, high visibility web sites using ecommerce platforms like Demandware, Magento, etc. 7+ hands-on working experience JavaScript, HTML, CSS 3+ years of experience developing using JavaScript frameworks like AngularJS, Ember, React, etc. Proven experience in working with any of following MVC frameworks or similar: Laravel, Zend, Symphony 3+ years of experience building responsive web applications using frameworks like Bootstrap, Foundation, etc. Experience building products for international audiences and optimized for various Search Engines  Attributes: Brand Ambassador for promoting continuous technical improvements and innovations Strong organizational, writing, interpersonal and communication skills Exceptional attention to detail and a high degree of accuracy Possess excellent time and project management skills Ability to work in a fast-paced environment with a high degree of change Ability to work efficiently under pressure A team player who builds strong relationships based on trust and integrity Entrepreneurial spirit Passionate and determined Egoless nature A continuous learner Follow through consistently on work commitments  Working Conditions: Usually work regular business hour Work in offices May require travel to local or international sites, conferences and/or seminars    We truly thank all applicants for their interest in joining the Goose Team, but only those candidates considered for an initial interview will be contacted.  Canada Goose Inc. is committed to delivering and improving accessibility in employment for all persons with disabilities. Accommodation is available, upon request, in the application and interview process and in the course of all other methods of selection of employees. Successful candidates for employment will be introduced to and trained in respect of all of Canada Goose Inc.’s human rights, accommodation and accessibility polices.
Title: Full Stack Developer

Job_Description: Navigator Marketingis an award-winning, full-service marketing agency that provides cutting-edge marketing strategy that produce results. We work with companies all over North America.Services: Web Design, Mobile Web Design, Monthly Marketing Strategy & Implementation, Social Media Management.Our Mission: Helping business owners grow their businesses from where they are now to where they want them to be.How We Do This: We increase a business' PROFILE, LEADS & SALES. We are a fun, talented & driven team who work at the intersection technology and consumer behaviour generating sales.Position Description: We are looking for an amazing & fun Web & UI/UX Developerto add to our team to assist with designing, coding and modifying websites, from layout to function. This person will strive to create visually appealing sites that feature user-friendly design and clear navigation. This person will also work closely with our designers & team members to execute & bring to life new ideas & projects in a team approach.The successful candidate will also be working on keeping websites up to date, landing pages, mobile optimization, analytics and much more. These tasks will require you to be comfortable and efficient with Google Developer Tools, and coding in HTML5, CSS, Javascript and PHP.We are looking for someone with minimum of one year experience in the field who can hit the ground running. Job_Description: Nous valorisons la diversité et avons à cœur de créer un milieu de travail inclusif qui nous inspire tous à donner le meilleur de nous-mêmes. Joignez-vous à notre équipe et faites une différence!  Votre poste  Nous Comment imaginez-vous les bureaux d’une compagnie d’assurance? Et l’atmosphère de travail qui y règne? Nous gageons que si vous passez nous voir au Lab de Intact, vous serez très surpris! Situé au centre-ville de Montréal, nous sommes un laboratoire d’innovation dont la mission est de créer des produits à la fine-pointe de l’insurtech qui améliorent la vie de millions de Canadiens.  Mariant la convivialité et la vélocité d’une startup aux ressources et aux moyens d’une grande entreprise (vous disposerez de tous les outils dont vous avez toujours rêvé!), le Lab est un environnement jeune et dynamique, offrant des défis stimulants, des collègues inspirants et une carrière passionnante (chez un des top 100 employeurs au Canada). C’est l’endroit idéal pour parfaire vos compétences et faire évoluer votre carrière.  Vous Vous êtes passionné par le commerce électronique et l’innovation numérique? Vous avez un talent particulier pour traduire des exigences complexes en expériences utiles et agréables? Vous restez à l’affût des dernières tendances en matière de design et vous aimez expérimenter de nouveaux outils et de nouvelles méthodologies? Nous avons l’occasion parfaite pour vous!  Rôle À titre de designer UX/UI, vous jouerez un rôle essentiel dans la conception et l’évolution de notre écosystème numérique. Relevant du directeur principal, Innovations numériques, vous aurez comme principales responsabilités :  Concevoir des expériences captivantes en vue de réaliser les objectifs d’affaires  Valider la fonctionnalité et l’utilité par l’entremise de tests et de recherches auprès des utilisateurs  Produire des livrables UX et design pertinents au besoin  Piloter une feuille de route aux côté d’un directeur de produit et d’une équipe agile multidisciplinaire  Présenter le travail aux parties prenantes  Aider les ingénieurs à produire des interfaces de qualité et agréables  Prôner une conception axée sur l’utilisateur et les données  Vos compétences  Minimum trois années d’expérience  Expertise en matière de convivialité et de pratiques de conception centrées sur l'utilisateur  Maîtrise des outils de conception (Sketch, Axure, InVision, Illustrator, etc.)  Expérience des outils de recherche UX (usertesting.com, Optimal Workshop, etc.) un atout  Expérience dans la production de flux de processus, d’inventaires de contenu, etc.  Vous aimez travailler dans un environnement de collaboration qui accorde une importance primordiale au travail d’équipe, à l’innovation, à l’ouverture d’esprit et au plaisir  Veuillez inclure votre portfolio dans votre dossier de candidature.  Vous êtes  Une personne avec qui il est agréable de travailler  Créatif, analytique, curieux et ingénieux  Un joueur d’équipe capable de partager et recevoir des commentaires constructifs  Excellent pour expliquer vos idées à différents intervenants  Profondément passionné par le design et la qualité  Organisé et proactif  En tant que salarié temps plein, vous bénéficierez des avantages suivants :  Un salaire compétitif  Un boni de performance annuel  Un régime de retraite  Un horaire de travail flexible de 35 heures par semaine  Des assurances médicales et dentaires hors pair  Et plusieurs autres avantages et bénéfices (remboursement gym, conférences, etc.)  Énoncé fermeture  Cette opportunité vous intéresse? Nous avons très hâte de faire votre connaissance!  D’excellents avantages sont offerts : salaire concurrentiel, avantages flexibles, aménagements de travail flexibles, congés mobiles, régime de retraite à prestation déterminée, etc.  Dans le cadre du processus de sélection d’Intact, les candidats peuvent être appelés à donner leur consentement à une vérification de leurs antécédents pertinente au poste à pourvoir avant de recevoir une offre d’emploi. Celle-ci peut comprendre une confirmation des références d’emploi, des études et des titres de compétences, une vérification des emplois, de l’identité, des infractions criminelles et du permis de conduire ainsi qu’un rapport de crédit.  Vous pouvez soumettre votre candidature à un emploi affiché pourvu que vous occupiez vos fonctions actuelles depuis au moins douze mois et que votre performance soit jugée bonne ou que votre contrat temporaire arrive à son échéance. Une recherche de talents à l'externe est menée parallèlement au recrutement à l'interne Veuillez donc prendre note que des candidats potentiels pourraient avoir été identifiés pour ce poste dans le cadre de leur plan de développement.   Veuillez noter que l'usage du masculin a comme but d'alléger le texte.  Cet affichage prendra fin 02 juin 2018.  Prime de recommandation  CE POSTE EST SUJET À UNE PRIME DE RECOMMANDATION DE 3000$.  #li-qc  Droit de travailler au Canada  Les personnes qui posent leur candidature à un poste permanent doivent, dès leur embauche, avoir le droit de travailler au Canada de façon permanente. Les documents pouvant servir de preuve dans le cas des rôles permanents sont un certificat de naissance canadien, un passeport canadien, un certificat de citoyenneté canadienne, une carte de résident permanent ou une confirmation de son statut de résident permanent pour prouver qu’il a le droit de travailler au Canada. Job_Description: Responsibilities:  Act as a ScrumMaster for 1-2 Scrum teams with a focus on guiding the teams towards improving the way they work. Facilitate daily standup, sprint planning, retrospective and sprint review meetings. Facilitate cross-team coordination and escalate if necessary for impediment removal. Assist the product owner with keeping the backlog groomed. Maintain relevant metrics that help the team see how they are doing. Foster better cross-functional communication: developers, QAs, UI/UX designers, POs and other stakeholders. Collaborate with other ScrumMasters and Agile Development Manager to ensure consistent process and agile direction across teams. Requirements:  Knowledge of software development life cycles, especially different Agile tribes. Experience in Scrum is an advantage, having ScrumMaster/Product Owner/Scrum Developer certification is a plus. Practical experience in implementing and coaching agile technical best practices such as TDD, ATDD, unit tests, pair programming, continuous delivery, etc. Excellent communication skills in English as well as interpersonal skills. At least 3 years’ experience working in an agile environment, preferably in a variety of roles, domains. Full-Time positions available.
Title: Project Manager_SCRUM

Job_Description: The ACL Impact ACL exists to help make the world a safer and more ethical place. Our software has been used by a national agency to help track down missing children, by banks to find suspicious patterns in their data, and by a state agency to identify money laundering fronts for a drug cartel. ACL has been at the heart of investigations that have helped save millions of dollars of fraud, waste and even saved lives… talk about making an impact!  The ACL R&D Team  The R&D team extends beyond the walls of ACL and stands on the shoulders of giants. We use the innovation of technology partners like Amazon, select OEMs, and the Open Source Community to ensure we’re meeting our challenges with the most current and effective technologies. We give back by contributing time, code and support to our engineers and across the community.  To understand more about software development at ACL, read Landing your Software Engineering Dream Job. To look through the window into R&D, check out our blog or read these articles: Inside ACL R&D Part I — Brigades, and R&D Baymax Team Spirit.  As a DevOps shop, we own what we build. We do not pass it off to others. We maintain it. We continually work to reduce the time required to build and safely deploy software. Security, integrity and performance are not an afterthought. They are built into our development process. We design for growing use. We use tools to continually scan our code base and stay current on patches and upgrades. If a serious vulnerability is discovered we pause everything else and immediately resolve it.  We have a product development group of 70+ and counting (the company has over 300 employees and counting). We work in small “brigades” comprised of 5 or so Software Engineers, 2 QA Engineers, a Manager, a UX Designer, UX Developer and a Product Manager. It’s our version of a scrum team.  The Challenge Ahead We're searching for a Software Engineer who has full stack web development experience to expand our existing suite of cloud based applications. We're looking for someone with proven knowledge in building high performing data driven applications from the database design, layering backend application concerns, designing APIs, and connecting them with the latest UI frameworks.  What Will You Get Out of This?  An amazing dynamic startup environment within a financially stable company (did we mention we just celebrated our 30th anniversary?)Some of the best benefits in the industry (asking for more information can be a great first question for us in the interview process).Working with an awesome team of professional software engineers with plenty of room to learn and grow.  What You Will Bring to ACL You are a solid full stack developer who has extensive experience delivering high availability, secure, fault tolerant largescale solutions using either Ruby on Rails or NodeJS. You have solid experience modelling database relationships, know what's needed to grow a codebase without growing technical debt, have designed APIs for performance and ease of use, and understand how it all fits with the latest UI frameworks like React or Angular You eat code for breakfast and lunch, and munch on software architecture blogs and books for dinner. When you wake up in the morning you usually have a solution to a complex problem in your head and you can't wait to get to the office to code it and share it with your teammates. You love to mentor others and get great joy from seeing others grow and learn.  Skills For Success at ACL  You have a Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or equivalent experience.You have at least 2 years of professional experience delivering large-scale, high availability, secure web applications in an agile environment.You have up-to-date knowledge on the state of modern Javascript tools and frameworks.You have experience building and consuming RESTful APIs, working with relational databases and SQL.You care deeply about code quality, are a TDD ninja, and detest having bugs slip through to production.You are passionate about learning and continuous improvement.You have creative ideas, a collaborative attitude and strong work ethic.  Bonus You are actively involved in local meetups and open source project contributions we can look at on Github.
Title: Software Engineer (Full Stack)

Title: Application Development Manager

Job_Description: We are looking for an embedded software engineer or developer to join our research and development team, which creates unique electronic tools for automotive, marine, and other vehicular applications. General Technologies Corporation designs and manufactures a variety of hand-held electronic tools which use embedded processors including various ARM microcontrollers. The successful applicant will develop and test complete firmware/software applications for ARM microcontrollers and/or microcontrollers, in collaboration with the rest of the hardware and software R&D team. The software may be super-loop or RTOS-based, and will likely be written in C and involve graphical user interfaces, as well as digital signal processing, and some digital communication. Requirements Must have knowledge and experience of/with: >2 years of experience in software development and/or research writing C in a development environment (IAR, Keil, or Codewarrior) debugging hardware using lab equipment (multimeters and oscilloscopes) working in a team environment, with engineers and production personnel The following will contribute to success in this position: experience and understanding of digital signal processing (e.g. FFT, wavelet) experience with real-time software development design for low power consumption (e.g. using low power modes) experience with and understanding of graphical user interface design, UI/UX design experience with and understanding of digital communications (SPI, I2C/I2S, UART, etc.) experience with, and understanding of FPGA design (Verilog, VHDL, or other) experience with electronic hardware design and/or debugging Python and/or Matlab experience interest in novel applications and circuit designs ability to work closely with hardware designers ability to communicate clearly and concisely a desire to produce reliable, cost-effective products for the user strong work ethic, and a sense of personal responsibility Benefits The successful applicant will be offered a full-time position subject to an employment agreement. GTC is a small, fast-moving company with no bureaucratic processes, and has an integrated design and manufacturing facility in Delta, BC. Please get in touch if you think you are a good fit, and thanks for reading our post!
Title: Embedded Software Engineer or Developer
