Job_Description: At Robots and Pencils, we’re expanding and looking for a Senior Android Developer to join our talented and world class robot team.  Who you are: You are someone who prefers to communicate through code. You love to create and have a strong desire to learn. You have strong opinions but that are weakly held; you are humble yet confident. In fact, you’re the first to pass along the latest headache busting library from Square to your colleagues just minutes after sending a link to a mind clarifying blog post from Romain Guy.  You can speak to language best practices and are not afraid of anonymous inner-classes. You never overlook the saved instance state and have contemplated the tradeoffs between activities, fragments, and views. You have knowledge of how a RESTful web service works, what makes it RESTful, and how it can be accessed from Android. You are also diligent about meeting allocated budgets and can work within time constraints, but you will never sacrifice quality.  What you’ll do: Design, program and test software. Author and maintain relevant documentation for developers, Clients and users. Develop and refine prototypes to confirm requirements. Program according to project plans (versions, sprints). Test according to pre-determined test plans. Support release and post-release activities, such as support, versioning and maintenance. Collaborate with our pencils (designers) to create interfaces that conform to the Google design guidelines. Peer review other team members’ code, and learn and adapt from peer review of your own code. Support sales and project managers with technical insights, leading to the creation of budgets and schedules for projects.  About Robots and Pencils: Robots and Pencils is a digital innovation agency companies engage to create what's next. Trusted by some of the world's best brands, we help our Clients use mobile, web, and frontier technologies to transform their businesses.  In 2009, we created Robots and Pencils with the then-contrarian view that mobile would be more transformative than the internet. Today, our thinking is rooted in the belief that, in the age of unprecedented technology acceleration, maintaining a competitive advantage requires new strategies and a focus on innovation.  Our approach has been to create a company designed to follow the talent, allowing us to amass an unfair share of hyper-skilled people who call Robots and Pencils home. A team of people who not only develop innovative solutions to transform businesses, but also create products that have been previously inconceivable.  At R&P;, we believe that our products and workplace are better with a diverse team makeup. Our Talent offers a variety of backgrounds, skillsets, and expertise from across the globe. Thank you Recruiters, but we’re not looking for help with this.  Requirements: 10+ years of delivering software with preference given to those who have a degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or equivalent Solid understanding and practical knowledge of the full mobile development and application life cycle Solid understanding of Android UX/UI guidelines and best practices Experience with Android using Android Studio and JAVA Experience with a distributed Version Control System Experience with mobile development issues related to performance optimization, caching and security Familiar with Architecture patterns (MVP/ MVVM etc.)  Excellent communications skills with the ability to share insights and expectations with Clients, stakeholders and colleagues, both locally and remotely
Title: Senior Android Developer

Job_Description: At Rogers we’re for supporting you on a journey to a rewarding career. Whether you’re a developer, an analyst, or a customer care consultant, Rogers is the place where ideas become reality. We embrace change, and find ways to do better. And we deliver on that commitment by fostering an environment of passion and innovation for all people.  Imagine working for an exciting entrepreneurial company whose employees are committed to meeting the big challenges and making a real difference. That’s Rogers. A leading communications and media company where people come to do great work. Right now we are looking for talented individuals to join our winning team where you will have a chance to innovate, grow and to do what really matters.  This role will be primarily based Downtown Brampton office. We are currently seeking unusually talented and highly versatile front-end developers who live and breathe HTML 5, CSS and JavaScript and either love or are willing to try a long term relationship with Angular framework and or React.js, with a bit of dabbling in other JavaScript frameworks from time to time. You ideally believe that single page applications are the future of Digital and are eager to work with server side developers to ensure they produce well designed REST services for you to consume. We strongly value deep technical skills, an eye for UI design and UX intuition, willingness to learn, and desire to work in an intensive, highly productive environment.  Primary Function: Develop interactive web applications (in a CMS or single page applications) that include browse, shop and self-service functions and customer friendly capabilities. A key responsibility is to use your creativity to produce highly responsive and enjoyable web-based user interfaces. The customer should never be confused about what is happening or become frustrated because they don’t know what to do next.  Responsibilities include: Creating highly interactive single page applications using Angular version 4+ frameworks and or React.js that respond to all user actions in fractions of a second Creating attractive experiences in content management that delight and inspire the customer Creating, maintaining, debugging and optimizing JavaScript, HTML and CSS Taking an active role in structuring our single page applications to make them easy to maintain and to ensure they are highly modularized Creating optimized HTML, CSS and JavaScript with breakpoints that work well on mobile browsers Working closely the architects and back end services team to ensure that we have a useful set of REST services Working closely with UX and UI designers to help them understand the constraints of single page applications and development frameworks so that they produce usable designs  Qualifications A university degree in arts, design, engineering, science, math or computer science is highly desirable 5+ years experience in web technologies such as HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, jQuery and react.js or Angular framework Experience in following industry’s best practices for desging highly UI and performance efficient web applications Expertise in identify, quantify, debug and remove performance bottlenecks across different browsers and devices Knowledge of consuming RESTful Web-Services and parsing json media types Experience with Social Media APIs (Facebook, Twitter, etc) Development using Scrum Agile methodologies is a plus Experience in unit testing and e2e testing is plus Demonstrated ability to create single page applications, either through prior experience, school projects or special websites you have built to showcase your skills You truly love to code and build Digital experiences as evidenced by prior projects and experience Strong organizational and estimation skills Exceptional communications and presentation skills Schedule: Full Time Shift: Day Length of Contract: Not Applicable (Regular Position) Work Location: 8200 Dixie Road (101), Brampton, ON Travel Requirements: Up to 10% Posting Category/Function: Technology & Software Development Requisition ID: 121230 WHY ROGERS? As a proud Canadian company, we're dedicated to making things easier for our customers. We’ve been embracing and leading change for over 50-years, and we’ll continue to seek out new opportunities to bring our customers simple solutions for today and tomorrow. We recognize that success is determined by the strength and diversity of our people. We work together because we want to win together, and these five shared values guide and define our work: Simplify and innovate Take ownership of the what and the how Equip people to succeed Execute with discipline and pride Talk straight, build trust, and over deliver Why Rogers? Because your tomorrow inspires our today. What makes us different makes us stronger. Rogers has a strong commitment to diversity and inclusion. Everyone who applies for a job will be considered. We recognize the business value in creating a workplace where each team member has the tools to reach their full potential. At Rogers, we value the insights and innovation that diverse teams bring to work. We work with our candidates with disabilities throughout the recruitment process to ensure that they have what they need to be at their best. Please reach out to our recruiters and hiring managers to begin a conversation about how we can ensure that you deliver your best work. You can also reach out to our team at RogersRecruiting@rci.rogers.com to begin a conversation about your individual accessibility needs throughout the hiring process. Posting Notes: Information Technology & Engineering || Canada (CA) || ON || Brampton || SF: LI-KM1 ||
Title: Digital Angular Developer

Job_Description: Job description: Full Stack developer  Uni3t Group is a young and dynamic IT company that is active in life science and pharmaceuticals.  The Uni3T Group was born of a desire to bring together and unify a comprehensive expertise in the field of life sciences under one roof. Uni3T Group’s mission is to improve access to public health care and products by providing consulting services, technology solutions, to life sciences companies.  Our approach is based on three main services. All of our missions start with obtaining a strategic vision that is highly aligned with the needs of our customers. We work with customers on transforming their processes to unleash their full organizational potential. Finally, technologies can be deployed to optimize the Business value chain through the automation of key processes.  We are looking for a Full Stack Web Developer who is motivated to combine the art of design with the art of programming. Responsibilities will include translation of the UI/UX design wireframes to actual code that will produce visual elements of the application. You will work with the UI/UX designer and bridge the gap between graphical design and technical implementation, taking an active role on both sides and defining how the application looks as well as how it works.  If you think you can be part of our team, join us now!  Responsibilities: D evelop new user-facing features.  Serve as functional lead to develop projects plans and accomplish goals.  Create, integrate and maintain responsive design.  Collaborate in an agile environment along with a dynamic team composed of software developers, architects, product managers and quality assurance specialists.  Optimize and improve website user experience (UX).  Recommend and apply best Web practices.  Collaborate with other team members and stakeholders.  Qualifications : Specialized college level diploma (DEC) or equivalent in Web Development or Multimedia Integration or related.  2+ years’ experience in a similar position.  Proficiency with integration.  Proficiency with web technology.  Excellent knowledge of web technologies, especially HTML, HTML 5, JavaScript, Ajax, JSON, JQuery.  Good understanding server-side CSS pro-processing platforms, such as LESS and SASS.  Good knowledge of multi-browser and multi-platform development.  Knowledge of Frameworks.  Critical spirit related to Visual Design.  Basic knowledge of Adobe Photoshop and Illustrator applications.  Skills: A detail oriented person.  Excellent verbal and written English communication skills.  Strong analytical and problem solving skills.  Strong sense of organization and prioritizing.  Ability to communicate, write and synthesize information.  Ability to work as a team player in a consulting environment.  Being able to work as a team member or independent.  Ability to work under pressure.  Basic knowledge as a Full Stack Developer.  Benefits: Competitive base salary + bonus (based on company, team and individual efforts);  Comprehensive insurance coverage by Sunlife;  Great company culture with career development opportunities!  Permanent full time position;  Located between Griffintown and the Old Montreal, in the Cité du Multimédia neighborhood, now part of Montreal’s holistic hub for innovation, education, and entrepreneurship: Le Quartier de l’Innovation.
Title: Full stack developer

Job_Description: ICE®is a dynamic software company based in Calgary, offering one of the most unique and exciting work atmospheres to be found between Barlow Trail, 52 St, Glenmore and 60 St! We are currently looking for a Project Manager/Business Analyst /Accounting System Specialist......or a P.M.B.A.A.S.S...ha...jeez that might not work.....OK.....actually....... we are just looking for smart motivated people in Calgary that don’t mind being called an ICEcube or DIRTTbag! We don’t use job titles, no one gets an office and we work together as a team towards a common goal so skies the limit on how you can contribute! With your resume please tell us about your favorite project, job or maybe hobby that you love. It can be as elaborate or simple as you like, as short or long and in any format you choose.  As part of the Ice Edge Project Team, you will drive internal projects including stake holder interrogation, system evaluation, asking why...why... why..... to the testing, implementation and support of our financial ecosystem.  Job Description: Project Manager/Business Analyst /Accounting System Specialist The successful candidate will be responsible for simultaneously managing multiple projects from engagement to implementation. This would include:  Evaluation of client (internal and external) requirements and related processes Creation of Requirements documentation Schedule estimation, adherence, and adaptation in order to achieve defined goals Liaise with developers, UI/UX designers and "random" team members Break down complex objectives into achievable and understandable goals Work with other project managers to allocate shared resources to achieve goals Weekly reporting of real time progress on sprint iterations to various stake holders Requirements:  Ability to work with DIRTTbags and ICEcubes to understand their needs, set expectations and manage relationships Experience with Sage, EZCM and Ultipro an asset Skilled in defining and managing projects – including scope, budget, schedule, resources, change and risk etc. etc. Able to effectively communicate with both technical and non-technical personnel Ability to adapt development processes to maximize efficiency Excellent organization and communication skills Demonstrated ability to multi task and manage multiple projects at one time Strong computer skills Able to turn on a dime as priorities change  To apply for this position, please apply on-line or email us at: careers@ice-edge.com. Please quote the position title in your subject line.No direct phone calls or in person visits please. DIRTT is an equal opportunity employer. We thank all applicants however only those selected for an interview will be contacted. Job_Description: Primary Location: Canada,Ontario,Mississauga Education: Bachelor's Degree Job Function: Technology Schedule: Full-time Shift: Day Job Employee Status: Regular Travel Time: Yes, 10 % of the Time Job ID: 18014863  Description  The Global Security Master (GSM) trading business is actively involved in the origination, securitization, and secondary trading of a variety of mortgage and asset-backed securities. They operate in three major regions, North America, Europe and other Emerging Markets and Asia. The primary products include residential mortgages, commercial mortgages, credit cards, auto loans, and student loans. GSM Front-office Technology team builds and supports cutting edge and robust technology solutions that allow our business users to gain a competitive advantage.  This technology team focuses on building applications that allow trading desks to manage their positions, price some of the most complicated financial products in the market, perform prepayment/cash flow/scenario analysis to hedge and risk manage their positions. The team, comprising of seasoned technologists and business domain experts, works closely with the traders, risk managers, research analysts and senior management to identify market opportunities and deliver solutions using Agile development principles. This is an experienced web developer position. Qualified candidate will be responsible for design and development of Modular, Maintainable, Measurable, and Efficient applications. Candidate will focus on the separation of content and presentation through the use of Web Standards, CSS, HTML5, leading JavaScript libraries, and robust and scalable presentation layer architectures.  Qualifications  Knowledge/Experience: 5+ years developing complex User Interface (UI) applications with contemporary frontend technology stack Experience with front-end build tools/task runners like NPM, gulp, grunt, webpack Experience with architecting Single Page Applications (SPAs) using common design patterns Hands on experience with ES6, HTML5, CSS3, CSS Preprocessors Expertise as designer in user interface Application and Developer in developing Web Application using Web Standards, javaScript, AngularjS Must have strong UI coding experience Hands on experience with Object Oriented JavaScript. Good understanding of OOPS Concepts. Good knowledge of AngularJS Responsive design. Extensive experience in Java script development is mandatory Strong team player and collaboration skills Experience with JavaScript Unit Testing frameworks Experience of DevOps environment and platforms ( git, TeamCity etc) Familiarity with an Agile approach to development Familiarity with an Agile approach for development Knowledge of working with UX teams and designers Development experience Strong team player Excellent communication and analytical skills Experience driving technology improvements Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience  Nice to Haves: Fixed income business knowledge  Citi Canada is an equal opportunity employer. Accordingly, we will make reasonable accommodations to respond to the needs of people with disabilities. Individuals who view themselves as Aboriginals, members of visible minorities, and disabled are encouraged to apply in confidence.
Title: Senior Web Developer

Job_Description: Permanent – Temps plein  CEDROM Technologies une filiale de CEDROM-SNi, est à la recherche pour son siège social de Montréal d’un Développeur Big Data de niveau intermédiaire (5-7 ans) passionné et créatif souhaitant s’associer à une solide équipe de développement de produit dans un environnement de travail stimulant et à la fine pointe des technologies.  CE QUI VOUS ATTEND : Vous rejoindrez une équipe SCRUM composée de Product Owner, Designer UI/UX, et de Développeurs. Vous travaillerez en mode agile dans un environnement technique en constante innovation.  Vous agirez à titre de spécialiste des données dans l’équipe Produits et à ce titre vous aurez à mettre en place, développer et maintenir des systèmes de stockage, de traitement et d’analyse sur d’importants volumes de données. Vous développerez de nouveaux moteurs et ferez évoluer les moteurs existants sur les technologies big data (elasticsearch, mongoDB, Redis, Spark...).  Vous pourrez être amené à travailler également sur des projets en Intelligence Artificielle et en traitement du langage naturel (NLP).  LES DÉFIS : Vous aurez les responsabilités suivantes : Participer à l’implémentation de l’architecture technique et fonctionnelle des différents systèmes de données  Mettre en place des systèmes performants et « scalables » (NoSql, MongoDB, Redis, …)  Participer à la migration des données et règles d’affaire présentes dans les moteurs existants (SQL Server)  Offrir une plateforme d’accès aux données aux autres équipes à travers des micro services  Assurer la qualité du code en mettant en place des tests fonctionnels  Participer à la définition des standards, rédiger la documentation et partager l’expertise technique aux autres équipes  Vous possédez les compétences et atouts suivants : La passion pour le développement et la mise en production de solutions pensées pour les utilisateurs  La connaissance de plusieurs frameworks et outils Big Data (MongoDB, Spark, Elasticsearch…) ainsi que du SQL  Une expérience en conception et développement de solutions big data  Une insatiable envie d’apprendre  Un esprit d’équipe et collaboratif  Un diplôme informatique ou toute autre formation pertinente  Bilingue, ou une connaissance de base de l’anglais technique (stackoverflow, reddit)  Les atouts : Toute expérience avec des technologies distribuées de gestion de données tel que : MongoDB, Redis, Cassandra, ElasticSearch …  Expérience de programmation en C#  Connaissance de la plateforme JIRA  Connaissances en méthodologie AGILE (SCRUM)  Connaissances de GIT  Pourquoi CEDROM Technologies ?  Un salaire concurrentiel en fonction de l’expérience  Un horaire flexible  Un programme complet d'avantages sociaux, dont des assurances collectives et un programme de REER collectif  Un environnement de travail idéal qui conjugue vie professionnelle et vie personnelle  Une ambiance décontractée, familiale qui allie plaisir et travail  Un accès facile en transport en commun (à proximité des métros Rosemont et Outremont)  Et un mur d’escalade au bureau  Faites-nous parvenir votre CV à l’attention des Ressources Humaines à l’adresse courriel suivante : emplois@cedrom-sni.com
Title: Développeur Big Data

This role reports to the VP Engineering and requires an individual with excellent web application development expertise, HTML/CSS/Javascript skills, insight into crafting a user friendly and efficient user experience as well as great teamwork, communication and attention to detail.WHAT YOU’LL BE DOINGWork closely in teams composed of Product Managers, UX/UI Designers, Front-end Developers, Back-end Developers and QA Analysts.Work with the product team to conceptualize and design a clean, intuitive and efficient experience with an elegant UIDevelop the front-end user interface for the main backend web application used to manage Inboxlab’s various brands, apps and gamesWork closely with backend developers to integrate REST APIs and develop the application’s logic and featuresCommunicate with the management team and translate business needs into technical specifications and requirementsIntegrate the UI and design for various products including websites, web apps, customized emails and more.Ensuring that all web design is integrated and developed to be both cross-platform compatible and mobile responsive.Working in a product development process that is primarily agile/scrumWHAT YOU’LL NEED TO BRING8+ years of front-end web development experience working on both websites and web apps using HTML, CSS and Javascript8+ years working in a product development team/environment, collaborating with Product Managers, UX/UI Designers, Front-end Developers, Back-end Developers and QA Analysts.2+ years experience with ReactJS. Web application experience for administrative web portals or other forms of apps using React is needed as the main web app is built using React5+ years experience working in an agile/scrum development processExperience with integrating REST APIs in web applicationsExperience with UI application design tools such as Invision, Sketch, Photoshop, etc...Experience working with Git and sharing code repositoriesStrong technical backgroundStrong attention to detailExcellent knowledge and experience in crafting simple, efficient and elegant user experiences through architecture and UI design/developmentAbility to communicate with end users and translate needs into technical requirements/specificationsAbility to work both individually and as a member of a teamOrganized with strong time management and estimation skills/experience (i.e. ability to give and stick to a timeline/estimate)Ability to work on multiple projects at the same time and help to determine priorities based on time, complexity, availability, etc...Experience with other web UI/application frameworks a plus as wellDesire to learn new technologies, languages, frameworks, etc.ABOUT INBOXLABBased in Denver, Colorado, Inboxlab is an incubator that builds companies revolving around email. Founded in 2017 by serial entrepreneur and angel investor, Nicholas Pardon, Inboxlab seeks to create value in new and existing companies by leveraging our core competencies around data, marketing, branding, and most importantly, the inbox.Job Type: Full-timeExperience:ReactJS: 2 yearsLanguage:English
Title: Senior Front-end Web Developer

Job_Description: Software Engineers are an essential part of Battlefy's Product Team. Working closely with designers and product managers, we implement and maintain the user interface and production systems. We make the most of modern tools like React, Angular, ES6, and even our next-generation apps are built with JavaScript on React Native. In Vancouver, the Engineering team is building world-class software to ensure our global customers, players, and organizers have a great experience on Battlefy.  We value passion and drive but we also believe that diversity is the key to success for every high growth technology startup. We welcome people from all walks of life.  Requirements You Are A passionate, entrepreneurial-spirited creative technologist that owns delivery from concept through to completion A relentless advocate for engineering excellence, dedicated to coaching and mentoring others A product thinker, who balances user pains and business needs while being pragmatic in making data driven decisions A meticulous designer with an eye for pixel-perfect detail, able to empathize with users to craft amazing UIs An expert at communicating, knowing exactly how to collaborate with sales, marketing, UX, product managers and other engineers You Will Engineer scalable and maintainable software to meet the application and infrastructure needs of the Battlefy platform Collaborate with product designers to design, prototype, test, and iterate on the product's UI Wear many hats working across Engineering, Quality Assurance, and Design. Continually set personal and professional goals and do everything in your power to surpass them Grow the Battlefy culture, from posting to #dev about good engineering patterns to posting in #designs about the latest Nielson Norman usability study. You embody our values of one team, drive and sportsmanship Your Experience You have 3+ years of experience writing client-side JavaScript You have built complex responsive layouts with CSS and HTML You have demonstrated design ability, and have a portfolio of products that you've designed the UI of You have a strong knowledge of cross-browser compatibility issues and client-side performance considerations You have worked in a fast growth environment where your pace and hustle was key to getting the right things done You know what technical debt is pragmatic and when to make trade-offs between architectural purity and reality You either know or are able to demonstrate that you can master the following: Javascript (ES6) and Node.js React, Angular or similar modern frontend libraries/frameworks JavaScript testing frameworks HTML5 / CSS3 MongoDB, Postgresql, Redis Bonus Points if you… Have experience in organizing or competing in esports tournaments Write blog posts Built a style guide Do tech talks at local Vancouver events Ran your own venture (even if it failed) Have open source contributions Benefits What you’ll get Stock Competitive salaries Paid time off Your choice of equipment (laptop) Company sponsored tech talks and happy hours Much more...
Title: Senior Frontend Engineer

Job_Description: Nokia is a global leader in the technologies that connect people and things. With state-of-the-art software, hardware and services for any type of network, Nokia is uniquely positioned to help communication service providers, governments, and large enterprises deliver on the promise of 5G, the Cloud and the Internet of Things. Serving customers in over 100 countries, our research scientists and engineers continue to invent and accelerate new technologies that will increasingly transform the way people and things communicate and connect.  Nokia's IP & Optics Division (ION) is recruiting highly motivated Software Professionals to develop cutting edge products in Software-Defined Networking, a new technology space that is revolutionizing the way networks are managed and controlled. If you want to be a part of this next generation of networking, this is the place for you!  Our products are built using various technologies, including:  Java, JavaScript, React, Redux, Webpack, Gradle, Npm, Bower, Gulp, Yarn.  Web Frameworks and Technologies (Spring, HTML5, CSS3, REST/JSON).  As a Web Application Developer / Technical Lead on our team, you will be challenged! The successful candidate’s responsibilities will include:  Define the technologies used to build, package and host Web applications.  Work in a team-based Agile Environment; collaborate with UX Designers, Web Developers, Testers, and Product Management to refine requirements, design, develop, and test our products.  Key Responsibilities / Functions:  Define the architecture of the NSP Web applications product suite.  Produce and maintain Web libraries and frameworks to support fast development of complex Web applications.  Support the development community using the team’s deliverables.  Research and evaluate software (open source and 3pp) to include in the development process and product.  Make informed technology and implementation decisions.  Accurately set and meet deadlines.  Continuously improve personal and the team’s skill set.  Degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science or related field.  Proficient in Java, JavaScript, scripting.  Strong interpersonal and communication skills, both written and verbal.  Strong problem-solving skills.  3+ years developing responsive web UI with HTML5, CSS3, JSON, JavaScript, TypeScript using frameworks such as Angular.js and ReactJS.  3+ years building RESTful web services, APIs and dynamic database driven web applications.  3+ years using web servers such as Tomcat.  5+ years developing applications in Java programming language  Experience using software design patterns such as MVC (Spring) and FLUX (Redux).  Experience with modern build infrastructure such as Webpack and Babel.  Experience using UX design concepts such as Material Design.  Experience collaborating with cross-functional teams.  Experience with various operating systems (Linux, Mac OS, Windows).  Proficient in exploring and evaluating new technologies.  Ability to work independently and in a team environment.  Canada is committed to building a skilled, diverse workforce reflective of Canadian society. As a result, we promote employment equity and encourage women, aboriginal persons, persons with a disability or members of a visible minority group to apply.
Title: Software Development Engineer

Job_Description: Located in the Mount Pleasant area of Vancouver, as part of the POWERSHiFTER team you will have access to some of the brightest minds in design, technology, strategy and data science. You will work in an environment that values people, process and performance, collaborating with team members. Your Mission  To drive delivery of your projects in a lean and collaborative way, working equally as close with your teammates as your clients while contributing to the strength and development of the agency’s delivery process. Responsibilities  Collaborate with the project team (UI/UX designers, developers, content strategists, QA testers and data scientists) to identify the approach, deliverables, budget, schedule and tools to deliver projects successfully  Coordinate activities for the project team, scheduling and facilitating meetings (i.e. kick-offs, internal/client demos, daily standups), while ensuring tasks get completed  Call out risks and remove obstacles enabling the team to do their job efficiently and effectively  Develop, maintain and disseminate all project documentation including status reports, invoices, change request orders, schedules, budgets.  Support Account & Delivery leads ensuring financial and status reporting is accurate and on time.  Contribute to agency delivery processes, seeking always to further optimize how work gets done  Maintain energy and excitement level of team while leading them to self-organize  Have fun! Job_Description: Nous valorisons la diversité et avons à cœur de créer un milieu de travail inclusif qui nous inspire tous à donner le meilleur de nous-mêmes. Joignez-vous à notre équipe et faites une différence!  Votre poste  Nous Comment imaginez-vous les bureaux d’une compagnie d’assurance? Et l’atmosphère de travail qui y règne? Nous gageons que si vous passez nous voir au Lab de Intact, vous serez très surpris! Situé au centre-ville de Montréal, nous sommes un laboratoire d’innovation dont la mission est de créer des produits à la fine-pointe de l’insurtech qui améliorent la vie de millions de Canadiens.  Mariant la convivialité et la vélocité d’une startup aux ressources et aux moyens d’une grande entreprise (vous disposerez de tous les outils dont vous avez toujours rêvé!), le Lab est un environnement jeune et dynamique, offrant des défis stimulants, des collègues inspirants et une carrière passionnante (chez un des top 100 employeurs au Canada). C’est l’endroit idéal pour parfaire vos compétences et faire évoluer votre carrière.  Vous Vous êtes passionné par le commerce électronique et l’innovation numérique? Vous avez un talent particulier pour traduire des exigences complexes en expériences utiles et agréables? Vous restez à l’affût des dernières tendances en matière de design et vous aimez expérimenter de nouveaux outils et de nouvelles méthodologies? Nous avons l’occasion parfaite pour vous!  Rôle À titre de designer UX/UI, vous jouerez un rôle essentiel dans la conception et l’évolution de notre écosystème numérique. Relevant du directeur principal, Innovations numériques, vous aurez comme principales responsabilités :  Concevoir des expériences captivantes en vue de réaliser les objectifs d’affaires  Valider la fonctionnalité et l’utilité par l’entremise de tests et de recherches auprès des utilisateurs  Produire des livrables UX et design pertinents au besoin  Piloter une feuille de route aux côté d’un directeur de produit et d’une équipe agile multidisciplinaire  Présenter le travail aux parties prenantes  Aider les ingénieurs à produire des interfaces de qualité et agréables  Prôner une conception axée sur l’utilisateur et les données  Vos compétences  Minimum trois années d’expérience  Expertise en matière de convivialité et de pratiques de conception centrées sur l'utilisateur  Maîtrise des outils de conception (Sketch, Axure, InVision, Illustrator, etc.)  Expérience des outils de recherche UX (usertesting.com, Optimal Workshop, etc.) un atout  Expérience dans la production de flux de processus, d’inventaires de contenu, etc.  Vous aimez travailler dans un environnement de collaboration qui accorde une importance primordiale au travail d’équipe, à l’innovation, à l’ouverture d’esprit et au plaisir  Veuillez inclure votre portfolio dans votre dossier de candidature.  Vous êtes  Une personne avec qui il est agréable de travailler  Créatif, analytique, curieux et ingénieux  Un joueur d’équipe capable de partager et recevoir des commentaires constructifs  Excellent pour expliquer vos idées à différents intervenants  Profondément passionné par le design et la qualité  Organisé et proactif  En tant que salarié temps plein, vous bénéficierez des avantages suivants :  Un salaire compétitif  Un boni de performance annuel  Un régime de retraite  Un horaire de travail flexible de 35 heures par semaine  Des assurances médicales et dentaires hors pair  Et plusieurs autres avantages et bénéfices (remboursement gym, conférences, etc.)  Énoncé fermeture  Cette opportunité vous intéresse? Nous avons très hâte de faire votre connaissance!  D’excellents avantages sont offerts : salaire concurrentiel, avantages flexibles, aménagements de travail flexibles, congés mobiles, régime de retraite à prestation déterminée, etc.  Dans le cadre du processus de sélection d’Intact, les candidats peuvent être appelés à donner leur consentement à une vérification de leurs antécédents pertinente au poste à pourvoir avant de recevoir une offre d’emploi. Celle-ci peut comprendre une confirmation des références d’emploi, des études et des titres de compétences, une vérification des emplois, de l’identité, des infractions criminelles et du permis de conduire ainsi qu’un rapport de crédit.  Vous pouvez soumettre votre candidature à un emploi affiché pourvu que vous occupiez vos fonctions actuelles depuis au moins douze mois et que votre performance soit jugée bonne ou que votre contrat temporaire arrive à son échéance. Une recherche de talents à l'externe est menée parallèlement au recrutement à l'interne Veuillez donc prendre note que des candidats potentiels pourraient avoir été identifiés pour ce poste dans le cadre de leur plan de développement.   Veuillez noter que l'usage du masculin a comme but d'alléger le texte.  Cet affichage prendra fin 02 juin 2018.  Prime de recommandation  CE POSTE EST SUJET À UNE PRIME DE RECOMMANDATION DE 3000$.  #li-qc  Droit de travailler au Canada  Les personnes qui posent leur candidature à un poste permanent doivent, dès leur embauche, avoir le droit de travailler au Canada de façon permanente. Les documents pouvant servir de preuve dans le cas des rôles permanents sont un certificat de naissance canadien, un passeport canadien, un certificat de citoyenneté canadienne, une carte de résident permanent ou une confirmation de son statut de résident permanent pour prouver qu’il a le droit de travailler au Canada. Job_Description: Our client is currently looking for a Product Marketing Manager to join their rapidly growing team at. You will join a team of elite product managers, developers, UX designers, content creators and data scientists to lead product marketing with a laser focus on product promotion and conversion funnel optimization. You will play a key role in helping some of their major brands be the leading source of web-based content & tools for sophisticated investors. They take pride in the fact that they have a very strong product model - highly targeted and specific to those securities and now are focused on amplifying their value proposition to a broader audience.  You could describe yourself as a hybrid of classical digital marketing & new age growth strategy focused on targeting consumers the right way. You will be skilled at promoting premium subscription models across affiliate sites using interactive content. Your work will reach millions of engaged and discerning users across multiple channels. You’ll have access to the data needed for next level marketing innovations and the support of the entire team. You will be creative, a great communicator, and have excellent problem-solving skills with a strong grasp of digital marketing and proven experience delivering business value via marketing initiatives. Join their team and use your Marketing skills to help people globally achieve financial freedom.  Responsibilities  Work with product managers to shape successful product launches.Develop product positioning, messaging and value proposition for maximum user impact.Be the Product Owner as part of an Agile Scrum process for marketing specific projects.Combine both quantitative (metrics) and qualitative (user feedback) data to optimize conversion funnels.Master their competitive universe, inform their roadmap as appropriate, and provide other team members with messaging and content to stay ahead.Collaborate with the content team to create thought leadership content for their products.Create & schedule engaging email, social media and other marketing channel campaigns that are delivered consistently to their audience.Stay up-to-date with digital marketing trends, new channels, and strategies.  Special Perks: Competitive salaries, upward mobility and an opportunity to grow professionally with the company.Paid GO Train, TTC commuting, and parking spaces.A beautiful loft workspace.Health, dental, and vision.A focused and hungry team of professionals who share the same vision and desire for success.Collaborative work environment built on respect, openness and intellectual honesty.  Must Have Skills: Bachelor’s degree in engineering, computer science or related field.5+ years of professional marketing experience; product management experience considered a plus.The ideal candidate will have experience in a SaaS company driving funnel optimization.Sound funnel optimization understanding and experience driving results.You have launched multiple successful products and/or features.You have optimized conversion funnels and developed new conversion strategies.You have made decisions based on data analysis (i.e. not just reported metrics).Solid understanding of website user flows, UX/UI design and trends, A/B and multivariate testing.Experience using marketing automation tools (social, email, web, etc.), web analytics tools (Google Analytics etc), spreadsheets and HTML/CSS/JS.Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, including communicating with senior management.Excellent listener and capable of asking good questions.Proactive and demonstrate initiative, strong at generating workable ideas.Thrives and succeeds in an entrepreneurial environment. Job_Description: About The Uncomplicated FamilyThe Uncomplicated Family (TUF) is a progressive health innovation company and passionate team who embrace commitment, innovation and compassion to enhance the quality of life for individuals, families and communities who are affected by disabilities. Our teams include: Speech-Language Pathologists, Occupational Therapists, Physiotherapists, Family Support Personnel, Software Developers and Engineers, Researchers, and Psychologists. (Software Development: Teleroo™ Technology).Teleroo™ is an award-winning group of technologies that has resulted in remarkable outcomes for children, families, and practitioners. Title: Full Stack Developer

Job_Description: Located in vibrant downtown Montreal, eXplorance is a rapidly growing software company recognized for its unique workplace culture. Currently, we are looking for a Full Stack Developer to join our dynamic team who thrives in a demanding, fast moving environment.As an eXplorance Full Stack Developer, you will be helping the development team to create innovative world class products. On the front-end, as a full stack web developer, you will use a combination of HTML, CSS, AngularJS, Node.js and JavaScript to build the user interface. On the back-end, you will develop applications, servers, and databases that make up the foundational structure using C#, ASP.NET, Python and SQL.What you will do as our new Full Stack Developer· Implementation of a robust set of services, features, and APIs that will power our web products.· Building secure and reusable code and libraries.· Translation of requirements and technical analysis into visual elements or back-end features.· Validation and correction of upstream technical design.· Understanding of fundamental design principles behind a scalable application.· Ability to implement automated unit testing.· Data migration, transformation, and scripting.· Write technical design and partial architectures.· Responsible of effective code review.· Troubleshooting and product bug correction.· Responsible for some feature demos.· Estimation of features and tasks.· Follow and participate to eXplorance development standards and guidelines.If you answer ‘yes’ to the following, you’d be a great fit for Full Stack Developer position· Web fundamentals like HTML, JavaScript, and CSS· Accessibility guidelines (WCAG)· CSS preprocessors like Sass or LESS· JavaScript frameworks like AngularJS, React, or Ember etc., or JS-based build tools like Grunt, Gulp, and Bower· Libraries like jQuery· Front-end (CSS) frameworks like Foundation or Bootstrap· AJAX· SOAP and REST API knowledge· Experience working with graphic designers and UI/UX requirements· API design and development· CRUD (Create, Read, Update, Delete)· RESTful Services· Passionate about new technologies· Creative, self-motivated, with good interpersonal skills· Ability to work independently & within a team· A problem solver ready for a new challengeJob Type: Full-timeLocation:Montréal, QC
Title: Full Stack Developer

Job_Description: The App DevOps team enables our consumers to experience Canadian tire through new and emerging digital channels. Retail is changing in Canada and Canadian Tire is on the leading edge of this transformation. To us, culture comes first and is based on support and teamwork.  In Winnipeg, we are investing in creative people to build world-leading software to enhance the Canadian Tire retail experience and continue to support and augment them in an evolving industry. We expect our Winnipeg lab to refocus the lens retail is experienced through by revitalizing current applications and cultivate new digital experiences.  Responsibilities: To be a part of the team, you must have experience in building applications with high performance connecting to several backend Web Services exchanging data with complex systems. Strong knowledge of modern best practices for professional software development including secure coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing, and operations. Experience developing native mobile applications connecting to Secured Web Services and familiarity with security standards for API’s, SSL, and Tokens is highly preferred. Design patterns while creating the functionality outlined in the requirement document and convert functional requirements into user interface designs and prototypes, and developed application(s). Work closely with the UI/UX design team to ensure feasibility of implementation of designs  Utilize different languages & web platforms to create scalable web and mobile applications based on business requirements.  Interface with internal project owners, creative team members and developers to ensure that the applications, experiences and websites display and function as expected.  Able to code and develop features that leverage in-app purchases, eCommerce, engaging experiences and social media integration.  Convert Mobile App, Digital Display and Website design specifications (wireframes and mock-ups) into working software.  Provide recommendations and solutions that meet business needs while ensuring an intuitive and best-in-class end user experience.  Play an active role and take ownership of optimization and performance activities for our interactive digital experiences.  Collaborate within the App DevOps team and key stakeholders to incorporate the business requirements based on research informed solutions for both psychological and physical elements that will enhance the customer journey and overall experience  Participate at all phases of the software development life cycle and work with the team via Agile programming practices (such as Scrum or Kanban) to drive team delivery.  Leverage your past experience with version control software, such as Git or Perforce to communicate and enforce sound code control practices within the development team.  Effectively develops and encourages clean, well structured, easily maintainable code bases.  Executes a regular cadence of Code Reviews and shares feedback throughout the team.  Consult on browser capability and rendering to ensure that proposals and development will work on specified platforms.  Experience working with remote data via REST and JSON.  Qualifications: Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Engineering preferred or equivalent Software Development industry experience.  5 years of Web or App development experience.  Holds a passion for client-side development and a strong background in building highly dynamic web apps leveraging a Javascript stack with HTML5, REST, CSS3, jQuery, and working knowledge of Cordova.  Has practical knowledge and experience with Git, Gulp, and Node.JS.  Functional and practical understanding of JavaScript MVC frameworks leveraging Ionic and Angular.  Experience with CSS frameworks and pre-processor’s similar to Bootstrap, Sass or Less.  Development experience on server side JavaScript.  Experienced with software architecture and design patterns.  Adapted to leveraging a Scrum/Agile development methodology and is passionate about optimizing process to keep agility high.  A meticulous eye for detail; finding and correcting the little issues that turn substandard experiences into best-in-class.  Possesses some native programming experience for Android using Android Studio, Android SDK, and related languages (Java).  Knowledge of Android M and N features and differences from prior versions  Experience with testing frameworks, continuous integration and build tools (i.e. jUnit, DBUnit, Jenkins/Hudson)  Proficient in writing automated Unit tests (Jasmine / Karma).  Advanced knowledge of JavaScript Single Page Applications and related tools.  Experience working with Unity 3D game engine is an asset, with a practical understanding of C#, Boo or Python.  Experienced using and automating tests, documentation, builds and deployment.  Large scale application development an asset.  What would success look like: As the successful candidate for the App Developer role on the Canadian Tire App DevOps team you would challenge the norm, push for excellence in everything and always seek discomfort. Everything you do and everything you are responsible for you will be on display for all of our consumers. Life in Canada depends on you and your expertise to make our digital experiences engaging and rewarding.  From the agile path you will be involved from the initial concept through to product delivery and be part of the decisions, direction and all facets that will impact the experiences we bring to Canadians. As a successful Developer you will never stop learning by keeping on top of changes with coding standards such as HTML5, CSS3, and responsive design functions.  In a pinch you fall back on guiding principles whether that be following Stack Overflow blogs, learning how to work directly with the UX designers, UI Developers and team members or spending time creating and refining a well-designed process methodology.If you enjoy looking outside of Web Development and into other areas such as 3D or possess a familiarity with Unity, we would love to hear from you.  Canadian Tire is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace for all. We recognize that our future success depends on the perspectives and contributions of all our employees -- their diverse backgrounds, abilities and experiences make our business stronger. If you are contacted for a job opportunity, please advise us of any accommodations needed to ensure fair and equitable access throughout the recruitment and selection process. All accommodation information provided will be treated as confidential and used only for the purpose of providing an accessible candidate experience.  Information Technology  Manitoba-Winnipeg  Permanent  Full-time  Job Posting  :  May 1, 2018, 1:41:49 PM
Title: Sr. Developer

Job_Description: Job Description  For you, making software is not just about the code, it’s about the user experience and the craft. You love not only to make it work, but you’re ready to mentor your fellow developers to learn to build it themselves. You are curious about this weird AI thing and you’re ready to take control of those robots. The primary responsibilities… Developing and supporting Web Application solutions for external clients Work with your team to transform business requirement into real, working amazing software Help and mentor more Junior developers into learning the many tricks of good sound software design Participate as a full member of an Agile team doing breakdowns, code reviews and have the best fun while building the best software Work our magical UI/UX designer, our Subject Matter Expert, and our PO to translate stories and sublime them through code The challenges... Distributed team: timezones, get used to many Bleeding-edge software in a cutting-edge industry Peta-level, nanosecond pace software and processes What success looks like… High-fives and celebration cake Simple "Thank yous!" and big gestures A customer that wants more of what you build The passionate UI designer that forgets to get their tea, because they're too excited to see it work What makes it rewarding... Working building the future of the networks, so your grandma will be using your code Working with people that are passionate about this stuff, like ‘I will travel the other side of the world to get my point across’ passionate Qualifications  How others describe you... You are passionate, by definition You know how to balance communicating your passion while keeping your emotion valuable as part of the conversation You take pride in refining your craftsmanship every time you can The skills and experience that will help you succeed... 5+ years doing software Strong working knowledge of at least one language framework Love and hate for at least 2 client-side JavaScript framework jQuery, Angular, React, Vue An interest in using the best component library in the world: Kendo UI Experience in leveraging prototyping tools such as InVision Experience in Cloud technology is a plus Experience working in an agile team is a plus such as Scrum, Kanban or Scrumban Strong knowledge of responsive websites Strong skills in using modern software practice and tools such as git, Jenkins, containers Experience with CI/CD pipeline and TDD/BDD/DDD especially applied to front-end Strong expertise in at least 2 languages such as Java, Python, Go-lang, Javascript Additional Information  When applying for the job, take the opportunity to tell us in five sentences or less what makes you the best candidate for this position and for our company, and why B.Yond is a fit for you. Please Note: This job description is not intended to be a complete list of all responsibilities, duties or skills and due to the changing nature of the job is subject to review and change at any time, with or without notice. B.Yond uses E-verify and third party background check services, including drug screening, as part of the hiring process. All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.
Title: Sr. Full Stack Developer

Job_Description: We are looking for a great JavaScript developer who is proficient with React.js. Your primary focus will be on developing user interface components and implementing them following well-known React.js workflows (such as Flux or Redux). You will ensure that these components and the overall application are robust and easy to maintain. You will coordinate with the rest of the team working on different layers of the infrastructure. Therefore, a commitment to collaborative problem solving, sophisticated design, and quality product is important. as a senior web developer your job will be mostly focused on the followings: Developing new user-facing features using React.js Building reusable components and front-end libraries for future use Translating designs and wireframes into high quality code Optimizing components for maximum performance across a vast array of web-capable devices and browsers Duration: Permanent, Full-time Requirements: Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent experience in related field. 8+ years of overall development experience and industry standards. Solid understanding and experience implementing software design patterns. Experience with Agile/scrum development processes and methodologies. Solid understanding of techniques to achieve high quality user experience. Strong proficiency in JavaScript, including DOM manipulation and the JavaScript object model. Thorough understanding of React.js and its core principles. Experience with popular React.js workflows (such as Flux or Redux). Familiarity with newer specifications of EcmaScript. Experience with data structure libraries. (e.g. Immutable.js) Familiarity with RESTful APIs. Knowledge of modern authorization mechanisms, such as JSON Web Token. Familiarity with modern front-end build pipelines and tools. Experience with common front-end development tools such as Babel, Webpack, NPM, etc. Ability to understand business requirements and translate them into technical requirements A knack for benchmarking and optimization Creating automated test suites and ensuring quality in your code Experience in building high quality software with extensive experience in code testing. Must demonstrate flexibility for work hours to meet important customer deliverables and project deadlines. Collaborating with designers, product managers, and your development team to deliver compelling user-facing products and services Additional Skills and Experience: Experience in ReactiveX Programming. Experience in Electron framework. Experience or solid understanding of Test Driven Development (TDD). Experience working in an Agile/Scrum environment, along with Confluence, JIRA, Bitbucket, Slack, and Git. Strong writing and technical communication skills. Knowledge of Linux, NodeJS, other web technologies, and UI/UX standards are a plus. Heroic get-it-done attitude; collaborates well with team members and can take ownership. Experience leading the performance tuning strategy of consumer applications. Understand what it means to be a consultant. Reliable and have a positive attitude. Great interpersonal skills. Ability to handle working on multiple projects or task and keep them all under control. Agile savvy. A desire to learn. Passionate about technology and using it to help solve business issues Strong analytical and problem-solving skills Strong work ethic

Extremely proficient with Objective-C, Swift, native iOS SDK, iOS frameworks, Xcode, and/or Cocoa Touch. Experience developing and consuming RESTful APIs, JSON, and push notifications. Title: Senior iOS App Developer

Job_Description: Job Description  As a member of our team, you will be involved in projects from the ideation and strategy phase all the way through launch and have a say in not just what we build, but how we build. Additionally, you will have the opportunity to contribute to the overall technical direction and project workflow through research and development of new tools and technologies. We are looking for someone with a solid understanding of the fundamentals of web development and the underlying technologies of the web who can easily pick up the technologies we’re working with now and will be working with in the future. Qualifications  Responsibilities Write high quality front-end code in native JavaScript and using libraries like jQuery and React Collaborate with Product Managers and Designers to conceptualize new features in an Agile environment Encourage and implement best practices and workflows Mentor other developers and review code Requirements Strong understanding of HTML, CSS and JavaScript Experience with JavaScript front-end testing and debugging tools Solid understanding of responsive/mobile-first design, web standards, UI/UX best practices Experience working in a cross-discipline environment to produce ideas and prototype early concepts Strong communication skills, a positive attitude You have a user-first mindset and are passionately driven to improve the user experience You work effectively in cross-disciplinary teams to solve technical and customer-related problems Additional Information  Why work at Venture Media? Here are some highlights for you! We are creating many different kinds of solutions that range from e-commerce integrations, building social network platforms to reinventing how the piano is played, digital sound processing and even more. We have a great office in Yaletown that allows for creativity, inspiration, focused development and play, be sure to apply. Our space includes a music room complete with a baby grand piano, ping pong, organic snacks, bike racks, standing/sitting desks, showers and more. We are privately funded and we don’t answer to clients. This is rare in business and it is fun as it allows us to explore and develop what tech we want to develop. Ideas come both from our CEO and our staff via hackathons, competitions and more. Additional Information: Please note that this opportunity is on-site in our Yaletown, downtown Vancouver office and we will only consider candidates based in the Greater Vancouver area or in Canada. We really appreciate all applications and we will contact you if you are selected for an interview.
Title: Sr. Front-End Developer

Job_Description: Job Description Senior Full Stack Cloud Software Developer Ottawa, ON  Why You? As the senior full stack cloud developer you will work as part of an agile continuous delivery team and collaborate with designers, senior developers, operators, project managers, and others to help deliver product capabilities and features (no working on legacy code here!). You will be working to develop new frameworks and scalable infrastructure utilizing technologies such as AWS, MuleSoft, OutSystems, Automation, Docker Containers, NodeJS, Java etc. If you have a passion for development and problem solving this could be the job for you!  What Will You Be Doing? Developing cloud based software applications quickly and with quality Writing code, tests, research and analyse to become an expert in cutting-edge technologies, frameworks, architecture and design You will move fast: look for new ideas, quickly prototype, A/B test, and move to production Working with development and project management teams to define user story acceptance criteria during a sprint, break down complex stories into tasks, and estimate, plan and deliver Interacting with architects, UX, and Ops. Participate in architecture, design, and review meetings Assuming various agile development and DevOps roles as required Stay up-to-date with development trends, cloud technologies, open source, and best practices Collaborate with cross-functional team members on all aspects of development and process Mentor more junior developers, do code reviews, peer programming  What Do We Need From You? While we know you may not have everything to be sucessful in this role you are likely to have; Undergraduate degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or related degree (or equivalent experience in software engineering) 7+ years experience in a similar developer job, developing large-scale web applications and/or large-scale server applications is a must Experience developing large-scale server applications and/or micro-services using several languages and frameworks (Java/JEE, Node.js, PHP, Python, Ruby on Rails, …) Experience developing multiple web client and/or mobile applications using different technologies (JavaScript, React, Angular, Backbone, Bootstrap, Swift, Android, React Native, …) Experience with variety of SQL (PostgreSQL, MySQL, Hibernate/ORM) and/or NoSQL databases (Cassandra, Mongo, RethinkDB, ElasticSearch). Familiarity with DevOps tooling for development (Docker, Vagrant), orchestration (Kubernetes, Google, or AWS cloud) and deployment (Ansible, Puppet, Chef). Experience in production deployments on IaaS (AWS, GCE, Azure, OpenStack) and PaaS (CloudFoundry) a plus Familiarity with Jira or other productivity platform extension development is a plus Experience with Kanban, Scrum and other agile development methodologies Experience leading agile teams and mentoring more junior developers, including students Adept at evaluating open source frameworks, commercial frameworks and technology options Desire to work in a fast paced, deadline driven, start up like environment  What Do You Get in Return? Competitive total rewards packages Why Commute? Work remotely Outstanding people Collaborate with the industry’s top minds Substantial training allowance Hone your skills or learn new ones; participate in professional development days Office Allowance Purchase a device of your choosing and personalise your work environment Fun, fun, fun blog during work hours; take a day off and volunteer for your favorite charity  Why Pythian? Pythian is a global IT services company based in Ottawa, ON, who specializes in designing, implementing, and managing systems that directly contribute to revenue and business success. We help companies adopt disruptive technologies such as advanced analytics, big data, cloud, databases, DevOps and infrastructure management to advance innovation and increase agility. We have continued to expand to offer not just services but also to focus on product development leveraging new and exciting technology that will empower our customers through digital transformation. Pythian is seeking a full stack cloud software developer that will serve as a technical contributor to Pythian's Software-Defined Enterprise (SDE) a team that acts as a hub for innovation within Pythian, who are charged with the research and development of new product offerings. We are looking for developers who consider themselves either specialists in back-end server technologies or UI technologies and/or both. More than just a job we hire people who love what they do!  Intrigued to see what a job is like at Pythian or check us out @Pythian and #pythianlife. Follow @PythianJobs on Twitter and @loveyourdata on Instagram!  Not the right job for you? Check out what other great jobs Pythian has open in Ottawa and around the world! Pythian Careers  Disclaimer For this job an equivalent combination of education and experience, which results in demonstrated ability to apply skills will also be considered Pythian is an equal opportunity employer and welcomes applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. All applicants will need to fulfill the requirements necessary to obtain a background check

Title: Senior Full Stack Developer

Job_Description: At Rogers we’re for supporting you on a journey to a rewarding career. Whether you’re a developer, an analyst, or a customer care consultant, Rogers is the place where ideas become reality. We embrace change, and find ways to do better. And we deliver on that commitment by fostering an environment of passion and innovation for all people.  Imagine working for an exciting entrepreneurial company whose employees are committed to meeting the big challenges and making a real difference. That’s Rogers. A leading communications and media company where people come to do great work. Right now we are looking for talented individuals to join our winning team where you will have a chance to innovate, grow and to do what really matters. This role will be primarily based Downtown but may expand to Brampton office. We are currently seeking unusually talented and highly versatile front-end developers who live and breathe HTML 5, CSS and JavaScript and either love or are willing to try a long term relationship with Angular.js or React.js, with a bit of dabbling in other JavaScript frameworks from time to time. You ideally believe that single page applications are the future of Digital and are eager to work with server side developers to ensure they produce well designed REST services for you to consume. We strongly value deep technical skills, an eye for UI design and UX intuition, willingness to learn, and desire to work in an intensive, highly productive environment.  Primary Function: Develop interactive web applications (in a CMS or single page applications) that include browse, shop and self-service functions and customer friendly capabilities. A key responsibility is to use your creativity to produce highly responsive and enjoyable web-based user interfaces. The customer should never be confused about what is happening or become frustrated because they don’t know what to do next.  Responsibilities include: Creating highly interactive single page applications using Angular 2/4 and React.js that respond to all user actions in fractions of a second Creating attractive experiences in content management that delight and inspire the customer Creating, maintaining, debugging and optimizing JavaScript, HTML and CSS Taking an active role in structuring our single page applications to make them easy to maintain and to ensure they are highly modularized Creating optimized HTML, CSS and JavaScript with breakpoints that work well on mobile browsers Working closely the architects and back end services team to ensure that that we have a useful set of REST services Working closely with UX and UI designers to help them understand the constraints of single page applications and development frameworks so that they produce usable designs  Qualifications A university degree in arts, design, engineering, science, math or computer science is highly desirable Experience in JavaScript, jQuery, CSS 3, and HTML 5 and in optimizing for fast rendering 5+ years experience in building mobile responsive pages with JavaScript frameworks Experience with Social Media APIs (Facebook, Twitter, etc) Development using Scrum Agile methodologies is a plus Demonstrated ability to create single page applications, either through prior experience, school projects or special websites you have built to showcase your skills You truly love to code and build Digital experiences as evidenced by prior projects and experience Strong organizational and estimation skills Exceptional communications and presentation skills Schedule: Full Time Shift: Day Length of Contract: Not Applicable (Regular Position) Work Location: 8200 Dixie Road (101), Brampton, ON Travel Requirements: Up to 10% Posting Category/Function: Technology & Information Technology Requisition ID: 119649 WHY ROGERS? As a proud Canadian company, we're dedicated to making things easier for our customers. We’ve been embracing and leading change for over 50-years, and we’ll continue to seek out new opportunities to bring our customers simple solutions for today and tomorrow. We recognize that success is determined by the strength and diversity of our people. We work together because we want to win together, and these five shared values guide and define our work: Simplify and innovate Take ownership of the what and the how Equip people to succeed Execute with discipline and pride Talk straight, build trust, and over deliver Why Rogers? Because your tomorrow inspires our today. What makes us different makes us stronger. Rogers has a strong commitment to diversity and inclusion. Everyone who applies for a job will be considered. We recognize the business value in creating a workplace where each team member has the tools to reach their full potential. At Rogers, we value the insights and innovation that diverse teams bring to work. We work with our candidates with disabilities throughout the recruitment process to ensure that they have what they need to be at their best. Please reach out to our recruiters and hiring managers to begin a conversation about how we can ensure that you deliver your best work. You can also reach out to our team at RogersRecruiting@rci.rogers.com to begin a conversation about your individual accessibility needs throughout the hiring process. Posting Notes: Information Technology & Engineering || Canada (CA) || ON || Brampton || SF: LI-JL1 ||
Title: Sr. Angular Front End Developer

Job_Description: OVERVIEW LMI developers are a team of doers. We don't hide behind reviews, change control, or validation outside of the team. We expect everyone on the team to understand the impact their changes might have on other teams and the Jive platform as a whole and to consider all aspects of software design on a daily basis. Front-end engineers at Jive have a passion for learning and staying up to date with the latest JavaScript libraries, releases, and frameworks.  This team is responsible for the automated testing, application design, choice of tools, deployment, operation, and life cycle of our applications. Jive builds front-end solutions using technologies such as Angular,JS Angular 2+, webpack, Redux, Observables, WebSockets, WebRTC, and REST. A compelling web-based unified communication experience featuring voice, chat, video, and collaboration capabilities have become critical to enabling Jive to capture and retain customers. RESPONSIBILITIES Design, develop, maintain, and deploy world-class front-end applications Participate in both the technical and UX design of our applications Help us deliver awesome products Participate in the overall decisions on the direction of our front-end technology stack Build shared SDKs, UI framework components, and application logic from top to bottom for the main application your team is responsible for Manage customer requirements against technical debt and added value Mentor other team members and contributing to quality objectives Delivering world class web applications using the latest JavaScript features Collaborate with product owners and user experience designers to deliver features while meeting team deadlines Assist the team with evaluating the adoption of the latest and greatest technologies providing value to our developers and customers QUALIFICATIONS A strong understanding of JavaScript and/or TypeScript A strong understanding of application architecture Experience with application bundling systems A desire to learn and to help others grow Expert level experience in dealing with asynchronous JavaScript An insistence on maintaining the quality of the code base and the customer experience A good understanding of webpack (a plus) A love for Observables (a plus) ES6 knowledge and BabelJS experience (a plus) Experience with Redux and can explain why it’s a great thing (a plus) Hands-on experience with AngularJS or Angular 2+ (a plus) Unit, integration, and end-to-end testing skills (a plus)
Title: Senior Front-end Developer

Job_Description: ONLY CANDIDATES LIVING IN THE MONTREAL AREA SHALL BE CONSIDERED. We're looking for a Senior Front End Web Developer with a passion for going beyond beautiful UI/UX, producing industrial strength secured clinical portals that shall be used by doctors, nurses, care managers and pharmacists worldwide. We've helped to create the current healthcare digital and mobile revolution. We need your help now to push it further and faster!  Tasks/Responsibilities Work on Tactio’s web clinical portal used by care professionals to monitor patients. Work closely with product management, user experience designers and users. Rapidly identify and solve problems proactively. Research and evaluate the latest web industry trends and technologies. Work with other developers to improve and standardize our design and development process. Take responsibility and ownership for the code you deliver. Job Requirements Education: Bachelor’s degree in computer science, engineering or another relevant field. Experience: 5-10 years of relevant experience. Legally entitled to work in Canada. Front-End Proficiency: HTML5, CSS3, JSON, Javascript and other Javascript librairies (Ember.js, AngularJS, jQuery, Bootstrap). Full knowledge of responsive design techniques for desktop, tablets & mobile. A passion for beautiful design, technology, healthcare a plus. Legally entitled to work in Canada. Bilingual: French & English. Good communication skills, spoken and written.
