Job_Description: Nous valorisons la diversité et avons à cœur de créer un milieu de travail inclusif qui nous inspire tous à donner le meilleur de nous-mêmes. Joignez-vous à notre équipe et faites une différence!  Votre poste  Nous Comment imaginez-vous les bureaux d’une compagnie d’assurance? Et l’atmosphère de travail qui y règne? Nous gageons que si vous passez nous voir au Lab de Intact, vous serez très surpris! Situé au centre-ville de Montréal, nous sommes un laboratoire d’innovation dont la mission est de créer des produits à la fine-pointe de l’insurtech qui améliorent la vie de millions de Canadiens.  Mariant la convivialité et la vélocité d’une startup aux ressources et aux moyens d’une grande entreprise (vous disposerez de tous les outils dont vous avez toujours rêvé!), le Lab est un environnement jeune et dynamique, offrant des défis stimulants, des collègues inspirants et une carrière passionnante (chez un des top 100 employeurs au Canada). C’est l’endroit idéal pour parfaire vos compétences et faire évoluer votre carrière.  Vous Vous êtes passionné par le commerce électronique et l’innovation numérique? Vous avez un talent particulier pour traduire des exigences complexes en expériences utiles et agréables? Vous restez à l’affût des dernières tendances en matière de design et vous aimez expérimenter de nouveaux outils et de nouvelles méthodologies? Nous avons l’occasion parfaite pour vous!  Rôle À titre de designer UX/UI, vous jouerez un rôle essentiel dans la conception et l’évolution de notre écosystème numérique. Relevant du directeur principal, Innovations numériques, vous aurez comme principales responsabilités :  Concevoir des expériences captivantes en vue de réaliser les objectifs d’affaires  Valider la fonctionnalité et l’utilité par l’entremise de tests et de recherches auprès des utilisateurs  Produire des livrables UX et design pertinents au besoin  Piloter une feuille de route aux côté d’un directeur de produit et d’une équipe agile multidisciplinaire  Présenter le travail aux parties prenantes  Aider les ingénieurs à produire des interfaces de qualité et agréables  Prôner une conception axée sur l’utilisateur et les données  Vos compétences  Minimum trois années d’expérience  Expertise en matière de convivialité et de pratiques de conception centrées sur l'utilisateur  Maîtrise des outils de conception (Sketch, Axure, InVision, Illustrator, etc.)  Expérience des outils de recherche UX (usertesting.com, Optimal Workshop, etc.) un atout  Expérience dans la production de flux de processus, d’inventaires de contenu, etc.  Vous aimez travailler dans un environnement de collaboration qui accorde une importance primordiale au travail d’équipe, à l’innovation, à l’ouverture d’esprit et au plaisir  Veuillez inclure votre portfolio dans votre dossier de candidature.  Vous êtes  Une personne avec qui il est agréable de travailler  Créatif, analytique, curieux et ingénieux  Un joueur d’équipe capable de partager et recevoir des commentaires constructifs  Excellent pour expliquer vos idées à différents intervenants  Profondément passionné par le design et la qualité  Organisé et proactif  En tant que salarié temps plein, vous bénéficierez des avantages suivants :  Un salaire compétitif  Un boni de performance annuel  Un régime de retraite  Un horaire de travail flexible de 35 heures par semaine  Des assurances médicales et dentaires hors pair  Et plusieurs autres avantages et bénéfices (remboursement gym, conférences, etc.)  Énoncé fermeture  Cette opportunité vous intéresse? Nous avons très hâte de faire votre connaissance!  D’excellents avantages sont offerts : salaire concurrentiel, avantages flexibles, aménagements de travail flexibles, congés mobiles, régime de retraite à prestation déterminée, etc.  Dans le cadre du processus de sélection d’Intact, les candidats peuvent être appelés à donner leur consentement à une vérification de leurs antécédents pertinente au poste à pourvoir avant de recevoir une offre d’emploi. Celle-ci peut comprendre une confirmation des références d’emploi, des études et des titres de compétences, une vérification des emplois, de l’identité, des infractions criminelles et du permis de conduire ainsi qu’un rapport de crédit.  Vous pouvez soumettre votre candidature à un emploi affiché pourvu que vous occupiez vos fonctions actuelles depuis au moins douze mois et que votre performance soit jugée bonne ou que votre contrat temporaire arrive à son échéance. Une recherche de talents à l'externe est menée parallèlement au recrutement à l'interne Veuillez donc prendre note que des candidats potentiels pourraient avoir été identifiés pour ce poste dans le cadre de leur plan de développement.   Veuillez noter que l'usage du masculin a comme but d'alléger le texte.  Cet affichage prendra fin 02 juin 2018.  Prime de recommandation  CE POSTE EST SUJET À UNE PRIME DE RECOMMANDATION DE 3000$.  #li-qc  Droit de travailler au Canada  Les personnes qui posent leur candidature à un poste permanent doivent, dès leur embauche, avoir le droit de travailler au Canada de façon permanente. Les documents pouvant servir de preuve dans le cas des rôles permanents sont un certificat de naissance canadien, un passeport canadien, un certificat de citoyenneté canadienne, une carte de résident permanent ou une confirmation de son statut de résident permanent pour prouver qu’il a le droit de travailler au Canada.  Indeed Commandité  IN-INFR

Document, implement and maintain an efficient, growth-oriented development process (product roadmap, collaborating on business requirements and UI/UX, actual development, QA, deployment) Drive and project-manage ongoing improvements in the frontend and backend of our marketing site, educational platform and other projects Manage relationships with other parties for current development needs and planned scaling of the development work (designers, QA, copywriters, outsourced developers etc) Improve marketing automation and support our marketing experiments (A/B testing etc)   Must Have Skills: Required At least 1- 2 years of web development experience (HTML, CSS, Javascript, PHP etc) At least 2 years of experience with WordPress, its themes and plugins Experience with web design for cross-browser and mobile platforms Experience integrating external systems via APIs Knowledge and experience with efficient software development processes (e.g. Scrum), from design to going live Experience working with remote collaborators (e.g designers) Understanding of usability and security principles for web software Good personal productivity system for dealing with many frequently changing tasks to prioritize and execute Attention to detail. Does not let important details slip through the cracks or derail a project.   Nice to Have Skills: Basic knowledge (and desire to learn more) about blockchain technology Understanding of basic design principles and Photoshop Experience with marketing process automation (e.g. data scraping)  Details: Starting: ASAP
Title: Senior Wordpress Developer

Job_Description: We are seeking for an experienced Product Manager to lead, develop, launch and manage different products for Filmora Video Editor. As a key member of the Product team working closely with in-house developers, marketers and designers, you will be using your outstanding leadership skills and interpersonal skills to ensure our software products can deliver practical solutions to meet our users’ needs.Responsibilities: Define the vision and strategy for multiple software products, develop positioning and strategic roadmap that outlines expend existing markets and enhance user acquisitionWork with product management team and marketing team to establish product feature set & definitions, scope of project and work, timeline and version planningWork closely with smart developers and engineers oversea to deliver features that grow app functionalitiesCollaborate with designers to integrate product UX/UIDemonstrate ownership of both desktop software and mobile app products, stay ahead of industry updates, be aware of new enhancements to existing applications and competing solutionsCoordinates with individuals in other department as needed for quality testing, reviews and associated materialsEager to obtain marketing knowledge and skills to grow into product marketing specialtySkills & Experience: Experience with UUID, internal marketing platform building or business data analysis products highly preferred;5+ years’ progressive experience in product management, B2C desktop software and mobile app technology industry preferred;Keen eye for product feature design and sensitive to user retention;Passionate about video editing, photography or YouTube community engagement;Able to adapt to fast-pace work environment;Strong communication skills, able to present complex workflow and collaborate with multiple teams oversea.About Wondershare & FilmoraWe at Wondershare create an array of simple software solutions for life’s everyday challenges. Hence our motto: Bring simple to life. Since our inception in 2003, we’ve been serving millions of customers in over 150 countries with commitment to providing software that brings simplicity to people's lives. We are transforming the way people work, share, learn and engage using software technology – and doing it all in a highly collaborative and endlessly exciting environment.Filmora and its line of related products make advanced video editing accessible to users at any skill level. Working with Team Filmora, you are going to dive in a fun and rewarding workplace where your teammates will never hesitate to share awesome ideas and support with each other! If you are curious about further details about what Filmora does, please visit www.filmora.wondershare.com for more information!Thank you for your interest in the position. Only shortlisted applicants will be contacted.Job Type: Full-timeExperience:Product Management: 5 yearsEducation:Bachelor's
Title: Senior Product Manager

Job_Description: Notre client est le plus grand concepteur et distributeur de systèmes de sécurité et démarreurs à distance pour véhicules de particuliers en Amérique du Nord. Il conçoit, développe et commercialise des solutions de télématique qui permettent le contrôle et l’interaction à distance avec les véhicules.  Vous désirez travailler sur l’art du « Connected car » et les solutions IoT (Internet des objets). Joignez-vous à nous pour faire partie de l'aventure en tant que Développeur Sr. de logiciels front-end de l'équipe télématique ! L'équipe est responsable de développer des applications de types Nuage et IoT, et la plate-forme de messagerie. Dans un environnement en mode Agile, l’équipe logiciel est en constante évolution améliorant les méthodologies et l'environnement de travail.  Relevant du Chef d’équipe du développement des logiciels télématiques, vous devrez concevoir, développer et faire évoluer les services télématiques visant à évaluer le comportement de conducteurs d’automobiles. Les solutions sont composées d’équipements spécialisés dans les automobiles, d’apps sur téléphone intelligents et de systèmes back-end. Votre expérience en développement d’applications vous aidera à être un membre actif au développement de solutions, plus précisément au niveau du front-end.  Vos principales responsabilités seront :  Participer aux définitions des exigences pour les solutions web et UI pour les produits télématiques Fournir une analyse pour les solutions Assurer la facilité d'utilisation, la facilité de support, la robustesse, l'évolution et la sécurité des fonctionnalités : des éléments clés pour les solutions de conception recommandées Développer et coder les solutions web et UI Collaborer avec les autres membres de l’équipe (Mobile, Interface, Embarqué, Test, TI et Marketing) and nos partenaires externes lorsque requis Travailler dans un environnement en mode Agile-Sprint Participer à notre philosophie d’amélioration continue  Qualifications :  Baccalauréat en génie informatique ou équivalent Dix (10) années d’expérience en développement d’applications web Minimum d’une (1) année d’expérience en développement d’applications avec Angular 2 Expérience avec les technologies de cartographie UI (Google, etc.) Expérience avec les conceptions UI/UX Excellentes aptitudes en communication orale et écrite, français et anglais  Atouts :  Expérience en intégration de la télématique à haute disponibilité 24X7 ou des services IoT pour véhicules Expérience avec les technologies basées sur Java o Architectures de micro-service incluant Spring Boot, Spring REST & Spring JPA o Développement d’application web avec Angular 4 et PrimeNG Expérience au niveau de la conceptualisation de systèmes utilisant des services Web (REST, SOAP, XML/JSON) Expérience au niveau de la plate-forme de messagerie télématique de véhicules (traitement des messages GPS, traitement des alertes, configuration de l'appareil OTA) Expérience en technologie des services web Amazon incluant EC2, ECS, RDS, DynamoDB, CloudWatch Expérience en déploiement de l’application Docker et de la gestion du contenu Connaissances de Target Process ou Jira, Confluence, SVN/Git, Jenkins Expérience avec les technologies Microsoft, un atout (ASP.NET, IIS, C#, Visual Studio, MSSQL, etc.) Expérience avec Linux, un atout  -  Our client is the largest designer and marketer in North America of consumer-branded vehicle security and remote start systems. They are designing, developing and promoting telematics solutions targeting the consumer market and the car insurance business.  You want to work on state of the art connected car and IoT solutions. Join us and be part of the adventure as a Sr. Frontend Software Developer of the Telematics team! The team is responsible to develop cloud base and IoT applications, and messaging platform. In an Agile environment, the software group is in constant mutation improving methodologies and working environment.  Reporting to the Team-Lead of the Telematics Software development, you will design, develop and evolve end-to-end telematics services used to assess end-users’ driving behavior and more. The solutions are composed of in-car devices, smartphone apps and backend systems. Your web side developer background will help you taking an active part in the development process specifically in the frontend.  Your main responsibilities are:  Participate in the business requirement definitions for web and UI solutions for telematics products Provide functional analysis for the solutions Ensure feature ease-of-use, ease-of-support, robustness, scalability and security, key ingredients to the recommended design solutions Develop and code web and UI solutions Collaborate with other teams (Mobile, Interface, Embedded, Test, IT Team and Marketing) and outsourced partners when required Work in an Agile-Sprint environment Participate in the Continuous Improvement philosophy  Qualifications:  Bachelor’s degree in computer science or equivalent 10 years of professional experiences in web application development 1 year + of experience with Angular 2 application development Experience with UI mapping technologies (Google, etc) Experience in UI/UX design Excellent communication verbal/written skills (English and French)  Assets:  Experience in integration of 24X7 high-availability vehicle telematics or IoT services Experience with Java based technologies o Micro service architectures including Spring Boot, Spring REST & Spring JPA o Thick client web application development with Angular 4 and PrimeNG  Experience with designing systems using web services (REST, SOAP, XML/JSON) Experience with vehicle telematics messaging platform (GPS message processing, alert processing, OTA device configuration) Experience with amazon Web Services technologies including EC2, ECS, RDS, DynamoDB, CloudWatch Experience with docker application deployment and container management Knowledge of those tools: Target Process or Jira, Confluence, SVN/Git, Jenkins Asset experience with Microsoft technologies (ASP.NET, IIS, C#, Visual Studio, MSSQL, etc.) Asset experience with Linux
Title: DÉVELOPPEUR FRONT-END SENIOR

Job_Description: Our client is seeking a hands-on technical Team Lead to join our Agile team tasked with designing, implementing and supporting products on our Edu-tech platform.  From their launch in Sep 2016, they have already scaled to over a million monthly visitors and have over 100,000 members daily. Our client is located in Toronto in a beautiful 6 thousand square foot headquarter and have one the best teams in the industry.  Our client’s mission at is to educate over 10,000 developers a year in blockchain to accelerate the ecosystem.  Do you have what it takes to execute a variety of technology projects in a collaborative, ultra fast-paced, egoless environment? Are you able to learn quickly and absorb new information? Are you able to act without being told what to do and bring new ideas to the team?  What you'll bring to the team An attitude where no technical challenge is too greatAbility to provide direction and mentoring to an experienced software development team utilizing Agile/SCRUM techniquesAbility to communicate and collaborate cross-functionally, and work well with a team-oriented environment2-5+ years of demonstrated success delivering productsDemonstrated experience building responsive web applications utilizing AngularDemonstrated knowledge of testable application design principles utilizing a unit test frameworkExperience with SQL and/or NoSQL databasesExperience working with Amazon Web Services (AWS) as a platform and CI tooling, desired The job’s mission is based on 2 pillars: Lead the development team (currently 3 engineers and 1 UX designer, and growing)Maintain and constantly improve reliable and healthy SDLC processes to efficiently fulfill our organization’s purpose Key outcomes (6 months time-frame) Thoroughly understand Our client business, it’s key drivers and supporting metricsTake over the development of the Our client WordPress-based community websiteReview and refine existing functionality and implement changes and enhancements as required.Document, implement and maintain an efficient, growth-oriented development process (product roadmap, collaborating on business requirements and UI/UX, actual development, QA, deployment)Drive and project-manage ongoing improvements in the frontend and backend of our marketing site, educational platform and other projectsManage relationships with other parties for our current development needs and planned scaling of the development work (designers, QA, copywriters, offshore developers)Improve our marketing automation and support our marketing experiments (A/B testing) What’s in it for you? Be at the forefront of an exciting, fast-paced, and hyper-growth industryOpen PTO: Work-life balance is important. We believe in giving our employees time to truly relax and recharge.Minimal Bureaucracy: An entrepreneurial environment of ownership and accountability allows you to get work done.Forge new relationships and connections with global leaders in the blockchain industryYou’ll learn more than you thought was possible; our team is obsessed with personal and professional growth.Opportunity to learn from experienced entrepreneurs who started multiple seven figure businesses.Freedom to plan, implement and lead the development of the technology platform  Must Have Skills: At least 3 years of full stack web development experience (HTML, CSS, Javascript, PHP, Ruby, etc)React, Node, Express, MongoDB, PostgreSQL and AWS/HerokuHands-on experience with building cloud deployment environment (Rackspace, AWS), version control (Git) and QA processes (automation, regression, UAT)Experience with web design for cross-browser and mobile platformsExperience integrating external systems via APIsKnowledge and experience with efficient software development processes (e.g. Scrum), from design to going liveExperience working with distributed cross-functional teamsGood personal productivity system for dealing with many frequently changing tasks to prioritize and execute  Nice to Have Skills: Basic knowledge (and desire to learn more) about blockchain technologyUnderstanding of basic UX principles and Photoshop  Details: Starting: ASAP
Title: Full Stack Developer

Job_Description: DEVELOPPEUR D’APPLICATIONS DIGITALES (FULL STACK) / FULL STACK APP DEVELOPER Job Description (English will follow) Collaborer étroitement avec le concepteur de l'interface et de l'expérience utilisateur et avec les programmeurs de l'interface utilisateur ainsi qu'avec les développeurs des autres disciplines afin d'élaborer le contenu du poste d'instruction. Participer à l’analyse, à la conception, à la programmation, à la validation, à l’intégration et à la mise au point de la plateforme de simulation et de l’interface-usager (GUI) sur les simulateurs et les applications complémentaires pour le cycle de vie de l'instruction. Le développement est exécuté avec des méthodes agiles (SCRUM). Collaborer étroitement avec les divers groupes de notre client Documenter les divers processus conformément aux politiques de notre client. Exigences: Baccalauréat en génie électrique, en génie informatique en génie logiciel, ou en informatique. Une maîtrise constitue un atout. Expérience en programmation orienté-objet, UML, C++, C#, and .NET et l’environnement MS Windows. Expertise en le développement d’interface usager complexe. Connaissance approfondie de .NET (WPF/WCF). Connaissances sur les principes architecturaux SOA. Capacité à travailler en équipe, bonnes aptitudes à communiquer et intérêt marqué pour le développement applicatif interagissant avec diverse source de données (simulation, BD, fichier). Intérêt dans la modélisation et les systèmes de simulation en temps réel constitue un atout. Doit être disposé à voyager à l’étranger.  Veuillez envoyer votre CV à ShaneB@experis-veritaaq.ca Work closely with UI/Ux Designer/artist and UI programmers, as well as developers from other disciplines, to develop instruction station content. Participate in the analysis, design, coding, testing, validation, integration of the simulation platform and the associated user interface (GUI) on simulators and for complementary applications used in the training life cycle. Development done with agile methodology (SCRUM). Work closely with various groups of our client Provide technical support for existing models. Document various processes in accordance with our client’s policy. Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, Software Engineering, or Computer Science. A Master’s degree is an asset. Experience with object-oriented, UML, C++, C#, and .NET and MS Windows environment. Expertise in development of complex Graphical User Interface. In-depth knowledge of .NET (WPF/WCF). Knowledge on the architectural principal of SOA. Ability to work as part of a team, good communication skills along with a keen interest in application development interacting with diverse data source (simulation distributed system, DB, file). Keen interest in real-time modelling and simulation systems is an asset. Travelling outside the country may be required.  Please send your CV to ShaneB@experis-veritaaq.ca We thank you for your application, however, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.  Nous vous remercions d’avoir posé votre candidature et désirons préciser que nous ne communiquerons qu’avec les candidats sélectionnés pour une entrevue.  About Experis-Veritaaq  Experis-Veritaaq is a leading IT consulting firm helping organizations achieve their business goals by leveraging information technology. With more than 30 years of experience, Experis-Veritaaq has a proven track record of building trusted relationships while providing the highest level of IT consulting.  Headquartered in Ottawa, Ontario, with offices in Toronto, Vancouver, Montreal, and Calgary, our team includes more than 750 highly specialized consultants. Experis-Veritaaq works with top clients in the telecommunications, financial, and oil and gas sectors and also serves all levels of government.  To learn more about us, visit our website at www.experis-veritaaq.ca.  À propos de Experis-Veritaaq  Experis-Veritaaq est un important cabinet-conseil en technologies de l'information, véritable levier qui aide les organisations à atteindre leurs objectifs commerciaux. Fort d'une expérience de plus de 30 ans, Experis-Veritaaq a fait ses preuves en tissant des liens solides et en fournissant des conseils de grande qualité dans le domaine des technologies de l'information.  Experis-Veritaaq a son siège social à Ottawa, en Ontario, et des bureaux à Toronto, Vancouver, Montréal et Calgary. Son équipe compte plus de 750 experts. Experis-Veritaaq sert de gros clients en télécommunications, finance et secteurs gazier et pétrolier, mais également plusieurs échelons de gouvernement.  Pour en savoir plus, consultez notre site Web www.experis-veritaaq.ca.
Title: Full Stack Developer

Job_Description: Job Description Job Summary:  Collaborative, assertive, flexible, passionate, driven, inspired. These aren’t just nice words, they’re the start of every great Fluidigm career.  We are a growing community of thinkers and creators, dedicated to pursuing the fundamental truths of biology. We seek to empower and inspire our customers and each other to push limits and envision ever more creative answers to “what if…?” As the industry pioneer and leader in revolutionary single-cell technology, we are committed to enabling biological exploration at every level.  And if you’re into all that too, we’re ready to commit to you.  Fluidigm is looking for a highly-motivated Senior Software Developer with strong UI development experience, to help revamp the user experience of our cutting-edge scientific software products. This is a full-time position in Markham, ON, Canada.  About You  You love code. You love to take novel ideas and build great products with C# and .NET. You know WPF is imperfect, but you embrace its positives and genuinely enjoy coding in it. At the end of the day, your passion is to write clean, simple code and ship new products and features (or improve existing ones).  You love great UX. You spend most of your time coding, but you also have an eye for great design and a feel for great UX. Maybe you were once a designer (or still are) or maybe your creative outlet has always been the code. Either way, great UX is of monumental importance to you.  You love learning new things. You love playing with new tech. Your focus is on front end .NET code, but you can dig in wherever needed. Back end, SQL Server, build tools, you name it. If you don’t already know it, you’re ready to learn it.  You can balance lots of concerns. As a front end dev you’ll need to take into account product performance (which integrates with hardware, drivers and devices that we can’t fully control), customer needs, UX research, code quality, and the list goes on. And we actually want to ship things too! You can balance those demands without getting overwhelmed, and keep the needle moving forward.  You love helping others. You love sharing knowledge with the rest of your team, the broader Fluidigm community, and directly helping customers.  Essential Duties and Responsibilities:  Take our software UI to the next level. Lead UI development efforts on our next .NET desktop product, and implement a delightful new UI with powerful customer-facing features Translate design into code. Work closely with UX designer, scientists, biologists, product managers and end users to understand their needs, implement intuitive UI, seek feedback, and iterate Develop features with strong attention to detail. You will be responsible for pixel-perfect implementation of designs Educate internal stakeholders on UI best practices and communicate trade-offs between feature richness, usability and development effort Progressively modernize our .NET code base and introduce features at a pace appropriate to technical and marketing needs Contribute to the architecture, design, and development of our applications Switch comfortably between front end and back end development work. Over time you should expect to become very familiar with the back end code Perform various design, development, documentation, and debugging tasks with other developers Take ownership of UI and other parts of the code and oversee their maintainability and technical quality When needed, produce architecture documents, feature requirement and design documents  Minimum Qualifications:  8+ years of .NET software development experience 4+ years of UI dev experience, with strong familiarity of latest web, mobile and desktop UI design trends Bachelor’s / Master’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or a related field Strong development skills in C#, .NET framework (3.5 – 4.7) and C++ for desktop applications Strong knowledge of WPF, MVVM, XAML, WinForms, user control design, XML, LINQ, GUI data binding, typed datasets, SQL Server, TSQL, and SSRS Practical experience applying different architectural patterns and styles (e.g., N-Tier or Plugin architecture). Strong background in asynchronous programming patterns and event driven applications. Experience with Agile Scrum methodology, unit testing (e.g. NUnit), code repositories (e.g., Git, VSTFS), coding standards, code reviews, team tools (e.g., JIRA, Slack), and software testing Excellent interpersonal and communication skills Excellent practical judgement. When facing hard problems you should know when to amp up efforts and when to suggest easier alternatives Genuine interest in the Fluidigm mission of helping researchers make the next breakthrough in medical research Nice-to-haves:  Post-secondary education background in Biology, Chemistry or Physics Experience working with mass spectrometry, flow cytometry, microscopy or similar scientific products Working knowledge of digital imaging and digital signal processing Experience with hardware integration and hardware communication protocols (e.g., USB, TCP/IP, RS232) Experience with WIX installer projects Experience working within a medical device environment (e.g., ISO 13485, IEC 62304) We Will: Value your contribution, enlist your feedback, and support you in your ongoing development and contribution both as an employee and a person Provide you with a fun, modern, sun-filled work environment in Markham, Ontario, near Rouge River walking trails and just 5 minutes drive off of Highway 404 Host excellent company-wide events multiple times a year Offer onsite yoga classes, espresso and fruits, ping pong and foosball tables, board games, samosa socials, walking and running clubs, an outstanding working environment and, seriously, a lot more How to Apply:  For this position, please submit: Your resume and cover letter Screenshot examples of UI you’ve implemented (if available) Answers to the following questions: What are some examples of great software UI that you admire today? How do they elevate the user experience? What is one change you’d make about them? Anything else that will let us know more about your skills and experiences that you’d be willing to share, ie. your GitHub, Twitter, blog, Behance, Dribbble, etc.  The Company is committed to providing an inclusive and barrier free recruitment process to applicants with accessibility needs in accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA). If you require an accommodation during this process, please inform The Company of your requirements. We are an equal opportunity employer.
Title: Sr. UI Software Developer

Job_Description: Arobas Personnel is looking, for one of its clients, for a senior frontend developer for a full-time position in Montréal. Do you want to be part of a team that's building applications and services that will revolutionize the management experience in thousands of apartments worldwide? Do you want to help to shape the future of real estate property management as well as communication? Do you want to be part of a team with a startup and a hackathon culture? As a senior Front-End Developer, you will be responsible for all front-end architecture/implementation and be a key player across all areas of the engineering lifecycle, including eliciting requirements from customers, de ning the feature with UI designers and product managers, building the experience by writing the code, shipping it with quality and on time, and sustaining it through its maturity. The candidate should have strong communication skills, both written and verbal. We also expect the candidate to display a bias for action in implementing new disruptive ideas, show a desire to make our team better, and to learn and adapt quickly. The project is built using the following technical architecture: ReactJS / ReduxES6+CSS / HTML Duties/Responsibilities Build modern front-end solution with best practicesBuild reusable front-end code and libraries for future useEnsure the technical feasibility of proposed UI/UX designsParticipate in stress tests, load tests, performance tests, making recommendations to improve performance and scalabilityPrepare software packages and documentation for deployment that adhere to the de ned standard deployment policiesBe highly responsive to critical production issues providing timely and effective solutionsCollaborate and able to lead, help team members in the development life cycle Required Skills & Experience At least 4 years of hands on experience in front end web developmentDeep experience with front-end architecture, packing, best practices, dev processDeep experience with JavaScript and JavaScript frameworks, e.g. jQuery, React, Node.js, KnockoutJS, BackboneJS, etc.Up to date knowledge of current Web UI best practices and usability conceptsExpert level (or at least) strong working knowledge of current HTML/CSSExtensive understanding of asynchronous AJAX processes, communication with back-end via WebAPI/jsonExtensive understanding of web securityExtensive understanding of front-end routingDeep experience with DOMKnowledge of design patterns (MVC, Strategy, Factory, Singleton) and general design considerationsExcellent communication (verbal/written) including the ability to distill technical details into human terms Experience Pluses Previous development experience using SQL serverExperience with Cloud like: Azure, AWS
Title: Senior Frontend Developer

Job_Description: Mobile Producer – Montreal  TouchTunes is the largest in-venue interactive music and entertainment platform, featured in over 75,000 bars and restaurants across North America and Europe. Our network supports a growing portfolio of location-based digital solutions. We aim to create and deliver engaging music and media experiences worldwide in order to inspire emotional connections in shared spaces. In 2017 TouchTunes merged with PlayNetwork! Together we’ve created a global market leader for music and media services, with boundless opportunities for our team members to learn, contribute and grow. We’re entrepreneurs, engineers, designers, marketers, creatives and visionaries. We are guided by our core values that serve as a compass for how we act and guide our approach to every aspect of our business every day. We are passionate about developing exciting and engaging products that impact consumers and generate emotional connections across our network of over 185,000 stores, restaurants, bars and other social spaces around the world.  TouchTunes is looking for a battle-tested Producer to lead the our mobile app to new heights in 2018. TouchTunes’ mobile app is already one of TouchTunes’ primary growth levers and an essential element of the TouchTunes ecosystem: This is a great opportunity to work closely with our outstanding Product Management and Development teams to plan and execute the business strategy and evolution of the Mobile App.  Responsibilities: Create and track schedules for software analysis, development, testing and delivery Manage the daily tracking of all development activities Host regular sprint activities like planning and retrospectives Help communicate roadblocks that may prevent developers and / or other TouchTunes teams from achieving established goals in the allotted time Create and maintain "up to date" detailed Jira tickets associated with development tasks Provide information to ensure that project goals, objectives, milestones and deliverables are achieved Communicate frequently with the product and development teams on project status, risks, and opportunities Required Qualifications: The Mobile Producer must bring with them a proven track record of charismatic leadership, technical expertise and business acumen. Bachelors of Art or Science (or equivalent) plus 5 to 10 years of experience in project and team management, including working closely with other teams within an software development organization (Product, QA, Marketing, Sales, etc.…) Prior Scrum Master experience Substantial technical expertise in mobile app development and online UI/UX design Strong understanding of client/server relationships, in order to work with the Platform Team in Montreal that develops TouchTunes’ APIs Mastery of the Agile development environment and the ability to handle the frequent changes it entails.   Required Skills/Competencies:  Able to communicate effectively with programming, test, IT, analysts and architecture personnel Able to facilitate for and communicate with other TouchTunes groups (e.g. Jukebox, Mobile, Touchtunes TV, B2B, International teams, etc.) Exceptional oral and written communications skills Exceptional attention to detail Proven experience managing schedules and employees to achieve desired results Leads by example and exemplifies the company’s Core Values in actions and behaviors   Preferences: Experience with consumer-centric products and/or game development is a plus. Bilingual (English/French)   Work Requirements: Must be legally authorized to work in Canada Ability to perform primarily sedentary work, sitting or standing, frequently using a computer (visual acuity, fine motor skills) and telephone (talking/hearing) Critical thinking — using logic and reasoning to identify the strengths and weaknesses of alternative solutions, conclusions or approaches to problems Coordination — adjusting actions in relation to others' actions Monitoring — monitoring/assessing performance of yourself, other individuals, or organizations to make improvements or take corrective action Reading comprehension — Understanding written sentences and paragraphs in work related documents Speaking — talking to others to convey information effectively
Title: Producer (Software Project Manager) - Montreal

Job_Description: Who You Are…  You're an experienced Software Developer, with more than 5 years of web application development experience, who has experience designing system architectures, including microservices and service-oriented architectures. You're comfortable collaborating in small teams to design, build and ship high-quality software and experienced in iterating in an agile fashion. You have knowledge of issues related to building Cloud infrastructures and have prior hands-on experience in developing and deploying Microservices solutions on Cloud infrastructure.  You’re comfortable working closely with designers and outside stakeholders to build both awesome UI/UX components and systems, as well as backend services and APIs that can process millions of request per day. You have experience liaising and collaborating with other departments in determining requirements and specifications.  You love to coach, lead and nurture the development of more junior developers while sharing your knowledge within the team along with the broader technical community, all the while shaping our software development culture by improving our processes and codebases.  You want to join us in using exciting new technologies to build the next generation of one of the most visible, and prominently placed components of the Hootsuite product. You are super smart and have a Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or Engineering, or have equivalent work experience.  Read about some of the things we're doing here: http://code.hootsuite.com  You’re Great At…   Building high-volume, highly available, and distributed server applications, hence you have a portfolio of web apps you’ve played a key role in shipping Building microservices in Go and have experience with container and orchestration technologies such as Docker, Mesos, Kubernetes Experience with event-based and message-driven distributed system Working with Big Data, utilizing SQL and noSQL databases, data warehouse technologies, and familiarity with data lakes and data marts. Working with REST APIs (bonus if you’ve worked with Twitter or Facebook APIs) Creating automated test suites and ensuring quality in your code Optimizing and applying best practices  Bonus Points…   Interest in startups and passion for social media Drive to succeed in a fast pace and continuously evolving environment You have open source contributions or personal projects you’ve shipped successfully  Hootsuite is an inclusive employer. Every effort will be made to provide accommodations requested by candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.  #LI-TG1
Title: Senior Software Developer

Job_Description: As one of the fastest growing companies in BC and Deloitte’s 2016 Technology Fast 500™ in North America, PDFTron is an industry-leading provider of document processing technology that powers everything from traditional desktop software (like AutoCAD), to web apps (like DocuSign), and mobile apps (like Xodo). We are actively changing the way people work with documents by being the graphics engine of choice for thousands of companies world-wide, within virtually all industry verticals. If you are working with documents, there is a chance that PDFTron is already working for you. We foster an atmosphere of opportunity, growth, and success for every single individual amidst an exciting, challenging and entrepreneurial culture where career progression is based on merit, not tenure. Guided by a clear company vision, every member of our vibrant team is empowered to be a contributor, innovator and successful leader. We are looking for a talented iOS Software Developer to join our mobile development team. You will be contributing to the iOS offering of our leading PDF and Office SDKs, used by tens of millions of people around the world. As an iOS developer in our company, you will not just be involved in all aspects of the software development process, but also be encouraged to provide input on future projects, code processes and company direction. You will also be making heavy use of the latest & greatest technologies, so a craving for learning new things is a must. Responsibilities Improving and maintaining the iOS version of our PDF and Office SDK. Design and develop sample code and contribute to technical documentation. Interact with customers who seek solutions to their inquiries. Assist and collaborate with other developers, and designers and product managers. Qualifications A degree in computer science, computer/software engineering or equivalent. 2+ years’ experience developing complex software. 1+ years of native iOS development, in Objective-C or Swift (and are happy to use both). Have contributed to an app that has been published in the App Store. Ability to write clear and concise documentation, for both APIs and product overview/tutorial materials. Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, both written and verbal. Ability to work effectively on assignments through correct prioritization and management of tasks in order to ensure high-quality deliverables at each stage of the project. Comfortable working independently, as well as part of a fast-paced and collaborative team environment. Assets An appreciation of great UX, and familiarity with iOS UI norms and Apple’s HIG. Experience developing clean, clear APIs with accompanying documentation for use by external developers. A strong interest in the mobile development landscape, emerging trends and new technologies. Knowledge of C++, Android development and/or JavaScript. Entrepreneurial. Fun to be around. What We Offer Competitive salary commensurate with experience & qualifications. A generous extended benefits package. A great team environment and resources, supporting you to do the best work of your life and providing unlimited career growth potential. Highly autonomous environment. Excellent work-life balance. Convenient location in downtown Vancouver, close to rapid transit. Diverse and inclusive workplace where we all learn from each other. Sound Interesting? To apply please send your resume to jobs@pdftron.com. Emailing a demo of your projects/programs or a link to a blog/website showcasing your work and programming skills/interests along with your application will be a definite bonus. Please note that due to the high volume of applications received only short-listed candidates will be contacted. We thank you for your interest in PDFTron and encourage you to constantly check our website for a list of all current opportunities.
Title: iOS Software Developer

Job_Description: Blueprint provides industry-leading software solutions that help large organizations build better business applications. Our products - Blueprint Storyteller for Agile, Blueprint Automate for DevOps and Blueprint RegTech for Compliance – resolve many of the time-consuming, costly, and error-prone challenges that IT organizations face when driving digital transformation for their businesses.  We ensure that large-scale mission critical projects are completed successfully, on time and on budget. Organizations across the globe use Blueprint solutions to better align IT with their business by ensuring regulatory compliance, speeding transition to Agile, and automating their end to end BizDevOps toolchain. Nearly half of all Fortune 100 companies choose Blueprint to de-risk and accelerate their software projects.  We work as a team to deliver an outstanding, reliable and scalable solution. We rely on a group of brilliant, motivated engineers that understand that “getting it right” means working hard, taking ownership and depending on the other smart people on their team. We follow an agile process and use the latest Microsoft development tools and platform technologies.  As a member of the development team, you will take significant ownership of a feature area, including: Developing and maintaining high-quality client software using Angular and TypeScript Working with other like-minded high performers within an Agile environment Working with Product Managers and UI/UX Designers to refine scope Working with others on architecture and system design Writing unit tests and automation tests to prevent regressions Occasionally assisting with the investigation and resolution of support issues Using your experience to contribute to the continuous improvement of our processes and culture As a Fullstack Developer, you will have: A degree in computer science, math, engineering or equivalent technical discipline At least 5 years commercial software development experience Some experience shipping commercial enterprise software using an Agile methodology A proficient understanding of distributed version control tools and source control strategies A commitment to excellent work and a tangible passion for software development Excellent knowledge of modern web development standards, JavaScript frameworks, and libraries Expertise in T-SQL, C#, HTML5, CSS, and Angular Expertise with modern ORM solutions Excellent communications skills As a member of our dynamic team, it would be an asset if you had: Familiarity with TypeScript Familiarity with GitHub Familiarity with Application Security Familiarity with Silverlight Familiarity with mobile technologies and responsive design Familiarity with Dapper ORM And if you are an open source contributor – we’d love to see your GitHub profile and examples of your work.  If you thrive on working in a dynamic and exciting environment then this is the role for you! We offer a competitive salary and benefits package coupled with a casual and fast paced work environment.  We strive to meet the accommodation needs of persons with disabilities. Applicants are encouraged to make their needs for accommodation known in advance during the application process.
Title: Full Stack Developer

Job_Description: A little information on our client: By helping some of the worlds largest organizations to manage millions of fleet and fixed assets in over fifty countries, we enable them to mine mission-critical data and ultimately help them to reduce their carbon footprint.  About their culture and work environment: Our diverse and deeply knowledgeable team loves solving problems for our customers, and enjoys a great work-life balance, including team events such as BBQs and ski days, and initiatives that support our local community.  Ongoing learning and knowledge sharing are a big part of our workplace culture with opportunities to develop a wide range of professional skills. Learning support is tailored to suit individual needs and includes industry events, mentoring, resources for self-study, and a first-class rewards program for industry certifications.  Location  Our northwest GTA location is easily accessed from 427, 401, 400, and 407 as well as by public transit. Free parking is available for all team members!  About the Role  Being a Senior Developer on our team means working on incredible projects, mastering your craft, and working on a product team with some of the most talented people in the industry. The mobile product team is a friendly, collaborative group of people working together to develop a suite of mobile web applications for our customers. Our team is passionate about solving complex business problems using Agile methodologies and paired development.  Our growing development team is looking for a Javascript Developer to join our product team. You need to be able to mentor developers, identify problems, perform research, explore proof of concepts, and code functional, clean code. We are looking for an individual who has experience with web applications, Angular, agile frameworks, and HTML/CSS/SASS/LESS. These are all critical aspects of this role and will be a part of your everyday workflow.  What You Will Do   Bring designs to life by using cutting-edge technologies and techniques. Work closely with developers and QA analysts across the project teams to implement clean, maintainable, and testable code. Contribute to our agile process by collaborating closely with the scrum master and product owner to encourage and motivate our team. Collaborate with our UX design team to maintain consistency across our applications and iterate on design concepts to improve the user experience. Be a critical thinker who helps drive efficiencies by identifying process improvement opportunities that help our team communicate, innovate, and collaborate better. Bring a passion for encouraging the best possible DevOps by staying ahead of the latest tools, trends, technologies, and methodologies. Contribute to our open-minded team culture by graciously giving and receiving constructive feedback. Create smart UI components for high performance, scalable web applications. Be a mentor for junior and intermediate developers and encourage their career growth.  Requirements and Skills   Post-secondary education in computer science, engineering, web development or other equivalent certifications/diplomas. 5+ years experience building large scale web applications from the ground up. Experience developing in JavaScript, Typescript, HTML, CSS/LESS/SASS, and Angular. Expert understanding of RESTful architecture and APIs. 5+ years experience maintaining and managing multiple applications with a focus on reusability and modularity. 3+ years experience with responsive web development and mobile standards. Experience with version control systems like Git and Team Foundation Server. Experience working in an agile environment. Champion of software best practices including pair programming, continuous integration, and coding standards.  Personal Attributes   You like to be in a super-collaborative environment, working alongside talented developers, designers, and QA analysts throughout the lifecycle of a project. You have superior communication skills and an ability to convey and debate your ideas. You are passionate about empathizing with customer/user needs, motivations, and behaviors. And, you have an acute ability to translate that empathy into actionable deliverables. You have strong organizational skills, including the ability to prioritize tasks and meet deadlines. You are an ego-free person with the ability to embrace the best idea even when it is not your own. You are excited about the opportunity to work in a fast-paced agile environment and are open to new frameworks. Youre a team player who equally values achieving exceptional outcomes and enjoying the ride by having fun along the way.  Bonus Points   A portfolio that demonstrates a variety of your skills as a developer. Experience working with UX designers at implementing a design system to maintain consistency and collaboration across disciplines. Have an understanding or experience with asset management software, localization, Cordova, Ionic or other progressive web app/hybrid application frameworks. Experience with voice recognition or RXJS or Reactive Programming. Knowledge of security standards or developing app stores for iOS/Android deployment. Knowledge of automated testing, unit testing, and user interface end to end testing.
Title: Senior Angular Javascript Software Developer

Job_Description: The Cogeco Peer1 Marketing Operations team seeks a Website Designer/Developer to join its team. We are looking for a passionate, driven person to be a key part of a high energy, innovative and global team. This role will help to lead the vision, design and implementation of our global digital experience, as a means to deliver innovative business solutions and customer outcomes. As an integral member of the Marketing Operations team, the seasoned Website Designer/Developer will constantly measure, evaluate and implement ways to increase website engagement and conversion rates of the Cogeco Peer 1 website. The ideal candidate should have an eye for clean and modern design by using the latest in effective B2B web design and development trends. The successful candidate for this role will report to the Director of Global Marketing Operations. Key Responsibilities: As the primary owner of the corporate global website, you will provide continuous refinement and improve functionality of our website. The Website Designer/Developer has a deep understanding of how to balance visual design, content strategy, information architecture and user research points of view in product design work. Good understanding of front-end technologies, including HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, jQuery Strong understanding of landing-page conversion best practices Background in brand aesthetics/UX such as understanding page layouts and the arrangement of elements on the screen for optimal conversion Proficiency in Photoshop, Illustrator or other visual design and wire-framing tools Understand and lead all analytical efforts, measurement, reporting, improvement and optimizations Responsible for improving SEO to help drive organic traffic Conduct usability testing to continually improve the user experience on the website Understand the importance of visual consistency across products and customer touch points, both in terms of branding and design patterns Collaborate with marketing managers to estimate scope, adjust priorities, and contribute to website strategy (including layout, CTAs, flow, etc.) Ensure that all programs embrace monitoring, measurement, analysis and continuous optimization You have enthusiasm for building and supporting the demand generation team to help acquire more leads Team player that has a positive attitude!  Requirements: 5 years of experience as Website Designer/Developer of enterprise applications Strong UI experience with a portfolio of Web design work Strong understanding of user experience testing and conversion optimization Strong understanding of mobile technologies and responsive web design Solid understanding of online marketing (SEM, SEO, Remarketing) In-depth experience using WordPress required Ability to write standards-compliant responsive HTML and CSS code Strong understanding of Google Analytics and how to prioritize changes based on quantitative and qualitative data Experience with Crazy Egg and Optimizely or other heatmapping and testing tools Proficiency in the Adobe Creative Suite (Illustrator and Photoshop) or equivalent Client and agency-side experience an asset Ability to comply with existing brand guidelines, color palette, and style Ability to work independently, learn quickly, and be proactive Demonstrated ability to work collaboratively with various team members, stakeholders and agencies. Ability to contribute to several different projects at once and be able to take ownership of the projects assigned Ability to work in a fast-paced environment A strong desire to continuously improve Degree, Diploma or Certification in Information Technology, Web Design, Interactive Marketing or related field an asset Excellent communication and interpersonal skills Fluency in French or Spanish an asset
Title: Website Designer/Developer

Job_Description: CAE is a global leader in training for the civil aviation, defence and security, and healthcare markets. Backed by a 70-year record of industry firsts, we continue to help define global training standards with our innovative virtual-to-live training solutions to make flying safer, maintain defence force readiness and enhance patient safety. We have the broadest global presence in the industry, with 8,000 employees, 160 sites and training locations in over 35 countries. Each year, we train more than 120,000 civil and defence crewmembers and thousands of healthcare professionals worldwide. www.cae.com     Développeur logiciel - Expérience Usager / Software Developer - User Experience   Position Type:  Regular  Role and Responsibilities (English follows)  CAE est à la recherche de développeurs logiciels talentueux avec un intérêt dans l'Expérience Utilisateur. Ils feront partie d'une équipe agile impliquée dans la conception, le développement, la personnalisation, la mise à jour et l'intégration de logiciel. Le département d'Expérience de Formation, au sein de l'Ingénierie Mondiale de CAE, développe les technologies utilisées dans les dispositifs d'entrainement et les simulateurs. Nos produits logiciels sont utilisés par les instructeurs de vol lors de l'entrainement des équipages dans les marchés Civils et Militaires.   Exigences Baccalauréat en Génie Logiciel, Informatique ou expérience équivalente Au moins 5 ans d’expérience en développement logiciel Expérience avec programmation orientée objet, UML, C++ ou C# .NET dans l'environnement Windows Connaissance des principes d'architecture Web et SOA Expertise en développement d’interface usager graphique (GUI) Bonnes aptitudes de communication en anglais et en français Capacité de s'intégrer à une équipe établie Des déplacements à l'extérieur du Canada pourraient être requis Doit être en mesure de rencontrer les exigences relatives aux Programme canadien des marchandises contrôlées (CGP), au programme américain International Trade in Arms Regulation (ITAR) et à l'obtention d'une cote de sécurité Secret OTAN. Intérêt marqué pour les systèmes de modélisation et de simulation en temps réel (un atout) Expérience avec WPF, WCF, SOA, C++ and UML (un atout)   Responsabilités Collaborer étroitement avec les concepteurs de l'interface et de l'expérience utilisateur et avec les programmeurs de l'interface utilisateur ainsi qu'avec les développeurs des autres disciplines afin d'élaborer le logiciel du poste d'instruction. Participer à l’analyse, la conception, la programmation, la validation, l’intégration et la mise au point de la plateforme de simulation et de l’interface-usager (GUI) des simulateurs. Développer et intégrer les éléments de l'interface utilisateur dans l'application, notamment : bibliothèques de contrôle WPF, modules interactifs, transitions animées et modèles de conception. Tester et déboguer afin de rencontrer les spécifications de design, performance et fiabilité.  ***********************************************************************************  CAE is looking for talented software developers with a focus on User Experience, to be part of an agile team involved in product design, development, customization, release and integration. The Training Experience department within CAE's Global Engineering provides technology solutions (frameworks, applications, tools, content) for use on CAE's flight simulators and training devices. Our software products are used by Flight Instructors to conduct training and evaluation for aviation crews in the Civil and Defense & Security markets.  Requirements Bachelor’s degree in Software Engineering, Computer Science, or equivalent experience At least 5 years of experience in software development Experience with object-oriented programming, UML, C++ or C#.NET in MS Windows environment Knowledge of Web and SOA architectural principles Expertise in Graphical User Interface development Good communication skills in English and French Ability to work within an established team Travelling outside the country may be required Must be eligible to meet requirements of Canadian Controlled Goods Program (CGP), American International Trade in Arms Regulation (ITAR) and Canadian government security clearance to secret level with NATO access Keen interest in real-time modelling and simulation systems (an asset) Experience in WPF, WCF or web development (HTML, CSS, JavaScript, REST API) (an asset)   Profile Work closely with UI/UX Designer s as well as developers from other disciplines, to develop instructor station software Participate in the analysis, design, coding, testing, validation and integration of the simulation platform and the associated user interface (GUI) on flight simulators Develop and integrate UI elements into the application, including: WPF control libraries, web interactive modules, animated transitions and design patterns Test and debug UI content to meet design, performance and reliability specifications    CAE thanks all applicants for their interest. However, only those whose background and experience match the requirements of the role will be contacted.   Equal Employment Opportunity CAE is firmly committed to ensuring a positive and professional working environment in which all people are treated with dignity and respect. We aim to provide a fair and consistent method for filling job openings in support of equality of opportunity and cultural diversity within the company.  The masculine gender is used throughout this job description solely to make the text easier to read and therefore applies to both men and women.
Title: Développeur logiciel - Expérience Usager / Software Develope...

Job_Description: Who You Are…  You're an experienced Software Developer, with more than 5 years of application development experience, designing system including microservices and service-oriented architectures.  You're comfortable collaborating in teams to design, build and ship high-quality software, iterating in an agile fashion.  You’re comfortable working closely with product managers, designers, and outside stakeholders to build both awesome UI/UX components and systems, as well as backend services and APIs that can process millions of request per day. You have experience liaising and collaborating with other departments in determining requirements and specifications.  You love to coach, lead and nurture the development of more junior developers while sharing your knowledge within the team along with the broader technical community, all the while shaping our software development culture by improving our processes and codebases.  Responsibilities...   Leading technical projects; collaborating with development manager and leads in the delegation of work. Being a technical resource and sounding board for fellow developers. Providing technical leadership and direction in the implementation of large new product features. Identifying and adopting software development best practices and processes. Stay current with industry best practices and relevant technologies; mentors same within the team  You’re Great at...   Writing efficient code in Python and Javascript Front-End frameworks like Angular JS Building high-volume, highly available, and distributed server applications, hence you have a portfolio of apps you’ve played a key role in shipping Building services and have experience with container and orchestration technologies such as Docker and Kubernetes Experience with event-based and message-driven distributed system Working with Big Data, utilizing SQL and noSQL databases, data warehouse technologies, and familiarity with data lakes and data marts Working with REST APIs (bonus if you’ve worked with Twitter, LinkedIn or Facebook APIs) Creating automated test suites and ensuring quality in your code Optimizing and applying best practices.  Bonus Points…   Experience with Ionic Framework Passion for social media and new ideas Drive to succeed in a fast pace and continuously evolving environment You have open source contributions or personal projects you’ve shipped successfully  Hootsuite is an inclusive employer. Every effort will be made to provide accommodations requested by candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.  #LI-TG1
